description:
Through my association with the local elementary
school where I teach carpentry classes, I have access
to a wood shop.  After seeing friends and family
succeed with a loan, I asked the school principle if I
could use the school shop in exchange for loaning the
students use of my new tools during class.  Now I have
my first orders for new furniture!  I am very excited
about my new business because I need to increase my
income, but also because my students will benefit.
loan_use: Purchase of tools and materials to full first order for furniture \r\n

description:
I am a baker who can do all kids of baking to meet the needs of my customers. Honduras has many delicious baked goods to try such as Rosquillas (corn and cheese donuts), tustacas (corn cookies with raw cane sugar), vanilla cookes and semitas (another cookie).

\r\n\r\nHowever, my specialty which I am well-known for, is cakes and sweets. My most popular product is birthday cakes, which are ordered by my clients a few days before the birthday party.
loan_use: Money to increase inventory and happiness.

description: I make all different kinds of Ã\xadtems for my clients.  I make clothes for children, women, and men, as well as sheets and curtains.  I both take orders for Ã\xadtems and also sell my goods door to door to shops that I have worked with for years.
loan_use: Working Capital

description:
This business is a member of the Golden Crown group. Group lending, also known as solidarity lending, is a mechanism that allows a number of individuals to provide collateral or guarantee a loan through a group repayment pledge. The incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the payment amount. - Kiva Staff

Joan she is 30 years old. Married with 4 children. She have not gone for any formal hairdressing training â€“ However, she have gained good experience in Sedona salon where she was employed for 2 years. From the commission she received she saved to start her own small salon.

In year 2002, she received a loan of US$143 from WEEC. She was able to rent a plot and put up a structure where she operates. She was also able to provide electricity in the room. She did weaving of the hair awaiting to by other equipments to enable her serve her customers.

After completing the loan she took US$286 and bought a Drier and Steamer. This has attracted more customers. She has also been able to employ one lady. Given a loan of US$575 she will be able to expand her business and serve all her customers under one roof.
loan_use: Expand business to one larger room.

description:
I have had my grocery store for three years. We are open all week, and I sell the household Ã\xadtems used everyday like butter, bread, milk, eggs, and other tasty treats. \r\n

\r\nMy business is widely-known for my kindness and my unforgetable smile! We open early and stay open late, so my whole family works in the store since together we are sending the children to school.
loan_use: Buy inventory like bread, ham, pens and paper, medicine, juices, and the like.

description: My name is Karla Aguilar and I have a business selling clothing, shoes, and cosmetics door-to-door and by request for 5 years. I visit government offices, private companies, my largest buyers being teachers in urban and rural schools and employees of different institutions. I am requesting this loan in order to buy school clothes to increase my sales. With this money I can pay family and educational expenses.
loan_use: To buy shirts, blouses, shoes, socks, etc

description:
This business is a member of Naretoi Women Group. Group lending, also known as solidarity lending, is a mechanism that allows a number of individuals to provide collateral or guarantee a loan through a group repayment pledge. The incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the payment amount. - Kiva Staff

She is an active lady and has experiences in various businesses such bead work. Hellen is married with four children.

Hellen joined WEEC in year 2001, received a loan of USD300. She started buying and selling Goats and sheep. The business went on well, paid up the first loan and there after, applied for a second loan. She was given a loan of USD.450 which she used to add more stock. She is unable to supply the required number to customers thus a need for more funding to increase stock.
loan_use: The amount requested for will assist her to boost her business such that she maintains and possibly add new clients.

description:
This business is a member of the Naretoi Women Group group. Group lending, also known as solidarity lending, is a mechanism that allows a number of individuals to provide collateral or guarantee a loan through a group repayment pledge. The incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the payment amount. - Kiva Staff

Rebecca is married with 6 children .She doubles as church secretary and merry go round.

Rebecca received her first loan of USD.300 from WEEC in 2001. She bought her first 2 steers paid well and in 2003 she was given another loan of USD.450 which enabled her to buy 3 more steers. To date Rebecca has a total of 13 steers. This business enables her to educate her children in good schools and provide for the rest of the family.
loan_use: She intends to restock such that she utilizes the rains which have just started after along period of drought. She will be assured of high income after a few months of grazing.

description:
C. Bosco has been an active member of Life in Africa since 2005. He currently works at the WE Center as a gatekeeper and he also makes bracelets for the Invisible Children Bracelet Project.

Like so many others who have been forced to leave the war torn Northern Uganda, he and his family live in the displaced persons camp known as the Acholi quarters. He supports three children and working in the stone quarry made it impossible for him to earn enough money. Since coming to Life in Africa, he now earns enough money to make their lives much easier since they now have money for food, rent, and more important, for the school fees for his children. Now he feels proud and for the first time, he can start to see a future for his family again.

His first priority is to build a family home. He wants his children to have the security of having their own home again. He has a plot of land that the King of Buganda donated to the Acholi some years ago. He has already started to build his home but was forced to stop due to lack of funds. He is now seeking a loan in the amount of 800,000 to finish this home. He will be able to repay this loan in 6 months.

LOAN AMOUNT: 800,000

PLAN: BUILDING

He wants to buy the following materials

1: 12 iron sheets @----------------11000--------132,000/

2: 12 bags of cement @--------------18500-----201,000/

3: 3000 bricks @ 60-----------------------------180,000/

4:13 pieces of timber for roofing

(3x4)- 3000----24,000/

(4x2)-----5000-------------------25,000/

5: 2 trips of sand @----------60000----------------120,000/

6: transporting materials to the site-------------- 40,000/

7: Labour-------------------------------------------78,000/

TOTAL: 800,000/

C. plans to pay back this loan in 6 Months in amounts of 147,335 per month and he saves Ushs 170, 500/= per month. He has designated the community impact portion of the interest he will pay to support Life in Africa's Talend Discovery team.
loan_use: Finish walls and roofing

description: Fana owns and runs a small grocery in one of the Roma neighborhoods in Sliven, Bulgaria.\xa0 She has had this small store for 15 years, and has built up enough of a capital base to enable her to extend credit to many of her customers in difficult times.\xa0 However, she has found herself with a surprising expense – a new refrigerator. Her current cooler has started to leak badly, and has become prohibitively expensive to operate, increasingly so as the summer approaches.\xa0 Unplugging it is not an option – yogurt is a staple of the Bulgarian diet, accounting for a significant amount of her sales year-round, and in the summer, ice cream sales become a major revenue contributor.\xa0 \xa0Fana’s daughter and husband work for her.\xa0 Her daughter typically works in the store while her husband focuses on sourcing inventory from the lowest-cost provider in the region.\xa0 \xa0Lenders interested in learning more about the Roma culture in Bulgaria might find “Bury Me Standing: The Gypsies and Their Journey” by Isabel Fonseca to be helpful.\xa0 The book was published in 1995 and is widely available.\xa0
loan_use: New refrigerator

description:
I am 42 years old, married with three children. I am the treasurer of a self help group called Konguini Thayu Women Group. Our major activity is savings and credit done by all members of the group.I have been the treasurer of this group since 2003.

I started my business in 1998 and have been able to construct a small shop and bought a dairy cow. Having a big space and on a strategic position at the centre of town coupled with the demand for soft drinks in this part of town, i believe it will be a good venture. This will bring in more income which wilgive me the opportunity to give my children better education and improve my standard of living.
loan_use: I would like to start selling sodas.I have been selling other packed juices but of recent i acquired a big space and the number of clients for sodas have been increasing day by day.This money will help me buy fifty crates of sodas which i anticipate to sell in about two weeks.

description:
Grace is the chairlady of Kabuta Ladies in action a post she has held since 2001. She is also a treasurer of her local church in Kabuta and a retired Primary school teacher.

She has been in this business for over 20 years and this gives her confidence in soliciting for more funding because she is sure and understands market trends. \xa0The group manages a revolving fund and she has been able to pay back two loans of USD 300. Her produce is sold in muranga town as well as to middle men who take it to Nairobi because of the cheap railway transport.
loan_use: She intends to increase the purchases such that she can directly sell to Nairobi because she will earn more than what the middle men give.

description:
Kyaziike Joan is a remarkable young woman. She is very responsible and dedicated even for her young years. She joined Life in Africa in November of 2005 and has been an active member being employed by the Invisible Children Bracelet project. She has just finished her secondary schooling and she now longs to go on to the University to complete her education.

She lives at home with her parents and she is the eldest of their four children. Her father's income in somewhat unsteady so she gladly helps financially using her salary. Her father wisely worked hard and built a two room house next to their family home. This is rented out and the income from this rental has paid the school fees for Joan so far. However, the University fees are much higher and they are looking at ways to increase their income to provide for this.

The plan is to add two more rooms to the existing house. This will double the amount of rent they will earn. Housing is in great demand in Kampala so they know they will have no problem finding tenants. The money from this rental will be used to pay the University fees for Joan's education and for her younger siblings who will follow her. She has carefully saved as much of her salary as she could and has 400,000 to put into this project. She is seeking a loan in the amount of 800,000 to complete it. She will be able to repay this loan in 10 months.

Below is her break down.

1: 16 Iron sheets @------11000------------176,000/

2: 16 bags of cement @--------18500-------296,000/

3: 4000 bricks @--------------60----------240,000/

4:15 Pieces of timber for roofing 8(3x4)-3000-24,000/

7(4x2) -----5000------35,000/

5: 2 trips of sand @---------60000-------120,000/

6: 2 windows @ 10,000-------------------20,000/

7: 1 door ----------------------29,000/

8: Labuor ------------------------------200,000/

9: Transporting materials to the site-- 60,000/

Total ------------------------------1,200,000/

WE Team to benefit:Internet4change Team
loan_use: Buying materials to expand tenant's room

description:
W. Kaemorak is married and lives with his wife and three children in the house they built quickly after moving into their new village. He started the works two weeks ago but needs additional funds to complete the improvement he planed. He is doing everything alone, “by my own” he said in English.

W. Kaemorak speaks a little English. He learnt when driving foreigners on his moto-taxi. He would like to learn more but his wife say he is too old now. “English is for fresh brains”, she said. Their two youngest children, 14 and 5 years old, are going to school six days a week.

As for the family resources, the moto taxi breeds around 12,000 Riel ($3) per day. Kaemorak’s wife can make around 10,000 Riel ($2.5) in sewing trousers and repairing clothes on her machine at home. The family eldest son is employed as a security guard in a night club in Phnom Penh. He makes $80 per month and works at night.
loan_use: Finish to build his house

description:
My name is Mariza.\xa0 I have been making cinder blocks for 4 years, that are used in the construction of buildings, houses, walls.\xa0 I have a great clientele, especially some iron workers in my city.\xa0 The generated income from this activity help me fulfill family and business commitments.\xa0 I am experienced in this business and due to the high demand, I employ a few young people to help manufacture the cinder blocks.

[Note from Kiva:\xa0 The above is Kiva staff member's transalation of the below text -- using Google translator and working knowledge of Spanish based off of 4 years high school Spanish, a very long time ago!\xa0 Apologies for any errors or omissions.]

Mi nombre es Maritza tengo cuatro años de dedicarme a la elaboracion de Bloques, que se usan para construccion de edificios, casas, muros, ya tengo una buena clientela especialmente algunas ferreterias de mi ciudad, las ganacias que me genera esta actividad son bastantes buenas ya que me ayudan a cumplir con los compromisos familiares y del negocio. Este negocio es familiar y debido a la demanda que tengo de pedidos he contratado a otros jovenes quienes nos ayudan para la fabricacion de los bloques.
loan_use: Compra de cemento, arena, herramientas como pala, carreta de mano y otros

description:
I have been working for one year in my hardware store, it is a family run business, in which my two children and other youths that I have contracted, attend to my clients. I have a loyal clientel, since, for the price, I make contracts with the houses being constructed and the builders in my city. This activity generates enough (income) to support my family.

Loan Use: Cement, sand, screws, nails, sockets, floodlights, lamps and other\xa0

Tengo un año de tener mi ferreteria, este es un negocio familiar en el que me ayudan mis dos hijos y otros jovenes que he contratado para atender a mis clientes, tengo clientela fija, ya que por los precios hago contratos con las casas constructoras y albañiles en mi ciudad. Esta actividad me genera lo suficiente para apoyar a mi familia.
loan_use: Compra de cemento, arena, tornillos, clavos, toma corrientes, focos, lamparas y otros.

description:
I have a grocery store in which I sell products for daily use like rice, bread, milk, eggs, coffee and other items. It is located en the Montañita, a community in which there are not many businesses and the demand is strong. I need the financing to increase my inventory and to increase sales, so that I can help and support my family more.

Loan Use: milk, bread, eggs, cheese, butter, drinks, over the counter drugs

Tengo una pulperia en la que vendo productos de consumo popular como arroz, pan, leche, huevos, cafe y otros. Esta ubicada en la Montañita una comunidad en la que no hay muchos negocios y la demanda es grande, el financiamiento lo necesito para incrementar mi inventario y mejorar las ventas, para poder ayudar y apoyar mas a mi familia.
loan_use: Compra de leche, pan, huevos, queso, mantequilla, refrescos, medicamentos de uso comun.

description:
My work is\xa0selling clothes and cosmetics in a store located on one of the boulevards of the city Danli. I have working in sales for seven years. Thanks to the earnings I recieve,\xa0I have been able to help my husband with the family expenses and to give my\xa0children the opportunity to continue in their studies.\xa0

Loan Use: Buying women's cosmetics and clothing for men, women and children.

Me dedico a la venta de ropa y cosmeticos en un puesto ubicado en uno de los boulevares de la ciudad de Danli, tengo siete años de dedicarme a esta actividad. Gracias a los ingresos que tengo por las ventas he podido apoyar a mi esposo con los gastos familiares y darle a mis hijos la oportunidad de continuar estudiando.
loan_use: Compra de cosmeticos para dama y ropa para caballeros, bebes y niños.

description:
Catherine is an active group member of Kabuta ladies in action. She has 4 children and fortunately they finished college and three of them are working. She supports her nephew with school fees and she pays $228 every year.

She started her business 9 years ago. Currently she has 2 dairy cows producing 17 litres in the morning & 10litres in the evening. She sells 25 litres per day at $ 29 cents per litre. She also farms horticultural products in her farm. Currently she has planted watermelon & butternuts, which she expects to harvest about 2000kg by end of August. This will give her roughly $200. She sells her fruits to people with groceries and market stall in muranga town as well as sagana market. She employs 3 permanent workers and pays them a total of $77 per month.

\xa0
loan_use: : She wants to buy pipes, sprinklers 7 fittings, for irrigation purpose. She will plant kales to meet the local demand.

description: Pauline was born 38 years ago, she is married and has 4 children; three are in primary and one in secondary school. She is the chairlady of Catholic Pioneer Movement and a good member of the group. She is a farmer by occupation and mainly grows vegetables and cereals. She gets her income from the sell of vegetables, milk and cereals. Milk produced is mainly for sale and a little is kept aside for home consumption. Her monthly income from business is about $87, this is not enough to pay her daughter’s school fees. However, she can pay back the loan because its spread through out the year.
loan_use: Pauline would like to pay school fees for her daughter

description: Nicolae, together with his family of four, grows vegetables for a living. Thanks to a self-constructed greenhouse, he begins seeding tomatoes and cucumbers early in the year for a first harvest in late May. The competitive advantage gained from the timing is supplemented by a convenient location, close to three different regional markets. Some of the seedlings are kept and planted in the fields for a second crop later in the year. Nicolae would like to build two more greenhouses, a large one to be used exclusively for tomatoes, and a smaller one for raising seedlings. For this he needs construction materials, including wood, plastic and accessories.
loan_use: Greenhouse Construction

description: Vera’s business idea was a simple one: buy new varieties of foods and goods to re-sell at the open-air market in her town. After giving much thought to the items she wished to stock (those previously unavailable), she went about purchasing them and securing a table at the market. Currently, she sells a variety of canned foods as well as an array of other products. Paying close attention to customer demand, Vera now wants to expand her offering with some dried food products. She needs a loan to procure these and to generally make more purchases in bulk to increase her profit margin.
loan_use: Working Capital

description:
ENGLISH

Mario has more than 29 years selling pewter stoneware and he was born in Monterrey. He knew this business when he fell in love with his wife years ago, because his wife’s parents were doing this activity. When he was young he worked and when his job ended, Mario sold his house to stock the pots and frying pans. Actually in Monterrey there is no production of this kind of pots, which is why he must travel to the Saltillo city located in Coahuila to purchase his merchandise. He needs a loan for $475 and he will repay in 6 months. A very good season is coming because in September his demand increases so he needs to be prepared with merchandise. He has a store in the farmers market in which he sets up every weekend and as a complement of his activity he also sells natural products with a little help from one of his daughters.

SPANISH

Mario tiene más de 29 años de dedicarse a la venta de loza de peltre, él es originario de Monterrey, N. L., y esta casado.Conoció el negocio de la loza de peltre cuando se hizo novio de su esposa, ya que los papas de ella se dedicaban a esta actividad, y siendo aun joven, trabajaba y al terminar su jornada salía a vender casa por casa las ollas y sartenes. Actualmente en Monterrey se dejo de producir este tipo de vasijas, por lo que tiene que viajar a la ciudad de Saltillo, Coahuila para abastecerse de mercancía. A la fecha ocupa un crédito por la cantidad de $5,000 a 6 meses, pues se avecina una buena temporada, ya que desde el mes de septiembre la demanda de ollas tamaleras se incrementa, por lo que necesita estar preparado con suficiente mercancía. Tiene un puesto en el Mercado campesino en donde vende los fines de semana y complementa su actividad con la venta de productos naturales, con el apoyo de una de sus hijas.
loan_use: To purchase merchandise

description:
Yordan is a 35-year-old Roma living in Sliven, Bulgaria. For the last 10 years, Yordan has supported his wife and two children (aged 14 and 17) by his work with walnuts. Yordan drives around Bulgaria buying walnuts in their shells by the sack. Upon his return to Sliven, he weighs the sacks and gives each to one of his independent contractors. The contractor removes the walnuts from their shells and returns the shelled walnuts to Yordan. Weighing the sacks before their distribution lets Yordan know approximately how many kilos of shelled nuts should be returned, to prevent his contractors from siphoning off his nuts. Yordan provides work for approx 50 people for 5 days when he brings in a load of nuts to be shelled. Yordan then sells his walnuts at the major nut markets in Sofia and Burgas.

Currently, Yordan can afford to buy 2,000BGN (1,300USD) worth of walnuts at a time, which he sells 10 days later for 2,500BGN (1,625USD). After salaries and expenses (gas for his van to drive around Bulgaria buying and selling the nuts), Yordan nets approximately 200BGN (130USD), which he can do every two weeks or so. This loan will give him the capital to increase the amount of nuts he can buy at a time (nearly double), employing more people in the Roma ghetto of Sliven.

The Roma, commonly referred to as gypsies, is a severely marginalized social group in the Balkans.
loan_use: Working capital

description: At 64, Nancy believes that she has not yet reached a point in life to give up working. Her 6 children are all independent but she takes care of 2 of her grandsons who give her company. These two grandsons are in primary and she is responsible for all the necessities. She joined WEEC and Kenyanjeru Women’s group 5 years ago and this has helped her in various ways. She was able to get a diary cow which she got as a loan in 2005, it’s fully paid up and she drinks milk as she wants while the balance is sold. She sells 5 litres a day giving her $42 per month. She saves this money to take care of her grandsons. She has tea and coffee not on a large scale but still gives her some $ 50 per month. She also grows beans and maize but they are seasonal. She hopes to increase output when she plants hybrid seeds and the main objective is to accumulate enough money to buy another dairy cow. With milk she will not go wrong because there is ready market because of the revival of Kenya cooperative creameries. Her grandsons will be assured of good education and to herself; she will enjoy her old age.
loan_use: Nancy wants to buy hybrid maize seeds and a water tank

description:
I have been working for five years in my small business, which is located in my home and is half a block from the Social Security building of out town. At the moment, I need to expand my business so that my daughter, who is in her final year of high school, can go to university to continue with her studies. The earnings I make help me with family expenses.

Loan Use: Purchase bonbons, chiclets, confections, churros, sodas and other items.

Tengo cinco años de tener mi pequeño negocio que esta ubicado en mi casa de habitacion y a media cuadra del Seguro Social de nuestra ciudad. En este momento necesito ampliar mi negocio ya que mi hija esta en su ultimo año de estudios secundarios y mi meta es enviarla a la universidad para que continue sus estudios. Los ingresos que percibo actualmente me ayudan con los gastos familiares.
loan_use: Compra de bombones, chiclets, confites, churros, refrescos y otros

description:
Joan is 33 years old, married and has two children. Her family depends on a small piece of land where she grows vegetables and beans. Joan has benefited from the group and WEEC by accessing small loans and this has increased her capacity to look after her family without relying on her husband. She is a dedicated agri-business woman; she applies the business skills she has attained over the years from group trainings to make money from what she produces. The following gives her income: sale of milk, tealeaves and vegetables from her small farm. For some time, she has been selling Napier grass from a rented small piece of land. From her farming, she is able to earn about USD150 monthly but this is not enough to sustain her family. 
Right now she plans to rent a bigger plot of land to plant more Napier grass vegetables for sale. As the business grows, she wants to buy another dairy cow to increase milk production. Joan is optimistic that she will get a break through and live a happy life.
loan_use: Joan would like to rent a plot of land to grow vegetables and Napier grass for sale

description:
ENGLISH

Isabel was born in Torreon, Coahuila, and she has lived in Monterrey for 15 years with two children. She started a business selling floral adjustment and handmade articles; she also sells clothes with Peter who is her husband. They are a very hard working family with a lot of business experience. Isabel learned to make handmade articles from friends and she knows that this activity will enable her to grow her income to help her support her home. Now she needs additional credit to invest in raw materials in order to elaborate her floral arrangements in preparation for “the died day” (this is a traditional festival in Mexico on November 1st and 2nd ). During this festival, she has a lot of demand of her products. Isabel is a very enthusiastic entrepreneurial woman and she wants to work hard to grow her business.

SPANISH

Isabel nació en Torreón, Coahuila, y tiene Quince años viviendo en Monterrey, es madre de dos hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración de arreglos florales y manualidades, además de compartir un negocio de venta de ropa con su esposo Pedro, son una familia muy trabajadora y con grandes habilidades de comerciantes. Ella aprendió a hacer manualidades con amigas y después vio que esta actividad le podría dar ganancias para colaborar a los ingresos del hogar. Ahora solita el crédito para hacer una inversión en materiales para la elaboración de “coronas de muerto” para el próximo 1 y 2 de noviembre, ya que vive cerca de un panteón y es una temporada en donde ella hace muchas de estas piezas para venderlas a las afueras del mismo. Es una empresaria muy entusiasta y tiene muchas ganas de crecer junto con su negocio.
loan_use: Purchase raw material for her business

description:
Cayetana is a married woman and has one son. Her husband is working as a hammock salesman and, as this is an unstable business, she must help with the family's expenses. Three years ago she made a decision to help her family's economy so she used an empty space at her home to raise chickens and sell them. Now her husband is a driver and Cayetana administrates two businesses. She is looking for a credit of US$200 dollars because in December she increases her sales. She needs to invest right now in order to allow her the time to raise all of the chickens and to make more money. She has very high expectations because people know her and always come to the business to buy her chickens and hammocks as well.\r\n

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

Cayetana es una mujer casada, su esposo se dedicaba a la venta de hamacas, siendo este un oficio un poco inestable, ella tiene la necesidad de colaborar en los gastos familiares pues tiene 1 hijo menor. Hace 3 años tomo la decisión de apoyar económicamente, contando con espacio en su domicilio particular, comenzó a criar pollos para su venta. Ahora su esposo se contrato como chofer cargador y es ahora Cayetana quien atiende los 2 negocios. Esta interesada en obtener un préstamo por la cantidad de US$200 dólares a 6 meses pues en Diciembre se incrementan las ventas. Necesita hacer la inversión ahora pues el pollo tiene un periodo de crecimiento para poder engordarlos y venderlos a buen precio. Sus expectativas son buenas, pues la gente ya los conoce y vienen a buscarlos de otros lugares para comprar tanto hamacas como pollos. \r\n
loan_use: chickens raise and sale

description:
Luci Margarita U. D. and her husband, who is a farmer, have been dedicated to the culture of the Pitahaya and Havanan Chile for approximately 10 years in Kinchil, a small town located in Yucatan. The agriculture is the only way that they have to maintain their children.

They began this business because they love commerce and also out of economic necessity. In addition, Luci has been selling fresh chicken and vegetables for 4 years. She does not currently have enough capital, and for this reason she needs credit of US$925 to purchase seeds, fertilizers, tools and raw materials. This is important for their business because of the season and potential success in December with sales.

Luci is offering to repay the loan in 6 months, at least. All of this is done with the purpose of obtaining a better harvest to increase sales and Luci's family income.

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

Luci Margarita U. D. y su esposo que es agricultor, se dedican al cultivo de la Pitahaya y chile habanero desde hace aproximadamente 10 años en Kinchil, un poblado de Yucatán; la agricultura es el único medio que tienen ellos para el sustento de sus hijos, ellos empezaron este negocio por el gusto al comercio y la necesidad económica, además, vende pollo fresco y verduras desde hace 4 años. Por falta de capital Luci necesita un crédito de US$925 dólares americanos para comprar semillas, fertilizantes, herramientas e insumos para su negocio en esta temporada que se avecina (Diciembre), ofreciendo pagarlo en por lo menos 6 meses. Todo esto con el fin de obtener una mejor cosecha, incrementar sus ventas y a su vez su ingreso familiar.
loan_use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers,and tools

description:
Marcelo for many years was working at a meat store, but he had to quit from this activity for health reasons. He always had to stay in very cold rooms and he was sick almost once a month. While he recovered, he was thinking about how he could provide for his family and a friend invited him to a fishing practice. He did not have any resources to practice this sport, so he started to manufacture his own nets. First he learned to fish and when he saw that his work was excellent and much stronger, his friends began to become interested and they wanted to buy from him. Through this, he found that he could do it as a business. At this moment he has 8 years of experience in this business and he sells his products to both friends, and also any sports stores that are interested in buying from him. Marcelo is requesting a loan of US$ 275 because the shrimp season is coming up and he needs to be prepared with enough merchandise.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Marcelo mucho tiempo trabajo en el área de carnicería, tuvo que retirarse de esta actividad pues su salud se vio afectada por el contacto directo de los cuartos fríos, se enfermaba constantemente. Mientras se recuperaba y pensaba como poder sacar adelante a su familia, un amigo lo invito a practicar la pesca deportiva. Escaso de recursos para poder practicar comenzó a elaborar sus propias redes, primero para poder pescar. Al ver lo bien hechas y resistentes que le quedaban, sus amigos comenzaron a encargarle redes, fue así como decidió que ese podría ser su negocio. Cuenta ya con 8 años de experiencia en este ramo y además de venderlo a particulares también ofrece su mercancía en las tiendas de deportes. A la fecha el Sr. Marcelo necesita invertir en cordel y avios para fabricar las redes por lo que esta solicitando un crédito por la cantidad de US$275 a 4 meses, pues se avecina la temporada de pesca de camarón y necesita estas preparado con mercancía suficiente.
loan_use: Purchase raw materials

description:
Velichka S. keeps a small grocery in one of quarters of Smolian – Ustovo. There are some other groceries in the quarter but her one is maybe the neatest and well-supplied. Her neighbours say that prices in the grocery are the lowest in the quarter.

Velichka S. graduated German language in University. Some years she worked as a German teacher in 11th classes but she was not satisfied and got quit of school. In 1997 she started her business. First she has kept a stall in the town but in 1999 she opened the grocery in Ustovo. On the stall now works her sister.

One of her biggest problems remains sales on credit. Although the dificulties she has no serious problems in collecting her debts.

Velichka will spend this 800 USD loan on buying wasing materials that she will supply in her grocery.
loan_use: Buying washing materials for the grocery

description:
Hello, my name is Amparo, and I make and sell bedding, curtains, cushions, and other accessories for the house. I’ve had my small workshop for four years, and it’s helped me support my family. Currently, I only work with requests from clients, who are store owners. My dream is to make my business grow and be able to hire people to help me make clothes. This is why I need to increase my inventory so I can offer new designs and color variety.

Loan Use: Purchase fabrics, thread, lace, zippers, pins, buttons, sponge, flannel.

SPANISH
Hola me llamo Amparo y me dedico a la fabricacion y venta de ropa de cama, cortinas, cojines y otros accesorios de hogar. Tengo cuatro años de tener mi pequeño taller el que me ha ayudado a sostener a mi familia, actualmente solo trabajo por encargos de clientes que tengo dueños de tiendas y almacenes. Mi sueño es hacer crecer mi negocio poder contratar a otras personas que me ayuden a confeccionar la ropa, es por eso que necesito surtir mas el inventario para poder ofrecer modelos nuevos y en variedad de colores.
loan_use: Tela, hilo, encajes, zipper, broches, botones, esponja, franela.

description:
My name is Nelson David and in my community I am very well known for my sale of sweet ice cream. My business is located near the catholic church in my city. I've been selling ice cream for 4 years and it has generated income to support my family. My children help me to sell in other neighboring communities. Now is the time when sales increase and I need to be able to cover the demand of my clients. This loan will help me get to that point.

SPANISH

Me llamo Nelson David y en mi comunidad soy bastante conocido por mi rica venta de helados, mi negocio esta ubicado en la parte de atras de la iglesia catolica en mi ciudad. Tengo cuatro años de tener mi venta de helados que me ha generado ingresos para mantener a mi familia, mis hijos me ayudan a vender en otras comunidades vecinas en sus ratos libres, ahora que es epoca de calor mis ventas aumentan y necesito poder cubrir la demanda de mis clientes.
loan_use: Sorbetes, ice cream, servilletas, vasos desechables.

description:
My name is Heberto S., and I sell vegetables. I have a stand that I use to distribute in different small towns in the area of my community. I’ve been in this type of activity for a year. I’ve been able to provide an education for my children, and to pay for my family’s expenses. I am a single parent, and when my children are free, they help me distribute the vegetables.

Loan Use: Purchase tomatoes, chili peppers, onions, cabbage, cucumbers, and others.

Mi nombre es Heberto S., cuento con un negocio de venta de Verduras ambulantes los que distribuyo en varias aldeas aledañas a mi comunidad. Tengo un año de dedicarmen a este tipo de actividad, con el que he podido ayudar a mis hijos en sus estudios y gastos familiares, soy padre soltero y en ratos libres mi hijos me colaboran en la distribucion del producto.
loan_use: Compra de tomates, chiles,cebollas, repollos,pepino y otros

description:
My name is Emilse and I run a small business which sells business clothes, footwear and cosmeticos. I usually sell them on foot by travelling around the community.

I've been doing this for three years and it is going well. It supports my family and my children who only have a single parent to support them. Right now, Christmas is approaching and I need to access a loan so that I can prepare for the business that is certain to come.
loan_use: Compra de ropa, calzado, cosmeticos y otros

description:
Mrs. Evangelina G. has been selling corn for 5 years. She prepares them very deliciously by first putting on butter or mayonnaise, then cheese, then lemon and hot sauce. Mmm, really flavorful.

Mrs. Evangelina sells them in her car and visits certain streets of the city, she has some sound equipment in her car that lets her announce the flavorful corn sale. Mrs. Evangelina G. would like to also open a fixed corn stall close to her house. With these two places of sale, one mobile in her car, and the other one fixed, it should increase her sales. She will acquire the fixed stall through a loan of $800 and she is determined to pay it back in a term of 1 year. With this loan she could increase her sales and generate a good income for her family. Besides, she is able to sell her delicious corn in another part of the city, well know in Nuevo Laredo, mmm.

ESPANOL

La Sra, Evangelina vende elotes desde hace 5 años, los prepara deliciosos, les agraga mantequilla o mayonesa y luego espolvorea queso ademas puede agregarles limon o chile, mmm realmente sabrosos. La Sra.Evangelina los vende en su auto y visita ciertas calles de la ciudad, ella va anunciandose atraves de un equipo de sonido que instala en su auto. La Sra. Evangelina pretende instalar un puesto fijo de venta de elotes cerca de su casa para incrementar sus ventas, con esto tendria ya dos puntos de venta uno movil en su auto y el otro fijo, este lo pretende adquirir atraves de un prestamo de $800.00 y para el cual tiene contemplado pagarlo en un plazo de 1 año, con dicho prestamo ella podria aumentar sus ventas y generar bienestar familiar, ademas de poder vender en otra parte de la ciudad sus ricos y deliciosos elotes, ya conocidos en Nuevo Laredo mmm.
loan_use: install a fixed sales point

description:
My name is Armando. I want everyone to know that we run a small store out of our house with the help of my whole family.

We are many sleeping in the same house which is also used as a warehouse for the inventory we keep overnight.

Thanks to this business I have been able to help to my family and my daughter who is 6 years old and start her studies. At this moment I need to provide my business for the Christmas season where all the people look for products to prepare their family meals.
loan_use: Compra de churros, panes, leche, huevos, refrescos y otros.

description:
My name is Mirna M. and my business is to manufacture bed linens. I have been in business for 3 years, and my clients favor the quality of my product. My business generates income to support my family. My goal is to increase my inventory and production capacity. I'd like to to remodel my home and support my family.

Mi nombre es Mirna M. me dedico a la fabricacion y venta de ropa para camas, tengo mi negocio hace 3 años, mis clientes son buenos ya que les gusta la calidad de mi producto, mi negocio me genera ingresos para mantener a mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mayor produccion y con los ingresos que obtenga poder remodelar mi hogar y mantener a mi familia.
loan_use: Compra de telas, hilo, tijeras, esponja

description:
My business is located on the Democracia Boulevard in the city of Danli. I am the single mother of a five year old boy. I have invested some money in the business of selling clothing. I have done well in this business so far. the holiday months are good for increased sales. This loan will go to purchasing various clothing items like pants, dresses, intimate apparell, etc.

\r\n\r\nTengo mi negocio ubicado en el Boulevard la Democracia en la ciudad de Danli, soy madre soltera mi hijo tiene cinco años de edad, por lo que decidi invertir algo de dinero y me ha ido bien en el negocio. En estos meses es cuando mas ventas hay por lo que necesito hacer una buena inversion para tener ropa variada para satisfacer a mis clientes.
loan_use: Compra de pantalones, vestidos de niña, camisetas, ropa interior y otros

description:
Rodrigo is separated and has one son. He had the opportunity to study a technical career in electronics. When he divorced from his wife, he had to care for his son and could not find a job. He thought, and decided to open his own business doing what he knew how to do. 10 years ago he started the business of repairing machines like televisions and washing machines, etc. Since he didn\'t have to make a large investment, it seemed at that moment sensible to open his business at home, and quickly soon after he had more and more clients. Now his business has grown and is growing, and as a result he needs to have a stock of pieces and spare parts to repair the equipment that people bring to him. For this reason he is requesting a loan of US $750 which he offers to pay back in 6 months.

**"This text has been translated from the following original business description."

Rodrigo esta separado y tiene un hijo. Tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera técnica en electrónica, al separarse de su esposa quedó a cargo de su único hijo y como no conseguía empleo, pensó y decidió en abrir su propio negocio en lo que sabía hacer y fue eso lo que hizo, hace 10 años atrás empezó en el negocio de reparación de televisores, lavadoras, refrigeradoras, etc. Como no tenía que hacer mucha inversión le fue en su momento sencillo abrir su taller en su propia casa y de ahí en adelante fue teniendo muchos clientes. Ahora como su negocio a mejorado el necesita obtener un stock de piezas y refacciones para los equipos que le lleven a reparar, por ello esta solicitando un préstamo por US$ 750 que promete pagarlos en 6 meses.\r\n
loan_use: To purchase pieces and spare parts

description:
Ashura is married with three children. She lives in Tandika area of Dar es Salaam. She owns a stall at Tandika market selling used clothes. She purchases these clothes from wholesalers and resells them in retail.

\r\n\r\nThrough her savings, she has managed to start keeping layers as a supplementary business. She came to notice that the second business needs more capital than she had originally anticipated. To smoothly run her businesses she needs USD 550. The money will be used to buy layers of feed and some medications. Ashura has attended Business and Entrepreneurship Training offered by Youth Self Employment Foundation.
loan_use: Working Capital

description:
Victor Manuel V. Padilla has been selling ice cream and candies for 1 year. He has a lot of customers in parks and schools where the kids play. I love kids. Mr. Victor Manuel V. wants to extend his business and his wife is very excited because she wants to help him and work together to give the best to their family. Mr. Victor V. is planning the acquisition of another sales unit for his wife. Mr. Manuel V. is asking for a loan of$ 800. He wants to repay in a term of 12 months. In the new sales unit, this next winter, her wife is panning to sell delicious hot corn with cheese and lemon.

Español

Víctor Manuel V. Padilla tiene un año de vendiendo dulces y helados, tiene muchos clientes, sobre todo en las escuelas y en los parques de diversión; donde hay niños, yo quiero mucho a los niños. El Sr. Víctor Manuel V. quiere ampliar su negocio pues su esposa esta muy entusiasmada y trabajar juntos para darle lo mejor a su familia. El Sr. Manuel V. solicita recursos por $ 800.00 y pagarlo en un plazo de 12 meses, con estos recursos el planea la adquisición de otra unidad y en la que además incorporará la venta de elotes pues es temporada de frío.
loan_use: buy another sales unit

description:
Mrs. Maria M. Chavez is married woman, she has a daughter. 3 years ago Mrs. M. decided to help her husband with the house expenses. In addition of her necessities she gets in charge of her sister who suffers a handicapped problem. She start selling food to the neighbors; at the present time she already has more clients, and she needs to acquire one more a stove that allows her to prepare more variety of foods, to cover the demand of his clients. On weekends her husband helps her with the food elaboration and distribution. She comments "I need to work very hard; I want that my daughter continues studying because she is very intelligent; she goes to the school and obtain very good notes". Maria Socorro requires $950.00 to grow her business and realizes her objectives.

Español

La Sra. Maria Martínez Chávez es casada y tiene una hija, hace 3 años la Sra. Martínez decidió apoyar a su esposo en el gasto familiar pues además de sus necesidades quedó a cargo de su hermana que sufre de una discapacidad motriz; inició vendiendo comida a vecinos; hoy ya tiene más clientes y necesita adquirir una estufa más grande que le permita preparar más variedad de alimentos para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes. En los fines de semana su esposo le ayuda en la preparación y distribución de lo alimentos que prepara. Ella comenta “Necesito trabajar muy duro; quiero que mi hija siga estudiando pues es muy inteligente; ya va a la escuela y tiene muy buenas notas” María del Socorro requiere $ 950.00. Para hacer crecer su negocio y lograr su objetivo
loan_use: buy a bigger stove and ingredients

description:
Veronica owns a small store where she sells a wide variety of items including: snacks, jewelry, appliances and office supplies. She started her business off with only $5 in capital when she only sold tortillas and coffee. Slowly she began to grow and with the help of her mother she was able to open her small store where she sold rice, sugar, chicken, eggs and other foods. Now she sells many different products that are not food and she still prepares tortillas and coffee on the weekends. Veronica is a single mother who lives with her parents who have supported her since she separated from her husband. She hopes to invest in new and diverse products with the loan she receives from Kiva and Mifex. She is also contemplating opening up a second operation selling clothing.

\r\n\r\n

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.
loan_use: Diversify and increase product offerings

description:
Mrs.Emma Olivares has a beauty shop since 2003.

This is her only source of income, and is in her house.

Mrs. Emma take care of her parents, because they are older.

She decided to install her beauty shop in her house, because she wants to work in her business and take care of her parents.

Her business is in a popular neighborhood, that’s why she has to give a cheaper price on haircuts and sometimes this price is not enough to buy haircut equipment and give maintenance to the beauty shop.

Mrs. Emma is asking for a loan of $900.00 to buy haircut equipment and give maintenance to the beauty shop.

She wants to repay in 12 moths.

Español

La Sr. Emma Olivares C. tiene una estética desde hace 3 años.

Esta es su unica fuente de ingresos, la instalo en su casa.

La Sra. Emma cuida de sus padres, pues son adultos mayores por lo cual decidió poner el negocio en casa y así poder atender tambien a ellos.

Su negocio esta ubicado en un colonia de bajos recursos, por lo que el precio de corte de cabello tiene que ser bajo y en ocaciones esto no le permite comprar equipo para su estetica y darle mantenimiento del negocio.

La Sra. Emma solicita un préstamo de $900.00 para comprar equipo de corte de cabello y para darle mantenimiento a su negocio. el plazo que solicita para pagarlo es de 12 meses.
loan_use: buy equipment and improve commercial location

description:
My name is Yeni Altamirano. I have a business located in the center of my city. I have been selling goods made of plastic for several years. I earn enough to support my family and to pay my suppliers of plastic goods. At this time, I need to supply my business. Clients are asking for a greater variety of goods and I can serve them better this way.\r\n

Loan Use: Purchase of various plastic goods to sell\r\n

Mi nombre es Yeni Altamirano, tengo un negocio uicado en el centro de mi ciudad de venta de productos plasticos, cuento con varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos para cubri los gastos familiares y otros compromisos con los proveedores, actualmente necesito surtir mas mi negocio ya que los clientes solicitan variedad de productos y poder brindar un mejor servicio.
loan_use: Compra de pailas plasticas,valdes,Bajillas de cridrio, escobas, desechables,juguetas,bolsas y otros

description:
For Mr.Eusebio and his wife Maria, The day begins at 3:00 am, they prepare tamales y atole (typical Mexican food), at 6:00 am, Mr. Eusebio goes to schools and crowd places to sell his products. Mr. Eusebio is a person who loves music, he said “Music is and will be the love of my life”. He sings to attract more clients. After he finishes the food sales, he goes to public places and buses to sing. Mr.Eusebio is asking for a loan of $850.00 to buy ingredients and renew his tricycle where he transports the food. This winter seems to be a good sales season for him. He plans to pay back in 12 months. Español

Para el Sr. Eusebio y su esposa María, el día empieza a las 3 de la mañana; preparan tamales y atole (comida y bebida típicas mexicanas) a las 6 de la mañana, el Sr. Eusebio se traslada a escuelas y lugares de afluencia de gente para vender sus productos; el es un apersona que ama la música “La música es y será el amor de mi vida” comenta Don Eusebio; pues como complemento toca la guitarra y canta para atraer a mas clientes. Después de la venta de alimentos se dedica a cantar en plazas públicas y transportes urbanos. Ya que está próximo el invierno, solicita apoyo por $ 850.00 para renovar el medio de trasporte en el cual se transporta el y sus alimentos, así como para adquirir materias primas pues en esta época se incrementa la demanda de sus productos. El Sr.Eusebio planea pagar en 12 meses.
loan_use: buy ingredients and a new tricycle.

description: Vasile is a farmer in the rural Moldovan village of Gradiste, where he is an active community member and strives to be involved in organizations and projects which serve the agricultural sector. He is the director of the local milk-collection cooperative which enables the area’s 75 small milk producers to combine their output and sell it on the regional market. Vasile himself owns three cows and wants to buy a one more now to work towards his goal of seven animals, which will allow him to have a steadier supply of milk, both for his family and for sale. For this he needs a loan.
loan_use: Purchase of a dairy cow

description:
Madam Bether A. is a dynamic and imposing young woman. She was born in Tsévié (district of Zio) in 1966. She is married does not have any child yet, because of reproductive health problems. But she raises her elder sister’s two (02) children. Coming from a very poor family, she had many problems because of the lack of support from her parents. But with eagerness to get out of her miserable situation, she never stopped struggling. In spite of her illiteracy, she is amazingly skillful, and owing to her many efforts, she succeeded in earning a little amount of money and begun a little clothing and other products business (toilet roll, can, generic products, etc.). After a hard beginning, she invested all of her energy and expertise in her activity. That is why she has a little place at the market of Nukafu where she sells to make some money for her survival. Her burning desire is to increase her sale and her source of income so that she can come out of her poverty. The credit of $ 850 she requested will help her buy cloths and essential products (soap, can, milk, etc.) which products are easily marketed in this festive end of year period.

Madame A. Bether est une jeune femme dynamique et imposante née à Tsévié (Préfecture de Zio) en 1966. Elle est mariée mais n’a pas encore d’enfant pour problème de conception. Elle a par contre à sa charge deux (02) enfants de sa grande sœur. Issue d’une famille très pauvre, elle a connu beaucoup de difficultés à cause du manque de soutien de la part de ses parents. Mais voulant à tout prix sortir de sa situation misérable, elle n’a jamais cessé de se battre. Malgré son analphabétisme, elle dispose d’une habileté étonnante, et grâce à ses multiples efforts, elle réussit à gagner un peu d’argent et commença avec $ 55 un petit commerce de pagne et de produits divers (papier hygiénique, boîte de conserve, produits générique etc.). Après un début pénible, elle met toute son énergie et tout son savoir-faire au service de son activité, ce qui lui permet de disposer aujourd’hui d’un petit emplacement au marché de N’kafu où elle exerce son petit commerce pour sa survie. Son désir le plus ardent à ce jour est de pouvoir élargir son commerce et augmenter sa source de revenu afin de sortir de son état de pauvreté. Le crédit de $850 qu’elle sollicite va servir à acheter des pagnes et des produits de première nécessité (savon, boîte de conserve, lait, etc.) lesquels produits s’écoulent facilement en cette période des fêtes de fin d’année.
loan_use: To buy cloths and essential products (soap, can, milk, etc.)

description: Mrs. D. Enabulele, a 42 years old caterer in one of the ancient streets in Benin City, specializes in providing special food for people in her environment. She planned to improve her business with food ingredients for preparing food for sale to the public.
loan_use: To buy food ingredients for preparing food \r\nfor sale to the public \r\n

description:
Elena V. is 39 years old and keeps a little coffee shop in Blagoevgrad. Many years she and her husband were unemployed.

Two years ago their friend borrowed them some money and they found this coffee shop. Now both Elena and her husband work in it and the coffee shop is the only income resource for the family.

Elena and her husband need a new coffee making machine so they apply for this $ 700 loan
loan_use: For a new coffee making machine

description: Rosemary is married with four children.She lives in Makangarawe area of Dar es Salaam.Her two sons are in secondary school.Rosemary is self employed and own a shop near her residence.The shop sells different consumable items.Mainly food items,which have high demand.The shop provides her with an opportunity to raise her children.She would like to expand her business so that she can meet costs of educating her children.The shop employs herself and her sister.To expand her business she needs USD 750.
loan_use: WORKING CAPITAL

description:
Married and without children, but with two (02) dependants, Madam Adjo A., was born on January 2nd, 1978 at Ahépé in the prefecture of Yoto, she is a hair dresser who exercises, beside her hairdressing salon, the beauty products trading. Issued from a numerous family and very poor, she has the mishap to marry an unemployed husband and all the family charges remain on her. However, her husbands, an accountant by trade but jobless, train her in accountancy to allow her to better manage her businesses. From her cleverness and experience, she succeeded to manage and repaid without incident her three first credits. Today, she is requesting a credit of $1000 to acquire a modern hair drier to buy and resell beauty products. She is convinced that this project will strengthen the increasing and profitability of her activities, and will develop her incomes to improve her family living conditions.

Mariée et sans enfant, mais avec deux (02) personnes en charge, Madame A. Adjovi Epiphanie, née le 2 Janvier 1978 à Ahépé dans la préfecture de Yoto, est une coiffeuse qui exerce, à côté de son salon de coiffure, le commerce des produits cosmétiques. Issue d’une famille nombreuse et très pauvre, elle a eu la malchance d’épouser un mari sans emploi et toutes les charges familiales reposent sur elle. Toutefois, son mari, un comptable de formation en chômage, lui donne des cours sur la comptabilité pour lui permettre de mieux gérer ses affaires. De par sa spécialisation et son expérience, elle su gérer et rembourser sans incident ses trois premiers crédits. Elle sollicite aujourd’hui, un crédit de $1000 pour acquérir un séchoir moderne et pour acheter des produits cosmétiques. Elle est convaincue que ce projet renforcera la croissance et la rentabilité de ses activités, et augmentera ses revenus pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
loan_use: to acquire a modern hair drier to buy and resell beauty products

description:
Flerida has a stand where she sells fruit in a local market. She started off with a very small amount of investment capital and with her husband’s help learned the trade quickly. She has been doing this type of work for about 10 years along with her husband. The most difficult part of this business is offering competitive prices to the customer. In order to do this Flerida has requested a loan so that she may purchase her fruits at wholesale quantities and prices. She and her husband have three children together including one who they are currently putting through college. Her dream is to have all her kids attain a college degree.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.
loan_use: Buy large amounts of fruits for her market

description:
Rosa runs a small store where she sells snacks and other groceries. She is asking for a loan in order to buy her products at wholesale quantities. Currently she cannot buy in large amounts and she sees her profits suffer. Her home is located in a very rough sector of Guayaquil. She lives up a dirt hill which makes it very difficult to transport groceries and merchandise, especially in the rainy season when the hill is muddy. Part of her business is made of cement but she aspires to make many more improvements to her home. She and her husband have three kids and their goal is to provide them with a good education.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.
loan_use: Buy her merchandise at wholesale quantities

description:
My name is Alba V. and I make and sell snacks such as tortillas with quesillo, bread with beans, pancakes, baleadas(traditional honduran taco), enchiladas, tacos, emparedados, tortas, fried plantains, chilaquiles, sliced banana, soups, lunches and breakfasts. I have had my business for 5 years and I have many customers as my business is located near a bus station. My business creates an income to support my family, and my goal is to expand my inventory so that I can have better production and with the earnings I can remodel my business and educate my two children.

\r\nMi nombre es Alba V. me dedico a la produccion y venta de golosinas como ser tortillas con quesillo, pan con frijoles, panqueques, baleadas, enchiladas, tacos, emparedados, tortas, platanos fritos, chilaquiles, tajaditas de platano, sopas, almuerzos y desayunos, tengo mi negocio hace unos 5 años, mi clientela es muy buena ya que estoy ubicada cerca de una estacion de buses, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el mantenimiento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mis inventarios y asi tener una mayor produccion y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi negocio y darles un buen estudio a mis dos hijos.
loan_use:
To purchase beef, chicken, pork, vegetables, salt, water, oil, lard, sodas, disposible plates and cups, tortillas, beans, rice, bread, coffee, sugar, confectionaries, juices, butter, quesillo(traditional white cheese), cheese, milk, kitchen utensils.

Compra de carne de res, pollo, cerdo, vegetales, sal, agua, aceite, manteca, refrescos, platos y vasos desechables, tortillas, frijoles, arroz, pan, cafe, azucar, confites, jugos, mantequilla, quesillo, queso, leche, utencilios de cocina.

description:
My name is Jenny H. and I fabricate and sell tortillas. I have had my business for 3 years and I have many customers as I distribute my products in a bus station. My business has generated income enough to support my family and my goal is to expand my inventory in order to have better production. With the added earnings I would continue to support my family and to give a better education to my daughter who is now of school age.

\r\nMi nombre es Jenny H. me dedico a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tengo mi negocio hace unos 3 años, mi clientela es muy buena ya que reparto mi producto en una estacion de buses, mi negocio me genera ingresos para sustentar mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mayor produccion y con las ganancias poder mantener mi familia y darle un buen estudio a mi hija que esta en edad para ingresar a la escuela.
loan_use:
To purchase cornflour, lime, salt, water, firewood, matches, and carbon.

compra de harina de maiz, cal, sal, agua, leña, fosforos, carbon.

description: A woman of 43 years old married with six (6) children, lives in semi-urban area of Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria, she started her business in the year 1985. She specialists in the sales of food items. According to her, the above amount will be a good help to her in other to expand her business.
loan_use: To buy more food items for sale \t\r\n

description:
I have a business located in the bus terminal of my neighborhood. It is a family business, attended by my wife in the mornings and myself in the afternoon, we are open from Monday to Saturday. This business generates what is necessary to cover family expenses and the education of my children. At this time we need to invest more to buy apples, grapes, and sweet christmas pears as people are buying more and the fruits are seasonal.

\r\nMi negocio lo tengo ubicado en la terminal de buses de mi colonia, este negocio es familiar lo atiende mi esposa por las mañanas y por las tardes lo atiendo yo, lo atendemos de lunes a sabado. Este negocio nos genera lo necesario para los gastos de mi familia y los estudios de mis tres hijos. En esta epoca necesito invertir en comprar manzanas, uvas, peras dulces navideños ya que las personas compran mas, ya que son frutas de temporada.
loan_use:
To purchase chewing gum, sweets, churros and fruits.

Compra de chiclets, confites, churros, frutas.

description:
Dimitar (Mitko) was 7 years old when he started to play the saxophone. He played throughout childhood, studied music at Burgas University for four years and was subsequently in the Bulgarian military band for two years (1972-1974) during the cold war. After completing his military service he was a part of the Bulgarian National Orchestra, a small group that was allowed to travel around the Eastern Block highlighting Bulgarian culture. During this period, Mitko had to work hard to get copies of the music of his favorite Western musician, Louis Armstrong, as no Western music or books were allowed in Bulgaria.

After the state orchestra was dismantled, Mitko returned to his Roma neighborhood in Sliven. (The Roma, often referred to as gypsies in the West, are a severely marginalized group on the Balkan Peninsula of Southeastern Europe.) Now in his early 60s, he works Roma weddings and banquets from fall to the spring and Black Sea beach resorts in the summer.

This loan will enable Dimitar to purchase a new saxophone; the one he uses in this video is held together in parts by hair bands and paper clips. His repayment schedule has smaller payments in the winter while business is slow, and larger payments next summer to pay down debt more quickly as his income increases. Mitko has 2 kids – 29 and 27 – and 2 grandchildren as seen in the video.

A short video of Mitko can be seen here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OwdFzrFg9_4
loan_use: New saxophone

description: Elisaveta has a colorful table at the outdoor market in the center of her hometown of Cahul. In nice weather people wander the isles between booths and browse each vendor’s selection. Many of those looking for good clothing, however, often don’t bother searching around but rather head straight to Elisaveta. They know she will have a great variety of children’s clothes, hats, scarves, etc. For three years now she has been at this place, working together with one employee to fill in for her when she has to run errands and buy goods to re-stock the inventory. Elisaveta would like a loan to cover the costs of the next several shipments of clothing she hopes to purchase for the winter season.
loan_use: Working capital

description: Nina and her husband have two sons, now in their late teens, and have always been involved with youth in their village. When her husband recently retired from being the village’s dentist, a position he had filled for ten years, Nina decided it was a good time to fulfill her dream of opening a place for young people to socialize. To make a viable business she came to the idea of opening a pizzeria that would attract youngsters from the area. She wants it to be a positive and safe place for youth, with current music and inexpensive food. The latter goal will be met by purchasing frozen pizzas from a Moldovan company and preparing them as they are ordered. She is also planning to have ice cream and of course various drinks. The whole family has been helping with preparing everything necessary, including renovating the building, and will continue to be involved. With a location near a lake that’s popular in the summer, Nina hopes to also add an outdoor terrace. She now needs a loan to purchase a large refrigerator / freezer and to cover the costs of initial inventory of food and supplies. Her sons’ friends and youth from the whole village are eagerly anticipating the opening of the pizzeria and Nina is looking forward to creating a welcoming atmosphere for them!
loan_use: Purchase of a refrigerator and inventory

description: Josephine A. is a colleague participant of Julie of Sibebe Enterprise. Mama Josephine, as she is popularly called, sells variety of products to members of the community called Christian Village with a population of of about 25,000 inhabitants. She has prepared a business plan and she keeps simple basic accounting records of her activities. She requires a loan of $700 to improve her business transactions.
loan_use: Working Capital

description:
38-year-old Sarvat lives his family life with 3 children. His family’s living condition is not good enough. The family income is rather limited. He is an internall displaced person (IDP). Since 2002 Sarvat has been engaged in selling home apliances .

He applies for a loan amount of $1000 for the first time to further develop his business, to buy new home apliances, to increase his incomes, to improve his family\'s living condition with this additional income, and to obtain some funds for the education of his children.
loan_use: To expand his business

description:
Carmen sells cosmetics, clothes and jewelry. She has been in this line of work for about 8 years. Prior to this, she had a small stand where she sold fruits and vegetables, but she had to close down after she became ill. After she got better, she decided to start a business that was more flexible. She sells all types of women’s items to her friends and neighbors. Carmen needs the loan in order to make a last round of investments before the year closes.

Carmen has three children, two of which are already working. Her youngest child, a nine year old boy, has a mental disability. It is very rough for her to raise him because she has limited access to psychological and medical services, but her son receives all the love and care her family can offer.
loan_use: Carmen needs the loan in order to make a last round of investments before the year closes.

description:
Alexandra needs the loan in order to continue making improvements to the business. Although the front part of her store, which is pictured, is made out of cement, the inside is still wood and is vulnerable to damage from heavy rains. She also wants to invest in toys to sell from her store for the Christmas season.

Alexandra is 40 years old and has 3 children. Her husband is her right hand man in business and in life. They are a very united family and believe firmly in the value of education for the children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.
loan_use: She needs the loan in order to continue making improvements to the business

description:
With an educational level of class CM2, Mr Mawulawoè E. was born in 1967 at Dangbessito in the district of Sanguéra. He is a monogamous father of four children, with one other dependent child. His main occupation is raising pigs, and he wishes to improve this business with a loan of $1000. This money would allow him to obtain a better breed of pigs, and to buy veterinary services and food for the animals. His current and potential future clientele represents a major asset for the success and durability of his venture. The ideal fulfillment of this project will allow him to increase his income considerably, with a view to making improvements for his family.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, a Kiva volunteer.

Du niveau de la classe de CM2, Monsieur E. Mawulawoè est né en 1967 à Dangbessito dans le canton de Sanguéra. Il est monogame et père de quatre (04) enfants et a un autre enfant à sa charge. Il a pour activité principale l’élevage de porcs qu’il souhaite améliorer à travers un crédit de $1000. Ce fonds lui permettra de se procurer d’une race améliorée de porcs, de s’acheter un service vétérinaire et des provendes pour les bêtes. La clientèle actuelle et potentielle qu’il dispose est un atout majeur pour la bonne réussite et la pérennité de ses activités. La parfaite réalisation de ce projet lui permettra d’augmenter sensiblement ses revenus en vue de l’amélioration acceptable de sa famille.
loan_use: to obtain a better breed of pigs, and to buy veterinary services and food for the animals

description: Sevda M. – E. is 45 years old. She is married and her husband has his own construction business. During her whole life Sevda has worked in the field of trade so in 2001 she decides to start her own trade business. She opens a stall on which she sells clothes and socks. She is running her business alone and has no help of anybody. Now she wants to open another stall and to supply it with clothes and needs $ 2 000.
loan_use: To open and supply another stall

description: Aihan J. is 31 years old and lives in Kardjali. He is married and ahs a son of 3. His wife is unemployed. Aihan graduated economy and before the start of his business has worked as an accountant. In 2004 he and his associate Subai Mehmed decided to rent a place in the town and make it a pizza restaurant. Subai has some experience in such business because he has worked as a barman in some restaurants and cafes for very long time. Now Aihan J. and his associate need . The loan amount is $ 2 000.
loan_use: To buy a new special pizza oven

description: Dimo P. is 22 years old. He is a second year law student in University. Although his dream is to be a lawer Dimo is familiar wit agriculture since he was a little boy. His family has always have an agriculture business and he knows almost everything about it. So two years ago Dimo decides to start own business. So he builds a greenhouse in the yard of his house and starts growing vegetables, especially cucumbers. The money that he earns of this business Dimo spends to pay his university fees. Dimo P. applies for $ 1 000 loan which he will use to supply seedings and fertilizers for his vegetable growing business. \r\n
loan_use: To supply seedings and fertilizers

description: Radostin K. is 38 years old. He lives in the village of Trapoklovo that is situated on a main highroad that connects Sliven and Bourgas. Radostin is an orphan since he was six and he has always coped with difficulties alone. He has a business for mire than ten years. Radostin keeps a fast food restaurant and a small general shop on the same highroad. Now he is building a bakery and a grocery store on the center of the village he lives in. They are going to be ready in a few months and now Radostin Ivanov needs some financial help for their equipment. He needs to buy a dough-kneader and two ovens for the bakery. The loan amount is $ 2000.
loan_use: To buy a dough-kneader and two ovens for the bakery

description:
Victor R. has 25 years of experience selling shoes, clothes, and he started working in Bahia, Ecuador. He worked for a boss who had the idea to work on foot and sell shoes in the local pueblos. After breaking off from this small business, Victor and his wife decided they would go into business together, and they followed a similar model from Victor’s previous job. They had success early on because they knew exactly whichi towns were the most lucrative, and they offered promotions to the best buyers, whom they knew personally. Each day they work from 5am until 10pm. They have recently been so focused on sales that they have not had the time to replenish their inventory with new stock, so they sell goods in the morning and then use the proceeds from those sales to buy just enough shoes to still sell in the afternoon. Victor’s wife is a great salesperson, and she typically goes to the small towns and local festivals which occur fairly often. They have two grown children who help sell their goods, and the family unit has maintained strong over the years. Their house is their greatest collateral. 

Victor needs this loan so that he can increase the volume of shoes and clothing  in stock to sell when the Riveras go to market.  He is a 48 year-old with four children, who of whom work for the family business. His wife is his right hand, and he could not do anything without her. She is responsible for the finances, taking care of the house, and looking after the children. They saved enough money to move out of Victor’s mother-in-law’s house, which was putting pressure on everyone. Their new home was made of cane and they slept on the floor. Now, after working hard, they enjoy a house that is made of concrete, and each child has a room of his own. The Riveras are proud to have gotten out of their previouos situation, which was dire poverty. Although they are still poor, they enjoy a standard of living that most do not have in Ecuador. Their wish is to continue growing the business and open a store located next to their house.
loan_use: Victor needs this loan so that he can increase the volume of shoes and clothing  in stock to sell when the Riveras go to market.

description: Madam N. operates the Vquaye Ventures as a food distribution depot for the community, which has about 15,000 people living in the area. Madam N.'s activity ensures that food is available to the community and especially the schools all year round. She travels frequently to up north the country to purchase the food items and then preserves them in the food storage facility she operates at home. She has been a participant of the TEACH lending programs of Kraban and keeps systematic but simple records of her activities. She wants a KIVA LOAN of $1000 to expand her community food distribution business.
loan_use: Working Capital

description: A. sells cooked food to the community and other neighbors. A. has improved her sales through the TEACH lending program she participated in. She now keeps simple records of her business. She has considerably improved her sales through the TEACH lessons taught. If she is provided with a loan of $700 from KIVA she will greatly increase her profitability level.
loan_use: Working Capital

description:
My name is Ana F., I make and sell tortillas. I have had my business for about 3 years, and I sell to several markets and small stores in the area, which helps me support my family. My goal is to be able to hire other people so that production and sales keep growing. I will use the profit from my sales to remodel my one room house and give my children a better education.\r\n

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

\r\nMi nombre es Ana F. me dedico a la fabricacion y venta de tortillas, tengo mi negocio hace unos 3 años, y mis ventas las realizo en varios negocios como ser mercaditos y pulperias de la localidad, dicha actividad me ayuda a mantener a mi familia, mi meta es poder darle trabajo a otras personas para que mi produccion aumente y tambien las ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi casa de habitacion y darle un mejor estudios a mi hijos.
loan_use: To buy corn flour, salt, lime, water, matches, wood, coal.

description:
My name is Ruth M.. I sell products that are popular in demand. My business is about 4 years old. My clients are from my neighborhood and business is very good because I’m located in front of a public school. My business helps me support my family and I would like in the future to be able to hire other people to improve customer service for my clients. With the profits I would remodel my one room house, support my family and provide good schooling for my children.\r\n

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.
