\r\nMi nombre es Ruth M. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo mi negocio hace unos 4 años, mis clientes son de mi localidad y son muy buenos ya que estoy ubicada en frente de una escuela publica, dicha actividad me ayuda a mantener a mi familia y me gustaría en mi futuro poder darle trabajo a otras personas para una mejor atencion a mis clientes y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi casa de habitacion, mantener a mi familia y darle un buen estudio a mis dos hijas.
loan_use: To buy oil, butter, churros, rice, beans, sugar, corn, coffee, sodas, eggs, juices, toilet paper, feminine pads, poultry, sausages, spices, salt, margarine, candy, cookies, bread, soap, toothpaste.

description: Madam Doris O. is a trader of vegetables including onions, tomatoes, carrots, cabbages, spices. Her market is vibrant since she sells to a large group of people. She is therefore seeking a loan of $800.00 from Kiva to enable her expand her business. Madam Doris O. is very hard working and capable of paying back because she has been with KSF and benefited from TEACH lending product. She therefore has knowledge in simple record keeping and accounting.
loan_use: Working Capital

description:
Juanita is very creative, enterprising, and hard-working; she is 45 years old and has a beautiful family with one son and one beautiful daughter. Her husband is employed by a private company, but his wages are not enough to cover all of the family\\\\\\\'s expenses. Juanita thought about supporting her husband by starting a business; she knew that her oldest son was in college, and that her home expenses had increased, so she began her own business; the business sells paintings/pictures and home decorations. Juanita\\\'s job has allowed her to pay for schooling for her children. She hopes that they both finish college. So, she needs $550.00 USD to buy more merchandise that will allow her to meet with the great demand generated this Christmas season. She and her family need your support and generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Juanita es una persona muy creativa, emprendedora y trabajadora; tiene 45 años D. edad y cuenta con una hermosa familia compuesta por un hijo y una hermosa niña. Su esposo es un empleado D. una empresa privada, sin embargo su salario no es suficiente para cubrir con los gastos D. L. familia. Juanita pensó en apoyar a su esposo haciendo un negocio, elL. sabía que su hijo mayor estaba en L. universidad y los gastos del hogar son mayores, por lo que inició su propio negocio; este consiste en L. venta D. cuadros y artículos decorativos para el hogar.

Para Juanita su trabajo le ha permitido pagar los estudios D. sus chicos, y espera que cada uno termine L. universidad, por lo que elL. necesita D. $550 USD para comprar una mayor cantidad D. mercancía que le permita enfrentar L. alta demanda generada por esta temporada naviD.ña. ElL. y su familia requieren tu apoyo y generosidad.
loan_use: Purchase Merchandise

description:
Nofal is a young businessmen. He has his own market. He has been selling the souvenirs since 2001. When he began his business he borrowed the loan amount of $400 and bought the souvenirs. 
The second time he borrowed $1000 to increase the amount of the souvenirs. 
He applies for the loan amount of $1500 to expand his business, to sell the manufactured goods 
( light industry ). 
This 30-year-old businessmen is from Kalbacar region. The single man was settled in Absheron region Masazir village.
The single man was settled in Absheron region Masazir village.
loan_use: To buy  of manufactured goods ( light industry )

description: Mariana D. is from Silistra town. She and her husband have worked several years in Spain. Two years ago they returned to Bulgaria. Until this moment they both are unemployed. That is why they decided to open a bar.  \r\nThey rented a former bar that needed a basic repair. With this loan they will repaired it and supplied the bar with the necessary goods to start-up.\r\n
loan_use: Repair and equipment of a bar

description:
Telesia is married with 5 children.

She joined SPBD in 2004 and used her first loan to make icy poles. With her subsequent loans she started a small general store which she has built from there. On her last loan she also started a BBQ which she carries out beside her shop on Fridays and Saturdays.

She is the leader of her village loan group and is known for being very tough in enforcing the group guarantee.
loan_use: Stock for the shop and home improvement

description:
Born in 1960 in Anfoin-Kpodji, Mr. Agossou K. raises livestock. He is married and the father of three children. Having a good business sense, he realized there is a terrible dearth of feed in the area. And so he has an idea that would further his livestock business. But his new business venture requires substantial capital that he does not have. He has however an excellent credit history with a previous $550 loan that he repaid without a problem.

Given the ever-increasing demands that he has not been able to meet, Mr. K. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to stockpile enough feed in case of shortages. The success of his plan will expand his business and increase his income considerably. He could then better support his family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1960 Anfoin-Kpodji, Monsieur K. Agossou est éleveur de bétails. Il est marié et père de trois (03) enfants. Il a le sens des affaires et a pu déceler le manque cruel de provende dans la région et en fait un projet complémentaire à son élevage. Or, cette nouvelle activité nécessite un fonds de roulement consistant qu’il ne dispose pas. Aussi, a-t-il obtenu un crédit de $550 qu’il avait su bien géré et régulièrement remboursé sans incident. Vu les demandes sans cesse croissantes qu’il n’arrive pas à satisfaire, Monsieur K. Agossou sollicite un crédit de $1200 pour acheter des provendes et avoir un stock de sécurité. La réalisation de ce projet va accroître ses activités et augmenter considérablement ses revenus. Ce qui lui permettra de mieux entretenir sa famille.
loan_use: to buy feed for a dependable supply

description:
Madame A. Kuya was born December 31st, 1965 and is the mother of four children. Tireless and very dedicated, she has the sense of a good educator and struggles for her children’s success. She lives in Gapé where she works in pottery and puts her income towards household expenses. This is a successful business activity because in her area large clay pots are used for cooking in the kitchen. With inadequate finance however, she is unable to meet market demand. Today Madame A. seeks a new loan of $750 which will serve as capital to increase her output. She possesses sound morals and deserves support to continue her activities in order to change her living conditions.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Kuya est née le 31 Décembre 1965 et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Infatigable et très dévouée, elle a le sens d’une bonne éducatrice et se bat pour la réussite de ses enfants. Elle vit à Gapé où elle exerce comme activité la poterie pour contribuer aux charges du ménage avec les revenus. C’est une activité qui marche bien car dans sa localité les marmites sont utilisé comme ustensiles de cuisine. Avec ses moyens dérisoires, elle n’arrive pas à satisfaire les demandes du marché. Aujourd’hui Madame A. sollicite un nouveau crédit de $750 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce en vue d’augmenter sa production. Elle jouit d’une bonne moralité et mérite des soutiens pour continuer ses activités en vue d’un changement de ses conditions de vie.
loan_use: increase pottery production

description:
Hi, my name is Laura. I have a small business making dairy products, located in my house for the past three years. This business generates income for my family and for the costs of educating my children. Right now I have one child in grammar school and another in high school. I have also been able to make improvements to my house.

Translated from Spanish by Ruth, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Laura, cuento con una pequeño negocio de productos lacteos,ubicado en mi casa de habitación, desde hace 3 años, actividad que me permimte generar ingresos para mis gastos familiares y gastos de estudio de mis hijos actualmente tengo en el colegio y el la Escuela, tambien he logrado hacerle mejoras a mi vivienda.
loan_use: To buy milk, salt, rennet, soap and wood.

description:
Telmo owns a small store that he runs with his wife. He has been selling various articles for about 14 years. The store is located in a section of his home. His wife attends to the store during the day while Telmo sells fruits and other articles from a tricycle cart. He needs the loan in order to restock the store at his home. He is recovering from a recent surgery he had on his gull bladder that has not allowed him to have the money to reinvest in his store. He and his wife have twins together. They are hoping that with this loan they will be able to reactivate the business.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.
loan_use: He needs the loan in order to restock the store at his home.

description:
Araceli, her husband and their three children live in Monclova, Coahuila. With the prime goal of helping her husband with the family costs she opened a shoe and clothing store some 12 years ago, a good match for her because she loves sales and is a proficient saleswoman. Throughout the years Araceli has kept up her business with much effort and dedication. And through this business she has been able to provide education for her three children.

In order to keep the business growing she needs a loan of $925 to purchase seasonal clothing and shoes. She plans to repay the loan within three months. It is important for Araceli and her family to have your support.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Araceli, su esposo y sus tres hijos, viven en la localidad de Monclova, Coahuila. Con él propósito fundamental de ayudar a su esposo con el gasto familiar, hace 12 años que ella comenzó con un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa y calzado, aprovechando el tener gusto y facilidad para las ventas. A lo largo de estos años Araceli con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha mantenido su negocio, y de ésta manera también ha logrado costear el estudio de sus hijos, pues los tres son estudiantes.

Para seguir creciendo ella requiere de un préstamo de $925 dólares para poder comprar ropa y zapatos de temporada, planeando cubrirlo en su totalidad en un plazo de 3 meses. Es importante para Araceli y su familia el apoyo que tú puedes brindarles, vuélvete parte de sus logros.
loan_use: Purchase merchandise

description:
Veronica is mother of two young children aged 10 and 3 years of age, and they live in Escobedo, Neuvo Leon. Her husband is a laborer and his income is very modest. They have faced many economic difficulties, the reason why Veronica wanted to help and ease their situation by selling candies and snacks. It is already 8 years now that she started her small business and it has grown a little at a time. Thanks to her efforts she has b een able to provide for her children and has given them an education. Now she needs a loan of $200 to keep up the business.

She will use the loan to stock her supplies and vary the products she sells, and therefore increase her sales. She plans on repaying this loan within 3 months. Veronica needs your support. The family thanks you for it.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

En Escobedo Nuevo León vive Doña Verónica, madre de dos pequeños de 10 y tres años. Su esposo es obrero y su sueldo es muy bajo, por lo que presentan muchas dificultades económicas, es por ello que Verónica pensó en ayudar a resolver un poco éste problema vendiendo dulces, frituras y golosinas. Ya son 8 años desde que inició ésta pequeña empresa y ha ido creciendo poco a poco. Gracias al esfuerzo que ella ha realizado ha podido brindarle a sus hijos sustento y educación, pero ahora ella necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $200 DLLS para poder continuar.

Ella utilizará el crédito para comprar más variedad y cantidad de mercancía y de ésta forma poder incrementar sus ventas, ella planea cubrir el monto total del crédito en un lapso de 3 meses. Es momento de apoyar a Verónica en esté proyecto, decídete y contribuye al bienestar de su familia. Ellos de te lo agradecen mucho.
loan_use: Purchase merchandise

description:
Sixteen years ago Rosaura decided to start selling cosmetics and shoes by catalogue given their difficult economic situation. Her husband\'s income as a driver was modest. They have 4 children that need an education. Through this business the family\'s welfare has been established and an education for their children has been secured. Strength, enthusiasm, and perseverence are the qualities that define Rosaura and, with the support of her family, she has been able to achieve her goals.

She requires a loan of $250 to purchase more items for resale, to increase her sales. You have the power to help her and her family. They are grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace 16 años Rosaura decidió comenzara vender cosméticos y zapatos por catalogo, debido a las dificultades que enfrentaban por el poco sueldo que su esposo, quien es chofer, percibía. Pues tienen 4 hijos quienes requieren de educación. Esta actividad ha ayudado mucho al bienestar de la familia y asegura la educación de sus hijos. Fortaleza, entusiasmo y perseverancia son cualidades que definen a Rosaura y ella con el apoyo de su familia ha logrado lo que se ha propuesto.

Ella esta requiriendo de un préstamo de $250 DLLS para poder comprar más mercancía y de esta forma incrementar sus ventas. Tu tienes la posibilidad de ayudarla, ella y su familia te lo agradecen.
loan_use: Purchase merchandise

description: Ramla is 34 years old,married with three children.She lives in Kigamboni area of Dar es Salaam.Ramla sells home use plastic products.She purchase these products from wholesellers at town center,hire a car and stock them in her store.She has been in this business for more than six years.She has experienced minimal improvements over the years.She learned from experience that,if she increase the size of her business she would experience ‘economies of scale’,thus enjoy the benefits of large scale operations.Hence she is in need of USD 550 to increase the size of the stock.
loan_use: Adding stock

description:
Abibatou D. was born in Atakpamé in 1972. Her husband is medical assistant assigned to Tsévié, the city where she owns a cafeteria called \"Café d’Or\". She is the mother of three children. Very energetic and friendly, she contributes enormously towards covering household expenses, since what her husband makes is not enough. With her 7th grade education, Mrs. D. runs her business well. As an honest woman with an instinct for overseeing other people’s property, she seems to be trustworthy, having repaid two initial loans without a problem. Her cafeteria would have been more profitable if she had obtained a bigger loan. So, to enhance her business and augment her income, Abibatou is requesting a loan of $750 to outfit her cafeteria and to stock up on cartons of milk, glasses, egg trays, and other cafeteria items. Her plan will certainly help improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Mariée à un infirmier affecté à Tsévié d’où elle tient une cafétéria, Madame D. Abibatou, née en 1972 à Atakpamé est mère de trois (03) enfants. Dynamique et très sociable, elle participe énormément aux besoins de son foyer car les seuls salaires de son mari ne suffisent pour couvrir toutes les charges de la famille. Avec son niveau de la classe de 5ème, Madame D. gère au mieux ses activités. Honnête et ayant le sens de la bonne gestion du bien d’autrui, elle a donné l’impression d’une femme de confiance à travers ses deux premiers obtenus et remboursés sans incident. Ses affaires auraient pu être plus rentable si elle avait bénéficié d’un crédit plus consistant. Ainsi, pour accroître ses activités et augmenter ses revenus, Abibatou sollicite un crédit de $750 qui va servir à aménager sa cafétéria et s’approvisionner en cartons de lait, des tasses, de plateaux d’œufs, et d’autres éléments qui entrent dans le domaine de cafétéria. Avec ce projet, elle pourra, d’une certaine manière, contribuer au mieux à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.
loan_use: To outfit and supply her cafeteria with necessities

description:
Véronique A. was born in Tsévié in 1976. She finished middle school in Aného before returning to her hometown. No longer able to continue her education due to a lack of support, she trained as a seamstress. But with her instinct for business, she soon started buying and selling colorful traditional cloths between Togo and Côte d’Ivoire. Although the crisis in Côte d’Ivoire ended her business, she adroitly made use of the situation to start up her dressmaking shop again, which she calls «Dieu Est Grand», or God Is Great. Mrs. A. is the second wife of her husband, a medical assistant. Her husband is polygamous, irresponsible, and hardly bothers with the family. So everything rests on her shoulders.

Mrs. A. would like to add to her dressmaking business to boost her income. To do this, she is requesting a loan of $950 to buy a sewing machine, some traditional cloths, and boutique materials. The success of her plans will clearly augment her income and allow her to improve the living conditions for her two children and her little sister.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1976 à Tsévié, Madame A. Véronique a fait ses études primaires et secondaires à Aného avant de revenir dans sa ville natale. Ne pouvant plus continuer les études par manque de support, elle s’est formée en couture. Mais, ayant le goût du commerce, elle s’est lancée très tôt dans le commerce des pagnes entre le Togo et la Côte d’Ivoire. Avec la crise ivoirienne, ses affaires ne marchent plus et très ingénieuse, elle a profité de ce temps pour reprendre son atelier de couture. Elle est la seconde épouse d’un infirmier polygame irresponsable qui ne s’occupe guère de la famille et tout repose sur Véronique.

Aujourd’hui, Madame A. Véronique veut associer le commerce à la couture pour renforcer ses revenus. Pour ce faire, elle sollicite un crédit de $950 pour acheter une machine à coudre, des pagnes et les articles de mercerie. Il est évident que la réalisation de projet augmentera les revenus de Mme A. Véronique pour lui permettre d’améliorer les conditions de ses deux enfants et sa jeune sœur.
loan_use: To buy a sewing machine, some traditional fabrics, and boutique materials

description:
Kossi Joseph K. was born in Davéli-Tsévié in 1973. The son of peasants, he used to spend all his time with his father in the fields, which prevented him from continuing his education beyond the 5th grade. Benefitting from the support of his village, he was able to learn woodturning. With an initial loan of $550 that he repaid in regular installments, he was able to open his own workshop, which he named «Aimons la Vie», that is, Let’s Love Life. Very energetic and of good conscience, he extended the reach of his business into certain villages near Tsévié. He is married and the father of three children. His wife got training in hairdressing with his help and support. An honest man, Joseph can be trusted, and he has efficiently mastered his business.

Mr. K. is requesting a loan of $1,500 which in part will serve to buy a new machine and to pay for boards. It will also serve to open a hairdressing salon for his wife. The will allow his wife to help with household expenses in order to better ensure the welfare of the entire family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur K. Kossi Joseph est née en 1973 à Davéli-Tsévié. Fils de paysans, il passait tout son temps à accompagner son père au champs ce qui à fait qu’il n’a pas pu continuer ses études au delà du cours primaire. Bénéficiant de l’appui de certains partenaires du village, il a pu apprendre le tournage du bois. Grâce à son premier crédit de $550 obtenu et régulièrement remboursé, il a pu ouvrir son propre atelier de travail. Très dynamique et de bonne foi, il a étendu son champ d’action dans certains villages proches de Tsévié. Marié, il est père de trois (03) enfants, il a su aider sa femme à se former à la coiffure. Honnête, Joseph est un homme de confiance qui gère avec efficacité ses affaires qu’il maîtrise assez bien.

Monsieur K. Kossi Joseph sollicite aujourd’hui, un crédit de $1500 va servir d’une part, à acheter une nouvelle machine et à payer les planches et d’autre part, à ouvrir un salon de coiffure pour sa femme. Ceci va permettre à sa femme de l’aider dans les dépenses du foyer afin de mieux assurer le bien-être de toute la famille.
loan_use: To purchase a new machine and lumber

description: This single man was born in 1981 in Salyan region Yenikand village. He likes the animals. He started his business 2 years ago. Natik wants to expand his business. \r\nHe applies for the loan amount $800 to buy 3 cattle. He is very opimistic about the future of his business.
loan_use: to buy 3 cattle

description:
Responsibility, strenght and proactiveness are the characteristics that define Guadalupe, that is married and is mother of two children, still minors. Her husband holds a casual job, for which the income is never stable in their home. It is for this difficult situation that for Guadalupe started to sell shoes by catalogue, already four years ago, and this way help have a little more income to cover the costs of the education for her little ones. But to be able to meet the strong demands she has during this season, she requires a loan of $250, of which she plans to repay in a term of 3 months.

Her primary concern is to secure the well-being and education of her little ones, it is this why she now needs your support, become part of the successes of Guadalupe and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Responsabilidad, fortaleza y proactividad, son características que definen a Guadalupe, quien es casada y madre de dos hijos aun menores de edad. Su esposo posee un trabajo eventual, por lo que lo ingresos nunca son seguros en su hogar. Es por esta difícil situación por la que Guadalupe, hace ya 4 años comenzó a vender zapatos por catálogo, y así poder tener un poco más de ingresos para poder hacer frente a los gastos de educación de sus pequeños. Pero para poder cubrir el fuerte pedido que tiene en ésta temporada, ella requiere de un préstamo de 250 DLLS, mismos que planea regresar en un plazo de 3 meses.

Su principal preocupación es asegurar el bienestar y educación de sus pequeños, es por ello que ahora necesita de tu ayuda, se parte de los logros Guadalupe y su familia.
loan_use: To purchase merchandise

description:
Felipa is mother of three children, two of which are married and the youngest one is currently studying a professional career. Her husband works as a taxi driver, for which his income is very variable. For this reason two years ago she started to sell shoes by catalogue. Her primary goal is to see her son finish his university studies, it is for him that she has fought so hard to continue this project. Without this business she would have no resources to cover the cost of their son’s education.

To realize her dream, Felipa requires a loan of $475 that will be put towards the purchase of merchandise to increase her sales, but more importantly to be able to pay off some outstanding accounts, for if she does not pay them she will not be able to go on. You have the power to help her and contribute to the training of their children. Make your decision – they thank you for it.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Felipa es madre de 3 hijos, dos de ellos están casados y el más pequeño se encuentra estudiando una carrera profesional. Su esposo trabaja en un taxi, por lo que sus ingresos son muy variables y eventuales, por esta razón hace 2 años ella comenzó a vender zapatos por catálogo. Su principal objetivo es que su hijo culmine sus estudios universitarios, es por ello que ha luchado muchísimo para continuar con este proyecto, pues sin esta actividad no tendrían los recursos para costear la educación de su hijo.

Para poder cristalizar su sueño, Felipa requiere de un préstamo de $475 dólares, mismo que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder incrementar sus ventas, pero más importante aún para poder pagar unas facturas que tiene pendientes, pues si no las cubre ya no podrá continuar. Tú tienes el poder de ayudarla y contribuir a la formación de sus hijos, decídete, ellos te lo agradecen
loan_use: purchase merchandise

description:
Martin is married and is father of three children. Some time ago he found himself unemployed and began to look for an alternative way to bring all that was needed for his home. This is how he had the idea to make and sell foods, supplying the local Monclova markets. The will to provide his children with a better quality of life and a future permitted Martin to not give up before such difficulties. And with the unconditional support of his family, that help him run the business, now he continues on with his project.

Nonetheless he now requires a loan of $475 to be able to purchase necessary ingredients to increase his sales. Become part of the efforts of Martin and his family and help them continue on.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Martín es casado y padre de 3 hijos, hace algún tiempo se quedó sin empleo y preocupado comenzó a buscar una alternativa para poder llevar lo necesario a su hogar. Es así como tuvo la idea de dedicarse a la venta y elaboración de alimentos, comerciándoles en los mercados rodantes de la localidad de Monclova en el estado de Coahuila. Las ganas de brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y futuro hicieron que Martín no se dejará vencer ante tal dificultad y con el apoyo incondicional de su familia, quienes le ayudan en el negocio, ahora continua con su proyecto.

Sin embargo el ahora requiere de un préstamo de $475 dólares para poder comprar los insumos necesarios para incrementar las ventas. Se parte de los logros de Martín y su familia y ayúdalos a continuar.
loan_use: purchase merchandise

description:
Mr. Komi A. was born on July 15, 1967 to a poor family in Lomé. Not having enough money to go far away for his studies, he decided to learn carpentry and thus receive profesionnal training. Now married and the father of three (03) children, he has his own workshop. He is dynamic and innovative, and attracts clients by displaying his products outside. But without modern tools, he continues to work by hand, which makes production extremely slow. He would therefore like to supply his workshop with more effective equipment for faster, more refined work. To do this, he is asking for a $1500 credit that will enable him to buy two machines that can handle all the necessary carpentry work. This will mean that he does not have to transport wood to other workshops, and can cut his costs. Realizing this plan will allow him to increase his production and his income to meet the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Komi est né le 15 Juillet 1967 dans une pauvre famille à Lomé. Ne pouvant pas aller loin dans ses études faute de moyens, il décida d’apprendre la menuiserie et avoir ainsi une formation professionnelle. Aujourd’hui marié et père de trois (03) enfants, il tient son propre atelier. Dynamique et innovateur, il séduit sa clientèle avec ses produits exposés en plein air. Mais n’ayant pas d’outils modernes, il continue de travailler manuellement, ce qui retarde énormément la production. Il se propose alors de doter son atelier de matériels plus performants pour un travail plus rapide et plus raffiné. Pour cela, il sollicite un crédit de $1500 qui lui permettra d’acheter deux machines pour tous travaux de menuiserie. Cela lui évitera de transporter le bois dans d’autres ateliers afin de limiter les frais. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra d’accroître sa production et d’augmenter ses revenus aux besoins de sa famille.
loan_use: Buy two machines for carpentry work

description: Nurida is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli. She settled with her family in Sumgait city. Nurida is 45 years old. She is a widow and has 3 children. She lost her husband in Karabakh war and she is the only breadwinner of her family now. In the beginning of her business, she borrowed $500 from Normicro and rented a small tea-house. For the second time she borrowed $700 and bought chairs, tables and electric stove. Now she has rented a cafe. On a dinner break workers have dinner here and clients are very happy with her service.\r\nShe applies for a loan of $1000 to expand the area of her cafe.
loan_use: To expand the area of hers cafe

description: Madam Josephine’s kenkey has always been enjoyed by the people in her community. She prepares her kenkey under very good hygienic conditions and therefore it is very attractive for buyers. She however needs capital to produce more to meet the high demand of her customers. She is therefore seeking a loan of $750.00 from Kiva. She can work very hard with this amoount and pay back the loan.
loan_use: working capital to expand her kenkey selling business

description:
Born in 1958 in Tabligbo in Yoto prefecture, Kokou G. ended his studies at the grade school level. Married and the father of six children, he is a welder by trade and currently own his own shop with a dozen apprentices. He is highly valued and renown in the city of Tabligbo because of the broad experience he has acquired in this trade, as well as for the quality of his work. He has complete control of his business, and his fine work is undeniably. This only brings in more customers! But Mr. G. only has at his disposal some worn and outdated tools that make his work slow and difficult. He has trouble meeting the expectations of his customers right now, and he seriously risks losing them. He therefore is seeking funds to upgrade his equipment and have a steady supply of work materials.

To do this, he is requesting a loan of $950 as capital for new and modern tools and to buy materials for his work. This will allow him to satisfy his customers on a timely basis and to make a substantial income for the welfare of his family.

Translated from French by Farron Blanc and Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteers.

Né en 1958 à Tabligbo dans la préfecture de Yoto, Monsieur G. Kokou a arrêté ses études au cours primaire. Marié et père de six (06) enfants, il est soudeur de formation et tient aujourd’hui son propre atelier avec une dizaine d’apprentis. La grande expérience qu’il a acquise dans ce métier et la qualité de ses prestations font de lui un soudeur très bien apprécié et de renommée dans la ville de Tabligbo. Il a une parfaite maîtrise de ses activités et ses prestations sont sans reproche. Ce qui ne fait qu’augmenter sa clientèle. Mais, Monsieur G. ne dispose que des outils vétustes qui rendent le travail lent et pénible. Il a du mal à satisfaire tous ses clients aujourd’hui et risque fort de les perdre. Il recherche alors des moyens pour renforcer son équipement et disposer permanemment du matériel de travail.

Pour ce faire, il sollicite un crédit d’un montant de $950 qui servira à acquérir des outils nouveaux et modernes et acheter du matériel pour son travail. Ceci permettra de satisfaire à temps sa clientèle et de disposer d’un revenu consistant pour le bien-être de sa famille
loan_use: Acquire new modern tools and buy material.

description: Madam Patience O. lives in the Dodowa community of the Greater Accra region of Ghana. She sells mainly yams and other agricultural produce, including groundnuts and beans. The demand for her goods increases daily. Madam Patience is a very hardworking woman who wishes to sell more than she is doing now but lacks capital. She is therefore seeking a loan of $850.00 from Kiva to help expand her business. She is also very good in keeping records and loan management, all of which was learned from KSF\x92s TEACH product.
loan_use: working capital

description: Hantet Local Foods is noted for its sumptuous Ghanaian dishes particularly \x93banku\x94 and kenkey. These are both staple foods prepared from maize. Faithful customers of Madam Hanna T. will not live a day without visiting her bar. She has limited cooking pots, stoves and other equipment for the smooth running of her bar. She also needs capital to renovate the area where customers sit to enjoy their meal. She is therefore appealing to Kiva to grant her a loan of $750.00 to enable her to buy the items needed to meet the high demand. Madam Hanna T. will in no way disappoint Kiva in paying the loan back because she is very hardworking and has good loan management capabilities.
loan_use: working capital to buy equipment for her bar and to renovate the dining area

description: Madam Emily L. prepares nutritious khebabs made from soy beans for sale. The nutritional value of soy bean creates a high demand for her khebab by both young and old. She wishes to produce more on a larger scale for all to have their fair share. Lack of capital is her limitation. She is hopeful that Kiva will grant  her a loan of $700.00 to help her operate as she wishes. She is very good in loan management and simple record keeping.
loan_use: working capital

description: Ms Lilian K. is a designer by profession and operates a clothing shop where she also sells crafts made by local artisans from local materials. The plants used in weaving these local baskets, chairs, and trays are unique to this area. The loan of US$450 will enable Ms Lilian to increase her stock of these items, hence promoting this local industry. She plans to promote the sale of these items outside the local area and even for the export market. Because the plants are harvested from along the rivers at no cost, the weaving industry would constitute a very viable source of income for the local community. PEMCI is very keen to support this type of innovative project, which would benefit the local community, enabling them to overcome poverty.
loan_use: Designer & Businesswoman

description: Madam Sandra K. D. sells both cassava and corn dough. She sells them in little quantities(retail) but it is her desire to sell them in bags and include other items in her trade. She is therefore seking a loan of $750.00 from Kiva. This will help her work harder than before and to her satisfaction.
loan_use: working capital

description: Tavakkul was born in 1961 in Gazax region of Azerbaijan. Tavakkul has been engaged in this business for 8 years. After wedding he settled with his family in Sumgait. He is married, has 2 children. rent a medicine-chest and to start selling medicinal preparations. The family income is rather limited. \r\nNow he had difficulties with cash, he needs a loan amount of $1200 has been provided with the medicinal preparations by firm.
loan_use: To buy the medicinal preparations

description: Madam Comfort M. trades in sewing accessories. A lot of fashion designers buy from her. She wish she could increase stock in her shop but lacks financial assistance. Madam Connie is seeking a loan of $500.00 from kiva to help expand her shop.
loan_use: working capital

description: Elizabeth is a mother of 4 and is 39 years old. She has been engaged in the clothing trade  for past 5 years. She works in and around the surburbs of Sekondi. Some of the merchandise includes ready-to-wear clothes for children and adults as well as suiting materials. She has undergone the TEACH program of KRABAN SUPPORT FOUNDATION. In addition she is being assisted to develop a business plan as a means of formalizing her operations. She is therefore requesting KIVA to support her with a loan of $1,000 to serve as working caital.
loan_use: Working  Capital

description: Bea is 42 years and a mother of two. She has been selling local liquor over the last 5 years. The liquor store is located in a heavily populated area of the city which bustles with a lot of social activities. She has gone through the TEACH learning sessions of KRABAN SUPPORT FOUNDATION and hopes to increase sales significantly if KIVA assists her with requested amount.
loan_use: Working Capital

description: Valentin D. is 34 years old. He is married and has one kid. He is in apiarian business for 7 years. Valentin has 50 hives on two different bee yards near the city. He is a specialist not only in honey producing but also is well known as one of the best bee breeder in the region. Valentin D. needs this $ 1200 loan to buy five more bee hives.
loan_use: To buy five more bee hives

description:
Twenty years ago, after returning defeated from his adventure of following the American dream, one that was coveted by all the farmers, and having returned to his city of Pedro Escobedo in Queretaro, and following the sense of responsibility for his little children, Felix decided to start his own business selling bales of alfalfa. He already knew the bountiful nature of the business, one that his father taught him, and with the support of his brothers he was able to gather enough capital to start a new life, one that he continues to enjoy thanks to arduous work and dedication.

Now Felix requires a loan in the amount of $925, that will be put towards increasing his sales and consequently the family income. He is now in need of your support. Help him. The decision is in your hands.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace 20 años después de regresar derrotado de su aventura por ir a alcanzar el sueño americano que tanto buscan las personas de campo, y viéndose nuevamente en su localidad, Pedro Escobedo, Querétaro, y con la responsabilidad de de sus pequeños hijos, Félix decidió iniciar con su propio negocio de venta de pacas de alfalfa. Pues el ya conocía las bondades de esta actividad que su padre le había enseñado, y con el apoyo de sus hermanos junto el capital necesario para iniciar con su modo actual de vida y hasta la fecha lo ha continuado gracias a su arduo trabajo y dedicación.

Ahora Félix requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $925 DLLS, mismos que utilizará en para incrementar sus ventas y consecuentemente el ingreso familiar. El ahora necesita de tu apoyo, ayúdalo, la decisión esta en tus manos.
loan_use: purchase material

description:
Born in Lomé in 1960, Conforte A. is married and the mother of five, and she also takes care of two other children. She sells chickens at the marketplace helping to support her family. Since her husband’s spare parts store was looted by thieves, Mrs. A. feels she must take on all household expenses, something that is not at all easy to do. But thanks to her devotion and dynamism, she manages somehow to provide the necessities for her family.

Today, she is requesting a loan of $650 as capital to be able to sell sheep in addition to her poultry. This will grow her business and augment her income. The loan will help her to raise the standard of living for her and her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1960 à Lomé, Madame A. Conforte est mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants et à sa charge deux (02) enfants. Elle exerce comme activité la vente des poulets au marché et contribue aux besoins familiaux. Depuis que le magasin de pièces détachées de son mari a été pillé par les voleurs, Madame A. se voit dans l’obligation de prendre toutes les charges du ménage. Cela ne lui est pas du tout facile mais grâce à son dévouement et son dynamisme, elle arrive tant que mal à subvenir aux besoins vitaux de la famille.

Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite un crédit de $650 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce pour qu’en plus de l’achat et vente de volailles y associer la vente de moutons afin d’accroître ses activités et augmenter ses revenus. Ce crédit va l’aider à relever son niveau de vie et celui de sa famille.
loan_use: To buy and sell poultry and sheep

description:
Mrs. Enyonam Séna A. is a young woman born in 1979 in Lomé. She is married with one (01) child. After she failed twice to pass the Bac university entry-level exam, she abandoned her studies in favor of an office training program, at which she did very well. However, she did not have the resources to begin working in this profession right away. Her husband, also unemployed, could not help her. With a credit that she received and successfully paid back, she opened a small service center where she provided word processing and photocopying services. However, her ambition is to increase her business by selling computer consumables and office supplies. In order to carry out this plan, she is asking for a further $1200 in financing. She is a woman of character who has a strong desire to succeed where other women have failed. Her dynamism and devotion deserve to be supported.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Enyonam Séna est une jeune femme née en1979 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère d’un (01) enfant. Suite à deux échecs successifs au Bac1, elle abandonna les études pour suivre une formation en bureautique qui lui a bien réussi. Mais faute de moyens elle n’a pas pu exercer ce métier à temps. Son mari également sans emploi ne pouvait pas lui venir en aide. Avec son crédit obtenu et d’ailleurs bien remboursé, elle a ouvert un petit centre de multi services où elle fait des traitements de texte et des photocopies. Toutefois, son ambition est d’accroître ses activités par la vente des consommables informatiques et de fournitures de bureau. Pour réaliser ce projet, elle demande un autre financement de $1200. C’est une femme de caractère qui a une forte envie de réussir là où d’autres femmes ont échoué. Son dynamisme et son dévouement méritent d’être soutenus.
loan_use: selling computer consumables and office supplies

description:
Simon is married and lives with his family in the community of Huinala, in the city of of Apodaca, Nuevo Leon. He makes and sells rustic furniture and this is the only source of sustenance for his family. With great effort and dedication he managed to keep to his business, always motivated by the great love he feels for his family.

He requires a loan of $1100 to purchase wood and therfore produce more furniture and increase his sales. He realizes now that his earnings are not enough to cover the school expenses for his two little ones. Help Simon provide his children with the education they need. He and his family will sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Simón es casado y vive con su familia en la comunidad de Huinala, en el municipio de Apodaca, Nuevo León. El se dedica a la producción y venta de muebles rústicos, es el único medio de sustento para su familia. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado continuar con su proyecto, siempre incentivado por el gran amor que le tiene a su familia.

El requiere de un préstamo de $1100 DLLS para poder comprar madera y fabricar un mayor número de muebles y así incrementar sus ventas. Ya que con lo percibe actualmente no es suficiente para cubrir los gastos escolares de sus dos pequeños. Ayuda a Simón a darles la ecuación que requieren a sus hijos, no lo dudes más, la decisión ésta en tus manos, el y su familia te lo van agradecer sinceramente.
loan_use: purchase wood

description: Ms N. is a single mother of 4 children. The eldest daughter is marries while the other 3 are still in school. She deals in new clothes moving from one market to another over the week.  She has been doing this kind of business for over 20 years. Hence she is well experienced in it. This is the first time she has taken a loan to boost her business. The loan of US$528/450 will be used to boost her stock which has been eroded with the payments of school fees in the month of January. She will also be able to sustain her stock longer as she is now forced to keep on traveling to the city to restock.  Ms N. is supporting the local economy  through her business.
loan_use: Buy Clothing Stock

description: 35-year-old Mrs Eunice O. lives in a semi urban area of Edo State, Nigeria.  She is married with six children. She sells food items to the community. She hopes to borrow the above money for her business expansion.
loan_use: To improve on her business

description: A business-woman with 24 years experience, Mrs Imunwanhen A. lives in Benin City with two children.  She needs the loan amount to expand her business.
loan_use: To improve on her business

description: Mrs Iva T. is a 62 year old lady that joined SPBD in April 2006. Iva is the only lady in the wheelchair in SPBD’s program in Samoa. She was in her wheelchair in her late thirties, due to mistreating at the hospital. She was awarded second price in our savings progam in 2006. Iva ia a happy lady like any other normal lady, but with the fact that she can’t walk no more, she is not giving up in trying to develop her family. I’ve visited Iva’s home up the mountain, and from there, It had a clear picture of Iva when she was strong. She’s got a beautiful garden in front of her house, and a vegetable garden at her backyard. Due to the fact that she can no longer work in her gardens, she decided to start a business that she can do, which she chooses Elei Printing. Elei printing is a man made Samoan type of  printing that is highly demanded by Samoan staying in Samoa and especially the Samoans staying overseas. After 4 months of starting her business, Iva realized that her business was becoming really successful, due to more demand from her local customers, because of the good quality and neat printings.
loan_use: Loan was used to buy materials, fabric paint and glitters, brushes, carved timber for printing.

description: Mrs. Eunice O. is a 55-year-old married woman with seven children. She lives in Benin city, Edo state of Nigeria. She acquired one year of formal training before she opened her own business in 1987. She promises to expand her business if loaned the above amount.\r\n    \r\n
loan_use: To buy more goods for sale.

description: A LAPO group leader, Mrs. Roseline E. is 43.  She started her business in 1991. She is a popular plantain seller in her community in Nigeria. She plans to improve her business with the above amount.\r\n
loan_use: To improve her business

description: Suepasi is a married lady with 7 children, all attending district schools due to cheaper of school fees. With her first loan in January 2004, she has developed her taro plantation, which is their main source of income that is financing her children’s education. She can now also afford to bring her children to the National Hospital in town where her children are been given good medications that are not available in the village. Suepasi’s husband is her right hand with the business, he’s the one responsible for selling taro twice a week, mainly on Friday and Saturday.
loan_use: Buy chemicals, weed killer and fertilizer.       \r\nHome Improvement

description: Elizabeth lives in Tandika area of Dar es Salaam.She is married and has three children.Two are in primary school,one in secondary school.Elizabeth runs a tailoring business in a rented premise near her residence.She has been in this business for three years now.Elizabeth is planning to increase the stock of sewing and tailoring materials.She recently get a lot of orders from nursery schools for uniforms for kids enrolled in these schools.The stock of sewing and tailoring materials she currently has cannot meet the orders.She is in need of USD 550 to have the right quantity of stock.
loan_use: Adding stock of sewing and tailoring materials

description:
My name is Jose C. and I sell daily consumer products. I have had my business for 3 years and I have a good clientel because I offer high quality products and above all, at a low price. My business produces enough income to support my family and my goal is to increase my inventory in order to have more variety. With the additional earnings, I will remodel my business, which is also my family home, which will alow my to care better for my customers, and also to give a better education to my children who are now of school age.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Mi nombre es Jose C. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo mi negocio hace unos 3 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que les ofrezco buena calidad en mi productos y sobre todo a un bajo precio, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el mantenimiento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi invetario para tener una mayor variedad en productos y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi negocio asi mismo mi hogar esto para dar una mejor antencion a mis clientes y darles un buen estudio a mis hijos que estan en la edad de ingrear al colegio.
loan_use: To purchase: sodas, juices, white bread, sweet bread, butter, oil, beans, butter, cheese, quesillo(traditional South American cheese), jam, bologna, churros, sweets, soups, suaces, toilet paper.

description:
Jesus Martin D. Leon Lopez is single and has no children. He has a snack shop where two people work. This business started as a result of a business transfer. For a long time he had searched for financial independence since he had always been working for someone else's company. His effort, dedication and enthusiasm have led him to achieve what he has today, and each day he works harder to grow.

Now Jesus needs a loan for $USD925 to invest in products for his establishment. All Jesus needs to move forward is your support. Don't think about it anymore. Today for him, tomorrow for you. Make it happen.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Jesús Martín D. L. L. es soltero, no tiene hijos. El tiene un snack como negocio, en el cual laboran dos personas. Este negocio lo inicio por medio D. un traspaso, pues durante mucho tiempo había buscado la autonomía económica, ya que siempre había laborado para alguna empresa. Su esfuerzo, dedicación y entusiasmo lo han llevado a lograr lo que hasta ahora tiene, y cada día trabaja mas para crecer.

Ahora el señor Jesús necesita un préstamo D. 925 DLLs, éstos los invertirá en la compra D. productos para su establecimiento. Para que Jesús siga adelante sólo basta con que lo apoyes, no lo pienses tanto. Hoy por el, mañana por ti. Hazlo posible.
loan_use: purchase mercandise

description:
My name is Noe M. and I sell daily consumer products. I have had my business for 4 years and I have a good clientel because I sell high quality goods at low prices. My business generates enough income to support my family and my goal is to expand my inventory in order to have higher sales. With the additional earnings I will be able to remodel my business(doubles as home) and to support my family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

\r\n\r\nMi nombre es Noe M. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular tengo mi negocio hace unos 4 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que ofrezco buena calidad en mis productos y un muy buen precio, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener mayores ventas y con la ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi negocio (casa de habitacion) y mantener a mi familia.
loan_use: To purchase churros, drinks, white and sweet bread, soups, powdered drinks, salsas, mustard, sanitary napkins, toilet paper, toothpaste, batteries, cookies, condiments, sweets, milk, eggs, oil, butter, corn, flour, sugar, salt, sausages, juices,cheese, beans, tortillas, pastes, bottled water.

description:
Hello, my name is Maricela Suyapa, and I hope to start a small, home-based traveling sales company producing rosquillas in the center of my community. The revenue generated from this business will cover familial costs and other obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Maricela Suyapa, cuento con una Micro Empresa de Elaboración de Rosquillas (productos para Consumo Humano) ubicado en mi casa de habitación en el centro de mi comunidad, producto que distribuyo de manera ambulante y que me genera ingresos para cubrir con los gastos familiares y ootros compromisos.
loan_use: To purchase corn, cheese, firewood, lard, raw sugar, butter, and margarine.

description:
Mr. Komi S. is a small farmer by profession. He is married and father to five (05) children, and works a large grove of oil palms. His wife, who works as a secondhand retailer, does not receive enough income to fully support the family. And so it was to meet all the family's expenses that Mr. S. invested his small savings in farming local land: leasing the farm, producing seeds, planting and caring for the palms until they produce their nuts. Palm nuts are very important for the population because they can be used to product palm oil, which is essential for cooking. Currently, Mr. S. is asking for $800 of financial support to expand his fields. The credit will allow him to pay for labor and to acquire the resources necessary to cultivate oil palms.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur S. Komi est un paysan de profession. Marié et père de cinq (05) enfants, il exploite un grand domaine de palmiers à huile. Son épouse, une revendeuse de la place, ne dispose pas un revenu assez fort pour venir pleinement en aide à la famille. C’est pour être à la hauteur des dépenses que Monsieur S. Komi a investi sa petite économie dans l’exploitation des terres locales : bail de terrain, production de pépinière, plantation et entretien des palmiers jusqu’à la production des noix. Les noix de palmes sont très importantes pour la population car elles servent à la production de l’huile de palme indispensable pour la cuisine. Aujourd’hui, Monsieur S. sollicite un appui financier de $800 pour élargir ses champs. Le crédit lui permettra de payer la main d’œuvre et d’acquérir des intrants pour la culture des palmiers à huile.
loan_use: paying for labor and acquiring the resources needed for cultivating oil palms

description: Rashad is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli. He settled with his family in Sumgait city. Rashad is 24 years old. He is the only sole support for his family. Rashad understands how important customers are and prides himself in providing the best customer service possible. He decided to apply for a loan of $300 in order to increase his retail trade. \r\nHe currently has applied for a loan of $800 to open his own perfumery and to increase his inventory of goods.
loan_use: To open his own perfumery and to increase his inventory of goods

description:
Married and mother to three (3) children, Mrs Joséphine E. works selling food stuff in her town. Her husband's main work is farming. With an average revenue Mrs Joséphine EDJEAME contributes enormously to her family. A courageous and determined woman she has managed two loans without difficulty despite her elementary level education. Her dynamism and her experience in the field are exemplary. She is asking for a new loan of $600 to enlarge her display and increase her revenue. This loan will be very beneficial because it will allow her to improve the standard of living of her family as well as increase her savings for future needs.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants, Madame E. Joséphine a pour activité principale la vente de denrées alimentaires dans sa localité. L’activité principale de son mari est l’agriculture. Avec un revenu moyen, Madame EDJEAME Joséphine contribue énormément aux charges de sa famille. Femme courageuse mais aussi déterminée, elle a eu à gérer deux crédits sans difficultés malgré son niveau d’instruction primaire. Son dynamisme et son expérience dans son activité sont exemplaires. Elle sollicite un nouveau crédit d’un montant de $600 afin d’agrandir son étalage et rehausser son revenu. Ce crédit lui sera très bénéfique car il permettra d’améliorer le niveau de vie de sa famille ainsi que la fréquence dans ses épargnes pour ses besoins futurs.
loan_use: to buy raw ingredients neccessary in the preparation of food.

description:
Mr. Sowanou H. is a father of eight children. Widowed ten years ago, his main business is farming. Despite the rudimentary nature of his tools, Mr. H. never misses a growing season. The income from his business goes towards family needs. In 2004 he received an initial loan of $500 which he paid off with faultless regularity. He now wants to modernize his tools and buy fertilizer for his crops. The granting of this $750 loan will allow Mr. H. to improve his crops and increase his yield, so that he can improve his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur H. Sowanou est un père de famille de huit (8) enfants. Veuf depuis 10 ans, son activité principale demeure l’agriculture. Malgré le caractère rudimentaire de ses outils, Monsieur H. ne manque aucune saison de culture. Les revenus issus de son activité sont destinés aux besoins de sa famille. Il fit en 2004 un premier prêt de $500 qu’il a soldé avec une régularité parfaite. Aujourd’hui, il souhaite moderniser ses outils et acheter de l’engrais pour ses cultures. L’octroi de ce crédit de $750 lui permettra d’améliorer ses cultures et augmenter son rendement afin d’offrir à sa famille une condition de vie meilleure.
loan_use: To buy tools and fertilizer

description:
Fonima is a very shy widow but is one of the more active savers in the SPBD programme. She joined the Centre at Tulaele in 2005. Since the husband died in 2003, she started thinking about ways of surviving with her two children and a grandmother. She got in, and her first Loan was 300 tala (US$ 120). This loan was used for purchase of  stocks for her small shop. With the second loan of  500 tala (US$ 200), she also spent it on more stocks.

Fonima paid off her loan promptly and was therefore entitled to get  1,250 tala (US$ 500)  on her next loan. Fonima already  spent the other two loans on the stock, and with this loan she thought of renovating her small shop, so she used it to double wall the inside of the store. Fonima is excited that these loans enable her family to go on and live since her husband died.

At the end of last year, Fonima paid off her loan and got another loan amounting to 1,750 tala (US$ 700). This loan also was used to further improve her store. As we have seen in the photo taken, the store looks new and it’s just after the work done last week.

Apart from the Loans, on the other side, Fonima is one of the ladies that have a vision. This vision enables her to save the extra money. So she is done with the store but now she is looking of starting up the Elei Printing – a traditional Samoan way of printing fabrics using handcrafted stencils.
loan_use: To purchase 50 yards of fabric, assorted ink, stencils, and printing block to start an elei printing business.

description: Nijat is n Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli. He is 32 years old and has one child. He is a driver on public transport. He began his business 19 years ago and it has allowed him to support his family. In 2004 he borrowed $800 from Normicro to repair the motor of his car. His minibus is old and he plans to sell it and to buy a new minibus.\r\nNijat has applied for a loan amount of $1000 to buy a new minibus.   \r\n
loan_use: To buy a new minibus

description:
Don Pedro is a second time lender in the Kiva and Mifex program. He is the owner of a small store in Guayaquil where he sells rice, sugar, oil and other basic groceries. With his last loan he invested in more products and he was able to make some minor improvements to his store. He made all of the payments from his last loan on time and is now hoping he can take out a second. He plans on using the loan money to buy a display refrigerator where he can keep products cool and market at them at the same time. Don Pedro is 56 years and has 6 children, 3 of which still depend on him. He is a Colombian who has lived in Ecuador since he was 18.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.
loan_use: Buy a refrigerator

description: Esin J. is 56 years old and together with her daughter keep an industrial goods store which is right to the cooperative market of the town. They both keep this store since 1996 and are well famous in their business.  They started their business because both were unemployed but the business had its development and now this store is the only source of income for both women and their families. Now Esin J. and her daughter need $ 1200 for working capital.
loan_use: For working capital

description: A mother of six Nancy lives in a house close to what many would call a shack. Four of her six children are in school. Because of her family’s poor standard of living Nancy wanted more four her children, family and herself but with a limited education background she didn’t know how to put her skills into good use. Nancy never made it to secondary level education. She first heard of SPBD in 2000 but thought it was not for her until she heard about the number of families whose lives have developed since being a part of the programme in 2003. In 2004 she joined using her baking and cooking skills to start a cake business with her sister Toeaso helping in the sales at one of the two local markets. With a new loan she hopes to purchase a new oven and additional ingredients for her cake business.
loan_use: To purchase a new oven and additional ingredients (flour, sugar, eggs, milk, yeast) for her cake business

description:
Mary who born in 1979 with household of 2 living in district 7 Kabul Afghanistan.

Mary who is a educated women but due to family problem she cant able to work outside then she decide to take loan from AFSG and continue the tailoring business in her home.

She hopes to receive more loans through AFSG, who can continue with her business and find more income that she can able to pay her children's fee and house payment.
loan_use: To buy fabric, new muchine

description:
Sandor A., married, father of one son, is the owner of a Cyber Cafe, which supports his family economically. He now has plans to expand his business and with the loan he recieves from PRISMA, he will buy 5 new computers and update the 5 computers he already owns. Futhermore, he plans on remodeling his cafe in order to install a small Bar, which he thinks will also help to increase his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

\r\n\r\nSándor A., casado, padre de un hijo, es dueño de un Cyber café con el cual mantiene económicamente a su familia, actualmente tiene planes de agrandar su negocio, con el crédito que le otorgue PRISMA comprará 5 nuevas computadoras y actualizará las 5 computadoras que actualmente posee. Aademás acondicionará su local para instalar un pequeño Bar, con el cual piensa incrementar sus ingresos.
loan_use: The money obtained by PRISMA will buy more modern computers and to make improvements on the site.

description: Ali A. is a refugee from the region of Shusha. For the past 13 years he has lived in the village of Qaraqoyunlu in the Agsu region. Ali has raised cattle, sheep and goats for the past 10 years. He is married with two children. He is using the loan to purchase food and supplies for his livestock.
loan_use: to buy food for his animals

description: Vaqif S. owns a small car wash off the main road that passes by Agsu city. He is 38 years old and married with four children. He has owned his business for the past six years. With this loan Vaqif wants to purchase better equipment for his shop.
loan_use: to purchase equipment for his car wash

description:
Hidayat is 62 years old, married, has 4 children and lives in Khaladj village in the Salyan region.
He works hard for the success of his children. He likes to breed pedigree ewes.
Hidayat has had his business for 10 years and it allows him to support his family. He wants to offer  an education to all  his children that allows them to continue their own lives and to be an honest and hard-working people.
Now he needs a loan of $500 to buy 10 pedigree ewes.
loan_use: To buy 10 pedigree ewes

description:
This 37-year-old man lives in Khaladj village,Salyan region. He is married and has a child.

Ahadaga breeds calves in a private farm shed. He has been in this business for 4 years. With this business he meets the demands of his family. Through his business he has gained a great deal of knowledge and skills to expand his business.
Now he needs a loan of $800 to buy 4 calves.
loan_use: To buy 4 calves

description: Gurban is a low income person from Agsu district. He is married has 4 kids. He is 45 years old. He started his business in 1997. In 2005-2007 he borrowed 2 loans from Normicro Agsu branch amounting 300-600$ and used them for business expansion. Now he applies for $1200 to buy more animals and expand the business.\r\n
loan_use: business expansion

description: Khilgat is a low income person from Agsu district. He is single, 36 years old. He started his business in 2005. He would like a loan from Normicro Agsu branch, which will be funded through KIVA, to do shop repair.\r\n
loan_use: shop repair

description: Isabellla, 37, is married and has four children. Her husband also does farming. She joined SPBD Microcredit Programme in 2005 and that is the only organisation that she believes can help her and her business. She used her first loan to establish her taro farm in the village. Now, she is proposing to expand her farm and needs a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides.
loan_use: To purchase organic fertilizers and pesticides for her taro farm

description: Fololina never gives up on her business because she is sure that “she can earn more money from her farm.” Her husband doesn't have another job but instead helps her with the farm work. She sells her bananas in the town market while her husband tends the farm. It is a lively joint family business which sustains their family needs.
loan_use: To purchase planting materials, organic fertilizers and pesticides

description: Rasela has been in this line of business for the past four years. She has great talent and understands the market for all kinds of handicrafts. The business specializes in fine mats, Samoan war weapons, and other handicrafts. Samoa is host to many tourists throughout the year so the handicrafts she creates never just lie around. There are also many Samoan occasions that create the need for these handicrafts so she is never left with too many at one time.
loan_use: To buy paint, flax and chicken feathers to improve the standard and design of created handicrafts

description: Omeka is 58, married, and has more than ten years' experience in sewing. Her business caters to locals, mostly people from her village. Her business is successful because people believe that it is cheaper to buy tailored clothes than ready-made ones. Her experience has gained her many customers some of whom come from overseas to buy her tailored clothes and designs.
loan_use: To purchase material and sewing tools

description:
Bahar is 26 years old and lives in Yenikand village, Salyan region. She is single.
She needs a loan of $1000 to buy a 0,3 hectare clover plot of land.Bahar has 8 years of experience in this business. 
This business has enabled her to cover most of her household expences.
loan_use: To buy 0,3 hectare clover plot of land

description: Guler is a Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Fizuli. She settled with her family in Sumgayit city after her displacement. She is a 42-year-old widow with three children. Guler lost her husband during the war. In spite of all her difficulties, she started her own business six years ago selling clothing and apparel.\r\nShe applies for this loan to increase the  assortment of goods she sells.\r\n
loan_use: To increase the assortment of goods for sale

description: Latifa K. owns a small bedding stand in the town of Devech’s Bazaar. Devechi is located just south of Khachmaz in the North Eastern part of Azerbaijan. Latifa wants to be able to increase the diversity of her inventory so that she can attract more customers to her small stand.
loan_use: To diversify her inventory to attract more customers to her bedding stand

description: Auntie Vic sells children's wear. She buys in bulk from companies and retails to her customers. She sells from house to house but she wants to open her own babies' wear shop where she can buy more goods to sell. She is seeking a loan of $800.00 to enable her open a shop.
loan_use: Working capital

description: Fishing is a family business. The skills needed for catching the best and biggest fish are usually passed on from the fathers to the sons. Faafetai's case is a bit different. When she was widowed and left to raise a family of four on her own, she had to take over her husband's fishing business. Using a small loan from the SPBD microcredit program, she was able to succeed. Now, she is expanding her fishing business and requests a capital loan of $1,175.00 to purchase a cooler for storing her catch, plywood and fishing nets. Her business will continue to be successful, because seafood is in high demand from local restaurants, and she knows how to catch the best and biggest fish.
loan_use: To purchase cooler, plywood, and fishing nets

description: Gladys sells rice porridge, locally called "rice water". She sells within the community especially to school children. She has participated in the TEACH lending programs and is a client of Kraban Support Foundation. She needs a Kiva loan of $500 to increase her business.
loan_use: Working capital

description: Josephine sells different kinds of threads and hair rollers in the community. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and has participated in the TEACH lending programs. She needs a Kiva loan of $800 to increase her business.
loan_use: Working capital

description: Filiata is 48 years old, married and has five children. She joined the program in 2004, and her husband and two of their sons have since then been doing taro farming. She sells the produce, including not only taro but also bananas and other vegetables, in the central market in Apia three times a week. Expanding her farm will enbale Filiata to improve her house and send her little children to school.
loan_use: To purchase organic fertilizers, fungicides, and pesticides

description: Madam O., a 47 year-old woman with 6 children, has a livesock farm where she rears local goats and sheep for sale. Her farm is producing well nourished varieties and she wants to expand livestock farm. She is seeking a loan of $1000 from Kiva to enable her expand and produce more. She has been trained using the TEACH lending model of Kraban Support Foundation.
loan_use: Working capital

description:
You can see in the picture a very kind, friendly, hard-working woman. She has had this business for 20 years.
Sevil was born in 1950 in the city of Baku. She is a widow and has 3 children.
She is a high school mathematics teacher. 
Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy a new computer to make her work easier. She tutors students for examinations. The computer would provide her with internet access to advance her students' educational level.
loan_use: To buy a new computer to ease her work and to administer tests for students

description:
Asiman has 10 years of experience in this business.
Having borrowed $200 he bought 4 pregnant sheep.
The second time he borrowed  $300 and bought 6 pregnant sheep.
The third time he borrowed a loan of $500 to buy 2 cows.
Now he requests a loan of $1000 to buy 4 male calves.Asiman was born in 1961 in Yenikand village, Salyan region. He is married and has a child.
loan_use: To buy 4 male calves

description:
Sudmila has a small store where she sells foodstuffs. She started this business 4 years ago.
This business has allowed her family to have a better income.
Having borrowed $400 she bought foodstuffs.
Now she needs a loan of $600 to expand the area of her store.
Sudmila is 40 years old. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli  region, settled in the Finnish houses, which are built temporarily on the front line in the Fizuli region. Sudmila is single.
loan_use: To expand the area of her store

description:
Maame O. sells fante kenkey to restaurants and individuals to retail. This is a local food prepared from maize. She cooks the kenkey per the demands of these restaurants and individuals. \r\n

\r\nAt certain times she is unable to provide the quantity demanded. When asked, on a visit to her kitchen, why she could not provide, she said, "The price of a bag of maize is very expensive and I cannot afford to buy it, making me not cook when the quantity demanded is high." She is seeking a loan of $700 from Kiva.
loan_use: Working capital

description: Lipine M. is a well-known businesswoman.  She works hard in order to satisfy the needs of her family. She has nine children; five are married, and three are not married.  Lipine comes from a family of six people.  She is a hard-working person and strives to earn income one day at a time.  She earns 150 tala (USD 50) a day for selling her products at the market, to small retailers, and at her residence.\r\n
loan_use: To purchase seeds, planting materials, fertilizers, and pesticides\r\n

description: Rosemary sells spare parts for different makes of vehicles. She lives in a community where many vehicle repair shops are located. She is losing business, because she can't afford to buy enough stock. Rosemary is requesting a loan of $1000.00 so she can buy more parts to sell to her customers.
loan_use: working capital

description:
Hello, my name is Denia Iyodesa and I work primarily selling food items in my grocery store. It is located in my own home and thanks to my business I am able to contribute to the payment of family expenses and to care for my family. Now I am in need of stocking my business because it is important to me to offer my customers a larger variety and in this way better my earnings and take care of our needs.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Hola Mi nombre es Denia Iyodesa, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con una pequeña pulperia de venta de productos para el consumo humano, ubicada en mi casa de habitación, gracia a este negocio puedo contribuir con los gastos familiares y atender a mi familia. Actualmente necesito surtir mas mi negocio ya que para mi es importante poder ofrecer al cliente mayor variedad y de esa forma mejorar los ingreso y por ende las utilidades.
loan_use: To purchase eggs, rice, sugar, coffee, flour, soap, butter, chicken, dairy products ham,corn and beans.

description:
My name is Teresa and I am a merhcant, I have a small grocery store located in my own homw which creates enough income to contribute to family expenses. I have worked in my grocery store for several years and I have the help of my children in their spare time. I currently need to stock my store so that I can offer a wider variety of goods to my customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Mi Nombre es Teresa soy comerciante, cuento con una pequeña pulperia ubicada en mi casa de habitación la que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia cuento con varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, cuento con el apoyo de mis hijos ya que en su tiempo libre ellos me colaboran en el negocio, actualmente necesito surtir mas y poder ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a mis clientes.
loan_use: To purchase rice, butter, sugar, soap, toilet paper, dairy goods, sausages and other items.

description:
My name is Digna Emerita and I am a merchant, I have a business in which I sell new clothing, in the manner of a traveling saleswoman. I have several years experience, and my business creates enough income to cover family expenses. I currently am in need of a wider variety of products because the demand has increased and I do not have the capital readily available to satisfy my customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

\r\n\r\nMi nombre es Digna Emerita, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con negocio de venta de ropa nueve la distribuyo de manera ambulante por encargo, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares, actualmente necesito mas variedad de producto ya que la demanda a crecido y no cuento con el capital suficiente para satisfacer la clientela.
loan_use: To purchase men's shirts, women's blouses, socks, girl's and women's underwear.

description:
Madam Yawa A. is a 42-year old married mother of five (05) children. After leaving her studies, she started her own business to share the household expenses with her husband, who was previoulsy an official. A very active woman, she manages her business well and brings in solid revenue. Her first two credits were reimbursed without problems.

She would once again like to ask for a $950 credit that would help her build her cloth business and equip her grocery store. She will then be able to increase her sales and contribute to the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 42 ans environs, Madame A. Yawa est mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants. Abandonnant ses études, elle exerce ses activités commerciales et arrive à partager les dépenses du foyer avec son mari qui est un ancien préfet. Très active, elle maîtrise bien son commerce qui lui procure assez de revenus. Ses deux premier crédit ont été bien soldé sans incident. De nouveau, elle sollicite un crédit de $950 qui servira à renforcer son commerce de pagnes et à équiper plus sa boutique d’alimentation générale. Elle pourra alors augmenter son chiffre d’affaires et contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
loan_use: Purchase of cloths and grocery store materials

description:
Married to two women and a father of six (06) children, Adam G. sells agricultural tools such as the matchet, the hoe and the "daba". He also prepares and sells salicylic creams and ointments, one of which became popular across borders due to its therapeutic properties.

He now sells his products in various communities and distributes to wholesalers that continue to increase the orders. Despite the well reimbursed financings received to date, he still has difficulty satisfying his customers' needs. Today he is asking for a $1000 loan in order to respond to the market needs.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Père de famille et marié à deux femmes et père de six (06) enfants, G. Adam est commerçant des outils agricoles tels que la houe, le daba, le coupe-coupe et se consacre aussi et surtout à la préparation et la vente des pommades salcilés.
