Une pommade dont la vertu thérapeutique a traversé les frontières. Il a créé des points de vente dans divers localités et a des grossistes qui continuent par multiplier les commandes. Malheureusement malgré les petits financements reçus et bien remboursés, il n’arrive pas à satisfaire à temps et en quantité ses clients. Il sollicite aujourd’hui un financement de $1000 afin de répondre au besoin du marché.
loan_use: Preparing and selling creams

description:
21 years old, married and a mother of a child, but illiterate, Mrs. Ami G., is specialized in the sale of peppers and gari (a local food) because of her very limited financial means . Today, she wants to take advantage of her youth to launch greater scale initiatives. She is asking for a credit of $1000 in order to be able to build a business to sell rice, oil, sugar and charcoal.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Agé de 21 ans, mariée et mère d’un enfant, Madame G. Ami, analphabète, est spécialisée dans la vente de piments et du gari à cause de ses moyens financiers très limités. Aujourd’hui, elle veut mettre à profit son jeune âge pour se lancer dans des initiatives de grande envergure. Elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour le commerce du riz, de l’huile, du sucre en poudre et du charbon de bois.
loan_use: Purchase and resale of rice, oil, sugar and charcoal

description:
Twenty-five years old and single, B. Cyrille is a computer technician and seller of computer equipment. He’s a young man who really applies himself in his technical field, but who lacks financial means. To re-energize his activities and possess capital would give him greater bargaining leverage with his suppliers, so he’s seeking a loan of $1200 for the purchase and resale of computer equipment and also to open a small word processing and photocopy service. This is a young man with lots of experience and courage who deserves assistance that will help him really go far.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Jeune célibataire de 25 ans, B. Cyrille est un technicien en informatique et vendeur des consommables informatiques. C’est un jeune homme qui exerce réellement dans son domaine de formation avec une très grande expérience mais les moyens financiers lui font défaut. Pour redynamiser son activités et avoir un fonds de commerce conséquent lui permettant de disposer d’une force de négociation avec ses fournisseurs, il sollicite un crédit de $1200 pour l’achat et la vente de consommables informatiques et ouvrir à côté un petit service de traitement de texte et de photocopie. C’est un jeune pétri d’expérience et courageux qui mérite d’être propulsé loin.
loan_use: purchase and sale of computer equipment

description:
Yawa A. is the second wife of her husband and the mother of five children. Her husband abandoned her over six years ago. Faced with this situation, she had to return to the home of her parents, with her children in tow, in order to pursue various business activities. She could then address the primary needs of her children and their schooling. With small loans that were repaid on time, she was able to get by as best she could.

She is presently requesting a loan of $600 to be repaid in 12 months. The loan will revitalize her business selling various items including snacks and finger food. Despite the difficult everyday realities she encounters, she has always demonstrated great promptness in her payments.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Deuxième femme de son mari et mère de cinq (05) enfants, Madame A. Yawa est abandonnée par son mari depuis plus de six ans. Face à cette situation, elle a du retourner chez ses parents avec ses enfants sous le bras pour entreprendre divers activités commerciales afin de faire face aux besoins primaires et à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Avec de petits financements bien remboursés, elle s’en est sortie tant bien que mal.

Elle sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $600 remboursable en douze mois pour relancer son activité commerciale. Malgré les réalités quotidiennes difficiles qu’elle traverse, elle a toujours fait preuve d’une grande promptitude dans ses remboursements.
loan_use: Selling various items (snacks)

description:
Born on June 27, 1972 in Aného, where he also currently lives, Mr. Messan L. is married and the father of three children, as well as being responsible for two apprentices. He opened his carpentry shop in 1998 at the end of his own apprenticeship. Blessed with tremendous experience, he does his best to satisfy the demands of his clients.

Today, he is hoping to benefit from this new opportunity and supply his workshop with boards in order to produce more furniture. He is asking for a loan of $950 which would enable him to realize his dream. This loan would help Mr. Messan L. increase his revenues and improvie the living conditions of his entire family.

Translated from French by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 27 Juin 1972 à Aného où il vit encore, Monsieur L. Messan est marié et père de trois (03) enfants et à sa charge deux (02) apprentis. Il ouvrit son atelier de menuiserie depuis 1998 à la fin de son apprentissage. Doté d’une expérience énorme, il fait son possible pour satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.

Aujourd’hui, il compte bénéficier de cette nouvelle opportunité pour s'approvisionner en planches afin de produire des meubles. Il sollicite un crédit de $950 qui lui permettra de réaliser son rêve. L’octroi de ce nouveau crédit aidera Monsieur L. Messan à accroître ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de toute sa famille.
loan_use: Supplying his workshop with boards for carpentry work\r\n

description:
I have been making trousers for 2 years as well as making shoes. My business is small, however I am working hard to make it grow and to make my products better-known. But for this I need capital to buy raw materials to make the trousers and shoes. With my efforts I will be able to make my business grow and to help my family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Tengo dos años de dedicarme a confeccionar pantalones, comunmente llamado ropa de maquila y fabricar calzado, mi negocio es pequeño aun, estoy trabajando para hacerlo crecer y dar a conocer mis productos. Es por eso que necesito capital de trabajo para comprar materia prima y fabricar pantalos y zapatos. Con mi esfuerzo se que puedo hacer crecer mi negocio y ayudar a mi familia.
loan_use: To purchase cloths and other materials to make shoes.

description:
For several years I have been working in the sales of clothing for adolescents, children and adults. My business has created enough income to help my family and now I need to invest money in order to stock my store and to have a wider variety of clothes for those customers who will be heading to the beaches. Thanks to my family's efforts I have been able to grow my business to what it is now, and at the moment it is rather difficult to find work, so there is a need to find another way to help one's family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

\r\n\r\nDesde hace varios años me dedico a la venta de ropa para jovenes, niños y adultos. Mi negocio me ha generado ganancias para ayudar a mi familia, ahora necesito invertir capital para surtir y tener variedad en ropa para las personas que salgan a las playas. Gracias al esfuerzo de mi familia he podido salir adelante con este negocio ya que en estos momentos es bastante dificil encontrar trabajo y hay que buscar algo para ayudar a la familia.
loan_use: To purchase various clothing articles for men, women and children.

description: Rufo is a 45 year old mother of one son and 3 adopted children.  Her business is a coffee shop located in the capital of Samoa which is Apia.    Rufo lived most of her life in America but when her husband passed away she moved back to Samoa. She started a coffee shop business that is her main source of income in taking care of her children.  Rufo had the idea of her business from America, and she found it really successful in Samoa. She has picked a good location which is near to the main bus stop.  Her daily customers are mostly students.
loan_use: To purchase additional stock for her coffee shop and buy new cooking equipment - stove, coffeemaker, pots, pans, and other utensils

description: Soloao is a retired teacher, aged 66. She’s a strong mother of 14 children, one deceased, 4 living overseas and 9 staying in Samoa. Soloao is a very hard working mother. When she was teaching, she realized that her salary couldn’t provide for all her kids, so she helped out her husband set up a fishing business. She started with a single canoe with just her husband alone. One day she resigned as a teacher because she realized that their business was growing and her husband needed support. From that single canoe, they now own 3 fishing vessels, with 3 employees on each boat. Her business has become really successful, but she still wants to do more. So she’s requesting a $850 loan for upgrading her fishing gear and maintenance of her boats.
loan_use: Buy fishing gear, maintenance of boats

description:
Marie Jeanette Makpowoassinou A., 29, is married, the mother of three children, and guardian of three others from her deceased older brother. She is a hairdresser by profession. Her husband teaches part-time on a farm and makes $20 a month, which barely covers one day of family expenses. Aware of the situation, she began a small business selling beauty products to make ends meet. However, the lack of sufficient means, particularly working capital, poses a serious handicap to her deteriorating finances. And this highly devoted and enterprising woman is becoming poorer and poorer as a result. So she is requesting a loan of $1,000 to grow her shop by paying cash for beauty supplies, a much less costly way to do it. She may also acquire certain tools of the trade, notably two hairdryers. The goal is to open a very modern hair salon of her own. And the loan will help increase her turnover, so that she can provide for her family at all times.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 29 ans, Madame A. Marie Jeannette Makpowoassinou est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants et a à sa charge les trois (03) enfants de son grand frère décédé. Son mari est enseignant volontaire dans une ferme et dont le salaire de $20 par mois, couvre à peine les dépenses d’une journée. Consciente de cet état de chose, Madame A., coiffeuse de formation, s’est lancée dans le petit commerce de produits de beauté afin de joindre les deux bouts. Mais le manque de moyens suffisants surtout le fonds de roulement constitue un handicap sérieux à son décollage économique et accentue la paupérisation de cette dame très dévouée et entreprenante. Aussi, sollicite t-elle un crédit de $1000 pour agrandir sa boutique en payant comptant et donc très moins cher ses produits et à acquérir certains matériels de travail notamment deux séchoirs en vue d’ouvrir son atelier de coiffure très moderne. Ce crédit l’aidera à augmenter son chiffre d’affaires afin de subvenir à tout moment aux besoins de sa famille.
loan_use: To purchase hairdryers and to open a hair salon \r\n

description:
Born in 1961 in Dévémé, Mr. Kokou A. is a brave and well-respected man. A married father of 4, he is experienced in coal production. It is thanks to this activity that he is able to support the people under his care. Currently, the demand for wood coal is growing incessantly as few people can afford to purchase gas. However, it requires modern equipment. He is now seeking a loan of $750 to acquire a sawing machine and purchase wood for producing charcoal and meet the demands of the market. He'll be able increase his business figures and improve his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1961 à Dévémé, Monsieur A. Kokou est un brave homme et bien respecté. Marié et père de quatre (04) enfants, il possède une expérience dans la production de charbon. C’est d’ailleurs grâce à cette activité qu’il subvient aux besoins des personnes à sa charge. Actuellement, la demande de charbons de bois ne cessent d’augmenter car très peu de gens arrivent à s’acheter des gaz, mais il faut des moyens modernes de travail. Aujourd’hui, il sollicite un crédit de $750 pour acquérir une machine à scier et acheter des bois pour produire des charbons afin de satisfaire la demande du marché. Il pourra augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
loan_use: Purchase a sawing machine and wood

description:
Fusiena is 35 years old and married, with 3 children. She sells grains and cereals in her community, including rice, beans, maize and groundnuts. \r\n\r\n

Because Fusiena buys on credit from her suppliers, it tends to reduce her profit margin. During the KRABAN 'TEACH' learning sessions, Fusiena got to know about the KIVA program, and she is therefore seeking a loan for seed capital to be able to pay off her suppliers at the point of purchase. She hopes this will improve her profit levels.
loan_use: Seed capital

description:
Mrs. Alougba K. is 56 years old and lives in the village of Agbanakin in the Lakes region. She has been a widow for five years, and is now the only one taking care of her six children, of which the oldest are unemployed. She specializes in the production and marketing of palm oil, commonly called "red oil" in the region. This is a business which she has undertaken for more than fifteen years; an activity which she has fully mastered.

She refunded all previously received loans, which have enabled her to have a more or less steady income. We the aim of securing and increasing her income to be able to provide to her family's needs, she is asking for a loan of $550 to buy palm nuts and wood in bulk for the production of oil.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 56 ans, Madame K. Alougba vit dans le village d’Agbanakin dans la préfecture des Lacs. Veuve depuis cinq ans, elle est la seule à prendre en charge ses six enfants dont les plus âgés sont sans emploi. Elle est spécialisée dans la production et la commercialisation de l’huile de palme communément appelée « huile rouge ». C’est une activité qu’elle mène depuis plus de quinze ans ; ainsi dit, c’est une activité dont elle maîtrise tous les rouages. Les prêts précédemment reçus et remboursés lui ont permis d’avoir un revenu plus ou moins régulier. Dans le souci d’accroître et de sécuriser ce revenu afin de pouvoir subvenir totalement aux besoins de sa famille, elle demande un crédit de $550 pour acheter en quantité des noix de palme, des bois pour la production de l’huile en conséquence.
loan_use: Purchase of palm nuts and heating wood

description:
Born in 1969 in Cotonou, Mr. Comlan B. is married and has three (03) children. As a mechanic, his job barely supports him, and he meets the needs of his family through pain and suffering because of a lack of work.

So, to avoid staying inactive during times when he is not working, he has decided to begin an income-generating business to make ends meet.

For this reason, he is asking for a loan of $800 to buy a motorcycle taxi. The fares obtained will allow him to repay this loan and will also give him the means to better meet the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1969 à Cotonou, Monsieur Comlan B., est marié et père de trois (03) enfants. Mécanicien de profession, une activité qui ne lui sourit guère, il arrive avec peine et souffrance à subvenir aux besoins elémentaires de sa famille par manque de travail.

Aussi, pour ne pas rester inactif pendant que son travail ne marche pas, il a décidé d’entreprendre une activité génératrice de revenu afin de pouvoir joindre les deux bouts.

C’est pour cette raison qu’il sollicite un financement de $800 pour s’acheter un taxi moto. Les recettes réalisées permettront de rembourser ce financement et aussi lui donneront les moyens de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
loan_use: To buy a motorcycle taxi

description: "Auntie Lizzy" lives in Amanfrom, Kasoah, Ghana, where she sells charcoal to her community. Since this is the main source of fuel in most homes, demand for her product is very high. She is seeking a loan of $950.00 from Kiva to enable her to buy more bags of charcoal in order to serve her customers. She has been trained by Kraban Support Foundation to adopt the TEACH Lending tool in keeping simple records of her financial and business operations.
loan_use: To buy charcoal

description: Emilia sells secondhand clothing and jewelry, both local and foreign-made. She would like to buy jewelry from manufacturers, but it is very costly and she is unable to buy it these days. She is seeking a loan of $900.00 from Kiva to enable her to expand her product line in this way.
loan_use: To buy jewelry

description:
The 35 year old Juenah has four children ages 15, 12, 10 dan 5. The $50 additional working capital from MBK will be partly used to purchase merchandise items for her store while the rest will be used to buy fertilizer and other chemicals for farming. From her store she typically earns 115,000 IDR with a profit of 15,000 IDR \r\n\r\n

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.
loan_use: To purchase merchandise items for her store

description:
Gina Moises Sitoe A., 37 years of age, married and a mother of 3, grew up with her parents. Her studies were interrupted at 8th grade due to the early pregnancy of her first child. Her husband is in the military and has always been away from the family. With the transfer of her husband to the northern most province of the country, Gina was obligated to start a business in order to sustain her 3 children. In conversation with her neighbors, she found out about Hluvuku-Adsema (Field Partner) and met and solicited a loan. Today, Gina’s business has expanded, having two counters and the fortune of employing one worker (a single mother). With the business’ revenue Gina supports the family’s expenses and her children’s education, as well as the family’s health in case of sickness. Currently, with both establishments, capital funds are fundamental to responding to the challenges of better serving the customer. It is in this context that Gina approached Hluvuku-Adsema to solicit a loan of 425 dollars. With this loan Gina intends to increase the volume of merchandise in order to respond to customer’s demands. Her business’ impact on the community is great; she supplies clothes at an extremely reasonable price and has created two jobs for herself and another woman.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Gina Moisés Sitoe A. de 37 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 3 filhos, cresceu sob responsabilidade dos pais viu os seus estudos interrompidos na 8ª classe devido a gravidez precoce do seu primeiro filho. O Marido é um militar e tem estado sempre fora da família. Com transferência do seu marido para província mais a Norte do Pais, viu-se obrigada a abrir um negocio de forma a sustentar os seus 3 filhos. Em conversa com vizinhos, soube da existência da Hhuvuku, aproximou-se e solicitou um empréstimo. Hoje em dia, o seu negocio conhece uma outra dinâmica, já conta com duas bancas e providencia emprego a 1 trabalhador ( uma mãe solteira). Com os rendimentos do negocio suporta as despesas familiares, escolares dos seus filhos, assim como de saúde da família em caso de doença. Actualmente com os dois estabelecimentos, o capital de trabalho é fundamental para responder os desafios de servir melhor o cliente é neste contexto que aproximou a Hluvuku e seus parceiros para solicitar um empréstimo de 10.400,00mt. Com este empréstimo pretende aumentar o volume de mercadoria de forma a responder positivamente com as exigências dos clientes. A sua actividade tem um maior impacto na comunidade, pois fornece roupas a um preço bastante acessível e criou dois postos de trabalho para ela própria mais uma senhora viúva.
loan_use: To increase the stock of clothes in her shop

description: Mrs. Mere V. talent is, ELEI.  She’s thirty-one years of age and married to Mr. V. from the village of Levi.  Mere elei's more than ten materials a day.  She elei's, print names design pictures on ielavalava and shirts.  During my project check Mere is very happy at what she’s doing.  She’s thankful to God for the gift that he gave to her to help fulfill the needs of her family.  Her business project has improved in many ways, x-rays papers provide by her friends, toothbrush, sponge,  paints and most of all her family support.  Mere believes that her business is doing fine because of the growth of the number of her customers.  She sells some of her stuff at her home, she also delivers some to the shops around the island.
loan_use: To purchase fabrics, paints, stencils and other materials for the business

description: Lipine M. is a well-known businesswoman.  She works hard in order for her to help and satisfy her family needs.  She’s born on the 20th April 1938.  She has nine children, five are married and three are not married.  Lipine comes from a family of six people.  She’s a hard working person due to her income earns from each day.  She earns $150 tala a day from selling her products at the market, small retailer and at her residence.
loan_use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers, pesticides

description: Taua started her own flea market stand and as time went by she decided that she wanted to expand her career to do something else to coincide with her present business. She is grateful to SPBD for giving her the financing to start working on her vegetable plots. From it she then earns another extra one hundred and twenty daily which is higher than what she usually gets from her flea market stand. Now her husband who is her co-partner and herself make a profit of six hundred tala from both her small businesses in a week. Taua is very impressed with the outcome and she is always ready to make weekly payments of her loan.
loan_use: To purchase materials, gel, sandals, spray, glass, bags, hats, tanoa, fertilizer, knives, cabbage(seeds),\t(HI)=cement,  and timber.\r\n

description:
Pe'a, 59, is a talented seamstress who is the sole provider for her family.  Her children are grown, but because her children were unable to complete their education due to lack of family funds, they are still living at home with no jobs or stable future.

Pe'a is applying for a loan of $1,000 to enable her to purchase materials and supplies in order to enable her to open a small business selling clothing and performing seamstress services.

She wants to build some savings so that when she passes on her kids will have something to fall back on.
loan_use: To purchase fabrics and sewing materials

description:
Sela grew up in Faleula and became a talented fisherman, but at the expense of an education.  As a result, when she was married, she did not have any other marketable skills, and her family lived in poverty.

Under the guidance of SPBD, she has put her fishing skills to good use by establishing a small fishing business that caters to locals.

She has been in business for five years, and is now applying for a loan of $850 in order to purchase a new boat to expand her business in order to improve her living conditions as well as provide an education to her five children so that they will have the opportunities that she did not have.
loan_use: Purchase boat

description:
Ati is a member of MBK who has requested her third loan of $100. She became a member to raise some working capital so she can help her family's economy. Ati owns a vegetable farm. The loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and crop protection agents. Ati harvests her crops once every 25 days, generates revenue of IDR 500,000 and profits IDR 300,000 from it\r\n

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

\r\n
loan_use: to grow vegetable

description: Mufliha is a mother of four children and has a grand-daughter, Salsabila.  She owns a small grocery shop that sells household goods like cooking oil, wheat, and salted fish.  She will use her loan to buy more goods for her shop.  She also wants to use some of the money to send one of her daughters to a sewing course like one of her sisters did.  Once her daughter has finished the sewing course, she can work in a garment factory.  Her salary would help Mufliha and the family.  The grocery shop is Mufliha’s only livelihood as her husband does not have permanent work.  Mufliha really wants to earn more money for her children’s education as her third child had to stop her education after elementary school.\r\n
loan_use: Purchase additional inventory for store

description: Yanti is a 31 year old mother of 2 children; a 9 year old girl and a 2 year old boy. She sells instant noodles, cigarettes and ice using a table in front of her house. Her husband, Aang, is a truck driver with irregular income. He usually earns $10/week. She really hopes to earn more income for her children’s education and to expand her business.
loan_use: Capital

description: Jamah is a seller of cooked foods and has been working on her business for a long time. She sells her goods by going around the village on foot, carrying a winnowing tray on her head. Her husband works in a factory outside her village. She plans to use the loan to buy more goods, so that she may earn more money to keep sending her children to school.\r\n
loan_use: Buy additional inventory for her shop

description: Madame A. lives in Nkurankan in the Eastern part of Ghana. She is 28 years old and a seamstress. She sews children's and ladies' wear. She has a lot of customers but few machines to work with. She is seeking a loan of $800.00 from Kiva to enable her to purchase some sewing machines.
loan_use: working capital

description: Sarah operates a drinking spot. She sells both local and foreign drinks (alcoholic and non-alcoholic). She has no place to serve her customers. She is  seeking a loan of $1000.00 from Kiva to enable her to build a spacious place to serve her customers.
loan_use: working capital

description:
Irina is a divorced mother of one daughter. She first became an entrepreneur 12 years ago when she started working in one of the local markets selling women’s clothing. However, soon her sales began to go down so she decided to change locations and start a new venture in the busiest city market. She received a loan from “Nadiya Ukraine”, bought a kiosk and went to work. Today Irina runs a prosperous small business selling seasonal clothing for women. Irina has proven to be a successful entrepreneur. She is very active, loves challenges and is continuously seeking new opportunities. Irina is very passionate about her work – she lives every minute of her life to its fullest. At the same time, she is very responsible and has repaid every loan from “Nadiya Ukraine” without any delinquencies. Irina would like to get a loan for $500 to purchase a new vending facility in the central city market. She is planning to do some necessary reconstruction work and buy an assortment of new inventory in bulk. Irina thinks that a variety of good quality knitted wear, sweaters, jerseys, and T-shirts will sell well and will attract many potential customers to her business. We believe that Irina’s entrepreneurial ambition, hard work and optimistic attitude in combination with financial assistance will promote the further growth of Irina’s business and will ensure better living standards for her family.

Ірина – розлучена, в неї є дочка. Вона стала підприємцем 12 років тому, коли почала торгувати жіночим одягом на одному з місцевих ринків. Однак, обсяги її продажів дуже швидко знизилися, тому вона вирішила змінити розташування свого кіоску, почала торгувати на найбільшому міському ринку. Отримавши позику від „Надії України” Ірина придбала кіоск та взялася до роботи. Зараз вона – досить успішний підприємець, торгує сезонним жіночим одягом. Ірина довела, що вона – успішний підприємець. Вона – дуже активна, полюбляє виклик, постійно шукає нових можливостей. Ірина дуже віддано ставиться до своєї роботи – вона намагається жити на повну силу. У той же час вона дуже відповідальна, сплатила усі позики від „Надії України” без жодних прострочень. Ірина хотіла б отримати позику в 500 доларів для того, щоб придбати нове приміщення на центральному ринку. Вона планує зробити необхідний ремонт, закупити оптом товар. Ірина вважає, що широкий вибір якісних трикотажних товарів, светрів, кофт та футболок обов’язково користуватимуться попитом серед потенційних покупців. Ми віримо, що підприємницькі прагнення Ірини, її наполеглива праця та оптимізм у поєднанні з фінансовою допомогою сприятимуть подальшому зростанню бізнесу Ірини та забезпечать кращий рівень життя для її родини.
loan_use: To purchase a vending facility in the market

description: Naomi operates her BBQ business on Saturdays and Wednesdays, prime days for selling BBQ plates. Naomi’s children are young and she works hard to support their schooling. Though her husband works hard too, her income is needed to provide for the family.\r\n
loan_use: To purchase 2 cottons of mutton flaps, 2 ctns leq quarters, 2 boxes sausages

description:
Mary is divorced and mother of six children with only one child attending school. Bad memories of the problems she faced in a polygamous marriage and the difficulties she encountered when her husband abandoned her are the reasons for her determination to make a go of life. She has a vision of building a house for herself and her children. With her two previous loans, she succeeded in providing her community with palm oil two days a week.

Given a loan of $500, she plans to increase her stock by buying tins of palm oil that could meet the demand in her neighborhood (at least four days a week). She also plans to buy and retail “country-nyama-njama” (a dish of green vegetables which is widely eaten), and chickens to raise for Christmas.

She plans to repay her loan in 18 months. The first installment repayment shall be on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of loan.
loan_use: Selling palm oil and vegetables and raising chickens\t

description: Susanti is a 26 year old mother of two children. The eldest is 4 and the second is a baby of only 4 months. She has had a small store called “Warung” for a long time. She sells household goods like instant noodles, cigarettes, sugar and kerosene. She was funded by her husband’s money but now she requires additional working capital from MBK. She wants to have this loan to buy more goods since her husband, Saipudin, is only an unskilled worker who earns a weekly income of $15.\r\n
loan_use: Purchase stock for her store

description:
Mary is a client of Kraban Support Foundation who knows about the TEACH Lending program. She needs a loan of $750 to expand her business.

She will be able to repay the loan because her record-keeping skills are very good.
loan_use: working capital

description: Vic moves from door-to-door and house-to-house selling vegetables. The vegetables are mostly from her husband's farm. She does this to supplement the family income. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and has been educated in the TEACH Lending program. She needs a loan of $650 buy more vegetables from other farmers in and around her locality for onward sale at the market.
loan_use: Expansion of business.

description: Mrs. Felicia I. is 52 years old woman who leanrt her trade business for the past 6 yuears. She is happily married with three (3) children. She needs the above amount for her business expansion.
loan_use: To buy more cassava for processing

description: Margeret is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and is familiar with the TEACH Lending program. She also knows how to keep records of her business. She needs a loan of $650 to expand her business.
loan_use: working capital

description: Azucena is a seamstress who has over 30 years of experience. She has been in this line of since she was 24 thanks to the support of her family. She has been living in this area for about 15 years, where she is well known for the products she makes and sells. She is requesting a Kiva loan because she would like to invest in fabrics and other necessary materials to make uniforms for the upcoming school year. This is the busiest time of year for her and she is hopeful that the capital will help her take advantage of the spike in demand. She is very hopefully that these investments will reap profits that will help her make improvements to the home she lives in.
loan_use: Invest in threads and cloth

description: Mr. B. R. is a primary school teacher in the “Flor de Sacuanjoche” Academic Center and, for more than five years, has been the owner of an appliance repair shop. He would use the credit to buy tools and materials that would allow him to make his shop more professional and increase his income; because Nicaraguan teachers receive low wages, it would be impossible to improve his family’s economic conditions through teaching.
loan_use: He would use the money to purchase tools and materials that would allow him to improve the quality of his services and increase his clientele.

description:
Ramona has a business selling all types of gifts for girls' quinceañeras, baptisms and weddings. She also sells school supplies. She has one year of experience. She took out a loan from a lending institution to start her business. The business is in her home and she tends to it every day of the week.

She would use the loan to buy school supplies since the school season is starting. With the earnings she generates she will be able to make improvements to her business premises.

Ramona is 31 years old. She has 3 children. Her husband abandoned her 5 years ago. She was not able to make ends meet with the monthly payments her husband was sending her, so she had to look for another solution. Currently she is both mother and father for her children. Her desire is to grow the business in order to be able to keep her children in school and continue making improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Ramona tiene un negocio de venta de todo tipo de regalos para: quinceañera, bautizo, matrimonio, también vende útiles escolares. Tiene una experiencia de 1 años. Ella saco un préstamo en una institución que brinda este servicio. El negocio lo tiene en su misma casa y lo atiende todos los días de la semana.

Ella usara el préstamo para comprar: útiles escolares que se inicia la temporada de clase. Con los ingresos generados podrá hacer mejoras en su local.

La señora tiene 31 años. Tiene 3 niñas. Su esposo la abandono hace 5 años. Con las mensualidades que su esposo le mandaba no le alcanzaba y tuvo que buscar que hacer. Actualmente ella es padre y madre para sus hijos. Su deseo es incrementar el negocio para poder mantener a sus hijos en la escuela y seguir adecuando su casa.
loan_use: Buy school supplies to sell

description:
Tatyana is married and has one daughter. After her schooling she couldn’t find a good-paying job so she decided to become self-employed. Today she runs a little kiosk selling men’s outerwear in the local central market. She has been in this business for two years. Tatyana has proven to have the heart of an entrepreneur and is enthusiastic about her small business. Her exceptional prices, positive attitude and cheery, smiling face attract many customers. Tatyana has very good reputation with “Nadiya Ukraine”. She has promptly repaid 12 loans in the past. In the last two years her turnover capital has increased to $600. She would like to get a loan for $700 to supplement her available capital. This will allow her to introduce some new clothing items and purchase assorted inventory. Tatyana’s responsibility, stable business growth, and prompt payment record characterize her as a consistent and serious entrepreneur who is capable of loan repayment.

Тетяна – одружена, в неї одна дочка. Вона певний час не могла знайти гарно оплачувану роботу, а отже, вирішила працювати на себе. В неї є невеличкий кіоск з продажу верхнього чоловічого одягу, розташований на місцевому ринку. Вона займається цим бізнесом вже два роки. Тетяна має справжній талант підприємця, вона з великим ентузіазмом розвиває свій бізнес. Вигідні ціни, чудове ставлення до кожного покупця та широка посмішка на обличчі приваблюють багато клієнтів. В „Надії України” в Тетяни склалася гарна репутація. Вона вчасно сплатила усі 12 попередніх позик. За останніх два роки її робочий капітал збільшився на 600 доларів. Тетяна хотіла б отримати позику в 700 доларів для того, щоб поповнити свій капітал. Завдяки їй вона зможе придбати новий одяг та поповнити асортимент товарів. Відповідальність Тетяни, стабільне зростання її бізнесу та чудова кредитна історія характеризують її як поступового та серйозного підприємця, який спроможний сплатити чергову позику.
loan_use: To increase turnover capital

description: Mamie is thirty two years old, married, and has one child. She owns a telephone card business and a small food service. She started her businesses in 1997 with only US$61. Mamie learned through her friend about Hope’s Microfinance program and decided to join the group. She has been a faithful client with Hope. Mamie needs US$500 to purchase more phone cards to meet the demand. Her business is helping many people in the community that do not have phones. She is trying to improve her services that are enjoyed by many clients in her neighborhood. Her dream is to become a successful businesswoman and a wholesaler in her community.
loan_use: To purchase phone cards for resale\r\n\r\n
country_name: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

description:
Antonio has been working for a long time in the business of selling shoes. He used to have a shop in his own house, but when his marriage ended, his wife kept the business and Antonio had to start over again. Little by little, he opened a new shoe store. Now that he has his own business, he needs a loan of $1,200.00, which he will use to fill many of the orders that he already has, and to provide better service to his clients.

Antonio really wants to get ahead and he knows that with a little bit of help he can achieve great things. He expects to repay the loan over a period of 6 to 12 months. You can contribute to the growth of this business. Be an important part of Antonio’s life, he will be sincerely grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Antonio tiene mucho tiempo en el negocio de venta de zapatos, anteriormente tenía su local en su propio domicilio, pero después de la disolución de su matrimonio, su esposa se quedó con el negocio y Antonio tuvo que empezar de nuevo, poco a poco logró abrir otra zapatería, ahora que ya tiene su propio negocio necesita de un préstamo de $1200 dólares que utilizará para surtir muchos de los pedidos que ya tiene, y para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Antonio tiene muchos deseos de superación, y sabe que con un poco de ayuda puede lograr grandes cosas, y espera devolver el préstamo en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses, tú puedes contribuir al crecimiento de este negocio, sé parte importante en la vida de Antonio, él te lo agradece sinceramente.
loan_use: To buy inventory

description:
My name is Magdalena and two years ago I decided to sell clothing for men, women and children. I also sell jewelry such as rings, chains and earrings. My sales are from client-direct orders, so they are safe. As Mother's Day and summer are approaching, I need to provide warm-weather products like bathing suits, sandals, shorts, T-shirts and some jewelry for gifts.\r\n

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer.

\r\nMe llamo Magdalena y me dedico a vender ropa para damas, caballero y ninos desde hace dos anos, tambien vendo anillos, cadenas y anillos de enchape de oro. Mis ventas son por encargos de mis clientes, por lo que mis ventas son seguras, en este momento por acercarse el verano y dia de la madre necesito surtir mis productos con ropa de verano como trajes de bano, sandalias, shorts, camisetas y algunas joyas para regalos.
loan_use: Buy clothing such as shirts, pants, shorts, T-shirts and jewelry accessories.

description:
Alice is a mother of five children. The death of her father and the pain of watching some of her children miss an academic year due to a lack of money is the source of her motivation. Inspired by single mothers sponsoring their children in school, she took her first loan in 2004. Now this is her third time borrowing. With her previous two loans she succeeded in providing her community with food and manure. She is proud of having taken, managed, and repaid the loan while providing for some of her kids’ needs.

Given a loan of $400, she plans to buy six piglets, feed, sticks, as well as nails and zinc to repair the pig-fence.  She also wants to set aside money for vet services for the pigs. She plans to pay the loan installments with money she earns from the sale of manure and vegetables, of which she will cultivate with manure from her pig farm. She plans to repay the loan in 18 months. The first installment will be four months from the date of disbursement of the loan.
loan_use: pig farming

description:
Miss Thu and her husband have 4 children who are 9, 8, 7 and 2. They don’t have a house of their own so they live at her husband’s parents' in a small hut. They don’t have any land. \r\n

\r\nMiss Thu’s husband, Quang, is a day laborer. He can’t easily find business. Miss Thu sells fruits in a small market in the village. Their family income is very low at $7/person/month. Miss Thu wants to borrow $50 to increase her sales.
loan_use: Sell fruits

description: Bairam S. is 29 years old. He is single and lives in the village of Muldava, near Asenovgrad. Bairam has had a farming business since 2000. Then he has bought a cowshed from the previous state agricultural company in Asenovgrad and started breeding cows. Now 6 years later he has 23 cows in his farm. Because the cowshed is old and needs repairs Bairam S. applies for a $1200 loan. He will refit the cowshed roof and will build some partition walls to separate his cows.
loan_use: To refit the cowshed roof and build some partition walls

description:
Nancy has a business making and selling fashion accessories. She also sells household items and bottled water. Nancy started out two years ago selling plastic items for the kitchen, with the help of a little bit of money given to her by her husband. Over time she also learned how to make bracelets, necklaces, and other items she now sells.

Nancy needs this loan to invest in the raw materials for the manufacture of her products, and to buy more supplies for selling water. She is sure that her sales will increase and she will be able to provide a better education for her children.

Nancy is 41 years old and she has two children who are in school. She helps support the household with the income from her business. Along with the salary earned by her husband, she is able to keep up with the household expenses. She is sure that with this investment she will be able to earn more and help with a better education for her children.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Nancy tiene el negocio de elaboración de bisutería y venta de artículos para el hogar. Nancy empezo con un pequeño capital que le proporciono su esposo con el comercio de artículos para el hogar hace 2 años, vendiendo la línea de artículos plásticos para la cocina.Con el tiempo fue aprendiendo la elaboración de pulsera, collares y otros que ella los comercia. Ella también vende agua en botellones.

Nancy necesita el préstamo para invertir en materia prima para la elaboración de sus productos y comprar mas pomas para vender agua. Ella esta segura que sus ventas crecerá y le podra dar una mejor educacion a sus hijos.

Nancy tiene 41 años y tiene dos niños que estudian. Ella ayuda en el hogar con las ganancias de su negocio. Junta con el sueldo que gana su esposo para poder afrontar con la economía del hogar tiene la seguridad que con la inversión que hará le permitirá tener mejores ganancias y poder ayudar con una mejor educacion para sus hijos.
loan_use: Nancy needs this loan to invest in raw materials for her crafts.

description:
Roxana works selling home electronics and plastics in the provinces. She started her business with the help of her spouse, who provided $200. At the beginning she only sold basins, buckets, and small utensils for everyday use. Now she also offers clothing, shoes, and wallets.

Roxana will use the loan to invest in sheets, curtains, and children's school shoes. She has faith that with these new products her business will grow.

Roxana is married and 21 years old. She depends on her business to get by, along with her husband. Roxana hopes that this loan will permit her to save toward the construction of a home.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer.)

Roxana se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos y plásticos en provincias. Ella empezó su negocio con la ayuda de su esposo quien le facilito 200 dólares. Al principio solo vendía lavacaras, baldes y pequeños utensilios de uso diario. Ahora continúa ofreciendo este producto junto con ropa, zapatos y carteras.

Roxana usara el préstamo para invertir en sabanas y toldos y zapatos escolares .Ella tiene la fe que con estos nuevos productos su negocio va a crecer.

Roxana esta casada tiene 21 años. Ella depende de su negocio para seguir adelante junto con su esposo. Roxana tiene la esperanza que este préstamo le permitirá ahorrar para construir su vivienda.
loan_use: Roxana will use the loan to invest in sheets, curtains, and children's school shoes.

description:
Rafaela works selling plastic items for the home. Rafaela started her business with the support of her spouse, who gave her the money to buy a booth in the outdoor market. At first, she only sold basins, buckets, and chairs. Now she also sells small home electronics and clothing.

Rafaela aspires to sell microwave ovens and dishware. She will use this loan to invest in home electronics and plastic items. She has faith tha twith these new products, her business will grow and permit her to continue investing in merchandise.

Rafaela is married, and she has one daughter, who is grown. She is convinced that her business will see growth.

(Tranlsated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Rafaela se dedica a la venta de artículos plásticos para el hogar. Rafaela empezo su negocio con el apoyo de su esposo quie le facilito el dinero para la compra de un modulo en el mercado.Al principio solo vendia lavacaras , baldes y sillas. Ahora continúa ofreciendo estos productos juntos pequeños electrodomesticos y ropa.

Rafaela aspira vender microondas y vajillas .Ella usara el prestamo para invertir en electrodomesticos y articulos plasticos .Ella tiene FE que con estos nuevos productos su negocio crecera y le permitira seguir invirtiendo en mercaderia.

Rafaela esta casada tiene una hija que es independiente .Esta convencida que su negocio tendrá un crecimiento.
loan_use: She will use this loan to invest in home electronics and plastic items.

description: Hello, my name is Blanca and I am a merchant. I have a used clothing store in my home in the center of my community. I have been doing this work for several years, and it has allowed me to provide my children with an education and cover my household expenses. My children now have an intermediate school degree and also work at the store.
loan_use: Purchase of mixed clothing, children’s clothing, skirts, nightgowns and pants.

description:
This 44-year-old man has 4 years of experience in this business.
Having borrowed $400 he bought fruits.
This business allows him to support his family.
Now he needs a loan of $900 to buy  more agricultural products.
He is optimistic that his business will allow him to help with family expenses.
Rauf is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region, Bala Behmenli village. He is marriedand has 3 children.
loan_use: To buy agricultural products

description:
Hello, my name is Orlandina. My occupation is the selling of used clothing and the framing of photographs and paintings. I've been in this line of work for some years now. With the income I've been able to help cover family expenses. Thanks to this business we have improved our family income and achieved a better standard of living.\r\n

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer.

\r\nHola mi nombre es Orlandina, mi actividad principal es la venta de ropa usada y enmarcado de de fotografia y cuadros decorativos, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de activida, la que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia, gracias a este negocio hemos mejorado nuestro ingreso familiar logrando asi un mejor nivel de vida.
loan_use: Buy American-style clothing and molding for picture framing.

description:
My name is Benita G. and I make and sell tortillas. I have had my business for 4 years and I have the help of my daughters in the production and distribution of my product. My clientel is good as I distribute my tortillas in different markets in our area as well as grocery stores and we also make tortillas by order for reunions and parties. My goal is to increase my sales and with the earnings I make, hire another person to help us with production, as well as be able to feed my family and give a good education to my daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Benita G. me dedido a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tengo mi negocio hace unos 4 años, tengo la ayuda de mis hijas para la produccion y reparticion de mi producto, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que rapartimos mi productos en diferentes mercaditos y pulperias que estan cerca de nuestra localidad, tambien producimos para reuniones y fiestas, mi meta es incrementar mi volumen de venta y con las ganancias que obtenga poder contratar una persona para que nos ayude con la produccion de mi producto asi mismo poder alimentar a mi familia y darles un buen estudio a mis hijas.
loan_use: To purchase corn flour, lime, salt, firewood, matches and coal.

description:
My name is Maria AdelaiD. Machava D. C., and I am a 44-year-old single mother and a native of the city of Maputo. I grew up under the care of my parents; however, the family’s financial situation did not allow me to study pass the 7th graD.. Since 1997 I have assumed full administrative responsibilities for the family business and owned a commercial establishment at the 16th kilometer of the Boane district. Currently my business serves as the source of income for myself and the other members of my family (3 siblings and 2 children); the revenues help support familial and educational expenses. With this loan, I intend to buy property and expand the production of ornamental flowers and inoculated fruit trees, thus responding positively to client demands.

Maria’s business’ impact on the community is great because beyond providing employment to herself and 5 other people she offers ornamental flowers and fruit trees to the clients of Boane and the cities of Matola and Maputo.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria AdelaiD. Machava D. C. D. 44 anos D. idaD., mãe solteira, natural D. cidaD. D. Maputo, cresceu sob a responsabilidades dos pais, a situação financeira da família não lhe permitiu estudar para além da 7ª classe. DesD. 1997 vem assumindo na integra a gestão D. negocio da família e possui um estabelecimento comercial no km16 distrito D. Boane. Actualmente o seu negocio serve D. fonte D. rendimento para ela própria e outros membros da família 03 irmãos e 02 filhos. Com a renda do negocio suporta os encargos familiares e as despesas escolares D. 05 filhos . Com o empréstimo D. 30.000,00 mt pretenD. comprar um terreno e aumentar a produção D. plantas D. ornamentação e fruteiras enxertadas D. forma a responder positivamente com as exigências dos clientes. A sua actividaD. tem um impacto maior na comunidaD. porque além D. providenciar emprego para ela própria e mais outras cinco pessoas, coloca plantas ornamentais e fruteiras para um universo D. clientes D. Boane e cidades da Matola e Maputo.
loan_use: To increase the production of plants and flowers

description:
Nadir is an honest and hardworking person. He is married and has 2 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region, Karabag village.
Three years ago he purchased a car and became a taxi driver.
This business is the only source of his income.
Having borrowed $400 he bought spare parts.
Now he needs a loan of $700 to repair his car in order to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.
He wants to repair his car because everyone wants to travel in a smart and comfortable car.
loan_use: To repair his car

description: My name is Ana, and I work selling roasted meat at night in my area. Normally, people in my area eat out during the weekends, so I use the weekends as an opportunity to sell meat, yucca, pastries and pupusas. With the income earned, I am able to help support my children and give them an education.
loan_use: Purchase of charcoal, meat, condiments, firewood, etc.

description:
Arif has his own shop, where he sells wooden materials.
He is 33 years oldand an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Agdam region Kurdlar village, settled in the Khirdalan settlement. He is married and has 2 children.
Having borrowed  $500 he bought wood for making doors, windows,and floors.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to start selling iron armatures.
He has run this business for 3 years.
loan_use: To start sale of iron armatures

description:
For the past five years I have dedicated myself to selling a local style of fried fish accompanied with fried plantain slices. The fish sells very quickly because our customers like it for its taste and health benefits. My business helps generate income to be able to help cover family expenses and pay my employees.\r\n

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

\r\nDesde hace cinco años me dedico a la venta de pescado frito estilo lago de Yojoa, son fritos acompañados de tajaditas de platano verde, este pescado se vende rapido ya que nos gusta consumir bastante pescado por lo saludable y sabroso. Mi negocio me genera ingresos para poder atender a mi familia en los gastos y pagar a mis empleadas.
loan_use: Buy fresh fish, cabbage, onion, plantains, oils, etc.

description:
My name is Catarina C., and I am a 39-year-old native of Salamanga, Matutuine district, Maputo province. I am a married mother of 4 children, and I attended school up until the 6th grade. I could not continue my studies due to the 16-year civil war that severely affected the Matutuine district. During the civil war my parents took refuge in neighboring South Africa. For two years I worked as a cabinet-maker in a carpenter’s shop and after that I worked as a housemaid for two residences. In 1989 I married a young Mozambique man who at the time also worked in South Africa. With the end of the civil war in 1992 my husband and I decided to return to Mozambique. In 1994, after settling the family in the city of Maputo, I dedicated myself to the sale of diverse products from my residence. My family found it difficult adapting to urban life and in 1995 we decided to move back to my native home of Salamanga, Matutuine district. That same year I began to work on a project of reintegration for those returning from neighboring countries; I worked as a sewing instructor. At project’s end in 1996 I returned to the sale of everyday goods at the local market. In 1998 I rented a small commercial establishment belonging to my brother, and to this day I continue to work there. At this time my husband and I and 4 other employees depend on this business. With the loan I intend to acquire a vehicle to transport diverse cargo to my commercial establishment. This would facilitate our contribution to the increased rent and to the availability of diverse products at accessible prices to more than 100 families residing in the town of Salamanga.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Catarina C. de 39 anos de idade, Natural de Salamanga, distrito de Matutuíne Província de Maputo, Casada Maritalmente, Mãe de 4 filhos, tendo sido escolarizada até 6ª classe, Não conseguiu continuar mais com os estudos devido a guerra civil dos 16 que afectou severamente o distrito de Matutuíne. Durante a guerra os pais refugiaram-se na vizinha África do Sul em 1985, Por lá começou a trabalhar numa Carpintaria com a Função de marceneira, por um período de Dois Anos e mais tarde veio a trabalhar como empregada Domestica em duas residenciais. Em 1989 Casou-se Maritalmente na Africa do sul com um jovem moçambicano, que na altura se encontrava a trabalhar naquele pais vizinho. Com o fim da Guerra em 1992 decidem com o marido voltar a Moçambique em 1994, Tendo fixado a família na cidade do Maputo e lá dedicava-se a venda de produtos diversos na sua residência, segundo ela, não foram felizes com a realidade urbana assim viram-se obrigados em 1995 a voltar para Salamanga no distrito de Matutuíne, zona de origem. Ainda no mesmo ano começou a trabalhar num projecto de reasentamento dos regressados dos países vizinhos como facilitadora dos cursos de corte e costura. Findo o projecto em 1996 retomou a sua actividade de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade no mercado local. Em 1998 alugou um pequeno estabelecimento comercial do seu irmão, onde continua a trabalhar ate hoje. Neste momento ela e o marido dependem deste negocio com mais outros 4 empregados. Com este empréstimo pretende adquirir uma viatura para transporte de cargas diversas para o estabelecimento comercial sob sua gestão, contribuindo deste modo para aumento da sua renda e disponibilização de produtos diversos a preços acessíveis para mais de 100 famílias residentes na vila de Salamanga.
loan_use: To buy vehicle for supporting her business

description:
Dieu is 35. Dieu’s husband, Em, is 37. They have two children, ages 12 and 7. The children are students. \r\n

\r\nThey have 3,000 square meters of land where they grow rice. Because of the alkalinity of the soil, their rice production is low. Em has learned how to raise several species of fish. Their income, which comes from both growing rice and aquaculture, is $10 per person/month. Now, they need to receive a loan of $75 for buying young fish and fish food so that they are able to continue and expand the aquaculture business. They will repay monthly.
loan_use: Continue and expand their aquaculture business.

description:
Zia Gul is a mother of 3 children and lives in district 14 of Kabul, Afghanistan. During the war she lived in a village and from there she learned tailoring. She took a loan from AFSG to buy a new machine, fabric, a table...etc.

She has 5 years' experience in the current business and has found a contractor for herself. She can buy fabric from a shopkeeper and after turning the fabric into clothes, she gives it back to the shopkeeper. Through this process she can make an income and develop her business.
loan_use: New machine & fabric

description:
Ameenullah is 27 years old, single, and has a shop in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He has been working in his current business, selling shoes, for about 3 years. During the Taliban government he sold 2nd hand shoes and after there was peace he opened a new shoe shop to cover his family financially and develop his business.

Ameenullah is happy with the procedure of AFSG, giving loans to people to increase their business. He took a 1st individual loan to design his shop and buy shoes.
loan_use: Buying Shoes

description:
Valentina Lives in the regional center of Floresti but owns a bar in Baranesti, a village on the outskirt of the city. The village of Baranesti is a medium size village with 7000 people, no running water and no gas. Valentina studied accounting in the capitol of Moldova, Chisinau and worked as an accountant for 15 years in a different regional center before deciding to go into business for herself.

Valentina is 40 years old and married. Her husband works in the Army, they have 2 boys ages 18 and 19. She named her bar “Valentina’s” and sells beer and spirits, snacks, and cigarettes. Valentina needs a loan to purchase materials to make repairs and add a terrace on her bar to make it enjoyable for all now that spring is finally here. Valentino has owned this bar for only 9 months and is determined to make it a success.
loan_use: To purchase material to construct a terrace for her bar

description:
Born in 1960, Nkemchob is one of two wives with six children. The heavy school demands made daily by her children obliged her to start income-generation activities. She is a third-time borrower, having taken her first loan of $40 in 2003. With previous loans she succeeded in providing fast food, firewood, and corn to her community. Her immediate goal is to continue to contribute towards the education of their children.

With her experience in “buyam-sellam”, given a loan of $300, she plans to increase her stock by buying palm oil, firewood, and corn. With increased stock she will become a major supplier in her immediate community. She plans to pay her loan in 18 months. First loan repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.
loan_use: Selling of firewood, palm oil, and corn

description:
Lem, popularly called Mama Koki, was born in 1968. She is married and has four children. Her major goal is to work hand-in-hand with her husband to get all her children through school. She has received training in marketing techniques, credit and other survival skills. With constant supervision and support from group and center members she took her first loan of $40 in 2006. From previous investments she succeeded in providing lunch to workers at construction and other job-sites.

With a loan of $200, she plans to increase her stock by buying beans, drum of oil and pig feed. She will continue to provide lunch to laborers at job-sites and families that are busy to cook for themselves or for ceremonies. She plans to pay her loan in 15 months. First loan repayment installment shall be made on the first month from the date of disbursement of the loan.
loan_use: Mobile Koki restaurant

description:
Martiza owns a store and bazaar. She sells groceries and school supplies. Her husband, who had worked at a market, helped her start the business. They began with $300 in capital, which they invested in adapting her house for the business and purchasing some stock. Maritza will use the loan to buy groceries and school supplies at wholesale prices. Her business is located close to her district’s schools, which makes for good daily sales. Maritza is 25 years old, married, and has two children. Her husband is her right hand in the business and is in charge of making purchases in the market. She is confident that her sales will increase and will improve her family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Maritza tiene una tienda y bazar. Se dedica a la venta de viveres y utiles escolares. Ella empezo su negocio con la ayuda de su esposo quien anteriormente habia trabajado en un mercado. Comenzaron con un capital de $300 dolares que invirtieron en la adecuacion de su hogar y un poco de mercaderia. Maritza usara el prestamo para comprar viveres a precio de mayorista y papeleria. Su negocio esta muy bien ubicado cerca de escuelas del sector ayudando esto para que sus ventas diarias sean buenas. Maritza tiene 25 años esta unida tiene 2 hijos su esposo es su mano derecha en el negocio el se encarga de las compras en el mercado. Ella esta segura que sus ventas se incrementaran y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
loan_use: Purchasing her products at wholesale prices

description:
Eliceo has a very humble plot of land that he uses for rice production. Although he does not have much, it helps make ends meet for Eliceo and his parents. He is not married nor does he have children, but he is still very close to his parents as they live together and work the lands. He also works at the local rice processing center.

The Santa Lucia Communal Bank

Eliceo is part of the newest Communal Banks in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Centro Agricola de Santa Lucia Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Santa Lucia. Their association works cooperatively to help in the commercialization of the product after it has grown. They will use the micro-loans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Primero de Agosto Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many micro-finance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we work with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about Santa Lucia compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program. Special thanks to Mario Balazantegui who provided expert insight and contributed to the development of the alliances with the local organizations.

Economy of Santa Lucia

Santa Lucia County has a population of about 33,000 people. The sector is fit for rice cultivating because it is not in the lowlands and therefore it is not at risk of flooding. There is also great access to water because of the Daule River, which is accessible to many of the farmers in the area. About 70% of the farmers have basic infrastructure for watering their crops.

Rice production is the main economic activity of the area as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Almost everyone is either directly or indirectly involved with rice production, as they produce, commercialize or participate in activities that add value to the product. Within the county, there is a small town also named Santa Lucia. The town is filled with many small businesses and it serves as the social and commercial hub of the area.

Rice Farming in Santa Lucia

Most of the people in the Santa Lucia area are small farmers. They produce about 100 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds and plowing. The farmers then fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water-intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them gather their production. A risk factor does exist in rice farming because of drought, but in Santa Lucia this is somewhat mitigated by the access to water form the nearby river.

Access to Credit

The biggest struggle in the area has been the lack of credit. Because people do not count on formal financial services, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also lack skills and knowledge to commercialize their products and pay fair prices for their crops.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will be used to to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. They will also be used to prepare the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase other materials. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical micro-entrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.
loan_use: Rice production

description:
Manuel is a farmer in the Santa Lucia County, where he has lived for twenty years. He is 63 years old, but he still has the will to work and provide for his family. He has a 14 year-old that he wants to make sure finishes school. Manuel is hoping to receive the loan in order to improve the production of his lands. He will primarily buy fertilizer and fumigation equipment. He and his wife Benita hope to save for the future of their son.

<

The Santa Lucia Communal Bank

All of the members of the Centro Agricola de Santa Lucia Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Santa Lucia. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.
loan_use: Rice Farming

description:
Dionicio has lived in Santa Lucia for about 50 years. As most of the other people in the sector, he has gone through life thanks to the fertile lands that produce rice. He has raised 5 children thanks to the help of his rice farming. He is now hoping that he can receive a loan in order to improve his farm and leave his children with more productive lands. He has had 5 children in total and he is happy that they have grown up but still help him on the family's farm.

The Santa Lucia Communal Bank

Dionicio is part of the newest Communal Banks in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Centro Agricola de Santa Lucia Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Santa Lucia.
