They also bring goods from the city back to Quevedo where they can resell them for a profit. He travels back and forth about twice a week and is happy with his business.

This is Miguel's second loan with Kiva and Mifex. WIth the first loan he was able to invest in a variety of household items that he resold in his hometown. The initial investment allowed him to permanently increase his capital reserves so he could bring in more profits consistently as he was able to purchase more products as investments. He ended up investing in a small plot of oranges in his hometown. He is still waiting to cultivate the profits, but he is very optimistic about this particular investment. Miguel was also able to improve his home by building a bathroom with plumbing inside his home when previously he only had an outhouse. He plans to invest his second loan just as the first one, in household products to resell in his hometown. He wants to continue to improve his home with the profits, beginning by changing the walls which are currently made out of bamboo.

Translated by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.
loan_use: Continue investing in household products

description: Loi was born in 1973 and her husband was born in 1960. They have a daughter and a son. Their daughter attends ninth grade. Their son doesn’t go to school yet. Loi sells vegetables at the local market. Her husband is a day laborer. Their income is $11 per person/month. If she gets a loan of $75, she can expand her business and save money for her daughter's school fees. They are going to repay monthly.
loan_use: Selling vegetables.

description: Thuong is 47 years old. Her husband died a long time ago. She supports 3 sons whose ages are 15, 13, and 6. The eldest stopped going to school to earn money.  The other 2 sons attend primary school. Thuong runs a small grocery store from her home. Their income is $7 per person/month. Thuong hopes to receive a loan of $75 to invest in her grocery store. She will repay monthly.
loan_use: Expanding her grocery store.

description:
This entrepreneur is a mechanic. He is 30 years old. He has a big family which consists of his wife, three children, and his mother and father. Because of his poor family, he didn’t get any education. He works with his partner in the industrial area in Kirkuk. Five guys work with him.

When he started his business, he went with his partner to his garage and waited for the customers to come. He works 12 hours in the day without rest. This is his first loan. He wants to buy new engines and sell them to his customers. As he said, "I'm looking for a better future."

Note: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, etc.).
loan_use: Buy a new engines

description: Mr. Nghiep is 34 years old.  Because the Mekong Delta has a lot of rivers, transporting by boat is useful for many people to go to market. Nghiep is a boat driver who transports customers daily, plus his wife wants to become a door-to-door salesperson by boat on rivers. Nghiep’s wife wants to sell vegetables. They have a daughter and son, and the son is attending fourth grade. They have no land for cultivation. Their income is $8 per person/month. They hope to receive a loan of $75 so that they can invest in selling vegetables on rivers. They will repay the loan monthly.
loan_use: To invest for selling vegetables from his boat shop

description:
Svetlana is married and has one daughter. She runs a small business selling women’s clothing at the market in Melitopol, Ukraine. Svetlana has been in business for over 10 years. Currently she has about $1,600 in gross income each month, and her monthly net profit amounts to $500.

Svetlana has an enterprising spirit. She is very hard-working and perseverant. The success she has achieved in her business is a direct result of her efforts and commitment to her work. Svetlana has repaid each of her loans from Nadiya Ukraine without any delinquencies.

Svetlana would like to get a loan for $500 to increase her assortment of clothing items so she can better present the benefits of her products and services to her customers. She always tries to offer a nice variety of stylish and unique outfits for ladies and avoids copying the products of other markets vendors. Svetlana has built a good reputation for the quality of her products and support services. We believe that her constant quest to improve her business and services will help her achieve continued success and enable her to repay this loan on time.
loan_use: To increase stock

description:
Ludmila runs a prosperous little clothing sales kiosk at the Pervomaiski Rhinok (market) in Nikopol, Ukraine. A teacher by profession, she decided to open her own business about ten years ago and has done very well. She sells a variety of women’s skirts, blouses, and dresses.

Income from Ludmila’s business helped her and her husband, Victor, build their own home. Her income also helps provide for her two children – a son aged 23 and daughter, 17. Ludmila is typical of many women entrepreneurs who desire to earn extra income to provide a better living for their families.

Ludmila has requested a loan for $800 to use to help her purchase additional inventory to sell. She typically will buy about $400 worth of clothes from her suppliers three times a month. This allows her to maintain an adequate amount of inventory on hand and she can easily update her product selection if an item is selling well or not moving quickly enough. Ludmila’s business has benefited much from loans she has received in the past. We believe that this loan will continue to help her business be successful and provide much needed income for Ludmila and her family.
loan_use: Increase inventory

description:
Mrs. Eva is a single mother of four children. She started her grocery store 27 years ago. After the separation from her partner, she had to take care of the children by herself. To obtain the means necessary to service, she started her business from her living room. Later, she set up a shop across the street and thanks to the good service she provides, she has stayed in business for so long.

She now needs $1,200 that she will use to buy merchandise to have a better assortment for sale, and to keep growing her business. She commits to paying back over a period of 6 too 12 months.

Right now, you have an opportunity to help those who need it most. You can improve the quality of life for Eva and her family! Stop doubting and help her out!

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Eva, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos, ella inició su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes desde hace 27 años, después de la separación de su pareja se quedó a cargo de sus hijos ella sola y para obtener los recursos necesarios para su manutención empezó con este negocio en la sala de su casa, después acondicionó un local en el frente y gracias al buen servicio que ofrece ha logrado permanecer por tanto tiempo.

Ahora necesita de un crédito de $1,200 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para tener mejor surtido su negocio y continuar creciendo, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Hoy es tiempo de ayudar a quien más lo necesita, tú puedes mejorar la vida de Eva y su familia, no lo pienses más y decídete a apoyarla.
loan_use: To buy merchandise

description:
Mrs. Paulina is a widow and has four children. She began her business 10 years ago, because she needed to support her children and their education, alone, after her husband passed away. She began by selling various items until she decided to open a small grocery store, in which her children would eventually work. Now she lives alone with her youngest daughter, and the good service and the high quality of her products have allowed her store to stand the test of time.

She needs to continue working in order to improve her living conditions and she wishes to see her business continue to grow, for which she will need a loan of $925, which she will use to buy merchandise. She will re-pay this loan in 6-12 months. You can be a fundamental part of this business and in Paulina's life, she believes in those who help others and she thanks you for your kindness.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

La señora Paulina es viuda y tiene cuatro hijos, ya casados, ella inició su propio negocio hace 10 años, ante la necesidad de mantener y darles estudio a sus hijos ella sola, después de que falleciera su esposo. Empezó vendiendo diversos artículos hasta decidió abrir su tienda de abarrotes, donde eventualmente recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, ahora solo vive con su hija menor, el buen servicio que ofrece y la calidad de sus productos la ha llevado a permanecer en el negocio durante tanto tiempo.

Ella necesita continuar trabajando para mejorar sus condiciones de vida, y desea que su negocio continúe creciendo para lo que requiere de un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, mismos que ofrece devolver en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Tú puedes ser parte fundamental en este negocio y en la vida de Paulina, ella confía en las personas que ayudan a quien más lo necesita y agradece tu ayuda.
loan_use: To purchase merchandise.

description: A. Hamid lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is in university and he has a cosmetics shop where he works part time. He wants to take a individual loan to make enlarge his shop and buy extra materials like earrings, bracelets, and new designs of clothes and extra things to expand his business. Because he is a young boy he wants to start a new life with this money and to be a great business dealer in the future. He is happy now that he can solve his problems with this loan.
loan_use: To buy jewelry and new clothing designs for his shop

description: Miss Hai is 35 and her husband is 43 years old. They have 3 children between 16 and 3 who are going to school. They are very poor; they don’t have any land even for their hut . They have to build a hut on neighbor land. Mr Phuoc, her husband works as a day laborer but the work is not stable. So selling coffee at her house is thus important for them. They borrowed a loan with no interest from the project, which increased their income by about $1/person/month. Average income is $9/person/month. Miss Hai has repaid a loan of $50, and now she asks to borrow a loan of $75.
loan_use: selling coffee at her house

description: S. Kamal Ziyad Oglu is one of the elder farmers is the region. He lives in Gazanbatan village of the Saatli region. He has a very small farm and to run such a small farm is not effective. So Kamal is going to extend his farm by purchasing additional cows. His farm has sufficient land to provide the animals with feed. He requested from “Agroinvest” 700 USD as credit to buy two cows.
loan_use: Buy two cows and expand his business.

description:
Arcadia is 23 years old and has three children. Her husband works as a brick layer. During the week Arcadia works as a maid in a private home. With her wages she purchases meat, corn and other ingredients to prepare tamales (a typical food of the region). On the weekends she sells the tamales to her neighbors door-to-door. With this loan she hopes to increase her production of tamales and to no longer have to work as a maid. She is part of the Grupo Ecatepec 1.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

\r\n\r\nARCADIA TIENE 23 AÑOS, TRES HIJOS, Y SU ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO AYUDANTE DE ALBAÑIL. DURANTE LA SEMANA ARCADIA TRABAJA HACIENDO LA LIMPIEZA DE UNA CASA PARTICULAR, CON LO QUE GANA COMPRA CARNE, MAIZ Y TODOS LOS INGREDIENTES PARA DESPUES PREPARAR TAMALES ( ES EL ALIMENTO TIPICO DE LA REGION) Y LOS VENDE LOS FINES DE SEMANA PUERTA A PUERTA ENTRE LOS VECINOS DE SU COMUNIDAD. CON EL CREDITO ESPERA AUMENTAR LA PRODUCCION DE TAMALES Y YA NO TENER QUE TRABAJAR EN CASAS PARTICULARES. ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO ECATEPEC 1.
loan_use: COMERCIANTE

description:
I have been making tortillas and selling them in my neighborhood for a number of years. My customers enjoy my tortillas because they are very soft and rich. With the income, I purchase my kids school supplies and can afford to buy my medicine.\r\n

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

\r\nDesde hace varios años me dedico a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas en mi comunidad. Mis clientes les gusta mis tortillas ya que son blanditas y ricas. Con los ingresos que percibo de las ventas compro los utiles escolares de mis hijos y medicianas para mi persona.
loan_use: Purchase corn, lime and milk

description:
Claudia G. runs a restaurant out of her home in the small town of La Pacuala. This loan of $450 allows her to purchase a freezer so she can store meat and other perishable foods as well as keep desserts and beverages cold. This will help Claudia save money by purchasing in bulk now that she can store food over a longer period of time and she won’t have to travel to the markets as freqently to restock her kitchen.

She is a single mother of three: Francisco (24), Jazmín (22) and Antonio (19). Claudia has received three previous loans from Esperanza to start up her restaurant, purchase supplies and receive business training.

Claudia says her life is different now that she has opened up her own business because she can stay at her store now rather than having to walk the streets looking for money. An average of eight to ten people eat at her store for lunch every day.
loan_use: Purchase a freezer and some beverages for her restaurant.

description: Marguerite has been active in business since 2003. She runs a boutique and sells beverages. Her business has prospered since she joined Hope DRC (a microfinance program) in 2004. Marguerite is requesting a loan of $1000 in order to diversify her business by adding fresh foods. This business has helped her to support her family. She is married and has seven children.
loan_use: To diversify her business by adding fresh foods
country_name: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

description: Clémentine is 45 years old and a mother of six children. She has been active in her business since 1986. She began her business with $30 selling fresh fish. She sells clothing and miscellaneous goods. She joined one of Hope’s groups (a DRCongo microfinance program) in 2004 and has received seven loans. Thanks to Hope’s loans, Clémentine’s business has prospered, and her current business capital is $800. With a loan of $500, Clémentine wants to buy 2 bundles of clothing and increase the inventory of miscellaneous goods.
loan_use: To purchase 2 bundles of clothing and increase the inventory of miscellaneous goods  in bulk for resale
country_name: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

description:
My name is Jose Evaristo, I sell watches in the street all around the city. I've been doing this for several years and it provides me with enough income to support my family. Right now I need to increase the range of watches on offer because more variety means more sales.\r\n

\r\nMi Nombre es Jose Evaristo, mi actividad principal es la venta de Relod de manera mabulante en toda la ciudad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y otros compromisos, actualmente necesito surtir un poco mas mi negocio ya que entre mas variedad ofresco mejores son las ventas.
loan_use: Purchase QSQ, Salco Brilliant, and Salco White watches, and watch batteries.

description:
My name is Dora Isolina, my main work is in sales. I own a small shop, located in my own home which provides me enough income to help my family. I have been in this business for various years, but now I need to buy more supplies in order to offer a greater variety to my clients. This way, I can increase my income and raise my family's standard of living.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Maite Barragán

Mi nombre es Dora Isolina, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un negocio de Pulperia ubicada en mi casa de habitación, la que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia, cuento con varios años de experiencia en este tipo de actividad, actualmente necesito surtir mi negocio para poder ofrecer variedad de productos a mis cliente y de esa forma mejorar los ingresos y el nivel de vida de mi familia.
loan_use: Purchasing sugar, rice, lard, soap, chicken,  instant soup, flour and dairy products

description:
My name is Alba Luz, and my principal activity is commerce. I have a small grocery store in my home, which is located in the center of my community. Thanks to this business, I can help my husband with the expenses of our children, since they are in school. I have a good clientele and experience in this type of activity. Presently I need to add more products to my store so I can offer my customers a greater variety.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer) Mi nombre es Alba Luz, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con una pequeña pulperia en mi casa de habitación, ubicada en el centro de mi comunidad, gracias a este negocio puedo ayudar a mi esposo con los gastos de nuestros hijos ya que ellos estan estudiando, cuento con buena clientela y experiencia en este tipo de actividad, actualmente necesito surtir mas y poder ofrecer a los clientes variedad de productos.
loan_use: To buy sugar, rice, lard, beans, and corn

description:
Mrs. Roeung S., 40 years old, is a mother of 4 and lives in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She sells vegetables at the busy market and can makes around $5/day in revenue. Her husband is a taxi driver and normally generates over $10 /day of income, which is a big help in his family's expense.\r\nAll of her children are students and help her business when they are free from their school.

S. is asking for $1000 loan to purchase a car for her husband in order to operate a taxi business. In the future, this couple hopes to own a restaurant serving rice, soup, noodles, all kinds of soft drinks and Karaoke.
loan_use: To purchase a car to run a business.

description: Martha is a mother of four who started her business in 2002. It includes buying cereals, especially maize, from the farmers during harvest seasons and selling in retail at the local trading centre. She is a trained tailor and dress maker. At first she used to make dresses to sell at the trading centre, but quit when she saw there was stiff competition and turned to selling cereals.  She says the business is doing well.  She also molds bricks and sells them at construction sites. Through her businesses, she has been able to educate her children and support her family. With a loan from PEMCI, she plans to increase on her cereals stock and also purchase some more brick molding tools.
loan_use: To increase her stock of cereals and buy brick-molding tools

description:
Ramón lives in Santa Catarina. He is married with four children, and has always like being a businessman. For 15 years, he has worked selling fruits and vegetables, starting with very little merchandise. Little by little, he made his business grow, and now he goes out to sell in small places located on the outskirts of the city where he has been able to gain many customers.

Ramón is a very responsible, honest man, and now requires a loan of $1,100 which he will use to purchase merchandise to continue growing his business. He is committed to returning this amount in a period of 6 to 12 months. This is important for the growth of this business, and will help improve the life of this family. You can help.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

En la localidad de Santa Catarina es donde vive Ramón, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos, siempre le ha gustado ser comerciante y desde hace 15 años se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, comenzó con muy poca mercancía pero poco a poco hizo creer su negocio, ahora sale a vender a las localidades pequeñas que se ubican en la afueras de la ciudad donde ha logrado tener muchos clientes.

Ramón es un hombre muy responsable y honesto, ahora requiere de un préstamo de $1,100 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para continuar creciendo con su negocio, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Se parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio, ayuda a mejorar la vida de esta familia, tú puedes hacerlo.
loan_use: Purchase of merchandise

description:
Mrs. Benita is 56 years old. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a carpenter and she started this business 10 years ago with a stand in the municipal market.

Although her business has grown, one of her children is still studying and this takes a larger portion of her income. With her business, she has enabled her other children to study as well, and they are now working.

This is not the only work she does. She also does door to door sales of clothing. She selects the place where she sells based on the different harvest times of the agrarian production in the country.

She plans to use the loan to buy more merchandise, especially since there is more demand for seasonal clothing. She innovates her business buying merchandise that in fashion. This way she can ensure that her son can finish highschool and enroll in university.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Benita tiene 56 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos; su marido es carpintero y ella empezó con este trabajo hace 10 años atrás con un puesto de venta en el Mercado Municipal.

Su negocio fue creciendo, uno de sus hijos estudia todavía y le absorbe gran parte de sus ingresos, así también con su trabajo ya ha hecho estudiar a sus otros hijos que ya son todos profesionales.

Ella no sólo se dedica a esta actividad, sino que también se dedica a la venta ambulante de ropas. Elige la zona de venta de acuerdo a las diferentes temporadas de cosechas de producción agraria del país.

Planea utilizar el crédito para comprar más mercaderías puesto que por ahora hay muchos pedidos de ropas de temporada, así también tiene que innovar sus negocio, comprando las mercaderías que están de moda de manera a asegurar la terminación de los estudios secundarios del hijo y por que no incursionar en la universidad.
loan_use: To buy winter clothing

description: Mrs. Noeun C. is 48 years old and a widow.  Her and her four children live in Khampong Cham province, Cambodia. In order to supplement the family's income and the childrens’ education, C. owns a grocery store and has been engaged in this business for several years since her husband passed away.  In this business, she can makes around $22/day in revenue. Therefore, two of her  daughters help in providing for the household by working at the local garment factory.  The other two children attend school. In order to satisfy and facilitate her clients' needs, Noeun C. is asking for $1000 to purchase an electric generator and some grocery products for her inventory. Eventually, she hopes to send her children to university with the help of her sustainable business.
loan_use: to purchase an electric generator and some grocery products for her inventory

description: Mr. Isaac A. is 38 years old, and is married with three (3) children.  He hails from Uromi of Edo State, Nigeria.  He sells palm nuts to the people in his community.  He is requesting a loan if $550 for business growth.
loan_use: To buy more palm nuts to sell

description: Christo O. is a young woman of 37 years. She is married with three (3) children, a LAPO client for over 6 years. She has proved her wealth of experience in her line of business. She needs the money ($550) to keep her business booming.
loan_use: To buy more ice cream ingredients

description: Mrs. T. is married with two children.  She is 25 years old and never had a job prior to joining SPBD.  When she had children, it was difficult for her and her husband to support their young family.  This prompted her to join the SPBD program in order to start a business and provide for her family’s growing weekly expenses and save for her children’s future education.  After SPBD training, Fieta took out an initial loan to launch a business.  She chose to start a barbeque stand and sell cooked food to passersby in her village.  She says that the business is going well. She is anxious to further invest in it and increase her profits by expanding her supply and product line.  The business is really helping her make things easier for her family.  She hopes that by putting more hard work into her barbeque stand she can ensure that her children can go to good schools.
loan_use: to purchase food in bulk, cooking utensils, containers, and packaging materials

description: Sonia is married and has seven children. She has been a vegetable farmer with a small farm for many years. Initially, she had trouble growing her farm.  With the advent of GHAPE in her community, she immediately joined the organization, received training on management and marketing techniques and later received her first loan of $40 in 2001. Since then, she has proven her credibility to manage and repay loans worth $880. \r\n\r\nGiven a loan of $1200, she plans to buy insecticides, fertilizers, and with manure collected from her pig farm, grow cabbages, tomatoes and pepper on a very large scale. Since this activity will be labor intensive, some youths will have the opportunity to get jobs on her farm.
loan_use: Growing of Vegetables

description: Mrs. Then N. is 18 years old and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham, Cambodia.  She operates a small grocery store in her village and can make about $10 per day.  N.'s husband buys grocery products in bulk, then transports them to the market to sell to grocers.  This business activity generates about $7 per day in revenue.  The couple hopes to use this loan to purchase two cows, which they will raise and eventually sell to a butcher.  Additionally, they hope to purchase more grocery products so that N. can expand her grocery business.
loan_use: To purchase two cows, and also to purchase grocery items to sell at her store.

description:
Daniel is married with four children, three boys and one girl. Two are still in secondary school while two are involved in the family business. Daniel is training as a truck driver but has also been in business for the last thirty years. He operates a store where he sells maize, beans, tomatoes and onions as well as manufactured retail goods. Daniel also operates a hardware shop, side-by-side with the other shops.

To support business, Mr K. ventured into Southern Sudan in 2004 where he also operates a hardware shop selling mainly construction materials such as iron sheets, nails, cement, etc. Although the demand for the goods is high in Southern Sudan, Daniel has been faced with challenges when it comes to expanding his business due to lack of capital. The other challenge that he faces is the high cost of transporting goods into Southern Sudan.

With the proposed loan of US$ 475, Daniel intends to increase his stock of goods for Sudan and hence be able to supply his customers with all the commodities that they need in the required volume. In view of the contribution that Daniel is making towards the reconstruction of Southern Sudan, we highly recommend the loan for funding through Kiva.
loan_use: Buy Additional Stock

description:
Praxides is married with four children who are all in primary school. She is a trained tailor. She also operates a small shop to supplement her tailoring business. From both her businesses she is able to meet her family’s basic needs.

In addition to carrying out her businesses, Praxides is also employed in a local clothing shop where she trains students in clothes design and tailoring. Given the loan of $75 from PEMCI, Praxides intends to expand her tailoring shop and also to start her own training facility. She is a lady who is trying her best to empower herself financially and to support her young family.
loan_use: Expand her tailor shop and start a training facility for tailoring

description: Jacqueline D. is 48-year-old widowed woman with 5 children. She lives in Yopougon, a township in north Abidjan. Jacqueline sells cereal in the Yopougnon open market. This activity is the main revenue source for her family. She heard about AE&I from her sister and got her first loan in January, 2005. She has reimbursed all microcredits she has gotten from AE&I since then without any problem. Jacqueline wants to purchase a stock of cereal (rice and maize) in bulk to benefit from lower prices and increase her retail sales margin.
loan_use: Jacqueline Djamble will use the loan to purchase stock of cereal.

description: Mrs Hien is 55 years old. She has a son who is 18 years old. She doesn’t have any land for cultivation. Her son has weak cardiac muscles so he can’t do heavy work. Mrs Hien has high blood pressure so her making baskets at home and then selling them at the small market is important for them. Their average income is $8/person/month. Now, she wants to borrow a loan of $50 to buy bamboo in larger quantities and pay cash, which improves their profit. Mrs Hien will repay this loan monthly.
loan_use: Basket making

description: Mrs Huong is 58 years old. She has two children who are going to the university. She doesn’t have any land for cultivation. Their income is low at $8/person/month, but the expense of tuition is high, so Huong’s selling food for breakfast at the local market is important for increasing their income by $1/person/month. She wants to borrow $50 so that she can buy a supply of rice with cash, which is cheaper.
loan_use: Buy rice to make breakfast food

description:
Mrs. Rein Bona, 27 years old and the mother of 1 child, lives with her husband \r\n(pictured here because Bona was unavailable) in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She works in a local garment factory and normally makes on average about $3/day, while her husband is an electrician and typically generates around $6/day in revenue. In order to satisfy his clients' needs, Bona's husband is requesting $1000 loan fun to purchase more electrical supplies for his inventory, so that he has sufficient materials to fix televisions, radios, microphones, speakers, video players and so on.

\r\nIn the future, this couple hopes to own an electrical shop, in which they can make additional money to offer a better education to their children.
loan_use: To purchase some electrical tools for a business.

description:
Margarita opened “Bazar Heidy” three years ago and sold cosmetic goods door-to-door. A year ago, she opened a shop out of her home and has been selling the products successfully. She mainly markets bazaar items, stationary, and cosmetics. Every day from 8am until 11pm, she works hard to support her family and is intent on expanding her business to provide them with opportunities that she never had.

She has already borrowed from our organization before. She used the capital to purchase toys, clothes, and seasonal products. Margarita’s first loan was a great success. She invested in items that allowed her to establish a great relationship with the distributors. Now, she has a great source of wholesale products. Her profits allowed her to improve her home, especially the part where her business is located. She hopes to use the second loan to invest in cosmetics and perfume.

Margarita is a single mother of four. Although her children are all adults now, two of them still live with her. Her wish is take out this loan in order to have additional sources of income in her business.
loan_use: to invest in perfumes and cosmetic items

description: Olga O. has sold women's clothing at a small market near a big apartment block in Zaporoshye, Ukraine for the last ten years. A dedicated entrepreneur, Olga runs her little kiosk day after day with a cheerful smile and a desire to meet the clothing needs of her customers. She has gained a wealth of experience and loyal customers along the way. No one else in her market offers the selection and prices that she does. Olga is married and has two grown children. Forced to start her own business after she had to leave her previous job, Olga is grateful for the income it has provided through the years.\r\n\r\n“Nadiya Ukraine” is happy to be able to assist entrepreneurs like Olga. She has proven to be an excellent loan client and has never had a late payment. She has requested a loan for $600 to help her purchase some new inventory and update her product selection. We look forward to continuing to help her business develop and be successful.
loan_use: Purchase inventory

description:
My wife and I are at work all day, leaving our house unoccupied for that time. We finally succeeded in securing the windows and doors, but now we would like to erect a fence of iron bars over a concrete block base for greater security. I'm asking for $1,200 to install the fence.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

“Mi esposa y yo trabajamos todo el día, así es que nuestra vivienda la mayor parte del día esta sola; con mucho esfuerzo logramos poner las protecciones de la puerta y las ventanas pero me gustaría levantar una barda de block y poner rejas alrededor en toda la casa”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para la barda y la reja.
loan_use: Build a security fence

description:
Mr. M. has sixteen years of experience in the field of publicizing local businesses. He distributes pamphlets and plays ads over his vehicle-mounted public address system. He is asking for a loan of $1,000.00 to upgrade to a more powerful sound system, so that he can get more clients and give his wife and children a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

Sr. M. es una persona que cuenta en este ramo con 16 años de experiencia su actividad dar a conocer negocios. Por medio de perifoneo y folletos, con este negocio mantiene a su familia .El necesita un crédito de $ 1.000.00 DLLS. Para comprar un equipo de sonido más potente. Para tener mas clientes y dar una mejor vida a sus hijos y su esposa.
loan_use: To buy public address system

description: Sevil A. has a dishes and tableware store. She is 55, married and has two children. She borrowed a $1200 USD loan to rent a place for her store, and she plans to use this loan from Aqroinvest CU to repair and improve it and her stock.
loan_use: Mrs. Amirova would like to repaire her store where she sells dishes and tableware.

description:
Maricela is married, 32 years old and has four children. Together with her husband, they sell fruits and vegetables door to door in their neighborhood. With the loan, they are planning to put up a small sales stand at their house so they can spend more time taking care of their kids.

They belong to the Maria del Carmen group along with the other women - Patricia Ruiz Gomez (who buys and sells calves), Victoria Hernandez Gomez (who has a grocery store). Both will invest the part of the loan pertaining to them. Patricia will buy more animals to raise and increase her sales, and Victoria is planning to buy canned goods, pastas, frozen foods, and drinks, to keep her store stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

MARICELA ES CASADA TIENE 32 AÑOS Y CUATRO HIJOS. JUNTO CON SU ESPOSO VENDEN FRUTAS Y VERDURAS PUERTA A PUERTA EN LAS CASAS DE LAS COMUNIDADES CERCANAS A SU HOGAR CON EL PRESTAMO QUIERE PONER UN PEQUEÑO LOCAL DE VENTA EN SU CASA Y ASI PODER DEDICAR MAS TIEMPO AL CUIDADO DE SUS HIJOS.PERTENECE AL GRUPO MARIA DEL CARMEN 3 JUNTO CON LAS SEÑORAS : PATRICIA RUIZ GOMEZ ( TRABAJA EN LA COMPRA Y VENTA DE BECERROS ) VICTORIA HERNANDEZ GOMEZ ( TIENE UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES ) AMBAS CON LA PARTE QUE LES CORRESPONDE DEL PRESTAMO VAN A INVERTIR ; PATRICIA COMPRANDO MAS ANIMALES PARA CRIAR Y AUMENTAR SUS VENTAS Y A SU VEZ VICTORIA PIENSA COMPRAR ALIMENTOS ENLATADOS, PASTAS,ALIMENTOS CONGELADOS, BEBIDAS, PARA MANTENER MAS SURTIDO SU LOCAL
loan_use: Buy fruits and vegetables to sell

description:
My name is Maria P. and I sell new clothing for ladies, gentlemen and children. I have been selling articles such as shirts, blouses, pants, jeans, socks and dresses for about three years. My sells are good because I am well located near the center of the town where I live. I wish to buy more clothes in order to have bigger sales because this time of the year is good for commerce and I could use the extra earnings to feed my family and give my son private university schooling since he is about to go into college

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Maria P. me dedico a la venta de ropa nueva para dama, caballero y niños como ser camisetas, blusas, pantalones, jeans, calcetines, vestidos actividad que realizo desde hace unos 3 años atras, mis ventas son buenas ya que estoy ubicada cerca de el centro de la ciudad en que vivo, deseo comprar mas ropa para tener mayores ventas ya que esta epoca del año es buena para el comercio y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia y darle un estudio en universidad privada a mi hijo que esta por ingresar a la universidad.
loan_use: Purchase new male, female and kids clothing

description:
Juliana buys leather wallets, pocketbooks and purses and hawks them at fairs in the south of La Paz. She does this work by herself, as her husband works as a laborer. She lives in the neighborhood of Callapa in La Paz. This is the first loan Juliana has requested. She will use the funds to purchase merchandise such as wallets, handbags and the like. She has been in business for four years and IMPRO's analysis of her financial situation recommends her for this loan.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Juliana compra carteras y billeteras de cuero y cuerina y las vende ambulando en las ferias de la zona Sur de la ciudad de La Paz; ella trabaja sola, su esposos es albañil. Vive en la zona de Callapa de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de mercadería (carteras, billeteras y maletines). Su experiencia de más de cuatro años de trabajo en este rubro le permite acceder a este crédito el cual es aprobado por IMPRO después del respectivo análisis financiero realizado.
loan_use: To buy leather goods for resale.

description:
Born in Afangnan in 1961, Dekaleme B. is a dynamic man, married and father of four children. After secondary school, he became a driver. He has a driver's licence and was able to buy a van for public transport which he has used for almost 12 years. This vehicle, now quite worn out, no longer lives up to his expectations, so he is often out of work. Having no other source of income, he is asking for a loan of $1200 that he will use to buy a better motor and other spare parts for his vehicle. Achieving this goal will allow him to have a more consistent source of income and supply the needs of his family who live in extreme poverty.

Translated from the French by Teresa Kramer, KIVA volunteer

Né à Afangnan en 1961, Monsieur Dékalémé B. est un homme dynamique, marié et père de quatre enfants. Après ses études secondaires, il s’est lancé dans la conduite auto. Aujourd’hui, titulaire d’un permis de conduire, il a acheté un premier véhicule de transport qu’il a utilisé près de douze ans. Cet engin, devenu totalement usé, n’arrive plus à combler l’attente de son propriétaire. Dès lors, Monsieur B. Dékalémé est désoeuvré. N’ayant plus de source de revenu, il veut aujourd'hui saisir cette opportunité pour solliciter un crédit de $1200 afin d’acheter un moteur plus sophistiqué et d’autres pièces pour réparer son véhicule. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra d’avoir un revenu plus consistant et de subvenir au besoin de sa famille qui vit dans une pauvreté extrême.
loan_use: repairing a public transport vehicle

description:
“I have had my business for 1 year, but there are many things I need. I would like to buy more merchandise and a vitrine to display it. I hope not to have to close my business, since it what my family and I live from. I am asking for $1,200.00 to buy merchandise and a vitrine.” .

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

\r\n\r\n“Tengo mi negocio desde hace 1 año pero me hacen falta muchas cosas, me gustaría poder comprar más mercancía y una vitrina para acomodarla, no quisiera tener que cerrar el negocio ya que es de donde vivimos mi familia y yo”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para comprar mercancía y una vitrina.
loan_use: To buy merchandise and a vitrine

description:
Mr. Najdat is 35 years old has a small bakery in Kirkuk. He lives with his big family in one house. This is his first application for a loan. He wants to develop his shop and purchase new bakery machines to improve his life and increase his business income. Mr. Najdat wants $1200 and he is looking for the more in the future.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).
loan_use: Purchase new bakery machine

description:
Mavsuna has sold women's clothes in Panjshanbe for over 4 years. She sells in a shop located in the center of the market. She is married and has 2 children who are in school. Mavsuna has a university degree as an engineer. Unfortunately, due to economic conditions of the country, she could not find a job with her major. So she took up the sale of women's garments.

\r\nMavsuna became a client of Micro Invest in 2006. That gave her an opportunity to start her own business while simultaneously being a salesperson in the shop. Her idea was welcomed and supported by the shop owner who is in fact her employer. Her products are traditional Tajik dresses that are sewn in local sewing workshops. Her husband has helped Mavsuna to negotiate a contract with several sewing-workshops and knitting-workshops who prepare Tajik dresses for the market.

Mavsuna wants to expand her garment assortment with modern clothing that is in high demand by Tajik women nowadays. To expand her business in this sphere, Mavsuna will need extra capital, so she is requesting a loan of $1,200.
loan_use: Import of garments from Turkey

description: Vidadi  wants to improve his family's living conditions.  He needs to work very hard every day to cover family expenses. Vidadi is 39 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Zangilan region, settled in Khirdalan settlement. He is married and has 3 children.\r\nVidadi is applying for a loan of $1000 to make capital repairs on his car so that he can offer better service to his clients and so earn a good income.
loan_use: to make capital repairs on his car

description:
Gloria is a widow of six years and to move herself and her five children forward she started her own business selling cheese and chorizo. Shortly after, one of her daughters fell ill with cancer and underwent costly treatment before, sadly, dying. Gloria has had to overcome great familial loses, but she still has four children, two of whom live with her along with two grandchildren. She wants to provide them nothing but the best, which is why she works so hard.

Gloria started buying her products through middlemen, but now she buys straight from their suppliers and gets a better discount. But she has to buy in larger quantities and currently she needs a loan of $925, which she plans to repay within six months, to cover the costs of stocking her business. Gloria and her family really need your support to help improve their quality of life. They are forever grateful for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Gloria es viuda desde hace 6 años y para sacar adelante a sus cinco hijos empezó su propio negocio con la venta de quesos y chorizo, poco después una de sus hijas enfermó de cáncer y estuvo en tratamientos muy costos, pero lamentablemente falleció. Gloria ha tenido que superar grandes pérdidas familiares, pero aún tiene cuatro hijos, dos de ellos y sus dos nietos viven con ella y desea ofrecerles lo mejor, por lo que se esfuerza mucho en su trabajo.

Gloria empezó comprando sus productos con intermediarios, ahora lo hace directamente con sus proveedores, por lo que recibe un mayor beneficio, pero tiene que consumir cantidades mayores y para surtir su negocio ahora requiere de un préstamo de $ 925 dólares, mismos que devolverá en 6 meses. Esta familia necesita mucho de tu apoyo, ayúdalos a mejorar su calidad de vida, ellos te lo agradecerán por siempre.
loan_use: Purchase cheese and chorizo

description: Galina has a small building supplies store located at a shopping center near the middle of Ivano-Frankivsk. Her business is a vital source of income for Galina. She is a widow and depends on the funds from her store to meet the needs of herself and her two youngest children, a 20-year-old son and a 26-year-old daughter. Her oldest daughter’s husband has started working with her, so the store also provides income for her daughter and son-in-law. \r\n\r\nGalina started the business 3 years ago and currently makes around $1200 per month. She has requested a loan $900 to help purchase additional supplies of plastic molding and tile. These are popular with the booming remodeling business in Ukraine and should sell very well during the summer months.
loan_use: To purchase inventory of plastic molding and tile for her building supplies store

description:
Svetlana S. has been an active client of MLF MicroInvest for over 5 years. She has been in business for no less than 20 years. She is married and has 3 children. Svetlana S. asks for $600 loan to increase the assortment of the goods sold to use the profits to renovate her apartment.\r\n

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

\r\nШарипова Светлана является активным клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» более 5 лет. В сфере предпринимательской деятельностью занимается не менее 20 лет. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Ей необходимо 600$, для увеличения ассортимента товара, а полученную прибыль потратить на ремонт квартиры.
loan_use: Increase the volume of goods sold

description: Asif is married and has 2 children. He is 40, lives in Salyan region, Yenikand village. Asif has raised cattle for 6 years. He has calves and cows. Now he needs a loan of $475 to buy grass.
loan_use: To buy grass

description: Gunduz is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region , settled in the Fizuli region, Makhmudlu village. He is 40 years old, married and has 2 children.\r\nGunduz has raised sheep for 5 years.\r\nNow he needs a loan of $1200 to buy 30 sheep to expand his sheep breeding business.
loan_use: To buy 30 sheep

description:
Madina  hasrun this business for 4 years. She is is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region , settled in the Fizuli region, Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs.
This 34-year-old woman is married and has a child. 
Previiously she bought a cow and so she supported her family. 
Now she needs a loan of $725 to buy a pregnant cow to increase the number of her cows and to meet all the needs of her family.
loan_use: To buy a pregnant cow

description: Zainab K. has a small grocery shop in a village on the outskirts of Makeni town.  She is one of only a few traders in the community and her store is very popular there. Thirty-six years old, she is married to a teacher and they have five children.  Since teachers' salaries are very small, Zainab’s business income plays a crucial role in the paying of education expenses for her children and other basic needs. Her previous loan from SMT, her first, was used to expand the business by purchasing more stock.  She would like to use the loan funds from this second loan for a similar purpose.
loan_use: Increase stock in grocery shop

description: Mr. Ey T. is 31 years old, single, and lives with his older sister in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia, since his parents passed away many years ago. Her sister works in a laundry shop and makes a moderate income: about $1.2 each day. He is, meanwhile, a motor-taxi driver and makes around $3/day. Currently, he is asking for $500 to purchase a motor bike to operate a business. In the future, he and his sister hope to have enough money to open a cafe shop, where it would enable him to make additional profits to assist his sole family member.
loan_use: To purchase a motorcycle to run a business.

description: S. Sefter is a local farmer from Sabirabad.  He has a big family: a wife and 3 children.  Animal husbandry is the only income source for the family besides pensions received by himself and his wife.  Sefter is 59 years old.  His business is very small, and he keeps a herd of sheep.  He has decided to improve his business by expanding into calf breeding for meat production.  To realize this idea, he has requested a loan of $1200 from Agroinvest to purchase 3 calves.
loan_use: Going to purchase 3 calves for meat production

description: Adamsay M. is a clothes trader in Makeni town of Sierra Leone.  Aged thirty two years with three children, she supports her husband to meet the family’s basic needs.  Her husband is a self-employed carpenter whose income is insufficient to meet all the family’s expenses.  Adamsay has been able to use past loans from CCF-SMT to expand her business and would like to use the new loan funds for the same purpose.  She said she is determined to get her family out of their poverty situation.
loan_use: Increase inventory and selection of clothes

description:
Francisca lives with her unmarried-partner and her five children. Her partner is a photographer, but his income was not enough to support their family. So, Francisca decided to start to work and one of her friends asked her to work with her selling beauty products. Before she began working as a saleswoman, she had helped her husband with his photography, but her own sales continue to grow, adding to the family's spending money. She is very happy with her achievements and with her earnings, which are going towards helping her children.

Francisca is applying for a loan of $275.00, which she will pay back in 6 months. She will use this loan to purchase merchandise and improve her family's standard of living. She already has many orders to fulfill and she doesn't want to disappoint her customers. She and her family thank you very much for your support, which they need to improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Francisca vive en unión libre y tiene cinco hijos, su pareja trabaja como fotógrafo, y por ello sus ingresos no eran suficientes para mantener a su familia, por ello ella decidió empezar a trabajar, fue por invitación de una amiga por la que ella entro a la venta de productos de belleza para mujer, ya que antes de este negocio ella le ayudaba a su pareja con la toma de fotografías, pero actualmente le esta yendo mejor cada vez y teniendo más clientes y así apoya con un ingreso adicional en la economía familiar, ella esta muy contenta con sus logros y sus ingresos, ya que le están ayudando a sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Francisca solicita un préstamo por US $ 275 que ofrece pagar en 6 meses, ella utilizará este préstamo para comprar mercadería y así sacar adelante a su familia, ya que tiene varios pedidos que surtir y no desea quedar mal con sus clientes, por ello ella y su familia te acrecen mucho el apoyo que les brindas para poder salir adelante.
loan_use: To purchase merchandise.

description: At 24, Ms. T. is the oldest of 6 children in her family. 3 years ago she decided not only to earn her own living, but also to help her aging parents who are farmers. She rented a market stall in the nearby Do Luong township and started to sell ladies' clothing.  3 to 4 times a month she makes the 8-hour bus ride to Hanoi to buy stock from wholesalers. Ms. T. took her first loan of US$200 from TYM in March and now is ready for the next one. With her bright and joyful character, she also agreed to become a Center Leader for TYM and assemble all the women for weekly meetings.
loan_use: Purchase of clothes for sale

description: Vuth has been married since 1993 and has four daughters. He has been a motor taxi driver for 7 years. His wife is a housewife. All of their children are studying. Vuth has finished grade 7, while his wife has never studied at school, but they both are polite, honest and reliable.  \r\nVuth is borrowing US$500 to change the motorbike. With the new motorbike he hopes to increase the revenues and decrease expenses related to repairing and the use of petrol. He is confident that he will be able to repay the loan.
loan_use: Purchase of a motorbike .

description: Esther B. lives in Magburaka town (Sierra Leone).  She is married, forty-four years old and the mother of three children.  Esther contributes substantially towards the family’s monthly income with the profits from her small business.  Her previous loan from SMT enabled her to purchase the fish wholesale and she was able to increase her income.  With this second loan she will increase her stock even more. Esther is determined to have enough income to properly educate her daughters.
loan_use: Increase stocks of fish

description:
Mr. Cristino is 44 years old. He opened his own tapestry shop ten years ago, after having worked for several years at a tapestry that shut down and left him unemployed. His wife also contributes income to the family as she owns her own business selling clothes. They have three children together, they are all going to school and are excellent students.

Cristino's tapestry is doing very well, he has his own clientèle which is very satisfied with his work. In his tapestry he fixes all kinds of sofas, chairs and cushions.

He only owns one sowing machine and he is wishing to purchase a second one. This new sowing machine would allow him to work with thicker fabrics and even leather, since he wants to make his own designs of leather sofas which have a strong demand and sell for high prices.

The cost of the sowing machine he wants to purchase is of $550 at the local plaza. Hence he is requesting a loan for this amount which he is committing to pay back in a monthly basis.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


El señor Cristino de 44 años abrió su propia tapicería hace diez años atrás, luego de haber trabajado varios años en una tapicería que cerró dejandolo sin trabajo. Su señora también aporta con los ingresos de la casaella tiene su propio negocio de venta de ropas, tienen 3 hijos juntos, todos van al colegio y son excelentes alumnos. La tapicería de Cristino marcha muy bien, cuenta con una buena clientela que está bastante satisfecha con su trabajo. En su tapicería arregla todo tipo de sillones, sillas y acolchados; el cuenta con una sola máquina de coser y está muy deseoso de adquirir una nueva que le permitirá trabajar con telas mas gruesas y hasta cuero, pues el desea fabricar sus propios diseños de sillones de cueros que hoy día tienen bastante demanda y son vendidos a buen precio. El precio en plaza de la máquina que el desea adquirir es de $. 550, es por eso que solicita un crédito por ese monto que se compromente a pagarlos de forma mensual.
loan_use: Purchasing a sowing machine for tapestry/Compra de máquina de coser para tapicería

description:
Mr. Narcizo is divorced and has three children; he used to work in construction but this was a transitory job and on occaision he wouldn't obtain any revenue; his parents had a grocery store with the result that making good use of his experience in this line of business, he decided to open his own store and commenced selling a few grocery items and soft drinks seven years ago.

Little by little he has been shooting up more and in order to continue growing he asks for a loan of $650 that he will use on the purchase of fruits and vegetables in order to have a better assortment and to offer better service to his customers; he is prepared to pay back this amount in six months. You can help Narcizo and better his quality of life; decide to support him; he will thank you sincerely.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Narcizo es divorciado y tiene tres hijos, él trabajaba en la construcción pero este era un trabajo temporal y en ocasiones no obtenía ningún ingreso, sus padres tenían una tienda de abarrotes así que aprovechando la experiencia que tiene en este giro decidió abrir su propio negocio y comenzó vendiendo pocos productos de abarrotes y refrescos desde hace siete años.

Poco a poco ha ido surtiendo mejor y para continuar creciendo solicita un préstamo de $ 650 dólares que empleará en la compra de frutas y verduras para tener un mejor surtido y ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, él esta dispuesto a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tú puedes ayudar a Narcizo y mejorar su calidad de vida, decídete a apoyarlo, él te lo agradece sinceramente.
loan_use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables for his grocery store.  Compra de mercancía

description: Mrs. Houn R. is 26 years old and operates a small floral shop in Siem Reap, Cambodia.  She can earn about $3/day in this business, while her husband earns $7/day working as a driver for a tourist company.  Together, they support 2 young children.  This loan will be used to purchase flowers for Mrs. Houn R.' shop.  As her business grows, she hopes to buy bicycles for her children to ride to school.
loan_use: To purchase more flowers for her shop

description: Mrs. Queen Victoria O. is a good cook who learnt her business for 5 years. She started her business in the year 2002 in the area of Asaba, Delta State. She is 37 years old, married with four children. She needs a loan of $550 so that she can expand her business.
loan_use: To buy more drinks and cooking ingredients

description: Mrs. K. is 44 yrs. old and together with her husband she lives in Ngoc Thanh commune, a rural area in Hung Yen province, approx. 50 miles south of Hanoi. They have 2 children, 24 and 18 yrs. old, who are both at school (college and university). A long time ago they realized that education is expensive in Vietnam, so they started saving. Their income is $62.50 per month and education is $80.00 per month. They have rice paddies, raise pigs, and make clothes, but their main business is making rice wine. The loan will be used to buy rice, so they can make more wine and increase their income.
loan_use: To buy more rice to make rice wine

description: Mrs. Patience E. is 36 years old and is a mother of two children.  She is a dedicated LAPO client.  She sells ice cream to support her husband in caring for the family.  The loan is intended to boost her business.
loan_use: To buy a freezer and more ice cream flavours

description: Mrs. Chea S. P. is 48 years old and lives in Kampong Chnang with her husband who is 67 years old. They have no children.  Mrs. Chea sews pillow cases and sells them to the market. Her husband uses similar material as his wife to produce hammocks.  They will use this loan to purchase some thread for their products, and also to buy a plot of land to start growing some crops.  In the future, Mrs. Chea S. P. hopes to expand her business and eventually hire a few workers to help in production.
loan_use: To purchase thread and a plot of land to grow crops

description: A 32 year-old woman, Mrs. Maria I. learnt the trade of selling provisions and drinks for one year before she started her own business in the year 2002. She is married with a child and living in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She says if she gets the amount of $400, she will be able to expand her business.
loan_use: To buy more drinks, provisions, and food items

description: Hikmat E. is single, and lives in Beylagan. Hikmat owns a butcher shop in Beylagan, which he established two years ago. He sells beef and sheep meat. He buys sheep and cows at the animal market in Beylagan and sells the meat in his butcher shop. His brother helps him in this business. Hikmat borrowed a loan in the amount of $300 from Normicro Beylagan Branch in 2006 and bought some sheep, and made a lot of profit selling them. Now he wants to borrow a loan in the amount of $500 to buy more sheep and to sell the meat at his butcher shop.
loan_use: To buy sheep

description: Marcel  Chuckwu spent five years learning the basics of business from others before opening his own company in 1996.  He is 42 years old, married and lives with his wife and four children in Benin City.  He is confident that he can expand his business, and has come to us for a loan of $750 to make that expansion possible.
loan_use: To buy more materials to sell

description:
There is very little room in my house and I therefore want to build an extra room for my family as one of my children currently sleeps on the floor as there is no space for a bed. I need $1200 to build this room.

Translated form Spanish by Liz Harvey., Kiva Volunteer

“El espacio en mi casa esta muy reducido por eso quiero construir un cuarto más para la comodidad de mi familia, ya que uno de mis hijos duerme en el piso porque no hay espacio para poner una cama”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para la construcción de un cuarto".
loan_use: To build a room/Construccion de un Cuarto

description: Lath is married since 1992 and has one son and two daughters. He is in business of driving remork (motor taxi with a carriage at the back). He started this business 12 years ago. His wife works in a garment factory. His two children study in primary school in the village.  \r\n\r\nHe is requesting a loan of $500 from MAXIMA in order to purchase lattice and zinc to repair his house. With his remork he can generate enough income to repay the loan to MAXIMA.
loan_use: Buying lattice and  zinc to repair the house.

description:
Maria Elena N. lives in San Pedro Cutzan. She is 31 and has three children with her partner Antonio. She has a small garment shop called Taller Helen where she makes beachwear, shorts and skirts, which people come from surrounding communities to buy in bulk. She works very hard to support her family. This is her tenth round of financing. In the past she has borrowed to purchase fabric, travelling to San Francisco el Alto to buy it by the yard. At this time she would like to borrow 5,000 Guatemalan Quetzals to buy a piece of equipment.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Elena N. esta unida con Antonio, ella tiene tres hijos, de 31 años de edad, su negocio es venta de ropa por menor, Maria ha trabajado su crédito para comprar el material, y actualmente necesita para comprar una maquina plana, para poder atender a todos sus clientes y lograr la satisfacción de los mismos, ella lleva diez ciclos de participación, Maria vive en la aldea San Pedro Cutzan y es una persona de trabajo, viaja a San Francisco el Alto a comprar las telas y el material por quintal, también hace playeras y pantalonetas, faldas entre otros, manifiesta que sus ganancias puede cubrir sus necesidades básicas de su familia. Maria Elena tiene su pequeño taller de Confecciones el cual se llama TALLER HELEN es muy popular ya que la buscan muchas personas de otras comunidades, para comprar ropa por docena, ya que Maria no sale para vender, si no la gente la busca para comprarle en su propio taller, Maria Elena necesita un credito de Q5,000.00 para su Taller
loan_use: To buy fabric and equipment for a garment shop.

description:
Maria lives in Monterrey, Santo Domingo. She has five brothers and sisters, none of whom could attend school on account of the family's precarious finances. Maria herself only attended first grade before she left to work in the cotton fields. At nineteen she married Pablo Esquipulas, who died nine years ago of an epileptic seizure. They had seven children together--the eldest daughter is 31 and married. The second daughter is 30 and also married. The third daughter is single at 29. The fourth child, a son, died at the age of 25 of a heart attack. The fifth and sixth children are sons, 23 and 25, both married, and lastly, the youngest girl, Elisa, 19, is unmarried. The family is very close-knit and hard-working. Maria is confident that with this loan she will be able to help her business by selling clothing in the market of Mazatenango succeed.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

\r\n\r\nMaria vivió en el parcelamiento Monterrey, Santo Domingo, tiene 5 hermanos, ella dice que todos sus hermanos no pudieron estudiar por problemas económicos, ella estudió primero primaria, desde pequeña trabajaba en el campo con sus padres cortando algodón, ella se casó a los 19 años con Pablo Esquipulas quien falleció hace 9 años de epilepsia y tuvieron 7 hijos, la primera tiene 31 años, es casada, la segunda 30 años casada, la tercera 29 años, soltera, el cuarto de 25 años quien falleció de un infarto, quinto hijo de 25 años casado, otro de 23 años casado y Elisa de 19 años soltera, son una familia muy unida y trabajadora, ella se siente bien trabajado un crédito, ya que ha podido salir adelante y hacer que su negocio crezca, solicitando para su próximo crédito unos Q7,000.00 su negocio es venta de ropa en la terminal del mercado de Mazatenango.
loan_use: Clothing sales.

description: Lori M. is a 55 year old dynamic craftswoman. She has been making pottery for more than 25 years. She is a well-known as a jar and pot maker in Abobo, a township north of Abidjan. She is a widow, taking care to her six children with revenues generated from her art. She is a motivated and ambitious woman. She wants to use the loan to increase her production of jars and thereby increase her revenue. She received her first loan from AE&I in December 2004 and has been a good performer so far.
loan_use: Lori Matomo will use the loan to increase her pottery production

description: Ahou B. is a dynamic young lady. She is 24 years old and she has managed her own cosmetics products store since May 2005 in Adjamé open market. She is a single woman and has no children. She lives in Adjame, a commercial township in North Abidjan. She has rapidly developed her business during the last 2 years. Ahou wants to take advantage of the holiday season to offer new fashion products to young ladies. She got her first loan from AE&I in February 2006 and has been a good performer since then.
loan_use: Ahou Brigitte will use the loan to purchase goods

description:
Maria Guadalupe started selling hamburgers about 3 years ago. She is married and has 2 small children. Maria is a resourceful and goal-oriented woman. She wants to set a good example for her children, and this is why she started her own business. By taking advantage of the area where she lives, she has set up a food stand in a major avenue(intersection) which has helped her increase her sales tremendously. She has also invested most of her profits back into her business. She has worked very hard all these years to make sure her children have a better life.

In order for her business to continue to grow, Maria is requesting a loan in the amount of $475 USD which she will use to purchase cooking ingredients and to do some improvements to her food stand so that she can better serve her clients. She has agreed to repay this amount within 6 months. Help Maria with her growing business. She and her family appreciate your support!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace tres años Maria Guadalupe se dedica a la venta de hamburguesas, ella es casada y tiene dos pequeños hijos, Maria es una mujer emprendedora y activa quiere ser un ejemplo para sus hijos por lo que inició su propio negocio, aprovechando la ubicación de su hogar instaló su puesto en una avenida principal de su localidad, esto le ha ayudado a incrementar sus ventas rápidamente y crecer con su negocio, además de que ha reinvertido la mayor parte de sus utilidades en el negocio, el ofrecerle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida la ha impulsado a trabajar arduamente durante todo este tiempo.

Para poder continuar creciendo ahora Maria solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos que le permitan incrementar su producción además de realizar algunas modificaciones en su local con lo que podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Ayuda a Maria a continuar creciendo con su negocio, ella y su familia agradecen mucho tu apoyo.
loan_use: To purchase cooking ingredients and to do some improvements

description:
Pascuala is 32 years old. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a farmer. She makes additional clothing and embroiders them. In addition, she makes embroidered pillows which she then sells to a person who resells them in the largest tourist towns of the region.

With the loan, she wants to buy more thread and cloth and, additionally, she wants to start a business from her home selling fruits and vegetables. She belongs to the group "Espina 5".

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

PASCUALA TIENE 32 AÑOS , CASADA 5 HIJOS, SU ESPOSO ES CAMPESINO. ELLA HACE ROPA TIPICA DE LA ZONA Y LAS BORDA , ADEMAS HACE COJINES BORDADOS Y POSTERIORMENTE SE LAS ENTREGA A UNA PERSONA QUE SE LAS COMPRA Y LAS REVENDE EN LAS CIUDADES DE MAYOR TURISMO DE LA ZONA. ESPERA CON EL PRESTAMO COMPRAR MAS HILO Y TELA Y ADEMAS PONER UN NEGOCIO EN SU CASA PARA VENDER FRUTAS Y VERDURAS. PERTENECE AL GRUPO ESPINA 5.
loan_use: To buy thread and cloth

description:
Maria Eugenia is 32 years old, married, and has 3 children. Her husband is a carpenter. She breeds chickens to sell in her neighborhood. She plans to invest the loan to buy more animals, medicins, and also to help her husband buy wood to craft furniture. This way, she wants to get ahead as a family, selling to people close to home. She makes part of the group "Metze 1", together with Mrs. Margarita Adalberta Gomez (who breeds and sells rabbits); the latter wants to start a small grocery store from her home with her part of the loan.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

MARIA EUGENIA TIENE 32 AÑOS , CASADA, 3 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO ES CARPINTERO. ELLA TRABAJA EN LA CRIANZA DE POLLOS PARA LA VENTA EN SU COMUNIDAD . CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERA INVERTIR EN COMPRAR MAS ANIMALES , MEDICAMENTOS Y TAMBIEN APOYAR A SU ESPOSO COMPRANDO MADERA PARA LA CONFECCION DE MUEBLES ARTESANALES Y DE ESTA FORMA SURGIR COMO FAMILIA AL VENDERLOS A LAS PERSONAS QUE VIVEN CERCA DE SU CASA..FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO MEZTE 1 JUNTO CON DOÑA MARGARITA ADALBERTA GOMEZ ( CRIANZA Y VENTA DE CONEJOS ) ELLA CON SU PARTE DEL PRESTAMO ESPERA COLOCAR UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN SU CASA.
loan_use: breeding and selling chicken

description: Farzhana lives in district 2 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is not married, and she lives with her father. Her father is old, and she is supporting him. She is bead worker. She wants to expand her business, so she wants to take a group loan to buy extra materials for her craft and to find more clients. She wants to make a good income to help her father and also make a good future for herself. She is happy now.
loan_use: To buy extra materials

description:
The entrepreneur is 36 years old. She has two children, and both of them are in school. She is a very active women. She has an office. She works with her husband in the office. This is her first loan from AL-Aman. She wants to borrow $1200 to purchase a new computer and printer. She wants to keep working with her husband and enhance her family's standard of living.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).
loan_use: Purchase new computer and scanner

description: Mrs Nghoy S. is 24 and lives in Siem Reap in Cambodia. She sells beef soup in her area. Her husband is a construction foreman. They earn nine dollars a day. They have one young child.  \r\nMrs Nghoy would like to purchase a motorcycle in order to transport the ingredients of the soup she makes.
loan_use: To purchase a motorcycle to transport ingredients.

description:
Maria A. sells fresh produce at her shop in Fao, where her vegetables like green peppers, string beans, and cabbage are sold alonside local coconuts. Maria will use her loan to expand her business model by selling charcoal as well as rice and cooking oil. All of Maria's nine children are studying either in public school or for a profession. Rafael (21), Emania (18), Yela (16), Quetrina (13), Mari (13), Chelene (11), Vitali (6), Ingrid (5), and Jose (8) live with Maria and her husband Felix. This loan will help her grow her business to support her large family. These loans help a lot, Maria says. With another microloan, her business can grow and prosper.\r\n

\r\nNote: Maria is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $825 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social ties in the community and helps ensure that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families. As soon as Maria pays off her current loan with Esperanza, this loan will become active.
loan_use: Business model expansion

description:
Rita is single and she has two children. She came to Mérida five years ago looking for better opportunities and also to take care of her elderly mother. Since then, in order to make an income that would allow her to provide for her family, Rita has been selling costume jewelry and silver. The good quality of the products, which she makes herself, and her originality, have helped her business to grow. Demand for her products grew quickly.

In order to meet demand from her customers, Rita is requesting a loan of $475.00, which she will use to buy materials that she needs to make her products. She will return the loan in 6 months. Your help would be a great help to this family. Rita thanks you sincerely for your trust and support.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Rita es soltera y tiene dos hijos, desde hace cinco años llegó a Mérida, Yucatán en busca de mejores oportunidades y para poder cuidar de su madre que es de edad avanzada, desde entonces para obtener un ingreso que le permitiera sostener a su familia Rita inició con la venta de bisutería y plata, la buena calidad de los productos que ella misma elabora y su originalidad le han ayudado a hacer crecer su negocio, pronto la demanda por sus productos se fue incrementando.

\r\nPara poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, Rita está solicitando un crédito por $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra del material que necesita en la elaboración de sus productos, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tu ayuda será de gran utilidad para esta familia, Rita agradece mucho tu confianza y apoyo.
loan_use: To buy supplies

description:
Business Description

Hugo began his business five years ago with his own savings. His business is selling plastic articles for the home, such as jars, plates, waste baskets, laundry baskets, brooms, and more. Hugo serves his clients from the shop that he rents near the main avenue of Trinipuerto from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day of the week.

Loan Use

Hugo requests a loan so that he can increase his business and meet the demand of his clients. Due to his service and low prices, his business is in high demand. Hugo will buy more laundry and waste baskets, big and small, and plates and trays.

Personal Information

Hugo is 37 years old and has two children who are studying. Hugo's wife supports him by tending to the clients. Hugo indicated that with this loan he will be able to increase his business and generate a better income that will enable him to give his family a better quality of life. Hugo also plans to save his profits to buy land and be able to build his house.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Hugo se inicio con su negocio hace 5 años con ahorros propios. Su negocio es la venta de artículos plásticos para el hogar como: Jarras, Platos, Cestos de Basura y de Ropa. Recogedores de Basura, Escobas y otros artículos más. Hugo atiende a sus clientes en local que arrienda acerca de avenida principal del trinipuerto en horario de 7: AM a 20: PM todos los días de la semana

Uso del Préstamo

Hugo solicita un crédito para incrementar su negocio y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes que por la atención y bajos costos de sus productos, tiene mayor demanda. Hugo compra más cestos de ropa y basura, lacaras grandes y medianas, platos y bandejas de loza.

Información Personal

Hugo tiene 37 años y 2 hijos que están estudian. Esposa de Hugo lo apoya en la atención de los clientes. Hugo indica que con el crédito podrá incrementar más su negocio y generar mayores ingresos que permitirían dar mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Además Hugo piensa ahorrar para poder comprarse un terreno y poder construir su vivienda.
loan_use: Increase his inventory of plastic goods

description:
Maria del Carmen is from García, Nuevo Leon. She has 2 children, ages 12 and 15. She has had to work very hard to raise her children because she is divorced and did not have the support of a husband. This is why she started her own business selling tacos. Little by little her client base has grown thanks to the quality of her product and her good customer service.

To further support her business and boost sales, Maria is requesting a loan for US$275 to purchase a grill that will help her increase her taco production and grow her business. She plans to repay the loan within 4 months. Help Maria and her children improve their quality of life by contributing to the growth of her business. Your help will be very useful for this family. Thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

En La señora Maria del Carmen es originaria de la localidad de García en Nuevo León, ella tiene 2 hijos de 12 y 15 años de edad. Maria ha tenido que esforzarse mucho para sacar adelante a sus hijos ella sola porque es divorciada y no cuenta con el apoyo de una pareja para su manutención, esta es la razón por la que inició su propio negocio con la venta de tacos, poco a poco se han incrementado sus clientes gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos y el buen servicio que ofrece.

Para poder darle un impulso a su negocio e incrementar sus ventas, Maria esta solicitando un préstamo de $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compra de una parrilla que requiere para la elaboración de los tacos, con esto espera incrementar su producción y continuar creciendo con su negocio, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en 4 meses.
