Ayuda a que Maria y sus hijos puedan mejorar sus condiciones de vida contribuyendo a mejorar su negocio, se parte en este crecimiento, tu ayuda será de mucha utilidad para esta familia, gracias.
loan_use: To purchase equipment

description:
Armando is a very hard working man and comes from Guadalupe in Nuevo León. He is disabled and this means he cannot find work in a company. After having been rejected for various jobs he decided to start his own business doing electrical repairs two years ago and he started it from his home. The good service that he offers has brought him a lot of clients and now he employs someone to help him meet his clients’ needs.

Armando’s desire is to keep growing as a micro businessman, and in order to do this he is asking for a loan of $750 to refurbish his shop and to buy some equipment so that he can improve the quality of service that he offers and so that his business can continue to grow. He will repay this amount over a period of 6 months. Your help will be very useful for Armando and he sincerely thanks you for your trust and support.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Armando es un hombre muy trabajador, es originario de la localidad de Guadalupe en Nuevo León, él tiene una discapacidad y esto le impedía conseguir un empleo en una empresa, después de haber sido rechazado en varios trabajos decidió iniciar su propio negocio haciendo reparaciones eléctricas desde hace dos años, inició en su propio domicilio acondicionando un pequeño lugar. El buen servicio que ofrece pronto le llevó a tener muchos clientes y ahora cuenta con la colaboración de una persona para poder cubrir la demanda por sus servicios.

El deseo de Armando es continuar creciendo como microempresario, para esto solicita de un crédito por $ 750 dólares que utilizará en la remodelación de su local y compra de equipo de trabajo, para mejorar la calidad de servicio que ofrece y continuar creciendo, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tu ayuda será de gran utilidad para Armando, él agradece sinceramente tu confianza y apoyo.
loan_use: Refurbishment and to buy equipment/Remodelación y compra de equipo

description:
Business Description

David has helped serving his mother’s business since he was quite young. From his father he learned the baker’s occupation. He got married one year ago and along with his wife managed to establish his own bakery. His sister helped him with merchandise. Little by little and being responsible he has managed to obtain loans so his business is the source to support his family. David has a shop and a bakery where he has put into practice the knowledge that his parents taught him. He works every day from 5:30 a.m. to 9:30 p.m. His wife helps him serving the clients. He also sells gas cylinders for domestic use.

Loan Use

The credit will be use to buy merchandise in order to have other products that have a lot of demand. He will refit his premises to provide a better service.

Personal information

David is 23 years old. Currently he has no children. His wife besides helping him in the business, she sells cosmetics. His wish is to be able to buy the small house where they live now and have the shop. The house belongs to his sister and she will allow them to pay her in installments to be able to buy it. He hopes that with the loan he will be able to fulfill his dream.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

David desde muy joven le ayudaba a su mama en la atención del negocio. Con su papa aprendió el oficio de elaborar panes. Hace un año se caso y junto a su esposa logro montar su propio local. Su hermana le ayudo con mercadería. El poco a poco siendo responsable ha logrado obtener créditos con los que su negocio ha podido mantenerlo. Tiene una tienda y panadería donde ha puesto en práctica sus conocimientos. Gracias a la ayuda de sus padres que le enseñaron. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 5:30 a.m. hasta las 9:30 p.m. Su esposa le ayuda en la atención del local. También tiene venta de cilindros de gas de uso domésticos.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de mercadería para surtir su local. Además exhibir otros productos que tiene demanda. Adecua un poco su local para dar mejor servicio.

Información Personal

David tiene 23 años. Al momento no tiene hijos. Su esposa a más de ayudarle en el local se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Su deseo es poder comprar la casita donde viven y tienen el local. La casa es de su hermana y ella les va ha dar facilidad para poder obtenerla. Espera con la inversión que realizara poder cumplir su sueño.
loan_use: Buy merchandise

description:
Business Description

Vitervo has 15 years of experience in agriculture and knows how to grow rice, corn, beans and such. In addition, he is an experienced cattle-trader, a pursuit which takes up much of his time, though of course, on the farm, time is always at a premium.

Use of Loan

Vitervo will use this loan to purchase more cattle, supplementing his income from farming.

Personal Information on the Borrower

Vitervo is married to Santa with whom he has five beautiful children, two in school. He works very hard to care for his family and their small, charming cement home. He hopes to increase the acreage and head of cattle under his care.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Vitervo es agricultor en la cual se a dedicado a la agricultura desde hace 15 anos ganando cada día mas experiencia en el manejo de los cultivos como arroz, maíz, gandul etc.…a mas también se dedica la compra y venta de ganado, ya que la ganadería es otro tipo de ingreso que Vitervo posee, la mayoría del tiempo la dedica a esta actividad, que por ser netamente del campo siempre la disponibilidad de tiempo es total.

Uso del Préstamo

Vitervo necesita el crédito para la compra de mayor cabezas de ganado, ya que no solamente de la agricultura se mantiene, sino que busco otra manera de ingresos y una de esas actividades es la ganadería.

.

Información Personal

Actualmente Vitervo es casado con dona Santa, en donde han llegado a procrear 5 hermosos hijos, que en la actualidad estudian 2 de ellos. Vitervo con mucha dedicación y esfuerzo mantiene su familia unida, en su pequeña y acogedora casa de estructura de cemento. Nuestro amigo Vitervo tiene por objetivos tener mayor número de terrenos para cultivarlas y tener mayor cantidad de cabezas de ganado
loan_use: To buy more cattle.

description: Obid R. is married and has 3 children.  He used to work in a factory as a welder but after the economic collapse, the salary was not enough to support his family. He decided to sell children clothes in the market, because he loves children very much. His wife is an accountant, but she could not find a good job too so she decided to help her husband in his business. Obid brings goods from the wholesale market and his wife and his eldest daughter sell them in the market.  Obid is an active client of Micro Invest. His first loan was for 100USD and he used it to develop his business. Gradually he increased his working capital and now his business is one of the better known trade places in the market.  Obid would to a loan of 800USD to rent another store space for his daughter, P.S.In the photo is of his daughter Farzonahon.
loan_use: Open a new trade store.

description:
Abravi N., age 36, is married and the mother of five. Her invalid husband is helpless in face of his responsibilities. Being illiterate, she contents herself with her small field of taro to feed her family. Her children do not go to school due to a lack of funds. She tries to meet their needs with the little that she has, so that they may be happy.

A hard-working, devoted, and honest woman, she had benefited from an initial loan that she was able to repay in the shortest time. Today, wishing to enlarge her field, she is requesting once again a loan of $600. This loan will allow her to produce a great profit in order to send her children to school and to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Agée de 36 ans, Madame N. Abravi est mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants. Son mari infirme, est incapable devant ses responsabilités. Analphabète, elle se contente de son petit champ de taro pour nourrir sa famille. Faute de moyens, les enfants ne sont pas scolarisés. Pour ne pas rendre malheureux, les enfants, elle essaie de les satisfaire avec le peu qu’elle a.

Travailleuse, dévouée et honnête, elle avait bénéficié d’un premier crédit qu’elle a su rembourser dans les meilleurs délais. Aujourd’hui, dans le souci d’aggrandir son champ, elle sollicite encore une fois, un crédit de $600. Ce crédit lui permettra de réaliser un profit maximum afin de scolariser les enfants et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.
loan_use: To enlarge her field and to diversify her crops

description: Nine years ago, Zinaida began her work as an entrepreneur in the markets of Melitopol, Ukraine. Her hope was to improve the standard of living for her family and to provide education to her two daughters. Over the past decade, Zinaida has successfully developed her own clothing business with the support of microfinance loans through Nadiya Ukraine. A committed and hardworking business woman, Zinaida has successfully repaid each loan. With the profits of her business, Zinaida has supported not only the education of her daughters, but also her aging parents. Currently, Zinaida is seeking a loan of US$400 to expand her inventory and increase the variety of products for sale. With the additional profits, Zinaida plans to continue expanding her business and supporting her family.
loan_use: Purchase of more inventory

description:
At 23, Mr. Gilbert G. is a bachelor and has no children. Having left formal schooling after the eighth grade, he began selling hardware and cement at an early age. He is responsible for two of his older brother's children who help him in his business.

Mr. G. has always been trustworthy in reimbursing each loan he has taken out. Very ambitious and hard-working, he now intends to expand his business by selling wholesale to smaller retailers. This necessitates a certain amount of capital, of course, so he is again requesting a loan, this time of $1200. This will allow him to get a maximum of profit from his enterprise and increase his sense of satisfaction.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agé de 23 ans, Monsieur G. Gilbert est célibataire sans enfant. Avec un niveau d'instruction du cours secondaire (4ème), il s’est très tôt lancé dans le commerce de quincaillerie et de ciment. Il a à sa charge, deux enfants de son grand frère qui l’aide dans ses activités. \r\n\r\n

Monsieur G. a toujours fait preuve de bonne fidélité dans les remboursements des crédits antérieurs qu’il avait bénéficiés. Très ambitieux et dévoué il a l’intention d’agrandir son commerce en vendant en gros aux petits détaillants. Ce qui nécessite des moyens financiers. Il vient encore une fois solliciter un crédit de $1200. Ceci lui permettra de dégager un profit maximum pour son plein épanouissement.
loan_use: expand his hardware business by selling wholesale to smaller retailers

description:
Martina S. is a 42-year-old widow with four children to care for. Life has been very hard since the loss of her husband. A taro farmer, she has difficulty making ends meet for the family. Though illiterate, she is ambitious and has good business sense, caring for her crops with an eye for profit in order to meet the family's needs. Without other resources, Martina is asking for a loan of $800 in order to improve her fields. If she can, it will have a great impact on the family's socio-economic status.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Agée de 42 ans Madame S. Martina est veuve avec quatre (04) enfants à charge. Cette disparition du mari cause des problèmes dans la famille et elle en souffre énormément. Cultivatrice de taro, elle arrive difficilement à satisfaire les besoins des quatre enfants que lui a laissés le mari. Malgré qu’elle soit analphabète, elle entretient très bien ses cultures pour un meilleur rendement afin de dégager un profit maximum. Ce profit maximisé lui permet de satisfaire les besoins de la famille. Très ambitieuse, elle a l’idée de moderniser son champ. Mais faute de moyen, elle vient solliciter un crédit de $800. Cette idée réalisée, changera favorablement le niveau de vie socio-économique de la famille.
loan_use: To expand and improve an arable plot.

description:
Sopheap married in 1983 and has 4 children, 3 sons and 1 daughter. She has run a grocery store at her home since 1999. In addition, she also sells vegetables wholesale by contracting with farmers to purchase the vegetables. Her husband drives a remork (motor taxi with carriage at the back). He transports garment factory workers from their villages to the factory site every day.

\r\n\r\nAfter receiving her first loan from MAXIMA, Sopheap was able to contract for vegetables from local farmers with advance payment. As a result, she was able to make more money. She has already taken loans from MAXIMA twice. The current loan amount requested is $1,000. She plans to use this loan to purchase more grocery items for her inventory, repair her husband's remork , and to repair their house.
loan_use: Purchasing grocery items, repairing remork (motor taxi with carriage at the back) & repairing house.

description:
Nelson is single and 26 years old. He lives in the downtown area of the city of Caaguazú, and he is the owner of a barber shop called "Peluquería Emmanuel". He started his own business 5 years ago and it is going very well. He has a good clientèle, and his shop is in a very busy commercial district. He studied to become a barber for a year in the country's capital, Asunción, and then came back to Caaguazú to exercise his profession.

A few months ago, he started selling cellphones, which generate some good extra income. He considers himself a good salesman, and the demand for cellphones has risen substantially. He only had a few phones in stock to try out the market for them, but now he needs to buy a larger quantity because the demand has increased substantially.

Nelson is requesting a loan of $200 to buy a larger quantity of cellphones. He commits to repay this amount monthly and on time.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

Original loan description in Spanish:

Nelson es soltero y tiene 26 años de edad, se encuentra viviendo en el centro mismo de la ciudad de Caaguazú, y es propietario de una peluquería llamada “Peluquería Emmanuel”. El monto su propio negocio hace 5 años, y le va bastante bien, posee una buena clientela, pues se encuentra en una zona comercial y de bastante movimiento. El estudio peluquería en la ciudad capital, Asunción, durante un año; luego volvió a Caaguazú para ejercer su profesión.

Hace unos meses empezó a vender celulares, que le generan un buen ingreso extra, él se considera buen comerciante, y la demanda de sus teléfonos ha aumentado bastante. Como el solo contaba con poco stock de teléfonos, pues solo compró unos cuantos para hacer una prueba de aceptación, el necesita adquirir ahora en mayor cantidad, ya que la demanda ha aumentado significativamente.

Nelson solicita un crédito de $ 200 para comprar mayor cantidad de teléfonos celulares, y se compromete a devolverlos mensual y puntualmente.
loan_use: to buy cellphones

description: Manuela
loan_use: Purchase corn and firewood to make tamales

description:
Genoveva I. Álfaro is a widow at the age of 57. She started her small store about four years ago at her husband's suggestion when he started to get sick. They knew that she needed a way to support herself when he was no longer able to provide for them. Now she has operated the store for four years, selling chips, noodles, sodas, dry goods, rice, beans, potatoes, and tamales.

Before she got credit from Friendship Bridge, she had to rely on her suppliers for credit, which significantly increased the cost of her goods. Now she's in her third loan cycle, and will use the credit to continue growing her inventory. Her next goal is to buy a larger refrigerator so that she can start to offer chicken and other meats for sale.

Genoveva has two grandchildren who live with her. They're too young to go to school, but they will go when the time comes, and she will help with the considerable cost of their schooling. When Genoveva was a child, she studied for only one year, but nevertheless can read and can do all the math necessary for her store in her head.

The biggest challenges that she faces are the hours that the establishment has to stay open, from early in the morning until the evening, with her minding it alone. In addition, it's always a struggle to come up with the cash to purchase the next round of inventory.
loan_use: Purchase increased inventory for store.

description: Taleh A. is a single man who lives in Khaladj, in the Salyan region of Azerbaijan. He is 27 years old and has 6 years of experience in this business. \r\nTaleh loves growing grape vines. He would like a loan of  $1200 to buy fertilizer and garden medicines to develop his orchard, especially the vineyard.
loan_use: To buy fertilizer and orchard medicines for his vineyard.

description:
Maria lives in a domestic partnership and has four children, all of them students. Her partner is a mechanical technician, but isn't able to help with all the home expenses and their children's school. She and the children go without many things they need and to improve their quality of life, Maria started to sell jewelry eight years ago. Little by little, she has increased her customers and incorporated the sales of linen, obtaining very good results.

To continue growing, Maria is requesting a loan of $650 which she will use to buy merchandise to be able to meet her customers' orders and offer good service. She will return this amount in 6 months. Be part of the growth of this business and help improve the life of this family. Thank you very much.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Maria vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos, todos ellos estudiantes, su pareja es técnico mecánico pero no le ayuda con todos los gastos del hogar y de la escuela de sus hijos, ella y sus hijos pasaban muchas necesidades económicas y para mejorar su calidad de vida Maria comenzó a vender joyería hace ocho años, poco a poco fueron incrementando sus clientes e incorporó la venta de lencería obteniendo muy buenos resultados.

Para continuar creciendo Maria está solicitando un préstamo de $ 650 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes y ofrecer un buen servicio, ella regresará esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte del crecimiento de este negocio y ayuda a mejorar la vida de esta familia, muchas gracias.
loan_use: Compra de mercancía

description:
H. Muyasar has been engaged in business since 1996. She is married and has 2 children. Her place of business is located on the first floor of Panjshanbe market.

Muaysar receives her products from chicken farms; she gets in about 4800 eggs every three days. She sells the eggs quickly, because her place is always very popular but her real problem at the moment is the condition of her sales area. She crushes about 100 eggs here every day.

H. wants to rent a stall in the corner of the market, where she would be able to sell her eggs without losses. For this purpose she is requesting a loan of US$ 900.
loan_use: Renting a stall to sell her eggs from

description: Etibar A. lives in Beylagan. He is 34 years old. Etibar is engaged in jewellery selling. He owns a small booth in the Beylagan city bazaar. He needs capital to purchase more diverse jewellery for sale. Etibar has therefore asked the Normicro Beylagan Branch for a loan of US$500.
loan_use: Expansion of business

description: Khalil K. is thirty-seven years old and married with one child.  He was trained as a tailor in 1982 and was self-employed from 1986 until the civil war broke out in Sierra Leone.  After the war, he reorganized himself and started his business in 2002 in Magburaka town of Sierra Leone on a very small scale but could not progress due to lack of capital.  With his first loan from SMT, Khalil purchased some cotton fabric, buttons, etc. and then started getting more customers.  His business is improving and he is requesting a second loan of $175 to purchase more materials to continue to expand his business.
loan_use: Purchase materials for his tailoring business

description:
Business Description

José started his business ten years ago. He sells juices, snow cones, and soft drinks in different flavors. He gives his customers excellent service every day from nine in the morning to six in the afternoon

Purpose of Loan

José needs this loan to restock his business, buy new products, and also to purchase a new tricycle vending cart. In his expanded business, he will be able to offer his younger brother a job.

About the Applicant

José is twenty-one. He is single and lives with his parents. He is the eldest of four brothers. He learned this business from his father when he was just a boy. At night, he works repairing electric appliances from his home. He hopes to improve and enlarge his business so that he can contribute more toward household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

José inicio su negocio hace 10 años. Los productos que vende son: Jugos, granizados y gaseosas en vasos en diferentes sabores. La atención de su clientela la realiza de manera personal todos los días desde las 9am-a -6pm.

Uso del Préstamo

José necesita del préstamo para invertir en la adquisición de más y nuevos productos y también la adquisición de un nuevo triciclo. Dado que se le ha presentado la oportunidad de expandir su negocio ofreciendo empleo a su hermano menor.

Información Personal

José tiene 21años. Es soltero vive junto con sus padres. Es el mayor de sus 4 hermanos. El negocio lo aprendió de su padre desde cuando era niño. Por las noches realiza trabajos de reparación de artefactos eléctricos. Por lo que para su negocio utiliza espacio de la casa don de vive. Aspira ha mejorar y crecer junto con su negocio. Para de esta manera colaborar de mejor manera y cubrir los gastos de la casa.
loan_use: To buy juices and soft drinks and purchase a new vending cart

description:
Esperanza is an enterprising and active woman. She is married and has two children, one six and the other 7. Her husband is a salesman. To help meet household expenses, eight years ago Esperanza started up a business selling leather items such as wallets and belts. Her business grew little by little, and today she sells in markets where the demand for her goods grows daily.

Now she has an opportunity to buy stock from her suppliers at a reduced price, but only if she places a large order. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of $475, which she plans to repay in six months. Esperanza sincerely appreciates this opportunity to improve and enlarge her business.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

Esperanza es una mujer emprendedora y activa, ella es casada y tiene dos pequeños hijos de 6 y 7 años de edad, su esposo es comerciante y para poder contribuir con los gastos de su hogar, desde hace ocho años Esperanza inició su propio negocio en el que vende artículos de piel, como billeteras y cintos, poco a poco ha hecho crecer su negocio ahora ya se instala en los mercados donde la demanda de productos y sus ventas se incrementan día con día.

\r\nAhora se le ha presentado la oportunidad de recibir un mejor precio por parte de sus proveedores pero tiene que hacer un pedido grande y para poder cubrir el costo está solicitando un préstamo de $ 475 dólares, mismos que se compromete a regresar en 6 meses. Esperanza agradece sinceramente la oportunidad que le brindas de mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio.
loan_use: To stock leather goods
town_name: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

description:
Leonardo is single. His mother is elderly. He started his business as a way to look after himself and his mother. He began by selling shoes, and he realized how much he liked the business. Little by little the business grew until he had an extensive clientele. Later he decided to take a course in handicrafts where he learned flower arrangement and decoration for special events. With these new skills, Leonardo began to sell handicrafts that he makes himself, and these have helped his business grow.

He is asking for a loan of $750 to buy supplies used in his arts and crafts and expects to repay the loan in six months. He appreciates your belief in him and your support in improving and expanding his business.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

Leonardo es soltero, su madre es una persona mayor, el inicio su negocio por que tenia que ver por el sustento de él y de su mamá, inició vendiendo zapatos y se dio cuenta del gusto que tiene hacia este oficio y poco a poco fue teniendo más clientes, así hizo una extensa cartera de clientes. Después decidió a tomar un curso de manualidades y aprendió a elaborar arreglos florales y decoración de eventos especiales, sabiendo el negocio de las ventas y con su nuevo conocimiento, Leonardo empezó a ofrecer productos decorativos que él mismo elabora con lo que ha hecho crecer con su negocio.\r\n

\r\nÉl esta solicitando un préstamo de US $ 750 para comprar insumos que necesita en la elaboración de las manualidades y ofrece pagar el préstamo en 6 meses, él les agradece mucho tu confianza y apoyo para mejorar y continuar creciendo con su negocio.
loan_use: To buy arts and crafts supplies

description:
Taurino is 61 years old and is married to Feliciana who is 54 years old. Both of them work in making handcraft baskets and hampers made out of wicker. The couple has 4 children ages 37, 30, 29, and 22 years old, respectively. The eldest of the children is already married and lives in his own home. The rest of them still live at their house and go to school and work at the same time.

Taurino told us that he learned the trade when he was 7 years old. His mother was the one that taught him everything he knows and in turn his mother learned it form his grandmother. That way the knowledge was transmitted from one generation to another.

The handcraft baskets are used to place gifts in them which are deliver by companies to their employees during the end of the year, mainly during Christmas and New Year (just like gift baskets). During that season the demand for their product increases.

They also cultivate diverse fruits and vegetables that are use mainly for family consumption but if they have a good crop they are able to sell it as well. They wish to obtain a loan to buy the raw materials needed to make the baskets. Their goal is to start making them early so they can count with a good stock for the end of the year when the demand is at its highest.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer.

Taurino tiene 61 años, es casado con Feliciana quien tiene 54 años y al igual que su esposo también se dedica a la fabricación de canastos artesanales hechos de mimbre. El matrimonio tiene 4 hijos de 37, 30, 29 y 22 años respectivamente. El mayor de los hijos ya está casado y vive en casa propia, los demás hijos aún viven con ellos, estudian y trabajan a la vez.

Taurino cuenta que aprendió la profesión a los 7 años, fue su madre quien le enseñó todo lo que sabe y ésta a su vez lo aprendió de la suya, transmitiéndose así el conocimiento de generación en generación.

Los canastos artesanales son utilizados para colocar en ellos obsequios que son entregados principalmente por las empresas a sus empleados en épocas de fin de año, principalmente por Navidad y Año Nuevo, por lo que tiene más demanda por esas fechas.

También cultiva frutas y verduras diversas que son destinadas a consumo familiar y si la cosecha es buena también le alcanza para comercializarlas. Desean obtener el préstamo para comprar la materia prima necesaria para elaborar sus canastos a fin de comenzar a fabricarlos y así contar con un buen stock para fin de año en donde la demanda es bastante alta.
loan_use: Elaboration of handcraft baskets

description:
Mrs. Em T. is 25 years old, married, and has 2 children who are too young to attend school. She sells vegetables and a variety of grocery products to the people in her area. With this activity, she can typically generate around $ 2.50 each day, while her husband makes approximately $3 a day selling containers of gasoline along the roadside in their area.

This young couple would like to maximize the number of products their little store offers to meet their clients' needs, but this is impossible due to their financial constraints. As a result, they are humbly requesting a loan of $500 to help them expand their store.
loan_use: Would like to expand her little grocery store by adding more products

description:
Albino Pinto M. was born in 1964. He is a native of Chiure, Cabo Delgado province. He is a son of fieldworkers, and he is a father of 2 children. He attended school until the 7th grade and was recruited to obligatory military service. He transfered to the city of Maputo where he continued his studies until the third year of Comercial school and obtained a house. In 2000 he sold his house and moved to the Bagamoyo village where he resides until this day. With the money from the sale of his house, he built another house and developed his water business. The architect's miscalculations of the structure caused the water tanks to collapse, and Albino lost his investment. Still, he continued with his project, and with the help of some friends, he was able to purchase a new water tank. He also came to know Hluvuku and asked him for a loan, increasing the number of tanks to two. With his second loan he purchased a pump with greater capacity and increased the number of tanks by one, subsequently increasing the number of customers. With the current loan of 1,200 dollars he intends to purchase more tanks and tubes.

He services 91 clients with fixed contracts, and another 300 people benefit from his business. He hopes to invest in other villages where the community suffers from diverse sicknesses due to a lack of natural water. This business helps him support the six people who are his responsibility. He pays the salaries of 2 workers, and helps support the reduction in the country's unemployment rate.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

\r\nAlbino Pinto M., nascido em 1964, natural de Chiure Província de Cabo Delgado, filho de Pais camponeses, pai de 2 filhos estudou ate sétima classe e foi recrutado para servico militar obrigatorio, tendo sido transferido para Cidade de Maputo onde veio continuar com os estudos até terceiro ano Comercial e adquiriu uma casa por alienação. Em 2000 vendeu a casa e mudou-se para o Bairro de Bagamoyo onde reside até então. Com o dinheiro da venda de casa construiu outra e com o valor remanescente dicidiu abrir um furo de água para fazer face a escassez de água potável que se atravessa naquele bairro. O mau cálculo da estrutura por parte do técnico causou o desabamento dos tanques e perda do investimento aplicado. Mesmo assim continuou com seu projecto e com ajuda de alguns amigos conseguiu comprar um outro tanque retomando a actividade. Através de colegas conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema tendo recorrido a um empréstimo de 25.000,00mt e aumentou para 2 o numero de tanques de abastecimento. Com o segundo empréstimo de 42.000,00mt comprou uma bomba com maior capacidade e aumentou mais um tanque e consequentimente o numero de clientes. Com o empréstimo de 30.000,00MT pretende comprar mais tanques e tubos para alastrar cada vez mais a sua rede, visto que a procura deste precioso líquido é cada vez maior.

Conta actualmente com 91 clientes com contractos fixos e com cerca de 300 que se abastecem directamente das fontanárias instaladas em sua residência. Tem como perspectiva investir noutros bairros onde o as comunidade sofrem devido a falta de água potável. O seu projecto é de vital importância pois abastece a comunidade em água potável evitado de certa forma várias doenças de natureza hídrica , resultante da falta de água potável e/ou consumo de água imprópria, por outro lado incurta as distãncias para aquisição deste precioso líquido.\r\nNa sua vida pessoal este projecto incrementa a renda ajudando-lhe a sustentar 6 pessoas que estão na sua responsabilidade e para além de pagar salários a 2 (dois) trabalhadores que emprega ate então, participando deste modo para a redução do elevado índice de desemprego que assola o país.
loan_use: To buy pipes for his water business

description: Federico
loan_use: Buy replacement parts and accessories for motorcycles

description: A. Rahim is 48 years old and married with 3 daughters and one son.  All three daughters are married. His son graduated from secondary school and now works in auto service as an assistant. A. Rahim has 27 years experience in this field of trade.  He is a trained accountant but started to work in a vegetable shop after the collapse of the USSR.  Afterwards he decided to open his own  business. He imports his goods from villages and neighboring countries and now wants to increase his business. His next loan will be used for the increase of volume of vegetables that he is able to import.
loan_use: Increase the volume of vegetables he is able to trade.

description: El Sr. Roberto Carlos
loan_use: Para la compra de joyas como anillos, cadenas, pulseras y aros// Purchase of jewelry such as rings, chains, bracelets, and earrings

description:
Fizza is a 44 year-old, married woman with two children. She and her husband (as seen in the picture) started their own business in 1998. In 2005, Fizza received her first loan from Normicro Baku branch. In time, their business received a second loan.

\r\n\r\n

Fizza invested these two loan amounts she received from Normicro to complete the building of her shop and to buy electronic control instruments. She hopes to further grow their business by purchasing new electronic equipment to aid in additional repair services. Fizza is requesting a loan amount of $1,000 to accomplish this.
loan_use: To purchase new equipment for shop

description:
Irene is 32 years old, and the mother of 3. Her husband works in a paint factory and helps her with the business in whatever way he can. Her store has allowed her to make significant improvements to her home, which only a couple of years ago, was still made out of wood.

\r\n\r\n

Irene has a general store where she sells clothes, school supplies, decorations and snacks. She has had this business for about 6 years. Prior to this she was a door to door clothing saleswoman. She set up her business with the intention of continuing her clothes sales, but she found that other items were also profitable and sold faster. She buys most of her products in bulk. This allows her to also travel to rural towns and sell in large quantities to micro businesses there. She is seeking her second loan in order to continue investing in wholesale quantities in order to increase her profits.
loan_use: Invest in more merchandise

description:
Juana Pax T. G. is 34, but her family already has a thriving business sewing jeans for the local market. They buy denim, cut it, and sew it into various children's sizes, then sell wholesale in the weekly market in nearby San Francisco El Alto. The jeans have a professional, polished look, with a good cut and a nice label.

Juana is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. The oldest, 13, works half days in the shop and can turn out 4 pairs of jeans himself. The whole shop hums with activity, and can produce 15 pairs per day, which increases to 25 with the purchase of an additional electric sewing machine to replace the old treadle-style machine that one of the workers had to use. They can sell the jeans for about US$3.30 each; material for each costs about US$.90, so they make a tidy profit of over $2.00 on each pair.

Someday Juana would like to have her own store in San Francisco El Alto and sell at retail, with the higher markup that would provide.

Women's group: "De la Cruz" in Paxixil, San Francisco El Alto, Totonicapán

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows
loan_use: Purchase electric sewing machine

description:
Petrona Celestina S. G. has a small store and a small garden. She lives high above the highway along a path in an agricultural area, so her store is not in a densely populated area, but it serves a neighborhood need, selling snack foods, drinks, eggs, juices, and the like. She just started the store about 6 months ago, and is gradually growing the inventory, bit by bit. Petrona has 10 children, of whom five are still in school, so it's a struggle to keep up with school expenses.

Petrona will use this credit for a bit of carrot and radish seed so she can sell some of the produce from her garden, and to increase the inventory in her little store.

Petrona and her neighbors in the area speak mostly the Quiché language among themselves. Spanish is a second language that some speak well and others just a little.

Written by Kiva Fellows: Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay
loan_use: Radish and carrot seed for the garden, purchase more inventory for the store

description:
Maria is married and has two children. Her husband is a day laborer, a job which is not particularly stable. Indeed, he is often unemployed and thus cannot pay for household expenses. Consequently, in order to support her husband, Maria decided to start a business selling snacks. She began by only selling one to two types of products. As she added more products, though, her business began to grow.

Maria is requesting a loan of $200, which she will use to purchase merchandise to resupply her business and thus help it continue to grow. She is committed to repaying the loan in three months. Maria and her family would appreciate your support.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

María esta casada y tiene dos hijos, un hombre y una mujer, su esposo trabaja como jornalero, y es un trabajo que no es estable, por eso en muchas temporadas él no tiene empleo y no puede cubrir los gastos del hogar, por ello, María decidió poner su negocio de venta de frituras, para apoyar a su esposo en la economía familiar. Ella empezó su negocio vendiendo muy pocas cosas hace un año atrás, empezó vendiendo de 1 a 2 tipos de productos y poco a poco fue surtiéndose de más productos y comenzó a crecer con su negocio.

María está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $200 para comprar mercaderías para abastecer y surtir su negocio y continuar con el crecimiento del mismo, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en tres meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen el apoyo que le das para continuar con el crecimiento de su negocio.
loan_use: Purchase of Merchandise

description: Feliciana has been in the carpentry business for over 15 years, and has much to show for it. She uses the empty lot next to her house as a workshop, and recently hired 2 employees. The piles of fragrant sawdust covering the ground are indicative of the hours of hard work. Feliciana lives with her husband, who is also a carpenter, and their three children. She produces both custom orders and regularly supplies several stores with “muebles” or furniture. She does not own a storefront, but rather conducts all of her business from her home. She makes everything from rocking chairs and armoires to desks and bed frames. \r\n\r\nOnce a week Feliciana travels an hour outside the city to buy the best quality, driest wood at the best price. She hopes to receive a loan of $500, which she would use to purchase her wood. She would also use part of the money to put toward another sanding machine, which she says is desperately needed.
loan_use: She hopes to receive a loan of $500, which she would use to purchase her wood. She would also use part of the money to put toward another sanding machine, which she says is desperately needed.

description:
Business Description

Pablo has been making and selling food for 30 years. He has a basic food store where he sells rice, oil, beans, sugar etc. He started this business when his wife died. He had his own money and decided to invest it in a business. It is open from 6.30am – 10 pm Monday – Sunday. Weekends he also sells ceviches ad encebollados from 6am – 11am.

Loan Use

Pablo would like a loan to buy more supplies such as rice, oil, sweets, diapers etc. These products are in demand in his area and he does not have enough to meet his clients’ needs.

Personal Information

Pablo is 59 years old and has been a widower for 3 years. When his wife died he was left in charge of the house. He currently lives with his 2 eldest daughters and he helps out with his grandchildren when he can. He has his own house which has 2 floors and is made of cement, although it is not yet finished. His daughters help him out with his business, especially by selling encebollado which is what they did before his wife died. They are very hard-working people despite difficulties which have meant they have had to fight to continue on together.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Don Pablo tiene 30 años de experiencia en el comercio y venta de comida. El tiene una tienda de víveres de primera necesidad, vende arroz, aceite, fréjoles, azúcar etc. El inicio el negocio de la tienda a raíz que su esposa falleció. El tenía su propio capital y decidió invertir en la tienda. Su negocio lo atiende de lunes a domingo de 6:30am hasta las 10:00pm. Además los sábados y domingos vende encebollados y ceviches, desde las 6:00am hasta las 11:00am.

Uso del Préstamo

Don Pablo desea el crédito para abastecer más su tienda de productos como arroz, aceites, confiterías, pañales, etc. Estos productos tiene bastante demanda en el sector y el no tiene para satisfacer la demanda que se le ha presentado de sus clientes.

Información Personal

Don Pablo tiene 59 años de edad, el es viudo hace 3 años. Cuando murió su esposa quedo a cargo de su casa. El vive actualmente con sus 2 hijas mayores de edad. Pero él ayuda a sus nietos en lo que el puede. La vivienda en que vive es propia, de 2 pisos de cemento y aun esta en construcción. Sus hijas lo ayudan también en el negocio de la tienda y especialmente en la venta de encebollado ya que esta actividad la tenía anteriormente su esposa y él decidió continuar con el negocio. Ellos son personas muy trabajadoras que a pesar de las situaciones presentadas luchan por salir adelante todos juntos.
loan_use: To stock his store with more products/Abastecer su tienda con mercaderia

description: Ly's parents-in-law are very old (77&78 years old); their son and Ly are farmers who grow green dragon plants (for fruit) and vegetables. Their average income is $11 per month per person. Ly wants to borrow $ 75 to raise rabbits so as to get more income from their farming venture. She plans to repay the loan over the space of 5 months.
loan_use: raising rabbits

description:
Dilfuza’s husband is away working in Russia right now. He was compelled to leave as he could not find a permanent job where they live. He left his business selling paint, varnish, and finishing materials to his wife Dilfuza to run.

In spite of her age (she is only 19), Dilfuza has managed to continue the business successfully. There is a high demand for these products and they make a good profit. Dilfuza has one child; her mother-in-law looks after him while she works.

As the business is capital-intensive, it needs more financial investments. Dilfuza received a loan from MicroInvest and expanded the assortment of products she sells. Now it is a good season for sales as many people are repairing their houses. That is why Dilfuza is requesting a second loan to further expand her inventory.
loan_use: expand her inventory

description: Mrs. Joaquina G. V. is 39 years old, single, and has 2 sons, 22 and 19 years old. The eldest son is currently studying in a local university, while the other one is finishing high school. Mrs. Joaquina is currently working as the main cook and as a fresh fish saleswoman in a co-owned restaurant near the Paraguay River. She has been in the business for over a year now, and the business is slowly growing. Mrs. Joaquina says that the restaurant is more decorated now, and she attends to more customers, including a defined lunch-time clientele. The restaurant's clientele mostly consists of people with a refined taste for fish from around the city. People from the city's surrounding areas also frequent her restaurant.    \r\nMrs. Joaquina is asking for a loan of US$400 to be able to fish better by acquiring better fishing materials. She plans on investing in a new canoe as well as a new net. Likewise, she plans to spend some of the money for buying fish such as the surubí and dorado that are very popular among her customers.
loan_use: Purchase of a new canoe as well as materials for a new net

description:
Ana Celia is married and has five kids. In order to earn some more money so that her kids could continue studying Ana decided to start her own business 6 years ago. She sells second hand clothes in markets and with the help of her husband her merchandise has increased and her service improved. Her love for her children and promise to her husband keep her going everyday.

In order for her business to grow and to increase the amount of products that she offers, Ana would like a loan of $250 which she will pay back over a period of 4 months. Your help is much appreciated in the development of this business. Help this family to improve their lives. They thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Ana Celia es casada y tiene cinco hijos. Ante la necesidad de un ingreso extra que les permitiera a sus hijos continuar estudiando desde hace seis años Ana inició su propio negocio con la venta de ropa usada, con el apoyo de su esposo realiza sus ventas en los mercados y poco a poco han ido incrementando la mercancía que ofrece y mejorando su servicio. El amor hacia sus hijos y el fiel compromiso con su esposo la motivan a esforzarse más cada día.

Para continuar creciendo con su negocio y ampliar la variedad de productos que ofrece Ana está solicitando un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que se compromete a devolver en 4 meses. Tu ayuda es de gran utilidad en el desarrollo de este negocio, apoya a esta familia a mejorar su vida, ellos te lo agradecen mucho.
loan_use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercancía
town_name: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

description:
The work on my house never ends. I need to build a concrete roof to be able to use a new room because my family needs more space and the house is really small. I am asking for a loan of $1000 to build a concrete roof.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

“Tengo una construcción sin terminar, me hace falta poner el techo de concreto para poder habitar el cuarto ya que a mi familia le hace falta más espacio debido a que la casa es muy pequeña ”. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para la construcción del techo de concreto
loan_use: To build a concrete roof

description:
After working for another mechanic for 8 years, Francisco Banitez J. decided to start his own business three years ago in the hope of gaining more money. He is 37 years old, married, and a father of two sons. His elder son, who is 16 years old, helps him at his mechanic shop. His other son is 10 years old and is studying at school.

Francisco mainly works on fixing large trucks and pick-up trucks. He works from Mondays to Saturdays all day long, starting at 7 in the morning and usually working until late at night when he finishes his work for the day.

After opening his own shop, he has accumulated a large group of his own clients that always seek his services. With his previous loan, he was able to purchase machinery that cost $900 to elevate the trucks. He is very grateful for the loan he received previously because the machine he purchased has helped him a lot in minimizing manual labor. Now he is seeking a loan to purchase more parts for a truck that he is working on.
loan_use: Purchase parts for a truck.

description:
Inobat has two children. She is divorced and is raising her sons by herself. She lives with her parents. Her father is a pensioner but his pension is not enough to live on, so Inobat started her business 6 years ago by selling men’s, women’s and children’s clothing. She travels to Karosuu, Kyrgyzstan and Kokand, Uzebkistan to purchase goods. It is very difficult for Inobat to travel to different countries to buy goods because there are problems with transportation and customs inspectors on the borders between countries. But Inobat has gotten used to difficulties and can’t imagine her life without trade.
Inobat is an active client of “MicroInvest”. In the past the loans she received helped her grow her business. With this loan she plans to open her own stall and with the profits she wants to buy a separate flat for her small family.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Инобат мать двоих детей. С мужем она развелась и осталась с двумя детьми на руках. Сейчас она живет со своими родителями и сама растит своих двух сыновей. Ее отец пенсионер и его пенсии не хватает на жизнь. 6 лет назад Инобат начала предпринимательскую деятельность. Начала бизнес с мужской, женской и детской одеждой. За товаром ездит в Каросуу, Кыргызстан и Коканд, Узбекистан. Инобат очень трудно ездить в другую страну за товаром, так как на границе этих городов возникают проблемы с таможенными органами и перевозкой товара. Но Инобат уже привыкла к этим трудностям и не может представить себе жизнь без торговли.
Инобат активный клиент Микроинвест. Полученные займы способствовали развитию бизнеса Инобат в лучшую сторону. В планах у нее открыть лавочку и на доходы приобрести отдельную квартиру для своей маленькой семьи.
loan_use: to expand business

description:
When the life conditions became completely unbearable, Salima went to sell on a market. This was 6 years ago. For the last several years, Salima’s husband has been away working as a seasonal laborer in Russia. He earns very little. The irregular money transfers that he sends are not enough to pay for necessities. Salima has 3 children. One of her daughters is mentally retarded and sits at home. Salima tries anything that might bring extra income. She specializes in sale of dried fruits (apricots and prunes). During the summer, when melons and watermelons appear on the market, Salima switches to sell them. Salima’s older daughter helps her mother to sell. Over the 5 months of being a MicroInvest borrower, Salima demonstrated that MicroInvest loans made a noticeable difference in her business. Salima plans to continue her relationship with MicroInvest, as the loans she receives help her sustain her business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Когда условия жизни Салимы стали совсем невыносимыми она вышла на базар торговать. Это произошло 6 лет назад. Ее муж уже несколько лет в России на заработках, но зарабатывает очень мало. Деньги высылает нерегулярно, и присланных не хватает на жизнь. У Салимы 3 детей, одна из дочерей умственно отсталая в развитии, и сидит дома. Салима старается заниматься всем тем что приносит прибыль. Основная направленность – это продажа сухофруктов (чернослив, абрикосы). В летний сезон, когда на базаре появляются арбузы и дыни Салима, переходит на их продажу. В торговле ей помогает ее старшая дочь. \r\nКредитуется 5 месяцев и за это время займы Микроинвест внесли заметный вклад в ее бизнес. Салима и дальше собирается сотрудничать с Микроинвест, так как займы помогают ей поддержать ее бизнес.
loan_use: Business expansion

description:
I have run this small convenience store for three years. Now I need to purchase more products in order to sell common goods like bananas, beans, rice, tortillas, churros and bread. This business helps me purchase medicines and afford electricity, water and the like. It is my only source of income. I would like it if you helped me be able to purchase these products, give my customers a better service and increase my sales.\r\n

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

\r\nYo tengo este pequña pulperia hace 3 años, ahora nesecito comprar mas productos para poder vender mas como: platanos, frijoles, arroz, tortilla en bolsas, churros, confites y pan. Con ete negocio me puedo comprar yo mis medicinas ya tambien pagar gastos como electricidad, agua y otros. Este es el unico sustento que tengo. me gustaria que me ayudaran para poder comprar estos productos y asi dar un mejor servicio a mis clientes y tener mas ventas.
loan_use: Purchase churros, rice, beans, sugar, bread, etc.

description:
Matlubahon is an experienced specialist in sewing dresses. She has a high education as designer of women's garments. She worked at a school as teacher of handicrafts, but the salary of a teacher is not enough for supporting her family.

She rented a premises for her own workshop. Gradually she bought several sewing machines and employed two assistants. Her business consists of purchasing fabric and making dresses, then selling them in the market. The high quality of their dresses has attracted many clients to her workshop. Presently her workshop is one of the best-known workshops in the area. \r\n

Since 2006 she has been a client of Micro Invest. Her first loan was $100. Step by step she increased her loan limit to $1000.Today Matlubahon takes orders from individuals for sewing modern garments for them. She always tries to do her best to satisfy her clients. In future months, Matlubahon wants to sew national autumn dresses from velour fabric. She wants to buy several kind of such fabric and she is requesting $600 for this purpose.
loan_use: Purchase of fabric.

description:
Муж Зухры находится на заработках в России вот уже несколько лет. Сама Зухра не имеет постоянной работы и сидит дома. Ей 34 года и она воспитывает 3 детей. Для пополнения семейного бюджета она занимается выращиванием домашнего скота дома. Это приносит солидный доход. Опыт работы Зухры в животноводстве 4 года. В Микроинвест она кредитуется недавно. На займ Микроинвест она приобрела одного бычка. На новый займ она собирается приобрести еще одного бычка.

For several years, Zukhra's husband has been in Russia working as a seasonal laborer. Zukhra has no permanent job and stays at home. She is a 34-years-old single mother of 3. To supplement her family budget, Zukhra raises cattle at home. The business brings a sizable income. Zukhra has 4 years of experience raising cattle. Recently, she joined MicroInvest lending program and purchased a young bull. With the new loan, Zukhra plans to buy another bull.
loan_use: For purchase one more gow

description: Mrs. Mich T., 48 years old, lives in Kampong Cham and sells vegetable and fruit for a living.  She earns about $2/day in her sales activities and her husband earns $2.5/day working as a teacher.  The couple also supports Mrs. Mich T.'s mother and their 2 children.  This loan will be used to purchase sugarcane and a motorcycle for transporting her product.
loan_use: To purchase sugar cane for her inventory and a motorcycle for her business transportation

description:
Velina R. is the owner of a small general store in Trou-Du-Nord, Haiti. Although she doesn’t have any immediate family in the area, Velina’s business enables her to be very involved in her local community. She will use this first loan to expand the inventory of her store with a variety of essential goods.\r\n

\r\nNote: Velina is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $750 loan for his/her respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying his/her share of this loan together. This group-lending methodology ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.
loan_use: Expand the inventory of her general store.

description:
Candelaria, 36, is married with 3 children; her husband is an agente municipal (municipal employee/policeman, possibly). She has a grocery store in her house. She belongs to the Lourdes 1 group along with dona Merida Velasco Molina (who sells shoes from catalogs). With the loan, they want to invest in their businesses: Candelaria, in buying merchandise--beans, rice, sugar, milk, pastas and non-perishable foods--and Merida will try to set up a small shoe shop in her house in which she will sell shoes that she will bring from Tuxtla where she can get a wider range of shoes that she can now order from catalogs.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

CANDELARIA, tiene 36 años, casada, 3 hijos, su esposos trabaja como agente municipal. Ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa. Pertenece al grupo Lourdes 1 junto con doña MERIDA VELASCO MOLINA (vende zapatos por catálogos) Ellas con el préstamo esperan invertir Candelaria comprando mercadería como porotos, arroz, azúcar, leche, pastas y alimentos no perecibles, en cambio Mérida intentará Poner en su casa un pequeño local de venta de zapatos los que traerá desde Tuxtla, solicitando mayor cantidad que lo que hoy pide por catálogos.
loan_use: Grocery store.

description: Mrs. Josephine O. specializes in the sale of provisions and foodstuffs. She is 56 years old, mother of eight children. She has been running a little grocery store for 5 years. She is requesting a loan of $800 to buy a wider range of goods for her inventory.
loan_use: To buy more provisions and foodstuffs for sale in her little grocery store

description:
Mr. Cándido is 35 years old, married and the father of two children. He comes from a very poor family and, since he was a kid, he worked to contribute to the family income. He worked several years as an assistant in an auto repair shop and, after several years of learning and saving, he was able to set up his own shop, presently located at his home.

Because of the high quality of his work, he has a good number of clients. His work allows him to feed and provide education to his kids. Since he wasn’t able to receive a school education due to his parents' bad financial situation, his biggest dream is that his children finish their studies.

He wishes to continue making progress and wants to buy replacement parts to sell at his repair shop; in this way, he will be able to make profit with both the sale of these and his labor. He is asking for a $300 loan towards this end.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Cándido tiene 35 años de edad, está casado y es padre de 2 hijos. Cándido proviene de una familia muy humilde y desde muy pequeño empezó a trabajar para poder aportar con los ingresos de la casa. Trabajó varios años como ayudante en un taller mecánico para autos, y tras varios años de aprendizaje y ahorro, pudo montar su propio taller, que hoy día se encuentra en su casa.

Posee una buena cantidad de clientes, ya que su trabajo es muy bueno; con su trabajo puede alimentar y dar educación a sus hijos. Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos puedan culminar sus estudios, ya que él no tuvo la suerte de acceder a una educación escolar por la mala situación económica que atravesaban sus padres.

El desea seguir progresando y desea comprar repuestos para la venta en su taller; de esta forma podrá ganar con la venta de los mismos y la mano de obra de su trabajo. Para ello solicita un crédito de $300.
loan_use: Purchase of car replacement parts

description:
Born in 1957, Alice N. is married and is a mother of five children. Her ill health caused her husband to sell some of their valuable properties and even exhausted all their money on medications. After that there was need for capital to start off a business that would be able to sustain the family. She then sought the help of GHAPE, became a member in 2002, and was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline. Since then, she has successfully invested, managed and repaid loans of about $600 with which she raised money to pay apprentice fees for her children, buy medications and pay school fees.

Given a loan of $800, she plans to sell fish, egusi and cultivate vegetables. Egusi is a rich source of protein and oil and is used as a thickener of soups and to make pudding. With the profit, she plans to increase her business and continue to pay school fees for her children.

She will repay the loan in 24 months and the first installment of repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.
loan_use: Purchase fish, egusi, vegetable seeds

description:
Senovio has a small workshop where he manufactures chamarras (jackets), which he sells in the city of Cochabamba. This is how he makes his living and supports his six children - two who attend the state university and four who attend local schools. He lives in the Rio Seco neighborhood in El Alto.

He requests this loan to purchase raw materials (fabric and yarn). This will be his third loan through IMPRO. His excellent payment history qualifies him to apply for this loan, which will help him increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Senovio tiene su taller de costuras de chamarras, las cuales son comercializadas en la Ciudad de Cochabamba. Esta es su principal actividad y por ende su principal ingreso que le permite la manutención de sus 6 hijos, dos están en la Universidad Estatal y cuatro en la edad escolar. Vive en la Zona de Rió Seco de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito requiere para comprar materia prima (tela y fibra). Este será el tercer crédito con Impro, su buen comportamiento de pago de los créditos anteriores le faculta para acceder a otro préstamo para que mejores sus ingresos y mejorar la condición de vida de su familia.
loan_use: To purchase raw materials

description:
Mukaddas is one of the active clients of Microinvest. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband and his two brothers have a big bakery at their big house. Their wives prepare the dough and bake the bread to sell in the bakery. \r\n

Today, they have many customers and they sell the bread quickly. Their bakery attracts more customers, because they use flour of high quality. Due to this fact, their bakery became one of the best bakeries in Kistakuz, Khudjand. \r\n

They received a lot of orders for September. So Mukaddas needs extra capital to purchase the flour for baking bread to fill the orders for September.
loan_use: For purchasing three sacks of flour

description:
J. is 33 years old, and has been running a pharmacy for the past seven years. He is married with one kid. He buys his stock in Kariokoo, Dar Es Salaam’s biggest trading area.\r\nHis stock consists of medicine for malaria, coughs, all sorts of pains and other related problems. He buys his medicine directly from the wholesalers/suppliers of the medicine and he sells as a retailer. He always stocks once a week, but sometimes he is forced to stock daily for medicine that is in high demand.

J. employs two people at his pharmacy and one relative always help him monitor critical issues for the business. J. is facing stiff competition, as the area has so many other pharmacies due to the presence of a hospital near his area of business. It’s his hope, therefore, that if he secures a bigger loan, as big as USD1000, it will help him boost up his working capital and auspiciously compete with other people doing the same business. With the loan, he hopes to buy more stock.
loan_use: EXPAND PHARMACY

description:
Description of the Business

Ms. Sefora gains from selling cosmetics and clothing. She sells these products to people around the sector, her friends and neighbors. She started this business with her son’s help, who sent her money from abroad.

Use of the loan

With this loan she will buy more products at a bulk price and she will re-invest with the profit she gains.

Personal Information

She is 39 years old, married and two sons who go to school. Her house is made of cement and her main goal is to save for her children’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Sefora se dicha a la venta de cosméticos y de ropa. Estos productos los expenden a las personas que circundan en el sector, amigos y vecinos. Ella empezó este negocio con la ayuda de su hijo quien le envió dinero del exterior

Uso del Préstamo

Con el préstamo ella aspira comprar mas mercadería a precio de mayorista y con las ganancias seguirá realizando inversiones para el negocio

Información Personal

Ella tiene 39 años de edad esta casada y tiene dos hijos que estudian su casa es de cemento. Su principal meta es de ahorrar para la educación de sus hijos
loan_use: Purchase merchandise at bulk prices

description:
Mr. Ekoué Claude K. was born on 15 June 1969 in Aného. Married and father of four (4) children, he is a carpenter and has his own workshop. His income being insufficient for all the needs of his family, he took the initiative and started a second business in conjunction with carpentry. Kind, courageous, and a hard worker, he decided to marsh farm to increase his income. With the help of his wife, who brings him considerable support, this undertaking is rapidly growing. He has been able to repay his previous loans. Currently, Mr. Ekoué Claude K. hopes to enlarge his marsh farm and make it a significant source of income for his family.

He is thus asking for a loan of $950, which will allow him to buy a motor pump, pipes, and other equipment necessary for marshland agriculture.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur K. Ekoué Claude est né le 15 Juin 1969 à Aného. Marié et père de quatre (4) enfants, il est menuisier et détient son propre atelier. Son revenu étant insuffisant pour tous les besoins de la famille, il prit l’initiative d’entreprendre une activité parallèle à la menuiserie. Brave, courageux et bon travailleur, il décide de faire du maraîchage pour améliorer son revenu. Avec l’aide de sa femme qui lui apporte un soutien considérable dans cette activité qui de plus en plus prend une allure considérable. Il a pu rembourser les crédits antérieurs. Aujourd’hui, Monsieur K. Ekoué Claude souhaite agrandir son maraîchage et en faire une source de revenu importante pour la famille Il sollicite à cet effet un crédit d’un montant de $950 qui va lui permettre d’acheter une motopompe, de tuyaux et d’autres matériels nécessaires aux cultures maraîchères.
loan_use: To buy equipment and pipes for marsh farming

description:
“I am Zarina B. and live in Lahore. I have a daughter and a son, both of whom are married. I live with my husband. My husband worked as a gardener while I take care of the chores at home. I would like to help my husband expand his business. He used to grow fruits but the salary he brought home from this activity was not enough. Recently, we leased a piece of land but do not have enough money to purchase seed and fertilizer for different seasonal fruits. If you can help us with a loan, we can purchase the necessary materials and hopefully improve our standard of living and provide for ourselves in our old age.” 


Zarina B., Lahore.
loan_use: To purchase seed and fertilizer for different seasonal fruits for my husband's farm

description: Agakerim J. is 63-year-old farmer, who runs his small business consisting of two cows from which he sells milk. Agakerim lives in Saatli region, in Alisoltanli village, which is situated in the southern part of Azerbaijan. He started his business in 1993, when he purchased his first cow. Together with his wife he started to sell milk and yogurt; this business helped them to improve their life conditions. \r\n\r\nSoon after, when they had saved some money, Agakerim purchased another cow. The milk and yogurt is in high demand all across Azerbaijan. Life in the village is become harder and harder every day, because there is much competition in this field. So he had applied for 1200 USD to purchase an additional cow for milk and two calves for meat production. The estimated cost for a cow in Azerbaijan 600-800 USD and for a calf is 200-400 USD.
loan_use: To purchase two calves each for 250 USD and one cow for 700 USD

description: Ibadet A. is a young 22-year-old businessman who lives in Yalavach village, in Imishli town, in the southern part of Azerbaijan. He started his toy business in 2005 and since then his income has considerably increased. He is planning on expanding his business and has ordered a consignment of toys from Moscow (Russia); these include mechanical and educational toys. He has saved some money but is requesting a loan of $1200 USD to make the payment for the first consignment. His entire consignment costs no more than $4,000.
loan_use: Going to purchase new goods for his toy shop

description:
Mrs. Sophath M. has had a business buying and selling flowers and bananas for more than 20 years. She is widowed with 6 children. Five of her children are married and live in different houses. Mrs. M.'s youngest daughter is single, lives at home, and assists her mother in the business every day. \r\n\r\n

Mrs. M. has borrowed money from MAXIMA four times already. Now she is requesting a loan of $500 to buy flowers and bananas from local farmers to sell in the market.
loan_use: Purchasing more flowers and bananas from local farmers to sell in the market.

description:
Paulina lives in the Villa Ingenio neighborhood, in the city of El Alto and has three small children, ages 3 months, 2 and 9. She sells chuno (potato starch) and tunta (dried, dehydrated potato), which she buys from rural areas. Her husband works as a tailor in a small garment factory in La Paz.

She will use this loan to purchase additional merchandise for her business and in that way, increase her family's income.

This is her 2nd loan with IMPRO. She used the 1st loan to install running water in her home, which greatly improved her family's health and living conditions. That loan was repaid in its entirety.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Paulina vive en la calle de Urus de la zona de Villa Ingenio de la ciudad de el Alto. Tiene tres hijos pequeños de 9, 2 años y uno de 3 meses, se dedica a la comercialización de chuño, tunta (patatas deshidratadas, que no se descomponen con el paso del tiempo, en ambiente seco) los cuales adquiere en el área rural del departamento. Su esposo trabaja como costurero en una pequeña fabrica de chamarras ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su negocio y así incrementar sus ingresos económicos en su familia. Es el segundo crédito con Impro, El primero lo invirtió en la conexión de agua potable al interior de su domicilio y así pudo mejorar la salud de su familia. Actualmente este credito esta completamente pagado.
loan_use: Working capital

description: Ramatu Lailah is eighteen years old and is married with a child.  She runs a business selling sandals, sauce pans and others small items in the market in Kabala, Sierra Leone.  Ramatu’s husband Jabari assists her in running the business.  Both are committed to prepare a secure future for their children.  Ramatu said that she used part of the profit generated from her previous loan to buy a cow so that the family can have milk for the family and to sell.  She plans to buy more cows in the future.  To enable her to do that, she is requesting a loan of $250 to expand her current business.
loan_use: to increase hermarket stall inventory

description:
Rano is 37 years old. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband fixes cars and her children study in school. After Tajikistan’s civil war, factories closed, life became very hard and Rano started making ground meat. She started her business with $30. Rano rented a refrigerator to store the ground meat.

In 2004 Rano received her first loan from MicroInvest. Back then her assets were worth $100. After several loans she started purchasing meat wholesale and purchased a refrigerator. Today her assets have risen to $380. In the future she plans on purchasing a large scale and improving her business location.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Орипова Рано – 37лет. Замужем, мать троих детей. Муж занимается ремонтом автомашины, дети учатся в школе. После гражданской войны в Таджикистане заводы и фабрики закрылись, жить стала очень трудной и Рано начала заниматься изготовлением и реализацией фарша. Начала свою деятельность с 30$. Она арендовала холодильник для хранения фарша. В 2004году получила первый займ в МЗФ «Микроинвест», тогда её активы составляли 100$. После неоднократного получения займа она стала закупать оптом мясо, приобрела холодильник. Сейчас её активы возросли до 380$. В будущем она планирует купить большие весы и улучшить место деятельности.
loan_use: to buy scales and improve activity place

description: Adamsay K. is running a small kiosk in the town of Makeni in Sierra Leone.  She is thirty-years old and a single parent of two children.  As a single parent, she is responsible for the welfare of her children. Although Admsay started with small capital, her business improved with her previous loan from SMT.  Recently, she began producing tye and dye and successfully selling it from her kiosk. Adamsay is requesting another loan of $200 to help her increase production of her tye and dye activity.
loan_use: Increase inputs for Tye and Dye business

description:
Baroatkhon has been selling children's clothes for 11 years. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a worker, but his salary is not enough to support the family. So she decided to help her husband.

Baroatkhon’s business is located in the open-air market in Panjshanbe. She brings her goods from Istaravshan’s wholesale market. She began her business by selling towels; gradually, she changed her type of goods to children's clothes. Baroatkhon became a client of MicroInvest in 2006. Her first loan was for 100USD. She used her loan to buy modern clothes for little girls. Soon she was able to increase the volume of her goods. Today her stall is one of the known stalls in the market. She has many clients and she always wants to meet their needs.

In future, Baroatkhon wants to expand her assortment by including seasonal clothes for autumn time. She is requesting $400 to do this.
loan_use: To expand her business

description:
Magda is a very hardworking woman. She is single and has three children; the older two are 6 and 12 years old, and the youngest is only 8 months old. She has had to raise her family by herself and in order to cover their basic needs and give them the time they need, she began her own business one year ago. She started by selling candies and then incorporated other grocery products. She now has a well-stocked store. She would like to be able to meet all the needs of her customers, so that she can offer good service and make sure her business remains their preferred grocery.

In order to continue growing, Magda is requesting a loan of $325.00, which she will use to buy merchandise. She is prepared to return the loan in 3 months. Be an important part of the development of this business and help improve this family’s quality of life. They will be sincerely thankful.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Magda es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos, de 6 y 12 años de edad y el más pequeño de solo 8 meses de nacido. Ella sola ha tenido que sacar adelante a su familia y para poder cubrir sus necesidades básicas y darles el tiempo que necesitan desde hace un año inició su propio negocio con la venta de dulces y poco después incorporó otros productos de abarrotes, ahora tiene una tienda bien surtida, ella desea cubrir todas las necesidades de sus clientes para ofrecer un buen servicio y continuar con su preferencia .

\r\nPara poder continuar creciendo ahora Magda está solicitando un préstamo de $ 325 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía, ella esta dispuesta a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Se parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio y ayuda a mejorar la calidad de vida de esta familia, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.
loan_use: To buy merchandise

description:
Munira has been a seller of household goods for the past 20 years in Tadjikistan. Her business is located in the open-air market in Panjshanbe, Khujand. Munira sells different kinds of household goods. She started her business from the selling of sieves and spoons. She is the one member of her family who earns money for family needs, because she lost her husband several years ago and is the sole provider for her five children. It is very difficult to support such a big family, but Munira is a very cheerful women. She says that difficulties in her life have made her stronger and resilient. She lives for her children. She must help them to find their way in their life.

\r\nHer eldest son helps her to import goods from Istaravshan, Tadjikistan. Her eldest daughter stays at her place of business, when her mother goes on a trip to buy goods .The turnover of her goods is good, but she has one problem. It is the condition of her place of business. She plans to increase the number of her goods in order to save money to renting a little stall in a bigger shop. For this purpose she is requesting a loan of $400.
loan_use: Business development.

description:
Antonieta AiD. L. D. E. lives in the town of Nueva Requena, in the department of Ucayali, and which is located 48km from the city of Pucallpa. It is surrounded by the Aguaytia river and several lakes. Antioneta is 54 years old and is separated from her husband. She is raising two grandchildren, which has caused her to confront very difficult situations, especially economic troubles. Some friends told her about a feminist institution that gives training workshops to women. She attended a meeting and felt like a part of the family with the Las Amigas Zulmiritas Communal Bank. She later received a loan of S/. 300.00 (approximately $49 dollars), which she invested in grocery items. She then traded them for chickens, plantains, and fruits from the region, which she sold in the city of Pucallpa. Her customers are people from villages where many do not have cash.

This loan of S/. 2,500.00 (approximately $790.00) will be used to invest in more merchandise (milk, rice, noodles) and to expand her business with agricultural implements (such as lanterns, hammocks, mosquito nets). People from this area have many needs. She is very happy to be able to proviD. this service to the people from this area so that they don’t have to go to Pucallpa. Additionally, the income from the business allows her to pay for her grandchildren’s studies.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Antonieta AiD. L. D. E., residente del poblado D. Nueva Requena del departamento D. Ucayali, se encuentra a 48km D. la ciudad D. Pucallpa y está rodeado del río Aguaytia, D. lagos y cochas.
