Antonieta a sus 54 años se separó D. su esposo y tiene a su cargo dos nietos donD. tuvo que enfrentarse a situaciones muy difíciles, en especial económico, unas amigas le comentaron D. una institución feminista que daba charlas para mujeres, fue cuando asistió y se sintió ser parte D. la familia del Banco Comunal Las Amigas Zulmiritas, posteriormente recibió un prestamos D. S/. 300.00 soles (US$ 94 aprox.) que invirtió en abarrotes, los mismos que intercambia con gallinas, plátanos, frutas D. la región y los venD. en la ciudad D. Pucallpa. Sus clientes son personas D. los caseríos donD. muchos D. ellos no cuentan con efectivo. Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

El prestamos D. S/. 2,500.00 soles (US$ 790.00 aprox.) servirá para invertir en mas mercadería (leche, arroz, fideos) y ampliar su negocio con implementos para la agricultura (linternas, amacas, mosquiteros), estos pobladores tienen muchas necesidades. Está muy contenta D. poder dar facilidades a estos pobladores donD. ya no tienen la necesidad D. ir a la ciudad D. Pucallpa y además estos ingresos le permiten costear los estudios D. sus nietos.
loan_use: To buy grocery merchandise and agricultural implements

description:
I have four children, three sons and a daughter, who all go to school. My husband is a photographer’s assistant in a well-known studio. We are unable to meet the high cost of living with his current income. I can not work as I have to take care of our small children. My husband would like to buy his own camera so that he can start offering his services at weddings etc. We need a loan to buy the camera. We are hopeful that this way we will increase our income and continue educating our children.

\r\nMariam B., Pakistan
loan_use: Purchase a camera

description:
Maria Fermina C. C. is 61 years old and studied only up to the third grade in primary school. She lives in the District of Victor Larco in the Province of Trujillo, Department of Liberty, Peru. When she became a widow 26 years ago, she assumed all on her own a business in raising and selling animals as well as milk. With this business she educated her four children, who today are independent. Her daughter invited her to participate in the B.C. "Las Palmeras," which she accepted with a great deal of fear because she had no experience with credit, and solicited her first loan of 300 Sol (approximately $95) with which she purchased small pigs to raise and then sell. She was very good in the business of raising and selling pigs, but today she has decided to stick with cattle, ducks, and turkeys because pigs are a lot of work. In addition to raising these animals she distributes the milk which her cattle produce to her clients every day. With the loan of 1,200 Sol (approximately $380) which she will receive, Maria will buy food for her animals.

Translated by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

María Fermina C. C., tiene 61 años de edad y solo estudio hasta tercer grado de primaria. Vive en el Distrito de Victor Larco en la Provincia de Trujillo, Departamento de La Libertad – Perú. Cuando enviudó hace 26 años asumió sola su negocio de crianza y venta de animales así como venta de leche, con este negocio educó a sus cuatro hijos los que hoy son independientes. Su hija la invitó a participar del B.C. “Las Palmeras” aceptó con mucho temor porque no tenía experiencia en créditos y solicitó su primer crédito de S/.300 ($95 aproximadamente) con los que compró cerdos pequeños para criarlos y luego venderlos le fue muy bien en el negocio de los cerdos pero hoy ha decidido solo criar ganado vacuno, patos y pavos porque los cerdos dan mucho trabajo. A parte de criar estos animales distribuye a sus clientes, todas las mañanas, la leche que producen sus vacas. Con el préstamos de S/.1,200 ($380 aproximadamente) que recibirá comprará alimento para sus animales.
loan_use: Purchase of food for cattle, ducks, and turkeys.

description:
Kadiatu B. is forty years old and married with four children. She sells fish in the open-air market in Magburaka. She also takes her business to the village market on special days.

Kadiatu's previous loan enabled her to buy two baskets of fish at a time, thus increasing her profit. As she will complete her previous loan repayments in August, she would like to take out another loan to further expand her micro-business.
loan_use: Purchase more fish to sell in the village market

description:
Ximena L. Zambrana, married and mother of 7 children, has been a member of Pro Mujer for two years, and is treasurer for the Asociación Cielo Azul (Blue Sky Association) of Villa Adela.

Ximena works buying and selling mobile telecommunication equipment, especially selling cellular telephones. She is not a wholesaler, rather she is an occasional seller who benefits from some contacts in offices and businesses to be able to sell her merchandise. In some cases it is her husband, who works in student transport, who sells equipment to students in the upper years of private high schools in the Southern part of the city of La Paz.

At present, Ximena has an urgent need for capital, in order to be able to increase her stock of merchandise. One of her daughters is having health problems, and needs an operation to remove a tumor. She needs as soon as possible to put together through sales of her products the necessary amount to cover the cost of this intervention.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Ximena L. Zambrana, casada y madre de 7 hijos, pertenece a Pro Mujer hace dos años, y tesorera de la Asociación Cielo Azul de Villa Adela.

Ximena se dedica a la compra y venta de equipos móviles de telecomunicación, principalmente a la venta de teléfonos celulares, ella no es mayorista, sino es vendedora ocasional, aprovecha algunos contactos en oficinas o negocios para poder vender su mercadería, en algunos casos es el esposo, quien trabaja en transporte escolar que logra la venta de algunos equipos a estudiantes de últimos cursos de colegiuos privados de la zona sur de la ciudad de La Paz.

En la actualidad, Ximena precisa con urgencia de capital, para poder incrementar en algo su mercadería, puesto que por cuestiones de salud una de sus hijas debe ser sometida a una operación para la extracción de un tumor, por tanto necesita lo antes posible llegar a reunir mediante la venta de sus productos el monto necesario que cubrirá los gastos de la intervención.
loan_use: Ximena has an urgent need for capital, in order to be able to increase her stock of merchandise. One of her daughters needs an operation to remove a tumor.

description:
Oscar P. and his wife have a stand along the highway Acceso Sur where they work every day. They sell all products that contain honey which includes syrup, pan de miel, and other types of sweet products. They wake up at 6 in the morning to travel to set up their stand and usually work until 6 at night. Weekends are their busiest days. The number of people that buy from them each day varies. Most of their customers are people that pass by on the highway.

\r\nBefore starting their stand, La Paraguayita, they used to make their own products to sell at their house. Now, they simply buy their products from Oscar's father-in-law's factory, Fruteria Paraguari, to resell.

\r\nOscar is very happy with his business and thankful for the opportunities that his previous loan has provided him. Due to the nature of his business, his capital is very small. Thus, with his new loan, he seeks to invest in his business and be able to buy his merchandise in larger quantities. He is also thinking of new ways to expand his business and perhaps to build a sturdier stand.
loan_use: Buy pan de miel, syrup, and other honey products.

description:
Maxima R., 42, is separated and has 3 children who are, respectively, 20, 11 and 10 years old. The oldest of her children is a police officer who has worked in the capital for a year and helps her with household expenses. She says that thanks to her efforts and hard work, her daughter has been able to enter that profession.

Maxima has worked for more than 25 years selling “menudencias” (the internal organs—livers, intestines, hearts, etc.—of cattle and pigs that are widely consumed in the country) and she has a well-established customer base of around 30 people that buy from her daily along with other customers who buy from her occasionally. She works everyday, getting up very early and working until approximately 5 p.m. when she returns home. She works rain or shine. She’s very proud of her work and thanks to her income, she has been able to build her own house and to buy little luxuries like a television, stereo equipment, a freezer, etc.

She’s asking for the loan so that she can buy more merchandise because there have been days when she’s run short of stock to sell and she wants to ensure that she always has plenty to sell in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Máxima R. tiene 42 años, es separada , tiene 3 hijos de 20, 11 y 10 años respectivamente. La mayor de sus hijos es policía urbana y trabaja en la capital desde hace 1 años y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Comenta que gracias a su esfuerzo y trabajo logró que su hija pueda acceder a dicha profesión.

Máxima se dedica hace más de 25 años a la venta de menudencias (son los órganos internos de vacas y cerdos como hígado, tripa, corazón, etc que son muy consumidos en el país), posee una clientela muy bien formada de aproximadamente 30 personas que le compran todos los días, además de otros clientes ocasionales. Trabaja todos los dias, se levanta muy temprano y está en su puesto de trabajo hasta las 17 hs. p.m. aproximadamente, hora en que emprende la vuelta a su hogar . No conoce de sol ni de días de lluvia. Está muy orgullosa de su trabajo ya que gracias a los ingresos que obtuvo con él pudo construir su casa propia y tener todas las comodidades del hogar como ser televisor, equipo de sonido, heladera, etc.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de más mercaderías debido a que hay días en que escasea y debe comprar de manera anticipada para tener siempre en stock.
loan_use: Buy stock for re-sale.

description:
Blanca C. H. is 52 years old and she belongs to the “Santa Barbara” Communal Bank. She lives in the Calleria District. She is separated from her husband and has 6 children. She currently sells medicinal plants from the area, such as rue, basil, and aloe. After Blanca separated from her husband, she found herself in a difficult economic situation. When she saw that it is custom in the region to use plants for medicines and also for some rituals, she decided to get into this business, but she didn’t have enough capital. The Movimiento Manuela Ramos gave her the opportunity to invest in this. It was four years ago that she began with a small amount of capital, S/. 300.00 (approximately $94.00). Her current request is for approx S/. 2,000.00 ($625.00).

She will use the money to buy more medicinal plants at whole-sale price. With this amount she could buy 6 bunches of rue, 5 bunches of rosemary, 2 of aloe, and 2 of Holy Wood, 6 of charamasho, and a dozen bottles of scented water.

Blanca is happy with this opportunity because in this way she will be able to get ahead and provide for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Blanca C. H., tiene 52 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal "Santa Barbara", vive en el A. H. Los Rosales MZ Z Lt 15, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Es una mujer separada con 6 hijos, actualmente vende plantas medicinales de la Región como Ruda, albaca y sábila. Blanca después de su separación con su esposo se encontró en una situación difícil en lo económico, fue cuando vio que las costumbres del uso de plantas así como algunos rituales es lo cotidiano en la Región, entonces se propuso poner este negocio pero no tenia el capital, sin embargo Manuela Ramos le dio la oportunidad de invertir en este rubro y hace 4 años empezó con un pequeño capital de S/. 300 (US$ 94.00 aprox.), siendo su préstamo actual de S/. 2,000 (US$ 632.00 aprox.). Este préstamo lo requiere para comprar mas plantas medicinales por atados, es decir, más cantidad a un costo menor, con esto podrá comprar 6 atados de Ruda, 5 atados de Romero, 2 atados de sabila, 2 docenas de Palo Santo, 6 atados de Charamasho y 1 docena de agua florida. Blanca esta contenta con esta oportunidad ya que de esta manera podrá salir adelante junto a sus hijos.
loan_use: To buy medicinal plants at whole-sale prices.

description:
Lilik, who lives in Guritama Road no. 32, owns a cookie shop. She needs about $10 daily to buy the ingredients for the cookies she sells. She expects to make $2.50 profit daily. Lilik plans to use part of that profit to pay installment for this loan from DINARI and the rest to pay school fees for her two children, currently in primary school. With her baking skill, Lilik can also help her husband in sustain their family's economic situation.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer.

Lilik yang tinggal di jalan Guritama no. 32 ini mempunyai usaha menjual kue, dengan biaya yang dibutuhkan 100.000 rupiah/hari untuk membeli bahan baku untuk membuat kue Lilik mendapatkan keuntungan 25.000 rupiah/harinya yang nantinya akan digunakan untuk mencicil pinjaman yang ada di DINARI dan untuk biaya sekolah kedua anaknya yang masih SD. dengan keahlian membuat kue mentah Lilik dapat membantu suaminya dalam menjalankan perekonomian keluarga.
loan_use: Purchase cookie ingredients

description:
Paulino works in his home, where he has a small, rudimentary carpentry shop. He has had for more than five years and it is the only source of income for his family. His family is made up of himself and his wife, their children no longer live with them. Paulino makes brushes, brooms, and other products that are in demand the area because of his low prices and high quality. Given the type of product that he makes, Paulino doesn’t have much competition because he is the only person in the area who does this sort of work. Additionally, he repairs furniture in people’s homes.

The prices of the raw materials for the carpentry shop vary according to the type of wood he buys and according to the quality demanded by customers. This loan request is also for the purpose of buying plastic products that he needs to make the brushes and brooms, which are his specialty.

This is the fifth loan that will be granted to this client, who has shown himself to be responsible in paying back his obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Paulino trabaja en su domicilio ya que en el mismo está instalado su pequeño taller de Carpintería, un taller rudimentario que funciona hace mas de cinco años y es él único sustento de la familia. Su familia está compuesta por él y su esposa, sus hijos ya no viven con ellos. En el taller, Paulino fabrica cepillos, escobillones y otros productos que son demandados en la zona por su bajo precio y calidad. Dado el tipo de trabajo y los productos que elabora Paulino, su competencia no es elevada ya que en la zona es el único que realiza este tipo de trabajos. Paralelamente también efectúa trabajos a domicilio para el mantenimiento y arreglo de muebles. El precio de la materia prima para el taller varia de acuerdo al tipo de madera que se compre o también de acuerdo a la calidad que demanden los clientes, la presente solicitud es también para la adquisición de productos plásticos, que necesita para la elaboración de los cepillos y escobillones, productos que son su especialidad. Este es el quinto préstamo que se le otorga al cliente, tiempo en el cual demostró ser una persona responsable en cuanto al pago de sus cuotas.
loan_use: To buy raw materials (wood and plastic) for making brushes and brooms

description: Zabita is a 32 year old widow with two children. After her husband died, she was left alone with two children to look after. During this time, she suffered a lot and had no choice but to start a very small retail trade business. Income from turnover of such a tiny capital, of course, isn't enough to provide her children with  basic necessities.Therefore, Zabita has applied for  a $500 loan from the Normicro Saatl branch. This amount would be quite enough to provide a monthly income to support Zabita's family.
loan_use: To increase variety of business

description:
Mrs. Ana Román is 41 years old, has been married since the age of 25 to Mr. Saturnino Domínguez who is 47 years old and who works as a bricklayer in the construction industry. They have three sons of 22, 19 and 17 years old, the oldest of whom works in their parents store and the younger two are students.

Doña Ana is an entrepreneur, and is the owner of a business selling drinks, which she began six years ago with small savings thanks to sacrifices and dedications from both sides that were necessary to open the store. Thanks to this hard work and concessions it is one of the most frequented shops in the area.

Today they are interested in making a venture into the traveling sales of motorcycle parts in addition to selling drinks. Because the construction work her husband is involved in does not bring him much work, this expansion will enable them to have greater profits and provide a better education for her sons. This is the motive behind her request for a loan of $1000 to purchase motorcycle parts to sell such as crowns, chains, fixed wheels and keys.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Ana Román de 41 años de edad, está casada hace 25 años con el Sr. Saturnino Domínguez de 47 años de edad, de profesión albañil (obrero en obras de construcción). El matrimonio tiene 3 hijos de 22, 19 y 17 años respectivamente, de los cuales el mayor trabaja en el negocio a sus padres y las 2 menores se encuentran estudiando. Doña Ana es una mujer emprendedora, actualmente es propietaria de una casa de bebidas, que se había iniciado hace 6 años con un pequeño ahorro que gracias al sacrificio y dedicación de ambos fueron juntando para poder emprender su negocio, gracias a esto es uno de los más concurridos de la zona Hoy día están interesados en incursionarse, además de su venta de bebidas en venta ambulante de repuestos para motocicleta; ya que las obras de construcción escasean y su marido no tiene mucho trabajo; de este modo generar más ingresos económicos para la familia y bridarles una mejor educación a sus hijos. Por este motivo están solicitando el préstamo de $1000 para comprar repuestos para la venta tales como corona, cadena, piñón y pistón para motocicletas.
loan_use: To purchase motorcycle parts such as crowns, chains, fixed wheels and keys

description:
Rita has had 7 children, 6 girls and 1 boy. She now lives with her husband and 3 children ( girls), and wishes to be able to make her children go to school and "become professionals". She, as well, states that she would like to finish high school. In fact, she mentioned she would try to get herself enrolled in the local school within the next few days, as this is a long-time aspiration of hers! (She failed school when she was in 8th grade, and would need to start this grade all over again.)

Luisa presently sells some $45 worth of personal home products a week. They are normally ordered via catalog, so she doesn\'t have to have a large inventory, but does have to manage a credit portfolio. Normally she can\'t buy more product than what she\'s collected, so her cash flow is limited to precisely the amount she sells, generally speaking. With the added cash from the loan, she expects to be able to increase her earnings some 3 times her actual figures.
loan_use: Buy additional products to sell

description: Vidamat lives in Yenikand village in the Salyan region. He is married and has 3 children. This 36-year-old man has 8 years of experience in vine-growing. \r\nHe needs a loan of $1200 to buy pesticides and fertilizer for improving his business.
loan_use: To purchase  pesticides and fertilizer

description: Amiraslan N. is 27-year-old farmer who keeps a sheep herd and lives with his wife and two children in the southern part of Azerbaijan, in the Saatli region. Amiraslan is an internally displaced person who fled to Saatli from Nagorniy Karabakh during the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993. He has kept a sheep herd since 2001. From the money he saved, he purchased his first five sheep. He sells mutton to the local and capital bazaar traders. Amiraslan does not have a bachelor degree and his family was too poor too allow him finish high school. Amiraslan started to help his father when he was fifteen. Currently, selling mutton is the only source of revenue in their family. The mutton is in high demand all across Azerbaijan and people eat meat at home and in the cafes. He applied for $1000 USD to purchase 15-16 sheep for estimated cost of $60-70 USD each.
loan_use: To enlarge his sheep herd

description: Asiasiga is 42 years of age and has 8 children. She is known for being an excellent  tailor and makes all the uniforms for the school and the village church choirs uniforms. She started her business with a loan of $750ST and is now on her 4th loan of $1250ST.  The loans have been used to expand her business, to purchase a new sewing machine and to help pay her kids' school fees. She is very happy to continue on this program and is looking forward to receiving another loan so that she can improve her house.
loan_use: Business expansion and education

description:
Mrs. Pham Thi S., 57 years old, currently lives with her husband and 5 children at Hung Nguyen district of Nghe An province. Of her 5 children, only two are going to school, while one is disable. To be able to make ends meet, Mrs. S. has to do all sorts of works, ranging from farming, loaning thresher and harrow machine service, to fish-farming. Though very busy with all these jobs, she still finds time to get involve in welfare works. Currently, she is the chairman of the women association as well as the head of district 17, branch 6 of the TYM Fund. Mrs. S. has had a long history of loaning money to raise pigs but the recent livestock and poultry epidemic diseases have forced her to change to rent out room for weddings. On average, each month she earns a profit of $75 from this service. Now, she is asking to borrow $250 more to buy tables, chairs, bowls and chopsticks for the service usages.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh Hoai Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Năm nay 47 tuổi, chị Phạm Thị S. sống cùng chồng và 5 người con tại huyện Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. Trong số 5 người con của chị thì hai còn đang đi học, một bị tàn tật. Để có thu nhập nuôi sống gia đình chị S. đã làm đủ loại công việc: làm ruộng, dịch vụ máy tuốt lúa, máy bừa, ao cá. Mặc dù bận rộn vất vả làm kinh tế nhưng chị cũng là người rất tích cực tham gia công tác xã hội. Chị hiện vừa đảm nhận công việc của một chi hội trưởng phụ nữ thôn vừa là cụm trưởng cụm 17, chi nhánh 6 Quỹ Tình thương. Đã có một thời gian dài vay vốn chăn nuôi lợn nhưng hiện nay khi xuất hiện dịch bệnh ở gia súc, gia cầm chị đã chuyển sang dịch vụ cho thuê phông rạp làm đám cưới. Trung bình một tháng chị thu lãi khoảng 75 USD từ dịch vụ này. Hiện nay chị đang xin vay thêm 250 USD để mua thêm bàn ghế, bát đũa nhằm phát triển dịch vụ của mình.
loan_use: buy tables, chairs, bowls and chopsticks for hire

description:
Born in 1971 in Gapé, Togo, Mrs. Adjo B. is a seamstress. Married to a farmer who has difficulty supporting the family, she manages daily to come up with her share of financial input for their family’s needs.

Adjo is illiterate since she lacked the financial means to attend school. Instead, she became an apprentice. At the end of her apprenticeship and in view of her rather difficult situation, she has been obliged to rent a sewing machine to use in order to practice her trade.

With all this in mind, Adjo is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 which she plans to use to buy a sewing machine and set up a workshop where she can do her work in proper fashion. This will allow her to improve her socio-economic condition and live life more fully.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née en 1971 à Gapé, Madame B. Adjo est couturière. Mariée à un cultivateur qui arrive difficilement à supporter la famille, elle se débrouille quotidiennement pour supporter les charges du ménage.

C’est une femme analphabète parce qu’elle n’a pas eu les moyens d’aller à l’école. A la fin de son apprentissage, compte tenu de sa situation difficile, elle se voit obliger de louer une machine à coudre afin d’exercer son métier.

\r\nVu les difficultés qu’elle endure, elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 afin de se doter des machines à coudre et aménager son atelier de couture pour exercer pleinement ses activités. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettrait d’améliorer ses conditions de vie socio économiques.
loan_use: buying a sewing machine and setting up a workshop

description:
TRANSLATED BY MATT FLANNERY

50 years old, Mrs A. Aku is a married, mother of five (5) children and has under her care three (3) other people. Her principal business activity is sale of paraffin oil in her locality. This activity gets enough incomes to her and allows her to contribute for a great part to the loads of the household.

Today, a very strong request for products of general food is felt and Mrs. A. Aku seized the occasion to also sell food in addition to oil sales. But she needs enough money to reinforce the activity. It is regularly in out-of-stock condition, and the customers are obliged to go elsewhere to make their purchases. To cure that and to satisfy her customers effectively, she requests a loan of $500 which will be used by her for the purchase and the sale of the products of general food.

ORIGINAL FRENCH

Agée de 50 ans, Madame A. Aku est mariée, mère de cinq (5) enfants et a à sa charge trois (3) autres personnes. Elle a comme activité principale la vente de pétrole lampant dans sa localité. Cette activité lui procure assez de revenus et lui permet de contribuer pour une grande part aux charges du ménage. Aujourd’hui, une demande très forte de produits d’alimentation générale se fait sentir et Mme A. Aku a saisi l’occasion pour associer ce petit commerce à sa vente de pétrole. Mais elle a besoin d’assez d’argent pour renforcer l’activité. Elle est régulièrement en rupture de stock, et les clients sont obligés de se rendre ailleurs pour faire leurs achats. Pour remédier à cela et satisfaire efficacement sa clientèle, elle sollicite un crédit de $500 qui lui servira de fonds de commerce pour l’achat et la vente des produits d’alimentation générale.
loan_use: Achat et  vente des produits d’alimentation générale.

description:
Mrs. Ami K. was born in 1977 in Tsévié, a territory of Zio. She is married and mother to four children. Her husband is a farmer in the town of Yoto and contributes rarely to the costs of the household. Mrs. K. runs a restaurant that she has managed for three years. Very enterprising, she is building her small business and delivers quality service to a client base which grows larger and larger. Honest and hardworking, she capably managed and promptly repaid the two previous loans she received. Today she seeks a loan of $850, which will allow her to buy grains to strengthen her sales of pasta and other foods. She will also be able to improve her revenues and sustain the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Erin Spencer, Kiva volunteer.

Madame K. Ami est née en 1977 à Tsévié (Préfecture du Zio). Elle est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. Son mari est cultivateur dans la préfecture de Yoto et contribue rarement aux charges du ménage. Madame K. Ami gère un restaurant qu’elle tient depuis 3 ans. Très entreprenante, elle développe sa petite activité et rend un service de qualité à sa clientèle qui devient de plus en plus grande. Honnête et rigoureuse, elle a su gérer et rembourser promptement les deux précédents crédits qu’elle avait obtenus. Elle sollicite ce jour un crédit de $850 qui lui servira à acheter des céréales en vue de renforcer ses activité de vente de boule de pâte et autres. Elle pourra ainsi augmenter ses revenus et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
loan_use: Buying grains to strengthen the sales of pasta and other foods at her restaurant.

description:
Aged 38, Mrs. Kossiwa A. is married and the mother of four children. Abandoning her studies at a very young age, she took up the business of traditional cloth that she acquired from her uncle’s wife. This business is very successful and the profit enables her to meet some of her family’s needs. Gifted with a good sense of business management, she had no trouble repaying her first loan. To increase the size of her business she is asking for a loan of $500 to enable her to buy from wholesalers at low cost. This will make her business more profitable and ensure she can send her children to school.

Agée de 38 ans, Madame A. Kossiwa est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Abandonnant ses études très tôt, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce des tissus pagnes qu’elle a acquis chez la femme de son oncle. Cette activité lui réussit bien et lui procure de bénéfice afin de satisfaire certains besoins de sa famille. Douée d’une bonne gestion de ses activités elle a su rembourser son premier crédit sans difficulté. Pour agrandir la taille de son commerce elle sollicite un crédit de $500 pour pouvoir acheter chez les grossistes à bas prix afin de plus rentabiliser son commerce et assurer la scolarisation de ses enfants.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.
loan_use: Sale of traditional cloth

description: Zibeyda is a mother of one child. She is a widow and lives with her child in the Khachmaz region, in Hulovlu village.  She has retailed  bedclothes and glassware for 15 years. Now she needs a loan of $1,000 to to increase her inventory and to get more income.
loan_use: To increase inventory

description: Musa M. L. is thirty one years old and married with two children.  He sells plastic sandals at the center of Magburaka town in Sierra Leone and his business is the sole source of income for his family.  Musa also takes care of his younger sisters and brothers.  His initial capital earned him a meager profit.  With his previous loan, he was able to increase his stock and is requesting a loan of $170 for the same purpose.
loan_use: Increase his profit by purchasing more stock for selling.

description:
José Leobardo has been in the business of selling roasted chickens and Mexican antojitos for over 2 years. It's a family business that my son and I work in, and we are concerned that our sales will decrease during the cold season, since the location is not set up for cold. We are requesting a loan of $1200 to prepare the location for cold.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. José Leobardo tiene mas de 2 años en el negocio de ventas de pollos asados y antojitos Mexicanos. Es el negocio de la familia en el trabajamos dos de mis hijo y yo, nos esta preocupando que bajen nuestras ventas en tiempo de frió ya que el local no esta acondicionado para la temporada de frió. Solicitamos un préstamo de $1,200.00 dlls para acondicionar el local.
loan_use: Set up location for cold season

description:
Mrs Phạm Thị Mỹ is 30 years old. She and her family live in Hưng Tây, in the province of Nghệ An. She and her husband have a rice husking business for retails. They also breed poultry and calves using the free land around their house. They have 3 young children and their dream is to be able to provide them a good education. This is the main motivation factor for Mrs Mỹ and her husband. They are requesting a loan of 625 USD which will be invested in the rice husking business and buy more breeding ducks.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Phạm Thị Mỹ năm nay ngoài 30 tuổi. Chị cùng gia đình đang sinh sống tại xã Hưng Tây, Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. Ngoài kinh doanh xay xát gạo, chị Mỹ và chồng vẫn chăn nuôi vịt và bò để tận dụng khoảng đất trống quanh nhà. Hiện gia đình chị có 3 đứa con nhỏ nên với nguyện vọng cho lo cho các con đầy đủ, vợ chồng chị lúc nào cũng chăm chỉ làm ăn. Xin vay mức 625 USD, anh chị đã thống nhất đầu tư một phần vào việc xay xát gạo tại nhà, một phần dùng để mua vịt chăn nuôi.
loan_use: buy rough rice, husked and sell it

description:
Bright K. is a business man of 29 who deals in a variety of merchandise such as baby toys, necklaces, puff holders, and pocket mirrors, among others. He sells his merchandise on both retail and wholesale basis and his business is located in the city center.

Bright is looking after three dependant children, girls aged 13 and 15 and one boy of nine years. He has been able to meet the needs of the children using the income from his business but unfortunately this leaves him with almost no savings available as capital for investment.

Bright is requesting a loan of US$ 1,200 to expand his business. When this is achieved, he believes he will be able to save money to buy a plot of land where he can construct a house. This loan will be repaid in 6 months.
loan_use: expand his wholesale/retail business

description: Sewing since her mid thirties, Silia enjoys it very much now that she is 50.  It is their source of income to provide for family as well as pay for her children’s education.  Clothes are sewn in any order with any pattern and any style whether it be for men, women, or children.  Schools also recommend her to sew students’ uniforms.  In April, 2007 she became a part of SPBD and appreciates the help the program has given her.  Because she enjoys sewing, she hopes to have a flea market stall in the near future.
loan_use: To purchase materials and sewing equipment

description: Mrs. Ha and her husband were born in 1953. There are 11 members in the family that include: 2 children, 7 working children, and 2 grandsons. Mrs. Ha has a small grocery store at the front of the home but the goods are of poor quality and limited various. She really needs a loan of $75 to run the grocery store. Mrs. Ha will repay the loan monthly.
loan_use: Buy inventory for grocery store.

description:
Genoveva, from Apodaca in Nuevo León, is an entrepreneurial and enthusiastic woman. As her husband’s income is insufficient to cover the basic needs of the family, she started her business selling cosmetics, in order to help with the household expenses. In association with a neighbor, they have managed to make this business grow, little by little. Genoveva is married and has two children who are studying, so she makes a greater effort every day, so that they are able to finish school and have a better future.

In order for her her business to continue growing and to meet all the orders she gets, Genoveva needs a $275 loan, that she has committed to repaying in five months. You can help improve this family’s life and contribute to their children continuing their studies. Thanks for your trust and help.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Genoveva, originaria de la localidad de Apodaca en Nuevo León, es una mujer emprendedora y entusiasta. Su esposo recibe un ingreso insuficiente para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia por lo que, para poder ayudar con los gastos del hogar, ella inició su negocio de venta de cosméticos. Asociándose con una vecina, poco a poco han hecho crecer este negocio. Genoveva está casada, tiene dos hijos que se encuentran estudiando, y se esfuerza más cada día para que ellos puedan culminar sus estudios y tener un mejor futuro. Para continuar creciendo con su negocio y poder surtir todos los pedidos que recibe, Genoveva necesita un préstamo de $275 dólares, que se compromete a regresar en 5 meses. Tú puedes ayudar a mejorar la vida de esta familia y contribuir a que sus hijos continúen estudiando. Gracias por tu confianza y ayuda.
loan_use: Purchase of merchandise

description:
Maria Elena is married and she has three children, they have motivated her to continue with the family business. It’s a furniture store that has been in the family for three generations. The business was going through some difficult times, but thanks to the good work that she realizes she has managed to keep the furniture store running. Now she wants to increase the variety of furniture that she sells; for this reason she is requesting a loan of $750 that will help to keep her business growing.

Maria is a very responsible woman and she promises to repay the loan in 6 months. The desire to see her daughters finish their studies and have a better future has motivated her to do better everyday. Now with your help she will be able to achieve it. Thanks for the trust and support that you offer them.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Elena es casada y tiene tres hijos, ellos la han motivado para continuar con el negocio familiar, es una mueblería que tiene ya tres generaciones, pasaba por épocas difíciles pero gracias al buen trabajo que realiza ha logrado sacar adelante la mueblería y ahora desea incrementar la variedad de muebles que comercializa para lo que está solicitando un préstamo de $ 750 dólares, con lo que podrá continuar creciendo con su negocio.

Maria es una mujer muy responsable y se compromete regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. El deseo de que sus hijas puedan culminar sus estudios y tener un mejor futuro la motivan a mejorar cada día y ahora con tu ayuda podrá lograrlo, muchas gracias por la confianza y apoyo que les brindas.
loan_use: Buy merchandise

description:
TRANSLATED BY MATT FLANNERY

Severiana is a hard worker and person in charge, is married and has two daughters. Her husband receives a very low wage and they could not handle all the expenses of his family. For that reason, she saw it necessary to also enter the family business. Severiana began to sell candies and refreshments in their house. This has been a fundamental piece in the growth of this business, together have managed to advance it.

At this moment Severiana is asking for a loan of $ 925 dollars that she will use in the extension of his business to be able to offer a better service to it's clients and to improve the aspect of his store, as well as to incorporate the rent of video game machines. She promises to give back this amount in 6 months. She thanks for much the confidence and aid that you offer her.

ORIGINAL SPANISH

Severiana es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, está casada y tiene dos hijas, su esposo recibía un salario muy bajo y no podían solventar todos los gastos de su familia, ante la necesidad de un ingreso extra Severiana comenzó a vender dulces y refrescos en su casa, después fue incorporando la venta de productos de abarrotes y sus ventas mejoraron considerablemente, la unión familiar ha sido una pieza fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio, juntos han logrado sacarlo adelante.

En este momento Severiana está solicitando un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que empleará en la ampliación de su negocio para poder ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes y mejorar el aspecto de su tienda, así como también para incorporar la renta de máquinas de videojuegos, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Decídete a apoyar a Severiana, ella agradece mucho la confianza y ayuda que le brindas.
loan_use: Remodelación

description:
MARIA is 23 years old and has 3 children. Her husband works in the corn fields. She is an artisan and makes clothing, table clothes and napkins. Maria belongs to the group Escuela 4 along with Mrs. Antonia Hernandez L. (artisan) and Mrs. Petrona L. L. (artisan). Since all of them make embroideries, they would like to invest in the purchase of more fabric, embroidery floss and wood for their looms. They will divide what they buy between them and each one will go out to the street and sell their merchandise to the tourists in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIA ,tiene 23 años , 3 hijos , su esposo trabaja en el campo en la cosecha del maíz, Ella se dedica a la artesanía confeccionando prendas de vestir, manteles, servilletas. Pertenece al grupo Escuela 4 junto con doña Antonia Hernández López (artesana) y doña Petrona López López (artesana). Como todas ellas se dedican a la confección de prendas artesanales bordadas quieren invertir en sus negocios con el préstamo comprando telas al por mayor, hilos de bordar y maderas para confeccionar sus telares posteriormente se repartirán entre ellas lo comprado y cada una saldrá a vender en forma individual a las calles de la ciudad a los turistas de la zona.
loan_use: ARTESANA

description:
Vidal del Carmen has been preparing tamales for the past 30 years. This is a typical dish of the region where she lives. She prepares them every evening and she sells them at her house. She is 63 years old and although her children want to support her economically, she feels strong and she stills wants to work. For this reason she will use the loan to buy kitchen accessories and wholesale corn to continue with this activity that helped her keep her family going and that is part of her life. Vidal of Carmen is a part of a group called “Delicias 4”.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Vidal del Carmense ha dedicado por más de 30 años hacer tamales, comida típica de su región que prepara todas las tardes y a la puerta de su casa los exhibe. Ella tiene 63 años y aunque sus hijos la quieren apoyar económicamente ella se siente fuerte y con muchas ganas de trabajar, por ello con su préstamo invertirá en accesorios de cocina, maíz al por mayor para continuar con esta actividad que le ayudo a sacar adelante a su familia y que forma parte de su vida. Vidal del Carmen forma parte del grupo llamado Delicias 4.
loan_use: Buy kitchen accessories and wholesale corn.

description: Chude is a 29-year-old resident of the Buguruni area in Ilala District, Dar Es Salaam region. Chude operates a 60-seat video hall in the Bugururni area, a business he has been doing for the past six years. He is grateful to this business; with the profits, he has been able to construct a house, send his kids to school, and support his family. Chude wants to make renovations to install up-to-date structures in the hall. His dream is to turn the hall into a modern theatre. He is in need of USD 550 to help him accomplish his mission.
loan_use: Expand his video hall

description:
John is thirty-nine years old, and is married with two boys who are in classes three and two. His wife stays at home but is currently training to be a hair dresser. She wants to open a salon so that she can supplement on her husband’s income, and and most important ly, to stay busy. John says, "An idle mind is the devil’s workshop."

As a side business to his work as a builder, John sells firewood to some business people in Malaba. He sells it to milk sellers who use it to pasteurize their milk; fish mongers who deep-fry the fish in their canteens; and sometimes to café owners who use firewood, which is the cheapest source of fuel. John gets his stock of firewood from different places within the district. He usually gets the waste from loggers, gathers the scraps of wood until they fillsa truck, and transports the wood to Malaba. John has been able to provide one the cheapest source of cooking energy to the community and also helps minimize waste from trees cut down for lumber.

Currently, Johns does not own a store, but uses his compound as the site for displaying his product. The price he charges for the wood is based on the quantity that his customer buys. He also offers a discount to those customers that come to get the firewood themselves. He does this to motivate customers to come get the wood rather than delivering it to them. He employs a young man who delivers the wood to his loyal customers.

With a loan from PEMCI, John plans to increase his stock by making more trips to get wood. He says that the demand is there and his problem is being able to supply enough firewood.
loan_use: Improve his firewood business

description:
Elias is originally from Sabinas in Nuevo Leon, three years ago he became unemployed and, faced with the difficulty of finding new work, he decided to open up his own business selling sweets and novelty items for children. With this be able to obtain the basic necessities for his family. Elias is married and has two small children. He began by selling very few products but thanks to his hard work he was able to sell his wares to other shops and his sales have increased considerably, recently he has been able to obtain a truck in order to increase the distribution of his products. His wife also helps out with the business.

At this moment, Elias needs a loan of $925 dollars that will be dedicated to the purchase of merchandise in order to cover his clients’ demands and continue to grow as he has been. He promises to payback this money within 6 months. Become a part of the development of this business and help this family, they sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva volunteer.

Elías es originario de la localidad de Sabinas en Nuevo León, hace tres años quedó desempleado y ante la dificultad para conseguir un nuevo trabajo emprendió su propio negocio con la venta de dulces y novedades para niños, y así obtener los recursos necesarios para su familia, él está casado y tiene dos pequeños hijos. Comenzó vendiendo muy pocos productos pero gracias al buen trabajo que realiza ahora surte a varias tiendas y sus ventas se han incrementado considerablemente, últimamente ha adquirido una camioneta para aumentar la distribución de sus productos y su esposa también le ayuda en el negocio.

En estos momentos Elías necesita un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y continuar creciendo como hasta ahora, él promete regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Forma parte del desarrollo de este negocio y decídete a apoyar a esta familia, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.
loan_use: Purchase of Merchandise

description: Mrs. C. Sophary was married in 1989 and has 4 children, 2 sons and 2 daughters. She started her business of buying and reselling silk products in 2003. In addition, she is also in the business of selling grocery items from her home.  Her husband is a teacher at High School in the village. All of their children are studying in high school and primary school. \r\n\r\nShe has borrowed money from MAXIMA  five times already. Now she is asking for a loan of $1,000. She will use this loan to purchase finished silk products for her stock.
loan_use: Purchasing finished silk products for her stock.

description: Mrs. S. Phally was married in 1985 and has 5 children, 1 son and 4 daughters. Since 2006, she has been in the business of weaving scarves by using semi-automatic machines at home. She learned from her sister. She owns one machine and now wishes to purchase another semi-automatic machine to expand her business in scarf production. Her husband is a brick construction contractor in the Kean Svay district.\r\n\r\nShe is asking for a loan from MAXIMA for the first time in the amount of $1,200. She will use this loan to purchase another semi-automatic machine to expand her scarf production and buy cotton fabric.
loan_use: Purchasing one more scarf semi-automatic machine and cotton fabric.

description:
Savri P. has been in the trade business for 13 years. She is married with 3 children and has a community college diploma. She started out by selling children’s clothing, with assets worth about $50. Gradually she moved on to selling men’s clothing. After getting her first loan, Savri increased the variety of her inventory (she added men’s sportswear), secured a better selling location and had her son also join the business to help out. Today her assets are worth twice what they were initially. Savri plans to increase her sales using the new loan.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer.

Парпиева Саври вот уже 13лет занимается торговлей. Замужем, имеет троих детей, образование среднее специальное. Начала свою деятельность с продажи детской одежды, тогда её активы составляли 50$. Постепенно она перешла на продажу мужской одежды. После получения займа она увеличила ассортимент товара (добавила мужскую спортивную одежду), приобрела новое более лучшее место для торговли, также сын начал помогать своей матери в торговле. Сейчас её активы увеличились в два раза больше. В дальнейшем планирует увеличить товарооборот
loan_use: to increase sales/turnover

description:
Ayubdjon H. is 27 yrs old, married and has a college diploma. He has been selling food since childhood because his father was not able to support the family due to frequent illnesses. He used to work/sell together with his sister, working on busy city streets with no fixed location. This resulted in frequent warnings and harassment from local authorities concerned about public order in central city streets. Such disruptions greatly affected his earnings, down to the basic ability to earn enough to feed himself and his family.

After learning about the collateral-free credit program at MLF MicroInvest he became a member in 2002 and obtained a loan for $100. Gradually he increased the variety of his offerings and most importantly was able to obtain a permanent trading stall at the central city market. All this showed his dedication to the MicroInvest program and his discipline. In the future, he plans to use the loans to move into wholesale trade.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva volunteer.

Хакимов Аюбджон – 27 лет ,женат образование среднее. С детства занимается торговлей продуктами питания, поскольку его отец не в силах обеспечить семью материально из-за частой болезни. Торговал со своей сестрой в многолюдных улицах без постоянного место деятельности и постоянных натисков местных органов по порядке центральных улиц, что сильно влияло зарабатывать хотя бы на хлеб. Узнав о программе без залогового кредитования для микро-предпринимателей в МЗФ «Микроинвест» Аюбджон без сомнения стал кредитоваться с 2002-го года с активами на 100$. Постепенно он увеличил свой ассортимент товара, добавил продукты питания и кроме всего приобрел постоянную точку деятельности в центральном рынке города, что говорит о его дисциплинированности перед программой. В будущем планирует перейти на оптовую продажу.
loan_use: To move into wholesale trade

description:
Faith is a reliable client of LAPO who started her business in the year 2003. She hopes to be granted a loan of US$ 400 to enable her to expand her business and buy more provisions & food items for resale to her community.

Faith O. is 28 years old, married, and mother of 5 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been a LAPO client for 2 years.
loan_use: To buy more provisions & food items for resale

description:
Daniel has a little garage for vehicle paint jobs. He works with his oldest son who is fourteen years old. His wife is a travelling saleswoman of cosmetics. These are their main incomes, which they use to raise their four children. They live in the town Villa Tunari in the city of El Alto.

The loan will be used to purchase raw materials (paint and putty) to stock his small garage. This is his first loan with IMPRO, but the evaluation that he completed qualifies him to receive a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Daniel tiene su pequeño taller de Chapería y pintado de Vehículos, trabaja con su hijo mayor de 14 años, la esposa es comerciante ambulante de cosméticos; estos son sus ingresos principales con los que cubren la manutención de sus 4 hijos, viven en la zona Villa Tunari de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinara para comprar materia prima (Pintura, masilla), de esa forma fortalecerá tu pequeño taller.

Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobarle el prestamos.
loan_use: To purchase raw materials

description:
Señora Micaela belongs to the Ricardo Palma Community Bank in the District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is 69 years old, and is the mother of 6 children. She was widowed 22 years ago, and since then she had be a breadwinner for her children. Señora Micaela and her children had to work together and with an initial loan of 300 Sol (US$94 approx) she decided to dedicate herself to sewing bedcovers and selling them in the settlements where she is placed well and is paid daily (5 Sol on average). With the recent loan granted to her by Manuala Ramos in the sum of 800 Sol. (US$254 approx.) she will buy 20 kilos of plain fabric, 10 kilos of decorative fabric, 3 boxes of thread and oil to maintain her sewing machine. Micaela feels very happy that, in addition to having a means to help her family, she can deliver her product to women who do not have enough money to pay cash, in this way she leaves her product to be paid "a pacos" (by credit). Now, with the help of her children, she takes care of this business.

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Micaela pertenece al Banco Comunal Ricardo Palma, del Distrito D. Calleria, Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 69 años, y es madre D. 6 hijos. Hace 22 años enviudó, desD. entonces tuvo que sacar adelante a sus hijos. La señora Micaela y sus hijos tuvieron que trabajar juntos y con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 (US$ 94.00 aprox.) deciD. dedicarse a coser cubrecamas y venderlas en los asentamientos humanos donD. coloca el bien y le pagan en forma diaria (S/.5.00 nuevos soles promedio). Con el reciente préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos D. S/. 800.00 (US$ 254.00 aprox.) comprará 20 kilos D. tela, 10 kilos D. tela para adorno, 3 cajas D. hilos y aceite para dar mantenimiento a su maquina D. cocer. Micaela se siente muy contenta, además D. tener un ingreso para alimentar a su familia, pueD. entregar su producto a mujeres que no disponen del dinero suficiente para pagar al contado, es así que deja su producto para ser pagado D. a pocos (crédito). Ahora conjuntamente con sus hijos atienden este negocio.
loan_use: Purchase of fabrics and oils. Maintenance of machinery.

description: Mr. Tebris is a low income vulnerable person. He is 29, married with three children and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.\r\nTebris has own mini market and his business goes good enough. But this summer when electicity was broken for some while, the ice cream fridge stoped and all ice creams went bad. That day Tebris lost $200. And he decided to apply for $500 to Normicro Saatli branch to buy compact power generator, which costs $400. And $100 will be spend to repair ice cream refrigerator.
loan_use: To increase variety of goods

description: Mrs. Docas E. is 51 years old, married, and a mother of six.  She sells beads and decorating materials.  She also provides decorating services at special occasions such as weddings and marriage ceremonies.  She started her business in 1997.  She has the intention of increasing the size of her business with a loan of US $625.  She is the secretary of her union (LAPO).
loan_use: To buy more beads and decorating materials

description:
Nigarkhanum T. was born in 1953. She was born and lives in the town of Aksu. Nigarkhanum is a widowed mother of 4 children. When her husband died, her family lived through some hard times. Nigarkhanum was able to recover by taking a $300 loan from Aksu branch of Normicro. She used the money to start selling fruits and vegetables on the central market. Now, Nigarkhanum wants to take another loan to increase the variety of goods sold. Nigarkhanum expresses her gratitude to all of you, who consider helping her and others.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Тарвердиева Нигарханум 1953 года рождения.Родилась и проживает в городе Аксу. Имеет четверо детей, вдова. Когда умер муж семье стало тяжело.Взяла в кредит из Нормикро Аксуниского филиала 300$ .На центральном рынке начала заниматься торговли фруктами и овощами.Теперь она хочеть взять еще кредит чтобы, купить больше товаров.Нигарханум благодарна тем людям который ей помогает.
loan_use: To increase the variety of goods sold

description: Vasily is a hard-working entrepreneur from the Ivano-Frankovsk region in Ukraine. He owns a small market vending business where he sells house shoes and robes at this busy locale. Vasily decided to start his own business after he was unable to find other work. Now, two years later, he has about $2000 invested in inventory and he makes about $700 a month profit. In addition to his business, Vasily also works part time as a tractor driver in the small village where he lives, which enables him to earn a little more income. Vasily has requested a loan of $800 to purchase some new inventory for his business. The extra capital will allow him to buy 120 pairs of house shoes and 100 new robes. Vasily will use profits from his business to improve his standard of living and do some remodeling to his home.
loan_use: To purchase inventory

description: Mrs. Doris Aghourenren is 38 years old. She lives in a semi-urban area of Benin City, Edo, Nigeria, where she sells drinks, provisions and fried meat to people. She is married and the mother of 6 children. She is a dedicated client of LAPO. According to her, if given the sum of $550, her business will be able to expand and she will be able to buy more provisions, drinks and meat for sale. She has been in business since 2004.
loan_use: To buy more provisions, drinks & meat

description:
Freddy produces cow milk that he sells to PIL Andina (a milk industrial plant). He also does work as a bricklayer and mason in his community. By these two means, he earns an income that he uses to take care of his family, which includes his wife and four year-old son. They live in the town of Chahuira-Pampa located two and a half hours from the city of La Paz.

Freddy will use the loan to buy a milk cow of a superior breed to increase the production of milk. It is his first loan with IMPRO and the evaluation done for him qualifies him to receive a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Freddy, es productor de leche de vaca que comercializa a Pil Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche), también se dedica a trabajos de albañilería en la comunidad, logrando así ingresos con los que mantiene a su familia que consta de su esposa un hijo de 4 años. Vive en la Comunidad de Chahuira-Pampa ubicada a dos horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca lechera de raza mejorada para incrementar la producción de leche. Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo
loan_use: Purchase a milk cow.

description: Mrs. I. Patience is a 47-year-old woman who sells wholesales & retail drinks to people in her environment in Nigeria. She is proud of her business & promises to effectively use the $1175 loan. She is from Benin City of Edo State, married with 6 children. She has been in business since 2003. She is a leader of her union.
loan_use: To buy more drinks

description:
Dionisia is 20 years old, three children and is married to a field worker. She is an artisan who makes blouses, tapestry, pillows, wallets and purses. She takes these to be sold at the local artisans house. Some times, she also goes to a nearby town to sell as well. She belongs to the group Espina 3, togehter with doña Marcela Hernández Hernández (artisan). They will invest this credit to purchase threads and fabric for embroidering.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

DIONISIA, tiene 20 tres hijos, es casada y su esposo trabaja en el campo, ella es artesana hace blusas, tapetes, cojines, monederos y bolsas y los lleva a vender a la casa de las artesanías de su localidad y otras veces al pueblo mas cercano. Pertenece al grupo Espina 3 junto con doña Marcela Hernández Hernández (artesana).Con el préstamo esperan invertirlo en la compra de telas e hilos de bordar
loan_use: Purchase threads and fabric for embroidering.

description:
Ms. Albina is 32 years old, attended school up to 9th grade, is the single mother of a girl and is expecting a second child. She lives is the Alto Trujillo Projects in the Florencia de Mora district of the Trujillo province. Ms. Albina started her business with a loan of approximately $96 she obtained from “Las Conquistadoras” Communal Bank. With that loan she bought fruits and vegetables to sell at the market of the Victor Larco district at the Trujillo province. With her next loan, she incorporated little outdoor coal stoves (“briquetas encendidas”) to her sales, which yielded a higher income. However, due to her pregnancy, she was forced to stop selling them, as the emanated smoke constituted a health risk. With the latest loan of approximately $286, given by Manuela Ramos, she bought corn and all kinds of produce to sell at a regular stand she now has in that same market. Ms. Albina dreams about traveling to the Sierra, to her native village of Cuyuchugo, in order to bring potatoes and other products to sell in bulk. She also wants to own her stand at the market. \r\n

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

\r\nLa señora Albina tiene 32 años de edad, estudió solo hasta tercer año de secundaria, es madre soltera de una niña y está en espera de otro bebé. Vive en el Asentamiento Humano Alto Trujillo del Distrito de Florencia de Mora de la Provincia de Trujillo, Departamento de La Libertad. La señora Albina inició su negocio con el préstamo de $ 96 dólares aproximadamente, que recibió del Banco Comunal “Las Conquistadoras”, con lo cual compró frutas y menestras para poner a la venta como ambulante en el mercado del distrito de Víctor Larco en la Provincia de Trujillo. Con su siguiente crédito, se dedicó también a vender briquetas encendidas (pequeñas cocinas de carbón de piedra), negocio con el que obtenía mayor ganancia, pero tuvo que dejarlo debido a su embarazo, ya que el humo que emana es perjudicial para su salud. Con el reciente préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos de $ 286 dólares aprox., compró maíz para chufla y todo tipo de menestras para vender en un espacio fijo que ahora tiene en el mismo mercado. La señora Albina sueña con viajar a la Sierra, a su pueblo natal, Cuyuchugo, para traer papa y otros productos y venderlos al por mayor. Además quiere tener un puesto en el mercado que sea propio.
loan_use: Purchase of grains and produce.

description: Eseta is a forty two year old married mother with four children. She is very good at cooking barbecued foods because she has worked in a restaurant in the town. She is now staying home and trying to start her own barbecue stand. She spent her $300 loan to buy all the needed ingredients for her business. She said that the profits she can get from her business are used to support her three children in school and provided food for the whole family. She is hoping to get another loan to make the business more profitable and help in paying her children's’ school fees. She really appreciates the help from SPBD and Kiva.
loan_use: Buying meats for the barbeque business.

description:
As a widow, Miatin has to work for her own living since all of her children are married and live with their own family. Before her husband passed away, Miatin had been selling meatball-noodle in a mobile food stall. After his husband passed away, no one could hep her to carry her food stall around. Miatin switched to a stationary food stall near the harbor. She opens her stall from 8AM to 9PM. With initial capital of 300,000 IDR (1USD~9,000 IDR), Miatin can earn a profit of 40,000 IDR daily. She used the profit to pay for her basic needs, for additional working capital and for paying the rent for her food stall of 150,000 IDR per month. With the loan from Dinari, Miatin plans to add more variety to her food stall so she can earn bigger profir and serves more customers.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Sebagai seorang janda, Miatin harus berusaha untuk menghidupi dirinya sendiri karena semua anaknya sudah menikah dan tinggal bersama pasangannya masing – masing. Sebelum suaminya meninggal, Miatin berjualan bakso dengan cara keliling di lingkungannya. Namun, setelah suaminya meninggal, tidak ada lagi yang bisa mendorong rombong yang dipakainya berjualan. Karena hal itu, Miatin beralih usaha dengan membuka usaha warung nasi di dekat pelabuhan. Miatin membuka usahanya dari pukul 8 pagi sampai pukul 9 malam. Dengan modal awal sebesar Rp. 300.000.-, Miatin bisa mendapat keuntungan Rp. 40.000.- per hari. Dengan keuntungan itu Miatin sisihkan untuk keperluan sehari – hari, menambah modal dan juga untuk membayar sewa tempat usaha sebesar Rp. 150.000.- per bulan. Dengan pinjaman dari Dinari, Miatin berencana untuk menambah jenis dagangannya sehingga ia bisa mendapat keuntungan yang lebih besar dan melayani lebih banyak pelanggan.
loan_use: To purchase raw materials and ingredients for her food stall

description: I have five children: three daughters and two sons. My husband buys vegetables from a wholesale market and then we both sell them in neighborhood market. We have yet to attain a steady income because with each passing day, our daily expenses are increasing. We hope to increase our business so that we can better our financial condition. We seek a loan of $175 to expand our vegetable-selling business.
loan_use: To expand her family's vegetable selling business

description:
Mr. I. earns a low income, which is vulnerable to the local economy. He is 32, married with three children, and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region

. He rents a barber's shop and at the end of each month pays the owner for the rent. But he sees that some of his customers are cutting their hair at another, nearby barber's shop because of its inventory.

Mr. I. is not so modern to keep competition at a high level. On the other hand, there is a school season coming up and as a rule all schoolchildren must cut their hair before going to school.

He believes that it is time to look for investment to buy new inventory immediately. He has applied for a loan of $500 to Normicro Saatli branch. After getting the loan, he plans to attract more customers and increase his daily income.
loan_use: To buy new inventory for barber shop.

description:
Herbierto is 67 years old and has been married for 41 years to his wife, Teófila, with whom he has 5 children. All of his children are grown, married, and working in various professions.

He lived in the neighboring country of Argentina for 11 years where he worked as a contruction worker until he decided to return to Paraguay. Currently he owns a large piece of land from which he cultivates tapioca, lettuce, sugar cane, and his primary product, strawberries. He also owns a small store which he runs out of his home and sells pre-cooked chickens on weekends and weeknights.

Herbierto has worked hard his whole life and has been successful in his endeavors. He is requesting a loan to pay for seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides to cultivate his strawberry crop.
loan_use: Purchase of insecticides, fertilizer, seeds, etc.

description: Mrs. Seng K., 58, and her husband, 62, work making and selling traditional medicine to people in their community. From this, they earn around $2 a day. They have 2 children, who both work at the garment factory, earning $4 a day between them. Seng K. intends to invest this $400 in buying more herbs and plants for her business.
loan_use: To purchase herbs and plants to make into natural medicine for their business

description:
Celeste Cossa Cumbula was born on May 3rd, 1961, in the city of Catembe. She is 46 years old, married. She is the mother of 5 children the oldest is 25 and the youngest is 13 years old. She was raised by her parents in the neighborhood of Catembe, and attended school until the 4th grade. Celeste married in 1980, and worked in agriculture. Due to the war, they had to seek refugee in the neighborhood of Xipamamine in the city of Maputo. She bought mangoes from Vatembe and sold them in Maputo during those years. In 1986, after the death of her mother, Celeste and her family moved back to Catembe, where she started to work in a small business selling rice, beans, peanuts, oil and other groceries from her home. She sought credit opportunities from an organization in Ponte-Catembe. This was not a good experience because the opportunity of acquiring credit was small, and members had to assume responsibility for other members’ loans in case they defaulted.

Celeste was introduced to Hluvuku through a neighbor. She requested her first loan of 10.000MT in hopes to increase her inventory. Celeste and her daughter attend to business together in order to increase the family income. In the future Celeste hopes to have her own stand and to acquire savings.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro Incassane -Catembe Cliente: Celeste Cossa Cumbula Actividade:Comércio Valor de empréstimo: 10.000,00 MT (400.00US$) Aplicacao: Compra de produtos de 1ª necessidade Início: 23/08/07 Fim: 14/12/08 Celeste Cossa Cumbula, nasceu aos 03 de maio de 1961 na Catembe, tem actualmente 46 anos de idade, casada com 5 filhos o mais velho tem 25 anos e o mais novo 13 anos, viveu e cresceu num ambiente familiar com os pais no bairro chamissava na Catembe, frequentou a escola até 4ª classe. Casou-se em 1980 e como não tinha alternativa de trabalhodedicava-se a agricultura. Devido a guerra de desestabilização tiveram que abandonar a casa e refugiar-se no bairro Xipamamine na ciadade do Maputo e no final de cada ano atravessava a Catembe para a compra de mangas e posterior revenda em Maputo. Em 1986 depóis da morte da mãe tiveram que voltar a Catembe difinitivamente e é dai que começou com pequenos negócios de venda de arroz, amendoim, feijões, óleo, etc no seu quintal. Teve o primeiro contacto com crédito com uma pequena organização sediada na Ponte-Catembe que ofereciam créditos em grupos, não tendo sido uma experiência boa porque para além dos valores cedidos serem menores tinham de assumir responsabilidade de pagar o empréstimo em casos de um dos constituintes do grupo não efectuasse o pagamento.

Conhece a Hluvuku, através de conversa com a Vizinha e dai se aproximou e solicitou o empréstimo, com este empréstimo de 10.000 MT, pretende incrementar o volume do seu negocio, adquirido mais mercadoria. Actualmente está explorando um pequeno estabelecimento emprestado, mas sendo a único no local que oferece um bom ambiente de negócio. Tem contribuido para colocar o produto mais perto do consumidor reduzindo desta forma os custos de deslocação Ela dirige pessoalmente o negócio e na sua ausença a filha é que tem tomado a conta do mesmo e com os rendimentos do negocio incrementa a renda familiar. A perspectiva futura é ter barraca própria e poupar algum dinheiro para momentos críticos do negócio.
loan_use: To increase stocks in her business

description:
Anadeli is 23 years old and has one child. In order to help her spouse out with the household costs, Anadeli sells clothes and prepares food typical to her region. She sells these items out of her mother-in-law’s house who also helps her with these sales. Anadeli belongs to the group Compañerismo 5 together with Ms. Pascuala Lopez Perez (who sells food) and Maria Luisa Caballero Silva (who also sells food). With this loan they hope to implement their businesses buying utensils for the kitchen and improve the condition of the places where they sell their food.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

ANADELI TIENE 23 AÑOS UN HIJO Y PARA APOYAR A SU ESPOSO EN EL GASTO FAMILIAR , VENDE ROPA Y PREPARA COMIDA TIPICA DE LA ZONA Y LA VENDE EN LA CASA DE SU SUEGRA QUIEN TAMBIEN LA APOYA EN LA VENTA.PERTENECE AL GRUPO COMPAÑERISMO 5 JUNTO CON DOÑA PASCUALA LOPEZ PEREZ ( VENTA DE COMIDA) Y MARIA LUISA CABALLERO SILVA (VENTA DE COMIDA). CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERAN IMPLEMENTAR SUS NEGOCIOS COMPRANDO UTENSILIOS DE COCINA Y CONDICIONAR MEJOR LOS LUGARES DONDE VENDEN SU COMIDA .
loan_use: Sale of food typical to the region

description:
Senia is the young mother of a 7 year-old girl. Her desire to improve her daughter’s quality of life has led her to do a variety of jobs. Three years ago she began a small grocery store in her house, taking advantage of the huge demand of her neighbors for basic goods. With the income that this small store generates, she is able to meet her family’s basic needs and also educate her daughter.

Due to the fact that her customers are always requesting a larger number and variety of products, Senia finds herself in the situation of needing to increase her stock so that she can provide good service to her customers. In order to do this, Senia is requesting a loan of S/. 600.00, which she is committed to repaying over a period of 6 months. Senia hopes you will be able to help her so that she can begin her project.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Senia, es una joven luchadora madre de una niña de 7 años. Los deseos de mejorar la calidad de vida de su hija la han llevado a desempeñarse en diferentes oficios. Hace 3 años inauguró una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su localidad aprovechando la masiva demanda de sus vecinos por los artículos de primera necesidad.Con el ingreso que genera a diario esta pequeña bodega, puede solventar las necesidades más urgentes de su familia y otorgarle una adecuada educación a su pequeña.Debido a que sus clientes cada vez exigen mayor cantidad y variedad es que Senia se ve en la necesidad de ampliar su stock con el deseo de brindarles un adecuado servicio a sus clientes. Por esta razón solicita un préstamos de 600 soles que se compromete a retornarlos en un período de 6 meses para poder ingresar mayor cantidad de artículos a su bodega. Senia espera tu pronta ayuda para iniciar su proyecto.
loan_use: To buy a greater stock of products for her grocery store, so that it can become one of the most popular in the neighborhood

description:
Lucia is a very enterprising woman. When her family's financial needs were not being met, she decided to open a business selling "puchero", a typical stewed dish from her town Huancayo. Starting with a small amount of her own savings, she began preparing puchero and selling it on the street. Many people enjoy Lucia's home cooking and she now has a loyal following. At this time Lucia would like to borrow $200 to buy a cart and some kitchen implements. This will make it easier for her to transport the stew so she can better serve her customers thereby increasing her family's income and quality of life. She promises to repay the loan in 6 months and thanks you in advance for your generosity.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Lucía, es una mujer muy emprendedora que decidió iniciar su negocio con la venta del riquísimo plato típico de Huancayo, “el puchero”. Emprendió el desarrollo de esta actividad debido a que las necesidades primarias de su familia no estaban siendo cubiertas satisfactoriamente.Con un pequeño capital se dispuso a salir a las calles de su ciudad y poco a poco; gracias a su excelente sazón fue adquiriendo asiduos comensales. Actualmente su propósito es adquirir un carrito para mejorar las condiciones y desplazamiento de tan exquisito potaje y renovar sus utensilios de cocina para incrementar su calidad en la preparación. Por ello solicita un préstamo de 200 dólares a fin de llevar a cabo su propósito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia con el ingreso monetario que genere la venta de comida, se compromete a retornarlos en un lapso de 6 meses y por esta razón apela a sus generosos corazones.
loan_use: To buy a food service cart.

description: Patisepa F. is 21 years and the mother of a three-year-old child. Initially Patisepa got her income from selling goods at s flea market, but now she has added ice cakes to her business as well. She says that it is a very successful business because of the hot weather. In fact, each day she runs out of ice cakes. She tries to make enough for a day, but still the demand from her customers is much more than she can produce with her current materials. Specifically she’s using a freezer that is too small. Patisepa sells her cakes for 70 cents, and due to the limited space in her freezer, she can only make 50 cakes a day. With a new refrigerator, which she hopes to buy with a loan, she will be able to stock more cakes and boost her daily income from $35 to $105 per day. She will use the loan to buy a new freezer and purchase more ingredients for her ice cakes.
loan_use: Buy a new freezer and ingredients for her ice cakes.

description:
Manuela B. is a young, optimistic and hard-working mother of three. She is determined to contribute to her family's income. A little while back, after welcoming the newest member to her household, she decided to start a business selling sandwiches in a spot she set up in her home. Little by little, she become better known, thanks to her excellent seasoning and patience to make works of art in the kitchen, and demand has grown. With the help of her husband and her savings, they set up the shop together, but they are still dealing with a very small space. This activity has brought much joy to Manuela and also her family. Her goal is to convert this small shop into a restaurant where she'll be able to offer not only typical dishes but also make the varied requests from her customers.

Manuela is requesting a loan of $650, which she plans to repay with eight months. This will help her improve her business and also allow her to hire six people and in this way help diminish the high rate of unemployment in her city. She appeals to generous hearts to help her achieve her goal of having a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Manuela B., es una joven madre D. 3 niños, optimista y trabajadora ávida D. contribuir con el ingreso familiar. Hace poco tiempo y con la llegada D. un miembro más a su hogar decidió iniciar el negocio D. la venta D. sándwiches en un espacio que acondicionó en su vivienda. Para contribuir activamente con la responsabilidad D. su esposo.Poco a poco se fue haciendo conocida, debido a la excelente sazón y paciencia que posee para hacer D. la cocina un arte y la demanda se fue incrementando. Con ayuda D. su esposo y sus ahorros fue acondicionando el lugar pero aún así se fue convirtiendo cada vez en un espacio muy pequeño. Esta actividad le ha generado muchas satisfacciones a Manuela y también a su familia. Por ello su deseo es convertir ese pequeño espacio en un restaurante dónD. podrá ofrecer no sólo los potajes acostumbrados sino también las variadas solicitudes D. sus clientes. El pedido D. Manuela es por la suma D. 650 dólares que se compromete a pagarlo en un período D. 8 meses, con este préstamo además D. obtener beneficios personales también podrá otorgarles trabajo a 6 personas más y D. esta manera contribuirá a disminuir la tasa D. desocupación en su ciudad,Manuela, apela a sus corazones generosos para emprender la carrera hacia su meta.
loan_use: The best small eatery in Juliaca wants to build a restaurant in the city to satisfy the growing demand from their diners.

description: Taufaiesea is a married woman of 41 years of age. She has 6 children and 2 family relatives living with her.
