Her husband is a farmer, and sometimes she has problems looking after her family, especially their daily expenses. The income from what they sell every week is not sufficient. Taufaiesea decided to start something of her own. Instead of relying on the farm, she opted to try selling ice cakes. She lives close to the school, so it was a great start for her. She used her first loan to buy business equipment, and she is very happy that she has utilized her time properly and focused on developing her family's living.
loan_use: To start her ice cake business.

description:
Laura Francisco M. is 34 years old. She is married with 4 children. They live in the neighborhood of Magoanine in Maputo. She has a small store where she sells various products. She joined the program in November 2006, and requested a loan of 3.000mt which she paid in full. She is now in the 3rd cycle of the credit program. Laura is requesting a loan of 6.000mt to be repaid in 5 months. She plans on increasing inventory and strengthening her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Laura Francisco M. tem 34 anos de idade e vive maritalmente com o seu esposo e 4 filhos no bairro de Magoanine em Maputo.Tem uma mercearia em casa onde vende uma diversidade de produtos.Entrou para o programa em novembro de 2006 e tomou como 1º empréstimo 3.000 MT.Vai para 3º ciclo de empréstimo e pretende tomar 6.000MT para pagar em 5 meses, o qual pretende reforçar o seu negócio que tem vindo a registar um modesto crescimento.
loan_use: Increase Inventory

description:
Maria and her husband have a seven year old boy. They repair bicycles at a small space that they have set up in their rented apartment.

They both wake up early every day in order to attend to their clients. They have a very high demand because most of the people in their area use the bicycle as their main transportation method.

Their repair tools have started to show imperfections and the workshop looks smaller every time.

This is why Maria wants to extend her workshop and acquire more tools to improve their services. She requests for a $275 dollar loan which she compromises to repay within 6 months, in order to start the project and to be able to give their son a better quality of life. Maria and her family look forward to your generous help.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

María y su esposo tienen un niño de 7 años y desempeñan su trabajo diario en un espacio que acondicionaron para reparar bicicletas en un domicilio alquilado hace ya varios años. Todos los días desde muy temprano ambos se preparan para atender a sus clientes; la demanda que tienen es muy alta debido a que la mayoría de las personas en esta localidad utilizan estas herramientas para desplazarse de un lugar a otro. Los instrumentos que utilizan para realizar las reparaciones están presentando desperfectos hace poco y el espacio en el que desempeñan esta labor cada vez se ve más pequeño. Por esta razón María desea ampliar el espacio en el que se encuentra el taller y adquirir nuevas herramientas para mejorar el servicio que ofrece. Su solicitud es por un monto de 275 dólares que se compromete a retornarlos en un período de 6 meses a fin de iniciar su proyecto y poder brindarle con los ingresos que genere esta actividad una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo. María y su familia esperan tu generosa ayuda.
loan_use: More tools and better distribution for Maria's workshop

description: Faaea has been a member of Mulivai Leauvaa centre for a long time. She is now 65 years old, but still has a feeling of wanting to support her family by doing her own gardening as a business, plus the help from her sons who work a taro plantation. Faaea sells 10-15 pineapples a day to the people of her own village and she goes to the market to sell more twice a month.
loan_use: To purchase gardening supplies

description: Faasegi S. is a businesswoman of fifty-five, and she has four children.  Her husband died three years ago. She wanted so much to have a business of her own to help her put her children in school and to develop her family.  Finally, she did what has she been dreaming of - having a plantation as a small business. Faasegi works so hard every day until the evening to clean and plant as many goods as she can to sell in order for her to earn money to satisfy the needs of her kids.   She’s happy of the way she runs her business even though her husband is not there to help out, but she has nothing to worry about as everything is going well.  She’s thankful to S.P.B.D for making the programme available for those who do not have a job to earn money.  She will use her loan to buy seeds to plant, and wire, nails, hammers, etc., for the fence.
loan_use: To purchase seeds, hammers, wiring, fencing, and nails

description:
Talalei S., 41 years old, of Vailoa-uta makes pudding for a living. Married with children, Talalelei and her husband have joined forces to earn their living. Since they were introduced to SPBD, they make and sell puddings for employment. These are being sold at the Fugalei Market where they have their own retail shop.

Talalei produces a maximum of 15-20 puddings a day and these are delivered to the market for sale. This has become a family business and Talalei’s husband has now learnt the skill of making a pudding. With an addtional capital of US$300 she and her husband is excited about the prospect of expanding their pudding business.
loan_use: To purchase raw materials for her pudding business and pay for overhead expenses for her pudding retail shop in the market

description:
Ferila K., a mother of two from the big island of Savaii, is now married to a hard man from Saletele Fagaloa on the island of Upolu. She's unemployed and her small business that provides her living is producing handicrafts. She also helps her husband planting kava and delivering it to the shop in town.

All this hard work turns into financial support for her family with the main financial assistance coming from S.P.B.D program. That’s where the progress started even though she has to pay back S.P.B.D; without their support this would never happen. Now Ferila is able to support her own family and also her parents and family on the island of Savaii. She is requesting a loan of US$ 300 to continue the dream.
loan_use: For purchasing supplies for her crafts

description: Michail B. makes a living for himself and his family of three by transporting people around Ukraine from his home base in Ivano-Frankisvk. An energetic, positive fellow, he has been self-employed as a taxi driver for the past five years. He contracts with a radio dispatching company in Ivano-Frankivsk to help ensure that he has a steady supply of customers in need of transportation. Michail’s typical daily income is around 150-180 Ukrainian Hrivna or about $30-$35. Michail has requested a short term loan of $200 to purchase some new tires for his taxi-cab.
loan_use: Purchase tires for car

description:
Maria Teresa is married with 3 kids who are 21, 15 and 11 years old. The eldest is a factory worker and the younger two are in high school and elementary school respectively. Her husband is also a factory worker and she had to find work in order to help her husband to cover the household costs and their kids' education. She is very hard working and knows a lot about cooking, so she decided to start selling toasted sandwiches, soft drinks and fried foods 3 years ago. Her sales have gradually risen and with her savings she was able to find a place to sell her foods to kids and teachers in a school.

Maria Teresa would now like a loan of $750 to buy more products for her canteen and more ingredients so that she can offer a wider range to her clients. She will repay this loan in 6 months. Her and her family thank you for your support which means that she can continue with her business and support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

María Teresa esta casada y tiene 3 hijos D. 21, 15 y 11 años, el mayor trabaja como obrero en una fábrica los otros dos menores estudian en secundaria y primaria respectivamente, su esposo trabaja como obrero en una fábrica al igual que su hijo mayor, ella tuvo que trabajar para apoyar a su esposo a cubrir los gastos del hogar y la educación D. sus hijos, pero ella como es muy trabajadora y conoce sobre la cocina, decidió vender tortas (sándwich), refrescos y frituras hace tres años atrás. Poco a poco fue incrementando sus ventas y con sus utilidades pudo solicitar la concesión D. una cafetería en una escuela para poder vender a los alumnos y maestros D. la misma.

Ahora maría Teresa solicita un préstamo por la cantidad D. US $ 750 para poder surtir su cafetería con productos y materia prima para poder ofrecer mayor variedad D. productos y comidas para sus clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses, ella y su familia te agradecen mucho por el apoyo que le brindas para poder continuar con su negocio y apoyar a su familia.
loan_use: To buy ingredients/Compra de insumos

description:
Seymur I. is a low-income person who is very vulnerable to shifts in the local economy. He is 25 and lives with his parents in Saatli town located in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

\r\nSeymur rents a barber shop and has one employee. They serve clients and at the end of each month they have to pay the rent to the shop owner. The school term is beginning and as a rule all school children get their hair cut before going to school. Seymur's barber shop isn't in good condition and needs to be renovated immediately. Seymur applied for a $500 loan from Normicro's Saatli branch. After getting the loan and renovating the shop, he hopes to attract more customers and increase his daily income.
loan_use: To renovate his barber shop

description:
Nataliya S. is married with two teenage sons. She lives in Pavlograd with her family. Nataliya was laid off from her previous job and had to find a stable source of income to provide for her family. That is how she ended up as an entrepreneur. Presently, Nataliya sells children’s clothing in the central city market. Her kiosk offers a large variety of clothing items at a reasonable price. Nataliya has repaid all of her previous loans from Nadiya Ukraine without any delinquencies. Financial assistance helped her purchase a new vending kiosk in a favorable location in January 2007.

\r\n\r\nNataliya has been in this trade for 5 years. Currently, she has 150 items for sale in her kiosk. Her monthly net profit is about $600. Nataliya is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase some inventory wholesale and increase her turnover capital. Her long-term plan is to open one more vending facility. Moreover, Nataliya is hoping to use generated profit to help her daughter get a good education in a technical school. We believe her enthusiasm, motivation and desire to improve her living standards will guarantee prompt loan repayment.
loan_use: to purchase 70 items of children’s clothing

description:
Mrs. Suong K., 50, is a widow and lives with her single daughter in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To supplement her household, K. works selling traditional Khmer cake and generally earns around $3.50 each day.\r\n

She intends to open a small grocery store for her daughter so that she will be able to help generate additional income. Mrs. Suong K. has recently applied for a loan to help her and her daughter to open and run the small grocery store.
loan_use: Open a grocery store to generate more income

description:
Muazama G. is a cheerful person, as you can see from this picture. She loves life and children very much. That is why she decided to choose this kind of business, selling toys. Her sales point is located in Chkalovsk, in Khujand. She has several shelves for her goods and two tables--that's it. She sells various toys such as dolls, cars, balls, and so on. She says that her business place is very crowded every day and she sells her goods in a short time.

The turnover of her working capital is good and she makes a good profit under the circumstances. She gets her toys from distributors from China. Her chief problem is the condition of her sales point especially in rainy and snowy weather. (It is upsetting to her and bad for business when her goods became dirty.)

The government of Chkalovsk plans to build shops in this market and Muazama hopes in future to be able to rent one for her business. For this purpose, she wants to increase her inventory of goods and save money for a future shop.
loan_use: increase her inventory so as to save to have her own shop

description:
Mohamed S. is a barber in Kabala Town of Sierra Leone. At thirty years old, he is married with two children. In addition to being a barber in his own shop, Mohamed employs three female hairdressers and sells wigs and extensions for female clients.

With his previous loans Mohamed was able to increase his profit, purchasing more wigs, extensions, and cosmetics. His business has created employment for five youths. Mohamed is requesting a loan of $275 to buy more supplies to further increase his profit.
loan_use: Purchase additional salon cosmetics for resale

description:
Edgar is 49 years old, married, with 7 children, 4 of whom are independent and 3 are high school students. Edgar repairs and maintains automotive turbo engines in his own shop for 4 years. He has been in the profession for 24 years, working with a friend, then dedicating himself to opening his own shop. Today he maintains a solid client base satisfied with his good work. He employs 2 people. Edgar dreams of having in his shop a lathe (a machine that makes pieces for the turbo engines) and an inventory of parts for all kinds of vehicles to better serve his clients, who currently have to purchase the parts elsewhere and return to Edgar's shop for the vehicle repair. The loan he seeks is to purchase various turbo engine parts.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Edgar tiene 49 tiene 49 años, está casado, tiene 7 hijos, de los cuales 4 son independientes y los otros 3 son estudiantes de la educación secundaria. Don Edgar se dedica a dar servicio de reparación y mantenimiento de turbo a automóviles exclusivos, tiene su taller propio hace 4 años. Adquirió la profesión hace 24 años en donde trabajaba en sociedad con un amigo, luego se decidió a dar apertura a su propio taller en forma independiente, y hasta la fecha mantiene una clientela formada y satisfecha por sus buenos trabajos. Actualmente da fuente de trabajos a 2 personas. El Sr. Edgar sueña con tener en su taller un torno (maquina que se encarga de fabricar las piezas de los turbos) y un inventario de repuestos para todo tipo de vehículos y así brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes que en este momento deben recurrir a una casa de repuestos para la compra del mismo y luego visitar el taller de Don Edgar para la reparación de sus vehículos. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de repuestos de varios para turbos de vehículos.
loan_use: Purchase various parts for turbo engine vehicles.

description:
Beatriz E. is a 45 years-old mother of four children. She is a hard working woman and her dreams of having a better life made her start working when she was only 15 years old. She started working by selling the following: stuffed potatoes, hamburgers, fruits, and other products. Once she started her family, she decided eighteen years ago to start her own small store in order to generate a stable source of income that would support her family. Beatriz starts work at five in the morning and hopes for the loan to improve and to expand her store. The income her husband makes as a mechanic does not cover the tuition costs for the higher education of her children. In order to complete her objectives, she needs $500 dollars to invest into her store’s expansion. She promises that her business will pay back the loan in a six-month period. With your support and generosity Beatriz and her family improve their lives. Believe in her because she will not disappoint you.

Translated from Spanish by Johnny of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Beatriz E. de 45 años es madre de 4 hijos su capacidad emprendedora y sus inmensos deseos de superación hicieron que empezara a trabajar a los 15 años vendiendo papa rellena, hamburguesas, frutas, entre otros productos; con el tiempo y una vez formada su familia hace más de 18 años decidió abrir su bodeguita con el fin de generar ingresos económicos más estables y sustanciales para su hogar..Beatriz empieza a trabajar desde las 5:00 de la mañana y desea el préstamo para implementar y ampliar su pequeña bodeguita, puesto que los ingresos de su esposo como mecánico es insuficiente para cubrir los gastos de estudios superiores de sus hijos.Para cumplir con sus objetivos solicita 500 dólares que podrá invertir en la bodega para ampliar e implementar su negocio ella promete devolver el préstamo en un lapso de 6 meses.Con tu apoyo y generosidad Beatriz puede salir adelante confía en ella, no te defraudará
loan_use: To buy more merchandise so that each and every one of her customers will receive better service and have more options when shopping at her store.

description:
Mrs. Heng S. P., 31, lives with her husband, 33, and four children in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia. Heng S. P. works growing and selling vegetables for $1.50 a day, and her husband earns $4 a day as a construction foreman.

Heng S. P. intends to use this loan to buy construction supplies such as wood and iron to help her husband with his work. She will use the remainder of the money for seeds and fertilizer to increase the amount of vegetables she can grow.
loan_use: to buy construction supplies and seeds

description: “I started this business of pop corn years ago and it has helped me take care of my family. I know how to manage my capital to ensure continuity in the business.”  These are the words of Mrs. Esther O.. She is a married mother of 7 children, and is 46 years old. She is a member of LAPO, and is requesting a loan of US$550 to buy another machine and more maize to improve sales.
loan_use: To buy an additional machine and maize for production

description: Alla is single and lives in Kahovka and has a small business there. She sells footwear in the local market. Alla has been in this trade for four years. Presently, she has about $2000 in inventory. Her turnover capital is about $1000. Monthly net profit is about 350. \r\n\r\nAlla would like to get a loan of $1200 to increase her turnover capital and her sales. Despite all the major challenges she had faced in her business Alla didn’t give up and is determined to press on with her business and achieve real success as a small entrepreneur. Today her mind is filled with many new ideas of how to make her business bigger and better and is planning for the long-term. Alla is hoping to use the loan to fulfill some of her dreams by promoting growth of her business.
loan_use: To purchase new shoes wholesale

description:
Hung and his family reside in Lap Phuoc hamlet, in the Tan Lap commune of Ham Thuan Nam district.

Hung collects garbage at the local market while his wife works at a Brick-kiln but does not have a regular schedule for working there. Together, they support their three children who are all in school (3rd, 6th and 9th grades, respectively).

Their average income is$ 12.50 USD per month/person. They wish to borrow $75 USD to raise a cow to save and to continue their children school. They will pay the loan back after seven months.
loan_use: To raise a cow

description:
Sylivia K. is a 26 year old entrepreneur in Kayunga town. She is a sub-dealer of Uganda Telecom, a telecommunications company which operates all over Uganda. On top of working, Sylivia attends weekend classes at Mukono University, where she pays for her own tuition.

\r\n\r\nShe says loans have helped her since 2005 and she looks forward to being the biggest phone dealer in the whole of Kayunga. Besides the phone business, she rears chicken and pigs, which earns her about USS100 net profit in a month. As a major sub-dealer, she is normally able to receive special phone offers from Uganda Telecom but due to not having enough cash, sha has had to forego the phone offers, which has dampened her earnings. Thus, she would like to take out a loan to buy Nokia phones to sell to her clients.
loan_use: Sylivia wants to buy Nokia phones to sell, especially model 1200 which is in high demand.

description:
A. Dilbar is a pretty business lady. She is married and has one child. She loves him very much and often takes him with her to the market. He is 5 years old, and she teaches him to read at her trade place during her free time.

Her mother is her business partner. She gave Dilbar money to open her business and introduced her to Microinvest, as she herself is one of the active clients of this organization. Their business is located in Ckalovsk, Khujand. They have two trade places and have common working capital. Her mother goes to purchase goods from Istaravshan, Khujand, and they sell the items in both places. Dilbar has many clients. As she is a mother, she helps young parents to choose clothes for their babies with great pleasure.

Presently she has a high turnover of her goods, and she plans to spend her future loan to purchase warm clothes for her little clients.
loan_use: Purchase warm clothes for the winter season.

description:
Ms Nguyễn Thị Tư was one of the first member of the "Quỹ Tình thương" fund in Nghi Lộc district, Nghệ An. Her first loan was only 50 USD. She invested that money in vegetables farming being that vegetables are consumed a lot, they are always served in farmer's everyday meals. This vegetables farming business suits her fine in term of providing her a revenue and the ability to make payment toward her loan. During her 6 year membership, she always participates in the activities organized by "Quỹ Tình thương" and she fulfills her responsibilities in term of repayment. Ms Tư has 3 children, all married and having their own family. They want her to retire now that she is 55 years old. Ms Tư does not agree with them. Her reason is that she is still in good health so she would continue to work and to contribute to the society. She is requesting a loan of 325 USD to buy fertilizer and pigs to breed, in time for the new year.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Chị Nguyễn Thị Tư là một trong những người vay vốn đầu tiên của Quỹ Tình thương tại huyện Nghi Lộc, Nghệ An. Với mức vay ban đầu 50 USD chị đầu tư vào việc trồng rau vặt, một món ăn thường ngày trong bữa cơm của người dân nông thôn, Nghệ An. Đây là một công việc phù hợp với khả năng sử dụng cũng như hoàn trả của chị Tư. Trong 6 năm tham gia Quỹ chị luôn T.ân thủ đầy đủ quy định và tham gia mọi hoạt động chi nhánh tổ chức. 3 con chị hiện đã trưởng thành và có gia đình riêng đều muốn mẹ được nghỉ ngơi. Nhưng chị quan niệm còn lao động được còn là người có ích cho xã hội. Ở T.ổi 55 chị tiếp tục xin vay 325 USD mua phân bón cho vườn rau và một vài con lợn để bán trong dịp Tết.
loan_use: buy fertilizer and some pigs

description: Hanifa is a married woman with four children. She has been in business for the last seven years. She deals in shoes and clothes. She hopes to turn her shoe business into a wholesale shop to be able to sell in big quantities and therefore increase her income. She will also be able to supply many retail traders in Kayunga town, hence reducing their costs of shopping from Kampala which is 78 km away from Kayunga town. She anticipates sales of USD $70 daily after stocking the highly demanded shoes from China.
loan_use: Hanifa wants to buy two boxes of ladies' shoes and one box of children's shoes.

description: Valentina is married with two grown children. She lives in Zaporozhye and owns a small kiosk in the local Malyi Rinok (“Small Market”). Valentina sells cosmetics at affordable prices. She has been in this business for 7 years. Currently, she has about $3000 in inventory. Her monthly profit is about $600. \r\n\r\nValentina is hoping to open a new vending facility which will allow her increase her sales. That is why she is requesting a loan of $1200.  Valentina is very enterprising and strong-willed and has learned to tackle all sorts of problems. She knows how to rise above failure and go on bravely. Valentina is determined to get more profit which would not only help her support her family but keep her business moving forward as well.
loan_use: To increase retail stock

description:
Isidro has a very large family with children of various ages. They are a very united family since they share the earnings of the businesses they are involved in. Isidro is experienced in construction. Due to the lack of skilled construction workers, Isidro finds himself in high demand. His wife and children have helped by selling refreshments in the pampa marketplace for several years. Working as a team has helped with their success. Isidro helps sell refreshments when not busy with construction jobs. The migration of skilled construction workers abroad has had little impact and qualified construction workers find a lot of demand for their work. The loan will be used to expand the refreshment business. As the warm season approaches, the family expects demands for their refreshments to increase. Isidro and his wife have sufficient credit history with various small financiers. They have aligned themselves with the institution and this is their forth loan request.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Isidro tiene una familia muy grande con hijos de distintas edades, son una familia muy unida ya que comparten el trabajo y las ganancias que les aporta los negocios a los que se dedican. Isidro se dedica a la construcción es maestro albañil donde tiene mucha experiencia, actualmente la mano de obra es escasa en nuestro país y debido a esto es que tiene mucha demanda de trabajo. Por otra parte la esposa y los hijos venden refrescos en el mercado de la pampa desde hace varios años atrás y conocen muy bien su mercado, el trabajo en equipo hace que el mismo de buenos frutos, el esposo también colabora en la venta de refrescos cuando no tiene obras que hacer. La competencia debido a la fuerte migración de mano de obra a países extranjeros es mínima y por ello los albañiles calificados son bastante demandados. El dinero esta destinado a la ampliación del negocio de los refrescos, ya que como comienza la época de calor incrementará la demanda de los mismos. Isidro y su esposa tienen bastante experiencia crediticia en diferentes financieras pequeñas, pero ahora se fidelizaron con la Institución y la presente solicitud es la cuarta secuencia.
loan_use:
BUSINESS CAPITAL\r\n

\r\nCAPITAL DE TRABAJO

description: Kadiatu K. is running a small business in the market of Magburaka, in Sierra Leone.  Her husband is also a petty trader in the same town.  The couple work together to make ends meet.  Previously Kadiatu was engaged in selling onions and some vegetables.  With her previous loan, she diversified her business by including tomato paste, cooking oil, rice and curry powder.  At forty two years of age, with three children, her dream is to provide them with the best education.  She said  she would like a loan of $175 to allow her to  purchase the business items on wholesale to make more profit.
loan_use: Diversification of her business to increase her family's profits.

description:
Bertha is a widow, and has two children for whom she is the only source of economic sustenance, and because of the misfortune they have found themselves with the death of her husband, she had to see the necessity of doing somethins to maintain her children. So, two years ago she commenced with much energy to form a little grocery store and now her children help her in the business, which has helped them to be able to move forward. Bertha is applying fo a loan of US $650, which she offers to pay in six months, to be able to buy more merchandise and be able to move forward with her two children who currently help her in the business. She is infinitely grateful for your help in being able to continue forward with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Bertha es una persona viuda, y tiene dos hijos para los cuales ella es el único sostén económico, y a raíz de la desgracia que se les presento con el fallecimiento de su esposo tuvo que ver en la necesidad de hacer algo para mantener a sus hijos. Así, hace doce años comenzó con mucho esfuerzo a formar su negocio de tiendita de abarrotes y ahora sus hijos le apoyan en el negocio, el cual les a ayudado a poder salir adelante.

Bertha solicita un préstamo de USD $ 650, que ofrece pagar en 6 meses para poder comprar más mercancía y poder salir adelante con sus dos hijos que ahora le ayudan en el negocio, agradecen infinitamente tu ayuda para poder seguir adelante con su familia.
loan_use: Purchase of merchandise - Compra de mercancía

description: Endang is 27 years old and married. She sells rice and some fried foods such as fried chicken, potatoes, fish, and fried snacks, as well as many other items. Her husband, Asep, is a musician in a group with a fluctuating income. Endang has been running her business since she joined MBK, and can earn $17 per day. She needs a $100 loan to buy some food and to increase her capital. She hopes that this will increase her business. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.
loan_use: To increase her business

description: Nurjanah A. is 30 years old and is married. She sells clothes on credit, based on customers' orders. She goes door-to-door around her village to sell her products, working to supplement her family's income. Her husband, Anwarudin is a driver with a fluctuating income. Nurjanah usually earns $7.50 in profit per week. She requests a $100 loan to expand her business and improve her income. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.
loan_use: To expand her business and increase her income

description: Sanaa, 39 years old, is the owner of a small tailoring business in the area of Sid Al Bauchrieh in Beirut. Sanaa has been a client of Al Majmoua for the past 3 years. Before knowing Al Majmoua, Sanaa was employed in a clothing factory, being paid $1 to $2 per piece of clothing she was tailoring. With the first loan from Al Majmoua, she bought her own sewing machine - the one shown in the picture - quit the factory and opened her own business.\r\nSince then, she has tripled her monthly income and is currently the main source of income for her family (her retired parents have no income).  \r\nSanaa needs a loan of $1,000 to buy a large stock of fabrics and accessories for her business.
loan_use: Purchase fabrics and accessories to tailor new pieces of clothing

description:
Teresa is 56 years old, a produce merchant, and married to Eric Escobar, who is 47 years old and a professional chauffer. They have three children who are older now and don't live with them.

Teresa has had her position selling fruits and vegetables in the city market of Paraguarí for over 20 years. Before then, she was selling them from her home. Later she took action and opened her own shop, which has a good location since it's found in the most important market in the city. She trades with an established clientel. Thanks to her work, all her sons are professionals.

She needs a loan to buy a freezer that will be very useful in the summers.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Teresa tiene 56 años, comerciante, está casada con Eric Escobar de 47 años de edad de profesión chofer, tienen 3 hijos todos mayores de edad ya no viven con ellos. Teresa tiene su puesto de venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado municipal de Paraguarí hace 20 años, anteriormente vendía en su casa, luego se animo y abrió su propio local, la cual tiene una muy buena ubicación ya que se encuentra en el mercado más importante de la ciudad; cuenta con clientela formada. Gracias a su trabajo todos sus hijos son profesionales. Necesita el crédito para la compra de un congelador que es de mucha utilidad para ella en época de verano
loan_use: Purchase a freezer

description:
Mukkaram, 31, is married and raising 2 children. For a few years, she has been selling fabrics. Mukkaram started with cheaper fabrics and then gradually added more expensive ones to her assortment. Now, she rents a sales spot at the central market of Isfara. Mukkaram buys her products at a wholesale market in Karosu, Kirgizstan. Her business demands significant investment of money. In addition to her personal resources, Mukkaram has been relying on MicroInvest loans for a year and a half. Now, she plans to receive a new loan to finance purchase of the Fall fabrics collection.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Муккарам 31 год, она замужем и воспитывает 2 детей. Муккарам уже несколько лет занимается продажей тканей. Она начинала свой бизнес с продажи простых тканей и постепенно перешла на продажу более дорогих тканей. Сейчас она арендует торговое место на центральном рынке города Исфара. За товаром она ездит на оптовый рынок города Каросуу, Кыргызстан. Ее бизнес требует больших денежных вложений. Кроме своих собственых денег Мукаррам получает займы в Микроинвест, с которым сотрудничает уже 1,5 года. Сейчас она планирует получить новый займ для закупки осеннего ассортимента тканей.
loan_use: Business expansion

description:
From the time she was a little girl, Llane learned to sell fruits next to her dear mother who, with her ability and gentle touch, taught her daughter diligence and patience. She is now the mother of two school-age children. With her sister's assistance in selling her products, and her husband's help with the household expenses, she buys and sells fruits, corn and beans around the small farms lining the Federico Basadre highway in her hometown. In this form she tries to generate additional income to improve her family's quality of life.

During this entire time, she has been saving money with the goal of buying a small space to sell her products, but her savings are not quite enough. For this reason, she's requesting a loan in the amount of $200, which she will repay over a period of six months.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Llane desde muy pequeña aprendió y desempeño la actividad de venta de frutas a lado de su querida mamá, quién gracias a su habilidad y buen trato inculcó en ella mucha diligencia y paciencia. Ahora es madre de dos hijos que aún se encuentran en etapa escolar; mientras recibe el apoyo de su hermana en la venta y la colaboración de su esposo para satisfacer los gastos que genera diariamente su hogar se dedica a la compra y venta de granos de maíz y frejol por las tierras de cultivo que se encuentran en los márgenes de la carretera Federico Basadre de su ciudad. De esta manera trata de generar un ingreso adicional para incrementar la calidad de vida de su familia. Durante todo este tiempo ha estado ahorrando con el propósito de adquirir un espacio propio de ventas en el mercado, sin embargo aún el dinero con el que cuenta es insuficiente para concretar la compra; por esa razón solicita un préstamo de 200 dólares con el propósito de alcanzar sus objetivos motivo por el cual ella ha puesto en nosotros todas sus esperanzas y se compromete a devolver lo solicitado en un periodo de seis meses.
loan_use: To buy more inventory to increase her sales and save enough to open her own retail space.

description: Mrs. Yem A., age 42, is a housewife in Phnom Penh. She would like to borrow $150 to finance the purchase of a motorbike so her husband (shown in the photo) can become a moto-taxi driver and earn $3 per day in revenue. They have eight children. One child is a garment worker who earns $80 per month,  three children are students, and four have gotten married and moved out of the house. With her husband's new job, the family will increase their income and be better able to pay for their children's education.
loan_use: Yem would like to purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate as a driver.

description:
With the help of her children and her beloved and yet old mother, in her own humble house, Rosalbina has installed a service to handle telephone calls for all the residents of her comunity with the purpose of keeping them close to their beloved ones despite the distance. This clever service came up after watching the needs of communication of the members of the comunity.The demand and the enormous distance they had to cover in order to access this tool for communication were enough reasons to set up a telephone inside her little house providing a friendly and efficient service. Today, Rosalbina wants to expand the customers attention space to provide a better and renewed service to her regular customers. With the purpose of reaching her goals, she asks for a 350 dollars loan to begin cristallizing her desires. Let’s keep this comunity communicated with the important support we can bring to Rosalbina. p>Translated from Spanish by Augusto Salazar, Kiva volunteer.

Rosalbina, con ayuda de sus hijos y su adorada madre que ya es muy anciana, dentro de su humilde morada, ha instalado el servicio de recepción de llamadas telefónicas para todos los residentes de su comunidad con el objetivo de mantenerlos cerca de sus seres queridos a pesar de la distancia.El ingenioso servicio de recepción surgió a causa de observar la necesidad de comunicación de muchos miembros de su localidad; la demanda y la enorme distancia que tenían que recorrer para hacer uso de esta herramienta comunicativa se convirtieron en motivos suficientes para instalar un teléfono en las instalaciones de su pequeña casa con el fin de prestar sus servicios de manera amigable y eficiente. Hoy Rosalbina quiere ampliar su espacio de atención con el objetivo de brindarles un mejor y renovado servicio a cada uno de sus asiduos clientes.Con el propósito de alcanzar sus metas solicita la suma de 350 dólares para iniciar la cristalización de sus anhelos.Hagamos que esta comunidad siga manteniéndose comunicada con el importante apoyo que le podemos generar a Rosalbina.
loan_use: Seting up the reception area to improve the service.

description:
Mrs. Putu Sorti has been running a business raising pigs for the past three years. She lives in the village of Berawantangi with her husband Ketut Wanes, and both her children are married and live separately from Putu Sorti. Starting with an investment of only Rp. 700,000, Putu Sorti bought one sow which along with her litter resides in a simple stall. Every four months a litter of between six and twelve piglets is born, and they are ready to sell two months later. Daily necessary expenses for the pigs can be Rp 8,000. When they are two months of age, the piglets can be sold for a total of Rp. 2,400,000, or 200,000 x 12 piglets. From that sale, Putu Sorti earns Rp. 912,000 every six month in profit, after subtracting the pig feed expenses which amount to Rp. 1,488,000 per 6 months. With these profits, Putu Sorti can maintain the necessities of her house, as well as slowly but surely make improvements to her house, which is still in the state of being constructed. The loan in the amount of Rp. 1,300,000 from Dinari will be used for expenses during the next six months, because the cost of pig feed has increased, and become more expensive. \r\n

Translated from Indonesian by Andrew Goss, Kiva Volunteer.

\r\nNi Putu Sorti menjalankan usaha beternak babi sejak tiga tahun yang lalu. Putu Sorti tinggal di desa Berawantangi bersama suaminya Ketut Wanes , sedangkan kedua anaknya sudah menikah dan tinggal terpisah dengan Putu Sorti. Dengan modal awal hanya Rp.700.000.- , Putu Sorti membeli satu ekor induk babi penginduk yang ditempatkan pada sebuah kandang yang sangat sederhana. Setiap 4 bulan sekali penginduk ini bisa melahirkan anak 6 sampai 12 ekor dan akan siap dijual setelah 2 bulan kemudian. Sedangkan biaya yang harus dikeluarkan setiap hari untuk pakan babi tesebut sebesar Rp.8.000. Setelah berumur 2 bulan setelah lahir maka anak babi tersebut bisa dijual seharga Rp.2.400.000, @200.000 x 12 ekor. Dari penjualan tersebut Putu Sorti mendapat keuntungan sebesar Rp.912.000/ 6 bulan setelah dikurangi biaya pakan sebesar Rp.1.488.000 selama 6 bulan .Dengan diperolehnya keuntungan ini maka Putu Sorti bisa mencukupi keperluan rumah tangganya,disamping itu juga sedikit demi sedikit sudah bisa memperbaiki rumahnya walaupun masih dalam tingkat semi permanen. Sedangkan pinjaman sebesar Rp.1.300.000 dari Dinari akan dipakai untuk biaya pakan selama 6 bulan kedepan karena sekarang biaya untuk pakan ternak itu terus meningkat / mahal harganya.
loan_use: Purchase livestock feed - Membeli pakan ternak

description: Mr. Mirjamal is a low income vulnerable person. He is 49, married with five children, and lives in Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan in  the Caucasus region. 20 years ago he started his butchery business and has run it very successfully since then.  His children are growing up and Mirjamal can hardly meet his family’s food and important consumption needs. He has to buy more animals to sell more beef and earn more money. Therefore, he finally applied for  a $500 loan with the Normicro Saatli branch. Now he is waiting for funding so that he can make some improvements to his business.
loan_use: To expand the volume of business

description:
Mrs. M. Thary learned to weave from her mother in 1985, and has been weaving silk since then. Her husband is a farmer, who grows vegetables and rice. However, he also assisting her in weaving silk when he is free from his farming activities. He learned to weave from his wife. They were married in 1988 and have 6 children, 4 sons and 2 daughters. \r\n\r\n

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA three times. Now she is asking for a loan of $400. She will use $200 to purchase silk materials and sewing thread, and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom. She will use the other $200 to supplement the money she has saved, so she can buy a small generator.
loan_use: Purchase silk materials and sewing thread, and pay fees for preparing the loom; and purchase a generator.

description: Mrs. M. Nouv has been married since 1976 and has 7 children: 2 sons and 5 daughters. Since 1979, she and her husband have been earning living growing rice and planting vegetables.\r\n\r\nMrs. M. has borrowed from MAXIMA already twice. Now she is asking for a loan of US$600 to be able to purchase cows for her farm.
loan_use: Purchase of cows for farming

description: Fatmeh, 21-years old, is a daily worker in a bakery. She lives with her parents in Abbassieh in South Lebanon. They live in an economically vulnerable situation and Fatmeh\'s status as a daily worker offers her limited revenues.\r\nShe is requesting a loan of  $300 to repay debts that she and her family owe four different persons, including money owed for food and plumbing. Fatmeh prefers to come to Al Majmoua to resolve her credit issues, because she wants to preserve her family\'s pride. She does not want the people of her community to look at her parents as if they are asking for charity. Fatmeh is part of a group loan with other women from the same village. They named their group "Fatmeh" because she was the one who had the idea of contacting our Institution. A group is usually constituted of self-chosen women, living in vulnerable conditions, mostly in rural areas. The group lending is based on incremental increase of loan amount and group solidarity to guarantee repayment. The strength of the group loan is that it encourages the collaboration approach in the borrowing community. It is a very powerful tool towards economic empowerment of women.
loan_use: To repay personal and family debts

description: Imran S. (his wife is pictured) and his wife own and operate a market in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Devechi. Imran and his wife have two children and have been working with this business for the last 10 years. They have successfully re-paid two prior loans with Norwegian Microcredit proving that they are trust-worthy customers. They are currently looking to get funding in the amount of $1,200 so that they can increase and diversify their inventory.
loan_use: Imran would like to increase and diversify their product inventory.

description: Muaileval Leaana is a sixty three year old lady who is married with eight children. Most of her kids are moving overseas to look for a better future, and now there are just two children living at home with her and her husband. Apart from that, she’s not relying on them for financial resources because she knows that they will eventually develop their own families as well. Muaileval Leaana would like to make ice-cakes and pancakes, not only to earn some money to live, but to use her time at home because she’s no longer able to do heavy duties; therefore, she’s applying for the amount of US $700 to buy the ingredients needed for her business, and to buy some cement, timbers, and iron roofing materials for house repairs. She's very happy with the SPBD program and hopes to stay in it for a long time.
loan_use: Buying ingredients for ice-cake store and for home improvement

description: There are 7 people in this family.  The husband is dead.  The mother and two daughters are the main workers, and the other 4 children are still pupils. The mother and 2 daughters usually work in the green dragon factory, but their incomes are unstable by their uncertain work. The family does not have any other source of income. Huong's nephew, Pham The Diep, used to live with his grandmother when he was still a child, but now he lives with Huong and her family because the grandmother passed away.  Diep got a project scholarship from Mekong Plus to help pay for school fees.  Huong wants to borrow $50 to raise rabbits to earn more income to support the family. She will pay back the loan in 5 months.
loan_use: Raise rabbits

description: Paridjahan (her husband is pictured) is 37 years old and a mother of three. Her husband started a transportation business five years ago. He transports goods to market with his car. The couple now needs a loan of $950 to purchase spare parts.
loan_use: To buy spare machine parts

description:
Félix is a father and for many years, he has been able to fulfill his responsibilities and financially support his family and provide for his children's education. Today, he is content to see that his sons have been brought up in a proper way. He was able to support his children by selling books after some failures in the transportation sector. With time and his diligence, he was able to start his own store near the city center and currently, his store sells a wide range of textbooks for students in his region. He also supports his aging, sick mother and also has his nephew under his care.

His love towards his family motivates him. He awaits the day in which he can return to his native region Churcampa to live the rest of his old age there. He is empowered to save for his future and therefore, seeks a loan of $100 to invest in more books, with the purpose of making higher profits to support his nephew and be a good-doer. Endorse Félix in his patriarchal efforts.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Félix es un padre de familia que durante largos años ha sabido cumplir responsablemente con su deber y les brindó abrigo, comida y educación a sus hijos y hoy observa con satisfacción la correcta forma con la que se conducen sus hijos dentro de su ciudad. Él logró sostener a sus hijos con la venta de libros tras sufrir varios fracasos en el área de transporte, con el tiempo gracias a su diligencia ha logrado obtener un propio local de ventas cerca del centro de su ciudad y en la actualidad ofrece una inmensa variedad de textos para la estudiosa población de su localidad con el propósito de sostener económicamente a su anciana madre que se encuentra delicada de salud y a un sobrino en su poder.

Motivado por el amor que siente hacia su familia, anhela poder volver a su tierra natal Churcampa para radicar y vivir su vejez allí. Con el ánimo de ahorrar para cumplir su deseo solicita un préstamo de 100 dólares para invertirlos en la compra de más libros con el objetivo de generar mayores ganancias para apoyar a su sobrino y hacerlo un hombre de bien. Apoya a Don Félix en su labor paternal.
loan_use: Compra de libros.

description:
Alice has always dreamed of seeing her children well educated, but this dream was almost shattered since she and her husband could not afford school fees.  This caused her to obtain a loan from GHAPE to start a business.  She has since successfully invested four loans and has been able to sponsor some of her children through secondary school.

With a loan of $1000, she plans to invest in her former business of selling groundnuts and also start selling ready-made dresses.  She plans to use the profit to further pay school fees for her children.

She plans to pay her loan in 24 months.  The first installment repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.
loan_use: Pay rent and start sale of ready-made dresses

description:
Nicolás is single and a mason. On the side, he also works various other gardening jobs, but principal skills are in masonry. He started this work in order to have other sources of income but grew to develop his work to engage in buying and selling iron and other metals. For 6 years, he worked with a business partner until Nicolás became independent. He now works for himself and wishes to advance in his career.

Nicolás is seeking a loan of $375 to buy raw materials for his work and a scale to weigh the iron and metals that he buys and sells. He will pay the loan back in 6 months. He thanks you for the support that allows him to continue and develop his business.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Nicolás es un hombre trabajador y esta soltero, él es albañil y también se dedica a varios trabajos de jardinería, pero su mayor destreza es la de albañil, el empezó con el ofició por la necesidad de tener recursos económicos que le permitan vivir y poco a poco poder ir creciendo, quiere además de su trabajo se dedica a vender y comprar fierro y metales, fue hace 6 años que empezó a trabajar con un compañero, hasta que se independizó y ahora trabaja por su cuenta, él desea salir adelante con su trabajo.

Nicolás esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 375 para comprar materia prima para su trabajo y una báscula para pesar el fierro y metales que compra y vende, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Él te agradece mucho el apoyo que le das para poder continuar con su negocio y trabajo y poder crecer con su esfuerzo.
loan_use: to buy raw materials and a weighing scale

description: I am Kalsoom B. and I was born and brought up in Mian Chunnu ( a small town in Pakistan) and then moved to Multan (a mid-sized city in Pakistan) after I got married. I am the mother of five children all of whom attend school. I make and sell embroidered clothes to the nearby  markets; I have also hired afew women to help me in this business. The business yields approximately $65 a month in profit. My husband works in WAPDA (a government institution that provides electricity) as a lineman for nominal wages. My embroidered clothes are unique in design and the latest in fashion but due to a lack of resources, I cannot produce a large quantity. I need a loan of USD250 to produce more and thereby profit more. I will make savings with these extra profits and plan to buy a piece of land to construct a house on.
loan_use: Expand embroidery business

description: Mrs. Try M., age 24, works with her husband to make chopping boards to sell to wholesalers, earning about $3 per day. They have three children, two of whom are students and one of whom is too young to attend school. In order to increase the number of cutting boards they can make, she would like to request a loan of $200 to purchase additional wood, saws, and other tools for their business. Selling these additional cutting boards will increase revenue and help pay for her children’s education.
loan_use: To purchase materials to make chopping boards

description:
Doña Maria Elisa is 38 years old, has 2 children and her husband works at a contruction site. She sells timber in the town of Tuxtla Gutiérrez with some distribuitors and also from her home. She belongs to the group Reina 5 together with doña Mauricia García Méndez, who sells food from a stand and doña Guadalupe T. Hernández, who sells clothes from her home. With the loan they will buy implements to condition their houses and promote the sale of their products.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

\r\n\r\nMARIA E., tiene 38 años, 2 hijos, su esposo trabaja en las obras de una construcción, ella se dedica a la venta de maderas en la ciudad de Tuxtla Gutiérrez con unos distribuidores y también en su casa. Pertenece al grupo Reina 5 junto con doña Mauricio García Méndez (vende comida en un local día por medio) y doña Guadalupe T. Hernández (venta de ropa en su casa). Con el préstamo compraran implementos para acondicionar sus casas y promocionar y vender mejor sus productos.
loan_use: PROMOTE SALE OF TIMBER

description:
Mrs Florinda belongs to a Communal Bank called " Working Women" from 341 Jr. Callao in the neighborhood of Arenal of the Calleria District in the Ucayali State. She is 60 years old and is mother of two children. Her husband, a baker, was working for a bakery that paid S/. 500.00 ( $157 US dollars), which wasn't enough to satisfy their basic house needs. Therefore, Florinda accepted her neighbor's invitation to join Manuela Ramo's Communal Bank. With the first loan of S/.300.00 soles she decided to start selling bread. Since then she had her own oven and little by little built their own artisan bread bakery.

Recently, Manuela Ramos gave them an additional loan of S/.1,500 (US $500.00 aprox.), which will be paid back in 6 quotas. She will use this loan to improve and maintain her oven and to purchase 20 bags of flour, 1 case of eggs, 3 kg. of salt, 3 kgs. of sugar and 1 bag of leavening.

Mrs Florinda is very happy to have her own business and work with her husband and sons, who attend the business. They wake up every day at 3:00 a.m. to bake the bread.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Florinda pertenece al Banco Comunal "Mujeres Trabajadoras", del Jr. Callao 341 del sector del Arenal del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 60 años y es madre D. 2 hijos, su esposo es panadero, estuvo trabajando para una panificadora donD. le pagaban S/. 500.00 (US$ 157.00), ingreso que no les era suficiente para satisfacer las necesidades básicas D. la casa. Es así que Florinda recibe la invitación D. una vecina a integrar en un Banco Comunal D. Manuela Ramos, entonces con el primer préstamo D. S/ 300.00 soles deciD. vender pan, desD. ese momento tiene la iniciativa D. tener su propio horno, por ello poco a poco construyeron su propio horno artesanal. Con el reciente préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos D. S/. 1,500 (US$ 500.00 aprox.) que será cancelado en 6 cuotas, mejorará su horno y dará mantenimiento al mismo, comprará 20 sacos D. harina, 1 jaba D. huevo, 3 kilos D. sal, 3 kilos D. azúcar y 1 bolsa D. levadura. La señora Florinda esta muy contenta D. tener su propio negocio y trabajar conjuntamente con su esposo y sus hijos, quienes atienden el negocio, se levantan a las 3.00 am para elaborar el pan..
loan_use: to maintain the bakery's oven and purchase ingredients

description: Taumainuumau is an old lady who supports her family by running her vegetable garden. She is 60 years old and has 6 kids. She attends the market to sell her produce once a week, and she can make $200-300 per visit. She uses the money to support her family and to pay school fees for her grandchildren.
loan_use: To buy supplies for her garden

description: Masina K. is a 62-year-old married mother of 6 kids. Two of her children have moved overseas, but the rest are still in Samoa. Masina used to rely on regular remittances from her overseas children until she joined the program last year. Since then, she has started a taro plantation and started making her own money by selling taro at the market and to fellow villagers.
loan_use: To buy supplies for her taro plantation

description:
Born in 1962, Regina is married and is a mother of six children, two of which are below 15 years of age.  As a caring wife and mother, she has always worked hard to support her husband and educate their children.  Motivated by other members, she decided to join GHAPE so she could obtain a business loan.

With a loan of $100, she plans to invest in the cultivation of yams, vegetables and corn which are all highly consumed food stuffs in the area.  She plans to sell these crops and raise money to support her husband in paying school fees for their children and to feed the family.

She plans to repay the loan in 12 months with the first installment on the day the loan is disbursed.
loan_use: Purchase of corn seeds and yam setts

description:
Sra. Melida belongs to the "Mujeres Trabajadoras" (Working Women) community bank in Ucayali, a region or "departamento" of Peru. She's 43 years old and the mother of 2 children.

Melida earns a living making clothes, e.g., shirts, blouses, lingerie, etc. With an initial loan of S/.300 (300 Peruvian soles or about US$94), she was able to make a down payment on a sewing machine. She and her husband now jointly operate the business, selling her products for both cash and on credit.

With a recently granted loan of S/.1,700 (about US$575) from Manuela Ramos, to be repaid in 6 installments, Melida will be able to maintain her sewing maching and buy raw materials (20 meters of cotton cloth, a dozen spools of thread, a roll of lace and buttons).

She's very happy with her sewing business and that she'll be able to extend credit to those people who can't immediately pay in cash.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Melida pertenece al Banco Comunal "Mujeres Trabajadoras", del Jr. César Calvo de Araujo 898 del sector del arenal del Distrito de Callería del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 43 años de edad y es madre de 2 hijos.

Melida se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir como son: polos, blusas, shor's, lencería, etc. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 (US$ 94.00 aprox.) pudo dar la inicial de una máquina de coser, ahora conjuntamente con su pareja realizan esta actividad donde venden al contado y al crédito con cuotas de pago de S/. 2.00 diarios.

Con el préstamo recientemente otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,700 (US$ 575.00 aprox.), que cancelará en 6 cuotas, podrá dar mantenimiento a la máquina de coser, además podrá comprar 20 metros de telas de algodón, 1 docena de hilos, 1 cono de blondas y un ciento de cierres.

Ella está muy contenta de trabajar en la costura y con la venta poder dar facilidades a aquellas personas que no cuentan con efectivo en ese momento.
loan_use: Buy materials and supplies at wholesale. Pay for upkeep on sewing machine.

description:
Leticia is married and has two children. Her husband works in a shop as a solder. She worked selling food to help her husband with the household expenses, and so she started in her house, selling hamburgers at night, and now she also sells tacos in the morning and home-style meals. With this, her clients have increased and she has a very good group of regular clients, since she is highly recommended because her food is very tasty. She wants to continue her business and expand it to offer a better service to her clients.

Leticia is requesting a loan for USD $650 to invest in remodeling her food stand and expand it, because in the rainy season it is uncomfortable for her clients go to her food stand. She offers to pay the loan in 6 months. She thanks you for the support you give her to grow with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Leticia es una mujer casada y tiene dos hijos, su esposo trabaja en un taller como soldador, ella se dedico a la venta de comida para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar , así ella empezó en su casa vendiendo hamburguesas por las noches y ahora en las mañanas vende tacos de harina y comidas caseras, y ya con esto sus clientes se han incrementado y tiene una buena cartera de clientes fijos ya que es recomendada por que hace muy ricas sus comidas y desea continuar con su negocio y ampliarlo para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Leticia esta solicitando un préstamo por USD $ 650 para invertirlo en la remodelación de su local y ampliación por que en épocas de lluvia es muy incomodo para sus clientes ir a su puesto de comidas, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella te agradece mucho el apoyo que le brindas para crecer con su negocio.
loan_use: Business remodel and expansion.

description:
Monica is a single mother. She lives with her two children, who are students in a small education center in their city. She decided to begin her business work outside her own home. Noticing the business opportunity offered by the location in front of the health clinic, she did not hesitate in moving her food sales to that space. In little time she was sought by a large number of people who daily go to the health clinic to receive medical attention to alleviate their problems. The delicious dishes she prepares and sells since very early in the day have become a favorite of many of the people who visit that place until the afternoon. This drove her to buy a tent to protect herself from the hot sun and also to offer comfort to her clients. In addition, she can count with the support of her children in giving attention to her clients in the busiest times. She requests US$ 350 to buy a new tent, kitchen utensils and products to prepare her dishes, which will allow her to increase the quantity and variety of dishes she offers daily. Let's make it possible for this hardworking mother to continue cooking her excellent dishes and decorating each one of them with her family's dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Mónica es madre soltera, vive con sus dos hijos, los cuales están cursando estudios en un pequeño centro educativo de su ciudad.Decidió empezar su labor comercializadora en las afueras de su hogar y observando la oportunidad de negocio que se presentaba en el frontis de la posta de salud no dudó en trasladar su espacio de ventas hasta este espacio.En poco tiempo tuvo acogida del inmenso número de personas que acude a diario para recibir distintas atenciones con el propósito de contrarrestar sus males. Las exquisitas viandas que prepara y vende desde muy temprano se han convertido en las favoritas de muchas personas que transitan a diario por ahí hasta pasado el medio día, hecho que la condujo a comprar una carpa para poder protegerse del fuerte sol y también para brindar comodidad a sus clientes, además cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos en la atención al público, en los momentos de mayor afluencia de comensales. Solicita la suma de 350 dólares para adquirir una nueva carpa, utensilios de cocina y productos para la elaboración de viandas esto le permitirá incrementar la cantidad y variedad de platos que ofrece a diario.Hagamos que esta diligente madre siga cocinando excelentes platos y adorne cada uno de los mismos con los sueños de su familia.
loan_use: Buying a tent, cooking utensils and materials.

description:
Lupepe is a 42-year-old mother of four kids and lives with her extended family of more than ten people. She works very hard at her small business of selling chips. She knows it’s a very tough business, but she commits all her time in it because it is her only source of income.

\r\n\r\n

Her first $300 USD loan was used to buy ingredients and expensive tools for making the chips. She goes around to the hospital, schools and the town area for delivering her chips. This is the hardest part of her work and also takes the most time. The business is important for supporting her children’s schooling fees, as well as for her family’s daily needs. Her next loan will be used to buy a gas oven for frying her chips more easily and for repairing the house.
loan_use: To buy  ingredients to make chips.

description:
Nelly is the mother of two small children who are enrolled in basic courses at the school in their city. She enjoys the support and company of her husband, who makes a living through the extraction of wood. It is for this reason that Nelly decided to begin selling the wood to increase their profits and to avoid the loss of money that happens when they use third party sellers. With the intention of starting her work soon, Nelly set up a small space in her home to keep the wood her loving husband obtains through his sacrifices safe for its later marketing. Before summer starts (along with the scarcity of wood extraction), they have to increase the quantity that they have in their small warehouse, and to be able to carry out their goal, they need the help of each one of you. With the profits that they receive from the sales of their products, they hope to open a small bakery so they can consolidate their income and increase the quality of life of their children. Let's help this family make their dreams a reality and remove the obstacles so they can have peace and happiness in their hearts.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

\r\n\r\nNelly es madre de dos pequeños niños que se encuentran aún cursando estudios básicos en un modesto centro educativo de su ciudad, goza del apoyo y compañía de su esposo que se dedica a la extracción de madera; es por esta razón que ella decidió incursionar en la venta de estos productos para incrementar sus ganancias y evitar la pérdida de dinero cuando recurre a las personas intermediarias.Con el propósito de iniciar pronto con su labor acondicionó un pequeño ambiente de su domicilio con el objetivo de mantener a buen recaudo el sacrificio de su querido esposo para su posterior comercialización Antes de que se inicie la temporada de verano en la que escasea la extracción de madera, requiere acrecentar la cantidad que posee en su pequeño almacén y para llevar a cabo su propósito requiere de la ayuda de cada uno de ustedes.Así mismo con las ganancias que reciban por la venta de sus productos desean aperturar una pequeña panadería para que puedan consolidar sus ingresos e incrementar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.Hagamos que esta familia convierta sus sueños en realidad y extraiga los obstáculos para sembrar paz y alegría en sus corazones.
loan_use: Purchase and supply of wood to increase their sales

description: Ana S. is 35 years old and a mother of five.  She has a vegetable garden and she sells the vegetables that she grows.  She hardly needs any help from her husband  and she does the gardening by herself.  Her  two sons eleven and thirteen year old help her out.  She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her vegetable garden.
loan_use: To buy supplies for her vegetable garden

description:
Luzmila is an enthusiastic and hard-working young woman who for more than 10 years has been selling articles of clothing that she brings from the city of Lima. She sells them in the markets of the little towns bordering the city where she lives, Juliaca. She lives in a rented room that she shares with her beloved mother Rosa and her younger brother. Luzmila wants to grow her business until it is an excellent distributor for articles of clothing. In this way she will generate a bigger income to help her mother with the expenses generated by the construction of the house she wishes for. To make these dreams reality, this beautiful young woman appeals for your unselfish help and asks for a loan of $350 which will allow her to grow her business and make her dreams of having her own house reality. Let’s help her achieve her dream soon.\r\n

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

\r\nLuzmila es una joven entusiasta y trabajadora, que desde hace más de 10 años se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir que trae de la ciudad de Lima para ofrecerlos en las ferias de los diferentes pueblitos aledaños a la ciudad en la que radica, Juliaca, en un cuarto alquilado que lo comparte junto a su querida madre Rosa y su hermano menor. El deseo que tiene es acrecentar su negocio hasta llegar a convertirse en una excelente distribuidora de prendas de vestir, generando así un mayor ingreso económico para ayudar a su madre en los gastos que genera la construcción de su anhelada vivienda.Para hacer realidad sus deseos esta bella joven recurre a tu ayuda desinteresada y solicita un préstamo de 350 dólares que le permitirá crecer con su negocio y hacer realidad sus sueños de tener su propia casita. Ayudémosla a cumplir su sueño en corto tiempo.
loan_use: Buy more articles in order to consolidate her small store space.

description:
Izzatoi Halikova has a very big family. It numbers 8 people, 6 of whom are children. Naturally in order to feed everyone one needs to have a good income. Since good jobs are hard to come by, Izzatoi decided to go into retail trade. She sells an assortment of small items at a market stall. Her husband works loading and unloading freight in the same market. Her eldest son does various odd jobs. Her two elder daughters help her out in the market stall. The profits from the business help sustain the family budget. She plans to use the new loan to expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva volunteer.

У Иззатой очень большая семья. Она насчитывает 8 человек, из них 6 детей. Чтобы прокормить такое количество нужен хороший заработок. Так как приличной работы не найти, Иззатой решила торговать. Ее муж работает грузчиком здесь же на рынке, а старший сын работает на частных работах. На базаре помогают две старшие дочери. Ассортимент товаров включает в себя разную мелочевку. Прибыль от бизнеса помогает Иззатой поддержать семейный бюджет. Новый займ она собирается употребить на дальнейшее расширение своего бизнеса.
loan_use: To expand the business

description: Mumbeja is a 52 year old widowed mother of 7 children and with her big heart she cares for 15 other children. In a gated, railed corral, she sells charcoal. She is known by everyone, for everyone uses charcoal for cooking. She has been in business for 13 years. The bags that she is standing next  to are 100kg each. Customers come in with half gallon plastic containers, which she then fills and sells.\r\n\r\nWith her loan she hopes to buy more charcoal and her dream is to expand her business for her children.
loan_use: Mumbeja plans to use her loan to buy more bags of Charcoal

description:
Alie S. became disabled when the vehicle in which he was traveling overturned in one of the villages in Sierra Leone. At fifty-two years old, he is not able to do as much as before but he is able to continue with his tailoring business.

With his previous loans, Alie bought 4 sewing machines. He later formed a solidarity group with two neighboring tailors, each of whom has two sewing machines. Together they rented a space in Kabala town for conducting their business.

Alie employs two ladies to assist him with the sewing of ladies' African dresses. Alie’s tailoring business has improved and because of his professionalism, he was contacted by an international NGO to train five disabled youth. He could not take more trainees as requested due to lack of sewing machines and cash to pay additional professional tailors to assist with the training. He is therefore requesting a loan of US$ 1050 to purchase six sewing machines and other tailoring materials to meet tailoring training demand in Kabala town.
loan_use: Purchase additional sewing machines to contribute to local demand for sewing apprenticeships

description:
Marco es un hombre viudo y tiene cinco hijos, comenzó hace mas D. 25 años viendo L. necesidad y convirtiéndoL. en oportunidad D. poder vender Escobas en su colonia, Al inicio empezó cargando pocas en el hombro, y ofreciendo sus productos casa por casa, poco a poco ha ido saliendo adelante y le ha permitido mantener a su familia. Hoy ya venD. sus escobas en un triciclo y piensa en un futuro poder comprarse una camioneta, para poder tener mayor alcance y mejorar sus ingresos.

Marco esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 1,200 para comprar mercancía y poder ofrecer más productos, ya que sus ventas se han incrementado y desea continuar con su crecimiento, ofreciendo pagar en 6 meses el préstamo. El te agradece mucho el apoyo que le brindas para continuar con su crecimiento.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Pixler, Kiva Volunteer.

Marco is a widower that lives with his five children. More than 25 years ago, he began to see the need to sell brooms in his village, and took the opportunity. At the start he charged very little, and sold his products door to door, little by little earning more and being able to support his family. Today he sells his brooms from a bike and hopes to be able to buy a truck in the future, to be able to increase his earnings. Marco is asking for a loan of $1200 USD to buy merchandise to be able to sell more products, since his sales have been increasing and he would like to continue that. He will pay back the loan in 6 months. He thanks you for your support that allows him to continue pursuing growth in his business.
loan_use: Merchandise for his business

description: Marta has a successful small business: preparing and selling food.  She started her business five years ago.  In the morning, she prepares food such as spaghetti, boiled eggs, bananas with fried hot dogs or fried eggs and so on.  In the night, she sells fried chicken, broth, fried potatoes, manioc, and so forth.  With the income obtained from her business, Marta, 36, provides her two sons with a good education.  Currently, she is thinking about remodeling the locale where she operates the business.  With the loan requested, she will also purchase raw materials to prepare the food.  Given the loan, the entrepreneur hopes the remodeled local will attract new customers to her business.
loan_use: To purchase raw materials to prepare food for her business.  Also to remodel the locale where she sells the food.

description:
DOLORES sells bread door-to-door in her community. She is 66 years old, has 8 children and is a widow. She is a member of the Santiago 1 group along with María Díaz Ruiz (fruit and vegetable sales), Marta Juárez Laguna (fruit sales), Dionisia Ruiz Vásquez (tamale sales). They hope to invest the loan to increase sales and, thus, earn more profits to help their budget.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

DOLORES, se dedica a hacer pan y lo vende de casa en casa entre las personas de su comunidad, tiene 66 años, tuvo 8 hijos y actualmente está viuda. Pertenece al grupo Santiago 1 junto con doña María Díaz Ruiz (venta de frutas y verduras) y doña Marta Juárez Laguna (venta de frutas) y doña Dionisia Ruiz Vásquez (venta de tamales).Ellas esperan invertir sus préstamos en incrementar la compra de sus productos y así lograr obtener mas ganancias que beneficien su presupuesto.
loan_use:
BREAD SALES

\r\nVENTA DE PAN

description:
Gloria and Héctor are dedicated parents who, through much hard work and sacrifice, have mangaged to provide for their 3 children. They are very proud to continue to support their children as they study in the best and most prestigious universities in their country. This is why the couple has to work even harder, so that they can continue to keep up with the expenses created by their children living outside of the home, such as food and rent for them. It is increasingly difficult to come up with the money due to the difficulties caused by nature, such as climate change, and competition from other farmers.

These factors have had negative effects on their economic stability and they have had to cut back on household expenses. So as not to disrupt their children’s studies, they are requesting a loan of $350.00 to buy fertilizers, with the goal of improving their crops. We hope you will contribute to this request. Your collaboration is invaluable and very important.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria y Héctor son unos abnegados padres que a costa de mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio en sus labores agrícolas, han podido mantener a sus 3 hijos a buen recaudo y con mucho orgullo ahora los mantienen cursando estudios superiores en las universidades más prestigiosas de su país. Por ello es que esta pareja tiene que dedicarse aún más en sus actividades con el propósito de seguir solventando los gastos que le demanda la permanencia de sus hijos fuera del seno familiar como es la comida y el alquiler de los cuartos. La suma de dinero que tienen que conseguir cada vez es más difícil de obtener por la dura lucha que hay que emprender con la naturaleza por los cambios climatológicos y con el hombre por la dura competencia de sus productos.\r\nEstos factores han perjudicado mucho la estabilidad de su economía y han tenido que acortar los gastos en su hogar.\r\nPara no interrumpir con los estudios de sus hijos solicita un préstamo de 350 dólares para comprar fertilizantes y abonos a fin de mejorar sus productos. Esperamos usted pueda contribuir con esta petición su colaboración es imprescindible y muy importante recuérdelo.
loan_use: To buy fertilizers

description:
Ramona is 45 years old and has 10 children and 8 grandchildren. She has a husband, but they are not married through the church.

\r\n

The name of her small business is “Carniceria Ramona” and she sells mainly pork and beef. She is able to buy a pig every week to sell and a cow about every month. She can make about US$ 60 – 90 profit on each pig she sells.

\r\n

Ramona took out her first loan with Esperanza 2 years ago for 3000 pesos (US$ 90). This is the 4th loan that she is going to take out from Esperanza, and she has successfully paid back the other 3. Esperanza typically offers smaller loans initially and as a group of women successfully pay back their loans and get a credit history, they can borrow increasingly larger amounts. Ramona is pictured at her biweekly repayment meeting.
loan_use: To continue to expand her butcher shop business

description: Mrs. Seang H., 43, widowed, lives with her younger brother in Batambong province, Cambodia. To support her household, she works selling fish at a busy market, where she typically earns a profit of around US$5 a day. Her brother, meanwhile, works buying and selling recyclable items in the local community. \r\nMrs. Seang H. is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a motorcycle which she could use to transport fish to the market, while the rest of the loan will be used for other types of investment in her fish-sales business.
loan_use: 1 ) Purchase of a motorcycle to transport  fish to the market 2) business expansion

description:
With only a Middle school diploma, and a so so looks, it was not enough for I Komang Muriada to get a job at a formal institution or a private company. Especially since married to Putu Putri Ariani, his responsibility has increased to provide a living for a wife and two children. Therefore Komang Muriada has to work hard to obtain enough income to support continued family living.
