Several work as laborer has been tried, however the income was not enough to support ever increasing family needs. Finally Komang Muriada follows his parents footsteps to work as a farmer. He works on the 40 are (about 4000 square meters) land owned by his parents with Dinari's loan. Komang Muriada started this new work since last year. As with othe farmers in his village, Komang Muriada also plants long bean vegetables on the land. From working the land, planting seeds, fertilized it, to spraying was done by Komang Muriada himself. During harvest time Komang Muriada is getting help from his wife and 2 daily laborers at a rate of Rp20,000 (about US$2.20)/day. In one plucking day harvest, Komang Muriada could make about 100 bunches (about 1 kg/bunch), which he sold for Rp2500-Rp3000 (about 30-35 cents). This was done once every two days. Long beans could be pluck about 25-30X per period (3 months). Within a period Komang Muriada could produce about Rp 6,000,000 (about US$660) in income. After subtracting Expenses for fertilizers, pesticides, labor cost, etc his net profit is Rp2,050,000 (about US$220)/ 3 months. This makes Komang Muriada more enthusiastic in doing his work.\r\n

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

\r\nDengan hanya memiliki Ijazah SMP dan ketrampilan yang pas-pasan, tak cukup bagi I Komang Muriada untuk mendapatkan pekerjaan di lembaga formal maupun perusahaan swasta. Apalagi semenjak menikah dengan Putu Putri Ariani, tanggung jawabnya semakin bertambah karena harus menghidupi istri dan dua orang anak.Untuk itu Komang Muriada harus berusaha keras untuk mendapatkan penghasilan yang menunjang kelangsungan hidup keluarga. Berbagai pekerjaan sebagai buruh sudah di cobanya, namun hasilnya tak cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya yang semakin meningkat. Sehingga akhirnya Komang Muriada harus mengikuti jejak orang tuanya terjun sebagai petani . Menggarap tanah seluas 40 Are milik orang tua dan dengan modal pinjaman dari Dinari, Komang Muriada memulai menekuni pekerjaan barunya sejak tahun lalu . Seperti halnya petani lain di desanya Komang muriada juga menanami tanah garapannya dengan tanaman sayuran yaitu kacang panjang. Dari mengolah tanah, menanam bibit , memupuk dan menyemprot di kerjakan Komang Muriada sendiri . Sedangkan pada waktu musim panen Komang Muriada di bantu oleh istri dan juga ada dua orang tenaga buruh yang di bayar harian sebesar Rp 20.000,- . Dalam sekali petik hasil panen, Komang Muriada bisa mencapai 100 ikat ( beratnya kurang lebih 1 kg) , yang per ikat nya di jual Rp. 2.500,- s/d Rp. 3.000.,- Itu dilakukan tiap dua hari sekali . Tanaman kacang panjang bisa dipanen sebanyak 20 s/d 25 kali dalam satu periode ( 3 Bulan ) Dalam satu periode Komang Muriada mendapat hasil produksi sebesar Rp. 6.000.000,- dan keuntungan yang di peroleh setelah di potong biaya bibit, pupuk , obat-obatan , ongkos buruh dan lain-lain adalah sebesar Rp. 2.050.000,- / tiga bulan . Hasil ini membuat Komang Muriada semakin semangat untuk menekuni pekerjaannya itu.
loan_use:
To buy long bean seeds, fertilizer, pesticides and maintenance upkeep\r\n

Membeli bibit kacang panjang, pupuk, obat - obatan dan biaya perawatan

description:
Sadwathi has a rice stall business. She has been doing it to increase family's income. Her husband's income is Rp700,000.00 (about US$77)/month. That amount is certainly not sufficient. Daily expenses are about Rp30,000.00 (about $3.30), rent for house and food stall. Although her 2 children are independent, she has to work. The rice stall business gives her gross profit of Rp100,000 (about $11). The distance she has to take between her house and her rice stall is about 2 km. Her rice stall location is quite strategic. One factor is that the road is quite busy. That fact is also supported that the food Sadwathi sells are liked by her customers. Also the many building laborers working around Sadwathi's food-stall. Raw materials prices are quite high, but this mother relies on capital to buy enough raw materials. The to be obtained loan would be used to add to her capital.\r\n

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

\r\nSadwathi memiliki usaha warung nasi. Dia menekuni usaha ini untuk menambah penghasilan keluarga. Penghasilan suaminya per bulan Rp 700.000,00. Uang sejumlah itu tentu saja masih belum mencukupi. Biaya hidup per hari Rp 30.000,00, kontrakkan baik untuk rumah maupun untuk warung nasinya. Walaupun kedua anaknya sudah mandiri, dia harus bekerja. Usaha warung nasinya ini memberikan keuntungan kotor per hari mencapai Rp 100.000,00. Jarak yang harus dia tempuh dari rumah menuju warung ± 2 km. Letak warung nasinya cukup strategis. Salah satu faktornya jalur yang melewatinya cukup ramai. Hal tersebut juga didukung oleh makanan yang dijual Sadwathi diminati oleh pelanggan. Hasilnya penjualannya pun sangat bagus. Hal ini ditambah dengan banyaknya buruh bangunan yang bekerja di sekitar warung Sadwathi. Harga bahan baku sekarang memang cukup tinggi, tapi ibu ini memanfaatkan modal yang ada untuk membeli bahan baku yang cukup. Pinjaman yang dia peroleh akan dia manfaatkan untuk menambah modal yang sudah dia miliki.
loan_use:
To buy rice, vegetable and spices\r\n

Membeli beras, sayur, dan bumbu.

description:
Cresencia I. lives in her own home with her husband and three children in the city of El Alto (above La Paz) in the zone of Bethlehem’s Star. Cresencia puts the finishing touches on artisan rugs and other products that she sells in the city’s fairs. Her husband is a lower official in the national police. Her plot of land is walled and needs a home constructed on it. Her neighborhood is demanding construction on the land in order to gain access to more works from the mayor’s neighborhood improvement plan. The loan will be used for the construction of two rooms. This is the first time that Cresencia has applied for a loan. A socioecomic analysis has shown her to have good qualifications and approved the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Cresencia I. vive en casa propia en la zona Estrella de Belén de la Ciudad de El Alto, con su esposo y sus tres hijas. La señora Cresencia elabora alfombras artesanalmente, productos que vende en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y su esposo es oficial de baja graduación en la policía nacional. Su lote de terreno se encuentra amurallado y se necesita construir una vivienda, pues el vecindario le esta exigiendo la construcción de la misma para acceder a obras de mejoramiento vecinal por parte de la alcaldía. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de dos habitaciones. Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.
loan_use: Construction of two rooms

description: Ruslan M. is a 33-year-old man who keeps and raises livestock and fodder in the small village near the Saatli region which is  situated in the southern part of Azerbaijan. Ruslan is married and has two sons. He started his business in 2007. Although he does not have  experience he works very hard. Ruslan started raising fodder for cattle and sells it to the local farmers. With the money he received for the fodder he purchased a calf and he is going to engage in the meat production business. For this purpose he has applied for 900 USD. This amount will help him to purchase three calves, raise them and sell them for meat to the local bazaar traders. The estimated cost for calf is 200-300 USD.
loan_use: Going to purchase 3 calves

description: Feyyaz A. is a 52-year-old man who raises and sells livestock for the meat production. Feyyaz lives in the southern region of Azerbaijan, Saatli. He is married and has four children. Feyyaz has eleven years of experience in raising livestock. He works very hard to cover his family's  needs. Besides raising livestock he works as woodsman and plowman. With the money he earned working on these jobs he purchased his first calf. Now he has one calf for raising, but it is not enough to feed the family and for other family expenses. Feyyaz has applied for 1200 USD to purchase four calves, with an estimated price of 300 USD for each.
loan_use: Going to purchase four calves

description:
Justine is a 32 year-old mother of four living in Makangarawe in the city of Dar Es Salaam. For the past two years, she has owned and run a shop selling fruits and vegetables, and various food items such as maize, rice, wheat and other cereal products.

\r\n\r\n

She now wants to upgrade her shop into a bigger shop in order to increase her income. She is now in need of USD 250, to help her expand her business.
loan_use: To further expand the food business

description: Rajab is a 31-year-old father of three. He runs a multi-faceted business in the Vituka area of Dar Es Salaam. For the past 8 years Rajab has done a little bit of everything. He is a camera man, sells sweet and Irish potatoes and has a restaurant which is open every evening, serving chips, chicken, and eggs. He would like to buy a modern camera and other studio equipments, and set up his own photo studio. Also, Rajab would like to upgrade his restaurant so that it provides services all day long. Rajab is in need of a loan of $450 to expand both of these businesses.
loan_use: To upgrade his restaurant so it can be open all day, and buy photographic equipment for an adjacent photo studio

description: Lemau G. is one of the younger women who have joined the programme recently. She is only twenty-one years of age and she is running a vegetable garden. She grows cabbages, tomatoes, cucumbers and beans. She sells her vegetables to the market and also to the village people. She sells her produce five days of the week, which earns her $80 a day. She is requesting her first loan of  $300 USD. Lemau is very proud to run her own business.
loan_use: To buy weed spray, weed-killing chemicals and knives for her plantation

description:
Gabriela has worked very hard to raise four children on her own since her husband left her. The two eldest are now independent but she continues to support the younger ones. They are the light of her eyes and her inspiration. She raises quail, guinea pigs, rabbits and chickens on her small homestead and the income has served her well to provide for her children. Still, she wants to increase production to finance a good education for them. He greatest goal is to see her sons grow into good men. She is asking for a loan of $375 to build more pens for the animals and raise money for school fees. Please help her realize this dream.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

\r\n\r\nLa señora Gabriela es padre y madre para sus 4 hijos a raíz del abandono de su pareja, desde entonces tuvo que trabajar muy duro, pero hoy ha aminorado su carga al ser sus dos hijos mayores independientes, ahora sólo vela por el bienestar de sus 2 menores hijos quienes se han convertido en el motor de su corazón y la luz de sus ojos.Esta responsabilidad la hizo una mujer con mucha entereza y vigor, así logró implementar en su hogar una pequeña granja de codornices, cuyes, gallinas y conejos; actividad que hasta ahora le ayuda mucho para satisfacer las necesidades de sus hijos.Sin embargo Graciela requiere aumentar sus ingresos para poder solventar los gastos de estudios superiores de sus hijos y para ello sigue trabajando arduamente con una clara visión, hacer de sus hijos hombres íntegros y con valores.Solicita la suma de 375 dólares, con el que podrá ampliar los espacios de sus animalitos e incrementará sus ingresos con los cuales podrá ofrecer una educación adecuada a sus menores hijos.Tu colaboración hará que sus anhelos puedan hacerse realidad en poco tiempo.
loan_use: To expand pens for raising quail and guinea pigs.

description:
This young entrepreneur is a single mom with big dreams. With the help of her parents, she was able to start selling spices in Chinandega's central market. She was able to finish her studies and graduate from the Secretariado Ejecutivo, but due to how hard it is to find a job and the low wages, she decided to start her own business with her savings, about $200.00. Back then her stand was just a wooden table.

She continued saving her money over the 10 months she worked for a private company as a secretary and receptionist. She now supports her parents who still have their own stand right next to hers. This young girl, in addition to helping her parents with their business and at home, makes floral arrangements and piñatas. We believe it's very important to help this kind of you entrepreneurs whose initiative helps create more jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

Esta joven emprendedora, es soltera sin hijos pero con grandes deseos de superación. Gracias a que sus padres desde hace varios años establecieron un modesto y humilde puesto de venta de especies en el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega ella logra terminar sus estudios y se gradúa de Secretariado Ejecutivo, pero ante las dificultades de encontrar empleos y a los bajos salarios, decide iniciar su propio negocios mediante unos pequeños ahorros de US$ 200.00 dólares, en ese entonces el puesto era una pequeña mesa de madera.

Los ahorros fueron acumulados durante los 10 meses que laboró para una empresa privada como secretaria-recepcionista. Ella ahora sirve de apoyo para sus padres, los cuales aún poseen su puesto de ventas, el cual está ubicado junto al que ella posee. Esta joven, además de cuidar de su propio puesto ayuda a sus padres en el de ellos y aporta en el hogar. Además de vender en el mercado, la joven elabora en su casa de habitación Adornos florales y piñatas por encargo. Creemos que es importante apoyar a este tipo de jóvenes emprendedores, cuyas iniciativas generalmente se vuelven generadoras de empleo.
loan_use:
Purchase of goods (spices) and materials for piñatas

\r\nCompra de productos (especies) y materiales para piñatas

description:
Mrs. Ly K., age 41, works at a factory near her village, earning around $2 per day in income. Her husband is a construction foreman, making around $2.50 per day. They have three children; two are grammar school students and one is still too young to attend school.

Ly would like to increase her family’s income to pay for her children’s education and improve their standard of living. She would like to request a loan of $800 to purchase construction tools so that her husband can vary the type of construction jobs he can work on. This will grow his business and increase income for the family. Ly is pictured with her husband and youngest son in the photograph.
loan_use: To purchase construction tools

description:
Latifa H. was born in 1959 in Agsu. She has a family with 3 children. She has been a pharmacist for over 20 years. After the breakup of the USSR she opened her own business and has been active in this sphere. Latifa needed new inventory and she turned to the Agsu division of Normicro. She borrowed $500 and purchased the necessary inventory.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Гусейнова Латифа, родилась 1959 году в городе Аксу. Семейная , имеет троих детей . Уже более двадцати лет она работает аптекарем. После падения союза она открыла свой бизнес. Активно занимаетсья в этой сфере. Латифе нужна было новый инвентарь и она обратилась В Нормикро Аксуниский филиал. Взяла кредит 500$ и купила необходимый инвентарь.
loan_use: For purchase of inventory

description:
This woman is a single mother and head of her family, she has six children- all married and with children, she supports with their expenditures and she is directly in charge on two of her grandchildren. They stay with her and she pays for their food and studies by the profits of her business. This woman has developed many activities to gain enough money. Before this business she had a store in her home, this helped her to take care of her children while they helped her to take care of the clients. Her business has been in existence since more than nine years ago, she started it with $600 from her savings and some help from her older children while they were still single. Her business was originally made by wood and plastic, but she has slowly made some improvements. She still needs more infrastructure for her business to be able to protect her merchandise and get more products. She has been working with CEPRODEL for two years and her daily sales are approximately $35.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva volunteer

Esta señora es madre soltera y jefa de familia con un total de seis hijos todos casados y con hijos, a los cuales ella apoya con sus gastos y tiene directamente a su cargo a dos nietos, los cuales le acompañan y a los cuales ella paga su alimentación y sus estudios por medio de los ingresos de su negocio.

Esta señora ha desarrollado diferentes actividades para ganarse la vida. Antes de tener este negocio tenía una pulpería en su casa lo cual le permitía cuidar de sus hijos, ellos le ayudaban a atender a los clientes. El puesto tiene más de nueve años de existir, el cual inicia con un capital inicial de aproximadamente US$ 600.00 aportado de sus ahorros y con el apoyo de sus hijos mayores cuando aún estaban solteros. El local inicial estaba elaborado de madera y plástico, aunque esta señora ha venido realizando mejoras paulatinas al local, aún necesita proporcionar a su negocio mejoras de infraestructura para proteger la mercadería y mayor surtido de productos. Tiene más de 2 años de trabajar con CEPRODEL y sus ventas diarias son de aproximadamente US$ 35 dólares.
loan_use: Compra de mercaderia para surtir y actualizar inventario

description:
Floricelda is married and has two children, who are both school age and are are studying. For more than 17 years she has had a small grocery store located in the Santa Ana Market in the city of Chinandega. She began it with a capital of $80.00 and sold sweets and a few basic grains.

In addition to the grocery store, and because her house is located in this important market, she also has a small shop where she sells sodas, for which there is good demand. Floricelda, apart from providing for her children, also takes care of her parents who are elderly and unable to work. He husband helps her with sales in both the grocery store and the soda shop, which operate in the same place. Both businesses are modest and are this humble family’s source of income. She has been working with CEPRODEL for more than three years and has a very good credit record.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Esta señora es casada con dos hijos los cuales están edad escolar y se encuentran estudiando. Desde hace más de 17 años posee una pequeña pulpería ubicada en el Mercado Santa Ana de la ciudad de Chinandega, el cual inicio con un modesto capital de US$ 80.00 dólares vendiendo golosinas y algunos granos básicos.

\r\nAdemás de la pulpería y por encontrarse su vivienda en este importante centro de compras, opera una pequeña refresquería con muy buena demanda. Doña Floricelda, además de hacerse cargo de sus hijos, tiene a su cargo a sus padres, los cuales están ya ancianos e imposibilitados para trabajar. Su esposo le ayuda con la venta tanto de la pulpería como de la refresquería que opera en el mismo lugar. Ambos negocios son modestos y constituyen el sostén de esta humilde familia. Tiene más de 3 años de trabajar con CEPRODEL con muy buen record crediticio.
loan_use: To buy merchandise for a small grocery store

description:
Ceberina is a hard-working mother of five. Every day she rises early to bake the delicious bread her community enjoys for breakfast. With the family's help, it is distributed to retailers throughout the city. The business is going well, but the family pays a lot of money for rent. They would like to buy their own space for the bakery and a small shop and are working very hard to save up towards this goal. Let us help Ceberina make this dream a reality.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

\r\n\r\nLa señora Ceberina es una diligente madre de familia, que diariamente se ocupa de brindar y satisfacer a su comunidad con sus deliciosos panes, los cuales son infaltables para un buen desayuno, dedicándose así mismo a las responsabilidades que demanda ser madre de 5 hijos.Diariamente empieza sus labores muy de madrugada junto a su familia, para la preparación de los panes, los cuales elabora de un modo muy especial, para después distribuirlos por todas las bodegas de la ciudad; el negocio marcha bien, sin embargo la carencia de un local propio hace que tengan que pagar una suma de dinero muy grande por el alquiler del local.Por esta razón desea tener un local propio donde trabajar tranquilamente y empezar a ahorrar para poder abrir más adelante una pequeña bodega con la que seguirá apoyando a sus hijos que se han convertido en su fuente de motivación. Ayudemos a que doña Ceberina haga sus sueño realidad
loan_use: To help a family of bakers open their own shop.

description:
Martha runs a small grains store located in the market inside León's old train station. She ran a convenience store out of her home for a number of years, but due to low sales she was forced to look for other options. After a lot of hard work she got the opportunity to get this simple stand in the popular market about six years ago. Because of low capital, it was very difficult for her at first because her earnings were insufficient to buy her own food and for a time she was malnourished.

This humble business has allowed Martha to support her husband and educate her children. Her husband works as a security guard at city hall, but his salary is insufficient to cover all the family's needs. She has three children, two of whom are in high school and one in elementary school. After years of very hard work she was able to get her own home. Rosa and her family continue their "fight" to improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Esta señora posee un pequeño negocio de abarrotería (Venta de granos básicos), ubicado en el mercado de la antigua estación del ferrocarril de la ciudad de León. Ella trabajó por varios años con una pulpería en su casa de habitación y ante las bajas ventas le sobrevino la necesidad de buscar otras opciones de trabajo o negocio presentándose luego de mucho sacrificio la oportunidad de obtener este sencillo local a manera de caseta en este populoso mercado desde hace 6 años aproximadamente y por ser un capital reducido al principio fue muy difícil porque lo que vendía no le alcanzaba ni para su propia comida y en ocasiones no se alimentaba bien.

Este humilde negocio le ha permitido apoyar a su esposo en la formación y educación académica de sus hijos. Su esposo trabaja como guarda de seguridad en la alcaldía de León, en donde el salario no le permite por sí solo solventar todas las necesidades de su familia. Ella tiene un total de tres hijos, de los cuales dos estudian en secundaria y uno en primaria. Tras el esfuerzo de muchos años logra obtener su humilde vivienda. Ella junto a su familia continúa su lucha (expresa ella) por sobrevivir y por buscar la mejoría de su familia.
loan_use: Purchase rice, corn, beans, etc.

description:
Muhabbat M., 40, a professional seamstress by training, is married and has 4 children. She lives in Kurgan-Tube. Muhabbat sells clothing for children at the town’s central market, where she rents a trading spot. Muhabbat has been selling for 5 years. In preparation for the Fall season, Muhabbat plans to use this loan to purchase a large quantity of seasonal clothing. She buys her inventory at a wholesale market in Dushanbe, which is located 100 km away from Kurgan-Tube. Muhabbat sells at the lowest prices making her products more attractive to low-income customers. Muhabbat plans to repay this loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Мирзоева Мухаббат, возраст – 40 лет, образование среднее техническое, по профессии – портниха, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Живет в городе Курган-Тюбе. Мухаббат занимается торговлей детскими вещами, для этого она арендует торговую точку на Центральном рынке города Курган-Тюбе. Этим бизнесом она занимается уже в течение 5 лет. Так как начинается осенний сезон клиент на полученный кредит хочет приобрести новый ассортимент товара в большом количестве, чтобы часто не ездить за товаром. Клиент приобретает товар на оптовом рынке в городе Душанбе, который находится в 100 км от города Курган-Тюбе. Привозя товар она продает его по более низким ценам в отличие от своих конкурентов. Таким образом Мухаббат дает возможность местным жителям приобрести товар по более низким ценам, что делает ее товар более доступным для людей с низким уровнем дохода \r\nКлиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.
loan_use: To purchase new inventory of clothing

description: This 30 year old woman, mother of four children, operates a women’s clothing stand in her house. She started that business eight years ago, so as to support the family’s needs. Her husband is currently unemployed. María Martha buys the clothing in Santo Domingo, the capital, as well as in Santiago, a province located in the northern center of the country. Currently, María Martha is short of supplies in stock. She is requesting a loan to replenish her business with bulk clothing, needed to satisfy an increase in her usual demand, as well as some new customers she expects to gain with diversified stock of clothing material.
loan_use: Purchase bulk clothing, as there is a perceived increase in demand for this cloth in the local market.

description: Mrs. Bol S. R., age 55, works grinding beans by hand and selling the shelled beans to members of her community, earning about $10 per day in revenue. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver who earns around $4 per day. They have seven children, three who work in a garment factory earning around $2 per day each, one who is a motor-taxi driver, and three who are students. She would like to request a loan of $1,200 in order to purchase a grinding mill to more quickly grind the shells off the beans and increase her output of product to meet customer demand. This will increase her income and help her fund her children’s education and increase the standard of living for her family.
loan_use: To purchase a grinding mill to shell beans.

description: Mrs. Tuy S., age 47, is a widow who sells rice at a busy market, making about $10 per day in revenue. Her two children are bakers, making bread at a nearby bakery store. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to purchase rice in bulk, which will lower her cost per kilo of rice and increase her inventory to meet customer demand. The greater margins will increase her income, which will raise the standard of living for her family and provide savings in case of an emergency.
loan_use: To purchase rice in bulk for resale.

description: Mrs. Elizabeth A. buys snails, fruits and foodstuff and sells it to people in the City. She started this business in 2001. This was a business she learned from her mother. She is 30 years old, married with two children, and lives in Benin City. According to her if the loan of $425 is given to her, it will enable her to buy snails, fruit and foodstuff to sell.
loan_use: Elizabeth would like to buy more snails, fruits & foodstuff to sell.

description: Mr. Borniface M. is 46 years old, is married with two children, and deals in foodstuffs and drinks. He lives in Benin, in Edo State. He is requesting a loan amount of $550 to buy more foodstuffs, provisions & drinks to sell at his market. He has been in LAPO for a year and in business since 1996.
loan_use: To buy more foodstuffs, provisions & drinks

description:
Gladys L. C. belongs to the village bank called “Solución,” which is a Spanish word meaning “solution.”

Gladys and her husband are in the type of business known in Spanish as “vender por campañas,” which directly translates into “selling through campaigns.” What this means is that they vary the types of products they sell according to the season and the demand. For example, in September they sell back-to-school supplies to families. When it is time to begin planting a new crop, they sell fertilizer to farmers, and during the Christmas season, they sell decorations. Gladys and her husband sell the majority of their products in “ferias,” or large, open-air markets in the countryside. Sometimes they must travel many hours outside of Ayacucho.

Gladys began with just a small supply of “abarrotes,” which is the name given to the general supply of a variety of bulk food products. These Gladys continues to sell year round. This was twelve years ago, and today Gladys is the owner of a thriving business that has branched out into several different markets. It is a dynamic way to do business, however, Gladys says it is the best way to earn the highest returns. Eventually, Gladys would like to enter the construction market, selling different types of materials to a variety of companies.

Within her village bank, Gladys says she feels like she has a second family. She says it is an incredible resource for women, and the savings aspect has helped her in constructing her very own house where she and her two children, ages ten and two, live. It has also helped her save enough money to buy a van that she and her family are able to use to take their large amounts of goods for sale to the "ferias". Gladys is asking for a $400 loan, with which she will be able to buy a large supply of fertilizer to sell.
loan_use: o buy a large supply of fertilizer for re-sale

description:
Married and father of 5 children, Mr. Yaovi Richard S. is 44 years old and lives in Amégnran, the village where he was born. A trained carpenter, he owns his own carpentry shop, "Lom Nava Dynamique". The quality of his work earns him a good reputation in his area, and the earnings from his shop are used to support his family. However, the regularity of this income depends on a steady supply of wood and on having modern tools and machines so that he can fill orders in a timely fashion.

For this reason, Mr. S. is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase wood and appropriate tools and machines. This will allow him to be certain of a steady income so that he can better cater for the needs of his family and improve their standard of living.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Marié et père de cinq (05) enfants, Monsieur S. Yaovi Richard est âgé de 44 ans et réside à Amégnran, son village natal. Menuisier de profession, il est maître de la menuiserie « LOM NAVA DYNAMIQUE ». La qualité de ses ouvrages lui confère une bonne réputation dans sa localité. Le revenu tiré de ses prestations de service lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Mais aussi, la stabilité de ce revenu dépend elle de la disponibilité des bois d’œuvre et de machines modernes afin de pouvoir satisfaire à temps voulu les demandes. C’est ainsi que Monsieur S. sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour acheter du bois d’œuvre et des machines appropriées. Ceci lui permettra de stabiliser et de sécuriser son revenu pour mieux répondre aux besoins primaires de sa famille et d’en améliorer ses conditions de vie.
loan_use:
Purchase of wood and tools

Achat de bois et de machines

description: Mrs. Huy I., age 21, is a housewife. Her husband sells sand and stone for construction, earning about $10 per day in revenue. They have one child, who is very young. In order to expand her husband's business and increase the volume of materials sold, she would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase a truck to transport the construction materials. This will allow hI. to fulfill larger orders and increase sales volume. They plan to use the additional income to reinvest in his business and save money for their child’s education.
loan_use: To purchase a truck to deliver construction materials.

description: Mrs. Chy H., age 50, works with her husband on their farmland to grow and sell rice, crops, beans, and vegetables, earning about $2 each day. They have seven children: some who are farmers and some who are students. She would like to request a loan of $1200 in order to purchase rice, seeds, beans, and fertilizer to expand their crops yields and therefore increase their revenue. They plan to use the resulting income to reinvest in their farm and help finance their children’s education.
loan_use: To purchase rice, seeds, beans, and fertilizer

description:
Kossi A. was born in 1976 in Lomé (Golfe Prefecture). He is married and the father of two. Not having been fortunate enough to continue his schooling, he very early on entered an apprenticeship. Lacking the financial support, he dropped out to be a moto taxi (zémidjan) driver in order to support his family. His plan is to have the funds to acquire his own moto, so that he can avoid excessive exploitation and to have the peace of mind to support his family in a positive way. He is requesting a loan of $900 to buy a moto and also to cover the licensing costs. This will then bring in added income and enable this gentleman to provide for the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur Kossi A., né en 1976 à Lomé dans la préfecture du Golfe est marié et père de deux (02) enfants. N’ayant pas eu la chance de continuer ses études, il s’est lancé très tôt dans l’apprentissage et par manque de support, il s’en va conduire taxi-moto (zémidjan) afin de subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Son projet est d’avoir un fonds pour acquérir lui-même une moto propre afin d’éviter la surexploitation et avoir un esprit tranquille pour supporter favorablement sa famille. Monsieur Kossi A. sollicite $900, un fonds qui servira à l’achat de moto et également faire les formalités pour l’immatriculation. Ce qui apportera un revenu supplémentaire et permettra à ce monsieur de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
loan_use: To buy a moto taxi for transportation

description:
After struggling for a long time in Veracruz, Reyna H. and her husband decided to move to Reynosa for a better future for themselves and their four children. With all of their hearts, they wanted to bring up their children to be good people. In the outskirts of the city, Reyna bought used clothing from the USA to resell in Reynosa. She initially bought few articles of clothing by pounds, but after seeing the business was profitable, she started to buy merchandise in bulk. However, she had to attend to her children, which threw her business off-balance.

Currently, she needs more capital to stock up on clothing. She is seeking a loan of $750, which she will repay in installments over 6 months. The loan will be used to buy clothing for the upcoming cold season, which is when she has the most sales. With your help, Reyna will be able to buy the necessary merchandise to stock up and celebrate the Christmas festivities.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Después de luchar largo tiempo en Veracruz, Reyna H. y su esposo decidieron mudarse a Reynosa para buscar un mejor futuro para ellos y sus cuatro hijos que desean de todo corazón se conviertan en unos hombres de bien. Por la cercanía de la frontera de Reyna comenzó a comprar ropa usada en USA para revenderla en Reynosa, comprando por libras, después en la medida en que el negocio le estaba dando ganancias empezaron a comprar su mercancía en pacas de ropa, sin embargo las necesidades de sus hijos han desequilibrado el negocio.

Hoy en día necesitan más capital para surtir su mercancía que les hace falta por lo tanto está solicitando un crédito de US $750 para pagar en un plazo de 6 meses, y con ese dinero poder comprar mercancía de temporada ya que muy pronto se acerca el frió y es cuando tienen más venta. Con tu ayuda Reyna podrá comprar lo necesario para surtirse y con ese dinero celebrar unas fiestas navideñas felices.
loan_use: buy clothing to sell during the Christmas season

description:
Mrs. Amélie G. was born on 5 October 1972 in Amégnra. She lives in Lomé, where she works as a seamstress. Unmarried with one (01) child, she abandoned her studies in primary school due to a lack of support, and began as an apprentice seamstress to be able to support herself. Today, she has mastered her profession, but does not have the necessary means to open a workshop, which means she works at her home. She is asking for a loan of $400 to buy sewing machines and outfit her workshop to attract more customers, since it will soon be festival season.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame G. Amélie est née le 5 Octobre 1972 à Amégnra. Elle réside à Lomé où elle exerce son métier de couture. Célibataire avec un (01) enfant, elle a abandonné ses études dès les cours primaires faute de manque du support, et elle s’est lancée dans l’apprentissage de couture pour pouvoir se prendre en charge. Aujourd’hui, maîtresse de son métier, mais n’a pas les moyens nécessaires pour ouvrir un atelier ce qui fait qu’elle s’exerce à la maison. Elle sollicite un crédit d’un montant de $400 pour payer les machines à coudre et aménager son atelier pour attirer plus de clientèle car bientôt c’est la période des fêtes.
loan_use: To buy sewing machines

description: Mrs. Nkechi E. is 30 years old and lives in Asaba, Delta State. She sells frozen meat to people, and is requesting a loan of $400 to buy more meat (beef) for sale. She is married with 2 children, and learned her business from her husband. She has 3 years of experience in this business and is a LAPO client .
loan_use: To buy more meat for sale

description: Mrs. Cordilia O. is 43 years old. She is married with 4 children. She sells foodstuffs and soup supplies, by first going to the village to buy and then selling to people in the city. She lives in Asaba, Delta State. She has been with LAPO for 8 years and has run her business since 1991. She needs $800 to buy more foodstuffs for sale.
loan_use: To buy more foodstuffs & soup supplies

description:
Eladio is a selfless father and son. He works hard to provide for his aging mother and his family. For the last 12 years he and his family have made ornamental pottery to sell in markets around the country. Through his labors he has given the family a good home. He would like to continue to expand his production and especially to begin to export his products. He is asking for a loan to buy clay and firewood and promises to repay it within seven months. Your help can make his dream a reality.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Eladio es un abnegado padre y ejemplar hijo, que lucha por brindarle lo mejor a su anciana madre y a su querida familia. Desde hace más de 12 años está dedicado junto a su familia a las labores artesanas y realiza trabajos decorativos en grandes cantidades utilizando como materia prima para la elaboración de estos trabajos la arcilla para luego comercializarlos en los diferentes mercados de las ciudades de su país, gracias a su desempeño ha podido brindar estabilidad económica a su hogar.Mantiene el deseo de seguir expandiendo la venta de sus productos y sobre todo de exportar su mercadería al exterior, para esto requiere de un préstamo que invertirá en comprar más cantidad de arcilla y leña insumos necesarios para la elaboración de sus trabajos. Así mismo se compromete a retornar el préstamo en un lapso de 7 meses. Vuestra ayuda posibilitará la cristalización de este anhelo.
loan_use: To buy clay and fuel for making ornamental pottery.

description: Metanet H. is a  31-year-old woman who owns  poultry and sells it to the local people and bazaar traders . Metanet lives with her husband and three childfren in Bilasuvar in the the southern region of Azerbaijan. She is an internally displaced person who fled from Jabrail to Bilasuvar during the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993.  Metanet has five years of experience, however it is the only source of income in her family and it is very hard for Metanet and her husband to cover all the family 's needs. Sometimes they have a very hard time, when they do not have any food at all, beside the poultry they sell.  Metanet has decided to purchase a diverse number of poultry which will help her to increase turn-over of her sales. For this purpose she has applied for 1000 USD to purchase more and diverse poultry.
loan_use: Going to purchase divers poultry

description: Ilham Q. is a 48-year-old butcher who sells meat in the local bazaar of the Imishli region. He lives in Imishli with his family and has  owned his business since 1996. First he was raising and selling meat to the local bazaar traders, and later he opened his own store where he cut and sold meat. He has many regular clients. The money IIham earns from selling is enough tonly to cover family needs and his working place is not very good. His place of working is very small, damp and dark. He would like to improve his working conditions and for this purpose he applied for 800 USD. This loan will help him to repair his small shop. He believes good conditions in his working place will help him to attract more clients and generally improve his business.
loan_use: Going to repair his butcher shop

description:
Nataliya has a small business selling women’s coats and shoes at a busy market in Pavlograd, Ukraine. She decided to start her own business because of a low salary at her previous job. In business now for ten years, she makes about $400 in profit per month. Nataliya sells products that are in good demand in Ukraine. This past year she decided to diversify her inventory and increase her income by selling shoes. Nataliya and her husband Alexander have two daughters. One daughter was married not long ago. Nataliya would like to use some of her income to help them buy a place to live.

\r\n\r\nNataliya has requested a loan of $1200 to purchase new inventory. As the cold season approaches, this loan will help her increase her profits and be prepared for a busy time of year.
loan_use: Purchase new inventory

description:
Mrs. Thek K. L., aged 50, works with her husband running a battery charging business. She charges batteries such as vehicle batteries and earns about $7.30 per day. They have three children, one who is a goldsmith and two are married and live separately with their own families.

\r\nShe would like to request a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for her family’s transportation. Mrs Thek's husband is pictured in the photo in front of their shop as she was not available at the time the photo was being taken.
loan_use: To purchase a motorbike to use for the family's transportation.

description:
Halid Mirzoeyv was born in 1985. He lives in the city of Agsu. He is married and has a child. He is a highly-skilled barber and has been working in this business for four years. He wants to buy new equipment for his barber shop. He seeks to obtain a loan from the Agsun branch of Normico to purchase a generator and other electrical equipment.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Мирзоев Халид 1965 года рождения. Родилсья и проживает в городе Ахсу. Семейный, имеет одного ребенка. Этот прекрасный мастер уже четвертый год подряд работает в этой сфере. Халид хотел купить новые оборудование для своей мастерской. Он взял кредит в Нормикро Ахсуниского филиала. Купил генератор и другие электротовары.
loan_use: For procurement of equipment

description:
Sra. Elida P. is 56 years old living in Benjamín Aceval, Paraguay. She has two children. One of her children is married. The other is 15 years old and lives at home while attending high school. Elida pays for her education. Elida sells fruits and vegetables on a rolling cart that she was able to obtain bit by bit through much hard work and sacrifice. Before she had this cart she used a metal basket, which she had attached to motorcycle wheels. Elida is able to sell many fruits and vegetables, and is always warm and optimistic with her customers.

Elida also runs a small kiosk out of her house, which she established after the death of her husband. Her daughter takes care of the kiosk while Elida is selling her fruits and vegetables around the neighborhood. When her daughter is at school Elida returns to her house to manage the kiosk as well as take care of household chores. Elida has an indomitable spirit that allows her to move forward and succeed in her life. Other than the money she earns from selling her fruit and through the kiosk, she also receives a monthly stipend of $58, which was allotted to her due to the death of her husband. Elida wishes to enlarge her stock and activities by purchasing various items for her store.
loan_use: Purchase merchandise including: Fruit, vegetables, rice, sugar, herbs, noodles, cookies, cigarettes, spices and others.

description:
Sr. Inocencio A. is 48 years old and lives in Benjamín Aceval, Paraguay, with his wife, Jorgina Garay, 54. The couple has three children, two of which live with them while attending school. 
Inocencio sells fruits and vegetables in a unique way. Ever since 1986, bicycle has been his sole means of transportation. Every day early in the morning, Inocencio bikes to the city of V. Hayes, where he meets with merchants and other regular clients. They depend on Inocencio for daily fresh fruits and vegetables. 
Inocencio also supplies the markets of Clorinda, Rca., Argentina, with his produce. He travels there in the afternoon four times a week and returns later, ready to begin his journey again the following day. The sacrifice he makes by making this long journey on a routine basis is worthwile, since fruit and vegetable sales is Inocencio's sole work and source of income. 
Sr. Inocencio has asked for a small credit of US$225 to allow him to buy more and better quality produce to respond to his loyal clients' needs.
loan_use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables for sale

description:
Josefina is requesting her sixth loan! She has made remarkable strides in improving her business, and also in improving the health and welfare of her children. Her goal is to keep working harder and harder in the future, and to keep advancing forward.

She is asking for this loan so that she can build a cement counter top in her store, and make it more attractive and clean for her customers. She has also recently started selling calling cards for the local telecommunications company, Claro—she plans to use part of the loan to continue purchasing these cards.

Josefina is very thankful that she is being given another chance to improve her life, and on behalf of her children and family, wants everyone to know that she is very thankful for this loan.

Josefina is part of the solidarity group, Miramar Feminina #5. The loan requested will be divided among the group members listed here, and each member will be jointly liable for their peers' repayments.
loan_use: Purchase additional inventory items and invest in supplies to improve her store
borrower_names: Rosa, Angela, Josefina, Floretina, Angela, Maria, Yenny
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Luz is a single mother of six and currently living with one of her daughters who is pursuing a career in education at the university. Despite having been left alone to raise six small children, Luz never lost hope of improving their lives and of dedicating herself to some endeavor that would help to support them all and secure their educations. She decided to focus on making local crafts, learning from her mother what a great art form this could be. This became her passion, and the means by which she could better her family’s quality of life. She travels to many places to market her products, supported in her endeavor at home by her daughter. She has generated earnings by taking the products around with her to sell, or to exchange for other goods with the farmers she meets in her travels. With the growth of her business, Luz is hoping to create more opportunities to increase sales by making more crafts and purchasing clothing to offer for sale. She is looking for a loan to make her plans into reality.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Luz es madre soltera y tuvo seis hijos, actualmente vive con una D. sus hijas, que esta cursando la carrera D. educación en la universidad, a pesar D. haberse quedado sola cuando sus hijos aún eran pequeños jamás perdió las esperanzas D. sobresalir y desempeñarse satisfactoriamente en alguna actividad para generarles bienestar y educación.Decidió dedicarse a la elaboración D. artículos artesanales aprendiendo D. su mamá este bello arte. Convirtiéndose en lo que sería su pasión y fuente D. trabajo con que el que pudo sacar adelante a su familia; ella actualmente trabaja viajandopermanentemente por los ríos, chacras y por la carretera ofertando sus productos, mientras que en su casa es la hija quién la apoya en la elaboración D. los productos, convirtiéndose en un elemento D. gran ayuda para ella; paralelamente lleva consigo mercadería para vender o canjearlas por animales que puedan ofrecer los moradores D. las chacras, generando una muy buena fuente D. ingresos para su hogar.Como se le presentan las oportunidades D. aumentar sus ventas gracias a las novedades que ofrece se encuentra en la necesidad D. producir más artículos y D. paso comprar ropa para ofertarla y así seguir trabajando.Solicita un préstamo con el objetivo D. concretar sus planes y ayudar con el término D. su carrera D. su gran socia.
loan_use: Purchase accessories for crafts/clothing.

description:
Mr. Antonio C. is 45 years old, and married with two children. He is the owner of a tire repair shop in Caacupé, Paraguay. In addition to tires, his shop also does minor repairs and sells a variety of tires of various sizes and other hardware for automobiles. His business is located in a busy commercial zone, and because of this he is able to attract many customers. Antonio has been dedicated to his business for 12 years. He is thankful to have a job, which earns him enough money to take care of his family and educate his children.

The loan he has asked for would go towards buying more tires for his shop. He has been presented with the opportunity to acquire a larger quantity of tires at very low prices. However, in order to be able to buy this quantity right now he will need to secure a loan. The added inventory at lower costs will allow him to attract more customers and grow his business. His ultimate goal is to expand his business enough to be able to sell a greater variety of items in his store.
loan_use: To buy tires

description:
Ketut Sumarmi and her husband Ketut Wiana comes from Manistutu village. She has a 6-year-old son called I Putu Diva who is now studying in kindergarten. She raises and breeds pig. Although she doesn't have a pigpen and can only raise the pig traditionally, she wasn't discouraged at all to start this business. Her pig just gave birth to 10 piglets 2 weeks ago. Every day she takes care of the piglets. The food mixtures that she gave to the pig consist of fine rice chaff, concentrate, and mineral so that the milk quality is good. After 2 months, the piglets can be sold for Rp. 250,000 (about $27) per piglet so she can earn Rp. 2,500,000 (about $276). As the food expense was Rp. 500,000, the net profit was Rp. 1,500,000 (about $166). She hopes to buy 1 more female pig.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Ketut Sumarmi dan suaminya Ketut Wiana berasal dari desa Manistutu. Ketut Sumarmi memiliki 1 orang anak yang diberi nama I Putu Diva baru berumur 6 tahun dan sekarang baru bersekolah di TK. Ketut Sumarni saat ini memelihara babi penginduk.Walaupun belum memiliki kandang dan hanya memelihara secara tradisional, tidak membuat Ketut Sumarmi putus asa untuk memelihara induk babi. Saat ini induk babi Ketut Sumarmi memiliki anak 10 ekor baru melahirkan 2 minggu yang lalu. Setiap hari Ketut Sumarmi memperhatikan perkembangan dari semua anak babinya. Adapun campuran makanan yang diberi Ketut Sumarmi seperti dedak padi yang halus, konsentrat dan mineral susu supaya air susu induknya bagus. Umur 2 bulan 10 ekor anak babi ini akan siap dijual dengan harga 1 ekornya Rp.250.000,- jadi uang yang didapat nanti Rp.2.500.000,-. Sedangkan pengeluaran pakan sampai dijual menghabiskan biaya Rp. 500.000,-. Keuntungan bersih yang didapat Ketut Sumarmi setiap panen sebesar Rp.1.500.000,-. Harapan Ketut Sumarmi supaya bisa membeli 1 ekor lagi induk babi.
loan_use: To purchase female pig and pig food

description:
Several families live together in our house, and between all of us we share one outhouse. The hygienic conditions of the bathroom are not very appropriate, so I would like to install a new bathroom for my family and thereby avoid infections. I am asking for $600 dollars in order to build a new bathroom for my house.\r\n

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

\r\nVivimos varias familias y entre todas tenemos que compartir un baño de pozo, pero las condiciones higiénicas del baño no son muy apropiadas así es que me gustaría instalar un baño nuevo solo para mi familia y así evitar infecciones. Solicito $ 600.00 dlls para la construcción de un baño nuevo para mi vivienda..
loan_use: Bathroom Construction

description:
Flor separated from her husband and currently lives with her eldest daughter. After the separation, she decided to open a tire repair shop in the outskirts of the city. She thought it was a good business venture, but things did not turn out as she had expected.

Flor decided to try another business idea and opened a general store/catering service in her home. Her daughter is studying to obtain a technical degree in IT and also helps her mother with the store. Sales are good, especially on weekends because their shop is located in the main square of her neighborhood and she wishes to increase her product range to meet the demands of the clients who visit the town square after sunset.

Flor is requesting a $1200 loan to increase her stock. Let´s make a contribution so this hard working single mom can achieve her aspirations.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.< Flor vive sólo con su última hija; a raíz de la separación de su esposo, se dedicó a crear su propio negocio e instaló con mucho entusiasmo una vulcanizadota en las afueras de la ciudad creyendo que daría resultado sin embargo la realidad fue otra, abandonó su propósito y surgió en ella otra idea y aperturó una bodega en casa paralelamente incursionó en la preparación y venta de comida regional como actividad secundaria para percibir ingresos extras siempre contando con la ayuda de su hija que aparte de colaborar se encuentra estudiando la carrera técnica de computación e informática en un instituto de formación profesional de su ciudad.Por la aceptación y las buenas ventas, en especial los fines de semana, que obtiene flor debido a que su bodega esta al frente de la plaza en el barrio que habita, se encuentra en la necesidad de aumentar sus productos, para poder atender la demanda de sus clientes que salen a recrearse a la plaza diariamente cuando cae el sol.La suma que solicita flor para cubrir las necesidades y poder tener los productos en stock es de 1200 dólares.Contribuyamos para que esta afanosa madre pueda alcanzar lo que se propone.
loan_use: Purchase stock to increase product offer

description: Mrs. Batai T. is 46 years old and lives in Dhalko in the Kathmandu district. She lives with her husband, Mr. Kainla T., and two sons. Her husband is a laborer and does house construction work. Her sons are studying in primary and pre-primary school.\r\nMrs. T. sells green vegetables in a footpath market. Their family condition is so miserable that they can hardly solve their hand-to-mouth problem. So she sells vegetables in the footpath to overcome this condition.\r\nNow she is asking for her first loan of Rs10, 000 (US$175) to buy vegetables.
loan_use: To buy vegetables

description:
The women of Nacoj are very enterprising and dynamic. What is more, they have an immense knowledge about Mayan crafts. Many of them are specialists in the meaning of the designs and colors that the Mayans use in the traditional clothing of the Chimaltenango region.

Since they were children, all of the members of this group have cultivated the art of traditional weaving. It is for this reason that they feel so confident about starting a business of traditional weaving, as they know the art like the palms of their hands. In total, the group is requesting a loan of $2,631, each woman receiving between $132 and $263 in six installments. This means that the women in the group will have the same business capacity, as the amount is similar for each.

The majority of the women in the group work making, selling, and reselling traditional weavings such as huipiles (traditional clothing of indigenous Guatemalan women), cortes (traditional skirts), tablecloths and napkins. Thus, they will use their loans to buy merchandise wholesale in order to resell it in the villages and markets of Chimaltenango, and to buy raw materials to weave their traditional products. Nonetheless, Mrs. María Lucia E. Tu has a bicycle repair shop. She is going to need her loan to buy spare parts. María B. has a tortillería (store that sells tortillas) and she needs the money to continue buying corn to make tortillas.

The dream of these craftswomen is to find a market for crafts abroad. They would like to be able to export their beautiful and well-developed products abroad. In addition, they have the desire to give a better future to their children. Ligia Verónica Sanjak C. said, “I would like a better education for my children so they will be able to have a better future.” Friendship Bridge is committed to giving these women a better future, but we can’t do it without your support.

Note: Due to health problems, one of the clients could not appear in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Las mujeres de Nacoj son muy emprendedoras y dinámicas. Además, tienen un conocimiento sobre la artesanía Maya inmenso. Muchas de ellas son especialistas en el significado de los diseños y colores que los Mayas utilizan en los trajes típicos de la región de Chimaltenango.

Desde niñas todas las integrantes de este grupo han cultivado el arte del tejido típico. Es por eso, que se sienten tan confiadas de empezar un negocio de tejido típico, ya que conocen el arte como la palma de su mano. En total el grupo está pidiendo un préstamo de US$2631 y el rango de préstamos por señora es de US$132 hasta US$263 a un plazo de seis cuotas. Eso significa que las señoras dentro del grupo tienen la misma capacidad empresarial ya que el préstamo es similar.

La gran mayoría de señoras dentro del grupo trabajan produciendo, vendiendo y revendiendo tejidos típicos como huipiles (traje típico de las mujeres indígenas Guatemaltecas), cortes (falda típica), manteles y servilletas. Por ende, sus préstamos los van a utilizar para comprar mercadería al por mayor para revenderla en sus aldeas y en el mercado de Chimaltenango y para comprar materia prima para tejer los productos típicos. Sin embargo, doña María Lucia E. Tu tiene un taller de bicicletas. Ella va a necesitar su préstamo para comprar repuestos. María B. tiene una tortillería y ella necesita el dinero para seguir comprando maíz para preprar tortillas.

El sueño de estas señoras artesanas es de encontrar un mercado de artesanías en el exterior. Ellas quieren ser capaces de exportar sus bellos y bien desarrollados productos al exterior. También, ellas tienen la ambición de brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Ligia Verónica Sanjak C. dijo: “A mi me gustaría una mejor educación para mis hijos ya que de esa manera ellos van a tener un mejor futuro”. Friendship Bridge está comprometido a darles a estas señoras un mejor futuro, solo nos falta tu apoyo.

Nota: Debido problemas de salud una de las clientas no pudo estar en la foto.
loan_use: Buy traditional clothing at wholesale price to resell in distant villages and in the Chimaltenango market.  Buy raw materials to weave traditional clothing which will be sold in the market along with napkins and tablecloths.
borrower_names: Ligia, María, María, Herlinda, Marcelina, María, María, María, María, Silvestra, Viviana
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
florinda has 3 children. She is not officially married. But she lives with a man who is the father of their 3 children. Florinda's husband is not employed. He lives from small jobs and the machamba (small agricultural field). Florinda is joining the credit program now. She lives in Chasson, a location along the national highway no. 1. In addition to the business, she works with her husband in the field, sometimes selling vegetables that she grows in her small field. Florinda's children are studying in primary school. In the future, she wants to build a house from conventional materials.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Florinda tem 3 filhos. Ela nao e casada oficialmente. Mas vive com um homem que e o pai de seus 3 filhos. O marido de Florinda nao esta empregado. Vive de pequenos expedientes e machamba. Florinda esta entrando agorea parao programa de credito. Ela vive em Chissano uma localidade ao longo da estrad nacional nr. 1. Para alem do negoci ela tambem trabalha com o marido na machamba, dai vender algumas vezes verduras que ela tira de sua pequena machamba. Os filhos de Florinda estao a estudar no ensin Basico. No futuro ela quer construir uma casa de material convencional.
loan_use: Florinda wants to use the loan to buy more clothes to sell

description:
Ena is a hard-working mother that got into the world of natural medicine as a result of the difficult illness from which her youngest child suffers, diabetes. She began her voyage by attending training talks, given by respected professionals, about the goodness of specific products native to their countries, capable of returning the health and well-being of those who consume them appropriately. Absorbed with a lot of information, and with the little savings that she had, she decided to aquire specific products to provide to the general public. In the beginning and because of the lack of knowledge of these natural products, she had a certain difficulty; however, gradually, the sales from these products became her primary source of income.

In this way and thanks to her hard work, she is contributing to the improvement of the quality of life of her humble home. Because of the great acceptance (of the products) and because her clientele is constantly growing, she has an urgent need to buy more products. To carry out the fulfillment her goals, she's asking for a loan of $425, which she will repay in 6 months, which will permit her to lay the foundation of her business. Through your help, we will make it possible to fulfill this desire.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Ena, es una diligente madre que incursionó en el mundo de la medicina natural a raíz de la delicada enfermedad que padece el menor de sus hijos, diabetes. Inició su travesía asistiendo a las charlas de capacitación que otorgaban profesionales respecto a las bondades de determinado productos oriundos de su país, capaces de devolverle la salud y bienestar a quién las consume adecuadamente.Empapada de mucha información, con los pequeños ahorros que tenia decidió adquirir determinados productos para ofrecerlos al público en general, a principio y debido a la poca difusión de estos preparados naturales tuvo cierta dificultad; sin embargo paulatinamente se fue convirtiendo en su principal fuente de ingresos. De esta manera y gracias a su desempeño contribuye a incrementar el nivel de vida de su humilde hogar.Por la gran aceptación y la cartera de clientes en constante crecimiento, se encuentra en la apremiante necesidad de comprar más productos. Para llevar a cabo el cumplimiento de sus metas esta solicitando 425 dólares en calidad de préstamo con un periodo de devolución de seis meses, que le permitirá la cimentación de su negocio.A través de vuestro apoyo posibilitaremos el cumplimiento de este anhelo.
loan_use: The purchase of Natural Products to increase her sales.

description:
Juanita is a very likeable, charming, and intelligent person.  She’s got a terrific sense of humor.  Her constantly smiling face makes her look younger than her 46 years.  She has ten children.  The two eldest live in Santo Domingo, the capital. Her husband is a self-employed radio technician.

Juana runs a ‘ventorillo’ ( a small business stand) that she opened six months ago with a loan she took from our organization.  That business has been very successful, and she makes a daily profit of about USD 15.00.

Now, Juana is thinking about making additional money.  She needs funds to purchase more inventory and in this way increase sales.  She would use part of the loan to buy clothes that she’ll sell from home, with the help of one of her daughters.  In this way, she hopes to expand and diversify her business so that she can take good care of her family.
loan_use: To purchase vegetables and clothing for resale

description:
Amelia is single, but she lives with a man who has 3 children. Amelia's husband is unemployed. He lives from small jobs. And that's why Amelia decided to join the credit program. She wants to use the money to invest in her business to see the business grow, and she can use the profit to help her husband pay household expenses and the children's schooling.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Amelia e solteira, mas vive com um homem de quem tem 3 filhos. O marido de Amelia nao esta empregado. Vive de pequenos expedientes. E por isso que Amelia decidiu entrar para o programa de credito.Ela quer usar o dinheiro para investir no seu negocio para ver se o negocio cresce e ela possa usar os rendimentos para ajudar o marido no pagamento das despesas da casa e da escola dos filhos.
loan_use: Amelia wants to use the loan to buy more clothes and shoes to sell

description:
Erumsiah is 40 years old and married with 3 children aged 13,11 and 9. She sells rice and fried snacks by going around her village every day. She has to work to support her family's living expenses. She usually earns $6.50 a day, which is not enough for her family's needs. Her husband sells rice at the market and earns up to $55 per month.

\r\nErumsiah is requesting a to complete her business, and hopes that this will improve her family's income. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.
loan_use: To complete her business

description:
Agnes owns the Agnes Beauty Salon in the village of Makindye on the outskirts of Kampala.  She is married with 5 children and she cares for 2 orphans.  She has owned her business for 10 years and has been a part of her lending group for 2 years.  

Her salon is in a stand-alone shanty-shack located on dirt road.  The floor dirt is covered with a rolled out piece of colorful vinyl.  She has decorated the salon with posters.  There is no electricity so she does not have a hair dryer.

With her loan she plans to buy braids, weaves and chemicals.  Agnes dreams of one day buying a plot of land and building her own home.
loan_use: Agnes plans to use the loan to buy braids,weaves and chemicals for her salon.

description: Amsah is 42 years old and married. She sells vegetables to people in her village, earning $15 a day. Previously, she sold prepared food, but that business has been declined, so she would like to concentrate on fresh vegetable sales. Her husband is a laborer who earns $7 per week. She would like a loan of $75 (IDR 500,000) to accomplish her goal and is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.
loan_use: To expand sales in her store

description:
Mrs. R. Lun was married in 1975 and has 4 sons and 5 daughters. She started her farming business in 1990. She plants vegetables and bananas. In addition, she also raises a few cows at home. Her husband also farms with his wife and looks after the cows.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA three times. She is now requesting a loan in the amount of $900. She will use this money to purchase a cow to raise and use in her farming activities.
loan_use: To purchase a cow

description:
Mr Bắc is 34 years old, married with 1 kid who's attending 4th grade. Both he and his wife have occupation. She sells peanuts and he raises poultry. They have about 70-90 chickens. He plans to repair the chicken coop: to solidify and clean up the environment. He had applied for a loan and plans to repay it in 6 months. He will put aside a portion of his income to make the monthly payment.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Anh Bắc 34 tuổi, có vợ và có 1 con đang học lớp 4. Cả hai anh chị đều có công việc để kiếm sống. Vợ anh là chị Hoàn làm đậu phụ để bán. Anh chủ yếu tập trung vào chăm sóc đàn gà khoảng 70-80 con của gia đình. Hiện tại anh đang muốn sửa chữa lại trại gà của mình cho sạch sẽ và kiên cố hơn. Anh hiện đã đăng ký vay vốn và trả dần trong vòng 6 tháng. Thu nhập của gia đình sẽ được tiết kiệm để hoàn vốn vay.
loan_use: To repair chicken farm

description: Dastagul (her husband is pictured) is the mother of three children. This 51 year-old woman lives with her family in Khachmaz region, in the Gobu-Girag village. This family has been in this business for 8 years. Now they need a loan of $725 to buy a cow to improve their business.
loan_use: Dastagul would like to buy a cow.

description: Elena is the secretary of Samatau 3 Center. She is one of the most active members of the loan program. She sells traditional Samoan clothing: puletasi for women, and aloa for men. She also does elei, a printing method on a traditional Samoan material that makes clothing. She is one of the oldest members of SPBD, and this will be her 6th loan. She is still running her business successfully and will be looking for more loans in the future.
loan_use: To buy fabrics and other supplies for her sewing business

description:
Florence owns a small restaurant within an open-air roadside produce market. For three years she owned a restaurant at a different location, but then she lost a child at birth and had to close. She is now ready to start again and has operated at this site for one month.

Her restaurant is very neat and clean. She has taken great care in making it bright and inviting. It is a good location. She serves typical Ugandan food: Matooke, a steamed or cooked banana dish; cassava, tubers; sweet potatoes; posho, a maize flour dish; rice; beef stew; fish; beans; peas; and tea. The diet of most Ugandans varies little, but is usually not lacking in nutrients, as all products are fresh and there are plenty of fruits and vegetables grown in adjacent fields.

With her loan, Florence plans to buy a deep fryer, a fridge and some more chairs for her restaurant. In the future, she would like to add a takeaway service so that she can deliver to people in the area. Florence is married with one child, and she cares for 2 orphans.
loan_use: To buy a deep fryer, a fridge and some chairs for her restaurant

description:
Hani has a long history with A. Majmoua. This is the sixth loan he is requesting. Hani first joined the association to buy enough merchandise for his restaurant. Then, his loans were for the decoration of his restaurant. Now he needs to buy equipment like a grill and a mixer to keep developing his business. Therefore, he is requesting this loan. \r\n

\r\nHani is a hard working man of 41 years. He lives with his wife and 2 children in the south of Lebanon, in the region of Saida.
loan_use: To buy equipment for his restaurant

description: Joy O. is 31 years old and happily married with 3 children. She is from Mebamu, a town in Lagos state, and she sells electronics and electrical materials. She has been in business since 2003 and needs the loan of $250 to buy more electrical materials for sale.
loan_use: To buy more electronics for sale

description: María Gertrudis P. is a 47-year-old woman who is striving in order to make a living and fend for her five children.  She runs a grocery store that she opened five years ago with her husband. \r\nShe gets the merchandise in the township, since there are a lot of fields there and she can obtain the goods fresh.  She sells all kinds of vegetables, beans, rice, flour and other foodstuffs.\r\nThe entrepreneur would like to augment the operations volume of her sales activity.  She thinks that she would attend to more customers if she could buy some products in bulk.  Given this loan, María Gertrudis will see her business dream fulfilled and will earn as much as necessary to keep on running the business and looking after her children.
loan_use: To purchase larger amounts of goods to supply her grocery store in order to increase the store's operations volume.

description:
Hawa owns a shop selling all items. She is a widow and has four children aged 2, 9, 13 and 15. She works very hard to improve her family's living standard. She is asking for a loan to expand her business. She is proposing to repay the loan in 12 months. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipments from the said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback" arrangement.
loan_use: Expanding business

description:
Asha owns a small restaurant. She is married and has four children ages 12, 15, 18, and 20 years. Her husband is jobless. Asha works very hard for her family. She has a dream to be a great business woman. She is asking for a loan of USD 275 to buy plastic chairs and catering materials. She is proposing to repay loan in 12 months. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipments from the said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback" arrangement.
loan_use: Buying plastic chairs and catering materials

description: Yaver G. is an Internally Displaced Person from Khojavend city of Nagorno-Karabakh, western Azerbaijan. He settled with his wife and two children in Beylagan city in 1992. Yaver is a taxi driver. He needs a $700 loan to repair his car.
loan_use: Yaver would like to repair his car for his taxi business.

description:
Ni Luh Sumiarni is a house wife and a mother of three. She started her business by using IDR 2 million (approx: USD 210) loan provided by Dinari. She bought 2 female local pigs for IDR 1.2 million and used the remaining IDR 800 thousand to feed the pigs. At the moment one of her pig has delivered 4 piglets while the other one is expecting very soon. When the piglets are 2 months old, they can be sold for IDR 250 thousand per piglet. Once every 5 month she can earn gross revenue of IDR 2.5 million from selling piglets produced by 2 female pigs. Those revenue is deducted with money spent to feed the pigs of IDR 500 thousand will give her a profit of IDR 2 million. Ni Luh Sumiarni plans to use this profit to refurbish the pig’s hut by make the hut structure more permanent as at the moment it is only made of bamboo structure.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Dengan pinjaman modal yang di dapat dari Dinari sebesar Rp.2.000.000,- Ni Luh Sumiarni memulai usahanya. Ni Luh Sumiarni membeli 2 induk babi lokal atau Babi Bali dengan harga perekor Rp.600.000,- jadi 2 ekor induk babi harganya Rp1.200.000,-. Sisanya Rp 800,000,- dipergunakan untuk modal pakannya. Saat ini salah satu induk babinya sudah beranak 4 ekor dan induk yang lain masih hamil. Setiap hari Ni Luh Sumiarni sibuk disamping sebagai ibu rumah tangga yang mengurus 3 anaknya yang masih sekolah juga sibuk mengurus ternaknya. Setelah berumur 2 bulan nantinya anak babinya sudah bisa dijual dengan harga per ekornya Rp 250.000. Setiap 5 bulan dari hasil penjualan anak babi dengan dua ekor induk babi memperoleh pendapatan kotornya Rp 2.500.000,-. Pengeluaran pakan untuk anak dan induknya Rp.500.000,-. Jadi bersihnya Ni Luh Sumiarni memperoleh keuntungan Rp2.000.000,-. Dengan keuntungan ini Ni Luh Sumiarni ingin memperbaiki kandangnya agar lebih permanen karena saat ini masih memakai kandang bambu.
loan_use: To buy female pigs and pig's feed

description:
Hawima has a beauty salon where she also sells cosmetics and clothes. Although her clients have little money, it is still very important to look and feel good. This is a small but very important luxury to the people of her village in Kayunga. She tries to offer her products at very reasonable prices. She has owned her business for 5 years and has a very established client base. She has also been a member of her lending group for the past five years, and has had no problem repaying any of her loans. With her loan, she plans to expand her business by increasing her inventory of clothes and cosmetics, lotions, shampoos, etc.

Hawima is 43, married, with 6 children. From the sales of her goods she has been able to pay school fees and meet her family’s basic needs. One day she hopes to buy a plot of land and construct a home for her family.
loan_use: To expand her business by adding more clothing, cosmetics, lotions, shampoos, etc.

description:
Judith belongs to the Community Bank "Las Saposoínas". She lives in the San Martón region, in the Huallaga province and the Saposoa district. Her business is located in Avenida Loreto No. 425. She sells a variety of prepared foods.

Thanks to her effort and the good service she gives to her clients she is succeeding in her goal of increasing her sales. She now sells ceviche (a typical Peruvian seafood dish), groceries and vegetables. She also now owns her own premises; she used to sell her products in a rented stall in the market.
