With this loan of S/2000 (Peruvian sols, equialent to $666) from Manuela Ramos, which she will repay in 6 months, Judith will buy a glass case in which to display her food, mirrors for her restaurant, dishware (dozens of plates, glasses and coffee cups, along with silverware and cooking utensils), as well as wholesale quantities of shellfish and fish, and raw ingredients for the prepartion of her products. With these purchases she will be able to meet the demand of her clients.

Judith is 35 years old and lives with her husband and her three children. She works daily, demonstrating in this way that she is an enterprising, goal-oriented woman.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Judith pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Saposoínas, vive en la región San Martín, provincia el Huallaga y distrito de Saposoa, su negocio está ubicado en Av. Loreto No. 425, y se dedica a la venta de la comida variada.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y al buen trato que da a los clientes está logrando aumentar sus ventas, ahora también vende cebiche (comida típica), abarrotes y verduras, por otro lado ahora tiene su local propio ya que antes vendía en un puesto alquilado en el mercado.

Con el crédito recientemente recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.2,000.00. ($ 666.00),el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará una vitrina de vidrio para exhibir sus comidas, espejos para su local, vajillas (docenas de platos, vasos, tasas y cubiertos y utensilios de cocina) además pescados y mariscos al por mayor e insumos para la preparación de los alimentos y así poder cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.

La señora Judith tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos, trabaja diariamente demostrando así ser una mujer emprendedora y con metas.
loan_use: Purchase of a glass display case. Wholesale purchase of raw materials.  Purchase of dishware.

description: G. Usmonjon is loves animals very much and owns a  dog, cat, calf and bull at home. His family plays with their pets every day. In 2003, Usmonjon began a cattle breeding business. He fattens bulls, sells them in the market and buys more calves to fatten. He became a client of Microinvest last year and has shown himself to be  a responsible and client who repays his loans punctually. He is requesting a loanto purchase feed for his animals.
loan_use: Purchasing animal feed

description: Zehra and her family (her son is pictured) own and operate a footwear stand at the bazaar in the town of Khachmaz on the northeastern coast of Azerbaijan. Zehra was born in Sabirabad, in the south of Azerbaijan, but then moved to Khachmaz. She is married with six children and has been working in this business for the last 13 years. Zehra has already repaid three prior loans with Norwegian Microcredit,  thus proving to be a trustworthy customer. She is currently requesting a loan of $800 so that she can increase the quantity and variety of her inventory.
loan_use: To increase the quantity and variety of her inventory

description:
Ludwin Osay B. J. is 47 years old. He is originally from this town, from Bluefield. He is married and has 5 children, all of whom are either in high school or college. Mister B. is from the creole ethnic group. He's been working in a collective transportation business for four years. This micro-businessman from the coast has monthly contracts to transport 60 students from Monday to Friday of every week from their home to school and back.

However, Ludwin's bus needs a series of replacements and engine maintenance so that he can continue to give this service for a few more years. He wants his bus to be more presentable and comfortable. He needs to purchase two pairs of tires at US $128 each pair, two pairs of retainers at US $12 each pair, two break pads for US $15 each, a set of rear frictions for US $48, and air filter for US $14, a fan clutett for US $80, a water band for $60 and engine maintenance for US $75.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Ludwin Osay B. J. tiene 47 años de edad, es originario de esta ciudad de Bluefields, es casado, tiene 5 hijos, los cuales estudian en secundaria y la universidad. El señor B. es de la etnia creole y se dedica desde hace cuatro años al transporte colectivo (bus) brindando el servicio a estudiantes de dos colegios de secundaria de esta ciudad. Este microempresario costeño tiene contratos mensual de trasladar a 60 estudiantes de Lunes a Viernes de cada semana de su casa al colegio y viceversa. Sin embargo su unidad de servicio (bus) necesita cambiarle una serie de repuestos que el señor Ludwin no tiene en su poder asi como el mantenimiento del motor para que pueda brindar este servicio por unos años mas y poder tener su bus mas presentable y confortable. Necesita comprar 2 pares de llantas a US$ 128 cada par, 2 pares de retenedores a US$ 12 dolares cada par, 2 bombillos de frenos a US$ 15 cada uno, un juego de fricciones traseras a US$ 48 el juego, un filtro de aire a US$ 14 dolares el filtro, un fan clutett en abanico a US$ 80 el fan, una banda de agua a US$ 60 la banda y el mantenimiento al motor con un costo de US 75.
loan_use: To purchase auto parts for his Owerhoul school bus.

description:
Gladys is a very hard-working woman who started her plantain business after having dedicated herself to the transportation business, which did not generate enough income since the maintenance of buses has a high cost.

She began her business approximately eight years ago with C$8,000 (Cordobas) in capital, renting a module in a major open-air market with only mesh enclosures. This business has provided sustenance for her family along with the work of Gladys’s husband.

Today Gladys has succeeded in increasing her sales through the credit lent to her through her sponsor, Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Gladys ha sido una mujer muy trabajadora que coloco su negocio de platanos despues de haberse dedicado al negocio del transporte, el cual no e generaba frutos ya que el mantenimiento de los buses tiene un alto costo.

Inicia su negocio hace aproximadamente 8 años con un capital de C$8,000 (cordobas) alquilando un modulo en el mercado mayoreo el cual estaba al aire libre solocercado con malla. Este negocio ha sido el sustento de su familia en conjunto con su esposo.

Hoy en dia Gladys ha logrado incrementar sus ventas a traves del credito brindado por CEPRODEL.
loan_use: Purchase products to stock the business

description:
MWANAMTAMA is 54 years old and opened the “Killy Shop” (named after her son) in 2002. This business currently brings in about $150-170 a month.

In 2005, the shop burnt down due to an electrical short. After this tragedy, a loan was taken out to rebuild the shop and to restock its inventory. Fortunately, only the shop was burnt during the fire, although it is connected to the front of their home.

Mwanamtama lives with her husband and with six children – three of their own and three orphaned relatives. They have three other children as well, who have grown and are now independent. Their house assistant and shopkeeper, whom they pay about $18 a month each, also live with them. The husband works in a hotel.

In hopes of receiving a second loan, Mwanamtama would like to buy a refrigerator for the shop and to start selling wholesale eggs in a new location. She belongs to the group "Giraffe," which consists of 27 other members who keep each other accountable and insure one another in paying back their loans.
loan_use: To purchase a refrigerator and buy eggs

description:
Maria L. lives in her parent's home in the Villa Nuevo Potosí neighborhood on the west side of La Paz, with her three children; Maria works for herself, making pants and warm-up suits that she sells to retail merchants in the city.

She has a bedroom, a small kitchen and a precarious bathroom. As she lacks space, Maria has put her sewing shop in her bedroom, resulting in an uncomfortable situation for her and her sons to do her work.

The loan she seeks is to refurbish a room that is deteriorating in order to use it as a tailor shop. This is the first time that she seeks a loan and the socioeconomic analysis resulted in a favorable score and she can obtain a loan. The social vision of our institution applies perfectly to this case and is an important factor in the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria L. vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz, con sus tres hijos; la señora Maria trabaja por cuenta propia, elaborando pantalones y buzos deportivos que vende a comerciantes minoristas de la ciudad.

Actualmente tiene un dormitorio, una cocina pequeña y un baño precario. Por la falta de espacio, la señora tiene instalado el taller de costura en su dormitorio, ocasionándole incomodidad tanto en su desempeño laboral, como a sus hijos.

El crédito solicitado será destinado a la refacción de una habitación que se encuentra deteriorada para utilizarla como taller de costura. Esta es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito. La visión social de nuestra institución se aplica perfectamente y es un factor importante en la resolución de crédito.
loan_use: Refurbish a room in order to use it as a tailor shop

description:
Remigia Tilleria is a 38 year old single mother with one three year old child. She lives with her mother their humble community of Rincón Guazú, Paraguay.

In 2003 she opened a small convenience store with the help of her brother. He later moved to Argentina in search of a better job. He continues to work there but sends money to Remigia so that she will be able to buy merchandise and continue to grow her micro-enterprise. Today she already has a loyal client base which she established by paying close attention to what products she offers. For the care she gives her store she as seen as a unique establishment in the area.

Remigia is optimistic and wishes to convert her store into a mini-market. In this way she hopes to achieve a higher standard of living for her daughter and mother, whom she is already supporting

With the money she has borrowed Remigia will buy sugar, flour, and rice to continue to offer the best products possible.
loan_use: Purchase sugar, flour and rice

description:
Señora Rosula M. is 42 years old, and is married to Mr. Melanio Esquivel. Together they have five children, two older ones and three school age children.

Rosula started her business with their savings generated with the money her husband earned working for a transportation carrier of passengers in the year 2000. They rented a small space just outside at the terminal of the company where her husband worked, where every day there was an interesting movement of people traveling. This is how they were inspired with the brilliant opportunity for this type of business.

At first she began selling fast foods such as pastries, croquettes, vegetable tarts, and so on. And then began diversifying her products and foods with more sophisticated offerings. Today this business is very profitable, especially since she already has a customer base, and even developed a catering service for people who work in the area.

The loan will be used to purchase various goods, as well as to supplement the sale of meals in her small shop.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rosula M. tiene 42 años de edad, está casada con el señor Melanio Esquivel, matrimonio con cinco hijos, dos mayores de edad y tres en edad escolar.

Rosula comenzó su negocio con los ahorros que genero con el dinero que ganaba su marido que trabaja como empleado en una empresa de transporte público de pasajeros, en el año 2000, alquiló un pequeño salón justamente en la terminal de la empresa donde trabajaba su marido, en donde cada día había un movimiento interesante de personas que viajaban, por lo tanto vio una oportunidad brillante para este tipo de negocio.

Comenzó vendiendo comidas rápidas tales como: empanadas, milanesas, croquetas, tartas de verduras, etc. y luego fue diversificando sus productos ya con comidas mas elaboradas. Hoy en día dicha actividad le es muy rentable, porque ya tiene una clientela formada e incluso ya ofrece servicio de catering a personas que trabajan en la zona.

El crédito será utilizado para la compra de mercaderías varias, ya que además de la venta de comidas posee una pequeña despensa.
loan_use: To purchase rice, sugar, noodles, meat, etc. (Compra de arroz, azúcar, fideos, carne, etc.)

description:
Rosa is 30 years old, and studied through secondary school. She has four children who are still dependent on her. She lives in the Wichanzao sector in the district of La Esperanza, the province of Trujillo and the department of La Libertad. She is a member of the community bank "Santa Elena II".

Rosa used to spend her days taking care of the household chores. Later she came up with the idea to open a small business, a general store, in her own house. She started the business with the help of her husband, who supported her with a small amount of money. That money served as her initial capital. With her first loan from Manuela Ramos of 300 Peruvian sols ($100) she bought additional products such as detergents, soaps, and toilet paper, to add more variety to her store. Currently Rosa sells bread, soft drinks, vegetables, snacks, eggs, etc.

With this new loan of 400 Peruvian sols ($133), which will be repaid in 4 months, Rosas will buy additional products such as sweets, cookies, and juices, as a way to continue adding variety to her inventory. She dreams of someday having a house with all the modern comforts and a great store.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rosa tiene 30 años, su grado de instrucción es secundaria completa, tiene cuatro hijos que aun dependen de ella; vive en el sector Wichanzao en el Distrito de La Esperanza, Provincia de Trujillo, Departamento de La Libertad, pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Elena II”.

Anteriormente se dedicaba a los quehaceres del hogar y tuvo la idea de poner un pequeño negocio en su propia casa, una bodeguita. Comenzó con la ayuda de su esposo que le apoyo con una pequeña propina que le sirvió de capital. Con su primer préstamo de S/.300.00 ($100) compró otros productos como detergentes, jabones, papel higiénico para surtir su bodeguita. Actualmente la señora Rosa vende pan, gaseosas, menestras, huevos, etc.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.400.00 soles ($ 133) el cual será pagado en 4 meses, compró otros productos como golosinas, galletas, jugos para continuar surtiendo su bodega. Ella sueña con tener una casa con todas las comodidades y una gran tienda.
loan_use: Purchase of sweets, cookies and juices

description: Emi has been working on a plantation for some time. The assistance from SPBD will be utilized to purchase tools for the plantation, as she is now looking into expanding her crops. She also hopes to be able to have more surplus supply for sale at the market, as this is good money that will help with the upkeep of the plantation business. She says she will continue to seek financial assistance from SPBD to help her with her plantation or in case she decides to expand the business into other areas in future.
loan_use: To buy tools for her plantation

description:
Catalina is a 52 year-old widow with 4 married children. Catalina works hard to rent out tables, chairs, tablecloths and other party related products. She opened this business together with her sister but after 6 years, her sister left the country and left her to run the business.

Catalina underwent difficulties to operate the business alone, which was worse after her husband's death. Her late husband supported her emotionally and financially. His job at the factory helped to cover their living costs.

In spite of these vicissitudes, Catalina persevered and today, her business is running more smoothly. She wants to buy more merchandise. She seeks a loan that will allow her to invest in plastic chairs so she can increase the variety of products to offer in her renting business.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Catalina tiene 52 años, ella es viuda y tiene 4 hijos, todos ya casados. Catalina se dedica al alquiler de mesas, sillas, manteles y otros afines para fiestas. El negocio lo abrió junto con su hermana, pero hace 6 años, su hermana viajo a otro país y quedo ella sola frente al negocio.

Le costo mucho a Catalina salir adelante sola, más aún luego de la muerte de su marido, ya que el era su gran apoyo emocional además de económico, pues el trabajaba en una fábrica y ayudaba con los ingresos y gastos de la casa.

A pesar de las vicisitudes, Catalina persevero y hoy día el negocio marcha bastante bien. Ella desea adquirir hoy un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de sillas de plástico de esta forma poder aumentar la variedad de su stock de alquiler.
loan_use: to buy plastic chairs

description:
Hilda, like many Bolivian women, is a single mother. She has a 17 year old daughter who helps her with her junior clothing store. This generates income to cover their rent and her daughter's education. The store is located in the Ceja area in the city of El Alto. They live in the same city as the Fero Petrol.

The credit will be used to increase their inventory, which will meet the market's demands. This is her first loan with IMPRO. A completed credit evaluation has approved her for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Hilda, como mucha mujeres bolivianas, es madre soltera de una hija de 17 años de edad, quien le ayuda con el puesto comercial de ropa juvenil que cuentan para la sobre vivencia y la educación de la hija. El puesto esta ubicada en la zona Ceja de la Ciudad de El Alto. Vive en la misma ciudad de la Zona de Fero Petrol.

El crédito lo destinara para incrementar mercadería y de esa forma satisfacer la demanda que tiene en su mercado. Es el primer crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
loan_use: buy products for her business's inventory

description:
Ms. Yunely belongs to the Progressive Womens' Mientras Tanto group. She lives in the San Martin Region, San Martin Province, Banda de Shilcayo District. Her home and business are located in Jr. Las Palmeras, number 135. She provides internet services, and sells snacks and soft drinks to the customers who use her service.

She is a single woman who opened her business of her own initiative. Her home is located near the Technological Institute, and she serves the needs of students. She has the support of her parents, and has been open for two months. Every day she gains new customers, giving them personal service based on the training that she has received.

With the recent loan of 300.00 soles ($100.00) which she has received from Manuela Ramos to be repaid in 4 payments, she has purchased some printing material (paper), snacks, and soft drinks.

Ms Yunely's goals are to become independent, (operate without her parents' support,) and to with her own location, open a store selling clothing and shoes, while continuing her internet service, as she feels able to manage both businesses at the same time.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

La señorita Yunely pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto “Mujeres Progresivas”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo, su domicilio y negocio están ubicados en el Jr. Las Palmeras Nº 135, se dedica a prestar servicios de Internet y en el mismo local vende algunos refrigerios y gaseosas para su clientela que utiliza este servicio.

Es soltera y su negocio lo puso con iniciativa propia ya que su domicilio está ubicado cerca de un Instituto Tecnológico y era una necesidad para los estudiantes, tiene el apoyo de sus padres, empezó hace 2 meses y cada día está incrementando sus clientes, la atención es personalizada y tiene estudios al respecto con el cual puede dar soporte a sus clientes.

Con el reciente crédito recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 ($ 100.00), el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, compró algunos materiales de impresión (papeles) y golosinas, gaseosas para la venta de refrigerios.

La señorita Yunely quiere, más adelante, independizarse (dejar el apoyo de sus padres) y teniendo su propio local piensa instalar una tienda de venta de ropas y zapatos sin dejar el servicio de Internet ya que se siente capaz de administrar los dos negocios a la vez.
loan_use: Purchase of paper.  Purchase of snacks and soft drinks.

description:
Mrs. Marleney is a member of the Las Estrellitas II Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martin Province, Tarapoto District. Her address is located in Jr. Progreso number 282 or Pueblo Joven 9 de Abril, and her business is at Jr. Tahuantinsuyo, block 8 (market no. 2). She sells groceries in small amounts, including products such as rice, sugar, beans, crackers, noodles, potatoes, and greens, among others. She is a single mother and as such has worked hard to grow her business. She has 2 small children who depend on her for support, but thanks to the support of Manuela R., her business continues to grow. In the beginning, she sold furniture, but sales were slow and she needed to have a business with daily sales to allow her feed her children and send them to school. She has all manner of customers now that her business is in the market. Now that she offers a greater variety of products, she also has other larger clients (restaurants) who request their orders on set schedules. With the latest loan that she received from Manuela R., which will be paid in 4 months, she will purchase a variety of products, including bulk rice and sugar, and tubers and produce from the coast, and by doing so she will be able to meet the needs of her varied clientele. Mrs Marleny is 25 years old, and her dream is to purchase land where she can build her own store and grow her business to provide more security for her children; her greatest motive to work. She says that by working as hard as she does, she is able to show that women can progress with strength and dedication.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Marleny pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Estrellitas II”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto su domicilio está ubicado en el Jr. Progreso Nº 282 del Pueblo Joven 9 de Abril y su negocio en el Jr. Tahuantinsuyo Cdra. 8 (mercado Nº 02), se dedica a la venta de abarrotes al por menor tales como arroz, azúcar, menestras, galletas, fideos, papas, verduras, entre otros. Es madre soltera y por lo tanto trabaja sola para sacar adelante su negocio, tiene 2 hijos que aún son pequeños y dependen de ella, pero gracias a su gran esfuerzo y al apoyo de Manuela R. cada vez su negocio está creciendo. Al principio vendía muebles pero el negocio es lento y ella necesitaba tener un negocio con un movimiento diario para poder alimentar y hacer estudiar a sus hijos, actualmente tiene clientes de todo sitio ya que su establecimiento está situado en el mercado y a parte tiene clientes grandes que le hacen pedidos en horarios determinados (restaurantes) ya que tiene variedad en sus productos. Con el reciente crédito recibido de Manuela R., el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas, comprará variedad de productos como arroz y azúcar en sacos, tubérculos y verduras que vienen de la costa, y así satisfacer las necesidades de su variada clientela. La señora Marleny tiene 25 años y su anhelo es comprar un terreno para construir su propio local y ampliar su negocio en un local propio dándoles seguridad a sus hijos que son el motivo de su trabajo, ella dice que trabajando como lo hace se puede demostrar a las mujeres que sí podemos salir adelante con esfuerzo y dedicación.
loan_use: Purchase of various products (groceries). Purchase of greens and tubers

description:
Nelida Esperanza belongs to the Creative Women's Cooperative Bank. She has a stand at the Moyobamba market where she sells vegetables including carrots, beets, yuca, potatoes, onions, cabbage, corn, and herbs like rue, cilantro and camomile. She makes an effort to stock a good assortment of fresh produce. She decided to open the stand in order to be an independent woman and to proviD. for her family. Nelida will use this loan of 1,300 soles, or about $450, to be repaid in six installments, to buy all of the vegetables she needs. Nelida is 47 and the mother of six. Four of her children still live at home and help her with the business and in maintaining the home. She is happy with the work she is doing, enjoys the daily contact with her customers, and is proud to have grown this business. Her customers really appreciate the quality of her produce. Nelida's dream is some day to open a similar shop in her home so she can tend to both the business and the home without neglecting her children.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Nélida Esperanza pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Creativas, se dedica a la venta D. verduras en su puesto que tiene en el mercado D. abastos D. Moyobamba, en donD. ella ofrece desD. culantro, zanahoria, betarraga, cebollas, papas, yucas, repollo, col china, maíz, yerbas aromáticas hasta ruda, manzanilla, etc., trata D. tener bien surtido su negocio con productos frescos. Decidió iniciarse en este negocio por que tenia la necesidad D. trabajar para generar sus propios ingresos y crecer como persona y mujer, así como aportar económicamente en los gastos D. su hogar. Con el reciente crédito otorgado por Manuela Ramos D. S/ 1,300 soles ($ 434.00) el cual será pagado en 6 cuotas, comprará sacos D. papas, cebolla, betarraga, yuca, repollo, zanahoria, y los demás productos que tiene que comprar a diario, como maíz, hierbas aromáticas, etc., para que puedan estar frescos y D. esa manera mantener a su clientela. Tiene 47 años y 6 hijos, D. los cuales 4 aun viven con ella y son quienes le apoyan en el negocio y la casa, está contenta con lo que hace, por que venD. en un lugar donD. acuD. bastante gente y pueD. estar en contacto con las personas y sus amistades, por eso disfruta D. su trabajo, desD. sus inicios, su negocio a crecido, ahora tiene buena clientela por la calidad D. los productos que venD., su meta es tener su propio negocio en su casa para poder compartir las actividades D. la casa con su negocio y sobre todo no descuidar a sus hijos.
loan_use: To buy wholesale vegetables and herbs.

description: Malia is a 58-year-old mother from the village of Vaimoso. Her first loan allowed her to start a BBQ business, and now she’s on her 5th loan. She plans to use it to open a small grocery shop in front of her house. Malia has 6 children. Three of her kids are still in school and the other three are working and help out their mother with the business. She earns around 300 Tala ($120 US) of profit per week.
loan_use: To buy inventory and supplies for her new grocery store

description:
Mrs. N. Sophallin got married in 1989 and has one daughter and three sons. She is currently in the business of selling custard apples. She buys custard apples from her district and resells them in a market in Phnom Penh. Her husband does construction work , grows rice, and raises chickens and pigs. With these businesses, the couple has been able to support their children's education and pay for a new house to be built. She is in the process of building her new house and is short of money to finish it. \r\n

\r\nShe is therefore seeking her first loan from MAXIMA, for about $1,200, with which to complete her house.
loan_use: Repairing her house.

description:
Sharif M., 36, is married and has 4 children. For 3 years, he has been selling clothing for children. His sales spot is located at the Vahdatsky region’s market. Sharif plans to use this loan to purchase new inventory of winter clothing. Sharif is one of the few vendors, who sell children’s clothing at the market, so to remain competitive; Sharif must sell at or below competitors’ prices. Sharif plans to repay the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Миров Шариф, возраст – 36 лет, образование среднее техническое, женат, имеет 4-х детей. Шариф занимается торговлей детских вещей уже в течение 3 лет. Свой бизнес он ведёт на рынке Вахдатского орайона где имеет торговую точку. На полученный кредит клиент планирует приобрести новый товар детской одежды для зимнего сезона, так как начинается пора холодов. На рынке где торгует клиент не так уж много торговых точек по продаже детской одежды. И чтобы быть конкурентноспособным Шариф хочет приобрести большое количество товара и реализовать его по цене ниже чем у других поставщиков, что даст ему возможность увеличить оборачиваемость своих товаров. а жители района смогут приобрести необходимые им детские вещи по ценам чуть ниже, чем у других. \r\nКлиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.
loan_use: Increase sales volume

description:
Mrs. C. Yoeun, 37, has been married since 1988 and has five children, ages 6-18. One day a week she buys fresh jasmine flowers and bananas from a neighboring village to resell at markets in Phnom Penh. On other days, she stays at home taking care of her children. Her husband, 38, has been a fish seller for the past 20 years. Every day, he travels to a neighboring village where he buys fish directly from the fishermen. He drives an old motorbike-scooter around the commune (a collection of 3 villages), reselling the fish door-to-door.

Yoeun is requesting a second loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $600. She will use this loan to purchase a new motorbike-scooter for her husband's business to replace the old, unreliable one he is currently using. She also plans to use this new motorbike for her weekly trips into Phnom Penh. A portion of the loan will also be used to build a new, thatched home for the family. This new home, will only take one month to complete and they are already preparing the foundations. The balance of the loan will be used to purchase additional jasmine and bananas for Yoeun to resell.

Of their five children, all currently attend the local schools and three of them also take English lessons at a private school. With the help of this new loan, Yoeun hopes to continue expanding their businesses and save money to ensure their children are able to pursue a higher education.
loan_use: To purchase a motorbike-scooter to sell fish, buy fresh flowers to resell, and build a new thatched home.

description: Poreh lives in the outskirts of Kabala town in Sierra Leone.  Married with five children, she needs to work hard to make ends meet and also take care of the children.  Because the children are still small, this thirty-year-old mother cannot travel out of the house to purchase her business items.  Poreh is assisted by her mother and brother to purchase palm oil and spices from the villages.  She sells the palm oil from her home.  With her previous loans, she expanded her business and was able to purchase an additional 30 gallons of palm oil.  She is requesting a $375 loan to purchase more spices and 20 gallons of palm oil.  This will enable her to generate more income for the future of her children.
loan_use: Purchase additional spices and palm oil to sell, generating additional income

description:
Dayhsen is married to Julio, who works as a laborer for a company in the community. While he does this, Dayhsen dedicates herself to her small shop, while still caring for their two small children. She would like to increase the quantity and variety of her merchandise to meet the great demand of her customers. With the increased income, she can make necessary repairs on their home, which was given to them by her dear elderly parents. To reach her goals, she needs your generous support and is requesting a loan. She has commited to repay the loan punctually and responsibly.

Dayhsen, esta casada con Julio, quién se desempeña como obrero en una empresa comunal y mientras él se dedica a este esforzado trabajo; Dayhsen incrementa su esfuerzo y dedicación para que su pequeña bodeguita de ventas de insumos de primera necesidad les otorgue bienestar, sin descuidar la atención y sumo cuidado que brinda a sus dos pequeños y amorosos niños.Tiene el deseo de aumentar la cantidad y variedad de su mercadería para cumplir con la gran cantidad de solicitudes que le genera su clientela, y con los beneficios que obtenga refaccionar la casita que habita junto a su familia, que por herencia le dejaron sus queridos y ancianos padres. Para concretar su propósito, apela a tu generoso corazón y solicita un préstamo y promete ser muy puntual y responsable.
loan_use: TO INCREASE THE QUANTITY AND VARIETY OF MERCHANDISE WHICH SHE SELLS IN HER STORE, HELPING TO IMPROVE THE STANDARD OF LIVING FOR HER FAMILY.

description:
Jesus, as a father of a family worried for the future of his son, decided to start looking for a business which could yield enough money to support his wife and child, and enough time for him to finish his studies because he had no support from his own parents, and spend time with his son. This is why with the few savings he had, he rented a cart and started selling hot dogs on the sidewalk outside of their home. With only a small gas tank, a few utensils and no clients, but with faith and enthusiasm to make his business succeed, little by little clients started coming to buy his products.

However, Jesus feels obligated to offer his clients a better service, so they do not go seeking other competing businesses, and also to be able to attract more clients. This is why he is requesting a loan for US $750, which he is willing to pay in a period of 6 months. With this money, Jesus will be able to buy a deep fryer to make French fries and paint his cart, in addition to installing light in his small locale. With these improvements he will have more clients and will be able to support his family and continue his studies to be able to offer a better future to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

Jesús padre de familia, preocupado por el futuro de su hijo, decidió comenzar a buscar un negocio que le pudiera dejar el dinero suficiente para mantener a su esposa e hijo y tiempo para poder terminar de estudiar, puesto que no contó con el apoyo de sus padres, y convivir con su hijo. Fue así que con los pocos ahorros que tenía, rentó una carreta y comenzar a vender hot dogs en la banqueta de su casa con un pequeño tambo de gas, pocos utensilios, sin clientes, pero con fe y entusiasmo para sacar su negocio adelante y poco a poco los clientes se fueron acercando a comprarle sus productos.

Sin embargo, Jesús se siente comprometido a ofrecerles a sus clientes un mejor servicio para que estos no se le vayan con la competencia, y poder atraer más clientes. Es por esto que está solicitando un crédito de US $750 que está dispuesto a pagar en un plazo de 6 meses. Con este dinero Jesús podrá comprar una freidora para hacer papas, y podrá pintar su carretón, además de instalar iluminación a su pequeño local. Y con estas mejoras poder tener más clientelas para sacar adelante a su familia y continuar sus estudios para poder ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su familia.
loan_use: Buying a deep fryer and remodeling the place where they sell products (Comprar una freidora y remodelar el lugar donde venden los productos)

description:
Lucia is 50 years old, and is married with four children. She is the owner of a business where she sells a wide variety of beverages and products for daily consumption, an enterprise she has owned for more than 15 years.

Of the items she sells we can list sugar, noodles, dairy products, canned products, etc. She notes that, for a few months she was sick and on bed rest, an episode that caused her to business suffer and did not allow her to restock her inventory.

For this reason she is today asking for a loan, given that she would like to reactivate her business with the purchase of basic necessities such as oil, sodas, candy/confections, noodles, flour, fruits and vegetables, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lucia tiene 50 años está casada y tiene 4 hijos, ella es propietaria de un negocio donde vende todo tipo de bebidas y productos de consumo diario, posee el negocio hace más de 15 años.

Entre otras cosas que vende podemos citar azúcar, fideos, productos lácteos, productos enlatados, etc. Comenta que hace unos meses estuvo enferma y con reposo, por lo que el negocio quedo descuidado y sin posibilidades de reponer las mercadearías vendidas.

Es por eso que hoy solicita un crédito, ya que desea reactivar el negocio con la compra de mercaderías al por mayor tales como aceite, gaseosas, golosinas, fideos, harina, frutas, verduras, etc.
loan_use: Purchase merchandise such as oil, sodas, candies, noodles, flour, fruits and vegetables, etc.

description:
Victoria has wonderful hands, with them she creates precious works of art of high quality, which are admired by her clients and have made her one of the preferred artisans for commissioning a craft job well made. Victoria has been working full time on creating embroidered cloth crafts. Her grandparents taught her how to embroider, and the experience of many years have made her an expert, as well as efficient in finishing commissioned jobs. With time, Victoria was encouraged to devote herself to embroidering as a means for survival, was offered an opportunity in a workshop not too far from her home. Now she is capitalizing her profits with which she hopes to open a general store in the future with the purpose of enhancing her quality of life. All this is motivated by the unconditional love she feels for her four children to whom she will keep giving her love every day. This is why she is requesting a loan with the goal of acquiring a greater quantity of thread, cloth, and needles to be able to optimize and improve her work. Remember that this hardworking mother and her little ones await soon the reply from your generous heart.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga and son, Kiva volunteers

Victoria, tiene unas manos maravillosas, con ellas realiza preciosas obras de arte y de mucha calidad que son admiradas por sus clientes y la hacen una de las preferidas para encomendarle un trabajo manual bien elaborado. Es así que victoria desde sus diez años se dedica de lleno al bordado de fustanes de manera artesanal, sus abuelos le enseñaron a bordar, y la experiencia de años la hicieron una experta y también ágil para terminar un trabajo encomendado.Con el tiempo victoria fue animada a dedicarse al bordado como un medio de supervivencia, le ofrecieron una oportunidad en un taller no muy lejos de su hogar y ahora está capitalizando sus ganancias con la cual espera a futuro abrir una tienda de abarrotes con el propósito de incrementar su calidad de vida, todo esto impulsado por el amor incondicional que siente por sus cuatro hijos a los cuales seguirá dando cada día todo su cariño.Es por ello que solicita un préstamo con el fin de adquirir mayor cantidad de hilos, telas y agujas a fin de optimizar y mejorar su trabajo. Recuerda que esta laboriosa madre y sus pequeñas esperan pronto la respuesta de tu generoso corazón.
loan_use: Buying more cloth, needles, and embroidery thread to continue and consolidate her craft for the benefit of her beloved children. (Compra de mayor cantidad de telas, agujas e hilos para continuar y consolidar su ocupación para beneficio de sus qeridos hijos.)

description:
Graciela is an enterprising woman, always willing and able to learn. These qualities have allowed her to perfect her embroideries with practice and have made her one of the best embroiders in her area. This skill was acquired when, 17 years ago, her sister-in-law taught her the techniques of clothe embroidery and she started embroidering the pieces she was commissioned little by little. Then she became independent to be able to get ahead and now she has a great demand. Thanks to this craft, Graciela has been able to responsibly take on her role and the care of her three children, and she will continue working because she wants to give them a promising future. Among her plans is buying knitting machines to be able to obtain greater profits for the benefit of her children. This is why Graciela is working hard with the goal of saving and buying what she hopes for in the medium term. She would like to produce more and is requesting a loan to buy cloth and embroidery thread with the goal of continuing to create her crafts. Your contribution will be wisely invested, please help.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga and son, Kiva volunteers

Graciela, es una mujer emprendedora con mucha disposición al aprendizaje, estas cualidades le han permitido perfeccionar con la práctica sus bordados y la han convertido en una de las mejoras bordadoras de su zona. Esta habilidad fue adquirida cuando su cuñada hace 17 años le enseñó las técnicas del bordado de fustanes y comenzó bordando poco a poco los encargos que le encomendaban; luego se independizó para poder seguir adelante y hoy tiene gran demanda. Gracias a este oficio Graciela durante años ha podido asumir su rol y el cuidado de sus tres hijos responsablemente y seguirá trabajando porque quiere otorgarles un prometedor futuro. Entre sus planes está el de comprar máquinas de tejer para obtener mayores ganancias en beneficio de sus hijos y es por ello que Graciela está trabajando arduamente con el objetivo de ahorrar y comprar lo que anhela en un mediano plazo.Ella desea producir más y solicita un préstamo para comprar tela e hilos a fin de seguir realizando sus trabajos. Tu aporte será sabiamente invertido, anímate a colaborar.
loan_use: Buying cloth and thread to continue her work for the benefit of her beloved children (Compra de tela e hilos para continuar con su labor en beneficio de sus queridos hijos.)

description: Potoae is sixty six years old with four kids. She is an active woman in her community where she is known for her hard work and her support of her family. Even though she is old, she still wants to help support her family financially. Potoae has  applied for this loan (her second) which is for the same amount as her first loan, in order to pay for the things needed for her plantation such as chemicals and tools.
loan_use: To buy chemicals and tools for her plantation

description: Koreti K. is  35 years old and married. She is a creative lady capable in making and designing elei (a traditional Samoan fabric) materials and she wishes to use her talent to earn a living. She has applied for this loan in order to buy the materials she needs, such as paints, brushes, and fabrics. Koreti delivers her products to big shops in town. She works  three days per week and make a profit of 260 Tala ($104 USD) per day. Koreti is very proud of her business especially now that she has some financial support through loans.
loan_use: To buy materials and supplies for her elei (traditional Samoan fabric) printing

description: Mohammad Zahar lives in district 7 of Kabul Afghanistan and is married with four children: two sons and two daughters. His daughters are at University and his sons are no longer in Afghanistan so he is the only one supporting his family.  Mohammad operates a retail shop in one of the more crowded areas of Kabul. He would like to expand his business so he is requesting a loan in order to have a better range of stock to attract more clients. This loan will help him earn more income to help his family and this would make him happy.
loan_use: To purchase more comprehensive goods for his shop

description:
Sanu Thapa M. is a 45 year old lady who lives in Sainbu Bhainshepati VDC. Bhainshepati is located in Lalitpur district, and most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Her husband's name is Rajendra Thapa M.. He is a farmer and works on his own land. Her daughter took the SLC exam this year, her older son is studying in grade 6, and her younger daughter is studying in grade 4.

Mrs. M. already owns two cows, and she sells cow's milk door-to-door in her locality.

Now she is asking for her fifth loan of Rs30000 to buy another young cow, because demand for milk is constantly increasing in the area, because people believe fresh cow milk is better for nutrition than dairy milk.
loan_use: To buy another young cow

description: Grace A. is from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is 34 years old, married and has four (4) children. She has a chemist's shop where she sells drugs. She has been a LAPO member for over 5 years. She has been in business for some years now. She is requesting a loan of US$800 to buy more drugs for sale.
loan_use: To buy more drugs for sale

description: Esther I. is a businesswoman who has a shop in which she sells provisions, foodstuffs and drinks. She is 50 years old, the married mother of 6 children. She is a native of Benin, Edo State and has been in this business over 4 years. She has been a LAPO member over 3 years. Esther is requesting a loan of US$ 1,175. This will enable her buy provisions, foodstuffs and drinks for resale.
loan_use: To buy provisions, foodstuffs and drinks for sale

description: Evelyn B. is 39 years old, married, and has 4 children. She has a restaurant were she cooks food. She lives in Benin City in Edo State. She is requesting a loan of $800 to buy a refrigerator and foodstuffs. This she said will help her serve customers better.
loan_use: To buy more food items and ingredients for cooking

description: Bimbo E.  is married with three (3) children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions, cosmetics, foodstuffs and drinks. This is a business she started in 2005. She is in need of $625 to enable her buy more provisions, cosmetics, drinks and foodstuffs for sale.
loan_use: To buy more provisions, cosmetics, drinks and foodstuffs

description:
Elvis lives in his own house with his parents. His home is located in the Max. Fernandez Avenue, Llojeta zone, City of La Paz, Bolivia. He works as a mechanic and his shop is located in the Tembladerani zone. He started to work as a mechanic on his own two months ago. He used to work on the same trade as an employee but he didn't got paid. Elvis became independent to improve his income plus he is studying Electronics at the university.

The loan he is applying for will be used to buy tools for his shop and be able to accept more jobs which he can't do now due to the lack of the necessary tools for the jobs. In this way, Elvis will improve his income

He doesn't have a record with Impro but because of his desire to built a better future for him and his family and the outlook that this type of work offers him, he deserves the opportunuity to be helped by having access to a loan. Give him a chance!

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Elvis vive en casa propia con sus padres en la Av. Máx. Fernández de la zona de Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz; trabaja como mecánico en un taller ubicado en la zona de tembladerani; esta actividad la realiza desde hace dos meses ya que antes trabajaba como empleado pero no le pagaban. Elvis se independizo para mejorar sus ingresos además que estudia electrónica en la Universidad; el crédito que solicita es para comprar mas herramientas de trabajo y poder aceptar más trabajos que actualmente no puede realizarlos por falta de las herramientas necesarias. De esta manera, Elvis espera mejorar sus ingresos. No tiene antecedente con Impro pero por su deseo de superación y las perspectivas que ofrece el tipo de trabajo que él desempeña merecen la oportunidad de ayudarle para que pueda acceder a un crédito.
loan_use: Buying tools for his mechanic shop

description:
Rosa I. is a 34 year old woman. She is married to Jorge Espinoza who is 36 years old and works as a sales supervisor in a known company in the city. They have 2 children age 11 and 9, and they live in their own house.

Rosa owns a convenience store since 2001, she has her own commercial space and a truck with which she delivers her merchandise and provides freight services.

They started their own business from scratch, and thanks to their entrepreneurial spirit, they now own a flourishing small business. They have been clients of Fundacion Paraguaya for the past three years, who has helped them in the implementation of their projects.

With this new loan they will buy devices that they need to fit out a callshop next to their convenience store.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer

Rosa I., tiene 34 años, esta casada con Jorge Espinoza de 36 años el trabaja como supervisor de ventas en una reconocida empresa de la ciudad. La pareja tiene 2 hijos, de 11 y de 9 años respectivamente. Ellos viven todos juntos en una casa propia.

Rosa posee una despensa desde el 2.001, posee local propio y un camión de cargas con el que realiza reparto de mercaderías y hace fletes a terceros.

El negocio lo empezaron de cero, gracias al espíritu emprendedor de la pareja, actualmente son dueños de una mini empresa floreciente. Son clientes de la Fundación Paraguaya hace 3 años y les hemos acompañado en la consecución de sus proyectos.

Con este nuevo préstamo comprarán algunos aparatos que les faltan para habilitar una cabina telefónica al lado de su despensa.
loan_use: To buy devices for callshop

description:
Doña Flor de María is a woman who started her clothing sales business out of small baskets. She would walk through the streets of the city of León with the baskets on her head to display her products. She did this for two years, exposed to the sun and the bad weather during some seasons. Thanks to the credits she received, she managed to obtain a location in La Terminal market in León.

While she has a location, she still needs to invest in building a shelter for it, and this is her goal for this next year, to have money to invest in and improve the infrastructure. She buys her clothes on a wholesale basis and then sells them as retail. She is married with two kids who are of school age. Her credits have helped her better her economic situation because she can buy better products and increase her sales, and logically, her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Doña Flor de maria es una señora que comenzó poniendo el negocio de venta de ropa en unas canastas pequeñas, caminaba por las calles de la ciudad de León con los canastos en su cabeza para exponer sus productos, llevó dos años así, exponiendose al sol y al mal clima de algunas temporadas. Gracias a los créditos, ella se logró establecer en el mercado La Terminal en León.

Pero buen, ya logro establecerse pero aun le falta invertir para construir su módulo y ese es su propósito para el proximo año....tener ya el dinero para invertir y mejorar la infraestructura. Como ella realiza las compras al por mayor y los vende al detalle. Es una señora Casada con dos hijos en edad escolar. Los créditos le han ayudado a mejorar su situacion económica, comprando mejores productos y de esta manera incrementar las ventas y logicamente sus ganancias.
loan_use: Purchase of clothes to sell to her clients.

description: Mr. Chin V., 28, is married to a woman, aged 28, and lives in Batambong province, Cambodia. He works buying and selling recyclable items, earning around $3.70/day. His wife works as a housewife looking after her two school-aged kids. Mr Chin V. hopes to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle to use for his business’s transportation because he expects the motorcycle will make his business grow faster, easier, and more effectively.
loan_use: To purchase a motorcycle for his business transportation.

description: Mrs. Mercy A. sells vests, cardigans, and school uniforms to schools and churches. She has been in this business since 1999. She is 43 years old, married with 6 children, and lives in Benin City. She has been a LAPO member. She is requesting the loan amount of $800 to enable her buy more material for making the vests, cardigans, and school uniforms for sale.
loan_use: To buy more material for making vests, cardigans, and school uniforms for sale.

description:
Mrs. Muny N. married in 1985. She has two sons and two daughters. She has been in the business of selling bananas and flowers since 1997. Two of her children help with her business. The other two are studying at high school in Prek Thmey commune. Her husband is a construction worker. In addition, he is also doing farming. He used to be in the business of repairing motorbikes.

\r\n\r\nMrs. N. is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time in the amount of $1,000. She will use some of this amount to expand their banana and flower business and some of the amount will be used to purchase a motorbike to transport the products to the market.
loan_use: Expanding agricultural business and buying a motorbike

description:
Mercedes is a merchant of food, clothes and medium-quality jewelry in private and public offices in the city of La Paz. Her husband works as a public transportation driver and with their combined incomes, they are able to support their three sons. They live in the district Tembladerani in the city of La Paz. The credit she is seeking will be used to increase her merchandise. This way she will be able to increase her income. This is the fourth loan with Impro. She is an outstanding client and is recommended for another loan. She has been our client since 2004.

Translated from Spanish by Gabrielle Sham, Kiva Volunteer.

Mercedes es comerciante múltiple de comida, ropa y joyas de mediana calidad, productos que comercializa al crédito con pagos diario en las oficinas publicas y privadas de la ciudad de La Paz; el esposo trabaja de transportista público y así complementan los ingresos principales con los que cubren la manutención de sus tres hijos; vive en la Zona Tembladerani de la Ciudad de La Paz. El crédito solicitado será utilizado para incrementar su mercadería y de esa forma poder generar mayores ingresos familiares. Es el cuarto crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le faculta para acceder a otro préstamo. Ella es nuestro cliente desde el año 2004.
loan_use: Purchase merchandise.

description: Together with her husband, Nikolinka G. keeps 16 sheep and a cow. They also keep about 130-140 sheep belonging to their fellow villagers. Nikolinka and her husband live in a house with their three kids. The loan they apply for will be used to buy 10 more sheep.
loan_use: To buy 10 more sheep

description:
Francisca is a member of the lending group, Nyame Beba of Elmina. These group members guarantee loans through a group repayment pledge. Peer support provides the incentive to repay; if one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the payment amount. The five members of this group have known each other for many years and provide a lot of support for each other as they all work inside the Elmina market.

Francisca owns a small general store. She sells a variety of goods used in Ghanaian dishes. Francisca has been purchasing much of her stock on credit, paying her supplier back after she has sold the products. This allows Francisca to purchase a lot of goods with the little capital she has; however, buying stock this way generates very little profit, as most of the profit goes to her distributor. With her loan, she hopes to buy tomatoes, onions, oil, and her other stock in bulk, so she can make more profit.

Francisca is currently supporting her four children through school. Two of her children are in middle school and two are in elementary school.
loan_use: Increase her capital so that she can stop buying on credit and get more profit to sustain her business.

description:
Patricia, 30, has been in the Mankessim market for over 10 years now. Initially, she was selling cosmetics, but soon realized that cloth and dressmaking material has a higher demand at the market so she switched over. Her goal is for her store be the purchasing center for dressmaking material, such that people from all the neighboring towns will come to the market for her products.

Sometimes Patricia lets her brother take care of her store so that she has time for her 10-year-old daughter. Patricia balances between being a single mother and a business owner.

Patricia is a member of the lending group in the Mankessim market. The group guarantees a loan through a group repayment pledge. Peer pressure and support provide the incentive to repay; if one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the payment amount.
loan_use: Purchase zippers, thread material, and other dressmaking materials

description: Rosalina M. is a young mother from the village of Sagafili Mulifanua. She has a vegetable garden of cabbages, tomatoes, beans, cucumbers and pumpkins. She also sells taro, taamu and bananas at the Fugalei Market (the main market in town) and occasionally in her village when there is a surplus. She has been using her previous loans solely on the business but she plans to use this loan to renovate her house as well as for school fees for her children. Rosalina is looking forward to more loans from SPBD and she is very thankful for being able to support her family.
loan_use: to renovate her house as well as for school fees for her children

description:
Ama sells a variety of foods, but mostly she carries bananas and plantains. She attributes her success to the fact that she is the only large-scale supplier of these products in her area. A few times a week, Ama travels to neighboring villages to purchase bananas and plantains. Then she lugs them back by carrying them into tro-tros (a packed Ghanaian bus, converted from mini-vans). Because of this tedious transportation process, many banana and plantain sellers in the area come to her for their stock.

Ama has three children. The youngest, 14, is in middle school, the second youngest, 19, is studying to become an electrician, and the oldest, 26, is finished school. She hopes to use the profits for their school fees and to build a house for her family. Currently they live in a compound with around 20 people.

Ama is a member of the lending group, Disciples. This group of 19 guarantees a loan through a group repayment pledge. The members sell various products in Cape Coast. They also offer each other support in their businesses. Support and peer pressure provide the incentive to repay; if one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the payment amount.
loan_use: To purchase bananas and plantains

description: Mrs. Sem V., 52, is a widow who lives with her two children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To help meet the financial needs of her family, she runs a stand at home selling various kinds of grocery products to the people in her area, making on average about $3/day in revenue. Moreover, two of her children are currently employed at a nearby garment factory, earning collectively around $160/month. Mrs. Sem V. hopes this loan will help her expand her inventory by adding more products to satisfy the growing demands of her customers.
loan_use: To purchase more grocery products to fulfill her clients' demands.

description: H. Nargiz is from Sumgayit city in the Azerbaijan republic. She is 35 years old. She is single but she lives with her parents. Her parents are elderly. She is the only breadwinner of her family. She began her business with $200 in 1995. She keeps busy with retail trade. She started selling a small variety of baby clothes. With this small business and only $200 in working capital, she could hardly earn enough money to meet her family's food and important consumption needs.\r\n\r\nNargiz needs $500 to expand her business. She wants to increase her assortment of goods and to buy additional sorts of goods. She will repay the loan within 12 months. She hopes eventually to expand her business. She hopes that this will improve the living condition of her family.
loan_use: To increase her assortment of goods and to buy additional sorts of goods.

description: Shakhsuvar Q.  is a 65-year-old farmer who raises vegetables in the southern region of Azerbaijan, Bilasuvar.  He is internally displaced person from occupied Jabrail region who fled to Bilasuvar during the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993. He is married and has six children; three sons and three daughters. He started raising vegetables in 1992. Every year he sells his crop in the local bazaar and to the local people. His garden is very big but during these fourteen years the land needed treatment and got drained. And every year it is getting harder to raise a good quality crop. Shakhsuvar is going to improve his land and start raising such vegetables as potatoes, tomatoes,  peppers and onions. For this purpose Shakshsuvar has  applied for 800 USD with a repayment term of 15 months. He will spend this money to purchase fertilizer and to  buy seeds for the vegetable he wants to grow.
loan_use: To expand his business

description:
Nataliya is married with a 3-year-old daughter. They live in Berdyansk where Nataliya works in the big “Privoz” market. Nataliya owns two stores where she manufactures and sells women’s clothing – skirts, specifically. All her clothing items are characterized by exclusive quality fabric, original design, affordable prices, and honest customer service. At the moment, Nataliya has about $700 in inventory. Her turnover capital is about $1200. Her monthly net profit is about $500.

Nataliya is requesting a loan of $500 to modernize her facility with some necessary equipment. She believes quality equipment will improve the financial indicators of her business, allowing her to increase the living standards of her family and give her a chance to invest a portion of her profit into the remodeling of her apartment. Nataliya is a strong character, sincere and honest with her clients. We believe her zeal and good customer service will help her to succeed and generate additional income.
loan_use: To remodel her vending facility and increase assorted goods

description:
Born November 11th, 1960, Mrs. Joséphine G. is a widow and mother of four children. She lives in the Adawlato neighborhood of Lomé and is a retailer of infant and children's clothing. She became and everywoman after the death of her husband in order to take care of her children. She is seeking a $1000 loan to stock clothing from wholesalers, which will increase her income. \r\n

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

\r\nNée le 11 Novembre 1960, Madame Joséphine G. est veuve et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Elle réside au quartier d’Adawlato à Lomé et est revendeuse de trousseaux bébé et d’habits pour enfants. Elle est devenue la femme à tout faire après la mort de son mari, pour bien entretenir ses enfants. Elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour s’approvisionner en habits pour enfants et trousseaux chez les grossistes ce qui augmentera ses revenus.
loan_use: Purchase and sale of infant and children's clothing

description:
Mrs. Abla A. was born May 31, 1977 in Lomé. She lives in the Djidjolé district of Lomé, where she has a bar/restaurant and specializes in serving “foufou” (mashed yams). She is a married mother who is alone responsible for taking care of her two (02) children. She is requesting a loan of $200 for the wholesale purchase of cassava, yams and corn from local farmers. This will allow her to expand her business and to develop a loyal customer base.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Abla A. est née le 31 Mai 1977 à Lomé. Demeurant dans le quartier de Djidjolé à Lomé, elle est gérante d’un restaurant-bar de foufou (igname pilée). Elle est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants qui sont à sa charge. Elle sollicite une somme de $200 pour acheter chez les paysans les maniocs, les ignames, le maïs en gros. Ceci lui permettra d’agrandir son commerce et de fidéliser sa clientèle.
loan_use: Wholesale purchase of yams, cassava and corn

description:
Martha is one of many mothers that are alone in raising their children due to the fact that her husband went to the United States to work. She has to struggle to raise her children well. Since there are long periods of time where her husband can not find a stable job in the U.S. She does not recieve enough money to pay for the needs of her children. That is how she began to sell cosmetic supplies to her friends and neighbors by catalog. Later she began to sell shoes and crafts. Presently she has more clients.

However, she has taken a special liking to the selling of clothing products and for that reason, she has decided to buy winter clothing, that way she can offer them to her clients. This is why she is asking for a loan of $650 that she will repay in 6 months. With this loan she will be able to buy clothing to sell, like jackets, jeans, and sweaters. With your help Martha will support her children even though her husband is so far away.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Martha es una de tantas mujeres mexicanas que se quedan a cargo de sus hijos puesto que su esposo de fue a Estados Unidos a trabajar, y ella tiene que luchar por sacar adelante a sus hijos. Ya que hay largas temporadas en que su esposo no consigue trabajo en Estados Unidos no recibe tan rápido dinero que le manda y los gastos de sus dos hijos no esperan, fue así como comenzó por ofrecerles a sus amigas y vecinas cosméticos por catálogo, y después empezó a vender zapatos y manualidades. Actualmente tiene más clientas.

Sin embargo ya le tomó un cariño muy especial a la venta de productos, y es por esto que está decidida a comprar ropa de temporada de invierno para poder ofrecerles a sus clientes. Es por esto que está solicitando un crédito de US $650 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero podrá comprar ropa, como chamarras, pantalones, y suéteres. Con tu ayuda Martha podrá sacar adelante a sus hijos a pesar de que su esposo se encuentra tan lejos.
loan_use: Purchase clothes to boost her supply of products.

description:
Mercedes is 45 years old. She co-habited with Miguel for 24 years, until she was widowed three years ago, leaving her in charge of their business that they started together when the began their relationship.

Mercedes owns a butcher’s shop, she recounts with much sadness that when her partner died, she had many difficulties in taking over this and the grocery store which they managed together, as it was he who had largely taken care of the businesses. Despite this, she managed to continue forward alone, with the help of her 5 children aged 28, 24, 22, 19 and 13 years-old respectively. Today only the youngest of them lives with her, while the rest are already married and have established their own homes although they continue to help her with the family business.

Today her business continues to function well, with a well-established customer base, and she struggles day-by-day to advance.

Mercedes needs a loan in order to buy livestock which she will then farm in order to sell the meat in her butcher’s shop.

Translated for the Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Katy Long

Mercedes tiene 45 años. Vivió en pareja durante 24 años con Miguel hasta que enviudó hace 3 años quedándose a cargo del negocio que montaron juntos cuando comenzaron la relación.

Mercedes posee una carnicería, cuenta con mucha tristeza que cuando falleció su pareja tuvo muchas dificultades para retomar el negocio de la carnicería y la despensa que manejaban juntos, debido a que él se ocupaba mayormente de dichos negocios. No obstante logró salir adelante sola con la ayuda de sus cinco hijos de 28, 24, 22, 19 y 13 años respectivamente. Hoy día solamente la menor de todos vive con ella, mientras que los demás ya están casados y han formado sus propios hogares aunque continúan ayudando en el negocio familiar.

Hoy día su negocio continúa bastante bien, cuenta con clientela bien formada y ella lucha día a día por salir adelante.

Necesita de un crédito para la compra de animales vivos que luego faena para vender la carne en su carnicería.
loan_use: Purcahse Livestock

description: Mrs. Eam H., age 63, works with her husband, age 73, on their plot of farmland growing rice crops, making about $2 each day. They have two children who live at home and work as carpenters, earning together $200 per month. She would like to request a loan of $600 in order to purchase one cow to work plowing on her farm and also to buy more carpentry tools for her sons to expand their shop and help support the family.
loan_use: To purchase a cow for farming and carpentry tools.

description:
Firuza A. is a very energetic and creative person. She has been selling clothes for over 5 years. From her profits, she has been able to add a room to her house for a food shop. She has 4 children and they are old enough for help her at the food shop. \r\n

She got her first loan from Microinvest in 2006, which she used to increase the variety of clothes to sell. Her sales were successful and with the profits, she purchased groceries to sell in her food shop. Her clothing stall is well known, and she sells her clothes quickly.\r\n

Firuza requests a loan from Kiva so she can buy two tables and eight chairs for her food shop and cafe, where her children can offer hot coffee and some baked goods.
loan_use: Furnish cafe

description:
Sadbarghon T. has been selling small household goods for over 3 years, in the J.Rasulov district of Khujand,Tajikistan. She loves her business very much, because it is interesting to help customers choose small items. She has a large assortment of goods and every day her stall is crowded. \r\n

Sadbarghon T. is an active client of Microinvest. For the coming holiday month, she wishes to purchase many fancy goods so she can take advantage of the holiday trade and increase her sales and profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods so she can increase sales.
loan_use: Purchase more goods to increase sales

description: Araz is a 42-year-old trader who owns a shop where he sells spare parts for cars, and he rents a small garage. He lives with his wife and 3 children in a southern village of the Saatli region. He has seven years of experience. Since that time, with the income he has earned he built his own garage and continues running his business in new place. He has a large number of customers because Araz can fix the spare parts that he sells. Customers are very satisfied with his work. However, more and more foreign cars fill the car market, and spare parts for them are very expensive. Araz is afraid he could lose his permanent customers because more and more people are selling their Russian cars and buying foreign ones. He urgently needs to diversify the products he sells. For this purpose he has applied for 1200 USD to purchase newer, modern spare parts.
loan_use: Going to purchase modern spare parts.

description:
Vilayet D. was born in 1958 is married and has a child. He was born and raised in the city of Karakjunlu. He has been raising cattle for more than 7 years. At the beginning it was very difficutl, but in 2004 he obtained a $300 credit from the Ahsulin branch of Normico. This money allowed him to increase the size of his business. Currently his business is in need of additional financing.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Дунямалиев Вилаят.1958 года рождения.Женат, имеет одного ребенка. Родился и проживает в село Каракоюнлу. Более семи лет занимается скотоводством. Проначалу было очень трудно, но в 2004-ом году после обращения в Нормикро Ахсуинского филиала он получил кредит на сумму тросто долларов. На полученные деньги успешно расширил свой бизнес. Вилаят нуждается в повторном кредите.
loan_use: To increase the quantity of animals

description:
Pascuala is 58 years old and has three children. Her husband is a farmer. The family lives in a small rented house.

Pascuala actually is unemployed. She is a seamstress and used to work part-time for an haute couture company. Pascuala says that the home is short of money since her husband is getting older and can't work as hard as before.

She has decided to start a small business within her house. She plans to sell cloth and sew tailor-made clothing. She expects business will be successful since she has a famous reputation as seamstress in the town.

She is asking for credits to purchase a quintal (100 pounds) of different kinds of cloth to sell in her community. She will also repaire her old sewing-machine so that she can prepare clothing the customers order.

This way, Pascuala’s family will have a second source of income and she will be in a condition to help her husband support her family financially.
loan_use: Purchase cloth to sell and to repaire a sewing-machine to prepare clothes.

description:
Elza is a hard-working, vigorous woman from a large and humble family. The tough nature of her life made her realize very early on the value of hard work; thanks to this lesson, she gets along well in the various activities that she’s worked at throughout her life. Currently, she devotes herself to raising and selling young animals and to agriculture. She works out of her home, and with her income she is able to provide a higher quality of life to her son, her greatest joy in life ever since her husband left her as the sole provider of the household. She is requesting a loan to purchase more small animals so that she can sell them once they reach adequate weight. With this investment, she will be able to substantially increase her earnings and improve her quality of life. Let’s get behind the plans of this selfless mother.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Elza es una mujer vigorosa y trabajadora, proviene de una familia amplia y humilde, el carácter duro y dificultoso de la vida hizo que conociera desde muy pequeña el valor significativo del trabajo, gracias a eso ella se desenvuelve sin ningún problema en diversas actividades que le ha tocado realizar durante su vida; actualmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animalitos y a las labores agrícolas, estos trabajos los realiza en su pequeña casita y con el ingreso que le genera le brinda una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo, quien es su mayor alegría ya que su esposo la abandonó y ella se convirtió en el único sostén de su hogar. Solicita un préstamo para comprar más animalitos pequeños para luego venderlos cuando alcancen un peso adecuado, así mismo con esta inversión podrá aumentar sustancialmente su margen de ganancias e incrementará su calidad de vida. Solidaricémonos con el propósito de esta abnegada madre.
loan_use: Purchase of greater quantity and variety of small animals to sell at market when they reach maturity.

description:
Laura worked for many years in a “maquiladora” (factory/assembly plant) but, unfortunately, she lost her job during personnel layoffs at the business. Nevertheless, with the bonus/severance she received as a result, she was able to purchase a sewing machine and start building a customer base. At first, she focused solely on hemming or repairing clothes. She gained the confidence of her customers and today they ask her to make skirts and shorts for them, among other things. However, her sewing machine broke and now she cannot work the way she needs to.

She is asking for a loan of $475USD to be repaid over a five-month term. With this money she will be able to purchase materials such as thread, buttons, fabrics, remnants, and other items she needs to make clothes. With your support, Laura and her children will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Laura trabajó durante muchos años en una maquiladora desgraciadamente hubo un recorte de personal en su empresa y se quedó sin trabajo. Sin embargo con el dinero que le dieron de aguinaldo se compró una máquina de coser y ahí fue como comenzó a adquirir clientes, primero lo único que hacía eran dobleces a la ropa, o arreglarlos, sin embargo después fue adquiriendo la confianza de sus clientes y hoy ya le encargan hacer faldas, shorts entre otras cosas. Sin embargo tiene una máquina de coser que se descompuso y por lo tanto ahora no puede trabajar como necesita.

Por lo tanto está solicitando un crédito de US 475 para pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero Laura podrá comprar materiales como, hilos, botones, telas, retazos, y otras cosas que necesita para poder elaborar las prendas. Con tu ayuda Laura podrá salir adelante y sacar adelante a sus hijos.
loan_use: Purchase sewing supplies to make clothes.

description:
Mrs. Mai, 31 years old, is marriaged and has 3 children who are currently going to school. At the moment, her family is raising around 1,000 hens. Her daily income is above 150,000 VND (94 USD). She would like to request a loan to buy food for her hens. Everyday, her husband collects the eggs their hens produces as well as buying additional eggs from individual sellers (others families) in the village and then sell it to small retailers. She is planning to borrow money to expand her business (raise more hens).

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. N., Kiva volunteer.

Chị Mai 31 tuổi đã có chồng và có 3 con đang đi học. Hiện tại , gia đình chị nuôi gần 1,000 con gà đẻ. Thu nhập hàng ngày của gia đình trên VND150,000. Chị vay vốn để mua cám nuôi gà. Chồng chị thường xuyên đi giao trứng của gia đình và thu gom trứng của các gia đình trong làng bán cho các cửa hàng bán lẻ. Chị có kế hoạch khi vay được nhiều vốn sẽ mở rộng chăn nuôi.
loan_use: To purchase food for chickens

description: Mrs. Proeung N., 52, is a market-vendor selling scallop and octopus, earning around $7.3/day in revenue. She is married and has six children. Her husband helps her sell at the market every morning and one of her children is self-employed as a motor-taxi driver, earning $2.40/day in revenue; a number of her other children are married and some are unemployed. Mrs. Proeung N. hopes to use this loan to expand her inventory and the remainder of the loan is to buy a motorcycle to assist in the transportation of her products.
loan_use: To expand her inventory of seafood to sell as well as to purchase a motorcycle to transport her products

description: Mr. Yem N., age 32, works selling garlic, earning around $43 per month. His wife works selling make-up products at the market, making on average $70 per month. They have two children who attend school. The children also help their father sell garlic when their school schedule allows. He is asking for loan of $1200 to purchase more garlic in order to meet customer demand.
loan_use: To purchase garlic for resale

description:
Guilaze Almeida M. was born in Massaca district, in Boane, province of Maputo. He is 50 years old; he was raised with both of her sisters who later passed away. After completing the 4th grade he enrolled in a school to be an electrical technician but he was not able to graduate. In the same here he attended driving school.

In 1988 he started working as a driver. The job only lasted a couple of months and after he started working planting potatoes. In 1979 he married his girlfriend and now has 5 kids, of whom 3 are girls. He has a small store and in he also raises chicken in the backyard. He approached Hluvuku-Adsema to request a loan to invest in his chicken business. His dream is to expand his planting area and to do better in the chicken business.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização Bairro 1- Boane/ Maputo Cliente: Guilaze Almeida M.
