SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. As they lack tangible collateral assets, they are termed not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from that client, extends a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment. The process is called a sale and leaseback arrangement.
loan_use: To purchase additional cows and milking equipment.

description:
Mrs Judith is 32 years old and has 5 children together with her husband Eulices.

Judith has had a business selling cold drinks and sweets for a long time. Eulices is a fisherman and he works for himself as he owns 2 little fishing boats. Together they work hard and constantly make an effort to offer well being and security to their beloved children.

Judith requests the loan in order to invest in her business and to help Eulices buy fishing equipment necessary for a good performance. With your help Judith will be able to materialize her objectives.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Judith, se dedica a la venta de bebidas heladas y dulces desde hace mucho tiempo, tiene 32 años y es madre de cinco hijos, su querido esposo, Eulices, es trabajador independiente y se dedica a al pesca gracias a que es propietario de dos botes. Judith en compañía de su esposo trabajan arduamente y se esfuerzan a diario a fin de otorgarles bienestar y seguridad a sus queridos hijos.

Ella desea el préstamo para invertirlo en su negocio y sobre todo para apoyar a Eulices con la compra de los materiales de pesca necesarios para su buen desempeño. Con tu ayuda la señora Judith concretará sus objetivos.
loan_use: Buy more supplies for a shop selling refreshments and to buy fishing equipment

description:
Mrs. Channa H. has been married since 2000 and has one son and one daughter. She has been weaving silk at home since 1998. She learned to weave silk from her sister and started her silk production within the same year. Her husband, Mr. Sal Puth, is a farmer who grows rice and vegetables. \r\n

\r\nChanna has borrowed money from MAXIMA twice already. Now she is requesting another loan, in the amount of $200. She will use this money to purchase a water pumping machine for her husband so that he can expand his farming business.
loan_use: To purchase a water pumping machine for her husband

description:
M. Ibrohim is 19 years old. He is not yet married and lives together with his parents and three sisters. His parents did not spare themselves working hard to raise him and his three younger sisters. Today he is helping his parents and earning for his future and the future of his sisters. 

Ibrohim has been working since he was sixteen. For three years already Ibrohim has been producing the eastern sweets which are called “nabot”. Nabot is made from sugar syrup that is boiled in a huge cauldron for several hours. After cooking, the nabot is left in the cauldron for 7-10 days to become hard. Then the nabot is taken out of the cauldron and is ready for use. The nabot is very sweet and health-giving. It helps with fever and stomach diseases. People say that in ancient times, when one was traveling, he would take with him bread and the nabot, both giving strength and energy. 

Today Ibrohim requests 600.00 US Dollars. He is planning to buy  sugar for producing nabot. This is Ibrohim’s first loan; however he is quite sure that he shall pay it in 12 months.
loan_use: Purchasing of sugar for producing of the eastern sweets “nabot”

description: Margret is 34 years old and married with 5 children. Her current business is selling charcoal on a small scale.\r\nShe intends to construct a house from the profits gained and also pay school fees for the children
loan_use: To buy more trees for making charcoal
borrower_names: Prossy, Christine, Christine, Max, Resty, Margret
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Teresa Q., widow of Bautista, is the mother of 6 children whom she has been able to support through her ability to work with wool, to knit, and to fabricate jerseys as well as other items which she makes by hand in order to sell in the commercial centers of her area and the city of El Alto.

Thanks to the credit she has received from Pro Mujer, Teresa has been able to buy a sewing machine, with which she has increased her production and at the same time satisfied the demand that existed. However, this has still not been sufficient, since she has 6 children to feed and care for.

For this reason Teresa needs capital in order to increase her supply of raw material, and in this way elevate her production so that it will create a better income for maintaining herself and her 6 children.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Teresa Q. Vda. De Bautista, es madre de 6 hijos, a los cuales supo sacar adelante con su habilidad para realizar trabajos en lana, tejodos, chompas y otros, los que fabricaba a mano para poder luego vender en los principales comercios de su zona y de la ciudad de El Alto.

Gracias a los créditos de Pro Mujer, Teresa pudo coprar una máquina de tejido, con la cual ha incrementado su producción y del mismo modo a satisfecho la demanda que existía, pero aún no es suficiente, ya que son 6 hijos los que debe alimentar y cuidar.

Por tanto, Teresa precisa de capital para poder incrementar la compra de su materia prima, y de esta manera elevar su producción para que esto represente un mejor ingreso para el sustento de ella y de sus 6 hijos.
loan_use: To increase her supply of raw material and thereby elevate production.

description:
Irma C. Cortez works as a secretary in her husband’s automotive repair shop. They have owned this shop located on the road to Viacha for the past 6 years. The garage is rented and they have 5 employees with expertise in the different branches of automotive mechanics. This is a family business in which her sister-in-law also works. The shop is equipped with the machinery necessary for automotive repair, and they repair things like fuel injection cars. Irma is requesting this loan in order to buy a small vehicle that will permit her to provide roadside assistance because this is the most lucrative activity for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Irma C. Cortez, trabaja como secretaria en el taller mecánico de su esposo, con quien conjuntamente han instalado un taller hace 6 años en el camino a Viacha. Actualmente el taller se encuentra en un ambiente alquilado, y trabajan con 5 dependientes en distintos rubros de la mecánica. Se trata de una empresa familiar, donde su cuñada trabaja con ellos. El taller ha sido equipado con maquinaria adecuada para el tipo de trabajo que realizan, como la reparación de cerebros electrónicos, y automóviles a inyección. Irma precisa de capital para la compra de una pequeña movilidad que le permita realizar los auxilios en carretera, que son los que representan mejores ingresos para el taller.
loan_use: Purchase of a small vehicle to provide roadside assistance

description:
Mary K. is a widow with two children. She runs a small pharmacy in Makeni town of Sierra Leone. She started her business in 1997 after the death of her husband. She started by selling basic medicines in a small quantity in her neighbourhood and has now expanded her business.

\r\nBeing a single mother and solely responsible for providing for her family's expenses, Mary took several loans from SMT to expand her business to earn better profit. Mary now intends to expand her business to another location in Makeni called Masimra where the demand for medicines is high. She is therefore requesting a $1,200 loan to undertake this expansion.
loan_use: Expand her pharmacy to another area of Makeni town where demand is high.

description:
Delfina C., a mother of 8 children, belongs to the association Escuelita 2 of Villa Adela. For three years, she has sold vegetables in the market of the 16th of July fair, where she walks long distances in order to achieve her desired number of sales. Before that, Delfina would travel to the countryside to bring back lambs which she would then work and sell in the Garita de Lima area in La Paz. For health reasons, she stopped traveling and now depends on her husband who's livelihood is heavy transport, to bring her merchandise back and forth. Depending on the season and the demand, Delfina has also sold diesel and gasoline which is a lucrative trade, but is also risky because this kind of merchandise can be confiscated and decommissioned due to new provisions established by hydrocarbon authorities. For this reason, Delfina requires capital that will allow her to seriously engage in the commerce of vegetables while taking advantage of her husband's trips in order to establish a shop in the city.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Delfina C., madre de 8 hijos, pertenece a la asociación Escuelita 2 de Villa Adela hace tres años se dedica a la venta de verduras en el mercado de la feria 16 de Julio, donde deambula largas distancias para lograr la venta esperada. Anteriormente Delfina se dedicaba a viajar al campo para traer corderos, mismos que ella misma faenaba y vendía en la zona Garita de Lima de la ciudad de La Paz. Por razones de salud, ella dejó de viajar, ahora solo deja que su esposo, quien se dedica al transporte pesado, lleve y traiga su mercadería. Dependiendo de la temporada y la demanda, en ocasiones, Delfina ha comerciado con diesel y gasolina, que si bien es un rubro muy bien remunerado, es riesgoso puesto que este tipo de mercadería puede ser confiscada y decomisada por nuevas disposiciones de las autoridades de hidrocarburos. Por tal motivo, Delfina requiere de capital que le permita activar de forma seria el comercio de verduras, aprovechando los viajes de su esposo, para poder establecer un puesto de venta en la ciudad.
loan_use: Delfina requires capital that will allow her to seriously engage in the commerce of vegetables while taking advantage of her husband's trips in order to establish a shop in the city.

description:
Mary E. is a trader who owns a cosmetics, gift and cards shop. She is married to a formal head of an institution. They have two children. Their family is surviving through Mary’s hard work.

At the moment Mary wants to increase her income by increasing her capital to purchase more stock for her shop to meet the growing demand for her goods. She is therefore asking for $1,200 as additional capital to buy more cosmetics, gifts and cards to meet the demand of her customers.
loan_use: As additional capital to buy more cosmetics, gifts and cards to meet the demand of her costumers.

description:
S. Rohat is 47 years old. She and her husband have three children, one of whom is married.

Rohat has been running her clothing store for three years. She sells and rents traditional wedding dresses including the national wedding dress. Traditionally families in Tajikistan are large. Consequently, there are lots of marriages and Rohat has a lot of clients. The stability of her business allows her to make a considerable contribution to the family’s income.

During the previous loan cycle she repaid the loan on time. Rohat is now requesting $300.00 in order to purchase a new wedding dress that she can rent to her clients. She gives her assurance that the loan will be fully paid in two months.
loan_use: To purchase a new wedding dress for rent.

description: Rose is 39 years old and married with five children ages 20, 18, 12, 9, and 6. Her current business is piggery. She plans to use the profits to purchase more piglets.
loan_use: To buy more land for expanding her piggery
borrower_names: Joyce, Sarah, Fatuma, Justine, Florence, Teddy, Rose
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Negmatova M. lives in Spitamen; she is married and has 3 children.  She has been an active client of MicroiInvest since 2006 and she recommended herself as an executive and reliable client who trusts the MicroiInvest loan procedures.  

She trades in the bazaar where her trade outlet is located.  She is engaged in the special material for the national dress selling industry.  She works with a straight supplier, which is why the prices for her goods are lower than the bazaar prices.  

Working in the bazaar she meets stiff competition and wants to provide a wider assortment of new goods to attract more repeat customers.  It also permits her to realize new business plans and to develop the existing business.  Now Mrs. Negmatova requests the loan of $850 to widen the existing assortment and to develop the existing business.
loan_use: to widen the existing assortment and to develop the existing business

description:
Tochiddin R. is 31 years old, has secondary education. He is a teacher and has 4 children. Tochiddin has been in the retail business for the past 5 years and has been selling small merchandise like sawing materials, glue, children's toys, hair clips and other things. For this purpose he is renting a space at the central market of town of Yavan called Tidjorat. He wants to use his loan to buy more assortment of merchandise. This loan will give local residents an opportunity to shop at the market for small, but very useful things for the home at moderate prices.

Tochiddin plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Раджабов Точиддин, возраст – 31 год, образование высшее, специальность – учитель, женат , имеет 4 -х детей. Точиддин в течение 5 лет занимается торговлей мелкими товарами народного потребления такими как нитки, клей, детские игрушки, заколки и другое. Для этого он арендует торговую точку на центарльном рынке города Явана под названием «Тиджорат». Полученный кредит он хочет использовать на пополнение ассортимента продаваемого товара. Данный кредит даст возможность местным жителям приобретать у себя на базаре не большие, но очень нужные вещи в домашнем хозяйстве по умеренным ценам.

Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.
loan_use: To increase the assortment of merchandise

description:
Marina K. is married with a grown son and a 14-year-old daughter. Her family lives in Berdyansk, on the Azov Sea.

Marina works in the local market, “Privoz”, selling women’s pants, skirts and footwear. One of the advantages of her business is a good balance of price and quality. Marina has been working with Nadiya Ukraine for four years. She has a perfect credit history and can be characterized as a very disciplined client with integrity. Currently, Marina has about $7000 in inventory. Her turnover capital is about $6000 and her monthly net profit is about $4000.

Marina is hoping to use this loan of $1200 to help attract additional funding, modernize her business and increase customer demand. She also wants to use some of her profits to remodel her apartment and possibly purchase a vehicle which would serve business purposes and make life more comfortable for her family.
loan_use: Increase inventory

description: Christine S. is married and has three children. She runs a hardware store, and has joined with four of her friends to apply for a loan to expand it. Because the rent in her shop's current location is high, Christine plans to use the extra profits to build her own shop.
loan_use: To purchase more inventory for a hardware store

description: Miss Joy O. is 28 years old, single, and lives in Benin City. Joy has been sewing clothes for people in her community since 2004. She began her business after training for 3 years. Joy is requesting a loan of $450 to buy more material and items for tailoring so she can improve her business. She is a very hard worker and a LAPO client. She thanks you.
loan_use: To buy more tailoring materials for her business

description:
Maria Julia and Angelica have been members of the community bank “Maria Antonieta” for one year, and Gloria has been a member for three. Maria Julia is 37 years old and Gloria is 30. They both live with their partners and have two children. Angelica is 23 and single.

Maria Julia has owned a grocery store in the small town of Ambarmarca for the last two years. She sells milk, sugar, fruit, vegetables, and beans. Angelica has been traveling around the town selling carrots, squash, celery and lemons from a cart for the past 12 years. Gloria has a stand in the Nery Garcia market where she has been selling chili peppers, garlic, and squash for ten years.

Their loans are for de 600 soles, 200 soles, and 1800 soles (3 soles = $1) respectively, which will be invested in buying milk, sugar, fruit, vegetables, beans, corn, and corn meal. Maria Julia, Angelica, and Gloria plan to continue saving. Eventually Angelica would like to open a store and stop moving around as much.

In their bank they feel relaxed and are able to forget their problems. The dreams of Maria Julia and Gloria are to buy their own house. Angelica hopes to prove herself by paying off her loan on time.
loan_use: Their loans are for de 600 soles, 200 soles, and 1800 soles (3 soles = $1) respectively, which will be invested in buying milk, sugar, fruit, vegetables, beans, corn, and corn meal.

description: Ratmini, 58, is the mother of 2 children. Both her children have already finished their schooling. Her husband, K., works at a workshop earning a small income, so she sells snacks at her house, earning about US$ 1 a day, and also kerosene, earning about US$ 1.50 a day. She is a member of MBK and is asking for a loan of US$ 100 to expand her business. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.
loan_use: expansion of her little retail businesses

description:
Adelaida is 53 years of age, married to a taxi driver, and mother of 3 grown-up children who work. Her youngest, who is 16 years old, helps her out with the business. She has been selling tortillas, cheese, baked beans, Nicaraguan tamales, and home cooked meals for over 15 years. Her day starts at 4:00 am and ends at 9:00 pm. She lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood of Managua. Adelaida is requesting this loan to invest it into her business and expand the kitchen, which is where she makes 100% of the products she offers. With this expansion, she will be able to offer better services to her customers. \r\n

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

\r\nLa Sra. Adelaida tiene 53 años de edad, es casada, su esposo es taxista, tiene 3 hijos dos de ellos ya son mayores de edad y trabajan por cuenta propia. Su hijo menor tiene 16 años de edad y es quién la apoya en el negocio. Tiene más de 15 años de tener este negocio el cual consiste en vender tortillas, cuajadas, frijoles cocidos, nacatamales y comida casera. Su día empieza a las 4:00 am y termina a las 9:00 pm. Habita en el barrio Laureles Norte de Managua. Doña Adelaida necesita el crédito para invertirlo en su negocio, quiere mejorar la infraestructura del lugar ampliando la cocina que es donde se desarrolla el 100 % de los productos que ofrece, y así poder ofrecer mejores condiciones a los vecinos que la visitan.
loan_use: Purchase of cinder blocks, sand, and metal to build kitchen

description:
I Wayan Sampun, 37 years old, has 10 acres of paddy field. Within a year, he can harvest twice from his field. Every 1 acre produces 60-70 kg of paddy and with the price of paddy Rp. 2.100,- per kg, from his 10 acre field his gross income is Rp. 1.470.000,-. In one planting period of 6 months, the crop needs fertilizer and insecticide spray and the cost of that is Rp. 750.000,-. Recently the price of fertilizer and insecticides are increasing and it directly affects the farmer. The costs for insecticides can be pressed down by using high quality and disease resistant seed which price is higher than the local one, but produces more and a better yield. With the loan, I Wayan Sampun plans to buy the high quality and disease resistant seed.

Translated from Indonesian by Iman Persada, Kiva Volunteer.

\r\n\r\nI Wayan Sampun, 37 tahun, memiliki areal sawah seluas 10 are. Dalam jangka waktu satu tahun, sawahnya bisa dipanen sebanyak dua kali. Setiap panen, per 1 are sawah bisa menghasilkan 60 – 70 kg padi dengan harga padi per kg adalah Rp. 2.100.- Jadi untuk 10 are sawah bisa mendapatkan penghasilan kotor Rp. 1.470.000.- Dalam satu periode tanam selama 6 bulan, tanaman padi membutuhkan perawatan berupa pupuk dan semprotan anti hama. Seluruh biaya perawatan tanaman menghabiskan biaya Rp. 750.000.- Belakangan ini harga pupuk dan anti hama mengalami peningkatan sehingga dampaknya sangat dirasakan oleh petani. Hasil yang didapat oleh petani sangat dipengaruhi oleh pemilihan bibit padi yang bukan merupakan jenis unggul. Untuk jenis padi unggul harganya relatif lebih mahal dari jenis lokal, namun mampu menghasilkan lebih banyak dan lebih tahan terhadap penyakit. Dengan pinjaman yang didapatnya, I Wayan Sampun berencana membeli bibit padi unggul sehingga bisa menghasilkan lebih banyak dan lebih baik. Biaya perawatan tanaman bisa ditekan karena kwalitas bibit unggul yang tahan penyakit.
loan_use: To buy high quality and disease resistant seed.

description: O. is a single mother of one child. She currently makes a large variety of crafts like mats, sandals, bags, necklaces, and shoes. She would like to use her extra profits to expand her business and make a business building.
loan_use: To expand her crafts business

description: Teddy is 32 years old, married, and has four children. She raises multiple forms of livestock, including poultry and pigs. In addition, she cultivates her land for crops. Teddy would like to apply for a loan in order to add another poultry shop to increase business and profits.
loan_use: To expand her farming business

description: Mrs. B. Chantha (age 44) and her husband, Mr. Nhean Dy (46) have been married since 1981. They have four children—two sons and two daughters. All of their children weave silk at home. Chantha and her family are living on an island on the Mekong River. She is in the business of weaving silk.  She learned to weave silk from her neighbor and started her silk production in 1980. Her husband is a fisherman.\r\n\r\nChantha is requesting his first loan for $500. She will use this money to repair her house.
loan_use: House repairs

description: Rusminah is a 40-year-old mother of 5 children. She has a food booth by her house where she sells fresh food, earning US$10.5 a day. As a member of MBK, Rusminah is asking for a loan of US$100 to increase her business capital. She works to help her husband, E., in providing the daily necessities for the family. Rusminah promises to repay the loan within a period of 12 months.
loan_use: Increase of business capital

description: Florence is 34 years old and married with 2 children. She prints cotton clothes and sells them wholesale and retail. Her income is solely from her business and she would like to expand it.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $350.
loan_use: She would like to create additional Gara tye and dye materials to sell in the market

description:
Mayi is 39 years old and married with five children. She sells used shoes. With the extra profits she hopes to make from expanding this business, she wants to pay school fees for the children.\r\n

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.
loan_use: To purchase more shoes thus expand her business

description:
Esther is a single mother of six children. She sells used clothes. She wants to use the extra profits to pay school fees for the children and buy a piece of land.\r\n

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.
loan_use: To purchase more clothes to sell in the store

description:
Sylvia is a single mother of two children. She owns a retail shop. With the extra profits she intends to build rental houses.\r\n

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.
loan_use: To purchase more goods for resale in her shop

description: Janet O. is a tailor by profession. She is 46 years old, married with 3 children; she lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been a LAPO member for 7 years. She is asking for the loan of $450 to buy more tailoring materials and clothing to sell. She trained for 4 years and has been in business since 1998.
loan_use: To buy more tailoring materials and clothing to sell

description: Rehile I. (her employee is pictured) owns a clothing and fabric store in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. She has been working in this business for the last 10 years and is currently looking for funding so that she can increase and diversify her inventory stock.
loan_use: To increase and diversify her inventory.

description: Abdul B. is a father of five children and pays their education expenses from the profits from the business.  Because of small loans from SMT, Abdul still takes some of the business items from the merchants on credit, which does not provide him with good profits. For two years, SMT has been working with Abdul and found him to be honest and hard working.  Abdul is requesting another loan to expand his business and build his own capital.  He would also like to involve his wife in the daily management of the business. Abdul is 36 years old.
loan_use: Abdul would like to expand his business so that his wife can help contribute to the success of the business.

description: Alpha sells basic items in the open market, in Makeni town.  His wife is engaged in petty trading to supplement the family income.  With his previous loans from SMT, he diversified the business and assisted his wife in starting a small business selling palm oil.  Alpha will complete repayments on his loan installments in late January and would like another loan to further expand his business.  Alpha is 35 years old with four children.
loan_use: Alpha would like to diversify his business and help it to grow.

description: Mashkhura M. lives in Spitamen and she is married with 3 children. She started her business selling small wares but now has her own store trading socks, fibers, mirrors, clothespin and the every day small wares. She is experienced in  her business (about 10 years) and has great ideas on how she would like to develop her business that she would like to implement. She is now requesting a loan to import new goods.
loan_use: to import new goods

description:
S. Nodira is 29 years old. She is married. Her husband is unemployed, but he is helping his wife. Nodira does not have yet the kids. However, she and her husband are supporting Nodira’s mother-in-law and sister-in-law.

Nodira is selling foodstuffs like macaroni, noodles, rice, oil, etc. in one of the local markets. Having been in this business for several years, Nodira knows how to run it properly. The business is stable and generates the significant income for the family.

Nodira has been a client of IMON for 7 years already. She is an accurate client having the positive history without any delinquency or violations. Today Nodira requests 1000.00 US Dollars for purchasing the foodstuff in order to enlarge the range of goods she is able to sell. She thanks everyone for their support and promises to pay the loan in 6 months.
loan_use: Purchasing of the goods to increase product selection

description:
Ruth is 26 years old. She is married and has a five year old child. She owns a vegetable stand, a business she started in 2005. This stand brings in a monthly profit of about $80 and is open until 8pm daily.\r\n

\r\nRuth hopes for a loan to buy more vegetables to sell. She belongs to the loan group named Tunajali.
loan_use: To buy vegetables for her business

description:
Mrs Magdalena’s grocery store is small, but very well supplied. That is why it is one of the busiest stores in the area.

The store belonged to Magdalena’s older sister but when she moved to another city, she transferred it to Magdalena.

Magdalena has been in charge of the store for 2 years now and she would like to further expand it. She wants to sell vegetables, fruits, poultry and red meat in order to give her demanding clients a good and complete service. With the profits she will obtain from the store, she wants to help her husband with the household expenses (they have 2 daughters).

In order to start her project, Magdalena requests this loan that she will pay back in 6 months. Magdalena and her family look forward to your prompt answer.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La pequeña pero muy surtida bodeguita de doña Magdalena es una de las más concurridas de su zona, anteriormente esta tiendita le pertenecía a su hermana mayor, quien por motivos de viaje se la traspasó, ahora ya con dos años de propietaria de este negocio desea ampliarlo mucho más para comercializar también verduras, frutas y carnes rojas y blancas. Ella tiene proyectado esta ampliación porque desea ofrecerles un buen y completo servicio a sus exigentes clientes, y con las ganancias que obtenga apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su familia que la conforman sus dos hijas, magdalena y su esposo. Para concretar su proyecto requiere adquirir un préstamo que se compromete a retornarlo en un lapso de seis meses. Magdalena y su familia esperan de corazón tu pronta respuesta.
loan_use: To increase the product offer of her grocery store, including buying and selling vegetables, fruits, poultry and red meat

description:
Gloria buys and sells fruit. Her work consists of purchasing large quantities of fruit to later transport to her warehouse or to other vendors for transport to other comercial locales such as Huancayo and Lima. Every morning, very early in the morning, she selects and packages the fruit with the help of her husband and children whenever they have free time, trying to help their mother whenever possible. Gloria needs more capital funds to stimulate the growth of her investment and obtain greater earnings, for savings and to build a house. She seeks a sum of money as a loan that we are sure you will be able to help with.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria, se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas; su trabajo consiste en comprar a las personas de la chacra una gran cantidad de frutas para luego transportarlos a su bodega o depósito donde los encajonan y los venden a las personas que transportan frutas a las ciudades más comerciales como Huancayo y Lima.Todas las mañanas desde muy temprano tiene que seleccionar las frutas y encajonarlas labor que realiza con la ayuda de su pareja e hijos quienes en los tiempos libres tratan de ayudar a su madre en lo posible.Gloria requiere de mayor capital para aumentar su inversión en la compra de frutas y por ende aumentar sus ganancias y ahorrar para la construcción de su casita y mejora de sus ambientes.Solicita una suma de dinero en préstamo que estamos seguros usted podrá proporcionárselos.
loan_use: An injection of Capital funds to stimulate growth of the investment and obtain greater earnings.

description:
Prof. Mery dedicates her time in the running of her corner store selling items and cold drinks to her community and she also works as a very good teacher, loved by her community. She is a very good business woman and she is dedicated to her work and gives fine customer service to the public. Given this demand Mery does not have sufficient funds to purchase products and merchandise and the few funds she does have from her work as a teacher she uses to cover her own living expenses. For this reason she is requesting your help to replenish and expand her business. You will be happy to share in the happiness of this devoted teacher, in her work, in her labor, for the benefit of her community.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La profesora MERY, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y bebidas heladas en su comunidad y aparte de ser una muy buena maestra y querida en la comunidad es una muy buena bodeguera dedicada a su trabajo y a dar una muy buena atención al público.Pese a esta demanda Mery no posee el dinero suficiente para la compra de sus productos y mercadería y el poco dinero que gana en el magisterio solo le ayuda a cubrir sus gastos propios; es por ello que solicita su colaboración para surtir su negocio y ampliarlo.No puede negarse a poder ser parte de la alegría de una maestra comprometida con su labor y el trabajo en beneficio de su comunidad.
loan_use: Inyección de capital para adquirir mayor y mejor calidad de productos para su bodega.  Influx of capital funds to acquire better and greater quantity of products for her warehouse.

description:
Aparicia Ramírez is more than fifty years old and is a single mother of two girls in elementary school. In order to achieve financial independence and to provide for young girls, she has had to work for years as a seamstress with a relative.

\r\nThanks to her great management of profits made from mending clothing, Aparicia was able to set up her own convenience store where she sells various goods. Along with her work at the store, she also continues to mend and sew clothes to keep the store supplied, and make a greater income and support her family. She wants to insure her girls never go hungry.

\r\n Aparicia is asking for a loan so she may supply her convenience store with sugar, rice, cheese, corn, cookies, along with keeping the materials and supplies stocked in her seamstress shop.
loan_use: To  buy sugar, noodles, cheese, rice, corn and cookies for her convenience store.

description: I am a mother of seven: five daughters and two sons. My husband and my elder son construct building and my younger son is a rickshaw driver.  Now, my son plans to buy a small truck to transport goods from one place to another for which we request a loan.  Parween B. will use the loan in their cycle repair shop. Basheeran M. requests this loan to buy stock for their general store. Zareen K. will use the money to buy an additional video game for their video games club.
loan_use: To buy a small truck

description:
Irina is a widow with a 16-year-old daughter. They live in Uzhgorod where Irina owns a business in the local market called “Belochka” (“Squirrel”). This is the only source of income for their family of two. Irina sells delicious baked cookies and cakes as well as a variety of candy and other sweets. Some of her inventory spoils quickly so Irina has to buy fresh merchandise every two days. Irina has a nice big vending spot in the market and offers a huge variety of fresh cookies, pastries, cakes and candy to please many different customers’ tastes. She has been in this food business for 4 years. Her turnover capital is about $2000. Last year Irina used profits generated from her business to remodel her entire apartment.

\r\n\r\n

Irina is very cheerful and open-hearted, which always attracts many potential clients to her vending kiosk. Moreover, she knows how to make reasonable investments in her business, work 24/7 and take risks whenever a new opportunity comes along. Irina outlived her husband who was killed in an accident. However, she overcame this tragedy and went back to work. Irina is requesting a loan of $500 to increase assorted inventory, continue to grow as an entrepreneur and possibly open a new vending facility in the near future.
loan_use: To increase inventory

description:
Rosa rents a spot in a market in the town of San Jose de Sisa, San Martín where she cooks and serves delicious food typical of the region to the townspeople.  She started the business 13 years ago with S/. 50 after she moved to the town with her husband and children from Iquitos were she was raised. Starting the restaurant was her idea; she loves to cook and wanted to help her family economically.  

Rosa is married and has four children. Her husband is supportive and often helps her with any manual labor the restaurant requires. Their four children study in Iquitos and live with other family members. Rosa uses the income she earns from her restaurant to fund her children’s education. She wants all of her children to have the opportunity to study and become professionals.

Rosa is a member of the community bank Maria Parado de Billido and is requesting S/. 700 to repay over a period of four months.  With the loan she would like to invest in new utensils, pots, and ingredients for her business. These investments will help Rosa provide a better service and attract new customers.  One day Rosa would like to return to Iquitos and open a shop selling clothing.
loan_use: invests in new utensils, pots, and ingredients for her business
town_name: San José de Sisa - San Martin

description:
Miss Julia is 50 years old. She is a single mother of two children, an 18 year old young woman and a 7 year old boy. Miss Julia has a small general store in her house and also sells clothing and cosmetics. Her daughter helps her sell the clothing and cosmetics at the university. She accepts payments in cash or in installments. Thanks to these two activities Miss Julia can support her family and provide an education for her children. The loan she is requesting will be used buy sand, cement, building blocks and iron (metal) to build an additional bedroom so she can provide her children a decent home.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Julia tiene 50 años, es madre soltera de dos hijos, una joven de 18 años y un niño de 7 años. Doña Julia tiene una pequeña pulpería en su casa de habitación y también se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos. Su hija le ayuda colocando ropa y cosméticos en la universidad, sus ventas las realiza al contado y al crédito. Estas dos actividades que doña Julia realiza le ayudan a mantener su hogar, y darles educación a sus hijos. El crédito lo quiere para comprar arena, cemento, bloques y hierros para construir un cuarto de habitación ya que desea darles una vivienda más digna a sus dos hijos.
loan_use: To buy construction materials to build a bedroom.

description:
Rosalva is a woman who likes to fight for her dreams. One of her dreams is to see her children going to college and having a greater chance of having a better quality of life than she did. This is why Rosalva started selling furniture three years ago. However, the sales of these type of products are very slow, and this is why she started selling clothing, which is what she does now. Little by little she has assembled a clientele who seeks her out to buy clothing from her.

However, Rosalva does not have enough merchandise to offer to her customers, and this is why she is requesting a loan for US $550, which she is willing to pay in a period of 6 months. With this money Rosalva will be able to buy clothing for the season to be able to offer it to her customers. With your help Rosalva will be able to succeed with her children.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Rosalva es una mujer a la que le gusta luchar por sus sueños. Y uno de ellos es ver que sus hijos puedan estudiar una carrera y tengan mayores probabilidades de tener un mejor nivel de vida. Es por eso que Rosalva comenzó desde hace 3 años a vender muebles pero las ventas de estos productos eran muy lentas, fue por eso que comenzó a vender ropa, a lo que se dedica actualmente. Poco a poco se a ido haciendo de clientela que la busca para comprarle ropa.

Sin embargo Rosalva no cuenta con suficiente mercancía para ofrecerle a sus clientes es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $550 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Rosalva podrá comprar más ropa de temporada para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Rosalva podrá salir adelante con sus hijos.
loan_use: Buying merchandise

description:
Maria del Socorro has 3 children, for whom she always wants to provide more. Her partner works hard but his earnings aren't enough to cover the family's expenses. Five years ago, Maria went to work in a taqueria for 4 hours every afternoon. Later, she decided to make food herself, at home, and sell it to the employees of a local company where she knew some of the workers. They recommended her food to their co-workers and, little by little, more orders for her food rolled in.

Maria del Socorro doesn't have, however, a secure way to store her deliveries and, consequently, she has to travel back and forth from home to factory in order to deliver her orders. She's applying for a US$650 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, so that she can buy a "stand" (cart?) for carrying her orders and, by speeding up her deliveries, increase her customer base. With your help, Maria can push her business ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

María del Socorro, tiene 3 hijos a los cuales desea siempre darles lo mejor, y su pareja también trabaja mucho, sin embargo lo que gana no es suficiente para poder pagar los gastos de sus hijos. Hace 5 años María ingresó a trabajar por las tardes en una taqueria por 4 horas, y después decidió preparar comidas en su domicilio y ofrecerlas a los trabajadores de una empresa, ya que ahí tiene varios conocidos y estos han sabido promover su negocio de comidas, y poco a poco más y más empleados de la empresa piden comidas.

Sin embargo María del Socorro, no cuenta con un lugar seguro para poder transportar su comida a la fábrica y esto hace que María tenga que dar más vueltas para poder entregar sus pedidos. Es por esto que María está solicitando un crédito de US $650 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero María del Socorro podrá tener en qué llevar sus pedidos y así obtener más clientes, porque se tardaría menos en entregarlos. Con tu ayuda María podrá sacar adelante su negocio.
loan_use: Buy a "stand" (cart?) for food deliveries.

description:
Cristobal is a young man who lives in the neighborhood of Milgaro de Dios (God's Miracle). Due to the lack of job opportunities, he found himself in search of something that would bring income to his family. From this need and from his love of computers, a business idea was born. He attends churches to record songs they make there, which afterwards, he edits the sounds to make CDs or DVDs for sale. When he can get free time, he also fixes computers for his neighbors. The loan he requests is to start building a recording studio.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator. Cristobal es un joven que habita en el barrio Milagro de Dios, debido a la falta de oportunidades de empleo se vió en la necesidad de buscar una actividad que le diera el ingreso de su familia. Es de ahí y de su gusto por la computación como nació la idea de su negocio, él se dedica a asistir a las iglesias a grabar los cantos que ahí se hacen, para después por medio de su computadora limpiar el sonido y grabar los cantos ya sea en cd o dvd, para después venderlos a la gente que se los solicita. En el tiempo que logra tener libre también se dedica a dar mantenimiento de computadoras a sus vecinos. El préstamo lo necesita para empezar las inversiones para hacer su estudio de grabación que en el momento son sus aspiraciones.
loan_use: to build a recording studio

description:
Francisco V. is a very capable and industrious gentleman. He has worked in the sale of groceries and basic grains in the Estación market of León. Since he found himself in a difficult economic situation 20 years ago with no employment to be found anywhere, he decided to invest his few savings in the purchase of grocery products and basic grains to sell them.

His activity is very stressful, since one must consider that he lives in León and his business is very far away from his home. Because of this he must leave at 6:30 AM every day to take a bus that carries him to the market where he has his business and arrives at this point at 7:30 AM (An hour of transportation). Similarly it happens in the end of the day which concludes at 5:00 or 6:00 PM. All these efforts he carries out for the sole purpose of maintaining his family, since he is a husband and father of three small children.

For 3 years he has been a faithful client of Ceprodel, completing 19 loans that he has utilized to supply more products and in this manner to be able to maintain his nuclear family.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Francisco V. es un C. muy esforzado y trabajador. Se desempeña en la venta de abarrotes y granos básicos en el mercado la Estación en León. Desde hace 20 años por la difícil situación económica que atravesaba debido a que no encontraba empleo en ningún lado, decidió invertir sus pocos ahorros en la compra de productos de abarrotes y granos básicos para venderlos.

Su actividad es muy agitada ya que a pesar que vive en León, su negocio está muy alejado de su hogar por lo que desde las 6:30 a.m todos los días espera un bus que lo lleve al mercado donde tiene su negocio y llega a este punto a las 7: 30 a.m (Una hora de transporte). De igual manera sucede al final del día el cual concluye a las 5:00 o 6:00 pm. Todos estos esfuerzos los realiza con el único propósito de mantener a su familia ya que es esposo y padre de tres pequeños hijos.

Desde hace 3 años ha sido un fiel cliente de Ceprodel, realizando 19 créditos que los ha utilizado para surtir mas sus productos y de esta manera poder mantener su núcleo familiar.
loan_use: To buy groceries for resale.

description:
Mrs. Maria I. has been selling cosmetics during the past 17 years at La Estacion market in Nicaragua´s Leon province.

She began her business subletting her stall in the market, but she was not making enough money so she decided to speak with the market managers to obtain her own stall. This was a sound business decision which lowered her fixed costs and helped her to reach her sales targets and increase her benefits.

Mrs. Maria Teresa I. has been able to do this thanks to the business loan given to her by Ceprodel. Thanks to this loan she has incresed her product range at her market stall in León.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.<
loan_use: Cosmetics purchase

description: Aflatun A. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He is 46 years old, married and has one son. He has been driving a taxi for a few years. He has applied for a loan of $1100, so he can repair his taxi.
loan_use: To repair taxi

description:
Hurmatvi was born in 1969, she is married and has 4 children. Three of the kids are girls who, together with Hurmatvi, sew izori, a type of pants made out of warm fabrics and worn as part of the national costume. Hurmatvi then sells the izori at the Korvon market in Dushanbe, capital of Tajikistan. During her own childhood, Hurmatvi had helped her grandmother to make national Tajik clothes. Nowdays, since her own family was forced to find additional income as there is not enough money for family needs, Hurmatvi taught her daughters this craft and now they all sew izori for sale. Hurmatvi has many loyal customers who she was able to attract because of the quality of her sewing and the sturdiness of the seams. She sells about 10-20 izori daily and her garments cost much less then imported clothes.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Хурматви 1969 года рождения,замужем имеет 4 детей.Из них 3 девочек которые шьют из теплых тканей национальные штаны с матерью.Мать реализует их на торгвой точке расположенной на рынке Корвон,Душанбе,Таджикистан.Хурматви с детства помогала бабушке шить изоры-нац.штаны.Сегодня когда жизнь вынудила искать работу из-за нехватки денег на семейные нужды,Хурматви обучила своих девочек этому ремеслу и теперь они все занимаются пошивом изоров-штанов.На сегодня Хурматви смогла привлечь многих клиентов качеством пошива и прочностью швов.Она ежедневно продает по 10-20 изоров и её изделия стоят на много дешевле импортных изделий.
loan_use: Buying velur-fabric for future sewing clothes for sale.

description: Inobat T. lives in Nau, Tajikistan. She is married and has 3 children. Mrs.T. is engaged in the business of selling national dresses in the flea bazaar. The stable business income helped her to open her own trade outlet. Additionally she works as a secretary. Mrs.T. works with the direct suppliers of the material which is the reason her prices for her dresses are lower than the bazaar prices. She has repeat customers and bulk buyers. Mrs.T. requests a loan of 2700 STJ for the purchase of new material lots.
loan_use: For the purchase of new material lots.

description:
This group has been together for five months. Jalia has a hardware shop. With the extra business profits, she intends to open up another hardware shop. Hellen sells vegetables in the market. Aisha sells firewood while Grace sells fish for a living.\r\n

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.
loan_use: To invest in their businesses

description: Olujoke S. is married with 3 children, is 32 years old, and hails from Ajamgbadi area in Lagos state, Nigeria. She is a stylist and sells weavon (a hair weaving product) and attachments (extensions). She has been in LAPO as a secretary of a union since 2005. She needs a loan of $450 to buy more weavon and relaxer for sale.
loan_use: To buy more weavon and hair relaxer.

description: Roberto Riva is a young 28-year-old man who lives with his wife Nélida Ovando and their child.  Since a young age, Roberto has worked arduously to improve his condition in life.  He began as a traveling salesman, and it was during this time he met his wife.  They worked hard and soon saved enough capital to create their own small business.  Now, with a wife and a child to support, Roberto must work even harder to provide for his family.\r\n\r\nRoberto’s business has continued to grow and now gives work to other people in the neighborhood.  He sells various things at their store including clothing and household goods. Roberto is asking for a loan in order to buy more jeans and shirts, bedding, cooking pans, grills, and thermoses.  The Riva’s plan is to continue expanding their business and provide a better life for their son. They hope that their son will someday become a great man and be successful in whatever profession he chooses.
loan_use: To buy jeans, shirts, thermoses, cooking pans, barbeque grills, and bed sheets.

description:
Lina C.’s business sells veterinary products and concentrates. It is located on the outskirts of la Estación market on a site frequently passed by people and motor vehicles. She began her business one and a half years ago when she stopped working in a veterinary practice because her income was too low to cover her household expenses: so she decided to market these products in order to help her partner maintain their home and their two children.

At present she needs to acquire more veterinary products and concentrates: for this reason she very wisely came to Ceprodel in order to ask for her ninth credit with this institution and thus be able to stock-up her business with products and improve her family’s quality of life.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

El negocio de la señora Lina C. es la venta de productos de veterinaria y concentrados. Se ubica en las afueras del mercado la Estación en un local muy transitado por personas y vehículos. Comienza su negocio hace un año y medio al terminar de trabajar en una veterinaria ya que sus ingresos eran muy bajos para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, decide entonces comercializar estos productos y así apoyar a su compañero de vida en el mantenimiento de su hogar y sus dos hijos.

Hoy en día su necesidad es la adquisición de los productos de veterinaria y los concentrados por lo que muy sabiamente acude a Ceprodel para realizar su noveno crédito con esta institución y de esta manera surtir su negocio de productos y mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.
loan_use: purchase of veterinary and concentrate products

description:
Mrs. Flor de Maria is married, and has 6 children, a boy and 5 girls; 3 of them are already professionals and the other 3 are in high school. Flor de Maria and her husband have worked hard to provide for their family and to be able to give an education to their children.

Flor de Maria’s husband works selling clocks, computers, necklaces door to door in the markets of Managua. Flor de Maria has been dedicating herself to sale “fritanga” which is a meat and vegetables fried meal.

The business has been growing in variety and clients. She is asking for a loan because she wants to invest in her business and be able to offer more products. Her goal is to have a fritanga restaurant that offers more comfort to her clients

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Flor de Maria es casada, y tiene 6 hijos, un varón y 5 mujeres; 3 de ellos ya son profesionales, y los demás están en educación secundaria. Doña Flor de Maria y su esposo han trabajado arduamente para poder sacar adelante a su familia y poderle dar estudios a sus hijos. El esposo de doña Flor de Maria trabaja vendiendo relojes, calculadoras, collares de forma ambulante en los mercados de Managua, y doña Flor de Maria desde hace 14 años se dedica al negocio de la venta de fritanga, el cual con el paso de los años ha ido creciendo en variedad y clientela. Doña Flor necesita el crédito porque quiere invertir más en su negocio, poniendo a la venta mayor catidad y variedad de productos. Por que su deseo dentro de algunos años, es tener una fritanga con más comodidades para sus clientes
loan_use: To buy vegetables and meat for her business

description:
Augustina and Marina have been members of the community bank “Kusikuy” for 13 years. Martina has been a member for 8. In that time they have learned about responsibility, punctuality, and a good work ethic. In addition they have learned about self-esteem, educating their children, and getting along with their neighbors. Within their bank they feel united and able to support each other, this is what they say is lacking in other banks.

Augustina is 38. She is single and doesn’t have children of her own, but has been raising her nieces and nephews. She sells emoliente, which is a traditional beverage made from herbs and served warm. She has been doing this for 22 years.

Martina is 39 and has three children. She has been selling grains for the past six years from a stand in the central market of Ayacucho. She sells a variety of grains such as wheat, barley, quinoa, and oats.

Marina is 62 years old and has two adult children. She has been selling food staples such as flour and beans for 10 years. Before that she traveled to the country to buy leather and sell it in Ayacucho, but enjoys having to travel less.

Augustina, Marina, and Martina need loans of 800, 600, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in their business by buying things such as sugar, wheat, cornmeal, barley, flour, milk, and oil. They dream of owning their homes and giving their children an education.
loan_use: Augustina, Marina, and Martina need loans of 800, 600, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in their business by buying things such as sugar, wheat, cornmeal, barley, flour, milk, and oil.

description:
Sayu Putu Murdani is a restless homemaker. She makes her trip to the market early in the morning to buy food to be resold later. Later in the day Murdani goes door to door doing sewing and alteration. Beside that, Murdani raises four hogs, two sows and two boars since in her village people rarely want to raise boars (to be used as breeders). In addition to the income from each piglet produced by the sows, Murdani also earns some money from breeding her boars to the neigbors' sows. She earns 50,000 IDR (~5.30 USD) for each breeding. Hence her income from the boars depends on the demand. Feeding the boars is not much different than that of the sows, except for additional supplements and formula to increase the boars stamina. Her profit is used to pay for her child's education at the Udayana University in Denpasar (in 3rd semester). Murdani hopes to use the loan to fix the hog pen.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Sayu Putu Murdani seorang ibu rumah tangga yang tidak bisa tinggal diam. Dari pagi Murdani sudah kepasar membeli bahan-bahan makanan yang nantinya akan dijual kembali.Siang hari Murdani mulai berkeliling sambil mencari jejahitan (canang) karena Murdani juga sebagai pengepul. Disamping itu Murdani juga memelihara babi sebanyak 4 ekor, 2 ekor induk babi dan 2 ekor pejantan karena di desanya masih jarang orang yang mau memelihara Babi jantan ( yang akan dipergunakan untuk pejantan ).Disamping pendapatan yang diperoleh dari anak yang dilahirkan oleh induk babi Murdani juga mendapatkan pemasukan dari pejantan yang Murdani miliki karena setiap satu kali mengawini babi tetangga yang birahi Murdani mendapatkan pemasukan Rp 50.000 untuk satu ekor dan satu kali kawin.Jadi pendapatan yang diperoleh dari babi jantan tidak menentu karena tergantung dari orang –orang yang membutuhkan jasa Pejantan.Untuk makanan yang diberikan untuk babi jantan tidak jauh berbeda hanya saja setiap kali babi jantan pulang dari disewakan harus diberi makan tambahan berupa jamu dan juga campuran telor ayam dan madu untuk menambah kekuatan Pejantan. Dari keuntungan yang di peroleh dipakai untuk membiayai anaknya yang sedang kuliah di Denpasar di Universitas Udayana semester 3. Murdani berharap pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari akan dipergunakan untuk memperbaiki kandang agar lebih baik.
loan_use: To purchase animal feed

description:
Muhsinhodja R. is 25 years old. He has twin sisters who are getting married soon. He wants to give each of his twin sisters a gold ring as a wedding gift. Muhsinhodja works at the Youth Center. He has never taken out loan before. He can’t afford to pay cash for the rings, so is applying for a loan. He thinks that any woman would be happy to receive a gift like that.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Рустамов Мухсинходжа молодой человек в возросте 25 лет брат двух сестер блезняшек,которым хочет подарить на свадьбу два золотых кольца.Мухсинходжа работает в секторе по делам молодежи раньше нигде не кредитовался .Он считает что чем купить за наличные ему выгодней купить в кредит.Ведь такому подарку будет рада любая женщина.
loan_use: Purchase of jewerly

description:
Aydee, Domenica, and Santa have been members of the community bank “Sr. de Luren” for between two and five years. During that time, they have learned about responsibility, saving, and punctuality. In addition, they have learned how to depend on themselves and develop enduring relationships with other bank members.

Aydee is 33 years old and has a seven year old daughter. She owns a bakery that was started by her mother. She has been running the business since her mother retired four years ago. In addition, Aydee is studying to be a lawyer.

Domenica is 33 and has a five year old son. She knits items such as hats and gloves that she sends to Lima to be exported. She knits all of her products by hand. Domenica has been knitting for five years, before that she sold firewood. She is much happier now.

Santa is 32 and has two children. She moved to Ayacucho nine years ago from the jungle region of Peru and started a business selling food staples such as rice, sugar, and oil. Since that time, and especially since joining the community bank, her business has grown considerably.

Aydee, Domenica, and Santa need loans of 1200, 600, and 400 soles respectively (3 soles = $1, which they will invest in buying materials to expand their business. These include flour, yarn, wool, sugar, and butter. The loan helps them buy in larger quantities and receive lower prices.

The community bank emphasizes the importance of saving, and each associate has an interest earning savings account. Aydee is saving to take her graduation exam. Domenica and Santa are saving to buy land and build a house. Their respective dreams are to become a lawyer and professional, own a home, and to be able to run their business from their home.
loan_use: to invest in buying materials to expand their businesses.  These items include flour, yarn, wool, sugar, and butter.  The loan helps them buy in larger quantities and receive lower prices.

description:
Esther is a member of the communal bank "The Jasmines," located in Moyabamba, San Martín, Perú. After her experience working at a commercial outlet she decided to start her own business, selling clothes house-to-house, and then eventually opened her own grocery store so as to watch over her youngest children while working. She sells dried goods, bread, vegetables, soft drinks, meat and more.

Esther is 28 years old and since a young age has stood out as a strong-willed woman, hard-working, responsible and persevering. She dreams of opening a restaurant since she she likes to cook and is skilled in the kitchen.

With her six month US $850 loan she plans to stock up on products such as soap, 50 kg sacks of rice, sugar, vegetables, vegetable oil, boxed milk, toilet paper, preserved fish and fruit, snacks, kitchenware, and even clothes for adults and children.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Esther es socia del banco comunal “Los Jazmines”, ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Moyabamba, departamento de San Martín. Dado la experiencia que tenía en la compra y venta de mercadería como empleada de una tienda comercial decidió poner su propio negocio de venta de ropa que los ofrecía casa por casa, luego para poder atender mejor a sus menores hijos instaló en su propia casa del Jr. Oscar Benavides Nº 100 una bodega en la que diariamente se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, panes, verduras, bebidas gaseosas, carnes y otros. Con el préstamo de S/. 2,500.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará diversos abarrotes como cajas de jabón de diferentes marcas, sacos de 50 kilogramos de arroz, azúcar, menestras de diversos variedades, botellas de aceite en litros, lecha en cajas, papel higiénico en paquetes, conservas de pescado y de frutas en cajas, diversas golosinas, además de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños y artículos para cocina y de esa manera poder satisfacer el pedido de su basta clientela. Tiene 28 años y desde muy joven se ha destacado por ser una mujer luchadora, muy trabajadora responsable y perseverante. Sueña con tener un restaurante porque también le gusta cocinar y tiene buena sazón. y sobre todo estar en contacto con las demás personas.
loan_use: Stock up on products for her grocery store

description:
Enriqueta P. T. runs a general store in the city of Jaunjiucillio, San Martin.  She started the store ten years ago after spending the majority of her life selling goods at the main market in downtown Juanjiu.  Enriqueta was tired of traveling and working for minimal wages.  Her store has grown annually and she has many loyal customers.  She provides daily, weekly, and monthly credit to trusted clients.  The people of Jaunjuicillio are also happy to use Enriqueta’s store instead of making the long trip to the main market.

Enriqueta is 62 years old, married, and has six children.  She is happy with her business, the independence she’s gained, and all of the friends she has made.  She is happy to serve her community and help her family.  Education is important and she is looking forward to helping fund her grand children’s University bills.

A member of the community bank Eden Celestial, Enriqueta is requesting a loan of $1,025 to repay over 6 months.  With the loan she would like to restock and add new products like underwear, and school uniforms.  The children of Juanjuicillo return to school soon.
loan_use: To restock and add new products like underwear and school uniforms.

description:
Chahonbek is a 37 year-old father of three. His wife keeps house and helps to and raise cattle.

Five years ago, Chahonbek obtained a plot of land. Since then, he has grown wheat and potatoes on his land. Chahonbek likes to work on the land. He believes if one works the land with love, the land feels this and pays back with rich yield. The spring is coming soon, and the hot season will start for Chahonbek. However, as any other farmer he is already preparing for this. Chahonbek wants to purchase mineral fertilizer and potato seeds.

To that end, Chahonbek is requesting 1000.00 Somoni (US$300) for a term of 12 months. This is Chahonbek's first loan and he is sure he shall be able to repay it in time.
loan_use: To purchase mineral fertilizer and potato seeds

description:
Jeniffer is a 35 year old wife and mother of 3 children from Nansana, Uganda. Over a year ago, she founded a restaurant and has since grown it into a successful dining and catering enterprise, with her partners, Margret, Resty, Hellen and Juliet, who provide an important part of Jeniffer’s produce. To further expand her business, she needs your help. With your loan she could grow her restaurant and continue to improve Uganda’s food service industry and her community.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.
loan_use: To improve her catering business

description: This group has been together for one year and six months. Aminah is married with two children and owns a retail shop that sells used clothes. She intends to save the extra profits for a poultry business. Madina owns a restaurant while Hadija sells charcoal.
loan_use: To add more stock in her business

description:
A young married lady and mother of three (03) children, Madam K. Soaméto is also responsible for two (02) children of her older sister, who is deceased. Having a principal activity of gardening, Madam K. is not always able to earn enough to meet her expenses. Today she requests a loan of $400 in order to buy fertilizer to improve her yield and to better to satisfy her clientele. This will improve her income as well as the living conditions of her home. \r\n

Translated from French by B, Kiva Volunteer.

\r\nJeune dame mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants, Madame K. Soaméto a aussi à sa charge deux (02) enfants de sa grande sœur décédée. Ayant pour activité principale le jardinage, Madame K. n’arrive toujours pas à joindre les deux bouts. Elle sollicite aujourd’hui un financement de $400 afin de s’acheter de l’engrais pour améliorer son rendement et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Ceci améliorera ses revenus ainsi que les conditions de vie de son foyer.
loan_use: To buy fertilizer for her garden.

description:
Fernando lives in the house of his godparents in the San Cristobal street of Tacagua area in the city of La Paz. He sells straw and brush brooms, he also sells woman's footwear. The loan will be use to increase his working capital since the income from this activity is his only means subsistence. His precedent record qualifies him as a good client and he can gain access to a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Fernando vive en casa de los padrinos en la calle San Cristóbal de la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que realiza es la venta de escobas de paja y de cepillo, también vende calzados de mujer. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital ya que con esta actividad genera sus ingresos y es su único medio de subsistencia. Su antecedente histórico lo califica como buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
loan_use: Buy straw to make brooms.

description:
Mr. Ronald lives with his in-laws in San Cristobal Street Nº 50B in the Tacagua area, of the city of La Paz. He is 38 years old and lives with her wife and children. He works making unisex jackets and vests of polar fabric (warmer than regular fabric). His workshop is located at his house. He supports his wife and meets their needs with this business. He will use the loan to buy fabric, threads, etc. His record qualifies him as a good client and he can gain access to a new loan. He is a client of IMPRO since 2002.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Ronald vive en casa de sus suegros en la calle San Cristóbal Nº 50B de la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene 38 años y vive con su esposa he hijos. La actividad que realiza es la confección de chamarras y chalecos de tela polar (que abriga más que la tela regular) para ambos sexos y su taller lo tiene ubicado en la misma casa; con esta actividad mantiene a su esposa y cubre sus necesidades. El crédito que solicita es para comprar tela, hilos y otros. Su antecedente histórico lo califica como buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2002.
loan_use: Buy polar fabric, thread, etc.

description:
Ceila lives on Rafael Pavon Street in the area of July 16th, located in the city of El Alto. She lives with her husband and her 5 year old son. She works alongside her husband in the fabrication of jackets and coats, which they distribute at wholesale in various fairs within the city. The loan will be used in the purchase of work material, such as fabrics, leathers and linings. This is the first loan request with Impro and the evaluation made has qualified her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Wendy Wise

Ceila vive en la calle Rafael Pavón de la zona 16 de Julio, ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto. Vive junto a su esposo y su pequeño hijo de 5 años. Trabaja junto a su esposo en la confección de chamarras, sacones los cuales distribuye al por mayor en las diferentes ferias de la ciudad. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de material de trabajo (telas, cuero, forros, etc.). Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
loan_use: Purchase of fabrics, leathers and linings for the making of coats and jackets.   Compra de telas, cueros, forros para la confección de chamarras y sacones.

description:
Eleven years ago, In order to support her two children, Ana Patricia H., a single mother, started a business selling frozen water, soft drinks, carbonated drinks and baked goods outside the Terminal market.

It's important to note that this type of business is very competitive. Ana H. has many competitors located very close to her place of business. She needs to buy her inventory and raw materials in order to later market them. For this reason, Ceprodel has been supporting Mrs. H. for a year. She has received 10 loans which she has used to acquire the soft drinks she needs to satisfy her clients and support her children.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Desde hace once años, en la ciudad de León, para poder mantener a sus 2 hijos por ser madre soltera, la señora Ana Patricia H. inicia un negocio de venta de agua helada, gaseosa, bebidas suaves y tortas en las afueras del mercado la Terminal.

Es necesario destacar que este tipo de negocio es muy competitivo por el hecho de que la señora Ana H. tiene muchos competidores que se ubican a su alrededor. Su necesidad es la compra de las gaseosas y la materia prima para luego comercializarlas. Es por esta razón que desde hace un año, Ceprodel ha apoyado a la señora H. con la realización de 10 créditos los cuales los ha utilizado para adquirí las gaseosas y de esta manera poder satisfacer a sus clientes pero principalmente a sus hijos que tanto lo necesitan.
loan_use: Purchase of carbonated beverages and water

description: Maryam, 18, is the mother of 9-year-old son. She sells snacks, crispy chips, etc., and earn $7 a day, while her husband, M., does not have any job. She is asking for a loan of $75 to buy more goods. She is a member of MBK and willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.
loan_use: To buy more goods

description: Naah, 43, has a husband, M., who has no job now. So she has to work by herself to provide income for her family by selling vegetables door to door around the villages, earning $7 a day. She is asking for a loan of $75 to expand her business, and as a member of MBK she is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.
loan_use: Business expansion

description: Mrs. Phun I., 34, is a widow and lives with her two sisters and two brothers in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. To help with her family’s expenses, Mrs. Phun I. works raising pigs and reselling them for a profit. After finding out about CREDIT MFI from her neighbor, she decided to ask for a loan to expand her livestock by adding more pigs for breeding. She believes her income will steadily increase about six to seven months after the purchase.
loan_use: To purchase more pigs.

description: Nigina is 32 years old.  She is married and has 2 children.  She first became our client in  September of.  Her business is selling of scarfs and clothes, which she buys from Bishkek.  She has a variety goods and many customers from the region of Dushanbe.  She has steady business that grows with each passing month.  She is requesting this loan from Kiva so that she may stock up on winter clothes
loan_use: Purchase of winter assortment.

description:
Ayo A. is 36 years old, married and has 5 children. She comes from Iba Area of Lagos State Nigeria. She's a fashion designer and also, sells ready made clothes. \r\n

\r\nAyo A. has been in business since 1999. She's requesting a loan of $875 to buy more clothes and tailoring materials for sale.
loan_use: To buy clothes and tailoring materials for sale

description: Elshad lives in Sumgayit city, he is married and has three children. He runs a sewing workshop. Elshad established this business four years ago, and he now has two more employees. He receives orders from customers, and makes different kinds of clothing. Sometimes he is short of raw materials to fill the orders on time. He heard about Normicro loans and decided to apply for a loan. He wants to borrow $500 for 6 months to buy raw materials such as fabric, thread, needles, etc.
loan_use: To buy raw materials

description:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 33-year-old Venancia Justin. She is married with three children, ages 8, 12, and 13. In 2001 Venancia established an African clothing business and now requires a loan of $450 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment—a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.
loan_use: To expand her range of African clothing.

description: Araz M., whose son is pictured, is a 50-year-old man who owns and operates a market in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. He has been working in this business for the last five years and is married with three children. He is currently looking for funding in order to increase and diversify his inventory stock.
loan_use: To increase and diversify his stock of inventory

description:
Mrs Clotilde lives together with her husband and daughters in a house they own. The house is located in the street of José Saravia’s, neighborhood of Alto San Pedro in the city of La Paz.

Her husband is a carpenter and she sells food at construction sites. Indeed, she works together with an engineer who helps her to get contracts to sell food to the construction workers.

She now needs a credit to buy more wholesale products for her cooking in order to lower her costs of production.

Clotilde has been working with the non-profit association “Amparo Gutierrez” since 2002 and due to her good credit history; she can access a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Clotilde vive en casa propia con su esposo e hijas en la calle José Saravia de la zona de Alto San Pedro de la Ciudad de La Paz; el esposo trabaja como carpintero y la actividad que ella tiene es la venta de comida en lugares donde se construyen edificios ya que trabaja con un ingeniero que le ayuda a conseguir contratos para ofrecer comida a los albañiles que trabajan la construcción de los edificios. El crédito que solicita es para comprar en insumos al por mayor para elaborar su comida y de esta forma abaratar sus costos de producción. Por su antecedente histórico puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Clotilde es cliente de nuestra Institución desde el año 2002 con un buen historial de pagos.
loan_use: To buy more wholesale products for her cooking in order to lower her costs of production

description:
Dora is married and has three older daughters. With the financial support of her husband, who works as a mechanic, she has been able to provide an education for them and they are now studying at the university. The family lives in the La Libertad neighborhood, a place where the residents find themselves in a precarious situation in life.

She attends to a school cafeteria that offers items such as breakfast, sandwiches, hamburgers, drinks, and sweets. The cafeteria’s customers are the school students and faculty, who are able to buy a quality product there. Given that the school has two daily sessions, morning and afternoon, Dora works from 6 am to 5 pm. Her daughters help her with tasks related to running the cafeteria.

Currently, her customers are asking that she add new dishes to her current menu. For this reason, she seeks a loan to buy additional food/ingredients such as rice, beans, chicken, and vegetables in order to prepare the meals. Her short-term goal is also to improve the physical condition of her cafeteria's location.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Dora es casada y tiene 3 hijas mujeres, con el apoyo económico de su esposo que se desempeña como mecánico es que ha podido educar y preparar a sus hijas las cuales se encuentran estudiando en la Universidad, esta familia habita en el barrio Villa Libertad en donde los pobladores se encuentran en precaria situación de vida.
