La Sra. atiende un Cafetín Colegial, en este cafetín se ofrece desayunos como sándwich, hamburguesas, almuerzos caseros, refrescos y golosinas. Los clientes del Cafetín son los alumnos del Colegio y los Docentes del mismo, los cuales se les ofrece un producto económico de acuerdo a sus necesidades, la Sra se encuentra trabajando desde las 6:00 a.m. hasta las 5:00 p.m., ya que el colegio tiene 2 horarios de clase, mañana y tarde. Las hijas le ayudan a su madre ha administrarlo. Actualmente, a la Sra. le están demandando nuevos productos y platillos para ofertarlo a sus clientes, es por eso que necesita el préstamo, para comprar productos alimenticios como arroz, frijoles, pollo, verduras para elaborar los platillos que ofrece. Su meta a corto plazo es ampliar la estructura física del cafetín.
loan_use: Purchase food/ingredients for cafeteria.

description: Zarmina H. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. She is 43 years old, married and has two children. She is engaged in clothing sales in Beylagan city bazaar. She rented a small booth there. She started her business ten years ago. She needs a loan in the amount of $1200 to purchase more kinds of goods and expand her business.
loan_use: To expand business

description: Ifaya G. lives in Amirzeyidli village of Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. She is 49 years old, married and has three children. Her husband owns and operates a chemist shop in the village. (Her husband is pictured). They started their business five years ago. They needs a loan in the amount of $900 to purchase more medicine and expand their business.
loan_use: To expand business

description:
Mercedes Concepcion F. V. owns a sewing workshop. From the time she was a young girl she has shown skill for this work, and today serves as a seamstress in the city of Chinandega. Her business began when her husband went out of work and support ran out for their children, so she began looking for ways to buy a sewing machine so she could work as a seamstress.

With little savings she decided to put a sign outside of her home with the phrase "all types of dresses made to order". This is how she really began to work, by attracting the attention of various people who have since become her customers.

Mercedes has been working with CEPRODEL for 4 years and is very happy with the loans because they have been provided in a timely manner, which in turn have helped her meet the needs of her business and satisfy her customers. She has a record of 7 loans with CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Mercedes Concepción F. V. es una dama que posee el negocio de taller de costura, ella desde muy niña ha demostrado la habilidad para esta labor y hoy en día se desempeña como costurera en la ciudad de Chinandega específicamente en Chichigalpa. Su negocio lo comienza cuando su esposo queda sin trabajo y por el apoyo que debía de dar a sus hijos, busca la manera de cómo adquirir su maquina para realizar sus trabajos de costurera.

Con los pocos ahorros que ella posee decide poner un rotulo en las afueras de su local con la frase “se hacen vestidos de todo tipo” es a si que ella comienza a trabajar por si sola captando la atención de varias personas que posteriormenente se convirtieron en sus clientes.

Mercedes trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 4 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados ya que se los han brindado en el momento oportuno, ayudando a sí a suplir las necesidades del negocio y poder satisfacer a los clientes con los pedidos que le hacen, ella tiene un record de 7 créditos.
loan_use: To purchase threads, fabrics and supplies for her shop. (Compra de hilos, bobinas, telas)

description:
Odete Alberto M., bearer of ID number 110255407P, is married and has 3 children. She joined the program on October 28, 2005 and is on her 6th loan. She is requesting 15000 MT, to be repaid in 6 months. She plans to invest the money in her business of selling staple goods such as eggs, oil, etc.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer.

Odete Alberto M., portadora do BI nº 110255407P vive maritalmente tem 3 filhos entrou no programa a 28/10/05 esta no 6º coclo vai tomar o valor de 15000 apagar em 6 meses com o valor vai investir no negocio ela vende produtos de 1º necessidade tais como ovos oleo etc.
loan_use: Purchase products

description: Tahir (his wife is pictured)  was born in 1956. His family lives in the Salyan region in Yenikand village. Tahir has 3 children. They have been in farming business for 17 years.  Now this family needs a loan of $1200 to buy vine props for improving their vineyard.
loan_use: To buy vine props

description:
Tuychi S. is 33 years old, he has secondary education an is an accountant by profession. He is married and has 4 children. Tuychi has a small grocery store in the village of Chorbog in the Varzobskiy region. He sells mostly groceries and wants to use the loan to increase his inventory. Because this kishlak (village) is located several kilometers away from the city of Dushanbe and it's difficult to travel there during the winter, the loan will provide an opportunity for the residents to buy the necessary groceries locally even in the winter time.

Tuychi plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Сангонов Туйчи, возраст – 33 года, образование – высшее, по специальности бухгалтер, женат, имеет 4-х детей. Туйчи имеет небольшой магазин в кишлаке Чорбог Варзобского района. Основной товар, которым он торгует это продуктами питание. На полученный кредит он хочет увеличить ассортимент продаваемого товара. Так как этот кишлак находится в нескольких километрах от города Душанбе и зимой туда трудно добраться, данный кредит даст возможность жителям кишлака приобретать необходимые им продукты питания даже в зимнее время.

Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.
loan_use: To increase inventory

description:
The young lady Leslie Aime belongs to a communal bank called El Breo. She lives in the region called San Martin, in the province of Mariscal Cáceres and in district of Juanjui. She devotes herself to the sale of watches and gifts, and the business is located in Jr. Huallaga, number 689.

She needs the loan of 3,000 Peruvian Soles, which she will pay off in six months; she will buy gifts and watches in bulk in order to increase her inventory and sales.

Leslie is 27 years old. She lives with her husband who is supportive of her and knows how to fix the watches. Another reason why people go to their business is because her husband knows how to repair watches. Together they are getting ahead because the business currently has two locations. That goes to show that Leslie Amie’s goals have no limits, and that with hard work and dedication she can achieve all of her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Johnny of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Leslie Aime pertenece al banco comunal El Breo. Vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres y distrito de Juanjui. Se dedica al comercio de venta de relojes y regalos y el negocio está ubicado en Jr. Huallaga No. 689.

Con el préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará regalos y relojes en cantidad para aumentar su producto.

La señora Leslie tiene 27 años, vive con su esposo quien la apoya, ya que él sabe arreglar relojes, es por eso también que los clientes van a su negocio. Juntos están saliendo adelante porque actualmente tiene dos establecimientos del negocio, demostrando de esa manera, que para cumplir metas no hay límites y que se pueden alcanzar con esfuerzo y dedicación.
loan_use: Buy gifts and watches

description:
Muzayam N. is 41 years old, has a high school diploma, is married and has 6 children. Muzayam has been raising and selling cattle for the last 16 years. She is planning to use this loan to purchase a calf which she will fatten and sell in the next 40-45 days. Every time she makes a sale she will purchase more animals and use the profits from animal sales to support her family. She is planning to pay back her loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Норова Музаям, возраст – 41 год, образование – среднее, замужем, имеет 6-х детей. Музаям занимается разведением крупного рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже в течение 16 лет. Полученный кредит она хочет использовать на приобретение одного молодого бычка, которого она планирует откармливать в течение 40-45 дней после чего продаст. Каждый раз после продажи она будет приобретать молодняк, а полученную прибыль использовать на оказание помощи в содержание семьи Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.
loan_use: purchase and sale of cattle

description: Mrs. Pich S., age 48, is a widow and lives with her grandmother and three nephews in Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia. Her son is pictured as she was not available at the time. She works selling gasoline, rice, and fertilizer, making on average around $10 each day of income. She has one son. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase more fertilizer and gasoline to expand her business.
loan_use: To purchase more fertilizer and gasoline to expand her business.

description: Mrs. Phov C., 29, is a mother of two children and lives with her husband in a part of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works selling various kinds of vegetables at a busy market, where she can typically make on average around $8 each day in revenue. Her husband works selling a variety of grocery products to the people in his area, making on average about $4 each day of income. One of her children is enrolled in school and the rest are too young to attend school. Mrs. Phov C. has humbly requested a loan to expand her inventory, to enable her to meet her growing customer demands.
loan_use: To expand her inventory, to enable her to meet her growing customer demand.

description:
M. Muhabbat is 47 years old. She and her husband have raised three children.

For 15 years already Muhabbat is working in the largest local market of the city. She is selling the green gram. This legume is very popular in Tajikistan and is very nourishing, healthy and tasty. The business is very stable and generates the main income for the family as the husband of Muhabbat is currently unemployed. 

Muhabbat has been working with IMON for several years already, and had proved herself as a reliable client. Today she requests a loan of 3450.00 Somoni (1000.00 US Dollars) over a term of 9 months. The loan shall be used to purchase additional green gram stock for selling. Muhabbat thanks your for your support and promises to pay the loan back in time.
loan_use: To increase stock for resale

description:
"My name is Shamim A.. I am married and the mother of three: two sons and one daughter. I live with my family in a small town, Arifwala, Pakistan. My husband wants to start a new business selling fruit on his cart and for this purpose he needs a loan. Currently, he works somewhere for very meager pay.

I would like to have a group loan and my group members are: Sakina B. who requires a loan for her son who runs a tea stall; Sabra B. whose husband runs a lumberyard; Sakina M. who wants a loan to buy her brother a donkey cart; and Shamim A. who needs a loan for their dairy store."
loan_use: Start a new business selling fruit from a cart

description: Mrs. Rin D., age 34, is a mother of four children. She doesn’t run any business beside staying at home cooking food and taking care of her three school-age children. Her husband works as a middleman buying bananas in a large quantity from the growers to resell for a profit, making on average around $18 each day of income. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order increase the business’s inventory of bananas and expand the business.
loan_use: To expand the inventory of bananas.

description:
This group has been together for one year. Leila is 36 years old, married and has five children. Her husband has a butchery business. Leila owns a public pay phone and also sells airtime cards. She wants to use the extra profits to reinvest in her current business.

Resty has a restauant business and wants to use the loan to buy a refrigerator and saucepans.

Berna sells new clothes.

Milly is a poultry farmer while Aisha sells charcoal.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.
loan_use: to invest in their businesses

description: Mrs. Thorn C. T., age 34, works as a farmer growing vegetables, mainly peppers, making on average $10 each day. Her husband runs a motorcycle repair shop making on average $5 each day. They have two children who are students. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase more spare parts to supply her husband’s inventory to meet his growing clients’ needs.
loan_use: To purchase spare motorcycle parts to expand the repair business.

description:
"I have been living in a small town called Chichawatni since I got married 12 years ago. I have four kids: two girls and two boys. Except my youngest son, all our kids attend school. I stitch clothes at my home to supplement my husband’s income. My husband is a rickshaw driver; he bought the rickshaw on installments. Now, we need to pay off the few remaining installments of our rickshaw for which we require a loan.

\r\nI would to like to borrow in a group with a few neighboring women. Parween B. needs a loan to buy her son a machine required in shoe manufacturing. Basheera R. will invest her loan in their family’s sanitary store. Basheera B. needs a loan to buy a rickshaw for her son. Tasmiah B.’s son is a barber."
loan_use: Pay off remaining installments on our rickshaw

description:
Mr. Famil G. is a low-income vulnerable person. He is 32 and lives together with his people in Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in Caucasus region.

Famil rents a barber's. He serves clients and at the end of each month pays for the rent. The business is going well, but Famil's barber shop isn't in good condition and needs to be renovated immediately. Otherwise Famil could incur the risk of losing clients. This winter he applied for $500 to Normicro Saatli branch.

After getting the loan and renovating the shop he plans to collect more customers and increase his daily income.
loan_use: For renovations

description:
Mrs. Cecilia V. is married and has 2 children. She lives in the Villa Reconciliación de Managua neighborhood. She works at the industrial zone but also sells milk curd and cream out of her home. Mrs. V.' husband is retired and receives a monthly pension from the Social Security. He helps her sell the cream and curd while she is at work.

Thanks to these three sources of income they have been able to get ahead and to start building their home. The loan will be used to raise one of the concrete walls of the house, which currently is made of sheets of zinc roofing material and causes them a lot of problems.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Cecilia es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación de Managua. Trabaja en una zona industrial, pero también tiene un negocio de venta de cuajada y crema en su casa de Habitación. El esposo de doña Cecilia está ya junilado y recibe una pensión mensual del Seguro Social, y es él quien le ayuda con las ventas del negocio mientras ella trabaja. Con estos tres ingresos de la familia es cómo han podido salir adelante y han ido construyendo su casa, el préstamo lo usarán para levantar una de las paredes de su vivenda de concreto, que actualmente es de zinc y conlleva muchas dificultades para ellos.
loan_use: To raise one of the concrete walls of their home

description:
Josefina P. is a hard working woman who has sold a variety of fruits in the market of Santa Ana in Chinandega for the past 26 years. She is a very happy and humble woman. She began her business with her own savings of $500.00, which she collected over a long period of time.

Today, she is a widow and has no children and so she is looking for a way to commercialize her sales in order to be able to support herself and her humble home. Mrs. Josefina has been supported by CEPRODEL for 4 years, obtaining loans which she invested directly in her business by purchasing fruits, through which was able to make a living and pay her bills. She has currently had 24 previous loans with CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Josefina P. es una dama muy trabajadora que desde hace 26 años se dedica a la venta de frutas de todo tipo en el mercado Santa Ana de Chinandega. Se caracteriza por ser una dama muy alegre y humilde. Su negocio lo comenzó con un capital propio de C$ 500 obtenidos por medio de sus ahorros propios de largo tiempo.

Actualmente es viuda y sin hijos y por tal motivo debe de buscar la manera de cómo comercializar sus frutas para así poder mantener su humilde hogar que esta compuesto solamente por ella. Desde hace cuatro años, la señora Josefina se ha apoyado de Ceprodel, obteniendo préstamos que los ha invertido directamente en su negocio para la compra de las frutas y sustento con los gastos de su hogar. Actualmente tiene un record de 24 créditos con Ceprodel.
loan_use: To purchase fruits.

description: Gunduz, despite his young age - he is just 25 years - is very active in his business, which he has been succesfully running for 4 years. He rents a small shop, where he is selling all sorts of household goods incuding some food stuffs and shoeware. His business has been developing well, but to maintain this positive developmen,t Gunduz needs a loan of 1000 USD. He applied for a loan of this size for 12 months to the Saatli branch of Normicro.
loan_use: To increase the variety of goods and increase business turnover

description:
For 6 years now, Mrs. Maira R. has had a general store in the market of Bisne of the department of Chinandega. She is a married woman, mother of two children of school age. This is the reason that she works very hard to bring sustenance to her home, and to ensure that her children do not solely depend on their father's meager income, but also on hers as a hardworking mother.

From the beginning of her business, Mrs. Maira has had loans with Ceprodel. She has used these loans to buy products to stock her general store. Nowadays she is again in need of investment to acquire these products, and for this reason she requests a loan from CEPRODEL, knowing that she will make it. Her record is of 6 loans with this institution. It is important to point out that Mrs. R. has paid all of these loans back in a timely manner.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Desde hace 6 años atrás, la señora Maira R. se dedica al negocio de pulpería en el mercado el Bisne del departamento de Chinandega. Es madre casada y con dos hijos en edad escolar. Por tal motivo es que ella se esfuerza grandemente por llevar el sustento a su hogar y que sus hijos no solamente dependan de los bajos ingresos de su padre sino también de ella como madre esforzada.

Desde que inició su negocio, la señora Maira ha realizado créditos con Ceprodel de los cuales los ha utilizado para la compra de los productos para surtir su pulpería. Hoy en día una ves mas necesita la inversión en su negocio para la adquisición de estos productos y para ello es que solicita crédito en CEPRODEL sabiendo que no le fallará. Su record es de 6 créditos con esta institución. Cabe señalar que todos estos créditos han sido pagados en tiempo y forma por la señora R..
loan_use: Buying merchandise for her general store (Compra de los productos de la pulpería)

description:
Maria M. sells tortillas and food which she prepares by hand in her home, later taking them to the market in the main terminal to sell. She prepares many local dishes, the most popular is a dish called nacatamal and her tortillas.

She has had her business for 15 years, starting it with her small savings which she got from her mother. She began selling her food outside the market until she was able to secure a stand inside.

The most important thing she needs now is to purchase stock and materials for her business; corn, charcoal and ingredients to make her tortillas and other dishes. Ceprodel has lent a helping hand in growing this business, with a total of 8 loans which have had a great impact on her business.

La actividad de la sra. Maria M. es la venta de tortillas y comida preparada por ella misma el cual la elabora en su hogar de habitación y luego la traslada al mercado la Terminal preparando variedad de platillos siendo los mas demandados el nacatamal y las tortillas.

Tiene 15 años de tener su negocio y se inició con un monto inicial de C$2,000 producto de ahorros personales que almacenaba cuando su madre le regalaba. Ella inició vendiendo estos alimentos en las afueras del mercado al aire libre hasta que logro conseguir su local en el mercado la Terminal.

La mayor necesidad que atraviesa actualmente la señora M. es que debe de adquirir el maíz, carbón y leña para realizar las tortillas y los nacatamales. Por tal razón acude a Ceprodel quien le ha brindado una mano apoyándola en el crecimiento financiero de su negocio con un total de 8 créditos los que han tenido impacto directo en su negocio.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes
loan_use: TO PURCHASE INGREDIENTS AND MATERIALS FOR HER SMALL STAND IN THE MARKET.  SHE NEEDS INGREDIENTS TO MAKE HER TORTILLAS AND OTHER LOCAL DISHES.

description:
Since she was very little, one of María Elena’s aunts, with whom she lived for a long time, owned a dressmaking and novelty business. Little by little, María learned the business and would help her aunt. Unfortunately, her aunt passed away sometime after that, leaving María responsible for the business, and that was how she made ends meet for her family with the help of her husband. Currently, her children are all grown up and married, and she has widowed, which caused her severe depression. However, this business is what has kept her desire to continue striving.

For that reason, María Elena does not want her business to fail. María Elena is requesting a loan for $375 that she is willing to pay in a 5-month term. With that money, María Elena will be able to buy clothing and merchandise to offer her clients a wider variety. With your help, María Elena will succeed in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde que era pequeña una tía de María Elena, con la que vivió mucho tiempo tenía un negocio de elaboración de ropa y venta de novedades. Poco a poco María fue aprendiendo este oficio y le ayudaba a su tía. Tiempo después desgraciadamente su tía falleció, quedando María Elena como responsable de este negocio. Y así fue como sacó a su familia adelante con la ayuda de su esposo. Actualmente sus hijos ya están grandes y casados y ella enviudó. Lo cual le trajo una depresión muy grande. Sin embargo este oficio e el que la a mantenido con ganas de seguir luchando por ella.

Es por eso que María Elena no quiere que su negocio se vaya decayendo. María Elena está solicitando un crédito de US $375 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero María Elena podrá comprar ropa y mercancía para poder tener más variedad para venderle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda María Elena podrá sacar adelante su negocio.
loan_use: Purchase fabric and merchandise to offer her clients a wider variety.

description: Mrs. Sok K. S., age 24, is a housewife. Her husband is a blacksmith making about $6 each day. They have one child. She would like to request this loan of $1200 in order to purchase more metals to increase the number of products the blacksmith shop can produce.
loan_use: Sok would like to purchase more metals to increase a number of products the blacksmith shop can produce.

description:
Mrs. Tâm, 30 years old, lives with her husband, Thắng, and two small children in Nghiêm Xá village, Chờ township, Yên Phong county, Bắc Ninh province. She raises poultry and her husband is a laborer. The family’s economy is stable at their income of 9USD a day. This is the first time she takes out a loan. The plan at Binh Minh is very convenient.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Tâm, 30 tuổi, ở thôn Nghiêm Xá thị trấn Chờ, huyện Yên Phong, tỉnh Bắc Ninh có 2 con còn nhỏ. Công việc tạo thu nhập chính của chị là chăn nuôi gà. Anh Thắng, chồng chị làm công nhân. Nói chung, cuộc sống của gia đình chị tương đối ổn định với mức thu nhập bình quân của hai vợ chồng là 150000đ/ngày. Anh chị chứ tham gia vay vốn ở đâu cả. Nay, anh chị tham gia vay vốn theo Chương trình Tài chính vi mô Binhminh cdc vì việc vay vốn rất thuận tiện.
loan_use: Invest in poultry

description:
Orosat is 46 years old, she is married and has 6 children. She owns a family bakery that makes Tajik bread. All members of her family work there and help to earn money for family needs. Orosta with her two daughters prepares dough for baking. One of her sons makes a fire in the tanur (oven). You can see Orosat's son Olim and the tanur in the photo. Her sons Olim and Tohir are responsible for baking bread in the tanur and her husband sells the bread in the food market in Dushanbe,Tajikistan.

Today Orosta's bread is in demand among customers and every day she gets a lot of orders from canteens and cafes. We can say that she is one of the successful clients of MicroInvest. Orosat would like to borrow $600 which she will pay back over 6 months via KIVA. She will spend this money to purchase the next batch of flour for her bakery.

Edited by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Orosat is women of 46,married and has 6 children.She has family bakery of national bread.All members of her family work here and help to earn money for family needs.Orosta with her two daughter prepare from flour bread for bake.One of her son makes fire in the tanur(where bread is processing to ready porduct,You can see tanur in the picture and Orosta's son Olim)Her sons Olim and Tohir are responsible for baking bread in tanur.And her husband sells bread in the food market,Dushanbe,Tajikistan. Today Orosta's bread is in good demand among popultion and every day she gets a lot of orders from many canteens and cafes.We can say that she is one of the success client of our organization. In KIVA she wishes to take part with request of 2000TJS for 6 months,which she wants to spend for buying next batch of flour and goal for bakery.
loan_use: Purchase flour

description: Rosa is thirty-eight years old and a mom of seven children. Rosa sells pants and shoes to men of the Mata Los Indios community of Santo Domingo. Rosa started her business a few months ago with a loan she received from our organization.  Rosa cautiously used her loan and now her business is moving forward. Rosa doesn’t have the means to rent space to operate her business so she runs the business out of her house. Rosa hopes that her business’s success will help her continue to support her large family. She will invest her second loan to buy more clothing in order to increase her income.
loan_use: To purchase additional clothing in bulk for a small business.

description:
On the patio of my house I began the construction of a room, but I could not complete it due to lack of funds. I would like to set up slabs of concrete and seal the walls well so that the room is hospitable. In this season of rain and cold there is a lot of humidity, and this causes my family to get sick. I request a loan of $1,000 so that I can finish building this room in my home.

 Translated by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer 

En el patio de mi casa empecé la construcción de un cuarto pero ya no lo pude terminar por falta de dinero, me gustaría poner una losa de concreto y cerrar bien las paredes para poder habitarlo ya que ahora en tiempo de frio y de lluvia hay mucha humedad y esta provoca enfermedades a mi familia”. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para terminar la construcción de un cuarto en mi vivienda.
loan_use: To finish the construction of a room in my home

description:
Baldemar has 4 children whom he wishes will study at the University level. However, his dream has been broken due to the fact that his business, a butcher shop, burnt down, but he couldn’t get rid of his interest in selling meat so he began to sell dried, grilled and sausage meat among other things. Thanks to his strength this business has been prospering bit by bit. Nowadays they are offering two pigs at a good price. Because of this he is requesting a loan of $475 USD that is arranged to be paid in one term of 6 months and with this money Baldemar could further his family.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Baldemar tiene 4 hijos a quienes desea darles estudios universitarios. Sin embargo su sueño se había visto roto debido a que su negocio anterior, una carnicería, quebró, sin embargo el gusto por la venta de carne no se le quitó sin embargo comenzó a vender carne seca, chorizo, asado entre otras cosas. Gracias a su esfuerzo este negocio ha ido prosperando poco a poco.

Actualmente le están ofreciendo dos puercos a un muy buen precio. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $ 475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Baldemar podrá sacar adelante a su familia.
loan_use: To buy two pigs that are being offered at a good price.

description:
Living with parents in law did not allow Komang Dwi Astuti to be relax and did nothing. With the skill she had, Dwi opened a tailor that provides clothes sewing service. The business was initiated by her mother in law. Dwi is able to sew and produce various clothes such as kebaya, uniform, etc. Dwi sews everyday from early in the morning until afternoon, and sometimes she should work until late in the night when she gets more orders. It usually happens before school holidays ends or before the Hindu festivals. At fist Dwi was only a helper to her mother in law to sew, but now she has many customers. She invested Rp 1.000.000 to buy a sewing machine to help her working faster. She earns Rp.50.000,- as income, and use it to support her family living, for they have had a 6 moths old baby. Dwi’s husband, I Putu Wiartika who works as a construction worker, is very supportive to her in running the business. With the loan that she wish to get from Dinari, Dwi hopes to be able to develop her business into a bigger one, and to have more workers so that able to receive more orders.\r\n

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva Volunteer.

\r\nTinggal menumpang di rumah mertua membuat Komang Dwi Astuti tidak bisa hanya tinggal diam dan berpangku tangan saja, dengan ketrampilan yang dimilikinya Dwi membuka usaha menjahit baju yang awalnya usaha ini dirintis oleh mertunya. Bermacam-macam baju bisa dijahitnya seperti kebaya, baju seragam sekolah dan lain-lain. Dwi mulai menjahit dari pagi sampai sore hari, kalau orderannya banyak Dwi bisa lembur sampai malam hari. Biasanya hal ini terjadi pada saat akan memasuki tahun ajaran sekolah yang baru atau menjelang hari raya. Awalnya hanya sekedar membantu mertuanya tetapi sekarang berkembang karena pelangganya semakin banyak. Jadi dengan modal awal Rp 1.000.000 Dwi membeli mesin jahit agar pekerjaanya bisa lebih cepat selesai. Keuntungan yang diperoleh sebesar Rp.50.000,- Keuntungan ini dipakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhannya karena Dwi sudah punya anak yang baru berumur 6 bulan. Suaminya, I Putu Wiartika, yang bekerja sebagai buruh bangunan sangat mendukung pekerjaan istrinya. Harapan Dwi dari pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari bisa mengembangkan usahanya menjadi lebih besar lagi dan memiliki keinginan untuk menambah jumlah tenaga kerja dan bisa menerima orderan lebih banyak lagi.
loan_use: Purchase sewing machine to enable receiving more orders and having more workers

description:
Mrs. Sáu, 45 years old, singled with two children. One is working, the other is still in school. The whole family’s income is about 4USD a day. Not much for their hard work but there are always laughter in their small house. She has tried hard to bring education to her children. She used to borrow money from her siblings. All debts were paid off. She would like to apply for a loan with Binh Minh. The weekly repayments are convenient for them.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Cô Sáu, 45 tuổi, không có chồng và có 2 con, 1 đã đi làm còn 1 thì còn đi học. Thu nhập bình quân của cả gia đình là 50000-70000đ/ngày. Dù cuộc sống còn vất vả nhưng trong căn nhà nhỏ bé luôn đầy ắp tiếng cười. Cô cố gắng vay mượn anh em để có tiền cho con ăn học, nay đã trả hết. Cô thích vay theo Chương trình Tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc vì hình thức trả góp hàng tuần rất thuận tiện.
loan_use: Nuôi lợn

description:
50 year old I Made wenten lives in Manistutu village in West Bali. 90% of the villagers work as farmers. I Made Wenten's neighbors mostly farms rice as the irrigation is very good for rice. As a farmer himself, I Made Wenten knows the needs of his neighbors during the planting season. Farmers in I Made Wenten's village really needs more fertilizer to improve productivity. However, it is difficult to procure fertilizer because the there are no nearby fertilizer vendors. Seeing this condition, I made Wenten saw a business opportunity. I made Wenten started selling fertilizer in addition to working his own farm. With DINARI loans, I made WEnten hopes to purchase more fertilizer from wholesaler to be resold. His farmer neighbors are so thankful to I made Wenten's effort to make it easier for them to obtain fertilizer. I Made Wenten also provides delivery service. This business really increased I Made Wenten's earnings. So he would be very thankful if his loan is approved.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

I Made Wenten, 50 tahun, tinggal di desa Manistutu, sebuah desa di Bali Barat yang mana hampir 90 % penduduknya bermata pencaharian sebagai petani. Khusus untuk lingkungan I Made Wenten, sebagian besar petani bercocok tanam dengan menanam padi. Hal ini disebabkan karena pengairan diwilayah tersebut mencukupi untuk menanam padi. Sebagai seorang petani, I Made Wenten paham akan kebutuhan para petani pada saat masa tanam. Petani di desa I Made Wenten sangat membutuhkan pupuk untuk meningkatkan produktifitas sawahnya. Namun yang menjadi kendala adalah sulitnya mencari pupuk karena selain jarak pedagang pupuk yang cukup jauh, ketersediaan pupuk pun sangat minim. Melihat hal ini, I Made Wenten menganggap sebagi peluang bisnis yang bisa diandalkan. Selain tetap mengerjakan sawahnya sendiri, I Made Wenten melayani penjualan beraneka jenis pupuk yang diperlukan oleh petani. Dengan pinjaman dari Dinari, I Made Wenten membeli pupuk di pedagang besar dan memasarkannya kembali. Para petani merasa sangat terbantu dengan usaha I Made Wenten, karena mereka dapat dengan mudah memperoleh pupuk. Satu hal yang sangat dihargai oleh para petani adalah layanan antar oleh I Made Wenten kepada para pembeli. Dengan usaha ini, I Made Wenten merasa sangat terbantu dari segi perekonomiannya dan ia sangat berterima kasih atas pinjaman yang didapatnya.
loan_use: Purchase fertilizer

description:
Parvina was born in 1985, is single and lives with her parents. Her family is of average means. Her parents do not have money to pay for higher education, so after high school Parvina and her elder sister started working at a bakery that made pirozhki - baked or fried pastries/patties with meat or vegetable filling. There were three other young women working at the bakery.

Parvina worked at the bakery from 2002 to 2005. During this time she became very good at making pirozhki and decided to open up her own business. For the last three years she has successfully run such a business. She and her sister make the dough, her younger brother bakes and then sells the pirozhki. Her food stand is located in the 'Safariyon' Market and is definitely one of the well known ones.

Parvina joined MLF MicroInvest in early 2007 and has had good credit standing. When she found out about the Kiva partnership, she requested a loan to buy 4 sacks of flour, 50 liters of cooking oil, 40 kilograms of meat and 6 sacks of potatoes for the filling. She would like to use any remaining funds to buy fire wood to fry the pirozhki because in winter the market does not have any electricity during the day. Parvina is very hopeful about getting a Kiva loan and extends her thanks in advance for the help.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva volunteer.
loan_use: Buying  ingredients & heating supplies for  the business

description: Mr. Norm S., 37, is married with four children and lives with his wife in Batambong province, Cambodia. He supports his family by driving a motor-taxi and makes about $4 a day. His wife stays at home cooking and looking after the family. But Mr. S. and his wife hope to raise their family's income by using this loan to buy a stall in the local market from which she can sell a variety of fruits.
loan_use: To buy a stand in the local market from which to sell a variety of fruits.

description:
The group leader of this small group is Hellen K.. She is currently in the business of brick laying and is requesting a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to expand her business. Hellen is a 23 year old widow. Each week Hellen makes approximately UGX 30,000 in profits. With the extra profits from her loan she hopes to buy more land for laying and making bricks. \r\n

\r\nHellen is joined in her small group by Florence N., Annet N., Sarah N., and Zam N.. Florence N. is currently in the business of fishing. She is requesting a loan of UGX 400,000 to to purchase more fishing nets. Annet N. is currently in the business of stone quarrying and is requesting a loan of UGX 800,000 to re-invest in the stone quary business. Sarah N. is currently in the business of stone quarrying as well. She is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to add to her stone business. Zam N. is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan of UGX 900,000 to increase her inventory stock.
loan_use: To expand the businesses

description:
Alisher H. is 33 years old, has a secondary education, is married and has 2 children. Alisher builds and repairs apartments for private individuals. He also raises and sells livestock. He has been in this business for 3 years. Alisher will use his loan to purchase livestock. He plans to fatten it and sell it every 40-45 days and purchase new calves. Alisher plans to make his loan payments using his earning from repairing apartments. This loan will give Alisher an additional income stream with which to support his family.

Alisher will pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Хайдаров Алишер, возраст – 33 года, образование средне, женат, имеет 2-х детей. Алишер занимается строительством и ремонтом квартир по частным заказам. Также помимо этого он занимается разведением и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 3 лет. Полученный кредит он хочет использовать на приобретение крупного рогатого скота. Он планирует после откорма, через 40-45 дней, продавать скот и приобретать новый молодняк. Текущие платежи по кредиту он планирует производить за счёт средств зарабатываемых ремонтом квартир. Данный кредит даст возможность Алишеру получить дополнительный источник получения дохода для соддержания своей семьи. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.
loan_use: Purchase livestock and feed

description: Uen, 40, is the mother of 2 children. She sells traditional food called 'doclang' at her house, earning about $3 a day, while her husband, A., sells the food door-to-door around the villages and earns about $5 a day. She is a member of MBK and is asking for a loan of $75 to expand her food business. She agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.
loan_use: Business expansion

description:
María Laura started her snow cone business 8 years ago because her husband did not earn enough money as a headwaiter to pay for their children’s expenses. María Laura knew that those expenses would increase in the future, so she decided to start her own business. However, because snow cone sales decrease during the winter season, she also started selling snacks. The people in her neighborhood gradually realized what María Laura was selling.

Nevertheless, she currently does not have enough products, so she is requesting a loan of $475.00 USD that she is willing to repay within 6 months. She will be able to buy more products with this loan. With your support, María Laura will help her children get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Laura comenzó con su negocio de venta de raspados hace 8 años. El negocio lo comenzó debido que lo que gana su esposo como jefe de meseros no es suficiente para pagar los gastos de sus 3 hijos y María Laura pensaba que en el futuro los gastos serían mayores y fue por eso que comenzó su negocio. Sin embargo debido a que en temporada de frio los raspados no se venden mucho, fue por lo que comenzó a vender cosas de snak. Poco a poco se fueron dando cuenta en su localidad de lo que vendía María Laura.

Sin embargo Actualmente no cuenta cn mercancía suficiente en su negocio, es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero María Laura podrá comprar más mercancía. Con tu ayuda Laura podrá sacar adelante a sus hijos.
loan_use: Purchase of goods

description:
The group leader of this small group is Ruth L.. She is currently in the business of raising and selling poultry and is requesting a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to expand her poultry business. Ruth is 30 years old and is married with 7 children. Her children range in age from 3 to 12 and they all go to school. Each week, Ruth makes approximately UGX 35,000 in profits from her business. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for the children and re-invest in her food business. \r\n

\r\nRuth is joined in her small group by Joyce Nakitenda, Jane K., Safina T., and Justine K.. Joyce Nakitenda is currently in the business of selling matooke and is requesting a loan of UGX 250,000 to re-invest in the business. Jane K. is currently in the business of raising and selling poultry and is requesting a loan of UGX 250,000 to start a piggery business. Safina T. is currently in the poultry business and is requesting a loan of UGX 700,000 to construct a new poultry house. Justine K. is currently in the poultry business as well and is requesting a loan of UGX 600,000 to buy a plastic water tank.
loan_use: To re-invest in the businesses

description:
The group leader of this small group is Amina Z.. She is currently in the business of selling used clothing and is requesting a loan of UGX 700,000 to increase her inventory. Amina is 30 years old and is married. She has 2 children who are 3 and 10 years old. Both go to school. Each week, Amina makes approximately UGX 40,000 in profits. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a piece of land and build a house. \r\n

\r\nAmina is joined in her small group by Margret N., Faridah N., Sulayina N., and Oliver M.. Margret N. is currently in the business of running a canteen and is requesting a loan of UGX 800,000 to increase her stock. Faridah N. is currently in the business of selling shoes and is requesting a loan of UGX 400,000 to purchase more shoes for sale. Sulayina N. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to expand her charcoal business. Oliver M. is currently in the business of running a canteen and is requesting a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to increase the stock in her canteen shop.
loan_use: To expand their businesses

description:
In partnership with her husband, Nanik works to sell scrap items. In this effort, due to their ages, her husband goes in search of items, while she picks out saleable items out of what has been collected. Their five-year old child is the source of motivation for their work ethic and their energetic spirit. The money they will receive will be used to increase their sales which have been as much as Rp. 400,000 per week (USD equivalent $43).

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Aarati, Kiva Volunteer.

Bekerjasama dengan suaminya, Nanik menekuni usaha Jual Barang Bekas. Dalam menjalani usaha ini - karena faktor usia – suaminya yang berkeliling mencari barang – barang bekas, sedangkan dirinya bagian yang menyeleksi barang – barang yang telah diperoleh tersebut. Anak mereka - yang berusia 5 tahun - yang menjadi tanggungan mereka memacu semangat mereka untuk lebih lagi bekerja lebih giat. Modal usaha yang dia terima akan ia gunakan untuk meningkatkan penghasilannya yang sebelumnya sebesar Rp 400.000,00/minggu.
loan_use: To purchase assorted scrap items for resale

description:
Leo: This word can be interpreted in many different ways, such as lions – or in this case, lionesses. It can also be thought of as a sign of the zodiac, the strongest sign, as well as in many other ways. But according to these businesswomen, these two concepts showcase each of their personalities. Sixteen women make of this group, and for more than six years, they have been each other’s constant and most important companions.

Most of the members devote themselves to preparing fast food, while others prepare more sophisticated dishes in the national tastes, while still others dedicate themselves to making lunches in hotels and restaurants in the area.

Their main concern is the demand that will exist during the folkloric events that will go on during the parties of Carnaval, given that the attendance at these events is massive and they generally consume throughout the entire event. For this reason, they need cash to be able to purchase the needed ingredients for the preparation of their dishes; this way, they can compete in variety and quality with the many other food vendors that will be at these events.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Leo; esta palabra puede ser interpretada bajo muchos conceptos, como leones, o en este caso leonas, también es conocido como un signo zodiacal, el mas fuerte del zodiaco, y muchos otros significados mas, pero según las socias, estos dos conceptos encajan en la personalidad de cada una de ellas. 16 mujeres integran esta sociedad, desde hace mas de 6 años, siendo una de las asociaciones destacadas y constantes.

En su mayoría sus integrantes están dedicadas a la preparación y venta de comida en distintas modalidades, algunas se dedican a la preparación de comida rápida, otras a la preparación de platos mas sofisticados de la gastronomía nacional, y otros se dedican a la atención de almuerzos en pensiones y restaurantes de la zona.

Su principal preocupación es la demanda que existirá en aquellas entradas folklóricas a realizarse en las fiestas de carnaval, puesto que la afluencia de gente a estos eventos es masivo y generalmente son consumidores potenciales por la duración misma de los eventos. Por tal motivo ellas precisan de capital para poder realizar la compra de sus insumos necesarios para la preparación de sus puestos, de esta manera poder competir con variedad y calidad ante los muchos otros negocios de comida que existirán para esas fechas.
loan_use: Purchase of needed ingredients to compete for food sales at upcoming holiday events
borrower_names: Tomasa, Mabel, Martina, Maria, Nelly, Fortunata, Felisa, Beatriz, Clementina, Maria, Eulogia, Teodora, Jacqueline, Magda, Graciela, Olga
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, false, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, false, true, true

description:
Zuleyka Patricia Alvarez Torres has been selling make-up for about a year in the local Chichigalpa market. She was a housewife for many years but, due to economic reasons, she decided to invest some of her savings and sell make up. Her current need at this moment is to purchase merchandise for her business.

Zuleyka, aware of her investment needs, goes to CEPRODEL in order to receive the credit that will allow her business to grow. For this reason, since her business began, she's been able to get 3 loans that wil allow her broaden her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Zuleyka Patricia
loan_use: Purchase of merchandise for her business

description:
Mr. N. lives in Koh Dach on Mekong River. He married Sok Lang in 1970, five years before the Pol Pot Regime. They have five children; three sons and two daughters. Three of the children have married and live in separate housing, the other two children are living with them. Mr. N. buys mangoes and jicama under contract in the village and takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. His wife helps him collect the fruit before they are taken to the market. \r\n

\r\nChhum N. is requesting his seventh loan in the amount of $600. He will use this loan to purchase mangoes and jicama under contract from the local farmers.
loan_use: Buy Mangoes and Jicama in contract

description: Mr. S. is married  and has one little child. He and his wife live with his mother in-law in Phnom Penh City. He has two jobs: he is a cassette player and TV repairman for people in his neighborhhood; he is a motor taxi driver. His wife is a fish seller in a market in Phnom Penh.  His mother-in-law stays at home and looks after hergrandchild and the house. Mr. S. is studying English because he wants to teach English. \r\nHe is requesting a $1000 loan amount for the first time to buy a motorbike to commute to his various jobs.
loan_use: To purchase a motorbike

description:
The leader of this small group is Rebecca N.. She is currently in business selling clothes and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Rebecca is 37 years old and is married. She has 2 children, aged 2 and 4, both of whom go to school.

Rebecca is joined in her small group by Milly N., Betty N., Joeria N., and Betty N.. Milly N. has a poultry business and wants to construct another poultry house. Betty N. is currently operating a restaurant and wants a loan to buy more equipment, like foodstuffs and a fridge. Joeria N. operates a business selling charcoal and wants to construct a shade for the charcoal. Betty N. is currently in the business of hair dressing and is requesting a loan to put up a personal salon.
loan_use: To expand businesses

description:
Carmen has a business selling fish and various other products. She got the idea for this business a year ago, when she saw a need in her neighborhood. Now she has become one of the main providers of fish in her area, converting a space especially for the business, and stocking it with popular vegetables as well. She starts early in the mornings and buys the fish wholesale. Thanks to this work, she is improving the economic situation for her family. Carmen has 5 children, but one of them is already independent, so Carmen works to take care of and educate the others. She is requesting a loan to expand her work space and increase the quantity and variety of the products she offers. This hardworking mother needs your support to continue improving the quality of life for her family.

Carmen, es una microempresaria de carne de pescado y helados de crema. La idea de involucrarse le surgió hace un año cuando vio que las vecinas de su barrio necesitaban comprar en una zona cercana el pescado; ahora ella se ha convertido en una de las proveedoras de carne de pescado de su barrio en un espacio de ventas que acondicionó para este fin y a la cual inteligentemente ha surtido de verduras de preferencia sale en las mañanas y muy temprano se dirige a los camiones de reparto de carne de pescado para comprar al por mayor. Gracias a esta actividad puede ser no solo la proveedora de carne de pescado en su barrio sino también una de las proveedoras de recursos para mejorar la economía de su hogar, ella es madre de cinco hijos pero uno de ellos ya puede sostenerse por si solo; ahora trabaja para poder cubrir los gastos de educación de sus hijos.Carmen quiere ampliar su espacio de ventas e incrementar la cantidad y variedad de artículos de primera necesidad que ofrece, con este fin solicita un préstamo. Recuerda que una mujer responsable es una madre que lucha por el bienestar de sus hijos y en este caso Carmen necesita de tu apoyo para seguir haciéndolo.
loan_use: TO INCREASE HER WORK SPACE AND PURCHASE A GREATER QUANTITY AND VARIETY OF PRODUCTS TO SELL.

description: Mrs. Duch R., 34, works on her rice paddy growing crops and also raises pigs. She typically makes on average around $3 each day in revenue. Her husband works as a policeman earning about $3 each day. Mrs. Duch R. would like to request this loan to purchase another plot of farmland to expand her crops.
loan_use: To purchase another plot of farmland to expand her crops

description: Fati R. is a distributor. She buys beans, maize, ground nuts, and other such foods in bulk and distributes them in smaller quantities to her customers. She is married and has 3 children. She is working very hard to support her husband and to meet her family’s financial needs. Demand for her goods has increased, so she wants to increase her sales.\r\n\r\nFati is seeking $525 of additional capital to enable her buy more beans, maize, and ground nuts to meet the needs of her customers.
loan_use: To purchase additional beans, maize, and ground nuts in bulk to meet the needs of her customers.

description: Eti, 33, is married to D., who has no fixed job. They have three children. To support her family, she sells sheets, bedspreads, and clothing on credit, earning $100 a month. She is a member of MBK. She would like a loan of $75 to increase her inventory. She will repay this loan within 12 months.
loan_use: To increase inventory of linens and clothing

description:
Apart from her regular job as a worker in local village administrative office, Sutini and her husband also have a pig farming business. At the moment she has 2 breeding pigs. A good team work with her husband makes this pig farming business successful and they can meet their household daily needs. They both live in a simple house with a 5 year old daughter. The proceed that they can get from the selling of piglets produced by these 2 breeding pigs in one year is IDR 4 million (approx. USD 420). This proceed is used to buy pig feed and to improve the pig hut. The future loan will be used to buy another breeding pig so they can improve the revenue that they get from the farming business.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Selain bekerja sebagai karyawati di Kantor Desa didesanya, Sutini dan suaminya memiliki usaha memelihara babi. Saat ini Sutini memelihara 2 ekor induk babi. Kekompakan dalam berusaha bersama suami membuat usaha ini berhasil dan bisa memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya. Mereka tinggal dirumah yang sangat sederhana, dengan 1 orang anak perempuan yang masih berumur 5 tahun. Keuntungan yang didapat dari 2 induk babinya dalam 1 tahun, sebesar Rp.4.000.000,- dari penjualan anak – anaknya. Keuntungan ini digunakan untuk membeli pakan ternak dan memperbaiki kandang. Pinjaman kedepan akan digunakan untuk membeli 1 ekor induk babi lagi, agar keuntungan yang diterima lebih banyak dan bisa menopang kebutuhan keluarganya.
loan_use: To buy a breeding pig (Membeli induk babi)

description: Susiawati, 39, is married to M. and does not work anymore. To support her family needs, she sells household goods such as glasses, clothes, etc. on credit door-to-door around the villages, earning $35 a week with small profit. She is a member of MBK and now asks for a loan of $150 to add to her business capital. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.
loan_use: Add to her business capital

description: Adel is 32 years old and lives in Nabatieh located in south Lebanon. Adel owns a shoe store and his shop is frequented by loyal clients who are inhabitants of the surrounding area. In order to sustain and develop his business, he needs a loan from Al Majmoua to buy merchandise.
loan_use: To buy merchandise

description:
The group leader of this small group is Agnes M.. She is currently in the business of clothing sales and is requesting a loan to expand the clothes business. Agnes is 32 years old and is married. She has 2 children, aged 4 and 9, and her children go to school. Each week, Agnes makes approximately UGX 60000 in profits, and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a piece of land. Agnes has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to invest in her business, and the loan was paid back on time. \r\n\r\n

Agnes is joined in her small group by Edith T., Betty N., Teopista N., and Gorette B.. Edith T. has a business in tailoring and wants to buy another sewing machine. Betty N. is currently operating a business in selling airtime/credit cards and wants a loan to add to the business. Teopista N. operates a beauty salon business and wants to buy more salon equipment like hair oils and mirrors. Gorette B. is currently in the canteen business and is requesting a loan to stock more goods and snacks.
loan_use: To trade large quantities of clothes and thus make more profits.

description: Mrs. Lux S. T., 23, is married and lives with her husband and one child who is a student in Preyveng province, Cambodia. She has two years of experience in making and selling soy milk at an open air market, making on average about two dollars each day. Her husband has worked as a policeman for about nine years and makes one dollar per day. Lux S. T. would like to use this loan to expand her existing soy milk stand to meet  growing customer demand.
loan_use: To expand her existing food stand to meet her growing customer demand.

description:
The group leader of this small group is Jesca N.. She is currently in the business of water selling and is requesting a loan to start up a retail shop. Jesca is 48 years old and is married. Her husband is a mechanic. She has 7 children ranging from age 6 to 21 and five of them go to school. Each week, Jesca makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits, and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to cater to home expenditures. Jesca has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to invest in her water business and the loan was paid back on time. \r\n\r\n

Jesca is joined in her small group by Zaina N., Harriet N., Farida T., and Zaitula N.. Zaina N. has a business in selling clothes and groceries and wants to uplift the clothes business. Harriet N. is currently operating a business in used clothing sales and wants a loan to start up a permanent clothes shop. Farida T. operates a local restaurant business and wants to invest in her restaurant. Zaitula N. is currently in the grocery business and is requesting a loan to increase the stock of items.
loan_use: To start up a retail shop and also add to the water business

description: Leonid has a small enterprise which allows him to combine his love of cars and driving with business. He travels around to small villages in the Zaporoshye Oblast in central Ukraine and operates a vending business where he sells a variety of small items such as tools, small parts, school supplies and office supplies. Leonid got into this type of business recognizing that the retail industry in many small villages was underdeveloped and he could meet a need. He is good about determining what items will be in demand depending on the season and adjusts his inventory accordingly. Leonid’s wife also helps him with the business. They have two grown children.\r\n\r\nLeonid has requested a loan to add to his working capital before the upcoming season change. The loan will allow him to be prepared with new inventory for the spring season and also help ensure that his car is in good working order. Leonid is a jolly, honest entrepreneur. We are happy for this opportunity to help him maintain a successful business.
loan_use: Increase working capital

description: Patience Ikponmwosa is 61 years old and mother of 9 children. She is married and sells provisions and firewood. She has been in her business for 31 years and needs a loan of $175 to buy more provisions and firewood for sale.
loan_use: To buy provisions and firewood for sale

description:
Born in 1959 in ADJOHOUN in the PLATEAU area, Mrs. Mededji N. L. has lived for more than 20 years in AVOTROU, one of the popular districts of COTONOU, characterized by a highly dense population. She is married to a man in his sixties and is a mother of 5 children of whom she still takes care. From a hangar in her house, she sells various condiments and beans, which her customers appreciate. In spite of her age, she is devoted to her business, and is determed and courageous. Mrs. Mededji N. L. is asking for this loan in order to meet the expectations of her clients.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Née vers 1959 à ADJOHOUN dans le département du PLATEAU, dame Mededji N. L. réside depuis plus de 20 ans à AVOTROU l'un des quartiers populaires de COTONOU caractérisé par une forte densité de population. Elle est mariée à un sexagénaire et est mère de 05 enfants qui sont à sa charge. Elle vend sous un hangar de la cour de sa maison divers condiments et du haricot que ses clients apprécient bien. Malgré son âge avancé, elle se consacre à ses activités avec détermination et bravour. Dame Mededji N. L. sollicite ce crédit pour répondre aux attentes de sa clientèle.
loan_use: Purchase of 50 bags of beans

description: Mercy I G. is married with 3 children. She is 47 years old and sells drinks and bread. She is from Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in business since 2001. She needs a loan of $675 to buy more bread and drinks for re-sale.
loan_use: To buy more bread and drinks for re-sale

description:
Seeing the need to support her family five years ago, Esperanza decided to open a grocery store in her neighborhood. She is a hard-working woman, however, she says, without the help of EDAPROSPO she would have been unable to start her business. Little by little, she has been buying the necessary furniture for her store. And, today it is quite a store, stocked with products where she and her two children help manage it. Esperanza's dream is to have a bigger store, so that some day she could leave it to her two grandchildren, who live with her as well.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Viéndose en la necesidad de solventar a su familia, hace cinco años, Esperanza pensó abrir un puesto de abarrotes en su barrio. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, sin embargo, ella afirma, sin la ayuda de EDAPROSPO no hubiera podido iniciar su negocio. Poco a poco con el paso del tiempo, ella ha ido comprando los muebles necesarios para su bodega. Hoy luce una tienda muy surtida de productos en donde ella y sus dos menores hijos ayudan a manejarla. El sueño de Esperanza es poder tener una tienda más grande para que algún día ella pueda heredarla a sus dos nietos que viven con ella también.
loan_use: To expand her grocery store, and to grow her business. (Agrandar su actual tienda de abarrotes e inaugurar uno nuevo.)

description:
Delia is a single mother. She has a five-year-old son who lives with her. Their house is located in Zona de Río Seco in the city of El Alto. Delia works as an elementary school teacher in the Bolivian Education System. The income she makes there isn't enough to cover her expenses, so she also makes aprons for cholitas (women of Andean dress that is traditional in Bolivia).

The required credit will be used to buy a sewing machine of medium quality, a tool that will let her generate more income.

This is the third credit offered by Impro to señorita T.. Because of the evaluation of her previous loans, it has been concluded that she is approved for this one.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Delia es madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 5 años de edad y vive con su madre; su domicilio esta ubicado en la Zona de Río Seco de la Ciudad de El Alto. Trabaja en el Magisterio como profesora del nivel primario del Sistema Educativo Boliviano, los ingresos percibidos por dicha ocupación no son suficientes para cubrir sus gastos, por lo que también se dedica a la confección de mandiles para cholitas (mujér de vestimenta andina, típica de Bolivia).

El crédito requerido es para comprar una maquina de costura de mediana calidad, herramienta que le permitirá generar mayores ingresos.

Este es el tercer crédito otorgado por Impro a la señorita T.. Debido a la evaluación de sus antecedentes, se concluye la aprobación de su solicitud.
loan_use: Purchase of work material

description: Vilma T. lives in the village of Rogozen. She is married and has three kids. Her husband works in the capital city of Sofia. Vilma breeds a cow and now wants to buy another one.
loan_use: To buy one more cow

description: Ilonka H. is married and lives with her husband and their two kids in the village of Mramoren near Vratza. She breeds 10 sheep and needs to buy three more. Daily, she gets about 15 litres of milk that she sells to one of the biggest dairies in the region.
loan_use: To buy three more sheep

description:
Dilorom K. is a resident of Tursun-zoda. She is 28 years old and is married with 3 children. She has a high school degree. Dilorom is planing to use the loan to purchase a milk cow. This loan will allow her to provide cheap milk for her family and sell milk to the locals, thus improving the financial situation of the family. She is planning to pay back the loan in the next 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Курбоналиева Дилором Жительница города Турсунзаде. Возраст 28 лет, замужем имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Планируемый кредит хочет использовать на приобретение дойной коровы для того чтобы получать молоко для своей семьи и на продажу, что поможет улучшить финансовое положение семьи.Кредит планирует погасить в течении 10 месяцев.
loan_use: Purchase of a milk cow

description: Bolale O. is 45 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in the Mushin Area of Lagos State. She sells provisions and drinks; she has been in her business since 1997. She needs the loan amount of $450 to buy more provisions and drinks for sale.
loan_use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

description:
Águeda and her husband, Saturnino, are responsible and hard-working parents of seven children. As more children entered their home they were forced to work even harder so their little ones wouldn't feel economic constraints. Águeda leaves her humble home every day at 3 a.m. for the bakery where she makes delicious varieties of bread. During the festivals in the villages around her childhood home, Ayaviri, she happily goes around buying quality cheeses, which eventually form a considerable quantity that she takes back to sell in the cities of Arequipa and Cuzco and also enjoy on her own. While Águeda carries out these businesses, her husband, Saturnino, works very hard as a driver of three-wheeler. Águeda wants to grow her business and sell more breads and cheeses, but needs more capital to carry it out. She turns to your kind heart for help.\r\n

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

\r\nÁgueda y su esposo Saturnino son padres muy responsables y trabajadores de siete hijos. Conforme llegaban más miembros a su hogar tuvieron que esforzarse y trabajar más para que sus pequeños no atraviesen limitaciones económicas.Desde las 3:00 de la madrugada diariamente doña Águeda sale de su humilde hogar rumbo a la panadería en el que elabora deliciosos y variados panes, y durante los días de feria de los pueblitos aledaños a su ciudad natal, Ayaviri, recorre muy contenta y animosa estos lugares comprando agradables y consistentes quesos que luego de acopiar una considerable cantidad los lleva para su venta y degustación a las ciudades de Arequipa y Cuzco.Mientras esta laboriosa madre se esfuerza en estas sus labores, su esposo, Saturnino, trabaja con mucho empeño y voluntad brindando servicio de movilidad en un triciclo a la población de su ciudad.Águeda requiere de mayor capital para invertir en su negocio y ampliar su mercado, es por esa razón que recurre a tu desinteresada ayuda.
loan_use: Increse her income by enlarging her offerings of breads and cheeses / Incremento de capital para acrecentar su producción de panes y oferta de quesos.

description:
Alejandrina, is a hardworking woman. Despite her age she continues to work with much enthusiasm, dedication and willingness as she did when she was young. With that same determination and energy, she alone educated her 8 children whom are now older and independent. Alejandrina is from the city of Lampa, but has lived in Juliaca for the last 40 years. Upon arriving to this city she began her business selling American clothing and little by little with her earnings she made changes to her home and opened a small general store. With these 2 businesses she has been able to provide her children a good life. Currently this model woman shares her home with her youngest daughter who is studying at a very recognized university in Juliaca. The desire of Mrs. Alejandrina is to grow and diversify her merchandise. This adorable lady believes these changes will bring about better profits. Your help will permit Alejandrina to continue to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

Alejandrina, es una mujer muy hacendosa, pese a su avanzada edad sigue trabajando con el mismo entusiasmo, empeño y voluntad que cuando era joven, con ese mismo ánimo y predisposición ha educado sola a sus ocho queridos hijos, quienes ahora ya son mayores e independientes.Alejandrina es natural de la ciudad de Lampa, desde hace cuarenta años radica en la ciudad de Juliaca, al llegar a dicha ciudad inició su labor comercial vendiendo ropa americana, y poco apoco con sus ganancias en su desempeño ha refaccionado su casita y a aperturado su pequeña bodeguita de abarrotes, con estos dos negocios ha podido mantener sin privaciones a sus queridos hijos.Actualmente esta ejemplar madre comparte su vivienda con su menor hija, quien estudia en una universidad muy destacada de la ciudad de Juliaca; el deseo de Doña Alejandrina es ampliar y aumentar el stock de su mercadería, esta adorable dama considera que con los cambios que realice su bodeguita obtendrá mejores ingresos. Vuestra ayuda permitirá que Alejandrina siga floreciendo con su negocio.
loan_use: Improving and remodeling her small store.

description:
Sención is thirty years old and sells fresh pork meat in the Mata San Juan community of Santo Domingo. She joyfully says that her business is very profitable and that the meat is sold as just rapidly as she can purchase it wholesale.

Sención explains that, during the past ten years, she has been able to fend for her three children by means of the business. Now, she plans on putting asiD. money to support the forthcoming university studies of her eldest son. This entrepreneur also is thinking about hiring a employee to help her run the business. She will use her loan to supply her business.
loan_use: To purchase fresh pork meat for a small business.

description:
Argentina is a multifaceted entrepreneur and a very organized person. She sells fresh pork meat in the morning and men’s and women’s clothing in the afternoon. Argentina is a single mother, and by means of these activities, she supports her five children. \r\n\r\n

This entrepreneur wants to expand her business. She plans to use her loan to purchase clothing in bulk. She will also buy the fresh meat of other animals, such as chicken and cows, to add to her inventory. Argentina says that her most important value is to work for the sake of her family.
loan_use: To buy clothing in bulk and to purchase fresh meat to supply her two businesses.

description:
R. Manzura is 42 years old. She is married with two children. The husband of Manzura is a teacher and does not earn much, which is why Manzura, with the support of her husband, decided to run her own business. For 14 years she has been selling foodstuffs like candies, pastries and other confectioneries, as well as sausages in the local market. Manzura says that for several years IMLF IMON supported her by providing additional funding.

This year is very important for Manzura as her elder daughter shall graduate from school and is going to enter the University. Being a loving mother, Manzura wants to support her daughter. In order to do so, she is planning to expand her business and increase the working capital for purchasing foodstuffs. Manzura plans to spend the extra income to pay the fees for her daughter's education.

For this purpose Manzura requests 2500.00 Somoni (725.00 US dollars) for the term of 4 months. Having proved herself a reliable, honest client Manzura promises to pay the loan on time and thanks all for supporting her.
loan_use: Expanding business and increasing capital for purchasing foodstuffs.

description: K. Ulugbeck was born in 1967 in the J.Rasulov region and he is married and has 3 children.   He sells his products at the nearby bazaar where his store is located. He has an assortment of meat products, canned food, spices and small wares that he sells at competitive prices. Now Mr. K. Ulugbeck requests the loan of 2500 STJ for 5 months to purchase a specialized refrigerator and increase his inventory (he wants to sell milk-sour products).
loan_use: To purchase a specialized refrigerator and increase his inventory

description: Inom Y. is 45 years old and he is married with three children. Inom sells CDs and DVDs, as well as eggs, in the central local market, and he has been in this line of business for 10 years. Over the years, his eldest son (pictured) became more involved in the business and now helps his father at the market. Inon's business generates sufficient income to support his large family. \r\n\r\nInom already received one loan from IMON and he successfully repaid that loan without any problems whatsoever. Now, he seeks $1,000 to purchase a computer in order to record DVDs and CDs and to purchase additional eggs, and he is confident that he can repay this loan on time. Inom would like to thank everyone for their support.
loan_use: To purchase a computer to record DVDs and CDs.

description:
Odetta T., age 39, is a widow and has two children (ages 18 and 15). She has a tailoring business which she started 7 years ago. The business is open from 7 am to 3 pm daily, and allows Odetta to earn a monthly profit of around US$34.

Odetta hopes to receive a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania in order to expand her tailoring business and to open a new food sales business. She will share this loan with her sub-group members who have businesses in the sale of fish, sarongs, cosmetics, table tops, and milk, and in running a bar.

In the picture, Odetta is the first one on the left.
loan_use: Expansion of a tailoring business and opening of a food sales business
borrower_names: Harriet, Dadi, Rose, Hamis, Odetta, Saimon, Paskaria
borrower_genders: female, male, female, male, female, male, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Eli L. is a gentleman who for six years has had a home business providing grinding services, which he takes great effort to attend to every day, from very early morning hours to late afternoon.

His wife and son are the reason he works day to day, to satisfy all their needs and further to complete his role as responsible father, giving food, sound shelter and education to his young son.

It is important to note that since he began his business, he has searched for a way to acquire new grinders but due to their high cost he has been unable to obtain them. For this reason, today he requested that CEPRODEL allow him to be granted a loan which he will invest in the purchase of the grinders so that he can continue giving his family sustenance every day.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Holmes, Kiva Volunteer

Eli L. es un caballero que desde hace 6 años posee un negocio propio en su hogar de habitación como lo es el servicio de molino que muy esforzadamente atiende todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana hasta el atardecer.

Su esposa e hijo es el motivo por el cual se preocupa día a día por satisfacer todas sus necesidades y además por cumplir su rol de padre responsable brindando alimentación, techo digno y educación a su hijo menor de edad.

Es de importancia señalar que desde que inicio su negocio ha buscado la manera de cómo adquirir nuevos molinos pero por su alto costo no lo ha logrado es por esto que hoy en día acude a CEPRODEL consiente de que será beneficiado con créditos que los invertirá en la compra de los molinos para así continuar brindándole a su familia el sustento de cada día.
loan_use: Purchase of machinery

description:
María, as she is known among the women in her village, is 21 years old, single and has been a craftswoman since she was 10. She uses her income to help with household expenses and buy raw material (fabric, threads and dyes) to make traditional blouses, which she sells to nearby villages.

María would like to use this loan to buy more raw material and increase her production. Other members of this group include Elvira Gómez and María Gómez, both of which own grocery stores.

Translated from Spanish to English by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

MARIA COMO ES CONOCIDA POR LAS MUJERES DE SU LOCALIDAD CUENTA CON 21 AÑOS DE EDAD, SOLTERA ARTESANA DESDE LOS 10 AÑOS LOS INGRESOS QUE OPTIENE DE SU TRABAJO ES DESTINADO AL INGRESO DEL GASTO FAMILIAR ASI COMO A LA COMPRA DE MATERIA PRIMA (TELA, HILOS Y TINTAS) PARA LA ELABORACION DE BLUSAS TIPICAS LAS CUALES LAS DISTRIBUYE PARA SU VENTA EN OTRAS LOCALIDADES CERCANAS A SU LOCALIDAD, CON EL CREDITO QUIERE INCREMENTAR LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES Y AUMENTAR SU PRODUCCION, LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON ELVIRA G. Y MARIA G. TIENEN TIENDA DE ABARROTES.
loan_use: Purchase raw materials (Fabric, thread and dye)
borrower_names: Maria De Los Angeles, Elvira, Maria

description:
Mrs. Ong S., 59, works as a housewife and cooking food for her husband. Her husband Mr. Hark, 72, is farmer and every day he has to go to his field to look after the rice. Generally he makes around $1 a day. They have two children and both are married already. The elder brother is a Khmer teacher in his village and other one works as English teacher, with a salary of about $100 each a month.

After much discussion, one son wants to run part-time English lessons for young people in his village. Unfortunately, they face a financial crisis: how to purchase classroom furniture such as tables, chairs, a blackboard and so on. So now Mr. Hark's family is requesting a loan from Kiva to run a part-time English class for young people in his area.
loan_use: purchase classroom furniture to use to run a part-time English class for young people

description: Chausiku is single, and she has a kiosk business. She would like a loan to expand her business.
loan_use: To expand her business.
