description: Khadija is a married woman, with one child who is 7 years old. She has a boutique business where she sells clothes, and she wants to expand her business.
loan_use: To expand her business

description: Mrs. Phat P. K., 33, works as a tailor, earning an average profit of $2 each day.  She is a widow and lives with her parents in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. Mrs. Phat P. is requesting a loan to purchase threads and clothing for her business.  The remainder of the loan will be used to assist in the building of her house.
loan_use: To purchase threads and clothing for her business; the rest of the loan will be used to assist in the construction of her house.

description:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 48-year-old Rose K.. She is single and has two children, aged 21 and 28. She also has two other dependents who are her nieces.

In 1990, Rose established a poultry business, and she now requires a loan in order to purchase additional chicks, as well as feed and vitamins to help raise them. She thanks you for your support.

Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially among SELFINA clients. "Kuku" means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons.

First, they require little start-up capital--clients can add to their stock or wait for them to multiply naturally. Second, they require little space. Third, while they are growing, they produce eggs, which can be either sold to provide a supplementary source of income or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein.
loan_use: To purchase additional chicks to raise and sell

description:
Tukae is 18 years old and is single with one child. Tukae sells chicken meat, a business she started in 2007. She works from 7 am to 1 pm every day at her business.

In the past, Tukae has taken out successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more chicken for her business.
loan_use: To expand her business.

description: Mrs. Nim C. L., 27, is the mother of one child and a vendor of grocery products in front of her house. She typically makes an average of $3.60 a day. Her husband, Mr. Yet Pet, 46, is a motor- taxi driver who earns about $3 a day of profit.  This couple plans to use the loan of $500 to purchase a vegetable stand at the market, which has a large  number of potential customers.
loan_use: To purchase a stand in the market to sell a variety of grocery products.

description:
Miriam has always distinguish herself as a good business owner at her brake shop located in the city of La Merced. Thanks to her responsibility and her performance, she and her family have been able to open a repair shop and spare parts garage at their home. The great demand that exists at her town for this service has given her the opportunity to increase her income but to be able to fulfill that she will need a bigger quantiy of products and spare parts brands that she orders from the capital. She hopes that she can count with your help to increase her investment capital and the daily support of her family, if you can help her, please don't hesitate and donate to help her

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Miriam, siempre se ha caracterizado por desempeñarse adecuadamente en su negocio D. venta D. frenos, en la ciudad D. la Merced, gracias a su responsabilidad y desempeño; ella y su familia han podido abrir un pequeño local y taller D. repuestos en su casa.La gran demanda que hay en la ciudad le ha otorgado la oportunidad D. incrementar sus ingresos pero para ello requiere D. mayor cantidad D. productos y marcas D. repuestos que demanda desD. la ciudad capital D. su país.Una D. sus esperanzas es poder contar con vuestra ayuda para incrementar su capital D. inversión y solicita una suma D. dinero que le ayudará ha adquirir su mercadería D. la cual depenD. su negocio y el sustento diario D. su familia, si usted pueD. ayudar no lo duD..
loan_use: Increasing capital to acquire a larger quantity of spare parts from the different car manufacturers in order to service most of the cars that drive around town on a daily basis.

description: Dilorom A. has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2003. She started the business practically from the scratch, but thanks to MicroInvest loans she improved her business situation. Now she rents a trade outlet in the flea market selling shoes and materials. She has a good assortment. Now she's applying for a loan to import new shoe models.
loan_use: Importing new shoes models

description:
Namoz lives in the Khuroson region. He is 36 years old, is married, has 3 children and a high school education. Namoz works in agriculture and plants wheat and other grains. He plans to use the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer for planting. He has worked in this area for 3 years and this business is the main source of income for his family. In addition agricultural expansion helps to provide locals with wheat and flour. Namoz plans to pay back the loan over a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Тагайназаров Намоз Тошкуватович житель района Хуросон. 36 лет ,женат, имеет 3 детей.Образование среднее. Занимается сельским хозяйством, посевом пшеницы и других злаковых культур. Кредит планирует использовать на покупку зерна и удобрений для посева.Опыт работы ав данном бизнесе 3 года. Этот вид бизнеса является основным источником дохода его семьи. Так же развитие сельского хозяйства позволяет обеспечить население пшеницей и мукой.Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.
loan_use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer

description:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 29-year-old Mwajuma C.. In 2006, Mwajuma established a general store, and she now seeks a loan in order to purchase additional goods in bulk for her store. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through sale and leaseback arrangements. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; therefore, they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. Accordingly, most women in Tanzania receive poor financial support and, as such, have very little income to provide for their basic needs and services. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. In practice, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women; specifically, in a SELFINA sale and leaseback transaction, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from that client (to provide the client with cash flow) and then leases the equipment back to her so that she can continue to use the equipment.
loan_use: To purchase additional goods in bulk for her general store.

description:
At the age of 14, Eusebia decided to marry Simón, and from that young age on, she took on big responsibilities. One of those responsibilities is being a mother and looking after her family’s well-being. As more family members arrived, her house would fill with joy and love, but at the same time, the family expenses would increase. For this reason, Eusebia decided to buy and sell sheep for a living, and with diligence and perseverance she has been able to move this business forward. While this charming lady engages in her noble work, Simón works as a master bricklayer in his hometown of Cupi. Between the both of them, they try to offer financial stability and an education to their 5 children. Eusebia would like to take this opportunity to appeal to your generous heart by requesting a loan that she will invest in her business of buying and selling sheep. With the profits earned, her family will be able to enjoy peace and well-being.\r\n

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

\r\nA los 14 años Eusebia decidió contraer matrimonio con Simón, desde entonces a su corta edad tomo responsabilidades muy grandes, una de ellas la de ser madre y velar por el bienestar de su familia, conforme llegaban más miembros a su hogar su morada se llenaba de alegría y amor, pero al mismo tiempo los gastos familiares se iban incrementando, razón por la cual Eusebia decidió dedicarse a la compra y venta de ganado (ovejas), negocio que con diligencia y constancia viene sacando adelante.Mientras ésta encantadora dama se dedica a esta noble labor, su esposo Simón trabaja como maestro albañil en su pueblo natal Cupi y entre los dos tratan de brindarles estabilidad económica y educación a sus cinco hijos.En esta oportunidad Eusebia recurre a tu generoso corazón y hace la solicitud de un préstamo que invertirá completamente en su negocio de compra y venta de animales, y con las ganancias que obtenga luego de su inversión su familia podrá gozar de tranquilidad y bienestar.
loan_use: Purchase of a greater quantity of sheep

description:
Putu Purnamayanti has been married for 15 years. Her husband is a security guard working for a private company. Putu Purnamyanti's husband makes about $88 per month. Putu Purnamayanti has 2 children, the eldest, Gusti Putu Purwanjaya, is 13 year old and currently in junior high school. THe second child, Gusti Kade Aroprasetya is 9 year old and is still in primary school. Putu Purnamayanti currently is working with her own kiosk business that sells various traditional Balinese food and snacks and local favorites. She started the business using her savings. Currently, Purnamayanti is applying to obtain a loan for business expansion from DINARI. Everyday, Purnamayant spends about $11 to purchase her goods to sell, and gets about $17 in revenue, so she gets $6 profit daily. Putu Purnamayanti is going to be grateful if she can get the loan so she can expand her business.

Translated form Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Putu Purnamayanti berkeluarga sudah 15 tahun . Suaminya bekerja sebagai seorang Satpam di sebuah perusahaan swasta. Penghasilan suami Purnamayanti per bulan Rp. 800,000,-. Putu Purnamayanti memiliki 2 orang anak yang pertama bernama Gusti Putu Purwanjaya berumur 13 tahun duduk di bangku SMP. Anak yang nomor 2 bernama Gusti Kade Ariprasetya umur 9 tahun duduk dibangku SD. Putu Purnamayanti saat ini sedang menekuni usaha warung yang khusus menjual makanan tradisional seperti berbagai macam kue khas Bali. Selain itu juga berbagai macam makanan dan minuman ringan yang sangat digemari oleh warga sekitar tempat tinggalnya. Untuk modal awal Purnamayanti mempergunakan tabungan mereka. Sekarang ini Purnamayanti mendapatkan tambahan modal usaha dari DINARI yang dipergunakan untuk modal berdagang. Setiap hari Purnamayanti menghabiskan modal warung Rp.100,000,-dan pendapatan kotornya Rp.150.000,- jadi keuntungan bersihnya Rp.50,000,- Putu Purnamayanti sangat bersyukur ada pinjaman modal dari Dinari sehingga ia bisa mengembangkan usahanya.
loan_use: Renovate kiosk and increase product offering

description: Mrs. Ken M., 28, is a mother of two children. She works as a garment worker and makes on average around $2 a day in profit. She also earns additional money by renting out rooms to workers. Her husband, Mr. But Tol, 40, works as a security guard makes $8 in income daily. Both of their children are students. Now, this couple is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva to renovate their house as their house is too old. The rest of the money will be used to buy a car.
loan_use: to renovate their house and purchase a car

description: Mirkhadi A. is a 52-year-old baker who has a bakery in the small village of Saatli region. He started his business in 2001 and since then, it brings him good income. He has applied for $1000 USD to improve the conditions in his workplace.
loan_use: To improve conditions in his workplace

description:
Mrs. E. Sophal, 59, is a widow with six children; four sons and two daughters. Mrs. Sophal and her family live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Four of her children are married and live outside the family home. The other two children sell flowers and clothing.

Mrs. Sophal has also been in the business of selling flowers and second-hand clothes since 1995. She buys her clothes in Phnom Penh for resale in the village. Mrs. Sophal also buys jasmine flowers under contract from a farmer in her village for her daughter to sell in Phnom Penh.

She is requesting her fifth loan in the amount of $1000. She will use this money to expand her business.
loan_use: To purchase additional inventory to expand the business

description: Juma is a 40-year-old father of 3, and a resident of Tandika. He has various businesses including sales of radios, TVs, and other electronics. He also owns a shop selling traditional medicine in the Tandika area, which his wife is taking care of. He gets the medicine from traditional healers, and he gets prescriptions from Zanzibar and Tabora. He is in need of USD $600 to help him expand his business.
loan_use: Expand his business of natural medicines

description:
Mr. A. Komlan Faustin was born on May 21, 1963 in Lome. He is handicapped, a father of one child and takes care of another person. Due to a lack of means, he had to give up his training in computer science and became a shoemaker. Having received his diploma after his training, he is now asking for a loan in order to open a workshop and to buy supplies and materials so that he can showcase his knowledge to his customers. A well-organized man, he would like to establish a more consistent credit in order to build other commercial activities. His dynamism and skill are his best assets to ensure the success of this project.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva translator

Monsieur A. Komlan Faustin est né le 21 Mai 1963 à Lomé père d'un (1) enfant et a une personne en charge et handicapé. Par manque de moyen, il abandonne sa formation en informatique et apprend la cordonnerie. Ayant reçu son diplôme après sa formation, il sollicite un crédit afin d'ouvrir un atelier et acquérir des fournitures et matériels de cordonnerie pour faire ressortir son savoir faire à sa clientèle. Bien organisé, il pense avoir plus tard un crédit plus consistant pour associer à la cordonnerie d'autres initiatives du genre commercial. Son dynamisme et son habileté constituent autant d'atouts pour le succès de son projet.
loan_use: Opening a shoemaking workshop and purchase of materials

description: Pili runs a ladies beauty salon in the Tandika area of Dar Es Salaam city suburb. She has recently expanded her salon and can now accommodate five clients at a time. She employs three people. Pili is in need of a loan  to help her buy another dryer, and stock cosmetics for her businesses.
loan_use: Expand her beauty salon

description: Aisha is a 32-year-old mother of 3, and a resident of Tandika. She sells wood and carpentry materials for construction purposes. She orders it from the Morogoro region and the Rufigi area. Recently, the forest authority has restricted deforestation, and this has affected her business. She is in need of a loan to help her expand her business into other areas.
loan_use: Expand her construction business

description:
Virtudes is a twenty-four-year-old budding businesswoman and mother of two girls aged four and two years. Recently, Virtudes started a small business selling fried vegetables with chicken and pork. She modestly explains that her clientele is still limited, but she manages to make the business profitable and says she will work harder to move it forward.

\r\n\r\nWith her loan, Virtudes will buy fresh vegetables, vegetable oil, fuel for the heater with which she prepares the goods, and other items to continue her business. Virtudes hopes she’ll increase her income so that she can pay the school tuition for her children.
loan_use: Purchase ingredients for food preparation

description:
Marleni is a woman who is at once admirable. The strength she show when she speaks gives clear testimony to her work and the effort she puts into it so that everything goes well.

For two years she has been selling gas. It all began with the idea of providing a better education for her three childen, who are fifteen, thirteen and five years old. Half of her income is for them and the rest is saved, since she has plans that she would like to fulfill. At her 39 years, her dream is to open a gift store as well as to buy what she needs to be able to sell sandwiches at night. She has no doubt about the help her husband and children will give her in this.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Marleni es una mujer que a primera vista resulta admirable. Esas fuerzas que demuestra al hablar brindan un claro testimonio de su trabajo y las ganas que le pone para que todo vaya bien.

Hace ya dos años que vende gas. Todo empezó con la idea de darle una mejor educación a sus hijos de quince, trece y cinco años. La mitad de sus ingresos lo destina a ellos y lo demás lo ahorra, pues tiene planes que desea realizar. A sus treinta y nueve años, el sueño de ella es abrir una tienda bazar y además comprar lo necesario para vender sanguches por las noches. Para esto ella no duda de la ayuda que su esposo e hijos le pueden brindar.
loan_use: Open a gift shop.

description:
Maria L. is a very dedicated and hardworking woman. She sells groceries at her home, in the city of Chinandenga. As she was going through a very difficult economic situation and could not find a job, Maria L. decided to invest her savings (370 USD) to buy groceries and sell them for a profit.

Being a very laborious person, she wakes up very early to open the doors of her business to her loyal clients. It is important to mention that Maria L. has been a constant client of Ceprodel, taking loans to buy more products in order to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria L. es una dama muy esforzada y trabajadora. Se desempeña en la venta de abarrotes en la ciudad de Chinandega específicamente en su casa de habitación. Por la difícil situación económica que atravesaba debido a que no encontraba empleo en ningún lado, decidió invertir sus pocos ahorros (Siete mil córdobas) en la compra de productos de pulpería para venderlos.

Como toda mujer trabajadora, ella desde muy temprano abre las puertas de su negocio para atender a su fiel clientela. Es necesario destacar que desde hace un año ha sido un fiel cliente de Ceprodel, realizando créditos que los ha utilizado para surtir más sus productos y de esta manera poder mantener su núcleo familiar.
loan_use: To buy more supplies for her groceries store

description:
Salome P. is 33 years old, married, with three children, ages 17, 15 and 11. Salome owns a small hardware shop that she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 6am to 7pm and can earn a monthly profit of approximately $70 from her sales.\r\n

\r\nIn the past, Salome has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member who has a small business as a food vendor.
loan_use: To expand her business

description: Martha is twenty-seven years old and she has four children, three of them boys. Martha has been selling a collection of fashionable jeans to men and women of the Batey of Palavé community of San Cristobal. Until now, she has been operating her business from her house, but she plans on renting a locale before long to run her activity. Martha will use her loan to expand the business and add an assortment of sneakers and blouses.  That way, the entrepreneur will attract more people and increase her income. Martha wants to provide a comfortable lifestyle with her family.
loan_use: Martha would like to purchase some sneakers and blouses in order to expand her small business.

description:
Asha B. is 30 years old, married with two children, ages 12 and 6. Asha owns a small kiosk. Everyday, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.\r\n

\r\nIn the past, Asha has taken out two successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who have businesses selling fish and general items.
loan_use: To expand her business

description: Cicilia M. is 40 years of age, married with 6 children, and lives in Shibiri, Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells drinks, and acquired this business knowledge from her mother. She has been in business since 1988, and needs a loan in the amount of $450 to enable her to buy more drinks to sell. She thanks you.
loan_use: To buy more drinks to sell

description: Dorcas O. is a mother of 7, married and is 45 years old. She lives in Isashi, Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells kitchen supplies and has been in business for over 5 years. She needs a loan of $450 to enable her to purchase more kitchen utensils to sell.
loan_use: To buy more kitchen utensils.

description: Naim I.  is 23 years old. Naim  supports his mother and his younger brother. \r\n\r\nNaim is provides taxi services from his vehicle. He is a very nice, diligent and smart young man. Naim has been working as a taxi-driver for the past 2 years. He is applying for a loan for the first time as he needs additional funding for purchasing spare parts to repairhis vehicle. He requests 2 000.00 Somoni ($600.00 US Dollars) for the term of 12 months. Let us help Naim with his intention to make his business more successful and to generate a stable income for his family.
loan_use: Purchase of spare parts for the repair of his vehicle.

description: M. Mahrom is 31 years old. Mahrom is divorced, however, he is supporting his kids as well as  his mother.\r\n\r\nMahrom has been a barber for more than 12 years. Mahrom's dream is to run his own barber shop. He also breeds cattle. The current winter is unusually cold in Tajikistan and Mahrom needs to build a heat-insulated cowshed. Though he earns a stable income, Mahrom still needs the additional funding in order to execute the planned tasks. He is requesting 2000.00 Somoni (600.00 US Dollars) for a term of 12 months. This is the first loan request of Mahrom and he hopes for the trust and in turn promises to pay the loan on time.
loan_use: Purchasing the fodder for his cattle and expansion of the barber shop

description: Vusal M. is a 24-year-old internally displaced person from Aghdam, Azerbaijan. His uncle passed down his knowledge of ceramic tile works. There’s demand for Vusal's work in the district where he lives. The problem is that he is using his uncle’s tools, which saw their good days years ago.  He is sure that the new tools he will buy with Kiva loan support will increase his productivity so he can make more money to support his family.  Vusal got married a year ago.
loan_use: Purchase of new tools to increase the speed of work and productivity

description:
Lucía is in her early fifties, and she and her husband have six lovely children (four boys, two girls), all of whom go to school. Lucía owns and operates a small business that sells basic food products (e.g., rice, beans, vegetable oil, milk, etc.). After four laborious years operating this business, Lucía now has a loyal following of customers who visit her stall every day to buy her goods. The entrepreneur wants to improve upon her business by adding new merchandise so as to attract new customers and, ultimately, to increase her income so that her family can lead a comfortable lifestyle.

Lucía would like to receive this loan with four other entrepreneurs who live in the Batey of Palavé community of San Cristobal: (1) María P., a 22-year-old mother of two sons, who would use her portion of the loan to purchase pants and men’s underwear to re-sell to members of the community; (2) Santa S., who would use her portion of the loan to purchase raw materials and ingredients to continue to produce her delicious empanadas; and (3) Cecilia S. T. and (4) Veronica S., who would use their loan portions to purchase clothing in bulk to replenish their respective businesses.

The members of this group guarantee the other members' loans. Accordingly, if one woman fails to repay her portion of the loan, the other members will assume that woman's obligations.
loan_use: To purchase of a wide variety of products (e.g., rice, beans, jewelry, and clothing) for the group members' businesses.

description: Hussein is a 24-year-old man. He works and lives in southern Lebanon, in Tyre. This is the first time Hussein has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. He wants to buy computers for his business. Hussein sells electrical appliances and computers, and repairs these items.
loan_use: To buy computers

description:
Daniela is a married 46 year old with 5 children, all of whom are students. She has spent about 15 years on her business, which consists of selling basic nutritious products, carbonated beverages, dairy products, personal hygiene products, and housecleaning products. Her small grocery store has been able to grow as a result of her efforts, and through the economic support of her husband, who works as a skilled construction worker. Her husband's work is not steady helps in the same way with house expenses.

The small grocery store has been the main source of fixed income in this family and with it they have been able to maintain themselves and live with dignity. At this time, Daniela reports there is not sufficient money to stock the grocery store and offer a significant variety in the products that she has in the store.

Translated from Spanish by Katrina H, Kiva volunteer.
loan_use: Purchase Basic Grains, Meats, Vegetables, and Perishable Products

description:
Gracias por su apoyo ya pude comprar el congelador que necesitaba para poder vender carne. Con este tengo mas ingreso a la casa. Ahora estoy solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la comprar de mercancía para el negocio de abarrotes y solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls. Para la comparar de mercancía.

Thanks to your support I was able to buy the freezer that I needed to sell meat. With this, I have more income in my household. Now, I am seeking a new loan to buy merchandise for the grocery business and I am seeking a loan of $1200 to compare merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.
loan_use: To buy merchandise.

description: Khamdamali A. was born in 1963 in the Asht region of Tajikistan. He is married and has three children. Mr. A. first applied to MicroInvest for a prior loan when he heard about a friend's successful business development loan. At that time, his business was having difficulties and he was going to sell it. However, with that loan, he was able to improve his business as he purchased a milk cow that his wife works with in milk production. He would now like to enlarge his livestock business by purchasing a pedigreed bull and is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of $1,200.00.
loan_use: To purchase a pedigreed bull

description:
K. Zafar, 27 years old, is married with one child.

Zafar has been selling men’s clothing for five years.  He began as an employee, but over time he saved some money, sold his car and started his own business. He has become a very experienced entrepreneur, working hard to keep his clients happy. The business is successful and generates a stable income for the family. 

Zafar requests a loan of $600.00 for a term of 9 months to purchase additional new men’s clothing for sale.  He thanks everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan on time.
loan_use: To increase the stock of men's clothing for sale.

description:
Sokinamoh R. lives in the town of Yavan. She is 45 years old, she is married, and has children. Sokinamoh has a high school education. She works on the market "Tijorat." She purchases goods from the city of Dushanbe and resells them on the market. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. This is the main source of income for her family and for that reason it is structured and functions very well. She plans to obtain the loan to increase the amount of inventory by purchasing more seasonal goods. She plans to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Рахимова Сокинамох Сохибназаровна проживает в городе Яван. Возраст 45 лет.замужем имеет 4детей. Образование среднее.Занимается торговлей на рынке « Тиджорат» города Яван. Привозит товар из города Душанбе и реализует со своей торговой точки. Опыт в данном бизнесе имеет около 10 лет. Эта деятельность является основным источником ее дохода, поэтому бизнес хорошо налажен. Планирует получить кредит для того чтобы увеличить товарооборот путем ввоза сезонного товара. Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 10 месяцев.
loan_use: To increase the amount of inventory

description:
Marhabo F. lives in the city of Yavan. She is 31 years old, is married and has 4 children. She has a high school diploma and is a teacher in school number 12 in Yavan. Aside from being a teacher, she raises farm animals. Yavan has milk cows and sells milk and yogurt products (kefir and yogurt). She sells milk to whole sale purchasers who then take these products to Dushanbe city. Marhabo would like to receive a loan in order to purchase one more cow. This will give her an opportunity to increase her profits. Marhabo's business supports her family. Moreover, by selling milk she provides markets with fresh milk and yogurt products at affordable prices. She plans to repay her loan within 12 months..

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Фатхуллоева Мархабо проживает в городе Яван. Возраст 31 год, замужем , имеет 4 детей. Oбразование средне-специальное. по профессии учитель средней школы № 12 города Яван. Кроме того занимается животноводством. Держит дойных коров для того ,чтобы продавать молоко и кисломолочные продукты(кефир и кислое молоко). Продает молоко оптовым покупателям , которые вывозят продукты в город Душанбе. Планирует получить кредит для того чтобы купить еще одну корову. Это даст возможность увеличить доход. Ее деятельность позволяет обеспечивать свою семью. А так же продавая молоко она обеспечивает рынки свежими молочными продуктами по доступным ценам.погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 12 месяцев..
loan_use: To purchase a milk cow

description:
Mr. Leang S. (picture with his wife under his house) was married in 1980 and has five daughters. Two of the daughters work in a garment factory and the other three are studying in the local school. The family lives approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.\r\n

\r\nHe has been in the house construction business since 1980. His wife stays at home to take care of their children. Mr. S. is requesting a second loan in the amount of $1000 to build a restroom and a concrete room under his wooden house for storage.
loan_use: To build a restroom and storage room.

description:
Olena is married with two children – a 16-year-old daughter and an 8-year-old son. Their family of four lives in the city of Drogobych, Western Ukraine. Olena sells men’s outer wear in the local market in Drogobych. She started this venture ten years ago. Currently, her gross income is about $1600 a month. Her monthly net profit is about $300. Olena has a perfect credit history with Nadiya Ukraine. \r\n\r\n

Olena has requested a loan of $1000 for one main purpose. She’d like to use it as working capital to buy necessary inventory and develop her business. With her history thus far as an entrepreneur, it will be exciting to watch how her business will grow and prosper in the future.
loan_use: To restock inventory for men's clothing store.

description:
Yelena is married with one child. She lives in Zaporozhye and works in the local city market called “Angolenko”. Yelena owns a small business selling household items, kitchen supplies, electric appliances, plastic dishes and other small items. Yelena has been in this business for six years. She has been expanding her trade during those years. Currently, Yelena has two vending locations and is hoping to expand her business even more in the future. Yelena has about $3000 in inventory. Her monthly net profit is about $300. \r\n\r\n

Yelena has requested a loan of $800 that will allow her to continue developing her business. It will help her open a new vending facility and purchase necessary supplies for her day-to-day business operations. Financial assistance will give her additional capital so that she can further promote her work and increase her business knowledge.
loan_use: To open a new household item store

description:
Yawa N. is married and the mother of four children, all of whom are in school. She has been the owner of a restaurant called Tantine de Fufu (Fufu Aunty) for 10 years. (Fufu is a local dish.) The restaurant is located downtown and welcomes many low-income customers. With the income from it, she covers over 80% of family expenses because of her husband's paltry and unsteady income. She is on her second loan, which is something she has always repaid. With the present loan, she is thinking of improving her restaurant's accommodations to meet customer needs and to increase her income.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Yawa N., mariée et mère de 04 enfants tous à l’école est propriétaire d’un restaurant Dénommé tantiD De fufu (Plat local) depuis 10 ans. Ce restaurant est situé au centre ville et accueille de nombreux clients à faibles revenus. Avec le revenu elle participe à plus de 80% des charges familiales du fait des revenus dérisoires et réguliers de son mari. Madame Yawa est à son deuxième crédit qu’elle a toujours payé .Avec le présent crédit elle pense améliorer la capacité d’accueil de son restaurant afin de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle et d’augmenter son revenu
loan_use: Fix up her restaurant's decor

description:
Fernando G. is 62 years old and has been married for 30 years. He and his wife have seven children, some of whom are in the university and some of whom live with them and help with their business.

Since 1986, Fernando has run a small convenience store from his house, which he began with a small amount of capital.

His dream is to see all of his children finish their schooling at the university level, so that they may have greater access to professions. He does not want them to struggle as he and his wife have had to. With the loan, Fernando will buy products to sell, including oils, flour, sugar, pasta, and fruits and vegetables. These goods will help his business grow and flourish.
loan_use: To buy oil, flour, sugar, pasta, yerba mate (tea), fruits and vegetable, mayonnaise, canned goods, and refreshments.

description:
Maria Céspedes has been married for 18 years to her husband, who repairs car radiators. Together, they have two children who are in high school.

Her husband's income helped Maria to open her own small business eight years ago. She sells beauty products, like shampoo, conditioner, perfumes, and facial creams. She began as a traveling saleswoman, but now has her own place in a nearby market. Maria began working with her children’s education in mind.

Maria will use the loan to invest in new products. More variety will make for a better income, because her store will be more competitive.
loan_use: To buy perfume, face creams, hydrating soaps, shampoo, and conditioner

description:
This business is my family's source of income and both my husband and my job. When he visits clients, I am in charge of the business. However, we are lacking raw material and a machine to make steel figures. We ask for a loan of $1,200 USD to buy raw material and a machine to solder steel.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de la familia en trabajos mi esposo y yo. Cuando el anda visitando los clientes yo me encargo del negocio pero nos esta haciendo falta materia prima y una maquina para ser las figuras de acero. Solicitamos un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls. para la comprar de materia prima y una maquina para soldar acero.
loan_use: Purchase raw material and a machine to solder steel.

description:
This committee of women has been formed for four months. It still is composed mostly of the first members. but some new women who have come on board. All of the women work in their own businesses. Many sell fruits, like oranges, pineapples, mangos, and lemons. Some make clothing, and others have their own small convenience stores, where they sell a little bit of everything. \r\n\r\n

These women are asking for a loan together so that they will have the support, both financially and socially. All of the women are working to insure that their children attend school.
loan_use: To buy the ingredients to make Paraguayan delicacies. Other women will use the funds to buy fruits, cosmetics, crafting, sewing material and refreshments.
borrower_names: Victoria, Zully, Maria, Francisca, Martha, Myrian, Rosa, Maria Paula, Olga, Rosalva, Ana, Nidia, Susana, Sebastiana, Rosa
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, false, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description: Helmina was born in 1978 and she is married. She lives with her husband in Lokvine near the town Zenica. Her husband has a full-time job and his monthly salary is 700KM. They are doing agriculture, too. They can earn 200KM monthly in their agriculture business. They have 2 children 10 and 13 years old. Helmina wants to use this loan of 1000KM to buy seeds. She believes that she will improve her living standard by reselling arable crops.
loan_use: Buying seeds.

description:
Mirella has been an associate of the community bank “Cocharacas” for one year. She joined after her mother, another associate, invited her. Mirella mentioned that she enjoys the training account values, and how to manage money.

Mirella is 20 years old. She is studying law at the university. Mirella is the oldest in her family, and when her parents separated she had to start working at a very young age. She worked 12 hours a day for less then US $200 per month.

Six months ago Mirella started a business. With the help of her mother and the little money she could scrape together, Mirella started selling women’s clothing. She travels to the city of Lima to buy products and then sells them to her friends and family.

Mirella needs a loan of 1600 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy shoes, shirts, and pants.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account each associate has. Marella plans to use her savings to pay for school, and to build a home. Her dream Is to continue moving forward, help her siblings, have a united family, own a home, and be a professional.
loan_use: Mirella needs a loan of 1600 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy shoes, shirts, and pants.

description: Helina A. is married and has one child. Her husband works as a taxi driver.  She helps support her family by selling jeans, hand bags, and sleepwear at Cape Coast University.  She is requesting a loan of $525 to buy a wider variety of bags and jeans so that she can attract more customers.  In addition to running this small business, Helina is a member of the Anointing Group, which is made up of 10 borrowers who live in Cape Coast, Ghana.
loan_use: To buy a wider variety of hand bags and jeans.

description:
Yolanda, Olga, and Karen are members of the community bank “Estrella”. Yolanda and Karen have been members of the bank for close to five years, while Olga joined four months ago. In that time they have learned punctuality, and responsibility. They have also found companionship and solidarity among the other women in the bank.

Yolanda is 26 years old. She buys live animals and then sells the meat at the central market in the city of Ayacucho. She sells mainly beef and lamb. She has run this business for ten years.

Olga is 22. She lives with her partner and newborn son. Olga sells “humitas”, which are similar to a sweet tamale. She has a stand in the central market of Ayacucho. She has been selling humitas since she was young. She is planning to start selling “salchipapa” which is a typical dish made by topping french-fries with scrambled egg and sausage.

Karen is 23 years old. She has a business selling cosmetics from a catalogue. She takes orders from friends and families and travels nine hours to Lima once each month to buy the products. Now she is planning to start selling clothing as well.

Yolanda, Olga, and Karen each need loans of 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy cows, sheep, corn, sugar, potatoes, eggs, oil, and to pay travel expenses.

Yolanda, Olga, and Karen dream of owning land, and building a home.
loan_use: Yolanda, Olga, and Karen each need loans of 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy cows, sheep, corn, sugar, potatoes, eggs, oil, and to pay travel expenses.

description: Margaret N. is married and has five children. Her husband is a driver, and she makes a living preparing and selling Banku, a local dish made from corn that is very popular in Ghana. Demand for this food is very high, and Margaret could sell a lot more of it if she had additional supplies. She has applied for a loan of $525 to buy the additional supplies she needs to increase her food production and meet the needs of her customers.
loan_use: To buy additional ingredients to meet the needs of her customers.

description:
Roman is 47 years old, and has a stable job at a milk processing plant. Additionally he is dedicated to the intermediary sale of cattle between ranchers and third party clients. Other work that he does to parallel his cattle trade is to rent out a light and sound system for special social events. Meanwhile, his wife works as a seamstress out of their home. Their family is made up of 5 people, him, his wife, and 3 children 16, 13, and 9. The couple has more than 21 years experience in their various activities, and as such the competition does affect them in any particular way. The prices they get for their goods are defined by the market (supply and demand) They have a very good credit history.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Roman es un señor de 47 años de edad, actualmente trabaja como empleado fijo de la Empresa de Lacteos PIL (Warnes), adicionalmente se dedica al comercio de ganado vacuno como intermediario entre ganaderos y terceros comerciantes. Paralelamente cuenta con un sistema de luces y sonido que alquila en s zona para distintos eventos sociales, por otra parte su esposa cuenta con un taller de costura ubicado en su domicilio. Su familia está compuesta por 5 personas, él su esposa y sus tres hijos de 16, 13 y 9 años respectivamente. La pareja tiene más de 21 años de experiencia en sus variadas actividades, por lo que la compencia si bien es media no les afecta de manera particular. Los precios con los que se manejan básicamente son definidos por los del mercado (oferta y demanda). Tiene muy buenos antecedentes crediticios.
loan_use: Capital for work

description:
Alberta, Beatriz, and Felicitas have been members of the community bank “Minke” for five years. In that time they have learned to be punctual and responsible and how to best invest their money.

Alberta is 41 years old. She is separated from her husband and has five children. Alberta sells shish kabobs from her home. She also runs a boarding house for travelers. In addition, Alberta has a small store where she sells food staples such as rice, sugar, and flour.

Beatriz is 38 years old. She a single mother and has two children. Beatriz sells “chicha”, which is a type of juice made from purple corn. She sells the chicha from a cart on a busy intersection in the city of Ayacucho. She also sells her juice at all of the festivals held in the city. Recently her sales have been down, and she plans to start renting a space to use as a store.

Felicitas is 48 years old. She is married and has five children. Felicitas sells candy and fruit during the day. In the evenings she sells “salchipollos” which is a popular fast food dish made from topping french fries with scrambled eggs and chicken.

Alberta, Beatriz, and Felicitas are asking for loans of 1600, 400, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1). Alberta, Beatriz, and Felicitas plan to use their savings to buy land and build homes. Their dreams are to own homes, to develop their businesses, and to provide for their children.
loan_use: To invest in sugar, rice, milk, oil, soft drinks, beer, corn, cookies, candies, and meat.

description:
Madame Ahliba B. was born in 1966. She is married and the mother of three children. She is a saleswoman of food products, an activity that has been very profitable but still needs a larger investment. To better satisfy her customers, Madame B. is asking for a loan that will allow her to reinforce her purchasing power and to buy larger stocks of corn and rice. This will allow her to see her revenue increase and better support the needs of her family.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Madame B. Ahliba est née en 1966, mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. Elle est revendeuse des produits alimentaires, une activité très rentable mais qui nécessite plus de fonds. Pour mieux satisfaire sa clientele, Madame B. Ahliba sollicite un financement qui va lui permettre de renforcer son pouvoir d’achat et constituer un stock de mais.et de riz. Ceci lui permettra d’accroître ses revenus et de mieux s’occuper des besoins de sa famille
loan_use: To stock corn and rice.

description:
When her husband was left without a job because of an illness, Aida searched desperately for a way to pay the bills of her home and the medical bills of her husband, who suffered from diabetes.

At first, because of a lack of resources, she bought her merchandise at retail prices, by the kilo. Little by little, with the help of one of her daughters, she increased her sales and started to buy larger quantities of her products. She says that this business isn't going badly for her, but she does earn very little compared to the work and effort she puts into her business every day. Upon having the opportunity of receiving financial support, she would like to open a bazaar and sell clothing in the same market.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Cuando su esposo se quedo sin trabajo a causa de una enfermedad, Aida buscó desesperadamente la forma de mantener los gastos de su vivienda y la salud de su esposo, quien padecía de diabetes.

En un inicio, Aida por falta de recursos, compraba su mercadería al por menor, por kilos. Poco a poco y con la ayuda de una de sus hijas pudo aumentar sus ventas y comprar por mayores cantidades sus productos. Ella afirma que no le va mal en este negocio; sin embargo, asegura ganar muy poco comparado al trabajo y esfuerzo que pone a diario en él. De tener la oportunidad de recibir un apoyo financiero le gustaría abrir un bazar y vender ropa en el mismo mercado.
loan_use: To begin constructing a clothing bazaar.

description:
Señora Vilma V. G. belongs to the communal bank, "Niño Manuelito". She has a grocery store and also sells food that she prepares. Her business is located in Huaraz in the department of Ancash.

With her previous credit of 1,000 nuevos soles, she invested in her business to increase her sales and her income.

With this loan of 1,500 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 8 months, she will buy soft drinks, beer, and rice. She will also buy sugar and oil to prepare food.

She is 41-years-old, her husband is a driver, and both work to take good care of their family.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora VilmaV. G., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Niño Manuelito”, ella tiene su bodega y también se dedica a la venta de alimentos, su negocio esta ubicado en Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Con el crédito anterior de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles lo invirtió en su negocio para mejorar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, el cual será cancelado en 8 meses , comprara gaseosas, cerveza y arroz, azúcar, aceite para la elaboración de alimentos.

Ella tiene 41 años de edad, su esposo es chofer y ambos trabajan para sacar adelante su hogar.
loan_use: With this loan, she will buy products to increase the amount of her merchandise

description:
Vicente López has been in the agriculture business all his life being that he lives in a rural zone such as is the Achuapa municipality in León. He is the father of two small children who along with his wife, a homemaker, make every effort to bring them forth successfully and educate them.

Currently, Vicente’s necessity lies in that there is no electric power in his town, for which reason he acquired a solar panel and must now repay this loan. Because of this circumstance, he turns to Ceprodel to request a loan with the objective of paying this debt, which will allow him to have electricity in his home so that his children can study in the afternoons and in the evening and so they have access to a small television. In this way, it will be possible that he and his family can improve their quality of living.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El caballero Vicente López durante toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura por vivir en una zona rural como lo es el municipio de Achuapa en León. Es padre de familia de dos pequeños hijos que junto con su esposa que es ama de casa se esfuerzan para sacarlos adelante y puedan estudiar.

Actualmente la necesidad que atraviesa Vicente es que en su localidad no existe luz eléctrica por lo que adquirió un panel solar y le urge cancelar esta deuda. Por esta circunstancia acude a Ceprodel para solicitar crédito con el propósito de cancelar la deuda y así aprovechar de la energía eléctrica principalmente para que sus niños estudian por la tarde y en la noche y además para tener acceso a un pequeño televisor. De esta manera se hace posible que el y su familia mejoren su nivel de vida.
loan_use: Pay for a solar panel that will allow him to have electricity in his home.

description:
U. Mamadaly is 45 years old and he lives in the Asht region of Tajikistan. He is married and has 3 children. Mr. U. Mamadaly has a home business raising and selling livestock. He has a rather large herd. Mr. U. does not understand life without his favorite business, because it brings him pleasure and general family income. \r\n\r\n

Now Mr.U. is applying to Kiva for a business development loan of 2100 STJ for 8 months to build a new building for his cattle. It will give him a place to keep his cows and allow him to keep more livestock.
loan_use: To build a new cattle barn

description:
"I am [the] group leader of my group of five other women, all of whom have been together for [the] last three years. During this tenure they have learnt the art of savings and becoming a responsible group member. These women are: Samina S., [who] needs the share of this loan to buy an embroidery machine. Samina B. will use the loan to pay-off remaining installments for her husband’s rickshaw. Irshad B.’s husband is a constructor. Sarfraz B. is also borrowing to pay off remaining installments of their rickshaw. \r\n

\r\n"Now let me tell you more about myself. I am a mother of five kids: two boys and three girls. All of my kids attend school because I feel education is very important for a decent living these days. I stitch clothes on order from my neighborhood clients, whereas my husband is an auto spare parts dealer."
loan_use: Buy spare parts for the spare parts store and support the other businesses

description:
Felicia K. is married and has 3 children. For the past 6 years she has run a small road-side stand selling handbags, sleepware, and other clothing items. She is requesting a loan of $275 to buy additional women’s clothing accessories to attact new customers and increase her client base.

\r\n\r\nFelicia is also a member of a lending group called “Calvary Group”, which consists of 11 members in Cape Coast, Ghana.
loan_use: To buy additional women’s clothing accessories

description:
Mrs. Yanex Edilu belongs to the communal bank “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women). She lives in the Region of San Martiín, in the province of Huallaga, in the district of Bellavista. She runs a business in a kiosk that is located at a rest stop for buses and cars traveling to and from the cities of Juanjui, Tarapoto and other outlying areas.

Everyday she sells juices made from various fruits, and foods like “juanes”, tamales, “humitas”, sandwiches, and she also sells snack foods. She serves many travelers that are passing through the area. Yanex decided to start her own business and because she likes to be around people, she likes to work for herself,make her own money, and she like to grow as a person and as a woman. Also, she owns three motorcycle taxis that she uses to earn extra money by transporting people.

With the loan of 3,000 Soles, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy the ingredients she needs for the preparation of the foods, juices and snacks that she sells. She will also invest in buying an ice chest for her products, glasses and glass jars. She will also pay to get her motorcycle taxis serviced.

Yánez is 40 years old and has two grown children who are responsible and independent. She is happy with what she is doing and her husband is supportive of her. She is well-known and she has a good customer base because of the quality of her products and because everything is prepared in a clean environment and displayed nicely.

Translated from Spanish by Edith of San Roque High School, Kiva voluteer

La señora Yanex Edilu pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres Unidas ”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia del Huallaga, distrito de Bellavista. Desarrolla un negocio en un kiosco ubicado en el paradero de autos y camionetas a las ciudades de Juanjui, Tarapoto y lugares aledaños.

Diarimente vende jugos de diferentes frutas, refrigerios como juanes, tamales, humitas, sanguches de todo tipo, también vende golosinas donde atiende a los pasajerosy transeúntes que pasan por el lugar. Yanex decidió iniciar un negocio por su propia iniciativa y porque le gusta estar en contacto con la gente, así mismo generar sus propios ingresos y crecer como persona y mujer. También tiene tres motocarros para el servicio de transporte urbano.

Con el préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará los ingredientes que necesita para la preparación de los refrigerios y frutas para los jugos y refrescos, golosinas diversas, así mismo financiará la compra de una conservadora de sus productos preparados, vasos y jarritas pequeñas de vidrio y también hará el mantenimiento de los motocarros que posee.

Yánez tiene 40 años y 2 hijos independientes, responsable y capaz de tomar sus propias decisiones. Está contenta con lo que hace, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, es muy conocida y tiene una buena clientela por la calidad de los productos y la preparación de sus productos con higiene y esmero.
loan_use: Buy ingredients like fruits for her juices and an ice chest

description:
I intend to put up a concrete wall in front of my house so that it may be safer. Later, I will install security bars, but I will need more money for that. These houses are quite unsafe, and I must provide security for my family. I am requesting $450.00 USD in order to build a concrete protective wall in front of my house.\r\n

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

\r\n“Tengo la intención de poner una barda de concreto al frente de mi vivienda para que así este más segura, después pondré las protecciones ya para eso necesitaré más dinero, estas casas son muy inseguras y debo darle protección a mi familia” Solicito $ 450.00 dlls para poner una barda de concreto enfrente de mi vivienda.
loan_use: Construction of protective wall

description: Toshpulot D. is 33 years old, married and has two children. He works as a vendor, selling men's clothing such as sport suits and pullovers. He conducts his business in the town's central market, where his shop attracts many customers, in part because his prices are low and affordable for most people. His wife (shown here in the photo) helps out a lot, often running the shop when he is away making purchases. Toshpulot would like to increase the range of goods he has to sell, and has applied for a loan of $1,000 to make that possible. He has been a client of IMON since 2005, and proved himself to be an honest and diligent businessman. He is committed to repay the loan on time, and wishes to thank everyone who chooses to support him.
loan_use: To increase the range of items for sale by buying more men's clothing.

description: Mohammad Asif lives with his family in district 4 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is educated. He earned his degree in India but, after a long time of working in government, he decided to open a retail shop. His business is going well and he wants to expand it, so he requested an individual loan to buy necessary materials to attract more clients and to make good income to help his family. He is happy.
loan_use: To buy necessary materials for his grocery store.

description:
Aisha is 28 years old. She is married with two children, ages three and nine. Aisha sells clothes. She started her business in 2005. Everyday, she works from 9:30 am to 3:00 pm. She can earn a monthly profit of about $50.00 from her sales.

\r\n\r\n

She would like a loan to buy more items to sell in her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, who has a business selling decorations.
loan_use: To buy items to sell in her business

description: Rada is from Srebrenica and she is 42 years old. She is married and her husband works in an auto service garage. He earns about 1200 KM monthly. This is her first loan at MCO WWI in the amount of 1200 KM ($925), and Rada wants to use it for buying material for sewing. She earns some extra money by sewing, and she intends to expand business in order to earn more money for her household.
loan_use: Buying material for sewing.

description: Kamel is 48 years old and is doing his best to support his family. Kamel owns and operates a grocery store. He has 4 children and lives in Saida in southern Lebanon. This is third time he has applied for a loan from A. Majmoua. With this loan, he would like to buy provisions and food for his business.
loan_use: To purchase additional provisions and food for his grocery store

description:
Augusta is an intelligent and valiant woman. Despite her deteriorating health, she remains optimistic that she will get better through her work. She's been selling wool in a small space in her house for 4 years. Holding this job has helped her better the economic situation at home and contribute to realizing the dreams of her 5 dear children. Due to this illness that she's been suffering greatly, she wishes to increase the quantity and variety of her products so she can put enough money together to afford undergoing short-term treatment. Let's realize her loan request so that this devoted mother can stop suffering and fill herself with joy the rest of her days.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

\r\n\r\nDoña Augusta, es una mujer muy valiente e inteligente, a pesar de su deteriorada salud mantiene el optimismo de mejorar pronto a través de su ocupación. Hace cuatro años se dedica a la venta e lanas en un pequeño espacio de su hogar que acondicionó para esta actividad, con su desempeño ha podido mejorar notablemente la situación económica de su hogar y ha podido contribuir a la realización de los sueños de sus queridos cinco hijos.Debido a que su padecimiento ha ido empeorando tiene el deseo de incrementar la cantidad y variedad de sus productos para reunir el dinero suficiente para llevar a cabo un tratamiento en corto tiempo.Posibilitemos su petición para que pronto esta abnegada madre pueda eliminar su padecimiento y colme de mucha alegría el resto de sus días.
loan_use: To buy a larger quantitiy and variety of wools to sell from her home.

description:
Rigoberto lives in a community that lacks industrial and commercial jobs. Due to these circumstances, he decided to become self-employed and thus not have to immigrate to the United States. He started selling clothes and other articles little by little. Soon he became known in his community and now sells blankets and clothing.

Rigoberto tells us that he has many pending blanket orders. This is the reason he is asking for a loan of $200 that he will pay back in 6 months. With this money, Rigoberto will be able to buy more merchandise in order to have a larger variety and fulfill his pending orders. With your help, Rigoberto and his family will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

Rigoberto, vive en una comunidad en dónde no existen industrias u otras compañías para trabajar. Por falta de trabajo fue por la que decidió auto-emplearse y así no emigrar hacia Estados Unidos. Comenzó poco a poco a vender ropa y otros artículos. Poco a poco se fue haciendo conocido en su comunidad y actualmente vende colchas y ropa.

Rigoberto comenta que tiene varios pedidos de colchas pendientes. Y es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $200 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Rigoberto podrá comprar más mercancía para así tener variedad y surtir los pedidos que le hicieron. Con tu ayuda Rigoberto podrá sacar a su familia adelante.
loan_use: Buy merchandise.

description:
Kadiatu sells food items in the market of Makeni town of Sierra Leone. With the help of several small loans from SMT, she has diversified her business and can now rent a stall in the market.

Kadiatu is an honest and loyal client of SMT who meets her repayments on time. She is currently requesting a larger loan of US$ 350 to expand her business further. SMT recommends her with pleasure to Kiva for the loan.

Kadiatu is 25 years old and married with 3 children. Her business is the main source of income for the family. Kadiatu was successful in the recent expansion of her business and would benefit greatly from additional capital to continue the pattern of growth.
loan_use: to further expand her little market stall

description: Fatmata is 35 years old and married with 3 children.  Although her husband is employed, his salary is insufficient to meet the family’s expenses.  With four loans from SMT, Fatmata was able to increase her stock of palm and nut oil.  She is now requesting a loan of $700 to purchase 120 gallons of palm and nut oil.  She would like to sell them on wholesale.
loan_use: Fatmata has a goal of selling her oil on wholesale.   Her loan from SMT would start her on the path to achieving that goal.

description:
Rocio, Delia, and Alejandra are all members of the community bank Juanito. From their involvement in the community bank they have learned to be responsible and punctual, and how to avoid getting sick.

Rocio is 24 years old. She lives with her partner and four year old daughter. She is studying social work at the local university. Rocio sells cosmetics from a catalogue to her friends and family in order to help pay for school. Rocio also has a car, which she uses as a taxi to bring in extra income.

Delia is 28 years old. She makes and sells handicrafts, such as small rag dolls. She buys materials from the city of Lima where prices are lower, and sells her products in bulk to stores. In addition, Delia owns a motorcycle taxi.

Alejandra is 28 years old. She is married and has three children. Alejandra embroiders weavings; she buys weavings, embroiders them, and does other finishing work. She sells her work to established clients in Lima.

Rocio, Delia, and Alejandra need loans of $1,050, which they will use to buy perfumes, creams, fabrics, wool, weavings, and repairing their motorcycle taxi.

Rocio, Delia, and Alejandra dream of finishing school, having a stable business, improving their children’s lives, and owning a home.
loan_use: To buy perfumes, creams, fabrics, wool, weavings, and repair their motorcycle taxi

description: Adama K. sells African cotton materials in the market town of Makeni in Sierra Leone.  Adama said, with her previous loans, her business volume increased by 50%.  Her business is the main source of income for the family.  Her husband also does some business to support the family, but at a very small scale.  Adama is requesting for a loan of $700 to expand her business.  Adama is 33 years old and married with 3 children.
loan_use: Adama would like to expand her business of selling African print cotton fabric and needs a loan from Kiva to be able to achieve her goals.

description:
Twenty years ago, Jorge Martín worked as a driver in public transportation, first as a minibus driver, then he purchased his own vehicle to start working for himself, despite the inconvenience of having to rent his permit. Little by little, he started to work until he was able to buy his own permit with a more recent car model. Thanks to his hard work and dedication, Jorge has been able to move his family forward.

However, he is currently experiencing difficulty because his source of income (his taxi) no longer offers the comfort and features his customers require. For this reason, he his requesting a loan of $300.00 USD, which he is willing to repay in 3 monthly installments, in order to repair his taxi and offer more safety. With your help, Jorge will be able to move his family forward.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace ya 20 años que Jorge Martín trabaja como chofer de transporte público, primero empezó como chofer de un microbús de ruta fija y posteriormente compró su propio vehículo para empezar a trabajar por su cuenta, aunque con el inconveniente de que tenía que rentar las placas, y poco a poco comenzó a trabajar hasta que pudo comprar su propia concesión y con un carro de modelo mas reciente. Gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación, es que Jorge ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia.

Sin embargo actualmente cuenta con una dificultad puesto que su fuente de ingresos (su taxi) ya no cuenta con las comodidades y con los servicios que sus clientes requieren. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $300 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 3 meses y con este dinero Jorge podrá reparar su taxi y así poder ofrecerle un servicio con mayor seguridad. Con tu ayuda Jorge podrá sacar adelante a su familia.
loan_use: Repair his taxi

description:
Luz María’s husband moved from Ciudad de Victoria to work, and therefore the money he sent occasionally took long to reach Luz and the daily expenses could not be covered. For that reason she began to sell second-hand electronic devices to obtain earnings that would allow her to pay the daily expenses of her three children, 16, 13, and 6 years of age.

Presently Luz is requesting a loan of $950 to be repaid in 6 months, and with this money Luz will buy merchandise, as clients looking for new items occasionally leave without. Therefore she needs more variety so her clientele always can find something new. With your support Luz will be able to keep her business going and also support her children to study a professional degree.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

El esposo de Luz María, salió de la Ciudad de Victoria a trabajar. Es por eso que en ocasiones el dinero tardaba mucho tiempo en que llegara a manos de Luz, y los gastos diarios no podían ser cubiertos. Fue así que comenzó a vender aparatos electrónicos usados, para poder tener una ganancia que le permitiera pagar los gastos diarios de sus tres hijos de 16, 13 y 6 años.

Actualmente Luz está solicitando un crédito de US $950 que está dispuesta a pagar en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Luz podrá comprar mercancía, puesto que en ocasiones llegan clientes a buscar cosas nuevas y se van sin nada. Es por eso que necesita tener más variedad para que sus clientes siempre encuentren algo nuevo. Con tu ayuda Luz logrará sacar su negocio adelante, además de ayudar a que sus hijos estudien una carrera universitaria.
loan_use: Purchase merchandise to increase sales of electronics.

description:
Dina, Neomi, and Rosa have been members of the community bank Manantial for less than one year. They were invited to join the bank by friends and colleagues. Through the community bank they have learned responsibility, the importance of saving, money management, and solidarity.

Dina is a 25 year old student studying elementary education at the local university. She sells cosmetics and other beauty products on order to help pay for school. She uses catalogues from companies such as Avon to take orders for her friends and family.

Neomi is 42 years old, married and has three children. Neomi joined the bank in order to take advantage of the interest earning savings account. She takes out small loans in order to help other family members.

Rosa is 22 years old, married and has one young child. She is studying elementary education. In order to help pay for school, Rosa works with a friend selling soft drinks and beer. She does not like this business, and with her loan she will open a store selling clothing.

Dina, Neomi, and Rosa need $675, which they will use to buy beauty products, support a family member, and start selling clothing.

Their dreams are to finish school, find good jobs, and build a house.
loan_use: To buy beauty products, support a family member, and start selling clothing

description:
The group leader of this small group is Annet N.. She is currently in the business of poultry keeping and is requesting a loan to purchase poultry feed. Annet is 30 years old and is married. She has 3 children ranging from age 8 to 12 and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy new poultry breeds and pay the school fees for her children.

Annet is joined in her small group by Mastula N., Nalongo S., Juliet K., and Amandah M.. Mastula N. has a business making and selling snacks and wants to expand her business. Nalongo S. is currently operating a fresh foods business and wants a loan to increase stock. Juliet K. operates a business of selling vegetables and wants to add capital. Amandah M. is currently in the business of running a bar and is requesting a loan to purchase a fridge.
loan_use: To add working capital to poultry business

description:
The group leader of this small group is Jesca N.. She is currently in the business of running a bar and is requesting a loan to stock more alcoholic drinks. Jesca is 38 years old and is single. She has 6 children ranging from age 14 to 20 and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for the children.

Jesca is joined in her small group by Aida S., Betty N., Magret N., and Ruth N.. Aida S. has a business making and selling crafts and wants to buy more craft materials. Betty N. is currently operating a retail shop business and wants a loan to add stock. Magret N. operates a business of charcoal sales and wants to increase inventory. Ruth N. is currently in the business of running a restaurant and is requesting a loan to purchase more food utensils.
loan_use: To add to bar business and improve the services

description: Hawa is 21 years old and is single with two children. She  also takes care of  5 other people, ages 12-45 years old. Hawa began selling milk and bites in 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $85 from her sales.  Hawa now hopes for a loan to buy more  items for her business.
loan_use: To buy more inventory.

description: Ali is 20 years old, and he works and lives in Tyre in southern Lebanon. Ali works in a bakery and makes what is called in Lebanon "manakish." This is the first time Ali has applied for a loan from Al Majmoua. With this loan, he would like to buy tools for the oven.
loan_use: To buy tools for his baking oven

description:
Limber is an employee at a company. He is single and lives with his parents. He works hard to provide services as an electrician. Currently, Limber is also a student. He seeks a loan to increase the savings that will be used to buy a computer. Limber needs this computer, for it will facilitate his job and help him in school projects. He has a very good credit history during his time with Agrocapital; he demonstrated that he is very responsible and punctual in his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Limber es un joven que trabaja como dependiente de una empresa. Es una persona soltera que vive con sus padres y se dedica a prestar servicios de electricista en la empresa donde trabaja. Actualmente Limber continúa estudiando y la presente solicitud es para incrementar capital que necesita para comprar una computadora. Limber requiere esta computadora ya que la misma le facilitará la elaboración de trabajos y proyectos en sus estudios. Tiene muy buenos antecedentes crediticios, durante el tiempo de relación financiera con Agrocapital demostró ser una persona responsable y puntual en sus pagos.
loan_use: buy a computer

description:
My name is Parween A. and I am a group leader of four other women. These women are: Khalida, who runs a beauty parlor; Farzana B., who wants to buy a donkey cart; Haseena, who will invest her share of the loan to improve her family's vegetables business; and Rubina B., who will spend her share to fix her husband’s car.

I am 42 and a mother of two: one boy and one girl. My son runs a food stall in a busy nearby market. I also help him to prepare the snacks for his stall. He wishes to expand his business, for which he requires a loan. His income has lessened many of our economic difficulties.
loan_use: Expand food stall

description:
The group leader of this small group is Betty O.. She is currently in the business of tailoring and is requesting a loan to add to the business. Betty is 36 years old and is a widow. She has 3 children ranging from age 3 to 10 and her children go to school. Each week, Betty makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a house for her children. Betty has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Betty is joined in her small group by Loy A., Mayimuna N., Mirabu N., and Betty M.. Loy A. has a business selling charcoal and wants to purchase more sacks of charcoal. Mayimuna N. is currently operating a business selling charcoal and wants a loan to expand to bulk selling. Mirabu N. operates a business selling matooke and wants to add capital. Betty M. is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to add stock.
loan_use: To purchase more cloth fabric

description:
Jessica is an admirable woman possessing the desire to work and the vision to launch new businesses. At her short 20 years of age, she runs three shops in a market. Until four years ago, she worked helping her mother selling food. When her mother heard about the inauguration of a new market, she didn’t hesitate to propose to her daughter that she ought to begin to sell produce from a market stand. Jessica was eager to work and immediately accepted her mother’s proposal. Besides, more income for her family would not have been a bad thing. She has four children and many hopes for them. They are the motor that pushes her the most. Now, she has two produce stands and a book store that has been open for two months with the help of her husband. Her objective is to expand over the next months and buy a photocopier.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Las ganas de trabajar y la visión de emprender nuevos negocios hacen de Jessica una mujer admirable. A sus cortos veinte años maneja tres puestos de venta en un mercado. Hasta hace cuatro años trabajaba ayudando a su mama vendiendo comida. Cuando su mamá se enteró de la inauguración de un nuevo mercado no dudó en proponerle a su hija que empezara a vender verduras en un puesto. Jessica tenía ganas de trabajar así que acepto de inmediato la propuesta de su mamá, además, un ingreso más a su familia no le hubiera ido mal. Ella tiene cuatro hijos y muchas esperanzas en ellos, ellos son el motor que la empuja a crecer más. Ahora tiene dos puestos de verduras y una librería abierta hace dos meses con la ayuda de su esposo, su objetivo es ampliarla en los siguientes meses y comprar una fotocopiadora.
loan_use: Expand her new book store.

description:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi L., 50 years old, is a 4th year member of TYM. Working hard all those years to taking care of her 6 children has made her look much older than her real age. Her youngest child is still in the last year of high school. With only a small area of rice paddy and a lot of mouth to feed, Mrs. L. spent all her remaining time to cattle-breeding. She normally has about 6 or 7 pigs in the pen, each weight close to 80 kilograms. In addition to that, she also raised cow to sell when the price is high. Each year her family can make all the way up to 1000 USD. After planning carefully, in this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 575 USD to buy another pair of cows.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh Hoai Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Liên, 50 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 4 của Quỹ Tình thương. Thời gian làm lụng vất vả nuôi 6 người con khiến chị trông già hơn tuổi thực. Người con út của chị hiện vẫn đang học năm cuối phổ thông. Nhà chỉ có vài sào ruộng lại đông người nên thời gian rỗi chị Liên dành hết cho việc chăn nuôi. Trong chuồng nhà chị Liên thường có 6-7 con lợn, mỗi con trên dưới 80kg. Ngoài ra chị còn nuôi bò để bán khi được giá. Thu nhập từ chăn nuôi hàng năm của gia đình chị Liên khoảng 1000USD. Dự án hiệu quả, vòng vốn này chị Liên xin vay 575USD mua 1 đôi bò.
loan_use: Buy cows

description:
Mariam is a married woman with 2 children, aged 12 and 7. Mariam is a clothes seller, and she started her business in 2006. Every day she works from 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM at her business.\r\n

\r\nMariam now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in a salon, tailoring, and charcoal selling.
loan_use: To buy more items for her business

description:
Mrs. Tang S., 52, has six children. She owns a plot of land and grows rice, earning approximately one dollar a day. Her husband works as a construction worker and makes on average, about three dollars a day.

Two daughters work as a garment workers with a salary $80 a month; three other children are students, one of whom lives outside the family home.

Mrs. Tang will use this loan to purchase construction tools for her husband.
loan_use: To purchase construction tools

description:
Fatuma is a married woman with 2 children, aged 18 and 10. Fatuma owns a small food vending store, which she started in 2007. Everyday she works from 6:00 AM to 4:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.\r\n
