\r\nFatuma now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses dealing in food vending.
loan_use: To buy more food items for her business

description:
Eduardo has recently married and now has the huge responsibility of taking care of a new life. His agricultural work has provided him a decent living, but he would like to increase his income in order to give stability and security to his child. To this end, he plans to increase his working capital with the goal of starting up a small grocery store, which his beloved wife will run. Your help would contribute to the achievement of this goal.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Eduardo, acaba de conformar su hogar y tiene la inmensa responsabilidad de velar por una vida nueva en nuestro planeta, su labor agrícola han podido otorgarle bienestar pero desea acrecentar sus ganancias para brindarle estabilidad e seguridad a su pequeño, para este fin tiene pensado incrementar su capital de trabajo con el objetivo de establecer en poco tiempo un espacio de venta de abarrotes para desarrollo y ocupación de su querida esposa.Vuestra importante ayuda contribuirá con la realización de este deseo.
loan_use: To improve the products he plants

description:
Two years ago Lilian received an idea from family members to start selling children’s clothes from the school where she works as a teacher. She decided to give it a shot, and since then has been very successful, thanks to help from her parents and family members.

Due to the large amount of orders she recieves, Lilian is applying for a loan so as to invest in greater quantities and varieties of garments. With your important contribution, this honest woman will continue working with her beloved parents.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

La señorita Lilian, se desempeña como maestra en un centro educativo de su localidad, hace un par de años sus familiares que residen en la capital le dieron la idea de ofertar prendas de vestir para niños desde su centro de estudios con el propósito de mejorar sus situación económica, decidió incursionar en este campo y ha ido cosechando satisfacciones gracias a la ayuda de sus padres y familiares, debido a la inmensa solicitud de prendas, solicita un préstamo a fin de invertirlos en la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de prendas.Con tu importante ayuda esta noble mujer seguirá contribuyendo con sus ancianos y amorosos padres.
loan_use: Buy a greater quantity and variety of garments for her clothes sales

description:
Maribel is an active, hard-working woman who teaches at a preschool in the mornings and in the afternoons can be found making the rounds throughout her city’s streets selling beauty products. This second job has allowed her to improve the income of her beloved family.

Maribel has decided to set up her business permanently in her house. To do this she will need a glass showcase to display the beauty products. Your important contribution will help fulfill this goal.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maribel es una mujer muy activa y trabajadora, por las mañanas se desempeña como maestra en un centro inicial de su ciudad y por las tardes recorre sus calles ofertando sus productos de belleza, la ayuda económica que obtiene de esta labor han servido para elevar el nivel de vida de su amada familia, con el propósito de ofertar sus productos en su domicilio de manera permanente ha decidido adquirir una vitrina para exponerlos, vuestra importante colaboración permitirá la realización de este deseo.
loan_use: To buy a glass showcase for her cosmetic products

description:
Mrs Tất has 2 children who are still going to school. She has been selling plastic products for a long time. Her products are made with recycled plastic, these are of good quality and beautiful design. She has built a good base of loyal customers. She would like to borrow 2006000 VND to expand her store, adding more products to her catalog. She likes SEDA's loan condition and the ability to make weekly installment

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Tất có hai con còn đi học, buôn bán nhựa từ lâu đời. Sản phẩm chị làm ra từ nhựa tái chế nhưng mẫu mã đẹp lại bền chắc nên được rất nhiều người tin dùng và trở thành bạn hàng thân thiết của cửa hàng chị. Chị muốn vay 2006000 đồng để mở rộng cửa hàng, làm ra nhiều sản phẩm để bán hơn nên chị đã vay theo chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc vì chị chỉ phải trả hàng tuần với số tiền nhỏ.
loan_use: plastic products

description:
Bahtier U. is a 46 year old male who works as an electrical mechanic in the Somonkom telephone company. He has two children. His wife is a school teacher. Bahtier U. makes enough money to provide well for his family’s life. But he wants to purchase computer and related equipment for his son's 18th birthday. This is why he decided to obtain a loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Урунов Бахтиер мужчина в возросте 46 лет работает в Сомонкоме в телефоной компании мастером электриком. Имеет двоих детей. Жена работает учительницей в средней школе. Урунов Бахтиер зарабатывает достаточно чтоб хорошо обеспечить жизнь семьи. Но для того чтоб обновить всю оргтехнику в доме он решил взять кредит, на день рождение своего 18 летнего сына.
loan_use: To purchase computer equipment for home

description:
Asirat T. is 40 years old. She is married with four children.

Asirat is a market vendor. She sells clothing for kids and teenagers. The goods are purchased in the neighboring country, Uzbekistan, as well as in the domestic market. As a rule, Asirat trades in the central city market. However, the village where Asirat lives is located on the border with Kyrgyzstan, and Asirat has customers from this republic also. Asirat's business is profitable, allowing her to contribute significantly to the family budget.

Now, Asirat is planning to purchase new clothing for kids and teenagers for her business. For this purpose, she requests 300.00 US Dollars for a term of 3 months. She has a positive credit history for her three years of cooperation with IMON. Asirat thanks all for supporting her and promises to repay promptly.
loan_use: Purchasing new clothing for kids and teenagers in order to increase the range of goods of her business

description: Mrs. Hem H., age 30, is married with two little children and lives in a Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She buys coconuts from the growers and resells them for a profit. She can earn about $2.50 each day. Her husband makes about $2.50 each day by working as a construction foreman. Mrs. Hem H. has applied for a loan to purchase a motorcycle to use for her business transportation.
loan_use: To purchase a motorcycle to use for her business transportation

description: Esmira ( her husband is pictured ) is a mother of 3 children. She buys cows and calfs to fatten for sales. 2 years ago they started this business. Esmira was born in 1977. The Varshayev's family live  in  Khachmaz town, Azerbaijan. Now they need a loan of $1200 to buy a calf and a cow for improving their business.
loan_use: to buy a calf and a cow

description: Mr. S. Thyda and his wife, Lim Sokheang, have been married since 1998. They have two children; one daughter and one son, both who study at lthe ocal school. The family lives about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Mr. Thyda has been a goldsmith for three years. He learned his skill in Phnom Penh. His wife has been a garment factory worker for five years. Mr. Thyda is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $200 to purchase goldsmithing materials for his business.
loan_use: To purchase goldsmith materials

description:
Suzy is 38 years old and is married woman with 5 children, ages14, 8, 5, 3 and 1 year old. Suzy owns a small food store, which she started more than 2 years ago. Every day, she works from 6am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $340 from her sales.\r\n

\r\nShe now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in hair dressing and food vending.
loan_use: To buy more food items for her business

description:
GIE Elybée is a group of mixed male and female membership which specializes in cashew nut processing in Ziguinchor. Processed products are packaged in plastic bags and put up for sale by individuals and even hotels; the current loan is sought to strengthen the stock of raw materials. \r\n

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

\r\nLe GIE Elybée est un groupement mixte compose d' hommes et de femmes qui s' est spécialise dans la transformation des noix d’acajou a Ziguinchor. Les produits transfomes sont emballes dans des sachets plastiques et mis en vente a des particuliers et meme a des hotels ; le present credit est sollicite pour renforcer le stock de matieres premieres.
loan_use: Processing and marketing of cashew nuts
borrower_names: Banna, Pape  Momar, Dianke, Binta, Ibrahima, Lena, Rocky, Salihina, Binta, Awa, Papa Elimane, Aminata
borrower_genders: female, male, female, female, male, female, female, female, female, female, male, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
In the region of Condega, in a humble home, Mrs. Maria V. dedicates herself to the baking of bread keeping an oven since she was more than 28 years old. Every day in the early hours of the morning Mrs. Maria V. prepares the dough to produce the bread and in this manner she sells it in her house where her clients come to purchase the product. To better her condition and business she has received credits from Ceprodel to acquire better quantities of bread and sell them with the proposal of obtaining an income to care for her 3 children that also need her support.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

En el municipio de Condega, en un humilde hogar de habitación, la señora Maria V. se dedica a la elaboración de pan teniendo un horno desde hace mas de 28 años que es el tiempo en el que ella se ha dedicado a esta ardua labor de elaboración y venta de pan.

Todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana la señora Maria V. prepara la materia prima para elaborar el pan y de esta manera lo vende en su casa de habitación donde sus clientes llegan a comprar el producto.

Para mejorar su condición en el negocio ha realizado créditos en Ceprodel para adquirir mayores cantidades de pan y así comercializarlos con el propósito de obtener ingresos para mantener a sus tres hijos que tanto necesitan de su apoyo.
loan_use: To purchase ingredients to produce bread

description:
Ni Putu Eka Yulianti opened a stall in front of her home. The road in front of her home is a road passed by many from the community. This made her stall sufficiently visited by many from the community surrounding her home. With capital of Rp. 1.000.000.- (about USD110) from her savings, Ni Putu Eka started this effort with purchasing goods for trade to stock the stall. Every morning at 4 am, Ni Putu Eka goes to the market in the city to buy goods such as vegetables, fish, raw meat and others. Ni Putu Eka opens her stall at 6 am till 6 pm. Apart from vegetables, Ni Putu Eka also sells several essentials from day-to-day, income from this amount to Rp. 50.000.- (USD5.50) per day. This income is used to fulfill needs. Her hope is that with the loan from Dinari, Ni Putu Eka will add capital to her business and increase the goods in her stall.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Putu Eka Yulianti membuka usaha warung di depan rumahnya. Jalan didepan rumahnya merupakan jalan yang ramai dilewati oleh masyarakat. Hal inilah yang membuat warungnya cukup ramai dikunjungi oleh masyarakat disekitar rumahnya. Dengan modal awal Rp.1.000.000.- hasil dari tabungannya, Ni Putu Eka mulai usaha ini dengan membeli barang dagangan untuk mengisi warungnya. Setiap pagi pukul 04.00 Ni Putu Eka pergi kepasar di kotanya untuk membeli barang dagangan seperti sayur mayur, ikan, daging mentah dan lain-lain. Ni Putu Eka membuka warungnya dari pagi hari jam 06.00 pagi sampai pukul 06.00 sore. Selain sayur mayur, Ni Putu Eka juga menjual berbagai kebutuhan sehari-hari, keuntungan yang diperoleh sebesar Rp. 50.000.- perhari. Keuntungannya dipakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhannya. Harapannya dengan pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari, Ni Putu Eka akan menambah modal usahanya dan memperbanyak isi warungnya .
loan_use: Purchase more goods for trade until adequate for customers' needs (Membeli barang dagangan lebih banyaklagi sehingga semua kebutuhan pelanggannya tersedia)

description:
Theresia is 50 years old and is a married woman with 4 children, ages 24, 21, 18, and 16 years old. Theresia is a food and vegetable seller, a business she started in 2003. Every day, she works from 6am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.\r\n

\r\nIn the past, Theresia has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Sharifa, who has a business dealing in retail sales.
loan_use: To buy more food items for her business

description:
Rahma is 29 years old and is a married woman with three children, ages 13,10 and 8 years old. Rahma owns a small charcoal store that she started in 2006. Her store also carries food items for sale. Everyday, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $170 from her sales.\r\n

\r\nShe now hopes for a loan to buy more food items and charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in grocery and salon.
loan_use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

description:
Ms. Beatriz Díaz sells fast food, such as hot dogs and hamburgers, for a living. She started this business 3 years ago, and she now needs a loan of $250.00 USD, which she will repay in 3 monthly installments. She needs the loan in order to buy supplies because her business is very prosperous and she receives more and more customers each day. Among her future goals are saving enough money so that she can open her own store and engage in both activities.

She is a single mother with a 19-year-old son who occasionally helps her prepare the meals and serve the customers. Beatriz started this business knowing that it would allow her to both generate income and same time stay home without neglecting her son. Betty and her son thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Beatriz Díaz se dedica a la venta de comida rápida hot dogs y hamburguesas, hace 3 años empezó con este negocio, ahora necesita de un crédito de US $250 que liquidara en un plazo de 3 meses para la compra de insumos ya que su negocio ha prosperado y cada día cuenta con más clientes. Entre sus metas futuras desea reunir un capital mayor para abrir su tienda y dedicarse a ambas actividades.

Ella es madre soltera de un joven que actualmente cuenta con 19 años quien ocasionalmente le ayuda en la preparación de los alimentos y la atención a los clientes, inicio esta actividad dado que esta le permitía generar ingresos y a su vez permanecer en su casa sin descuidar a su hijo. Betty y su hijo te agradecerán tu apoyo.
loan_use: Purchase of supplies

description:
A few years ago, Nancy opened a little store in her community with the help of her father who has since passed away. Little by little, thanks to her hard work, this little rental space of a store has gained notoriety; every day, new customers come in to shop for basic items. Currently, she is planning to move her store into her home to eliminate the expensive rental fee, and thus, offer more products at much better prices to the satisfaction of her esteemed clientele. Your generous support will help Nancy put her much-yearned-for plan into action.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

\r\n\r\nHace un par de años Nancy, aperturó una pequeña bodega en su comunidad con ayuda de su fallecido padre, poco a poco y gracias a su empeño este pequeño espacio de ventas alquilado ha ido cobrando notoriedad y a diario son más las personas que acuden en búsqueda de algún articulo de primera necesidad. Ha decidido mudar su bodeguita a su domicilio para evitar las inmensas sumas de dinero por el alquiler, con el objetivo de ofertar mayor cantidad de productos a mejor precio para la satisfacción plena de sus estimados clientes.Tu importante apoyo contribuirá con este anhelado plan.
loan_use: To buy more grocery items and merchandise.

description:
Edita has worked in the agriculture fields since she was young. When she decided to support her household, the work intensified and her product yield increased. However, the needs of her young children kept increasing, and for this reason she decided to acquire a greater quantity of land to cultivate a more products. Despite this, she has difficulty growing crop due to lack of capital, which is the reason why she is asking for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Edita, desde pequeña trabajó en sus campos de cultivo, cuando decidió formar su hogar las tareas se intensificaron y la cantidad de productos se incrementaron, sin embargo las necesidades de sus dos pequeños hijos iban en aumento por esa razón decidió adquirir mayor cantidad de terrenos, para cultivar mayor cantidad de productos a pesar de este hecho tiene la dificultad de siembra por la falta de capital de inversión y este es el motivo por el cual solicita un préstamo.
loan_use: Capital to grow tubers on her ample agriculture land

description: Munavar is 66 years old; she and her husband have raised ten children. In spite of her senior age, Munavar is still full of energy and works hard. She worked on a collective farm and later on she bought the plot of land that she works today. There is 1 hectare of land where Munavar grows grapes and 0.50 hectare of  garden.  Munavar has been in this business for 20 years and has managed to make her business profitable. \r\n\r\nMunavar plans to purchase mineral fertilizer and to pay the salaries of hired seasonal workers. For this purpose,  she requests US $850.00 for 9 months. Munavar has proved herself a reliable client and she promises to repay this loan promptly.
loan_use: Purchase of mineral fertilizer and hired seasonal labor

description:
A. Ismatov is 47 years old, married and has 3 children. His wife works as a seamstress and sews kimono to order. A. himself works as a cashier at the local hospital. Recently A. purchased a plot of a land for gardening, but without fencing around it. He needs 1000 somoni to build a fence around his plot. A. feels that it will be more economical for him to take out a loan to build the fence and pay it back monthly using his salary.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Исматов Абдурахмон, возрост 47 лет имеет 3 детей ,жена портниха на дому шьет кимано по заказу.Сам Абдурахмон работает в областной больнице кассиром.Недавно Абдурахмон купил дачный участок ,но без ограждения.Ему для этого необходимо 1000 сомони.Абдурахмон считает что ему выгодней взяв кредит решить свою проблему, и каждый месяц погашать сумму со своей зарплаты.
loan_use: Fencing for a gardening plot

description:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 47-year-old Marietha M.. She is married with 4 children, aged 13, 17, 21, and 22.\r\n

\r\nIn 2002 Marietha established a food stall and charcoal business. Working 9 to 12 hours a day, 6 days a week, she earns about $175 per month from this business. Marietha has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan from SELFINA, and she now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks of fruit, vegetables, and charcoal in bulk. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $260. In the future, Marietha also plans to employ more staff, renovate her shop, and increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.
loan_use: To purchase additional stocks of charcoal, fruits, and vegetables

description:
Ragil P. was born in 1982. He lives in the Agsu region in Azerbaijan. He is single. Over the past three years he has been working hard on developing his business - raising cattle. He has big plans for the future. He has come to the Agsu branch of Normico to obtain a loan that will allow him to increase the size of his business.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Поладов Рагиль 1982 года рождения. Уроженец Ахсуниского района. Холость. Уже прошло три года как он начинал свое дело. Этот молодой человек активно работает. У него свои планы на счет будущего. Рагиль конкретно будет заниматся скотоводством. По этому ему нужны деньги. Он обратился в Нормикро Ахсуниский филиал. Получив кредит будет расширятся.
loan_use: To increase the quantity of animals

description:
Gloria and Norma have been members of the Obreras Communal Bank for 10 years. From their membership with the bank, they learned to support their fellow man, to be disciplined and to save.

Gloria is 45 years of age, divorced and has one daughter. She sells Unión products like baked goods and desserts, products she sells through credit to workers from different institutions. Gloria also sells cosmetics through catalog.

Norma on the other hand is 45 years of age, married and has 5 children. She sells candies as a peddler in one of the central streets of the city of Ayacucho. Additionally, Norma works at an institution doing general cleaning.

Gloria and Norma need loans of 1200 and 600 soles, funds which will be invested in the purchase of baked goods, plantain snacks, loaves of bread, perfumes, jewelry, cookies, sodas and chewing gum.

Gloria’s and Norma’s dream is that their children become professionals, their businesses prosper, their financial situation is stabilized and that they are able to improve their home.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria y Norma son socias del Banco Comunal Obreras hace 10 años, en su Banco Comunal aprendieron a apoyar al prójimo, ser disciplinadas y a ahorrar.

Gloria es divorciada, tiene 45 años y 1 hija, Gloria vende productos Unión, como panes, postres, productos que vende al crédito a los trabajadores de distintas instituciones. Además Gloria vende cosméticos por catálogo.

Mientras que Norma es casada, tiene 45 años y 5 hijos, Norma vende golosinas de manera ambulatoria en una de las calles céntricas de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Norma trabaja en una institución haciendo limpieza.

Gloria y Norma necesitan préstamos de 1200 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de panes, piononos, pan molde, perfumes, joyas, galletas, gaseosas y chicles.

Los sueños de Gloria y Norma son que sus hijos sean profesionales, su negocio sea prospero, tener estabilidad económica y mejorar su casa.
loan_use: Gloria and Norma will purchase baked goods, plantain snacks, loaves of bread, perfumes, jewelry, cookies, sodas and chewing gum.

description:
When Rosita’s daughter moved to Lima, Rosita was left in charge of a fish stall which opened twenty years ago. That’s how Rosita, now 61 years old, began selling fish in the market. Before that she spent ten years buying meat in Matucana and selling it in Lima. Rosita’s daughter suggested that she went to live in Lima with her but Rosta prefered to stay and work in Matucana because she was not used to Lima and furthermore because the climate in Matucana is better for her osteoporosis, which she has suffered from for many years. Nowadays she has spent seven years selling fish with the help of her son, and whatever she earns she uses for her medecine and taking care of her home. She insists that luckily everything is going well as she would like to open a grocery store in her home and pass on the stall to her son.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Al mudarse la hija de Rosita a Lima le dejó encargado el puesto de pescado que hace veinte años había abierto. Es así que Rosita en ese entonces con 61 años empezó a vender pescado en el mercado. Anteriormente ella se dedicó durante diez años a comprar carne de res en Matucana y venderla en Lima. La hija de Rosita le propuso ir a vivir a Lima con ella pero Rosita prefiere quedarse trabajando en Matucana porque no se acostumbra en Lima y además pero que el clima de Matucana es mejor para la osteoporosis que sufre hace un tiempo. Hoy en día ya lleva siete años vendiendo pescado con la ayuda de su hijo, lo que gana de ello lo destina a sus medicinas y al mantenimiento de su hogar. Ella asegura que felizmente le va muy bien pero que le gustaría abrir una bodega en su casa y dejarle el puesto a su hijo.
loan_use: In the future, open a shop in her home

description:
Hanoi Altagracia is 30 years old and married with no children. Hanoi is an ambitious and successful entrepreneur. She owns and operates a clothing store in the Hato Nuevo community of San Cristobal. Her store is well stocked and lots of people regularly visit to get pants, shirts and to check out the chic collection of shoes she offers.

Hanoi wants to expand her business. She’s thinking about offering nail-care services to her customers. She says that she worked for a long time in a nail center and that she has a huge knowledge and experience in the matter.

With her loan, Hanoi will buy fashionable new pants and shoes to add to her inventory so as to attract new customers.

This is the third loan Hanoi will take from FSMA. She is a trustworthy and responsible person, and she always had repaid the loan on time.
loan_use: Hanoi will invest in bulk clothing in order to replenish her store.

description:
Mariam is a 49 year-old married woman with 5 children whose ages range from 12 to 30. She owns a small charcoal store which she started in 1999, and is an African articles arts dealer. Everyday, Mariam works from 9 a.m. to 8 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.\r\n

\r\nShe now hopes for a loan of $775 to buy more charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in food vending and tailoring.
loan_use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

description: Saadat was born in 1976. She lives in Khachmaz town, and has 2 children. Four years ago, she started a tailoring business. Now she is requesting a loan of $600 to buy cloth for her business.
loan_use: To buy cloth for tailoring business

description:
Kulwa is a 33 year old married woman with two children, ages 12 and 8. Kulwa is a cloth seller, a business she started in 1999. Every day she works from 5 A.M. to 4 P.M. at her business where she earns a monthly profit of about $ 330. \r\n

\r\nShe now hopes for a loan to buy more cloth for her business.
loan_use: To buy more cloth for her business

description:
Winfrida is 38 years old and is a married woman with three children, ages 9-25. Winfrida is a clothes seller; she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 9:30 AM to 6 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $240 from her sales.\r\n

\r\nShe now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in clothing sales and food vending.
loan_use: To buy more clothes for her business

description:
Hanzeran, age 40, is a single parent of three children (ages 20, 17, and 12). She has a cosmetics business and she also sells clothing door-to-door to make a living. She travels to the island Zanzibar to purchase her goods. She started this work five years ago and now makes a monthly profit of about $90. She works from 2:00 in the afternoon to 8:00 each evening.

In the past, Hanzeran took out two loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to make trips to Zanzibar, pay school fees for her kids, and expand her line of products. She now hopes for a new loan to travel to Zanzibar once again to buy cosmetics and clothing. She will also use the loan to pay the examination fees for her child who is in Form 2 (second year of secondary school).

Hanzeran will share this loan with her subgroup who have businesses dealing in charcoal, clothing, food, and fabric sales.

In the picture, Hanzeran is in the back row, first on the left.
loan_use: To expand the various businesses of the group members
borrower_names: Zainabu, Hanzeran, Agness, Zainabu, Ayun, Tausi
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true

description: Grace T. is married with 5 children. She is 52 years old and owns a rental business. She is from Edo State, Nigeria, and has been in business since 2001. She needs the loan of $450 to buy more canopies for renting.
loan_use: To buy canopies

description: Salamatu is 38-years old and married with 5 children.  Like many Sierra Leonean women, she runs her business to earn income to support the family expenses.  She owns a grocery store in the town of Makeni and would like to expand her business.  She is requesting a loan of $1,200 to grow her grocery business.
loan_use: To grow grocery business

description:
M. Agnes is a fishmonger. Her husband is also a fishmonger and they have two children together. Her business is doing well but her problem is insufficient capital to buy more fish.

\r\n\r\n

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more fish for processing and sale.
loan_use: To buy more fish to process and sell

description:
Rosita T. C. runs a general store in the town of Picota, San Martin. At the store, which is in an excellent location, she sells goods of primary need. Rosita's clients are happy that they do not need to travel across the town to the main market to buy goods.  

Rosita is 38 years old, married and has two children. She started the business 3 years ago, because she wanted to help her family and gain some independence. Now she can save money for her children’s education and give them more opportunities in life than she has had.

A member of Manuela Ramos and the community bank Los Claveles, Rosita is requesting a loan of s/ 1700 to be repaid over 6 months. With the help of the extra money, she will buy oil, sugar, and rice.
loan_use: Purchase of oil, sugar, and rice for sale

description:
Mrs. Angela belongs to a communal bank named “ LasTriunfadoras”, located in Marketplace #2, in the meat section, in the district of Calleria, in the department of Ucayali. She is 53 years old and a mother of 7 children. Her husband has passed away. At the moment she has a meat stand. She wakes up early in the morning and works at her meat stand and in the afternoons she dedicates her time to her children and also takes care of her domestic chores. With the loan of 1,000 Soles, which she will pay back in 5 months, she will invest it in buying beef, heart meat and liver meat. Angela is very happy with her business because it supports her family. The business provides the economic stability that she’s always wanted, and she can also give her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Ángela pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Triunfadoras, ubicado en el Mercado N° 2 sección carne, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 53 años es madre de 7 hijos, su esposo es fallecido En la actualidad tiene un puesto de venta de carne de res, se levanta muy temprano para ir a su puesto de venta y en las tardes se dedica a sus hijos y a los quehaceres de su hogar. Con este préstamo recibido de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de carne de res, vísceras, mondongo, corazón, hígado. Ángela se siente muy contenta con su negocio porque es un gran apoyo, le da una estabilidad económica que siempre quiso, puede darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
loan_use: She will invest in buying beef.

description:
Mrs Ngại is 43 years old. She has been selling basic goods to make a living for a long time now. She also raises pigs to increase her income. She has 3 children who are employed so they could help her with the living expenses. Mrs Ngại has never borrowed money before because she lives far from a bank. Now she has joined SEDA because the loan officers go down to her village to distribute the loan and pick up the payment as well. She has applied for 2006000 VND to buy pigs and basic to resell.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Ngại, 43 tuổi, làm nghề đi chợ sắt vụn từ lâu. Thêm vào đó, chị còn chăn nuôi lợn thịt để tăng thêm thu nhập. Chị có ba con giờ đều đã đi làm nên phần nào đỡ cho bố mẹ trong cuộc sống hàng ngày. Chị chưa từng vay vốn ở đâu vì sự bất tiện và xa xôi khi vay ở Ngân hàng. Nay, chị tham gia chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc vì ở đây cán bộ xuống tận nơi để thu và phát vốn. Chị đã vay 2006000 đồng để đi chợ sắt vụn và chăn nuôi.
loan_use: buy basic goods to resell, pigs

description: Mrs. Huk O., 43, sells rice (rice with variety of foods), eventually earns around $2 a day of profit. Her husband Mr. Kong Srang, 50, is a well maker (he digs to make  wells) in his village and makes on average $5 a day of profit. They have four children, one of who is married and lives away from home. The other children are students. To help his business grow, he needs to purchase tools (this equipment is use to dig the well). (A mother of Mrs. Huk O. is pictured because Mrs. Huk O. and her husband were not available).
loan_use: To purchase tools to be used to dig a well

description:
Nuru A. is a 28-year-old married woman living in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. To her support her children, ages 3, 7, and 10, Nuru works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day selling food at a local stall. Each month, she earns about $50 in profit.

\r\n\r\nNuru hopes to expand her business, which is why she's applied for a group loan of $400 U.S. dollars. Nuru completely trusts her two other loan partners, Ester E. and Fatuma F.. Both of these women have their own businesses, selling supplies and cloth.
loan_use: To buy more food and supplies for a vending business

description:
Rahma is 44 years old and is a married woman with 5 children, ages 25, 23, 21, 19 and 17 years old. Rahma is a cloth seller. She started her business in 2007. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $78 from her sales.\r\n\r\n

She now hopes for a loan to buy more cloth for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in tailoring, food vending, tatique sales, and charcoal sales.
loan_use: To buy more cloth for her business.

description:
Felicitas has been a member of the Banco Comunal Ayni II for one year. She mentions that she likes her Banco Comunal because it provides training in diverse areas.

Felicitas lives with her partner. She is 28 years old and has two children. She owns a small store from which she sells CDs, DVDs, rolls of film (for a camera), car radios, and other products that she brings from the cities of Lima and Tacna. She says that she started with capital in the amount of 100 soles, selling in the streets and growing little by little. Currently, she is opening a new branch in the Ayacucho jungle.

Felicitas needs a loan of 3,000 soles, money that she will invest in the purchase of DVDs, CDs and film.

Felicitas dreams are to grow her business, start a new business selling fertilizers, and that her children study.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal Ayni II hace 1 año, Felicitas menciona que le gusta su Banco Comunal porque les brindan capacitación de diversos temas.

Felicitas es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Felicitas tiene una pequeña tienda donde vende CD, DVD, rollos para cámara, auto radios, productos que trae de la ciudad de Lima y Tacna. Felicitas cuenta que inició con un capital de 100 soles, vendiendo en las calles y poco a poco fue creciendo. Actualmente esta aperturando una nueva sucursal en la selva ayacuchana.

Felicitas necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de DVD, CD y rollos.

Los sueños de Felicitas son ampliar más su negocio, iniciar un nuevo negocio de venta de agroquímicos y que sus hijos estudien.
loan_use: Felicitas needs a loan of 3,000 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of DVDs, CDs, and film.

description:
In 1996 when TYM fund opened a branch in Quang Tiến, Mrs Nguyễn Thị K. was on of the first woman to joined TYM. Mrs K. is 39 years old, she used her first loan (50 USD) to invest in pig raising. After a few rounds, she became familiar with the procedure so she applied for max loan in later rounds. She invested all her loans in farming pigs, ducks and chickens. Her husband is a construction worker, he is very supportive of her. He helps her make the weekly payment whenever she is short. In 2001, Mrs K. converted her rice field into a fish farm. Today, her family's farm has an area of 8/10 acre. There are 200 egg laying ducks, 11 pigs, 2 cows and a fish pond of 5/10 acre. Her family income is 250-300 USD a month. Mrs K. is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to buy feed for her animals and fishes.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Năm 1996, khi Quỹ Tình thương về với xã Quang Tiến, chị Nguyễn Thị K., 39 tuổi, là một trong những thành viên đầu tiên tham gia. Số tiền 50USD của vòng vốn đầu tiên được chị đầu tư cho chăn nuôi. Sau khi làm quen với cách cho vay của Quỹ, các vòng vốn tiếp theo chị vay mức tối đa tiếp tục chăn nuôi lợn gà vịt. Chồng chị, một thợ xây, luôn giúp đỡ vợ trong công việc và hỗ trợ tiền trả tuần khi chị có khó khăn. Năm 2001 chị K. đổi ruộng làm kinh tế trang trại vườn cây ao cá. Hiện nay trang trại của gia đình có diện tích 8 sào với trên 200 con vịt đẻ trứng, 11 con lợn thịt, 2 con bò và trên 5 sào ao cá. Bình quân thu nhập của gia đình 250-300USD/tháng. Chị K. dự định vay thêm 1200USD đầu tư thêm vào trang trại.(mua cá giống, thức ăn gia súc)
loan_use: Buy fishes, food for pigs, ducks

description:
Mrs. Meng K., 55, is a mother of ten children. She works growing a variety of vegetables and earns around $4 a day of income. Her husband is a teacher in the village with a salary of $45 a month. Three of her children are married and live away from home. One daughter works in a garment factory and another one sells groceries. \r\n

\r\nMrs. Meng K. wants to use a loan from Kiva to purchase fertilizers and petroleum and more grocery inventory for her daughter. (Mrs. Meng K., wearing the black shirt, is pictured with her neighbor and her husband sitting behind.)
loan_use: To purchase fertilizers and petroleum and more grocery inventory for her daughter.

description:
Mrs. Sean Y., 34, works selling chicken in a busy market, making on average around $3.50 of profit per day. Her husband Mr. Mot Mak, 34, is a musician in the village; on average, he earns about $2 a day of profit. All four of their children are students.\r\n

This loan will be used to purchase more chicken to sell in the market to meet customer demand. \r\n

(Mrs. Sean Y. is pictured with her husband.)
loan_use: To purchase more chicken to sell

description:
Dalia P. D. runs a business selling homemade meals typical of the tropical region in Pucallpa, Ucayali.  She serves cakes, sandwiches, tamales, and more from her home for breakfast and dinner.  Dalia owns a stand where she also serves delicious evening meals to the people of her neighborhood and others passing through.  
	
Dalia is 40 years old, married, and has 3 children.  Education is very important in her family so she makes sure all of her children get the opportunity to study.  She is proud of her business, happy to have a second income, and loves to cook.  
	
A member of the community bank Juan Zaplana Belliza, Dalia is requesting a loan of s/2000 (US$725) to repay over 6 months.  She will use the loan to buy ingredients for her meals such as sugar, milk, eggs, and butter.
loan_use: To buy ingredients of foods for sale

description:
The sale and marketing of lamb’s wool and alpaca fiber is one of the most popular activities in the city of Juliaca. Maritza is 24 years old and no stranger to this kind of work. She’s been doing it since she was an adolescent, and little by little she acquired excellent knowledge and results, thanks to the advice and motivation that her parents inculcated in her. She learned this job from her parents who were hard-workers with big aspirations in life, just like Maritza. This enterprising woman buys her merchandise from intermediaries or travels to nearby towns to buy it, and when she acquires enough, she sells it wholesale to a textile factory in Arequipa. Market demand is increasing, and as such, Maritza needs to increase her business capital. That’s why she is asking for a loan.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste.

\r\n\r\nLa comercialización de lana de oveja y fibra de alpaca es una de las actividades más populares en la ciudad de Juliaca. Maritza joven de 24 años de edad no es ajena a esta labor, se dedica a este negocio desde adolescente y poco a poco fue adquiriendo excelentes conocimientos y resultados, gracias a los consejos y motivaciones que sus padres inculcaron en ella.Aprendió esta labor de sus padres quienes siempre demostraron ser personas muy trabajadoras con grandes aspiraciones en la vida al igual que Maritza.Esta emprendedora muchacha adquiere su mercadería de los comerciantes minoristas dedicados a este negocio, y en algunas oportunidades viaja a los diferentes pueblitos aledaños a su ciudad con el fin de reunir una buena cantidad y ser vendido al por mayor a una empresa textil de la ciudad de Arequipa.Al ver la demanda del mercado Maritza tiene pensado aumentar el monto de su capital, con ese propósito recurre a tu persona para solicitarte un préstamo.
loan_use: To increase capital in order to buy bigger quantities of lamb's wool and alpaca fiber.

description: S. Nodirahon is 24 years old and she lives in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan. She applied to MicroInvest in 2007 and today she is an active client. She started her own business from scratch and through the loans she organized this business in wholesale rice trading. Despite her young age, she has been engaged in the business for 8 years. She works directly with the suppliers and delivers rice to the many traders in her region at very low prices. She is now applying to Kiva for an 8 month loan of $775 to open a new trade outlet.
loan_use: Opening a trade outlet.

description: Bon, who owns a soup stand, has received loans from Kiva twice before. She has successfully paid back each loan on time. Now she hopes to carry on her partnership with Kiva in order to acheive continued business growth.
loan_use: To buy more ingredients

description: Macrene, age 54, is the chairperson of Gwali Mutala Women’s Group in Kasanje. She is a farmer growing sweet potatoes and cassava on her family land; and at the same time she buys produce from other farmers, including bananas, Irish potatoes, tomatoes, and green pepper, which she takes to Kibuye farmers’ market every Wednesday for sale. She has been doing this with the help of her husband, who is also a farmer, for the past 20 years; and so far she is not regretting the path she took, especially with the loans she has been getting together with her members for 8 years now. Her dream is to buy a motorcycle to help her with the transportation of her produce from the villages, where she buys most of the produce. She is married with 8 children, the eldest being 35 years old and the youngest being 19. She also helps to look after 4 grandchildren who are still in school.
loan_use: Macrene intends to use the loan to buy more green bananas, Irish potatoes, tomatoes, onions, and green pepper so as to expand her business.
borrower_names: Christine, Macrene, Hussein, Agnes, Jenifer, Mariam, Rose, Resty, Mary, Barbara, Betty, Margaret, Mildred, Eva, Edward, Bernald, Harriet, Regina, Amina, Allen, Florence, Agnes
borrower_genders: female, female, male, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, male, male, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Juana belongs to the women’s marketplace group “Grupo Mientras Tanto Mujeres del Campo Ferial”, and makes her living selling decal T-shirts, sun hats, and ball caps. Her stand is located alongside the main plaza in the city of Huaraz, Department of Ancash.

With the loan of US$125.00 (PEN 300.00) which will be paid in full in 4 payments, she will buy T-shirts and sun hats to sell to her clients.

She is 37 years old, and is a single mother with an 11 year-old son; both work so that her business will continue to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Juana, pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Mujeres del Campo ferial, se dedica a la venta de polos estampados y gorros. Su negocio se encuentra ubicado al costado de la plaza de armas de la ciudad de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Con el préstamo de S/. 300.00 el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará, polos y gorro para el sol, para ofrecer a sus clientes.

Ella tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera tiene un hijo de 11 años de edad, ambos trabajan para que su negocio sea cada vez más grande.
loan_use: With this loan she will buy more merchandise to sell

description:
Shahlo D. lives in Tursun-zoda, she is 25 years old, is married and has 2 children. Shahlo has a high school education and is a homemaker. She does not have a full household because she does not have the resources to purchase domestic animals and you cannot live in a rural area without a cow or at least a few calves especially with little children who need dairy products.

As a result, Shahlo has decided to purchase a dairy cow to provide her family with milk and to sell leftover milk to neighbors. This will allow her to provide her family with milk to drink, dairy products to eat and extra income. In addition, her neighbors who do not have a cow will be able to purchase milk at affordable prices. This is her dream and she is applying for a loan to purchase a dairy cow. Shahlo will pay back the loan over a 15 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Дустмуродова Шахло Хусановна проживает в городе Турсун-заде. Ей 25 лет, она замужем и имеет 2 детей.Образование среднее. Домохозяйка. У нее нет хозяйства та как нет средств , для того чтобы завести домашних животных , ведь в сельской местности нельзя без коровы или хотябы бычков, тем более у нее двое маленьких детей , которым необходимо молочное питание. Поэтому Шахло решила купить корову молочной породы , чтобы обеспечить свою семью молоком, а лишнее продавать соседям. Этим она даст возможность своей семье постоянно пить молоко ,есть молочные продукты и заработать денег, кроме того ее соседи , которые не имеют корову смогут покупать молоко у нее по доступным ценам.Она мечтает об этом , а для того, чтобы купить корову у клиентки нет денег, поэтому она запланировала получить кредит.А погасить кредит она сможет в течении 15 месяцев
loan_use: Purchase a Dairy Cow

description: Safa is a 39-year-old woman who lives and works in Aley. Sahar has seven children and is helping her husband support their family. Safa does beautiful crochet work. This is the second time she is applying for a loan at Al Majmoua. She needs to buy the necessary materials to sustain her small business.
loan_use: to buy material

description: Zarema is an experienced entrepreneur from Simferopol, Ukraine.  She has been in business for eighteen years and currently has two sales locations at the large Central Market in Simferopol.  She sells a huge variety of house-shoes as well as clothing items, some of which she makes herself.  House shoes or slippers are very popular in Ukraine. Generally, upon entering a home, it is customary to take off one’s outdoor shoes and replace them with house shoes while indoors.  Many times, extra house shoes are kept on hand for guests to wear.  Zarema has built a successful business selling these practical items.  She makes about $700 profit in a normal month.  Zarema is married and has two sons.  Her youngest son is 22 and lives at home with Zarema and her husband.\r\n\r\nZarema has requested a short term loan of $500 to help purchase new inventory for her second sales location which she just recently opened.  She is hoping to buy a good supply of new inventory and increase her profits.  This is Zarema’s first loan from Nadiya Ukraine.  We are happy to have the opportunity to assist her with her business endeavors.
loan_use: Purchase inventory for a new sales location

description:
Guadalupe, Alejandra and Rufina have belonged to the Violeta community bank for 2, 4, and 3 years respectively.

Guadalupe is married, 45 years old and has 8 children. Guadalupe sells vegetables - which she always buys from the same producers - in the Nery García market. In addition, Guadalupe travels to different markets in the region where she buys grains and sells them at retail in her market.

Alejandra is married, 36 years old and has 2 children. Alejandra has a grocery store in her home, located in the community of Huayllapampa. She also sells food to the workers in the area.

Rufina is married, 44 years old and has 2 children. Rufina has a store where she sells groceries and vegetables. In addition, Rufina travels to the market in Paras where she also sells groceries, and from the various markets she brings cheese, which she later sells wholesale at the markets in Ayacucho.

Guadalupe, Alejandra and Rufina need loans to invest in the purchase of wheat, barley, corn, lettuce, cilantro, rice, pasta, oil, sugar, eggs and cheese.

Guadalupe, Alejandra and Rufina's wishes are that their children become professionals, to improve their busineses and to be successful in everything.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Guadalupe, Alejandra y Rufina pertenecen al Banco Comunal Violeta hace 2, 4, 3, años respectivamente.

Guadalupe es casada, tiene 45 años y 8 hijos, Guadalupe venD. verduras en el mercado Nery García, sus productos los compra D. los mismos productores. Además Guadalupe viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región donD. compra cereales y lo venD. al por menor en el mismo mercado.

Por otro lado Alejandra es casada, tiene 36 años y 2 hijos, Alejandra tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa ubicada en la comunidad D. Huayllapampa. Además venD. comida a los trabajadores D. la zona.

Mientras que Rufina es casada, tiene 44 años y 2 hijos, Rufina tiene una tienda donD. venD. abarrotes, verduras. Además, Rufina viaja a la feria D. Paras donD. también venD. abarrotes y D. las ferias trae queso que luego venD. por mayor en los mercados D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Guadalupe, Alejandra y Rufina necesitan préstamos D. 600 soles, 1000 soles, 1600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. trigo, cebada, maíz, lechuga, culantro, arroz, fideo, aceite, azúcar, huevo, queso.

Los sueños D. Guadalupe, Alejandra y Rufina son que sus hijos sean profesionales, mejorar sus negocios y salir adelante en todo.
loan_use: To buy wheat, barley, corn, lettuce, cilantro, rice, pasta, oil, eggs and cheese.

description:
Angélica, Blanca and Maria have belonged to the Hormigas community bank for 2, 8 and 3 years respectively.

Angélica is a widow, 51 years old with 6 children, 3 of whom live with her. Angélica sells baskets and chocolate from Ayacucho in the Santa Clara market. She hand makes the chocolates herself at home.

Blanca is married, 45 years old and has 4 children. Blanca sells natural products by catalog and she also sells Renaware cookware, products which she offers to friends and relatives.

Maria is married, 35 years old and has 2 children. Maria sells vegetables at the market on Cuzco Avenue. In addition, Maria travels out to the Ayacucho jungle to sell vegetables.

Angélica, Blanca and Maria need loans to invest in the purchase of baskets, cocoa, natural products, tomatoes, onions and pumpkins.

Angélica, Blanca and Maria´s hopes are to have money for their old age, that their businesses grow, to start new businesses and that their children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Angélica, Blanca y Maria pertenecen al Banco Comunal Hormigas hace 2, 8, 3 años respectivamente.

Angélica es viuda, tiene 51 años y 6 hijos D. los cuales 3 viven con ella, Angélica venD. canastas y chocolate ayacuchano en el mercado Santa Clara, los chocolates lo elabora ella misma en su casa D. manera artesanal.

Por otro lado Blanca es casada, tiene 45 años y 4 hijos, Blanca venD. productos naturales por catálogo y también ollas Renaware, productos que ofrece a amigos familiares.

Mientras que Maria es casada, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, Maria venD. verduras en el mercadillo D. la Av. Cuzco. Además Maria viaja a la selva ayacuchana donD. venD. verduras.

Angélica, Blanca y Maria necesitan préstamos D. 600 soles, 1000 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. canasta, cacao, productos naturales, tomate, cebolla, zapallo.

Los sueños D. Angélica, Blanca y Maria son tener dinero para su vejez, su negocio sea más granD., iniciar un nuevo negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
loan_use: Purchase baskets, cocoa, natural products, tomatoes, onions and pumpkins.

description:
Graciela, Elena and Delfina have belonged to the Hormigas community bank for 6, 3 and 6 years, respectively.

Graciela is married, 40 years old and has 1 daughter. Graciela has a stO. where natural medicines are sold, which is located in Lima. She travels continually to Lima to supervise her business.

Elena is married, 40 years old and has 3 children. She sells sweaters by request to friends and family, and brings her products from the city of Huancayo.

Delfina is married, 54 years old and has 5 children, 3 of whom live with her. Delfina sells food at the different markets in the region and travels 3 times a week. In addition, Delfina offers catering service to different events.

Graciela, Elena and Delfina need loans to invest in the purchase of pomades, capsules, syrups, sweaters, rice, sugar, pastas and meat. Graciela, Elena and Delfina´s hopes are that their children become professionals, their businesses grow and to build their own homes.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Graciela, Elena y Delfina pertenecen al Banco Comunal Hormigas hace 6, 3, 6 años respectivamente.

Graciela es casada, tiene 40 años y 1 hija, Graciela tiene una tienda de venta de medicamentos naturales, que esta ubicada en la ciudad de Lima, Graciela viaja continuamente a Lima para verificar su negocio.

Por otro lado Elena es casada, tiene 40 años y 3 hijos, Elena vende chompas por pedido a amigos, familiares, sus productos son traídos de la ciudad de Huancayo.

Mientras que Delfina es casada, tiene 54 años y 5 hijos de los cuales 3 viven con ella, Delfina vende comida en las diferentes ferias de la región, viaja 3 veces por semana. Además Delfina brinda servicio de preparación de comida para diversos compromisos.

Graciela, Elena y Delfina necesitan préstamos de 1800 soles, 800 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de pomadas, cápsulas, jarabes, chompas, arroz, azúcar, fideo, carne.

Los sueños de Graciela, Elena y Delfina son que su hija sea profesional, su negocio sea grande y construir su casa.
loan_use: Purchase pomades, capsules, syrups, sweaters, rice, sugar, pastas and meat.

description:
Señora Ana lives with her husband and children in her inlaws' house on Buenos Aires Avenue in the Las Lomas zone of the city of La Paz. The work that she does is selling cell phones of different brands, which is how she generates income. The credit she is requesting is to increase her capital and to purchase more cell phones because her sales are very good right now.

Her previous credit history qualilfies her to obtain a new credit. She has been a good client of ours since last year.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Ana vive con su esposo e hijos en casa de sus suegros en la Av. Buenos Aires de la zona de Las Lomas de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que tiene es la venta de celulares de distintas marcas con la cual genera sus ingresos. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y comprar más celulares pues tiene muy buenas ventas.

Su antecedente Histórico la califica para obtener un nuevo crédito, es buena cliente nuestra desde el año pasado.
loan_use: Purchase of more cell phones to sell

description:
Over the past twenty years, Cirila and her husband have made great strides and put in much effort to advance their business in the clothing trade. At present, they run a shop making sportswear and a large clothing store in Huaycán.

It was not easy for them to achieve this. Previously, she spent a good amount of time selling clothing as a street vendor in Ayacucho (located in the Peruvian mountains). Upon moving to Lima with her husband, they decided to continue with this endeavor. They sold their wares in various locations and always from the street, until they realized the risks in this type of informal activity and decided to more formally establish themselves by renting a location for their business. Little by little they increased their inventory and, five years ago, they opened their own shop for sportswear. This gave their business a good boost, although they assure it was not easy, and they have worked very hard to get to what they have today.

Despite this, Cirila dreams of more. She would like to sell clothing at wholesale in one of the largest commercial centers in Lima called “Gamarra”.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Cirila y su esposo en los últimos veinte años han hecho crecer a grandes pasos y con mucho esfuerzo su negocio de venta y confección de ropa. Hoy por hoy, ellos manejan un taller de confección de ropa deportiva y a la vez, una tienda grande de ropa en Huaycán. No les fue fácil llegara esto. Anteriormente ella estuvo un buen tiempo vendiendo ropa como ambulante en Ayacucho (ubicado en la sierra peruana). Al mudarse a Lima con su esposo, decidieron seguir con este negocio. Estuvieron vendiendo en diversos lados y siempre como ambulante. Hasta que se dieron cuenta del riesgo que corrían como informales y decidieron establecerse alquilando un local para su negocio. Poco a poco fueron aumentando su mercadería. Hasta que hace cinco años abrieron su taller de confección de ropa deportiva. Esto ultimo les dio un buen impulso a su trabajo aunque aseguran que no les fue fácil, trabajaron arduamente para llegare a lo que hoy tienen. Aún así Cirila sueña aun con más. Ella quiere vender ropa al por mayor en uno de los centros comerciales mas grandes de Lima: “Gamarra”.
loan_use: Improve clothing shop.

description:
Nila is a member of "The Angels" communal bank and lives in Picota in the San Martín region of Peru. She is dedicated to selling groceries (fruit, vegetables, etc.) at her post in the city's wholesale food market and also sells hens at her home. She started her business with the support of her daughters, selling a few products, and little by little she was able to get to where she is thanks to a lot of hard work and perseverance.

With the $375 loan, which she plans to repay within six months, she will invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, beans, regional fruits and vegetables, and also hens.

Nila is 51 years old and lives with her husband and one of her three daughters, whom she worked so hard for to provide a better future. She feels good about her plans to better supply her business to meet the demands of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Nila García M., es socia del Banco Comunal “Los Ángeles” vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Picota distrito de Picota, se dedica a la venta de, abarrotes en general, frutas, verduras, en su puesto del mercado de abastos de la ciudad, asimismo en su casa vende gallinas de chacra. Inicio su negocio con el apoyo de sus hijas, vendiendo algunos productos, que poco a poco fue aumentando hasta lograr lo que ahora tiene con mucha constancia y perseverancia. Con el préstamo de S/.1,000.00 el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, invertirá en la compra de: arroz, azúcar, frijoles en sacos, frutas y verduras de la región como: sapotes en cientos, plátanos verdes en racimos, papaya en cajas y también comprará gallinas. Tiene 51 años vive con su esposo y una de sus 3 hijas por quien se esmera en salir adelante y brindarle un futuro mejor, ella se siente bien, tranquila, dentro de sus planes es surtir mas su negocio de acuerdo a la exigencia del cliente
loan_use: Purchase rice, sugar, beans, regional fruits and vegetables, etc. / Con el prestamo comprara frijoles,azúcar,etc para su venta

description:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is Anna L.. She is 22 years old, single, and has one six-month-old child. In 2003, Anna established her poultry business. She works seven days a week, and more than 16 hours a day. Anna has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now seeks a new loan in order to purchase additional chickens. In the future, Anna plans to diversify her business. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. As such, low income women in Tanzania typically receive poor financial support and in turn only limited access to basic needs and services.

Fortunately, SELFINA has been a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women in Tanzania. Simply put, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women through an arrangement called a sale and leaseback transaction. More specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extends a loan to her to facilitate the transaction, and then leases the equipment back to her.
loan_use: To purchase additional chicks to raise and sell.

description:
Martha, 38, lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. She finished high school and now has two children, both of whom still live at home. She earns a living making whatever clothes are appropriate for the season of year. For example, she's now making skirts and trousers appropriate for high school students at the beginning of their school year and smocks for kindergarten aged children. Furthermore, she makes blouses, dresses and skirts. When Martha started her business, she only made costumes, but as she's become known, her customers have ordered everyday articles of clothing from her.

Martha belongs to the Santa Lucia community lending group from which she received her first loan of S/.300. She used the first loan to make articles of clothing that had been ordered. With this loan of S/.500, to be repaid in four months, she will buy a dozen school sweaters that the students of a local school always want and cloth to make 20 skirts and smocks. Her greates dream is to set up her a tailoring shop in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Martha Elizabeth H. L. tiene 38 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Moche provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad. Estudio secundaria completa, tiene dos hijos que aun dependen de ella. Se dedica a la corte y confección de ropa, de acuerdo a la temporada, por ejemplo en esta época del año esta elaborando faldas y pantalones de colegio, además mandiles para niños que asisten al jardín así también blusas, vestidos y faldas para dama. Cuando la señora Martha inició su negocio confeccionando solo disfraces poco a poco se fue haciendo conocida y le hacían pedido de prendas de vestir.

Ella integra el Grupo Mientras Tanto “Santa Lucia” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 este dinero lo invirtió para confeccionar algunas prendas pedidas. Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00 el cual pagara en cuatro meses comprara, una docena de chompas de colegio que siempre le solicitan de algunos colegios particulares y tela para la elaboración de 20 faldas y mandiles para el jardín. Su mayor sueño es instalar en su casa un taller de costura
loan_use: Buy supplies for tailoring business.

description:
Mrs. Chanphun Y. and her husband have been married for six years. They have no children. Chanphun and her husband live with her father, who is a motor taxi driver. The family lives in an old house, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Chanphun is a garment factory worker. Her husband, Sary Yin, has been a carpenter for thirteen years.

Mrs. Chanphun is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $800 to purchase a motorbike. She would like to replace her father's old bike. He runs a motor taxi business. They would like to use the extra income to repair their house.
loan_use: To purchase a new motorbike to replace the old one. Her father runs a motor taxi business.

description:
Mrs. Phạm Thị Nồng, 45 years old, joins the TYM Fund in early 2007. She lives with her husband and two school age children. The family weave straw mattresses for living. Their oldest son who labors over sea also sends money home to help his parents. At first, she was afraid to borrow thinking unable to repay, but finally she took out a 200USD loan to buy straw, raw material of straw mattress. Their mattresses are always popular and oversold. The average monthly income is 130-150USD. This second loan she is applying is 325USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Phạm Thị Nồng, 45 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ đầu năm 2007. Chị sống với chồng và hai con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Thu nhập chủ yếu của gia đình chị là dệt chiếu. Người con lớn đi lao động ở nước ngoài cũng thường gửi tiền về phụ giúp bố mẹ. Thời gian Quỹ mới về hoạt động chị Nồng không dám tham gia vì sợ không trả được. Thấy chị em trong thôn vay trả thuận lợi, chị bàn với chồng vay 200USD về mua thêm cói dệt chiếu tăng thu nhập đồng thời tạo việc lúc rãnh rỗi. Kinh nghiệm dệt chiếu của gia đình chị có thâm niên nên chỉ sau vài tháng sử dụng vốn vay chị cảm thấy yên tâm với việc trả tuần. Chiếu dệt ra của chị được rất nhiều người ưa thích, thu nhập bình quân đạt 130-150USD/tháng. Vòng vốn thứ hai này chị tiếp tục xin vay 325USD về mua cói.
loan_use: Buy straw, raw material to make straw mattresses

description:
Tatu is a married woman with 3 children, ages10, 5 and 2 years old. Tatu started selling food in 2007. Everyday, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $170 from her sales.\r\n

\r\nShe now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.
loan_use: To buy more food items for her business.

description: Rafiga A. is a 59-year-old woman who raises milk cows and sells milk and yoghurt to the local people. She is married and has six children. Selling dairy products is the only financial source for her family, and it is not enough to cover the family's basic needs. To improve the situation, she need to improve and develop her business. For this purpose, she has applied for $1200 USD to purchase four calves for $300 USD each.
loan_use: To purchase four calves

description: Julie E. is 51 years old, married and has 6 children. She sells oranges in both retail and wholesale quantities; she has been in business since 2002. Julie needs a loan of $525 to buy more oranges for sale.
loan_use: To buy more oranges for sale

description: Samara is a 49-year-old local resident of Saatli town. She is married and lives with her husband's family and her two children. She and her husband breed cattle in their yard. They have been engaged in this business since 2003 and now are quite experienced in this business. She raises calves and sells them alive to the local market or to butcheries. Cattle breeding is traditional in this region, where it is only source of income when there are no other jobs, and it can bring good income. Samara wants to develop this business and to increase the number of calves she raises. She wants to buy two more calves to add to their livestock.
loan_use: To buy calves

description:
B. Rohat is 28 years old. This young and brave woman is raising her daughter . She supports her family; her husband left for Russia to work, and now he cannot attain remittance. So Rohat is the main bread winner, and she has to work hard. Rohat has been running her business for 8 years.

\r\nShe purchases young cattle in the local market, fattens them, and sells them in the local markets. As a rule, she sells the fattened animals and buys the young ones once a week. With the help of a loan, she is planning to develop the business and to increase the income for her family.

\r\n This is her fist loan and she is so grateful for those who trusted her and decided to support her. Rohat promises to do her best in order to able to pay the loan in a timely manner.
loan_use: To increase her capital to expand the business and improve the living conditions of her family.

description: Zuwena is 32 years old and married. She owns a small hardware store which she started in 2003. Every day, she works from 9 am to 12 pm at her store, and is now hoping for a loan to buy more items for sale.
loan_use: Purchase of various items for a hardware business

description:
For these 7 women of Faga on the island of Savaii, these are their first loans from SPBD. They all undertook 4 weeks of training on managing a business, maintaining a savings account and then passed a written test on the SPBD principles: business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee. Over the next 52 weeks, they will support each other in their individual business development and to guarantee on-time payments. The women of Faga will use their loans for the following purposes:

Elise Faatu S. (56, married, 5 children) and Eve Eleni T. (47, married, 4 children) will both purchase a weed-killing sprayer, chemicals, 2 knives, filings, a planting stick and axes to cultivate and sell taro, yams, tuamu and bananas.

Filiga T. (56, married, 8 children) will purchase a fishing boat, fishing net and flashlight to catch fish and seashells.

Laulelei A. (67, married, 10 children) will purchase 4 bundles of wire, chemicals and a knife to support her taro and banana business.

Lita F. (42, married, 3 children) will purchase a sewing machine, a weed-killing sprayer, knives and filings for both her sewing and vegetable businesses.

Patouli T. (49, married, 5 children) will purchase fertilizer, a spade, chemicals and bananas for both her vegetable (bananas, etc) and pancake businesses.

Silaulelei F. (53, married, 4 children) will purchase thread, scissors and other materials for her sewing business.
loan_use: Purchase of a weed-killing sprayer, chemicals, knives, etc…
borrower_names: Filiga, Eve Eleni, Laulelei, Lita, Patouli, Elise Faatu, Silaulelei
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
The village of Sili on Savaii Island is one of the well-endowed villages in terms of natural resources.  It has very rich soil, with a large number of springs and creeks which serve as natural irrigation for farms located at the foot of the mountain ranges. Most of the households in Sili village farm taro, bananas and vegetables. They sell their products in the capital town of Salelologa, which is about 40 kilometers from the village. The village learned about SPBD through the radio talk-back shows and from a meeting SPBD staff made with a village chief.   After the successful training of the first loan group in Sili village, more women became interested in the SPBD savings and loan program.  The village chief has convened the village council, endorsed the SPBD program and encouraged women in the village to join. They are now thinking of putting up a string of stalls by the roadside so that women sell their produce to passersby as an alternative to going to the Salelologa market.

Sili 2 group will be using their loans for the following purposes:


Eseta L. (45, married, 2 children): purchase 2 bush knives, 2 knife filings (sharpeners), spades, workers to cultivate and sell taro, tuamu and bananas.  

Lina I. (60, widow, 8 children): purchase a knife, spade, filing, 3 bush knives and other farming equipment to grow and sell taro, tuamu and yams. 

P. Komisi (45, widow, 2 children): purchase a bush knife, filing, spade and other farming equipment to cultivate and sell popcorn, taro and yams. 

Ruta T. (50, married, 6 children): purchase 2 knives, a pick, a filing, a rake and other farming equipment to grow and sell taro and bananas. 

Sau T. (48, married, 4 children): purchase 5 bush knives, a weed killing sprayer and workers to grow and sell taro and yams. 

Silifu T. (38, married, 2 children): purchase 3 bush knives, a spade, a filing and other farming equipment to grow and sell taro, bananas, and tuamu. 

Sulesa I. (36, married, 1 child) purchase 2 knives, a filing, a wheel barrow, a spade and a weed killing sprayer to cultivate and sell taro and bananas. 

Toaiga A. (43, married, 7 children) purchase a bush knife, filing, spade and other farming equipment to grow and sell taro and bananas.  

Tofe A. (24, married, 2 children) purchase 2 knives, 2 filings, boots, a weed killing sprayer to cultivate and sell taro and bananas.
loan_use: Purchase of bush knives, spades, knife filings, etc…
borrower_names: Sau, Ruta, Silifu, Sulesa, Toaiga, Eseta, Petasa, Tofe, Lina
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Mrs. Hằng, 48 years old, married with two school age children, one still in school, is a cadre in her village. Besides her community activities, she raises pigs. She is applying for a loan of 2006000 đồng to buy feed for pigs. Her group has 5 other members. They all apply for loans of the same amount as hers.
  • Trần Thị Tình applies for a loan to invest in her business.
  • Lê Thị Thảo applies for a loan to buy feed for her pigs. She is also a veterinarian.
  • Nguyễn Thị Toàn applies for a loan to buy feed for pigs and buys scrap metal.
  • Lê Thị Nhung applies for a loan to invest in livestock.
  • Lê Thị Huê applies for a loan to buy a sewing machine.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Hằng, 48 tuổi là cán bộ phụ nữ thôn, chị có chồng và hai con trai hiện nay 1 cậu đi làm và một còn đi học. Ngoài công việc trong chi hội phụ nữ thôn, chị còn tham gia chăn nuôi lợn ở nhà. Lần này chị vay 2006000 đồng để thêm vốn mua cám chăn nuôi lợn. Chị còn muốn tham gia lâu dài với chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc. Trong nhóm chị còn có: Chị Trần Thị Tình vay 2006000 để thêm vốn bán hàng lân đạm tại nhà cho bà con trong thôn làm nông nghiệp. Chị Lê Thị Thảo vay 2006000 đồng để mua cám chăn nuôi lợn, chị là một bác sĩ thú y tại thôn. Chị Nguyễn Thị Toàn vay 2006000 đồng để chị mua cám chăn nuôi lợn và một phần chị thêm vốn để đi chợ sắt hàng ngày. Chị Lê Thị Nhung vay 1534000 đồng để chăn nuôi gà, lợn. Chị Lê Thị Huê vay 2006000 đồng để thêm vốn mua máy may mặc (chị làm thợ may tại nhà).
loan_use: Buy feed for pigs
borrower_names: Thi Nhung, Thi Hue, Thi Hang, Thi Tinh, Thi Toan, Thi Thao
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Ama O. is a fishmonger. She is married and has five children. She buys fish fresh from the fishermen, brings it home for processing, and then sells it to her customers. She wants to increase sales to meet the demand of her customers.

\r\n\r\n

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more fish for processing and sale.
loan_use: To buy more fish for processing and sale

description:
Dina is a member of Banco Comunal Juan Zaplana Belliza, and is located at Jr Copaiba Mz C2 Lt 16, in the Calleria district of Ucayali. She is 23 years old, has one child and her husband is a delivery man. Dina invested her first $100 loan from Manuela Ramos in a cosmetics shop.

These days, her shop sells food as well as cosmetics. She starts her day at 7am to prepare breakfast for her family, after which she works in her shop selling cosmetics. In parallel she prepares food, which she sells from midday until 2pm.

With this next loan of $550, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy perfume, talcum powder, creams, lipstick, rice, sugar, milk, oil, noodles etc.

Dina is very happy because after much hard work and effort she has managed to overcome the difficulties that were facing her and her family, and improve their quality of life.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Dina pertenece al Banco Comunal Juan Zaplana Belliza, ubicado en el Jr Copaiba Mz C2 Lt 16 del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 23 años y es madre de 1 hijo, su esposo es motocarrista. Dina con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de productos de belleza.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de productos de belleza y de venta de comida, se levanta a las 7am, para preparar el desayuno de su hijo y de su esposo, luego se dedica a la venta de sus productos de belleza y paralelo a eso prepara su comida que lo vende a partir del medio día hasta las 2pm.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1500 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará : perfumes, talcos, cremas, labiales, colonias, arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, fideos, etc.

Dina esta muy feliz, porque con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado salir adelante con su familia y ha superado los problemas que se le presentaban.
loan_use: To buy goods for her shop

description:
Born around 1958 in the economic capital of BENIN, Mrs S. Jeannette is married and mother of 4 children. A seamstress by profession, she also sells fabric loinclothes as well as goods such as buttons, threads and linings. She also does a lot of baby clothes because of the demands of her clients. She is asking for a loan to respond to the increasing demands of her clientele.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Née vers les années 1958 dans la capitale économique du BENIN, dame S. Jeannette est mariée et mère de 4enfants. Couturière de profession, elle mène parallèlement à celle-ci la vente des tissus pagnes, des produits de mercerie tels que les boutons, les fils, les doublures, etc. Elle s’investie beaucoup dans la layette à cause de la demande de sa clientèle. Elle sollicite ce crédit afin de répondre à la demande sans cesse croissante de sa clientèle.
loan_use: Purchase of 40 spools of thread, 15 pieces of fabric and 5 roles of lining

description:
