Emigdio Cáceres is 48 years old and is married to Victorina Mendoza, who is 44 years old. They have 6 children, of whom 4 are sons. They are 22, 18, 16, and 12 years old. Their daughters are 20 and 14 years old. The three oldest children all work and contribute to the family’s income; the three youngest are in still studying in secondary and high school. Emigdio is very proud of his family. He says that despite the fact that they are numerous, they have been able to stay close even during the most difficult moments. In spite of all that goes on with young people these days, his children have chosen to study and work in order to help out the family.

Emigdio has been selling charcoal for more than 25 years. Through this occupation, he has given food, a roof, and education to his family. Emigdio buys charcoal in large quantities and then divides it into 1 and 2 kilogram bags for sale to businesses in the area.

In addition to supplying area businesses, he also distributes charcoal to nearby towns like Villa Elisa and Ñemby.

Emigdio’s dream is that his children will finish a university degree and have a better future, since he had to work from the time he was very young so that he could help his parents. Today he is requesting a loan because a supplier has offered him a large quantity of charcoal at a very good price; he would like to take advantage of the occasion and increase his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Emigdio Cáceres tiene 48 años y esta casado con Victorina Mendoza de 44 años, ellos tienen 6 hijos de los cuales 4 son varones de 22 , 18 , 16 y 12 años respectivamente y dos hijas de 20 y 14 años; los tres hijos mayores trabajan actualmente y aportan a la canasta familiar y los tres menores van al colegio están cursando sus estudios secundarios. Emigidio esta muy orgulloso de su familia, dice que a pesar de que son numerosos ellos han sabido mantenerse unidos en los momentos más difíciles. Cuenta que a pesar de todo lo que ocurre en estos días con los jóvenes, sus hijos han optado por estudiar y trabajar para ayudar a la familia.

El sr. Emigdio se dedica a la venta de carbón vegetal hace ya 25 años, con este oficio a dado comida, techo y educación a su familia. Emigidio compra el carbón en grandes cantidades y luego los fracciona en bolsas más pequeñas de 1 y 2 kgs. para venderlas a los negocios de la zona.

Además de proveer a negocios de la zona, también distribuye a ciudades aledañas como Villa Elisa y Ñemby.

Emigidio sueña que sus hijos puedan culminar una carrera universitaria y tengan un mejor futuro, ya que el trabajo desde muy pequeño para ayudar a sus padres. Hoy el solicita un crédito pues un proveedor le ha ofrecido una buena cantidad de mercadería a muy buen precio por lo que el desearía aprovechar la ocasión y aumentar sus ventas.
loan_use: To buy large amounts of charcoal

description: Ula has 3 years experience selling handicrafts and vegetables. She was motivated to start by her friend, who is in the same line of business and is very successful. With the help of a close friend who lent her money, Ula was able to start up her business. She sells her goods by visiting the homes of family, friends and acquaintances. Like her, the clients she sells to often lack cash flow and must pay for the products in installments. Part of Ula’s work is to collect the weekly and biweekly payments owed to her by clients. She feels that her work is getting tougher, but she’ll never give up for she believes her business has a future for her family.
loan_use: To purchase more inventory for her flea market stall.

description:
Joseph owns a small pharmacy in the town of Makeni in Sierra Leone. Joseph is 46 years old and married with 4 children. His business is the main source of income for the family. Joseph supplies many small pharmacies and individuals. Recently, various non-governmental organizations (NGOs) requested that he supply them with medicines in their clinics, but Joseph did not have enough capital to do that. He is requesting a loan of Le.3, 500,000 to meet his customers' demands.\r\n\r\n

Joseph has a great opportunity to work with local NGO's in his area. He needs to be able to supply them with an adequate amount of the medicines they need.
loan_use: To increase his stock of medicine to supply the NGOs in his area

description:
Señora Leonor is 55 years old. She is very lonely due to the loss of her two dear children and her beloved husband. Thanks to her great love for the kitchen, she has found in her devoted clients a big family who help her through moments of sadness. With them she shares part of the morning and a great part of the afternoon since they come and go quickly during the course of the day. To offer them better comfort, she desires to improve her sales space and for this reason she has requested a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La señora Leonor de 55 años de edad, se encuentra muy sola debido a la pérdida de sus dos queridos hijos y de su amado esposo. Gracias a su gran amor por la cocina ha encontrado en sus asiduos clientes a la gran familia que le hace falta para aplacar momentos de tristeza, con ellos comprate parte de la mañana y gran parate de la tarde ya que acuden presurosos en su búsqueda al término de sus jornadas diarias.Par brindarles mayor comodidad desea implementar su espacio de ventas y a esta razón a tiende su solicitud de un préstamo.
loan_use: Improve her little sales space.

description: Mr. Tchéfiou Akiloyé O. was born on November 26, 1978 in Lomé. He is married and the father of two children. He has been selling cloth and dressmaking supplies, electrical products, and daily necessities since 2001 in Adidogomé in Lomé. This first loan in the amount of US$ 500 which he is presently requesting will permit him to purchase sewing supplies, among others, 25 bags of buttons, 12 rolls of hooks and eyes, and thirty meters of lining material. Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteerMonsieur O. Tchéfiou Akiloyé est née le 26 novembre 1978 à Lomé. Il est marié et père de deux enfants. Il est revendeur des produits de mercerie, d’électricité et des produits de première nécessité depuis 2001 à Adidogomé à Lomé. \r\nLe premier crédit d’un montant de 200.000 FCFA qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter des articles pour la mercerie notamment  vingt cinq sachets de boutons, douze rouleaux de grippures et trente mètres de doublures.
loan_use: Expand his stock of sewing suppliesAugmenter son stock de mercerie

description:
I am Rani F. from the city of Lahore, Pakistan. I am married and the mother of four: three boys and one girl, all of whom are married and live separately, with the exception of one son, who lives with me and is the major breadwinner of the family. To make a living he operates a rickshaw which needs to be replaced with a new one, hence our need of a loan. \r\n

\r\nThe members of the group who will share in the loan are: Sardaran B., who will invest her portion in her furniture business; Tahira A., who wants to fix her rickshaw, and Asiah Y., who is borrowing for the expansion of her grocery store.
loan_use: To purchase a new rickshaw.

description: O. Joy is married with 3 children. She is 25 years old and has been in business since 2005. She is from Edo State Nigeria and sells fruits. She needs the loan of $350 to buy more fruit for sale.
loan_use: To buy pawpaw and pineapple for sale

description: Osatohanmwen E. is 60 years old, is married, and has six children. She lives in Benin City, where she sells yams. She requests a loan of $875 to enable her to buy more yams to sell. She studied this business for 12 months and started her own business in 1980, and for two years she has been a dedicated LAPO client.
loan_use: To buy more yams to sell

description:
Ama is the mother of a young daughter. She sells palm nuts, okra, and cornmeal at a street-side stand in the market at Kronum.

She is seeking a loan in order to begin selling cassava at her stand and to increase her inventory of maize (for cornmeal). With the profits from the expected increase in sales, she hopes to pay for her daughter’s school fees.

Ama is a member of the trust group God’s Love. The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.
loan_use: To add cassava and additional maize to her inventory

description: Caro I. is a 39 year old woman, who is married and lives in Benin City with her husband and 5 children. She sells women's clothing, shoes and bags. She needs a loan of $1200 to buy more women's clothing, shoes & bags for sale, which, she said, will enable her to retain her customers. She has been borrowing from LAPO for the past 3 years and has been a dedicated client. She thanks you.
loan_use: To buy more women's clothing, shoes and bags for sale

description:
Ludmila is married with a daughter named Svetlana. She is an enterprising business owner who works in the sphere of clothing sales. Ludmila runs a small business selling men’s shirts in one of the most popular markets in Zaporozhye. Ludmila offers merchandise that is unique – there are very few kiosks with the same inventory in her market. She has been in this trade for 5 years. Her turnover capital is about $2500. Some of the strong characteristics of her business are its stability and the quality of merchandise offered. \r\n\r\n

Ludmila wants a loan of $1000 to purchase a wide range of clothing items. which will help her improve the quality of her work and get more customers. Ludmila is willing to take business risks, but she knows how to weigh all her decisions before committing to anything. Moreover, she is very devoted to the success of her business and has proven that she will be able to repay this loan without a problem.
loan_use: To increase her turnover capital

description:
It requires a lot of capital to invest in transport business. It also requires a lot of guts & determination to make it work. Mrs Nguyễn Thị Chí is 46 years old. She and her husband had used a loan from TYM to buy a truck to start up a transport business since they live near a brick factory. They have signed a contract to assure the delivery of bricks to the company's customers. This business is stable. They make about 370-400 USD a month. Her husband drives the truck all day, she's at home raising poultry. She is very busy but she always participates in TYM group meetings. This time she applies for a loan of 1200 USD to repair the truck so it does require a lot of money. In the future, she will apply for other loan to invest in retails.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Đầu tư vào kinh doanh vận tải là một trong ít số dự án có vốn đầu tư lớn, đòi hỏi phải mạnh dạn, dám nghĩ dám làm. Với lợi thế ở gần nhà máy gạch men gốm sứ, chị Nguyễn Thị Chí, 46 tuổi, và chồng đã huy động vốn của gia đình và vay của Quỹ mua xe tải chở hàng. Chị ký hợp đồng với nhà máy vận chuyển gạch men cho khách hàng ở nhiều nơi, nhiều tỉnh. Công việc nhiều và đều dặn nên thu nhập rất ổn định. Thu nhập hàng tháng của cả gia đình từ 370-400USD. Chồng đi chở hàng cả ngày, chị Chí ở nhà chăn nuôi. Công việc bận rộn nhưng chị vẫn luôn tích cực tham gia vào các hoạt động của cụm. Vòng vốn tới chị đầu tư để đại tu và nâng cấp lại cho xe nên vốn vay cần cũng lớn, chị Chí dự định xin vay 1200USD. Thời gian tới kế hoạch của chị là tiếp tục vay vốn lớn để đầu tư mở cửa hàng buôn bán kinh doanh dịch vụ tổng hợp
loan_use: Repair her van

description:
Mrs.Dopé A. D. is married and the mother of eight children who are all enrolled in school. She was born on January 23, 1961 in Lomé and is married to Mr. Kodjo Sowou. She buys and sells locally produced mineral water in the market of Agoè Assiyéyé which is located to the north of the city of Lomé. With the income from this business, Mrs. Dopé A. D. helps to pay her children's school fees. She would like to add the sale of rice and vegetable oil to her primary business venture.

The loan of US$ 600 that she is requesting should allow her to purchase 10 sacks of rice and 10 tins of vegetable oil.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame A. D. Dopé est mariée et mère de huit (8) enfants qui fréquentent tous l'école. Elle est née le 23 janvier 1961 à Lomé et s’est mariée à Monsieur SOWOU Kodjo. Elle achète et revend de l’eau minérale produite localement dans le marché d’Agoè Assiyéyé situé au nord de la ville de Lomé. Avec le revenu de cette activité Madame A. D. Dopé contribue à la prise en charge scolaire de ses enfants. Elle souhaite ajouter la vente de riz et d’huile végétale à son activité principale.

\r\nLe crédit de 250.000 FCFA qu’elle sollicite devrait lui permettre d’acheter dix (10) sacs de riz et dix (10) bidons d’huile végétale.
loan_use:
Stock up on oil and rice

Faire le stock d'huille et de riz

description:
Mrs. Akoko Abla A. was born October 23rd, 1972 in Tekponou village, in the Vo prefecture of Togo. She has three children and is married to Mr. Kpowenou ASSAGBA who is a taxi driver in Lomé. Mrs. Akoko Abla A. is a retailer of beauty and consumer goods in the Kodjoviakopé neighborhood of Lomé. She is seeking her first loan of 300,000 francs CFA to buy two dozen boxes of lotion to increase her stock and better serve her customers.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Akoko Abla est née le 23 octobre 1972 à TEKPONOU dans la préfecture de Vo au Togo. Elle a trois enfants et s’est mariée à Monsieur ASSAGBA Kpowenou qui est un chauffeur de taxis à Lomé. Madame A. Akoko Abla est revendeuse des produits de beauté et des produits de consommation courante dans le quartier de Kodjoviakopé à Lomé. Elle sollicite un premier crédit de 300.000 FCFA pour acheter deux (2) douzaines de cartons de crème pour pouvoir augmenter son stock et de mieux servir ses clients
loan_use: Increase her cosmetics stock

description:
Esthela Sánchez is a hard-working woman who began a business two years ago making and selling a small amount of tamales. Today her sales have increased. She began her business to help her partner with the household expenses and the support of their two children ages 10 and 13. Because of her exquisite flavor, little by little her business has been able to prosper, but she still wants to grow more.

She now needs a loan of US $250, which she will repay over 3 months, in order to make a greater quantity of tamales and sell them to more customers, making more income. Let’s contribute to the development of Esthela’s business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Esthela Sánchez es una mujer trabajadora que comenzó hace 2 años su negocio haciendo y vendiendo una pequeña cantidad de tamales y hoy en día sus ventas se han incrementando, esta actividad la inicio para ayudar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar y la manutención de sus dos niños de 10 y 13 años. Debido a su exquisito sabor poco a poso ha logrado prosperar con su negocio pero aun desea crecer más.

Ahora necesita un crédito por US $250 que esta dispuesta a pagar en 3 meses para poder hacer una mayor cantidad de tamales y ofrecerla a más gente obteniendo mejores ingresos. Contribuyamos al desarrollo del negocio de Esthela.
loan_use: Purchase raw materials

description:
Margarita V. is a single woman who had the necessity of starting an activity that would generate her sufficient income to cover her personal expenses. Because she is a creative woman, she decided to create and sell handmade crafts among her friends and neighbors, who little by little started recommending her, and that is how she started her business.

She is currently requesting a loan for US $250, which she will repay in 3 months, to invest in supplies to continue creating her crafts and generating income. With your contribution, she will be able to prosper and afford a higher quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Margarita V. es una mujer soltera que tenia la necesidad de realizar una actividad que le generar ingresos para solventar sus gastos personales, y al ser una mujer creativa dedico dedicarse a elaborar y vender manualidades entre sus amistades y vecinas, quienes poco a poco la fueron recomendando y así fue que comenzó su negocio.

Actualmente solicita un crédito por US $250 que esta dispuesta a pagar en 3 meses para invertirlo en material para seguir realizando manualidades y continuar generando ingresos. Con tu contribución ella podrá prosperar y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
loan_use: Purchase supplies to continue creating her handmade crafts.

description:
Melisa Vázquez is a single and ambitious woman. She has worked in at her parents' business, where they roast and sell chickens, for one year. The business has operated for 23 years. When her dad got sick, they had to let their personnel go because they couldn't afford to pay them anymore. Since then, she has helped her parents with their business of selling and preparing the chickens. She also sells cosmetics on her own.

Presently, she requires a credit of $200, which she will repay in 4 months, to purchase raw materials for the restaurant. With your help, Melisa and her parents will be able to keep up and make their business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Melisa Vázquez es una mujer soltera y ambiciosa, y desde hace un año trabaja en una rosticería propiedad de sus padres, esta opera desde hace 23 años, cuando su papa enfermo tuvieron que desocupar al personal que tenían por que ya no podían pagarles fue desde entonces que ella ayuda a sus papas con el negocio en la venta y preparación de los pollos además de vender cosméticos por su cuenta.

Actualmente requiere un crédito por US $200 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar materia prima para el restaurante. Con tu ayuda Melisa y sus papas podrán conservar y hacer crecer su negocio.
loan_use: To purchase raw materials

description:
Amanda has a business where she sells sewing supplies and gifts. She started it because her husband's income wasn't enough to cover their home's expenses, and she saw the need to support him with extra income. She started her business more than a year and a half ago, when they needed to pay for their bills, their personal expenses, and taking care of their two children.

Now she is requesting a loan of $950, which she will repay in 6 months, to supply merchandise in general as well as thread and yarn, products that her clients have requested. Let's contribute to Amanda's achievement.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Amanda tiene un negocio de venta de mercería y regalos, el cual inicio porque el sueldo de su esposo no alcanzaba para los gastos de la casa y ella se vio en la necesidad de apoyarlo con un ingreso extra esto hace mas de año y medio cuando requerían pagar, recibos de servicios, gastos personales además de la manutención de sus dos hijos

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $950 que pagara en 6 meses para surtir mercancía en general además de hilos, estambres, productos que sus clientes le han solicitado. Contribuyamos a la realización de Amanda
loan_use: To purchase merchandise and shelves

description: Judith E. is 39 years old, is married with five children, and she lives in Benin city. She sells cooking pots and plastics. She needs a loan in the amount of $875 to buy more cooking pots and plastics for sale. She has been in business for the past ten (10) years. She thanks you.
loan_use: To buy coolers, pots and plastics for sale

description:
Ciriaco has a seven people in his family: himself, his wife, and his five children. His children are 20, 18, 15, 13 and 12 years old respectively. Ciriaco and his son named Codeudor are employees of the business SOBOLMA LTD, a motortaxi company in Warnes. Motortaxis are important because it is one of the main means of mobilization for city dwellers. They purchased a new motorcycle to transport their clients and to guarantee that they are able to sell their services for a price comparable to the rest of the motortaxi market.

Their predecessors in the institution always complied with repayment of their loans.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sedloff, Kiva Volunteer.

Ciriaco tiene una familia que se encuentra conformada por 7 personas, él, su esposa y sus 5 hijos de 20, 18, 15, 13 y 12 años respectivamente. Ciriaco al igual que su hijo (codeudor) son empleados fijos de la empresa SOBOLMA LTDA. y amobs en sus tiemos libres se dedican al transporte de pasajeros en moto, es decir trabajan como mototaxistas en Warnes. En ambas actividades su nivel de competencia es medio, sobre todo en el de transporte de pasajeros ya que es uno de los principales medios de movilización de los ciudadanos. Compraran un nueva moto para transportarse y para trabajar de acuerdo al precio que este en el mercado. Sus antecedentes en la intitución son excelentes, demostró un cumplimiento bueno en el pago de sus cuotas.
loan_use: Buy a New Motorcycle to Improve His Mototaxi Company

description:
Omar, who had, a short time ago, dedicated himself to the growth and production of citrus fruits in cultivation because of a number of obligations that he had to meet, was with much effort able to buy himself a motorcycle to work and earn additionl income for his household with which he satisfactorily covered the academic expenses for his three daughters, who are without a doubt the greatest source of happiness in his daily life. Every day, he leaves very early to be able to transport people to their destinations and, now that classes have started, to transport students to their respective centers of education. Due to the large volume of work and to the local weather and climate, his vehicle has suffered from some imperfections, and he wishes to quicky fix those so that he can continue his daily work.

\r\n

Translated from Spanish by Sheila Johnson, Kiva Volunteer.

\r\nOmar, hace poco tiempo se dedicaba a la producción de cítricos en sus terrenos de cultivo, a consecuencia del sin número de necesidades que tenía que satisfacer, logró comprarse con mucho esfuerzo una moto para trabajar y llevar un ingreso adicional a su hogar a fin de cubrir satisfactoriamente los gastos escolares de sus tres hijas quienes sin duda son su mayor motivo de alegría día a día.Todos los días sale desde muy temprano para poder trasladar a las personas a sus destinos y ahora que empezó las clases traslada a los estudiantes a sus respectivos centros educativos. Debido al enorme trabajo y a las consecuencias climáticas su herramienta ha sufrido algunos desperfectos y desea solucionarlos pronto para continuar con su diaria labor.
loan_use: Purchase of spare parts and maintenance for his transport vehicle.

description:
Jaqueline is 40 years of age and juggles two different businesses. She sells cosmetics via catalogue and has a call center.

Jaqueline is a single mom with two children and lives with her mother who helps her to take care of the children.

She sells Yanbal and Avon cosmetics and has a call center in her home. She has been doing these two activities for over four years.

There is a lot of competition in both activities, but also a lot of demand for these goods and services. Thanks to her experience over the years she has a loyal clientele.

The price of her cosmetics depend on the brand and the sales from the call center depend on the destination called. Her voice provider has set rates and she receives aproximately 30% of every Bs.100 called.

This is her third loan with Agrocapital and Jaqueline has allways taken care of her payments on time. She currently has no pending debts with other financial institutions.

Please note that Jacqueline was not present when we went to take her picture, so we only profiled a picture of her call center.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.
loan_use: Expand call center

description: Mrs. Mercy D. is married with 7 children.  She is 42years of old and  hails from Obulosho in Ogun State,Nigeria. She sells drinks and foodstuffs and has been in this business for the past 22 years. Mercy needs a loan of $875 to enable her to buy more foodstuffs and drinks for sale.
loan_use: To buy more drinks and foodstuffs

description:
Amina is 27 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 6 and 4 years old. Amina owns a small food store that she started in 2005. Every day, she works from 7am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.\r\n\r\n

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mwanaid , who sells coconuts.
loan_use: To buy more food items for her business.

description:
Donato is 51 years old. For the past 23 years he has lived with his partner Cristina, who is 52 years of age. Together, they have five children ranging in age from 8 to 25 years old.

He recounts that previously he dedicated himself to making and selling “chipas”, a typical Paraguayan food made from a base of starch, corn and cheese, which his parents taught him how to make. Donato comes from a humble family, for whom he started working at a very young age to help earn food each day.

A few years ago he suffered a hemorrhage which forced him to put a halt to his business for a time. When he recovered, he invested his savings into purchasing corn, starch, flour, nuts and other merchandise to sell.

Donato has advanced greatly and, thanks to excellent sales, he was able to buy a small truck to use for his business. He previously had to sell to order, and carry the merchandise in bags for delivery. With the loan he is seeking he wants to start buying his merchandise at wholesale prices. This will allow him to improve his profit margins and take advantage of discounts that are offered for purchasing at wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Donato tiene 51 años. Vive en pareja hace 23 años con Cristina que tiene 52 años. De la unión de ambos nacieron 5 hijos que hoy día tienen el mayor de sus hijos tiene 25 años y el más pequeño tiene 8 años.

Comenta que anteriormente se dedicaba a la fabricación y venta de chipas, la chipa es una comida típica paraguaya a base de almidón, maíz y queso que el aprendió a cocinar de sus padres que también se dedicaban a este rubro. Donato proviene de una familia muy humilde, por lo que el trabajo desde muy temprana edad para ganarse el pan de cada día.

Hace unos años, sufrió un derrame facial, por lo que dejo de trabajar en la elaboración de la chipa por un tiempo. Cuando se recuperó, el invirtió unos ahorros y compro granos de maíz, poroto, almidón, harina, maní entre otras mercaderías para vender.

Donato ha progresado bastante, gracias a sus buenas ventas ha podido comprarse una camioneta para realizar sus ventas, ya que anteriormente lo hacia abajo pedido y debía cargarse con las bolsas para transportarlas. Con el crédito que solicita tiene proyectado comprar sus mercaderías en mayor volumen y así obtener mayores ganancias y beneficios con los descuentos especiales que recibe cuando compra al por mayor.
loan_use: Purchase of grains of corn, nuts, flour, sugar, etc.

description:
Ms. Maria de Jesús has been creating floral arrangements for over 12 years. “This business is my family’s sole source of income, since I am a single mother who\'s trying to help my children get ahead in life. I need more supplies for my flower shop so that the arrangements can be ready for delivery. I am requesting a loan of $1,200.00 USD so that I can purchase the supplies I need for my flower shop and promptly ship my customers’ orders. \r\n

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

\r\nLa Sra. Maria de Jesús tiene ya más de 12 años dedicándose a los arreglos florales. "Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de mi familia ya que soy madre soltera y con este negocio e sacado a mis hijos a delante. En la florería me esta haciendo falta mas material para tener listos los arreglos y entregar unos pedidos que tengo. Solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls para la comprar de material para la florería y así poder entregar los pedidos que tengo a tiempo a mis clientes."
loan_use: Purchase supplies for flower shop

description:
Cayetano R. Díaz is from the Ycua Pai neighborhood of the city of San Estanislao. He is 59 years old with 2 children who are now grown and living independently. His wife, Rogelia Toledo, is 58 years old. She assures us that the happiest man in the world is living by her side.

Cayetano owns a convenience store where he now has a well developed clientele made up largely of people from the neighborhood who come to his store looking for convenience items. He and his wife are beloved in the community and thanks to their good client service the local people prefer to buy what they need in Cayetano's store.

One of his largest projects is the expansion of the room where he sells his products. The expansion would allow him to stock his store with a wider variety of merchandise for sale, including books, which are difficult to find in the neighborhood and would sell well with the large number of students living there. Cayetano and Rogelia are very hardworking people and much loved in the neighborhood.

Cayetano already has a small amount of money saved and he hopes to fulfill his dream of adding books to the store next year. At the moment, he is requesting a loan with which to stock more merchandise, such as sugar, meat, dairy products, baked goods, canned goods, sweets, cleaning products, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Cayetano R. Díaz es de la ciudad de San Estanislao, del Barrio Ycua Pai, es casado, con 59 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos que ya son mayores de edad y viven independientemente, su esposa se llama Rogelia Toledo tiene 58 años de edad y asegura que la vida al lado de ella lo hace el hombre más feliz del mundo.

Cayetano posee una despensa en su domicilio particular, donde ya cuenta con una clientela formada especialmente por vecinos del barrio que todos los días acuden a su despensa en busca de artículos de primera necesidad. Son personas muy queridas en el barrio y gracias a su buena atención la gente prefiere comprar en su negocio.

Uno de sus proyectos mas grandes es la de ampliar su salón comercial y así poder surtir de más variedad de artículos para la venta como los de librería, ya que en la zona hace mucha falta, por la cantidad de estudiantes que hay. Son personas muy trabajadoras, y muy queridas en su barrio.

Cayetano ya tiene un pequeño dinero ahorrado y espera cumplir su sueño para el próximo año, en esta ocasión, solicita un crédito para surtir de más mercaderías para su despensa tales como: azúcar, carne, lácteos, panificados, productos enlatados, gaseosas, golosinas, productos de limpieza, etc.
loan_use: Purchase of merchandise such as meat, dairy products, baked good, canned goods, soft drinks, sweets, cleaning products, etc.

description:
Maria de la Luz M. is a hardworking woman who once divorced assumed all the responsabilities in the raising of her son. At that moment she started working on her own in order to obtain money to cover all of her daily expenses as well as her son's studies. She started her business more than 12 years ago, and during this time she has learnt that you have to try everything in order to obtain earnings. There were times when one product would not sell well, and then she would have to try to sell another product so that she would not depend on the sales of one product only. Currently she sells menudo (a traditional soup), sausages, and beauty supplies. That way she can ensure that she will always have work and it also helps her keep active. On top of all these activities she also works at a laundromat where she has the opportunity to get more clients for her products.

She requires a $750 loan which she will repay in 6 months. She will use the loan to buy merchandise and also beauty supplies . With your help Maria can keep on working.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Ma. de la Luz Martínez es una mujer trabajadora y ejemplar al divorciarse asumió sola las responsabilidades de su hijo fue entonces que empezó a trabajar por su cuenta para poder obtener dinero y solventar los gastos de su casa y también los estudios de su hijo. Su negocio comenzó hace más de 12 años y a lo largo de este tiempo ha aprendido que se tiene que intentar de todo para poder obtener ingresos. Había ocasiones en que no se vendía un producto y había que intentar con otro para no depender de la venta de un solo producto. Actualmente vende menudo, chorizo y también ofrece productos de belleza, de esa manera siempre tiene trabajo y se mantiene activa. Además de todas estas actividades trabaja en una lavandería donde tiene la oportunidad de buscar más clientes

Requiere un crédito por US $750 que liquidara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y también algunos pedidos de productos de belleza que tiene pendientes por surtir. Con tus contribuciones María podrá seguir trabajando.
loan_use: To buy merchandise for her business.

loan_name: La Union Hace La Fuerza Group
description:
Denise P. is the president of her Bank of Hope in the small community of Imbert, on the north coast of Puerto Plata. 28 years old, she is married with one child. Denise sells new clothing out of a small store, and takes pride in the fact that she sells good quality clothing. She attends a Baptist church in the area, and enjoys reading her Bible in her spare time. Her favorite foods are rice and chicken, but she also likes the “ducles” that people are famous for in the Dominican Republic. She hopes that one day she can buy a house and a car because it would make her life much easier.

This is the first loan that this community has applied for, and they are all very excited to improve and start their businesses. Many of the women in this bank are Haitian, and have come to the Dominican Republic in hopes of a better life and future. Esperanza hopes that every single one of these women will experience success and begin the process of lifting themselves out of poverty.

Oh behalf of this entire group, and Esperanza – thank you for your continued support and generosity!
loan_use: To invest in new clothing.
borrower_names: Monique, Elicia, Jacsinette, Janithe, Eliasienne, Gladis, Kelly, Marie, Mimose, Anne, Daphne, Estelina, Denise, Venicia, Alina
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
The entrepreneur is 38 years old. He has three children. They are studying in school. His elderly father lives with his family and he is very sick. The entrepreneur has an old taxi and he applied to get $1200 to replace the old taxi with a new one to increase his income. He wants to save for a better life for his family and to take care of his elderly father .

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).
loan_use: Replace the old taxi with new one

description:
Darti lives alone with her husband. Their two children are married and they live in another town. Darti and her husband lives in a permanently built house which is simple but clean. Darti wants to stay working as she does not want to be dependent to their children's support. Therefore she farms pig. At the moment she has 5 pigs which are kept at a hut build from cement.

She can earn profit of IDR 2 million every 6 months (around USD 220/ 6 months). She uses this money to finance their daily life. In the future she wants to have more pigs so she can have more income.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Darti hanya tinggal berdua dengan suami. Dua orang anak mereka sudah menikah dan tinggal di kota. Rumah tempat tinggal Darti permanen dan sangat bersih. Walaupun dalam hidupnya tidak lagi menanggung anak –anak mereka tetapi Darti tetap bersemanggat untuk bekerja. Darti tidak mau hanya mengharap dan bergantung pada anak –anak dan juga menantunya. Untuk itu Darti memelihara 5 ekor babi, agar bisa mendapat penghasilan yang lumayan. Setiap harinya Darti disibukkan dengan usaha babinya. Dengan kandang terbuat dari beton, Darti setiap paginya mengurus ternak mereka. Pada sore harinya Darti mencari dedaunan untuk babi peliharaannya. Keuntungan yang didapat sebesar Rp. 2.000.000.- per 6 bulan. Keuntungan ini digunakan untuk biaya hidup sehari-hari. Suaminya sangat mendukung usaha ini, bahkan untuk kedepannya Darti ingin lebih banyak memelihara babi dan bisa menambah jumlah kandang lagi.
loan_use: To buy good quality pig feed (Membeli pakan babi berkwalitas)

description: Salongo K. is such an outgoing person, and no doubt this has enabled him to keep his all-time customers. He is 43 years and married with 6 children. He used to look after his relatives’ children, but now they are old and most of them married. He is a farmer of rice, tomatoes, coffee, vanilla, cassava, and potatoes, and he has been doing this all his life. The loans have helped him buy from other farmers when he does not have enough for his customers, especially in a bad season. So he needs a loan to buy coffee and green bananas from farmers to sell in the markets in Buikwe, Kawolo, and Lugazi. Both Salongo and Sarah are members of Zibula Atudde Women’s Group.
loan_use: Salongo Kalam plans to buy coffee and green bananas from farmers to sell in the markets in Buikwe, Kawolo, and Lugazi.

description:
Ama is mother of six children living in Offinsu, Ghana. She earns a living by selling cosmetics, such as body lotion, hair pomade, perfums, and soap. With her earnings, she has been able to send three of her children to trade school so that they will have future profession. Her other children are currently in school.

\r\n\r\nAma has applied for a loan of $925 U.S. dollars to purchase more products so she can increase her sales. She hopes to one day be able to rent a store, so she will no longer have to carry the loads on her head. With the additional profits, she hopes to pay for her children's school fees.
loan_use: To buy more body lotions, hair relaxers, soaps, perfumes, etc.

description:
Fati is 28 years old and the mother of three children, all of whom are currently in school. She has been preparing and selling corn dough (prepared from maize and used in preparing kenkey, banku and porridge) and maize to her community folks for the past three and a half years. Fati’s working capital is very small and therefore she wants to use her new loan to buy more bags of maize for the lean season. She plans to start saving for her children’s school fees. \r\n\r\n

Fati is a member of the trust group called Gold. The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.
loan_use: To purchase more bags of maize.

description:
On one of streets farthest from the city of Juliaca you will encounter the small and humble residence of Doña Gregoria, a 39 year-old hard-working, happy and persevering mother. She is originally from the district of Saman and after five years she decided, together with her loved husband and children, to leave her native town in search of better opportunities. With the savings they have and the little land that they sold in their town they were able to build their house. Nowadays, her unselfish husband Teodoro leaves the house from the early hours of the morning accompanied by his only tool of work, his tricycle, with the goal of obtaining the daily sustenance of his loved family. In the meantime Doña Gregoria is in charge of caring for their three young children, but at the same time she manages their small store with the objective of generating extra income for the expenses of their home. After seeing the requests and convenience of her neighbors, she decided to increase the stock of her business. With this project in mind she reaches out to your heart, hoping to receive your prompt response.

Translated from Spanish by Helen C. Smith, Kiva Volunteer.

En una de las calles más lejanas de la ciudad de Juliaca encontramos el pequeño y humilde domicilio de Doña Gregoria, madre empeñosa, alegre y muy perseverante de 39 años de edad. Ella es natural del distrito de Saman y hace más de 5 años decidió junto a su querido esposo e hijos salir de su pueblo natal en busca de mejores oportunidades.Con el ahorro que tenían y el pequeño terreno que vendieron en su pueblo lograron construir su domicilio, actualmente su abnegado esposo, Teodoro, desde tempranas horas de la mañana abandona su hogar acompañado de su única herramienta de trabajo, su triciclo, con el fin ganar el sustento diario de su amada familia.En tanto Doña Gregoria se encarga del cuidado de sus 3 menores hijos, pero al mismo tiempo administra su pequeña bodeguita con el objetivo de generar ingresos económicos extras para los gastos indispensables de su hogar.Ahora viendo las solicitudes y comodidad de sus vecinos decidió aumentar el stock de su negocio, con ese proyecto en mente recurre a tu buen corazón, sin perder las esperanzas de recibir pronto tu respuesta.
loan_use: Increase in capital to offer a greater amount of products in her small grocery store

description:
Mirella R. D. M. has a business selling bananas in the city of Pucallpa, in the Ucayali region of Peru. She rents a spot in the crowded Bellavista market, where she has sold her fruits for four years.

Mirella is 50 years old with three children, and she is happily married. She loves working and being able to help her family. Mirella loves sales and building relationships. She never had the opportunity to study, so her goal is to send all of her children to school so they can become professionals.

A member of the community bank Las Abejitas, Mirella is requesting a loan of $1,100 to repay over four months. She will use the loan to increase her daily stock of fruit to sell to the population of Pucallpa.
loan_use: To increase her daily stock of fruit to sell in the market

description:
Since leaving his hometown of Cuzco with his beloved parents as a teenager to live in the city of Juliaca, Hilario and his parents had been engaged in various activities to support themselves financially. But despite their great efforts their income continued to be inadequate. Using their initiative, they decided to begin making clothes hangers. Initially they did not put much emphasis on this work because it did not generate sufficient income. But gradually, as they decided to make the hangers in larger quantities and distribute them wholesale, the situation improved.

Hilario has his own family now and is the father of two small children, whom he adores and are his motivation. That is why this enterprising father plans to produce a variety of clothes hangers in different sizes and models. With your important contribution, his plans would be realized.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Desde adolescente Hilario y sus queridos padres decidieron salir de su ciudad natal, Cuzco, para radicar en la ciudad de Juliaca, desde que viven en dicha ciudad se han dedicado a diversas actividades para cubrir sus gastos familiares pero aún con mucho esfuerzo seguía siendo insuficiente, es así que con mucha creatividad y habilidad han ido fabricando colgadores para ropas, en un principio no le dieron mucha importancia a esta labor porque no les generaba ingresos económicos sustanciales pero poco a poco conforme fabricaban en mayores cantidades y los distribuían al por mayor las cosas fueron cambiando.Actualmente Hilario ya formó su propia familia y es padre de 2 pequeños niños, quienes son su mayor adoración y el motivo de su esfuerzo, es por ello que este emprendedor padre tiene pensado seguir fabricando variedad de colgadores y en diversos modelos y tamaños.Con tu importante aporte obtendrá concretar sus planes
loan_use: Capital injection to purchase larger quantities of raw materials for making finished products

description: Samir is a 59-year-old man. He works and lives with his family in the Beirut suburbs. He has 4 children. Samir owns a dry-cleaning shop. This is the third time he's applying for a loan at Al Majmoua. He wants to develop and enhance his business.
loan_use: to develop and enhance his business

description:
Afia is thirty five years old, married, and has three children. Two of her children are currently in school. She has been selling frozen fish and meat in Obuasi for six years now. She has not been able to buy more frozen products due to low working capital.

Afia wants to use this loan to buy more frozen products, like fish and meat, to increase her stock. She has been educated by Sinapi to save some money from her profits in order to take care of her children.

Afia is member of the group called “Papa Ye” (meaning Goodness). The members of the group guarantee for each other in repaying the loan.

Afia is the person pictured above wearing a pink dress. Beside her is her sister Janet.
loan_use: To purchase more frozen products, like fish and meat

description:
Vilma del Rocío T. C. is 33 years old and studied as far as sixth grade of primary school. She has one child who is still dependent on her. She lives in the province of Otuzco, in the department of La Libertad, Perú.

Her business is the purchase and sale of small livestock, such as pigs, calves, chickens and guinea pigs, which after fattening them up, she slaughters and sells the meat. She also sells wheat and barley grain as well as buys curd and cheese which she resells.

Through one of her relatives, she was able to join the "Mujeres del Olivo" community bank, where she obtained her first loan which she used to buy a sack of wheat grain, a sack of barley grain and small livestock. With another loan, which will be repaid in four months, she will buy pigs, chickens and guinea pigs.

Her greatest dream is to have her own house in the city of Trujillo

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Vilma del Rocío T. C. tiene 33 años de edad, estudio hasta el sexto grado de primaria. Tiene un solo hijo que aun dependen de ella. Vive en la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento La Libertad – Perú.

El negocio al que se dedica es la compra y venta de animales menores tales como: chanchos, huachos, gallinas y cuyes los cuales después de engordarlos sacrifica para vender la carne. Así también vende grano de trigo y cebada, además compra cuajada y queso para volver a vender.

Por medio de un familiar pudo integrarse al Banco Comunal “Mujeres del Olivo” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compró un saco de grano de trigo, un saco de grano de cebada y animales menores. Con el préstamo de S/. 600.00 el cual cancelara en cuatro meses comprara 4 chanchos, gallinas y cuyes.

Su mayor sueño es tener una casa propia en la ciudad de Trujillo
loan_use: Purchase pigs, chickens and guinea pigs for resale.

description:
Mrs. Carmen Rosa G. M. is 32 years old, and only finished through primary school. She has two children, but only one depends on her. She lives in the small town of Cruz de Pargo in the Salpo district of the Otuzco province in La Libertad, Perú.

Mrs. Carmen Rosa has a small general store where she sells daily necessities. Also, she buys and sells small cheeses, which she distributes through Carabamba and to the settlers that pass through the area. She and her husband also grow potatoes, which they sell by the sack to people coming from Trujillo.

She was able to join the communal bank "Luchando por el Progreso" (Fighting for Progress) through a neighbor, where she received a previous loan for S/.1200 soles. This loan was very useful to her as she was able to invest it in her business, which has gone very well.

With this loan for $550, which she will repay in four months, she will buy 150 kg of cheeses, groceries and candies.

Her greatest dream is to expand her general store even further.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Carmen Rosa G. M. tiene 32 años de edad, estudio solo educación primaria. Tiene dos hijos en total pero solo uno aun depende de ella. Vive en el centro poblado menor Cruz de Pargo en el distrito de Salpo en la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento La Libertad – Perú. La señora Carmen Rosa tiene una pequeña bodega en la que vende productos de primera necesidad, además, se dedica a la compra y venta de quesillo el cual distribuye por Carabamba y a los pobladores que llegan por la zona. Junto con su esposo también se dedica a la siembra de papa, el cual vende por sacos a las personas que llegan de Trujillo. Por medio de una vecina pudo integrarse al Banco Comunal “Luchando por el Progreso” lugar donde le recibió un anterior préstamo de S/. 1200.00 el cual le fue de mucha utilidad ya que pudo invertirlo en su negocio el cual le ha ido muy bien. Con el préstamo de S/. 1500.00 el que cancelara en cuatro meses comprará 150 kilogramos de quesillo, abarrotes y golosinas. Su mayor sueño es implementar mas su bodega.
loan_use: Purchase more merchandise for her general store.

description:
Lisania Karm M. T. helps run a family carpentry business making custom furniture and doors in the city of Pucallpa, in the Ucayali region of Peru. Lisania does the majority of the buying and selling, while her husband is a skilled carpenter. They have invested in different woods, mainly capiona and cimilla.

Lisania is 24 years old with one child and is happily married. She loves working with her family, building relationships, and making deals with her clients. Lisania has experience selling clothing and chickens in the main market of Pucallpa. Her goals are to educate her children and continue to grow the business.

A member of the community bank Fray Martin, Lisania is requesting a loan of $725 to repay over four months. She will use the loan to purchase more wood and cover some operational expenses. She recognizes that purchasing modern tools would help the family business as well.
loan_use: To purchase more wood and cover some operational expenses

description:
Carmen is an older and experienced entrepreneur who lives in the Batey D. Palavé community of San Cristobal. Her five children are grown and are not living with her.

\r\nFrom her house, Carmen operates a small store, and she offers various products to the clientele, such as perfumes, deodorants, slippers, shirts, pants, beauty products and the like. Carmen explains that her business allows her maintain an adequate lifestyle and support her husband who cannot work anymore.

\r\nWith her loan, Carmen will buy more products to add to her stock in order to increase her sales volume and her income. The entrepreneur says it is important for her to continue doing her business, because she likes to feel independent and not to wait for money from her children or other people.
loan_use: To buy various products such as perfumes and beauty products for a small store.

description:
“Last year I was granted the house where I presently live with my family. I would like to start the construction of an additional room, as the space is very limited. I intend to make additions to the house, but it will have to be little by little, as I don’t have the required capital. I am requesting $ 1000 to build the additional room”.\r\n

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

\r\n“El año pasado me entregaron mi casa, donde vivo con mi familia, y me gustaría empezar con la construcción de un cuarto adicional, ya que los espacios son muy pequeños. Tengo pensado ampliarla más, pero tendrá que ser poco a poco ya que no tengo el capital completo. Solicito 1000 dólares para la construcción de un cuarto en mi vivienda.”
loan_use: Building of an additional room in the house.

description:
Rosa is a hard-working woman and a good mother. She has not always been dedicated to her business. She always considered herself a homemaker until four years ago when she needed to make her own income because she separated from her husband. As a result, although her husband continues to help her with housing expenses, when her youngest daughter finished high school and she decided to prepare herself to start university, Rosa decided to give her that opportunity. For this, she opened a small shop where she currently sells breakfasts and sometimes, if there’s demand, also lunches. Little by little, she has been growing her business despite the difficulties with the national economic situation. She dreams about a future when she can have a soda fountain.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa es una mujer muy trabajadora y buena madre. No siempre se ha dedicado a ocupar de su negocio. Ella se ha considerado siempre una ama de casa hasta hace cuatro años que tuvo la necesidad de contar con un ingreso económico propio. Ella esta separada con su esposo. Por eso, aunque él aún continúe ayudándola con el mantenimiento del hogar, cuando su menor hija termino el colegio y decidió prepararse para ingresar a una universidad, Rosa decidió darle aquella oportunidad. Fue así que abrió un pequeño local donde actualmente vende desayunos y a veces, según la demanda, también almuerzos. Poco a poco va creciendo en su negocio a pesar de las dificultades que atraviesa la situación económica nacional. Ella sueña en un futuro con tener una fuente de soda.
loan_use: Convert her shop into a soda fountain.

description:
Jroge is a very hard working individual, and he is married and has a son aged 3 years. When he was born he didn't have a steady job, and there was a great deal of economic uncertainty in his home, which is why he started his business 5 years ago. He purchase a car and since he didn't have s steady job he bought a taxi permit. Today he counts on this job and it provides his family with their needs.

He is requesting a loan of $1125 that he will repay in a term of 6 months to renovate his service station, so that he might provide better costomer service to his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Jorge es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor, esta casado y tiene un hijo de 3 años. Cuando nació su hijo el no tenia un trabajo estable, había mucha incertidumbre económica en su hogar por lo que hace 5 años empezó su negocio compro un carro, y al no tener un trabajo fijo compro unas placas para operarlo como taxi. Actualmente cuenta con una base de taxis y este trabajo le provee lo necesario para mantener a su familia.

El solicita un crédito por US $1,125 que pagara en 6 meses para remodelar su estación de servicio para mejor atención a sus clientes.
loan_use: To renovate his service station

description:
Maria Delfina is married and has two daughters, 11 and 15 years of age. She started the business because her salary was not enough. Then some acquaintances offer her the opportunity to sell shoes through catalogues and she liked the idea, because where she works they also sell, and she takes advantage to offer her merchandise. She started 3 years ago to sell shoes among her friends, and little by little she started selling more because at her day job she also has customers to whom she sells her merchandise. She has never been out of customers and her prices are accessible and she offers deferred payments. in fact, her daughters also help her sell among their friends and in this way she is able to increase her orders.

She requests a loan for US $475, which she will pay in 6 months, to buy merchandise and be able to cover pending orders because if she takes too long her customers may cancel their orders.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Maria defina es casada y tiene 2 hijas de 15 y 11 años. Inició el negocio porque con el sueldo que recibe del trabajo que tiene no le alcanza entonces unas conocidas le ofrecieron integrarse a vender calzado por catalogo y le gusto la idea, porque donde trabaja también venden y aprovecha para ofrecer su mercancía. Comenzó hace mas de 3 años a vender la mercancía del calzado entre sus amigas, y poco a poco fue vendiendo mas porque en el trabajo donde esta también tiene clientes y aprovecha para colocar su mercancía. Nunca le han faltado clientes y además los precios son accesibles y dan facilidades de pago. De hecho sus hijas también le ayudan a vender entre sus amigas y con eso logra incrementar sus pedidos.

Requiere un crédito por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y poder sacar los pedidos que tiene pendientes porque si se tarda en surtirlos le pueden cancelar el pedido los clientes.
loan_use: Buying merchandise (Comprar mercancia)

description:
María Bernalda is 45 years old, and she and her husband have two sons and one daughter, all of whom attend school. Her husband is an accountant and works for a private company. María Bernalda has been running a clothing store for 16 years. She says that her business helps her supplement the family's income, and she helps her husband support the children's studies. Bernalda also explains that through her business, she has been able to contribute to repairing her house.\r\n

With her loan, the entrepreneur will buy a large range of products to add to her stock. That way, she'll be able to increase her sales volume and thus her income.
loan_use: To supply a small clothing store

description:
Dia is a married woman with 3 children, ranging in age from 14 to 20 years old. Dia owns a small food vendor store which she started in 1988. Every day, she works from 6am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.\r\n

\r\nShe now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.
loan_use: To buy more food items for her business

description:
Rehema is widow with 2 children, ages 9 and 6 years old. She is a cloth seller who started her business in 2000. Every day, Rehema works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $170 from her sales.\r\n

\r\nShe now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business inventory.
loan_use: To buy more items for her business inventory

description:
Oksana, an entrepreneur from Vinogradovo, in western Ukraine, is the married mother of a two-year-old child. She has a small children’s clothing business, located in a large supermarket, which she has operated for three years, and currently makes around $300-$500 in profit per month. To encourage parents to have more children, the Ukrainian government has set up a financial incentive program where families are given support for each child from pre-birth to three years old. This program benefits entrepreneurs like Oksana who provide child-related products, as parents are able to spend more money caring for their children.

\r\n\r\nOksana has requested a loan to purchase new inventory for her store. This will help her to continue making a good profit and work towards her goal of expanding her business in the future.
loan_use: To purchase new inventory

description:
Juan Ramón T. is a 23-year-old enterprising young man, who is married and lives with his wife and parents. Juan works tailoring and silk-screening school and sports attire.

He opened his business in 2006, after gaining a great deal of experience thanks to the fact that he had been working for a company in this field for many years. Thanks to those years of apprenticeship and saving money, he now works for himself.

Juan says that at a young age, he started working to help his parents with the household expenses. Today, his entire family supports and helps him with the business. His parents are very proud of the great man that he has become, despite his young age. Juan would like to keep expanding his business. He plans to purchase an industrial sewing machine, which will allow him to increase production and fulfill his customers’ orders more speedily.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan Ramón T. es un joven emprendedor de 23 años, el esta casado, y vive con su señora en una casa junto con sus padres. Juan se dedica a la confección y serigrafía de atuendos deportivos y escolares.

Desde el año 2006, abrió su propio negocio luego de adquirir mucha experiencia gracias a que trabajo varios años en una empresa que se dedicaba a dicho ramo. Gracias a esos años de aprendizaje y ahorro el hoy día ya trabaja por su cuenta.

Juan dice que desde muy joven empezó a trabajar para ayudar a sus padres con los ingresos de la casa. Hoy toda su familia lo apoya y ayuda con el negocio, sus padres están muy orgullosos del gran hombre que es, a pesar de su corta edad. Juan desea seguir ampliando su negocio, y tiene pensado adquirir una maquina de coser industrial que le permitirá aumentar su producción y cumplir con los pedidos de todos sus clientes con mayor rapidez.
loan_use: Purchase of sewing machine

description:
Priscila is 55 years old and is a widow with three grown children, two boys and a girl, who are now independent. Her entire forty-year career has been spent building her own business. She learned from her parents when she was very young and, with the dream of getting a good job, moved to her country’s capital to find work and to study. However, she soon faced the sad reality that it wasn’t so easy and that there was a lot of competition and no shortage of employers waiting to take advantage of her. It was then that she decided to start her own business in market number four there in the capital and rented a stand where she could sell staple goods.

Later she married and returned to her hometown where she continued in the same business with much success. Today she has a general store where she sells staple goods and items for the home and her prosperous business continues to grow.

This loan will be used to buy sugar, pasta, baked goods, herbs, rice, fruits, vegetables, canned goods and items for the home.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Priscila tiene 55 años de edad, es viuda con tres hijos, dos varones y una mujer; todos ya mayores e independientes. Ella se dedica al comercio hace más de cuarenta años, toda una vida dedicada a esta actividad.

Este oficio lo aprendió de sus padres desde muy joven, y con el sueño de obtener un buen empleo se mudó a la capital, para poder trabajar y estudiar, sin embargo se encontró con la triste realidad de que no era fácil ya que había mucha competencia y no faltaban empleadores que querían aprovecharse de ella. Fue así que decidió emprender su propio negocio en el mercado cuatro de la capital, alquilando un puesto en donde vendía mercaderías de primera necesidad.

Luego se casó y regresó a su ciudad, en donde prosiguió en el mismo ramo con mucho éxito, hoy día tiene un prospero negocio que crece cada vez más, el mismo es un almacén en donde vende productos de primera necesidad para el hogar.

El préstamo lo utilizará para compra de azúcar, fideo, panificados, yerba ,arroz, frutas, verduras, productos enlatados, artículos para el hogar, etc.
loan_use: Purchase merchandise to sell including herbs, rice, fruits, vegetables, canned goods and items for the home.

description: Mr. Dy S., 61, and his wife, Ouk Chea, 60, are farmers in Thmor Village, Kampong Cham Province, where they grow mushrooms. They both earn about $10 per day and have five children, two married and three single. One is a grocer in Siem Reap, while another is a motorbike taxi driver. The other three children are students. \r\n\r\nMr. S. seeks a $1,100 loan to expand his mushroom growing business. He hopes this investment will improve his family’s financial stability and pay for his children’s education. S., Chea, and their child are shown in the photo.
loan_use: To expand his mushroom growing business

description:
Mrs. Chhem C. S. is a 40-year-old policewoman who supplements her income by selling beef tripe, earning about $5 per day. Her husband, Puon Ly, earns $5 per day as a taxi driver. They live with their three children in Baray Toch Village, Kampong Thom Province. \r\n\r\n

Mrs. S. requests a $500 loan to expand her beef tripe business. With the extra income, she hopes to further her children’s studies as well as improve her family’s financial stability. In the photo, the woman with black shirt is Mrs. Chhem C. S..
loan_use: To expand her beef tripe business

description:
Amina is 46 years old and is a married woman with 1 child, age 26 years old. Amina is a fish seller, and she started in 1984. Every day, she works from 5am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $30 from her sales.\r\n

\r\nShe now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business.
loan_use: To buy more fish for her business.

description:
Mwanahawa is 36 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 10, 7 and 4 years old. Mwanahawa is a alcohol retailer; she started in 2007. Every day she works from 6am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.\r\n

\r\nIn the past, Mwanahawa has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.
loan_use: To buy more items for her business.

description:
Radhia is 27 years old and is a married woman with 1 child, age 4 years old. Radhia is a soft drink seller and she started in 2006. Everyday, she works from 9am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.\r\n

\r\nShe now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mwanaheri, who has business dealings in used clothes sales.
loan_use: To buy more items for her business.

description: Toyin A. is married with 3 children.  She is 48years of age and hails from Ijaniki, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells cooked food and drinks, a trade that she acquired for 2 years. She has been in this business since 1988 and has been with LAPO Microfinance for 4 years. She needs the sum of $1200 to enable her to buy more food items and drinks for sale. With this she will be able to make more profit.
loan_use: To buy more drinks and food items

description: Bola I. is 40 years of age, married with 4 children, and hails from Okoko Lagos State Nigeria. Bola has been selling kerosene for 1 year. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 3 years and has been in her business for the past 7 years. Bola is requesting a loan of $1200 to enable her buy more kerosene for sale. This will enable her to earn more income.
loan_use: To buy more kerosene for sale.

description: Mrs. Sang L., age 53, has seven children and lives in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. Her husband, Mr. Kong Ven, 40, is a logger and earns about $5 a day. One of their children is married and lives away from home, and another works as a waitress in a restaurant in Siem Reap, where she earns around $100 a month. Their five other children are all students. This couple has applied for a loan to buy a plot of farmland, on which they will grow a variety of vegetables. By doing this, they will increase their income and provide better support to their family.
loan_use: To buy land on which to grow vegetables.

description:
Sophia is 23 years old and is a married woman with one child, age 3 months. She and her husband also take care of one other person, age 17 years old. Sophia is a tailor and she started her business in 2005. Everyday she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.\r\n

\r\nShe now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.
loan_use: To buy more items for her business.

description:
Mrs. Thy C. and her husband, Mr. Phoung Ya, married in 1972. They have six children; two sons and four daughters. All of their children are employed full time. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Thy has been a weaver for over one year. It’s a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished product to a middleman in the village who then sells it in Phnom Penh. Besides weaving, she buys recycled materials in her village to resell. She started this business two years ago. Her husband raises cows.

Thy is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase materials for silk weaving and buy recycled materials to resell.
loan_use: to purchase materials for silk weaving and buy recycling materials to resell

description:
Mrs. Saroeun C. (pictured with her daughter) is a widow with six children; two sons and four daughters. Both of her sons are married and live outside the family home. Three of her daughters work in a garment factory and other one weaves silk at home. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Saroeun has been a weaver since 1965. It’s skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished product to a middle man in the village who then sells it in Phnom Penh. 
Mrs. Saroeun is requesting a loan of $300 to repair some parts of her house.
loan_use: to repair some parts of her house

description:
I am Rabia B. and I have five kids: two boys and three girls. I reside with my family in Borewala, Pakistan. My elder kids could not finish school because of our poor economic condition, but now we are better off and have enrolled all three of our girls in school. I have been sewing clothes on order since my teens. One of my sons works at a local food market. He sells fruits there. We need a loan so that he can purchase fruits and vegetables in bulk, so that our income can increase. \r\n

\r\nThe following are my group members with their businesses: Nazira B. is borrowing for her milk business; Khursheed B. needs to expand her wood business; and Sajida B. wants to buy a sewing machine. Please help all of us by lending us the loan as quickly as possible. We shall never forget your assistance.
loan_use: To expand the fruits and vegetables business and to fund the other businesses

description: Patience S. is a typical business woman who is married with 3 children. At 32 years of age, she has the vigor and determination to expand and diversify into a new business that is related to her existing business i.e. sale of food stuffs. She hails from Okoko Lagos State Nigeria. Patience sells provisions and drinks and has been in her business since 2001. She requests a loan of $450 to enable her to buy more provisions and drinks. She intends on adding to her business with the sale of foodstuffs. This will be made possible on the receipt of Kiva loan. She thanks you.
loan_use: To buy more drinks and provisions for sale.

description:
Mr. Pablo Emilio M. N. is the man wearing a red shirt and blue cap. He is a 63-year-old man from the city of Bluefields. He is married to Mrs. Virginia López, with whom his has 3 adult kids who have received an education thanks to the income generated from Mr. M.’s business. He has been a photographer for over 45 years. His customers are people of all ages who prefer him because he gives specialized in-home services. He currently needs to buy 30 boxes of Polaroid film—at $16.00 per box—and 65 rolls of film—at $6.00 per roll. With this investment, he will be able to meet his customers’ demands. \r\n

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

\r\nEl Sr. Pablo Emilio M. N. es el que se encuentra vestido con camisa roja y gorra azul, es originario de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 63 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Virginia López ambos tienen 3 hijos mayores de edad, que han obtenido sus estudios por el ingreso del negocio del Sr. M. quien tiene más de 45 años de ser fotógrafo, sus clientes son hombres y mujeres de todas las edades que lo prefieren por brindar servicio especializado y a domicilio, en estos momentos necesita comprar 30 cajas de polaroid a $16.00 dólares cada caja y 65 rollo películas a $6.00 dólares cada rollo con esta inversión podrá satisfacer sus demandas.
loan_use: Purchase 30 boxes of Polaroid film and 65 rolls of film

description:
Seng M., age 50, is a mother of six children and has resided in Phnom Penh over 30 years. To raise the family’s income, she works growing rice and raising fish to earn approximately $1 a day. Her husband, Ouy Mao, age 54, works as farmer growing rice. Normally, he makes $5 a day in revenue. Two of their children are employed by a garment factory with a salary $70 each per month and the rest are students and farmers. \r\n\r\n

To help with their farm, this couple would like to request a loan from Kiva to purchase a harvest machine. This will be used to hire to the local people to gain more profit for the family.
loan_use: To purchase a harvest machine.

description: Jaweed lives in District 11 of Kabul Afghanistan with his wife and son. He has a car parts shop in a busy area of the city, and in order to better serve his customers and expand his business, he is requesting a loan to import additional parts.  With the increased income, Jaweed will be better able to support his family.  He thanks all for their support.
loan_use: To import more auto parts

description:
B. Elizabeth is a trader who sells clothing materials. She is married and has 2 children. She is working very hard to support the family. She wishes to increase sales, but lacks funding to do so.\r\n

\r\nShe is asking for $425 as an additional capital to buy more goods for sale.
loan_use: As an additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

description:
Constantina is 31-years-old, originally from Inhambane Province. She married in 2001, had a daughter in 2002 and in 2006 got divorced. In addition to supporting her 6-year-old child that goes to school (currently at 1st grade), Constantina also supports her two younger brothers that are studying (the oldest in 12th grade and the youngest in 7th grade).

Constantina studied until 6th grade in Inhambane, but due to her family’s financial difficulties, she had to stop school and work. She got a job as an assistant at the district’s educational administration. She started cleaning the offices and helping carrying documents around. She was promoted to administrative assistant and started to work only with clients and documents, filling out requests and other things. Currently she has a monthly salary of MTn 1,700 (around US$70), plus a house that was given to her to live, just adjacent to the administration office. She plans to go back to school one day so that she can finish 10th grade and be promoted again.

This will be Constantina’s second loan with Hluvuku. Constantina used the first loan of MTn 5,000 to buy construction material and start building her house. She is very conscious that if she gets fired she won’t have a place to live. This second loan of MTn 9,000 will still be used to buy more construction materials. Initially the house will have 2 bedrooms, a living room and bathroom. With a third loan, Constantina believes she will be able to buy all the roofing and move in. In the future, she would like more loans to furnish the house and expand to a 3-bedroom house.
loan_use: Buy construction material

description:
Juana has been a member of the Communal Bank “Love and Truth” for 10 years.

Juana is 47 years old. She is married with 9 children, and 5 of them live with her. Juana travels to different fairs in the region three times a week to buy pigs and sheep, which she then raises for butchering. Later, she sells the meat at wholesale in the Santa Clara market and she also sells it from house to house.

Juana needs a loan of 2000 soles (approximately $737.00 US). This money will be invested in the purchase of cattle, goats, and pigs.

Juana’s dreams are for her children to become professionals, to build another house, and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Gearhart and Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteers.

Juana pertenece al Banco Comunal Amor y Verdad hace 10 años.

Juana es casada, tiene 47 años y 9 hijos de los cuales 5 viven con ella, Juana viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región 3 veces por semana donde compra cerdos, carnero y luego lo beneficia, la venta de la carne lo realiza al por mayor en el mercado Santa Clara y también de casa en casa.

Juana necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado vacuno, caprino y porcino.

Los sueños de Juana son que sus hijos sean profesionales, construir otra casa y que su negocio mejore.
loan_use: Juana needs a loan of 2000 soles (approximately $737.00 US).  This money will be invested in the purchase of cattle, goats, and pigs.

description: Pon T. is 40 years old and has been working since 1990 as a collector of recyclable items. She makes her living by reselling these bottles, cans, and other such recyclables bringing in roughly US $1 per day. Her husband shares in this family business making US $1 per day as well. They have four children, one of whom works as a local tailor making about US $189 per month. She wants to use her loan to buy a greater quantity of recyclable items. Her hope is to be able to someday soon afford a motorbike on which to transport her purchased goods and make her business more efficient.
loan_use: To purchase recyclable items

description:
Moli is 34 years old and is divorced with 2 children, ages 13 and 7 years old. Moli has been selling fish since 2006. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.\r\n

Moli now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have small businesses.The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.
loan_use: To buy more fish for her business.
borrower_names: Sada, Mtumwa, Aziza, Tatu, Moli, Zuwena
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true

description: Mrs. Try M., age 42, is married with six children and resides in Kampong Cham province with her husband of many years. She and her husband, Ek Sam Eoeun, 44, work to raise the family’s income by making cutting boards and selling them to the market to earn approximately $2.5 of profit per day. One child is a construction worker building a house and makes about $2 a day.\r\nThis couple would like to request a loan from Kiva to purchase cashew nuts to stock and resell for profit.
loan_use: To purchase cashew nuts to stock

description: Bou S. is 50 years old and owns a small farm in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband have grown vegetables to sell in the market since 1980. They support themselves and their only child on a combined daily income of US $3. Their daughter also works at a local garment factory making US $50 per month. They want to invest in an additional plot of farmland on which to grow vegetables, which will bring them greater financial security.
loan_use: To buy farmland

description:
Fatma S. is 35 years old and is divorced woman with 3 children, ages 12,8 and 2 years old. Fatma S. conduct a small business of making and selling chapatis, she started in 2007. Everyday, she works from 6am to 6pm at her chapati business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.\r\n
