\r\nFatma now hopes for a loan to buy more food items to make more chapatis for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Fatma Y.. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other member is responsible.
loan_use: To buy more food items to make chapatis

description: Im M. is 44 years of age and has been farming rice since 1998. She makes approximately US $1.60 per day. Her husband raises pigs earning US $1 daily. They have had seven children together, only one of whom is married. One of the older children helps the family by collecting juice from sugar palm trees to be refined into local wine. He adds US $2 per day to the family income. Two others help their father with the pigs. With her loan, Im M. hopes to buy more pigs for her husband to breed. She also wants to invest in a small grinding mill for food production that she can also rent out to her neighbors.
loan_use: To buy pigs and a grinding mill

description:
Asha is 35 years old and is a married woman with 4 children, ages 12-20 years old. Asha has a small business. She started in 2004. Every day, she works from 8am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.\r\n

\r\nShe now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Viwe, who has a small business.
loan_use: To buy more items for her business.

description:
Fatuma, age 51, is married and has four children, ages 21, 19, 17 and 4 . For the past six years, she has made a living selling cosmetics and food. She works from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily, and makes a monthly profit of around $26.

In the past, Fatuma took out two loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to start her businesses. Now she has applied for a new loan to increase her capital and expand these businesses. Fatuma will share this loan with the Chimbuko group, which has 15 members. These members will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans. They run a variety of businesses which sell food, soft drinks and beer, oil, clothing, charcoal and other items.

In the picture, Fatuma is second from the left in a blue dress.
loan_use: To buy more food items and cosmetics
borrower_names: Salma, Mwanamboga, Happines, Hamis, Sophia, Mariam, Mwamvita, Salma, Fatuma, Mohamedi, Mbeyu, Monica, Severin, Aisha, Zubeda
borrower_genders: female, male, female, male, female, female, female, female, female, male, male, female, male, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, false, false, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description: Mrs. Salamotu M. has been a faithful client of LAPO Microfinance for the past 4 years. She is 36 years old and has 3 children. She sells groceries in cartons (wholesale). She hails from Ajambgadi, Lagos State, Nigeria and has being in business since 1999. She needs a loan of $875 to buy more groceries to sell.
loan_use: To buy more provision for sale.

description:
Ahazi, age 64, is married and has 11 children. He started a furniture business in 1978, and works there from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. daily. From this business, he makes about $480 a month.\r\n

\r\nIn the past, Ahazi used a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to expand his business. Having successfully paid back this loan, he has applied for a new one to continue this expansion. He will share this loan with his group, whose members are in the chicken- and charcoal-selling businesses.
loan_use: To buy more stock for his furniture business
borrower_names: Sarah, Ahazi, Christina, Meena, Grace, Tyness
borrower_genders: female, male, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true

description: Zoraida was born in 1953 and she is married. Her husband has a full-time job and his monthly income is KM 1500, 00. This is the first time they have taken a loan. The amount of the current loan is KM 1200, 00. Zoraida wants to use it to buy chicken and turkey, in order to improve her business and allow her to sell poultry at the market.
loan_use: For buying chicken and turkey.

description: The experience of Genoveva's husband in putting together fireworks shows, motivated her to start promoting his business. Now she helps with each of his contracts and also contributes in the production and final arrangements of each show, including security to avoid any accidents. These fireworks shows are very popular in every village of their city. That's why Genoveva, with her excellent administrative skills, would like to grow the business and prepare for the requests from their clients who are getting ready for the festivals they will celebrate in this beautiful Peruvian valley. La experiencia del esposo de Genoveva, para fabricar espectáculos pirotécnicos han conducido a esta trabajadora madre ha introducirse y ser un especie de promotora de la labor de su querido esposo, ella asesora cada uno de sus contratos y también contribuye con la fabricación y arreglos finales de cada uno de los castillos que llevan a cabo, también está pendiente de las normas de seguridad y trata de supervisar a diario el cumplimiento de lo pactad a fin de evitar accidentes,Estos espectáculos son muy vistosos y agradables y no faltan en las actividades de cada pueblito de su ciudad, ella como excelente administradora desea incrementar su capital de trabajo a fin de prepararse con antelación a las solicitudes de sus exigentes clientes que están próximos a hacer las peticiones por las fechas festivas que celebrarán en este hermoso valle del Perú.
loan_use: TO PURCHASE THE SUPPLIES THEY WILL NEED FOR THEIR FIREWORKS SHOWS,  PREPARING IN ADVANCE FOR THE UPCOMING FESTIVALS.

description:
Juan de Dios is a very responsible man, and when he was only 19 he had the great responsibility of becoming a father. Now he is 31 he has 3 kids who he adores, and they help him to carry on going as a farmer. Along with farming, Juan and his lovely wife Antonia work in agriculture, which is an activity they know a lot about and have a lot of experience in. Due to this fact they are very happy with the results of this business. Thinking about their good calves, Juan would like to buy some roughage to give them better nutrition, and therefore increase the productivity of their milk. This would give him income enough to cover their most urgent needs. With your contribution you will help Juan and his family’s projects.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Juan de Dios es un hombre muy responsable, a la edad de 19 años asumió la gran responsabilidad de ser padre, actualmente a sus 31 años ya alberga a 3 inquietos niños quienes son su mayor adoración y el motor que lo impulsa a seguir adelante perseverando con su noble labor de ganadero.Adicionalmente a la producción de ganado don Juan y su querida esposa Antonia se dedican a la agricultura, actividades que con su amplio conocimiento y experiencia vienen desenvolviéndose eficientemente y se sienten muy contentos y satisfechos por los resultados que han ido obteniendo.Pensando en sus generosas becerritas don Juan tiene pensado comprar forraje para mejorar la alimentación de sus animalitos y por ende mejorará la producción y productividad de leche, ingresos con el que también cubrirán sus necesidades más urgentes. Con vuestra contribución permitirás concretar los proyectos de don Juan y su querida familia.
loan_use: To buy balanced foods to better nourish his cows/Compra de alimento balanceado y forraje para mejorar la nutrición de sus vaquitas.

description:
Nagina J., who comes from the small town of Raiwind, Pakistan, is married with two children: one girl and one boy. Both of her children attend a local school and she hopes that they will be able to do well so that they can find successful jobs in the future. Nagina’s husband, who is a rickshaw driver, had an accident with his rickshaw, and now they are in need of a loan to get it fixed. \r\n

\r\nThere are several other women in her loan group including: Rubina B., who wants to invest in her wheat business; Ramzana B., who wants to expand her wood business; Parween N., who wants to get her rickshaw fixed and Rehana B., who will buy a donkey cart.
loan_use: Fix a rickshaw

description:
I Nengah Sedra is a diligent and tenacious farmer, who strives to meet his family’s needs. His wife does not work, and thus, he carries the burden alone through his farming income to meet his family’s needs. I Nengah Sedra works on a 1-hectare farm owned by his parents. His family’s daily expense is quite expensive especially since his children are still in school. His harvests are sometimes not maximized because his cultivation method and seeds are not the best. Better farming equipment, seeds and supporting materials require a larger capital, which he didn’t have. I Nengah Sedra is relieved that DINARI is helping him get a loan he needs to improve his farming. This loan will be used to buy superior seeds, organic fertilizers and pesticides. I Nengah Sedra rents a tractor to till his farm because he doesn’t have an ox to do the job. I Nengah Sedra is waiting for his next harvest, which he hopes to yield better results from his previous harvests. He will use his farming income to support his children’s educational needs, and if there is still some money left, he really hopes to fix his unfinished house.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

I Nengah Sedra seorang petani yang sangat rajin dan ulet, semua dilakukan supaya ekonomi keluarga bisa tercukupi. Apalagi istrinya tidak mempunyai penghasilan tambahan sebagai pendukung keuangan keluarga. I Nengah Sedra hanya mengandalkan penghasilan dari pertanian untuk mencukupi kebutuhan keluarga. Sawah yang dikerjakan seluas 1 hektar dan itu pun masih menjadi milik orang tuanya. Biaya yang dikeluarkan setiap hari cukup besar apalagi anak-anaknya masih duduk dibangku sekolah. Sedangkan dari hasil panen yang diperoleh tidaklah maksimal karena dalam pengolahan tanah maupun pembibitan dan pemeliharaan tidak bisa dilakukan dengan maksimal,ini semua karena terbentur dengan modal. Tetapi sekarang I Nengah Sedra sudah merasa lega karena adanya pinjaman dari Yayasan Dinari untuk menunjang usahanya dibidang pertanian. Modal tersebut dipergunakan untuk membeli bibit unggul,pupuk organik dan juga obat pestisida. Pengolahan tanah dilakukan dengan menyewa traktor, karena I Nengah Sedra tidak mempunyai sapi untuk membajak. Kini I Nengah Sedra sedang menunggu panen tiba, ia sangat berharap panen kali ini berhasil dan mendapat keuntungan yang meningkat dari panen sebelumnya. Keuntungan ini nantinya akan dipergunakan untuk menunjang pendidikan anak-anaknya dan apabila ada sisa I Nengah Sedra ingin sekali bisa memperbaiki rumahnya yang belum selesai dibangun.
loan_use: To buy quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

description:
Mrs. Horn S. is a clothing seller and lives in Roteang Village in Kandal Province. She is 58 years old and is married with eight children. Three of the children are working and two others are enrolled in school; the others are too young to study or work. Her husband, Mr. Toun Teoun, who is on the left in the photo, is a farmer and can generate a small income.

\r\nMrs. Horn S. usually faces a problem during the rainy season because no customers come to buy her products. The family typically spends money on vegetable seeds, as well as on Mrs. Horn S.’s business and everyday family expenses. In order to expand her business, she now wants to apply for a loan to buy more clothes to sell in the village.
loan_use: To buy more clothes to sell

description:
Tania belongs to the communal bank Ricardo Palma, located at Jr. Las Gaviotas Mz 44 Lt. 6, in the Yarina Cocha District in the region of Ucayali. She is 30 years old and is a mother of 3 children. Her husband works at a company. With her first loan of 300 Peruvian Nuevos Soles from the Manuela Ramos organization she decided to invest in a retail business.

Currently she sells phone cards. In the mornings she takes care of her children and works selling her cards and in the evenings she studys.

With this loan of 1,300 Nuevos Soles, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy cards for prepaid cell phones using Movistar for long distance and local calls.

Tania is a very selfless mother that studies in order to be able to offer better opportunities to her children. With the loans she has received, she can contribute to the household earnings and feel more independent.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Tania pertenece al Banco Comunal Ricardo Palma, ubicado en el Jr. Las Gaviotas Mz 44 Lt. 6, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 30 años es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo trabaja en una compañía. Tania con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en la venta de mercadería.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de tarjetas telefónicas, en las mañanas se ocupa de sus hijos y se dirige a vender sus tarjetas, y por las noches estudia.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,300, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará tarjetas para celulares claro, movistar, para larga distancia, local.

Tania es una madre muy abnegada estudia para poder brindarles mejores oportunidades a sus hijos con los prestamos recibidos, puede contribuir a la economía de su hogar y sentirme mas independiente.
loan_use: Buying phone cards for celular phone in order to sell

description:
For these 6 women of Taga A on the island of Savaii, these are their first loans from SPBD. They all undertook 4 weeks of training on managing a business, maintained a savings account, and then passed a written test on the SPBD principles: business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee. Over the next 52 weeks, they will support each other in their individual business development and to guarantee on-time payments.

Elise T. (32, married, 1 child), Loluama F. (22, married, no children), Sina A. (58, married, 7 children) and Lagomau N. (34, married, 5 children) all sell taro, yams, and bananas--staples of the Samoan diet--at the market. With their loans, they wish to purchase a weed killer, knives, shovels, seeds, an axe, and other equipment for farming.

Olepa V. (25, married, 3 children) is also in the farming business, but she has a different product line than the other women. She sells tomatoes, cucumbers, cabbages, sugar cane, and tauaga (used to squeeze coconuts for the juice). With her loan, she will purchase onions, sugar, carrots, potatoes, salt, and noodles.

Sina L. (33, married, 3 children) is requesting a loan in order to help her husband, a taxi driver for over 5 years, maintain his taxi. She is requesting money to purchase 4 tires and taxi parts.
loan_use: Purchase various farming tools for plantation farming
borrower_names: Loluama, Olepa, Sina, Sina, Lagomau, Elise
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Mrs. Chanroeun S. and her husband married in 1998. They have two sons and one daughter. One of her sons is in school and the other two stay at home. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River about twelve kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Chanroeun has been selling groceries for 18 years. It’s a business skill she had learned from her mother. She buys grocery items from a market in Phnom Penh then sells them at her store in the village. Her husband is a wooden house constructor.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $1000 to purchase grocery items for resale.
loan_use: To purchase grocery items for resale.

description: Veronica is 21 years old and is a single woman.  She works as a  cloth seller through a business she started in 2007. Everyday, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $170 from her sales.  She now hopes for a loan of $275 to buy more cloth for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Bahati, who also has  business dealing in cloth sales.
loan_use: To buy more cloth for her business.

description: Zakati is a married woman with four children.  Zakati also owns a small domestics shop, which she started in 1996. Everyday, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.  She now hopes for a loan of $150 to buy more household items for her business.
loan_use: To buy more household items for her business.

description:
Gifty is forty two years old and the mother of three children, who are all currently in school. She has sold second (used) clothing for the past five years. Gifty buys her clothes from Accra and resells them in her community. She wants to use her loan to buy more bails of used clothing from Accra.\r\n

She is a member of the group called “Awurade Aye” (meaning God has done it). Members agree in principle to guarantee for each other as social collateral in repaying the loan.
loan_use: GIfty would like to buy more bails of second hand clothes to resell.

description:
Ana Isabel P. P., a member of the communal bank “Alonso Ugarte”, lives in the region and province of San Martín, located in the district de Tarapoto. She runs her business out of her home, which is located at 239 Jirón Alfonso Ugarte. She sells snack foods, treats and soft drinks. She also sells different types of meats, like sausage and jerky, in the Market #2 of her city.

She began her business by selling sausages with her aunt in the Market #2 in a small stand. Little by little, her sales have increased and her client base has grown. Now she has expanded her business and she works independently. Also, she began selling soft drinks, treats and snack foods out of her own home. She is very happy with what she has accomplished and she wants to continue to be successful so that she can give her children the best future possible.

With a loan on 3,000 Soles, which she will repay in 6 payments, she will buy pigs to raise for the preparation of her products. She will also purchase soft drinks, and mineral water in bulk, various types of cookies and different types of sweets to sell.

She is 28 years and has two small children. She is a very responsible and hard-working woman. Her desire to get ahead and to help her husband in raising their children has motivated her to become a small business owner. In the future she hope to start a restaurant that sells Creole and International food.

Translated from Spanish by Edith of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Ana Isabel P. P., es socia del Banco Comunal “Alfonso Ugarte”, vive en la Región y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa situado en el Jirón Alfonso Ugarte Nº 239, tiene venta de golosinas, bebidas gasificadas y en mercado Nº 2 de la misma ciudad vende cecina, chorizo y relleno de cerdo.

Se inicio vendiendo rellenos en el mercado N° 2, en un pequeño puesto de ventas junto a su tía y poco a poco fueron creciendo las ventas y el reconocimiento, ahora amplio su negocio a la venta de cecina y chorizo de cerdo y lo hace sola, además implemento la venta de golosinas y bebidas gasificadas en su propia casa y se siente bien, contenta de lo que ha logrado y sigue logrando para dar a sus hijos un mejor futuro.

Con el préstamo de S/. 3000.00 el cual será pagado en 6 cuotas, comprará cerdos para la preparación de sus productos, también bebidas gasificadas en paquetes, agua mineral en paquetes, galletas variados sabores en paquetes, y golosinas diversas.

Ella tiene 28 años de edad, con dos hijos pequeños, es una mujer muy responsable, decidida, sus deseos de salir adelante y apoyar a su esposo en la educación de sus hijos la han impulsado a desarrollarse como pequeña empresaria, posteriormente piensa poner un restaurante de comida criolla e internacional.
loan_use: Pigs to raise for the preparation of her products.

description:
Aisha is 20 years old and is single with 1 child, age 4. Aisha owns a small food vending store, which she started in 2006. Every day she works from 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.\r\n

\r\nShe now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.
loan_use: To buy more food items for her business

description: Dženita is a 26-year-old woman and she is not married. She works and her monthly income is 320 KM (about US$ 250).  This is her first loan in the amount of US$ 975 and Dženita will use it to buy more inventory items for her shop of mixed goods. She wants to improve her available selection of goods in order to increase her monthly income.
loan_use: For supplies for her shop

description:
Mwanahawa is 31 years old and is married with 1 child, age 7. Mwanahawa owns a small food vending store, and she is a cloth seller, which she started in 2005. Every day she works from 7:00 AM to 8:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.\r\n

\r\nShe now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Elizabeth, who has a business dealing in fish sales.
loan_use: To buy more food items for her business

description:
Olga is 33 years of age and has been selling clothing in a small business space in her home for 4 years. At times, she goes out to sell her products in nearby communities. She buys her merchandise in La Mesilla, Guatemala. She supports her son with the profits earned from her business. She would like to invest the loan in purchasing merchandise and avoid the expense of having to travel to La Mesilla. The other members of the group are: Bertha H. A., who sells foodstuff from home (she was not able to come to the meeting because she is ill); Sulama H. N., Natividad G. G., and Ana Maria G. G., who sell cut-up chicken; and Ofelia G. V., who sells foodstuff.\r\n

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

\r\nOLGA, TIENE 33 AÑOS DE EDAD, DESDE HACE 4 AÑOS SE DEDICA A VENDER ROPA EN UN PEQUEÑO LOCAL QUE TIENE EN CASA, EN OCASIONES SALE A OFRESER SU MERCANCIA A COMUNIDADES CERCANAS, SU MERCANCIA LA VA A COMPRAR A LA MESILLA EN GUATEMALA, CON LOS INGRESOS MANTIENE A SU HIJO, CON EL CREDITO QUIERE INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MERCANCIA Y EVITAR EL GASTO QUE GENERA VIAJAR A LA MESILLA. LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON: BERTHA H. A. VENDE ABARROTES EN SU CASA NO PUDO LLEGAR A LA REUNION POR QUE ESTA EMFERMA, SULAMA H. N., NATIVIDAD G. G., ANA MARIA G. G. VENDEN POLLO TROZADO Y OFELIA G. V. VENDE ABARROTES.
loan_use: Purchase merchandise
borrower_names: Natividad, Ofelia, Ana Maria, Olga, Sulama, Bertha
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Mrs. Lili C. D. V. belongs to the group Mientras Tanto "La Union Hace la Fuerza" lives in the San Martin Region, San Martin Province, Tarapoto district. She resides in the Jr. Manco Inca #234 and her business is located outsiD. D. main doors of the Central Cementery of this city. She is dedicated to sell drinks and beverages. The opportunity of a loan in Manuela Ramos will allow her to offer a greater quantity and more varieties of drinks and beverages, improve her stand, and also will allow her to finish the construction of her house since the preparation of her products doesn't need too much capital.

Her children help in the business as well as preparing the products and with customer service. With the 1,000 soles (Peruvian currency) loan that she will pay back in 6 months, Mrs. C. will buy a new, bigger umbrella, new pails and also some construction materials. She is 56 years aold, lives with her 3 sons, who help her in the business. Her children are her greatest strength to keep going. Her wish is to see them as professionals with careers.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Lili Córdova D. V. pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto “La Unión Hace la Fuerza” vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia D. San Martín, distrito D. Tarapoto, su domicilio está ubicado en el Jr. Manco Inca Nº 234 ,su negocio esta ubicado en las afueras D. la puerta principal del Cementerio Central D. esta ciudad, se dedica a la venta D. refrescos. La oportunidad D. un préstamo en Manuela Ramos le permite ofrecer en mayor cantidad y más variedad D. refrescos, mejorar su puesto D. venta, además le está permitiendo terminar la construcción D. su casa ya que para la preparación D. su producto no necesita más inversión. En el negocio la ayudan sus hijos tanto en la preparación como en la atención al cliente. Con el crédito por S/. 1,000.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará una nueva sombrilla, baldes nuevos y además algunos materiales D. construcción. La señora Lili tiene 56 años, vive con sus 3 hijos, quienes la ayudan en el negocio , sus hijos son su mayor fuerza para salir adelante, su deseo es verlos profesionales.
loan_use: Buying a big umbrella, pails and other things for her business.

description:
Magaly works daily in a small sales space from which she offers excellent fruits from all parts of the country. Given that she is the only person to offer this wide variety of products, she encounters a demanding range of clients and has decided to make improvements to her workspace with the goal of improving the quality of her service and her product display.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson Kiva volunteer.

La señora Magaly, se desempeña a diario en un pequeño espacio de ventas en el que oferta día a día excelentes frutas de todas partes de su país, debido a que es la única persona que ofrece estos productos y con gran variedad cuenta con una exigente gama de clientes y ha decidido mejorar las instalaciones de su espacio de desempeño diario a fin de mejorar la calidad de su servicio y la exhibición de sus productos.
loan_use: To improve workspace conditions

description:
Sara is 50 years old and is married with 5 children, ages 7 to 18 years old. She and her husband also take care of two other children. Sara owns a small animal stock, a business she started in 1998. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.\r\n

\r\nShe now hopes for a loan to buy more animals to increase her stock. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Elizabeth, Zabira, Pudensia, and Monica, who have businesses dealing in fruits sales.
loan_use: To buy more animals to increase her stock.

description:
Kumrihon Abdumalikovna H. lives in the region of Vahdat. She is 38 years old, married and has five children. She has secondary education and has been selling women's and children's clothing on the local Vahdat market for the past 15 years. Kumrihon's husband is currently unemployed and this is why the retail business is the only source of income for her big family. Three of her children go to school. Kumrihon wants to purchase seasonal clothing and she needs the money so she decided to apply for a loan. By receiving a loan she will be able to fully support her family and satisfy the needs of the residents with quality merchandise. She plans to pay off the loan within 6 months.\r\n

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

\r\nХоликова Кумрихон Абдумаликовна жительница района Вахдат.Ей 38 лет .Кумрихон замужем, имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее .Клиентка уже 15 лет торгует на местном рынке города Вахдат женской и детской одеждой. Муж Кумрихон временно не работает.Поэтому торговля является единственным источником ее большой семьи.Трое детей Кумрихон ходят в среднюю школу. Клиентка хочет закупить новую сезонную одежду. Для этого ей нужны денежные средства и она решила получить кредит. Получив кредит, она сможет лучше содержать свою семью и удовлетворить потребности местного населения качественным товаром. Планирует погасить кредит в течении 6 месяцев.
loan_use: To increase the variety of merchandise

description: Mrs. Hib L. makes about $4.50 per day selling clothes at the market. L. has been selling for eleven years. Her husband, Mr. Tan Than, is a 55-year-old who makes $3.30 per day sewing clothes. L. and Than live with one child in Chykreng District, Siem Reap Province. L. and Than are requesting a loan of $ 1,100 to purchase more clothes to sell. By using this loan L. can improve her business and increase her famiL.’s income.
loan_use: To purchase more clothes to sell

description: Mr. F. is 53 years old. He has 5 children. He works and lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Tyre. Youssef sells livestock. This is the second time he has applied for a loan through kiva. He wants to buy a cow to sustain and develop his business.
loan_use: to buy a cow

description:
Meth K. is a 60-year-old widow with five children who lives in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer and makes about $1 a day. One of her children is married and lives away from home, two have opened a small shop Phnom Penh city where they earn about $5 a day selling food, and two others are farmers.\r\n

\r\nThe business in Phnom Penh city is doing very well, which is why Meth K. has applied to Kiva for a loan to buy more chairs, tables and other supplies. This will allow the family to expand the business and earn more income.
loan_use: To expand her business by buying more chairs, tables and other supplies.

description:
Asha is 28 years old and is married with one child, age 10. Asha has been selling bed sheets since 2004. She works from 7am to 7pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.\r\n

\r\nIn the past, Asha has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania. She now hopes for a loan to buy more bed sheets to expand her business.
loan_use: To buy more bed sheets for her business.

description:
Rosa Alpina’s business is the sale of prepared meals (fritanga) from her home in the municipality of Somotillo in Chinandega. She puts great effort into her business and is open in the evenings, when she sells her delicious dishes to the general public who visits her.

Rosa is a married mother and has the advantage of having her daughters support her in the business. However, the necessity she is facing is the urgency to purchase prime materials for the creation of her meals. For this reason, she has turned to Ceprodel to obtain a loan that will enable the purchase of the necessary ingredients to make her dishes. Curently, she is a loyal customer of Ceprodel and for that reason, she is confident that she will receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio al que se dedica la señora Rosa Alpina es a la elaboración y venta de comida (fritanga) en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Somotillo de Chinandega. Se dedica a este negocio con mucho esfuerzo teniendo su horario de atención por las noches donde vende sus deliciosos platillos al público en general que le visita.

Rosa es una madre casada y posee la ventaja de que sus hijas le apoyan en el negocio, sin embargo la necesidad atravesada por ella es la urgencia de la compra de la materia prima para elaborar los alimentos. Por ello ha buscado apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita la compra de los ingredientes para elaborar los platillos. Actualmente es fiel cliente de Ceprodel y por ello es que confía que su crédito sea otorgado.
loan_use: Purchase the necessary ingredients to make her dishes.

description: Saima B. is from Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. She is married.  Her husband runs a small restaurant where he bakes and sells wheat chapattis. She stays at home and make ice cream sticks. She lives in a family house with her in-laws. Her loan group consists of: Nasreen B. (who will invest in her family’s fruits business), Zubaida B. (who is borrowing for her sugar cane business) and Asiah B. (who sells ready made garments). \r\nThese women have been together for a long time and practice values such as punctuality and responsibility.
loan_use: to expand her husband's restaurant

description:
Abel has a mechanics workshop where he offers his welding, bodywork and painting services. He personally runs the workshop whilst his wife sells clothes. Abel has been working in this same business for more than 20 years, which is why he has such vast experience in the field. Competence in this field is important, but Abel’s experience goes a long way which means he has a secure client base. This loan is to purchase a ramp for his worhsop, the price of which depends on the market. This is Abel’s third loan with the organisation and he is always on time with payments.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Abel tiene un taller de mecánica en el cuál presta sus servicios de soldadura, chaperío y pintura. el cliente atiende personalmente el taller, mientras que su esposa se dedica a la venta de ropa. Abel se dedica a este negocio desde hace más de 20 años por lo que su experiencia en el rubro es elevada. La competencia en este rubro es elevada pero la experiencia de Abel tiene mucho peso ya que gracias a ella cuenta con clientela fija que perfiere sus servicios. La presente solicitud es para la adquisición de una rampla para equipar el taller, el precio de la misma es variable dependiendo del mercado. Este es el tercer préstamo con la institución y siempre registro un comportamiento bueno en sus pagos.
loan_use: Workshop equipment

description:
Where there is an opportunity to sell her delicacies, Teresa is there. From Monday to Friday she sells delicacies from her small cart outside of a school. Weekends she is located inside a market and for seasons she has participated in fairs or in local holidays always selling her delicacies. Sadly, last week Teresa suffered from an automobile accident, which left her with a fracture of her arm. For that reason she has stopped working for a time. Happily she can count on the support of her husband who also works at the same thing that she does and who, these days, is her only company. For now, she hopes to recover and to be able to work again.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Donde sea que tenga la oportunidad de vender sus golosinas teresa esta ahí. De lunes a viernes ella vende en su pequeña carretilla golosinas afuera de un colegio. Los fines de semana se ubica dentro de un mercado y por temporadas participa en ferias o en fiestas patronales vendiendo siempre sus golosinas. Lamentablemente, la semana pasada Teresa sufrió de un accidente automovilístico, el cual la dejo con una fractura en su brazo, razón por la cual ha dejado de trabajar por un tiempo. Felizmente cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien también trabaja en lo mismo que ella y quien, por estos días, significa su única compañía. Por ahora, ella espera reestablecerse y poder volver a trabajar.
loan_use: To invest in her business of selling delicacies.

description:
Mema is 25 years old and is a married woman with 1 child, age 3 years old. Mema is a tailor and she started in 2003. Every day, she works from 8 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.\r\n

\r\nShe now hopes for a loan to buy another sewing machine for her business.
loan_use: To buy another sewing machine for her business

description:
Elly is a married woman with 2 children, ages 10 and 2 years old. She and her husband also take care of 1 other child, age 4 years old. Elly owns a small clothes shop, which she started in 2003. Every day, she works from 8 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $350 from her sales.\r\n

\r\nShe now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.
loan_use: To buy more clothes for her business.

description: Joseline is 32 years old and the single mother of a unique school-going 12-year-old son.  After her husband left, Joseline had to quickly find a way to survive and take care of her son, so she started a small business selling perfumes, shoes, silver jewels and other goods.  In a few years, she hopes she will have earned sufficient money to rent or buy a small shop.\r\nWith her loan of $175, this entrepreneur will purchase more goods to add to her stock, her goal being to maintain a comfortable life for her son.
loan_use: To acquire perfumes, jewels and shoes for a small business.

description:
Flora is a native of the district of Capachica. As long as she has been situated in the city of Juliaca she has dedicated herself to numerous activities to generate income and so help her husband with the household expenses. Some years ago, with extreme dedication and diligence, she decided to open her small grocery store, which is a very competitive store due to the variety of products that it offers. She was feeling quite content because everything was going well with her business and her family life; unfortunately, however, several months ago, she suffered the terrible loss of the youngest of her two daughters. This fact caused this mother to feel a great heartache and deception, but now she is trying to overcome and rise above this difficult situation. It is because of this that she has been thinking about the well-being of her only daughter, Luz Delia, and of her beloved spouse and has decided to start over with big plans for her family and her business. With this goal in mind, Flora turns to you to request a loan. She is certain that your generosity will help to turn her dreams into reality.

\r\n

Translated from Spanish by Sheila Johnson, Kiva volunteer.

\r\nFlora es natural del distrito de Capachica, desde que radica en la ciudad de Juliaca se ha dedicado a innumerables actividades para generar ingresos económicos y así apoyar a su esposo en los gastos de su hogar, hace algunos años con suma dedicación y diligencia decidió abrir su bodeguita de abarrotes, tiendita muy concurrida por la variedad de productos que ofrece.Se sentía muy contenta porque todo marchaba bien en su negocio y vida familiar, pero desafortunadamente hace algunos meses sufrió la penosa pérdida de la menor de sus dos hijas, este hecho hizo que esta madre sintiera un gran dolor y decepción, pero ahora trata de superar y sobre llevar esta difícil situación, es por ello que ha pensando en el bienestar de su única niña Luz Delia y de su querido esposo y decidió empezar de nuevo con grandes planes para su familia y su negocio.Con esa aspiración en mente Flora recurre a ti para solicitarte un préstamo, está segura que vuestro generoso aporte cristalizará sus anhelos.
loan_use: An injection of capital to promote her small grocery store and reinforce her work.

description:
Maryuri is a young woman 32 years of age. She is married and has a small daughter of 2 years. Her husband is actually in the United States and supports her economically for the sustenance of her daughter.

Maryuri works in a duty-free zone of Managua as a machine operator. At the same time she is dedicated to selling jewelry on foot chiefly in her workplace. The dream of Maryuri is to be able to build her own house, to be able to be established with her daughter and in that way to be able to have a better quality of life.

The business of jewelry sales was started with her own savings and she hopes to be able some day to have a fixed location and sufficient inventory to form her business. She requires the loan to buy more jewelry and thus to supply her merchandise to be able to continue offering them to her coworkers.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Maryuri es una joven de 32 años de edad. Está casada y tiene una pequeña niña de 2 años de edad. Su esposo actualmente se encuentra en Estados Unidos y le apoya económicamente para el sustento de su niña.

Maryuri trabaja en una zona franca de Managua como operaria máquina, al mismo tiempo que se dedica a vender prendas de forma ambulante principalmente en su lugar de trabajo. El sueño de Maryuri es poder construir su propia casa de habitación para poder establecerse con su hija y de esa manera poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.

El negocio de las ventas de prendas las inició con ahorros propios y espera poder algún día tener un local fijo y suficiente inventario para formar su negocio. Requiere el préstamo para comprar más prendas y así surtir su mercadería para poder seguir ofreciéndola a sus compañeras de trabajo.
loan_use: To buy jewelry for resale to her co-workers.

description:
Nancy and Edith have been members of the Sol Radiante (Radiant Sun) Community Bank for 1 year and 4 months, respectively.

Nancy lives with her boyfriend, is 23 years old and has a 6-year-old daughter. She sells breakfast made of grain products such as soy and maca (Peruvian ginseng) in a small marketplace in her neighborhood. She also has sold sweets near a school entrance for the last 3 years.

Edith is single and 28 years old. She has run a beauty salon on a busy block in Ayacucho for the last 2 years.

Nancy and Edith need a loan of 400 soles (about $150) and 1,000 soles (about $375), which they will use to purchase liquids, dyes, peroxide, display cases and tables, in order to sell more products.

Nancy and Edith’s dream is for their children to have professional careers. They also would like to expand their business and have several branches.

Translated by Todd Anderson, Kiva volunteer

Nancy y Edith pertenecen al Banco Comunal Sol Radiante hace 1 año, 4 meses respectivamente.

Nancy es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 1 hija de 6 años, Nancy vende desayunos elaborados con cereales como soya y maca, sus ventas lo realiza en un mercadillo de su zona . Además Nancy vende golosinas en la puerta de un colegio, actividad que realiza hace 3 años.

Mientras que Edith es soltera y tiene 28 años, Edith tiene un salón de belleza en una cuadra concurrida de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza hace 2 años.

Nancy y Edith necesitan un préstamo de 400 soles, 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de líquidos, tintes, oxigenta, vitrinas y mesas para vender más productos.

Lo sueños de Nancy y Edith son que sus hijos sean profesionales, ampliar sus negocios y tener sucursales.
loan_use: Purchase of liquids, dyes, peroxide, display cases and tables

description:
Dilma is the principal breadwinner for her family, ensuring the health and security of her husband, children, and elderly parents. Dilma owns a guinea pig farm and earns a substantial amount from selling these animals. The high demand for guinea pigs has led Dilma to ask for a loan to expand her market and acquire more animals in order to make her farm the best in the city.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Dilma, es la principal fuente de ingresos que provee bienestar y seguridad a su amado hijos y a sus ancianos padres, posee un criadero de cuyes y semana a semana obtiene sustanciales ganacias gracias a al comercialización de los mismos. La gran demanda de sus productos la conducen a solicitar un préstamo para ampliar su mercado y adquirir mayor número de ejemplares con el objetivo de convertirse en la mejor criadora de cuyes de su ciudad.
loan_use: Acquire a larger quantity of guinea pigs.

description:
The leader of this small group is Betty C.. She is currently in the business of baking bread and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Betty is 29 years old and is married; her husband is a teacher. She has 2 children, ages 6 and 12 and her children go to school. Each week, Betty makes approximately 400 Sudanese pounds (about US$ 195) in profit and with the extra money from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

Betty is joined in her small group by Hellen J., Mary B., Betty K., and Poni J.. Hellen J. has a business brewing alcohol and wants to expand the business. Mary B. is currently operating a business selling bread and wants a loan to expand her business. Betty K. operates a business selling beer and wants to expand the business. Poni J. is currently in the business of selling at a hotel and is requesting a loan to expand her business.
loan_use: expand their business

description:
Lourdes dedicates herself to the sale of cosmetics and perfumes by catalog, and her husband works at an entity as a store assistant. Lourdes is 23 years old and, with her husband, has two children ages 4 and 2 respectively.

The cosmetics brands she sells are Yanbal and Avon. In her house she also has a place for making calls, and she has been doing both activities for about four years. There is substantial competition with regard to cosmetics sales, but demand for these products is also high. Her sales allow her to meet her obligations. She seeks the current loan to purchase cosmetics, whose prices vary depending on make and type of product.

This is Lourdes’ third time with the foundation, and she has shown herself to be responsible with her payments. She currently has loans with other financial entities where she has also met her installments on a timely basis.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Lourdes se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y perfumes por catalogo y su esposo trabaja en una entidad como auxiliar de almacenes. Lourdes de 23 años de edad y su esposo tienen dos hijos de 4 y 2 años respectivamente. Los cosméticos que ella vende son los de Yanbal y Avon, en su casa también tiene un punto de llamadas lleva con ambas actividades una antiguedad de aprosimadamente 4 años. Existe bastante competencia en cuanto a la venta de cosméticos pero así también la demanda es elevada, la comercialización de los mismos permiten cumplir con las obligaciones que tiene Lourdes. La solicitud del presente préstamo es para la compra de cosméticos y el precio de los mismos varian dependiendo de la marca y del tipo de producto. Esta es la tercera secuencia de Lourdes con la institución y durante este tiempo demostró ser una persona responsable con sus pagos, actualmente también tiene créditos en otras entidades financieras donde también cumple con sus pagos.
loan_use: Working capital.

description:
Ketty belongs to the La Familia Community Bank, located inside the Pucallpa gas station, in the Calleria District of Ucayali. She is the 38 year old mother of one son. Her husband is retired. With the first loan that Ketty received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to begin her business of food sales.

She relies on her business selliing food, for which she gets up at 6 a.m., in order to prepare breakfast for her son and husband, and afterwards she prepares for to sell at the gas station until 2 p.m.

With this loan of $500, which she will repay in 5 months, she will buy provisions for food sales, including food, fruit, and a display case,etc.

Ketty is thankful for the peace of mind that comes from supporting her family, and for the self-value that comes from working for herself and moving her family forward, all thanks to Manuela Ramos's support of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Ketty pertenece al Banco Comunal La Familia, ubicado en el interior del grifo Pucallpa, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 38 años y es madre de 1 hijo, su esposo es jubilado. Ketty con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de venta de comida.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de comida, para lo cual se levanta a las 6 am, para preparar el desayuno de su hijo y de su esposo, luego se dedica a la preparación de sus comidas para luego venderlas en el interior de un grifo de la ciudad hasta las 2 pm.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,300 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará víveres para ampliar su negocio de venta de comida, una vitrina, frutas, etc.

Ketty esta muy orgullosa y alegre, al fin puede estar tranquila y solventar los gastos de su familia, puede valerse y trabajar por si misma y sacar adelante a su familia, esta muy agradecida con el apoyo de Manuela Ramos para su negocio.
loan_use: Supplies for food production

description:
Gladys is a single mother of two children, ages 17 and 8. She started her business when she realized that she could not cover all their expenses with her salary. She decided to start selling hamburgers and hot dogs out of her brother in-law's house. Gradually she started to get customers and now she wants to give her business a better presentation.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $400, that she will pay in 6 months, to purchase a grill and a display case made of aluminum and glass. With your support Gladis will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Gladys, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos de 17 y 8 años. Empezó su negocio al ver que no alcanzaba a cubrir sus gastos con el salario que ganaba, por lo que decidió iniciar la venta de hamburguesas y hot dogs en casa de su cuñado, poco a poco fue ganando clientes y ahora desea montar el negocio con una mejor presentación.

Solicita un crédito por US $400 que pagara 6 en meses para adquirir una parrilla y una vitrina de aluminio y cristal. Con tu apoyo Gladis saldrá adelante.
loan_use: To purchase a grill

description:
Professor Rosalio fills his time as an educator involved in secondary education at the Rubén Darío Institute. He has worked as an educator for 30 years. His dream is to enjoy job stability and a decent home with all of the basic conditions that every citizen aspires to. This client has two daughters, both of whom are educators. The older of the two, who is 25, is a teacher at a private school, and the younger, who is 22, teaches physical education at the Rubén Darío Institute. He also has a grandson under his care.

His wife also works as an educator at the same institute, and all of them assume the responsibilities and the family expenses since they are a close family. Rosalio is the only person recognized in the municipality of Nueva Guinea for being responsibe and sociable. Currently, Professor Rosalio is studying for a degree in English at the University of the Autonomous Regions of the Caribbean Coast of Nicaragua (URACCAN).

He is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of construction materials in order to plaster the kitchen and a room in his house, which is located in zone # 6 in Nueva Guinea.

Translated from Spanish by Sheila Johnson, Kiva volunteer.

El Profesor Rosalio se desempeña como docente de educación secundaria en el Instituto Rubén Darío labora desde hace 30 años como docente, su sueño es tener estabilidad laboral y una vivienda digna con todas las condiciones básicas como todo ciudadano aspira, este cliente tiene dos hijas ambas son docentes la mayor de 25 años es docente de un colegio Privado y la menor de 22 años es docente de educación Física en el Instituto Rubén Darío, y un nieto que esá a su cargo.

Su esposa trabaja también como docente en el mismo Instituto todos asumen las responsabilidades y los gastos familiares ya que son una familia unida, él es una persona reconocida en el municipio de Nueva Guinea por ser responsable y sociable, actualmente el Profesor Rosalio esta estudiando Lic. En Ingles en la universidad URACCAN.

Está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en compra de materiales de construcción para repellar la cocina y un cuarto en su casa ubicada en la zona # 6 de Nueva Guinea.
loan_use: To plaster walls in kitchen and bedroom

description:
Ana is taking out her first loan with Esperanza, along with the other nine members in her group. She has asked for this loan to improve and expand her business, the manufacture of curtains and linens.

Ana lives in the city of Santiago, the second-largest city in the Dominican Republic, with her husband and two small children. Her goal is to expand her business. Within the next two years, she hopes to have a factory and not just a small business that she runs by herself. She dreams of providing a safe and healthy upbringing to her children. She wants to teach them to become hardworking individuals and help them go to college. For herself, Ana dreams of becoming a successful and strong businesswoman, and improving her family's economic status.

On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International, and Ana herself, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!
loan_use: To buy materials for high-quality curtains and linens.
borrower_names: Eladia, Yanelys, Dilcia, Rosa, Milagro, Marlenis, Luz, Deicy, Ana, Fulvia
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Mrs. Trinidad is an old client, and a very good one. She has worked with our institution for four years now. She was a member of a credit Group, and now she works with individual credit. She has never defaulted on any credit; rather, she is very punctual and responsible. Her husband is the owner of the vehicle she uses for work. She helps him with the maintenance on it and also works with the automobile. Also, she works as a domestic employee, and in this way she is able to help support her large family. She needs this credit now to improve their quality of life by installing needed electrical connections in their home.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Trinidad es una Cliente antigua y muy buena, ella trabaja con nuestra institucion ya cuatro años, ella era miembro de un Grupo solidario, ahora trabaja con un Crédito Individual, no falló en ninguno de sus creditos, al contrario es muy puntual y responsable. Su esposo es dueño de la movilidad con la que trabaja, ella ayuda a él con el mantenimiento del mismo y tambien trabaja con el Automovil, ademas ella trabaja tambien como empleada doméstica, con lo cual ayuda a mantener a su numerosa familia. Ahora necesita el Crédito para mejorar sus condiciones de vida, pues instalará en su casa las conexiones electricas necesarias.
loan_use: Maintenance on their taxi and the installation of electricity in their home.

description:
Imelda is 47 years old, married and has 7 children between the ages of 14 and 27. Imelda owns a small clothes shop, which she started in 2005. She works at her shop from 7am to 9pm every day earns a monthly profit of about $400 from her sales. \r\n

Imelda has requested this loan so that she can buy more clothes to sell in her shop.
loan_use: To buy more clothes to sell

description:
Mrs. Lorena is 24 years old; she is a single mother and lives in a rented room in the city of La Paz. The business she is in is makeup sales. This was the only source of income she has for herself and her young son, who still goes to school. Today, she would like to expand her market and also sell clothes to her clients, making her dues payable in installments. As far as her payment history, she has demonstrated being a very responsible person; since she began with her loan with our institution, she has not presented any problem making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Lorena tiene 24 años, es madre soltera y vive en una Habitacion alquilada en la Ciudad de La Paz. El negocio al que ella se dedica es el de la venta de cosméticos, esta es la unica fuente de ingresos que tiene para ella y para su pequeño hijo que aun va a la escuela. Ahora ella pretende ampliar su mercado y tambien vender ropa a sus clientes, haciendo que sus pagos sean a plazos. En cuanto a su historial de pago, demostró ser una persona muy responsable, ya que desde que inicio su crédito con nuestra institucion no ha presentado ningun problema en sus pagos.
loan_use: Will purchase clothing to sell to her clients.

description:
Benta is the 25-year-old mother of two school-age children who lives in the town of Nyamasaria Kisumu, Kenya. She is also the proprietor of a food kiosk which she opened in 2004. The business is located along the busy Kisumu -Nairobi highway. Every day, she serves over 500 customers and takes in over Kshs 8000 ($129) in revenue. She has applied for a $700 loan to move her business to a larger space to accommodate increased demand from her clients.\r\n

\r\nDisclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.
loan_use: To move her business to a larger space.

description:
Effia B. is married and has six dependents. She prepares palm oil for sale. She wants to buy more raw materials to increase production.

\r\n\r\n

She is asking for $325.00 as additional capital to enable her buy more raw materials for oil production and sale.
loan_use: Additional capital to buy more raw materials for palm oil production and sale

description:
A. Adjowah is married and has three children. She sells clothing and shoes but she is running out of stock.

\r\n\r\n

She is asking for $325.00 as additional capital to buy more goods to sell.
loan_use: Additional capital to buy more clothing and shoes to sell

description:
Kimseang C., 40, is widow with no children. She lives with her parents and sister in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

For the past six years, Kimseang has earned a living by weaving silk into cloth. She sells her finished products to a middle man in her village, who then sells them in Phnom Penh.

Kimseang is requesting a loan of $1,000 U.S. dollars to buy raw silk use in her weaving. She also hopes to buy a motorbike for her family.
loan_use: To purchase silk to weave into cloth and a motorbike for her family

description:
Christabel is a 33-year-old entrepreneur with five school-aged children. She lives in Kisumu, Kenya, where she opened a second-hand clothes shop in 2004. She specializes in women’s clothing: skirts, dresses, casual apparel and bed sheets. From time to time, she travels to Nairobi, where she buys a good variety of items at wholesale prices. Her shop is on a prime location along a busy street. That, plus her three years of experience and her friendly attitude, have allowed her to establish a good clientele base. Christabel has applied for a loan of $800 to expand her business.\r\n

\r\nDisclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.
loan_use: To expand her business

description:
George is 32 years old, has three school-aged children and lives with his wife in the town of Kisumu, Kenya. He runs a second-hand clothes store in a busy market located on Kisumu-Nairobi road. George specializes in selling both men's and and women's clothing. He has applied for a loan of $800 to expand his business.\r\n

\r\nDisclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.
loan_use: To expand his business.

description: Kheng C. is a 35-year-old widow with one child. She lives in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, where she earns around $1.50 a day working in a garment factory. To increase her income, she has applied for a loan from Kiva to rent a plot of land on which to grow beans, and to buy the seeds she needs to start her new business.
loan_use: To rent land on which to grow beans and to buy seeds.

description:
Tausi N. is the chairperson of the Bugolo Lending Group in Kikondo, Lugazi. She is 42 years old and married with sx children, and also cares for two more kids. One of the children is an orphan and one is her step-child. They are both in school along with three of her kids.

\r\n\r\n

Tausi\'s business is buying "mukene" (small silvery fish) from Kikondo to sell in the Tororo district. She\'s quick to say that the transport costs are worth it because each time she has to move she takes around 80 basins of fish, which she can buy for $400.00 and then sell for $500.00. She can\'t earn this profit margin if she is stationed at Kikondo in her area. She says the loans have really been helpful because she\'s been able to stop renting. She would now like a loan to expand her business and buy another plot for farming.
loan_use: Tausi would buy more basins of small fish to sell and buy a plot to farm.
borrower_names: Zam, Rehemah, Musa, Hamidah, Tausi, Nambi, Sanyu, Enock, James, Sarah, Abdul, Faridah, Fatumah, Eunice
borrower_genders: female, female, male, female, female, female, female, male, male, female, male, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Pov S. is 35 years old and with her husband, she has two small businesses to help her family have a good living. She owns a plot of farmland growing yams. Everyday she has to go to her farmland to take care of her crops. Sometime she waters the farmland and takes out the grass, which is not necessary and harms the yam crop. After the farm work, she still has three school-age children to take care of. She always cooks and looks after the children and sometime she teaches lessons to the children. Her husband works collecting palm juice to refine to sugar cane and sells it to the local market. Normally, he makes $5 of income per day.\r\n

\r\nBecause the yam output makes more income to support the household, she would like a loan from Kiva to hire another plot of land to grow more yams.
loan_use: To hire another plot of farmland to grow more yams

description:
Norboy G. lives in the Khuroson area. He is 53 years old, married with 6 children. He has a community college degree. He raises and sells sheep and goats. His family helps him in this business. Norboy buys the animals at the local market. He fattens them up and then either re-sells them at the same market or sells them to the butcher for meat. This business gives him a small profit. Right now Norboy has an opportunity to buy the animals at a cheaper price. He has decided to request a loan to take advantage of this and to buy some young sheep and goats. He plans to repay his loan in 10 months

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva volunteer.

Гулмиратов Норбой житель района Хуросон. Норбою 52 года, женат , имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее. Клиент занимается животноводством. Помогают ему его дружная семья. Норбой покупает на рынке коз и овец для дальнейшей перепродажи.Откормив их ,клиент продает их на рынке или сдает на мясо в ларьки. Это деятельность приносит ему небольшой доход. В данный момент можно купить животных немного дешевле. Поэтому Норбой решил взять кредит,что бы купить на рынке молодых коз и овец. Планирует погасить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.
loan_use: To buy sheep and goats

description:
Saida is 42 years old and is married with 5 children, ages 4-19 years old. Saida is a charcoal seller; she started in 2007. Every day she works from 10am to 18pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.\r\n

\r\nShe now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Zulfa, who has business dealing in food vending.
loan_use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

description: Stella W. runs a store where she sells provisions and food. She is married and has 1 child. She is running out of stock.\r\n\r\nShe is asking for a loan of $525 buy more goods for resale.
loan_use: To stock a small store.

description:
Maria is 52 years old and prepares and sells lunches and dinners in her guesthouse. She has both sons and daughters, but it is the daughters who help her in the guesthouse that forms part of her home, which she owns. Maria has many years of experience in this type of work. There is little competition since she owns the only guesthouse in the area. Her speciality is a la carte and set menu meals. She sells full lunches for 8 bolivianos and dinners for 6 bolivianos. Currently she owes money to another financial institution, but she doesn’t pose a big risk as Maria has demonstrated that she fulfils her obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria de 52 años de edad se dedica a la elaboración y venta de almuerzos y cenas en su pensión. Tiene hijos e hijas, las hijas son las que ayudan en la pensión que se encuentra instalada en el domicilio que es propio. Maria tiene muchos años de experiencia en este rubro y el nivel de competencia es bajo ya que es la única pensión por la zona. Su especialidad son platos a la carta y los menus del día, los almuerzos completos los vende a 8 bolivianos y la cena a seis bolivianos. Actualmente tiene una deuda con otra institución financiera, pero no representa un riesgo mayor, Maria demostró ser una persona responsable con sus obligaciones.
loan_use: Restaurant expansion

description:
Mrs. Trương Thị Bằng, 46 years old, lives with her husband, 46, and two children, 18 and 20. She sells charcoal. Her family has been in this business for 5 years now. Two or three times a week she buys wholesale coal then resells to those restaurants in the area. It is hard work but makes her happy and independent. Her motto is honesty in business that earns her a lot of customers. Her average monthly income is about 150-170USD. She’s been with the TYM Fund for 7 years. She would like to apply for a loan of 625USD to invest in her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Trương Thị Bằng năm nay 46 tuổi, còn chồng chị 47. Anh chị có 2 cháu, 18 và 20 tuổi. Công việc chính của gia đình chị Bằng là bán than. Gia đình chị làm nghề này được 5 năm. Cứ 2 đến 3 lần 1 tuần, chị mua buôn từ các cơ sở sản xuất than về bán lại cho các hộ gia đình và cửa hàng ăn trong vùng. Công việc tuy vất vả nhưng chị Bằng luôn rất vui khi đồng tiền kiếm được thực sự do công sức mình làm ra. Trong bán hàng chị luôn giữ uy tín nên có đông khách quen đặt mua hàng. Thu nhập hàng tháng của gia đình từ 150-170USD. Sau 7 năm tham gia Quỹ sử dụng đồng vốn hiệu quả, vòng này chị làm đơn xin vay 625USD để mua thêm hàng phục vụ cho công việc kinh doanh.
loan_use: Buy wholesale charcoal to resell

description:
Elvira and her husband, Pedro, started their business, a restaurant, 4 years ago. They had always had the idea of starting their own business, and after saving for quite some time they decided to open a restaurant as they thought this would be a good opportunity as there was a grill from a public transport office near their house. Although the business belongs to them both, the money they make goes to Elvira as it is her who is in charge of the restaurant's administration and outgoings. Her husband, on the other hand, works for a transport company, and has 2 buses that he rents to work on.

Thanks to both of their efforts, in a short amount of time they got a juicer in their restaurant. Their plan is to keep expanding and progressing so that they can give their kids, who are 17 and 9, a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Elvira y Pedro, su esposo, hace cuatro años iniciaron una empresa juntos: un restaurante. Siempre tuvieron la idea de poner un negocio. Después de ahorrar durante una temporada decidieron abrir un restaurante ya que creyeron que sería una buena oportunidad al ver que cerca a su casa se encontraba el paradero de una empresa de transporte público. Si bien el restaurante es de ambos, todos los créditos recaen en Elvira ya que ella es la que se encarga de la atención y administración del restaurante. Su esposo, por otro lado, trabaja en una empresa de transportes y además tiene dos ómnibus que los alquila para que sean trabajados. Gracias al esfuerzo de ambos, dentro de poco implementarán su restaurante con una juguería. Su plan es continuar creciendo y progresando. Esto con la idea de darle una buena educación a sus dos hijos menores de 17 y 9 años.
loan_use: To buy some new furniture to improve the ambience of their restaurant/Comprar nuevo mobiliario para mejorar el ambiente de su restaurante

description:
Mrs. Teresa Rodríguez V. belongs to the Communal Bank “Dynamic Women”. She lives in the San Martín region in the Picota province and Picota district. Her home and business are located at the Jr. El Comercio, where she sells basic medicine for first aid and over-the-counter medicines. She's a nurse by trade, and in addition to her work in the store she offers medical care and sells basic medicines to nearby communities on the weekends.

With a loan of 1,000.00 soles, Teresa will buy medicines, such as: anesthetics, antipyretics, and supplies to make serums and give injections. These are in high demand by the patients that she tends. She'll pay back the loan in 6 months.

Theresa is 52 years old and has spent most of her life working in rural zones, where she learned to treat people with many health needs. She is happy to be able to help others with her business. Because of this, her store never has a set schedule and she's always ready to help those in need.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Teresa R. V., pertenece al Banco Comunal” Mujeres Dinamicas” vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de Picota, distrito de Picota , su domicilio y negocio están ubicados en el Jr. El Comercio, se dedica a la venta de Medicina Básica para primeros auxilios y confecciones en general Es enfermera técnica de profesión y paralelo a este trabajo ofrece asistencia sanitaria, venta de medicinas básicas recorriendo los fines de semana las comunidades cercanas Con el préstamo por S/. 1,000.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará medicinas como analgésicos, antipiréticos en cajas y material para dar servicio de inyectables y sueros, que son los que tienen mayor requerimiento entre los pacientes que atiende. . La señora Teresa, tiene 52 años, y es una mujer que la mayor parte de su vida ha trabajado por zonas rurales donde aprendió a servir a personas con muchas necesidades de salud y se siente feliz de poder servir a los demás con su negocio que no tiene horario definido y que siempre está al servicio de los demás.
loan_use: With a loan Teresa will buy medicines to sell.

description:
Meyling has a 5 year old business selling silver accessories. She started the business with her own funds, hoping to help her husband with household expenses. She is 29 years old and lives in the Libertad neighborhood of Managua. Her husband works as a customs supervisor and they have 3 children, 2, 5 and 7. Her goal is to buy a house in a neighborhood where her children can get a good education. She wants to invest the loan in inventory so that she can sell more and increase her earnings.\r\n

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

\r\nLa Sra. M. tiene un negocio de 5 años ella vende prendas de plata su negocio lo inicio con fondos propios con el objetivo de apoyar económicamente a su marido actualmente tiene 29 años con dirección anexo villa libertad, su esposo trabaja es supervisor aduanero, tienen 3 hijos de 2, 5 y 7 años de edad. Su objetivo es comprar una casa en un reparto para lograr la buena educación de sus hijos. El capital de trabajo lo quiere invertir en inventario para vender más y obtener mas ganancias
loan_use: Buy products for resale.

description:
The entrepreneur is 49 years old. She has 4 children studying in school. After her husband died, she became responsible for them. She has a small sewing shop in her rented house. She applied to borrow $1200 to purchase a new sewing machine and some new fabric in order to increase her income and save for a better life for her family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).
loan_use: Purchase a new sewing machine and some new fabric

description:
Anjelina is a married woman with 4 children. Anjelina owns a small grocery store, which she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 7am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.\r\n\r\n

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.
loan_use: To buy more food items for her business.

description:
Teddy, age 29, is married with 3 children (ages 10, 6, and 4). She has a shop where she sells clothes, which she began 1 year ago. She works from 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $99 from this business.

Teddy has taken out 2 previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her capital. She hopes for a new loan to buy more clothing for her shop. Teddy will share this loan with her subgroup members, who sell general items, fruits, and vegetables.

In the picture, Teddy is standing second from the left.
loan_use: To purchase more clothing stock
borrower_names: Magret, Adela, Teddy, Happy, Ally, Christina, Gaudensia
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, male, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description: Charles A. is forty years old and a refrigerator repairman. He works very hard to meet the demands of his various clients. However, Charles is constrained by capital to acquire the needed equipment and raw materials like dryers, copper rods, compressors, etc., to improve the business. He wants to use the loan to buy more dryers, copper rods, compressors, etc., to enable him serve his customers. Charles has seven apprentices under his training, to enable them also to learn the trade to earn a living. He has a personal guarantor to repay the loan in case of default. Charles is the one wearing a gray round-neck shirt in the photo, with one of his apprentices.
loan_use: To buy more copper rods, dryers, compressors, etc.

description:
Vasilina has a small clothing business at a busy market in Kahovka, Ukraine. In business for eleven years, she has gained much valuable experience and met the clothing needs of many customers along the way. Vasilina is married and has a fourteen-year-old daughter. She currently makes about $300 per month in profits and has about $3000 worth of inventory on hand.

\r\n\r\nVasilina has requested a short term loan to help purchase additional merchandise to sell in her kiosk. The spring and summer are busy times of the year for clothing vendors like Vasilina as the weather improves and customers get out to shop and update their wardrobes. This loan will help Vasilina obtain necessary inventory so she can earn a good profit and continue the success of her business.
loan_use: Purchase new invenory

description:
Señora Maritza P. D. Ramírez is a member of the communal bank called 'El Gran Pajaten'. She lives in San Martin, Juanjui. Her store is located in Puerto Amberes where she sells groceries and school supplies.

With the support of her husband and her children and her perseverance and dedication, her store is a success. When she first started, she only had a few things to sell but now she has a wiD. variety of products to sell.

With this loan, which she will repay within 6 months, she will purchase rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil, detergent, body soaps, cleaning supplies, refreshments, snacks among others so that she's able to fulfill her customers' high demand.

Señora Maritza is 31 years old. She lives with her husband and one son. They are her main motivation. She hopes to one day be able to plant cacao trees in her land to make chocolate goods to sell and thereby proviD. another source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Maritza P. D. Ramírez, es socia del Banco Comunal. “El Gran Pajaten “ , vive en la región D. San Martín, provincia D. Mariscal Cáceres , distrito D. Juanjui, su negocio esta ubicado en el Jr. Prolongación Dos D. Mayo - Puerto Amberes , y se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes y útiles escolares. Con el apoyo D. su esposo y sus hijos, la constancia y dedicación propia ha logrado que el negocio se incremente considerablemente, ya que cuando se inicio solo tenia un andamio casi vació, ahora oferta variedad d productos. Con el crédito D. S/.1300.00 el cual será pagodo en 6 meses, comprará: arroz, azúcar en bolsas , leche, aceite, en cajas, detergentes, jabones y útiles D. limpieza en general, gaseosas, golosinas diversas, entre otros, para surtir su negocio y cubrir las expectativas D. sus clientes. La señora Maritza tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo, quienes la impulsan a esforzarse cada día más a lograr cumplir con sus metas trazadas, desea para el futuro sembrar en su chacra cacao para la elaboración D. chocolates ya que sería otro ingreso para su hogar .
loan_use: To purchase more inventory

description:
Luz comes from a family that specializes in handmade embroidery and for as long as she can remember she has been involved in this work. She has received training and developed her skills since she was a little girl. Now that Luz has reached adulthood, she is ready to earn a living doing this work. She sells her embroidery to dance troupes which are common in many schools and high schools in her region.

Luz would like to increase her embroidery sales, with the goal of putting the additional income toward the education of her six-year-old daughter, who is studying in a prestigious primary school. To improve her embroidery she needs to acquire different colored threads and wool, which, when purchased in large quantities, are less expensive.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Anderson, Kiva volunteer.

Luz proviene de una familia que se dedica a los bordados artesanales y siempre ha estado ligada a este trabajo por esa razón su entrenamiento y habilidad se desarrolló desde su niñez y ahora que es una persona adulta esta preparada para afrontar la vida con esta ocupación. Oferta sus bellos bordados a los elencos de danza típica de las diversas escuelas y colegios de su zona, y su deseo es ampliar sus posibilidades de ventas a fin de solventar satisfactoriamente con las ganancias que obtenga de su inversión la educación de su pequeña hija de 6 años que está estudiando en una prestigiosa escuela de educación primaria, para poder mejorar sus bordados requiere adquirir hilos de diversos colores y lana en grandes cantidades ya que a mayor cantidad menor es el precio.
loan_use: Purchase of thread and wool in various colors

description:
Mrs Đoàn Thị Hà is 54 years old. She is a 6th year TYM fund member. She sells fruits at the local market. This type of work is typical for the women in the region. It provides her with cash flow so it is suitable for her to make the weekly payment toward the loan. On average she makes 6-7 USD a day. Her children are all grown up and they can help her out financially so she feels comfortable to apply for bigger loan. This time she is seeking 625 USD to invest in her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Đoàn Thị Hà năm nay 54 tuổi. Chị đã tham gia Quỹ TYM được 6 năm nay. Công việc hiện tại của chị là bán hàng hoa quả ở chợ. Đây cũng là một nghề phổ biến với người dân trong vùng. Việc bán hàng vừa giúp chị Hà có thu nhập thường xuyên lại thuận tiện cho việc hoàn trả tuần. Bình quân mỗi ngày chị Hà lãi từ 6-7USD.
