Các con chị Hà đều đã lớn và luôn hỗ trợ mẹ nên chị không cảm thấy ngại khi vay những mức vốn lớn. Vòng vốn này chị làm đơn xin vay 625USD để mua thêm hàng về bán.
loan_use: Buy fruits

description: Mrs. Prech H. is the group leader of four member group in Chom Teav Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is 28 and the mother of three children. One of her children is a student while the others two are too young to work or study. She sells coconuts in the village. Her husband, Mr. Ri Sok, is helping her out by going to buy the coconuts. Last year, in order to improve her business, Mrs. Prech H. requested and obtained a loan from AMK to buy a motorbike to transport coconuts. Her business is very successful and she wants to expand it by obtaining another loan.
loan_use: to buy more coconuts to sell

description:
Elsa, Maria and August have been members of Banco Comunal Tu Angel Lucy for 2 years, 4 months and 8 months respectively.

Elsa is single and is 38 years old. She produces biscuits and typical sweets made from eggs and cornflour, and sells them as a street-trader at the Santa Clara market.

Maria is married, is 47 years old and has 9 children, 5 of whom live with her. Maria sells vegetables at the 12th April market.

Augusta lives with her partner, is 26 years old and has one daughter. She produces biscuits and bread that is typical of her region, and sells them at the market where she also buys animals, cheese and cereals, which she then sells at the Ayacucho market.

Elsa, Maria and August need a combined loan of $875 to invest in the purchase of flour, sugar, pumpkins, casava and sheep.

Elsa, Maria and August have four dreams: that their children do well in their careers, to have their own homes, to improve their businesses and to upgrade their oven.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Elsa, Maria y Augusta pertenecen al Banco Comunal Tu Ángel Lucy hace 2 años, 4 meses, 8 meses, respectivamente.

Elsa es soltera y tiene 38 años, Elsa elabora biscochos y dulces típicos hechos a base de huevo y harina de maíz, sus productos lo vende de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Santa Clara.

Por otro lado Maria es casada, tiene 47 años y 9 hijos de los cuales 5 viven con ella, Maria vende verduras en un puesto del mercado 12 de abril.

Mientras que Augusta es conviviente, tiene 26 años y 1 hija, Augusta elabora panes típicos de la zona y biscochos que vende en las ferias y de las ferias compra animales, queso, cereales que vende en la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Elsa, Maria y Augusta necesitan préstamos de 1000 soles, 400 soles, 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina, azúcar, zapallo, yuca, harina y ganado ovino.

Los sueños de Elsa, Maria y Augusta son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener casa propia, mejorar sus negocios y mejorar su horno.
loan_use: To invest in the purchase of flour, sugar, pumpkins, casava and sheep.

description:
Wankaia is married with 5 children. She sells food items in the market town of Kabala. She needs to increase her stock of food items for purchasing so that she can consistently meet her clients' demands.\r\n\r\n

Her business is the main source of income for the family, because her husband is a daily labourer whose income depends on the availability of work. The 36-year-old would like to increase her stock and is requesting a loan of Le.1,000,000 ($350 USD).
loan_use: To buy more food to sell

description:
Danilo, who is the oldest of 4 siblings, has been enterprising, diligent and collaborated well with others since he was a child, virtues which he inherited from his dear parents who always struggled to improve their lives and offer educational opportunities to their children. Approximately 3 years ago Danilo, seeing the need of his family, proposed to his father the idea of opening a veterinary store is their hometown of Santa Rosa and together they now offer a wide variety of food and medicine for animals. This little store is very busy because it is one of the few businesses that exists in their city. But now, observing the great number of requests they have received, they see the need to expand their products with the goal of pleasing their loyal and demanding customers and he requests a loan in order to expand their offerings.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer.

Danilo, es el mayor de 4 hermanos, desde niño fue muy colaborador, emprendedor y diligente, esas virtudes las heredó de sus queridos padres que siempre lucharon par salir adelante y ofrecerles estudios superiores a sus hijos.Hace aproximadamente 3 años, Danilo viendo la necesidad de su familia propuso a su padre abrir una tienda veterinaria en su pueblo natal Santa Rosa y ahora en sociedad ofrecen una inmensa variedad de alimentos y medicamentos para animales. Esta tiendita es muy concurrida porque es uno de los pocos espacios que existe en su ciudad, pero ahora, observando la gran cantidad de solicitudes se ve en la necesidad de aumentar sus productos con el propósito de complacer a sus fieles y exigentes clientes solicita un préstamo para ampliar sus ofertas.
loan_use: To increase working capital

description:
Mrs. Natividad belongs to the Community Bank “Mujeres al Progreso,” or Women for Progress, and is dedicated to the sale of bread and cakes. Her stand is located in the central market of the district and province of Yungay, in the “departamento” of Ancash. With this loan of S/. 1,000.00 soles (US $375.00), which will be repaid in six months, she will buy 15 sacks of flour and 3 boxes of butter. She is 56 years old, married and has five children. Her income allows her to educate her children.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Natividad pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso, se dedica a la venta D. panes y pasteles, su puesto D. venta esta ubicado en el mercado central del distrito y provincia D. Yungay, departamento D. Ancash. Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará: 15 sacos D. harina y 3 cajas D. manteca. Ella tiene 56 años D. edad, es casada tiene 5 hijos, sus ingresos le permite educar a sus hijos.
loan_use: To buy more supplies for the preparation of her products

description:
Mrs. Raymunda is 47, married, with four children. Her husband is a farmer and she belongs to Banco Comunal Mujeres Trabajadoras del Campo Ferial (“Women Fairground Workers’ Community Bank”) selling foodstuffs in the market at Yungay District and Province, State of Ancash. She and her husband work to financially support their children who are in higher education.

With this loan, repayable over four months, she will purchase a cooker, four tables and 16 chairs.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Raymunda pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Trabajadoras del campo Ferial,se dedica a la venta de alimentos en el mercado del distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 Nuevos Soles el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará 4 mesas con 16 sillas y una cocina. Ella tiene 47 años, es casada con 4 hijos, su esposo es agricultor ambos trabajan para educar a sus hijos que están en educación superior.
loan_use: Loan for the purchase of tables, chairs, etc.

description:
Mallesa sells fresh fish in Kabala town of Sierra Leone. With her previous loan, she increased her stock and income. With the profit, she was able to purchase a cell phone to contacti her customers and suppliers. She is now able to communicate to more potential customers and is now requesting a loan of Le.1, 000,000 ($350 USD) to increase her stock.\r\n\r\n

Mallesa needs to purchase a greater quantity of fish now that she has been able to more effectively communicate with customers and suppliers. She needs a loan from Kiva in order to do so.
loan_use: To buy fish to sell

description:
Sarrah M. sells palm oil in outskirts of Kabala town. Sarrah is 46 years old and married with 6 children.

With her previous loan, Sarrah was able to increase her stock of palm oil. Sarrah said that, with the profit, she renovated her house and was able to pay her children’s school fees. Now, she would like to purchase 75 gallons of palm oil to increase her stock and income.

Sarrah needs to purchase an even larger quantity of palm oil to meet the demands of her customers. She needs extra capital from Kiva to do so.
loan_use: To buy palm oil to sell

description:
Lilian is 31 years old and is a divorced woman with 4 children, ages 11,9,7 and 4. She and her husband also take care of 1 other person, age 24. Lilian has been asoft drink seller since 2008. Everyday, she works from 1am to 2pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.\r\n

\r\nShe now hopes for a loan to buy more soft drinks items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Silivian, who has grocery business dealing.
loan_use: To buy more soft drinks items for her business.

description:
Mrs Ratna Shova T., a 36 year-old lady, lives in Dhalko, Kathmandu. Most of the people in this area are engaged in small businesses. Mrs T. lives in a joint family with her mother-in-law, husband and four daughters. Her husband's name is Mr Raju T. and he works in a private office. Her four daughters are studying in grades 12, 10, 6 and 5 respectively.

Mrs T. is a grocery shopkeeper in Dhalko. She opened her grocery store three years ago to improve the living standard of her family, because the income of her husband is not sufficient to run her family smoothly. Mrs T. sells different types of grocery items in her shop such as maize, rice, noodles and so on.

Now she is requesting her first loan of Rs 10000.00 to expand her business.
loan_use: To expand her grocery shop.

description:
Mrs Kamala P., 18 years old, is a tailor in the town of Sanepa in Kathmandu. She lives with her husband Mr Amrit P. who works in a private office.

Mrs P. opened her tailoring shop a year ago. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies dresses and school uniforms for both boys and girls. She prefers to make popular dresses like Kurta Sulwar, blouse, ladies long dress, Makhshi, and others. Before starting her own business, Mrs P. took a six-month training course in tailoring.

Mrs. Paiyar is requesting a loan of Rs 10000. She plans to use the loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring work.
loan_use: To buy raw material for her tailoring business.

description:
Antonia is a married woman with 3 children, ages 15, 7, and 2 years old. Antonia is a charcoal seller. She started her business in 2007. Every day, she works from 6am to 16pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.\r\n

\r\nShe now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business.
loan_use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

description: Mariam K. is from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania.  She is 30 years old, married, and has five children between the ages of six and 15.  In 1998, Mariam established a cereal crops selling business with the help of SELFINA, an organization that works towards the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through sale and leaseback agreements for small farmers. Mariam has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan of $425 in order to buy more rice stocks in bulk.
loan_use: To buy more stocks of rice in bulk.

description:
Elena is a widow who supports herself with a small business selling fresh fish at a market in Melitopol, Ukraine. Her husband died tragically, leaving Elena and their son, who is now about seventeen. Elena has been selling fish for two years and works with her mother in the business. Her mother has extensive experience as an entrepreneur, which has been a help to Elena.

\r\n\r\n

Elena has requested a loan of 1500 Ukrainian Griven ($325 USD) to add to her business working capital. Her goal is to expand the business in the future. We are happy to be able to offer this financial assistance to Elena and look forward to her continued success.
loan_use: Add to working capital

description:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Yến, 55 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Lương Bằng, Kim Động. She tends a general sweet stand at the open market in the area. The business fits the weekly repayment plan. Her husband support her business. The average income is 7USD a day. Her grown up children are always help her when she is in need. She’s been with the TYM Fund for 6 years. This time she would like to apply for a loan of 950USD to stock more good for her stand.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Yến, 55 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 2 con tại thị trấn Lương Bằng, Kim Động. Chị có một quầy bán hoa quả và bánh kẹo ở chợ. Công việc này rất thuận tiện cho việc trả tiền tuần và cũng phù hợp với độ tuổi của chị. Bên cạnh đó chị cũng nhận được sự hỗ trợ tích cực của chồng trong việc kinh doanh. Tiền lãi hàng ngày từ việc bán hàng khoảng 7USD. Con trai, con gái của chị đều đã trưởng thành và luôn hỗ trợ mỗi khi chị gặp khó khăn. Tham gia Quỹ TYM đến nay được 6 năm, chị hoàn toàn hài lòng với những kết quả có được. Vòng vốn tới chị tiếp tục xin vay 950USD để mua thêm hàng bán.
loan_use: Buy fruits, confectionery

description:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Luân, 48, lives in Kim Động, Hưng Yên with her husband. They have a son who is attending university away from home. Mrs Luân opened a clothing store 5 years ago. Today, her business is striving. Her annual income is 3000-4000 USD after expenses. According to her, this type of business requires a lot of capital to keep a high level of inventory. For the last 7 years with TYM, she has totaled a few thousands of dollars in loans. Every sum that is invested in her business brings her good profit. This is why she is seeking a new loan of 1200 USD to buy new clothes for her shop

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Luân, 48 tuổi, sống cùng chồng tại huyện Kim Động, Hưng Yên. Anh chị có một cháu trai đang học cao đẳng trên tỉnh. Cách đây 5 năm chị Luân mở cửa hàng kinh doanh quần áo. Công việc hiện nay đang rất phát triển, sau khi trừ chi phí thu nhập mỗi năm của gia đình khoảng 3 đến 4 nghìn USD. Chị Luân tâm sự với nghề nghiệp này thì lúc nào chị cũng cần vốn. Trong 7 năm tham gia chị đã vay của Quỹ vài nghìn USD. Số vốn vay luôn mang lại hiệu quả kinh tế nên vòng vốn này chị Luân quyết định xin vay 1200USD để mua thêm hàng bán.
loan_use: Buy clothes

description:
Mrs. Orfina P., as all Nicaraguan women, is very hard working and has a business selling shoes and clothing from her residence or if necessary as a street vendor. She does need to travel to other places to be able to attain the income from the sales of these products.

She is a resident of the municipality Cinco Pinos of Chinandega where she attends to her customers offering them shoes and clothing in order to provide for the necessities of her home. Mrs. Orfina is currently in need of support due to her lack of financial resources for the purchase of merchandise. She has turned to Ceprodel to acquire a loan that will enable her to buy the products that she can sell. She is confidently waiting for this loan approval so that she can continue to maintain her home.

Translated from Sapnish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Orfina P. como toda mujer nicaragüense es muy trabajadora dedicándose al negocio de la venta de zapatos y ropas el cual atiende en su casa de habitación y a la vez ambulantemente cuando es necesario y le es de necesidad viajar a otros lugares para percibir sus ingresos por medio de la venta de estos productos.

Es originaria del municipio de Cinco Pinos en Chinandega donde atiende a sus clientes para ofrecerle los zapatos y ropa para suplir las necesidades en el hogar. La necesidad que hoy en día atraviesa la señora Orfina es que a pesar que no posee recursos económicos para la compra de su mercadería ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con el crédito que le permita la compra de sus productos para así comercializarlos. Por esto es que ella espera muy confiadamente sabiendo que recibirá la aprobación para continuar con el mantenimiento de su hogar de habitación.
loan_use: Purchase of merchandise.

description:
Mr. Sopharith S. lives in Angk Village in Kandal Province, Cambodia. He is 28 years old and is married to Mrs. Sokheourn Tith, who works in a garment factory. They do not have any children and they live with their parents. \r\n\r\n

Mr. Sopharith S. is a farmer and pig breeder in the village. He usually hires a worker to cultivate his rice plantation. Last year, he got a loan from Brasac Co., Ltd. to pay for hiring a worker, but insects destroyed his rice. Now that the rainy season is arriving, and Mr. Sopharith S. starts to cultivate rice, he needs to hire workers to work on the field. Therefore, he has asked for a loan to pay for the workers. He will also use the loan to buy more insecticides to help increase rice productivity.
loan_use: To pay for the workers and buy insecticides.

description:
Alfoncina is 48 years old and is a married woman with 4 children, ages 16-25 years old. Alfoncina is a tailor. She started in 2004. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $240 from her sales.\r\n

She now hopes for a loan to buy more supplies for her tailoring business.
loan_use: To buy supplies for her tailoring business

description:
Asha, age 50, is a single parent of 7 children. She makes a living by selling clothing and works from 8am to 4pm daily. Each month, her sales bring her a profit of about $85. \r\n\r\n

Asha hopes for a loan to buy more clothing to sel. She is a member of the Karim loan group, whose members guarantee one another in paying back their loans.
loan_use: To buy more clothing to sell

description:
Habiba is 40 years old and is married with 2 children. Habiba owns a small food vendor store, which she started in 2000. Everyday, she works from 5am to 6pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.\r\n

\r\nShe now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.
loan_use: To buy more food items for her business.

description:
We are a group of women inspired by one ideal and one will. We want to work for the power of women to make decisions in their milieu. Our principal activity is commerce. We plan to buy fruits and vegetables and process them into a finished product that we can then sell to the local population at a reasonable price. This will allow us to lighten the load of the housewife, provide autonomy for women, try to stop the exodus of women, and improve living conditions for group members.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Nous sommes un groupement de femmes animées d'un même idéal et d'une volonté qui œuvrent pour le pouvoir de décision des femmes dans leur milieu. Notre principale activité est le commerce. Il s'agit d'acheter des fruits ét légumes et de les transformer pour avoir un produit fini que nous allons revendre à bon prix aux populations locales. Ceci nous permettra d'alléger le panier de la ménagère, donner une autonomie aux femmes, lutter contre l'exode des femmes, améliorer les conditions de vie de ses membres
loan_use:
purchase of fruits and vegetables for processing

achat de de fruits et légumes pour transformation
borrower_names: Seynabou, Fatou Ndour, Khady, Ndiouck, Maguette

description:
Joshpen B. has been married for the last 17 years and has one daughter and one son. Her daughter attends school in standard ten and her son in standard seven. Joshphen runs a boutique and her husband has been a motor mechanic for 28 years. \r\n

Joshpen's boutique does well and therefore she has hired a few employees to help her. She has also displayed her work in various exhibitions and at her home. She has been in this profession for 13 years. She has a diploma related to her profession from a renowned college and is strong in her work. Through the earnings from this business she has been able to convert her one-storey house into a four-storey house. Now she wishes to train her employees in shoemaking and beautician courses. Joshpen needs this loan to expand her boutique business.
loan_use: Expand a boutique business

description: I am Seema A. M. and I have been married for 25 years. I have lived all my life in Lahore, a famous city of Pakistan.  I have three sons and one daughter.  My elder son completed grade ten and now has a private job, and the younger son to him has run a CD shop named J.S Music Video Center for the last 4 years. My other  two children attend a local school . My husband works in the Pakistan High Court. I do not work but remain at home and complete my household chores. I request a loan for my son, who wants to expand his CD business.
loan_use: Expand the CD Business

description:
Mambo from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 33-year-old Luth M.. She is married and has 3 children aged 9,12 and 2. She has 3 dependents who live with her because they are street children. In 2002, Luth established her red palm extraction business. Luth has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more stock of red palm in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facilitation as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment—a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.
loan_use: To buy more stock of red palm in bulk.

description:
Fatuma is 28 years old, married, and has two children (ages 2 and 9). Fatuma owns a small food store, which she started in 2003. Everyday she works from 6am to 9pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $290 from her sales.\r\n

\r\nShe is requesting a loan to open a small cafe.
loan_use: to open a small cafe

description:
Andres A. is a gentleman native of the city of Chinandega, where he runs his business selling basic grains in the Villanueva municipality. He is married and is the father of six children, who have characterized themselves as being good students thanks to the motivation offered by their mother and father, who make great efforts every day so that they are never in need.

The sale of grains such as rice, beans, corn, etc, requires much dedication being that one must generate massive publicity to captivate potential clients, and one must have sufficient products on hand ready to sell. For this reason, Andres is seeking support in Ceprodel to benefit from a loan that will allow him to acquire basic grains such as rice, beans and corn for its respective sale.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Andres A. es un caballero originario de la ciudad de Chinandega el cual posee su negocio de venta de granos básicos en el municipio de Villanueva de donde es originario. Es casado y padre de seis hijos los cuales se han caracterizado por ser buenos alumnos gracias a la motivación de su padre y madre que a diario se esfuerzan para que a estos no les falte nada.

El negocio de la venta de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, maíz, etc. requiere de mucha dedicación para ofertarlo a sus clientes ya que se debe de dar una masiva publicidad para captar una potencial clientela y para esto se debe de contar con suficientes productos para comercializarlos. Es por este motivo que el caballero Andres busca apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con el crédito necesario que le permita la adquisición de los granos básicos tales como arroz, frijoles, maíz, etc. para su respectiva comercialización.
loan_use: Purchase basic grains such as rice, beans and corn.

description:
Estefania has a small business preparing ham in the village of Salpo, high in the Sierras of the La Liberted Region. With over 20 years of experience, Estefania knows how to prepare the tastiest ham. She has many loyal clients and often sends her meats to customers in Peru’s third largest city, Trujillo.

Estefania is 85 years old, married and has 6 children. Although towards the end of her life, Estefania is healthy and lucid. She has no problem hustling around her village situated at over 10,000 ft above see level and enjoys taking care of her family.

A member of the community bank Virgen de Las Mercedes, Estefania is requesting a loan of s/1000 to repay over 6 months. She will use the loan to buy more meat to prepare her popular ham.
loan_use: She will use the loan to buy more meat to prepare her popular ham.

description:
“Villa Florida” is a small rural community bank of FINCA Peru’s Wari project, which provides its credit with education services in the rural areas of Huancavelica. Huancavelica is considered one of the poorest regions of Peru and has many limitations being a very mountainous area (altituD. ranges from 2,000 – 5,000 meters above sea level), the cold, the difficulty of growing crops and the lack of an adequate infrastructure of roads and communication systems.

BCR “Villa Florida” is located at approximately 3,500 meters above sea-level, in the community of Huanchos, in the district of Paucarbamba, province of Churcampa. The main activities of the population are the growing of corn, potatoes and wheat, and also raising cows, bulls and sheep. In the small town the population have some shops and proviD. several services.

Currently the bank has initiated its fourth loan cycle with 15 female borrowers and a total loan of 6,200 soles (about 2,225 US$). The loans range from 200, 400, 600, and up to 1,200 soles. The group already is in its fourth loan cycle, with one and half years of existence, and is one of the “oldest” community banks is the Wari project. In the time with FINCA Peru the members have learned to save, be more responsible with money and in their business. They have learned to be punctual and to respect each other. The dream for all is to make their business grow and to have a higher income in future. Most of the members use their loans for buying school supplies for the children or to increase merchandise for their business.

One of the members of the community bank is Sonilda Tristán T.. Sonilda has a small shop where she sells marmalades and sweets with she buys in Huancayo. With her 200 soles loan, she will buy more things for her business. Over time, with FINCA Perú she was able to save over 500 soles, which she used took out to buy herself a refrigerator. And her future savings she will use for making her house a little more comfortable and buying a television.

Another story tells of Flor Edith V. Tristán, a mother of 2 children: one of 6 years, the other 3 years old. She has her business of raising small animals like pigs, chickens and guinea-pigs. And in her small shop, she sells cheese that she buys from local producers. With her 400 soles loan she will buy more animals. When asked about her savings she tells us that she uses them for buying clothes for her children. Her dream for the future is to buy a car and to move to a bigger city, like Huancayo or the country’s capital of Lima, where it will be more easy to run a business because there is more economical movement.
loan_use: buy new supplies
borrower_names: Gloria, Carmela, Fortunita Segundina, Florinda, Maria Magdalena, Rudy, Constanza Esperanza, Bertha, Flor Edith, Mariluz, Paulina, Sonilda, Maxima Simona, Brigida, Julia
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, false, true, true, false, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
“Dios es Amor” is a small rural community bank of FINCA Peru’s Wari-project which provides its credit with education services in the rural areas of Huancavelica. Huancavelica is considered one of the poorest regions of Peru and has many limitations being a very mountainous area (altituD. ranges from 2,000 – 5,000 meters above sea level), the cold, the difficulty of growing crops and the lack of an adequate infrastructure of roads and communication systems.

BCR “Dios es Amor” is located at approximately 4,000 meters above sea-level, in the community of Pilpichaca, in the district with the same name, province of Huaytará. The main activities of the population are growing potatoes and wheat at lower altitudes, and raising sheep and alpaca in the higher areas. The area is known for alpacas and their wool production. Because of the high altituD., the area is not very suitable for agriculture, but the natural grass (pasture) makes it very favorable for raising alpacas and sheep. In the small town of Pilpichaca, on the main road from Huancavelica to the “Vía Libertadores” highway that connects Ayacucho with the coast and Peru´s capital, L., there are some shops and some produce cheese, but alpaca wool and meat production is the main activity.

Currently the bank is starting its first loan cycle with 19 female borrowers and a total loan of 4,400 soles (about 1,575 US$). Most of the loans are of 200 soles, with three exceptions of loans of 400 soles. As the group is just starting its first cycle, the group was not able to save, except for the initial loan to start. But all agree to save in the future.

One of the members of the community bank is Lourdes C. C.. Lourdes has a small grocery store where she also sells sweets. Her 200 soles loan she will use to fill up her small store again. During the breaks at the local school, she also sells sweets at the entrance of the school. In the future she hopes to be able to buy a house in a bigger city and run a business there. And like most women, she wants her children to be professionals when they leave college. In the shorter run she will be saving for her children’s education and to increase her business. Now that she has entered in FINCA Peru, she wants to learn how to work more enthusiastically and responsibly and how to save.

Victoria S. D. S. has her business of selling clothes at local weekly or biweekly markets. Other business she runs are buying and selling of cheese, trout and sheep. With her 200 soles loan she will buy new merchandise to go to the markets. Her dream for the future is to have a small restaurant and to grow little by little. Victoria will save for the education of her children and for her future restaurant. Now that she will be working with FINCA Peru, she hopes to save more. A neighbor, a member of FINCA in the city of Ayacucho, told her a lot about FINCA, especially about the savings, and maD. Victoria very interested. Besides that , she will work more responsibly and receive trainings like practicing values and how to care for herself.
loan_use: Buy new supplies
borrower_names: Oilivia Luzmila, Ida, Elena, Juana, Teresa Reyna, Miriam Marleny, Idelia, Mery, Lourdes, Nelly Irene, Georgina, Maceda, Viviana Agustina, Esther, Maria Madgalena, Cirila, Imna, Maribel, Victoria
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, false, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, false, false, true, true, true, true

description:
Beatriz is an independent, single woman who saw in the shoe sale-by-catalog business an opportunity to generate extra income since her regular salary job paid her too little and did not provide an income that was satisfactory. She started out selling to friends and then she became more popular thanks to their recommendation.

She is requesting a credit line in the amount of US$250 which will be repaid in 3 months. It will be used to purchase new merchandise. With your help, Beatriz can continue to progress.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Beatriz es una mujer soltera e independiente que inicio su negocio de venta de zapatos por catalogo porque vio la oportunidad de ganar dinero extra, ya que el trabajo que tenia en una empresa no le ofrece suficiente sin ingresos, porque pagan muy poco. Comenzó vendiendo entre sus conocidos y así se fue dando a conocer gracias a la recomendación de estos.

Solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía nueva. Con tu ayuda Beatriz saldrá adelante.
loan_use: Purchase Merchandise

description: Msami S., is 22 year-old high-school student residing in Kibaha town, a few kilometers from Dar Es Salaam. He runs a kiosk and small restaurant in Dar Es Salaam. The profits he makes help him pay his school fees and also help his mother. His mother is always in charge of the business when he is away from school. Msami needs a loan to help him expand his business and increase his profits so that he can pay his school fees and support his family.
loan_use: To expand his restaurant

description:
Millicent is thirty eight years old and the mother of two children. One of the children is currently in school. She has been selling grocery products and cosmetics for four years now. She wants to use her loan to buy more products, because, as she reports, the products sells fast in the market and she needs to increase her inventory. \r\n\r\n

Millicent is a member of the group called "By His Grace." Members agree in principle to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.
loan_use: To buy more cosmetics and grocery products.

description:
Amina is 32 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 6 and 1 year old. She and her husband also take care of 2 other people, ages 48 and 50 years old. Amina owns a small general store and she is market seller, which she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 8 am to 8.30 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $200 from her sales.\r\n

\r\nShe now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.
loan_use: To buy more items for her business.

description: Sejada was born in 1983 and she is married. She lives with her husband and 4 children near the town of Visoko. Her husband buys and resells copper, aluminum and scrap iron from the scrap-heap. He can earn about 1 500 KM (US$ 1200). Sejada will use this loan in the amount of US$ 975 to buy more of this material for reselling in order to earn more money.  Her wish is to earn money in order to finish her house that she started to build.
loan_use: To buy scrap metal for re-sale

description:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 40 year-old Elici L.. She is married and has six children aged between 7 and 23. In 1999, Elici established her seamstress business. She is assisted by her three employees. Elici requires a loan to purchase stocks of cloth and sewing accessories in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets. The lack of tangible collateral assets means they are deemed not-creditworthy by financial institutions, restricting access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extends a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.
loan_use: To purchase stocks of cloth and sewing accessories in bulk.

description:
John King A. owns a provision store. He is married and has seven children. He has been in the trading business for some years now. Business is going very well he wishes to increase sales.

\r\n\r\n

He is asking for $1200.00 as additional capital to buy more goods to sell.
loan_use: To buy more goods to sell in his provision store.

description:
Darlin M. is a business woman in the municipality of El Sauce in the city of León. She works arduously in this field with the aim of supporting her two nephews, who are under her care. It is necessary to note that she is single, which means that her only source of income is this job that she carries out daily in order to cover the household expenses and offer her children an education.

It is important to emphasize the area in which she lives does not offer electricity, so she has obtained a solar panel in order to accomplish both the education of her two young nephews and the household chores. For this reason, upon obtaining the solar panel, she has sought Ceprodel’s financial support so that she can receive a loan that will allow her to pay off her debt, thus acquiring a better quality of life along with her loved ones and moving forward as the head of the household.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Darling M. es una dama que se dedica al negocio en el municipio de El Sauce en la ciudad de León. Se dedica arduamente a este trabajo con el propósito de mantener a sus dos nietos que están bajo su responsabilidad. Es necesario destacar que esta dama es soltera y por este motivo su único sustento es el trabajo que a diario ella lleva a cabo para suplir las necesidades del hogar y también para brindarles a sus hijos las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo escolar.

Es necesario destacar que en la localidad donde ella habita no cuentan con energía eléctrica y por tal motivo ha adquirido un panel solar para lograr llevar a cabo tanto el estudio de sus dos pequeños sobrinos como los quehaceres del hogar. Por esta razón es que al adquirir el panel solar ha buscado el apoyo crediticio en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita la cancelación de esta deuda y así tener un mejor nivel de vida junto con los suyos para lograr mejorar y salir adelante como cabeza del hogar.
loan_use: Payment of home solar panel

description:
Eligio M. is a gentleman from the municipality of El Sauce in the city of León. He works in the agricultural business in order to support his wife and three children, whom he must provide for and offer an education to because he is the sole provider. He arduously dedicates himself to his business with the aim of improving his family’s financial status.

One problem that Mr. Eligio faces is that there is no electricity in his neighborhood because he lives in a zone that is far away from the urban area. For this reason, he has requested the installation of a solar panel. Upon having obtained the panel, his obligation is to pay off his debt. For this reason, he seeks the help of Ceprodel to get a loan, improving his living conditions by counting on this invaluable service: electricity.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El caballero Eligio M. originario del municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de León se ha dedicado al negocio agropecuario con el cual mantiene a su familia compuesta por su esposa y tres hijos los que tiene el deber de alimentarles y brindarles las posibilidades de estudio por ser el único ingreso del hogar. Se dedica muy esforzadamente a este negocio con el propósito de mejorar la situación económica de su hogar.

Una problemática que atraviesa el señor Eligio es que en su sector de habitación no poseen energía eléctrica por ser una zona muy alejada de la zona urbana, para ello ha solicitado la instalación de un panel solar para resolver esta situación. Al haber adquirido el panel su obligación es cancelar esta deuda y es por ello que ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita la cancelación de esta deuda y así iniciar con el mejoramiento de las condiciones de vida de su hogar contando con este valiosísimo servicio como lo es la energía eléctrica.
loan_use: Payment of home solar panel

description:
It is Lupe’s wish to give the best and necessary to her 3 young children so they may become successful members of their community and she will spare no effort to reach her goal with the support of her beloved husband. She uses her talent to make beautiful fabrics and produce lovely bedspreads to be sold at the mine where her husband works and at the same time she gets to visit him periodically. It is her dream project to install a space there and start to prepare and offer varied dishes of food to the hundreds of workers that leave all their strength behind carrying out their work in the mine.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

\r\n\r\nLupe, tiene el anhelo de ofrecerle lo mejor y necesario a sus 3 pequeños niños para que estos puedan desempeñarse con éxito dentro de su comunidad y no escatimará esfuerzos para lograrlo con ayuda de su amado esposo. Ella utiliza su talento para realizar bellos tejidos y producir hermosas colchas de cama a fin de ofertarlas en la mina en la que labora su esposo y a la vez visitarlo periódicamente. Tiene en mente el gran proyecto de instalarse en este espacio e iniciar a preparar diversos platillos para ofrecerlos a los centenares de trabajadores que día a día dejan toda su fuerza en el desempeño de esta labor.
loan_use: Increase capital to start new business.

description:
Vadim is a businessman from Kherson who sells sports footwear in the central city market. Over the last 10 years, Vadim has successfully increased his business to establish a stable income. With rich market experience in the sphere of trade and an enterprising spirit, Vadim has expanded his business to build $2000 in inventory and to where he makes $300 in net profit each month.

Currently, Vadim is seeking a loan of 2500 Grivnas ($US525) to increase assorted merchandise. With the increased profits from additional sales, Vadim hopes to expand his business even further. Eventually he would love to invest additional profits in new business projects.

We believe Vadim’s disciplined, analytical approach, flexibility of thinking, innovative methods, stress resistance and great business aspirations will guarantee the consistent growth of his venture and success in all his entrepreneurial endeavors.
loan_use: Purchase assorted merchandise for his shoe sales.

description:
Lalis offers various items in small quantities in accordance with the dates and seasons of celebration of one or another large event. She has two small school-aged children who have become her best partners and her main motive for her daily effort. They have in mind to establish a sales space in their home so they can offer their beautiful items with better comfort in this space.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

\r\nLalis, oferta diversos artículos en pequeña cantidad de acuerdo a la fecha y a las temporadas de celebración de uno u otro acontecimiento masivo. Tiene dos pequeños niños en edad escolar que se han convertido en sus mejores socios y en su principal motivo de esfuerzo diario.Tienen en mente establecer un espacio de ventas en casa para que desde este lugar oferte con mayor comodidad sus bellos artículos.
loan_use: Establishment of a sales space in her home

description:
Alex O. is a young Kenyan father, aged 30 with 6 children. He also lives with 2 orphan children of his late sister who perished 2 years ago.

Alex started his business 3 years ago after accumulating savings from his former work place. He currently operates a small posho mill (maize grinder) in the neighborhood. He also stocks maize, which he sells to his customers who want to buy and grind it.

With the little profit that he gets from the business, Alex still struggles to feed, clothe, and educate his children and to pay his rent. With the help of his loan, Alex will be able to expand his business by purchasing maize in bulk and to increase his monthly sales.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.
loan_use: To purchase maize in bulk, for his posho mill (maize grinder)
borrower_names: Joseph, Harun, Hellen, Vincent, Everlyne, Jared, Lidia, Newton, Mark, John, Castrol, Alex, James Simiyu, Beatrice
borrower_genders: male, male, female, male, female, male, female, male, male, male, male, male, male, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Mr. Alton Fernando N. H. comes from the city of Bluefields, Nicaragua. He is 76 years old and is married to Mrs. Lucia Lacayo. Together they have 10 adult children. Mr. N. has been selling cheese for more than 10 years. His clients are residents in the neighborhood where Mr. N. resides, and they like his cheese because he offers fresh products. Currently, in order to meet demand, he needs to purchase 300 lbs of cheese at $1.00 per pound and 700 kg of beans at $36.00 dollars per kilogram.\r\n

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

\r\nEl Sr. Alton Fernando N. H. es originario de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 76 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Lucia Lacayo ambos tienen 10 hijos mayores de edad. El Sr. N. vende queso por más de 10 años teniendo como clientes a los habitantes del barrio donde reside que lo prefieren por ofrecer productos frescos, en estos momentos necesita comprar 300 libras de queso a $ 1.00 dólar la libra y 7 quintales de frijoles a $ 36.00 dólar el quintal para poder satisfacer su demanda.
loan_use: To purchase 300 lbs of cheese and 700 kg of beans

description:
Iris María is a well experienced entrepreneur who has been carrying on businesses for more than fifteen years in the San Luis community of Santo Domingo.  She has five children, two of whom live with her.  
Iris María is operating a small store and people of the community visit her regularly to purchase different kinds of goods such as beauty products, perfumes, clothing and the like.
The entrepreneur plans to invest more capital in the business in order to add more varieties to her stock and attract new customers.  She says that at her age, she can walk no more all along the streets, and therefore will be operating the business from her house.
Iris María hopes that her business will allow her maintain a comfortable lifestyle for her family.  Iris will receive the funds with the following entrepreneurs:
Ana Teresa C. L., to purchase beauty products
Clara María C., for a small cafeteria
Yohanna B. C., to buy products for a beauty parlor
Angelica C. P., to buy clothing for her store.
Picture: Left to right: Iris María, Ana Teresa, Clara María, Yohanna B. and Angelica.
loan_use: To invest in the purchase of beauty products, clothing and perfumes for a small business.
town_name: San Luis, community of Santo Domingo
borrower_names: Yohanna, Clara María, Iris María, Ana Teresa, Angelica

description:
Mrs. Saveth V. is a subsistence farmer in Dei Edth Kaoh Posh Village in Kandal Province. Her plantation has no obstacles; thus, she now asks for a loan to purchase more fertilizer and vegetable seeds to expand her field.

Mrs. Saveth V. is 46 years old and the mother of three children, all of whom are attending school. Her husband, Mr. Mao Sam, is a farmer and he always works with his wife in the field. Previously, Mrs. Saveth V. obtained a loan from Acleda Bank to buy fertilizer and vegetable seeds. Last year, the second child became ill and Mrs. Saveth V. went to see a doctor and had to buy medicine to cure her child.
loan_use: To purchase fertilizer and vegetable seeds

description:
Elizabeth Anna T. is married with three children. She has a business selling sewing materials that is doing well, but she wishes to increase her sales. \r\n

\r\nAs she is running out of stock, she is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more sewing materials to sell.
loan_use: To buy more sewing materials

description:
Alejandrina, Jesusita and Angelica are all members of the same village bank at FINCA. All three of them agree that being members of FINCA has reinforced the values of punctuality, responsibility, saving; values that they believe are important in the growth of their businesses.

Alejandrina is forty-two years old and has four children -- three boys and one girl -- ranging from six to twenty three years old. She was a member of FINCA in 1993, left for two years, and rejoined in 1995. She has been receiving support from FINCA ever since. Alejandrina has a business selling all kinds of vegetables from a stand in the local market. She used to sell vegetables in her village in the country before moving to the capital city of Ayacucho, Huamanga.

Jesusita is 33 years old and has 2 children, a boy of 8 and a girl of 16. Jesusita has been a part of FINCA for 18 years. Jesusita has a little store where she sells food staples, such as pasta, grains, soft drinks and candy.

Angelica is 26 years old and has a new, 10-month-old baby girl. She recently joined FINCA in December of 2007. Before moving to Ayacucho, she was living in Lima and studying to become a nurse, but moved to Ayacucho with her new husband to raise a family here. Now she serves lunch from her house as her business.

Alejandrina, Jesusita and Angelica need loans of 750, 900, and 600 soles (3 soles = 1 dollar) to buy more vegetables, rice, potatoes, pasta, lemons and other foods to expand their businesses.

Alejandrina, Jesusita and Angelica all have dreams of someday improving their houses. They dream that their children will become professionals. Angelica also plans to complete her nursing degree.
loan_use: To buy more vegetables, rice, potatoes, pasta, lemons and other foods to expand their businesses

description:
Seth P. has a machine that grinds rice. He earns about $6 per day working from his house. His wife, Mrs. Lot Vay, earns about $3 per day making wine and selling ground rice. They have two children, all of whom are young, and live in Phkar Rumchek Village in the Siem Reap Province, in Cambodia. \r\n\r\n

To increase their income and make it easier to operate their business, they are seeking a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike to use for business. With the remainder of the loan, they will buy rice to grind and sell. This loan will help to expand their business and improve their family income.
loan_use: To purchase a motorbike and rice

description: Rose E. is 48 years old and is a widow with 4 children. She has been borrowing from LAPO micro finance for 2 years. Rose lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria, and she engages in the business of selling drinks and cooked food. This business is a demanding one because it requires human energy and financial support. Rose acquired the skills of cooking and selling from her mother, and she has been in the business for 12 years. Rose is soliciting the loan of $875 to buy more drinks and foodstuffs for sale.
loan_use: To buy more drinks and cooked food

description:
Marcelina lives on Pasco Street in the Rio Seco zone of the city of El Alto. She is divorced and lives with her 16-year-old son. She sells rice, noodles, cooking oil, and other goods for a living, allowing her to receive daily income.

The loan being requested will be used to repair the front part of her house and to build a small general store, where she will sell her products with more comfort.

This is the client’s first loan with Impro. Her credit evaluation qualifies her to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Marcelina vive en la Calle Pasco D. la zona D. Rio Seco ubicada en la ciudad D. El Alto. Ella es divorciada y vive junto a su hijo D. 16 años. Se dedica a la comercialización D. arroz, fideo, aceite y otros al por menor, por lo cual recibe ingresos diariamente.

El crédito requerido será destinado para la refacción D. la parte frontal D. su casa y la construcción D. una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes en donD. expenderá con mayor comodidad sus productos.

Es el primer crédito que Impro le otorga a esta clienta, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
loan_use: Remodelling and construction

description:
Bernardina y Paulino, are both very industrious and enterprising parents, since they formed their family they have dedicated themselves to countless activities so their 3 beloved children do not experience economic constraints.

Paulino, purchases and sells building bricks while Bernardina has a country store. In addition, 2 years ago the couple purchased a motorcycle taxi to rent it and earn extra money for family expenses.

The couples wish is to increase the amount of capital for their brick business; both believe that by increasing their capital they will also increase their profits.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

Bernardina y Paulino, son padres muy laboriosos y emprendedores, desde que formaron su familia se dedicaron a innumerables actividades con el fin de que sus 3 queridos hijos, no pasen limitaciones económicas.

Paulino, se dedica a la compra y venta de ladrillos de construcción, mientras que Bernardina se dedica al negocio por campañas, adicionalmente a sus labores hace 2 años adquirieron un mototaxi con el fin de alquilarlo y obtener ingresos extras para el gasto y sustento familiar.

El deseo de esta pareja es aumentar el monto de inversión de su negocio de ladrillos, ambos creen que aumentando su capital incrementarán también sus beneficios.
loan_use: Increase in capital to raise the production of bricks.

description: Mrs. Neurn E. is a farmer in Taing Russey Village in Kampong Speu Province. In the dry season she grows vegetables and during the monsoon season she grows rice. Last year she hired a cow to plough her field but it was very expensive, so she is now asking for a loan so that she can buy a cow for herself. She is 44 and married with four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in state school. Her husband, Mr. Ron Chuon, is a farmer. Her husband is on the left of the photo.
loan_use: to buy a cow to plough her land.

description:
Mrs. N. Thị Quý (MS: 070002), 49 years old, has been a loan group leader before and trusted by her group members. She sells pork at the open market. Her children are grown up and have jobs. She like this type of loans. They are convenient and encourage her to save. That’s why she volunteers to be a group leader. She is applying for a loan of 2,478.000 VND to buy bean for selling back to tofu makers. Her group has 4 other members. They all apply for loans of the same amount as hers.
  • Nguyễn Thị Hiền (MS: 2.478.000 VND), 33 years old, applies for a loan to invest in her grocery stand.
  • Nguyễn Văn Minh (MS: 070010), 30 years old, applies for a loan to invest in his electronic shop.
  • Chương Thị Duyên (MS: 070007), 25 years old, applies for a loan to buy wood for making furniture.
  • Nguyễn Khắc Ngọc (MS: 070013), 37 years old, applies for a loan to buy feed for chickens and buy scrap.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Cô N. Thị Quý (MS: 070002), năm nay 49 tuổi. Cô làm nhóm trưởng của kỳ trước, được các thành viên trong nhóm tín nhiệm nên cô lại tiếp tục làm nhóm trưởng của kỳ tiếp. Cô bán thịt lợn ở chợ. Cô có con đã lớn và đã đi làm. Cô rất thích với việc trả góp sẽ giúp mọi người tiết kiệm, Chính vì vậy cô làm nhóm trưởng để khuyến khích mọi người tham gia. Cô vay 2.714 để mua đỗ tương về bán cho các hộ làm đậu. Chị Nguyễn Thị Hiền (MS: 2.478.000 VND), năm nay 33 tuổi. Chị vay 2.478.000 VND về để bán hàng tạp hoá. Anh Nguyễn Văn Minh (MS: 070010), năm nay 30 tuổi. Anh vay 2.478.000 VND để mua đồ điện về bán. Chị Chương Thị Duyên (MS: 070007), năm nay 25 tuổi. Chị vay 2.478.000 VND để mua gỗ về đóng bàn ghế để bán. Chị Nguyễn Khắc Ngọc (MS: 070013), năm nay 37 tuổi. Chị vay 2.478.000 VND để mua cám cho gà, và đi mua bán phế liệu.
loan_use: Invest in business

description:
K. Rashidah, the Chairperson for Jinja Agency Lending group, is an exception. She is a “hawker” and sells new clothes for young girls without a fixed location, but walks around busy markets and taxi parks carrying and selling them, a job she has done for 6 years. She is 50 years and married with 7 children, as she caters for 2 stepchildren and 4 grandies. Rashidah says life is good now, compared to when she was trading in used clothing, and she has been able to buy a fridge with the previous loan, stocked it with soda, and placed it in a friend’s shop. \r\n

\r\nWith her portion of the group loan, she plans to buy more new girls’ clothing to sell, which she buys from Kampala, the capital city, as well as stock the fridge with more soda, beer and juice. She is really business oriented and respected as the group leader, and she has a 6 years’ experience with loans. Her dream is to be able to rent a store as her shop because moving around is not an easy job now that she is growing old.
loan_use: Kayingo Rashidah plans to buy more new girls’ clothing to sell, as well as stock the fridge with more soda, beer and juice.
borrower_names: Dauda, Margaret, Mutesi, Joseph, Barbara, Sarah, Hasifah, Monica, Sula, Margaret, Amina, Rashidah, Aisha, Joshua, Peter, George
borrower_genders: male, female, female, male, female, female, female, female, male, female, female, female, female, male, male, male
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
N. Grace is the chairperson of Baligenwa women’s group in Jinja. She prepares local brew known as “malwa” for sale using millet that is fried on a large metallic tray, milled, mixed with water, and after a few days, it’s ready. She is 42 years old and married with 7 children, and also cares for 1 grandchild. \r\n

\r\nThe group has been together for 6 years and all members agree that with the loans, life has improved a lot and this has enabled them to send their children to school. Grace would like a loan to expand her business by buying more millet since she is now able to sell 4 jerry cans of malwa in a day at $6, yet other customers enjoy the drink at her home where she has constructed shelter for them. Customers come with their jerry cans and her job is to fill them.
loan_use: Nayigu Grace would like a loan to expand her business by buying more millet for making more malwa.
borrower_names: Ruth, Peter, Fatumah, Moses, Scovia, Grace, James, Joan, Monica, Aidah, Nite, Zaina
borrower_genders: female, male, female, male, female, female, male, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Moses is a 32 year old butcher, who is married with four children. He and his one worker have been working in his butcher shop for 9 years. He buys a cow from the abattoir every couple of days for $235, sells half of it straight away for $135 to another butcher making him $18. The other half he takes back to his shop and butchers the meat to sell by the kilo. Aside from the head, which he leaves at the abattoir, he sells every part of the cow. He makes around $30 profit on the second half of the cow. \r\n

\r\nHe is looking for a loan of $600 to buy some new scales, new machetes and to help him buy a fresh cow as he has recently used his profits to pay for the children's school fees.
loan_use: Moses is looking for a loan to use in his butcher business.  He wants to by some new scales, new machetes and to help him buy a fresh cow as he has recently used his profits to pay for the children's school fees.

description: Fatima A. sells foot wear and provisions. She is 28 years old and is married with two children. She hails from the western part of Nigeria and resides in Edo State. Fatima started her business on her own in 2003 and has been running it ever since. She needs a loan of $450 to buy more provisions to sell.
loan_use: To buy more provision for sale

description:
Marcela works in a law firm as a secretary and transcriptionist. Her home is located in the Villa Copacabana Sector Pacasa are of La Paz. She is single, lives with her parents, and her food, education and other expenses are covered by her job as she is an adult. This is the first time she is seeking a loan from Impro, and the loan will be used for a deposit on a room with the objective of saving money in order to live independently. Her work and desire to succeed enable her to access this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Marcela trabaja en un estudio Jurídico como secretaria y transcriptora. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Villa Copacabana Sector Pacasa de la ciudad de La Paz. Es soltera, vive en la casa de sus padres y los gastos de alimentación, educación y otros los cubre con su trabajo ya que es independiente. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, el crédito será destinado para anticrético de una habitación con el objetivo de Ahorrar y también vivir independiente. Su trabajo y las ganas de superación le permiten acceder a este crédito.
loan_use: Pay a deposit for a room in order to live independently and save money for rent payments.

description:
Mrs Amelia is a member of Las Orquideas Community Bank, located at Jr. Lieutenant Clavero 149, Calleri District, Ucayali Province. She is 57, widowed and has six children.

With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for approximately $110, Amelia opened a small sewing and alterations workshop, as a result of which she has improved her life. After her domestic chores in the mornings, Amelia works in her workshop in the afternoons on her customers’ orders.

With this loan, repayable over four months, she plans to purchase: quantities of textile and fabrics, threads of different colors, elasticated materials, zippers, buttons, etc., as it is very important to her to feel more independent, making her happier and more secure within herself.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Amelia pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Orquídeas, ubicado en el Jr. Teniente Clavero 149, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 57 años es madre de 6 hijos, es viuda. Amelia con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un pequeño taller de costura. En la actualidad con su taller de costura esta saliendo adelante, por las mañanas realiza sus labores domesticas, y en las tardes se dedica a confeccionar sus prendas que le piden sus clientes. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: telas por metros, hilos de diferentes colores, elásticos, blondas, cierres, botones, etc. Para ella es muy importante sentirse mas independiente, eso la hace muy feliz y mas segura de si misma.
loan_use: Purchase of fabrics, threads, etc. for the business

description:
Zulema has a talent for making pastries and cakes, and is helped by her new molds used in the preparation of sweets and various desserts. She leaves at dawn to prepare them in the “bread workshop” in the home of one of her relatives, before leaving to sell them in the streets. She remembers learning this occupation from her beloved father. She would like to improve and put her bakery equipment to use in order to soon have a permanent shop to sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Zulema tiene el talento para elaborar pasteles y tortas, ayudada por los novedosos moldes que utiliza para la preparación de dulces y variados postres. Sale de madrugada para poder prepararlos en el taller panadero de uno de sus familiares para después recorrer las calles. Ella recuerda que aprendió esta ocupación de su amado padre. Desea mejorar e implementar sus artículos de repostería para pronto poner un espacio de venta permanente.
loan_use: Installation of a bakery

description:
In one of the main streets of the urban community of Huancayo, you will find Nelly, who exemplifies hard work. She creates deliciously seasoned local dishes by hand. Hoping to improve her sales, Nelly has in mind a project to rent a commercial space, meanwhile continuing to work as she does now. Her loan request is intended to improve her work space and the facilities of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

En una de las calles principales de la comunidad urbana justicia paz y vida verán a una mujer ejemplo y símbolo de trabajo, sus manos y su exquisita sazón dan como resultado platos típicos deliciosos. El deseo de Nelly es mejorar sus ventas y tiene como proyecto en mente arrendar un local comercial, mientras tanto seguirá trabajando de esta manera. Su solicitud de un crédito atiende a la necesidad de mejorar su espacio de trabajo y las instalaciones de su hogar.
loan_use: Implemention of a work space.

description:
Lotty belongs to the Mujeres Talentosas (“Talented Women’s”) Communal Bank. Her business is located at Jr. Tarapaca 399 in the Callería District, in the Department of Ucayali. She is 34 years old and has 3 children. Her husband is a merchant, but his income is not enough to meet the family’s daily needs. It is for this reason that Lotty received her first loan of 300 Peruvian Soles ($100) from Kiva Partner Manuela Ramos, which she decided to invest in constructing retail units to rent out.

With the loans she received and the profits she earned Lotty was able to construct more retail units to rent out. Because of the retail units’ central location, Lotty rented them out very quickly, and they are now thriving businesses that generate more income for her.

Lotty will use this loan of 2,000 Soles ($750) to refurbish her retail units. The loan will be repaid in 4 months.

Lotty feels more independent, and is now able to enjoy the financial stability that she always wanted. She is very happy to provide for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Chris Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Lotty pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Talentosas, ubicado en el Jr. Tarapaca 399, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 34 años, es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es comerciante, pero el ingreso que tiene no le alcanza para su economía diaria, es así que Lotty con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la construcción de locales para alquilar.

En la actualidad con los préstamos recibidos y las ganancias obtenidas, pudo construir mas locales para alquilar, por la zona céntrica en que se encuentran sus locales los alquilo rápidos y están funcionando negocios, que le generan mas ingresos económicos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, refaccionara sus locales.

Lotty se siente más independiente, ahora puede gozar de una estabilidad económica que siempre quiso tener, aporta en su hogar y eso la hace muy feliz.
loan_use: Refurbishing her retail units

description:
Fiorella is a young mother willing to improve life for herself and her young child. She is working towards becoming a qualified health visitor. In the meantime, she earns an income by selling various types of clothing.

She would like to improve the variety and increase the quantity of items of clothing she sells.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Fiorella, es una joven madre de familia que tiene muchos deseos de progreso. Para brindarle bienestar a su pequeño niño oferta todo tipo de prendas de vestir.Desea mejorar la oferta de sus productos con el propósito de especializarte en su carrera de visitadora médica.
loan_use: Additional capital to be able to offer more items of clothing for sale

description:
Arleth is separated from her husband and has three children. She began her business because she wanted to become independent and take advantage of savings to start her own business. In addition, she wanted to pay her housing bills. She began her business selling tacos a year ago with a grill and four tables.

Arleth needs a loan of US $1,200, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase ingredients and, therefore, increase her sales by offering a greater variety on the menu of her establishment.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Arleth esta separada de su marido y tiene 3 hijos. Inició el negocio porque se quería independizar y aprovechar un ahorro que tenia para iniciar su propio negocio, además que debía solventar los gastos de su casa. Comenzó su negocio de venta de tacos hace un año con una parrilla y cuatro mesas.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $ 1200 que pagara en 6 meses para comprara insumos y asi incrementar sus ventas ofreciendo mayor variedad en el menú que ofrece en su establecimiento
loan_use: Purchase ingredients.

description:
Mr. Em C., 65, and his wife, Mrs. Nut SOUN, 53, were married in 1972. They have three sons, one of whom weaves mosquito nets at home. The other two of  are masons. And their only daughter has full time employment. The family lives across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Em and his wife have been mosquito net weavers since 1985. He is in his middle 60s but still strong enough to work. They sell the finished products to the middleman in the village who will take them to sell in Phnom Penh. 

Now, Em is requesting a loan of US$1100 to purchase a looming semi machine for weaving mosquito nets.
loan_use: To purchase a looming semi machine for weaving mosquito nets.

description:
Jose is 28 years old, and has been running a transport business. He is also involved in the purchase and sales of wood. Jose is married but they still have no children. He works alongside his wife in both their businesses.

He transports agricultural products with his truck, but he purchases wood in the country and sells it to carpenters in the community where he lives. He has been running these businesses for 8 years. There is a great deal of competition for this field of work which is great for Jose because he has earned a steady clientele.

With this loan he will purchase a new vehicle. This is his eighth loan with his institution and he has demonstrated commitment to meeting his payments in the past.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

José de 28 años de edad, se dedica hacer fletes en camión y también se dedica a la compra y venta de madera. Actualmente José se encuentra casado pero aún no tiene niños, él trabaja junto a su esposa en sus dos actividades. Realiza fletes de productos agrícolas en su camión, en cuanto a la madera la compra en el campo y la vende a los aserraderos que se encuentran en la comunidad donde vive. En este rubro ya tiene una experiencia de 8 años. Existe competencia pero lo que le favorece a José es que ya cuenta con clientes fijos. Con la presente solicitud el reintegrará a su presupuesto que tenía fijado para la compra de un vehículo. Esta es la octava secuencia de Jose con la institución y demostró un buen cumplimiento con sus pagos.
loan_use: To purchase a vehicle.

description:
Señora Edessia López of H., her husband (Hernán H.) and their three children live in their home in the Villa Fátima zone of the City of La Paz. The couple is dedicated to the breeding of chickens in a province of the fore-mentioned metropolis.

Previous loans served to build four rooms in all, of which two are finished. At present, Edessia requests a loan for construction of the fine work for the remaining rooms. This is the fourth occasion when she has requested a loan. The economic analysis associate notes that she qualifies favorably.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Edessia López D. H., su esposo (Hernán H.) y sus tres hijos viven en casa propia en la zona D. Villa Fátima D. la Ciudad D. La Paz. El matrimonio se dedica a la crianza D. pollos en una provincia D. la mencionada urbe.

Anteriores créditos sirvieron para construir cuatro habitaciones en obra gruesa, D. las cuales dos están terminadas. Actualmente, Edessia solicita crédito para construcción en obra fina D. los restantes cuartos. Siendo esta la cuarta ocasión en la que requiere un préstamo, el análisis socio económico la califica favorablemente.
loan_use: To finish the detail work on two rooms in her home.

description:
Maribel is a very hard-working woman. Her and her partner work cultivating potato and maize. Their most urgent need right now is of fertilizers and medicines which will help to look after their products and will allow the earth to give them excellent vegetables as the market requires.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Maribel, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora.Ella y su pareja se dedican al cultivo de papa y maíz, su necesidad más urgente ahora es comprar fertilizantes, abonos y medicinas para el cuidado de sus productos a fin de que sus terrenos puedan producir excelentes vegetales acorde a la exigencia del mercado.
loan_use: To buy fertilizers/Compra de abonos y fertilizantes.

description:
Dilbaroy K. is 35 years old, and she is the loving mother of two children. Dilbaroy’s husband is a businessman. They both work extremely hard in order to support their family and to ensure that their children have the opportunity to receive a higher education. For the past 6 years she has been selling bed clothes in the local market known as “Somon-bozor,” which is a very popular market among the population and is why Dilbaroy has a great deal of clients. Generally, Dilbaroy travels to Bishkek, which is located in the neighboring country of Kyrgyzstan, to purchase new goods. When purchasing new goods, she tries to choose various products of high quality at reasonable prices, which allows her to maintain a dedicated and loyal client base.

\r\nThe business generates stable income and thereby allows Dilbaroy to improve her family's living conditions and to save money for the needs of her children as they grow older. Dilbaroy is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 to increase her inventory of bed clothes and to expand the range of goods she offers to her customers. Dilbaroy would like to thank everybody for supporting her and promises that she will pay the loan back within the 9-month loan term.
loan_use: To expand her inventory and to meet her customers' demands by purchasing a wider array of goods

description: Sesay is very thankful to Kiva for the previous loan she received. She purchased more stock of bottled water and sold it in the market town of Magburaka. Before the loan, Sesay used to sell water in a plastic bag. With the profit, Sesay diversified her business. She purchased agricultural produce, such as rice, palm oil, and peanuts, and sold it to suppliers in Freetown. The family income increased, and they can eat 3 meals a day. Sesay is very grateful to Kiva, and she is requesting another loan of Le.800,000 to increase her stock of agricultural products.
loan_use: To increase her stock of water and agricultural products

description:
Eduarda V. lives with her daughter in the Pasankeri zone of La Paz. Eduarda owns her own home and is retired. Her husband works for the mayor’s office of La Paz.

The requested loan will be used to build a fully functional bathroom for Eduarda’s home and to complete foundation/ground work for the same.

This is the fifteenth time that Eduarda has requested a loan. The socio-economic analysis continues to give Eduarda high ratings. Eduarda has been a client of IMPRO since 2002 and has an excellent repayment history.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Eduarda V. vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri de la Ciudad de La Paz. Con su hija. La señora Eduarda es rentista de los beneméritos y su esposo trabaja el la alcaldía de La Paz. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción en un baño completo y al compactado y traslado de tierra en su terreno.

Esta es la quinta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito. Eduarda es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2002 y su historial de pagos es excelente.
loan_use: Construction of a bathroom and completion of foundation/ground work.

description:
Mrs. E. is 58 years old and a widow. 13 years ago her husband died and left her two properties. She rents one for US$200 and the other for US$300 a month and uses that income to cover family expenses and other commitments, as is the case with a loan.

At this time she needs to make improvements to the home where she lives before the winter (rainy) season arrives. The children she is responsible for are two women who are the owners of the properties left by her husband. She has already had other loans and with them has been able to improve her home to provide her daughters better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. E. R. de 58 años de edad, viuda. Hace 13 años que murió su marido dejandole 2 propiedades, una la alquila en U$.200.00 dólares y la otra en U$.300.00 dólares mensuales, y así obtener ingresos que le permite cubrir los gastos familiares y algunos compromisos, como es el caso de un credito; en este momento requiere mejorar la vivienda donde ella vive antes de que entre el invierno. Los hijos que tiene a su cargo son 2 mujeres y son las dueñas de las propiedades que dejó su mario, ella ya ha tenido otros creditos y con ellos ha podido mejorar su casa para brindar mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijas.
loan_use: Improvements to the infrastructure of her home

description:
Doris N. is a twenty-nine-year-old single parent of one child. She has owned and operated a beauty salon for the past eight years. Doris is a very skilled and talented hair dresser who adds beauty and value to the hair of her many customers. That is her secret. \r\n

\r\nDoris believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service. Therefore, she wants to use the loan to buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, pomade, shampoo and activators, among other products. This will help her to avoid shortages and poor service. Doris is a member of the community group called Nkwabin Ladies Trust Group. Nkwabin is the name of the local community. In this group, members use social collateral to guarantee the loans for one another. They use positive peer pressure to encourage each other to repay the loans.
loan_use: To buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, pomade, shampoo and activators

description:
In the “Five Pines” district of Chinandega town, Bartolomé P. has spent the last six years establishing a hardware store which he runs from his house, offering all types of materials to his customers in the area. It is necessary to state that being a single father of three children his efforts are greater in order that he may be able to provide them with all the necessary condition of life for their development.

Ceprodel have been a cornerstone of his business, for the simple reason that he has benefited from credits which have been of enormous use in the marketing of his hardware products. Each and every one of his loans has been repaid on time and in the manner agreed by both parties.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer
