En el municipio de Cinco Pinos en la ciudad de Chinandega el señor Bartolomé P. se ha dedicado desde hace seis años al negocio de ferretería el cual atiende en su casa de habitación ofreciendo todo tipo de materiales a sus clientes en el sector. Es necesario destacar que por ser un caballero padre de tres hijos sus esfuerzos son mayores por lograr proporcionarles todas las condiciones de vida necesarias para su desarrollo.

Ceprodel ha sido un pilar en el negocio por la sencilla razón que le ha beneficiado con créditos que le has sido de muchísimo beneficio para la comercialización de sus productos ferreteros. Hoy en día él acude una vez mas a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita la compra de los productos ferreteros para comercializarlos. Todos y cada uno de los créditos que el ha tenido han sido pagados en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido por ambas partes.
loan_use: Purchase of tools and materials

description:
A. Adinajon lives in the Asht region of Tajikistan, where agriculture and livestock are common pursuits. Mrs. A. Adinajon has a large farm with cows, bulls, and rams, and she also makes and sells yarn and warm wool socks. She has 6 years of business experience. In addition, Mrs. A. Adinajon works in a collective farm. \r\n\r\n

She is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of 1200 STJ ($350 USD) for 6 months to purchase a spinning frame to make yarn.
loan_use: To buy a spinning frame for making yarn.

description:
Doña Mireya is a member of “Banco Comunal Las Orquídeas”, located in Jr Maya de Brito, District of Calleria of the Department of Ucayali. She is 26 years old and the mother of 4 children. Her husband is a tank driver but his income is not sufficient to feed his family, and with a previous first loan received from Manuela Ramos, S/.300, doña Mireya decided to invest in a business selling chickens. Presently she is selling chickens from a stall at the market, and therefore she gets up at 7 a.m. to prepare breakfast for her children and husband, then she takes care of her chores and later she sells chickens from 4 to 8 p.m. With this loan of S/.700 to be repaid in 4 months, she will buy more chickens to increase sales. Mireya is happy, and she feels she is on the right track as her business starts paying off and she is able to help out with the expenses at home and she is very grateful for the support Manuela Ramos has offered her to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

\r\n\r\nLa señora Mireya pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Orquídeas, ubicado en el Jr Maya de Brito del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 26 años y es madre de 4 hijos, su esposo es motocarrista, pero los ingresos económicos con los que cuenta no le alcanza para el sustento familiar, es así que Mireya con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de venta de pollos. En la actualidad ella cuenta un puesto de venta de pollos en el mercado, para ello se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo, de allí se dedica a los que haceres de su hogar para luego ir a vender sus pollos a partir de las 4 pm hasta las 8 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 700 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará mayor cantidad de pollos para incrementar sus ventas. Mireya esta muy contenta, y se siente encaminada puesto que su negocio empieza a darle frutos y de esta manera puede apoyar en los gastos de su hogar y esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos para su negocio.
loan_use: Purchase merchandise to increase sales of poultry.

description:
Mr. Kossi A. is 33 years old, married, and the father of two children (his daughter, Renée, is in the photo with Kossi). In order to earn money to meet the needs of his two children, he is a tailor in Adéta, a town located about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this first loan from FECECAV, he would like to strengthen his business by purchasing new fabric, buttons, and other sewing materials. With the profits he’ll make from selling clothing, Kossi hopes to also purchase another sewing machine to expand his business. He appreciates the opportunity that this loan will provide to improve his family’s quality of life. \r\n

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

\r\nMr. Kossi A. est âgé de 33 ans marié et père de 2 enfants (sa fille, Renée, est dans la photo avec Kossi.) Pour gagner de l’argent afin de subvenir aux besoins de ses 2 enfants, il fait la couture à Adéta, une ville située à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Avec ce premier crédit de FECECAV, il veut renforcer sa boutique dans l’achat des nouveaux tissus, boutons et plaintes. Par les profits qu’il va dégager dans la vente de ses vêtements, Kossi aussi espère acheter un autre machine à coudre pour agrandir son entreprise. Il apprécie l’opportunité que ce crédit va lui donner pour améliorer la qualité de sa vie et la vie de sa famille.
loan_use: Building his business by purchasing new equipment

description:
Madame Akoss A. is the person to the right in the picture, together with the woman on the left who helps her. Akoss is 25 years old, married and mother of one. She runs a restaurant in Lavie, a small village about 130 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. She specializes in making traditional plates like fufu and pastas. She is applying for her first loan with FECECAV to purchase yams and corn to improve her business which will help her to support the needs of her family and satisfy the demand of her regulars.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Madame Akoss A. est la personne située à droite et l’autre personne est sa collaboratrice. Akoss est agée de 25 ans, mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle opère un restaurant situé à Lavie, un petit village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de , la capitale togolaise. Elle est spécialisée dans la préparation des plats traditionnels comme fufu et la pâte. Elle désire avec ce premier crédit de FECECAV acheter les ignames et du maïs pour améliorer son activité afin de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et satisfaire les demandes de sa clientèle fidele.
loan_use: To purchase food supplies

description:
Virginia belongs to the community bank, Las Flores of Paraíso (The Flowers of Pardise), located in Jr. Ucayali 669, Distract of Calleria, of Department of Ucayali. She is 40 years old and is the mother of one child. With the first loan that Virginia received from Manuela Ramos (for 300 Peruvian Soles), she decided to invest it in a small business of making clothing.

She sews all kinds of clothing. She wakes up at 7 am, to prepare breakfast for her child. From there she dedicates her time to make clothing to be able to deliver them to her customers until the late hours of the night.

With this next loan of 300 Soles, which will payoff in 4 months, she will buy: clothes for adults and kids, fabrics in diverse colors, zippers, elastics, buttons, etc.

Virginia is very happy, because her business is growing a little by little. Her sales are also increasing. All of the effort she puts into her business is so that she can give her child a good education and a bright future.

Translated from Spanish by Johnny of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Virginia pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Flores del Paraíso, ubicado en el Jr Ucayali 669, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 40 años y es madre de 1 hijo. Virginia con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un pequeño negocio de confecciones.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de confecciones de ropas de todo tipo, para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar el desayuno de su hijo y de allí se dedica a la confección de sus prendas para entregárselos a sus clientes hasta tardes oras de la noche.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: ropas para damas caballeros y niño, telas de diversos colores, sierres, elásticos, botones, etc.

Virginia esta muy feliz, su negocio esta creciendo poco a poco y sus ventas también aumentan y todo el esfuerzo que realiza es para darle una buena educación y futuro a su hijo.
loan_use: Buy more merchandise to sell.

description:
Living in a city encourages Komang Rani to start the kiosk business in front of her house. She runs the business to support her husband who works a truck driver because her husband's income is not enough to cover the family's life expenses. With the initial capital of Rp. 1,000,000, Rani filled her kiosk with various kinds of merchandises such as food, drink, staples, snack, etc. Rani opens the kiosk in the morning from 6 am until 6 pm. Everyday, Rani goes to the market to buy the supplies at around 5 am as her house is quite near to the state market. Her profit is about Rp. 50,000 per day. She uses the profit to cover her daily expenses. As the price of staples is getting higher and higher nowadays, Rani feels that she needs to save some money for the future since her children are all married and live with their hussbands. She uses the loan from Dinari for adding her business capital so that she can offer more merchandise and she can expand the business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Hidup dikota membuat Komang Rani membuka usaha warung didepan rumahnya. Untuk membantu suaminya , Nengah Jasa, yang bekerja sebagai sopir truk ke Jawa . Karena Penghasilannya sebagai sopir tidak mencukupi untuk kebutuhan ekonominya. Maka Rani membantu dengan membuka warung di rumahnya.Dengan modal awal Rp.1.000.000,- Rani melengkapi isi warungnya dengan bermacam-macam barang dagangan seperti makanan, minuman,sembako ,snak,dan lain-lain. Rani membuka warungnya pada pagi hari jam 6 pagi sampai sore jam 6 sore. Setiap pagi Rani juga pergi ke pasar untuk membeli keperluan dagangannya,sekitar pukul 5 pagi,karena rumahnya dekat dengan pasar negara. Keuntungan yang diperoleh sebesar Rp.50.000,- perhari, Rani bisa mempergunakan untuk memenuhi kebutuhannya sehari-hari ,karena kebutuhan sembako harganya sangat mahal sekarang ini,maka Rani juga harus bisa menabung untuk masa depannya,karena anak-anaknya sudah semua menikah dan tinggal bersama suaminya. Pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari dipakai untuk menambah modal usahanya agar dagangannya semakin banyak dan berkembang.
loan_use: To add capital for buying more kiosk materials

description:
Aminata D., married with 08 children in her care, has been a member of the village bank of Médina Plateau in Ziguinchor for 5 years. She would like to expand her business, which consists of buying dried fish and then reselling it. Her income will allow her to improve the living conditions and health of her family. Aminata is asking for a loan which will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Aminata D., mariée, 08 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Médina Plateau à Ziguinchor depuis 5 ans. Elle veut renforcer son activité qui consiste à acheter des poissons séchés puis revendre. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie et de santé de sa famille. Aminata sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
loan_use: To buy dried fish

description: Mrs. Omosefe O. is 30 years of age; she lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is married with a child. She does hair and also sells drinks and pure water, a trade which she learned in 6 months and started in 2005. She is requesting a loan of $875 to enable her to buy more drinks, pure water, and salon materials for sale. She has been a LAPO client for 3 years.
loan_use: To buy more drinks, pure water, and salon materials for sale

description: Gloria E.’s fashion designing place is a very unique one in the sense that the styles showcased are lovely and highly demanded by her customers. She is 39 years old and married with 4 children; she lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She learned the trade for 8 years and started in 2002. She needs a loan of $450 to buy more tailoring materials for sale.
loan_use: To buy more tailoring materials for sale

description:
Natalya is married with two kids. This is an average family from Ordzhonikidze, Ukraine. However, Natalya is a unique entrepreneur. She has been selling clothing in the central city market for about a year, running her own small venture successfully. The secret of her success is simple: she tries to not only let her customers know the benefits of her products – she also gives them a sense of relationship which brings them back again and again. \r\n

\r\nPresently, Natalya has over $4000 in turnover capital. Her monthly net profit is over $500. However, she doesn’t want to stop where she is at with her venture. Natalya is seeking a loan of 2500 Ukrainian Griven to re-stock the merchandise in her kiosk for the upcoming summer season. We believe that Natalya’s desire to excel in pleasing her customers will determine her further success and encourage new customers to buy from her.
loan_use: To re-stock her inventory before summer season

description:
Yanet belongs to the “Renacer” Comunal Bank.

Yanet is a single mother, she is 24 years old, and has a very young daughter. She studied for a technical degree in computation. Yanet sells soft drinks of different brands and sizes at her father’s restaurant, which has at its specialty barbequed chicken.

Yanet needs a loan of 1500.00 soles, which she will invest in buying a variety of soft drinks. Part of the loan will be for making improvements to her house.

Yanet’s dreams are to expand her business and to provide the best for her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Yanet pertenece al Banco Comunal Renacer.

Yanet es madre soltera, tiene 24 años y 1 hija muy pequeña, estudió una carrera técnica de computación, Yanet se dedica a la venta de gaseosas de diferentes marcas y tamaños, las ventas lo realiza en el restaurante de su papa que tiene como especialidad los Pollos a la Braza.

Yanet necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas variadas y parte del préstamo será para hacer mejoras en su casa.

Los sueños de Yanet son ampliar su negocio y brindar lo mejor a su hija.
loan_use: She will use her loan of 1,500.00 soles to buy a variety of soft drinks and also to make some improvements to her house

description:
Nolvia is 37 years old, is married and has one son aged 17 years. She lives in the region of Waspan Norte in the city of Managua. Her husband works as an officer in a company and he covers the household expenses. Nolvia is a designer and the loan she is requesting is to install ceramic tiling in her home as a remodelling project to improve their way of life. The family's plans are to continue improving and remodelling their home to obtain a dignified place to live and help with the professional education for their son.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Nolvia tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo de 17 años de edad. Habita en el barrio Waspan Norte, de la ciudad de Managua. Su esposo trabaja como fiscal en una empresa y aporta a los gastos del hogar, Nolvia es diseñadora y el préstamo lo quiere para poner cerámica y mejorar su vivienda y tener un mejor nivel de vida. Los planes de la familia es seguir haciendo mejoras a su vivienda para lograr obtener un hogar digno y ayudar en la educación de su hijo para formarlos como profesionales.
loan_use: To install ceramic tiles in her home.

description:
Candida Rosa A. is a lady that makes living selling clothes which she does in her own stall at the municipal market of the City Sandino in Managua.

She started her business with little capital counting on her 3,000 cordobas (USD$ 157) from her savings and loans obtained from lenders. As time has passed, she has been able to stock her business with the support of the loans from Ceprodel, which she has used to buy merchandise and grow her business. Currently she needs to buy articles of clothing such as pants, shirts, etc. For this reason she hopes that her loan will be granted and she can continue her business of selling clothing and continue to improve the support of her home and enable her four children to continue their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Candida Rosa A. es una dama que se dedica a la labor de venta de ropa que comercializa en su propio tramo en el mercado del municipio de Ciudad Sandino en Managua.

Inició su negocio con poco capital contando con C$ 3,000 (Tres mil córdobas) obtenidos por sus ahorros propios y préstamos realizados a prestamistas. A medida que ha venido transcurriendo el tiempo ha logrado surtir su negocio apoyándose de los créditos recibidos por CEPRODEL el cual los ha utilizado para la compra de la mercadería y ampliación del negocio. Hoy en día su necesidad es la compra de la ropa como pantalones, camisas, etc. Por esta razón es que espera en que su crédito le será otorgado para así continuar con su negocio de venta de ropa para continuar llevando el sustento a su casa de habitación y así sus cuatro hijos puedan continuar estudiando.
loan_use: Purchase of merchandise

description:
Elena has three children, two daughters ages 19 and 23, and one son age 28. Eight years ago she realized she needed to find work when she separated from her husband. The money he gave to the children didn't cover the family's expenses, and after a lot of time looking for work, Elena decided to start her own business selling used clothing. Little by little she has grown her business.

She is requesting a loan, which she will repay in 3 months, to purchase more clothing to offer her customers and increase her income. Your contribution will help make this possible.

Elena, es madre de 3 hijos: 2 mujeres de 19, 23 y un varón de 28 años; desde hace 8 años se vio en la necesidad de buscar un trabajo debido a que se separo de su esposo, y con el dinero que le daban sus hijos, no le alcanzaba para cubrir los gastos familiares, después de mucho buscar decidió poner su propio negocio de venta de ropa usada, y fue así como poco a poco fueron incrementando sus ventas.

Ahora solicita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses, para surtir con ropa nueva para así tener más opciones para sus clientes, y tener un mayor ingreso. Con tu contribución Elena saldrá adelante.
loan_use: TO PURCHASE MORE USED CLOTHING TO OFFER HER CUSTOMERS.

description:
Olga started her business to support her husband with household expenses. Since her husband didn’t have a stable job, she was forced to look for a lucrative activity, and that’s how she got into selling clothes. She started two years ago, selling door to door. Now she holds events where she shows her clothes three times a week, a strategy that has resulted in greater sales.

She is presently requesting a $400 loan, to be repaid in six months, which will be invested in buying a sales rack, to be used in more frequent clothes shows.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Olga inició el negocio para salir adelante por si misma y para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares y salir adelante. Su principal necesidad fue el que su esposo no tuviera un trabajo fijo, lo que la obligó a buscar una actividad que le generara ingresos y se puso a vender ropa. Comenzó hace 2 años vendiendo casa por casa hasta realizar demostraciones 3 dias por semana, estrategia que le genero mejores ventas y es asi como ha continuado su negocio.

Ahora solicita un prestamo por US $ 400, que pagará en 6 meses, para comprar un estante para ventas y poder utilizarlo para realizar demostraciones de ropa más de 3 veces por semana.
loan_use: Purchase of a sales rack.

description:
Mayra took over her mother’s business. She decided to keep selling shoes for a living because she needed to help her parents with the household expenses, as well as raise her 2 children. She started following her mother’s footsteps 6 years ago, selling shoes by catalogue and at the local markets, until finally setting up a business space in her home.

She is requesting a loan of $400.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase a display shelf for the shoes and to restock merchandise to fill some orders.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Mayra inició el negocio para seguir con el negocio con el que contaba su madre, decidio seguir trabajando en la venta de zapatos ya que requiera apoyar a sus padres con el gasto de la casa asi como sacar a sus 2 hijos adelante. Comenzó hace 6 años seguiendo los pasos de su madre en la venta de zapatos por catalogo y mercados hasta poner un local estable en su casa.

Ella solicita un prestamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para un estante para la exibicion de los mismos y surtir pedidos pendientes por entregar.
loan_use: Purchase merchandise and a display shelf

description:
Astuti was born in Java and she went to Bali to work. She met I Putu Abdika and finally was married to him. They have a son named I Putu Pradyana Putra who is now 1 year old. Astuti's husband works in a repair shop, while Astuti runs the kiosk business. She got a loan of Rp.5,000,000 from Dinari and she used it as the business capital. She spent the money to make a simple kiosk and to purchase the supplies. She sells merchandises such as snacks, bread, coffee, and drinks. Everyday she spends about Rp. 150,000 to purchase the supplies. Astuti opens the kiosk from 7 am until 3 pm. Her daily gross income is Rp.200,000 so she can get net income Rp.50,000 per day. With the loan from Dinari, Astuti hopes she can gain more profit and she can cover all of her family's expenses.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Astuti berasal dari jawa dan merantau ke Bali. Akhirnya bertemu dengan I Putu Abdika yang sekarang menjadi suaminya.Dari perkawinan mereka memiliki 1 orang anak laki-laki yang diberi nama I Putu Pradyana Putra umur 1 tahun. Suami Astuti bekerja sebagai bengkel. Sedangkan Astuti menekuni usaha warung. Modal yang dipergunakan untuk usaha warungnya diperoleh dari pinjaman Dinari sebesar Rp.5.000.000,-. Modal ini dipergunakan untuk membuat warung yang sederhana dan sisanya untuk membeli dagangan. Adapun dagangan yang dijual seperti; makanan ringan, roti,kopi,berbagai macam minuman. Setiap hari modal yang dikeluarkan untuk membeli dagangan sebesar Rp.150,000,-. Astuti membuka warungnya mulai jam 7.00 pagi dan tutup warungnya jam 15.00 wita.Setiap hari penghasilan kotor yang didapat dari berjualan Rp.200,000,-. Jadi tiap hari penghasilan bersih Rp.50,000,-.Dengan pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari Astuti mengharapkan keuntungan yang meningkat dan bisa memenuhi semua kebutuhan rumah tangganya.
loan_use: To add business capital for getting more merchandises

description:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Hồng is 42 years old. She participates in TYM fund since 2007. Her 2 children are grown up. She has a small store selling basic goods. Her business model is to make small profit on each item to keep the price down but to sell a lot of merchandise. Her store is always busy. Her husband is very supportive of her and their 2 children do help her out. Since she just started this business, her inventory is low. This is why she is applying for a loan of 375 USD to buy more merchandise for her store. Her monthly income is around 170 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Hồng, 42 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2007. 2 người con của chị đều đã qua tuổi đi học. Công việc chính của chị là bán hàng tạp hóa. Bán được nhiều hàng nhưng ăn lãi ít đó là phương châm của chị Hồng. Vì vậy dù mới mở cửa hàng nhưng nhà chị lúc nào cũng đông khách. Chồng chị luôn giúp chị tích cực trong việc đồng áng, hai con cũng đi làm để hỗ trợ gia đinh. Mới bắt đầu nên số lượng hàng hóa bày bán cũng chưa nhiều. Vì vậy chị Hồng xin vay mức 375USD mua thêm nhiều hàng về bán phục vụ nhiều hơn cho bà con nhân dân và nâng cao mức thu nhập trong gia đình. Thu nhập bình quân của chị hiện nay khoảng 170USD/tháng.
loan_use: Buy goods for her grocery store

description:
Mrs. Phan Thi Huong, 53 years old, joined the Fund since 2006. She is living with her husband and 3 grown-up children. At first, she used her borrowed money in retailing. Her profit, together with convenient repaying method of the Fund, motivate her to borrow more money. Since price for food has been going up, Mrs. H. wants to borrow 575 USD to buy cows and sell beef. She always wishes to be able to borrow large amount of money to expand her business. Her average income is 200 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Phan Thị Hồng, 53 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2006. Chị sống cùng chồng và 3 người con đều đã trưởng thành. Số vốn vay ban đầu của Quỹ được chị đầu tư buôn bán nhỏ. Lợi nhuận thu được cộng với sự thuận lợi trong cách hoàn trả khiến chị Hồng tiếp tục xin vay những vòng tiếp theo. Hiện nay giá thực phẩm ngày càng tăng cao, chị Hồng làm đơn xin vay 575USD để mua bò về làm thịt bán. Mong muốn của chị là được vay những mức vốn lớn để mở rộng kinh doanh. Thu nhập hàng tháng của chị Hồng là 200USD.
loan_use: Buy cows

description:
Mrs Ngô Thị Liên is 51, she joined TYM fund in 2006. She lives in Hưng Tây, Hưng Nguyên with her husband and their 2 children. Her first loan was used to buy ducks for laying eggs. But because of the bird flu scare, she has switched to raising cows. The money made from this business enables her to provide good education for her 2 children: they're attending university. Her monthly income is 220 USD. This time she is requesting a loan of 750 USD to buy calves.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Ngô Thị Liên, 51 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2006. Chị sống cùng chồng và 2 người con tại xã Hưng Tây, Hưng Nguyên. Vòng đầu tiên chị vay 200USD từ Quỹ để đầu tư nuôi vịt đẻ. Sau một thời gian khi có dịch cúm gia cầm chị Liên chuyển sang chăn nuôi trâu bò. Lãi thu được chị dùng mua sắm đồ đạc và đầu tư cho hai con đang học đại học. Thu nhập bình quân hàng tháng của chị Liên hiện nay là 220USD. Vòng vốn tới chị tiếp tục xin vay 750USD mua trâu bò.
loan_use: Buy calves

description:
Gregoria has always been a hard-working woman who has wants to send her three dear children to college. Since beginning her family, she has always thought about getting ahead and helping her family prosper. This is why she began selling food and opened a small stand to sell candy and soft drinks. Every day she sells her goods until late at night so that she can sell the most that she can. Gregoria has her small candy stand in a strategic location of which she wants to take full advantage. This is why she wants to increase the variety and stock of her goods.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Gregoria, siempre fue una mujer emprendedora con el gran deseo de ofrecerle estudios superiores a sus 3 queridos hijos. Desde que formó su familia tuvo en mente salir adelante y prosperar junto a su familia, es por ello que se dedica a la venta de comida y al mismo tiempo posee un puestito de venta de golosinas y bebidas gaseosas en el que también se desempeña diariamente para ofrecer sus productos hasta altas horas de la noche con el fin de vender la mayor cantidad de mercadería posible.El puestito de venta de golosinas de doña Gregoria es muy estratégico, es por ello que desea sacarle mayor provecho, para ello tiene pensado aumentar la variedad y el stock de mercadería.
loan_use: A loan to be able to offer more goods.

description: Sak S., age 40, is a mother of four children and lives with her husband in Prey Veng, Cambodia. Before she had a small business in Prey Veng, but because of the difficulty and because it made less income she decided to move to Phnom Penh to create another business. Recently, she has become a vendor in a busy market selling eggs, and normally she receives three dollars of profit a day. Her husband is a wedding chef and earns around $2 per day. This couple has four children, one of whom is selling eggs with Ska S., two are students, and the other one is too young to attend school.\r\n\r\nShe would like to get a loan from Kiva to purchase more eggs to sell in order to expand her business, moreover, to receive more income to support the family.
loan_use: She hopes to use this loan to purchase more eggs to sell.

description:
Born in 1980 in Aného (Lacs prefecture), Akouavi B. attended school through the 9th grade. After earning her middle school diploma, and due to a lack of financial support, she couldn't continue. After finishing her training in sewing, she became an excellent seamstress. Single and without children, she has a nephew in her care. The meager income from her poorly-equipped dressmaking shop is not enough to cover expenses.

To meet the demands of her customers and to hold onto them, Ms. B. need to get better equipment. This is why she is requesting a loan for buying other sewing machines and cloth to make ready-to-wear clothing to sell. Then her income will increase in order to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Née en 1980 à Aného dans la préfecture des Lacs, Mlle B. Akouavi a fait ses études jusqu’en classe de troisième. Après son BEPC, par manque de support financier elle n’a pas pu continuer. Après sa formation en couture, elle est devenue une excellente couturière. Célibataire sans enfant, elle a en charge un neveu. Les maigres revenus de son atelier de couture très peu équipé ne suffisent pas à couvrir les charges.

Pour répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle et la maintenir, Mlle B. Akouavi a besoin de mieux s’équiper. C’est ainsi qu’elle sollicite un crédit qui servira à acheter d’autres machines à coudre et des tissus pour confectionner des habits prêt-à-porter pour la commercialisation. Ce qui augmentera ses revenus afin d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
loan_use: To buy sewing machines and cloth

description:
Born on December 31, 1969 in Dalavé in the Zio Prefecture, Mr. Komi A. is married and the father of five children, plus takes care of a nephew. After primary school, he learned motorcycle mechanics. After three years' training, he opened a workshop in Tsévié, which he manages well. His wife, who sells miscellaneous items, contributes very little to the family expenses. Dynamic and honest, Mr A. is exceptionally skilled at his trade. To be able to satisfy his customers, he is asking for a loan that he can use to buy more materials for his work, sell motor oil and buy a motorcycle for transport. This will enable him to increase his income so he can better look after his family.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 31 décembre 1969 à Dalavé dans la Préfecture du Zio, Monsieur A. Komi est marié et père de cinq (5) enfants et a en charge un neveu. Après les études primaires, il apprit la mécanique à deux roues. Après trois ans de formation, il a ouvert son atelier à Tsévié, qu’il gère bien. Sa femme, revendeuse de divers produits et contribue très peu aux charges de la famille. Dynamique et honnête, Monsieur A. Komi a une parfaite maîtrise de son métier. Pour pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle, il sollicite un crédit qui servira à l’achat d’autres matériels de travail, la vente d’huile à moteur et l’achat d’une moto pour le transport. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus afin de mieux entretenir sa famille.
loan_use: To buy a motocycle taxi and sell motor lubricant

description:
Soro Faizalievna S. lives in Fayzabad. She is 26. She lives with her family. She is married and has 2 children. She has been selling vegetables and fruit for two years. She has a shop in the area’s central market. She wants to increase her sales volume by taking out a loan. It will help her make her business more profitable as well as help provide the population with fresh vegetables. She plans to pay off the debt in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer

Сатторова Соро Файзалиевна жительница района Файзабад. Возраст 26 лет. Живет со своей семьей. Она замужем и имеет 2 детей. Два года занимается торговлей овощей и фруктов. Имеет торговую точку на центральном рынке района. Хочет увеличить товарооборот , путем получения кредита. Он поможет ей увеличить прибыльность бизнеса , а так же поможет обеспечить население свежими овощами. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.
loan_use: Increase sales volume

description:
Asha M., is 52 years old and is a widow. She has seven children between the ages of 38 and 12. Asha provides for her home by running a small butcher shop, where she works from 7am to 6pm daily. She started this business three years ago and now makes a monthly profit of about $135 from her sales.\r\n

Asha hopes for a loan to open another small butcher shop. She will share this loan with her loan group called Serena, which has 23 members. In the picture, Asha is in the second row, second from the right in the pink scarf.
loan_use: To open another butchery
borrower_names: Mtetwa, Maimuna, Hadija, Halima, Joyce, Asha, Mwanahawa, Shani, Asha, Prisca, Asha, Stumai, Hadija, Augustino, Neema, Chiku, Asha, Amina, Subira, Agatha, Halima, Abdalah, Watende
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, male, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, male, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, false, true, false, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Bernadette D. is 51 years old, a widow, and the mother of three. She is therefore responsible for all household expenses for her family. Given this difficult situation, Bernadette has found hope and strength. She runs a boutique in Kpalimé, where she sells plastic goods, but there is more. Three times a week, she travels with her merchandise to neighboring villages to make sales in marketplaces. This motivation has earned her a lot of profit, which she uses to improve her family's living conditions. With this loan, Bernadette hopes to bolster her boutique by purchasing new plastic items for retail sale.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame Bernadette D. est âgée de 51 ans, veuve et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est donc responsable de toutes les charges du foyer pour sa famille. Avec cette difficulté, Bernadette a trouvé l’espoir et la puissance. Elle opère une boutique à Kpalimé ou elle vend les plastiques, mais elle n’arrête pas là. Trois fois par semaine Bernadette voyage avec ses marchandises dans les villages environnants pour vendre aux marchés. Cette motivation l’a fait gagner beaucoup de profits qu’elle utilise pour améliorer les conditions de la vie de sa famille. Avec ce crédit, Bernadette espère renforcer sa boutique dans un l’achat des nouveaux plastiques pour revendre.
loan_use: Bolster her boutique by buying new plastic items

description:
Abena M. is a 60-year-old widow mother of seven children. She is a trader who trades in tomatoes, yams, onions, beans, maize, dried fish and other goods from a tabletop in the local market. Abena says her husband died several years ago and through this business she has managed to support her seven children to finish school and enter the workforce. She is, however, convinced that her business can grow better with increased capital and therefore wants the loan to buy more tubers, baskets of tomatoes, onions, bags of maize and beans to increase her stock and make bigger income to put up a decent shelter.\r\n

\r\nAbena belongs to the community group called Okamafo (Deliverer) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans.
loan_use: To buy more yams, baskets of tomatoes, onions, bags of maize and beans.

description:
Ms. Cao Thi L., 51 years old, joined TYM Fund in 1997. Two of her children already got married. She lives with her husband and three other children. Their main jobs are farming and breeding animals. The types of animals she breeds are also varied: chickens, ducks, pigs, geese, and buffaloes, depending on each season, the condition of the economy, and the local weather. Since investing in the farm brings good profit, each year Ms. L. is able to borrow more money from TYM Fund. On average, her income from breeding animals is about 2000 USD per year. Her three children are working and helping her whenever she finds difficulty with the repayments. This coming loan cycle, Ms. L. applies for a loan of 625USD to buy more ducks, chickens, and their food.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Cao Thị Liên, 51 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 1997. 2 người con đã có gia đình riêng, chị Liên sống cùng chồng và 3 con. Công việc chủ yếu của gia đình là làm ruộng và chăn nuôi. Loại hình chăn nuôi cũng rất đa dạng: gà, vịt, lợn, ngan, trâu tùy mùa vụ và tình hình kinh tế, thời tiết của địa phương. Đầu tư chăn nuôi có hiệu quả, số vốn vay từ Quỹ tăng dần lên qua các năm. Bình quân thu nhập từ chăn nuôi của chị Liên khoảng 2000USD/năm. 3 con của chị đều đi làm và hỗ trợ mẹ mỗi khi có khó khăn. Vòng vốn sắp tới chị Liên làm đơn xin vay 625USD để mua thêm vịt, gà và thức ăn gia súc.
loan_use: Buy ducks, chickens

description:
Mrs. Salamatou A. was born in 1957; she is married to a carpenter and is the mother of seven (07) children. She sells wood coal. She alone provides financial support for the family and she fights day and night to see her trade flourish. Unfortunately, she is limited by financial constraints and needs financial support. This is why she is requesting a loan to strengthen her business.

\r\n

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

\r\nNée en 1957, madame Salamatou A. est mariée à un menuisier et mère de sept (07) enfants. Elle est revendeuse de charbons de bois. Elle porte sur elle seule tout le poids des charges familiales et se bat nuit et jour pour faire prospérer son commerce. Malheureusement elle est financièrement limitée et nécessite un appui financier. C’est pourquoi elle demande un crédit pour renforcer son commerce.
loan_use:
Purchase and sell of wood coal

\r\nAchat et vente de charbons de bois

description:
Born in 1951 in Lomé, Mrs. Adjoagan Lucienne A. is separated from her husband who began taking additional wives twenty years ago. Since then she has been taking care of her children by herself with her small grocery and basic goods business. She is seeking financing to expand the size of her business and to stock food products in bulk to better satisfy her customer demand. This will allow her to increase her income in order to better take care of her children. \r\n

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

\r\nNé en 1951 à Lomé, madame Adjoagan Lucienne A. s’est séparé de son mari qui est devenu polygame il y a de cela 20 ans. Depuis lors elle a pris soin de ses enfants seuls avec son petit commerce produits alimentaires de premières nécessités. Elle sollicite un fonds de financement pour agrandir la taille de son commerce et s’approvisionner en grande quantité en produits alimentaires et mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. Ceci lui permettra d’accroître ses revenus afin de mieux s’occuper de ses enfants.
loan_use: Retail of grocery products

description:
Mrs. Mercedes is 52 years old, she is single and lives in the community of San Jose Oriental in the city of Managua, she has 3 children of 15, 18 and 20 years of age. Mrs. Mercedes prepares and sells tortillas, her business is called El Mana and has 10 years working on this activity, which she started with her own effort.

She is requesting the loan to acquire supplies to prepare tortillas to improve her business and be able to grow and get more profit and therefore improve her life and her children’s life and to teach them to work and have an honest life.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Mercedes tiene 52 años de edad, es soltera y habita en el barrio San José Oriental de la ciudad de Managua, tiene 3 hijos de 15, 18 y 20 años de edad. Doña Mercedes se dedica a la venta de tortillas, su negocio se llama El Maná y tiene 10 años de estar con esta actividad, la cual empezó con esfuerzo propio.

Requiere del préstamo para adquirir materia prima para la elaboración de tortillas para así poder fortalecer más su negocio y en un futuro poder agrandarlo más y explotarlo lo suficiente para generar más ganacias y así poder darles una mejor vida a sus hijos al mismo tiempo que les quiere enseñar a trabajar y a ganarse la vida de una forma honesta.
loan_use: To buy supplies to prepare tortillas / Comprar materia prima para la elaboración de sus tortillas

description:
Fahriddin A. lives in the city of Vahdat. He is 30 years old, is married and has 2 children. Fahriddin is in business of purchasing and reselling building materials. He has a medium sized store on the Vahdat market. This business is the only source of income for his family. Right now is summer and people begin to do repair work in their homes. This is why Fahriddin would like to increase the variety of goods he has for sale and is in need of a loan. He plays to repay the loan within a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Абдулхамедов Фахриддин житель города Вахдат . Возраст 30 лет , женат , имеет 2 детей. Образование средне-техническое. Фахриддин занимается куплей продажей строительных материалов. Он имеет небольшой магазин на рынке города Вахдат .Этот бизнес является единственным источником дохода его семьи. Сейчас лето и люди начинают делать в своих домах ремонт. Поэтому клиент хочет увеличить ассортимент товара своей точки ,для чего ему нужны деньги. Поэтому он решил взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев
loan_use: Increase the variety of goods for sale

description: Mr. Chuks E. is 43 years and married with three children. He lives in Benin City in Edo State in Nigeria. He is a motorcycle rider. He learned his trade over four years and started riding in 2000. He needs a loan of $875.00 to buy a motorcycle. He is very grateful to LAPO Microfinance and Kiva.
loan_use: To buy a motorcycle.

description: Mrs. Magdalene I. is 51 years old and married with seven children. She lives in Benin City in Edo State in Nigeria. She sells kerosene, a trade she learned from a friend. She started her business in 2004. She is requesting a loan of $875.00 to enable her buy more kerosene to sell.
loan_use: To buy more kerosene to sell.

description:
Elvira is married, and she has two children, who are eight and ten. Her husband is a mechanic. She started her business three years ago because she needed to support her husband, who was faced with extra expenses. Due to the lack of money for their children and the commitment to help their family get ahead, she started selling cosmetics by catalog. This activity has allowed her to have income to help her husband give a better quality of life to their children.

Now she needs a loan of $500, which she will repay in 5 months, to purchase merchandise and to be able to sell more. With your support, she will be able to continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Elvira es casada, tiene 2 hijos de 10 y 8 años, su esposo es tecnico en mecanica. Inició el negocio hace 3 años porque ocupaba apoyar a su esposo ya que se le presentaron gastos extras, ante la falta de dinero para sus hijos y compromiso de sobresalir con su familia, inicio con la venta de cosmeticos por catalogo, actividad que la he permitido tener ingresos para poder ayudar a su esposo a darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $500 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar mercancia ya asi poder vender mas, con tu apoyo ella podra continuar con su negocio.
loan_use: To purchase merchandise

description:
Flor belongs to the Communal Bank “Las Mercedes,” and she sells veterinary supplies in her store located in the Carhuaz district and province of Ancash state.

With the S/.1,000.00 nuevos soles loan, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy 3 cases of vaccines, antibiotics, vitamins and dewormers.

She is 54 years old, married, and her husband supports her in this business. Her income enables her to educate their three children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Flor, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Mercedes, tiene su veterinaria, que esta ubicado en el distrito y provincia D. Carhuaz, departamento D. Ancash. Con este prestamos D. S/. 1, 000.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará 3 cajas D. vacunas, antibióticos, vitaminas, productos para parásitos. Ella tiene 54 años D. edad es casada, su esposo la apoya en este negocio, sus ingresos le permite educar a sus 3 hijos.
loan_use: Purchase veterinary supplies to sell

description:
Amina M., 42, married mother of 3 children, sells charcoal and groundnuts in a nearby community market. She has been in this business for almost twelve years now. With this business, she has supported her first son to complete senior high school. She wants to use this loan to buy more supplies of charcoal and bags of groundnuts to increase her stock. She believes this will help to provide her with increased income for her children’s education.

Amina belongs to the community group called Twen Awurade Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access a loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.
loan_use: To buy more charcoal and bags of groundnuts for re-sale

description:
Teo K. is a 40-year-old widow with six children. The oldest is 27; three are still in school. She works in Wakaliga, a semi-urban area just outside Kampala where she sells waragi, or local brew. She buys it wholesale in 20-liter jerry cans in a nearby village for 30,000 Ugandan shillings (about $17 US) and retails it for 50,000 shillings (close to $30).

She has been doing this business for the past two years. With a new loan, she will be able to buy more and invest her capital. The extra money will help her look after her children at home, especially with the school fees for their education. Her future goal is to buy a plot in Bulenga, a Kampala suburb (within the city limits) and build a house.

Teo has successfully paid back more than five loans.
loan_use: To buy more stock to sell

description:
This Comite San Rafael group of women was formed in October 2006. Maria Teresa Franco and Juliana V. initiated the first meeting and convinced 16 ladies to work together to form the group in order to have access to capital. Excited about the idea, the ladies decided to form a committee in order to bring prosperity to their families.

The ladies are involved in many business activities such as: running grocery stores and selling fruit, clothes, bags, shoes, drinks and sheets among others. The money provided by Kiva lenders will be used to purchase these goods.

The Committee of Entrepreneuring women is a program carried out by Fundación Paraguaya which targets groups of enterprising women who create a village bank through which they receive assistance in terms of loans. The main goal is to give them the opportunity to carry out economic activities which enable them to live in dignity and contribute to a better quality of life in their homes. Lending to poor women creates a cascading effect that brings social and economic benefits to a whole family, and thus to the entire community. What is more, the sense of belonging to a group gives these women the energy and motivation to reach success.
loan_use: The money provided by Kiva lenders will be used to purchase fruits, clothes, bags, shoes, drinks and sheets.
borrower_names: Alice, Gladys, María Delia, Juana, Juana, Rosalinda, Lucila, Juliana, Venancia, Fermina, Norma, Maria Zunilda, Petrona, Delia, Irma, María Mercedes, Lidia
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, false, true, true, true

description:
The Committee of Entrepreneuring women is a program carried out by Fundación Paraguaya which targets groups of enterprising women who create a village bank through which they receive assistance in terms of loans. The main goal is to give them the opportunity to carry out economic activities which enable them to live in dignity and contribute to a better quality of life in their homes. Lending to poor women creates a cascading effect that brings social and economic benefits to a whole family, and thus to the entire community. What is more, the sense of belonging to a group gives these women the energy and motivation to reach success.

Yolanda A. contacted her friends and neighbors and told them about the committee. She shared with these women her desire of changing their world for the better by working very hard. Yolanda’s hopeful words stimulated optimism among these women and they decided to form a Committee.

The members of the commitee are involved in many different business activities such as the sales of cosmetics, food, gift wraps, cloths, jewellery, cleaning products and drinks.

The money provided by Kiva lenders will be used to purchase

1. Food ingredients such as meat, chicken, ham, cheese, bread, eggs, vegetables, pastas, etc;

2. Drinks such as Coke, beers, wine, soft drinks; and

3. Clothes such as T-shirts, socks, pants and shoes
loan_use: To purchase food ingredients such as meat, chicken, ham, cheese, bread, eggs, vegetables, pastas, etc; drinks such as Coke, beers, wine, soft drinks; clothes such as t-shirts, socks, pants and shoes.
borrower_names: Salvadora, Beatriz, Lourdes, Ignacia, Maria Celsa, Maria, María Luisa, Nilda, Gladys, Hilda, Yolanda, Carmen, Eva, Mirtha, Verónica, Pelagia, Estanislaa
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, false, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Two months ago, Miriam started a bookstore in her house. It was her son who gave her the idea to start the store, because he saw that in the neighborhood they needed this type of business. However, for two years Miriam has also been selling shoes by the order.

The loans that she has received have been used to travel to Trujillo, eight hours from Lima to buy wholesale shoes. She travels in selling seasons, like school season, July 28th or Christmas. She brings back between three and four dozens of shoes. Her clients are her neighbors or people her sister knows, Miriam's sister helps in the sales. Miriam wants to buy more merchandise to supply her store and expand it as a bazaar.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 2 meses, Miriam tiene una librería ubicada en su casa. Fue su hijo quien le dio la idea de poner esta tienda, pues vió que en su barrio hacía falta un negocio de este tipo. Sin embargo, Miriam también se dedica a la venta de zapatos por pedido desde hace 2 años.

Los préstamos que ella ha recibido han sido para viajar a Trujillo, a 8 horas de Lima, y comprar zapatos por mayor. Ella viaja en campañas de ventas, como en época escolar, 28 de julio o Navidad. Trae entre 3 y 4 docenas de zapatos. Sus clientes son sus vecinos o los conocidos de su hermana, quien es intermediaria en la venta. Miriam quiere comprar más mercadería para surtir su tienda y ampliarla como un bazar.
loan_use: Buy merchandise for store.

description: Isatu is 37 years old and married with three children.  Her husband works as a driver and his income is insufficient to meet the family expenses. Isatu sells yogurt in a Kabala market to supplement her husband's income.  With her previous loans, she increased her yogurt stock by two barrels. The demand for yogurt is especially high during the school period.  Isatu is requesting a loan of Le.1,200,000 to increase her stock and generate more income.
loan_use: To purchase more yogurt for resale

description:
Long S. is 45 years of age. She sells traditional Khmer noodles from her roadside shop in Siem Reap province. She does fairly well, earning $5 USD per day of profit.

Her husband, Sek Saren, is a construction worker. Construction work is readily available in a developing province like Siem Reap, which draws over a million tourists each year. He earns $7 USD per day. They have a somewhat large family with five children. Two of the older kids are already employed, one as a teacher, and another as a construction worker alongside his father.

Long S. wants to take out a loan to buy rice in bulk, which she will then resell. Rice prices are currently high and she thinks this will be a reliable source of extra money.
loan_use: To buy rice in bulk.

description:
Muhabbat P. is 37 years old. She is married with four children, all of whom are in school except for her oldest son, who is in his freshman year of university. As any mother, she wants her children to have everything they need, and she dreams that all of them will be able to receive higher education.

\r\nShe and her husband are both farmers. She has been working the land for six years. In fact, she began cultivating her land through her and her oldest son’s efforts, and she has gradually gotten ahead in life with such efforts. On the cultivated land, Muhabbat grows wheat, rice, and maize. When it is prime growing season, Muhabbat works in the field from early morning until late at night. She is proud to say that her business is one of her greatest accomplishments in life.

\r\nMuhabbat is planning to cover the higher education expenses of her second son because he is soon finishing school and is about to enter university. Therefore, Muhabbat is applying for a loan for the first time, seeking 2,000 Somoni ($600) over a term of 12 months. With the loan proceeds, Muhabbat is planning to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer, and she use the remaining proceeds to pay the salaries of her hired seasonal workers. Muhabbat thanks everyone who trusted her and for their support, and she promises to pay the loan in a timely manner.
loan_use: To pay for her children's higher education fees by purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer, and by using the remaining loan proceeds to pay the salaries of her seasonal workers

description:
Lea C. is 39 years old and lives in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She is a tailor, working out of her home each day sewing traditional Khmer clothing and making additions and repairs to older clothing. She earns $2 USD per day. Her husband is a government official in the local office. These positions are often grossly underpaid, as evidenced by the $2 USD he earns per day.

Even with their meager salaries, the couple supports five children. The oldest works as a motor-taxi driver to support his family, also earning $2 USD per day on average. They need to develop additional sources of income if they are to continue to support their large family. Even dual incomes are rarely enough to support families in poorer countries like Cambodia.

Lea C. would like to buy a motorbike for her second oldest son to operate as a taxi, adding to the family income.
loan_use: To buy a motorbike to operate as a taxi

description: Long M. is 24 years old and lives in Siem Reap province. She sells produce and various food products outside a local Buddhist temple. Long reports doing quite well, actually earning $50 US on a good day! This puts her at the top of her trade easily, earning much more than the average grocery store owner. One of the reasons for her success is high sales to people who buy offerings for the temple each day. Her husband is also a hard worker, doing electrical and mechanical work on cars. He earns about $5 US per day. The young couple has one child, who is too young to attend school. Long M. wants a loan to invest in her already quite successful business; she will further boost her inventory to respond to customer demand.
loan_use: To buy more grocery products.

description:
The primary economy of Paraguya relies on beef cattle an on agriculture. With this in mind, Perfecto P. purchases livestock. In current day he has 20 milk cows, 14 calves, and 4 horses. Perfecto sells the milk and he starts his days in the early hours of the morning to care for his cows and to later distribute and make his sales with a small cart.

Perfecto cares for his animals as if they were his daughters, each one even has a name. Perfecto cares for them with a great leave of love and they always obey him.

In future Perfecto wishes to purchase a car to facilitate the distribution of his milk products.

The funds of the credit requested will be invested in milk processing machines to prepare for sales.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Las principales actividades económicas del Paraguay son la ganadería y la agricultura. Teniendo en cuenta esto, Perfecto P. compro animales; actualmente cuenta con 20 vacas lecheras, 14 vaquillas y 4 caballos. Perfecto vende leche y se levanta tempranas horas de la madrugada para ordenar las vacas y así después procesarlas para luego distribuirlas y venderlas en su carrito.

Perfecto cuida a sus vacas como si fueron sus hijas, inclusive cada una de ellas tiene nombre, y Perfecto las trata con mucho cariño, es por eso que ellas siempre lo obedecen. En un futuro Perfecto desea comprar un automóvil que le facilite la distribución de la leche.

El dinero del crédito solicitado será invertido en maquinas para el procesamiento de la leche para su venta.
loan_use: To purchase a milk processing machine.

description:
Francisco started out as an assistant in a repair and body shop. That's how he acquired his knowledge in the field. A few years later he decided to open his own garage with the help of his brother.

Francisco is 35 years of age and has been married for eight years to Cristina del Rocio Figueredo who is 29 years old. The couple has a 4-year old daughter. Cristina has always dreamed of being a teacher. So when they got married Francisco paid for Cristina's university studies to help her realize her dream. Today is a teacher in a school, and she also supports the family with another source of income.

The two are hard working people and they are building their own house. The funds of the credit requested will be invested in building materials and to pay for labour in the completion of their house.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Francisco empezó a trabajar como asistente en un taller de chapería y pintura. Es ahí donde adquirió conocimientos en el rubro. Unos años después decidió abrir su propio taller con la ayuda de su hermano.

Francisco tiene 35 años de edad está casado hace 8 años con la Sra. Cristina del Rocío Figueredo de 29 años de edad, la pareja tiene una hija de 4 años. Cristina siempre soñó con ser docente, entonces cuando la pareja se caso, Francisco pago los estudios universitarios de Cristina para ayudarla a realizar su sueno. Actualmente ella es profesora en una escuela, y así también es otra fuente de ingresos para la familia.

Los dos son personas muy trabajadoras que están construyendo su casa propia. Es por eso que el dinero del crédito solicitado será invertido en la materiales y mano de obra para la finalización de su casa.
loan_use: To purchase construction materials such as bricks, cements, sand, and paint.

description:
Isauro started his business because of the family tradition. Since his entire family has been in this business, this spurred him to start in the business also. For 15 years he has had a butcher shop and he also enjoys preparing braised pork. He started in Cadereyta, when on trying some braised pork he noted that the flavor and preparation were not like in his home town. Knowing how to prepare them better, he decided to start his business in that town.

He needs a loan of $775, which will be repaid in 6 months, to improve his location and maintain his van.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Isauro inició el negocio por tradicion familiar, puesto que toda su familia se dedican a eso para el fue un estimulo para iniciarse en el negocio, hace 15 años tenia una carniceria y despues le gusto la preparacion de las carnitas. Comenzó en Cadereyta, cuando al probar unas carnitas noto que el sabor y la elaboracion no eran como en su ciudad natal, por lo que al saber elaboralas decidio inicar su negocio de este giro.

El necesita un prestamo por US $775 que pagara en 6 meses para mejorar el local y mantenimiento de la camioneta.
loan_use: To remodel his butcher shop and repair his van.

description:
Efraín is a responsible father who, seeing the strategic location where his home was located, decided to outfit it so he could open a small concession stand. He offers delicious cakes, sodas, hamburgers, juices and yogurts. He prepares his items personally for his regular and demanding customers. Thanks to this business which he started more than four years ago, and the income earned by his dear wife at her restaurant, they maintain their home and provide an education for their child.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Efraín es un padre muy responsable, observando el lugar estratégico en que está ubicado su domicilio decidió aprovechar y adecuarlo para abrir un pequeño snack en donde ofrece deliciosas tortas, gaseosas, hamburguesas, jugos y, yogures. Que personalmente prepara para sus asiduos y exigentes clientes.Gracias a este negocio que emprendió hace más de 4 años y a los ingresos que obtiene su querida esposa en su restaurante mantienen su hogar y le otorgan educación a su pequeño.
loan_use: Increase of capital to make improvements to work area.

description:
Fortunata and her hardworking husband come from the district of Orurillo-Melgar, a humble little town with few work opportunities. Since deciding to relocate to the city of Juliaca, they have tried at every opportunity to proviD. the best possible quality of life for their four dear children. Fortunata, despite lack of experience, decided to dedicate herself to selling food as a traveling saleswoman. She started by selling traditional dishes from her town but, little by little, she began improving her seasonings and varying her offerings. Meanwhile, her husband Jorge worked for security, but in his spare time he assists his wife with her business activities. Fortunata’s wish is to purchase kitchen utensils and expand her business, and with this investment she will improve her image.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Fortunata y su laborioso esposo son naturales del distrito D. Orurillo- Melgar, pueblito humilD. con pocas oportunidades D. trabajo. DesD. que decidieron emigrar hacia la ciudad D. Juliaca tratan en todo momento poner lo mejor D. sí para ofrecerles una mejor calidad D. vida a sus 4 queridos hijos.Doña Fortunata pese a la poca experiencia y cualidades que tenía para la cocina decidió dedicarse a la venta D. comida en forma ambulatoria. Inició vendiendo platos típicos D. su pueblito, pero poco a poco fue mejorando su sazón y variando sus potajes, mientras que su querido esposo Jorge trabaja como seguridad pero en sus horas libres no duda en colaborar con la actividad D. su amada esposa. El deseo D. Doña Fortunata es adquirir utensilios D. cocina e implementar su negocio, con esta inversión mejorará su imagen.
loan_use: Purchase of utensils and improving her place of sales.

description:
Nigora S. lives in the city of Tursun-Zoda. She is 39 years old, married, and has 5 children. She has been working in the trading business for two years and has her own small shop in the local market. Her husband brings in shoes to sell from the city of Dushanbe. Selling these shoes is her family's only source of income. In order to improve her family's lives, and also supply goods to the population, Nigora needs to increase her cash-flow. She needs a loan to be able to do this and will be able to repay it within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Dan Ostrovsky, Kiva volunteer.

Шарипова Нигора проживает в городе Турсун-заде. Возраст 39 лет , замужем и имеет 5 детей. Два года занимается торговлей . Имеет торговую точку на рынке города. Продает обувь, которую привозит из города Душанбе. Товар привозит ее муж. Поэтому их бизнес это единственный источник дохода их семьи. Для того , чтобы улучшить условия жизни , а так же помочь населению с обеспечением необходимых товаров Нигоре необходимо увеличить товароборот. А для этого она должна получить кредит . Погашать сможет в течении 12 месяцев.
loan_use: Increase Cash-flow

description:
Fruit sales is the principal activity of the “Chascañawi” association (translated to Spanish it means big eyes with long eyelashes, in a quechua accent), they have been working with the Pro-Mujer family for more than 10 years.

Every week they travel to the Luribay (La Paz) y Chapare (Cochabamba) to purchase a variety of fruits that are later sold at different open markets throughout the city of La Paz and El Alto. Their children usually conduct the sales since they are no longer attending school and need to staff the stalls while their parents make the aforementioned trips to purchase fruits.

The group needs larger loans to inject capital into their businesses, since the prices of products have dramatically increased. By generating higher revenues it will increase their quality of life as well at their children’s lives.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

La venta de fruta es la actividad principal de la asociación “Chascañawi” ( traducido al castellano significa ojos grandes con pestañas largas, en voz quechua) , que trabaja con la familia de Pro-Mujer hace mas de 10 años aproximadamente.

Cada semana viajan a la localidad de Luribay (La Paz) y Chapare (Cochabamba) para adquirir variedad de frutas, para luego ofrecerlas en los distintos mercados de la ciudad de La Paz y El Alto, venta que por lo general la realizan con la ayuda de sus hijos, que muchos de estos tuvieron que dejar sus estudios para atender los puestos de venta mientras sus padres realizan los mencionados viajes para la compra de fruta.

Necesitan mayores créditos para inyectar capital a sus negocios, ya que dichos productos tuvieron una alza elevada en sus precios. Generando mayores ingresos conseguirán mejorar su calidad de vida junto a la de sus hijos.
loan_use: Need more capital to purchase products that have increased in price.
borrower_names: Carmen, Reyna, Amalia, Margarita, Josefina, Alicia, Teodora, Sonia, Primitiva, Juana, Elvira, Guillermina
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Mohamad is a 25 year old father of 1. He lives and works in southern Lebanon, in Saida and owns a coffee shop.

\r\nThis is the second time he is applying for a loan at A. Majmoua because he needs to buy provisions for his business. The income generated from this investment will help him pay a part of his house payments.
loan_use: To buy provisions

description: Nidal is 31 years old and lives and works in southern Lebanon, in Saida. Nidal owns a mini market and is applying for a loan because he needs to buy merchandise to sustain and develop his business.
loan_use: To buy merchandise

description:
Elizabeth A. sells childrens clothing at the local market. Her husband lives and works in Spain and his income is not sufficient to pay the expenses of Elizabeth and six dependents. \r\n

\r\nA loan will allow her to purchase a wider variety of clothing, thus increasing her sales and profits.
loan_use: To purchase a larger inventory of childrens clothing for resale

description:
Kankou Kouyaté is a 46-year-old married woman and the mother of five children (two boys and three girls). She lives in a monogamous family with her husband and the children. She started working in commerce at an early age and (now) has thirty years of experience. Before joining the SORO YIRIWASO loan program, she had some difficulties running her business well because of meager working capital. With this loan, she expects to expand her business and to diversify it.

She gets her stock in Bamako at the Medina Coura marketplace from recognized wholesale merchants, and she sell it retail in Bougouni. She sells each day in Bougouni. The different goods are displayed in small piles or in small bags on a large table. Her customers are composed essentially of women who come to buy condiments each day to cook meals.

The turnover of her business is very high, and she realizes a monthly profit of 46,000 francs CFA. Thanks to this profit, Ms. Kankou Kouyaté ensures coverage of certain family expenses by helping her husband in particular.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame Kankou Kouyaté est une femme mariée de 46 ans et mère de 5 enfants 2 garcons et 03 filles. Elle vit dans une famille monogame avec son mari et les enfants. Elle a commencé les activités économique dès son jeune âge avec une experience de 30ans, Avant d’intégrer le programme de crédit de SORO YIRIWASO madame Kankou Kouyaté avait certaines difficultés pour menrer à bien son activité à cause de la faiblesse de son fonds de roulement. Avec ce pret elle compte augmenter la taille et diversifier lson activité

Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako au marché de Medina Coura à Bamako, auprès de grossistes reconnus et revend à Bougouni. Elle vend tous les jours au marché de Bougouni. Les différents produits sont exposés en petit tas ou dans des sachets sur un grand étable Sa clientèle est composée essentiellement de femmes qui viennent acheter quotidiennement les condiments pour préparer les plats..

La rotation de son activité est très élévée et elle réalise un bénéfice mensuel de 46 000 FCFA. Grâce à ce bénéfice Madame Kankou Kouyaté assure certaines depenses de la famille en aidant surtout son mari.
loan_use: To buy and sell condiments

description:
Señora Lisset V. lives with her partner. She was born on October 29, 1982 and is 25 years old. She has three children who depend upon her and her husband. She has completed her high school studies and lives with her in-laws in Prolongación Cesar Vallejo in El Palomar, Trujillo, Perú.

Since 2007, she has sold clothing for women, men, children, and babies. At a minimum she has done this to help her husband financially with the household expenses.

She received her first loan of 300.00 Soles from the Manuela Ramos Movement which she used entirely to buy merchandise. She belongs to the group “Mientras Tanto Estrellas De Jesus.”

With a loan of 1200.00 Soles ($425) that she will repay in 4 months, she will buy clothing for the winter season like Peruvian alpaca sweaters, jackets, turtlenecks, overalls, etc. She delivers orders placed by her relatives, friends, and even clients to their homes.

Judith dreams of having a more stable business with a store where she can sell in better conditions and, later on, build a house for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lisset V., es conviviente, nació el 29 de octubre del año 1982, tiene 25 años, con 03 hijos dependientes aún de ella y de su esposo, tiene estudios secundarios completos, y vive junto a sus suegros en la Prolongación Cesar Vallejo en la Urb. El Palomar - Trujillo – Perú.

Desde el año 2007, se dedica a la venta de ropa de damas, caballeros, niños y de bebe, al por menor como un medio para ayudar a su pareja económicamente en los gastos del hogar.

Recibió un primer préstamo otorgado por el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, de S/.300.oo, lo invertio completamente en la compra de mercadería. Pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto “Estrellas De Jesus”.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1200. el cual cancelará en 4 meses lo invertirá en la compra de ropa de temporada invierno esto es chompas, casacas, cafarenas, buzos, etc. ella trabaja la modalidad de reparto a domicilio de los pedidos que le hacen sus familiares, amigas y demás clientes.

Judith sueña con tener un negocio más estable con un local donde pueda vender en mejores condiciones, y así más adelante construir su casa para su familia.
loan_use: Purchase of Merchandise

description:
Enma Cristina R. es from the municipal, Condega in the city of Esteli. Enma is working on her education at a small community college. She is the mother of a small child, and feels the need to give him every opportunity she can for his development. For this reason she decided to reconstruct her house to improve conditions for her son because of the simple reason that over time her house has been devastated by natural phenomena.

Since the initiation of the reconstruction of her house, she has felt the need to stop the work for a moment to obtain economic resources. With this motive, she is again looking to Ceprodel to obtain credit to buy construction materials. Thanks to this credit, Enma has advanced the reconstruction, and at the same time has acquired sofas to furnish her home. Her credit record is five credits.

Translated by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Enma Cristina R. es originaria del municipio de Condega en la ciudad de Estelí. Se dedica a la labor de docencia en un pequeño colegio de la comunidad. Actualmente es madre de un pequeño hijo con la necesidad de brindarle todas las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo. Por esta razón es que ella decidió reconstruir su casa de habitación para dar mejores condiciones a su hijo por la sencilla razón de que a través del tiempo su casa había sufrido grandes daños por motivos de los fenómenos naturales.

Al haber iniciado en la reconstrucción de su vivienda se vio en la obligación de detener la obra por un momento para obtener el recurso económico. Por este motivo es que una vez mas hoy acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción. Gracias a estos créditos ha avanzado su reconstrucción habiendo de igual manera adquirido sofás para amueblar su hogar. Actualmente su record crediticio es de cinco créditos.
loan_use: Construction Materials

description:
Son O., 46 years old, lives in Kampong Cham Province, where she and her daughter share a business selling charcoal from village to village. Together they earn $5 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver who adds an additional $4 per day to the family income. Son O. is now requesting a loan to enhance her charcoal business. She plans to buy a trailer to hook up to the back of a motorbike to transport the charcoal each day from village to village. This will save her and her daughter both time and money.

\r\nHer husband, Bun Thob, is pictured here, as she was unavailable to be photographed.
loan_use: To buy a trailer.

description:
Araba F. sells palm oil. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient to cover the expenses of Araba and her five children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

\r\nShe is asking for additional capital to expand her business.
loan_use: Additional capital to expand her business

description: Jalil K. is 53 years old, married and he and his wife raised three children. All of their children are married except one who lives at home. Jalil sells clothing and shoes for women in the local central market which is called “Panjshanbe”. Once a week Jalil travels to the neighboring city Istaravshan to purchase new goods to sell. His younger son (who is pictured in the photo) helps Jalil with the business. Jalil and his son are very polite and open people by nature, and this helps them in their business. For 10 years he has managed to have great clientele. Jalil‘s business is stable and brings the main income, allowing his family to improve their living conditions and make their plans for the future. This year is very important for Jalil as he is going to arrange the marriage of his elder son. For this reason he wants to increase the range of his goods. With this purpose he requests $600 US Dollars for the term of 6 months. The loan will be spent on new summer clothing and shoes for women. Jalil would like to thank everyone for their support and promises to pay the loan in time. Jalil is counting on your help. With your help he can arrange the marriage of his dear eldest son.
loan_use: Jalil would like to purchase of the new clothing and shoes for women in order to increase the range of goods for selling.

description:
Aristides started working in a service station, but for various reasons, the station unfortunately had to close and the company was obligated to give Aristides a one-time severance pay. When Aristides received the money, he was very astute and decided to invest it in starting his own small business that he could use to generate greater income.

Due to his great interest in animals and due to the fact that his brother is studying to be a veterinarian, he decided to open a veterinary store. The work is very well organized; while Aristides sells animal food and medicine, his brother does vaccinations. The two work together in a very efficient way which has brought them more and more customers.

This loan will be used to purchase balanced meals for animals.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

Arístides inicio trabajando en una estación de servicio, por diversos motivos, la compañía tuvo que cerrar entonces se vieron obligados a pagarle a Arístides una indemnización. Cuando Arístides recibió esta suma de dinero fue muy inteligente y no dudo en invertir en una microempresa que le pueda generar más dinero.

Debido a su gran pasión por los animales y debido al hecho que su hermano estudia veterinaria decidió abrir una veterinaria. El trabajo esta muy bien organizado; mientras Arístides vende remedios y alimentos para animales, su hermano se dedica a la parte de vacunación. Los dos trabajan conjuntamente de una manera muy eficiente. Por lo tanto el número de clientes va a aumentando día a día.

El dinero proveído por el crédito será utilizado para la compra de balanceados para animales.
loan_use: Purchase of balanced meals for animals

description:
Ms. Natividad is a 57 years old widow, who lives in the Hugo Chávez neighborhood. She has two children who work and are independent.

Ms. Natividad has had a grocery store for seven years. Meager sales volumes are amongst the difficulties she faces. With the loan, she intends to buy basic products to offer to her clients, in order to sell more and obtain a greater profit. Her future plans include the improvement of her store’s infrastructure and the increase in her merchandise stock, in order to improve her life quality.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Natividad tiene 57 años de edad, es viuda, y habita en el barrio Hugo Chávez. Tiene dos hijos que trabajan y son independientes.

Doña Natividad tiene una pulpería y lleva siete años de experiencia. Entre las dificultades son las ventas bajas, que muchas veces son superables. Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos básicos para tener bastante para ofrecer a sus clientes y vender más y obtener más ganancias. Sus planes futuros son mejorar la infraestructura del negocio y hacer más grande la pulpería con diversos productos, y así mejorar el nivel de vida.
