loan_use: Purchase of basic products for her grocery store.

description:
The leader of this small group is Susan K.. She sells milk in her shop and is requesting a loan to expand the shop. Susan is 50 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has 5 children ranging from 12 to 20 years old, and her children go to school. Each week, Susan makes approximately 80 sudanese pounds in profits and, with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the shop. \r\n\r\n

Susan is joined in her small group by Alice S., Mary S., Rose S., and Veronica Amose. Alice S. sells charcoal and wants to buy a bicycle. Mary S. sells vegetables and wants a loan to expand her business. Rose S. sells charcoal and wants to buy tools for digging, such as hoes. Veronica Amose sells charcoal and is requesting a loan to buy chairs to sell.
loan_use: To expand her shop

description:
Regina A. is a hair dresser. She has many customers, and her services are in great demand. She is married, but her husband's income from the Sanitary Office at the University of Cape Coast does not cover the expenses for Regina and her two children.\r\n

Regina plans to use the loan as captial to expand her business.
loan_use: As additional capital to expand her business

description:
Fatou G. is single and was born in 1971 in Thies. She lives near the Moda Kane bank in the Senghor sector of Thies. She is requesting this loan for the purpose of bolstering her commercial business. With this loan, she expects to buy bags of chili peppers in Mali that she is going to stock for retail sale to her loyal customers, who are at the central marketplace in Thies.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

FATOU G. EST UNE CELIBATAIRE NEE EN 1971 A THIES .ELLE HABITE PRES DE LA CAISSE DE MODA KANE AU QUARTIER CITE SENGHOR DE THIES .ELLE SOLLICITE CE PRET DANS LE BUT DE RENFORCER SES ACTIVITES COMMERCIALES .AVEC CE PRET ELLE COMPTE ACHETER DES SACS DE PIMENT AU MALI QU ELLE VA STOCKER POUR LES REVENDRE AU DETAIL A SES CLIENTS FIDELES QUI SONT AU MARCHE CENTRAL DE THIES/
loan_use: Commerce in chili peppers

description:
Mariana A. lives in Igbelerin in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells firewood and akara as beancake (product from beans). She has been in this business since 1988. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past three years. She is 56 years old and married with five children.

\r\n\r\n

She is soliciting for the loan amount of $1200.00 to buy more beans and firewood to sell. She expresses her gratitude to Kiva and its lenders.
loan_use: To buy more firewood and beans to sell.

description:
Mrs. Bola A. lives in Lagos State in Nigeria. She is a hair stylist in her area. Bola acquired her skill over three years and has been in this business since 1998. She is 32 years old and married.

\r\n\r\n

She needs a loan amount of $1025 to buy more weavons, attachments, and hair cream so that she can serve her customer better.
loan_use: To buy weavons, attachments, and hair cream for her salon.

description: Mukimjon M. was born in 1961 in the Asht region of Tajikistan. Like many of his fellow villagers he is engaged in the livestock business. Mr. M. is very experienced in livestock; he has been in the business for 20 years. He has a large herd. His business includes raising the livestock and selling meat and milk-sour products he makes. He is married and has five children so he has to work hard to ensure good lives for his family. He works as a tractor driver on a collective farm. Now Mr. M. is applying with KIVA with a request for financial support. He requests a business development loan of 2100 STJ for 8 months to open a trade outlet to sell meat.
loan_use: Mukimjon would like to open a trade outlet to sell meat.

description: Dorcas is married with 2 children. She sells clothing in her town through hawking. Buying brand new clothes is very expensive, but many prefer that to used clothes. This has created a big market for dealers in clothing. Dorcas wants to use the loan to buy more bales of clothing and scarves to increase her inventory and sales. She is a member of the group called Sons of God. Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.
loan_use: To buy more bales of clothing and scarves

description: Nofisatu A. is a local trader; she goes door-to-door selling powder and earrings. she has been in this business for the past 5 years. She is 38 years old and is married with two children. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past two years. She needs a loan of $275 to buy more powder and earrings to sell. She thanks you for your support.
loan_use: To buy more powder and earrings to sell

description: Adeola A. is 35 years old and is married with 4 children. She lives at Iyano_ Ajamgbadi, Lagos State, Nigeria. She has been a secretary in a lending group for the past 3 years. She sells cooked food, and has been doing so for the past 10years. She needs a loan of $350 to buy more cooking items so that she can meet the demands of her numerous customers. She thanks you.
loan_use: To buy more cooking items

description:
Luz Maria launched her business because her husband really likes hojarascas (a traditional Mexican sweet) and baked cookies. Since she had never made them at home, she decided to learn how. She grew to enjoy it, and offered the homemade sweets to her acquaintances, who told her that it would be a good idea to sell them. She listened to them, and that's how her business came to be.

She felt the need to open the business because of her family's low income. They were spending more now that their son was older, and so she opened a bakery - a business that she enjoyed - which enabled her to earn extra money to cover her family's needs.

Luz Maria began her business seven years ago, and has never regretted that decision. She has brought in good earnings, which have allowed her to pay for severla unforseen expenses. She has a very good clientele, and even distributes her sweets to big businesses like Helados Sultana, an ice cream company. This creates a steady stream of income to cover household expenses.

Today, Luz Maria needs a loan of $600, which she will repay in 6 months. She will use the money to buy ingredients to make her sweets so that she can fill her existing long list of orders.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Luz Maria inició el negocio porque a su esposo le gustan mucho las hojarascas y galletas horneadas y como en su casa ya no le hacian, se propuso aprender a hacerlas y poco a poco le comenzo a gustar mas, entonces las ofrecio a conocidos quienes le comentaron que, seria buen negocio el venderlas y les hizo caso, asi fue como inicio el negocio que ahora tiene.

Su principal necesidad para emprender su negocio, fue la poca entrada de dinero, ya que tenian mas gastos ahora que su hijo estaba creciendo por lo que tomo la reposteria como un negocio que ademas le gustaba, y le iba a dejar dinero extra para cubrir sus necesidades.

Comenzó hace 7 años con el negocio y no piensa dejarlo porque desde aquel entonces, le ha dejado buenas ganancias para salir de algunos imprevistos, tiene muy buena clientela e inclusive tiene reparto a negocios grandes como Helados Sultana donde coloco sus productos y este tambien es un ingreso seguro para los gastos de su casa.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses, le va a servir para comprar materia prima para hacer su productos ya que actualmente tiene muchos pedidos
loan_use: Buy ingredients to make cookies

description:
Ravshanoi N. lives in the high mountain Asht region of Tajikistan where she raises and sells livestock, like many other local people. Mrs. N. has been a client of MicroInvest since 2008, and she has shown herself to be a serious entrepreneur. Mrs. N. works also on a collective farm. Her husband went to the Russian Federation for a well-paying job, so now Mrs. N. works to raise her child on her own.

\r\n\r\nMrs. N. is asking KIVA for a business support loan of $625.00 US to build a cowshed.
loan_use: To build a cowshed

description:
Manzura D. lives in the Asht region of Tajikistan. She was brought up in an intelligent family―her father is a doctor and her mother works in the registry office. Mrs. D. is very well educated, and she works at the local rural school. She also participates in her family's livestock business where she helps take care of the animals and also does the milking.

\r\n\r\nMrs. D. is asking KIVA for a business development loan of $625.00 US so she can purchase one more pedigreed bull.
loan_use: To buy one more pedigreed bull

description:
Helena is 64 years old and originally from the Salamanca District in the Maputo Province. Helena is married and has six children, three daughters and three sons, all above 18 years old.

Helena studied until 3rd grade and stopped to help with her parents’ house duties, as she was the older daughter. As soon as Helena married she started to sell alcoholic drinks made of sugar cane. With the profits from this business she was able to buy cattle, achieving a herd of 50 cows. During the Mozambican Civil War Helena lost all her cattle and was forced to move out of her house.

In 1986 Helena moved to Salamanca village, where she built a small house with a grocery store in front. Ever since Helena has been selling basic needs products. Helena’s most famous products are sugar, cooking oil and peanuts. She has a daily sale of MTn 750 and has one employee to help her during the day. Helena pays him MTn 500 per month.

Helena has been a client of Hluvuku since 1996. Her first loan was a group loan of MTn 600 to help her with her commerce business. Helena has had more than 10 loans, some to help buy consumer goods and some to help build her house. With this loan of MTn 7,000 Helena intends to buy more merchandise in bulk, reducing the acquisition cost and increasing her profits.

In the future, Helena would like to repair her house and would like to expand her business.
loan_use: To increase her inventory and buy in bulk.

description:
Mr. José Ariel L. has worked very hard since he was a young man raising cattle. He has developed his skills in raising livestock such as calves, cows, heifers, and pigs.

He is the father of three children and since he started his business, he has been through difficult situations such as the lack of financial resources for the acquisition of animals. Nonetheless, despite these difficult situations he has survived thanks to his hard work and the support that Ceprodel has provided him through business loans. Today he is requesting a loan with the purpose of obtaining enough money to purchase calves. It is important to point out that this credit will bring him greater opportunities to improve his financial situation.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

El caballero José Ariel L. se dedica con mucho esfuerzo desde muy joven al negocio de la ganadería el cual ha desarrollado habilidades en la crianza de ganado como terneros, vacas, vaquillas y cerdos.

Es padre de tres hijos y desde que inició en este negocio ha atravesado múltiples situaciones adversas como la ausencia del recurso económico para la adquisición de los animales. Sin embargo a pesar de sus difíciles situaciones ha sobrevivido gracias a sus esfuerzos y al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel por medio de los créditos para el negocio. Hoy en día solicita un nuevo crédito con el propósito de adquirir el dinero para la compra de los terneros. Es menester destacar que gracias a este crédito logrará mayor oportunidad para mejorar su condición económica.
loan_use: Purchase calves

description:
Taleb Jan, son of S. N., is 33 years old. He returned to his home country of Afghanistan two years ago. During the war in Afghanistan, he was not able to continue his education in Pakistan because he encountered numerous financial problems while he was living there.

\r\nFortunately, however, now he is the owner of a small shop near his house in the Shewa district. He wants to improve this small business and to generate a nice income from the shop, so he is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,100 (50,000 Afghanis) to buy many things for his shop and to thereby increase his income.
loan_use: To generate greater income by purchasing necessary goods for his shop

description: For the past three years, Justina A. has made a living selling frozen foods like chicken and fish and other items to her customers. She has been active with LAPO Microfinance for the past two years. Justina is 38 years old and married with five children. She needs a loan of $350 to expand her business by buying more frozen food and other items to sell to her customers.
loan_use: To buy more frozen food and other items to sell.

description:
Mrs. Yoeun P., 55, and her husband, Mr. Thaung You, 59, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 1970 and have seven children, four sons and three daughters. One of their children is married and lives outside the family home. Two of their children have full time employment. Of the other four children, two are in school and two weave silk at home. They have two looms in the family.

Mrs. Yoeun has been a silk weaver since she was young but now she has stopped weaving and transferred her looms to her daughters (one is shown in the photo), who continue the business of silk production. Now Yoeun sells fish in her village and a nearby village, while Mr. Thaung has been a fisherman since he was seventeen years old.

Now she is requesting a loan of US$1200 to purchase silk materials for her daughters' weaving.
loan_use: To purchase silk material for weaving

description: Kate E. is 40 years old, married with two children and lives in Benin City, Nigeria, where she makes a living selling groceries. She studied this business for 12 months before opening her store in 1999. She is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy more supplies to sell. She has been a LAPO client for six years.
loan_use: To buy more groceries to sell.

description:
Ingrid has one twelve year-old daughter. To support her family, Ingrid owns and works in a small shop selling clothing, shoes and perfume. She struggles with being able to pay the bills because her customers purchase items on credit and then don´t pay her back. She then has to track them down and get the money from them, but sometimes they don´t have enough. Because of this, Ingrid has to take out loans and stay in debt.

Ingrid has had one loan with Esperanza International and successfully paid it back. She is thankful to Esperanza for the opportunity to borrow money at a low interest rate and also to save some money. With the next loan, she hopes her business will one day be debt-free. She aspires to provide her daughter with a great education so that she can become a successful professional. With a proud smile on her face, she said her daughter is a good student.
loan_use: To grow her business and provide for her daughter

description:
Dominga sell herbs, spices and home-made "guisantes en pasta" (a local pasta dish made with peas). She used to work as a street vendor selling sandwiches. A friend showed her how to make guisantes en pasta and, for the last year, she's been making and selling it in a market near her house. She works from 8 in the morning until 2 in the afternoon.

The loans that she's applied for have helped her set up her business. Dominga would like to expand the business and offer new products.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Dominga vende hierbas, especias y guisantes en pasta hechos de forma casera. Antes, ella vendía sándwiches de forma ambulatoria. Pero una amiga le enseñó a hacer los guisantes en pasta, por lo que desde hace 1 año vende estos productos en el mercado que está cerca de su casa. Trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 2 de la tarde.

Los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido para implementar su puesto. A Dominga le gustaría aumentar el stock de ventas y ofrecer nuevos productos.
loan_use: Develop food business.

description:
Carlos P. is a gentleman whose business is carpentry. He has been dedicated to this work for eight years during which he has acquired enough experience that he can create all types of furniture, such as beds, wardrobes, doors, cradles, etc.

Currently, Mr. P. is father to three school-age children who have benefited from their studies thanks to their hard work and desire to get ahead. Today, the Pichardos are looking for a way to improve their economic situation and the business needs an investment in more wood so that Carlos can make more furniture. For this reason, he has applied to Ceprodel for a loan so that he may purchase raw materials and continue his work as always.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Carlos P. es un caballero cuyo negocio es la carpintería el cual se dedica a esta labor desde hace ocho años habiendo adquirido basta experiencia en esta labor ya que realiza todo tipo de muebles como camas, roperos, puertas, cunas de niños, etc.

Actualmente el caballero P. es padre de tres hijos en edades escolares los cuales ha beneficiado con los estudios gracias a su arduo trabajo y ganas de salir adelante. Hoy en día ha buscado la manera de mejorar su situación económica y el negocio requiere la inversión en madera para realizar los muebles. Es por este motivo que acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito para la compra de su materia prima y así continuar en su labor como lo ha hecho hasta ahora.
loan_use: Purchase wood.

description: Mesi S., 47, is married with 4 children.  She has 3 years of experience in general business. She sells to the village and general public 6 days per week. She has had 3 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).  SPBD loans are Mesi’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She wants to improve business and accommodate her family needs.
loan_use: To purchase ice cakes, pancakes, pork cakes, etc

description: Talita Foleni, 33, is married with 2 children.  She has many years of experience in the fish business. She sells to the villagers and the general public 4 days per week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD).  SPBD loans are Talita’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her earnings will also help her with her many family obligations. Her husband does the fishing duty.
loan_use: To buy an extra pair of fishing shoes for her husband, a fishing net, and to make home repairs.

description: Maelega S.'s  lawn mowing  business is running  successfully. She has received 2 prior loans that she has repaid.  She will use this loan to renovate her family home and also to buy another lawn mower for her business.
loan_use: To renovate her home and to buy a lawn mower for her business

description: Nuutupu S., 37, is married with 5 children.  She has 5 years of experience in the pork cake business. She sells to the village people  6 days per week. She has 6 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be $208 USD.  SPBD loans are Nuutupu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her husband is also working hard as a fisherman to support her pork cake business.
loan_use: To provide capital for her pork cake business.

description:
Jose and his family are dairy farmers and they also dedicate themselves to agriculture in order to feed themselves. Jose is also the manager of the milk producers of the province of The Andes. His main source of income with which he maintains his family (his wife and 3 kids) comes from selling milk to the PIL Andina factory.

He lives in the community of Huayrocondo-Batallas which is in the province of The Andes in the state of La Paz (two hours from the city of El Alto).

He needs this credit in order to buy a medium quality milk-producing cow so that he can increase milk production and thereby improve his familiy's economic income.

This is his second credit with Impro and his good behaviour with regards to loan repayments means that he qualifies to make another loan application.

Translated form Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

José y su familia, son productores de leche y se dedican a la agricultura solo para su alimentación y él también trabaja como dirigente de los productores de leche de la Provincia los Andes. Sus ingresos principales con los que mantiene a la familia (3 hijos y esposa) provienen de la venta de leche a la Fábrica PIL Andina. Vive en la Comunidad Huayrocondo – Batallas de la Provincia Los Andes del Departamento de La Paz (Ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de El Alto). El crédito requiere para comprar una vaca lechera de mediana calidad, de esa forma incrementar la producción de leche y mejorar sus ingresos económicos para su familia. Es el segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado.
loan_use: To buy a medium quality milk-producing cow to increase milk production/Compra de una vaca lechera de mediana calidad para incrementar su produccion de leche.

description:
Kamolov Shavkat is 43 years old. He’s married and the father of five children. His wife is a housekeeper. Thus, Shavkat’s business is the main source of income. Shavkat works hard on the farm in order to make his children happy and to give them a good education. His business includes growing and selling agricultural such as tomatoes, onions, potatoes, cucumbers, and carrots.

\r\n\r\nHe has worked in agriculture for ten years, and in that time has gained much experience and a love for the land. With the beginning of the sowing season, Shavkat is planning to sow onion, potato, and carrot. That is why he wants to buy mineral fertilizer and seeds. He needs a loan of 850 $ US Dollars for the term of 12 months. After gathering his yield, he wants to sell his goods to local inhabitants for lower prices than in the market. Shavkat is promising to be timely in paying the loan. Shavkat is counting on your help. He expresses his gratitude to everyone supporting him.
loan_use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

description: Mutabar T. became a client of MicroInvest earlier this year, when she applied for her first loan. She succeeded in paying this loan back on time while also expanding her business and her income. Mrs. T. lives in the high mountains of the Asht region of Taijikistan, where raising livestock and making yarn are the main businesses. Mrs. T. supports herself by making and selling yarn and warm socks in the local bazaar, where she has many repeat customers. She has been in this business for 10 years and knows it very well. Mrs. T. has applied for a Kiva loan to open up her own shop. She will repay the loan in eight months.
loan_use: to open her own shop

description:
Marta is 39 years old and a native of Namaacha, a district that borders with Swaziland. Marta is married and the mother of 3 sons the oldest of which is 17 years old, the second is 11, and the third is 4. Marta studied until the 7th grade, not continuing due to mandatory military service which lasted 2 years.

After her discharge she returned with her husband that she met in the army to the town of Namaacha. Marta learned the business through her father in law who was a great trader in the area. The establishment that she runs was from her father in law who is deceased. Marta says that the products with the most sell-through are beer, that she buys for 21MTn and resells for 25MTn, and sugar.

Marta has had a monthly income of 2,500MTn and is able to save a little by the end of the month. Besides the business of selling staple products she also raises cattle, and currently has 24 head. Marta has 2 employees, one for each activity, and she pays 1,200MTn per month to each one.

This is her first loan with Hluvuku and with Kiva. She has never had a loan before. She came to know Hluvuku through a friend who is a client. With this loan, Marta intends to purchase basic staple products to resell in her establishment. She would like to refurbish and paint her stand, increase her animal count as well as recoup a tractor that was her father in law's.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Marta tem 39 anos de idade e é natural de Namaacha, distrito que faz fronteira com a Swazilandia. Marta é casada e mãe de três filhos, sendo a primeira com 17 anos, a segunda com 11 anos e a terceira com 4 anos. Marta estudou ate 7ª classe, não tendo continuado devido ao serviço militar obrigatório no qual permaneceu lá durante 2 anos. Com a sua desmobilização voltou com o marido que conhecera lá na tropa para vila de Namaacha. Marta aprendeu o negocio através do seu sogro que foi um grande comerciante na zona. O estabelecimento que explora foi do falecido sogro. Marta diz que o produtos que tem mais saída são a cerveja que compra por MTn 21 e revende por MTn 25 e o açúcar. Marta tem tido um lucro mensal de MTn 2,500 e consegue poupar um pouco no fim do mês. Marta para alem do negocio de venD. de produtos da primeira necessidade dedica se a criação de gado bovino, contando atualmente com 24 cabeças. Marta tem dois empregados, um para cada atividade, e paga MTn 1,200 por mês para cada um. Este é o primeiro empréstimo de Marta com Hluvuku e Kiva. Marta nunca teve outro empréstimo antes e conheceu a Hluvuku através de um amigo que é cliente. Com o empréstimo, Marta pretende comprar produtos de necessidade básica para revender em seu estabelecimento. Constitui sonho para ela reabilitar a sua barraca pintar e ampliar, aumentar o seu efectivo animal, alem de recuperar um trator do falecido sogro.
loan_use: Purchase goods to restock her store

description: Mrs. Chhovon C. is 37 and a subsistence farmer in Trapang Mates Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Previously, Mrs. Chhovon C. obtained a loan from Prassac Co., Ltd to buy  part of a rice field. Now, her plantation business needs a draft animal. Mrs. Chhovon C. is requesting a loan to buy a second cow to plow her rice field more efficiently. Her husband, Mr. Sam At Im, is a farmer. They have five children, three of whom are attending a local school while the two others are too young to work or enroll in school.
loan_use: To buy a second cow for rice field plowing

description: Mr. Von V. is a subsistence farmer in Trapang Mates Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. His wife, Mrs. Sambath Nhem, is a grocer in the local market. Mrs. Sambath Nhem's business is doing well, so she wants to expand it. Mr. Von V. is requesting a loan to buy more stock for his wife's grocery business. Mr. Von V. and his wife have a child who is a garment worker.
loan_use: To buy more stock for grocery store

description: Mr. R. Saifudin was born in 1958 in the Utkansoi region of Tajikistan and is married with five children. His family was not able to provide him with a higher education, but he has raised and sold livestock for the past 40 years and is very skilled at it. Mr. Saifudin has applied to Kiva for a loan to expand his business by buying a new bull. This is his second loan through MicroInvest. He used his first loan, which he received earlier this year, for the same purpose of expanding his business.
loan_use: to expand his business by buying a pedigree bull

description:
Mrs. Mom B., 50, and her husband, Mr. Savuth Sor, 51, live on an island of the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1980 and have two children: one son and one daughter. Both children are married, and one lives in the family home.

Mrs. Mom has been selling vegetables for twelve years. She buys tomatoes, corn, and bananas from the farmers in the village for resale at Phnom Penh. Beside selling vegetables, she also raises pigs at home. Mr. Savuth has been driving a motor taxi for over twenty years and also assists his wife with her business. Currently, he wants to buy a new motorbike to replace the old one, but does not have enough funds. Mrs. Mom is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase a new motorcycle for her husband so he can continue driving a motor taxi and also carry vegetables to sell.
loan_use: To purchase a new motorcycle to replace the old one to operate a motor taxi.

description:
Nilton is a young entrepreneur who, day after day, performs his work with excellence in an agricultural project near his home. After three years of academic preparation he now applies his knowledge to the agricultural project as well as to his own cultivated land. He wishes to support his communal land with an agricultural consultant's office where he can work daily to achieve success. He yearns to improve their harvests with his technical knowledge and is asking for a loan to achieve each of his goals.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva volunteer.

Nilton, es un joven emprendedor que día a día ejerce su profesión con calidad en un proyecto agrícola cercano a su localidad y es así que después de 3 años de preparación académica hoy aplica estos conocimientos en su trabajo y en sus propias tierras de cultivo con el deseo de apoyar a su propia comunidad con asesoría agrícola es así que el diariamente trabaja para lograr éxito, su anhelo es mejorar sus cosechas con sus conocimientos técnicos y solicita un préstamo para llevar a cabo cada uno de sus planes.
loan_use: Capital to improve harvests on communal land

description:
Rufina is an admirable woman. Having been orphaned at a very young age and suffered much, she knew that to get ahead in life she would have to make it all on her own. In the course of her life she has become a self-confident woman who wants more than anything to help her 8 children by offering them the opportunity to go to university and become successful. This exemplary mother would like a loan so that she can invest in her business of selling groceries. Her little stall is situated insiD. the Las Mercedes market in the city of Juliaca. Rufina is confident that with this investment she will be able to complete the most important project of her life: to proviD. a good education for her beloved children, of whom she is very proud.\r\n

Translated from Spanish by Chris Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

\r\nRufina, es una noble mujer, desD. que se quedó huérfana a muy corta edad sufrió mucho y supo valerse sola para salir adelante, la vida la convirtió en una mujer segura D. sí misma y D. lo que esta dispuesta ha alcanzar por amor a sus 8 queridos hijos, a quienes en su humildad viene brindándoles la oportunidad D. seguir estudios superiores para que en un futuro sean hombres D. bien.El deseo D. esta ejemplar madre es recibir un préstamo para invertirlo en su negocio D. venta D. abarrotes, puestito ubicado al interior del mercado Las Mercedes D. la ciudad D. Juliaca.Rufina está segura que con dicha inversión concretará el proyecto más granD. D. su vida, la D. ofrecerles una buena educación a sus queridos hijos, D. quienes se siente muy orgullosa.
loan_use: Increasing her capital so she can increase her stock of products

description:
Having come together as a group, these five illiterate women used their first loan of 500 000 CFA to start a business raising cattle in their village. Two (2) other loans of 500 000 CFA allowed them to increase their production capacity. Each of the women are given one ox which she raises alone. The income drawn from this business serves to improve the daily meals and pay for the medical costs of their children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Regroupées au sein d'un groupement ,ces cinq femmes analphabetes ont avec un premier pret de 500000f cfa demarré une activité d'embouche bovine dans leur village.Deux (2) autres successifs de 500.000f cfa leur ont permis d'augmenter leur capacité de production .Chacune d'elle bénéficie d'un boeuf qu'elle embouche seule.Les revenus tirés de l'activité servent à amelliorer les repas quotidiens payer les frais médicaux des enfants.
loan_use: Working capital

description:
Blanca U. is originally from the Nagarote district in the city of León. She works hard as owner of a small general store, which she operates out of her home in a neighboring area called La Paz Centro.

Blanca has been running her business for 8 years. With income from her business, Blanca has managed to get ahead and provide for the education of her two school-age children.

Blanca is turning to Ceprodel for a loan, which she will use to purchase merchandise. She has had 8 loans with the organization, all of which were paid on time and according to the terms of the agreement.

Translated by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer

La señora Blanca U. es originaria del municipio de Nagarote en la ciudad de León y se dedica muy esforzadamente al negocio de pulpería el cual atiende en su casa de habitación en una zona aledaña a Nagarote llamada La Paz Centro.

Actualmente ella posee 8 años de dedicarse a esta labor y por medio de este ingreso ha logrado salir adelante proporcionándole los estudios a sus dos pequeños hijos en edad escolar.

Hoy en día ella acude a Ceprodel con el propósito de obtener un crédito con el cual pueda obtener su mercadería. Actualmente posee un total de ocho créditos con la institución pagados en tiempo y forma correcta según lo establecido.
loan_use: Purchase of products

description:
Bilda is a happy and hard-working woman and due to her performance as a farmer she has had the opportunity to travel abroad and publicize and gain recognition for Peruvian agricultural products on behalf of her community.

She produces citrus fruits, bananas, and coffee beans, which she sells in the Capital. Due to her willingness to transport her produce, she has succeeded in attracting customers in the surrounding towns in addition to her local area.

Now, by investing a large sum of money, she plans to increase her sales of coffee beans further, her most profitable product, by improving the quality of the beans.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

BILDA, es una dama muy jovial y muy trabajadora gracias a sus actividades y desempeño como agricultora tuvo la oportunidad de viajar al exterior en representación de su comunidad y dar a conocer los productos que producimos en el Perú.Ella posee terrenos de producción de cítricos, plátanos y café los cuales comercializa en la capital y gracias a su movilidad puede trasladarse a captar compradores en su localidad además de trasladar algunos de sus productos por las ciudades más cercanas. Y ahora no solo va captando clientela sino que desea también captar su interés para mejorar su producción de café que es el producto más rentable en el mercado y para su siembra y cosecha se invierte grandes sumas de dinero.
loan_use: Capital investment for the production of coffee beans

description: Nargiz is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, now settled in the Fuzuli region. She is a mother of 3 children. This woman has been in the dairy business for 6 years. Now she needs a loan of $1000 to buy a cow for improving her dairy business.
loan_use: To buy a cow

description:
Umurzok K. has only been a client of MicroInvest since 2008, but he has already proven himself to be a successful borrower. Thanks to his previous loan he was able to buy a pedigreed bull. Now he has 2 cows and one bull.

Mr. K. is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of $925 US for 8 months to build a new barn.
loan_use: To build a new barn

description:
Silvia learned to raise chickens by observing her parents and she decided to start her own business. An entrepreneurial woman, she began with two small chickens two years ago. Currently, she has more than 40 chickens; however, now she wishes to purchase turkeys in order to fatten them so that they will weigh more and their selling price will be greater than that of chicken. Currently, Silvia is pregnant. Her child is the reason why she is more motivated than ever to raise not only chickens but also turkeys. In this manner, she will have better income and provide a better quality of life for her child.

She needs a loan of US $250, which she will repay in three months, in order to purchase turkeys and begin to fatten them since, in five months, her town's festivities begin as will demand. With your help, Silvia will grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Silvia aprendió a criar pollos observando a sus padres y decidió empezar su propio negocio, ella que es una mujer emprendedora comenzó con dos pollitos hace ya 2 años, en la actualidad ya son mas de 40 los pollos que tiene pero desea ahora comprar pavitos para engordarlos, pesan mas y su costo de venta es mayor a la del pollo. Actualmente Silvia esta embrazada, espera a su primer hijo razon por la cual esta mas motivada que nunca de ademas de la crianza de pollo añadir la de pavo, para asi tenr mejores ingresos y darle mejor calidad de vida a su hijo.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar pavos y empezar a engordarlos porque en 5 meses inician las festividades del pueblo donde aumenta la demanda. con tu ayuda silvia hara crecer su negocio.
loan_use: Purchase turkeys.

description:
Lupita is married and has 3 children, 22, 18 and 16. Her husband, Manuel Arellano Hernandez, is a construction worker. She started working primarily to help her father-in-law who, for more than 10 years, had earned a living selling cheese and chorizo. He had just arrived from the countryside so, to help him and to help her husband with household expenses, she decided to start selling and little by little she's managed to earn a good income.

Now she need a US$700 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, so that she can stock more merchandise and buy a display case for more kinds of cheeses and chorizo. With your help, Lupita can grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Lupita es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 22,18,16 años. Su esposo Manuel Arellano Hernandez trabaja como albanil. Inició el negocio primero para apoyara su suegro en la venta de queso y chorizo quien desde hace mas de 10 años se dedica a esto, para que se ayudara porque acababa de llegar del rancho, despues como necesitaba ella tambien dinero para apoyar a su esposo en la economia familiar decidio empezar a vender y poco a poco ha logrado buenos ingresos.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $ 700 que pagara en 6 meses para poder invertirlo en mercancia y comprar un aparador para vender mas tipos de queso y chorizo en su casa. con tu ayuda Lupita hara crecer su negocio.
loan_use: Buy merchandise for resale.

description:
Señora Agripina E. does agricultural work in her community of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega. Her multiple efforts have allowed her to support her home, which is composed of three small, school-aged children who she loves so much.

Right now she needs to acquire the economic resources to purchase animals to raise so she can sell their milk to her customers. For this reason, she is turning to Ceprodel. She is very confident that the credit will be offered to her and will benefit her a lot.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Agripina E. se dedica al negocio agropecuario en su comunidad de Somotillo en la ciudad de Chinandega. Sus múltiples esfuerzos han permitido que ella pueda llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación compuesta por sus tres pequeños hijos en edades escolares a los que ama tanto.

La necesidad que hoy en día atraviesa es que necesita adquirir el recurso económico para la compra de animales para la crianza por lo que al criarlo les extrae la leche la cual es comercializada a sus clientes. Por este motivo acude a Ceprodel muy confiada de que su crédito será otorgado y le será de mucho beneficio.
loan_use: Purchase of cows

description: Deam Y., 46, grows crops and makes thatched roofing out of palm leaves. Through the sale of her goods, she earns approximately $1.67 per day. Her husband, Mr. Pong Chin, is a motorcycle-taxi driver, earning around $3.33 per day. They have three children, two of whom are married. The family lives in Momeanh Village, Siem Reap Province. Mrs. Y. seeks a loan of $100 to purchase a new motorcycle to replace the old one that her husband currently uses. The loan will allow her husband to improve his motorcycle-taxi business, and thereby increase the family income. (The photo is Y.’s husband)
loan_use: To purchase a new motorcycle to replace the old one that her husband currently uses

description: Mrs. Ly P. and her husband, Mr. Nak Hin, are subsistence farmers in Trapaing Angkrorng Village in Kampong Speu Province.  She is 39 years old and married with three children, two of whom are attending school while the other is too young. During the rainy season, Mrs. Ly P. cultivates rice and during the dry season, she grows different kinds of vegetables. In her plantation business, Mrs. Ly P. always hires a laborer to plow her rice field because she does not own a draft animal. Mrs. Ly P. currently would like to plow the rice field by her self, therefore, she is asking for a loan to buy cows. Previously, Mrs. Ly P. obtained a loan to cultivate watermelons on her field. Her husband and her son are presented in the photo.
loan_use: To buy cows to plow her rice field.

description: Nai B. is an unmarried woman who lives in Sundhara, located in Lalitpur district. The majority of people in this locality are engaged in their own small businesses. Nai B. lives with her father, mother and two brothers. Her father is a tailor. Both of her brothers and herself are engaged in making brass religious statues. They make different types of brass religious statues. They make statues according to the demand of their customers. In this business they need a lot of investment to fulfill the demand of their customers so Ms. Nai B. is requesting for a Rs 15000.00 loan to buy raw materials for their work.
loan_use: Nai would like to buy raw materials for her work making brass religious statues.

description:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! Asha S. is 35 years old, is married, and has three children between the ages 12 and 19. In 2007, Asha started her grocery business. \r\n

The Swahili word for this type of outside shop, or stall, is genge. A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood with a tin roof. At a genge, customers can purchase general items such as onions, tomatoes, chili peppers, oil, rice, and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal, and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.\r\n

Asha has already received and successfully repaid two loans from SELFINA. She now requests a loan in order to purchase more fruit, vegetables, flour, and rice in bulk. She thanks you for your support.
loan_use: To purchase additional fruits, vegetables, flour, and rice in bulk to stock her genge

description:
MRS. GLORIA, ever since being a little girl, has been involved with agricultural work and now that she is a mother she carries out her work for the benefit of her beloved family. Her production has increased notably and along with this is the requirement for natural manures and fertilizers in order to obtain products of excellent quality. Due to the increase in the costs of these products she is asking for a loan in order to acquire them and obtain an excellent harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

DOÑA GLORIA, desde pequeña se ha relacionado con la labor agrícola y ahora que se ha convertido en madre se desempeña en beneficio de su amada familia, su producción se ha incrementado notablemente y con ella la exigencia de abonos y fertilizantes naturales para obtener productos de excelente calidad, debido al incremento del costo de los mismos solicita un préstamo para adquirirlos a fin de obtener una excelente cosecha.
loan_use: Purchase of manures and fertilizers

description:
Mariela is a woman who has creativity and talent in her hands. From the time she was a child, she showed great interest in learning how to make these beautiful handicrafts. At the urging of various friends and neighbors, she is currently taking handicraft classes where she is learning to make a great variety of decorations for the kitchen, bedrooms, and other uses. Mariela works hard with the goal of saving enough to open a small store for her handicrafts. The decorations that she designs and makes with the help of her beloved daughter, Anita, who is ten years old, allow her to cover satisfactorily the household expenses. She has many projects in mind—projects that, with your help, she hopes to carry out.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariela, es una mujer que tiene creatividad y talento en las manos, desD. niña demostró tener gran interés por aprender a realizar estos hermosos trabajos D. manualidades; actualmente por solicitud D. algunas amistades y vecinos viene dictando diferentes cursos D. manualidades, cursos donD. elaboran gran variedad D. adornos para cocina, dormitorios y uso personal, Mariela trabaja arduamente con el fin D. ahorrar lo suficiente y abrir su tiendita D. manualidades. Los adornos que diseña y elabora con apoyo D. su querida hija Anita D. 10 años D. edad le está permitiendo cubrir satisfactoriamente los gastos D. su hogar, y tiene muchos proyectos en mente, proyectos que espera con tu apoyo concretarlos.
loan_use: To increase her capital so that she can soon open her handicrafts store

description:
From a young age, Hermelinda has always worked in the agricultural field. Even today, alongside her husband, she works in agriculture with the aim of providing well-being for their beloved children. She grows potatoes, ollucos (a South American root crop), corn, and broad beans. She also raises bulls in order to sell them. Her desire for progress motivates her daily, which is why she has decided to improve her business activities with the help of a loan. \r\n

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

\r\nHermelinda, desde muy joven se dedica a las labores agropecuarias y ahora en compañía de su esposo con el objetivo de procurarles bienestar a sus amados hijos. Siembra papa, olluco, maíz y habas, además de engordar toros para su posterior venta.Su deseo de progreso la motiva a diario y por esa razón a decidido mejorar cada una de sus actividades con la inyección de un préstamo.
loan_use: Capital for improvement of agricultural activities

description:
Teofila, Miriam, and Robertina are members of the Village Bank Estrella.

Teofila is married, 56 years old and has five children. Teofila travels to the different fairs of the region where she buys cereals and sells them at the Nery García market. She is also dedicated to raising young animals.

Miriam lives with her boyfriend, is 36 years old and has two children. Miriam sells aggregates - such as sand, concrete, and cement - to people and brings them to their homes by the use of a dump truck. She is also dedicated to the production of gypsum.

Robertina lives with her boyfriend, is 30 years old and has four children. Robertina sells fruits at the market Las Américas. Robertina is also going to begin selling salchipapas and other food from the door of her home.

Teofila, Miriam and Robertina need loans of 400 soles, 1400 soles, and 600 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of barley, wheat, gypsum, and various fruits and to cancel the rental of a stand.

Teofila, Miriam and Robertina´s dreams are to build their businesses, buy a car, better their quality of life, and to have other businesses.
loan_use: Teofila, Miriam and Robertina need loans of 400 soles, 1400 soles, and 600 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of barley, wheat, gypsum, and various fruits.

description: Fariz is 39 years old.  He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Kalbadjar region of the occupied territory of Azerbaijan. Fariz is married, with 2 children. They have settled in Baku city, Sabunchu region.\r\n Fariz started his business 8 years ago. Now he needs a loan of $625 to buy clothes to improve his business.
loan_use: To buy clothes to improve his business.

description:
Milly N. is the Treasurer and group leader of the Balikuddembe women’s group in Lugazi. She is married with 8 children, 5 of whom are still in school while the other 3 are married. In addition, she helps care for her grandchild who is in nursery section.

\r\nSince 2001, she has been operating a business of buying dried and smoked fish from Kiyindi and Masese landing sites and later selling such fish from the stall at her home in Buwoola. Before embarking upon this business, she was a farmer; though she is not complaining about her change of business, she is in need of additional capital to be able to buy more fish in a short period of time in order to generate more income. As such, she is seeking a loan to purchase additional fish and to continue to pay for her children’s school fees.
loan_use: To expand her business by purchasing additional smoked and dried fish
borrower_names: Sarah, Teddy, Florence, Madinah, Josephine, Rose, Aukisa, Milly, Rehema, Grace, Harriet, Fatumah, Sarah, Rehema
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Mouktarou I., 35, is married and the father of three children, all enrolled in school. He sells motor oil on the side of a road in Kpalimé, a town located about 120 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. He hopes to use this loan to buy more motor oil for resale. By doing this, he will earn more profit to cater for the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Mouktarou I. est âgé de 35 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants tous à l’école. Il est revendeur d’huile à moteur au bord de la route à Kpalimé, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il espère par ce crédit acheter plus d’huile à moteur pour la revente. Ce faisant, il gagnera plus de bénéfices pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
loan_use:
purchase more motor oil for resale

Acheter plus d’huile à moteur pour la revente

description:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi T. is 46 years old. She has been a part of the Tinh Thuong Fund since 2002. She has six children,of which two are school-aged and four are grown and have stable employment. Before she joined the fund, her family experienced many difficulties because most of her children were still young.

After joining the fund in 2002, they were able to raise capital to improve their financial situation by using the funds to purchase more pigs to raise. The family's main source of income is their livestock rearing business. Her family also uses the capital to purchase more grains which they use to make cakes and pastries to sell.

Today, her family has three children that are able to contribute financially to the family. From the time she joined the fund, her family's situation continues to improve. In addition to caring for her school-aged children, her family was able to construct a home. The family income is 4,000,000 VND per month.

Mrs. Nguyen would like to raise 10,000,000 VND to buy more livestock and grains to help the family's livestock rearing and food production businesses.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Thiết năm nay 46 tuổi. Chị bắt đầu tham gia vào Quỹ Tình Thương từ năm 2002. Gia đình chị có 6 người con trong đó có 2 con đang tuổi đi học, 4 con đã trưởng thành và có công việc ổn định. Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ gia đình chị gặp rất nhiều khó khăn do đông con, các con còn nhỏ.

Hơn nữa thu nhập của gia đình chị chủ yếu dựa vào chăn nuôi trồng trọt. Năm 2002 sau khi tham gia vào Quỹ, được vay vốn phát triển kinh tế gia đình chị đã sử dụng vốn để mua thêm lợn về nuôi. Ngoài ra gia đình chị còn sử dụng vốn để mua thêm lúa nếp về làm bánh chưng, bánh xéo để bán.

Hiện nay gia đình chị đã có 3 con có nghề nghiệp và có thu nhập để giúp đỡ gia đình. Từ khi tham gia Quỹ đến nay kinh tế gia đình chị đã ngày càng ổn định hơn. Ngoài việc chăm lo cho các con đi học, gia đình chị đã xây được ngôi nhà khang trang, thu nhập của gia đình đạt 4.000.000đ/ tháng.

Chị mong muốn được vay thêm 10 triệu đồng để đầu tư thêm vào chăn nuôi và mua thêm lúa, gạo giá rẻ trong vụ mùa để phục vụ cho việc làm bánh của gia đình.
loan_use: Livestock (Pigs) and Grains

description:
Mrs. Menuka B. is twenty years old. She lives with her husband, father-in-law, mother-in-law and brother-in-law. Three years ago, her husband, Mr. Pradip B., went to Dubai to work. Her father-in-law is a driver and her brother-in-law works in a private office.

\r\nMrs. B. started a poultry farm two years ago to improve the standard of living for her family. Her family members also help her with the work. She sells her chickens at the local market. Due to a lack of funds, she cannot expand her business. Therefore, Mrs. B. is requesting a Rs 10000.00 loan.
loan_use: To expand her business

description:
Agaissa M. is a 40-year-old married woman, the mother of six children, and she lives with her husband and their children in a monogamous family in the Médine district of the city of Sikasso. Very early on, she started working in commerce after having dropped out of school for social reasons. She has been in the business of selling dyed damask (a popular fabric in West Africa) for ten years.

In her search for financial resources, she decided to rejoin a group loan association in her district (Association BENKADI Médine). She is on her fourth year of working with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and has benefited from four individual loans.

She needs this loan to buy more damask, 10 pairs of mens' shoes, and 30 pairs of women's to meet her ever-increasing customer base. She gets her supplies monthly in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali in Africa) per back-orders. She buys white damask cloth and dyes them, then sews boubous (traditional dress) from them, and then sells them. She produces 20 outfits of dyed damask each month that she sells in the city of Sikasso and in Abidjan (economic captial of the Republic of Cote d'Ivoire). This business is run year-round without major difficulties. The turn-over for this business is very high, and she expects to realize a monthly profit of 70,000 francs CFA.

Ms. Agaissa M. expects to increase the size of her business and to sell her output in other markets.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame Agaissa M. est une femme mariée de 40 ans, mère de 6 enfants et vit avec son époux et leurs enfants dans une famille monogame au quartier Médine de la ville de Sikasso. Elle a commencé très tot les activités commerciales après avoir arreté les études pour des raisons sociales. Elle mème l’activité de vente de Bazins teints dépuis 10 ans (tissus très prisé en Afrique de l’ouest).

Dans sa recherche de ressources financières, elle décida de rejoindre une association de crédit solidaire de son quartier (Association BENKADI Médine), Elle est à sa quatrième année de collaboration avec de l’institution microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et a bénéficié de 4 prets individuels.

Elle a besoin de ce prêt pour acheter plus de bazins, 10 paires de chaussure pour homme ,30 paires pour femme afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako (Capitale de la République du Mali en Afrique), par commande et cela une fois par mois. Elle achète les bazins blancs les teint , ensuite les coud en Boubou afin de les vendre.Elle produit 20 complets de bazin teintés par mois qu ’elle vend dans la ville de Sikasso et à Abidjan (Capitale économique de la République de Côte d’Ivoire). Cette activité est menèe durant toute l’année sans difficultés majeures. La rotation de son activité est très élévée et elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70 000 FCFA.

Madame Agaissa M. compte augmeneter la taille de son activité et vendre sa productin sur d’autres marchés.
loan_use: To buy damask fabrics and shoes

description:
Salamatu A. is forty years old. She is married and is the mother of six children. Two of her children have completed senior high school, while the rest are currently in junior and primary schools.

\r\nShe is a local manufacturer of palm kernel oil, which is produced from palm kernel and is used to prepare many local dishes like fried fish and pastries. Indeed, she produces and supplies her oil to food vendors so that they can prepare their meals. Although palm kernel oil production is one of the most common occupations among local women in the town of Obuasi, it is nonetheless a lucrative business to be in. However, her oil production has been on the decline in recent months by virtue of the fact that she has very little working capital in order to afford a machine to process the oil. Therefore, she is seeking a loan to buy seventy bags of palm kernel and an electric milling machine to both reduce the need for manual labor in the production process and to produce oil in larger quantities. Ultimately, she feels that this loan will enable her to generate more income to thereby provide food her family and finance her children’s education.

\r\nSalamatu belongs to the community group called “Megyefo Tease” (My Redeemer Lives) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral in order to access loans and apply peer pressure to ensure that the group members' loans are promptly repaid.
loan_use: To increase production and to make the business more efficient by purchasing additional raw materials (i.e., bags of palm kernel) and an electric milling machine.

description:
Beatrice A. is fifty six years old. She is married and is the mother of three children. Of her three children, two have completed polytechnique and the third is in senior high school. She is a petty trader, and she firmly believes in hard work and dedication to her craft which, according to her, is the secret to her business' success.

\r\nMore specifically, for the past twenty years, she has been a retailer of eggs and soft drinks and has generated a nice stream of income for her family. She is requesting a loan to buy a larger supply of maize and eggs in order to better serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in her country.

\r\nShe is a member of the trust group called God is Able. In this group, members provide guarantees for one another as social collateral in order to access loans and apply peer pressure so that the group members properly repay their respective loans.
loan_use: To better serve her customers' needs and to meet their demands by purchasing maize and eggs in bulk.

description:
This is the third time the Illmani group has applied for loans, so most of them know the process well. This time they only have 3 new members. Their president Mrs Genara is very outgoing and this is one of the oldest groups in the institution. Their costs range from between 1000Bs - 3300 Bs. The most that they have given was to Ingrid, and they can only give money to members of the institution. In this new cycle they hope to meet everyone's needs and all the members promise to respect and conform to the rules of the credit cycle. The women live in the neighbourhood of Sensata which is where they have their meetings. The women all work in different roles, such as selling food, clothes and clothing articles, fruit and other things. They do this responsibly and the group is very ethical which is why they have high hopes for this cycle.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

El grupo Illimani esta ya en su tercer ciclo, es por esto que ya se conocen muchos D. los componentes, en esta ocasión solamente se cuenta con tres nuevos a los que se les recomendó marchar al ritmo D. la asociación. Su presidenta la Sra. Genara esta muy animada ya que serian unos D. los grupos más antiguos dentro D. la institución. Los montos oscilan entre los 1000 Bs. Y los 3300 Bs. El monto mayor se le dio a la Sra. Ingrid, y según los informes D. central D. riesgos solamente sería cliente D. nuestra institución. En el nuevo ciclo se espera cumplir con todas las disposiciones del grupo, ya que todos los componentes se comprometieron a respetar y cumplir las reglas del ciclo D. crédito. Las señoras pertenecen al barrio D. Sensata, misma zona donD. se realizan las reuniones, las señoras son trabajadoras en diferentes rubros como la venta D. comidas, venta D. ropas y artículos D. vestir, venta D. frutas y otros. Estas actividades la realizan con responsabilidad, y existe bastante solvencia moral en el grupo por lo que se espera acabar el presente ciclo con las mejores expectativas.
loan_use: Capital for operations/CAPITAL DE OPERACIONES
borrower_names: Teodora, Carla Jhovana, Ingrid  Paula, Delfin, Julio, Manuel, Basilia, Andrea, Beatriz, Maria, Lorena Valeria, Genara
borrower_genders: female, female, female, male, male, male, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Lorena is an enterprising young woman, who started out as an entertainer at the age of 14 in a well-known children’s show. As she gained experience, she started her own show with her mother’s help. Now that she is grown, she wants to invest in her business to make it grow and to have greater independence. She employs 13 workers who participate in the events with her.

She seeks a loan of $825USD, to be repaid over a period of three months, because she needs additional funds to invest in additional and more varied costumes. On occasion, she has lost a customer who requested a certain type of show that she could not provide and this would allow her to increase her enterprise's wardrobe. With your support, Lorena will be able to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Lorena, es una joven emprendedora que inicio como animadora desde los 14 años en un reconocido Show Infantil, como adquirio experiendia realizo su propio show con la ayuda de su mama, pero ahora que ya es mayor de edad desea empezar a invertir en su negocio para hacerlo crecer y tener mayor solidez. En su show cuenta con 13 empleados que participan en los eventos con ella.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $825 que pagara en 3 meses ya que ante la falta de dinero para invertir en mayor cantidad y variedad de botargas en ocaciones ha perdido clientes porque le que solicitan un show que no tiene, ademas de esto podra invertir en mas vestuario para su negocio. Con tu apoyo Lorena consolidara su negocio.
loan_use: To buy new costumes.

description:
Odisea is a 42 year-old mother of two. Presently she sells food in front of the facilities of an educational center offering a variety of dishes to students and teachers. As a single mother she has been able to improve remarkably her life quality through this activity and today, thanks to the demand of her food she wishes to build a small space where she can receive her customers comfortably. This dream can come true if your significant support reaches her at this moment.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

\r\n\r\nOdisea tiene 42 años de edad y es madre de 02 hijos. Actualmente se desempeña frente a las instalaciones de un centro educativo ofertando diversos alimentos para los estudiantes y maestros. Con su actividad, debido a que es madre soltera, ha podido mejorar notablemente su calidad de vida y ahora gracias a la demanda de sus alimentos está deseosa de construir un pequeño espacio para recibirlos con comodidad. Y este sueño podrá hacerse realidad si vuestra importante ayuda llega a ella en estos momentos.
loan_use: Build a secure and comfortable sales space.

description:
Zulaikhan baji, who is the wife of M., lives in the city of Pakpattan, Pakistan. She has been married for the last 15 years and is the mother of four children. Zulaikhan baji is a housewife and prefers to run the household. Her husband makes iron trunks and buckets and sells them in various places. She successfully completed her first loan from Asasah a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan to improve her husband’s business.

She has been joined in her loan group by three other women. Nooran baji wants the loan for her bakery. Razia baji will use her portion for her milk business and Fatima baji will fund her scrap business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group member and each will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.
loan_use: To expand and improve heir businesses

description:
Parveen baji, wife of M. N., has lived in a city named Pak Pattan, Pakistan for the last 17 years. She is a mother of seven children: three sons and four daughters. All of her children are enrolled in a local school. Parveen baji wishes to give her children good education. Parveen baji’s husband is a building contractor. She successfully completed her first loan from Asasah. She bought a buffalo with her first loan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy a buffalo for selling milk for profit.

\r\nShe has been joined in her loan group a few more members: Tahira baji wants a loan to buy a pop corn maker; Karam baji wants a loan for her grocery shop; Kalsoom baji wants a loan to buy land and start a farm; Mairaj baji wants a loan to buy fertilizer.

\r\nThis is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.
loan_use: To buy a buffalo

description:
Sardaran baji is a wife of N. A. and the mother of four children. Her eldest son, Asim A., quit school when he was in 2nd standard. The next son, Tasawar Hussain is 7 years old and is in 2nd standard. The younger sons, Faisal A. and Eshan A. are enrolled in a local school. \r\n\r\n

Sardaran baji is a housewife and makes embroider clothing on order. Her husband runs a poultry farm and sells chicken meat. Sardaran baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institute of Pakistan. Now she is applying a loan for her husband’s chicken meat business. Her husband hopes that if he earns a good profit he can buy his own shop where he can sell chicken meat independently.
loan_use: To expand her husband's chicken business so he can open his own shop

description:
Mohira G. is 49. While she does not have children of her own, Mohira lives happily with her brother and his six kids. She raises livestock and sells milk for a living, which helps her brother's family. Mohira has a cow and sells the milk wholesale at the market. She would like to purchase another cow in order to increase the yield of milk. This will help Mohira make more money. In order to buy the cow, Mohira decided to apply for a loan, which she can repay within twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

 Гулова Мохира -49 лет. Детей не имеет. Живет с братом у которого шестеро детей. Не смотря на это они живут дружно и весело. Занимается она животноводством и продажей молока. Этим она помогает семье брата. Имеет корову . которая дает молоко и продает оптом на рынке. Хочет купить еще одну корову для того , чтобы увеличить количество молока. Это поможет заработать больше денег. Для того , чтобы купить корову Мохира решила получить кредит . Погасить его она сможет в течении 12 месяцев.
loan_use: To purchase a milk cow

description:
Amin Fatima, a wife of R. I., lives in a two-room brick house in Kasur, Pakistan. She is a housewife and prefers to do household work. Her husband is a shoe maker and he has been in this profession for the last 5 years. By the grace of God, their business grew; due to this expansion, they were able to hire five workers. Now they have their own shoe shop, and they have good reputation in the eyes of their customers.

Amin baji wishes to expand her husband's shoe business much more and wants to start another shoe shop.

NOTE: "Baji" (elder sister) is an Urdu term of respect for women.
loan_use: To expand her husband's shoe business and open another store

description:
A. Raupov is 27 years old. He is married but does not have children yet. He has finished High school. He has been helping his mother at the market since he was a little boy. When he came of age, he decided to separate from his mother and start his own business. It has been 7 years now since he started purchasing goods and selling them on the market by himself. He would like to obtain a loan in order to increase the variety of summer goods he has for sale.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Раупов Амир парень в возросте 27 лет женат но пока детей не имеет, образование имеет среднее. С детства помогал маме по бизнесу торговать на рынке , по совершенолетия он решил отделится от матери и начать свой бизнес.Вот уже 7 лет как он сам привозит товар и продаёт на рынке, для увеличения летнего товара он хочет взять кредит.
loan_use: women's shoes

description:
Lucrecia never imagined that she would be able to earn a good income through her wine selling business. It all started a few years ago when this diligent mother decided to travel for a few days to the city of Tacna, Peru. On the way back to her hometown of Juliaca, Peru, she decided to purchase some wines in order to offer them to her family and neighbors. From that day forward this business has allowed her to provide post-secondary education to her two adorable children, for whom she feels very proud and satisfied as a mother. Each weekend she offers her wines in her hometown market. Her clients come regularly to purchase Lucrecia’s pleasant wines. On week days Lucrecia helps her husband in his noble labor as a tailor in order to further assist with family finances. Lucrecia and her husband are no longer responsible economically for their children, but they want to continue to improve their income. For this reason, they need generous hearts that will offer them the opportunity to increase their investment capital\r\n

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

\r\nLucrecia, nunca imaginó que con su negocio de venta de vino podría obtener buenos ingresos económicos, todo empezó cuando hace algunos años esta diligente madre decidió viajar por algunos días a la ciudad de Tacna, al retornar a su ciudad natal, Juliaca, decidió comprar vinos para ofrecerlos a sus familiares y vecinos, desde entonces hasta la fecha este negocio le ha permitido brindar estudios superiores a sus 2 adorables hijos por quienes se siente muy orgullosa y realizada como madre.Cada fin de semana oferta sus vinos en el mercado dominical de su ciudad natal, lugar a donde sus asiduos clientes se aproximan para adquirir sus agradables vinos, los días laborables para seguir colaborando con los ingresos económicos de la familia doña Lucrecia apoya activamente a su esposo en su noble labor de sastre.Doña Lucrecia y su esposo ya no tienen ninguna responsabilidad económica con sus hijos, pero desean mejorar sus ingresos, para ello requieren de corazones generosos que le brinden la oportunidad de mejorar su capital de inversión.
loan_use: Injection of capital in order to improve her wine-selling business

description:
Liz, Lucila, and Hilda María are all members of the Village Bank Lila. Liz is 27, single, and has one child, Lucila is 43 years old, married and has 5 children, and Hilda María is 48, single, and has 4 children. The three women have different businesses for which they use their loans from FINCA.

Liz has a business of selling cosmetics from house to house, and has been doing this for 2 years. Lucila sells sweets at the front doors of schools to children and has been doing this for 10 years.

Hilda María sells drinks such as beer and sodas out of her home, which she has been doing for 10 years.

Liz, Lucila, and Hilda María are asking for loans of 200 soles, 400 soles, and 200 soles, respectively, money which will be invested in the purchase of cosmetics, sweets, and soda and beer to add to their businesses.

Liz´s dream is to have enough money to support and raise her new baby, Lucila´s dream is to finish the house she is building, and Hilda María dreams that all her children will receive good educations.
loan_use: Liz, Lucila, and Hilda María are asking for loans of 200 soles, 400 soles, and 200 soles, respectively, money which will be invested in the purchase of cosmetics, sweets, and soda and beer to add to their businesses.

description:
Doris lives in the Colonia Primero de Mayo neighborhood. She is 53 years old and married. Her husband is retired and they have three grown children.

Doris operates a mobile disco rental business. She started her business with her own money and with the support of her husband and her son, who is living in the United States. If her loan is approved, Rosa will buy ceramic and make improvements to her home. Her plans are to improve the quality of her business’s musical equipment and to live a stable life.

Translated by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer

La Sra. Doris habita en el barrio Colonia 1ro de Mayo, tiene 53 años de edad, es casada su esposo es ya jubilado y tiene 3 hijos que viven independientes.

El negocio de Doña Doris es alquiler de Disco Móvil, ella comenzó con dinero propio con la ayuda de su esposo y su hijo que está en Estados Unidos. Con este préstamo que le otorguen es para comprar cerámica y hacer mejoras a su vivienda. Sus planes son tener mejor calidad de sus equipos de trabajo, y un nivel de vida estable.
loan_use: Install ceramic in her house

description:
Ni Luh Roteh used her first loan to buy pig food because previously she already owned a female pig and a piglet. Ni Luh Roteh already obtained some profit from the pig farming business. Despite the humble barn made of bamboo, Ni Luh Roteh is still very keen to develop the business. Using the second loan from Dinari, Ni Luh Roteh bought one female pig which cost Rp. 800,000. Since she started breeding it, it has produced 12 piglets. In three months, she could sell 12 pigs for Rp. 3,000,000. Her profit is Rp.2,000,000 after deducting the revenue with the pig food expense for 6 months. She hopes she can add one more female pig in the future so that she can gain more revenue.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Pada pinjaman pertama Ni Luh Roteh mempergunakan untuk membeli pakan karena sebelumnya ia sudah memiliki 1 ekor induk dan 1 ekor penggemukan. Ni Luh Roteh telah mendapat keuntungan dari usahanya beternaknya.Dengan kondisi kandang yang sederhana memakai kandang bambu Ni Luh Roteh tetap bersemangat dan ingin meningkatkan usaha peternakannya. Dengan mendapat tambahan modal pinjaman periode ke dua dari Dinari Ni Luh Roteh membeli 1 induk seharga Rp.800.000,- untuk dipelihara. Pada masa pemeliharaan sampai dengan saat ini sudah beranak sebanyak 12 ekor.dan bibit babinya dijual setelah dipelihara selama tiga bulan dengan harga Rp.3.000.000,-untuk 12 ekor. Dengan keuntungan sebesar Rp.2.000.000,- setelah dikurangi untuk biaya pakan selama enam bulan. Harapan kedepannya dia ingin menambah 1 induk lagi agar penghasilannya bisa bertambah.
loan_use: To buy female pig

description:
In the first phase of the loan Ni Komang Suarniti used it to buy 4 piglets for fattening, and also additional food. From this pig farming, Ni Komang Suarniti could help her husband in paying for daily expenses, and even from the profit Ni Komang Suarniti also repaired her pig stalls that initially was from bamboo wall to a batako wall. From this second phase of the loan Ni Komang Suarniti used it to buy 5 piglets for fattening for Rp 1,250,000 (Translator’s note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp8,000-9,500.00). During the time her pigs got sick, and although it was medically treatedm they died. Ni Komang Suarniti did not give up, and together with her husband, she wants to again buy piglets for fattening, and continue her business.\r\n

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

\r\nDengan modal pinjaman tahap pertama Ni Komang Suarniti menggunakan untuk membeli bibit babi penggemukan sebanyak 4 ekor dan juga mempergunakan untuk membeli pakan tambahan. Dengan usaha beternak tersebut Ni Komang Suarniti bisa membantu suaminya untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidup sehari- hari bahkan dari keuntungannya Ni Komang Suarniti juga memperbaiki kandang babinya yang semula dari dinding bambu dengan dinding batako. Pada pinjaman tahap kedua ini Ni Komang Suarniti menggunakan untuk membeli bibit babi penggemukan 5 ekor dengan total harga Rp. 1.250.000,-. Pada masa pemeliharaan babinya terkena penyakit dan walaupun sudah ditangani secara medis, namun babinya mati. Ni Komang Suarniti tidak patah semangat bersama suaminya dia mau membeli lagi bibit babi penggemukan untuk melanjutkan usahanya.
loan_use: To buy piglets (Membeli anak babi)

description:
Mawuena A., 35, is married and the father of four children. In the photo, Mawuena is the first person on the left and the others are his apprentices. He lives in Avetonou, a little village situated about 100 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. He is a mechanic and hopes, with this loan, to purchase some tools so as to better meet the needs of his clientele. He also wishes to set up a workshop for his younger brother who has just finished his training as a tailor. In this way, Mawuena will participate in improving living conditions for his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Mawuena A. est âgé de 35 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants. Dans la photo monsieur Mawuena est la première personne à gauche et les autres sont ses apprentis. Il habite à Avetonou, un petit village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il est mécanicien et, souhaite avec ce crédit, acheter des outils de travail pour mieux répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle et aussi ouvrir un atelier à son petit frère qui vient de terminer sa formation en couture. Ce faisant Mawuena participe à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
loan_use:
Purchase tools and also open a workshop for his younger brother

Acheter des outils de travail et aussi ouvrir un atelier à son petit frère

description:
Born November 10th, 1968 in Lomé, Mrs. Kossiwa Thérèse S. is a very energetic woman married to Mr. Yao SOADJEDE who is a master upholsterer. She has three children and sells mattresses and fabric in Agoè neighborhood. She began doing business in 2000 and has already benefitted from one loan from WAGES. She promptly repaid her first loan and is now seeking a second to purchase 20 mattresses in order to be able to offer her customers the latest designs. \r\n

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

\r\nNée la 10 novembre 1968 à Lomé, Madame S. Kossiwa Thérèse est une femme très dynamique qui s’est mariée à monsieur SOADJEDE Yao qui est un maître tapissier.
