Elle a trois enfants et exerce le commerce de matelas et de tissus dans le quartier d’Agoè. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis l’an 2000 et a une fois bénéficié du crédit auprès de WAGES. Elle a promptement remboursé son premier crédit et sollicite ce second prêt pour acheter 20 matelas afin de pouvoir mettre ses clients au parfum des nouveautés.
loan_use: Purchase of 20 mattresses

description: Chea E., age 50, is a widow and has five children. One child is married; one is in security; one is a garment worker and the other two work in the Casino. The rice price is currently good in the market and if the family produces more rice to sell in the market they will have more money to support the family. To reduce the expense that Chea always spends to hire a small tractor to plow her farm, she would like a loan from Kiva to purchase a cow. This will help her a lot with the farming, allowing her to grow more rice to sell to support her family.
loan_use: Chea would like to purchase a cow to plow her land.

description: Mr. Morn N. is 49 years-old. He makes and sells Cambodian noodles from his house, earning approximately $2.93 per day. His wife, Mrs. Dy Yan is 50 years-old. She farms and raises pigs, earning $1.33 per day. The couple has four children. Two of their children are married and the other two attend school. They request a loan of $300 to buy a motorcycle. This motorcycle will support their businesses by making transportation faster and more convenient. The motorcycle will also be helpful for family use. (The picture is N.'s wife)
loan_use: To buy a motorcycle

description:
Sandra H. works in a grocery store in Somotllo in the city of Chinandega, where she comes from. Seven years ago she decided to invest in some stock to sell. As they started to sell bit by bit, she decided to buy more which led to her setting up her grocery store from home.

Her two children are very proud of her as she is now able to give them everything they need to study and to survive.

She has turned to Ceprodel for financial support in order to purchase more stock. She hopes to receive support as soon as possible to invest in her business and continue with her successful venture.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Sandra H. es una dama cuya labor es el negocio de pulpería atendido en el municipio de Somotllo de la ciudad de Chinandega de donde es originaria. Hace siete años decidió invertir en la compra de productos para comercializarlos y al ver que los vendía poco a poco fue incrementando sus productos hasta llegar a establecer su pulpería y ubicarla en su casa de habitación.

Sus dos hijos se sienten muy orgullosos de ella porque ha logrado proporcionarles todo lo necesario para sus estudios y además les ha proporcionado el alimento para su desarrollo.

Ha acudido a Ceprodel con el objetivo de ser beneficiada con un crédito el cual le sea proporcionado para la adquisición de su mercadería. Por este motivo ella espera recibir su crédito para invertir lo mas pronto posible en el negocio y así continuar con el mantenimiento de los suyos.
loan_use: To purchase stock

description:
Samer is 35 years old, married, and has one child. He lives in a small village close to the town of Nabatieh in Southern Lebanon. Samer distributes TV Satellites and cable to his clientele. His child, who is four years old, will enter school next year and Samer needs $1200 to pay for the registration fees.\r\n

\r\nSamer has requested a loan before, and has an excellent record of on-time repayment. He is a responsible entrepreneur who works hard to secure his family’s safety and the education of his child.
loan_use: To pay for the education of his child

description:
Born on December 5, 1971 in Sakété in the southeast of Benin, Mrs. Mouïnatou Morayo S. is married to Chakirou Sadikou, who is a truck driver. She is the mother of four children; Raïmi (18) is in eleventh grade, Manfous (15) is in ninth grade, Adjara (12) is in sixth grade, and Toybath (8) is in second grade. She has a hardware store where she also sells shoes and plastic ware. Presently, she is having financial difficulty stocking her shop. She is requesting this loan so that she can achieve her noble ambition.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née le 5 Décembre 1971 à Sakété au Sud-Est du Bénin,dame S. Mouïnatou Morayo est mariée à SADIKOU Chakirou, Chauffeur transporteur de profession. Elle est mère de 4 enfants dont Raïmi âgé de 18ans est en classe de Seconde, Manfous âgé de 15 ans est en classe de Quatième, Adjara âgée de 12 ans est en classe de Sixième et Toybath 8 ans est en classe de CM1. Elle dispose d'une boutique de quincaillerie où elle vend en plus des chaussures et des plastiques. Actuellement, elle est a des difficultés financières pour approvisionner sa boutique. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour réaliser sa noble ambition.
loan_use:
Purchase of 15 dozen door locks, 2 cases of padlocks, 50 bags of galvanized nails, and 5 boxes of pots of glue

Achat de 15 douzaines de serrures de portes, de 02 cartons de cadenas, de 50 sachets de pointes galvanisées et de 5 boîtes de pot de colle.

description:
María has been selling beer and sodas for the past 5 years. Her husband has a workshop where he makes decorations from polyester fabric. She also works helping her husband in this business. The loans that she has requested have served to buy the materials that she needs for making the decorations.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

María se dedica a la venta de cerveza y gaseosas desde hace 5 años. Asimismo, su esposo tiene desde hace 3 años un taller donde hacen acabados de adornos a base de poliéster. Ella también trabaja ayudando a su esposo en este negocio.\r\nLos préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido para la compra de los materiales que necesita en la producción de los adornos.
loan_use: To buy materials that she needs to make decorations

description:
For the last six years, Lida has sold native products from the highlands in the market close to her house. Previously she used to live in the provinces, where she also used to work as a saleswoman. However, she later decided to move to Lima and to establish a business selling highland products such as broad beans, maize, corn, etc.

Lida travels fortnightly to the highlands to buy her products. The loans she has asked for have allowed her to cover the expenses of the trips she makes. She would like to be able to accumulate more capital to allow her to have a stall and her own house.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Desde hace 6 años, Lida vende productos oriundos de la sierra en el mercado cerca de su casa. Antes ella vivía en provincia, donde también trabajaba vendiendo. Sin embargo, luego decidió mudarse a Lima y poner un negocio de productos de la sierra, como habas, maíz, mote, etc.

Lida viaja quincenal a la sierra a comprar sus productos. Los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido para cubrir el gasto de los viajes que realiza. A ella le gustaría poder tener más capital para así tener un puesto y una casa propia.
loan_use: To travel into the provices to buy the products she sells.

description:
Born around 1970 in Cotonou in Littoral County in the south of Benin, Mrs. Bolanlé A. comes from Nigeria, a country that borders Benin. Married to Jonas Odounfa, a transporter, she is the mother of four children; Ismaël (16) is in eighth grade, Constantine (13) is in sixth grade, Igor (9) is in third grade, and Josiane (6) in first grade. She retails cosmetics, soaps, and other beauty products. She is requesting this loan to bolster her business and satisfy the demands of her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née vers 1970 à Cotonou dans le département du Littoral au Sud du BENIN, dame A. Bolanlé est originaire du NIGERIA, un pays frontalier au BENIN. Mariée à ODOUNFA Jonas, transporteur,elle est mère de 04 enfants que sont Ismaël âgé de 16 ans,est élève en classe de Quatrième, Constantine âgée de 13ans est élève en classe de Sixième, Igor âgé de 09 ans est élève en classe de CM1 et Josiane 06 ans est en classe CP2. Elle est revendeuse de produits cosmétiques, de savons et autres produits de beauté. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer et satisfaire la démande de sa clientèle.
loan_use:
Purchase of 4 cases of ointments and 2 cases of Fanico-brand soap

Achat de 04 cartons de pommades et de 02 cartons de savon FANICO.

description: Tem S., 41, lives in Siem Reap Province with his wife, Seng Socheat (seen in the picture), and their two children. He is a taxi driver and typically makes $4 each day, but his motorbike is old and in need of replacement, so he is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase another one.  This new piece of equipment is essential to an opportunity Tem has to expand his business and make some extra income. He has ambitious goals, including a plan to open a store in the market in the future.
loan_use: To purchase a motorbike.

description:
Vaysiddin R. lives in the Khuroson region. Vaysiddin has a large family, and that is why he needs to work long hours to provide for his family. He owns a piece of land, which he uses to plant various cultures. In order for him to work the land, he needs to purchase a number of fertilizers. To finance this purchase he is applying for a 10-months loan. This will help him grow quality crops, which he will be able to sell without any problems.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Рустамов Вайсиддин проживает в районе Хуросон. Работает агрономом , а так же в частном порядке занимается земледелием.Имеет участок земли , который засеивает различными сельхозкультурами. Для того , чтобы обработать землю ему необходимо закупить удобрения , Но для этого нужно получить кредит со сроком в 10 месяцев. Это поможет ему получить качественный урожай , который он сможет продать без каких-либо проблем. У Вайсиддина большая семья , и поэтому ему приходится много работать для того , чтобы обеспечить свою семью
loan_use: To purchase fertilizers

description:
Celmith S. S. works every day selling treats like popcorn, fried chips made from a variety of plantains, candied nuts, and other snacks as well as soft drinks of all kinds on a street corner near the sports fields of Club Chacarita.

Celmith is happy to be a member of the Manuela Ramos group and, thanks to the financing it provides, she was able to start her own business to generate her own income to pay for household expenses and better her family’s economic situation. With this loan of 1000 Nuevo Sol ($350), which she will repay in four months, she will purchase nuts and popcorn by the kilo, plantains by the bunch, soft drinks by the dozen, sugar for preparing the nuts. This way she will be well stocked with the necessary elements to prepare her snacks and satisfy her customers.

Celmith is 40 years old and relies on the help of her eldest son with her business. She is a mature and content person who has made good investments in her business. She wishes to continue working in order to increase her business and help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

La señora Celmith S. S., socia del Grupo de Crédito Mientras Tanto “28 DE JULIO”, vive en el Departamento de San Martín, provincia de San Martín y distrito de Tarapoto, se dedica de manera diaria a la venta de golosinas como: palomitas de maíz, chifles de diversos variedades de plátanos, así como maní confitado y saladito, además bebidas gasificadas de diferentes marcas y tamaños, todo esto en una de las esquinas de la cancha deportiva del Club Chacarita de Tarapoto, ella vive en el Jr. 28 de Julio No 110. La señora Celmith se siente contenta de pertenecer al Grupo de Manuela Ramos, y que gracias al financiamiento que le brindan, decidió invertir para implementar su propio negocio para poder generar sus propios ingresos, poder solventar los gastos de su hogar y mejorar su economía familiar. Con el préstamo de S/. 1000.00 que será devuelto en 4 meses, ella comprará, maní en kilos, plátanos en racimos, maíz canchita en kilos, gaseosas en docenas, azúcar para preparar el confitado de maní, de esa manera implementar, y contar con los elementos necesarios para preparar sus golosinas y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Celmith tiene 40 años, cuenta con el apoyo de su hijo mayor, ella se siente una persona realizada, cuenta también, que tiene buenos ingresos y que no le va nada mal, tiene muchas ganas de seguir trabajando para crecer en el negocio y sacar adelante a su familia.
loan_use: Wholesale purchase of nuts, plantains, corn and soft drinks.

description:
Mrs. Lucy has a store where she sells spare parts and accessories for automobiles. Her husband is a mechanic and together they worked hard to purchase the house in which they were former tenants. They have a son that is studying and she is punctual client with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

LA SEÑORA LUCY TIENE UNA TIENDA DOND. VEND. REPUESTOS Y ACCESORIOS PARA MOVILIDADES, SU ESPOSO ES MECANICO Y JUNTOS TRABAJARON MUCHO PARA COMPRARSE LA CASA EN DOND. ANTES ERAN INQUILINOS TIENEN UN HIJO AL QUE ESTAN HACIENDO ESTUDIAR ES UNA CLIENTE PUNTUAL EN SUS PAGOS.
loan_use: Increase in merchandise of automotive parts

description:
The group of two people are working on new loans with an institution with whom they have a good history of payment; both have children and spouses. Mr. German is a mechanic and has an automobile which he uses at night as a taxi service. Mr. Angel sells accessories and spare automotive parts. He has a son that married very young and so he still supports him economically. Both members of the group are very enterprising people.

Translated from Spanish by H. Smith, Kiva volunteer.

EL GRUPO DE DOS PERSONAS TRABAJAN NUEVE CREDITOS CON LA INSTITUCION CON UN BUEN HISTORIAL DE PAGOS, AMBOS TIENEN HIJOS Y ESPOSAS, EL SEÑOR GERMAN ES MECANICO Y TIENE UN TRANSPORTE CON EL QUE EN LAS NOCHES TRABAJA COMO SERVICO DE TAXI, EL SEÑOR ANGEL VENDE ACCESORIO Y REPUESTOS PARA MOVILIDAD TIENE UN HIJO QUE SE CASO MUY JOVEN AL CUAL AYUDA ECONOMICAMENTE AUN, AMBOS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON PERSONAS MUY EMPRENDEDORAS.
loan_use: One member will purchase car accessories and the other member will purchase tires for his vehicle

description:
Ms. Dolores C. A. is a member of the “Santa Isabel” microfinance institution, located in the district of Picota, in the province of Picota, San Martín department. She prepares and sells meals for a living in the district’s market, courteously serving her patrons—mostly all residents of the area.

The need to improve her financial situation impelled her to start her own business, having at that time only a small kitchen, a table, and a few utensils. She later improved her business via loans from the microfinance institution and the profits from her daily sales.

With the loan of 1,500.00 Peruvian soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase ingredients such as: rice, sacks of sugar, cooking oil, and condiments in bulk. She will buy meats (chicken, beef, pork, fish) and assorted vegetables daily. She will buy kitchenware such as pots, plates, bowls, spoons, forks, and plastic table covers so that she can meet her patrons’ needs.

She is 67 years of age and has 3 independent children. She would like to have a well-established business so that she can have a calm old age. She counts on the affection and respect of her patrons.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Dolores C. A., es socia del Banco Comunal ”Santa Isabel” ubicado en el distrito de Picota, provincia de Picota, departamento de San Martín, se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida, en el mercado del mismo Distrito atendiendo con amabilidad a sus clientes que en su mayoría son los moradores de la localidad.

La necesidad de mejorar su situación económica le impulsaron a iniciarse en el negocio, contando en ese momento solo con una cocinita pequeña, una mesa y unos cuantos utensilios de cocina luego fue implementando con los prestamos del Banco Comunal y con las ganancias de sus ventas diarias.

Con el préstamo recibido de S/. 1,500.00 que será pagado en 6 meses, compró ingredientes como: arroz, azúcar en sacos, aceite en litros y condimentos en grandes cantidades, y diariamente compra carnes (pollo, res, cerdo y pescado) y verduras diversas, también compró utensilios de cocina como ollas, platos (tendidos y soperas), cucharas, tenedores, plástico con motivos para tender sus mesas, así satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes.

Tiene 67 años, y 3 hijos que ya son independientes, desea estabilizarse como negocio para tener una vejez tranquila, cuenta con la simpatía y respeto de sus clientes.
loan_use: Purchase wholesale supplies

description: Rous S., 48, is a single man, living with his elderly father in the Prey Veng province. He sells ice cream, typically making US$10 each day. He has asked for a loan of US$800 to purchase some farmland to grow rice. Many families in Cambodia have struggled with the rising inflation and are seeking out loans to expand and diversify their sources of income. Rous S. believes that a new rice field will allow him to have two sources of income to support his family. He has seen how profitable rice fields have become in his area and would like the opportunity to increase his daily income and improve his standard of living.
loan_use: Purchase farmland to grow rice

description:
Mary is 44 years old. She is married with three children aged seventeen, fifteen, and twelve years respectively. They are all currently in school.

Mary is a petty trader who trades in maize and ginger. She has been a retailer of ginger and maize for the past twelve years and provides for her family.

Mary wants to use the loan to buy a bulk supply of maize and ginger to serve her customers throughout the season. She faces increasing food prices due to the current food crisis in the country. The loan will help her with increasing costs and enable her to raise her income to support her children at school.

She belongs to a community group called "Blessing Trust Group" where group members assist one another to provide support in handling loan repayments.

This photo of Mary was taken during a group meeting.
loan_use: To buy bulk supply of maize and ginger.

description:
Oimgul B. is a resident of Khuroson distrct. She’s married and has two children. She has a higher education and works as a teacher in a secondary school. To supplement her income, she runs a small stall near her home where she sells food products. She has been doing this for three years now and would like to expand her stall and stock turnover. To do so, she decided to take out a loan that she expects to repay within 10 months. This will enable her to increase her business and income which she needs to support her family.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer.

Бобоева Оимгуль жительница района Хуросон. Замужем мать двоих детей. Имеет высшее образование. Работает учителем в средней школе. Кроме того подрабатывает торговлей. Имеет небольшую торговую точку рядом с домом , где продает продукты питания. Занимается этим делом уже три года. Теперь хочет увеличить торговую точку и товарооборот. Для этого она решила получить кредит со сроком на 10 месяцев. Это поможет увеличить бизнес и увеличить доход , необходимый для ее семьи.
loan_use: Increase of stock

description:
The formation of the group was in May of 2007. Hermogena T. learned about the Programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras (Committee of Entrepreneurial Women program) and decided to form a group with her neighbors. Looking for women she could trust, she finally managed to form the committee which they named Kuña Aty.

The committee is in its 6th cycle and is not at all behind in their payments, which makes them an excellent group. They have 16 members, and they all work together to pay for their loans. They attend their weekly meetings and have a good amount of savings, which are deposited in a bank. The women have different occupations such as the sale of items like coal, fruits and vegetables, lingerie, handicrafts, baskets, bijouterie, etc.

The group Kuña Aty is situated in a rural settlement in the city of Capiatá. They are all the kind of people who daily place great effort to attain a better quality of life. They work hard so that they do not fail Fundación Paraguaya, and they place extreme value in the funds they receive through the committee loans.

Today, they are requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise for its sale in their respective businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El inicio del Grupo fue en el mes de Mayo del 2007, la señora Hermogena T. se informó sobre el Programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y decidió formar un grupo con sus vecinas, buscando señoras de su confianza, ella logró finalmente formar el comité al que denominaron Kuña Aty.

El Comité se encuentra en el 6º ciclo cuentan con 0 (cero) días de atraso lo que las convierte en un grupo excelente, son 16 las integrantes y todas trabajan en forma conjunta para pagar sus créditos, asisten a sus reuniones semanales y cuentan con una buena cantidad de ahorro el cual lo tienen depositado en una Financiera. Las integrantes se dedican a distintas actividades como: Venta de artículos varios como carbón, verduras y frutas, lencería, artesanías, canastas artesanales, bijouterie, etc.

El Grupo Kuña Aty se encuentra localizado en un asentamiento rural de la Ciudad de Capiatá. Todas son personas que día a día se esfuerzan por lograr una mejor condición de vida, se esfuerzan para no fallar con la Fundación Paraguaya y valoran sumamente el dinero que reciben através de los préstamos de comités.

Ellas hoy solicitan un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en la compra de mercaderías para la venta en sus respectivos negocios.
loan_use: Purchase food, coal, fruits and vegetables, lingerie, handicrafts, baskets, bijouterie, etc. to sell in their respective businesses.
borrower_names: Sonia, Estela, Brigida, Dora, Alfonsa, Carmen, Bernardina, Selva, Alejandra, Celia, Eugenia, Dora, Agueda, Hermogena, Cheni, Gladys
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, false, true, true

description:
The LONLON Agoè Association ("L’ Association LONLON Agoè") was founded in July 2006 in the Agoè district of Lomé. The members who make up this group are involved in small businesses. Three women from this association had the vision to help each other and find ways to profit each of their businesses. They are all married and have families. They are talented in their work, having had more than 7 years of experience running small businesses. This is the LONLON Agoè Association's second loan. The group requests a loan to buy 3 sacks of rice, 1 bag of chili peppers, and 6 sacks of mustard.

Translated from French by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

L’ Association LONLON Agoè est créée en juillet 2006 dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Les activités des membres de cette association sont les petits commerces. Les trois femmes de cette association ont pour objectif l’entraide mutuelle et la recherche du profit sur leurs activités. Elles sont mariées et mères de famille. Elles sont douées dans l’exercice de leur activité car ayant des expériences de plus de 7 ans dans le petit commerce. L’association LONLON Agoè est à son 2ème cycle de près et sollicite ce crédit pour acheter 3 sacs de riz, 1 sac de piments et 6 paniers de moutarde.
loan_use: to buy basic goods

description:
Mrs. Rister M. G., member of the Community Bank “Virgen de la Inmaculada”, lives in the Departament of San Martín, province de San Martín, District de Tarapoto. She sells beauty products and other items such as shoes, wallets, etc. She sells primarily by taking orders. She began working in this field three years ago and she sells perfumes and cosmetics of different brands such as ESIKA, AVON, and UNIQUE, which she sells through orders and by catalog and she also maintains a supply in her home. She supplements her income with the preparation and sale of humitas (tamales) and juanes (similar to a tamal, except made with rice, spices, a stuffing, and wrapped in leaves) which she makes to order for special events such as birthdays, weddings, quinceañeros and others. With the the loan of 1,300 Peruvian Soles, which will be returned in six months, she will buy various items such as perfumes, creams, shampoos, soaps, makeup, deodorant, lipstick, and also shoes. In addition she will buy ingredients for the preparation of the refrigerated foods which will allow her to complete orders and satisfy the needs of her customers. She is 60 years old, lives with her husband and daughter, who is studying at the university. It is because of her family that she works day alter day with such perseverance. One of her goals is to have a trimmings (embellishments for clothing and other textiles) shop because there is nothing like that in her neighborhood, and another goal is to see her daughter become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy, a Kiva volunteer.

Compra de artículos de belleza. Comapra de insumos. Description La señora Rister M. G., es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen de la Inmaculada”, vive en el Departamento de San Martín, provincia de San Martín, Distrito de Tarapoto, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, y otros artículos como zapatos, carteras, etc, sobre todo trabaja con pedidos, su negocio esta ubicada en su propia casa en la Av. Lima Nº 830. Se dedica a este tipo de negocio hace 3 años ella vende artículos de perfumería y cosméticos de diferentes marcas como ESIKA, AVON, UNIQUE, que lo vende a través de pedidos y por catalogo y que también tiene un Stock en su casa. Complementa su negocio con la preparación y venta juanes, humitas, que los prepara a pedido eventos especiales como: cumpleaños, matrimonios, quinceañeros y otros Con el crédito recibido de S/. 1,300.00 que será devuelto en 6 meses, comprará diversos artículos como perfumes, cremas, champús, jabones, maquillajes, desodorante, lápiz labial y otros además zapatos, también comprará insumos para la preparación de los refrigerios y así atender sus pedidos y poder satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes. Tiene 60 años, vive con su esposo y su menor hija, que está estudiando en la Universidad, por quienes día a día trabaja con mucha perseverancia. Una de sus metas es tener un negocio de pasamanería porque ve que falta este tipo de negocio por su barrio, otra de sus metas es ver a su hija realizada con una profesión.
loan_use: Purchase of beauty products/cosmetics and consumables.

description:
Married with four children, Margaret is thirty-eight-years-old. She sells home products like cooking utensils, plastic bowls, buckets and plates. She makes her sales by ‘hawking,’ which means door to door sales.

Margaret is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to build a shop to house her goods. She wants to use the loan to buy an increased stock of plastic materials and kitchen sets to serve her customers.

She is a member of the community group called St. Benedict Trust Group. In this group members assist one another to provide support in handling repayment of loans. Margaret is in the photograph, taken during her group meeting.
loan_use: To buy increased stock of plastic materials and kitchen sets.

description:
The Sabiduría II Communial Bank is a bank that was started recently with 27 members. Some of the members were invited by members of other communal banks and others were invited by the promoters.

The members have different businesses such as selling fish, fruits, handicrafts, vegetables, groceries, cosmetics by catalog, spare parts and clothing. They sell in different markets in the city of AyaC., in their homes and some sell by traveling from place to place.

The members need loans of different amounts. Some loans are for 300 soles or 600 soles but make up a grand total of 12,600 soles in loans from the communal bank.

The loans will be used to purchase tomatoes, carrots, onions, sugar, rice, pasta, cooking oil, perfumes, paint, fish, spare parts, sweaters and coats.

The dreams of the members are to grow their businesses, have their own home, buy nice things and that their children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer. El Banco Comunal Sabiduría II es un banco que recién inicia con 27 socias, algunas de las socias fueron invitadas por socias de otros Bancos Comunales, otras fueron invitadas por las promotora.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta pescado, frutas, artesanía, verduras, abarrotes, cosméticos por catalogo, repuestos y ropa.

Sus ventas los realizan en diferentes mercados de la ciudad de AyaC., en sus casas y algunas de manera ambulatoria,

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de préstamos, algunos montos son de 300 soles, 600 soles, haciendo un total de 12,600 soles de préstamos en el Banco Comunal.

Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra de tomate, zanahoria, cebolla, azúcar, arroz, fideo, aceite, perfumes, pinturas, pescados, repuestos, chompas y casacas.

Los sueños de las socias son ampliar sus negocios, tener casa propia, comprar sus artefactos y sus hijos sean profesionales.
loan_use: Purchase tomatoes, carrots, onions, sugar, rice, pasta, cooking oil, perfumes, paint, fish, spare parts, sweaters and coats.
borrower_names: Paulina, Serafina Benita, Alejandrina, Ruth, Claudia, Janeth Cecilia, Rene, Maria Pelagia, Martha Isabel, Maria Victoria, Bedenisse Kelly, Zaira, Marilu, Alejandra Ruperta, Rosa Flor, Marleny Marilu, Norma, Gladys Elena, Bacilia, Zintia Margot, Teofila, Marta, Marina, Raquel Victoria, Maritza Yanina, Melida Sandra, Margott Elizabeth
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description: Jose Maria is a young man, married with three boys. About 8 years ago he decided to open his own business, with very little help, but with much effort and sacrifices. His business has grown with attention to his clients and food products. His business is flourishing with the possibility of expanding even more. He already has his own house and his son is studying and helping with the micro-business.\r\n\r\nHe request the loan in addition to buy meat, eggs, cheese and drinks.
loan_use: to buy hamburguer meat, cheese, eggs, and drinks like soda.

description:
Simple and traditional way of raining pigs is considered as not giving maximal results by Komang Wati. However from raising pigs, Komang Wati hopes to give good results to assist in family's economy. Komang Wati raised 1 mother pig. Then Komang Wati decided to borrow capital from DINARI that was used to buy 1 mother pig and another for fattening. From those 2 mothers, 12 piglets were produced that was sold at Rp175,000'piglet (Translator’s note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp8,000-9,500.00) plus sales of fattened pig for a total nett profit of Rp 1,500,000 for 6 months. Komang Wati continues to the next loan from DINARI since it is considered as very helpful to expand the business. The next loan would be used to buy feed and 2 fattening piglets, so that it would increase obtained profit in the upcoming 6 months. This result would decide the economical road of Komang Wati's family that also has to provide child schooling.\r\n

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

\r\nPemeliharaan yang sederhana dan tradisional pada ternak babinya dirasakan tidak menghasilkan hasil yang maksimal oleh Komang Wati. Padahal dari memelihara babi Komang Wati mengharapkan hasil yang baik untuk menunjang perekonomian keluarga. Komang Wati memelihara 1 ekor babi penginduk. Kemudian Komang Wati mengambil keputusan untuk meminjam modal ke DINARI yang digunakannya untuk menambah populasi babinya dengan membeli 1 ekor penginduk lagi serta 1 ekor bibit penggemukan. Dari kedua penginduk tersebut menghasilkan 12 ekor anak babi yang dijual @ Rp. 175.000,- ditambah penjualan babi penggemukannya didapatkan keuntungan bersih sebesar Rp. 1.500.000,- selama 6 bulan. Komang Wati meneruskan pinjaman selanjutnya ke DINARI karena dianggap sangat menolongnya mengembangkan usaha. Pinjaman berikutnya akan digunakan untuk membeli pakan serta 2 ekor bibit penggemukan sehingga akan menambah keuntungan yang diperoleh pada 6 bulan berikutnya. Hasil ini menentukan jalannya perekonomian keluarga Komang Wati yang juga harus menyekolahkan anaknya.
loan_use: To buy piglets and feed (Membeli anak babi dan pakan)

description:
Mrs. Nguyen Ngoc M., joined the TYM Fund since 2000. At that time, her family’s main activity is to run a small studio on ID and wedding pictures. At first, she borrowed 40 USD to buy a more modern camera. Later, she used the borrowed to send her husband to a photography class. She now expands her studio and they also do typing documents for customers. She has to hire one helper to assist her with the studio’s work with a wage of 80 USD/month. This time, she wants to borrow 1150 USD to upgrade her studio. Her family average income is 625 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Ngọc M. 38 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương năm 2000, lúc đó gia đình chị làm nghề chụp ảnh thẻ và đám cưới. Khi tham gia Quỹ vòng vốn đầu chị vay 500.000đ để mua một chiếc máy ảnh với nhiều tính năng hơn. Các vòng vốn sau chị đầu tư cho anh đi học nâng cao tay nghề chụp ảnh và quay phim và làm ảnh kỹ thuật số. Cho đến nay gia đình chị đã có 1 cửa hàng khá khang trang với các dich vụ như quay phim, chụp ảnh kỹ thuật số, photo coppy và đánh máy vi tính, với số lượng công việc nhiều gia đình anh chị phải thuê 1 người phụ giúp với mức lương 1.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 19.000.000đ đầu tư vào cửa hàng. Thu nhập bình quân. 10.000.000đ/ tháng.
loan_use: upgrade photography studio

description:
Jose is 23 years old, single, with no children. He is a native of the neighborhood Ndavarù in the city of Carapeguá, 100 km from the capital. He lives with his parents.

Jose is a young entrepreneur who walks around selling his crafts. He has done this for 10 years, since his first work experience was learning this profession from his parents and siblings. Moreover, he is pursuing his fourth year of a Science Administration career in a private university; thanks to his work revenue he can afford his studies. With this loan, he will buy bedspreads, hammocks, shoes, and sheets.
loan_use: To buy merchandise (bedspreads, hammocks, shoes, sheets)

description:
In the city of San Roque Gonazalez in the neighborhood Sagrado Corazon de Jesús, located 12 km from the Carapeguá office, some women of few resouces learned of the program Women Entrepreneurs Group and decided to meet to receive information about the program. They were looking for a little more support to promote credit through their family incomes and improve their quality of life. These individuals grew thanks to this program. They need this operating credit to invest in their respective micro-businesses and to achieve sustainable growth that makes them grow as a group as well as individuals. Thanks to this new venture, they were able to have better economic returns.

\r\n\r\nUnable to attend the meeting for the photograph: Cinthia M., for reason of studies, Nilda S., for reason of work, Laura A., for reason of work.
loan_use: to purchase merchandise for grocery stores, crafts, a freezer, candies, soda, and some ingredients to prepare meals.
borrower_names: Nilda, Liliana, Lucia, Zunilda, Justina, Juana, Dolores, Modesta, Greta, Laura, Cinthia, Lourdes, Mirna, Ingrid, Nilda
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: false, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, false, false, true, true, true, true

description:
Ms. Rosa B. works selling all kinds of decorative plants and flowers at the local market every weekend. She likes to be involved in this activity, which she has been doing for 19 years when it started out of curiosity. Today, she is still selling plants because she really enjoys this job, which also permits her to look after her four young children. They are studying in order to keep moving forward on the road of success, which further motivates Ms. B.. She would like to increase her amount of merchandise, which is why she is requesting a loan of 500 Peruvian soles. Support Ms. B.’ efforts and her desire to keep working.\r\n

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

\r\nDoña Rosa trabaja todos los fines D. semana vendiendo en un puesto D. la feria D. su localidad todo tipo D. plantas ornamentales y flores. Ella gusta D. realizar estas actividades y lo viene haciendo desD. hace 19 años cuando todo comenzó por simple curiosidad, ahora lo sigue haciendo porque realmente disfruta D. este trabajo, que le permite además, atender a sus 4 jóvenes hijos, ellos ahora están estudiando para seguir en el camino D. la superación y esto anima más a Doña Rosa. Su deseo es incrementar la cantidad D. mercadería que posee para lo cual esta solicitando un préstamo D. 500 soles. Apoya este esfuerzo y las ganas D. seguir trabajando D. Doña Rosa.
loan_use: Increase her variety of plants and flowers

description:
Sousa L. is 46 years old. He is married and he had 6 children. The oldest one is 26 and the others are 21, 13, 11, 8 and 1 year old respectively. The are all in school except for the youngest one. Besides his sons and daughters, he also supports his mother and nephews that live with her by sending money and food. Sousa went to school until the 8th grade and because of his family situation he had to start working at an early age to cover the expenses, worse yet, there were no evening classes available at that time. Sousa worked for a pottery company in Mozambique that awarded him in 1981 with a 3-year scholarship in Cuba. He still receives pension payments from that company. He lives in his own home. In 1989, Sousa built an iron shop that later had to be passed on to his ex-wife when they were divorced. Sousa is now self-employed. Since 1999 he has been running a restaurant he built with his own resources. The restaurant opens at 8:00am and closes at 9:00pm; it has 3 employees. He learned the skills needed on his own when he realized that his salary was not enough to pay for his family´s needs. The best selling dish is pork meat which goes for 80,00mt and costs him 45,00mt. His monthly income is 12000,00mt and from that amount he saves 3500,00mt. This is his second loan request in his life and first through Kiva. The first loan was in the amount of 10000,00mt given by BPD (People´s Development Bank) and it was used to build the iron shop his ex-wife now owns. The second loan will be used to purchase a variety of products for the restaurant, thus, increasing sales. In the future, with help from other loans, Sousa intends to open up a butcher´s shop to sell meat and expand his business.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Sousa L. tem 46 ano de idade, casado maritalmente e pai de 6 filhos sendo de 26 anos de idade o primeiro, 21 o segundo, 13 o terceiro, 11 o quarto, 8 o quinto e um ano o sexto. Todos ainda estudam excepto o menor de todos. Para além dos seus filhos sustenta a sua mae e seus sobrinhos que vive com a sua mae enviando dinheiros ou generos alimenticios. Sousa estudou até Oitava Classe e por situação familiar teve que começar a trabalhar muito novo para sustentar a familia e como na era nao tinhas escolas que davam aulas de noite. Sousa trabalhou na ceramica de Moçambique empresa que lhe deu bolsa para estudar em Cuba em 1981 por tres anos, empresa que até hoje se benificia de uma pensao. Vive numa casa própria. Em 1989 Sousa construiu uma ferragem qual teve que deixar com sua primeira esposa, quando se divorciaram. Sousa trabalha a conta própria, onde desde 1999 explora um estabelecimento (Restaurante) construído por fundos próprios o Restaurante abre as 8:00h e fecha as 21:00h e tem 3 empregados. Aprendeu o trabalho por inciativa própria quando viu que o salario não respondia as necessidades da casa. O prato com mais saída é o acompanhado com carne de Porco que vende por 80,00mt meticais qual lhe custa 45,00mt. Tem uma receita mensal de 12000,00mt e poupa 3500,00mt. Este é o segundo emprestimo na vida e primeiro na Hluvuku e Kiva o primeiro foi de 10000,00mt contraído no BPD( banco popular de desenvolvimento) valor que usou para construção da ferragem que deixo com a sua primeira esposa. O segundo usara para adquirir produtos diversos para o restaurante aumentando assim as vendas. Sousa pretende futuramente com ajuda dos empréstimo abrir um talho para vende de carne e expandir o seu negocio.
loan_use: To increase stocks in his Restaurant

description:
Feliciana is a young mother and a professional at the same time. Her vocation as an early childhood teacher goes beyond this role as she understands that she forms these young students for their entire lives. She is very dedicated to her family and loves her work for which she is well prepared as she applies her knowledge by creating educational materials from plastic molded crafts. The quality with which she produces them allows her to improve her work each day which is why her orders have increased. In this occasion Feliciana needs a loan of 1000 soles that will allow her to obtain the raw material for the elaboration of her educational materials. Help Feliciana to move forward with her success. \r\n

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

\r\nFeliciana es una joven madre de familia y buena profesional a la vez, su vocación como profesora del nivel inicial trasciende más allá, pues entiende que ella forma a sus pequeños alumnos para toda la vida. Ella es muy dedicada a su familia y ama su trabajo para el cual está preparada, pues aplica sus conocimientos elaborando de manera independiente todo tipo de materiales didácticos a base de corrospum, la calidad con que ella produce le permite mejorar cada día sus trabajos por lo cual sus pedidos van en aumento. En esta ocasión Feliciana necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles que le servirá para obtener la materia prima para la elaboración de sus materiales didácticos. Apoya a Feliciana a continuar adelante con su éxito.
loan_use: To increase raw materials in order to be able to make crafts.

description:
Mrs. Bùi Thị Toàn, 52 years old, joined the TYM Fund in 2006. She put her first loan of 3,000,000 VND towards purchasing merchandise. Currently, her family has a general store. They get a steady income from their business of selling miscellaneous merchandise.

Even though they have the store, her family still grows rice and raises pigs. All of her children are grown. Her eldest child has moved out and has his/her own family. The other three children still live with her and are attending either high school or middle school.

Although they live in the countryside, her family is very determined to raise their children with an education. All of her children perform well in school. Her husband is a hardworking person. He is constantly active and helps with growing the rice and raising the pigs.

For this round of loans, they want to raise 9,000,000 VND to invest in their retail store. Their average income is 4,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Bùi Thị Toàn 52 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương năm 2006, vòng vốn đầu chị vay 3.000.000đ đầu tư mua hàng hóa, hiện tai gia đình chị có cửa hàng tạp hóa tại chợ thu nhập từ việc kinh doanh hàng tạp hóa rất đều đăn, mặc dù đi chợ nhưng gia đình chị vẫn làm ruộng và chăn nuôi lợn, các con chị đều đã lớn con đầu chị đã xây dựng gia đình và ra ở riêng, 3 con đang sống cùng gia đình chị đều đang đi học đại học và trung cấp, mặc dù ở nông thôn nhưng gia đình chị rất quyết tâm nuôi các con ăn học, các con chị học rất giỏi, chồng chị là người chịu khó thường xuyên động viên chi và giúp chị những công việc đồng ruộng và chăn nuôi. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000đ đầu tư vào cửa hàng tạp hóa. Thu nhập bình quân 4.000.000đ/ tháng.
loan_use: To put towards their retail store that sells general merchanise.

description:
Sarah E. sells clothes and is also a fashion designer. She lives in Ajamgbadi, Lagos State, Nigeria.\r\n

\r\nSarah has two apprentices and four sewing machines. She studied for 2-1/2 years prior to starting her business in 1998. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past three years and is requesting this loan to buy more fabric and another sewing machine for her business.
loan_use: To buy more fabric and one sewing machine for the business

description:
Abdurahim is 36, married, and has 3 children. He has been involved in business for several years. He now has two area of business - at home he raises cattle, and in addition, since he is a chef by training, he rents a small cafe, where he cooks and has hired employees. At his cafe customers can sit with friends, enjoy a good lunch, and drink cold beer and other refreshing drinks. Both businesses are stable and allow him to support his family. Since he invested a large amount of money in the cafe, he came to Microinvest for a loan. With the loan he bought two large bull calves. His family helps raise the animals. Business grew steadily and he earned a good profit. When he found out about Kiva, he decided to request a new loan, which he would like to invest into expanding the livestock business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Абдурахиму 36 лет, женат. имеет 3 детей. Предпринимательством занимается уже несколько лет. Сейчас у него 2 направления бизнеса - дома откармливает крупный рогатый скот и еще, так как он по профессии повар, он взял в аренду маленькое кафе где наняв работников работает по профессии. Там у него можно вкусно пообедать, выпить холодного пива и прохладительные напитки, посидеть с друзьями. Оба бизнеса стабильные и позволяют содержать семью. Так как большая часть денег была вложена им в кафе, он обратился в Микроинвест за займом. Получив займ он купил 2 больших бычков. В откорме скота ему помогает его семья. Бизнес развивался стабильно и он тогда получил хорошую прибыль. Узнав О КИВА он решил обратиться за новым займом. который собирается вложить в дальнейшее расширение откорма скота.
loan_use: Purchase of bull calves

description:
Mr. Man L. and his wife, Mrs. Sata Ham, who live along National Road Number Six, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, have been married for 28 years and have 11 children: four sons and seven daughters. Five of their children are married and live outside the family home, while the other six attend the local school.

\r\n\r\nAssisted by his wife, Mr. Man has been in the recycling business for over 10 years, buying recycling materials from villagers for resale to a middleman, who then sells them in Phnom Penh. Mr. Ma is requesting a loan of $150 to purchase recycling materials for resale.
loan_use: To invest in his recycling business.

description:
Mame D., age 49, is  married and has four children in her care.  She has been a member of the village bank of Château d’eau Bignona for three years.  She does business in shoes and second-hand clothing next to the TOTAL station.  Mame buys merchandise in Dakar for resale in Bignona.  She want to bolster her business to better help her family.    The loan that she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

 Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer


Mame D., 49 ans, mariée avec 04 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Château d’eau Bignona depuis 3 ans et demi. Elle fait un commerce de friperies et de chaussures à coté de la station TOTAL. Mame achète la marchandise à Dakar pour revendre à Bignona Elle veut renforcer son activité pour mieux aider sa famille. Le  prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
loan_use: To buy and resell second-hand clothing and shoes

description:
Latifat M. owns a fish pond in which she rears fingerlings into adult fish for sale. She studied this business for one year and has been operating her pond since 2006. Latifat is 34 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Egan, Lagos State, Nigeria. \r\n

Latifat has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 2 years. She needs a loan of $1,200 to buy more fingerlings and feed, which she says will enable her to produce more fish for sale.
loan_use: To stock a fish pond

description:
The leader of this small group is Rose F.. She currently sells beer and is requesting a loan to open up a bar. Rose is 30 years old and is married to a peasant. She has three children, ranging from age 7 to 15, all of whom go to school. Each week, Rose makes approximately 80 Sudanese pounds in profit. With the extra capital from her loan, she hopes to open up a bar.

\r\n\r\n

Rose is joined in her small group by Poni S., Juru L., Ruth K., and Jane A.. Poni sells vegetables at the market (like okra and cabbages) and wants to expand her business. Juru sells charcoal at home and wants a loan to pay school fees for her children. Ruth sells bread at the market and wants to build an oven. Jane sells beans and posho at the market and is requesting a loan to open up a bar.
loan_use: To open up a bar.

description:
Mrs. Vanny D. is employed in a garment factory in Kraing Svay Village in Kampong Speu Province (she and her husband are shown in the picture). She is 34 and the mother of four children, two of whom are attending the local school, while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Sam Al Buth, is a subsistence farmer. \r\n

\r\nMr. Sam Al Buth’s plantation has faced an obstacle because he does not have enough money to hire labourers to work the field. Thus, Mrs. Vanny D. decided to ask for a loan to solve this problem. In addition, she would use part of the money to buy fertilizers for the field. Last year, one of her children got dengue fever and Mrs. Vanny D. had unforeseen expenses to cure them. That is why today, she cannot afford to hire labourers to work the field.
loan_use: To hire labourers to work the field and buy fertilizers for the field.

description:
Mrs. Prum T. is a subsistence farmer in Kandal Village in Kampong Speu Province. Aside from this business activity, she also owns a small grocery store in the village.

Mrs. Prum T. is a 49 year old widow with five children, two of whom run a motorbike with cart to transport people or goods as a business. The three remaining children are attending the local school.

Mrs. Prum T.’s grocery store is too old so she wants to build a new one. Unfortunately, she has insufficient money to afford it. Therefore, Mrs. Prum T. asked for a loan to build a new, more attractive store in order to sell her products more easily.
loan_use: To build a new grocery store to replace the old one.

description:
Mrs. Vech M. is a subsistence farmer in Sya Village in Kampong Speu Province. She cultivates twice a year. During the rainy season, Mrs. Vech M. cultivates rice, while during the dry season, she grows vegetables. Her husband, Mr. Try Men, helps her out with the farming in his spare time from working in a kiln. \r\n

\r\nIn order to improve her living conditions, Mrs. Vech M. now wants to start a cow breeding business. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan. Mrs. Vech M. is a 38 year old mother of four children, three of whom are attending school, while the youngest one is too young to work or enrol in school. Her husband is shown in the left of the photo.
loan_use: To start a cow breeding business in order to improve her family income.

description: Tagi (his brother is pictured) is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Kalbadjar region, the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. He is settled in the Absheron region. He has 6 years of experience in this business. Now this 51-year-old man needs a loan of $1200 to buy the necessary materials for making cisterns. He is married and has 3 children.
loan_use: To buy the necessary materials for making cisterns

description:
Bashoratkhon B. is 40 years old. She is married and the loving mother of five children. Her elder son is studying at the university and the rest of her children are of school age. Her husband is a master.

Bashoratkhon is a seamstress. She sews the national dresses for women and girls. Bashoratkhon works at home, accepting the orders and performing her duties. She also accepts orders to sew the outfits of bridegrooms for their weddings. Bashoratkhon purchases the fabrics required for sewing by herself in the market. Her daughter helps her with her business.

Bashoratkhon has been in this business for more than ten years. She is a very popular seamstress and has lots of orders. The business is stable and generates considerable income for the family.

Today, Bashoratkhon is applying for a loan for the first time. She is requesting a loan of $600 USD for the term of 12 months so she can purchase the new, modern fabrics for sewing the national dresses. Bashoratkhon thanks everyone for supporting her and promises to be accurate in her loan payment. Support this woman with much strength and courage to keep working.
loan_use: To purchase the new modern fabrics of sewing the national dresses.

description: Sokhrab B. is 29 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Kalbadjar region, settled in Khirdalan town. He is married and has 2 children. He has been  in the taxi business for 3 years.  Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy  spare parts for his taxi and to improve his business.
loan_use: to buy spare parts

description:
Grace is 42 years old, and the mother of 6 children. All her children currently attend school. Grace treks to a nearby village to purchase products, and sells them in Kumasi, where she earns good sales and additional income to support her family. Grace would like to purchase more farm products to avoid price hikes as farmers enter the planting season. Grace wants to use the loan to purchase plantain, and cocoyam.\r\n

\r\nGrace is a member of a group called Isaiah. Members support one another in repaying loans.
loan_use: To bunch of plantain and bags of cocoyam

description:
Janet is father and mother to her three children. Driven by her great hope to earn her own income, she set up a small shop, selling basic commodities, two years ago. Thanks to her efforts and dedication, she has seen her business improve day after day. Janet feels in her bones the effects of the increase in the cost of living in her country and she dreams of having a mini-market, selling all kinds of products that are both of good quality and low price, where all her neighbors can come. For her shop to keep growing, she needs to buy more products, so she's asking for your help and trust.\r\n

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

\r\nJanet es padre y madre para sus tres hijos, movida por sus grandes deseos de generar ingresos propios, puso una tienda de productos de primera necesidad hace dos años. Ella ha visto como ha mejorado su negocio día tras día con su esfuerzo y dedicación. Janet sueña con tener un minimarket, al cual acudan todos los vecinos de su localidad, vender toda clase de productos de muy buena calidad y a precios bajos, ya que ella sufre en carne propia el aumento del costo de vida en su país. Para que su bodega crezca día a día, necesita comprar más productos, y es para lo que ella ahora pide su apoyo y confianza.
loan_use: Buy products for resale.

description: Pamata V., 44, is married with five children.  She has many year of experience in the taro-growing business. She sells to the villagers and the public two days per week and has one previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 150 Tala (~62 USD). SPBD loans are Pamata’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use the loan to buy weed killer, barbed wire, nails, fertilizer, bush knives, and transportation. Pamata's husband is a musician who is the only other income earner of the family. He will sometimes work on the plantation when he is available.
loan_use: Purchase weed killer, fertilizer, and other agricultural implements for her farm.

description: Tolusefulu I., 52, is married with six children. Her husband does the fishing and gets some help from his two boys. She has many years of experience in the fishing business. She sells to the village and general public 4 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~$187 USD). SPBD loans are Tolusefulu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her earnings will be used to improve her fishing business and help out with family expenses.
loan_use: Tolusefulu would like to purchase another fishing net and canoe for fishing and also to improve his home.

description:
Ms. Bui T. is 49 years old. Her family consists of 4 children, 2 of which are grown. Her husband is a construction worker and makes approximately 1.500.000d/month. The two eldest children are independent and have jobs of their own. She has been a member of this organization since 1997; her first loan was 300.000, in which she used to invest in buying pigs to raise. After seeing the success of her initial investment, she has been investing more into fixing the pig pens and the care of raising pigs. Besides raising pigs, she has been collecting recycling items and selling them to the big company in her town. With the income of her husband, children and businesses, her family is presently financially stable. Her family was able to build a house and their lives has been better. She is requesting a loan of 10.000.000d to remodel, fix and expand the pig pens and buy more pigs to raise. Her present income is 3.000.000d/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Bùi Thị T. năm nay 49 tuổi. Gia đình chị hiện có 4 người con trong đó có 2 con đã trưởng thành. Chồng chị làm nghề thợ xây cho thu nhập khoảng 1.500.000đ/ tháng. Hai con lớn của chị đã đi làm và có thu nhập ổn định. Chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1997 với vòng vốn ban đầu là 300.000 đ chị đã đầu tư mua thêm lợn về nuôi. Đến nay sau một thời gian dài sử dụng vốn có hiệu quả, gia đình chị đã đầu tư được nhiều hơn vào việc sửa sang chuồng trại phục vụ cho việc chăn nuôi. Ngoài thời gian chăn nuôi tại gia đình, chị còn đi thu mua phế liệu về bán cho các đại lý trong vùng. Cùng với thu nhập của chồng con và công việc tăng thu nhập của chị hiện nay kinh tế gia đình chị đã rất ổn định. Hiện gia đình chị đã tích lũy và xây được căn nhà rất khang trang cuộc sống gia đình chị đã được cải thiện rất nhiều. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 10.000.000đ để sử sang chuồng trại và mua thêm lợn về chăn nuôi. Thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng.
loan_use: Invest in raising pigs

description:
Born October 4, 1975 in Lomé, Mrs. Kayi Suzanne F. is married and the mother of three children. She is a dynamic woman who has opened up a store selling sewing notions in the Adidogomé neighborhood in Lomé. She buys her inventory at the big open-air market in Lomé so that she can satisfy the needs of seamstresses and tailors in her neighborhood which is 10 kilometers from the big Lomé market.

This first loan that she is requesting will allow her to stock up by buying a carton of buttons, a carton of zippers, and some poplins.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Né le 04 octobre 1975 à Lomé, Madame F. Kayi Suzanne est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle est une femme dynamique qui a crée un magasin de vente des articles de mercerie dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé. Elle achète ses articles au grand marché de Lomé afin de pouvoir satisfaire les couturières et tailleurs de son quartier distant de 10 Km du grand marché de Lomé.

\r\nCe premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de refaire le stock par l’achat d’un carton de bouton, d’un carton de fermeture et des popelines.
loan_use:
Purchase of sewing notions for re-sale

Achat d'articles de mercerie

description: Vaiana T., 32, is married with 2 children. She has many years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the general public 2 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 480 Tala (~200 USD). SPBD loans are Vaiana’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Vaiana is running a plantation business. Her husband is unemployed but working together with her in running the business.
loan_use: Purchase purchase pesticides, empty gallon jugs for carrying water.

description: Oliveta Vaioso, 42, is married with 2 children. She has 2 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and public 3 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD). SPBD loans are Oliveta’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will be all use to maintain the business. Her husband does the farming
loan_use: to finance equipment needed for the taro plantation

description: Amen A. is 31 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Benin City. She sells videos and audio CDs. She learned this business in 1 year and 8 months. She started her own business in 2000. She is a LAPO client. Amen is requesting the loan amount of $875 to buy more videos and audio CDs for sale.
loan_use: To buy more videos and audio CDs for sale

description:
Reynaldo lives on “B” street in the Villa Adela zone of the city of El Alto.

He lives with his wife Fabiola in his parents’ house.

He dedicates himself to selling printed goods such as wedding announcements and invitations that he sells from his rented store located in a central part of the city.

The loan would be to purchase additional merchandise (invitations, announcements) to supply his store and be able to offer a greater variety of products to his customers.

This is his first loan with IMPRO, and the financial evaluation conducted qualifies him to receive credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Reynaldo, vive en la calle “B” de la zona de Villa Adela de ciudad de El Alto. Vive junto a su esposa Fabiola en la casa de sus padres. Se dedica al comercio de trabajos de imprenta, partes matrimoniales e invitaciones, los cuales los expone y vende en su tienda que posee en alquiler en una zona céntrica de la ciudad. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de mayor mercadería (invitaciones, partes matrimoniales, etc.), para surtir su tienda y ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgar el crédito.
loan_use: Purchase merchandise such as invitations, wedding announcements, cards, etc., to sell in his store.

description:
Ms. Alba T. is a married, 35-year-old mother of three (ages 4, 6, & 10) who lives in the Waspan Norte neighborhood. Her husband works as an agriculturist and contributes to the household expenses.

Ms. T. sells assorted products by credit. She has eight years of experience in the business. She started the business with loans, and it was been growing ever since. She wants to invest this new loan in the purchase of more products to offer her customers because she wishes to increase her merchandise variety and attract even more customers.

She plans to keep investing into her business, provide an education for her children, and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Alba tiene 35 años de edad, habita en el barrio Waspan Norte, es casada y tiene tres hijos de 4, 6 y 10 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como Ing. Agrónomo y aporta a los gastos del hogar.

Doña Alba vende mercadería variada al crédito, y lleva ocho años de experiencia, ella inició con préstamos y ha ido creciendo. Con el préstamo que está solicitando es para invertir en capital, en la compra de más productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, variedad de mercadería y la captación de clientes.

Sus planes son seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, educar a sus hijos y mejorar el nivel de vida.
loan_use: Purchase a variety of merchandise to offer to her customers

description:
Aisa T., 40, is married with 3 children. She has 2 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells food to the villagers and school children 5 days a week. She has received 2 previous loans from SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).

\r\nSPBD loans are Aisa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks. The loan will be used primarily to purchase ingredients for her food business. The remainder will be used to pay for her children's school fees.
loan_use: To purchase ingredients for her food (pancakes) business.

description:
Mr. Mon S. (his wife is shown in the picture on the right) was selected to be a group leader of two families for a loan from Maxima. All of the group members live along National Road Number Two, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

1-Mr. Mon S., 52, (not in the picture) and his wife, Mrs. Hoy Him, 51, were married in 1973 and have six children, two sons and four daughters. Three of their children have full time employment and two are in school. Mon has been a Motor Remoque Taxi driver for six years, and his wife stays at home taking care of the children. Now he is requesting a loan in the amount of $300 to purchase a new trailer to replace the old one.

2-Mrs. Chanthea N., 40, (shown in the picture on the left) and her husband, Mr. Sam-aun Pol, 44, were married in 1986 and have two daughters who are in school. Chanthea has been selling grocery items for four years, while Mr. Hoy has been a policeman since 1980. Chanthea is requesting a loan in the amount of $300 to purchase grocery items for resale.
loan_use: To purchase a trailer for the motor taxi and expand the business of selling grocery items.

description:
Mrs. Phally T., 45, and her husband, Mr. Bin Bou, 52, who live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1987 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. Their oldest daughter is in the makeup business and also weaves with her parents, while the other three children are in local school.

Mrs. Phally and her husband have been silk weavers and in the makeup business for over 20 years. Phally sells her silk products to the middleman in the village, who then resells them in Phnom Penh. Her makeup business is in demand for wedding ceremonies in the village and nearby communities. Now she is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase silk material for her family’s weaving business and to build a handrail for her house.
loan_use: To purchase silk material for weaving and build a handrail for her house.

description: Chingiz has worked in a printing house for 2 years. He was born in 1954. He lives in the Khachmaz region. He is married with 3 children. Now Chingiz needs a loan of $1,200 US to buy the necessary equipment for improving his business.
loan_use: To buy the necessary equipment for improving his business

description:
Mrs. Dao Thi N., aged 54, is a member of TYM Fund. She has been using the loans from TYM Fund to invest into the business of buying and selling poultries in the market. Mrs. N. also provides services for weddings, funerals and other religious events etc. Because Mrs. N. has many years of experience in this business, the numbers of customers keep increasing. Mrs. N. has three children, all of whom graduated from high school and are working with an average income between 2.000.000 VND and 3.000.000 VND. In the next loan level, Mrs. N. wishes to borrow 10.000.000 VND ($ 600) to invest into her business. Her family’s income is 5.000.000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Đào Thị Nhạt 54 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương vay vốn gia đình chị đã lựa chọn hoạt động kinh doanh buôn bán gia cầm, mua gia cầm sống về giêt mổ bán tai chợ, ngoài việc bán tại chợ gia đình chị còn nhận phục vụ các gia đình có công việc như hiếu, hỷ, tết..... Trải qua nhiều năm trong nghề kinh doanh măt hàng này nên gia đình chị thu hút được lượng khách hàng rất đông, chị có 3 con đều học hết phổ thông trung học hiện nay các con chị đều có công ăn viêc làm ổn định, hàng tháng thu nhâp từ 2.000.000đ đến 3.000.000đ phụ giúp gia đình. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 10.000.000đ đầu tư vào buôn bán giết mổ gia cầm.

Thu nhập bình quân. 5.000.000đ/ tháng.
loan_use: Business

description:
Coumba D. is 41 years old, divorced with three children and has been a member of the Peyrissac village bank for seven years. She buys her merchandise, such as thioub fabrics, shoes, and bags, in Dakar and sells them for cash or credit in Ziguinchor. Her business revenues allow her to help pay for the family’s health, food and school expenses. She is taking out a loan that will be repaid in six months with one single payment.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva volunteer.

Coumba D., 41 ans, divorcée, 03 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Peyrissac depuis 7 ans. Elle achète de la marchandise à Dakar (tissus thioub, chaussures et sacs) et revend au comptant et à crédit à Ziguinchor. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent de participer à la prise en charge des besoin de santé, d’alimentation et de scolarité de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
loan_use: Buy thioub fabrics, shoes, and purses to resell

description:
Rosa is 24 years old and completed 11 years of school. She lives with her only son, her husband died three years ago. She is one of the leaders of Mulla Contihueco, in the Juli district, Chucuito province, Puno region, Peru.

She sells embroidered tapestries and raises cattle. With the first loan she received from Las Kantutas Wilkauta Common Bank of $115 in 2007, she invested in 16 meters of material and 3 kilograms of colored wool yarn, allowing her to improve her income.

With this loan of $200, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy 20 meters of material, 3 kilograms of wool, and other needed supplies. Overall, Rosa is very happy, especially since her improved earnings have increased her production. Her biggest dream is for her son to become a professional and that she can continue to capitalize in order to increase her production.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosa tiene 24 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto de secundaria, vive con su único hijo, su esposo falleció hace tres años. Ella es una de las líderes del Centro Poblado de Mulla Contihueco, del distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, de la región Puno. Ella se dedica a la actividad económica de venta de bordado de bayeta y crianza de ganado. Con el primer crédito que recibió del Banco Comunal Las Kantutas Willkauta fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos soles en el año 2007, lo cual invirtió en la compra de 16 metros de bayeta y 3 kilos de lana de color, esto permitió mejorar sus ingresos. Con este préstamo de S/.500.00 nuevos soles, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 20 metros de bayeta, 3 kilos de lana y otros. Por todo ello, ella esta muy feliz, ya que con la ganancia viene ampliando su producción. Su sueño más grande es que su hijo sea profesional y capitalizarse más para ampliar su producción.
loan_use: Wholesale purchase of embroidery supplies.

description:
Entrepreneur Armando Martin P. F.is 43 years old, is married, and has two children who study in the secondary level. Armando for 6 years has operated a woodworking shop where he constructs all types of furniture including chairs, tables, and playpens, among other products.

Mr. P. suffered an accident a few years ago in which he lost his right leg, necessitating that he use a prosthesis. Nonetheless, he has not been limited by the incident, and has been able to get ahead in his business and to support his family. Armando normally works only in his shop, but when there is great demand, he contracts other workers in order to be able to fulfill his work commitments.

Armando needs an electric sander to faciliatate his work as he currently does his sanding manually. He requires financing to buy an electric sander, which costs $250 US, and to buy 200 feet of wood as raw material, which costs $1.00 US per foot.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

El microempresario Armando Martin P. F.tiene 43 años de edad, es casado, tiene dos hijos los cuales estudian en nivel secundaria. El señor P. desde hace 6 años tiene un taller de ebanisteria en donde construye todo tipo de muebles tales como sillas, mesas, camas jugueteras entre otros productos.

El señor P. hace varios años sufrió un accidente en donde perdió su pierna derecha, lo cual le obliga a usar una prótesis. Sin embargo esto no ha sido una limitante y el microempresario P. a podido salir adelante con su taller y ser el sustento de su familia. Este microempresario trabaja normalmente solo en su taller pero cuando tiene mucha demanda contrata otros trabajadores para poder cumplir sus compromisos de trabajo.

Actualmente requiere una lijadora eléctrica que le permita agilizar su trabajo ya que el servicio de lijado lo hace a través de lijas manualmente. Por lo tanto requiere el financiamiento para comprar una lijadora eléctrica la cual cuesta US$ 250 y 200 pies de madera como materia prima la cual le cuesta US$ 1.00 cada pie.
loan_use: Purchase of an electric sander and 200 feet of wood.\r\nPara comprar una lijadora electrica y 200 pies de madera.

description:
Konoba F. is married and raising 6 children. She has been a member of the village bank of Karsia for seven years. She wants to bolster her business by buying sugar, tea, matches, palm oil, smoked fish, Omo (detergent), etc. in the weekly markets and big stores to retail in Karsia. Konoba has transformed her storeroom into a little store where she sells general merchandise. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single payment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Konoba F., mariée avec 06 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Karsia depuis 7 ans. Elle veut renforcer son activité en achetant du sucre, du thé, des allumettes, de l’huile de palme, du poisson fumé, de l’Omo etc… au niveau des marchés hebdomadaires et des grandes boutiques pour revendre au détail à Karsia. Konoba a transformé son grenier en une petite boutique ou elle vend ses divers produits. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
loan_use:
purchase and resale of various products

achat et revente de produits divers.

description:
With our first loan with Kiva, we were able to buy cattle and sheep, which we raised and fattened, allowing us to resell them in the weekly markets around the village of Mboul.  However, after benefiting from our first loan, we would like a second loan to continue with our business by increasing our capital and buying more cattle and sheep.  

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva volunteer. 

Aprés avoir bénéficié d'un premier prêt kiva qui nous a permis d'acheter des bovins et ovins que nous avons élévé en les engraissant, nous avons pu les revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires situés aux alentours du village de Mboul. 
Cependant, nous souhaiterions être financés une deuxiéme fois pour pouvoir continuer nos activités en ayant un plus grand capital qui nous nous permettra d'acheter beaucoup de bovins et ovins.
loan_use: Raise cattle and sheep

description:
Isabel Jamisse M. is 47 years old, a widow, and the mother of 4 children with ages of 25, 22, 16, and 12. The oldest is already together with someone and lives in her home. Isabel studied until the 12th grade and stopped going when her husband passed away. She has taken the value she got from her studies and passed it on to her children.

Isabel never moved from the city. She was born and raised in the city of Maputo and has her own home. She is an official of the state and works for the Municipal Council in the city of Maputo.

This is her first loan through Hluvuku which she discovered through some coleagues that were already clients for some time. She intends to pay back the loan before maturity so she can request another loan to refurbish two other homes for her children.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer Isabel Jamisse M. Tem 47 anos de idade. É viuva e mae de 4 filhos com idade entre o primeiro com 25 anos, o segundo com 22 anos, o terceiro com 16 anos e quarto com 12 anos de idade. O primeiro ja se junto e vive na sua casa. Isabel estudou até 12ªclasse e deixou de continuar quando faleceu o seu marido. Tendo levado os valores que custearia os estudos dela para custear os estudos dos filhos. Isabel nunca mudou se de cidade, nasceu e cresceu na cidade de Maputo e tem casa própria. Isabel é funcionaria do estado e trabalha no conselho municipal da cidade de maputo. Este é o primeiro empréstimo e conheceu a Hluvuku atraves dos colegas que já são clientes a muito tempo. Isabel pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro emprestimo para reabiliatr outras duas casa para os seus filhos.
loan_use: To buy materials to build family house

description:
Lauama S., 39, is married with 2 children. She has 4 years of experience in the Vegetable Garden business. She sells to the village people 5 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD).

SPBD loans are Lauama’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use all the loan money to start the business.
loan_use: Buy vegetable seeds, fertilizer for soil, also spade

description:
Mrs. Sreypov C. (shown in the picture with her daughter), 42, and her husband, Mr. Pich Pin, 36, live on an Island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1990 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. Their oldest daughter is a silk weaver and two of the children are in a local school.

Mrs. Sreypov has been a silk weaver since she was fifteen years old, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to a middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. Pich is a hairdresser in the village.

Sreypov is requesting a loan of US$300 to purchase silk material for her weaving business and to buy a hairdresser’s chair for her husband.
loan_use: To purchase silk material for weaving and buy a hairdresser’s chair for her husband

description:
