Mamata D. is 39 years old, married, and mother of five. She lives in Wome, a city about 120 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. She resells loincloths and other products. Mamata would like to use her loan to buy two rolls of cloth, boxes of milk, bags of rice, boxes of soap and jars of jam. This would allow her to grow her business, increase her income, and provide for her children.\r\n

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

\r\nMamata D. est âgée de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle réside à Wome, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé la capitale togolaise. Elle est revendeuse de pagnes et des produits divers. Mamata souhaite par ce crédit acheter 2 balles de pagnes, des cartons de laits, des sacs de riz, des cartons de savons et des boîtes de conserves. Ce qui lui permettra d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaires, de tirer plus de profits et de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
loan_use: to buy cloth and other goods to grow her business

description:
Mrs. Gam Thi P. is a 33 year old woman. She has 2 small children. In 2000, she became a TYM partner, making loans to invest in order to improve her family’s financial situation. She has been using most of the loans to buy scrap-iron in adjacent areas and then reselling it to manufacturers; the rest of the loans are invested in a live-stock farm. For 8 years, the family budget has been greatly growing; they saved money to build a small 4-roomed house and to provide their children with the most possible facilities. She plans to use the next loan of 9,000,000 to renovate the farm and buy 5 more pigs. Family’s frequent income is 3,000,000 Vietnamese Dong.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Phạm Thị Gấm năm nay 33 tuổi. Gia đình chị hiện có hai con còn nhỏ. Năm 2000 chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương vay vốn để làm ăn phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Chị đã sử dụng phần lớn vốn vay cho chồng đi thu mua phế liệu về bán, phần còn lại chị đầu tư mua lợn về nuôi. Qua 8 năm tham gia vào Quỹ kinh tế nhà chị đã tăng lên rõ rệt, anh chị đã tiết kiệm và xây được 4 gian nhà ngói và có điều kiện để đầu tư, chăm sóc cho các con nhiều hơn.Vòng vốn tới chị muốn vay 9.000.000đ sể sủa sang chuồng trại và mua thêm 5 con lợn về nuôi.

Thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng
loan_use: invest in live-stock farm

description: Susana is thirty five years old. She has three children who are in school. She has been trading in weave-ons and local soaps for ten years now. Her dream is to expand her shop to include assorted weave-ons and hair creams, shampoo and activators to make it a one-stop shop for her customers, especially beauticians who typically demand such items. She is a group member of “Yesu Nti” (meaning for the sake of Christ) Trust Group. Peer pressure and support provide additional incentive to repay, because if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the repayment amount.
loan_use: To buy assorted weave-ons and hair creams, shampoo and activators

description: Cynthia is a fine lady. She is a 38 year old business woma, a wife and a mother of three children. She trades in batik tie and die and lace materials. She would like to use the loan to purchase to buy those items in build and begin selling jewelry.  She plans to use part of her profits to provide her children with quality education. She is a member of the community group called ‘For Christ Trust group’. The group guarantees a loan through repayment pledge. Peer pressure and support provide additional incentive to repay, because if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the repayment amount.
loan_use: To purchase batik tie and die, lace clothes and jewelry

description:
Freddy is 32 years old, is single and has no dependents. He works as a driver of a microbus in public transport with a bus given to him by his father. He has more than 6 years of experience in the transportation field, since his father is an owner of various microbuses. Although there is quite a bit of competition in this field, there is also similar demand for the service. In addition, the family belongs to a transportation line that has an established route. The current loan is to increase his operating capital. This is his fourth loan and has demonstrated excellent punctuality in his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Freddy tiene 32 años de edad es soltero y no tiene dependientes. Trabaja como chofer de micros en el transporte público con un micro que su padre le dio, tiene más de 6 años de experiencia en el rubro del transporte, ya que su papá es propietario de micros. Si bien existe bastante competencia en este rubro, paralelamente también existe demanda por este servicio. Además la familia pertenece a una línea de transporte con ruta establecida. La presente solicitud es para incrementar su capital de operaciones. esta es su cuarta operación y demostró tener excelentes referencias de puntualidad en sus pagos.
loan_use: Increase his operating capital

description:
Adolfo lives in the neighbourhood Villa Reconciliacion. He is 45, married and has 4 kids that are all studying. His wife sells tamales and helps around the home. Adolfo is a taxi driver and has been for 7 years. He started off as a lorry driver but he sold the lorry and bought a taxi. With the loan that he is asking for he will build a better kitchen in their home. He also plans to buy another taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Adolfo habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, tiene 45 años de edad, es casado y le tienen cuatro hijos que están estudiando, su esposa vende nacatamales y ayuda en su hogar. Don Adolfo es taxista tiene siete años de experiencia, e inició en una camioneta de acarreo, la vendió y compró un taxi. Con el préstamo que está solicitando es para infraestructura en la construcción de la cocina de su vivienda para estar más cómodo. Sus planes son comprar otra unidad de taxi.
loan_use: To build a kitchen in his home/Construcción de cocina en su casa de habitación

description:
Maria Teresa has a small cafe where she sells coffee, soft drinks and enchiladas. She started selling these products 8 years ago with the money that she had been saving and had at the time. As the years have gone on she has been able to improve her business and change the products that she offers. Maria Teresa is married and has 8 kids, and as she has prepared them for life well they are now all independent. She would like to invest in another source of income and would like to buy construction materials to build a room to rent. She has been an excellent client and has repaid all credits on time and in full.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Maria Teresa tiene un cafetín en el que vende café, refrescos, enchiladas. Hace 8 años empezó con estas ventas, los fondos los adquirió gracias a unos ahorros que en su momento tenía. Con el pasar de los años ha podido mejorar su negocio y diversificar los productos que ofrece. Maria Teresa es casada, tiene 8 hijos, que ya pudo preparlos para la vida, ya ellos son independientes a ella. Quiere invertir en otra fuente de ingreso como lo es la compra de materiales de construcción para hacer una habitación para alquiler, ha sido una exelente clienta, ha pagado todos sus créditos en tiempo y forma.
loan_use: To build a room to rent/Construcción de un cuarto para alquiler

description:
Ram Maiya S. is a tailor in the town of Bholdhoka, lalitpur. She has four members including herself in her family. Her husband's name is Chabi Lal S., and he is a laborer who does house construction work. She has one son and one daughter. Her son and daughter are studying in secondary school.\r\n

\r\nMrs. Ram Maiya S. works in a tailoring shop. The condition of her family is not good because her husband's work is not permanent. So to upgrade the living standard of her family, she wants to utilize her morning and evening time to sell fresh green vegetables in a local market. So to start her new business, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 NPR to buy various types of green vegetables and furniture for her business.
loan_use: To buy fresh vegetables for her new business

description: Binu G. lives with her husband and three children in the town of Kuleshwor. She has two daughters and one son; all of them are studying in lower secondary school.\r\nMrs. G. and her husband Mr. Krishna G. opened their shop six years ago. They just sell mineral water in their shop. Especially they sell 20-liter jars of mineral water. They also serve mineral water to the customers’ homes according to the order. Nowadays in Kathmandu Valley the demand for mineral water is increasing rapidly due to the scarcity of water. So to meet the demands of customers they need to invest funds to fulfill the demands of customers. So Mrs. G. is requesting for Rs 15,000 (US$225) loan to increase the numbers of mineral water jars for her shop.\r\nMrs. G. utilizes her income in providing good education for her children. She also wants to uplift the living standard of her family.
loan_use: To buy mineral water jars

description:
Shabnam baji is the wife of A. S. and lives in Arifwala, Pakistan. (Baji is the Urdu term of respect for 'elder sister'.) They have been married for the last 25 years and she is the mother of seven children: three sons and four daughters. Her eldest son works in a rice factory. All of her daughters are enrolled in a local school near her neighborhood. Shabnam’s husband has a livestock business and Shabnam baji sews clothes on order from her neighborhood. Now she wants a loan for her husband’s livestock business. He wants to buy another animal and resell it for profit.

The loan group has three additional members. Hanifan baji wants a loan for her scrap work. Jannat baji requests a loan for her embroidery business, and Yasmeen baji wants a loan for her garment business.

Loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.
loan_use: To expand their businesses

description:
Mrs. N. Thi Chau is 58 years old. She has been a member with TYM for past 10 years. Both she and her husband are retired military personnel. In 1998, she joined TYM to borrow money to raise poultry and improve their family's income. With the original loan of 30 USD she was able to purchase chickens to raise. This project has changed her family's economic situation. Currently, in her spare time she also babysits children for additional income. In addition to their retirement pensions, she and her husband make an additional 120 USD per month from raising poultry and babysitting. In order to continue her business and increase her income, which would allow her 2 children to go to school, she wishes to borrow 725 USD. Her income is 210 USD per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Châu năm nay 58 tuổi, chị là thành viên của Quỹ tình thương đã được 10 năm. Hiện nay hai vợ chồng chị đều là cán bộ hưu trí. Năm 1998 chị đã tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương vay thêm vôn đầu tư cho chăn nuôi phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Với vòng vốn ban đầu là 500.000đ chị đã sử dụng để mua gà về nuôi. Đây là dự án đã mang lại sự đổi thay về kinh tế đối với gia đình chị. Tận dụng thời gian rảnh rỗi chị còn nhận trông trẻ để tăng thêm thu nhập. Hiện nay ngoài lương hưu anh chị còn có thêm 2.000.000đ/ tháng từ dự án chăn nuôi và công việc trông trẻ. Để mở rộng mô hình kinh doanh tăng thu nhập và có điều kiện đầu tư tốt hơn cho 2 con đi học vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 12.000.000đ. Thu nhập 3.500.000đ/ tháng.
loan_use: Raising

description:
Afua is 51 years old and a widow with 4 children. She has been selling farm produce in the local market for 20 years now. Due to her low income, she has not been able to support her children for them to acquire employable skills or the level of education needed to earn a living. She wants to use the loan to buy more produce to enable her to save some money to enable 2 of the children to learn a trade, as her children are grown, and they need to work so that they do not become social deviants.

She believes she can buy more for the lean season, when demand for the produce would be high and would give her a good income. Afua is a member of the group called Isaiah. Members agree to guarantee for each other as a form of social collateral in order to repay the loan.
loan_use: To buy more bags of maize and plantains

description:
The group is maD. of 13 partners. Twelve women and one male. The group is from the Kiswaras area. An area of a few resources, but the people have a big heart and integrity. The majority of the partners are artisans. They do blankets, macramé, fabric painting, among others. Mrs. Bertha, the group treasurer, she does gold rescue in a mining center of the city. Mrs. Bertha mentions that this business is profitable and what she earns is for the studies of her children. Mrs Bertha also has an individual loan, that she has always paid in time and she plans to keep on working with Agrocapital. Mrs. Eliana is a proprietor of the house where they meet and where photo was taken. Eliana has a shop at her house.

Name of the partner, Sex ,Activity, Years working

L. VDA. D. C. BERTHA, Female, Handy-crafts, 3 years

L. V. JENNY VERONICA, Female, Grocery store

R. T. ROSA MARIA, Female, Prosthodontist

A. C. INES, Female, Jacket dressmaking, 2 years

M. M. LOURDES , Female, Candy wrapping, 2 years

V. DEL C. BERTHA, Female, grocery store, 7 years

L. V. ELIANA CECILIA, Female, Grocery store, 2 years

H. M. YANET, Female, Clothes sales, 4 years

G. D. I. MARTHA, Female, Food sales, 5 years

A. D. S. ISIDORA, Female, Seamstress of comforters 3 years

M. Q. MARIO, Male, Spare parts sales, 3 years

S. A. JUSTINA ESTELA, Female, Spare parts sales, 3 years

P. G. MARI LUZ, Female, Salchipapas sales, 15 years

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva volunteer.

El grupo está conformado por 13 socias. Doce mujeres y un varón. El grupo es D. la zona D. Kiswaras. Una zona D. pocos recursos pero con gente D. gran corazón y mucha honradez. La mayoría D. las socias son artesanas, se dedican al tejido D. mantas, macramé, pintura D. telas y otros. Doña Bertha, tesorera del grupo, ella se dedica al rescate D. oro en un centro minero D. la ciudad. Doña Bertha comenta que este negocio es rentable y lo que gana es para el estudio D. sus hijos que ella tiene. Doña Bertha también tiene un crédito individual, donD. la señora no tiene retrasos mas al contrario esta pensando en seguir trabajando con Agrocapital. Doña Eliana es dueña D. la casa donD. se reúnen y donD. se tomo la fotografía. Eliana tiene una tienda en su mismo hogar.

Nombre del socio Sexo Actividad Años en el Rubro

L. VDA. D. C. BERTHA Femenino ARTESANIAS 3

L. V. JENNY VERONICA Femenino TIENDA D. ABARROTES

R. T. ROSE MARIE Femenino PROTESISTA DENTAL

A. C. INES Femenino CONFECCION D. CHAMARRAS 2

M. M. LOURDES Femenino ENVOLTURA D. DULCES 2

V. D. C. BERTHA Femenino ATENCION D. TIENDA D. ABARROTE 7

L. V. ELIANA CECILIA Femenino TIENDA D. ABARROTES 2

H. M. YANET Femenino VENTA D. ROPA 4

G. D. I. MARTHA Femenino VENTA D. COMIDA 5

A. D. S. ISIDORA Femenino COSTURA D. EDREDONES 3

M. Q. MARIO Male VENTA D. REPUESTOS 3

S. A. JUSTINA ESTELA Femenino VENTA D. RESPUESTOS 3

P. G. MARI LUZ Femenino VENTA D. SALCHIPAPAS 15
loan_use: Working Capital
borrower_names: Eliana Cecilia, Ines, Mario, Bertha, Yanet, Martha, Jenny Veronica, Rose Marie, Isidora, Lourdes, Estela, Bertha, Mari Luz
borrower_genders: female, female, male, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Anthony is 24 years old. He is a proactive, single young man. He is currently a student in Management. He is a young person with a business vision. He joined with his mother, señora Oliva, to open their Cevicheria "La Kalesita" which is very crowded because of its good flavors and service. Anthony decided to open this business because he found a good location and because he was thinking about his future. Now he is very content thanks to the support of his family. He would like to continue studying while he runs his business and, above all, to support his mother. However, he would like a better atmosphere and to increase the size of the cevichería. To do this, he has estimated the amount of money he has requested as a loan. Support this young man who demonstrates his desire to keep growing.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

\r\n\r\nAnthony tiene 24 años de edad, es un joven muy proactivo y soltero, pues él en la actualidad es estudiante de Administración. Anthony es un joven con visión de negocio, se asoció con su mamá, la señora Oliva, para poner su Cevicheria de nombre La Kalesita, la que es muy concurrida por su buena sazón y atención. Anthony decidió abrir este negocio debido a encontrarse en una buena zona, motivo que le hizo reflexionar acerca de su futuro, ahora él está muy contento porque gracias al apoyo de su familia. Él quiere mediante su negocio seguir estudiando y sobre todo apoyar a su mamá. Sin embargo él quiere ambientar mejor e implementar su cevichería y para ello estima de una cantidad de dinero que solicita como préstamo. Apoya a este joven que demuestra sus ganas por seguir creciendo.
loan_use: Enlarge and remodel his cevichería to better serve his customers

description:
For many years, Julián has been in the business of selling charcoal wholesale. His daily routine is to go to the market to sell and to deliver his clients' orders. Señor Julián is 43 year old and is the father of six marvelous and very caring children. He, with his wife, Roslava, who always supports him in everything, want to educate, love, and care for their children in good and bad. As always, señor Julián aspires to be a charcoal exporter on the national level. However, to realize this dream, he needs money. For the time being, he asks for this loan to increase the capital of his business and to buy a motorcycle to transport charcoal where his clients request it. Let's support this father who, with strength and dedication, continues working arduously for the prosperity of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Julián se constituyó en el negocio de la venta de carbón al por mayor desde hace mucho tiempo, su rutina diaria es de ir cada día al mercado para vender y entregar los pedidos de sus clientes. El señor Julián tiene 43 años y es padre de 6 hijos maravillosos y súper cariñosos, él junto a su esposa Rosalva, quién siempre la apoya en todo, ellos desean educar, amar y querer a sus hijos en lo bueno y lo malo. Desde siempre el señor Julián aspira con ser un exportador a nivel nacional de carbón, sin embargo para la realización de este sueño, necesita dinero, por el momento el solicita este préstamo para aumentar el capital de su negocio y comprar un motocarro para transportar el carbón donde sus clientes lo pidan. Apoyemos a este padre que con esfuerzo y dedicación sigue trabajando arduamente por la prosperidad de su familia.
loan_use: Increase his charcoal sale business and acquire a motorcycle to transport charcoal.

description:
Mr. Chinkiry M. and his wife, Mrs. Sopheak Mak, who live in a small village off of National Road Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, were married in 1989 and have five children: four sons and one daughter. All of them are in school.

\r\n\r\nMr. Chinkiry has been driving a Moto-Remorque taxi (a motorcycle with a trailer at the back) for eighteen years. He carries people and goods from his village to Phnom Penh City. His wife has been a hairdresser for twelve years. His motorcycle is broken now and needs to be exchanged for a new one but he lacks some money to add to his own for buying a new one. So he is requesting a loan of US$ 300 to purchase a new motorcycle to replace the old one for running his business.
loan_use: To purchase a new motorbike to replace their old one

description:
Hilda is 28 years old, studied elementary school, and only speaks aymara and understands Spanish. She is married and has three boys, who are studying. They have their own house and is located on Chimbo, Cuturapi district, Province of Yunguyo.

She used to work selling sheep and cows; now she works selling food for cows and bulls, she brings this product from Yunguyo.

She belongs to the community bank “Central Progreso” where she got an initial credit of S/. 300.00 new soles that she used to buy 6 sheep that she used to sell.

With the loan of S/. 1000.00 of new soles, which will be paid in 4 payments, she will buy more food for cattle.

Her dream is to continue with her business and get more products, buy cows, provide her kids with good education and to grow financially.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Hilda tiene 28 años de edad, estudió primaria completa, habla solo el aymará y entiende el castellano. Está casada y tiene tres hijos varones, quienes están estudiando, la casa que tiene es propia y está ubicada en el centro poblado Chimbo, Distrito de Cuturapi, Provincia de Yunguyo. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de ovejas y vacas; ahora cambió de negocio, se dedica a la venta de Alimento Concentrado para Vacas y Toros, producto que trae de Yunguyo. Pertenece al Banco Comunal " Central Progreso" donde tuvo un crédito inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles con lo que pudo comprar 6 ovejas, las cuales las comercializaba. Con este préstamo de S/: 1000.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará al por mayor alimento concentrado para ganado. Su anhelo es seguir con el negocio poder adquirir mas mercadería, comprarse vacas, darles una buena educación a sus hijos, crecer económicamente.
loan_use: Tou buy food for cattle at wholesale prices / Compra al por mayor de alimento para ganado.

description:
Mrs. Sonia is 24 years old and is married, she has a daughter. Lives in Chimbo, Cuturapi district, Yunguyo Province.

Three years ago she worked in Lima, then she had her baby, and went to live in Chimbo, currently Sonia and her husband sell caws, sheep and donkeys, that they sell on the Chacachaca fair, every Thursday each week.

Sonia belongs to the community bank “centrl Progreso” she started with a credit of S/. 500.00 new soles that she used sheep and veal.

With the loan of S/. 1000.00, which will be cancelled in 4 months, she will buy 3 sheep and with the rest her husband will buy jackets and will bring them to the city of Lima to sell them – is the first trip he will do-, and expects to continue with the business.

His vision is to have his own business, a big one in the city of Lima and later on to buy a house.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Sonia tiene 24 años de edad, está casada y tiene una hija. Vive en el Centro Poblado de Chimbo, Distrito de Cuturapi , provincia de Yunguyo. Hace tres años trabajaba en la Ciudad de Lima ,después que tuvo su bebe, se vino a vivir al centro poblado de Chimbo, actualmente Sonia y su esposo se dedican al comercio de vacas , ovejas y burros, los mismos que vende en la feria de Chacachaca , todos los jueves de cada semana. Sonia pertenece a al banco comunal "Central Progreso" ella inicio con un crédito de S/. 500.00 con lo que compro ovejas y una ternera. Con este préstamo de S/.1000.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará 3 ovejas y con el resto del dinero su esposo comprará casacas y las llevará hacia la Ciudad de Lima para venderlas - es el primer viaje que hace , espera continuar con ese negocio. Está muy agradecida porque su negocio le está dando posibilidades de tener un nuevo negocio. Lo que ella aprendió al ser socia del Banco Comunal es que, con el dinero que se le presta, tiene que trabajarlo con la finalidad de incrementar su mercadería y sus ingresos. Su visión futura es tener un negocio propio, grande y un puesto en la ciudad de Lima y con el tiempo comprarse una casa.
loan_use: Buy sheep and jackets at wholesale prices / Compra de ganado (ovejas). Compra al por mayor de casacas.

description:
Anatasia is the president of the group Banco Comunal Estrellitas del Sur and for 15 years she has been selling vegetables daily in the plaza 15 D. agosto square. At first she got a loan of $300 new soles with which she bought tomatoes, onion, carrots, spinach, celery, pumpkin etc in small quantities.

With the credit of $7000 soles which she will repay in 4 months she will buy vegetables in bulk.

Anastacia is very grateful for the loans she has received as they have helped her to increase merchandise and her income.

Anastacia is 40 years old and studied until fifth graD. of primary school. She has 4 kids who are studying, and is married - her husband supports her.

The dream that she has is that her kids will become professional, to buy more land and to keep going forward.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Anastacia es presidenta del Banco Comunal Estrellitas del Sur; hace quince años atrás se dedica a la venta D. verduras en la plaza 15 D. agosto, lo hace diariamente; cuando ella al inicio tuvo un préstamo D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles que lo invirtió en la compra D. tomates, cebolla, zanahoria, espinaca, apio, zapallo, etc en poca cantidad. Con este crédito D. S/. 700.00 nuevos soles, el cual cancelará en 4 cuotas, comprará verduras al por mayor. La señora Anastacia está muy agradecidas con los préstamos ya que le han permitido incrementar su mercadería y a la vez sus ingresos económicos. Anastacia tiene 40 años D. edad, estudio hasta el quinto D. primaria, tiene cuatro hijos quines estudian, es casada y cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo. El sueño que ella tiene es que sus hijos sean profesionales, comprar mas terrenos, y seguir trabajando.
loan_use: To buy vegetables in bulk/Compra de verduras al por mayor.

description:
Maria is a 54 year old woman, born in 1953 in the province of Yunguyo and she managed to study up to the third graD. of secondary school. She is married, and has 8 children, 4 boys and 4 girls, who are all studying at different levels. She has her own house with complete basic services.

From when she was very young, Maria learnt from her mother how to make empanadas. She travelled, for reasons for work, to Lima, where she put even more effort into this activity. Then, on returning to her hometown, she didn't hesitate to set-up a Snack Bark, where she offers sandwiches, cakes, empanadas and a special fixed meal.

She is a member of the Community Bank, ““Wiñay Marca” , where she started with a loan of 300 soles, purchasing the ingredients needed to make empanadas such as flour, fat, eggs and sugar.

With this loan of 1000 soles, which will be repaid within 4 months, she will buy rice, flour, fat, sugar, vegetables and potatoes wholesale. In this manner she will be able to expand her production.

Being a bank member has taught her to be reliable, responsible and organised in her business, and as a result she's very happy. Her future ambitions are that all her children become professionals and work. She will continue working in her business, as she can depend on her husband's help.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

María es una señora D. 54 años D. edad, nació en el año 1953 en la provincia D. Yunguyo y logró estudiar hasta el tercer grado D. secundaria, se casó tiene 8 hijos cuatro varones cuatro mujeres quienes están estudiando en diferentes niveles D. estudio, tiene una casa propia con los servicios básicos completos.

Ella desD. muy joven aprendió la elaboración D. empanadas D. parte D. su madre, viajo por motivos D. trabajo a la ciudad D. Lima, donD. puso mas empeño a esa actividad; pues al regresar a su tierra natal no dudó en instalar una Snack Bar, en donD. se atienD. desD. bocaditos, alfajores, empanadas y menú especial.

Es socia del Banco Comunal “Wiñay Marca” donD. inicio con un crédito D. S/. 300.00, comprando productos para la elaboración D. empanadas como harina, manteca, huevos y azúcar.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará arroz, harina, manteca, azúcar, verduras y papa al por mayor. D. esa manera incrementará su producción.

Siendo socia del banco comunal aprendió a ser cumplida, responsable y organizada en su negocio, por lo que esta muy contenta. La visión futura que tiene es que todos sus hijos sean profesionales y trabajen. Seguir trabajando en su negocio, para ella cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo.
loan_use: Purchase ingredients wholesale

description:
Mrs. Sreyry N. and her husband Chheang Nhean are subsistence farmers who raise pigs and cows in Trapaing Ronas Village in Kampong Speu Province. They have five children. Three of their children attend school. The other two are too young to work or study. Mrs. Sreyry N. now has insufficient money to buy a pig and a cow and food to feed them. Therefore, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. \r\n

\r\nPreviously, Mrs. Sreyry N. had obtained a loan from AMK to buy a motorbike for transport purposes. Last year, some of Mrs. Sreyry N.’s children got dengue fever and she spent $500 to cure them. This is one of the reasons that Mrs. Sreyry N. does not have enough money to buy animal food. Mrs. Sreyry N. and his wife are shown in the picture.
loan_use: To buy a pig and a cow and food to feed them.

description:
Afia is 42 years old and married with three children. Two of them are in school. She is so grateful to Sinapi for giving her a loan which saved her marriage since, before, her husband saw her to be a burden on him. She used the previous loan to start selling cooked rice for schools and children and other workers in her town. This enabled her to save to help her husband in paying the children’s school fees.

Afia wants to add to her rice business the selling of spring rolls which she says customers want for breakfast. She therefore wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice and flour, vegetables, eggs and assorted meat to expand her operation. She is a member of the group called Confidence. Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.
loan_use: To buy bags of rice, flour, vegetables, eggs, and assorted meat to expand her operation

description:
Ahmad, 28 years old and single, lives in the Southern Suburbs of Beirut. He is a hair designer for men. The low income generated by his business doesn't support Ahmad's dreams to drastically improve the living conditions of his family. However, he believes he can make a better life for his parents, brother and sisters by undertaking small steps. He now needs a loan of US$1,000 to make some house improvements including painting and sanitary work. \r\n

This is the first time that Ahmad has requested a loan from A. Majmoua.
loan_use: Home improvement

description:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Beth M.. She is married and has two children, aged 6 and 3. In 2006, Beth established her used clothing business. She opens her business six to twelve hours a day. Beth requires a loan in order to buy more clothing. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately US $87. She thanks you for your support. \r\n

\r\nSecond-hand clothes journey across the oceans from America and Europe, and are then washed, ironed and sold in bulk by wholesalers in Dar es Salaam to retailers who then re-wash and re-iron them for sale on the streets of Dar es Salaam and the surrounding towns and villages. These clothes are becoming increasingly popular, especially among the younger generation, because they are so cheap and because of the general appeal of anything western or modern. Many people argue that the popularity of the West’s cast-offs is damaging the local cloth and garment industry. Others still appreciate the beauty of traditional Tanzanian dress; however, the growing market in used clothing, and its importance to many micro-entrepreneurs, cannot be denied.
loan_use: To buy more used clothing.

description:
Loch L. grows crops on her farmland behind her house, which she sells in the local market. Her husband is a bricklayer. Mrs. L. earns $2 per day and her husband earns $4 per day. They live with one child in Tapang Village, Siem Reap Province, Cambodia.

Mrs. L. is asking for a loan to purchase fertilizer because it will allow her to increase the yield of her crops, allowing her to grow and sell more, thereby increasing her family’s income.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.
loan_use: To purchase fertilizer for her crops

description: Zakir was born in 1974. He is  an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Khodjali town, and he settled in Baku city.  He has run this business of building houses for 4 years.  Now he needs a loan of $625 to buy necessary materials for building houses.
loan_use: to buy necessary materials for building the houses

description:
Véronique G. is 35 years old. She is married and the mother of two children.She owns a loincloth store in Assahoun, a village about 50 kilometers from the Togolese capital of Lomé. This is her first loan coordinated through FECECAV. With it, she hopes to increase the scope of her business by purchasing many more loincloths, as well as thread for sewing, to satisfy her customers’ needs and draw in much more profit. In so doing, she will contribute to the improvement of her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer.

Véronique G. est âgée de 35 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle tient une boutique de pagnes à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle souhaite par ce premier crédit de FECECAV accroître la taille de son activité, en achetant beaucoup plus de pagnes et des fils à coudre, pour satisfaire la clientèle et dégager beaucoup plus de bénéfice. Ce faisant elle contribuera à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de a famille.
loan_use: Purchase of many more loincloths

description:
Ilva is 30 years old and is a shopkeeper. In her home she has a small store where she sells basic products of consumption to people in her neighborhood Laureles Sur. She started this business 5 years ago with her own capital and it has continued to grow thanks to the loans of AFODENIC.

Ilva’s dream is to see the store converted into a prosperous business that will give her financial stability. Ilva is married and has 4 children of the ages of 4, 6, 8, and 12. With the loan she would make a concrete wall so as to make it stronger and more secure.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

Ilva tiene 30 años de edad, es una pequeña comerciante, en su casa de habitación tiene una pulpería donde ofrece productos de consumo básico para sus vecinos del barrio Laureles Sur. Hace 5 años empezó este negocio con capital propio y ha ido creciendo gracias a los préstamos otorgados por AFODENIC.

El sueño de Ilva es ver su pulpería convertida en un negocio próspero y autosostenible. Ilva es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 4, 6, 8 y 12 años de edad. Con el crédito hará un muro minifalda de concreto para así hacerla más fuerte y más segura.
loan_use: Construction of a wall in her home

description:
Aydalina is 37 years old, with two children of 18 and 2 years of age, her life companion is a taxi driver and supports her in maintaining her family. She hopes to benefit from good health to raise her small two year old child, and continue the education of her other 18 year old child. She wants to educate them and support them in all they need.

For 4 years she has had a small general store in her home, which she set up with her own funds and whose plans are to make her business larger and convert into a general store. With the loan she will fortify the inventory to increase her sales and begin the desired growth.

Aydalina tiene 37 años de edad, tiene dos hijos de 18 y 2 años de edad, su compañero de vida es taxista y la apoya en la manutención de su familia. Espera poder gozar de buena salud para criar a su pequeño niño de 2 años, y seguirle dando estudios a su otro hijo de 18 años. Quiere educarlos y apoyarlos en todo lo que necesiten.

Tiene 4 años de tener una pequeña pulpería en su vivienda, la que montó con fondos propios y cuyos planes son poder hacer más grande su negocio y convertirla en miscelánea. Con el crédito fortalecerá el inventario para aumentar sus ventas y así empezar su crecimiento tan deseado.

Translated by Mark Holmes, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Fortify inventory to increase sales

description:
Mrs. Hoang Thi D., 40 years old, has 2 children who are still going to school. She joined the TYM Fund since 1997. At first, she used the borrowed money in planting vegetables. However, this activity did not bring her a large amount of profit. She then switched to investing in a general store. After 10 years of membership, she has helped improving her family economy. She is able to furnish her house with tables, closets...Her children are sent to good school. This time, she wants to borrow 1150 USD to buy more merchandise for her store. Her average income is 200 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Hoàng Thị Doãn năm nay 40 tuổi. Hiện gia đình chị có 2 con đang tuổi đi học.Chịtham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1997. Các vòng vốn đầu chị vay để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi trồng trọt song nhận thấy các dự án này mang lại hiệu quả kinh tế không cao chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn để đầu tư vào buôn bán hàng tạp hoá. Qua 10 năm tham gia Quỹ tình thương đến nay kinh tế gia đình chị đã phát triển và ổn định hơn. Nhờ chăm chỉ làm ăn và tiết kiệm trong chi tiêu chị đã mua sắm được một số trang thiết bị như tủ,bàn ghế và một số vật dụng khác .Các con của chị được đầu tư cho ăn học đầy đủ. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 19.000.000đ để mua thêm hàng tạp hoá về bán cho người dân địa phương. Thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng
loan_use: general store

description:
Yasmeen baji, the wife of F. H., has lived in Chichawatni, Pakistan for the last 20 years. She owns a four room brick house and is the mother of five children: two sons and three daughters. Her sons finished their education at the 10th standard (grade) while her daughters are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. She recently successfully completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan) and now is applying for a loan to buy more shoes to resell in her husband’s shoe shop.

She is joined in her loan group by four other members: Anwar baji wants to buy garments to resell locally; Rashda baji seeks a loan for her grocery shop; Nadia baji wants a loan for her stove to make and sell nan (bread), while Majeedan baji wishes to buy oil to cook her Punjabi food (samosas, pakodas, etc.), which she then sells.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members guarantee one another's loans, so if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.
loan_use: To expand their businesses.

description: Ambica P. lives in Koteshwor, Nepal. Koteshwor is located in the Kathmandu district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in their own businesses.  Ambica P. has four members including herself in her family. Her husband's name is Bhishma Raj P.. He works in a private office. They have two children. Her older son is studying in grade 10 and the younger son is studying in grade 9.\r\nTwo years ago Ambica opened her ready made clothes shop to uplift the living standard of her family. She sells different types of clothes in her shop. She specializes in children clothes. \r\nNow  Ambica is requesting a $300 loan to buy new design clothes for her shop.
loan_use: To buy clothes for her shop

loan_name: BENKADI 3 (L’Entente est une bonne chose). Group
description:
The women of the Benkadi group are married and, on average, are 35 years old and have five children. They live in traditional families with their husbands, generally their husbands’ other wives, and their children in Djinina, a village in the Fana subprefecture, Dioila prefecture, Koulikoro Region, Republic of Mali. They all have small businesses that consist of selling food items, clothing, charcoal, fruits and vegetables, etc. They are primarily united by the fact that they live in the same village. Benkadi has been working with Soro Yiriwaso for four years and has obtained eight group loans which were all repaid in full. The group members who sell charcoal generally buy it in other villages and then sell it for cash on market days to business clients from Bamako or Ségou. The other women buy their condiments in Fana and then sell them retail in the village. With this loan, the women of the Benkadi group from Djinina, Fana hope to each earn a monthly profit of 10,000 CFA francs, which will be mostly used to pay off the interest on the loan and resolve some financial problems. The rest will be used for capital.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Les membres du groupe Benkadi sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’age de 35 ans et 5 enfants qui vivent dans de familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, généralement avec coépouses et des enfants dans le village de Djinina, un des villages de la sous préfecture de Fana, Préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali. Elles exercent toutes le petit commerce : de denrées alimentaires, d’habillements, de charbon de bois, de fruits et légumes etc. Elles sont essentiellement liées par des relations de voisinage. Benkadi est en relation avec Soro Yirwaso depuis maintenant 4 ans et a obtenu 8 prêts solidaires, tous correctement remboursés. Pour celles qui vendent du charbon de bois, elles s’approvisionnent généralement dans les villages et effectuent leurs ventes au comptant les jours de foires à une clientèle de commerçant provenant d Bamako ou de Ségou. Par contre, les autres s’approvisionnent en condiment à Fana pour les revendre au village en détail. Avec ce prêt les femmes du groupe Benkadi de Djinina, Fana espèrent avoir chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 10.000 FCFA qui sera essentiellement utilisé à payer les intérêts du prêt, à résoudre certains problèmes sociaux et le reste incorporé au capital.
loan_use: Purchase of charcoal and fruit

description:
Beatrice K. is a fishmonger. She is married, but her husband's income as a fisherman is not sufficient for Beatrice and her 6 children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

\r\nBeatrice is asking for additional capital to expand her business.
loan_use: Additional capital to expand her business

description:
Mrs Anna K. is married and the mother of five children. She is requesting a loan to set up a business selling women’s clothing, watches and chains in order to help improve the living conditions and health of her family. She will repay the loan after six months in a single installment. 
Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

La dame Anna K. est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle sollicite un prêt pour s’activer dans la vente d’habillement pour femme, de montre et de chaine afin de contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie et de sa santé de sa famille. Elle va rembourser au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
loan_use: To buy and sell women's clothing, chains and watches

description:
Leni belongs to the “Mujeres Audaces” Communal Bank located at Jr. Roca Fuerte #421 in the Callería district of the state of Ucayali. She is 42 years old, the mother of three minor children and her husband is employed. Leni sees the necessity of having a business and so with the first loan of 300 soles received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in the business of renting Internet booths installed in her own home. Besides the business, she attends to all of the household chores and takes her children to school. Her daily routine is very tiring but at the end of the day she feels satisfied because she sees herself as an accomplished woman, mother and wife.

With this loan of 1,500 soles, which she plans to repay in five months, she will invest in five Web cams, two used computers and a printer.

Every day Leni is growing as a businesswoman and she feels happy because she is providing for the necessities of her children. She is thankful for the immense support that Manuela Ramos gives to her.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Leni pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Audaces” domiciliada en el Jr: Roca Fuerte Nº 421 del Distrito de Callería en el Departamento de Ucayali tiene 42 años, es madre de 3 hijos menores, su esposo es empleado. Leny ve la necesidad de un negocio, es así que con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300 soles decidió invertir en el negocio de alquiler de cabinas de Internet. En la actualidad cuenta con su negocio de alquiler de cabinas de internet instalado en su propio domicilio. Leni además del negocio atiende todos los quehaceres de la casa y lleva a los hijos al colegio, realmente su rutina es muy agotadora, pero al final del día se siente satisfecha porque se ve realizada como mujer, madre y esposa. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de 5 Web Cam, 2 computadoras de segunda mano y 1 impresora. Leni cada día esta creciendo como empresaria se siente muy feliz porque esta aportando en las necesidades que puedan tener sus hijos agradece por el apoyo inmenso que Manuela Ramos le brinda.
loan_use: Purchase five Web cams, two used computers and a printer

description:
Mírela belongs to “Las Azucenas II” Communal Bank located at Jr. Yarina Cocha, Mz. B Lt. 7, in the Yarina Cocha district of the state of Ucayali. She is 20 years old and single. With the first loan received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles, Mírela started a business selling candies. She also works in an accounting firm which enables her to bring additional income to her family while receiving the support of her mother who takes care of her business until she returns.

With this loan of 1,000 soles, which she plans to repay in five months, she will buy five cases of cookies, five bags of lollipops, one bag of “chisitos,” one case of gum, one bag of toilet paper and three cases of soft drinks.

Mírela is a very enthusiastic young lady with a lot of desire to get ahead, both professionally and economically, as she is a help to her parents. She is very happy to be a part of the Manuela Ramos bank.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

La señorita Mírela pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Azucenas II, ubicado en el Jr. Yarina cocha Mz.B Lt.7, Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 20 años es soltera, Mirela con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 implemento su negocio en venta de golosinas. Mírela también trabaja en un estudio contable y es así que trae un ingreso mas a su familia ella recibe el apoyo de su mama ya que ella queda a cargo de su negocio hasta que ella regrese.. Con este préstamo recibido de S/ 1,000 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 5 cajas de galletas 5 bolsas de chupetines, 1 bolsa de chisito, 3 tiras de ch, 1 caja de chicle ice, 1 bol. papel higiénico, 3 paquetes de Gaseosas, Mirela es una señorita muy entusiasta tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante tanto en lo profesional y económicamente; ya que ella es un apoyo para sus padres y esta muy contenta de participar en el Banco Manuela Ramos.
loan_use: Purchase candies and soft drinks at wholesale prices

description:
Sara belongs to “Las Azucenas II” Communal Bank located in the Unión de Damnificados neighborhood of Callería in the state of Ucayali. She is 42 years old and the mother of three children. Her husband is an electrical technician.

With the first loan of 300 soles that Sara received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in the purchase of products for a grocery store. Nowadays she continues to sell groceries and little by little is introducing hardware items. In the evenings she receives additional income selling foods typical of the region and is very happy because she is progressing. With this loan of 1,800 soles, which she plans to repay in five months, she will buy three sacks of rice, three sacks of sugar, two cases of milk and some hardware items. Sara feels very grateful to the Manuela Ramos bank because thanks to it, she can continue to grow her business. She has the desire to continue growing until she has her own bookstore and mini hardware store.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Sara pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Azucenas II , ubicado en el AA.HH Unión de Damnificados Mz.B Lt.8, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 42 años es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es Técnico Electricista. Sara con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/.300 decidió invertir en la compra de productos de abarrotes. En la actualidad continua con su venta de productos de abarrotes y esta implementándose poco a poco en lo que es ferretería; por las noches también tiene otro ingreso vende comida lo que son comidas regionales y que esta muy contenta por que esta progresando. Con este préstamo recibido de S/ 1,800 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 3 sacos de arroz, 3 sacos de azúcar, 2 caja de leche, y un poco de ferretería Sara se siente muy agradecida con el Banco Manuela Ramos ya que gracias a ello puede seguir creciendo su negocio ella tiene toda esperanza de seguir creciendo hasta lograr formar su librería y mini ferretería.
loan_use: Purchase products for a general store at wholesale prices

description:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 35 year-old Rose M.. She is married and has two children aged 5 and 15. In 2007, Rose established her rice selling business. Working six days a week, and nine to twelve hours a day, she earns about US $100 every month from this business. Rose requires a loan in order to buy more stock of rice in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.
loan_use: To buy more stocks of rice in bulk.

description:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! Edina M., 36 is married, and has four children aged between 3 and 15. She has one dependent, who lives with her because she is an orphan. In 2004, Edina established her crops business. Working seven days a week, and nine to twelve hours a day, she earns about US $250 every month from this business. Edina requires a loan in order to buy more stock of maize in bulk. She thanks you for your support.  

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facilities as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed uncreditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from the client, extending a loan to then, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.
loan_use: To buy more stock of maize in bulk.

description:
Estama M. has found a unique niche in her local community juS.outside of Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic. When someone has an old or broken piece of furniture, they take it to her. She has begun a small business repairing chairs, sofas, beds, and other furniture. Left by her husband several years ago, Estama has found herself in the same position as many women here in the Dominican and in her home country, Haiti. She is left to provide for her two boys (ages 14, 16) with whatever means she can. The money from this loan will go towards purchasing paint, sand paper, various tools, as well as several old beds that may be refurbished and sold. She aspires to continue growing her business, so that someday she might be able to own her own shop that she can work out of.

Estama is one of the leaders of the 10 person micro bank Hermanas Unidas, which means "United Sisters". All ten women in the bank are Haitian immigrants who have come to earn a living in the Dominican informal sector. These unique entrepreneurs unite in solidarity, promising to cover one another if someone fails on a payment, thus allowing them to access funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own. The concept of this group bank paying their loan together is to reduce the risk of one person defaulting due to the strong peer pressure from their fellow bank members. As these 10 women embark upon their firS.ever loan from Esperanza, we are confident that they will all succeed in bettering their lives and the lives of their families with this loan. Their businesses are simple, but offer a stream of income that could never have been accomplished without such a loan for initial capital. Several of the women sell clothes and shoes in the street, and a couple of them will offer housecleaning services and beauty supplies.

On behalf of Estama M., the Hermanas Unidas group, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support and awareness of the global issue of poverty, in which your efforts are helping to make a difference
loan_use: To purchase, paint, sandpaper, tools, and several old beds to be refurbished and sold.
borrower_names: Chartes, Serafine, Catia, Bonny, Ernise, Suzette, Estama, Bernadette, Anide, Senatus
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, false, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
In one of the new developments in the city of Juliaca is located Julia’s home. Julia decided eight years ago to add a room to her house and start her store. Thanks to the benefit that this business has given her, she has been able to give an education to her two children, to whom she wishes to give the opportunity to continue with their higher education, an opportunity that she never had because of the limited economic resources of her humble parents. The wish of this happy and loving mother is to grow and multiply her stock of products, with the goal of meeting all of the requests of her new neighbors, who take a keen interest in this little store.\r\n

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva volunteer.

\r\nEn una de las nuevas urbanizaciones de la ciudad de Juliaca está ubicado el domicilio de Julia, quien desde hace 8 años decidió adecuar un ambiente de su casa e implementar su bodega, gracias a los beneficios que obtiene con este negocio puede brindarles estudios a sus dos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles la oportunidad de seguir sus estudios superiores, oportunidad que ella nunca tuvo por los bajos recursos económicos de sus humildes padres.El deseo de esta alegre y amorosa madre es ampliar y aumentar el stock de sus productos con el fin de complacer cada uno de las solicitudes de sus nuevos vecinos quienes encuentran en esta bodeguita una cálida atención.
loan_use: Investment capital to buy merchandise for her store.

description:
Mrs. Sophea K., 21, and her husband, Mr. Saran Chheang, 24, live on an Island of MeK. River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2004 and have two sons.

Mrs. Sophea has been a silk weaver since she was sixteen years old, a skill she learned from her mother, while Mr. Saran has been a silk weaver since he was married. The couple sells their finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh.

Sophea is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.
loan_use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

description: Mrs. Sarin I, age 33, is a widow who lives along National Road Number Five, about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She has four children, two sons and two daughters. All of them attend the local school.\r\n\r\nMrs. Sarin has been selling lotus flowers for ten years. She buys them from her village and resells them at market in Phnom Penh. Now she is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase lotus flowers on contract to expand her business.
loan_use: To purchase lotus flowers on contract to resell

description:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 24-year-old Zuwena S.. She is married and has two children ages 2 and 6.

In 2006, Zuwena established her grocery business. Zuwena requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, beans and vegetables in bulk. In the future, Zuwena plans to to open another business. She thanks you for your support.

The Swahili word for this type of outside shop, or stall, is "genge." A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chili, oil, rice and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal, and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.
loan_use: To purchase additional stock of beans, rice and vegetables in bulk.

description:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 37-year-old Pudensiana R.. She is married and has three children with ages between 2 and 13.

In 2007, Pudensiana established her poultry business. She earns about US $170 every month from this business. Pudensiana requires a loan in order to purchase additional chicks and feed. In the future, Pudensiana plans to to increase the quantity and range of the stock. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale-and-leaseback arrangement.
loan_use: To purchase additional chicks and feed.

description:
Gulmahmad S. lives in the Vakhsh district. He is 72 years old and married with three children. Despite his age, he practices animal husbandry, weaves ropes for animals and makes horse saddles and other necessary accessories. Gulmahmad sells completed merchandise at a market. He wants to purchase materials specifically for his business to help guarantee uninterrupted work. Continued business would only be possible with a loan of $450.00 (1500.00 TJS). He would like to repay the loan within 10 months. \r\n

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina, Kiva Volunteer.

\r\nСайтиев Гулмахмад житель Вахшского района. Возраст 72 года. Женат и имеет троих детей. Не смотря на возраст занимается животноводством , а так же плетет веревки для животных и производит седла для лошадей и другие необходимые принадлежности. Именно для этого бизнеса хочет закупить материал . Это поможет ему обеспечить бесперебойную работу. Готовую продукцию продает на рынке. Все это возможно лишь получив кредит в размере 1500 сомони. Срок на который он хочет взять кредит 10 месяцев.
loan_use: Purchase of materials

description: Narkhol A. is 39 years old. She is a widow, and she has two children. Narkhol has never had anyone's assistance in helping her children get ahead, so for the past 11 years she has been working in the sales industry; more specifically, she sells fuel and lubricants. This line of business has been her only source of income to support and to educate her children, and it has not been easy for her to bear such responsibility for her family. Even so, the love she has for her children is what drives her forward from day to day. At present, her older son helps her with the business. \r\nNarkhol is now requesting a loan in the amount of 300 Somoni ($100 USD), the proceeds of which will be used to meet her clients' demands and to thereby increase her sales volume. She promises to repay the loan in 4 months. The well-being of this brave woman and her family is in your hands, so please help them by contributing to the growth of her business. They sincerely thank you for your support.
loan_use: To meet her customers' demands and to increase the business' sales by diversifying her product line through the purchase of additional goods

description:
Adelaide Joaquim C. is 50 years old and is from Manjacaze, province of Gaza, in southern Mozambique. She is the single mother of 7 children. Besides her children she supports her grandchildren, who live with her.

Adelaide studied until the 4th grade and then had to quit because she got pregnant and was forced to go back home. In 2000 she decided to go back to school to finish 5th grade, and she is currently in the 7th grade.

In 1987 Adelaide, along with her husband and children, was forced to abandon Gaza province due to the war and move to the outskirts of the city of Maputo. In 2001 her husband decided to abandon her and the 7 children, leaving them in the worst possible conditions, especially in terms of housing. The house he left them collapsed, and Adelaide is trying to solve the problem by building a better one.

Adelaide has worked as a cook since 1982. Her workday begins at 7:30 a.m. and ends at 4:00 p.m. Her monthly salary is 1,800.00 MT, and she is not able to set aside any of it. Her savings go toward paying her loan, and whatever is left goes toward food expenses. This is Adelaide’s third loan through Hluvuku. All her loans have been for construction materials, since she is building her home in phases. Her biggest dream is to see her family living in good housing conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer.

Adelaide Joaquim C. tem 50 anos de idade e natural de manjacaze provincia de gaza ao sul de Moçambique. Solteira e mae de 7 filhos. Para alem da sua familia sustenta netos que vivem com ela.

Adelaide estudou até 4ªclasse e parou por ter se engravidada e foi obrigada a ir ao lar. Só em 2000 é que decide voltar a escola e fez a 5ªclasse e agora frequenta 7ªclasse. Em 1987 Adelaide foi obrigada abandonar a Provincia de gaza junto com a familia que tinha formada ( Marido e filhos) devido a Guerra e foi para nos bairros perifericos da cidade de maputo onde em 2001 o marido decide abandonar a ela com os 7 filhos em piores condições principalemte habitacional e a casa que lhes deixou ficou a tumbar e agora está nesta de procurar resolver o problema construindo uma casa melhorada.

Adelaide trabalha como cozinheira desde 1982. Tem um horário de 7:30 até 16:00h. Aprendeu o serviço dentro da empresa a 20 anos atras. Tem um salário mensal de 1800,00mt,não consegue poupar . a minha poupança é para pagar o credito e o que resta é para despesas de alimentação.

Para Adelaide este é o terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku sempre pediu para compra de material de construção uma vez que está construindo em fazes. Constitui seu grande sonho ver sua familia bem alojada.
loan_use: To buy materials to build family house

description:
The following military personnel are requesting a loan of US$ 1,700. They are: Osman M., Patrick T., Mohamed S., Borbor Patrick S. and Mohamed T.. All of these except Mohamed S. want to give their loans to their wives to invest in their current businesses. For Mohamed, he wants to invest his in his academic pursuits.

Osman M. who assumes leadership of this group was born in Kabala but is presently working in Makeni. He is 28, married with 2 children.
loan_use: Give to their wives to invest in their current businesses
borrower_names: Osman, Patrick, Mohamed, Borbor Patrick, Mohamed

description:
Margarita is a fifty-seven year old separated mother with one child. She is an unemployed teacher, but owns a convenience store at her house where she sells vegetables, meat, groceries, liquor, telephone cards, and gasoline. Additionally, Margarita travels to the city of Tambo every two weeks where she sells telephone cards and gasoline, products that she buys in the city of Lima. Margarita plans to open a small gas station at her house.

Margarita is a member of the Violeta Village Bank.

Margarita needs a loan of 1600 Peruvian Nuevos Soles ($575 US Dollars) to invest in more telephone cards and gasoline.

Margarita´s dream is to buy a motor line to distribute gasoline, and to have a vacation and visit countries outside of Peru.
loan_use: to invest in more telephone cards and gasoline.

description:
Isabel is a thirty-eight year old mother with two children. Isabel sells traditional food on Saturdays and Sundays in a regional fair located on a street near the city stadium. Isabel´s specialty is to make mondongo (a soup with corn and meat, broiled overnight) with the help of her partner.

Isabel is a member of the Suni Village Bank. (Suni means “Secure” in Quechua).

Isabel needs a loan of 1500 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($550 US Dollars) to invest in rice, noodles, oil, potatoes, corn, and firewood.

Isabel´s dream is to own the property for her restaurant, have a grocery store, and provide a good education for her children.
loan_use: to invest in rice, noodles, oil, potatoes, corn, and firewood.

description:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Fatuma S.. She is married and has three children aged between 4 and 15. In 2005, Fatuma established her café business. Fatuma requires a loan in order to purchase additional rice, beans, and cooking oil. In the future, Fatuma plans to open another business. She thanks you for your support.

When you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business title is ‘restaurant’ or ‘café’, you may have to adjust your mental image of what that is. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches, with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don’t even appear in the Lonely Planet’s budget guide, but if you’re looking for a cheap and tasty meal and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to be. The food is all-local; rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces.
loan_use: To purchase additional rice, beans, and cooking oil

description:
Martha has 3 children who are 22, 15, and 9 years old respectively. They help in her business. She started her business because she didn't have another job and needed to be able to help her children succeed and give them schooling. She began 8 years ago with the sale of sodas and fries in her home; gradually, she added merchandise until she had a general store.

She needs a loan of $500, which she will repay in 6 months, to purchase merchandise to continue with her sales and expand her business.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha tiene 3 hijos de 22, 15 y 9 años, quienes le ayudan en el negocio. Inició su negocio porque en ese momento no contaba con un trabajo y necesitaba sacar adelante a sus hijos y darles estudio. Comenzó hace 8 años con la venta de sodas y frituras en su casa, y poco a poco fue surtiendo mercancia hasta que logro tener su tienda de abarrotes.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia para continuar con las ventas y poder agrandar su negocio
loan_use: Purchasing merchandise

description:
Mr. Bladimir Antonio M. is 33 years old, married, and has one daughter. His daughter is 6 years old, and is in the first grade. Bladimir works in welding and soldering and his wife works for ARNECOM. In addition to their day jobs, the couple also has their own clothing business. This business serves as a means of increasing their household income, and they've been operating it for 4 years. Bladimir is asking for 9800 Cordobas, which he'll use to buy pants, shirts, and underwear in Managua twice a month, depending on sales. He and his wife will then bring the clothing to sell to colleagues, neighbors, and friends in Leon.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Bladimir Antonio M., tiene 33 años de edad, es casado, tiene una hija de 6 años, que actualemnte cursa el primer grado, su esposa trabaja en ARNECOM, es en solicitar un financiamiento por la suma de C$ 9800.00 córdobas para adquirir ropa actividad que lleva a cabo en conjunto con su esposa ya que donde labora tambien tiene la oportunidad de ofertarle a sus compañeros de trabajo, al igual que el señor M. ya que tambien trabaja en un taller de torno y soldadura. Dicha actividad economica la desempeña como una alternativa para poder incrementar los ingresos del hogar, desarrollandola de forma ambulante teniendo 4 años de dedicarse a esta actividad. El financiamiento será utilizado para comprar mas ropa como pantalones, camisas y ropa interior, llevando a cabo sus compras en managua dos veces al mes dependiendo de sus recuperaciones, sus ventas las realiza de contado y credito que recupera a los quince dias o al mes. Sus principales clientes son sus compañeros de trabajo, y perosnas del sector aledaños a su domicilio
loan_use: Working capital

description:
The group called “El Ceibo” has been working with Pro-Mujer for the last several years, finishing their tenth cycle. Currently it has 13 active associates who have shown to be a well organized group as it relates to their loan quotas. Within the group, the majority are married with an average of 6 children. They feel in need to look for additional sources of income since the necessities of their children are always increasing.

There are various businesses within the organization such as sales of food, dairy products, and cereals; the main activity, however, is the making of wool skirts (polleras) and other clothing for the local women (typical clothing used in the altiplano region). They sell their clothing at the 16th of July fair, which only allows them to sell twice a week, for this reason they need a loan to rent store space where they can offer their clothing all the days of the week. This will enable them to generate more income and continue to maintain the well being of their children.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La asociación denominada “El Ceibo ” trabaja junto a Pro-Mujer hace ya varios años cumpliendo su décimo ciclo, a la fecha cuenta con 13 socias activas que han demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito. Dentro el grupo la mayoría son casadas y con un promedio de 6 hijos, se ven en la necesidad de buscar otras fuentes de ingresos ya que las necesidades de sus hijos aumentan cada día mas.

Existen diferentes negocios dentro la asociación como ser; la venta de comida, de lácteos, cereales, pero la actividad principal es la confección de polleras y ropa en general para cholitas (vestimenta típica en algunas regiones del altiplano ) luego venden sus productos en la feria de la 16 de julio, pero esta feria solo les permite vender dos veces por semana por lo que necesitan crédito para poder alquilar tiendas para ofrecer sus prendas todos los días, de esta manera generar mayores ingresos que les permita ofrecer bienestar a sus hijos.
loan_use: They need a loan to be able to rent spaces for their businesses.
borrower_names: Alicia, Graciela, Pamela, Antonia, Corina, Feliza, Agustina, Claudina, Estefania, Florencia, Francisca, Lidia, Sonia
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Maria Julia started her business after her husband died, leaving her alone to raise and support her three children. She had to obtain a loan in order to carry on and support and care for her family. She began to wash clothing and clean houses for other people, but one day she was invited to attend a course in tailoring and dressmaking and it was there she met her current business partner who proposed the idea of working together in order to take on larger orders. Since June 1997 when they began working together, things have gone very well for them and many know of their work. They are accredited by the school system, which sends them business making uniforms.

Maria Julia is requesting a loan of US $800, which she will repay in six months, to purchase material and supplies that will enable her to complete her customers’ orders, and ensure that they turn out well.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

Maria Julia inició el negocio al fallecer su esposo, se qued sola con sus tres hijos y tuvo que trabajar para sostenerlos. Ella necesitaba oibtener un ingreso que le permitiera mantener a sus hijos y sacarlos adelante, al mismo tiempo que pudiera estar al cuidado de ellos. Comenzó lavando ropa ajena y haciendo la limpieza en casas, pero un día la invitaron a un curso de corte y confección y ahí conocío a su actual socia, la que le propuso que se uniéran para poder cumplir con pedidos grandes de ropa que les hacían. Desde Junio de 1997 a la fecha les ha ido muy bien ya que muchas personas las conocen y estan acreditadas en las escuelas, donde les mandan hacer uniformes.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $800 que pagara en 6 meses para poder comprar materiales que le permitan cumplir con los pedidos que tiene de sus clientes a los cuales no les quiere quedar mal.
loan_use: Purchase material and supplies

description:
Armanda is an enterprising woman. Ever since she married she saved the maximum she could in order to acquire a small plot of land where she could live comfortably. She was able to acquire it and build a house, and she began a business selling food upon seeing that there wasn’t a similar business in her area. In addition, she sells bread in the afternoon. These activities help them meet their family’s expenses. Nevertheless her wishes to grow as a businesswoman have not diminished. Armanda is asking for a loan, money that will help her expand her business and equip her location where she sells food, making it more welcoming for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Armanda es una mujer emprendedora, desde que se casó ahorro al máximo para poder adquirir un pequeño terreno donde pueda vivir cómodamente, logró adquirirlo y construir su casa, ahí instaló un negocio de venta de comida, viendo que en su localidad no había tal, adicionalmente vende pan por las tardes.Estas actividades le ayudan a solventar los gastos de su familia. Sin embargo sus deseos de crecer como negociante no han menguado.Armanda solicita un préstamo, dinero que le ayudará a ampliar su negocio y acondicionar el lugar donde vende comida, hacerlo más acogedor para sus clientes.
loan_use: Increase capital to expand and equip her bread and food business.

description:
Aida is a widowed, 67-year-old mother of ten children, two of whom currently live with her. She has had a garment workshop for many years, income that helped support her children to become professionals. Aida is a member of Las Hormigas Village Bank.

Aida uses a machine to make traditional clothing such as jumpers, blouses, underskirts, slip dresses, etc. In one day she is able to make up to three underskirts, which she sells at fairs in the rural area and the city of Ayacucho. Furthermore she purchases cheeses at the fairs and resells them in Ayacucho.

Aida needs a loan of 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (US$ 375) to invest in fabrics and thread.

Aida’s dream is to have a garment workshop where she can make more clothing and count on her workers.
loan_use: to invest in fabrics and thread

description:
Señora Rosa María is married and 51 years old. She studied until the third year of high school. She has 7 children, 5 living in Lima and 2 who are students. She lives in the neighborhood of Víctor Larco Provincia de Trujillo, La Libertad. She is a businesswoman that works in the preparation of fast food for university students. She has also started to work raising animals. Her friend motivated her to join Manuela Ramos. The first loan she recieved was for S/.300.00, which she invested to buy a blender and also to travel to Lima because her son passed away. She belongs to the Community Bank of "Las Palmeras." With this loan of S/.800.00 that she will repay over 6 months she will buy food for her animals and also rice, oil, and beans. Her other dream is to have a restaurant in an appropriate location, to buy a television, and to build her savings.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosa María está casada, tiene 51 años, estudió hasta 3er año de secundaria y tiene 07 hijos, 05 trabajan en Lima y 02 son estudiantes; vive en el distrito de Víctor Larco Provincia de Trujillo, La Libertad. La empresaria, se dedica a la preparación de comida rápida, para los estudiantes de la universidad y también empezó a dedicarse a la crianza de animales. Su amiga la animó a participar en Manuela Ramos, el primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00, invertido en la compra de una licuadora, y tuvo que viajar a Lima porque su hijo había fallecido. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS PALMERAS”. Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 06 meses, comprará alimento para los animales y también arroz, aceite, menestras.
