La socia sueña con tener un restaurant en un sitio apropiado, comprar un televisor y seguir ahorrando.
loan_use: To buy better ingredients and to by food for animals.

description:
Fanny used to bake and sell her desserts 2 years ago. She even sold desserts in schools. She used to have a distribution menu, but due to economic reasons she had to quit.

This loan will be used to purchase wholesale ingredients needed to make her desserts for sale again. Fanny would also like to rent a room and put in a fountain soda business.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Fanny se dedica a la venta de postres y dulces por reparto desde hace 2 años. Antes preparaba y repartía menú, pero por problemas económicos tuvo que dejarlo. También ha vendido golosinas en colegios. Los préstamos le han servido para comprar por mayor los ingredientes que necesita en la preparación de sus postres. Fanny quisiera alquilar un local y poner una fuente de soda.
loan_use: Loan will be used to purchase ingredients needed for her desserts. (Para comprar por mayor los ingredientes que necesita en la preparación de sus postres.)

description:
Mersija is a 33 year old woman from Tojsici, a small village outside the town Kolesija. She is married and has two children, aged 11 and 13 years old. Mersija and her husband run a small convenience store. Like many Bosnians, Mersija also practices subsistence farming—growing food in her home garden to feed her family. She and her husband also raise cattle and breed poultry to earn additional income.

\r\n\r\nFor her first loan from Zene za Zene, Mersija has requested 1000 KM. Part of this loan she will use to buy more chickens to fatten and sell, and the rest she will use to purchase additional inventory for her small shop. Mersijia hopes these investments will increase their overall family income. With two growing kids it seems their expenses go up every year, and she wants to make sure their earnings can keep up.
loan_use: To buy chickens and other goods to increase the inventory of her convenience store.

description:
Herminia lives in the neighbourhood of Laureles Norte where she sells pork products. She is 40 years old, her partner is a taxi driver. She has a daughter of 15 years of age who is a student, and who Herminia would like to become a professional and to get ahead in life. Herminia started her small business selling pork 7 years ago, with the difficult economic situation she hopes to have enough resourses to continue with it and, if possible, to increase her inventory. But she needs to replace the roof of her room immediately as it is in a very bad state and the rains are affecting it a lot.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne, Kiva volunteer.

Herminia habita en el barrio Laureles Norte donde se dedica a la venta de carne de cerdo. Tiene 40 años de edad, su compañero de vida es taxista y tiene una hija de 15 años de edad, estudiante y quien Herminia desea que se convierta en una profesional para que salga adelante en la vida. Herminia hace 7 años empezó el pequeño negocio de la venta de carne de cerdo, con lo difícil de la situación económica ella espera poder tener los recursos suficientes para mantenerlo y si es posible poder aumentar en inventario. Pero sus necesidades inmediatas son cambiar el techo de su casa de habitación que está en muy mal estado y las lluvias le están afectando mucho.
loan_use: To replace the roof of her room

description:
Mamadou W. is a married artisan who lives in the Belfort neighborhood of Ziguinchor. He has made a living with his art for over 15 years, and is requesting this loan to strengthen his production and prepare for the tourist season that will begin again in September.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer.

Mamadou W. est un artisan marié et domicilié au quartier Belfort de Ziguinchor. il vit de son art depuis plus d'une quinzaine d'année, il sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer sa production et préparer la saison touristique qui va démarrer en septembre.
loan_use: Strengthen his shop in a traditional village

description:
Marciana, 42, has a fifth-grade education. She has 6 children, with five of them still at home. Their home is in the Porteno neighborhood in the Zepita district, Chucuito Province.

Marciana has been raising sheep to sell for the last seven years. She belongs to the Zepita District Communal Bank "Primero de Agosto". As member of the communal bank, she was able to increase her capital by borrowing 300 soles to purchase 5 sheep to raise. Her income improved and this motivated her to take advantage of increasing loans from the communal bank.

Marciana is now requesting 1000 soles to invest in the purchase of 4 blackface sheep. With these sheep she will spend less in fodder and she will make a higher profit. She will pay back the loan in 4 installments.

Marciana is happy because her income is increasing and she is saving money for her children's support and education.

Her dream is to open a small grocery store across from the Andrés Avelino Cáceres school in Zepita, and that her children have a college education.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva volunteer

La señora Marciana tiene 42 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto de secundaria, es casada, madre de seis hijos, cinco dependen de ella, su domicilio queda en el barrio Porteño, del distrito de Zepita, Provincia de Chucuito – Juli y Región de Puno. La actividad que realiza es engorde de ovejas para la venta, que viene desarrollando hace siete años. Ella es parte de Banco Comunal Primero de Agosto del distrito de Zepita, con el fin de incrementar más su capital y su crédito inicial que recibió es de S/. 300.00, este dinero invirtió en la compara de 5 ovinos para el engorde y cuando obtuvo un poco más de ingreso económico, la cual siguió motivando para seguir escalando con los créditos del banquito. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles, comprará 4 ovejas cara negras, ya que con ello tiene mayor ganancia y además para el engorde gastará menos forraje. Este su crédito serà cancelado en 4 cuotas. Marciana, esta contenta, por que está incrementando su capital y esta asegurando dinero para los gastos de estudios de sus hijos y alimentación. Su sueño mayor es poner una tienda de abarrotes al frente del colegio de Andrés Avelino Cáceres de Zepita y algún día sean profesionales sus hijos.
loan_use: Purchase of sheep

description:
Mr. Amadou W. is 41 years old and lives with his two children in his father’s house with his extended family in the Massablacoura quarter in the city of Bougouni (Bougoni Prefecture in Mali). Coming from a Diawanbe family (an ethnic group which is very skilled in business in West Africa), he never went to school because his father was always moving. After a period of apprenticeship in the techniques of business, he decided to start a business selling hooved animals, notably cattle. Mr. W. has been doing this for 15 years and is an expert in this field. In order to obtain additional financial help, he visited the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, where he just got his first individual loan. With this loan he plans to buy 15 head of cattle. He buys cattle in the villages surrounding Bougouni from cattle farmers, but he also goes to the main livestock markets in the region (Siékorolé, Niéna, Koumantou, Massigui, Bougouni, etc.). His client base is comprised mostly of butchers from the market in Bougouni, but also families who are holding ceremonies (marriages, baptisms, funerals). He hopes to make a profit of 60,000 FCFA (about $142) per cycle which will be used to pay the interest on the loan, reinvested in his business, and used to take care of his family’s expenses.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur Amadou W. est âgé de 41 ans et vit avec ses 2 enfants chez son père dans une grande famille élargie au quartier Massablacoura de la ville de Bougouni.(Préfecture de Bougouni République du Mali) Ussie d’une famille Diawanbé (ethnie très habile dans les négoces en Afrique de l’Ouest) il ne fréquenta pas l’école en raison des déplacements fréquents de son père. Après une phase d’apprentissage des techniques de commerce et de négoce, il décida de méner l’activité d’achat vente d’animaux sur pied notamment des bouefs. Monsieur W. exerce cette activité depuis 15 ans et a une maîtrise parfaite de activité. Afin d’obtenir une ressource financière complémentaire il démarcha l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso où il vient d’avoir son premier prêt indivuduel. Avec ce pret il compte acheter 15 bouefs. Il s’approvisionne en boeufs dans les villages environnants de la ville de Bougouni auprès des éléveurs mais fréquente aussi les principaux marchés à bétail de la localité (Siékorolé,Niéna,Koumantou,Massigui, Bougouni etc). Sa clientèle est composée essentiellement de bouchers exerçant au marché de Bougouni mais aussi de familles ayant des céremonies (Mariage, Bapteme ou déccès). Il espère réaliser un bénéfice par cycle de 60.000FCFA qui servira à payer les intêrets de prêt, renforcer le fonds de commerce et subvenir aux dépenses de la famille.
loan_use: Purchase of cattle

description:
Mrs. Aminata D. is 47 years old and lives with her eight children and her husband in a monogamous family in the Pelengana quarter, south of the city of Ségou (fourth largest economic region in Mali). In the beginning she used to send her servants out to search for firewood for her own personal use, but when her neighbors saw the bundles of wood, they would always come and ask her to sell them some of it. Therefore, she decided to get involved in the firewood business and has been involved in it for 13 years. She makes all her sales at home, for cash or credit to her customers, who are mainly comprised of women as well as bakers. She sells firewood year-round. After having taken out five group loans, she is on her second individual loan and all previous loans were correctly repaid. With this loan she hopes to buy 20 loads of firewood from the surrounding villages of Ségou from farmers who are legally established in the firewood business, and she hopes to make a monthly profit of 12,000 FCFA (about $29), which she hopes to reinvest into her business.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

Madame Aminata D. est âgée de 47ans et vit avec ses 8 enfants et son mari dans une famille monogame dans le quartier Pelengana sud de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région économique de la république du Mali). Au début elle envoyait ses domestiques chercher du bois de chauffe pour usage personnel, ses voisins voyant les tas de fagots, venaient toujours lui demander de leur en vendre une partie. C’est ainsi qu’elle a pris l’initiative de faire ce commerce et cela depuis 13 ans. Elle effectue toutes ses ventes à domicile au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée à majorité de femmes et également de boulangers. Elle mène cette activité toute l’année. Apres 5 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe), elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel et tous les précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt 20 chargements de bois de chauffe dans les villages environnants de la ville de Ségou auprès des paysans légalement établis pour cette activité et espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 12 000 FCFA. Elle compte renforcer son commerce avec ce bénéfice.
loan_use: Purchase of firewood

description:
Catarina C. is 46 years old and a native of Maputo in the south of Mozambique. She is single and the mother of a 29 year-old son who is already married. She lives with 2 nieces and 2 grandchildren.

Catarina attended school until the 4th grade and stopped because she was pregnant. She grew up with her mother who was separated when she was a baby. She got pregnant when she was 16 which obliged her to quit school. The father of her son refused to assume responsibility so Catarina had to arrange for another husband. With their first child something went wrong, and since she was unable to have more children she was rejected for the second time. She decided to return to her mother's house and never married again.

She started an business to sell various products and gradually was able to build a home. Catarina has lived for 6 years raising chickens. She works alone, learned from a friend and has 6 years of experience. She has an average monthly production of 300 chickens which equates to about 3,000MT per month.

This is the second loan with Hluvuku and she had one with the Tchuma cooperative. The first loan with Hluvuku was for 10,200MT and the second will be for 16,000MT. All proceeds are for raising chickens. She came to know Hluvuku through a friend who was already a client. Catarina is confident that with this loan she will be able to increase her production, respond to her clientele, and consequently realize better profits.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer Catarina C. tem 46 anos de idade e natural da provincial do Maputo ao sul de Moçambique, solteira e mae um filho de 29 anos e já se casou. Vive com duas sobrinhas e dois netos. Catarina estudou até Quarta classe e parou por ter ficada gravida. Cresceu junto da mãe esta que separou-se quando ela era bebe. Ficou gravida aos 16 anos de idade situação que lhe obrigou a deixar de estudar e o pai do filho que veio ater negou de assumir e teve que arrumar outro marido e no primeiro filho algo não foi bem durante ao parte fez com ela não pudesse dar mais filhos e assim foi rejeitada pela segunda vez e decide voltar a casa da mae e nunca se casou mais e optou por criar um auto emprego de venda de produtos diversos e aos poucos construiu sua casa. Catarina vive a 6 anos na base de criação de frangos e trabalha sozinha, aprendeu a traves de uma amiga e tem uma experiência de 6 anos. Tem uma produção media mensal de 300 frangos o que aproxima a 3000,00mt liquido mensal. Este é o segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku e um na Cooperativa Tchuma , o primeiro na Hluvuku foi de 10200,00mt e o segundo sera de 16000,00mt todos destinados para criação dos frangos e conheceu a Hluvuku a traves de uma amiga que já era cliente. Catarina está confiante que com este empréstimo vai aumentar a sua produção assim responderá a sua clientela e consequêntimente verá da melhor maneira os lucros.
loan_use: To raise chickens

description:
José Benvindo C. was born in Maputo. He is 45 years old and married. He went to school through the 10th grade and had to interrupt his studies to fulfill his obligatory military service. He has 4 children. The oldest is 22 years old and is in the 10th grade. The youngest is 3 years old.

He grew up in a family environment with his parents, however his father passed away when he was 9 years old and his oldest sister ended up caring for him. In 1978 he was solicited to fulfill his military service in the Beira Province of Sofala in the center of the country.

In 1984 for his abilities in dealing with people he received a scholarship and entered the Beira institute of health sciences where he studied nursing. Years later he was transferred to Maputo to command in the Navy. In 1988 he was discharged and began working in the Hospital of Catembe as a nurse. He has worked as a supervisor in the areas of Tuberculosis and leprosy for 20 years which has given him great experience.

He has a monthly income of 3,285MT but is unable to save any money. This is his first loan through Hluvuku which he discovered through some coleagues. He has a dream to one day raise hogs.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

José Benvindo C. nasceu em Maputo, casado maritalmente, tem 45 anos de idade, estudou até 10ªclasse e teve que interromper os estudos para cumprir o serviço militar obrigatório. Tem 4 filhos o mais velho tem 22 anos estuda na 10ªclasse e o mais novo tem 3 anos. Cresceu e viveu num ambiente famíliar com os pais, contudo o pai faleceu quando tinha 9 anos e quem passou a tomar conta dele foi a irmã mais velha. Em 1978 foi solicitado para cumprir o serviço militar na Beira Província de Sofala no Centro do Pais e em 1984 por suas capacidades em lidar com as pessoas teve bolsa de estudos onde ingresso no instituto de ciencias de saude da Beira onde cursou enfermagem e anos mais tarde foi transferido para o comando da Marinha de guerra em maputo. Em 1988 foi desmobilizado do exercito e passou a trabalhar no Hospital da Catembe como enfermeiro. É funcionario efectivo na area de supervisão da Tuberculese e lepra a mais de 20 anos. Facto que lhe assegura maior experiencia . Tem um rendimento mensal de 3.285,00mt e nao consegue poupar nenhum, este é o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e tomou conhecimento da existencia da Hluvuku atraves de colegas. Tem como sonho começar com a criação de suinos.
loan_use: To buy construction materials

description:
Graciela Lucina is married and is 40 years old. She studied higher technology and works in the Region teaching the people of La Sierra handicrafts. She has 2 kids who study, she lives in the district of Moche in the province of Trujillo in the department of La Libertad.

On her days off this businesswoman sells cosmetic products of different beauty lines which she sells in craft markets to generate additional income. She received an invitation from a friend who belongs to the group 'Virgen de Fatima', and the first loan that she had with them was of $300 which she invested in buying cosmetic products to increase her stock.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 2 years. With the loan of $1,300 that she will pay off over a period of 6 months she will buy a photocopier so she will offer a photocopying service too, and this will help her kids and husband. Her dream is to see her kids become professional.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Graciela Lucina está casada, tiene 40 años, estudió Superior Técnica, trabaja en la Región capacitando a los pobladores de la sierra en el curso de manualidades, tiene 02 hijos, son estudiantes, vive en el Distrito de Moche en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad. La empresaria, en sus días libres se dedica a vender productos cosméticos de diferentes líneas de belleza y participa en ferias vendiendo manualidades para poder generar ingresos adicionales. Recibió la invitación de una amiga para pertenecer al Banco Comunal “VIRGEN DE FATIMA”, el primer préstamo que solicitó fue de S/. 300.00, el cual ha invertido en la compra de productos cosméticos para incrementar el stock. Hace 02 años viene trabajando con Manuela Ramos. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,300.00, que cancelará en un plazo de 06 meses, comprará otra fotocopiadora ya que también brinda el servicio de fotocopias actividad en la cual le ayudan sus hijos y esposo. La socia sueña con ver a sus hijos profesionales.
loan_use: To buy a photocopier/Compra de fotocopiadora.

description:
Cesar Antonio B. is from the Mongelos neighborhood of the city of San Estanislao. He is married to Lilliana Mabel Rojas and they have a daughter.

Cesar works as a street vendor in various parts of the city selling sewing supplies and costume jewelry to a well developed client base. The works earns him a good income. He's been working in this business since 2002.

Cesar would like to buy more merchandise for his inventory, since he has a lot of orders from his clients. With the additional merchandise he will generate better earnings and begin to improve his family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Cesar Antonio B. es de la ciudad de San Estanislao del Barrio Mongelos, està casado con la Señora Liliana Mabel Rojas, y tienen 1 hijo.

\r\nSe dedica como vendedor ambulante de Articulos de Mercerias y Viyouterias, con clientela formada, por varias zonas , lo que le genera buenos ingresos. Empesò con esta actividad desde el año 2002.

\r\nEl Sr. Cesar B. quiere comprar màs mercaderìas para la venta, ya que tiene muchos pedidos de clientes, lo que le generarà màs ingresos y tambièn va mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
loan_use: To buy merchandise.

description:
Lucia is 24 years old, and she was able to complete secondary school. She speaks both Spanish and Aymara, and currently lives with her partner and their three children. Two children are in school, and the youngest is in kindergarten. She is from M. and lives in the El Collao province.

Lucia has a printing business called "Imagen" (Image) where she has worked for the last five years. She belongs to the communal bank "22 de Setiembre" (September 22nd) where she got an initial credit of S/. 300.00 nuevo soles which she invested in printing materials such as two boxes of bond paper in various colors.

With this loan for $550, which she will repay in four monthly payments, she will buy five boxes of paper, ink, thread, etc.

She told us that she is learning to be a hardworker, responsible, and united with her companions.

Her greatest wish is to buy a new offset machine and expand her business so that her children can study to become professionals, and then to later be able to buy their house.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Lucia tiene 24 años, logro estudiar secundaria completa, habla el idioma aymará y castellano, actualmente convive con su pareja con quien tiene tres hijos, de los cuales, dos de ellos están en la escuela, y el mas pequeño esta en el jardín, ella es de la Parcialidad de M. y vive en el Jr. Bolognesi de la ciudad de Ilave Provincia de El Collao. Lucia tiene su negocio de imprenta llamada “Imagen” con la que trabaja desde hace cinco años, pertenece al banco Comunal de “22 de Setiembre” donde tuvo un crédito inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles que lo invirtió en la compra de materiales de imprenta como dos cajas papel bond de colores. Con este crédito de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles, que será pagado en cuatro cuotas; comprará cinco cajas de papel, tinta, telas etc. Ella manifiesta que aprendió a ser trabajadora, responsable y solidaria con sus compañeras. El gran sueño que ella tiene es comprar una nueva maquina offset y ampliar su negocio, para que sus hijos puedan estudiar y ser profesionales, posterior mente comprar su casa.
loan_use: Purchase wholesale paper, ink, and other supplies

description:
Enrique is a hard working, 46 year old man who has considerably improved his economic situation due to growing potato. He feels happy to have the privilege of being a father to 7 children, today he takes care of the three youngest children. He grows a native variety of potato and sells them at wholesale to a food processor who makes french fries. He is saving money in order to become a taxi driver in the future, when his efforts in the field no longer are fruitful. In order to have a successful harvest, he is asking for a loan to buy sacks of organic fertilizer and hire workers to help him with the planting.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Enrique es un hombre trabajador y esforzado, a sus 46 años ha mejorado considerablemente su situación económica debido al cultivo de la papa, se siente feliz de tener el privilegio de ser padre de 7 hijos, ahora cuida de los tres últimos.Siembra papa de la variedad Nativa, las que vende al por mayor a una empresa agroindustrial que elabora papas fritas, está ahorrando para en un futuro dedicarse al transporte de pasajeros, cuando sus fuerzas en el campo ya no resistan.Para tener una cosecha exitosa, solicita este préstamo para la compra de sacos de abono, a su vez contratar personal que le ayuden en la siembra.
loan_use: buy organic fertilizer and pay workers who will help with the planting

description:
Herminia is married to Andres Pereira and is a mother of four children.  She sells used clothing and shoes for men, women and children, among other things. 
Herminia has dedicated herself to this business for two years.  Her business is located in a very busy part of the city of Pdte. Franco.  She runs her business from her home to which she had to make some modifications in order to have enough room for her merchandise. 
Herminia notes that during this cold season her sales are high.  This is why she wants to acquire a greater quantity of merchandise so that she can satisfy the demand that she has during this time of year.  Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Herminia, es casada con el señor Andrés Pereira,  es madre de cuatro hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas y zapatos usados para damas, caballeros y niños, entre otras cosas.

Herminia se ha dedicado a este rubro desde hace  2 años atrás y su local comercial se encuentra en un lugar muy concurrido  de la Ciudad de Pdte. Franco. Su negocio tiene en su propia casa, dónde tuvo que realizar algunas modificaciones para tener un espacio para sus mercaderías.

 
Herminia, comenta que en esta temporada de frió en nuestra zona, la venta  es bastante alto. Es por ello que  desea adquirir mayor cantidad de mercaderías, de este modo podrá abastecer la  demanda que tiene en esta época del año.
loan_use: Purchase of all kinds of clothing such as t-shirts, shirts, pants and shoes.

description:
I. Anvar is 35 years old and is married. He and his wife are raising five children. His wife is a housekeeper and she takes care of their children. Anvar is a farmer. He has been farming since he was a young boy. 

He has 8 years of experience, and he has been able to support his family by learning how to take care and manage his crops in the short growing season. He produces potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers, pumpkins, cabbage and other vegetables. Each year, his yield is sufficient for his family's consumption and for selling. 

His business is his family's main source of income, and generating a stable income requires considerable funding. He’s asking for a loan of 1000 Somoni ($300) for a term of 6 months to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer. Anvar would like to use this loan to buy supplies for the harvest and to improve production, and thus increase the quality of his yield along with his earnings at the time of sale. With your help, he will get ahead. He thanks all supporting him and promises to repay the loan on time.
loan_use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer

description:
Mrs. Trần Thi Điệp (MS: 11040032) is 40 years old. She is a cadre helping the women of the hamlet. Her family has quite many activities. Her husband is a cadre of the village and she works for the community in the fields, retailing and providing agricultural services. Today, she needs a loan of 3.186.000 VND for retailing. She has some seed capital, but she decided to participate to the Fund because of the convenient payment terms and conditions.

The other members of the group are:

  • Trần Thị Ánh (MS: 11040033), borrowing 3.186.000 VND to buy and sell fruit
  • Nghiêm Thị Quyên (MS: 11040034), borrowing 3.186.000 VND to buy pig feed
  • Nguyễn Thị Phượng (MS: 11040035), borrowing 3.186.000 VND to buy pig feed
  • Nguyễn Thị Mai (MS: 11040036), borrowing 3.186.000 VND to buy more pigs to breed

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Minh, Kiva volunteer

    Chị Trần Thi Điệp (MS: 11040032), năm nay 40 tuổi. Là cán bộ phụ nữ thôn. Gia đình chị có khá nhiều hoạt động. Chồng là cán bộ xã, chị vừa công tác xã hội lại làm ruộng bán hàng (cung cấp dịch vụ nông nghiệp ...). Nay chị đã vay 3.186.000 VND để bổ xung vốn bán hàng.Chị đã được tiếp cận khá nhiều nguồn vốn nhưng nay vì thích hình thức tiết kiêm để hoàn trả của tài chính vi mô bình minh nên đã tham gia.

    Các thành viên khác trong nhóm:

  • Trần Thị Ánh (MS: 11040033), vay 3.186.000 VND để bán hàng hoa quả
  • Nghiêm Thị Quyên (MS: 11040034), vay 3.186.000 VND để mua cám lợn
  • Nguyễn Thị Phượng (MS: 11040035), vay 3.186.000 VND để mua cám lợn
  • Nguyễn Thị Mai (MS: 11040036), vay 3.186.000 VND để lấy vốn đi chợ và mua lợn giống
loan_use: Retailing and breeding
borrower_names: Thi Quyen, Thi Diep, Thi Phuong, Thi Mai, Thi Anh

description:
Yasser is 53 years old, married, and the mother of five children. She lives in Beirut.

Yasser is a hardworking and ambitious seamstress. She is requesting a loan for an amount of USD 1,200 to purchase fabric and accessories.

This will allow her to continue to provide needed income for her husband and children. Yasser has been a microcredit client of Al Majmoua for the past eight years, a sufficient period of time to build solid trust and confidence.
loan_use: Purchase of fabric and accessories

description: Mercy S. sells bananas and plantains. She is married, but her husband's income as a carpenter is not sufficient for Mercy and her child. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.\r\n\r\nShe is asking for additional capital to expand her business.
loan_use: Additional capital to expand her business.

description:
Mohamad is a 52-year-old single man who lives in Saida, in the south of Lebanon. Mohamad is a hardworking and very ambitious person who wants to improve his own social status. He works in many different businesses: he owns a restaurant, he does telephone exchange, and he deals in trading cars.

\r\n\r\n

Mohamad already borrowed twice from Al Majmoua and repaid each loan on time. The first loan was dedicated to the maintenance of his restaurant and the second loan to purchase a new refrigerator. Mohamad now needs a loan for $1200 to decorate his restaurant.
loan_use: To decorate his restaurant

description:
Nida is a very responsible mother, and is very dedicated to her work. She puts all her effort into her small brick factory, and she has been doing this hard task for 8 years. Over this time period she has acquired a lot of experience making a large quantity and variety of bricks. The motivation for her effort is her young son, Alexander, who she wants to give greater opportunities in life. Nida is sure that getting more raw materials to make bricks, such as sawdust and guano, will allow her to increase brick production, and this is why she is looking for your support with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Nida es una madre muy responsable y comprometida con su trabajo, pone su mayor esfuerzo y dedicación en su pequeña fabrica de ladrillos, lleva ya 8 años con esta ardua labor, en este tiempo logró adquirir amplia experiencia elaborando incansablemente gran cantidad y variedad de ladrillo.El motivo de su esfuerzo es su pequeño niño, Alexander, a quien desea brindarle mejores oportunidades de vida. Nida está segura que adquiriendo mayor materia prima para la fabricación de sus ladrillo, tales como aserrín y guano, le permitirá ampliar la cantidad de producción de sus ladrillos, con este objetivo recurre a la búsqueda de tu apoyo con la presente solicitud de préstamo.
loan_use: To buy raw materials for his brick factory/Compra de materia prima para su fábrica de ladrillos.

description:
David is 23 years old, and lives in his mother's house with his wife and 1 year old daughter. David is a farmer, and since his marriage he has demonstrated that in spite of his youth he can support his family with hard work and dedication. Because of this, he is always in the fields, growing potatoes. David leaves early in the morning to water the fields, then fertilizes and fumigates the crops. This work is satisfying, and it enables David to purchase goods for his home. However the most trying feature of this work is dealing with the changes in climate, which can damage the crops. Because of this, farmers like David must buy products that help protect the crops from shifts in the weather. David is motivated by his desire to offer his family a better quality of life. This time, he would like to invest in the purchase of supplies to protect his crops, so as to have a better harvest and sell his crops outside of his hometown.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

David tiene 23 años, vive en la casa de su madre, junto a su esposa y su pequeña hija de 1 año. Es agricultor, desde que se casó demostró que a pesar de ser joven puede solventar a su familia a base de esfuerzo y dedicación, por ello, siempre está en sus terrenos de cultivos sembrando papa, en lo que ocupa gran parte del día, desde la madrugada sale a regar sus terrenos para luego dedicarse al abono o a la fumigación. Esta actividad le ha dado grandes satisfacciones, como adquirir implementos para su hogar.Sin embargo, lo más duro, es enfrentarse a los cambios de clima, ya que pueden perjudicar su trabajo, para ello debe afrontarlo con la compra de productos que ayuden a proteger los cultivos. Para David, el motivo de su empeño es ofrecer a su familia una mejora calidad de vida. Esta vez, quiere invertir una suma de dinero en la compra de insumos que protejan su producción, para una mejor cosecha y lograr comercializar sus productos fuera de su ciudad.
loan_use: Purchase supplies to protect his crops from pests and shifts in the weather.

description:
Jancy is requesting her sixth loan; this time she will invest it in installing floor tile in her home. Jancy has been a school teacher for 12 years, and she is also enrolled at URACCAN University. Jancy has proven to be responsible, honest, and eager to improve herself. She has a 6-year-old daughter who is in first grade of elementary school. Jancy's husband works as a driver and they both contribute to the household expenses. Jancy's dream is to have a stable job, a good home, and to see her daughter receive a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva volunteer

La clienta Jancy está solicitando su sexto refinanciamiento para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda como es poner ceramica al piso de su casa, esta cliente labora como docente de Educación Primaria desde hace 12 años, actualmente esta estudiando su quinto año en la Universidad URACCAN, Jancy se caracteriza por ser responsable, honesta y con mucho deseo de superación personal, tiene una niña de 6 añitos de edad, estudia su primer grado de educación primaria, su esposo labora como ayudante de un camión el cual ambos comparten con los gastos familiares, su sueño es tener estabilidad laboral, una vivienda digna y que su hija estudie para que llegue hacer alguien en la vida.
loan_use: Install floor tile in home

description:
Rocío is a hard-working woman who for many years has been dedicated to selling cosmetics and various knick knacks, depending on the occasion. However, for the most part, she is dedicated to the sale of groceries, which she distributes among her neighbors and friends. So far, she is doing well but her wish is to get ahead and her goal is to have a minimarket in the future. In the meantime, she continues to work so that she may provide her small, seven year old daughter everything that she deserves. At this time, Rocío wishes to increase her working capital for which she is requesting a loan of 1,300 soles which she will invest in the purchase of more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Rocío es una mujer de mucho empeño, se ha dedicado durante varios años a la venta de cosméticos, de productos variados de acuerdo a la ocasión y también a la costura, pero en mayor medida a la venta de abarrotes que distribuye a sus vecinos y amistades, hasta el momento le va muy bien y su deseo es seguir adelante, con la meta de tener un minimarket en el futuro, mientras tanto seguirán trabajando para darle a su pequeña de 7 años todo lo que se merece.En esta ocasión Rocío desea incrementar su capital de trabajo, para lo cual está solicitando un préstamo de 1300 soles que invertirá en la compra de más mercadería.
loan_use: Increase merchandise for her small grocery store.

description:
K. Farhod is 28 years old. He is a loving husband and father, and for a long time has been running a grocery store which he rents. Farhod began his own store with his hard-earned savings as he had always wanted to be an entrepreneur. He has been selling fruits, vegetables and different kinds of foodstuffs in his grocery store for the past 7 years. During these years Farhod acquired the knowledge and skills required for the business. Vegetable and fruits sales are flourishing for the simple reason that every home needs vegetables. \r\n

His wife Amina helps Farhod with the business. They were able to make it grow and they want to turn it into a great success. Since he started their store, he was able to increase its clientele and in order to provide them with good service. He is requesting a loan of 950 USD for the term of 12 months, which he will use to buy merchandise to increase his assortment. With your help, this will be possible.
loan_use: Increasing of the range of goods

description:
Khursheda R. has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2002. She is a hard-working and non-problem client. She trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures so she applies regularly to MicroInvest. Mrs. Khursheda R. lives in the B.Gafurov region and she is married. Having 2 pretty children, she dreams of a happy future for them.

\r\n\r\nMrs. Khursheda R. sells children's and women's wear in the local bazaar where she has a stall. She has direct suppliers so she sells at prices that are lower than the bazaar prices. She wants to import new seasonal goods. Mrs. R. Khursheda is applying to KIVA for financial support, for a loan in the amount of 4100 STJ for 6 months for business development.
loan_use: business development

description:
Rehema A. is a Tanzanian business woman (pictured standing). For 4 years, she has run a retail shop selling soft drinks in the Kigamboni area. She purchases the soft drinks from wholesale shops and sells to consumers in the area near the shop. \r\n

\r\nRehema uses the profits from the business to meet her family's daily needs, including paying school fees for her children. She doesn't have enough supplies to meet the demands of her many customers. She requests a loan of $750 to increase the supply of soft drinks to sell.
loan_use: Purchase more soft drinks to sell

description: Rebecca I. is 37 years old and married with four children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs. She has been in this business since 2003. She needs the loan amount of US$ 600 to buy more provisions and drinks for sale. She says thank you.
loan_use: To buy more drinks and provisions for sale

description:
I am Gilberto Treviño Córdova. I work as an employee of a company in Piedras Negras, but my salary is not enough to pay all living expenses. I have three small children, and two of them are already of schooling age. To support the children, my wife helped me with a small grocery store that we have in the house, but we could not make it work for a lack of resources. Therefore, we are asking for the amount of $225 to supply our grocery store to make it more productive.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

Yo soy Gilberto Treviño Córdova, yo trabajo como empleado en una empresa de Piedras Negras, pero mi sueldo no es suficiente para pagar todos los gasto de la casa y de mis tres pequeños hijos dos de ellos ya están en edad escolar, así que para esto mi esposa me ayuda con una pequeña tienda de abarrotes que tenemos en la casa pero no hemos podido hacerla funcionar por falta de recursos así que pedimos la cantidad de 225 dls para poder surtir nuestra tiendita y hacerla productiva.
loan_use: To supply his grocery store

description: Faith O. is 36 years old and married without children.  She lives in Benin City, in the Edo state of Nigeria.  Since 2005, she has been selling clothing materials and offering sewing services.  In order to expand her business, Faith is requesting a loan of $450, which will be used to purchase more tailoring materials.
loan_use: To buy more tailoring materials for cloth production.

description: Enisa, a young woman from the town of Doboj, is married with one child, and her husband is currently employed.  The family receives a small pension through Enisa's mother-in-law as well.  This will be Enisa's first loan from Zene za Zene, which she is requesting in the amount of $800 to buy seeds to grow tomatoes and peppers in her greenhouse.  She may also spend part of the money on fertilizer and pesticides. Enisa will be busy in the early fall planting these seeds after the weather has cooled down and growing conditions are optimal.
loan_use: To buy seeds & supplies for farming

description: Efua B. sells fish. She is married, but her husband's income as a commercial driver is not sufficient for Efua and her seven children. Because there is good demand for her goods, she is requesting a loan to increase her stock and expand her business.
loan_use: To expand her business

description: For the past four years, Faustina has been trading in palm oil. She is a 50-year-old married woman, with two children who are in school. She treks to Asamang, a town in the eastern region of Ghana, to purchase palm oil from the producers in bulk so she can sell it to her customers. She says increased prices of rice and fuel have affected her working capital and she can no longer buy enough palm oil to sustain her business. She wants to use the loan to buy palm oil in bulk to avoid price hikes and frequent travel. She hopes to increase her savings to support her husband in paying the children's school fees. She is a member of the group called Gold Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee for one other as social collateral and help each other to repay the loans.
loan_use: To buy bulk gallons of palm oil.

description:
Antonio lives on Arturo Valle Street in the Villa Esperanza area of the city of El Alto [suburb of La Paz]. He lives with his two children, who are 19 and 14 years old. His wife lives and works in the country to take care of their cattle.

Antonio is a welder working with freight vehicles. He rents a workshop where he performs this work.

Antonio will use the loan to purchase materials in bulk to reduce his costs. This is his first loan from IMPRO, which performed an assessment qualifying her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Antonio vive en la calle Arturo Valle de la zona Villa Esperanza en la ciudad de El Alto. Vive junto a sus dos hijos de 19 y 14 años respectivamente, su esposa vive y trabaja en el área rural cuidando su ganado.

Trabaja como soldador de partes de vehículos pesados, tiene un taller en alquiler donde cumple esa función.

El crédito lo destinara para compra de insumos, al por mayor y así disminuir sus costos. Es el primer crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
loan_use: Purchase of welding materials for his business

description: Rebecca is a twenty-eight year old lady.  she is married with two kids in school. She has been trading in grocery products like rice, fresh tomatoes, tin tomatoes, cocoa products, skimmed milk, body pomade, etc in the market of Obuasi, Ghana for ten years. Her experience in trading has made her one of the most successful traders in the market. Rebecca considers this loan a great opportunity to enable expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy cartons of milk, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable and palm oil to increase her inventory. Rebecca is a member of  the community group called Anointed Ladies. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and assist themselves to repay the loan.
loan_use: To buy cartons of milk, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetables and palm oil.

description: Afia D. is a thirty-one year old widowed mother of five children. She believes in hard work and dedication. She owns and operates a local restaurant and sells local foods like fufu and banku. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantains and is taken with all kinds of soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and is taken with hot pepper or soup. Afia needs the loan to enable her inject more working capital into her business to purchase more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantains, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood to beat up cost. She hopes the loan would enable her to increase savings to support  two of her kids in school. She is a member of the community group called "Amen" Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access a loan and provide support for members to repay. Afia\'s photograph was taken at her busy group meeting.
loan_use: To buy more raw materials like maize,  cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

description: The leader of this small group is Martina L.. She sells charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Martina is 40 years old and is married with a husband who is a teacher. She has two children, ages 13 and 20, who go to school. Each week, Martina makes approximately 100 Sudanese pounds in profits, and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business. \r\n\r\nMartina is joined in her small group by Margret K., Nadia J., Jackline J., and Fasia J.. Margret K. sells clothes and wants to expand her shop. Nadia J. sells charcoal and bread and wants a loan to expand her business. Jackline J. sells groundnuts at the market and wants to expand her busines. Fasia J. sells HP printers and is requesting a loan to open an Internet café.
loan_use: Expand their businesses

description:
Alexei is an entrepreneur from Novomoskovsk. He is a single gentleman that lives with his mother and willingly supports the expenses of his family. His primary goal has always been to give his family a better standard of living. Alexei is very hard-working and enterprising. He works in his car repair workshop day and night. He always says his work is something that gives him enthusiasm and inspiration. As a good manager, Alexei has succeeded in managing his loans in "Nadiya Ukraine" and repaid all of them without any delinquencies.

Alexei has been in business for 15 years. He is eager to access the above amount to buy good quality modern tools that he can use fixing vehicles in his shop. Alexei will benefit from more consistent financial support because it will strengthen his trade and provide an important profit margin to improve his business.

Note: this is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in a month.
loan_use: To purchase modern tools

description:
Maria lives with her 10 children, her husband left her when she was younger and she had to figure it out on her own for all of them. Since she has been alone, Maria has been working on different activities to support her 10 children, the situation was not easy back then, but now thanks to the hard work, she acquired a truck, which she uses to provide freight services. Making a good use of her time, she also sells second hand clothing on Sundays and Mondays, the rest of the week she works with her truck.

Maria has always liked working, the only difficulty that she finds in selling second hand clothing is transporting the merchandise and set it up properly. Maria has always worked for the wellbeing of the children, although they are older now, she wants to give as much as she can to them. With the money from the loan, she will buy more clothing to generate more income and in the near future be able to purchase another truck to expand her freight business.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

María vive con sus 10 hijos, su esposo la abandonó cuando era más joven y tuvo que encargarse sola de todos ellos. Desde que se quedó sola María ha venido trabajando duramente en diferentes actividades para sostener a sus 10 hijos, la situación no era fácil en ese entonces, pero hoy gracias a su arduo esfuerzo, pudo adquirir un camión, el cual lo emplea en brindar servicio de carga, aprovechando el tiempo, también se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano los domingos y lunes, el resto de días trabaja en su camión.

A ella siempre le ha gustado trabajar, la única dificultad que encuentra en la venta de ropa de segunda mano, es tener que trasladar la mercadería y acomodarla debidamente. María siempre ha trabajado por el bienestar de sus hijos, aunque ahora están más grandes ella desea brindarles lo mejor hasta que las fuerzas se lo permitan. Con el dinero que se le facilite, comprará más ropa de segunda mano para generar más ganancias y en un futuro cercano poder comprarse otro camioncito para poder expandir su empresa de servicio de carga.
loan_use: Buy clothing to sell, and use the profit to purchase a truck for freight services

description:
The group leader of this small group is Nehina N.. She is currently in the business of selling bread and is requesting a loan to buy oil for sale. Nehina is 40 years old and is married to a husband who is a businessman. She has 2 children, 12 and 26, and her children go to school. Each week, Nehina makes approximately 100 Sudanese pounds in profit and with the extra money from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy oil for sale.

Nehina is joined in her small group by Marbaba J., Mary M., Leila H., and Unex G.. Marbaba J. has a business selling clothes and wants to stock more clothes. Mary M. is currently operating a business selling cold water from the fridge and wants a loan to expand her business. Leila H. operates a business selling charcoal and wants to expand the business. Unex G. is currently in the business of selling fried chicken and is requesting a loan to construct a cafe.
loan_use: buy oil for sale

description:
Melina is 29 years old. She is a single mother and lives with her 5 year old son.

She is a very hardworking woman, who makes her living selling groceries from her own tiny convenience store. She was able to open the store a year ago with a great deal of effort. She is now working on improving her business. She works all day, tending to her clients and offering products of the highest quality. What she most appreciates about her business is that she is able to share her working hours with her small son, who requires a lot of attention. Her store requires lots of her attention, and as well and she is determined not to neglect it. Lately, the prices she pays for her products have increased and she is not able to keep up with the increased costs, which has limited her ability to offer her clients the best.

As a result, Melina would like to invest in the the purchase of food products and merchandise in order to stock her store well. She wants her store to be a place where people come and find what they need.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Melina tiene 29 años, es madre soltera y vive con su pequeño hijo de 5 años.

Es una mujer muy trabajadora, dedicada a la venta de abarrotes dentro de su pequeña bodega, la cual pudo instalar con mucho esfuerzo hace 1 año, ahora trabaja en mejorarla, para ello le dedica todo el día, atendiendo a sus clientes y ofreciendo los mejores productos de calidad.Lo que más le agrada de su negocio es que puede compartir horas de trabajo junto a su pequeño hijo, quien requiere de muchas atenciones, al igual que su tienda la cual no puede descuidar.Pero es estas últimas temporadas, los productos subieron sus precios y Melina no puede lidiar con ello, limita su posibilidad de ofrecer lo mejor a sus clientes.

\r\nEs así, que Melina desea invertir en la compra de productos y mercadería, para así surtir su bodega y ser una tienda donde las personas recurran y encuentren lo necesario para sus necesidades.
loan_use: Invest in additional inventory in order to better stock her grocery store.

description: Kikelomo M. is 48 years old, is married, and has six children. Kikelomo sells kerosene and has been in business for over twenty years. She learned this business from her mother and she started her own business when she got married. She started by selling door-to-door around her community until the business grew to what it is now. She has lots of customers. She needs a loan of $700 to buy more kerosene to sell.
loan_use: Purchase of more kerosene to sell

description:
Maria is 42 years old, has 4 children, 3 of them are independent and she lives with her husband, who is a chauffeur, and her youngest 6 year-old son. She works in her general store trying to satisfy the demands and needs of the neighbors; the store is built of pre-construction material and has been operating for 3 years. What she enjoys about her work is that she has been able to establish friendship with her neighbors and has their trust, but more than once she has thought of closing because of lack of safety at the premises, and this represents a problem that needs to be solved soon. Therefore Maria wishes to built her store to be safe, and in the future turn into an important general store with a vast variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

María, de 42 años tiene 4 hijos, 3 de ellos ya son jóvenes e independientes, ahora vive con su esposo, quien es chofer y su último hijo de 6 años. Trabaja en su bodega, tratando satisfacer las demandas y necesidades de los pobladores de la zona, dicha tienda está preconstruida, y hace 3 años que está en funcionamiento. Lo que le agrada de su trabajo es que a través de ello pudo formar lazos de amistad con sus vecinos y lograr un alto grado de confianza con ellos, pero por más de una ocasión pensó cerrar, por la falta de seguridad de su local, siendo esto algo que quiere resolver pronto. Es por ello, que María tiene pensado construir su tienda, para dar seguridad a su negocio y con el tiempo ser una gran bodega con diversidad de productos. .
loan_use: Build safe premises for a general store.

description:
Emiliana is 32 years old, studies until 5th grad, is married, and mother of a daughter who still depends on her. In her small store she sells, sweets, soft-drinks, gelatin, candy, crackers, etc. Her store is located in the ENTEL of Zepita, in addition she sells general goods in the weekly Fairs of Huapaca, in the Pomata, Desguadero, and Zepita districts.

She is a partner of the Zepita Communal Bank, in the Zepita district, Chucuito district--Juli, of the Puno region, en which she obtained her first loan of $125. She invested this money in the purchase of 2 packages of soft-drinks, 2 boxes of crackers, 1 package of gelatin, and 4 bags of caramels. She says that with all of these loans her merchandise has grown, so that she can offer her clients all kinds of general good and snacks.

She is requesting this loan of $600 to purchase more items, such as 3 sacks of rice, 2 sacks of sugar, 10 packages of soft-drinks, 5 boxes of crackers, among other things. This loan will be returned in 4 months.Emiliana is happy because her merchandise has increased in the same way that her income has. Her greatest desire is to roof her home and build a general good store, as well as making an education possible for her daughter.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

Emiliana tiene 32 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto de secundaria, es conviviente y madre de una hija que aún depende de ella. En su pequeña tienda vende golosinas, gaseosas, gelatinas, dulces, galletas, etc, que esta ubicada en el ENTEL de Zepita, además ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en las ferias semanales de Huapaca del distrito de Pomata, Desaguadero y Zepita. Es socia del Banco Comunal Zepita, del distrito del mismo nombre, provincia de Chucuito – Juli, de la región de Puno, en cual tuvo un primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles. Este dinero lo invirtió en compra de 2 paquetes de gaseosas, 2 cajas de galletas, 1 paquete de gelatina, 4 bolsas de caramelos. Ella relata que con todos los crédito ha crecido su mercadería para ofrecer a los clientes tanto abarrotes y golosinas, por ello con el préstamo de S/. 1,700.00 nuevos soles, comprará más cosas por ejemplo 3 sacos de arroz, 2 bolsas de azúcar, 10 paquetes de gaseosas, 5 cajas de galletas entre otras. Este crédito lo pagará en cuatro meses. Emiliana esta contenta ya que su mercadería ha incrementado de igual manera sus ingresos económicos. Su deseo más grande es techar su casa y poner una tienda de abarrotes por mayor y menor, además hacer estudiar a su hijita.
loan_use: Purchase of general goods.

description:
Shamim Akhtar baji is the widow of M., and she lives in the small city of Riwind, Pakistan. She owns a two-room, brick house, which she and her family have lived in for the last 24 years. She is the mother of seven children: six sons and one daughter. Her oldest son has a compact disc (CD) shop, and he has 6 years of experience in the business; her next three oldest sons work as tailors; and her other sons and daughter are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood.

\r\nTo generate income for her family, Shamim baji makes school bags and sells them in various areas. Moreover, she does work around her house and takes care of her children. Notably, she successfully repaid three previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now, she is applying for another loan in order to buy more CDs to expand her son’s business.
loan_use: To expand and improve her son's CD-selling business by purchasing additional CDs

description:
Rahat baji is the wife of A. M., and she lives in the city of Riwind, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children: three sons and two daughters. Her oldest son sells milk; her other sons are in school (5th and 3rd standards, respectively); her oldest daughter works in a cotton Mill; and her younger daughter is in 7th standard.

\r\nRahat baji makes embroidered dresses and generally does a lot of work around her house. Notably, Rahat baji successfully repaid three previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Currently, she is applying for another loan in order to buy a buffalo to expand her son's milk business.
loan_use: To buy a buffalo in order to expand and improve her son's milk-selling business

description: Maxim was born in 1970. He is married, with 2 children. Maxim's wife is pictured. Maxim is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Kalbadjar region in the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, now settled in the Absheron region, Masazir village. 9 years ago he started his produce business. Now the M. family needs a loan of $1200 to buy vegetables and fruits to improve their business.
loan_use: To buy vegetables and fruits

description: Vann P., 46, is a rice farmer who lives in Siem Reap with her husband, Nginh Nghor, and their six children. Her husband works in construction, repairing and building roads for the city, making US$2.50 each day, while one of the children also works on roads and makes the same income. Vann P. would like to expand her farm and increase her yields, allowing her to sell more crops in the local market. She has asked for a loan of US$300 to purchase more rice seeds to expand her crops.
loan_use: Vann would like to purchase more rice seeds for her farm.

description: KH. K. H., 27, raises pigs in her home with her husband, Meang Sin, in Siem Reap. They typically make US$10 per day and they have three young children to support. One of their children is a student in the local public school system, while the other two are still too young to attend school. KH. K. H. has asked for a loan of US$1000 to purchase 10 piglets to breed for additional income. She would also like to use some of the money to purchase feed for the pigs. Raising pigs is a profitable business in Cambodia and the family would like to see this business continue to grow in the future. After this loan is repaid, they will consider expanding the pig's barn to accommodate their growing business.
loan_use: Purchase 10 piglets to raise and breed

description:
Saida is a forty-two-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She rears kuku for sale. Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. What are kuku, you may ask? Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular because they require little startup capital, require little space, and their eggs can be sold or eaten. Saida is assisted in her poultry business by one employee, her husband, and her children. Her monthly profit is approximately 120 USD. She is seeking a 275 USD loan to purchase additional chicks and feed that she hopes will help her breed more chickens for sale.\r\n

\r\nSELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; because of this, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services. When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan, a process called a sale-and-leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client. The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.
loan_use: To buy additional chicks and feed

description:
Mambo from Tanzania! Angela is a 44-year-old married woman with four children. Additionally, another family member is dependent on her. She owns a small Mama Lishe, or local café, that she started in 2005 and runs with two employees. When you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business title is ‘restaurant’ or ‘café’, you may have to adjust your mental image of what that is. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches, with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don’t even appear in the Lonely Planet’s budget guide, but if you’re looking for a cheap and tasty meal, and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to be. The food is all local; rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces.

Angela is requesting $US275 in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, cooking oil, and beans and to add more chairs for customer seating. In the future, she hopes to open another café, which would allow her to serve her delectable food to even more customers.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence the poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client. The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.
loan_use: To buy additional foodstuffs

description:
S., a young craftsman in iron, is based in Ziguinchor. He is requesting this loan to acquire new equipment, because the demand is higher than the offer. Thus he will be able to increase his profit and consequently his purchasing power.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

S., jeune menuisier metallique, est base a Ziguinchor. Il sollicite ce pret pour acquerir de nouveaux materiel ; car la demande est superieur a l'offre. Ainsi il pourra realiser davantage de benefices et par ricochet accroitre son pouvoir d'achat.
loan_use: Wrought iron workshop

description: Mariam M. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur. She runs a shop that sells a variety of items at the Mbagala market in the Temeke District of Dar-es-Salaam. She purchases products from the wholesalers at the Kariakoo city shopping center and then resells them. She wants to run a wholesale shop. Income generated from her business is used to meet daily family demands and also to pay the school fees of her two children. She is requesting a loan to expand her business.
loan_use: Expand business

description:
Wilson lives in his parents´home on Arturo Borda street in the Sopocachi area of the city of La Paz. He is 26 years old and his work is assemblying computers and installing software. In addition to this activity, Wilson is a technician and he also repairs radios and other electrical equipment.

He is requesting a loan to make repairs to his home. The wood flooring in the living room is deteriorating because of humidity and runs the risk of collapsing if it is not fixed immediately. His record with IMPRO is good, his payment history is excellent and this qualifies him to obtain a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Wilson vive en casa de sus padres en la calle Arturo Borda de la zona de Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene 26 años de edad y la actividad a la que se dedica es el armado de computadoras y el software de las mismas; además de esta actividad, Wilson es técnico y también arregla radios y artefactos eléctricos.

El crédito que solicita es para refaccionar su casa ya que el piso de machimbre de la sala esta cediendo por la humedad y corre el riesgo de hundirse si no se efectúan los arreglos inmediatamente. El historial que tiene con Impro es bueno, su historial de pagos es excelente y esto lo califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.
loan_use: Buy supplies to repair the floors in his home.

description:
The community bank JASMINES-UNO is composed of 13 female members that are thankful for the help that the institution has provided. They have got together again in order to be able to work. Due to a bad experience in the previous cycle, in the current cycle the number of members has been reduced, assuring that in the next cycle the number of members will be increased. They are currently in their fourth cycle. The majority of the members invest their money in their businesses that are located in the German Moreno market in the city of Montero, such as Concepción who invested her loan in her clothing store or Sonia who, with a loan from AGROCAPITAL, started her business, which is a grocery store in her home in the Pampa la Madre neighborhood in Montero and proudly wants everyone to know that thanks to the institution she was able to start her business which is prosperous and helps her to support her children.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

El Banco comunal JASMINES-UNO compuesta por 13 socias agradecidas por el apoyo económico que brinda la institución es que se reorganizaron nuevamente para poder trabajar, ya que una mala experiencia en el anterior ciclo hizo que este actual ciclo disminuye en número D. integrantes , asegurando que el posterior ciclo aumentaran el numero D. socias, actualmente están en el 4 ciclo, la mayoría D. las socias invierte su dinero en sus negocios pues tienen sus ventas en el mercado German Moreno D. la ciudad D. Montero, como el caso D. la sra. Concepción que invirtió el préstamo en su venta D. ropa o el caso D. la Sra. Sonia que con el préstamo D. AGROCAPITAL inicio su negocio, una venta D. abarrotes en su domicilio en la zona D. la Pampa la Madre en Montero, que orgullosa hace conocer a todos que gracias a la institución pudo comenzar con su negocio que es prospero y le ayuda para mantener sus hijos.
loan_use: Operating capital
borrower_names: Constanza, Deisy, Sonia, Justina, Salome, Concepcion, Ofelia Juana, Martha, Elvia Mariela, Julia, Liboria, Carlota, Carmen
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, false, true, true, true, true, true, true, false, true, true, true

description: Mrs. Suon S. owns a grocery store in Ankrorng Village in Kampong Speu Province. Her husband, Mr. Mol Man, is a farmer; he is on the left in the photo. Mrs. Suon S. is 48 years old and the mother of seven children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while two others are attending school. The remaining three are too young to work or study. Previously, she had obtained a loan from AMK to start her current business and she has fully paid it back. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more inventory for her store.
loan_use: To buy more inventory for her store.

description:
Mirzosharif A. lives in the city of Yavan. He is a driver. He is married and has six children. In his free time, which he usually has during the week-ends, Mirzosharif buys and sells animals at the local market. He buys a couple of bulls and then resells them at a higher price. He has been in this business for 9 years. In order to increase profit, he needs additional funds. Mirzosharif wants to receive a loan in order to be able to buy and sell more. This way, he would be able to purchase well-bread cows and bulls. He plans to repay the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer.

Ашуров Мирзошариф проживает одном из кишлаков города Яван. Работает водителем . Женат и имеет шестерых детей. В свободное от работы время , а это обычно в субботу и в воскресенье он выходит на животный рынок и занимается перепродаже скота. Покупает пару бычков подешевле и тут же перепродает по более выгодной цене. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 9 лет. Для того , чтобы увеличить прибыльность необходимы дополнительные средства. Он хочет получить кредит и увеличить товарооборот. Таким образом он сможет покупать породистых коров и бычков. Погасить кредит он сможет в течение 6 месяцев.
loan_use: To increase the number of animals

description:
Juan lives in the Villa Reconciliacion neighborhood. He is 28 years old and is married with three young children. His wife sells cosmetics to help with the household expenses and to help improve the living conditions for their children who are in grammar school. Juan works as service laborer; a job he has held for four years. The loan that he is seeking will be used for improvements on their home such as pouring in a concrete floor as their home currently has a dirt floor. For this he needs to buy cement, sand and stones. He wants to improve his home in order to be more comfortable with his family. His dream is to continue improving his home and to help his wife in invest in the sale of clothing as she has been successful in the sale of cosmetics. Juan also wants to be able to have his children continue in school so that they can make an honest living.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Juan habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, tiene 28 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos menores de edad, ella vende cosmético para ayudar en los gastos del hogar y así apoyar a su esposo y poder tener mejores condiciones para sus hijos que están estudiando en la primaria. Juan trabaja de operario de servicios, tiene cuatro años de estar laborando. El préstamo que está solicitando es para hacer mejoras en su hogar como es poner piso de concreto ya que hasta el momento es de tierra quiere hacer la mejora en su casa para estar mas cómodo con su familia, para esto necesita comprar: cemento. arena y piedrin.\r\n\r\nSu sueño es seguir mejorando su vivienda, ayudar a su esposa para que invierta en la venta de ropa ya que le va bien con la venta de cosméticos. Lograr que sus hijos sigan estudiando para que puedan ganarse la vida honestamente.
loan_use: Add a concrete floor to home.

description:
Maria is an enterprising woman, she has worked on different activities, but unfortunately she didn’t succeed in any of them because she was alone facing family problems and hard economic times. Recently, with hard work and determination she started a business selling spare parts for cars. She brings the merchandise from La Paz, Bolivia and then distributes them in the city of Juliaca. In addition, Maria sells basic need items. She has been able to support her children with these two activities. She requests a loan to increase her working capital and increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

María es una mujer emprendedora, se dedicó a diferentes actividades, pero desafortunadamente en ninguna pudo salir airosa, porque sola tuvo que enfrentar sus problemas familiares y difíciles momentos económicos por las que atravesaba su familia.Ahora con empeño y mucha dedicación viene emprendiendo su negocio de venta de repuestos para carros, mercadería que trae de la ciudad de la Paz- Bolivia y los distribuye en la ciudad de Juliaca, adicionalmente a este oficio María se dedica a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad, con estas dos actividades viene manteniendo sin privaciones económicas a sus hijos, con quienes vienen lidiando para mejorar su situación de vida.Por ello, solicita este préstamo para aumentar su capital de inversión y para en adelante, mejorar sus ganancias.
loan_use: Increase working capital.

description:
Angel has a job as a driver, but upon seeing that with his wages, he wasn’t able to support his children, he decided four years ago to dedicate himself to the sale of toys in the villages. Upon realizing that it was going very will for him, he started to sell at he village fairs, and this is how each day he has increased his sales.

He needs a loan of $250 which he will repay in four months to buy merchandise and have a better inventory to sell at the town fairs.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva volunteer.

Ángel tiene un empleo de chofer, pero al ver que con su sueldo no le alcanzaba para mantener a su hijos decidió hace 4 años dedicarse a la venta de juguetes en los pueblos, al darse cuenta que le iba muy bien, empezó a vender en las ferias de los pueblos, y es así como cada día han ido aumentando sus ventas.

El necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar mercancía y tener mayor inventario para vender en las feria del pueblo.
loan_use: To buy merchandise

description:
Manuel worked as a factory worker, but after seeing that with his salaries he was not covering his family’s expenses, and because of his knowledge of tin and paiting, he decided to start his own business four years ago. To date, the business has done very well, and each day, it has been growing.

He needs a loan for $250 which he will repay in three months to buy tools for work. With your support, he will move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva volunteer.

Manuel trabajaba como empleado de una fábrica, pero al ver que con su sueldo no alcanzaba a cubrir los gastos familiares y debido a los conocimientos que tenia en hojalatería y pintura, decidió poner su propio negocio, hace 4 años, con el cual a la fecha le ha ido muy bien y cada día ha ido creciendo.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar herramientas de trabajo con tu apoyo el saldrá adelante.
loan_use: Buying tools for work

description:
Jose Marcelo is a person who based on much dedication has been able to create his business. He started it 10 years ago when he was unemployed and had to look for an activity that would allow him to meet his family’s expenses, so utilizing his knowledge of fishing, he decided to dedicate himself to this. Little by little he has achieved a portfolio of customers that has allowed him to move forward.

He needs a loan of $150 which he will repay in three months to buy material for the creation of fishing nets, now that he is thinking about making traps and nets during the off season, and taking advantage of the demand for fishing traps for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva volunteer.

José Marcelo es una persona que a base de mucha dedicación ha logrado hacer crecer su negocio, el lo inicio hace 10 años cuando se quedó sin empleo y tenia que buscar un actividad que le permitiera solventar los gastos de su familia, entonces aprovechando sus conocimientos sobre pesca decidió dedicarse a esto, poco a poco ha logrado tener una cartera de clientes que le han permitido salir adelante.

El necesita un préstamo por US S150 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar material para la elaboración de redes para pescar ya que piensa elaborar trampas y redes para la temporada de pulpo que esta por empezar y aprovechara la demanda para ofrecer trampas para pesca en venta.
loan_use: Buying materials to make nets.

description:
Magna is a member of the Pura Vida Communal Bank. She is single and 27 years old. Magna lives with her parents and everyone in her family has the same [type of] business but operates them independently. Magna buys potatoes in different small towns in the region. She [gathers and transports] them with her father’s car and then sells them in the Santa Elena potato market where her father has two warehouses. Besides that, in the months of July and September, Magna buys cereals and then sells them at wholesale prices to merchants in the different markets located in the city of Ayacucho. Before, Magna also maD. dried potatoes but had to stop that activity because her mother was ill and she had to take care of her.

Magna needs a loan of 2,500 soles - money that will be invested in the purchase of wheat and barley.

Magna dreams of building her house on the land given to her by her father and to have more capital to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Primer Préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=30409&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Magna es socia del Banco Comunal Pura Vida.

Magna es soltera y tiene 27 años, Magna vive con sus padres y toda su familia tienen el mismo negocio pero con capitales independientes. Magna compra papa en los diferentes pueblos D. L. región, el acopio lo realiza con el carro D. su papa y lo venD. en el mercado D. papas D. Santa Elena donD. su papa tiene dos depósitos. Además Magna en los meses D. Julio a septiembre compra cereales que luego venD. por mayor a los comerciantes D. los diferentes mercados D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho. Magna también hacia papa seca, actividad que dejo D. realizar porque su mama estaba delicada D. salud y tenia que atenderL..

Magna necesita un préstamo D. 2500 soles, dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. trigo y cebada.

Los sueños D. Magna son construir su casa en el terreno que le regalo su papa, tener más capital para ampliar su negocio.
loan_use: Purchase wheat and barley

description: Ibrahim has been in this business for 5 years. He transports agricultural produce with his car. He is married and has 2 children. Ibrahim is is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Agdam region in the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. He has settled in Khirdalan town.
