Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy spare parts for improving his business.
loan_use: To buy spare parts

description:
Elizabeth is a 49 years old. She is divorced, and has nine children. She is resourceful and very enterprising. Through her business, she has supported four of her children, who have graduated from high school. The other four are currently in school. She operates a local restaurant and sells local foods, like cooked rice and banku. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is eaten with hot pepper or soup.

Elizabeth says that prices of raw materials have gone up significantly, and she is no longer able to afford production costs. This has adversely affected production quality. She plans to use the loan to buy more raw materials like maize, rice, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood. The loan can provide additional capital so she can increase production and still maintain quality.

Elizabeth is a member of a group called Adekyensroma Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and provide support to one another to repay the loan.
loan_use: Buy more raw materials like maize, rice, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood to increase food production

description:
Señora Milagro del Socorro L. is dedicated to the business of selling various products, having her own general shore where she markets from her house of habitation in the municipality of El Viejo in the city of Chinandega. It is important to emphasize that she is a mother with two children which she has the obligation to maintain and to offer the conditions for their development.

The market of Señora Milagro has been improving little by little due to the fact that she has very wisely requested loans from Ceprodel to improve the business. Today once more she has requested a loan to permit her to purchase of her products in order to offer them for sale and in this way improve her economic condition and do well in her business. It is her dream to become a great merchant and in this way to do well making a living for her home.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Milagro del Socorro L. se dedica al negocio de venta de productos varios teneiendo su prodipa pulperia la cual comercializa en su casa de habitacion en el municipio El Viejo de la ciudad de Chinandega. Es importante destacar que ella es una madre con dos hijos los cuales tiene la obligacion de mantener y de brindarle las condiciones para su desarrollo.

La ferreteria de la señora Milagro ha venido mejorando poco a poco debido a que muy sabiamente ella ha solicitado creditos en Ceprodel para mejorar el negocio. Hoy en dia una vez mas ha acudido para solicitar un credito el cual le permita la compra de sus productos para ofrecerlos y de esta forma mejorar su condicion economica y salir adelante en su negocio. Son sus sueños llegar a convertirse en una gran comerciante y asi salir adelante llevando el sustento a su hogar de habitación.
loan_use: To buy merchandise for her general store.

description:
Muzaym S. lives in Vahdat district. She is married and has a high school education. She and her husband have five children. Muzaym's business is buying and selling produce. Early in the mornings, she purchases fruits and vegetables from local farmers wholesale. Muzaym then sells the produce for a profit, allowing her to support her family. Since she already sells a wide variety of fruits and vegetables, Muzaym would like to diversify the goods offered at her market stall. She has applied for a 12-month loan to purchase additional inventory.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Савидова Музаям жительница района Вахдат. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. Клиентка занимается куплей продажей овощей , фруктов и зелени. Музаям рано утром скупает у местных крестьян их продукцию оптом.Затем реализует ее на своей торговой точке в розницу.На прибыль от торговли она содержить своих детей.Так как в данное время поспели все фрукты и овощи ,клиентка хочет увеличить ассортимент своей торговой точки. Музаям берет кредит срокм на 12 месяцев.
loan_use: To diversify the goods for sale

description: This group, which consists of six members, is located in Preaek Thum Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Vat P. is the group leader and she sells clothes in the local market. Since her business is going well, Mrs. Vat P. wants to expand it. Therefore she decided to ask for a loan to buy fashionable clothes to sell to the younger generation. Her husband, Mr. Meas Chanuth, is a construction worker. Mrs. Vat P. and her husband are married without any children. They live in poor conditions because they have only a bike for traveling and a television in their household. Mrs. Vat P. hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.
loan_use: To buy fashionable clothes to sell to the younger generation.
borrower_names: Pouch, Vat, Kung, Yoeun, Kheng, Lun
borrower_genders: male, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true

description: Tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2006, chị Nguyễn Thị Vy 36 tuôi. Trước khi trưa tham gia vào Quỹ kinh tế gia đình chị còn gặp nhiều khó khăn vì nguồn thu nhập chính của gia đình hoàn toàn phụ thuộc vào mấy sào ruộng. Khi tham gia vào Quỹ gia đình chị đã vay vốn. Vòng vốn đầu tiện gia đình chị xin vay 3.000.000đ chị đã đầu tư vốn vào đi chợ bán chiếu, từ khi có vốn đi chợ kinh tế gia đình chị đã phát triển hơn và bớt đi khó khăn. Trong quá trình đi chợ anh chị đã nhận thấy sản xuất dây chun đang là một nghề mới và trên thị trường đang có nhu cầu. Với suy nghĩ đó gia đình chị đã Quyết định chuyển hướng kinh doanh. Sử dụng đồng vốn sẵn có của gia đình kết hợp cùng vay vốn của Quỹ gia đình chị đã mua được một chiếc máy cắt dây chun. Hiện tại công việc làm ăn của gia đình chị diễn ra rất tôt. Thu nhập bình quân 200.000đ/ ngày. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000đ.\r\nThu nhập bình quân. 6.000.000/ tháng .
description_translated:
A member of TYM fund since 2006, Ms. N. Thi Vy is 36 years old. Before joining the fund, her family's financial situation was difficult because the main source of their income came totally from farming. The first loan with TYM was for 180.00 USD and she invested in her business of selling mats. Since then, the family's income has improved. In the process of shopping, she and her husband notice the production of rubber bands as a new craft, and there is a demand for them in the market. With that thought, they decided to change direction of their business. With the money they have saved combined with a loan from TYM fund, they were able to purchase a rubber band cutting machine. Presently the business is doing very well, with average daily income of 12.00 USD. For this loan, she wishes to borrow 550.00 USD. Average monthly income is 360.00 USD

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Services

description:
Agnes K. is married with three children (ages 16, 14, and 10). She has had a business selling food since 2002. She works from 7am to 9pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about US$ 43.

In the past, Agnes has taken out two previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her business capital. She hopes for a new loan to continue to grow her business. Agnes will share this loan with her subgroup members selling clothes, cosmetics, and fruits and vegetables.

In the picture, Agnes is the tallest, second from right.
loan_use: to grow her business

description:
Mrs Julia P. is a 51 year old woman living in barrio 380 in Managua. She is divorced, with a 19 year old daughter and a 7 year old son. The children's father provides support for them. She has a small store in a room in her home, which she began 7 years ago by selling ice and ice cream. She used her last loan to improve her home, and she will use this loan to improve her business. With the money that she is requesting she plans to purchase basic grains and cleaning products to stock her business and to meet the needs of her customers in the neighborhood. This is a very poor neighborhood, and people purchase their daily needs in the small stores. For this reason,Juila must keep her store stocked with products so that her customers do not lose faith in her.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Julia P. tiene 51 años de edad, habita en el barrio 3-80 de Managua, es divorciada, tiene una hija de 19 años de edad y un niño de 7 años de edad, el papá le apoya en la manutención de sus dos hijos. Tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación, la cual desde hace 7 años ha venido administrando, la cual empezó con ventas de hielo y helados. El crédito anterior fue usado para mejoras de su hogar pero éste será usado en la mejora de su negocio, con el dinero solicitado comprará granos básicos y productos de limpieza para abastecer su negocio y satisfacer las demandas de sus vecinos del barrio. Este barrio es un barrio pobre, la manera de vivir de la gente es comprar en las pulperías las necesidades del día, es por eso que Julia necesita tener su pulpería llena de sus productos para así no quedar mal a sus clientes.
loan_use: Purchase of basic grains and cleaning products

description:
Glenny is 20 and lives alone in the house that her parents left her. Glenny is very eager to support herself and be an independent young woman and to that end she started selling clothing a year ago. She works all week, in the morning and afternoon, as well as on weekends at the various markets in Juliaca. Being on her own is hard for Glenny since she was used to living with her family and not having to worry about supporting herself. However, Glenny enjoys her work because it brings her a sense of freedom and independence. Glenny wants to do well with her business in order to support herself, and in the future, raise a family and give them a comfortable life. With the money from the loan, Glenny will be able to purchase more clothing and increase her sales. Also, in the future she will be able to rent a stand in a store to sell her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Glenny tiene 20 años vive sola en la casa que le dejaron sus padres. En su afán de mantenerse por sí misma y ser una joven independiente, se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace un año, esta venta la realiza durante toda la semana por las mañanas y las tardes; los fines de semana en las diferentes ferias de la ciudad de Juliaca.Estar sola es muy difícil para Glenny ya que estuvo acostumbrada a vivir con su familia, y no preocuparse por su manutención, pero a Glenny le gusta su trabajo por que la hace sentirse libre e independizada. Glenny quiere prosperar en su negocio para auto mantenerse y formar una familia en el futuro a la cual pueda brindarle una vida confortable. Con el dinero que se facilite, Glenny podrá comprar más ropa e incrementar sus ventas, para en un futuro alquilar un stand en alguna tienda comercial y ofrecer su mercadería.
loan_use: Increase amount of merchandise (clothing) and rent a stand in the future.

description:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Mage G.. She is married and has five children aged between 10 and 18. In 2005, Mage established her crops-selling business. She opens her business six days a week between nine and twelve hours a day. She is assisted by her children. Mage requires a loan in order to purchase more crops in bulk. In the future, Mage plans to expand and establish another business. She thanks you for your support.\r\n

\r\nSELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; because of this, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services. When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan, a process called a sale-and-leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client. The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.
loan_use: To purchase crops in bulk

description: Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Kristina  M.. She is married and has three children aged six, nine and 12. In 2001, Kristina established her crops-selling business. Kristina requires a loan in order to buy more crops in bulk. She thanks you for your support.\r\n\r\nSELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; because of this, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services. When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan, a process called a sale-and-leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client. The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.
loan_use: To buy crops in bulk

description:
Naziran baji is a wife of A. A. and lives in a small city named Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur is famous for its sweetmeat and shoes. She has been living with her family in this city for the last 45 years. Naziran baji is a mother of two daughters. Her family has a decorative embroidery business. Naziran baji and her daughters make embroidered dresses, and her husband helps them by selling those dresses in a big market. She is out of stock now; because of that, she is losing her customers. She is applying for a loan to buy material (thread, cloth) to fulfill the orders of her customers.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Yasmeen baji and Naziran baji each want a loan to buy a power loom machine. Tasleem baji wants a loan to buy a lathe machine. Khadija baji wants a loan to buy thread to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.
loan_use: To buy material to fulfill the orders

description:
Svetlana has two grown children. She started working as a market vendor 6 years ago. Today she runs her own business selling men’s suits in the central city market. Presently, Svetlana has about $4000 of working capital. Her monthly profit amounts to $600. \r\n

\r\nThere are very few other businesses selling similar items in the market where Svetlana has her kiosk. Because of this, customer demand continues to grow all the time. Svetlana has established a reputation as an entrepreneur of integrity. She has repaid every loan she has received from Nadiya Ukraine without any defaults. Svetlana is requesting a loan for 3000 Grivnas to re-stock her inventory before the fall season. Compelling prices and a wide range of fashion choices to suit every taste and lifestyle will attract many new male clients to Svetlana’s business. An increase in sales will help her generate more profit and develop her trade even more.
loan_use: To increase her stock

description:
Fidelia Paola is a grocery store clerk at the San Antonio Super. She is 34 years old, married with a 2 1/2 years old girl. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. Her niece takes care of her daughter and her only free day during the week is Tuesdays. She has been working for this business for 10 years. She is asking for her 6th loan to repair the floors of her sister's house where she lives and to repair the windows. In the future, she will build her home. She already has purchased the lot with the previous loans. Her husband helps her a little. Fidelia's wish is to be able to apply for a bigger loan in the future to start the construction of her house. She is a very responsible woman. Her previous five loans have been paid properly and on time. She is very satisfied for the courtesy and attention that the personnel of AFODENIC has given her

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Fidelia Paola trabajadora del Súper San Antonio, con 34 años de edad, casada, con una niña de 2½ años, ella trabaja de 8:00 am a 8:00 pm, su hija se la cuida una sobrina, el único día libre es el martes de cada semana, tiene 10 años de laborar para este lugar. Está solicitando su 6to crédito el que utilizará para embaldozar el piso de la casa de su hermana que es donde ella habita y componer las ventanas, en el futuro construirá su casa pues ya compró el terreno con los créditos anteriores; su esposo le ayuda un poco y su mayor ilusión es en el futuro solicitar un crédito mayor para iniciar la construcción de su vivienda. Es una joven muy responsable, sus 5 créditos los ha cancelado en tiempo y forma, se siente satisfecha por la atención con que ha sido atendida por el personal de AFODENIC.
loan_use: Floor repairs and restoring the windows.

description:
Haydee is a member of the communal bank called "Alondras."

Haydee is separated from her husband. She's 37 years old. She has 2 kids and one in the way. Haydee used to go to the city of Chincha every week to purchase eggs, but now that she's expecting she can no longer travel long distances. She gets the eggs delivered to her and she sells them by foot at the local supermarket in the city of Ayacucho.

Aside from that, she sells bread, which she purchases at wholesale price from local bakeries, and sells it every weekend with the help of her daughter.

Haydee would like to use this loan to purchase eggs. Haydee dreams to own a home, to continue to work and move ahead, and to own a car to lease and make more money.

Translated by a Kiva Volunteer.

Haydee es socia del Banco Comunal Alondras.

Haydee es separada, tiene 37 años, 2 hijos y esta esperando a su tercer hijo, Haydee viajaba semanalmente a la ciudad de Chincha en donde compra huevos, pero debido a su estado ya no puede viajar y solamente le envían, sus ventas lo realiza ambulantemente en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Además Haydee los días sábados y domingos vende panes que compra de las panaderías por mayor, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hija.

Haydee necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de huevos. Haydee sueña con tener casa propia, seguir trabajando para salir adelante y tener un carro que le genere mayores ingresos.
loan_use: To purchase eggs

description:
The trust banks Mujeres Nahuala is made up by a group of women who come from three different remote villages around Nahualá called Patzig, Palenqeuch and Rakantela.

Although these groups of women are used to live in their villages and like their lifestyles a lot, they have to leave their towns in order to earn some money. These towns are very poor and commercial activity is very scarce. There are very few shops out there, maybe one or two convenience store per town. Running water is a novelty and men often leave the towns to work in far away cities, even the United States. Most of the "Mujeres Nahuala" travel 3 days a week for 4 hours as far as the coast and Totonícapan to sell their products in the main markets over there.

The number three is a perpetual factor with this group. This is because the women have to travel 3 days a week, they come from 3 different town, and the ladies work in 3 different economic activities. One group of 3 women are buying and selling skirts and huipilles (traditional blouses), 3 of them are buying and selling other typical clothes, and the last 3 including the president, make and embroider skirts and pañuelos. The pañuelos are the pieces fabric women use to carry their babies, their goods from the markets, and during a chilly day they will wrap the panuelos around them to stay a bit warmer.

The president of the group who herself sows and embroiders skirts and huipilles was the one who formed the group. She was inspired by the success of other people who asked for loans before, so she wanted request one too so she can in her own business and improved her life this way. So, she went to recruit all of the members one by one. The group members went to the office and attended the pre-credit orientation session and after a couple of months later the group was formed.

For all of them this will be their first credit, and they are all very excited to get this opportunity to invest in their businesses and through that; in their lives and the lives of their family members.
loan_use: To invest in a more diverse stock
borrower_names: Catarina, Manuela, Magdalena, Carmen, Maria, Maria, Francisca, Elena, Lucia
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Mrs. O. Chanthy, 41, sells Cambodian noodles (Nom Banhchok). It is a popular food in her town market. She makes noodles and mixes them with ingredients such as vegetables. She always gets up early in the morning to take her noodles to sell in the market. She lives with her husband and four children. All of her children are young and attend school. Her husband, Mr. Svay Sokhom, is a soldier. \r\n

\r\nBecause of the family’s increasing expenses, Chanthy needs to expand her business to increase her income. She wants a motorcycle taxi for her husband to drive. She would like to request a loan to purchase a motorcycle. She will use the remainder of the loan to purchase more rice to make noodles. Chanthy's husband is pictured with the noodle-making mill because Chanthy was not available.
loan_use: To purchase a motorcycle and more rice to make noodles

description:
Mary B. is the leader of a group of 5 women. She is 45 and married with 3 children, who are 20, 12, and 10 years old. All of her children are in school. Mary lives in a semi-urban slum on the outskirts of Kampala that is prone to flooding during the rainy season.

Mary has been a midwife in the Kiwunya Zone for the past 22 years. The market for her business is good; however, she faces the challenges of high taxes, women who don't pay, and high transportation fees.

Mary plans to use this loan to purchase medicine for her patients. Since she began working with MCDT, Mary has been able to expand her business to include a laboratory. In addition, she has been able to use her profits to educate her children.

Mary hopes to one day be able to build her own house.
loan_use: To purchase medicine

description:
These are teachers of the Benevolent Secondary School Makeni. These teachers are: Aiah Saspo K., Zainab K. and Brima Ironnsky T.. They are requesting a loan of Le 2,500,000.00. With this loan, Aiah will buy building materials to complete the building of a house he has begun constructing.

Zainab will invest her share of the loan in agriculture. She has been in agriculture for many years now. And Brima Ironnsky will use his to pay his childrens' school fees and other charges. Aiah is the leader of this group; he is now 52. He is married with 4 children. Aiah is today a senior teacher at the Benevolent Secondary School Makeni and has been in the teaching profession for over 15 years now.
loan_use: Buy building materials

description:
The community of Erusco is located 45 minutes from the capital in the district of Huancapi. This community concentrates mainly in the production of cereals but most people grow vegetables.

Hermelinda sells groceries and she also sells young livestock. She buys livestock and takes it to the local fairs to sell. Hermelinda would like to one day have an animal farm with chickens, ducks and turkeys. She would like to save some money and put it towards her kids' education. She would also like to stock up her grocery store. Hermelinda learned some saving techniques from her communal bank, and would like for FINCA Perú to teach her and educate her on business in general.

Alraidina sells vegetables and wheat products on weekends. Alraidina would like to take care of the monthly bills for her family and would like to proviD. for her children a roof over their heads. She's currently saving some money so that she can make some improvements to her home and to put up a store. Alraidina has learned from her communal bank to love and to value herself. She tells us that no other institution has taught her as much as FINCA Perú. She would like to one day proviD. a college education for her kids.

Mirtha sells clothes and she buys and sells wheat products which she takes to Ayacucho to sell. Her dream is to one day have a farm and to save money to be able to proviD. an education for her kids in the future. She has learned from her communal bank to love and to value herself.

Translated by a Kiva Volunteer.

L. comunidad D. Erusco esta ubicada a 45 minutos D. L. capital del distrito D. Huancapi, esta comunidad mayormente se dedican a L. producción D. cereales y tubérculos, pero es mas L. producción D. verduras y L. mayoría D. L. gente se dedica al negocio

Hermelinda, venD. abarrotes, tambien venD. animales menores, los compra y lleva a L. feria D. cangallo, a Hermelinda le gustaria tener uan granja D. gallinas, patos y pavos. ElL. desea ahorrar para L. educación D. sus hijos y comprar mas cosas para su bodega. En su bancomunal Hermelinda a aprendido a ahorrar y le gustaría que FINCA Perú le enseñe y eduque sobre los negocios.

Alraidina, venD. verduras, también venD. cereales los días sábados y domingos. A Alraidina le gustaría mejorar su familia, comprar las cosas D. L. casa y ver por sus hijos para que tengan un lugar donD. vivir. Ahora esta ahorrando para ampliar su casa y poder poner una tienda. Alraidina ha aprendido en su bancomunal a quererse y valorarse como persona, elL. dice que nunca ninguna institución le enseño y le lleva D. L. mano para caminar, con FINCA Perú elL. aprendió sobre las mejores herencias que tiene para dejarle a sus hijos que es el estudio.

Mirtha, venD. ropa, tambien compra y venta cereales, las que lleva a Ayacucho. Su sueño es tener una piscigranja, hacer estudiar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales, por ello va a ahorrar. En su bancomunal a aprendido a quererse y valorarse como persona, también recibe prestamos con mucha facilidad.
loan_use: The members of the communal bank called "Women for Development" are requesting a loan in the amount of $700 USD for the prodcution of wheat products and to start their own individual businesses.
borrower_names: Segundina Julia, Dolores, Lucia, Victoria, Mercedes, Mirtha Fabiana, Rosa Maria, Susana, Hermelinda, Alraidina, Elizabeth, Flavia, Aydee Maria
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Ana is a woman who dedicates herself to selling foods like baked good, coffee and snacks at a post in the Israel Lewites market in the city of Managua. Since she started her business with few products, she has been able to make do and at times has been the means of support for her household. Over time she has been able to increase her selection and has improved her quality of life thanks to the support of loans from Kiva partner Ceprodel. Once again she is requesting a loan to purchase her products. She is very confident that her request will be fulfilled and she will be able to continue providing for her household.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

La señora Ana Cecilaia P. es una dama que se dedica al negocio de venta de comestibles como reposterias, café y golosinas estando ubicada en el mercado Israel Lewites de la ciudad de Managua.

Desde que inició su negocio con pocos productos ha logrado mantenerse y a la vez ha sido el sustento de su hogar de habitacion. Hoy en dia a medida que el tiempo ha transcurrido ha aumentado su mercaderia y ha mejorado su nivel de vida gracias al poyo brindado por Ceprodel opr medio de los creditos que se le han birndado. Una vez mas solicita el credito para la compra de sus productos, ella está muy confiada que su credito le será otorgado y asi continuara con el mantenimiento de su hogar de habitacion.
loan_use: Purchase products for her business / Compra de los productos

description:
Francisca belongs to the Teresa Ramos Community Bank located in Jr. Callao # 427 of the Yarina Cocha District of the Ucayali Department. She is 26 years old. Her husband is a sales agent. She decided to invest her first loan of S/. 300 received from Manuela Ramos in the purchase of fishing products. Her stand is located in a market close to the port, allowing her to sell these products to the fishermen that work there. With this loan of S/ 1,000, which will be paid over 5 months, she will increase her business by buying fish hooks of all sizes, nets, nylon and line preparation products. Francisca is a very happy person because she feels very accomplished as a woman, a businesswoman and a wife and thanks the opportunity that has been given in giving her a loan to invest in this business.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Francisca, pertenece al Banco Comunal Teresa Ramos, ubicado en el Jr. Callao # 427, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 26 años. Su esposo es agente vendedor. Francisca con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en venta de productos par pesca. Su puesto se encuentra en un mercado que esta cerca del puerto donde le permite vender estos productos a los pescadores que trabajan allí. Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, incrementara su negocio comprando anzuelos de todo tamaño, redes. Nailon y productos de pasamanería. Francisca es una persona muy alegre dado que se siente muy realizada como mujer, empresaria y como esposa y agradece la oportunidad que se le dio en darle un crédito para invertir en este negocio.
loan_use: To purchase fishing supplies (nets, fish hooks, etc.)

description: Née en 1976, madame Afi T. n’a pas fait de brillantes études par manque de support financier. Elle s’est lancée dans la vente de produits génériques à porter de la population de son milieu qui ne dispose pas assez de moyens pour aller à l’hôpital tout le temps. Mariée à un cultivateur, elle participe aux besoins de ses trois (03) enfants grâce aux revenus qu’elle tire de son activité. Ainsi, elle sollicite un financement pour acheter les produits en grande quantité. Ceci permettrait une augmentation de ses revenus pour lui permettre une amélioration de son niveau de vie.
description_translated:
Born in 1976, Mrs. Afi T. was not able to go far at school because she lacked the necessary financial support. She began selling generic pharmaceutical products that are within reach of the people in her area who do not have the financial resources to go to the hospital at the drop of a hat.

\r\n\r\nMarried to a farmer, she contributes to the support of her three children thanks to the income from her business. Thus, she is requesting a loan to buy the products she sells in large quantity. This should lead to an increase in her income which will permit her to improve her family's standard of living.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: sale of generic pharmaceutical products

description:
Madame Kadiatou C. est âgée de 47 ans, mariée et mère de 1 enfant. Elle vit dans le 3ème quartier de Ségou (quatrième région économique de la république du Mali) avec son mari et son enfant.
Dès son jeune âge elle s’essaya à plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus sans succès .Elle finit par approcher et apprendre auprès de sa grand-mère (qui est une spécialiste réputée d’une science traditionnelle à savoir la fabrication de Gongonlili et d’encense qui sont des produits aphrodisiaques traditionnels). Après sa phase d’apprentissage, depuis maintenant 15 ans, elle exerce cette activité (relevant des connaissances sécrètes). Madame Kadiatou C. jouit aujourd’hui d’une notoriété d’envergure sous régionale. Elle reçoit des commandes de toute la sous région de l’Afrique de l’ouest (Mali, Burkina et Cote d’Ivoire). Pour avoir ces produits aphrodisiaques, il faut amener une nouvelle calebasse qu’on remplit d’eau propre et qui sera versée sur le gongonlili (plante exotique très prisée en Afrique de l’ouest pour avoir des vertus aphrodisiaques et médicales). Elle donnera à ce gongonlili totalement imbibé une forme circulaire ou ovale après l’avoir attaché d’un fil blanc.). Cette plante est soit bouillie dans de l’eau chaude et la décoction en liquide est consommée. 

Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus importante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après 4 prêts solidaires, elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt : 50 sacs de gongonlili, 20 kg d’encense, 2 cartons de parfums, 2 rouleaux de fil local et des bouteilles vides de mayonnaise. Elle s’approvisionne en matières premières essentiellement à partir de Bamako (capitale de république du Mali) et San (région de Ségou). Très connue pour détenir cette science, elle réalise d’énormes ventes au comptant souvent en gros à une clientèle variée. Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice de 200 000 FCFA et rêve ardemment de construire une maison.
description_translated:
Mrs. Kadiatou C. is 47 years old, is married and a mother of one child. She lives in the 3rd district of Ségou (fourth economic region of the Republic of Mali) with her husband and child. At a young age. she tried herself out at several businesses but without success. She ended up approaching and learning from her grandmother (who is a famous traditional science specialist) to learn the production of Gongonlili and incense, traditional aphrodisiac products. After completing her training, she continued to work in this area concerning secret knowledge. Today, Mrs. Kadiatou C. enjoys a great reputation in her region. She receives orders from all areas of West Africa (Mali, Burkina and Ivory Coast). To produce these aphrodisiac products, a new water bottle needs to be filled with clean water that is poured on the gongonlili (exotic plant in West Africa believed to have aphrodisiac and medical properties). She then shapes the completely soaked gongonlili into a circular or oval form after having attached it to a white wire. This plant is then boiled in hot water and the liquid concoction is then consumed. She decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution 3 years ago in order to satisfy the needs of her growing clientele. After 4 group loans, this is her second individual loan, with all preceding loans refunded in full. With this loan, she intends to buy: 50 bags of gongonlili, 20 kg of incense, 2 boxes of perfume, 2 rolls of local wire and empty mayonnaise jars. She gets her raw materials primarily from Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali) and San (Ségou region). Very well known in this science, she generates enormous cash sales, often in wholesale, with various customers. She hopes to generate a profit of 200.000 FCFA and passionately dreams of building a house.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase of basic materials to produce aphrodisiac products

description:
Madame B. Jeannette est née en 1956 à Agomé-Tomégbé. N’ayant pas eu la chance de faire de brillantes études, elle a embrassé le Commerce de céréales et de fruit. En faisant ce commerce, elle voulait se procurer de revenu et a mis un accent particulier sur la vente de fruits et de céréales.
 Mariée et mère de six (06) enfants, elle arrive à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille grâce à son revenu minimum. Très dévouée et sage dans ses réactions, elle gère bien ses activités et 
sollicite un financement qui pourra lui permettre d’agrandir son stock de céréales et de fruit
et par conséquent augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
description_translated:
Ms. Jeannette B. was born in 1956 in Agomé-Tomégbé. Having lacked the opportunity to really shine in school, she embraced commerce in grain and in fruit. By working in commerce, she wanted to have an income and has focused on fruits and grains. Married and the mother of six, she manages to provide for her family's needs thanks to her minimum income. A very devoted woman who is wise in her reactions, she manages her business well and is requesting financing that will enable her to enlarge her stock of grain and fruit. This would then increase her sales figures to help more with improving her family's living conditions. \r\n

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To sell fruit and grain

description:
Née en 1970 à Tékponou, Madame A. Adjakpassi est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Très dévouée, elle exerce le commerce de cola qu’elle vend de marché en marché. C’est un produit très recherché dans la localité. 

Outre cette activité, elle fait la restauration, c’est pourquoi elle est très reconnue et populaire dans son village. Seulement, le manque d’argent reste son principal handicap. 

Pour s’en sortir, elle sollicite un crédit pour redynamiser ses activités et améliorer son revenu.
description_translated:
Born in 1970 in Tékponou, Mrs. Adjakpassi A. is married and the mother of three children. Very devoted to her work and her family, she sells kola nuts from one market to the next. They are a much desired product in that area.

Besides that business, she is engaged in food service. That is why she is very well-known and popular in her village. Only the lack of capital is her principal handicap.

In order to make a go of it, she is requesting a loan to revive the businesses and improve her income from them.


Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: selling kola nuts

description:
Gladys A. is married and has 2 children. She has received schooling through the primary school level. Gladys sells onions, dried tilapia, and other food items in Abura, which she has done since 2000. Her husband repairs electronics. \r\n\r\n

Gladys uses her income to pay for school items like books, etc. for the children. Gladys will use the loan to increase her business capital. With the new profits from her expanded business, Gladys plans to help build their own house.
loan_use: to increase her business capital

description:
For seven years, Miriam has been dedicated to selling clothing by order. She also makes handicrafts that serve as raw material in the creation of earrings and necklaces. She works molding metal wires and then offering them for wholesale prices in stores that sell artesanal materials and costume jewelry.

She has used the loans that she has received to invest in clothing. Miriam would like to have a clothing stall in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Miriam se dedica a la venta de ropa por pedidos desde hace 7 años. También hace artesanías que sirven de materia prima en la elaboración de aretes y collares. Ella trabaja moldeando los alambres de metal y luego los ofrece por mayor a las tiendas que venden materiales artesanales y de bisutería. Los préstamos que ha recibido los ha utilizado para invertir en la ropa que reparte por pedidos. A Miriam le gustaría tener un puesto de ropa en el mercado.
loan_use: To invest in clothing that she sells by order.

description:
For two years, Rosa has sold clothing and cosmetics by orders. Also, she sells natural products from the brand "Biolife" to her acquaintances and friends. Rosa is in charge of finding new people who want to test and distribute these products. At the same time, twice a week, Rosa takes care of an elderly person.

The loans that she has requested have been used to invest in more natural products and to have her own stock. Rosa would like to have a shop where she can sell a variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa vende ropa y cosméticos por pedidos desde hace 2 años. También, ella ofrece productos naturistas de la marca “Biolife” a sus conocidos y amigos. Rosa se encarga de buscar nuevas personas que quieran probar estos productos y distribuirlos. Asimismo, dos veces por semana, Rosa cuida a una anciana. Los préstamos que ha solicitado los ha utilizado para invertir en más productos naturistas y tener un stock propio. Rosa quisiera tener un bazar donde ofrecer productos variados.
loan_use: To invest in more natural products and have her own stock.

description: Джалолов Насруло родился 20 сентября 1955 года, женат и у них 5 детей. Он является мастером по ремонту радио-телеаппаратуры. Свою трудовую деятельность начал в 1980 году в качестве ученика. Постепенно набирая опыт в этой деятельности, Насруло стал самостоятельно принимать заказы и ремонтировать радиоприемники.  Теперь его знают во всей округе как мастера своего дела. Любой клиент, который приходит к нему с просьбой о починке аппаратуры, уходит с улыбкой на лице. Для оказания своих услуг Насруло ездит в город Душанбе, где в фирме ООО «Голубой экран» закупает запчасти и комплектующие к аудио и видеоаппаратуре. \r\nНасруло мечтает расширить свой бизнес, построить собственный цех и воспитывать учеников. Узнав о программе Кива решил участвовать в ней и получить займ на сумму 4100 сомони для воплощения в реальность своей мечты.
description_translated:
Nasrullo J. was born on September 20, 1955, is married, and has 5 children. He is a specialist in radio and television equipment repair. He began working in 1980 as an apprentice. As he gradually amassed experience in this area, Nasrullo began to independently accept contracts and to repair radio receiver sets. Today he is known across the district as a master of his trade. Any client who comes to him with equipment to be fixed leaves with a smile on his face. To provide his services Nasrullo travels to the city Dushanbe to buy spare parts and accessories for audio and video equipment from the company Goluboy Ekran, LLC.

Nasrullo dreams of expending his buisness, building a private shop and mentoring apprentices. When he found out about Kiva he decided to take part and take out a loan of 4100 somoni ($1200) to bring his dreams into reality.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase of spare parts

description: Хосамох 1971 года рождения. Она разведена и у нее 1 сын, который учится в 8 классе. Свою предпринимательскую деятельность она начала в 1998 году с продажи небольшого количества кондитерских изделий в небольшом арендуемом магазине. Сейчас Хосамох торгует конфетами, кондитерскими изделиями и сухофруктами в большом ассортименте на рынке «Саховат» города Душанбе. В ее ассортименте разновидность конфет производства России и Турции, пряники, сушенные абрикосы, изюм, грецкие орехи, миндаль, фисташки и т.д. Свой товар закупает в оптовых магазинах «Сафар-Центр»-а города Душанбе и у оптовиков из города Худжанда. В дальнейшем хочет выкупить магазин.\r\nУслышав о программе Кива решила участвовать и получить займ в сумме 4100 сомони для расширения товарооборота.
description_translated:
Hosamoh was born in 1971. She is divorced and has a son who is in the eighth grade. She started her business in 1998 by selling a small quantity of confectionary products in a small store that she rented. Now Hosamoh trades in a large assortment of candies, confectionary products, and dried fruits at the “Sakhobat” market in Dushanbe city. Her stock includes different candies from Russia and Turkey, gingerbread, dried apricots, raisins, walnuts, almonds, and pistachios, etc.. She buys goods from wholesalers such as “Safar-Center” in Dushanbe city as well as wholesale dealers from Khujand city. In the future, she wishes to buy a store. Having heard about Kiva’s lending programs, she decided to participate and take out a loan in the amount of 4100 somoni to expand her assortment of products.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase of dried fruits

description: Philomena is 30 years old. She is a wife and mother of 4 children who are currently in school. She has been a local manufacturer of palm kernel oil for 6 years. Palm kernel oil is produced from palm kernels. The palm kernel is a by-product of palm oil. The palm kernel is also processed through various stages to obtain the palm kernel oil, which is used to prepare many local dishes. Her production is on a small scale due to low working capital to buy a machine for processing. Philomena wants to use the loan to buy more palm kernels and an electric milling machine to improve production. She believes the loan would allow her to raise enough income to finance her children's education. She belongs to the community group called St. Paul's Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.
loan_use: To buy more palm kernels and an electric milling machine.

description:
Jose T. is a taxi driver who is 42 years old. He lives in the Tres Ochenta neighborhood of Managua. He is married and his wife is also in business and she sells clothing and cosmetics. They have four children (ages 17, 13, 9 and 4). Jose has been a taxi driver for 10 years now and he began this work when jobs were hard to come by during a rough period in his country. He hopes in the near future to change his taxi for a newer one.

This loan will be used to build a porch onto his home in order to add more security for his family, since his neighborhood has recently become more dangerous and he spends the greater part of each day away from home.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

José T. un taxista de 42 años de edad, habita en el barrio Tres Ochenta de Managua, es casado, su esposa es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos. Tienen 4 hijos de 17, 13, 9 y 4 años de edad. Desde hace 10 años José T. ejerce la profesión de Taxista, y empezó este negocio debido a la falta de empleo que existía en aquellos tiempos en el país, sus planes son poder cambiar en un futuro corto su unidad de taxi por una más nueva. El préstamo lo usará para construir un porche en su vivienda y así darle más seguridad a su familia, ya que el barrio se ha vuelto peligroso y él pasa la mayor parte del día fuera de su hogar.
loan_use: To add a porch onto his home for added security. (Construcción del porche para su vivienda)

description:
Emilia is 40 years old, lives with her partner and has a 13-year-old daughter. She has an elementary school education and is a native of Santa Rosa in the Colloa province of Peru. A year ago she became a member of the Julia Jiménez Community Bank and received her first loan to buy more products for her general store, to which she has dedicated herself for 15 years. With this current $425 loan she is requesting, she plans to purchase more snacks, sugar, rice, noodles and fruit, and she plans to repay it within four months. Emilia has been working since she was 12 years old and she has always known how to confront problems and keep moving forward. She feels good about her business and the loans she receives. Her dream is enlarge her business and start selling school supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

Emilia es conviviente, madre de una hija de 13 años y ella tiene 40 años de edad, estudió primaria completa, es natural del Centro Poblado de Mazocruz, Distrito de Santa Rosa, Provincia del Collao. Integra hace un año el Banco Comunal Julia Jiménez, al obtener su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, incrementó su negocio comprando más productos para su tienda de abarrotes y venta de frutas, dedicándose a este negocio hace 15 años. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará más golosinas, azúcar, arroz, fideos, frutas, crédito que pagará en cuatro cuotas. Doña Emilia indica con ese ánimo de seguridad que desde los 12 años de edad empezó a trabajar y siempre ha sabido enfrentar los problemas y salir adelante, ella se siente bien con el negocio que hace y con los créditos que recibe. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio incrementando con la venta de útiles escolares.
loan_use: Purchase snacks and other grocery products / Compra de golosinas y otros productos (abarrotes).

description:
Gregoria is 38 years old and was able to complete some schooling. She has 2 childen and lives with her husband in the community of Huarancamaya, Mazacruz, where she was born. She has been a member of the communal bank of Julia Jimenez in Mazocruz for 8 years. Before that, she used to sell sandals in the city of Cuzco. Three years ago she changed her work and began to sell vegetables.

With the loan, which she will repay in 4 payments, she will be able to purchase carrots, onions, tomatoes and other produce to sell. Her dream is to one day be able to afford a house. For now, she would like to continue to grow her business and her income so that her children can go to school without any problems.

Gregoria tiene 38 años de edad estudió primaria completa, conviviente, madre de dos hijos, nació en la comunidad de Huaracamaya – Mazocruz y vive en dicha comunidad. Es socia hace 08 años del Banco Comunal Julia Jiménez – Mazocruz, anteriormente vendía zapatillas en la ciudad de Cuzco, hace tres años cambió de negocio actualmente vende verduras, los sábados en Mazocruz y los domingos en Ilave semanalmente. Con este crédito de S/. 800.00 Nuevos Soles, que pagará en 04 cuotas, comprará 02 sacos de zanahoria, 01 saco de cebolla ,02 cajas de tomate, 04 cabezas de de zapallo y otros. Su visión es comprar una casa en la ciudad de Ilave para que sus hijos estudien sin problemas y seguir con su negocio incrementando más mercadería.
loan_use: TO PURCHASE FRUITS AND VEGETABLES TO SELL IN THE MARKETS.

description: Née le 04/06/1984 à Lomé, K. Alpha Essohanam est une femme mariée sans enfant. Elle est couturière et à plusieurs apprenties. Malgré tous ses efforts, elle  est toujours limitée par le manque de moyens financiers. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour s’équiper en matériel et en outils de travail afin de d’optimiser la productivité de son atelier et  agrandir ainsi son atelier
description_translated:
Born on June 4, 1984 in Lomé, Alpha Essohanam K. is a married woman with no children. She is a seamstress and has several young women apprentices. Despite her best efforts, she is always limited by a lack of financial means. She is requesting this loan to outfit herself in materials and the tools of her trade, so as to optimize the productivity of her workshop and to be able to enlarge the workshop.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: purchase of materials and tools of her trade

description:
Nina is a small entrepreneur from Uzhgorod where she sells women's clothing items in one of the local markets. Nina used to work as a hired employee in a company. However, she couldn't support herself after her retirement and had to find another source of income. This is how she started her own vending venture. Today her business has grown a lot. It has been characterized by affordable prices and consistent expansion within the past 5 years. Nina is constantly working on further business expansion.

Nina is hoping to get a loan of 3000 Grivnas to increase her stock of assorted merchandise and her sales as a result. On the individual level she is hoping to do some repair work in her house which has been a need for her family for awhile. Nina is a very skilled entrepreneur. She can easily adjust to all seasonal trends which helps her meet clients' demands and satisfy different customers' tastes.

Note: this is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in two months.
loan_use: To increase her stock of merchandise

description:
Doña Cecilia is 50 years old. She is married and is the mother of three children who still depend on her. She finished primary school completely. She lives in the Comunidad de Pusuyo.

She is affiliated with the Banco Comunal Gregoria Apaza in the community of de Pusuyo, in the District of Ilave, Province of Collao, Puno Region. She has been with the Banco Comunal for two years. Lacking capitol to further increase her earnings, with the first loan she bought three lambs at S/. 50.00 Nuevos Soles each. With the rest she bought beads and alpaca wool in order to make beaded braiding.

With this loan of S/. 1,400.00 Nuevos Soles, that she will repay in 4 installments, she will buy a small bull to fatten for S/.800.00 Nuevos Soles. The rest of the capital would buy beads and alpaca wool for the braided adornments that she would sell in Ilave.

Her dream is to buy a house in the city of Ilave so that her children can study and later buy 5 or 6 head of cattle to fatten.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Cecilia cumplió 50 años de edad, es casada, madre de tres hijos que aún dependen de ella, estudió primaria completa, vive en la Comunidad de Pusuyo. Es socia del Banco Comunal Gregoria Apaza de la comunidad de Pusuyo, Distrito de Ilave, Provincia del Collao, Región Puno, hace dos años se asoció al Banco Comunal por falta de capital para incrementar más sus ganancias, con su primer préstamo compró tres corderos a S/. 50.00 Nuevos Soles cada uno, con el resto compró mostasillas, lana de alpaca para realizar las trensillas de mostasillas. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,400.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual pagará en 04 cuotas, comprará un torete con S/.800.00 Nuevos Soles para engorde y con el resto del capital comprará mostasillas y lana de alpaca para las trensillas, esto será vendido en Ilave. Su sueño es comprar una casa en la Ciudad de Ilave para que sus hijos estudien y posteriormente comprar de 05 a 06 cabezas de ganado vacuno para engorde.
loan_use: To buy materials (beads and wool).  To buy livestock (1 bull).

description: Vanesa was born in 1989. She is married, and her husband has a full-time job with a monthly salary of 500 KM. They don't have any children. This is Vanesa's first loan, and she requested 1000 KM. Her intent is to buy a cow which costs 2100 KM. She has some saved money, and she thinks that this loan would be a great help for her and her husband. Her wish is to improve her household income by selling milk to the local dairy.\r\n
loan_use: To buy a cow

description: Джобаров Джума 1958 года рождения, женат, отец пятерых детей. Занимается продажей обуви уже 5 лет. Местом деятельности Джумы является  рынок «Сафина» в районе Рудаки.  Он товары закупает на рынке «Корвон», иногда заказывает поставщикам из Китая. \r\nАссортимент продаваемых его товаров очень разнообразен. От самых элегантных  туфель для выхода до спортивных для любого возраста. Качественные и удобные обуви всегда в моде и этого он хорошо знает. В разгар сезона продажи осенней обуви Джума хочет участвовать в программе Кива и получить займ в сумме 3500 сомони сроком на 8 месяцев для закупа сезонных товаров.
description_translated:
Djuma D., born in 1958, is married and has five children. He has been in the business of shoe sales for 5 years. His retail outlet is located at the Safin market in the Rudaki district. Djuma buys his goods at the Korvon market and sometimes from China. His wide goods assortment ranges from elegant dress shoes to athletic shoes for any age. Djuma knows well that quality and comfort shoes are always in style. During the fall sale season, Djuma wants to participate in the Kiva program and obtain an 8 month $1025 loan in order to purchase seasonal goods.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To purchase shoes

description:
Elizabeth A., age 22, is the single mother of an 8-year-old boy. She has two businesses that she started in 2003, one selling clothes and the other selling powdered soap to her customers door-to-door. She works from 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. daily and earns a monthly profit of about $41 from selling powdered soap and $51 from selling clothes.

The loan she hopes to receive now will be her fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She has paid back the first three successfully and used them to build a two-room house and increase her inventory of items for sale. She will use half of the funds from this new loan to build a bathroom and the other half to import more supplies from Zanzibar to Dar es Salaam (including bags) to sell. She will share this loan with her group, which totals 15 members. These members hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

In the picture, Elizabeth is in the front center wearing a blue and white striped shirt.
loan_use: to increase the number of items she has for sale and to repair the bathroom in her home
borrower_names: Beatrice, Zulfa, Zubeda, Sauda, Msami, Ally, Magdalena, Elizabeth, Jesca, Hadija, Rosemary, Jacline, Zaina, Tatu, Salha
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, male, male, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Mrs. Henriete Eugenia H. H. is a native of the city of Bluefields, is 59 years old, and is a single mother of 9 dependent children.  Mrs. H. has been the owner of a small grocery store for more than 5 years, having a clients the residents of her neighborhood who prefer her for the variety of products that she offers (basic grains, juices, soups, sodas, and natural refreshments among other things).  This business is her only income.  It should be emphasized that the demand for the products that she sells has not diminished since they are widely consumed by the population.  Mrs. H. needs to buy:  one 100 lb sack of rice at US$62.00 per sack, one 100 lb. sack of sugar at US$32.00 per sack, one jug of oil at US$46.00 per jug, three cases of laundry soap at US$12.00 per case, three bags of toilet paper at US$10.00 per bag, two cases of coffee at US$27.00 per case, and three cases of powdered milk at US$25.00 per case.  With this investment she will increase her earnings and will be able to satisfy her clients’ needs.

 Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Henriete Eugenia H. H. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 59 años  de edad, es madre soltera de 9 hijos mayores de edad. La Sra. H. es propietaria de una pulpería por más de 5  años, teniendo como clientes a los habitantes de su barrio que la prefieren por ofrecer variedades de productos (granos básicos, jugos, sopas, gaseosas, refrescos naturales, entre otras cosas), siendo este negocio su único ingreso, cabe destacar que los productos que ella oferta no a disminuido  su demanda ya que son de alto consumo para la población. La Sra. H. necesita comprar: 1 quintal de arroz a $ 62.00 dólares el quintal, 1 quintales de azúcar a  $ 32.00 dólares el quintal, 1 bidones de aceite a $ 46.00 dólares el bidón, 3 cajas de Jabón para  lavar ropa a $ 12.00 dólares cada  caja, 3 bolsones de papel higiénico a $ 10.00 dólares el bolsón, 2 cajas de café a $ 27.00 dólares cada caja,  3 caja de leche en polvo a $ 25 .00 dólares la caja, con esta inversión podrá aumentar su ganancia y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
loan_use: To buy rice, oil, soap, sugar, powdered milk, toilet paper

description:
Maribel started her business when someone brought her packages of used toys from the United States that she offered for sale. It went well, and so she started buying and selling toys out of her home 2 years ago. Now, she also sells her wares in the open-air markets.

She needs a loan for $250, that she will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

Maribel inició el negocio ya que una persona que trae pacas de juguetes usados de estados unidos le ofreció para vender y le pareció bien, así comenzó hace 2 años, compro una paca de juguetes, y los vendía afuera de su casa, ahora va a los tianguis a vender también.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mas mercancía.
loan_use: To purchase merchandise.

description:
Cô Nguyễn thị Thìn Ms 01050042 nă nay 49 tuổi, vợ chồng cô sinh được 3 người con. Trong đó 2 con đã đi xây dựng gia đình, hiện tại chỉ còn một con đang đi học đại học. Hàng ngày chồng cô giúp cô đi lấy thịt bò về bán, cô rất chịu khó và nhanh nhẹn. cô đã vay vốn được một chu kỳ và hoàn trả rất tốt ,lần hai này cô đăng ký vay mức 5.152.000 VND để mua thịt trâu, bò về bán tạo thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Hiện tại mức thu nhập của 2 vợ chồng cô thu được từ 150.000 VND đến 180.000 VND/ ngày. Trong nhóm cô có các thành viên sau :

  • chị Nguyễn thị Cúc Ms 01050043 chị vay mức 4.256.000 VND để mua lợn nái về nuôi
  • chị Nguyễn thị Thiết Ms 01050044 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để mua vải về may quần áo
  • chị Nguyễn thị Thao Ms 01050045 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để kinh doanh chén, bát
  • chị Đặng thị Ngọc Ms 01050047 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để mua cám chăn nuôi lợn
  • chị Lê thị Môn Ms 01050048 vay mức 2.912.000 VND để kinh doanh hàng khô
  • chị Nguyễn thị Chí Ms 01050051 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để kinh doanh đồ nhựa
  • chị Ngô thị Hiền Ms 01050052 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để sản xuất túi đựng đồ
  • chị Nguyễn thị Viên Ms 01050053 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để kinh doanh hàng khô
description_translated:
Mrs. N. Thi Thin (ID Number 01050042), 49 years old, has 3 children. 2 of them have already been married whiL. the youngest one is attending college. Everyday, her husband buys beef, which is then resold at the market by Mrs. Thin. Mrs. Thin is very hardworking. She has already borrowed one loan and repaid the loan fully. This time, she would like to borrow 5,152,000VND to purchase beef and buffalo meat to sell, so as to increase the family's income. Her family's current daily income is from 150,000VND to 200,000VND (about 9.40USD to 12.50USD). Her group also consists of:
  • Mrs. N. Thi Cuc (ID Number 01050043), borrows 4,256,000VND to purchase breeding pigs.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Thiet (ID Number 01050044), borrows 4,256,000VND to purchase cloth for her tailoring business.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Thao (ID Number 01050045), borrows 4,256,000VND to buy and sell crockery.
  • Mrs. Dang Thi Ngoc (ID Number 01050047), borrows 4,256,000VND to purchase pig feeds.
  • Mrs. L. Thi Mon (ID Number 01050048), borrows 2,912,000VND to sell dried goods.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Chi (ID Number 01050051), borrows 3,186,000VND to sell plastic products.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Hien (ID Number 01050052), borrows 3,186,000VND to produce grocery bags.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Vien (ID Number 01050053), borrows 3,186,000VND to sell dried goods.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: selling beef and buffalo meat
borrower_names: Thi Cuc, Thi Vien, Thi Chi, Thi Thiet, Thi Thao, Thi Mon, Thi Ngoc, Thi Thin, Thi Hien
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
El Señor Francisco T., cuenta con 35 años de edad, tiene dos hijos. Desde muy temprana edad el Señor Francisco se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, ya que siendo muy joven empezó a trabajar en una panadería, donde aprendió uno de sus oficios, lo cual lo ayudó bastante.

Viajó a la Argentina en el año 1992 en donde pudo conseguir un pequeño capital, para regresar a su país de origen y realizar la venta ambulante de masitas y facturas dulces que el mismo preparaba. Hoy día la venta de sus dulces es una de sus fuentes de ingreso, el prepara de madrugada sus facturas para que a tempranas horas de la mañana el pueda salir a venderlas por los barrios recorriendo con su bicicleta casa por casa todas las tardes y los domingos en los partidos de fútbol.

La otra actividad que realiza a la par es la jardinería. El realiza trabajos de jardinería a domicilio, esta actividad ha ido incrementándose y hoy ya le genera mayores ingresos que la de la panadería.

El crédito solicitado es para la compra de un cortacésped para su actividad de jardinería, que le está siendo falta para realizar de manera más eficiente este trabajo.

Gracias a su espíritu emprendedor ha podido adquirir un terreno en donde ya ha empezado el proyecto de construcción de su casa propia.
description_translated:
Mr. Francisco T. is 35 years old and has two children. From a young age Francisco has described himself as being hard-working and enterprising, as when he was young he began to work in a bakery, where he learned a trade that helped him quite a bit. He traveled to Argentina in 1992 where he was able to save a bit of money to return to his country and become a traveling vendor of pastries and sweet rolls that he himself made. Today the sales of his sweets is one of his sources of income, he prepares his rolls in the early morning hours and then he can leave and sell them in the neighborhood, traveling by bicycle house to house in the afternoons and on Sundays at soccer games. The other job he does is gardening. He gardens at private homes, an activity that has been growing and today this generates more income than his baked goods. The loan he is seeking is to buy a lawn mower for his gardening service, this is an item he needs in order to be more efficient with his work. Thanks to his enterprising spirit he has been able to acquire a plot of land where he has begun building his own home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Buy a lawn mower

description:
K. Zarrina is 29 years old. She is married with three children. She owns a specialized fabrics store at the central market in Spitamen town, where the demand is always very consistent and high. National dresses in Tajikistan are very popular and very important item of the dowry of any girl. K. is one of the leading fabrics vendors in the market where she works for these dresses. She is very perseverant and determined in all of her business endeavors, which has helped to sustain her store for 10 years. Zarrina has about $3500 in inventory at the moment. \r\n

\r\nZarrina is a skilled entrepreneur. When she started this trade, she decided to implement basic concepts of integrity and hard work in her business to reach ultimate success. This laid a firm foundation for quality results and Zarrina has obviously been a successful small entrepreneur. However, she doesn’t want to stop. She would like her venture to continue to grow. Today, she is requesting a loan of $750 for 12 months to increase her assorted inventory and possibly open a new vending location in the future. One of her personal goals is to generate additional profit so she can remodel a new apartment she recently bought for her family.
loan_use: To purchase new fabrics and increase the range of goods

description: Indra B. (37) memiliki usaha sebagai petani agrobisnis yang bergerak dibidang pertanian padi dan palawija. Lahan yang dimiliki ditanam bergantian dengan tanaman lain seperti padi dan kedelai, tetapi yang dominan adalah padi. Usaha ini sudah dijalaninya beberapa tahun, dan untuk kali ii dia memerlukan dana untuk dipakai sebagai modal member sarana pendukung pertanian seperti traktor dan pupuk. Dia sangat berharap dari modal yang didapat dari KIVA kali ini bisa meningkatkan hasil dari panen padi nantinya. Selain itu, pendampingan dan penyuluhan bagi para petani di sekitarnya sering dilakukan, dengan tujuan agar mereka juga bisa mendapat hasil maksimal dari usaha pertanian mereka. Saat ini Indra B. tinggal di Buana Kubu - Denpasar dengan istri dan dua anaknya. Dengan menempati rumah sendiri, mereka tidak harus membayar sewa seperti kebanyakan orang dilingkungannya.
description_translated:
Indra B. (37) is in the business of agriculture. He grows paddy and soy bean. He needs fund to buy farming equipments such as tractor and fertilizers.

He hopes the capital that he gets from KIVA can help him improving the output of his agriculture business.

In addition, training to local farmers are given regularly to enable them to get optimum result from their farms.

Indra together with his wife and 2 children live in Buana Kubu - Denpasar. They live in their own house.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: to buy agriculture and farming equipments (Membali Sarana Pendukung Pertanian)

description:
Aynura is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Kalbadjar region in Azerbaijan. She has settled in Khirdalan town. She was born in 1979. \r\n

\r\nAynura is the mother of one child. She has been in this business for 4 years. Now she needs a loan of $625 to buy foodstuffs to improve her business.
loan_use: To buy foodstuffs

description:
Madame Darrah Maïga est âgée de  53  ans et vit avec ses 4 enfants( 3 garçons et 1 fille)et son mari à Koko, un des quartiers de la ville de Kadiolo(une des préfectures de la troisième région économique de la république du Mali).
Dès son jeune âge, elle a commencé les activités économiques notamment la restauration qu’elle a apprise  auprès de sa mère depuis maintenant 20 ans. Elle travaille avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 4 ans et est à son troisième prêt indivuduel, après avoir bouclé sept prêts de groupe ( prêt solidaire)  avec une assocaition de son quartier. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés
Ce prêt servira à  l’achat de 100 Kilogrammes de riz, 50 kilogrammes d’arachide,  5 régimes de bananes, 100kg de d’oranges, 2 chargements de bois de chauffe et d’importantes quantités de condiments  alimentaires   pour  une période  d’un   mois.
Elle  s’approvisionne sur place( à Kadiolo) en fruits et légumes. Le  riz  et condiments alimentaires dans les differents marchés de la ville de Sikasso ou de  Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) auprès des grossistes spécialisés des domaines concernés.
Elle prépare plusieurs plats: riz au gras, à la sauce tomate, gombo  et arachide,  les soupes de viande, de  pintade,  de  poulet  et de poisson.  Son lieu de vente se trouve au  grand marché de la ville de Kadiolo où il ya une grande affluence d’individus comme les voyageurs, les employés de commerce  et  les  routiers.
 Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel d’environ 80 000 FCFA.qui servira à contribuer aux dépenses familiales et investir le reste dans son activité.
description_translated:
Madame Darrah Maïga is 53 years old and lives with her four children (three boys and one girl) and her husband in Koko, one of the neighborhoods of Kadiolo (a prefecture of the third-largest economic region of the Republic of Mali). At a young age she started off in the restaurant business, which she learned from her mother for over 20 years. She has been working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso for four years and is on her third individual loan after having completed seven group loans (solidarity loans) with an association in her neighborhood. All of the previous loans were properly paid back. This loan will be used to purchase 100 kg of rice, 50 kg of peanuts, five bunches of bananas, 100 kg of oranges, two loads of cooking wood, and large quantities of seasonings for a month. She stocks her fruits and vegetables on-site. The rice and seasonings are bought in the various markets in Sikasso or Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali) from wholesalers who specialize in the product concerned. She cooks several dishes: "riz au gras" (similar to rice pilaf), rice with tomato sauce, rice with okra and peanuts, meat soups, guinea fowl, chicken, and fish. Her sales site is in the main market in the town of Kadiolo where there are crowds of individuals such as travelers, business people, and drivers. she envisions making a monthly profit of around 80,000 Francs CFA that will be used to contribute to family expenses and the rest will be invested in her business.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase ingredients for restaurant

description: T. Ismoiljon is 35 years old. He is married and has 6 children. Ismoiljon began earning income selling seasonal vegetables when he was 19 years old by helping his dad. After a while, he began working at other jobs, but realized that his work wasn't bringing in enough income to cover the expenses of his family. Therefore, Ismoiljon decided to independently re-engage in the seasonal vegetable sales business. Gradually, he is becoming known in the area; however, he still needs additional capital to purchase vegetables for sale, given the high demand during the current season. Ismoiljon is asking for a loan of US$600, which he will repay within 4 months. With this money, Ismoiljon will be able to buy additional vegetables for sale and thus earn more profit. Ismoiljon plans to use the additional income to help his children move forward in completing their studies. He is thankful to everyone for support.
loan_use: Purchase of seasonal vegetables for sale

description:
El Sr. Antonio Candía Romero está casado con la Sra. Amada Ramona Núñez, tienen 2 hijos (un varón y una nena) los dos adolescentes, el señor Antonio tiene un comedor en el Taller de la Municipalidad ya hace 15 años. Antonio le provee desayuno, almuerzo y merienda a 200 funcionarios municipales que habitualmente trabajan en ese lugar. Sin embargo, necesitan este préstamo para la compra de vacas faenadas que el señor Antonio se va a traer de la ciudad de Caazapá.

\r\n\r\nAdemás de la compra de frutas frescas y verduras que lo hacen diariamente, debe pagar al municipio un impuesto por la utilización del predio del comedor. Ellos son felices con este negocio que les permite estar más cerca de sus hijos que trabajan con ellos. Este será su primer préstamo con la Fundación.
description_translated:
Mr. Antonio Candía Romero is married to Mrs. Amada Ramona Núñez. They have two children, a boy and a girl, both adolescents. For 15 years, Mr. Antonio has had a cafeteria in the Municipal Repair Shop. Antonio provides breakfast, lunch, and afternoon snack to the 200 municipal workers who regularly work there. Nevertheless, they need this loan to purchase beef that Mr. Antonio is going to bring from the city of Caazapá.

In addition to the daily purchase of fresh fruits and vegetables, he has to pay a tax to the municipality for the use of the space for the cafeteria. They are happy with this business that allows them to be closer to their children, who work alongside them. This will be their first loan with the Foundation.


Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase of meat, rice, sugar, oil, milk, sweets, etc.

description: Kasiati mempunyai usaha sebagai Pedagang es batu  yang sudah ditekuni selama 3 tahun. Suaminya  sebagai seorang sopir. Kasiati harus berusaha agar bisa membantu pendapatan rumah tangga ,mengingat 4 orang anaknya membutuhkan biaya untuk sekolah. Dengan modal awal sebesar 2 juta rupiah Kasiati membeli sebuah lemari es untuk membuat es batu. Namun satu buah lemari es tidak bisa memenuhi kebutuhan pelanggan yang kini mulai meningkat. Langganan pembelinya adalah warung yang menjual minuman ringan dan pedagang ikan supaya ikannya tidak membusuk. Dengan satu lemari es tentu saja keuntungan yang didapat juga sedikit, karena satu bungkus es dalam plastik usuran 1 kilogram dijual seharga Rp.700. Keuntungan ini dipakai cukup untuk keperluan dapur saja. Karena kebutuhan akan es batu terus meningkat maka Kasiati mengajukan pinjaman modal ke Yayasan Dinari. Modal ini dipergunakan untuk menambah lemari es, sehingga kini Kasiati sudah memiliki 3 lemari es. Dengan tambahan peralatan tersebut diharapkan penghasilan serta keuntungan yang didapat akan meningkat sehingga Kasiati bisa melanjutkan sekolah anak-anaknya ketingkat yang lebih tinggi lagi,dan Kasiati sangat berterimakasi kepada Yayasan Dinari karena sudah membantu dalam permodalan.
description_translated:
Kasiati sells ice cube/ ice block. She has been in this business for 3 years. Her husband is a driver. She has this business to help the family's economic condition as they have 4 school age children.

With the start up capital of IDR 2 million (around USD 220), she bought a refrigerator to make ice cubes. Her customers are nearby soda or soft drinks vendors and also the fish sellers. She sells 1 kg of ice cube for IDR 700 (around 10 US Cent).

However one refrigerator is not enough now as her customers are growing. Therefore she applied loan to Dinari foundation to enable her to buy more refrigerator. She now has 3 refrigerators. She hopes that this can help her expanding her business. She hopes she can send her children to higher level of education.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: to buy refrigerator (Membeli lemari es)

description:
The Las Margaritas communal bank is made up of eleven women and one man. Most of them have families of five (two parents and three children). Most are middle class, while some are from rural areas and have scarce resources. Most of the group lives in rented homes. They are involved in various economic activities: Maribel is a gym teacher; Juana and Eugenio sell sweets and cookies; Mery and Reyna own neighborhood stores; Alicia sells laundry detergent; Angelica has a liquor store; Ariana, Patricia and Jhovana sell cosmetics; Juana Alejandra is an elementary school teacher; and Pamela sells silpanchos (breaded, thin-sliced beef, a popular lunch or evening meal in Bolivia).

There is a fair amount of competition in all of these areas, but the group members remain competitive by quickly moving from market to market, offering a variety of merchandise and introducing new items frequently. Most of the group will use this loan to buy more merchandise to sell.

Since this is not the group's first loan, most of the group members have credit experience already. Other members have participated in previous group loans at other microfinance institutions.
loan_use: Purchase merchandise to sell (detergent, cosmetics, liquor, sweets) and ingredients to prepare food.
borrower_names: Reyna Isabel, Mery Martha, Angelica, Eugenio Alejandro, Patricia Florentina, Jhovana Liveth, Maribel, Alicia, Pamela Ivone, Juana Paulina, Juana Alejandra, Ariana Patricia
borrower_genders: female, female, female, male, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, false, true, true, true, true, false, true, true, true, true

description:
