Married with four kids who are currently in school, Amina O. is 46 years old. She sells food like cassava, plantain, maize, etc. in the local market of Sunyani where she lives. Selling for the past eight years, she has a lot of selling experience to win customers. \r\n

\r\nAmina is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to provide her kids with quality education for their future careers. She wants to use the loan to buy increased stock of cassava, plantain, maize, beans, etc. to serve her customers. She is a member of the community group called Janet Trust Group. In this group, members assist one another to provide support in handling repayment. She would be grateful for that assistance.
loan_use: To buy increased stock of cassava, plantain, maize, beans, etc.

description:
Marcelino is 40 years old and lives with his wife and three children. He is a farmer dedicated to studying the land and to the cultivation of potato, corn and beans. After planting his crops he spends six anxious months awaiting the fruits of his labor. His farming generates earnings that allow him to support his family. He takes his products to the city of Huancayo to sell throughout the primary markets of that town. Marcelino is always vigilant of his farmland, making sure to keep tabs on any possible pest infestations or diseases that may harm his crops. While he waits for the planting season (six months), he dedicates himself to selling small electronics that he buys on his trips into the city to acquaintances. This activity, however, does not generate the desired income. Marcelino is motivated, day in and day out, by his desire to better provide for his family and by his wish for his children to complete their educations so that they can look forward to bright futures. He seeks a loan with which to buy products for planting his crops, such as sacks of fertilizer, to be able to improve his yield in the future. He also hopes to continue to grow his small appliance business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Marcelino tiene 40 años y vive con su esposa y 3 hijos. Es un agricultor dedicado a las tareas de la siembra, y a la cosecha de papa, maíz y arveja que luego de sembrar espera 6 meses la ansiada cosecha, que le permite, con sus ganancias, sostener a su familia, para lo cual, lleva toda su cosecha directamente a la ciudad de Huancayo para venderla en sus principales mercados. Marcelino siempre está vigilante todos los días de sus campos de cultivo para estar pendiente si entró alguna plaga o enfermedad en sus plantaciones. Mientras espera la época de la cosecha (6 meses) se dedica a vender a las personas que conoce pequeños artefactos eléctricos que compró en su viaje a la ciudad, para él lo más difícil es cuando no valoran el precio de sus productos, eso no le permite obtener las ganancias deseadas. Marcelino está motivado cada día, porque desea darle lo mejor a su familia, que sus hijos se superen a través del estudio. Solicita este préstamo con el que podrá comprar para la siembra, sacos de abono y fertilizantes y a un futuro poder mejorar su cosecha, a la par mantener su creciente negocio de venta de artefactos.
loan_use: Purchase fertilizers for planting his next crop.

description:
Luis is 27 years old and lives with his parents. He is a young man who devotes all his vitality and youth to farming and is a very important contributor to the economy of his family. For 8 years, he has worked independently planting potatoes, corn, beans and peas. Luis’s work process is to first to prepare the land and pour the fertilizer. Then, he sows the seed, usually with plows and then later care for his plants through fertilizer, and if necessary, fumigation. Thus, Luis ensures that the crop yields good results as a reward for their daily effort. He acknowledges that, in recent years, agriculture is not being rewarded by the low prices being offered in the market, but this does not discourage him because he wants to continue on.

His constant motivation is continuing the same production being done, so that his family and his future have a good solvency.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

Luis tiene 27 años y vive con sus padres. Es un joven que dedica toda su vitalidad y juventud en las tareas del campo y es un aporte muy importante para la economía de su familia, desde hace 8 años trabaja de manera independiente sembrando papa, maíz, habas y arveja, el proceso de trabajo que lleva Luis es primero el de preparar la tierra, echándole abonos y regándola, después es el momento de poner la semilla, generalmente con arados y luego es el cuidado que tiene que brindar, tanto de sus plantas, echándoles fertilizantes y si es necesaria la fumigación. De esa manera Luis garantiza que la cosecha rinda buenos frutos como recompensa de su esfuerzo diario, él reconoce que en estos últimos años la agricultura no está siendo recompensada, por los bajos precios que se ofrece en el mercado, pero esto no lo desanima porque quiere seguir adelante.

Su motivación constante es la misma producción que realiza, para que su familia y su futuro tengan una buena solvencia.
loan_use: Purchase of fertilizer for sowing and recruiting staff for the next harvest

description:
33-year-old Celine Fointain lives in Cameroon's North West Province and is hoping to take out her third business loan.
Celine runs a small but successful food stall near the centre of Bamenda, a medium-sized town in the country's Anglophone west.

She intends to spend the money buying three sacks of rice, a large bag of beans, groundnuts (fresh peanuts), sugar, soap, washing powder, and firewood. She will also invest in a drum of palm oil. Unrefined palm oil is a deep orange colour and rich in flavour and nutrients.  It is the most important oil used in Cameroonian cooking and forms the basis of many dishes. 

Celine is married with six children, five of whom are school age. She is happy that previous business profits have allowed her to pay school fees and buy study books. As well as continuing her children's education, she hopes to eventually buy some land and build a house for her family.
loan_use: To buy food supplies for re-sale

description: Pinjaman kali ini merupakan pinjaman yang kedua bagi Normawati (44). Sebelumnya pinjaman sebesar Rp.1.000.000 dari KIVA melalui DINARI telah dipakai untuk mengembangkan usaha lain selain menjual bakso. Kalau sebelumnya dia hanya menjual bakso, dengan bantuan modal usaha dari KIVA dia sudah mulai mengembangkan usaha lain yaitu menjual mie ayam. Dengan adanya dua variasi makanan yang dijualnya, pembeli lebh senang karena mempunyai dua pilihan. Dengan cara ini, dia sekarang bisa mendapatkan penghasilan bersih Rp.40.000 per hari, padahal sebelumnya dari satu usaha saja dia hanya mendapatkan Rp.20.000 per hari. Hal ini sangant membantu dia dalam mengembalikan pinjamannya ke KIVA. Saat ini, dia berharap mendapatkan pinjaman yang lebih besar dari sebelumnya. Rencananya pinjaman tersebut akan dipakai untuk mengembangkan usahanya lagi seperti menambah jumlah rombong dan peralatan yang diperlukan.
description_translated:
For Normawati (44) this is her second time loan. Before, KIVA through DINARI has lent her IDR 1.000.000 (USD 109.9) which she used to diversify her business of selling meatball soup. Now, with the help from KIVA she is developing another business of selling chicken noodle soup. This makes her customer happy of the variety. She enjoys raise on her daily net income, from IDR 20.000 (USD 2.2) of selling only meatball soup, to IDR 40.000 (USD 4.4) of selling both meals. This helps her in repaying her loan to KIVA and she hopes to receive bigger amount for her second loan. She plans to use the loan to buy new equipments and utensils needed to develop the business.

Translated from Indonesian by Iman Madaze, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To add business capital

description:
Narzullo U. is 42 years old. He is married with 4 children. Narzullo and his wife work together in the cultivation of potatoes, onions, and carrots, something he has done since he was very young. Thanks to his work, he's been able to provide an adequate education for his four beloved children.

\r\n\r\nNarzullo has a big family. Besides his wife and children, he is also supporting his mother who is very ill. This year he hopes to get a rich harvest so he will be able to take his mother to a good hospital which is very expensive. With this purpose in mind, he is asking for a loan of 3000 Somoni (900 USD) for the term of 10 month in order to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer to grow seasonal vegetables. With your help he can grow his business and provide his beloved mother with good treatment in a good hospital.
loan_use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables

description: Afi Glwadis A. est âgée de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle habite à Adeta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle est revendeuse de bassines et d’assiettes de puis plus de 7 ans. Elle désire par ce crédit acheter plus de marchandises afin de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle et par là mieux gagner sa vie
description_translated:
Afi Glwadis A., 42, is married and the mother of 5 children. She lives in Adeta, a village located about 150 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. She has been selling bowls and plates for more than 7 years. With this loan, she would like to purchase more merchandise so as to satisfy the demands of her clientele and better earn her living in this fashion.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: purchase plates and bowls for re-sale

description:
Rose V. is 45 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Okoko, Lagos state, Nigeria. Rose sells foods like tubers of yam, Garri, palm oil, and corn. She has been in this business since 2000. Rose is a LAPO client. \r\n

She needs the loan amount of $850 to buy more food for sale. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.
loan_use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale

description:
Ana is 49 years old and lives with her husband Pori, who is in the sales business. She has two daughters, 29 year-old Nery and 24 year-old Derly, who is in higher education. Ana has 20 years of experience in grocery sales, always working in her some store, which she can manage without much trouble since it is in her own home. She begins working at 6 am and finishes at 9pn, during those hours she serves her customers, which she has been attracting throughout the years. Se loves her jobs, since because of it she has been able to give her children a higher level of education, which they have eagerly and fully taken advantage of. The difficult part of her job is having to stay in the tiny store all day, without going out for a second to rest or visit her daughters who live in the city, since she works during the entire week. Ana wants to see her daughter form their own families and to have a better future. She will supply her store with products that people ask for with the loan money, and in that way continue to maintain customer loyalty and attract new customers, so that in the future she will be able to open another store.

\r\n

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

\r\n

Ana tiene 49 años, vive con su esposo Pori, que se dedica al comercio, tiene dos hijas; Nery de 29 y Derly de 24, la cual cursa superiores. Ana tiene 20 años de experiencia en la venta de comestibles, siempre se ha dedicado a su pequeña tienda, la cual puede administrar sin problema porque se encuentra en su propia casa, su trabajo empieza a las 6 de la mañana y termina a las 9 de la noche, tiempo en el cual se interesa mucho por atender a su clientela, la que se ha ido incrementando a lo largo de todos estos años.A ella le encanta su trabajo, ya que gracias a él, pudo brindarle a sus hijas educación superior, la cual, ellas han aprovechado con mucho ahínco.Lo difícil de su trabajo es tener que permanecer durante casi todo en día en su tiendita, sin salir ni un momento a pasear, distraerse o visitar a sus hijas, que se encuentran en la ciudad, ya que el trabajo es durante toda la semana. Ana quiere ver a sus hijas formando sus propias familias y con un futuro mejor. Con el dinero del préstamo implementará su tienda con los productos que la gente está demandando, así poder mantener la fidelidad de su clientela y atraer a nuevos clientes, para que en un futuro pueda poner una sucursal.
loan_use: To supply her store with a large amount of her products.

description: Rafaela tiene 53 años, tiene 2 hijos que cursan estudios universitarios,  es madre soltera, pero no hay dificultad para salir adelante, nos menciona.\r\n¿Qué hace?\tElla se dedica a vender sábanas, ropa para niños y adultos, lleva en este trabajo 3 años y le va muy bien, lleva a vender sus prendas por los distintos lugares de Pucallpa, dejándolos al crédito o al contado. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo, es que intercambia ideas y socializa más, lo más importante es que mediante él, está pagando los estudios de sus hijos, que pronto serán profesionales. \r\nElla quiere alquilar un local para la venta de sus productos, así dejar de caminar y tener una labor más tranquila.
description_translated:
Rafaela is 53 and has two sons in university, and although she is a single mother, she is having no trouble progressing in life. She has been selling sheets and adult and children’s clothing for three years, and it is going well. She sells her goods in various places in Pucallpa for cash or on credit. The thing Rafaela likes about her work is discussing ideas and socializing with others, but the most important aspect is the fact that she can pay for her son’s education. They will soon be professionals. She wants to rent premises to sell her products so that she does not have to move around. Then her work will be more peaceful.\r\n\r\n

Translated from Spanish by ian harvey, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Renting premises to sell her products

description:
Aina R. is 35 years old and married with four children. She lives in Sabo Oniba in Lagos state, Nigeria.

\r\n\r\n

Aina works from her home selling foodstuffs, like garri, beans, palm oil, and rice. She has been in this business for a long time and is also a LAPO client. She needs the loan for $425 to buy more foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you.
loan_use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

description: Maria O. sells drinks and cooked food in her shop. Maria is a LAPO client. She has been in this business for a long time. She is 43 years old and she is married with 5 children. Maria lives in Satellite town, Lagos state, Nigeria. She needs the loan amount of $700 to buy more drinks and foodstuffs for sale. This she says will expand her business and increase her business productivity. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.
loan_use: To buy drinks and food stuffs for sale

description: Oluwakemi M. sells foodstuffs and cooked foods. She cooks foods like eba, amala and fufu. She has been in this business for a long time. M. is 46 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Iran, Lagos state, Nigeria. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 3 years. She is requesting the loan of $1200 to enable her to buy more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers.
loan_use: To buy more foodstuffs and drinks for sale

description: Dina A. est âgée de 33 ans, mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle est revendeuse depuis 3 ans en gros et détail des sacs du charbon de bois à Apéyémé, un village situé à environ 170 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle souhaite par ce crédit acheter de nouveaux  sacs  de charbon, afin d’augmenter la capacité de son commerce et faire face aux besoins de sa clientèle. Les profits tirés de son activité lui permettront de prendre en charge une partie des besoins de son foyer
description_translated:
Dina A. is 33 years old. She is married and the mother of one child. For three years, she has sold coal wholesale and retail in Apéyémé, a village about 170 kilometers from the Togolese capital of Lomé. With this loan, she hopes to buy new sacks of coal in order to increase the size of her business and meet her clients' needs. The profits she earns in this way will allow her to help meet the financial needs of her household.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase of sacks of coal

description:
Art S., 28, is married with three children and lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Since 2008, she has been raising pigs to earn a living and is able to make about US$2 of profit per day. 

Her husband is a taxi driver (Phnom Penh- Kampong Cham). Normally, he makes around US$3 of profit per day. Her husband states some problems that he faces in running his business such as: the gas has skyrocketed and passengers have no will to pay more even though they know the gas price is high. That is why he makes less profit to support the family. 

Mrs. Art is asking for a loan to add to her livestock.
loan_use: To expand her livestock, raising pigs.

description:
Lucrecia is 49 years old, single, she lives in her parent’s hom with her 20-year old son Ramiro who is studying at the university. She was born in Juliaca, and with the support of her parents she opened an auto parts store. The work is difficult and Lucrecia had to learn everything associated with auto repair. Now, with 19 years of experience, she has become an expert. What she most enjoys about her job is that she is the manager and her own boss. She works on behalf of her son Ramiro, who as her only child is her sole focus, and she wants to see him become a professional and have a beautiful family. With the money from the loan Lucrecia wants to buy some parts that her customers have asked for and until now she has not been able to acquire them. In the future she wants her business to grow in earnings in order to have a bigger locale.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Lucrecia tiene 49 años, es soltera, vive en casa de sus padres con su hijo Ramiro de 20 años, el cual cursa estudios superiores. Es natural de la ciudad de Juliaca, con el apoyo de sus padres puso una tienda de repuestos para motor de autos. El trabajo es difícil y Lucrecia tuvo que aprender todo lo relacionado con la mecánica de autos, ahora, ya con 19 años de experiencia se ha convertido en toda una experta, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que ella lo administra y es su propia jefa. Trabaja a favor de su hijo Ramiro, quien al ser su único hijo es su adoración, quiere verlo profesional y que conforme una linda familia. Con el dinero del préstamo Lucrecia quiere comprar algunos repuestos que le solicitaron y que hasta ahora no había podido conseguir.En el futuro quiere que su negocio incremente sus ganancias para tener un local más grande.
loan_use: Buy auto parts that her customers have asked for

description: Violeta tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos de 9 y 7 años. Se dedica a la venta de muebles, su esposo trabaja en la mina La Rinconada y por lo tanto no se queda mucho tiempo en casa, es así, que para ayudar a los gastos familiares, Violeta decidió dedicarse a la venta de muebles, eso desde hace ya 6 meses.Tiene un local alquilado en una cuadra de su localidad donde se venden muebles de toda clase, ella atiende desde las 8 de la mañana hasta la pasada la tarde, entretanto, se las arregla para mandar a sus hijos a la escuela y prepararles sus alimentos, esta es la parte difícil de su trabajo, pero Violeta ya está acostumbrada y le gusta poder ganar su propio dinero.\r\nVioleta quiere que sus dos hijos sean profesionales, para que no tengan que dedicarse solo al comercio, sino a estudiar y trabajar en otros ámbitos.\r\nCon el dinero del préstamo, quiere comprar más muebles para aumentar su venta y con el tiempo poner otro negocio, que le permita solventar sus gastos económicos y mantener a su familia unida.
description_translated:
Violeta is 31 years old and she lives with her husband and siblings of age 9 and 7. She sells furniture for a living and her husband works at a mine called La Rinconada and he hardly spends time at home. This is the reason why Violeta 6 months ago decided to sell furniture to help the family. She rented a place in her neigborhood where all kinds of furniture are on sale. She works from 8am until late in the afternoon while she also sends her kids to school and prepare them meals which is precisely what makes her work more difficult but Violeta is already use to this and she enjoys being able to work to earn a living. Violeta wants her two kids to become professionals. She would like her kids to study and work in something other than sales. \r\n

\r\nWith the loan money she wants to buy more furniture to increase her sales and in time be able to buy another business to be able to further support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Yvette Diaz, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Increase her sales with the purchase of new furniture

description:
Rosa Maria is 40-years-old and lives in the Sabana Grande region in the city of Managua. She is a single mother of two children, who are 12 and 16, whom she fights for every day to be able to take good care of them and above all to give them an education so they can be worthy people in society. Rosa Maria has sold used clothing and phone cards for 18 years. She started this business with her own funds and much effort. This loan will go towards purchasing a package of assorted clothing, since the price of it increased she doesn't have enough capital to acquire it.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

\r\nRosa Maria tiene 40 años de edad, habita en la comarca Sabana Grande de la ciudad de Managua, es madre soltera de dos niños de 12 y 16 años de edad, por los cuales lucha diariamente para poderlos sacarlos adelante y sobre todo para darles estudios, para que sean personas de bien para la sociedad. Rosa Maria se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y tarjetas telefónicas desde hace 18 años y empezó este negocio con fondos propios y con mucho esfuerzo. El destino del préstamo será para la compra de una paca de ropa variada, ya el precio de ésta subió y no cuenta con suficiente capital para poder adquirir este producto.
loan_use: Purchase of a package of clothing

description: Эшаева Норбиби жительница города Яан. Живет далеко от центра со своей семьей. Замужем и имеет четверых детей. Занимается животноводством. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы купить бычка. Кредит поможет ей увеличить поголовье скота. Она откормит бычка и попозже в сезон сможет продать по более выгодной цене. Это будет дополнительным доходом для ее семьи. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев
description_translated:
Nurbibi A. is a resident of Yaan. She lives far from the center of the town with her family. She is married and has 4 children. Her main occupation is cattle breeding. She would like to obtain a loan so she could purchase a calf. These funds will help her increase the number of her livestock. She plans to feed the calf and sell it at a better price during the season later on. This will supply additional income for her family. She plans to pay off the loan in 12 months.\r\n

Translated from Russian by N Aviva, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To purchase a calf

description:
Emmanuel A., popularly called Agyengo, is 32 years old. He is married with one kid who is currently in school. Emmanuel is a dealer in hardware such as assorted paints, nails, roofing sheets, hammers, PVC pipes, etc., in Goaso, the town where he lives with his family.

\r\n\r\nEmmanuel buys his supplies from importers in Kumasi, the regional capital Ashanti, at wholesale prices and sells to his customers at retail prices. He is requesting this loan to enable him to procure increased stocks of paints, nails, hammers, etc., to accelerate his business progress. With the loan, he hopes to increase his savings so as to expand his shop to include the sale of cement. He would be very grateful for your support.
loan_use: To purchase more assorted paints, nails, sandpaper, hammers, etc.

description:
Galina is a successful and consistent entrepreneur from Melitopol in southeastern Ukraine. She works as a traveling vendor selling women's clothing in small markets in the region. Galina launched her business about 10 years ago. Financial assistance in Nadiya Ukraine has been an effective means of stimulating her sales and growing her business throughout those years.

Currently, Galina has about $1600 of gross income each month. Her net profit is about $600. Galina feels secure and peaceful when she sees that her family gets everything they need for normal living. She is happy to generate enough money to cover her son's college fees and pay their bills. She is hoping to continue seeing her business thrive and bring her sufficient income. 

This time she is seeking a loan of 3000 Grivnas ($650 USD) to increase her sales and develop her trade.  

NOTE: This is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in two months.
loan_use: To increase her sales

description:
Ana started her own business in order to have an income rather than having a steady job with low wages. She decided to set up her own food production and sales business.

She needs a loan of $500.00 USD, which will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase the ingredients she needs to keep her food sales going.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Ana inició su negocio por la necesidad de tener una entrada de dinero en vez de tener un trabajo fijo que le de un sueldo bajo, ella decidió tener su propio negocio de elaboración y venta de comida.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar materia prima y así poder continuar con su negocio.
loan_use: Purchase ingredients

description:
Ángel is married and has a one-year-old son. He started his own business as a result of being laid off from his previous job. He decided to start a business that would bring in better earnings for him while at the same time allow him to spend more time with his family since his schedule at his previous job never permitted him to spend much time with them. In shoe sales, he found what he was after, so now he sells shoes for a living.

He is requesting a loan of $500.00 USD, which he will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase merchandise and thus be able to fill his customers’ orders.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Ángel es casado y tiene un pequeño hijo de 1 año. Empezó con el negocio a raíz de que lo desocuparon del trabajo, es por ello que decidió dedicarse a una actividad que le redituar mejores ingresos y que le permitiera pasar mas tiempo con su familia, ya que por los horarios de su anterior trabajo no pasaba mucho tiempo con ellos. En la venta de zapatos encontró lo que buscaba y se dedica a esto.

El necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y así poder cumplir con unos pedidos que tiene que entregar.
loan_use: Purchase merchandise (footwear)

description:
Mr. Asael R. works as both a deliveryman and bill collector for a private company. He and his wife, Mrs. Amanda Ramirez, have three children together. They are requesting this loan in order to purchase a computer because their children are at that point in their student lives where they need a computer in order to complete their work. They would like to offer their children a better future in society. \r\n

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

\r\nEl señor Asael trabaja en una empresa como repartidor y realizando la cobranza, el y su esposa la señora Amanda Ramirez quienes juntos tienen tres hijos, estan solicitando este prestamo para comprar una computadora ya que sus hijos la requieren porque estan en edad de escuela para realizar las tareas que se les pidan y brindarles un mejor futuro dentro de la sociedad.
loan_use: Purchase a computer

description:
La señora Alicia socia del Banco Comunal “Las Moralinas”, vive en el Departamento y Provincia de San Martín, Distrito de Morales. Se dedica a la venta de zapatos, sobretodo trabaja con pedidos. Tanto su esposo como su hija  promocionan los productos con sus amistades y familiares, que en estos últimos tempos las ventas que se han mantenido como en las mejores épocas son los escolares y las fiestas de promoción. 

Se inició en el negocio con la venta de lencería y por razones de la variada competencia tuvo que cambiar de producto, ahora se dedica a la venta de zapatos. Ya tiene 2 años en esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Con el préstamo de S/. 2 500, el cual pagará en 06 meses, invertirá  en la compra de zapatos de diversas tallas, modelos y colores para entregar a sus clientes que ya les hicieron sus pedidos, además quiere comprar una máquina de coser porque también le gusta coser.

La señora Alicia tiene 31 años, es una mujer optimista, trabajadora y hábil para el negocio, su meta es ampliar su casa y tener una zapatería en su propio domicilio.
description_translated:
Ms. Alicia, a member of the communal bank "Las Moralinas," lives in the department and province of San Martín, in the Morales district. She sells shoes for a living, primarily on order. Her husband and her daughter promote her products among friends and family. Lately, she has been experiencing sales like she used to in better times, mostly from students for graduation parties.

\r\nShe began in her business selling lingerie, but because of the stiff competition, she had to change products. She now sells shoes, as she has been for the last two years, and it\'s going very well. With this loan for $850, which she will repay in 6 months, she will invest in buying shoes of various sizes, styles, and colors to deliver to clients who have already placed their orders. She also wants to buy a sewing machine, as she likes to sew. Alicia is 31 years old, and an optimistic, hard-working woman, well-suited for her work. Her goal is to expand her house, and open a shoe store in her own home.


Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Compra de zapatos de diversas tallas, modelos y colores y la compra de un máquina de coser

description: Manuel tiene 31 años de edad, habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, es casado y tiene dos hermosos hijos de 6 y 9 años de edad, su esposa trabaja en en ventas en un mercado de Managua. Manuel tiene un carretón de caballo que lo utiliza en servicios de acarreo, pasa todo el día en un mercado esperando por clientes que soliciten el servicio de acarreo tiene diez años de experiencia, inició vendiendo leña en el carretón y con ahorro compró su caballo. La solicitud que esta haciendo es para construcción de la sala de su casa ya que es pequeña y quiere aumentar para tener más espacio y poder estar más cómodo, para lo cual debe comprar arena, cemento, piedra, entre otros. A largo plazo es poder ofrecer siempre el servicio a sus clientes con mejoras a su carretón ya que en el mercado son de mucha utilidad para los que llegan a comprar, así como seguir haciendo mejoras a su casa.
description_translated:
Manuel is 31 years old and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood. He is married and has two beautiful sons who are 6 and 9 years old. His wife works in sales at a market in Managua. Manuel has a horse cart which he uses to provide transportation services. He spends all day at the market waiting for customers. He has ten years of experience, and started out selling fire wood using his cart. He was then able to buy his horse with his savings. The request he is making is to build a room on his small house, as he would like to expand to have more space and to be able to live more comfortably. He needs to buy sand, cement and stone, among other items, for this renovation. Long term, he wants to make improvements to his cart to continue providing his services at the market as they are very useful to those who come to the market to make purchases. He would also like to continue making improvements to his house.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Finish construction on his house.

description: Norma tiene 29 años, es madre soltera de dos niños, María de 7 años y Robiño de 4. Se dedica al negocio de la venta de popcorn (Palomitas de Maíz) de forma ambulatoria por las calles de la ciudad de Juliaca, negocio que es la fuente principal de los ingresos de su familia, ya que tiene que mantener sola a sus dos hijos.Siempre ha sido una mujer muy alegre y perseverante, a pesar de las pequeñas dificultades que se le presentan, siempre ha sabido superarlas, haciendo que su trabajo sea fácil de hacer. Un día común en el trabajo de Norma empieza a las 12 del día para terminar a las 8 de la noche, que es donde hay más venta, por el frío que hace en la ciudad de Juliaca.\r\nEsta madre, sola, quiere sacar a sus hijos adelante y demostrarles que pueden tener un gran futuro a pesar de las penurias económicas que a ella le tocó vivir.\r\nCon el dinero Norma quiere comprar algunos accesorios que le faltan a su triciclo, para mejorar la preparación del popcorn, haciendo que sea más consumido. En un corto tiempo, le gustaría comprar otro triciclo para ampliar su negocio.
description_translated:
Norma is 29 years old. She is a single mother of two children: 7 year old María and 4 year old Robiño. She focuses herself on the business of selling popcorn (Palomitas de Maíz) on foot through the streets of the city of Juliaca. The business is the principle source of income for her family, since she only has to look after her two sons. She has always been a happy and persevering woman. Despite the small troubles she is faced with, she has managed to overcome so that her work should be easier to do. Norma's typical day starts at noon and ends at eight in the evening, which is when there are greater sales because of the cold in Juliaca. This single mother wants to move her children forward and demonstrate to them that they can have a good future despite the kind of economic hardships she has lived through. With this loan Norma wants to purchase several accessories she is missing for her tricycle so she can improve her production of popcorn so that it will be in greater demand. In a short while, she would like to buy another tricycle to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Refurbishment and remodel of a tricycle used for selling popcorn on the go

description: Eleodoro tiene 45 años, vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos de 18,12, 9 y 6 años, los cuales son estudiantes. Se dedica a la crianza de animales, sus carneros son los que mayor rentabilidad le proporcionan, dicha actividad la viene realizando hace 30 años y desde entonces, sale desde muy temprano por la mañana a los diversos pastorales del lugar para alimentar a su ganado  y llevarlos a los ríos o lagunas cercanas para que puedan beber el agua necesaria. Esta actividad le toma todo el día, hasta el atardecer, regresa muy cansado por el implacable sol del día y el terrible frío de la tarde.Pero le agrada su trabajo, sabe que tiene que alimentar y cuidar muy bien a sus animales, lo complicado es transportar la carne que obtiene hacia los mercados más cercanos.\r\nEleodoro tiene en su hogar el mejor motivador que todo padre y esposo pueda tener para  salir adelante, su esposa y sus hijos.\r\nÉl desea invertir en la compra de dos carneros de raza, para el incremento de su ganado, con ello, incrementará la cantidad de carne que llevará a los mercados para vender.
description_translated:
Eleodoro is 45 years old; he lives with his wife and four children who are 18, 12, 9 and 6 years old and are students. He raises animals, his sheep are what are the most profitable. He has been doing this activity for 30 years and since that time, early every morning he goes to the various grazing fields where he lives to feed his stock and takes them to rivers or nearby lagoons so they can drink water. This takes him all day to do, until sunset, and he returns home tired from the constant daytime sun and the terrible cold during the afternoon. But he likes his work. He knows he must feed and care for his animals very well. What is complicated is transporting their meat to the nearby markets.

Eleodoro's home, his wife and his children are the greatest inspiration he has a father to get ahead.

He would like to invest in the purchase of two rams, so he can increase his stock and increase the quantity of meat that he takes to market to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Buy two rams to improve the quality and quantity of his herd.

description: Catalina tiene 42 años, vive con su esposo y sus 5 hijos estudiantes.  Desde muy pequeña se dedica a criar diversos animales, ya que desde muy niña, esa fue la forma de ganarse la vida en su familia, lo que aprendió es ahora su mayor actividad dentro de su hogar, nos comentó que lo difícil de criar a los cuyes es realizar constantemente una selección, y estar pendientes de sus alimentos porque son muy delicados, pero esto no limita su amor y cariño por estos animales, a los cuales después de un tiempo, los vende en los mercados de las ciudades a donde los lleva con mucha dificultad.\r\nCatalina desea lograr el bienestar de su familia, por eso trabaja arduamente por conseguirlo.\r\nEl dinero que solicita desea invertirlo en la compra de cuyes de raza, de la misma forma carnerito, para poder criarlo y así, poco a poco llegar a ser una gran ganadera.
description_translated:
Catalina is 42 and lives with her husband and her 5 children, who are in school. Since she was very young, she has raised different animals. This is how her family earned a living. She uses what she learned to earn the main source of income for her home. She told us that the hard part about raising guinea pigs is constantly having a good selection of them and paying attention to their food because they are very delicate. But this doesn't limit her love and care for these animals, which she sells after a time in the city markets where she takes them with much difficulty.

\r\nCatalina hopes to achieve well-being for her family, but she must work very hard to achieve it. She hopes to invest the money that she is requesting into purchasing a good breed of guinea pigs and also a ram to raise so she can gradually become a big livestock farmer.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To increase the quantity and quality of her guinea pigs and to purchase a ram

description: Sajida baji is the wife of A. H. and lives in an area of city Lahore named Ismail Nagar, Pakistan. She has been living in this area for the last 11 years. She is the mother of four children: two boys and two girls. Her one daughter and one son are in kindergarten. Her husband is a butcher by profession. He runs a meat shop, with experience of 11 years. Sajida baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. Sajida baji and her husband want to give their children a better future. Sajida baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy livestock (goats, cows) for her husband's meat business.
loan_use: To buy cattle for the meat business

loan_name: Sesame rice crackers, livestock, rice noodles, clothes, wholesale retail Group
description:
chị Vũ thị Tính năm nay 36 tuổi Ms 13050020, vợ chồng chị có 2 con, cả 2 con chị còn nhỏ và đang đi học. Hàng ngày chị và chồng làm nghề tráng bánh đa để bán và chăn nuôi thêm tại nhà. Chị đã vay vốn qua một C. kỳ và hoàn trả vốn rất tốt, C. kỳ này chị lại tiếp tục đăng ký vay ở mức 4.256.000 VND để mua gạo tráng bánh. Trong nhóm chị có các thành viên sau :

  • chị N. thị Chung Ms 13050007 vay mức 4.704.000 VND để chăn nuôi và tráng bánh phở
  • chị Đặng thị Dinh Ms 13050008 vay mức 3.360.000 VND mua vải may quần áo bán
  • chị C. thị Bắc Ms 13050009 vay mức 3.808.000 VND để thêm vốn đi chợ
  • chị Nguyễn thị Liệu Ms 13050010 vay mức 4.704.000 VND vay vốn trồng trọt, chăn nuôi .
description_translated:
Mrs. Tinh Thi V. is 36 years old. She and her husband have two small children, both of whom are going to school. Each day she and her husband make sesame rice crackers to sell and also raise livestock to supplement their income. She has already completed one funding round and has repaid the loan with good conduct. In this round of funding she is registering again for a loan, in the amount of 4,256,000 VND to buy more rice to make the crackers. Her group also includes the following participants:

  • Mrs. Chung Thi Nghiem, requesting 4,704,000 VND to raise livestock and make rice noodles.
  • Mrs. Dinh Thi Dang, requesting 3,360,000 VND to buy fabric for making clothes to sell.
  • Mrs. Bac Thi C., requesting 3,808,000 VND to use as capital for wholesale retail business.
  • Mrs. Lieu Thi Nguyen, requesting 4,704,000 VND to grow plants to sell, and to raise livestock.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Buy more rice, fabric, buy wholesale goods
borrower_names: Thi Tinh, Thi Chung, Thi Băc, Thi Dinh, Thi Liêu

description:
Irshad rani baji is the wife of B. M. and lives in the city named Lahore, in a district called named Walton, Pakistan. She has been married for the last 25 years. She is the mother of five children: four boys and one girl.

Irshad baji's brother has a cigarette shop. Her elder son works with her brother. The next eldest is in 10th standard. The one after him works in a factory. Her younger son wants to be a tailor. Her daughter completed her 10th standard and presently she is free and does household work.

Irshad baji's husband is a daily wage laborer. Irshad baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She has successfully repaid her three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more cigarettes for her brother's cigarette shop.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Mumtaz baji wants a loan to buy wood for her shutter business. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics for her beauty parlor. Bashiran baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle). Nasreen and Shabnam baji each want a loan to buy spare parts for vehicles.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.
loan_use: To buy cigarettes to re-sell
borrower_names: Nasreen, Irshad Rani, Bashiran, Mumtaz, Nasreen, Shabnam
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Sadia I. M. is the wife of I. M. and lives in the Walton area of Lahore City, Pakistan. She has been living in this area for the last seven years. She is the mother of a four-year-old daughter. Sadia baji's husband is a painter, and he paints offices, doors, windows, and walls. For the last four years he has also run a scrap business. Sadia baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She has successfully repaid four loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more scrap parts (iron, wastepaper, and bottles) for her husband to resell.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Niamatay M. Ashraf wants a loan to buy beams for her shuttering business. Rani S. M. wants a loan to buy a donkey cart. Bilquis N. P. M. wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motorized vehicle). Maryam W. M. wants a loan to buy electric supplies (tubes, switches and switch boards) for her electric shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.
loan_use: To buy scrap items (iron, wastepaper, bottles)  to resell

description:
Blanca es casada y tiene 2 hijos: Kelia Mareza de 26 años, Hever Arturo de 23 años, su esposo trabaja en la venta de ropa. Inicio el negocio para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares y del hogar. Empezó hace 5 años vendiendo abarrotes en su casa y poco a poco fue invirtiendo en mercancía hasta lograr establecer su tienda de abarrotes.\r\n

\r\nElla necesita un préstamo por US $350 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu ayuda ella saldrá adelante.
description_translated:
Blanca is married and has 2 kids: Kelia Mareza who is 26 and Hever Arturo who is 23. Her husband works selling clothes. She started her business to help her husband with the family's expenses and household costs. Five years ago she started selling bric-a-brac from her house and bit by bit she invested in merchandise until she was able to open a bric-a-brac shop.\r\n

\r\nShe needs a loan of $350 (which she will repay over a period of 4 months) to buy merchandise. With your help she will move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy merchanside/comprar mercancia

description:
Ariana tiene un pequeño de 6 meses, Raúl Antonio quien es el motor de su vida. Ella inicio el negocio para salir adelante con una actividad que le diera buenos ingresos, y actualmente lo hace para sacar adelante a su hijo ya que ella es la que se hace cargo de la manutención de su pequeño. Comenzó hace 7 años vendiendo comidas en su casa posterior mente rento un local y se amplio.\r\n

\r\nElla necesita un préstamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para invertirlo en su negocio.
description_translated:
Ariana has a six-month-old, Raúl Antonio, who drives everything in her life. She started the business to get ahead through a venture that would provide her with good income. These days she also runs it to help her young child get ahead, given that she is his sole means of support. She started seven years ago selling food from her house, and she subsequently has rented and outfitted a separate space for her enterprise.

She needs a loan of $400 USD, which she will repay over a period of six months, to invest into her business.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase merchandise.

description: Elsa tiene 38 años, vive con 3 de sus 4 hijos y su esposo.  Ella sabe que trabajar en equipo es más loable, por ello, junto a su esposo decidieron abrir un taller de cerrajería desde hace 15 años, el cual les ha servido para poder sostener a sus 4 hijos, realizan todo tipo de fabricaciones metálicas, tanto muebles, como estructuras para el hogar, como ventanas,  puertas, escaleras caracol, techos metálicos, entre otros.Por la calidad de producción, con el paso de los años Elsa y su esposo pueden ver el incremento  de sus clientes, para los cuales a veces es se ha necesario trabajar hasta los días sábados, su esposo se encarga de cortar y soldar, por su parte, Elsa da los acabados de pintando. \r\nEsta pareja de esposo se esfuerza para mejorar cada día la situación de la familia, para que sus hijos puedan superarse cada día más, a través de la educación que puedan solventar.\r\nElsa solicita este préstamo con el que podrá adquirir fierros, materia prima básica para  la elaboración de las construcciones metálicas.
description_translated:
Elsa is 38 years old, lives with 3 of her 4 children and her husband. She knows that working in a team is more commendable, and therefore, together with her husband they decided to open an ironworks shop 15 years ago, which has served to support their 4 children. They make all kinds of metal items, such as furniture, items for the home such as windows, doors, spiral stairs, metal roofs, and more. Because of the quality of their production, over the years Elsa and her husband can see the growth of their customers, and at times they have had to even work on Saturdays. Her husband is in charge of cutting and soldering, and Elsa does the finishing touches and painting. This husband and wife strive to improve their family’s situation every day, so that their children may be successful, and through education they can be free of debt. Elsa asks for a loan with which she will be able to acquire iron, the raw material needed to make the metal items.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Acquire iron, the basic material to make furniture and metal structures

description: Là một phụ nữ rất khéo tay nên hàng ngày ngoài chăn nuôi chị Hoạt còn làm hàng mã để bán nhằm tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2000, đến nay qua 8 năm vay vốn để chăn nuôi và kinh doanh hiện nay kinh tế gia đình chị Hoạt đã rất phát triển. Chồng chị ngoài  thời gian đi làm công nhân tại nhà máy Z151 cũng hỗ trợ chị rất nhiều trong công việc chăn nuôi vì thế chị cũng có nhiều thời gian hơn để đầu tư cho công việc sản xuất và kinh doanh hàng mã của mình. Hiện tại anh chị đang sống cùng hai người con đã trưởng thành. Các con chị đều có công việc ổn định nên hàng tháng đều hỗ trợ bố mẹ thêm về kinh tế. Với nguồn thu nhập ổn định từ chăn nuôi, kinh doanh  và lương của chồng cuộc sống của gia đình chị ngày càng tốt hơn. Chị mong muốn được vay thêm vốn để đầu tư mở rộng mô hình chăn nuôi phát triển kinh tế gia đình.\r\n Mức vốn xin vay 15.000.000đ
description_translated:
Ms. H. is considered to be very skilled with her hands, so besides raising farm animals she also makes fine paper crafts to help with the family’s income. She has been a member of this funding since 2000. After 8 years of investing into her business and raising livestock, her family’s income has increased and since been steady. Ms. H. husband also contributes his time caring for the farm animals, in addition to his regular job at the Z151 Company. Her husband help has allowed Ms. H. more time to focus in on her business. They also have two grown children who also live with them. Her children are grown and both of them are able to contribute to the family financially with jobs of their own. Her family is able to live a better life with the resources coming in from her business, agriculture, and her husband’s job. She hopes to borrow a loan of 15.000.000d to help remodel and expand her farm.

Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Business

description:
Matlyuba R. is 44 years old. She is married and the loving mother 4 children. She worked for 2 years in a gift shop, and thanks to the savings of her husband, 9 years ago she was able to start her own business. She now sells clothing for children. She gets help from her children, who take care of the store in the afternoon.

\r\n\r\nThanks to her hard work, her customers increased and she had to rent the store next door to expand and offer a better variety. She is now requesting a loan of 4100 Somoni (1200 USD) which she will use to buy school uniforms for children due to the season. She commits to repay the loan over a period of 10 months. Matlyuba is thankful for your generosity and help.
loan_use: Purchasing school uniforms for children to increase her range of goods

description: O. Samoeurn is 51 years old and sells roasted bananas in her village, while her husband, Heng Davut works as a motorcycle taxi driver. O. earns approximately $1.27 per day and her husband earns around $2.50 per day. Together, they have five children, one of whom is married, living in Ratanak Commune in the Battambang Province.  Another one of her sons is a construction worker.  She also has two daughters who are employed as garment workers.  Unfortunately, the income of O.'s husband has been declining due to a shift away from motorcyle taxis.  After several discussions, O. and her husband decided that purchasing a higher quality motorcycle would attract more customers and therefore strengthen his daily income.  Therefore, O. is requesting a loan of $1,000, which will be used to purchase  a new motorcycle for her husband (who is pictured with their son).
loan_use: To purchase a motorcycle to instead existing old one

description: Magatte N. est une femme agée de 59 ans. Elle habite à Bambey au quartier DVF, malgré son age , elle s'adonne au commerce de bijoux et de tissus depuis quatre ans.Elle tire des revenus subtentiels sur ce commerce. Avec les fetes qui s'approchent, elle veut renforcer son stock et  sollicite ce pret à cet effet.
description_translated:
Magatte N. is 59 years old. She lives in the DVF neighborhood of Bambey and, despite her age, she has devoted herself to the sale of jewelry and fabrics for four years. She generates a great deal of revenue in this business. She is requesting this loan to strengthen her supply for the upcoming holiday.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Jewelry and fabric sales

description:
Ingrid tiene 38 años, actualmente vive  con su esposo y dos hijos.
Desde hace 8 años trabaja en su propio tienda, la necesidad de emprender su propio negocio fue a raíz de no querer trabajar fuera de casa, para atender a sus pequeños hijos que necesitan del calor de una madre, por tal motivo instaló la bodega en su mismo domicilio, aprovechando que se encuentra en una zona céntrica de su localidad, además le permite estar al tanto de los quehaceres de su hogar, todo el día es la atención de su bodega, en la cual vende todo tipo de mercadería, desde gaseosas, golosinas hasta abarrotes, Ingrid disfruta de realizar esta actividad cada día y no considera dificultades que pueda mencionar.
El motivo de su esfuerzo es por ver crecer a sus hijos con una estabilidad económica para educarlos.
Ingrid solicita este préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de mercadería y de esa manera aumentar su capital de trabajo.
description_translated:
Ingrid is 38 years old and lives with her husband and two sons. For 8 years she has worked in her own store, the necessity of launching her own business began when she didn’t want to work outside the home so she could care for her small children who needed their mother. So she opened a store in her own home, taking advantage that she is located centrally in her area. In addition this enabled her to get the household chores done and attend to her store all day, where she sells all kinds of merchandise, from soda pop, candy to groceries. Ingrid enjoys working every day and doesn’t consider herself to have any particular difficulties that she can mention. The motive behind her efforts is to see her children grow in a economically stable home and provide them an education. Ingrid asks for this loan to invest in purchasing merchandise and in this way increase her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Increase the quantity of merchandise in her store

description:
Elisa, de 49 años de edad, socia del Banco Comunal “Unión Pedregal”, sueña con tener un negocio propio, como un restaurante. 

Debido a que ella realiza actividades en su barrio, la venta de alimentos como las tamaladas, polladas y otros, beneficia en parte a su familia, a pesar de contar con ingresos que genera su esposo, también (su esposo) colabora junto a sus tres menores hijos con la realización de este negocio. 

Elena prepara los alimentos en su casa, el cual está ubicada en el barrio de pedregal alto en la ciudad de Huaraz, luego lo distribuye a pedido de los clientes. La mayor dificultad está en que a veces los clientes no le pagan a tiempo, pero aún así, ella espera tener un local donde pueda tener un negocio de servicio de restaurante.

Con el préstamo de S/. 500, el cual pagará en 4 meses, invertirá en insumos para sus polladas, platos y tenedores descartables que lo almacenará para las próximas actividades.
description_translated:
Elisa is 49 years old and is a member of the communal bank “Union Pedregal.” Her dream is to have her own restaurant.

She works selling food such as tamaladas and polladas in her neighborhood in order to benefit her family. Even though they count on her husband’s income, her husband and her three small children also help Elisa with her business.

Elisa prepares the food in her home which is located in the pedregal alto neighborhood in the city of Huaraz. She then distributes her clients’ orders. Her biggest difficulty is that her clients sometimes do not pay her in time. Even so, she hopes to be able to have her own business space where she can establish a restaurant.

With this $175 loan - which she will repay in four months - she will purchase ingredients for her polladas, plates and disposable forks.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase of ingredients for her buisiness.

description: Afif is 53 years old, married, and has three children. He lives in a small village of the West Bekaa. Afif owns a small restaurant and also has a small piece of farmland next to his home that he cultivates. Because of the high cost of the raw materials needed for his business, Afif decided to further develop his farm to raise animals, in particular poultry breeding. He needs a loan of $US1,200 to finalize construction of the chicken farm. This is the first time Afif has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.
loan_use: Construct a poultry farm

description: F. Saiyod is 30 years old. He is married with 3 children. Saiyod is an optimistic, hardworking father. He works in his vineyard with love and dedication every day so that it produces excellent fruit.\r\n\r\nSaiyod has been in agribusiness for more than 6 years. In fact, he draws strength and vitality to make his products the best in the city. Though growing grapes is a very difficult and a time-consuming job, he hopes to gather a rich harvest. He is planning to fix the house and save enough money to pay for his kids at school. With this purpose he is requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni (600 USD) which he has committed to repay within 9 months. With the desire to realize his plan, Saiyod appeals to your generous hearts for a swift contribution.
loan_use: Purchasing of the mineral fertilizer and paying labour power for growing vineyard

description: Носирлоева Хосият  жительница района Дж.Руми. Возраст 42 года,вдова,имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Клиентка имеет на местном рынке торговую точку,где торгует  зап.частями для велосипедов.Этот вид бизнеса является основным источником дохода ее большой семьи. В данный момент она хочет закупить товар у оптовых поставщиков.Планирует погасить кредит в тчении 12 месяцев.
description_translated:
Hosiyat N. lives in the J. Rumy region. She is 42 years old, is a widow and has 4 children. Hosiyat has a high school education. She has a sales location at the local market where she sells bicycle parts. This business is the main source of income for her large family. Right now, she would like to purchase products from wholesalers. Hosiyat plans to pay back her loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase additional products for sale

description:
Narayan Devi M., 40 years old, lives in Kritipur, Kathmandu. She lives in a nuclear family with her 45-year-old husband Sri Krishna M. and two sons who are studying in grades 11 and 12 respectively. Her husband works in a private office.

\r\n\r\nHer economic condition was so weak that she could hardly fulfill the basic needs of her family. So she opened her tailoring shop five years ago. Other tailoring shops are not available near her shop. The number of her customers is increasing by day, so she seeks a loan of Rs. 25000/- to buy another machine and employ a tailor to meet the demand of her customers. She will be happy if she earns more to spend for her children's education and for the betterment of her family.
loan_use: To buy another sewing machine

description:
Jasminka‡ is 54 years old and she is from Lukavac. She is married and her husband is employed. Her husband helps her with paying for household expenses and school for their daughter. He earns 680 KM a month. Jasminka sells milk and milk products and in this way she earn about 150 KM monthly.

\r\n\r\nThis is her first loan with Women for Women International in the amount of 600 KM. She will use this loan to buy a calf for reselling. She has her own food for cattle, which she produces in her field. Her wish is to buy more cattle for reselling.
loan_use: To buy a calf

description: Doña Esperanza tiene 47 años de edad, habita en Hialeah en Managua, casada y con cinco hijos mayores de edad, los cuales los tres la ayudan con los gastos, su esposo trabaja en servicios de seguridad. Actualmente ella cuida a dos niños  desde hace un año, esta iniciativa la hizo con el propósito de ayudar a los gastos de su hogar ya que no se le hace tan difícil, y son ingresos propios de ella. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para hacer un baño y comprar un inodoro ya que no tiene,  esto le va permitir mejor comodidad como e higiene en su familia porque actualmente tienen una letrina. A largo plazo es poder terminar de construir su casa con las comodidades que se merece su familia.
description_translated:
Doña Esperanza is 47 years old and lives in Hialeah in Managua. She is married with five adult children, three of whom help with the expenses. Her husband works in security services. She has been caring for two children for a year now with the aim of helping with living costs as it is not so difficult, and the earnings are her own. The loan application is for purchasing a bath and a toilet, items which they don’t have. This will allow better comfort and health for her family because they now have a latrine. In the long term, she wishes to finish building her house with the comforts that her family deserves.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Construction of hygenic service within her home

description: Samiha A., 49 years old and single, lives with her elderly mother in a village in the Northern Bekaa Valley. Samiha owns a grocery shop, her only source of income, and is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more merchandise so as to be able to offer a larger choice of products to her regular clients. This is Samiha’s first loan request from Al Majmoua.
loan_use: To purchase more merchandise

description:
Mounira S. is 41 years old, married, and has 3 children. She lives in a small village located in Northern Lebanon, close to Baalback. Mounira is an energetic woman who has a mini-market in town which sells many household staples such as bread and oil, as well as fresh chicken.

\r\n\r\nMounira has asked Al Majmoua for a loan of US$ 1200 to purchase a more diverse array of goods for her shop. Mounira has been a client of Al Majmoua for the past 4 years.
loan_use: To diversify product offerings at Mounira's mini-market

description: Angelina Y. sells oil and other food items at Duakor which is a small town near Elmina. She also prepares gari (a popular food) for sale. Cassava is used for the preparation of gari. Angelina has received a senior high school education. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a security guard. Angelina has been selling gari, oil and other food items since 1985. She is responsible for helping in the payment of the children's school fees and other utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more gari and different kinds of cooking oil for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest for the expansion of her business.
loan_use: To buy more cassava for the gari production and different kinds of cooking oil for sale.

description:
Sabina O. was born in 1974 and she is from Kalesija. She is married and has two children, one 11 and the other 14 years old. Her husband is employed and he helps her with paying for food and the other things.\r\n

\r\nThis is Sabina's first loan with Women for Women International, in the amount of 1200 KM ($US900). Sabina will use this loan to buy poultry. She wants to work more with poultry and in that way she will make better conditions of living for her family.
loan_use: To buy poultry.

description:
Norma inicio su negocio porque tenia muchos gastos ya que 2 de sus hijos estudian la secundaria y el mas pequeño de 7 años esta en la primaria, fue entonces que para ayudar a su esposo busco una actividad que le brindara ingresos y con ayuda de su cuñada quien la enseño hace 2 años a vender productos plásticos ella poco a poco esta logrando una estabilidad económica a través de sus ventas.\r\n

\r\nElla solicita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía ya que la falta de capital hace que se le caigan algunas ventas. Con tu ayuda Norma saldrá adelante.
description_translated:
Norma began her business because she had a lot of expenses. Now her two older children are in middle school and the smallest, seven years old, is in elementary. To help her husband cover household expenses, Norma looked for a means of earning income. With the help of her sister-in-law, who taught her how to sell Tupperware two years ago, Norma is using her sales to slowly achieve economic stability. Norma is asking for a loan of US $250 to buy merchandise. She currently lacks the capital because her sales have fallen. She’ll repay the loan in three months. With your help Norma will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Buy merchandise

description: La Sra. Maricruz vive con su mama a ellas les esta haciendo falta un cuarto mas ya que la casa está muy reducida ella quieres construir una recamara en la planta alta de la casa para así ampliar mas la sala y cocina. \r\nMaricruz trabaja como vendedora de productos de belleza esté es su ingreso familiar ella tiene una hija de edad escolar.\r\nLa Sra. Maricruz está solicitando un préstamo de $925.00 dlls para la construcción de un cuarto para ella y su hija.
description_translated:
Mrs. Maricruz lives with her mother, and they’d like to build and additional room for their small house. They’ll build it on the upper floor of the house to expand the living room and the kitchen as well. Maricruz works selling beauty products and this is the family’s main source of income. She has a school-age daughter. Mrs. Maricruz is asking for a loan of $925 dlls to build the room for herself and her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Build a room

description:
La señora Orfith, socia del Banco Comunal “Judith Tuanama”  vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de El Dorado, distrito de San José de Sisa. Se dedica a la venta de pollos eviscerados. El negocio se ubica en el mercado de la localidad, lugar donde tiene un puesto de venta y donde acuden a diario a comprar gran cantidad de clientes. También reparte a las señoras que venden comida y bodegas de la ciudad. 

Con este crédito de S/. 2,200, el cual cancelará en 6 cuotas, comprará pollos en grandes cantidades para luego sacrificarlos y poder proveer a sus clientes de la ciudad, además comprará ganados para criarlos y venderos cuando sea necesario.

Orfith es una mujer entusiasta de 28 años de edad. Se siente contenta de estar alcanzando sus objetivos propuestos, pues tiene asegurada su venta. Su meta es crecer más en el negocio y poder darles una profesión a sus hijos.
description_translated:
Mrs. Orfith, member of the “Judith Tuanama” Community Bank, lives in the region of San Martín, El Dorado province, district of San José de Sisa. She makes a living selling chickens whose entrails have already been removed. Her business is situated in the local market, where she has a regular stand and where large quantities of clients frequent daily. She also sells to neighborhood women who sell food and to grocery stores around the city. With this loan of S/.2,200, which she will repay in six installments, she hopes to buy large quantities of chickens to slaughter as necessary to provide for her clients. She also hopes to buy livestock, which she will raise and sell when necessary. Mrs. Orfith is an enthusiastic woman of 28 years of age. She is happy to be given the possibility of reaching her proposed objectives. Her ultimate goal is to further expand her business and to see her children enter a profession.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Wholesale purchasing of chicken.
town_name: San José de Sisa - San Martin

description: Ninfa, a su corta edad (22) sufrió la penosa perdida de su esposo Fredy de 23 años de edad, con quien tenía muchos planes y proyectos en la vida, desde entonces, trata de sobre llevar este episodio y salir adelante junto a su pequeño niño, quien la motiva a cumplir con los sueños y proyectos que algún día tuvo con su compañero.Esta joven madre pone su mejor esfuerzo y creatividad  en cada una de las prendas que teje, gracias a eso, tiene  gran cantidad  de  solicitudes, por ello recurre a este préstamo, dinero que será invertido en adquirir variedad de lana, para seguir tejiendo sus prendas y cumplir satisfactoriamente con los pedidos de sus exigentes clientes.
description_translated:
Ninfa, a su corta edad (22) sufrió la penosa perdida de su esposo Fredy de 23 años de edad, con quien tenía muchos planes y proyectos en la vida, desde entonces, trata de sobre llevar este episodio y salir adelante junto a su pequeño niño, quien la motiva a cumplir con los sueños y proyectos que algún día tuvo con su compañero.Esta joven madre pone su mejor esfuerzo y creatividad en cada una de las prendas que teje, gracias a eso, tiene gran cantidad de solicitudes, por ello recurre a este préstamo, dinero que será invertido en adquirir variedad de lana, para seguir tejiendo sus prendas y cumplir satisfactoriamente con los pedidos de sus exigentes clientes.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase of wool so she can sew in order to be able to meet the demand of her clients.

description: Mrs. Le Thi K., aged 50, has been in TYM Fund since 2003. With the first loan worth VND 2 million, she bought and sold pork. Before joining TYM, she was experienced in this job. So since she had more capital, her business has been more profitable. Besides this business, her family raises some buffalos and pigs. Therefore, her economy is stable with the total income of VND 4.5 million/month. For the next loan cycle, she wants to borrow VND 9 million to buy and sell more pork.
description_translated:
Note: the original description is in English.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: to buy and sell more pork.

description: Thierno Omar S. est un boutiquier qui habite au quartier Malamine Senghor de Thiés. Depuis dix ans ,il gére une boutique d'alimentation générale.C'est dans le but de renforcer son stock de marchandises afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle qu'il sollicite ce pret.
description_translated:
Thierno Omar S. is a shopkeeper who lives in the Malamine Senghor district of Thiés. For ten years, he has been managing a grocery store. It is with the goal of bolstering his stock of merchandise that he is requesting this loan, so he may satisfy his customers better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To bolster his stock of merchandise

description:
Oksana is married. She owns a small business in the town of Vinogradovo, Western Ukraine. It is a small store selling clothing items. There's no high competition in the area where she works. The favorable location coupled with financial assistance from Nadiya Ukraine have been the factors that impacted growth of her business.

Oksana likes to work in the sphere of trade. She has been working in it for three years during which she faced different challenges such as shaky sale trends, bad timing and other vagaries that can afflict a startup. A combination of core commercial skills, creative enthusiasm and determination to succeed have been her motivating factors.

Oksana would like to get a loan of 5000 Grivnas ($US1,075) which she believes would help her not only sustain her business but also promote its significant growth.
loan_use: To increase range of inventory in her clothing store.

description: Ruth es una muchachita de 18 años, a su corta edad, es propietaria de un taller de artesanía de tejidos, lugar donde ofrece trabajo a otros dos jóvenes, con quienes hacen un equipo perfecto para el cumplimiento de sus pedidos.Ella adquirió sus conocimientos de su madre, quien con paciencia y dedicación le inculcó este bello  arte.Actualmente  se dedica a la confección de hermosos y coloridos chuchos, chalinas, medias y guantes, que son vendidos al por mayor  en la ciudad capital, Lima. El deseo de esta joven es adquirir materia prima para cumplir con sus  pedidos y seguir prosperando en este noble oficio que la va llenando de satisfacciones.
description_translated:
Ruth is a young 18 year old woman, and at her young age, she is the owner of a workshop for fabric artisanry, where she offers work to to other young people, who make a perfect team for completing their orders. She acquired her knowledge from her mother, who with patience and dedication taught her this beautiful art. Actually she makes beautiful and colorful chuchos, chalinas, medias and gloves, which are sold mostly in the capital city, Lima. The hope of this young woman is to acquire fine material to complete her orders and continue prospering in this noble work which is filling her with satisfaction.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Increasing the material she uses for her work

description:
Rene owns a restaurant in the 16 de Noviembre neighborhood in the tropical Santa Cruz region of eastern Bolivia. He and his wife own their own home in the same neighborhood and have two children, both students, who are 16 and 20 years old and help their parents out in the restaurant. The restaurant offers lunch each day and has many regular customers.

There is a lot of competition with other lunch counters, but Rene's prices are very low, which allows him to maintain a loyal customer base. The restaurant also has very high hygienic standards and the food is high quality, so the business is very stable.

Rene and his wife will use this loan to buy more tables and chairs for their restaurant so that they can seat more clients, as well as new dishes and silverware.

The couple has excellent credit history. This is their fourth loan with AgroCapital, and they have never gotten behind on their payments.
loan_use: Buy tables, chairs, dishes and silverware for restuarant

description:
Eam H., 64, is an elderly rice farmer who lives with two of her children. Living in Kampong Cham, she and her husband are able to make around US$ 1.50 per day. One of their sons works selling firewood to the local people.

\r\n\r\n Mrs. Eam would like to borrow through Kiva to increase the quantity of wood for sale for her son. This will allow her son to make more profit to support the family. In the future, she plans to open another business selling groceries.
loan_use: To increase the quantity of wood for sale for her son

description: Née vers 1975 dans un village de Porto Novo, dame O. Yabo a épousé à monsieur ODJO Pierre. Elle est mère de 02 enfants, Annick et Gwladys, tous à sa charge et scolarisés. Elle vend des tomates en boîtes  qu'elle achète du Nigeria et qu'elle livre immédiatement au marché à ses clientes qui l'attendent déjà. A cause de la cherté de la vie que nous traversons actuellement et de la flambée des prix, elle s'est rapprochée de notre institution pour obtenir un prêt afin de mieux se positionner sur le marché.
description_translated:
Born around 1975 in a village in Porto Novo, Mrs. Yabo O. is married to Mr. Pierre Odjo. She is the mother of two children, Annick and Gwladys, and she is responsible for both the children who are still in school. She sells tinned tomatoes that she buys in Nigeria and delivers immediately to the market to her customers who are already waiting. Because of the rising cost of living that we are undergoing at present and the price hikes, she came to our institution to obtain a loan so as to better position herself in the marketplace.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: purchase of 50 cases of canned goods (tomatoes)

description: 18 mujeres conforman  la asociación “Nuevo Corazón” que trabaja en el centro focal de Germán Buch ubicada en la zona de Huayna Potosí de la ciudad de El Alto. Ellas tienen diversas actividades, venden refrescos, elaboran almuerzos, pero una actividad común entre ellas es la confección de ropa ligera (blusas, camisas, vestido) luego de su confección la venden en puestos fijos que tienen el la Ceja de El alto. Necesitan capital para la compra de maquinaria especial, para poder aumentar su producción, están seguras que con esta inversión, generaran mayores ingresos, con lo que podrán responder  a sus créditos y mantener equilibrio económico en sus hogares.
description_translated:
Eighteen women make up the group “Nuevo Corazon.” They work in the German Buch focal center located in the Huayna Potosi zone in the city of El Alto. They have diverse businesses such as selling soft drinks and making lunches but a common business for all is making clothing (shirts, blouses, dresses). After the clothing is made, they sell it in stalls they have in the “Ceja” of El Alto. They need capital to purchase special machinery to increase their production. They are certain that with this investment they will generate greater income with which they will be able to repay their loans and maintain the economic equilibrium of their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase of special machinery for making clothing.
borrower_names: Pascuala, Viviana, Amalia, Zulema, Jenny, Carlota, Alicia, Rosa, Paulina, Crsitina, Lordes, Felipa, Maria, Bernarda, Elena, Justina, Agreda, Fransisca
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, false, false, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Rous S. is a 61 year old woman living in Penh, Cambodia. She is a widow and sells Khmer cake from her home to earn a living and is able to make $6 per day. She has two children, one works at garment factory while the other sells fruit at a market. Mrs. Rous would like a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorbike for her son’s commute to work. This will save her son money that would be spent on taxi fare bringing fruit to and from the market.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.
loan_use: To purchase a motorbike for her son's commute to work.

description: R. Odilboy is 22 years old. He lives in Isfara with his parents. Despite his young age, Odilboy has already become the main bread-winner in his family. Odilboy is a dynamic and ambitious young man who is very professional and focused on his business. He has a business selling cement at the building materials market. He has been in this business for 5 years and has gained a rich variety of experiences. He has a special warehouse where he safely keeps his goods. He knows how to save cement so that it doesn’t deteriorate. All this allows Odilboy to make his business quite successful and it brings in stable income for the family.
