With money from his business he is also able to pay for his university fees. Today, knowing that the price of the cement is low but will increase soon, he wants to purchase more goods. For this reason, he is asking a loan of $750 for the term of 6 months. He wants to use the money that he earns from his business to pay for his wedding. Odilboy expresses his gratitude to everyone for supporting him.
loan_use: Purchasing cement

description: Mr. Tith P. was born in 1986, and he now lives in Roneam Tnort Village in Takeo Province. \r\n\r\nHe is single, and he is a farmer and duck breeder. Since his second business is going well, he wants to buy more ducks to raise, so he decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducks for breeding. He hopes to improve his living conditions with this loan.
loan_use: To buy more ducks for breeding.

description: Doña Mercedes tiene 55 años de edad,  es una mujer luchadora, desde muy joven ha trabajo en la venta de cosméticos  lo cual fue un comienzo como comerciante,  e inició con fondos propios, ella habita en un barrio llamado el Pilar de la ciudad de Managua, tiene un hijo de 17 años de edad, es casada, su esposo trabaja desempeñándose como contador. Doña Mercedes logro poner una pulpería hace trece años, su dificultad ha sido falta de capital para crecer mas. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para invertir en capital de productos para la pulpería pues quiere surtir de toda variedad de productos para tener una mejor oferta hacia sus clientes. Espera poder seguir ampliando el negocio hasta convertirlo en una miscelánea que es el mayor anhelo de Doña Mercedes
description_translated:
Doña Mercedes is 55 years old. She is a fighting woman. From a very young age she has worked selling cosmetics. This was her start as a businesswoman, and she began with her own funds. She lives in a neighborhood called Pilar, in the city of Managua. She has a 17 year old son and is married. Her husband works very hard as an accountant. Doña Mercedes began a paper store three years ago. Her biggest challenge has been a lack of capitol that keeps the business from growing larger. With the help of this loan, that will be invested in an inventory of products for the paperstore, she wants to stock a large variety of products in order to have a better selection for her clients. She hopes to be able to continue growing her business until she can change it into a variety store. This is the biggest dream of Doña Mercedes.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To invest in products for a paperstore

description:
Soy K., aged 49, is married and works with her husband, Soam Kean, 48, to grow rice and rear pigs. On average, she makes around US$2.50 in profits each day. Farming has become increasingly difficult as the weather is unreliable and inflation is spiralling upwards this year. This couple has five children, one of whom is married and four others who are employed in different industries. 

Soy is requesting a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a cow to help plow her farm, and to purchase more pigs. 

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor as well as small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.
loan_use: To purchase a cow to plow her farm, as well as more pigs to rear

description: Mrs. Soeung L., 46, sells a variety of grocery products and earns US $2.00 per day. Her husband, Mr. Ngok Hov, 40, is a motorcycle taxi driver. They live in Orchar Commune, Battambang Province, and have five children, all of whom are studying in school and living in the family home. They have discussed increasing their income. Facing the obstacle of lacking capital, L. requested a Kiva loan of US $400 to buy a second-hand motorcycle to replace her husband's old one for his business and to use the rest to stock more groceries to sell. The loan will enable them to increase their income to sustain her family's expenses.
loan_use: To buy a second-hand motorcycle for her husband's business and more groceries to sell

description:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 32 year-old Joyce M..  She is not married and has one child, aged 1. In 2003, Joyce established her crops business. Joyce has already received and successfully repaid three loans from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more crops in bulk. She thanks you for your support.  

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment Ð a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement
loan_use: To buy more crops in bulk.

description:
Sean C., 30, is married with two young children living at home in the Siem Reap province. She and her husband, Nin Phat, work together catching fish from the river and then selling their catch at the local market. They earn approximately four dollars each day.

Sean also owns another business selling food products from her home. Soft drinks, beer, cake and ice are a few of the products she sells to the people in her area. The two businesses are going smoothly but she still needs more income to improve her standard of living.

She has told a loan officer that she wants her children to take a higher class so they will be able to get better jobs in the future. To double the family's income, she is requesting a loan of US$500 to add to the number of fish they sell in the market. The balance of the loan will be used to purchase more fishing tools.
loan_use: To increase the number of fish to sell at the market and to purchase more fishing tools.

description: Dame T. Félicienne est dans la vente d'igname, des oignons et des cossettes d'igname depuis une dizaine d'années. Elle vend également des condimlents aux habitants de son quartier. Elle se rend généralement au  grand marché Tokpa pour ses achats. Elle envisage très prochainement se rendre au nord du pays pour faire de plus importante achats. Agée de 34 ans, elle est originaire de  Savè dans le département des Collines. Elle vient solliciter ce prêt pour renforcer son commerce.
description_translated:
Ms. Félicienne T. has been selling yams, onions, and yam cossettes (sun-dried slices of yams) for a dozen years. She also sells condiments to the residents of her district. She generally goes to the Tokpa marketplace for her purchases. She very soon envisions going up north to make more sizable purchases. She is 34 years old and originally from Savè, in the county of Collines. She has come to request this loan to bolster her commerce. \r\n

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy 100 kg of yams and 2 sacks of onions

description:
La señora Madeleyne Rodríguez U. tiene treintaiocho años  y vive en la calle soledad sin número del distrito de Mache, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió hasta  tercer año de primaria,  ya no siguió estudiando porque sus padres eran negociantes y ella tenía que ayudar en el negocio dedicándose al cuidado de los animales.
Se casó de diecisiete años con el señor Miguel Carranza Castillo y tienen tres hijos los que todavía son estudiantes.
Su negocio consiste en la compraventa de animales, reses, cerdos y ovejas, los compran de las chacras y los venden en las plazas pecuarias a mejor precio. Su negocio se ubica en las plazas pecuarias de Julcán y Otuzco.
Recuerda con gratitud que Manuela Ramos le otorgó un préstamo de 300 soles por primera vez, con lo que compró productos para una bodega que tenía en ese tiempo. “Se vendía mucha golosina porque mi casa está muy cerca de la escuela” comenta Madeleyne. El préstamo lo devolvió en cuatro meses.
Con este préstamo de S/ 2000 soles, el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas, comprará dos terneros, para ser vendidos en la plaza pecuaria de Julcán.
Tiene un gran sueño y es el de conocer Europa.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres de Trabajo desde hace aproximadamente diez años.
description_translated:
Madeleyne Rodríguez U. is 38 years old and lives on Soledad Street in the district of Mache, province of Otuzco, department of La Libertad, Perú. She studied up to third grade of primary school, but did not continue her studies because her parents were merchants and she had to help out in their business by taking care of the animals. She married Miguel Carranza Castillo when she was 17 years old and they have three children who are students. Their business is the purchase and sale of animals: cows, pigs and sheep. They buy them from farms and sell them at livestock markets for a higher price. The business is located in the livestock markets at Julcán and Otuzco. She remembers with gratitude the first time that Manuela Ramos granted her a loan for 300 soles, with which she bought products for a small general store she had at that time. "A lot of sweets were sold because my house was very close to a school," says Madeleyne. That loan was repaid in four months. With this loan for S/2000 soles, which will be repaid in four payments, she will buy two calves to be resold in the livestock market at Julcán. She has a huge dream and that is to go to Europe. She has belonged to the Working Women Communal Bank for approximately 10 years.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Buy livestock (two calves).

description:
Mina M., 28 years old, lives in Kritipur, Kathmandu. She lives in a single family household with 4 family members: her husband, 30-year-old Shyam M., and two sons who are six years and two years old.

\r\n\r\nShe and her husband work together in their furniture shop. She needs a loan to purchase some materials for their shop like wood, a saw and other items. She seeks Rs 10000/-for her shop in order to earn more and maintain the family .
loan_use: To buy timber and a saw

description:
La señora Rusbi, socia del Banco comunal “Mujeres de la Colina II”, vive en el  Departamento y Provincia de San Martín, Distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de verduras y frutas de manera ambulatoria en el mercado de la ciudad. Los clientes son las personas que también venden verduras pero en menor cantidad.

Con este préstamo de S/.800, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará  verduras en sacos como papa, cebollas, arvejas, apio, poro, zapallo, lechuga para tener bien surtido su puesto y los clientes encuentren lo que buscan.

Rusbi tiene 25 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su pequeño hijo, por quien trabaja para salir adelante. Le gusta el negocio y mantenerse ocupada. Su meta es tener su propio puesto en el mercado, en vista que vende de manera ambulatoria.
description_translated:
Señora Rusbi, member of the community bank "Mujeres de la Colina II," lives in the province of San Martín, district of Tarapoto. She is dedicated to selling vegetables and fruits in a traveling manner at the markets of the city. The clients are people who also sell vegetables but in smaller quantities. With this loan of 800 Soles, which will be repaid in six months, she will buy vegetables in sacks like potatoes, onions, peas, celery, gourds, and lettuce to expand her business and so her clients can buy what they are seeking. Rusbi is 25 years old. She lives with her husband and her little son, for whom she is working. She likes the business and it keeps her busy. Her goal is to have her own stand at the market, because right now she sells her goods in a travelling manner.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: vegetables in sacks (potatoes, onions, celery, peas, gourds, lettuce, etc.

description:
La señora Silvia, socia del Banco Comunal “Tesoro Escondido“, vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. Se dedica a la venta de golosinas y bebidas. El negocio está ubicado en su propia casa en la Prolongación Loreto No 280. 

Se inicia en el negocio ante la necesidad de generar ingresos para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos de la casa, aprovecha que su casa está ubicada en un lugar estratégico, y ya tiene buena cantidad de clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/.3,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, con dicho capital comprará productos como gaseosas de diferentes marcas, sabores y tamaños, frugos (Pulpin, Cifrut), agua mineral, galletas, yogurt de diferentes tamaños sabores y marcas, también quiere surtir su negocio con abarrotes, para ello comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, aceite en botella de litro, huevos en javas, leche en caja, productos de aseo personal y detergente debido  a que estos artículos  son muy requeridos por los clientes. 

Silvia tiene 37 años de edad, vive con su esposo y con 2 de sus hijos, motivo de su lucha y dedicación constante a sus actividades diarias. Por su carisma y amabilidad en la atención atrae a los clientes, cree que tener un negocio surtido también garantiza las ventas. Su meta es surtir más su negocio.
description_translated:
Señora Silvia, member of the community bank "Tesoro Escondido" (Hidden Treasure), lives in the region San Martín, province of Mariscal Cáceres, district of Juanjui. She is dedicated to the sales of sweets and beverages. The business is located in her own home at 280 Prolongación Loreto. She began the business when faced with the need to generate income to support her husband in the household costs. She took advantage of her house's good location and already has a good quantity of clients. With this loan of 3,000 Soles, which will be repaid in six months, she will buy products like sodas of different brands, flavors, and sizes, frugos (Pulpin, Cifrut - beverages), mineral water, cookies, yogurts of different sizes, flavors, and brands. Also, she wants to expand her business with groceries, and for this, she will buy rice and sugar in sacks, one-liter bottles of oil, eggs, boxed milk, personal toiletries, and detergent, because these items are requested often by her clients. Silvia is 37 years old, lives with her husband and two of her children; they are her motivation to fight and dedicate herself always to her daily activities. Due to her charisma and friendliness, she attracts a lot of customers. She believes that an expanded business guarantees sales. Her goal is to expand her business more.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Products like sodas, mineral water, cookies, yogurt, etc.

description:
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Legión.

Nancy es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 3 hijos, Nancy tiene su casa en el barrio de Santa Elena, Nanci junto a su esposo venden artículos diversos, dependiendo de la demanda como guantes, sombreros, frutas, lentes, pescado y entre otros productos novedosos, actividad que realizan caminando en toda la ciudad de Ayacucho, para lo cual cuentan con un triciclo y en algunas oportunidades viajan a los distintos pueblos de la región.

Nancy necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de sombreros y lentes. Nancy sueña con comprar un terreno en el centro de la ciudad para construir un local y abrir una tienda estable y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
description_translated:
Nancy is a member of the Bank Communal Legión. Nancy is a partner, is 31 years old, and has 3 children, Nancy has a house in the neighborhood of Santa Elena. Nancy and her husband sell various items, depending on demand, such as gloves, hats, fruit, glasses, and fish among other original products. They walk across the city of Ayacucho and occasionally use their tricycle to travel to various cities in the region Nancy needs a loan of $525, which she will invest in the purchase of hats and glasses. Nancy dreams of purchasing land in the center of the city to build and open a stable shop and also that her children complete their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: For the purchase of hats and glasses

description:
La señora María Z. D. Gutiérrez  tiene 59 años vive en la Avenida Primavera sin número del distrito D. Mache provincia D. Otuzco,  departamento D. la Libertad  Perú.
Cursó hasta el tercer año D. Primaria y no continuo estudiando porque no contaba con el apoyo económico D. sus padres, tuvo que trabajar desD. muy pequeña y no podía ir a la escuela.
Se casó D. dieciséis años con el señor Víctor Gutiérrez y tuvieron dos hijas mujeres y un hijo varón, una D. sus hijas falleció a causa D. neumonía.  Su hijo varón y su hija mujer ahora viven cerca D. ella pero ya no dependen económicamente, son casados.
Tiene un negocio que consiste en comprar animales, engordarlos y venderlos en carne, lo realiza en su propia casa.
Manifiesta que gracias a Manuela Ramos obtuvo un préstamo D. 300 con lo que compró dos cerdos y algunos cuyes los que volvió a vender en muy buen precio, devolvió su préstamo en cuatro meses. D. esto ya hace mucho tiempo  manifiesta.
Con este préstamo D. 600 soles y comprará cerdos y gallinas, que los venderá en carne porque así obtendrá mejores ganancias. Su préstamo lo devolverá en cuatro meses.
María pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres D. Trabajo, es una socia que está muy contenta con su Banco.
Su gran sueño es reunir a toda su familia y celebrar una gran fiesta.
description_translated:
Mrs. Maria Z. D. G. is 59 years old and lives on Primavera Avenue in Mache, Otuzco in the state of La Libertad, Peru. She studied through the 3rd year of elementary school but could not continue studying since her parents could not support her. She had to work since she was very young and could not attend school. She got married when she was 16 to Victor G. and they have two daughters and one son. One of their daughters died of pneumonia. Her son and daughter now live close to her but are now independent and are married with their own families. She runs a business purchasing animals, feeding them (fattening them up) and selling them; she runs it out of her own home. Thanks to the Manuela Ramos organization, she received a $100 loan which she used to purchase 2 pigs and some guinea pigs which she sold for a good price. She paid back her loan in 4 months. With this loan of $225 she will purchase pigs and chickens which she will sell and hopefully earn more income. She will repay her loan in 4 months. Maria belongs to the Working Women village bank and is very glad to be a member of the bank. She would love to gather who whole family in order to have a great celebration.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase of livestock in order to sell at retail prices

description: Назире 27 лет и у нее 2 детей. После развода с мужем ей пришлось тяжело, она решила открыть свой бизнес. Начала предпринимательскую деятельность с продажи женской одежды. Сейчас она торгует женской и детской одеждой на оптовом рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе. В ее ассортименте товара можно увидеть махровые и велюровые халаты для женщин и девочек. Закупает товар у поставщиков из Китая. У нее много клиентов из пригородов столицы.  \r\nС наступления осени Назира хочет получить займ в сумме 2000 сомони для закупа халатов чтоб увеличить товарооборот.
description_translated:
Nazira is 27 years old and has two children. After divorcing her husband the times got tough and she decided to start her own business. She began her entrepreneurship career with sales of women's clothing. Right now she is selling women's and children's clothing on the wholesale market of Korvon in Dushanbe. Some of the items that could be found in her stock are terry and velour robes for women and girls. She buys her stock from the suppliers in China. She has many customers from the capital's suburbs. \r\n

With the arrival of autumn, Nazira wants to get a loan for 2,000 somoni ($600USD) to buy robes and increase circulation of merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy robes

description: Veronica A. sells used clothing at Bantama in Elmina. Veronica has received no formal education. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a security guard. Veronica has been selling used clothing since 2003. She is responsible for feeding the family and utility bills. Her loan will be used to add to her capital to buy more goods for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest to increase sales, which will eventually increase her income.
loan_use: Her loan will be used to add to her capital to buy more goods for sale.

description:
La señora Grimaldina Rosmeri G. F. tiene treintaicinco años,  vive en el caserío la Primavera en el distrito de Mache provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió primaria completa pero no continuo estudiando debido a la falta de apoyo económico de sus padres.
Se casó a los dieciséis años con el señor Francisco Medina con tienen cuatro hijos, dos de ellos ya trabajan independientemente y los otros dos están estudiando.
Empezó a negociar con animales pequeños para carne ahora compra reses y las vende en las plazas pecuarias de Otuzco y Julcán.
Hace dos años recibió su primer préstamo de Manuela Ramos que fue de 300 soles, con los que compró cuyes y gallinas, el préstamo fue devuelto en cuatro meses.
Con este préstamo de S/. 2000 soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas,  comprará una vaca de 1500 soles y una cerda de 300 soles. Los 200 soles restantes los utilizará en comprar  balanceado para el alimento de sus animales.
Pertenece al Comedor Popular Corazón de Jesús de la Primavera y al Banco Comunal Mujeres de Trabajo.
Tiene un gran sueño y es el de comprar una linda casa en Trujillo para que sus hijos continúen educándose.
description_translated:
Mrs. Grimaldina Rosmeri G. F. is 35 years old and lives in the La Primavera farmhouse in the Mache District of Otuzco Province, in the La Libertad Department of Peru. Grimaldina completed primary school, but could not continue her studies due to the lack of economic support from her parents. When she was 16 years old, she married Mr. Francisco Medina. They have four children, two of whom work and are independent, while the other two are still studying.

When she first started her business she worked with small animals, but now she buys beef and sells it in the livestock plazas of Otuzco and Julcán.

Two years ago, Grimaldina received her first loan from Manuela Ramos for 300 soles (slightly more than $100), which she used to buy guinea pigs and hens. She repaid this loan in four months. With this loan of 2000 soles (about $700), she will buy a cow for 1500 soles and a pig for 300 soles. The remaining 200 soles will be used to buy animal feed. Grimaldina belongs to the Corazon de Jesus Comedor Popular (an eatery for low-income families) and is a member of the Mujeres de Trabajo Communal Bank (a group loan). Her dream is to buy a nice house in Trujillo so that her children can continue their studies. .

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Buy a cow, a pig and animal feed

description:
Mrs. Bina C. has already paid back her first loan from Kiva. She was the first member of her loan group to repay and she paid back well before the term. Mrs. C. purchased green vegetables with her first loan. She sells her vegetables in the town of Bholdhoka. Her husband, Mr. Puspa C., has no work, so her family's living conditions are still very miserable. She has not been able to send her children to boarding school. They all depend solely on the small vegetable shop.

Mrs. C. is a very hard-working woman. She wants to expand her business to earn more from her shop. So she is requesting a loan of Rs 15000.00 fb. She is very grateful to all the lenders who supported her by giving her the first loan.
loan_use: To expand her shop further

description: ASTOU K.  est une femme mariée et mere de plusieurs enfants.Pour aider son mari retraité,elle fait la transformation des poissons .les poissons transformés sont vendus au marché.Elle a eu bénéfié de plusieurs prets pour le renforcement de son activité. les revenus tirés de l' activité servent à payer les frais de scolarité et le frais medicaux des enfants mais aussi la nourriture pour la famille.
description_translated:
Astou K. is a married woman who has several children. To help her retired husband, she processes fish. The processed fish are then sold in the market. She has benefitted from several loans to improve her business. The income generated by this business is used to pay her children’s school fees and medical expenses as well as to purchase food for the family.\r\n\r\n

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To impove her business

loan_name: Mr. Eng Am's Village Bank Group
description: Mr. Eng A. is 45 years old and has four children, one of whom helps Mr. Eng A.'s plantation and another one who is employed in a garment factory. The remaining two are attend the local school. Seventeen people in Chrey Bet Meas Village in Kampong ChA. Province formed a village bank loan and Mr. Eng A. is the village bank president. He is a construction worker who does not earn enough money to support his family. Aside from working in construction, he is a farmer who owns two hectares of land in which he cultivates rice. However, his plantation has become infertile and is unable to produce any more food. To solve this problem, Mr. Eng A. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to enrich his plantation. He would also use the loan to purchase pesticides to kill crop destroying insects. His wife, Mrs. Kong Nuon, is a Khmer cake seller who earns $2.50 per day, which is not enough to support her family. Together, they would like to be able to provide a quality education and future for their children.
loan_use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides
borrower_names: Chorn, Roth, Kruy, Kong, Phen, Chhun, Un, Keo, Mom, Eng, Chorn, Pov, Bu, Chorn, Pau, Heng, Thorn
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, male, female, female, female, female, male, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description: Ndèye Fallo Ndao, 52 ans, mariée avec 07 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Bayouf Pout à Thiès depuis 3 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des fruits locaux comme les pastèques, les mandarines et les mangues selon la saison. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. <b>Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
description_translated:
Ndèye Fallo Ndao, age 52, is married and has seven children in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Bayouf Pout in Thiès for three years. Her business consists of buying and reselling local fruit, like watermelons, mandarin oranges, and mangoes according the season. Her income enables her to improve her family's living conditions. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To sell local fruit

description:
Nora es la coordinadora de este grupo, ella inicio su negocio de venta de ropa para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa comenzó con este negocio hace 5 años vendiendo enfrente de su casa y actualmente vende en mercados rodantes cercanos a su casa.

Blanca inicio su negocio para poder ayudar a su esposo a darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijas y que no les faltara nada. Inicio hace poco mas de 1 años comenzó como snack vendiendo refrescos, frituras y dulces, actualmente surtió su negocio con más cosas de abarrotes, ya que desea tener su tienda mejor establecida en un futuro.

Nely inicio con su negocio ya que necesitaba una actividad que le permitiera atender a sus hijos y a la vez poder obtener un ingreso extra. Comenzó con este negocio hace 2 años vendiendo para otra persona, pero poco a poco hizo sus clientes por lo que decidió vender independientemente y asi obtener mejores ganancias.

Ellas forman el grupo Kilimanjaro y necesitan $1125 que pagaran en 5 meses para poder comprar mercancía para sus negocios y poder así mantenerlos. Ellas confían que con tu apoyo esto será posible.
description_translated:
Nora is the coordinator of this group. She started her business selling clothes to be able to help her husband with the household expenses. She started this business 5 years ago, selling in front of her house, and she currently sells in street markets close to her home.

Blanca started her business to help her husband give their daughters a better quality of life and make sure they were not lacking in anything. She started a little more than 1 year ago, selling snacks like sodas, chips, and candy. She has currently stocked her business more like a general store, since she wants to have a better established store in the future.

Nely started her business because she needed an activity that would allow her to tend to her children and at the same time obtain an extra income. She started with this business 2 years ago, selling for another person, but little by little she got her own customers so she decided to sell independently in order to obtain higher profits.

They form the group Kilimanjaro and they need $1125, which they will pay back in 5 months, to be able to buy merchandise for their businesses and thus be able to maintain them. They trust that with your support this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: buying merchandise
borrower_names: Blanca Aurora, Nora Hilaria, Nely Guadalupe

description: Gladys N. is 45 years old. She is widowed and the mother of three children who are currently in school. She has manufacturered palm kernel oil for four years. Palm kernel oil is produced from palm kernel. The palm kernel is a by-product of palm oil. The palm kernel is also processed through various stages to obtain the palm kernel oil which is used to prepare many local dishes. Her production is on a small scale because she lacks the working capital to buy a machine to process the palm kernel oil. She wants to use the loan to buy more palm kernel and an electric milling machine to increase her efficiency so she can produce oil in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business snd raise more income to support the business and to provide food for her family and finance her children's education. She belongs to the community group called Ntoboase (Patience) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee the repayment of loans for one another.
loan_use: To buy palm kernel and an electric milling machine

description: Gulsara A. is 26-years old, has been married for 8 years and has one child. Her husband is a driver.For the past 9 years, Gulsara has been running her own small business that sells shampoos, soaps, detergents and other items. This business is one of her greatest accomplishments. She always dreamed of owning a business and not having to depend on anyone else. Thanks to the good quality of her merchandise, she has grown her business and is now requesting a loan of 4000 Somoni ($1175 USD) that will be used to purchase more goods to meet her clients' demands. Gulsara promises to repay her loan during a 12 month period and thanks everybody who decided to support her.
loan_use: To increase stock for the store

description:
Mrs. Nak R., 49, a widow, sells porridge and noodles with soup in the Slaket Market. She has been selling food since 2005, earning US$ 4 per day, while Mr. Sharey Mot, her son, is 21 years old and a motorcycle taxi driver. Nak lives with five children. One son left to work in Thailand and three of her daughters stay home to help with Nak's business. Because of lacking capital to upgrade her business, she would like to request a loan of US$ 300 to use as capital to expand her porridge and noodle soup selling business. Nak was chosen to be group leader by the five other members as follows:

Mrs. Srou P., 52, is a widowed fish seller. She needs a loan of US$ 300 to add more fish to sell.

Mrs. Noeun I., 59, is a widowed housewife wH. helps in her daughter's grocery. Noeun needs a loan of US$ 300 to buy grocery inventory.

Mrs. Sophea S., 42, sells fish. She needs a loan of US$ 300 to purchase fish from suppliers to stock and sell.

Mrs. Monika H., 43, is a teacher. She needs a loan of US$ 300 to buy a second-hand motorcycle instead of the old one her husband uses to drive a motorcycle taxi.

Mrs. Phan P., 58, wH. is also widowed, buys and sells chickens. She requests a loan of US$ 200 to buy more chickens to sell.

They all live in Slaket Commune, Siem Reap Province.

Two men wH. are in the picture are not actual borrowers but co-borrowers; the one on the left side is Monika's husband and the other one is Sophea's husband.
loan_use: To use as capital to expand her porridge and noodle soup selling business
borrower_names: Noeun, Nak, Sophea, Srou, Monika, Phan
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Khursheda A. is a very hard-working woman and knows that each day she has to give her best effort and all her courage. She's married with 3 children. She works raising animals and feeding them with the goal of later selling them. This activity creates feelings of satisfaction in her  because it allows her to provide for a considerable amount of the household income. 

The care that she takes to feed the animals and supply them with occasional medical visits from the veterinarian has increased their numbers and so now she guides them into the field each day for feeding. She makes sure not to neglect her role as a mother, because she’s also very dedicated to lovingly raising her three children, who also help out in caring for the animals during their free time. 

Khursheda wants to improve her stable's stalls and produce milk in a quantity sufficient for selling it commercially. It is for this reason that she’s requesting a loan of 4000 Somoni (1175 USD) for the term of 12 months to buy calves and fodder for her animals. Please support this woman who is determined to change the course of her life through dedication and hard work.
loan_use: Purchasing calves in order to expand her business

description:
Svetlana is married with two daughters. She runs a small business selling outer clothing and underwear. Svetlana currently has about $1,000 of working capital. Her monthly gross income amounts to $750.    

Svetlana has a perfect credit history with Nadiya Ukraine. She has promptly repaid all loans without any delinquencies. Her neat kiosk, a beautiful array of inventory, customer-friendly service and exceptional prices have ensured preeminent success of her business. Svetlana would like to get a loan of 1,000 Grivnas to re-stock her inventory. She is planning to increase her supplies of clothing to attract more potential clients to her vending kiosk. Svetlana believes her efforts and determination, in combination with financial support, will eventually help her fully achieve her potential, leading to increased income and success.      

Note: this is a short-term express loan that will be repaid in a month.
loan_use: To increase inventory

description: La Sra  Lucia  C. tiene  46  años de edad,  tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad y 2  hijos menores  que están cursando la primaria.\r\nElla nos cuenta que  hace más de 5  años  que se dedica a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad, para empezar con  su negocio ella cobró su liquidación de haberes, en la  Hilandería de Ybycuí, donde trabajaba, antes de montar su negocio. Con la ayuda  económica de su marido que  trabaja  hasta hoy día como empleado de la fabrica, gracias al esfuerzo de  su trabajo y de su pequeña Despensa, se ayudan  mutuamente  para poder solventar  los gastos de la casa, los estudios de sus hijos y de apoco ir mejorando su nivel de vida y lograr el ingreso necesario para llevar una vida mejor. \r\nEl crédito solicitado es para aumentar el stok de sus mercaderías y así brindar  una buena atención a sus clientes.
description_translated:
Mrs. Lucia C. is 46 years old, has 4 grown children and 2 small children who are in primary school. She tells us that she has been selling basic needs items for more than 5 years. To begin her business she sold her assets in the spinning mill in Ybycuí, where she used to work before starting her business. With the economic help of her husband who works even today as a factory employee, thanks to the effort of her work and to her small store, they are able to help each other meet their household expenses, their children’s education expenses, and little by little improve their standard of living and achieve the necessary income to have a better life. The loan is to increase the stock of merchandise and in this way provide good customer service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Buy merchandise (rice, sugar, noodles, tea, etc.)

description: Mary A. sells oil and gari at Duakro near Elmina. Mary has a Junior High level education. She is married and has two children. Mary has been selling oil and gari since 1999. She is responsible for feeding her family and paying the utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more coconut oil and gari. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in her children's education.
loan_use: To buy coconut oil and gari

description: Chị Nguyễn Thị S. tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2001. Vòng vốn đầu tiên chị vay 1.000.000đ để sử dụng buôn bán hàng khô tại chợ. Sau đó chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn để đầu tư chăn nuôi vịt đẻ và lợn nái. Hiện tại thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị đạt 4.000.000đ/ tháng. \r\nVòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 19.000.000đ để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi phát triển kinh tế gia đình.
description_translated:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị S. is a TYM fund member since 2001. Her first loan of 1.000.000 VND was used to buy/trade dry food at the market. After that she decided to to switch to raising egg laying ducks and pigs. Today her family income is 4.000.000 VND a month. She is seeking a loan of 19.000.000 VND to expand her operations, increase her revenue.\r\n\r\n

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Raising

description:
Les membres du groupe Balimaya sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de trente cinq (35) ans et cinq (5) enfants. Elles vivent dans des foyers monogames et résident toutes au quartier Odioumabougou à Ouéléssébougou (deuxième région administrative se la république du Mali). Elles se sont connues par des liens de parenté et d’affaire. Elles exercent la même activité à savoir la vente de miel.

En raison de la rentabilité de cette activité et de la forte demande du miel, elles décidèrent de se regrouper et adhérer au programme de crédit Soro Yiriwaso. Avec ce prêt de 25.000 FCFA par membre, elles comptent acheter chacune 30 litres de miel. Elles s’approvisionnent chaque quinze (15) jours à Bougouni et vendent sur les marchés de la localité au comptant ou à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes amateurs de produits naturels.

Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice prévisionnel moyen de 12.000 FCFA par membre. Avec ce bénéfice, elles désirent après remboursement de l’intérêt du prêt, investir le reste dans leur affaire.
description_translated:
The members of the Balimaya group are married women with an average age of thirty five and five children. They come from monogamous homes and all live in the Odioumabougou neighborhood of Ouéléssébougou (a second-level administrative subdivision of the Republic of Mali). They met through relatives and business connections. They all work in the same business - selling honey.

For reasons of profitability and the high demand for honey, they decided to get together and join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. With this 25,000 FCFA ($56) loan per member, they each intend to buy 30 liters of honey. They stock up at Bougouni every fifteen days and sell the honey at local markets, for cash or credit, to a clientele of men and women who are fond of natural products.

They expect to make an average profit of 12,000 FCFA ($28) per member. After repaying the interest on the loan, they want to invest the remainder of this profit in their business.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy honey

description:
Praxadis inicio con este negocio ya que necesitaba dinero para pagar los gastos de la casa y de su familia. Inicio con este negocio desde hace 2 años vendiendo ropa y regalos en mercados rodantes cercanos a su casa y en su domicilio, y poco a poco ha hecho crecer su negocio.\r\n

\r\nEl necesita un préstamo por US $950 que pagara en 6 meses para invertirlo comprando mas mercancía ya que se acerca una buena temporada
description_translated:
Praxadis started in this business because he needed money to pay his family's household expenses. He started the business two years ago selling clothes and gifts in local travelling markets and in hishome, and little by little he has grown his business.\r\n

\r\nHe needs this loan of $950 which he will repay in 6 months to invest it buying more merchandise now that the good season is coming.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Buying merchandise

description:
Raquel tiene 18 años. Ella actualmente estudia con miras a ingresar a la universidad. 
En su tiempo libre ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y a la preparación de bombones de chocolate.

Para mantener su negocio, Raquel necesariamente tiene que vender sus productos a crédito, lo cual hace muy lento el crecimiento de su negocio y algunas veces hasta le provoca deudas.

El último crédito que recibió Raquel lo empleó en su negocio de venta de productos de belleza, así mismo ella cuenta que le gustaría ampliar su negocio, para lo cual necesita un capital mayor para trabajar.
description_translated:
Raquel is 18 years old. Currently, she is studying for her college entrance exams. In her spare time, she sells beauty products and prepares chocolates. To maintain her business, Raquel needs to sell her products on credit, which slows business growth and occasionally leads to debts. Raquel used the last credit that she received toward her beauty products business. She would like to expand her business, but requires a greater financial investment to do so. \r\n


Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To increase her stock of beauty products.

description: Yovana tiene 32 años. Desde hace siete años ella  administra su taller de fabricación de accesorios de grifería. El esposo de Yovana trabaja manejando un mototaxi desde hace tres años. Con su trabajo duro ellos aseguran los ingresos mensuales que les permiten mantener a sus tres hijos.\r\nSin embargo, Yonvana cuenta que hace algunos meses el mototaxi de su esposo tiene problemas mecánicos. Yovana necesita un capital para comprar materiales, como el bronce, para su taller de grifería, además para apoyar a su esposo con la reparación de su mototaxi.
description_translated:
Yovana is 32 years of age. For seven years she has run a shop where she makes accessories for faucets. Yovana's husband has worked driving a "mototaxi" (a motorcycle with a covered seated area attached to carry passengers) for the last three years. With her hard work, they have been able to insure that they have the monthly income needed to support their three children.

However, Yovana reports that it has been some months that her husband's "mototaxi" has had mechanical problems. Yovana needs capital to buy materials, like bronze, for her faucet shop, and also to support her husband in the repair of his "mototaxi."

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To purchase material for the making of faucet accessories and to repair her mototaxi.

loan_name: La unión hace la fuerza Group
description:
El Grupo denominado LA UNIÓN HACE LA FUERZA; se conformó en fecha 25 de agosto de 2008, dicho grupo fue organizado gracias a que la actual Presidenta María Rossana C., quien se dedica a la venta de ropas, se acercó a la asesora en una reunión semanal que tenia la misma en la zona, para informarse de como funciona el programa del Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. La Sra. María habló a sus vecinas y amigas y logró juntar a 15 mujeres las cuales integran hoy día este comité.

Las integrantes de este grupo se dedican a diferentes actividades tales como: venta de ropas, venta de frutas y verduras, venta de comidas, venta de carbón, ventas de artículos de plásticos, venta de bijouteri, venta de sábanas y manteles, venta de carnes, panificados, azúcar, yerba, arroz, etc. y a la venta de artículos de mercerías como remeras, medias, lencerías, binchas, etc.

El grupo trabaja en forma conjunta, demuestran compañerismo y solidaridad. Todas las integrantes del grupo asisten a las reuniones semanales y realizan actividades para recaudar fondos para el bien común del grupo.

Las actividades que desarrollan cada una se especifica a continuación: 1. María C.. Venta de ropas.

2. 2-Juana R.. Venta de comidas.

3. 3-Elodia V.. Venta de artículos de plásticos.

4. 4-Jorgelina Sánchez. Venta de bijouterie.

5. 5-Marina G.. Venta de sábanas y mantel.

6. 6-Dora F.. Despensa.

7. 7-Herminia R.. Venta de carbón y despensa.

8. 8-Antonia R.. Venta de miel y chipa.

9. 9-Nery S.. Venta de bebidas.

10. 10-Sonia D.. Venta de carne.

11. 11-María R.. Venta de frutas y verduras.

12. 12-.Diana M.. Venta de sábanas.

13. 13-Amelia T.. Venta de frutas.

14. 14-Cinthia C.. Venta de mercerías.

15. 15-María I.. Venta de comidas.
description_translated:
The group LA UNION HACE LA FUERZA was founded on August 25, 2008. It is said that the group was organized thanks to the current President Maria Rossana Cespedes, a woman with a career in selling clothes. She contacted the adviser of a nearby weekly meeting that informed people about the program called “Committee of Women Entrepreneurs”. Maria talked to her neighbors and friends and put together a group of 15 women who now make up this committee. The committee members take part in various activities such as the sale of clothing, fruits and vegetables, carbon coals, plastic products, trinkets and jewelry, sheets and blankets, meat, pastry, sugar, herbs, rice, etcetera as well as the sale of clothing like T-shirts, stockings, lingerie, hair bands, and etcetera. This group works together as a team, demonstrating camaraderie and solidarity. All of them help with the weekly meetings and with the fulfillment of duties in order to raise money for the common wellbeing of the group. The activity that each woman performs is specified as follows: 1. María C.. Sale of clothing 2. Juana R.. Sale of food. 3. Elodia V.. Sale of plastics 4. Jorgelina Sánchez. Sale of jewelry and trinkets 5. Marina G.. Sale of blankets and sheets 6. Dora F.. Household items 7. Herminia R.. Sale of carbon coals and household items. 8. Antonia R.. Sale of honey and chirpa 9. Nery S.. Sale of drinks 10. Sonia D.. Sale of meat 11. María R.. Sale of fruits and vegetables 12. Diana M.. Sale of sheets. 13. Amelia T.. Sale of fruit 14. Cinthia C.. Sale of clothing. 15. María I.. Sale of food.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase of clothes, fruits and vegetables, ingredients for food preparation, plastics, jewelry and trinkets, sheets and blankets, groceries (rice, sugar, pastries, candy, herbs, meat, etc.), drinks, carbon coals, clothing (t-shirts, lingerie, wallets, hair bands, etc.)
borrower_names: Marina, Diana, Sonia, Elodia, Amelia, Dora, Jorgelina, María, Nery, Juana, Herminia, Cinthia, María, María Rossana, Antonia
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, false, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Doña Angélica tiene 28 años de edad, estudió quinto de secundaria, es conviviente y madre de tres hijos varones de 11 y 8 años y 1 mujer de 4 años de edad, vive en el Jr. 28 de Julio S/N.

Hace 10 años que es socia del Banco Comunal “Generación 2,000”– Mazocruz. Desde los 15 años de edad empezó a preparar comida, lo cual vendía en la plaza de Mazocruz. A los 17 años de edad formó su hogar y seguía con su negocio. Con el primer crédito de S/.300 Nuevos Soles aumentó el capital y pudo comprar más carne, verduras, papa, etc. Así fue acumulando capital y cambió de negocio, desde el año 2004 se dedica a la venta de combustible.

Con este crédito de S/.1,500 Nuevos Soles, el cual será cancelado en 04 cuotas, comprará 02 cilindros de combustible.

Su meta es comprar una casa en la ciudad de Puno y educar a sus hijos, también piensa instalar un grifo en el distrito de Mazocruz.
description_translated:
Angelica is 28 years old and she completed high school. She lives with her common law husband and is mother to three boys aged 11, 8 and 1, and a 4-year old girl. They live in Jr. 28 de Julio S/N.

For 10 years she has been a member of the Banco Comunal "Generation 2000" in Mazocruz. Since she was 15 years of age she started purchasing foods which she would then resell in the main square of Mazocruz. At the age of 17 she started her family but she kept on with her business. With her first loan of S/300 she complimented her capital savings to purchase more meats, vegetables, potatoes etc. Her capital started to increase once again and then she decided to change her business. Since 2004 she has been dedicating her time to selling fuel gas.

With this loan amounting to S/.1500, which will be repaid in a term of 4 months, she will purchase 2 gas tanks.

Her goal is to purchase a house in the city of Puno and to send her kids to school. She also wants to set up a hot water service in the district of Mazocruz.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To purchase gas tanks.

description:
Doña Bárbara tiene 39 años de edad, estudió primaria completa, es conviviente y progenitora de cuatro hijos varones cuyas edades son de 10, 8, 6 y 2 años. Vive en el Jr. Trujillo S/N. distrito de Mazocruz, provincia El Collao – Puno.  

Hace un año que es socia del Banco Comunal “Generación 2,000”- Mazocruz. Con su primer crédito de S/.500 Nuevos Soles, compró galletas, gaseosas, caramelos, yogurt (venta de abarrotes). Desde los 10 años de edad empezó a trabajar ayudando a sus tías de parte de su padre, a cambio de su trabajo sólo recibía víveres y lana de alpaca. Cuando ya cumplió los 19 años de edad empezó a trabajar por cuenta propia, vendía salchimote en la ciudad de Juliaca y a los 29 años de edad convivió con su esposo, desde entonces se dedican a la crianza de ganado vacuno, ovino, llamas (engorde), la mayoría de veces entrega alpacas, llamas en pie a los Bolivianos que viene a comprar al campo y al mes una ó dos veces entrega carne a los mayoristas de la ciudad de Tacna, en un promedio de 03 a 05 degollados. También pertenece a una Organización de Artesanas y les llega pedidos de Cuzco y Arequipa en convenio con el “Proyecto Sierra Sur”.

Con este crédito de S/.1,000 Nuevos Soles, el cual será pagado en 04 cuotas, comprará más alpaca, llamas para engorde y posterior venta en carne.

Su meta es tener una tiende de abarrotes en Mazocruz y que sus hijos estudien en la ciudad de Puno.
description_translated:
Ms. Barbara A. is a 39-year-old woman who completed elementary school, is married and has 4 sons ages 10, 8, 6, and 2. She lives in Jr. Trujillo S/N, Mazocruz district, in the El Collao Ð Puno province.

She has been a member of the “Generación 2,000” – Mazocruz microfinance institute for a year. With her first loan of 500.00 PEN, she purchased cookies, soft drinks, candy, and yogurt for her grocery store. From the age of 10, she started working, helping out her paternal aunts. In exchange for her work, she only received provisions and alpaca fleece. When she turned 19, she started to work independently. She used to sell salchimote, Peruvian street food made of maize and sausages, in the city of Juliaca. At 29, she went to live with her husband and ever since then, they raise livestock—cows, sheep, and llamas (for meat). Most of the time she delivers alpacas and llamas by foot to the Bolivians who come to the countryside, and once or twice she delivers meat to retailers in the city of Tacna at an average of 3-5 carcasses. She also pertains to an organization of craftswomen, and they receive orders from Cuzco and Arequipa in agreement with the “Proyecto Sierra Sur” (Southern Sierra Project).

With this loan of 1,000.00 PEN, which will be repaid in 4 monthly installments, she will purchase more alpacas and llamas to fatten them and sell their meat.

Her goal is to have her own grocery store in Mazocruz and to have her children study in Puno.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase alpacas and llamas to be fattened and sold for meat

description:
Doña Elizabeth nació el 12 de Julio de 1971 en Chanchamayo, Junín. A los 05 años de edad toda su familia emigró a la sierra, estudió primaria completa, es conviviente y madre de una hija de 16 años y un hijo de 09 años de edad. Vive en la comunidad de Queñuani, distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, Puno.

Gracias a la invitación de su amiga Teresa decidió integrar el Banco Comunal “Fe y Alegría” en Yunguyo. Desde hace 08 años se inició con un crédito de S/.300 Nuevos Soles, con lo cual aumentó su capital y compró 01 cabeza de ganado. Desde los 15 años de edad se fue a trabajar donde su tía quien le pagaba por su trabajo, con ese dinero se compraba ropa y ayudaba a sus padres porque eran muy pobres. Desde los 20 años de edad convive con su esposo y juntos empezaron con el negocio de compra y venta de ganado vacuno, semanalmente compraban en la feria de Acora y vendían en la feria de Yunguyo. Desde hace siete años se dedica a la venta de ají que traen del departamento de Tacna (Sama, Ite) y venden los viernes en la ciudad de Desaguadero, paralelamente se dedica al engorde de ganado vacuno.

Con este crédito de S/.2,300 Nuevos Soles, el cual será pagado en 04 cuotas, comprará 02 cabezas de ganado vacuno a S/.900 cada uno, y con el resto comprará 03 quintales de ají a S/.180 cada quintal. 

Su sueño es aumentar más ganado vacuno (mejorados) para obtener más ganancias y que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.
description_translated:
Elizabeth was born on July 12, 1971 in Chanchamayo, Junín. At 5 years old her family immigrated to the mountains where she completed primary school. She is married and a mother to a 16 year old daughter and a 9 year old son. She lives in the Queñuani community in the district and province of Yunguyo, Puno. Thanks to the invitation of her friend Teresa, she decided to become a member of the Communal Bank “Fe y Alegría” (Faith and Happiness) in Yunguyo. 8 years ago she began with her first loan of S/.300 Nuevos Soles, with which she increased her capital and bought 1 head of cattle. Since she was 15 years old she went to work for her aunt who paid her for her work, and with his money she bought clothing and helped her parents who were very poor. Since she was 20 she has lived with her husband and together they began a business buying and selling cattle. Weekly they would buy in the Acora market and sell in the Yunguyo market. For the past 7 years she has been selling chili pepper that they buy in Tacna and sell on Fridays in Desaguadero city, and at the same time she also raises and fattens cattle. With this loan for S/.2,300 Nuevos Soles, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy 2 head of cattle at S/.900 each, and with the rest she will buy 3 quintals (a quintal is approximately 46 kg) of chili pepper at S/.180 per quintal. Her dream is increase her cattle to obtain greater earnings and that her children study and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Buy two head of cattle and three quintals of chili pepper

description:
El señor Danilo P. se dedica al negocio de venta de repuestos de todo tipo para motocicletas atendiéndolo en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino donde es originario.

El negocio comenzó desde hace 3 años ofertando pocos repuestos pero muy sabiamente se ha apoyado de los créditos brindados por Ceprodel y gracias a estos ha logrado mejorar y aumentar la cantidad de repuestos para ofertar.

La principal razón por la que hoy en día ha solicitado el crédito es para la compra de dichos repuesto con el propósito de ofrecerlos en su comunidad. ES de importancia destacar que él ha sido un buen cliente de la institución y son sus anhelos continuar hasta mejorar todo su negocio.
description_translated:
Mr. Danilo P. sells parts for all makes of motorcycles in the city where he was born, Ciudad Sandino. He began his business 3 years ago offering a few parts but very wisely he has supported himself through loans provided by Ceprodel and thanks to these loans he has been able to improve and expand the quantity of parts that he offers. The reason for his loan today is to buy parts with the intention of selling them in the community. It is important to note that he has been a good client of this institution and his goals are to continue improving his business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase motorcycle parts

description:
Yudith tiene 23 años de edad, estudió cuarto de secundaria, es conviviente y madre de un niño de 04 años de edad. Vive en el Jr. Ejército s/n (frente al mercado), distrito de Mazocruz, provincia El Collao, Puno.

Desde el año 2005 integra el Banco Comunal “Generación 2000” en Mazocruz. Por motivos familiares tuvo que dejar el Banco Comunal, reingresando nuevamente hace dos ciclos. Con el crédito que le otorgaron de S/.500 Nuevos Soles pudo comprar 03 cabezas de alpaca. 

Yudith empezó a dedicarse al negocio desde que tuvo su pareja, a los 22 años de edad, con la venta de carne y fibra de alpaca, llama y también carne y lana de ovino que entrega a los mayoristas de la ciudad de Tacna. De vez en cuando prepara comida para vender en la feria sabatina de Mazocruz.

Con este crédito de S/.800 Nuevos Soles, el cual será cancelado en 04 cuotas, comprará 05 cabezas de alpaca que será entregado en carne a los mayoristas.

Su meta es comprar una casa en la ciudad de Ilave, apoyar a su hijo hasta que sea profesional. También piensa llevar productos de abarrotes a las diferentes ferias para generar más ganancias.
description_translated:
Yudith is 23 years old and completed a fourth of primary school. She is married and mother of a four year old son. She lives in Jr. Ejército (in front of the market), district of Mazocurz, province of El Collao, Puno. In 2005, she joined the community bank "Generación 2000" in Mazocruz. For family reasons, she had to leave the community bank, and rejoin after two cycles. With the credit of 500 Soles that they granted her, she was able to buy three heads of alpaca. Yudith began to dedicate herself to this business since she has been with her husband, at the age of 22, with the sale of meat and fiber from alpacas and llamas, and also meat and wool from sheep, which she sells to the wholesalers of the city of Tacna. Sometimes she prepares food to sell at the Saturday market in Mazocruz. With this loan of 800 Soles, which she will repay in four months, she will buy five heads of alpaca that she will sell as meat to wholesalers. Her goal is to buy a home in the city of Ilave and support her son until he becomes a professional. She also plans to deliver grocery products to the various markets to generate more earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: five head of alpaca

description:
Esta señora tiene un negocio de pulpería, inició vendiendo refrescos y helados, luego probó con otros productos como gaseosa y vio que ella podía producir para aportar a los gastos de la casa, pues su esposo no podía con todos los gastos y los niños son estudiantes y tenían gastos .Pensando esto decidió vender otros productos y así ella llego a tener la pulpería que hasta hoy tiene y que está ubicada en la carretera panamericana con rótulo grande para vender a los viajeros de la carretera. 

Decidió obtener un crédito con ADIM y así ofreció más variedad de product6os a los clientes, así ella con todos los financiamientos ha mejorado en la presentación del local que al día de hoy tiene un espacio seguro y a la par su calidad de vida para la familia. 

Está satisfecha con haber logrado salir a delante por su familia y sentir que es empresaria que puede seguir creciendo.
description_translated:
Rosa runs a convenience store. She started out selling beverages and ice cream, then added other products like soft drinks and saw that she was able to help with household expenses; her husband couldn't afford them all on his own and their children are in school. With this in mind, she started selling more products and now has her store located on the Panamerican Highway with a big sign to attract travelers. She decide to obtain a loan through Kiva partner ADIM so she could offer a wider selection of merchandise to her customers, and with all the help, she has been able to improve her store's presentation, making it more secure and improving her family's quality of life at the same time. She's satisfied with having been able to make headway for her family and feels that her business can continue to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase merchandise for her convenience store.

description: Mayela es propietaria de dos motocarros, adicionalmente  se dedica  a la venta de comida por las noches, tiene dos hijos menores. Su esposo Sergio es el chofer de uno de los motocarros y es quien se dedica al cuidado de las motos. El dinero que solicita será invertido en el mantenimiento y arreglo de sus herramientas de trabajo, y mejorar su negocio de venta de comida,  para posteriormente mandar a construir un kiosco para vender su comida cómodamente. Apoyemos a esta madre que con esfuerzo y dedicación  sigue trabajando arduamente por prosperar.
description_translated:
\r\nMayela owns two motorcycles and also dedicates herself to selling food in the evenings. She has two young sons. Her husband Sergio drives one of the motorcycles and also takes care of their maintenance. The money she is requesting will be used to maintain the motorcycles and repair Sergio's tools and to improve Mayela's business of selling food so that she can build a kiosk to sell her food comfortably. Support this mother who with effort and dedication keeps working arduously to prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Maintenance of two motorcycles and investment in food selling business.

description:
Boginiso T. is 53 years old. She’s married with 2 children. Surrounded by beautiful and tame cows on pasture land, Boginiso is carrying out her daily work herding the grazing cattle. She has been dedicated to this occupation for the last eight years.

Boginiso works as cleaning staff at the same center as her dear husband. Both work very hard to support and offer an adequate education to their dearest children as they wish to give each of them the opportunity of enrolling in higher studies.

Boginiso wishes to buy calves for breeding and production of her own cattle and therefore she is asking for a loan of 2500 Somoni (750 USD) which will be repaid over a period of 12 months. Let us help this industrious mother make her dreams come true, seeing her beloved children as professionals and with a bright future.
loan_use: Purchasing calves to expand her business

description:
T. Dilmurod is 23 years old. He is married and has a young child. For the past 10 years, Dilmurod has been producing sieves in his house. He learned this type of business from his father. Dilmurod became a real expert in his business and has a lot of clients. His wife helps him sell the sieves in the market. Because Dilmurod has many clients and demand for his goods, the business is very successful. The business provides a stable and significant income that allows Dilmurod to improve the living conditions of his family. \r\n

\r\nNow Hakimjon has orders for producing the sieves. So he is requesting a loan of 2500 Somoni ($750) to purchase the raw materials for producing the sieves. With your help, this will be possible. Dilmurod is counting on your help and he expresses his gratitude to everyone for supporting him.
loan_use: Purchasing materials for production of sieves

description:
Hanča, born in 1954, lives with her husband, a painter, in the village of Omazići near Banovići. Hanča, as almost every woman in a village, does much in her garden, field and home. She produces vegetables for her own use and has a cow whose milk she both sells and uses for home consumption. As well, she has a few chickens and now wishes to begin raising poultry.

Hanča’s husband helps her in his free time with all things and the request for a loan of $725 was a joint decision. Hanča will use this amount to buy poultry and poultry feed, with the ultimate goal of raising the family income through the establishment and expansion of a poultry farm.
loan_use: To buy poultry and poultry food.

description:
Oluchi is 29 years old and married with 3 children.  She lives in Benin City, Nigeria where she is a food vendor.  She has her shop in one of the semi-urban areas of Benin City.  She likes cooking.  It was a hobby before she decided to go into food vending for a living.  She is happy with her decision as she still enjoys cooking and it helps her take care of her family.  

Her goal, now, is to expand the business and open a more beautiful restaurant where she can seat no less than 20 people at one time.  But for now, she needs a loan of $425 to buy more foodstuffs (cooking staples) and drinks to meet the demands of the customers.  Perhaps she will use a future loan and some of the savings she is building to realize her dreams for the future.  

She thanks the Kiva lenders for any assistance they can provide and says that your efforts are good.
loan_use: To buy more foodstuffs to cook and sell

description: La Sra. Azusena Julieta González, ha montado un Cyber Café, enla zona céntrica de la ciudad, debido a la insistencia de clientes en que la propietaria solicite los servicio de carga para celulares de las líneas  Personal y Tigo, ha solicitado crédito con la Fundación para dicho efecto, hoy cuenta también con el servicio ya mencionado, siendo así uno de los negocios con mayor éxito.
description_translated:
Azusena has set up a cyber-cafe in the city center to meet demand from users of Personal and Tigo cell phone services. She has applied to Fundacion for a loan to set up the cyber-cafe with the understanding that providing cell phone services is a business that has proven to be very successful for others.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Compra de mercederías

description:
Dolores inició el negocio para apoyar a su esposo ya que el estuvo desempleado y empezó a trabajar como taxista, lo que les generaba un ingreso variable. Empezó vendiendo frutas y verduras en su casa, al inicio con poca mercancía y los clientes de la colonia le fueron pidiendo mas variedad hasta lograr tener mas productos.\r\n

\r\nElla necesita un préstamo por US $375 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu apoyo ella saldra adelante.
description_translated:
\r\nDolores started her business to help her husband who was unemployed. Her husband started working as a taxi driver but this generates a variable income for them so she started selling fruits and vegetables from her home. At first, she started with a little merchandise but the clients in the neighborhood started asking for more variety and she obtained more products.

\r\nDolores needs a loan in the amount of $375 - which she will repay in four months - to purchase merchanside. With your help she will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase fruits and vegetables.

description:
El Bancomunal Señor de Luwirco se ubica en la provincia de Huancavelica en el departamento del mismo nombre. Esta comunidad tiene zonas turísticas con aguas termales. Su actividad principal es la ganadería, agricultura y el comercio.

Haydee M. es casada, tiene 5 hijos. Haydee se dedica a la venta de joyas, ropa, y cosméticos por catalogo, estas ventas son por campañas. Su sueño res terminar de construir su casa.

José María R., es casado y tiene 5 hijos, es protesista dental, especialista en salud oral, de lo cual se siente orgullos. Aunque es liciado por una complicación, José María se siente una persona normal. Quiere invertir su prestamos en la compra de materiales y renovar sus equipos e instrumentos dentales. Su sueño es concluir sus estudios profesionales de Cirujano Dentista.

Carmen R., es conviviente, se dedica a la venta por catalogo de cosméticos, también realiza decoraciones de tortas, Carmen dice ser mil oficios. Ahora con su préstamo quiere implementar una tienda de regalos.
description_translated:
The Community Bank Señor De Luwirco is located in the province of Huancavelica in the department (like a state) of the same name. This community is a tourist zone with hot springs. Their principal activities are livestock, agriculture, and commerce.

Haydee M. is married with 5 children. Haydee sells jewelery, clothing, and cosmetics by catalog through campaigning (door-to-door sales). Her dream is to finish building her home.

José María R. is married with 5 children and is a prosthetic dentist specializing in oral health, of which he is very proud. Even though he is hampered by a complication, José María feels like a normal person. He wants to invest his loans in the purchase of materials and renovation of his dental equipment and instruments. His dream is to complete his professional studies to be a Dental Surgeon.

Carmen R. is married and works in catalog sales of cosmetics. She also decorated cakes. Carmen is said to be a "jack of all trades." With her loan she wants to open a gift shop.


Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: The Community Bank Señor de Luwirco needs a loan of $2150 for thier 14 members to invest in their businesses.
borrower_names: Doris, Sonia Nancy, Yeni Yovana, Francisco, Matilde, Jose Maria, Wendy Rossini, Milagros, Marilin, Miriam, Guisela, Haydee Paulina, Carmen Soledad, Maria Elena
borrower_genders: female, female, female, male, female, male, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, false, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description: Catherine E., 50 years old and married with five children, owns a groceries and beef shop selling both provisions and drinks. With an increase in her volume of customers, she wants to increase her stock and is therefore requesting a loan of $600 to buy more beef to sell. Selling more products will help Catherine increase her profit level, the proceeds of which will help in supporting her children's education. She says thank you.
loan_use: To buy more beef for sale

description:
Mariam A. is 39 years old and married with four children. She lives in Issashi in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells provisions and drinks from the front of her house. She has been in this business for a long time.

\r\n\r\n

Miriam is a LAPO Microfinance client. She needs a loan for $700 to buy more provisions to sell. She says this Kiva loan will change her business and family life. She thanks all that made this loan possible.
loan_use: To buy more provisions to sell in her shop.

description: Madame O. B. Mariam est née le 31 décembre 1966 à Sokodé dans la région centrale du Togo. Elle s’est mariée à un pauvre mécanicien et est mère de 6 enfants. Presque la totalité de la charge de la famille repose sur elle seule d’autant plus que son mari a un revenu irrégulier. Elle a pour activité principale la restauration du riz dans son quartier. Elle a commencée cette activité depuis l’année 2002 et tire un revenu acceptable. Elle accueille beaucoup de consommateurs et leur rend un bon service.\r\nCe premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 10 sacs de riz et 6 bidons d’huile végétale.
description_translated:
Mariam O. B. was born December 31, 1966 in Sokodé in central Togo. She is married to a struggling mechanic and is the mother of six children. Mariam is nearly the sole support of her family since her husband cannot count on a regular paycheck. Her primary field of endeavor is the supply of rice to her neighborhood. She began this business in 2002 and earns an adequate income providing good service to her many customers. This, the first loan she has requested, would permit her to buy ten sacks of rice and six drums of vegetable oil.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase of rice and vegetable oil

description: Feao S., 51, is married with 6 children. She has 3 years of experience in the pancakes, pork cakes, ice cakes, etc., business. She sells to the village and general public 5 days per week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD). SPBD loans are Feao's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her earnings will be use to improve business and help out with the family. Her husband helps out with the business
loan_use: To improve business status and also help to improve her home

description: Toga E., 29, is married with 4 children. She has 3 years of experience in the barbecue business. She sells to the village and general public 3 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD). SPBD loans are Toga's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The earnings will be used to improve business and help out her family. Her husband helps out with the business.
loan_use: Purchase to improve business status and also help to improve her home

description:
Gularam K., who lives in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan, is married and has one child. She is engaged in the business of selling various products for use in customers' homes, so she trades small wares such as sunflower seeds, chewing gum, drop yeast, and plastic packages. Further, Gularam is involved in the livestock industry by providing low-cost feed to facilitate the growth and sales of such animals.

\r\nAt present, Gularam would like to expand and improve her business. Therefore, she is seeking financial support via a Kiva business development loan in the amount of 2,400 STJ ($725) for 4 months to capitalize on the seasonal nature of her businesses.
loan_use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing seasonal goods

description: Married with three children who are currently in school, Rachael O. is 43 years old. She sells food like cassava, plantain, maize, bananas etc. in the local market of Nankese in Koforidua, where she lives. She has been selling for the past fifteen years; she has lots of selling experience to win customers. Rachael is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to provide her children with quality educations for their future careers. She wants to use the loan to buy increased stock to serve her customers and grow her business. She is a member of the community group called "Nyame mma" Trust Group. In this group members assist one another to provide support in handling repayment. She would be grateful for your assistance.
loan_use: To buy increased stock for her food market.

description: Susitina F., 40, is married with four children.  She has three years of experience in the food market business. She sells to the village people, five days per week. She has had five previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (approximately 166 USD).  \r\n\r\nSPBD loans are Susitina's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy sacks of flour, mutton flaps, chicken legs, foam plates, foam cups, and soya for her business. Her husband is one of her great assistants in running her business.
loan_use: Purchase to buy sack of flour, mutton flaps, chicken leg, foam cups and soy-souce

description:
Magdalena J. ić is a modern young girl who comes from Doboj. She is 21 and lives alone. She works in a popular cafe in the town. Working there, she meets many people her age and that gives her an opportunity to earn somewhat more. She sells cosmetics and ornaments.

\r\n\r\nMagdalena goes, from time to time, to a big marketplace to purchase her reserves of products. She doesn't earn much but enough to live on. Taking a loan through WWI in the amount of 600 KM will allow her to buy somewhat bigger reserves of the products that she sells.
loan_use: To buy cosmetics for re-sale

description: Greetings from Francois in Kigali, Rwanda! Francois is 47 years old, married with 6 children. Francois is a retail shop owner, who sells items like juice, bars of soap, clothes for children, shoes, bottles of water, toilet paper, powder, etc.\r\n\r\nFrancois is looking for a loan worth 519,175 Frws to increase his stock. The loan repayment term is 8 months.
loan_use: To increase his inventory

description:
S. is 45 years old and married to Joseph Nfona. 

She sells Koki pudding, which is made up of ground beans mixed with red oil and salt; this is eaten with boiled plantains, coco yams, potatoes, and cassava. This is a very delicious meal that many inhabitants in the community love eating. Palm wine is a drink gotten from Palms and is white in colour. It is usually called "White mimbo".

S.'s life has been especially difficult because her child has been ill and she hasn't been able to take her to the hospital because S. hasn't been able to pay the fees. Faced with this illness, S. joined GHAPE in order to improve her living standards. She is a hard-working woman who has acquired many business and management techniques from GHAPE.
loan_use: To buy ingredients

description: Chị Đoàn Thị Đông 47 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2006. Các vòng vốn vay của Quỹ gia đình chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn và chồng cây ăn quả. Hiện tai gia dình chị đang nuôi 10 con lợn thịt và chồng 200 cây cam, Bình quân môi năm gia đình chị thu nhập từ chăn nuôi và chồng trọt ước tính khoảng 40.000.000đ. Chồng chị là người chịu khó ngoài công việc gia đình anh thường đi làm thuê bình quân mỗi ngày 50.000đ, chị có 3 con, 2 con nhỏ hiện đang đi học, 1 con lớn đã có công việc làm ổn định lương 1.500.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn nay gia đình chị xin vay 15.000.000đ mua con giống và phân bón trồng cây ăn quả.\r\nThu nhập bình quân. 5.000.000đ/ tháng.
description_translated:
