Mrs. Đoàn Thị Đông - 47 years old - joined the TYM Fund in 2006. She has used every TYM loan to invest in raising livestock and planting fruit-bearing trees. Today, her family has 10 pigs and 200 orange trees. Each year, on average, the family has an income of about 40,000,000 VND from raising livestock and planting rice. Her husband is a hardworker. In addition to the family businesses, he regularly works as a hired hand for an average of 50,000 VND per day. She has two children who are currently in school. One older child has steady employment with a salary of 1,500,000 VND per month. For this loan cycle, her family wishes to borrow 15,000,000 VND to purchase more pigs and fertilizer for their fruit trees. Their average income is 5,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy fertilizer and pigs.

description: "Mujeres Confiadas," as the name suggests, is a group of 10 confident women. Each one of these women is ready to change her life and start her own small business. Mirtha J. was chosen as the representative of this group. Mirtha is a hardworking mother of 6 children. She feels that starting her own business is a way she can improve her life and the life of her big family. She plans on starting a small business selling clothes, and hopes to someday turn it into a thriving business. Her dream is to provide her family a comfortable life and improve their situation. This whole group realizes that this is their chance to change their situation, and they are all ready for this loan and this opportunity. On behalf of Mirtha, the group, and Esperanza International, thank you for your support!
loan_use: To start a clothing business
borrower_names: Florene, Jusiene, Martina, Emilienne, Gertrude, Marie, Mirtha, Nidia, Lovely, Ana
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
M., age 37, is married and has four children. As a young woman M. was treated badly by a relative with whom she was living, and so M. resorted to getting married early to relieve the stress on her. She is a very hard-working woman who produced and sold products, but she encountered a break down when her goods were destroyed inside a transport vehicle that was carrying animals. This caused her to become short on market capital.

It was under this stress that a friend introduced her to GHAPE, from which she took a loan and was able to pay it back. She has also learned loan and business techniques and management skills through GHAPE, which she wants to use to expand her business.

Through her business M. provides the community with soap, omo for washing utensils and bathing, and rubbing oil. She also sells garri, bananas and kernels. She will use the profit to care for herself and her family.
loan_use: To buy chemicals, bananas, garri, pears and kernels.

description: La señora Maria Elena D. Álvarez tiene la edad de 36 años de edad habita en los Madrigales Nortes del municipio de Ticuantepe con su compañero de vida José Luís González, este señor es contratista y tiene un ingreso de C$ 3,800.00 córdobas tienen a cargo a 2 hijos que estudian primaria. Esta señora es comerciante   distribuye productos de la compañía de belleza llamada ZERMAT,  tiene dos años de trabajar con esta empresa y su sueño es tener mas condiciones de vida, por lo cual quieren comprar 12 laminas de zinc, 7 cuartones de pino, 11 reglas de pino, 10 libra de clavo de 3 “, 5 libra de clavo de zinc y un galón de pintura. Para lo cual no tienen los suficientes recursos y optaron por hacer un préstamo de C$ 5,000.00 córdobas  pagando la cantidad prestada en 9 meses
description_translated:
Maria Elena D. Álvarez is 36 years old and lives in the Madrigales Nortes of the municipality of Ticuantepe with her partner José Luís González. He is a contractor and has an income of C$ 3,800.00 córdobas. They care for their 2 children who are in primary school. She is a salesperson and distributes products for the ZERMAT beauty company. She has been working with this business for two years and her dream is to have better living conditions which is why she wants to buy 12 sheets of zinc, 7 wooden doors, 11 wooden boards, 10 pounds of 3" nails, 5 pounds of zinc and a gallon of paint. Because they do not have enough resources they decided to take a loan of C$ 5,000.00 córdobas, paying the amount borrowed in 9 months.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To purchase construction materials to make improvements to her housing

description: Adjowa A.  est âgée de 38 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est boulangère et habite à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Madame fabrique et revend des pains  depuis plus de 5 ans. La particularité de ce travail consiste à avoir assez de stock de farine de blé et de bois de chauffage .Elle tient son activité au serieux et ne fait pas de doute avec ce second crédit de FECECAV. Ce crédit lui permettra d'augmenter la capacité de son activité qui lui assurera une bonne marge à la revente et tirer rapidement un bénéfice de cet investissement et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
description_translated:
Adjowa A. is 38 years old, married and the mother of three children. She is a baker and lives in Lomé, the Togolese capital. She has made and sold bread for five years. In her line, it is important to have enough wheat flour and firewood on hand. Adjowa takes her business seriously and has not any doubts about a second loan with FECECAV. This loan would permit her to expand her business, assuring her of a substantial sales margin to make a quick profit from this investment to provide for her family.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase of sacks of wheat flour and firewood

description: Touch L., 48, is a widow living in the Phnom Penh with her four children. Since 2001, she has been operating a grocery store to earn a living and is able to make around US$5 each day. She is aided by her children, who are employed as garment factory workers. Currently, she is still looking after her elderly mother. Touch L. is asking for a loan of US$1000 to add to the grocery store's inventory. She believes this opportunity will be able to raise her standard of living. (Touch L., wearing a red shirt, was pictured with her mother at their home.)
loan_use: To add to her grocery's inventory.

description: Comfort Kraasibea is 49 years old, divorced and a mother with two children. Her children are grown and currently working. Comfort sells frozen foods in the local market to support her business growth. With her six years\' experience, she says demand for fish is high but she does not meet the capital requirement to meet such demands. She wants to use the loan to buy more cartons of frozen foods to enable her raised enough income to expand her business operation as she is recognized as the number one cold store operator in her community. She is a member of the group called "Biako Ye". Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan. Her picture was captured at her business premises.
loan_use: To buy cartons of frozen foods like fish, chicken, mutton, etc

description:
George A. is 65 years old, married and a father with five children. Currently all his children are working. George A. has owned and operated a hotel for the past three years. Because of the friendly attitudes his staff shows towards customers and its serene atmosphere of the hotel, a lot of people patronize the the facilities there. George says during weekends there are lot of people who booked the place but could not get in because of the limited rooms available and the damage to some of the facilities there. He said he wants to use the loan to buy additional air conditioners, furniture and other things to add to the existing ones. With the loan he also believes he can build more rooms to accommodate travelers and other people who want to have a perfect place to lodge. George says this will also help him maximize profit.

\r\n\r\nGeorge belongs to the Trust group called "Biako Ye" Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to for the loan and support one another to repay the loan. His picture was taken when he was visited at his meeting place.
loan_use: To purchase air conditioners, furniture and do other maintenance.

description: Comenzó como operaria de un taller de costura ya que su mama le había enseñado a bordar, luego con un dinero que le proporciono su esposo compro materia prima y empezó a trabajar su propia mercadería, no teniendo maquina, ya que la alquilaba, se siente agradecida de  adim, ya que hace 3 años se le financio para la compra de una maquina de coser, que es la que utiliza para la elaboración de trajes típicos, los cuales los vende en el mercado municipal de masaya. Vive con su esposo y 2 hijos los que asisten a clases y su esposo atiende los quehaceres de la agricultura, ella sueña con tener un taller grande con 3 maquinas y tener su personal, ya que su producto tiene demanda.
description_translated:
She began as a worker in a sewing workshop since her mother had taught her to embroider. Later, with the money that her husband gave her, she bought raw materials and started working on her own goods. She didn’t have a sewing machine, so she was renting one. She was thankful for ADIM, because for 3 years she had been saving for a sewing machine. She uses the sewing machine to make traditional suits, which she sells in the municipal market of Masaya. She lives with her husband and two children, who are in school. Her husband is involved in agriculture. She dreams of having a large workshop with three machines and having a staff, because her product is in demand.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy raw materials

description:
El Bancomunal Nueva Generación esta ubicado en la comunidad D. Yauli, provincia D. Huancavelica. Esta comunidad es una zona rural muy hermosa, cuna D. chanchos y willcas, zona D. papa y mujeres chopccas con vestimenta multicolor. Su principal actividad es la agricultura, ganadería y el comercio.

MatilD. M., es casada, tiene 5 hijos, su negocio es la venta D. chupetes, MatilD. tiene una tienda D. abarrotes, antes realizaba transporte D. Yauli a Huancavelica, pero se vio paralizado por un accidente. Con los prestamos ha mejorado las ventas que realiza, ahora desea comprar mercadería para su tienda y materia prima para elaborar sus chupetes. Su sueño es tener una bodega granD..

Isabel R., es conviviente, tiene un hijo D. 6 años D. edad, su negocio es la venta D. salchipapas, empezó muy joven, con las ganancia fue implementando su negocio compro una licuadora para vender jugos. Invertirá su préstamo en la compra D. papa para la venta en su negocio. Su sueño es tener una casa D. material noble y tener mas adelante una bodega granD..
description_translated:
The Nueva Generacion communal bank is located in the community of Yauli, Huancavelica province. This community is in a beautiful rural area, land of wild boars and willcas (indigenous culture), of potato growers and of choppca women wearing their multicolor traditional dresses. The community's main economic activities are agriculture, cattle raising, and traD..

MatilD. M. is married, has 5 children and sells chupetes (a kind of popsicles). MatilD. has a small grocery store. She used to proviD. transportation from Yauli to Huancavelica, but an accident stopped that activity. Her store sales have improved with the loans she has received. Now she would like to purchase merchandise to restock the store and raw ingredients to make chupetes. Her dream is to have a large store.

Isabela R., is a common-law wife, has a 6-year-old son. Her business is the sale of salchipapas (a fast food dish, maD. of french fries and sausages). She began her business since she was very young. As the business grew, she was able to buy a blender to sell juice. With the loan that she is requesting she will buy potatoes for making salchipapas. Isabel dreams of having a house maD. out of noble materials and later on a larger warehouse.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Nueva Generacion Communal Bank needs 11,900 soles for 14 members to invest in their businesses
borrower_names: Veronica, Santosa, Cecilia, Silvia Elizabeth, Francisca, Juana, Isabela, Isabel, Beatriz, Victoria, Martha Ruth, Tomasa, Matilde, Liliana
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description: Ann S., 30, is married and lives in Phnom Penh with her little child. She is a rice farmer, making around US$3, while her husband has a business as a motor-taxi driver, typically making US$4 each day. She said she wants her son to complete high school and then acquire a specific skill to raise a family. Ann S. has asked CREDIT [Kiva’s Field Partner] for a loan of US$1000 to replace an old and unreliable motorbike for her husband. The old motorbike uses a lot of gas when it is operating. In the future, if she has enough capital she will set up a grocery store to make extra profit.
loan_use: To replace her husband's motorbike for his motor-taxi business

description: Tasi S., 50, is married with 4 children.  She has many years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the public and villagers 3 days a week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD).  SPBD loans are Tasi's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will be used to purchase chemicals, pesticides, bush knives, spades and an axe. Her whole family, including her husband, supports this business.
loan_use: purchasing chemicals, pesticides, bush knives, spades and an axe

loan_name: Mrs. Run Oeurn's Village Bank Group
description: Mrs. Run O. is a village bank president of thirteen people who all live Korng Keb Village in the Kampong Chhnang Province. The loan will be used for different purposes. For instance, Mrs. Run O. is a pig breeder who is currently raising one pig. Since this business is going well, she would like to expand it so she has decided to ask for a loan to buy two more piglets for breeding. Mrs. Run O. is 34 years old and the mother of six children, four of whom are attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Chem Kech, is a breeder who is raising six cows. Aside from this business, he owns a 2-hectar rice field. \r\n\r\nThis is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Nine members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.
loan_use: To purchase two more piglets for breeding.
borrower_names: Nuo, Vorn, Khlouk, Chin, Poeurk, Morn, Run, Port, Men, Yoem, Sem, Moun, Run
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Cleidi es una mujer joven y emprendedora, que trabaja por las tardes cuidando niños en su casa, y disponía de tiempo en las mañanas para hacer alguna actividad para tener un dinero extra, una amiga le recomendó vender plata y decidio que esa era una buena opción para lograr obtener ingresos extras.\r\n

\r\n Ella necesita un préstamo por US $150 que pagara en 3 meses para tener mayor variedad de productos que ofrecer y así incrementar sus ventas.
description_translated:
Cleidi is a young entrepreneuring woman who works in the afternoons taking care of children in her home, leaving her mornings to perform some activity to make extra money. A friend recommended that she sold silver and she decided that was a good option to obtain an extra income.

\r\nShe needs a loan for US $150 that she will pay in 3 months to have a larger variety of products to offer, and in that way increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: comprar mercancia

description:
El Sr. Roberto B. no está solicitando un préstamo para poner el piso de concretó al frente de su casa ya que cuando llueve se le inunda el lugar y el agua se va para dentro de su casa y los muebles ya están algo dañados por la humedad.

Sr. Roberto trabaja en una compañía que se dedican a la construcción de casas el está en el aria de electricista esté es su ingreso familiar.

Roberto nos contó que el por el momento se esta haciendo cargo de sus 2 hijos porque se separa de su esposa.

El Sr. Roberto está solicitando un préstamo por $575.00 dlls para poner le piso al frente de su casa.
description_translated:
Roberto Baez is soliciting this loan in order to lay a cement patio in front of his home. This needs to be done in order to stop the flooding of his house when it rains, which ruins the furniture and the home itself. Roberto is an electrician and works for a home construction company for his primary source of income. He is currently the only care taker of his two children because he has separated from his wife. Roberto is soliciting this loan of $575 dollars to lay a cement patio in front of his home.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Put a cement patio in front of his home.

description:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 36-year-old Miriam from Dar es Salaam. She is married with two children between the ages of three and 14 years. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because their parents do not take care of them. Miriam has been running a pharmacy since 2005. Her business is doing well. She works at the business for nine hours per day, five days per week and is assisted by one employee. Miriam currently earns about 100 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 250 USD in order to purchase additional medicine for her business. In the future, she plans to increase her business through new product offerings. Miriam thanks you for your support!\r\n

\r\nSELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.
loan_use: To replenish her inventory of medicines

description:
Mrs. Thoeurn N., 32, sells vegetables and lives in Archarleak Commune, Kampong Thom Province. She sells her goods at the market and earns around US$3.50 per day. Her husband, Mr. Thin Pak, is a motorcycle driver, earning around US$2.50 per day. The couple has four children, all of whom live at home and are students. Thoeurn and her husband work hard every day to support their family. \r\n

\r\nVegetable sales is the main income for the family and Thoeurn needs to increase her business by improving and offering more vegetables to sell. She would like a loan of US$500 to purchase a larger variety of vegetables to sell. The remainder of the loan will be used to pay for transporting her goods from land she bought to the village. Her future goal is to purchase a store in the market.
loan_use: To purchase a variety of vegetables to sell at the market and to pay for transporting the goods to the market

description:
Mrs. Savoeun C., 50 years old, and her husband, Mr. Song Sorn, 50 years old, live on an Island near the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. This couple was married in 1979 and have eight children: three sons and five daughters. Two of their children were married and live outside the family home. Two sons are security guards while the two daughters are silk weavers and the other daughter is a salesperson.

Mrs. Savoeun has been a silk weaver since she was fifteen years old. Silk weaving is a skill she learned from her parents. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. Song is a chef and regularly cooks for weddings and other ceremonies in the village.

Savoeun is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase silk materials for weaving.
loan_use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

description: Saúl es un joven dedicado a la crianza de animales, con el fin de poder ayudar a sus padres en sus gastos, esta actividad no es desagradable para él, todo lo contrario,  la realiza con sumo gozo porque tiene gran aprecio y cariño a los animales, los cuida de la mejor manera.  Como todo joven tiene sueños que realizar, uno de ellos es incrementar la cantidad de animales, para con el tiempo venderlos en los mercados, especialmente en los días festivos. Por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de un carnerito y así, en algo, aumentar sus animales y sus ingresos para fines de este año.
description_translated:
Saul is a young man who raises livestock as an end to a means to help his parents with their expenses. This isn't an unpleasant occupation for him, actual it is quite the contrary - he carries out his duties with an enormous pleasure and with great affection towards the animals, taking care of them the best way possible. Like every young person, he has dream that he wants to see materialized. One of them is to add to his livestock herd, so that with time he will be able to sell them in the markets, especially on holidays. He is requesting a loan for this reason. He wishes to purchase a calf to add to his herd of animals and to increase his income by the year's end./p>

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To purchase a calf to add to his herd.

description: Berlín quien tiene 30 años, es padre de 2 hijos maravillosos que le incentivan a salir adelante, vive junto a su pareja, quien lo apoya en todo sus decisiones y está de acuerdo con sus metas trazadas.  Desde hace 6 años, trabaja en el transporte de pasajeros por diferentes lugares  de Pucallpa, es propietario de un motocarro, en el cual solo trabaja por horas, ya que también se dedica a la venta de artefactos eléctricos para el hogar. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, porque así conoce muchos lugares.   Trabaja duro, ya que quiere brindarles todo lo necesario a sus hijos que estudian y son su razón de ser, como también velar por los gastos familiares.  Desea comprar repuestos para la reparación de su motocarro, en el futuro quiere alquilar un local para su negocio de venta de artefactos.
description_translated:
Berlín is 30 years old, father of 2 marvelous children who are his incentive to be successful. He lives with his wife who supports him in all his decisions and is in agreement with his goals. For 6 years he has worked transporting passengers to different places in Pucallpa as owner of a motorcar, which he works alone for hours. He also sells home electronics. He likes his work a lot because he gets to know many places. He works hard as he wants to provide his children with everything they need and they are his reason for being, and he also takes care of his family’s expenses. He wishes to buy parts to repair his motorcar. In the future he wants to rent a locale for his business selling electronics.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Buy parts to repair his motorcar

description: Esta cliente inició su negocio en una pequeña pulpería y con los créditos que adim le ha proporcionado ella empezó a ofertar gran variedad de productos. Ella ha ido creciendo en sus negocios con la ayuda de sus hijos y de su  esposo el que desempeña el oficio de sastrería  y tiene su propio taller; con estos ingresos extras  le ayuda con los gastos de la casa y el estudio de sus hijos que están en la universidad. Por su carácter amable se ha ganado la simpatía de sus vecinos logrando mantener una gran clientela. Su mayor sueño es de ampliar su negocio hasta llegar a tener una abarroteria.
description_translated:
This client started her business in a tiny general store and with the loans that ADIM has granted her she began to offer a large variety of products. She has been growing her business with the help of her children and her husband who works as a tailor and has his own shop. With this extra income she helps him with the household expenses and with the education of their children who are in university. Because of her pleasant personality she has won the friendship of her neighbors, succeeding in keeping a large clientele. Her biggest dream is to enlarge her business so that it will one day be a convenience store.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Working Capital

description:
S. Muhiba describes herself as a hard-working, enterprising and happy married mother of two children. Her husband is a laborer. She decided to start a tailoring business to help him with household expenses. She wanted her children to get an education and that wasn't possible on her husband's salary alone. She started by helping a woman who ran a tailoring shop. After she learned the business well, she installed a small shop in her home. During the last 20 years, the business has gone very well and grown. \r\n

\r\nNow Muhiba is requesting a loan of 2500 Somoni ($750). She plans to use the loan to purchase modern materials so she can fulfill her customers' requests for national dresses. Muhiba and her family are very grateful for your support in helping this business grow and move ahead.
loan_use: Purchase new modern materials to sew the national dresses

description: Nelly, de 47 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos, se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos, desde hace mucho tiempo, su esposo Roldan es trabajador independiente y la apoya mucho en su negocio. Nelly se levanta muy temprano a preparar todas sus prendas para luego llevar a venderlas por diferentes lugares de su zona. Junto a su esposo  trabajan con mucho esmero para ver felices a sus hijos y que en un mañana sean profesionales y hombres de bien.  El objetivo de Nelly  es crecer con su negocio, motivo por el cual solicita este préstamo, para el alquilar un local para la venta de sus prendas, además de comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería. Con tu ayuda logrará su objetivo en muy corto tiempo.
description_translated:
Nelly, 47 years old, is a mother of 2 children has worked selling clothing and shoes for quite some time. Her husband Roldan is an independent worker and helps her a lot with her business. Nelly rises very early to prepare her garments to later sell them in different places in her area. Together with her husband they work with much diligence to see their children happy and that in the future they be professional, good men. Nelly's objective is to grow her business, which is why she is requesting this loan in order to rent a location to sell her garments, as well as buying a larger quantity of merchandise. With your help she will achieve her goal in very little time.\r\n

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Rent a location to sell clothing and shoes and increase her merchandise

description: Esta clienta tiene mucha experiencia en lo que respecta al negocio de costura, tiene 5 años en este negocio, comenzó solo con  una maquina de coser y una ayudante, debido a que tiene un mercado grande que abastecer, su marido la apoyó  con la  compra  de una maquina.  En la actualidad tiene 3 maquinas y 2 trabajadoras,  las que elaboran vestidos de niña y trajes de dama. Con los créditos y con las capacitaciones de adim logra administrar bien su negocio, lo que la hace sentirse realizada como mujer y microempresaria Vive con su esposo y dos niños que asisten al colegio de primaria, tiene casa propia y su mayor ilusión es poder remodelar su casa de habitación y separar el taller.
description_translated:
This client has a lot of sewing experience. She has had her business for 5 years and she started with only one sewing machine and an assistant. As she had a large market to supply for, her husband supported her by buying a sewing machine. Now she has 3 machines and 2 staff who make girl's dresses and women's clothing. With the credit and training from ADIM she managed to administrate her business which makes her feel that she has proved herself as a woman and microentrepreneur. She lives with her husband and 2 kids who are in primary school. She has her own home and her dream is to remodel the house and separate the workshop.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Work capital/Capital de Trabajo

loan_name: Mr. Ey Sam Ort's Village Bank Group
description:
Nine people in Da Village in Kampong Chhnang Province form the village bank and they plan to use the loan for different purposes. Mr. Ey S. O. is the village bank president and he is a fisherman in the local lake. In this business, he now faces a small problem because he does not have enough money to purchase more fishnets to catch more fish. His wife, Mrs. Nhil S. Oeurn, is a farmer who owns a hectare to cultivate rice to earn for a living. Mr. Ey S. O. is 46 years old and the father of five childR., one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the others help their parents' business. Mr. Ey S. O. hopes he can make more income to improve his living condition with this new loan. \r\n\r\n

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Six members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.
loan_use: These people would like to improve their small businesses, such as by purchasing more nets to catch more fish.
borrower_names: Chek, Svay, Chek, Ten, Ey, Um, Lom, Khoy, Ket
borrower_genders: female, female, female, male, male, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Mrs. Bina M. lives in Thecho, Lalitpur. She lives in a single (ie. not extended) family with her husband Chakra and five daughters. Her husband is a farmer and works on his own land. All five daughters are now studying. 

Mrs. M. opened a grocery shop one year ago to raise the living standard of her family. Their financial condition is not good, so they can't provide better education for their daughters, as the cost of education is very high in Nepal. To overcome this problem, Mrs. M. opened her grocery shop. 

Due to a lack of capital, she can't keep stocks of grocery items for her shop. She is asking for her first loan of Rs10000.00 to buy goods like rice, utensils, noodles, etc. She plans to spend her income to provide better education for their daughters and wishes to help her husband to upgrade the quality of life of her family.
loan_use: To buy grocery goods

description: Margarita tiene 28 años, convive con su pareja Elvo, de también 28 años de edad.  Ella se dedica a atención de restaurantes desde hace 8 años, su buena sazón la motivó a ahorrar y decidir poner su propio restaurante hace 1 año y medio, tiempo en el cual se ha dedicado íntegramente a esta labor.  Margarita alquiló un local donde puso su restaurante, trabajando duro todo el día para lograr mejores ingresos económicos, le dedica todo su tiempo y esta labor, que siente que a veces la ata sin poder salir, pero el gusto por la cocina y la atención a la clientela es mucho mayor, haciendo que pueda vencer cualquier dificultad. Margarita se esfuerza mucho cada día para poder conformar una familia en el futuro, y poder brindarles una buena estabilidad económica. Con el dinero que obtenga del préstamo comprará más cantidad de comestibles para poder elaborar sus ricos platos.  En el futuro, quiere agrandar su restaurante, consiguiendo un local propio y contratando personal para la atención.
description_translated:
Margarita is 28 years old and she lives with her partner Elvo, who is also 28 years old. She has devoted her attention to restaurants for 8 years, her good food motivated her to save and she decided to have her own restaurant one and a half years ago, during which time she has been devoted entirely to this work. Margarita rented a place where she put up her restaurant, working hard all day to achieve better economic returns. She devotes all her time to this work, sometimes feeling that she is unable to leave, but her love for cooking and caring for her customers is greater and allows her to overcome any difficulty. Margarita works hard everyday so she can form a family in the future and provide them with good economic stability. With the money she gets from the loan she will buy more groceries to make her delicious meals. In the future, she wants to enlarge her restaurant, owning her own location and hiring wait staff.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase ingredients to make food for her small restaurant

description:
Noheli es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasum que significa Trabajemos en Quechua. Noheli es madre soltera, tiene 21 años y 1 hijo de 3 años, estudia computación en un instituto, Noheli tiene una tienda en la casa de sus padres ubicado en la Urbanización Emadi, en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, carnes, frutas, artículos de regalos, actividad que realiza desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de su mamá cuando ella asiste a sus clases, Noeli realiza sus compras 3 veces por semana.

Noheli necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz, fideo, leche, aceite. Los sueños de Noheli son ampliar su negocio, brindar una buena educación a su hijo y culminar sus estudios.
description_translated:
Noheli is a member of the Community Bank Llamkasum, that means “We work” in Quechua. Noheli is a single mother. She is 21 years old and she has one 3-year-old son. She studies computation in an institute. Noheli has a store in her home of her parents, which is located in Emadi, where she sells groceries, vegetables, meats, fruits, and gifts. This is an activity that she does from 5 in the morning until 9 at night. She is helped to do this by her mother when she has to attend her classes. Noeli buys her merchandise three times a week. Noheli needs a loan of 3000 soles, money that she would invest in the purchase of sugar, rice, vermicelli, milk, and oil. The dreams of Noheli are to grow her business, to get a good education for her son, and to finish her own studies.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Noheli needs a loan of 3000 soles which she would invest in the purchase of sugar, rice, vermicelli, milk, and oil.

description:
En el municipio de Condega en la ciudad de Estelí, el señor Asunción O. se dedica desde hace 3 años al negocio de venta de refrescos y comida atendido en su propia casa de habitación. Sus inicios fueros muy duros por la razón de que vendía en pequeñas cantidades pero a medida que vino pasando el tiempo fue incrementando sus productos.

Hoy en día el señor Asunción atraviesa la necesidad de adquirir las bebidas y preparar los alimentos para su respectiva comercialización y por esta razón es que busca el apoyo en CEPRODEL para obtener un crédito y así continuar en el negocio que es su única fuente de ingreso para mantener a su familia que tanto ama.
description_translated:
Within the Municipality of Condega in the city of Esteli, Asuncion O. has been selling food and drinks for the past three years from their home. The beginnings were very difficult because his sales were weak but slowly with the passage of time he began to increase the products he could offer.

In present day Asuncion sees the need to acquire drinks and prepare foods for sale, and due to this need he seeks the support of Ceprodel to obtain a loan. With the loan he will be able to continue with his business, the only source of income he has to support his much beloved family.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To purchase drinks and ingredients.

description: Esta señora vende de manera ambulante con un carretón de caballo, ella vende frutas y verduras, etc. se desplaza por todos los barrios de Nindiri, se destaca por mantener ella sola su negocio, lo que la ha convertido en una mujer muy popular del municipio, cuenta con una clientela fija la que además les lleva por encargo. Los créditos de adim le han servido para hacer crecer su negocio. Sus hijos ya mayores vive aparte son sus esposas, ella con su negocio les dio educación y el día de hoy son personas de buen comportamiento
description_translated:
Sonia engages in traveling sales with a horse and small cart. She sells fruits and vegetables, among other things, making her way through all the districts of Nindiri. She stands out by running her business by herself, a fact which has made her very popular in her municipality. She has a fixed clientele who she makes deliveries to by order. She has employed loan proceeds from field partner ADIM in growing her business. Her children are grown and live apart from her with their wives. With her business, Sonia was able to provide them an education and today they are good citizens.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy produce.

description: Doña yesenia V. es una cliente que tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo de apenas tres años de edad, su compañero de vida tambien es comerciante, su mayor sueño es poder tener su propia casa ya que habita con su señora madre actualmente. La actividad eocnomica de doña yesenia es la comercializacion de ropa actividad que tiene seis años de ejercer, ella compra en conjunto con su compañero de vida en mercados de managua, a un costo mas bajo y posterirmente entrega a comerciantes locales de los mercados, ademas de comercializar de ropa nueva tambien comercializa con cosmeticos; en dicha actividad da incio como una necesidad de empleo y de poder salir adelante con su familia a fin de poder logar sus sueños y ofrecerle mejores condicones de vida a su familia, para eso solicito este credito siempre para capital de trabajo teniendo la conviccion que el dia de mañana producto de las utilidades y del esfuerzo de sus trabajo pueda cambiar su vida.
description_translated:
Mrs. Yesenia V. is 32 years old and is a single mother, she has a 3-year-old son and her life partner works as a sales person. Her biggest dream is to buy her own home, because she currently lives with her mother. She works selling clothes for the past 6 years, she buys with her partner merchandise on the markets in Managua at a lower price and then she distributes the merchandise to local retailers. She sells clothes as well as beauty products. She started this activity to support her family and improve her living conditions. She is requesting this loan to increase her working capital and in the future due to her hard work she will be able to change her life.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Working Capital

description:
There are four members of this group loan. Mrs. Trich S., 47 years old and the group leader, is a fish seller. She has operated her business for over twenty years. She sells her fish from village to village, earning approximately US$3.00 a day. Mrs. Trich married to Mr. Set Sei, 47, a fisherman. Set always leaves the house early in the morning to fish. They have three children, one of whom lives with them and their two daughters work for a garment factory. Set is facing difficulty with his fishing tools often being broken. Therefore, he had a discussion with his wife and decided to seek a loan of US$400 to purchase more nets and bait for fish. The other members of their group are:

Mrs. Thoeun V., 33, is a fish seller. Her husband fishes and she sells them in addition to fish she buys from suppliers. Thoeun requests a loan US$250 to buy more fish to sell.

Mr. Sarat Y., 23, is a fisherman in Tonle Sap Lake, and he has been fishing for long time. Sarat is asking for a loan of US$200 to buy a net for fishing.

Mrs. Vany C., 47, is a farmer. She has a lot of experience in faming. Vany seeks a loan of US$150 to purchase a net to help her husband's fishing business.

They all live in Sarikakao Commune, Kandal Province.
loan_use: These people would each like to improve their fishing businesses by buying nets and bait for fish.

description: Mrs. Anu K., 33 years old, lives in Kritipur. Kritipur is located in the Kathmandu Valley. Kritipur is one of the developing villages of Kathmandu and most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Mrs. K. lives in a home with her husband and three children. She has two daughters and one son. Her older daughter is studying in grade 9 and the younger one is in grade 1; her son is in grade 8. Her husband, Mr. Bhim K., is a taxi driver in the Kathmandu Valley. Her husband's taxi was damaged and it needs to be repaired. Mrs. Anu is requesting a loan to help her husband with the repair of his taxi.
loan_use: To repair taxi

description: Zilha J. is 52 years old and lives in a suburb of Doboj. She is not married and the only income that she has is from her business with poultry. This is seasonal work and she earns only enough to pay her daily costs. Zilha is not able to save much money, and every time she has to buy chickens she has to borrow money or take a loan. She has taken out loans with WWI in the past, and and now she requests a loan of 600KM ($450 USD). Zilha will use this loan to buy little chickens and turkeys for fattening and reselling.
loan_use: To buy chickens and turkeys

description: Mrs. Kalpana K. lives in Sanepa, Lalitpur and lives with her huband Mr. Shyam Kumar K.. He is a taxi driver in the Kathmandu valley. Mrs. Kalpana opened her fruit shop a few months ago in the Sanepa-chock. Now Mrs. K. is requesting a $150 loan to buy fresh fruit to sell during the festivals of Dashain and Tihar.
loan_use: To buy fresh fruits

description:
Mrs. Nasy M., 42, and her husband, Mr. Phat Pheng, 45, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, married twenty-one years ago and have six children: three daughters and three sons. Two of their children are silk weavers and other two sons are workmen. Two children study in a local school.\r\n

\r\nNasy and Phat have been raising pigs and producing rice wine for five years. They sell the pigs and rice wine to the middleman in their village. Nasy is requesting a loan of US$ 1200 to purchase feed for raising pigs and producing rice wine.
loan_use: To purchase feed for raising pigs and supplies for producing rice wine

description:
Victoria D. L. C., Benigna DomitiL. C. C., and Felicitas L. D. L. C. are members of the community bank San Antonio D. Padua, in a small town called Mauallasacc in Ayacucho. The residents of the area are dedicated to agriculture, cheese production, and raising cattle.

Victoria is a single mother with a 20-year-old son who is currently studying at the University of Alas Peruanos. She helps run a restaurant that offers all types of Peruvian dishes. Her dream is to have her own restaurant and open a small store in the area. She is saving because the interest she earns continues to grow, and she plans to use the money to open her own store in the future.

Benigna lives with her partner and their 4 children, who are all in school. She has a small snack bar in the area. She hopes to open her own small restaurant in December 2008. She is currently saving to purchase more materials to stock her future restaurant and for her knitting business.

Felicitas is married with four children, aged 26, 22, 16, and 12. Felicitas has been selling candies since she was young, and she has now begun selling children's clothing. Her dream is to have her children become professionals. She is very proud that her two eldest are studying at the university in Ayacucho--they are on their way. She is currently saving to ensure they remain in school and to supply her future needs.

Felicitas will invest this loan by purchasing more clothing to sell. Benigna plans to purchase groceries to stock her snack bar, along with yarn because she also spends time knitting. Victoria will invest in her business by purchasing drinks and groceries to keep her restaurant stocked with food.
loan_use: The community bank, San Antonio de Padua, needs a loan of 4700 nuevos soles in order for 10 of its members to improve their businesses.
borrower_names: Victoria, Vilma Digna, Yolanda, Ninfa, Teodora, Gladys, Graciela, Benigna Domitila, Felicitas, Elena
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description: La señora Maria Nela habita en el barrio Batahola Norte, barrio ubicado en la capital de Managua, tiene 27 años, se encuentra acompañada del señor Daniel Enrique Rodriguez, el se dedica a la supervisión de construcción, tienen un hijo de 7 años. Actualmente la señora Maria Nela se dedica a su negocio que es una pulpería, donde vende al por menor diferentes productos de granos basicos,  tiene 2 años de tener su negocio, donde comenzó con capital  propio y en los  últimos años ha venido trabajando como mucho esfuerzo  para poder   ampliar su negocio, por tanto recurre al micro crédito para solicitar fondos para incrementar su inventario y obtener mayores ventas, ella esta solicitando la cantidad de C$ 6,000 a un plazo de 9 meses para invertirlo en su pequeña pulpería.
description_translated:
Mrs. Maria Nela lives in the town of North Batahola, in the capital city of Managua, Nicaragua. She is 27-years old and lives with her companion Mr. Daniel Enrique Rodriguez, who is a construction supervisor. Together they have a 7-year old child. Currently, Mrs. Nela has a business where she sells various basic grains. She has maintained this business for the last 2-years that initially started with equity. In recent years she has been working hard to be able to expand her business and has resorted to applying for a loan to increase her store’s inventory and generate more sales. She requests a loan of $6,000 to be repaid in 9 months for her little shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy more inventory products for her store.

description: El señor Fidel habita el barrio Maria Auxiliadora, barrio ubicado en la capital de Managua, tiene 57 años de edad, se encuentra   casado con la señora Maria Solórzano, que es ama de casa, ambos tienen dos hijos  de 16 y 7 años de edad, son estudiante de secundaria. Actualmente el señor Fidel es transportista, el tiene su propio taxi y el mismo lo conduce, tiene 30 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, donde inicio con esta actividad alquilando  vehículos y luego solicito un financiamiento para poder obtener su propio vehiculo y de esta manera poder tener mayores ingresos en su familia y prestarle mejores condiciones de vida a su esposa y sus hijos, por tanto solicita este crédito de C$ 7,000 a un  plazo de 10 meses para realizarle mejoras a su vivienda, ya que necesita comprar material de construcción Gypsum.
description_translated:
Fidel works in the region of Maria Auxiliadora, a region located in the capital city of Managua. He is 57 years old and he is married to Maria Solorzano. She stays home with both of their children aged 16 and 7 years, and they are attending school. Fidel is a taxi driver. He owns his own taxi and he drives it himself. He has been driving it for the last 30 years and he started out by renting a car. He later requested a loan to get his own car, to have a better income for his family and provide them with a better quality of life. He is requesting a loan of C$7000, to be repaid in a term of 10 months, to renovate their home. He needs to purchase building material especially Gympsum.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To purchase building materials to remodel their home.

description: Con 52 años y 25 de ellos vendiendo salchipapas, la señora Reynalda se sacrifica por sus hijos y nietos, todo es por y para ellos, cuenta con mucha experiencia y una fiel clientela, lo que le ha permitido ir creciendo de a pocos, lento pero seguro, logrando así casi terminar de cambiar el material noble por el adecuado para su casa, que la comparte con hijos y nietos.\r\n\r\nRequiere de 500 soles de préstamo para poder lograr tan ansiada meta, trazada desde hacía 25 años, cuando empezó en un puesto ambulante situado fuera de su casa, que luce hoy en día distinta.
description_translated:
At 52, with 25 years spent selling salchipapas (sausage and fries), Señora Reynalda sacrifices herself for her children and grandchildren, everything is for them. She has plenty of experience and a faithful clientele, which has permitted her to keep growing little by little, slowly but surely. She has almost succeeded at finishing the house she shares with her children and grandchildren. She needs a loan of $175 in order to complete this long-desired task, envisioned 25 years ago, when she started in a mobile kiosk outside of her house, and now seeing the light of day.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Finish construction of her salchipapa business with a roof and floor

description: Habib, 44, lives in Beirut and owns a mini-market that caters to his local neighbors. Habib has requested a loan of $1000 USD from Al Majmoua to purchase a large stock of items for his shop. This will be Habib's second loan with Al Majmoua. His first was repaid in full and on time.
loan_use: To purchase a new stock

description: Jamshed has owned a transportation business for the past 2 years. He transports people around his town. As he is the only bread-winner in his family, his car service business is the only source of  family income. When he bought his car it was new, but as his auto is always on the move it is in need of some repairs. This loan will help to make a fast and quality repair of his car.
loan_use: Repairing his car

description: LAMINE D. HABITE AU QUARTIER CHAMP DE COURSE A DIOURBEL. SON ACTIVITE CONSISTE A ACHETER DES MOUTONS, LES ENGRAISSER ET LES REVENDRE. IL A UNE EXPERIENCE DE 5 ANS.
description_translated:
LAMINE D. lives in the CHAMP DE COURSE district of DIOURBEL. His work involves buying sheep, fattening them, and selling them. He has five years of experience.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Fattening sheep

description:
Mrs. Phaer P. is a villager in Ta Skaom Village in the Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Suos Soeur, are farmers. They have four children, three of whom are attending the local school while the other one is too young to work

\r\nMrs. Phaer P. and her husband cannot both support their family and improve their living conditions without a loan. In order to improve their housing situation, Mrs. Phaer P. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to be able to buy timber and build a new house for her family. Her husband is on the right in the photo.
loan_use: To combine savings with a loan and buy timber to build a new house for the family.

description:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Sesilia D. from Mbeya, married with two children between the ages of 9 and 13. Sesilia has been running a grocery and crops business since 2007. After purchasing commodities such as rice, cooking oil, and soda wholesale from regional farmers, she retails them to people in the area. Assisted by one employee and her brother, Sesilia currently earns about $200 per month working 12 hours each day, 6 days per week.

She is requesting a loan of $650 to purchase additional crops and commodities such as cooking oil, sugar, soap and salt for her grocery store. In the future, she plans to open another business. Sesilia thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.
loan_use: To purchase additional crops and commodities for her grocery store.

description:
Marina H. Y. is married with three children over the age of eighteen. Marina is a member of the community bank Emprendedoras, which means "enterprisers" in Spanish. Marina sells groceries every day from her home.

She will use her loan of 400 soles (~$150 USD) to invest in her business by purchasing vegetables, fruits, various meats and cheeses, refreshments, cookies, and candies. With her savings, Marina's goal is to continue improving her grocery sales. She is also helping her children pay for their education at the University. She dreams that they will continue with their education and become professionals. .
loan_use: To purchase vegetables, fruits, various meats and cheeses, refreshments, cookies, and candies for her grocery business.

description:
La señora Delia Dalila V. Fernández tiene 42 años  y es tesorera de su Banco Comunal Mujeres Valerosas II, vive en la calle Francisco de Miranda 1998 del distrito Esperanza Alta de la provincia de Trujillo departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió secundaria completa pero no continuó estudiando debido a que se casó con Basilio Minchola León con quien tiene 2 hijas  estudiantes.
Delia vendía objetos de plástico y zapatillas, luego gracias al préstamo de Manuela Ramos pudo incrementar su negocio y empezó a vender también objetos de vidrio y ropa de diversa calidad. Su trabajo es ambulante.
Con el primer préstamo de 300 soles devueltos en 4 cuotas, compró juegos de platos, jarras y otros pedidos de sus clientes.
Con este crédito de 1700 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará ropa y objetos de vidrio.
Sueña con tener una tienda mayorista y cumplir los sueños de su hija que le gustaría hacer el bien a todas las personas.
description_translated:
Ms. Delia Dalila V. Fernández is 42 years old and is the treasurer of the Mujeres Valerosas II (Valiant Women) Microfinance Institute. She lives on Francisco de Miranda Street 1998, in the district of Esperanza Alta, in the Trujillo province of the La Libertad Perú department. She finished high school but was unable to continue with her studies due to the fact that she married Basilio Minchola León, with whom she has 2 school age daughters. Delia used to sell plastic goods and shoes, but then, thanks to a loan from Manuela Ramos, she was able to expand her business and started selling glass products and apparel. She works as a street vendor. With her first loan of 300.00 PEN, which were repaid in 4 monthly installments, she purchased dish sets, pitchers, and other products that customers ordered. With this 1,700.00 loan, which will be repaid in 4 monthly installments, she will purchase clothing and glass products. She dreams of having a wholesale store and of helping her daughter’s dream come true, which is helping other people.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase clothing and glass products

description: Mrs. Moeng O. is a farmer in Prey Khla Tboung Village in Takeo Province. In this plantation, she now faces an obstacle because her field is infertile which has a bad effect on her crops. To solve this problem, Mrs. Moeng O. is requesting a loan to purchase more fertilizer to improve her field to make her crops more productive. Her husband, Mr. Un Thol, is a pig breeder. Mrs. Moeng O. is 42 years old and the mother of three children, all enrolled in the local school. Her husband is also in the photo.
loan_use: To purchase more fertilizer to make her crops more productive

description: Memelihara sapi sudah pekerjaan yang biasa bagi ibu 2 anak ini. Walaupun memerlukan tenaga yang ekstra karena harus mencari rumput, tetapi Ni Putu Muliasih tidak sendiri. Ni Putu Muliasih dibantu suami dalam menjalani usaha ini. 2 ekor anak sapi yang dipelihara harus mendapat perhatian yang baik agar pertumbuhannya baik sehingga bisa dijual dengan harga tinggi. Untuk itu setiap hari setelah selesai memasak, Ni Putu Muliasih mencari pakan seperti rumput dan berbagai jenis dedaunan. Dalam 1 tahun dari hasil penjualan 2 ekor anak sapi sebesar Rp.10.000.000,- Ni Putu Muliasih  mendapatkan keuntungan Rp. 5.000.000,-  Ni Putu Muliasih juga membeli pakan berupa konsentrat untuk sapi. Keuntungan ini sangat membantu keluarga Muliasih karena sangat lumayan keuntungannya.Untuk pinjaman ini Ni Putu Muliasih ingin memelihara lebih banyak sapi lagi sehingga keuntungan yang didapat lebih banyak. Dengan Pinjaman Rp. 6.000.000.- Ni Putu Muliasih bisa membeli 2 ekor anak sapi.
description_translated:
Raising cow has become customary work to this mother and child. Although required extra energy due to the need to find grass, but Ni Putu Muliasih is not alone. Ni Putu Muliasih is assisted by her husband to undertake this effort. Two calves being reared is given good attention in order that they grow well until they can be sold for a good price. For that, everyday after completing cooking, Ni Putu Muliasih seeks grass and various leaves. In a year, revenue from selling 2 calves amounts to Rp. 10.000.000,- Ni Putu Muliasih obtain profit of Rp. 5.000.000,- Ni Putu Muliasih also purchase special feed for the calves. This profit assists her family, as their income is mediocre. For this loan Ni Putu Muliasih intend to raise more calves to increase her income. With loan of Rp. 6.000.000,- Ni Putu Muliasih can buy 2 calves.\r\n\r\n

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase calves and supplies (Membeli anak sapi dan pakannya)

description: Саймуродов Рахмон, 1966 года рождения. Он женат и у них многодетная семья. Вместе с женой они воспитывают 10 детей. Чтоб прокормить большую семью Рахмон решил занятся продажей школьных книг и принадлежностей. Сейчас он в месте со своей женой продают разновидность препаратов для истребления насекомых и грызунов. Продаваемый ими товар всегда в спросе, так как эти препараты часто востребованы в сельской местности. Свои товары Рахмон закупает в оптовом рынке и продает на рынке Мубориз Гисарского района.\r\nДля увеличения товарооборота хочет получить займ в сумме 3000 сомони для закупа препаратов от вредителей домашних животных.
description_translated:
Rahmon S. was born in 1966. He is married and raises 10 children with his wife. In order to support his large family, Rahmon decided to start selling school books and supplies. Currently, his wife and he sell a variety of insect- and rodent-controlling pesticides. The goods are always in demand especially in their agricultural locality. Rahmon purchases his goods at a wholesale market and sells them at the Muboriz market in the Gissar district. In order to increase goods turnover, he wants to obtain a $900 loan for purchasing pest control products for domestic animals.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To purchase pest control products for domestic animals

description:
Assadllah is married. He lives with his own family. He has a restaurant. He has been involved in this business for a long time. He got the first-cycle loan and used it for his business and until now he is furthering his business. Now he plans to enlarge his business. He wants to take out his second-cycle loan.

Therefore he has requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghanis with a term of 12 months to enlarge his shop and complete his stock and change the design of the restaurant. He would love to be a good business dealer in the future.

He is happy. He plans to open another restaurant in the next 5 years. He tries his best to open another restaurant with his income. He wants to say that without this loan it was impossible to get his restaurant to be its best and he hopes that he is going to be the best in the future.
loan_use: To continue to expand his business

description: Elizabeth is 28 years old and married with two kids. Her kids are currently in school. To support her family, she has been hawking cosmetics in the neighborhood to her loyal clients. She says that selling cosmetics is very lucrative and, therefore, she wants to expand her inventory to enable her to make a good income to sponsor her children's education. Elizabeth is a member of the group called St John. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay their loans.
loan_use: To buy more stock of cosmetics.

description:
Kwabena O. is married and has one child. He has received schooling through the junior high level. His wife is a fishmonger.

Kwabena makes artifacts and crafts and sells them at Coconut Grove near Elmina. He has been in this business since 2003. Kwabena uses his income to pay his utility bills and other family expenses.

Kwabena will use this loan to purchase carving tools, wood, and other materials for his business. With the new profits from his expanded business, Kwabena plans to improve the living conditions of his family.
loan_use: To purchase carving tools, wood, and other materials

description:
Justa es socia del Banco Comunal Alborada.

Justa es casada, tiene 56 años y 7 hijos, Justa junto a su esposo tienen una tienda en su casa que se ubica al frente del mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde vende abarrotes, cereales enteros y molidos, sus ventas son al por mayor y menor para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de un empleado, sus productos los adquiere de las feriantes y también de distribuidores que le traen a su negocio. Actividad que realiza todos los días de la semana.

Justa necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, harina. Justa sueña con tener una empresa en donde tengan participación todos sus hijos, que el ultimo de sus hijos culmine sus estudios universitarios y descansar, disfrutar de unas buenas vacaciones.
description_translated:
Justa is a partner in the Alborada community bank.

She is 56 years old and is marries with 7 children. Justa and her husband have a store in their home, which is located in front of the market in the city of Ayacucho, where they sell groceries as well as whole and ground grains. She sells her products in both large and small amounts, and she has one employee. She purchases her products from wholesalers and from distributors who visit her store. She is open 7 days a week.

Justa is requesting a loan of 3000 soles which she will invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, and flour. She dreams of having a company where her children can work, to have her children finish their university studies, and to rest and enjoy a nice vacation.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Justa is requesting a loan of 3000 soles which she will invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, and flour.

description:
Fusana Y. is married and has 4 children. She has received a junior high education. Her husband is a fisherman.

Fusana buys fish from the fishermen, brings them home for processing and preservation, and then sends them to be sold at the market at Elmina. She has been in this business since 2000. Fusana uses her income to help her husband pay the children's school fees and the utility bills.

Fusana will use this loan to increase her capital to buy more fish to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Fusana plans to save for a piece of land she wants to buy with her husband.
loan_use: To buy more fish to sell

description: La Sra. Ileana  tiene 41 años de edad, habita en el barrio Monseñor Lezcano, su negocio es la venta ropa, cosméticos, al contado y al crédito, con veintidós años en las ventas, ha carecido de capital para invertir más en su negocio, su esposo la ha apoyado siempre,  él trabaja  en una empresa privada como jefe de presupuestos. Sus hijos le ayudan con los quehaceres del hogar y actualmente están estudiando en la  universidad. Con la solicitud del préstamo quiere invertir en compra de ropa en los diferentes estilos, de adultos y de niños así como los productos de cosméticos para ofertar a sus clientes.
description_translated:
Lleana is 41 years old and lives in a neighborhood called Monsenor Lezcano. She has had a business selling clothing and cosmetics for 22 years and has managed her money carefully to invest in her business. Her husband has always been supportive. He has a good job in a private company. Their children help with chores around the house and attend university. With the loan, Lleana would like to purchase different styles of clothing, for adults and children, as well as various cosmetics to offer to her customers.

\r\n

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To purchase different styles of clothing and various cosmetics to offer to her customers.

description:
D. la Paz nació el 24 D. Enero D. 1,958, estudió hasta el tercer año D. primaria, es casada y madre D. 05 hijos varones D. 23, 19, 17, 14 y 09 años D. edad. Vive en la Parcialidad D. Huaripujo, distrito D. Conduriri, provincia El Collao, Puno.

DesD. hace 01 año es socia del Banco Comunal “Maria Prado D. Bellido” en Conduriri. Con su crédito inicial D. S/.300 compró cueros y fibra D. alpaca. Siempre se dedica al engorD. D. alpacas, ovinos y trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo. 

Con este crédito D. S/.500, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, tiene presupuestado comprar S/.300, 30 libras D. fibra D. alpaca D. primera y con S/.200.00 comprará cueros D. alpaca y ovino para ser comercializado a los mayoristas.

Su sueño es que sus hijos sigan estudiando y sean profesionales.
description_translated:
D. la Paz was born on January 24, 1958. She studied up to the third graD. of primary school, is married and the mother of 5 sons who are 23, 19, 17, 14 and 9 years of age. She lives in the village of Huaripujo, in the district of Conduriri, province of El Collao, Puno. For the past year she has been a member of the "Maria Prado D. Bellido" Communal Bank in Conduriri. With her first loan for S/.300 she bought alpaca leather and wool. She has always been involved in raising alpacas and sheep and works alongsiD. her husband. With this loan for S/.500, which will be repaid in 3 installments, she has budgeted S/.300 to buy 30 pounds of top-quality alpaca wool and with S/.200 will buy alpaca and sheep leather to be sold to wholesalers. Her dream is that her sons continue studying and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Buy good quality alpaca wool and alpaca and sheep leather.

description: El señor Silverio habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, barrio ubicado en la capital  de Managua, tiene la edad de 55  años, se encuentra casado con la señora Andrea Valle, quien es ama de casa, juntos tienen 6 hijos dos varones y 4 mujeres, quienes trabajan. Actualmente el señor Silverio se dedica a la venta de granos básicos y productos  lácteos, actividad que la inicio con la ayuda de un hermano hace 16 años, el desea un crédito de C$  4,000 a 6 meses, para la comprar mas inventario de granos básicos y lácteos para aumentar sus ventas, ya que también aspira poder hacer que su negocio crezca y de esta forma mejorar su nivel de vida poco a poco.
description_translated:
Silverio lives in the Reconciliación Village neighborhood of the capital city, Managua. He is 55 years old, married to Andrea Valle who is a housewife. Together they have 6 children, 2 sons and 4 daughters, all of whom work. Today Silverio sells basic grains and dairy products, a business he began with the help of his brother 16 years ago. He wishes for a loan of C$4,000 which will be repaid in 6 months to buy more inventory of basic grains and dairy products to increase his sales. He also aspires to be able to make his business grow and in this way improve his standard of living little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Buy basic grains and dairy products

description:
Composé de cinq (5) femmes toutes mariés les membres du groupe Benkadi de l’association Yiriwaton ont en moyenne 39 ans avec 6 enfants. Vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies (avec beaux parents, beaux frères, soeurs, nièces, fils, cousins, petits fils etc.), elles habitent dans le village de Kimparana préfecture de San (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali)
Les membres du groupe, en plus de leur activité principale qu’est l’achat et la vente des noix de néré font également la cueillette et la vente du soja.
Unies par des liens économique et social, elles sont à leur premier prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe) avec Soro Yiriwaso.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, des sacs de noix de néré auprès des femmes qui font la cueillette et de quelques commerçants spécialisés dans ce domaine. Les produits ainsi achetés sont revendus au marché de Kimparana à des revendeurs venant des grandes villes (tel Ségou, et Bamako). Ce cycle est renouvelé chaque semaine. L’essentiel des bénéfices servira à faire face aux dépenses familiales (scolarité, santé et nourriture).
NB : Pour des raisons sociales la nommée Tata Traoré est absente de la photo de groupe.
description_translated:
Consisting of 5 married women, the members of the Benkadi group of the association Yiriwaton have an average age of 39 and on average, 6 children. Living in big traditional extended families (with parents-in-law, brothers- and sisters-in-law, nieces, sons, cousins, grandsons, etc.) they are residents of the village of Kimparana, Prefecture of San (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

The members of the group gather and sell soy beans, besides their main business of buying néré tree nuts.

United by economic and social ties, they are on their first solidarity loan (group loan) with Soro Yirwaso. They intend to use this loan to buy sacks of néré tree nuts from other women who gather them and from some merchants specialized in this field. The products they buy will be sold at the market in Kimparana to wholesalers who come from the big cities (such as Ségou and Bamako). This cycle is repeated every week. Most of their profit will be used for family expenditures (school fees, health-related expenses, and food).

Note: for societal reasons, Tata Traoré is absent from the group photo.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: purchase of nuts from the néré tree for re-sale

description: This entrepreneur is Olga P.. She sells shoes in her home town of Nikopol. She started this business 9 years ago. Due to her unbelievable determination and stamina she managed to grow her trade within these past years. Currently, she has about $4,000 invested in inventory. Her income is about $2,000 a month. \r\n\r\nOlga has just opened a second store. She is hoping to get a loan of 5800 Grivnas ($1000 USD) to stock it with new clothing items. Olga is a skilled and experienced business woman who knows how to identify a problem and come up with a proper solution even in the most challenging situations. We believe Olga’s professionalism and willingness to go all the way to achieve her goals will help her persevere and repay this loan without any problem.
loan_use: To buy clothing to sell

description: Mrs. Hun S. lives in Trapeang Krasang Village in Takeo Province. She is 47 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the remaining three attend the local school.She rears pigs for a living. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it, so she is requesting a loan to buy six more piglets for breeding. She will use the rest of the money to buy more pig food. Her husband, Mr. Ven Ping (on the right in the photo), owns a small piece of land on which he can cultivate rice.
loan_use: To buy six more piglets and more pig food

description: Азимова Фотима, 1988 года рождения. Она торгует детскими  одеждами, начала свой бизнес вместе с матерю. Сейчас у нее 4 года опыта в этом бизнесе. У нее в продаже в основном имеются детская одежда и головные уборы. Также в продаже у нее можно найти головные уборы для религиозных людей. Свой товар она закупает у местных производителей, у поставщиков из Коканда и продает на Центральном рынке Гисарского района. Фотима хочет расширить семейный бизнес и открыть еще одну точку для продажи женской одежды. \r\nНу а на данный момент Фотима хочет хочет получить займ в сумме 2000 сомони, для закупа головных уборов
description_translated:
Fotima A. was born in 1988. She has a business selling children's clothing which she has started together with her mother. She has four years of experience in this business. She is selling mostly children's clothes and women headdresses as well as head covers for religious people. She buys the merchandise from local manufacturers and suppliers from Kokand and sells on the central market of the Gissar region. Fotima wants to expand her family business and open another location to sell women's clothing. At this time Fotima wants to get a loan for 2000 somoni (USD$600) to purchase a stock of headdresses.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy headdresses

description: Latif P. has managed a transportation business with a minibus for many years.  Because he is recognized for being an experienced driver, he has many regular clients and earns a respectable income.  But increasing petrol prices have made it difficult for him to turn a profit.  Therefore, he has decided to convert his minibus to natural gas, which will save him money on fuel and allow him to offer his services for cheaper prices.  Latif is requesting a loan of $300, which will be used to purchase  a gas canister.
loan_use: To purchase gas canister for a minibus.

loan_name: Panama (nom d’une personne honoré de leur village) Group
description: Le groupe P. est un regroupement de 6 femmes âgées de 40 ans en moyenne, mariées et mères d’au moins 5 enfants vivant dans le village de Kimparana préfecture de San région de Ségou(quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali)\r\n\r\nLes membres du groupe P. sont des spécialistes de la teinture d’habits. Très sollicitées pour la qualité de leur production, elles reçoivent des commandes importantes d’une clientèle de plus en plus importante. Pour faire face à cette demande importante elles décidèrent de rejoindre le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a de cela deux ans. Le montant du prêt est passé de 50.000 FCFA au premier prêt à 150.000 FCFA pour le cinquième prêt. En plus de cette principale activité, elles mènent d’autres activités comme la vente d’encens (déodorant naturel apprécié pour l’odeur de sa fumée) et de henné (plante dont les feuilles permettent de noircir les pieds et les mains). Elles s’approvisionnent en bazin (tissus blancs très appréciés en Afrique de l’ouest) à Bamako en achat groupé pour les teindre en motifs et couleurs différentes sur place à Kimparana. Les produits finis sont vendus sur place à Kimparana et à Koutiala à une clientèle variée. Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice de 180 000FCFA tout le long du prêt qui servira à faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille.
description_translated:
The P. group is an association of six (6) women, whose average age is 40 years. They are married and each are mothers to five (5) or more children. They live in the village of Kimparana, a prefecture in the San region of Segou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

The members of the P. group are specialists in dying clothing. Their high quality products are in much demand and they have been receiving major orders from an ever growing clientele. To meet this growing demand they decided to join the loan program of the Soro Yiriwaso (microbank) two years ago.The amounts of their loans has gone from a first loan of 50,000 francs CFA to their fifth loan of 150,000 francs CFA.

Besides their principle business, they manage other activities such as the sale of incense (natural scents known for their odour and smoke) and "henné" (plant leaves that darken the hands and feet). They buy "bazin" ( a white cloth, popular in West Africa) in the city of Bamako as a group purchase, then dye the product to various designs and colors (to customer request) in Kimparana. The finished products are sold in Kimparana and Koutiala to a wide range of clientele. They each expect to earn a profit of 180,000 francs CFA over the life of the loan which will be used to meet ongoing family expenses.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase of "bezin" (white cloth) for dyeing
borrower_names: Koumba, Oumou, Sitan, Tinimgnini, Assitan, Djeneba
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true

description: ASSANE D. EST ROPIETAIRE D'UN MAGASIN DE QUINCAILLERIE AU QUARTIER MEDINA FAL DE THIES DEPUIS 18 MOIS. IL EST MARIE ET PERE DE 02 ENFANTS. IL COMMERCIALISE DU CIMENT, DU FER, ET DIVERS MATERIELS DE CONSTRUCTION.
description_translated:
ASSANE D. has been the owner of a hardware store in the MEDINA FAL district of THIES for 18 months. He is married and the father of two. He markets cement, iron, and various construction materials.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Commerce in hardware

description: Акбаров Ганиджон, 1979 года рождения, женат и у них 2 детей. У Ганиджона 6 лет опыта в этой деятельности. Он торгует на центральном рынке Гисара продуктами питания. В его ассортименте имеются разновидность конфет производства России, Ирана и Турции. Также в продаже имеются кондитерские изделия такие как печенье, пряники, халва, сахар и сушеные фрукты.   У Ганиджона небольшая лавка, но в дальнейшем хочет арендовать большое помещение для открытия продовольственного магазина.
