Покупает свой товар в кондитерских цехах и в оптовых магазинах Сафар – Центра. \r\nГаниджону нужны средства для покупки халвы и сахара и он хочет получить займ в сумме 1000 сомони.
description_translated:
Ganijon A. was born in 1979, is married, and has two children. Ganijon has six years of sales experience. He sells food in Gissar’s central market. His inventory includes candy from Russia, Iran and Turkey. He also sells pastries such as cookies, ginger cakes, halva, sugar and dried fruit. Ganijon has a small stall, but in the future, he would like to rent a large place in order to open his own shop. He buys his goods in the confectionery shops in the wholesale shop Safar in the Shuhrat region. Ganijon needs to take out a loan to buy halva and sugar, and would like to borrow 1,000 somoni.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Buying halva and sugar

description: Delfina tiene 28 años de edad, es socia del Banco comunal Mujeres Luchadoras de Yungay y vive en el Jr. Acobamba s/n, distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash. \r\nTiene un negocio de venta de abarrotes, el cual empezó con muy pocos productos y vendiendo en el mercado campo ferial de Yungay. Con la ayuda de Manuela Ramos y con su esfuerzo ha ido creciendo y su mayor sueño es que junto a sus dos hijos puedan hacer grande el negocio. Su esposo se dedica a movilizar a las personas mediante una moto taxi y también la ayuda en el negocio.\r\nCon este préstamo de S/. 800, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará 10 sacos de arroz, 10 sacos de azúcar, 5 cajas de atún y 5 cajas de aceite. Con esta inversión podrá mejorar el negocio.
description_translated:
Delfina is 28 years old, member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Luchadoras” in Yungay and she lives at Jr. Acobamba s/n, Yungay district and province, Ancash Department. She has a business selling groceries, which she began with very few products and selling them in the country market of Yungay. With the help of Manuela Ramos and with her effort she has grown her business and her greatest dream is that together with her two children they can make the business great. Her husband is a motortaxi driver, providing public transportation, and also helps in the business. With this loan for S/. 800, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy 10 sacks of rice, 10 sacks of sugar, 5 boxes of tuna and 5 boxes of oil. With this investment she will be able to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Buy rice, sugar, tuna and oil.

description:
La señora Julia C. M., tiene 56 años  pertenece al Banco Comunal  Mujeres del Milenium  y vive en la Mz 14 lote 6 Víctor Raúl Parte Alta del distrito del Porvenir provincia de Trujillo departamento de la Libertad Perú.
Tiene instrucción superior incompleta y estudió 2 años básicos de costura.
Se casó con Enrique Francisco Córdoba, con el que tuvo dos hijos, que actualmente ya trabajan.
Julia cosía y no se atrevía a hacer otra cosa, pero ahora vende briquetas, leña, cose ropa y vende golosina y comida.
Su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles devueltos en 4 cuotas, no invirtió su préstamo porque tenía miedo no poder reponer, a partir del segundo préstamo ya empezó a trabajar.
Con este crédito de  1000 soles que será cancelado en 4 cuotas comprará briquetas (carbón de piedar), telas para confeccionar y otros insumos y leña porque después se pone muy escaso.
Sueña con ampliar su negocio y dar trabajo al que no tiene. Pero su gran pasión es la Educación inicial.
description_translated:
Mrs. Julia C. M. is 56 years old and belongs to the Women of the Millenium Community Bank. She lives in Mz 14, lot 6, Victor Raúl Parte Alta in the Porvenir district of Trujillo, La Libertad, Perú. She didn’t complete her higher education and studied the basics of sewing for two years. She married Enrique Francisco Córdoba, with whom she has 2 children, who are currently working. Julia used to sew and wouldn’t have dared to do anything else, but now she sells briquette, firewood, sews clothes, and sells sweets and food. She repaid she first loan of 300 soles in 4 installments. She didn’t invest the loan because she was afraid that she wouldn’t be able to repay it. Starting with her second loan, she began to work. With this loan of 1000 soles, which she will repay in 4 installments, she will buy briquettes, fabrics, and other supplies and firewood because later it will be scarce. She dreams of expanding her business and giving employment to someone without a job. Her great passion, however, is early education.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy fabric at wholesale.  To buy briquettes and firewood.

description: Elena Marisol L. M. de la edad de 30 años, su estado civil es de casada  con 1 hijo, de seis meses de edad, su compañero de vida es comerciante, una de los sueñosella  desea ayudar a los gastos de la familia, de esta manera apoyar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, y como microempresaria tiene la visión de negocio, teniendo como objetivo contribuir a realizar mejoras a su vivienda y poder brindarle un poco mas de condiciones ahora a su hijo, teniendo como sueño que en un futuro sus hijos tengan un lugar adecuado para vivir, con el esfuerzo que realizan. \r\n\r\nLa actividad económica de doña Elena es la comercialización de mercadería en general, teniendo tiene 5 años  de ejercerla. Doña Elena empezó ofreciendo cosméticos de casa en casa a través de catalogo, para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes cada uno de los productos que ella ofrecía y mas tarde decidió invertir en ropa de dama y caballeros, pero no por catalogo sino por cuenta propia y por encargo, el cual detalla en sus planes de inversión que esta destinada  a la compra de ropa de dama, caballeros niños y otros para poder obtener de esta forma sus metas a realizar.
description_translated:
Elena Marisol L. M. is 30 years old. She is married and she has a 6-month old son. Her life partner is a business man. One of her dreams is to help cover the family expenses, and in this manner, help her husband with household costs. As a small business owner she has a business outlook, having an objective to remodel her home and to be able to provide better living conditions to her son. She dreams that in the future her children will have an adequate place to live as a product of their hard work.

Elena's occupations is the sales of general merchandise, having passed the past 5 years in the business. Elena started out selling cosmetics door to door by catalogue, to provide her clients with every one of the products. Later on she decided to invest in ladies and gentlemen's clothing but not through a catalogue, but by her own accord. Her investment plans are to purchase more clothing for ladies, gentlemen, and children, all as a way to meet her goals.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Working capital.

description: Mrs. Nan C., 32, is a farmer and raises pigs in the Tuol Chombok Village, Kompong Cham Province, earning around $1.50 per day. Her husband, Mr. Dy Thea, 34, is a farmer too. Nan has two children, both in primary school. Nan requests a loan of 1,200,000 Riel to purchase more small piglets and food to feed them. She and her husband hope the loan will make their family’s living conditions better and help further their children's studies.
loan_use: To purchase more small piglets and food to feed them

description:
Rose is a leader of 4 members of a group. She is a 46-year-old married woman with 6 children, aged between 30 and 8. Two of her children go to school. Rose takes care of 4 grandchildren. She resides in and owns a 6-room house, where she is staying with 6 people. Rose takes care of additional family members. They have electricity but no piped water at home.

The family gets 3 meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area that is on the outskirts of Kampala. Rose operates a retail shop in Kamwokya Kifumbira, one of the city suburbs, and buys her products from Kampala City. Rose uses public transport to go back and forth to her business. She sells to all categories of people, and her monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

Rose works 7 days a week and has been with MCDT for 8 years, servicing her sixteenth loan. She wants to use this loan to expand her business and aspires to sell wholesale.
loan_use: To expand her business

description:
For many years, Farhod has offered taxi services with his personal car. He is married and has two children and is the only bread-winner in his family. \r\n

\r\nHis car is wearing out so he wants to borrow money in order to repair it. He needs to keep the vehicle in good operating condition in order to continue his business and support the family.
loan_use: To repair the car being used as a taxi

description:
En el mercado Israel Lewites de la ciudad de Managua la señora Julia S. posee su propio tramo donde vende frutas y verduras ofreciéndolas a los clientes que día a día visitan el mercado en busca de sus productos. Debido a que la competencia de la señora Julia se ha incrementado, hoy en día le urge aumentar sus ventas y ofertar mayores cantidades de frutas y verduras y es por este motivo que una vez más ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de sus productos.

Hoy en día espera que su crédito le sea otorgado para continuar con el negocio y de esta forma continuar llevando el sustento a su hogar.
description_translated:
Mrs. Julia S. has her own stand in the Israel Lewites market in the city of Managua where she sells fruits and vegetables to her clients, who visit the market day after day in search of her products. Because of her ability, the business has grown. Today, it is necessary for her to increase her sales and offer more fruits and vegetables. As a result, she has come to Ceprodel again to get a loan, which will allow her to buy products.

She hopes that this loan will be offered to her so that she can continue her business and, in this way, continue bringing sustenance to her house.


Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy fruits and vegetables

description: Usaha warung Ni Kadek Ariani sudah cukup menjanjikan untuk dapat menopang ekonomi dalam keluarganya selain dari pendapatan suaminya.\r\nUntuk periode kedua dana pinjaman dari Yayasan Dinari dipakai untuk menambah modal usahanya. Seperti biasa Ni Kadek Ariani membuka warung sejak pukul 06.00 pagi dan tutup pada pukul 07.00 sore. Waktu untuk menunggui warungnya kadang dipergunakan untuk menyelesaikan pekerjaan dirumahnya seperti memasak, mencuci dan merawat anaknya yang masih kecil. Walaupun seharian Ni Kadek Ariani menunggui warung namun tidak pernah melupakan segala keperluan suaminya sebelum berangkat bekerja sebagi tukang maupun setelah pulang bekerja. Keuntungan bersih dalam sehari dapat mencapai Rp. 30.000,- s/d Rp.40.000,- cukup  dapat membantu pendapatan suaminya dan keperluan anaknya yang masih balita.Usaha warung ini ditekuninya dengan harapan  kedepannya  warung dapat lebih meningkat dan lebih besar lagi.
description_translated:
Ni Kadek Ariani opens a small stall that sells daily necessities such as snack, cooking ingredients, rice, coffee, etc.

For this 2nd loan period, she wants to use the loan money from Dinari foundation to add her working capital. She opens her small stalls at 6 am until 7 pm. During the day she usually also does house chores such as cooking, does laundry and taking care of her children.

She can earn IDR 30 thousand to IDR 40 thousand/ day (around USD 3-4/ day). This business provides money to ease her family's economic burden.

She is hoping to be able to expand her business.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To add working capital (Menambah modal usaha)

description: This is the second time Mrs. Uy K. has taken a loan in order to improve her living conditions. She now lives in Ponlai village in Takeo province. She owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. She now faces a small problem on her land because of infertile soil. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Uy K. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field to make it more productive. Mrs. Uy K. is a 56-year-old widow with two children who are both employed in a garment factory.
loan_use: To buy fertilizers to restore her field

description: Mrs. Mey U. is the leader of a loan group with six members who all live in Pou Doh village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns two hectares to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Morn Ran, is a construction worker who earns a small income to support the family. Although Mrs. Mey U. and her husband have different businesses, they still live in poor conditions. Therefore, Mrs. Mey U. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She is 37 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is a construction worker while the others attend the local school. \r\n\r\nOne of the members in this group loan has an end-of-term loan, so this member is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time.
loan_use: To buy a cow for breeding
borrower_names: Soem, Chip, Mey, Svay, Mey, Mey
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true

description: Урунова  Саодат жительница города Турсунзаде. Возраст 38 лет,разведенна, имеет 3 детей.Образование среднее. Саодат занимается куплей продажей обуви и женской одежды.Она имеет  небольшую торговую точку на центральном рынке города.Бизнес является единственным источником дохода ее семьи.На кредит клиентка хочет увеличить товарооборот.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 10 месяцев.
description_translated:
Saodat U. lives in the city of Tursunzoda. She is 38 years old, divorced and has three children. Saodat has a high school degree and makes a living selling shoes and women clothes. She manages a small market stall at the city's central market. This business is the sole source of income for her large family and Saodat is hoping to use this loan to expand her inventory and consequently improve sales. She is planning to pay back the loan in the next 10 months.\r\n

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Expanding inventory

description:
Hipolita C. S. is a member of community bank Tarpuy, a Quechuan word meaning “to sow or to plant.” Hipolita lives in Ayacucho with her husband and their 4 children, ages 24, 23, 20 and 14. Hipolita is an artisan who makes purses, belts, hats, and upholstery. \r\n

\r\nWith the help of her children, she works in a store where she sells her products. She will use her loan of 1000 soles to purchase more material to make her products including buttons and yarn. Her dream is to leave Ayacucho and sell her products in a different area.
loan_use: to purchase more material to make her products

description:
Maritza tiene 47 años de edad, es casada y madre de 03 hijos, todos ya mayores (con familia) termino sus estudios superiores y trabaja en el Hospital de Ilave, vive en el Jr. Pumacahua Nº 184 – Puno.

Hace 01 año es socia del Banco Comunal “San Miguel”- Ilave, con el primer préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles compró mas mercadería para su negocio de artesanía, y así mejorar sus ingresos. Ella  cuenta  que desde los 43 años de edad compra y vende bordados en bayeta para enviarlos al  Cusco. Debido a la competencia,  inició hace 04 meses con el negocio de compra y venta de quesos, estos productos los vende en las Pizzerías de la misma ciudad donde lleva también su artesanía, Actualmente se dedica a ambos negocios.

Con el crédito que solicitara de S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles que pagará en 03 cuotas, comprará mas quesos  en Juliaca para viajar al lugar antes mencionado.

“Es de gran ayuda el préstamo que nos brindan para nuestros negocios” manifiesta muy contenta, Maritza.

 Su visión  para el futuro es vivir con comodidad y asegurar su vejez
description_translated:
Maritza is 47 years of age, is married and is the mother of 3 children, all of them older (with families). She finished her secondary education, works at the hospital in Ilave and lives at Jr. Pumacahua Nº 184 – Puno. Since a year ago she has been a member of the “San Miguel”- Ilave Communal Bank. With the first loan of S/. 500.00 new soles she bought more merchandise for her craft business and through this improve her income. She tells that since she was 43 years of age she has bought and sold embroideries on wool cloth to send them to Cusco. Due to this ability, 4 months ago she started with a business buying and selling cheeses, products which she sells to pizzerias in the same city where she also brings her crafts. Currently she works on both businesses. With the loan that she is applying for of S/. 1200.00 new soles which she will repay in 3 installments, she will buy more cheeses in Juliaca to travel to the place mentioned previously. “The loan that you provide us is of great help for our businesses” Maritza expresses very happily. Her vision for the future is to live comfortably and secure her old age.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy cheeses wholesale.

description: K. Naome is the leader of Muvo women’s group in Lugazi. Along with taking care of, and paying school fees for her five children, she also looks after two of her relatives' children. Naome has a retail shop which she has maintained and expanded with the assistance of her first loan. She is requesting another loan so she can buy more products like bread, toothpaste, cooking oil and other products for her shop. By joining this lending group, she hopes that she can get a loan to help improve her business and the life of her family.
loan_use: To buy products for retail shop
borrower_names: Alice, Patrick, Naome, Geofrey, Moses, Sylivia
borrower_genders: female, male, female, male, male, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true

description: Cate N. is a devoted and hard working client of Pearl Microfinance of Kasenyanku women. She is a farmer growing potato and cassava both for sale and home consumption, as well as buying from others when the season is not favorable for her. When it is harvest time, she is always a happy woman with a lot of work to do that brings in more income. For a season like this where she has less on her plantations, she needs a loan to help with buying cassava and potatoes for sale, as well as employing manpower on her farm. She is married but her husband does not care about her and her children and this is why she works so hard to take them to school and feed them, and to save for their medical care. She is determined for a bright future for her four children in the picture.
loan_use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale and to pay for labor on her farm.

description: Néé le 05/06/1966 à Cotonou, elle est originaire de Ouidah. Dame G. Marie Cica n'a jamais été à l'école ni appris un métier. Avec sa maman elle a commencé, alors adolescente, à vendre des boules de pâte préparée à base de maïs (communément appelée Akassa) avec du poisson frit. Il y a 7 ans elle fit un changement d'activité et se mit à vendre de la farine à base de manioc (gari), de l'arachide grillée et de cacahuètes. Ce changement d'activité est intervenu du fait de la mévente qui est devenue de plus en plus croissante avec sa précédente activité. C'est pour augmenter le capital de la nouvelle activité et mieux répondre à la demande de la clientèle qu'elle sollicite ce troisième prêt de 100000fcfa. Marié, elle est mère de quatre enfants dont seule la benjamine Sylvia est encore à sa charge.
description_translated:
Born on June 5, 1966 in Cotonou, Ms. Marie Cica G. is originally from Ouidah. She has never attended school nor learned a trade. At her mother\'s side, she started as an adolescent selling balls of "pâte" , commonly called "akassa" (similar to polenta made with boiled corn meal) and served with fried fish. Seven years ago, she switched her business to selling cassava flour (gari) and two types of roasted peanuts (arachide and cacahuète). This switch came about in her previous business due to an accelerating drop in sales. So, increasing the capital of her new business and better meeting customer demands are the reasons why she is requesting this third loan of 100,000 francs CFA. Ms. G. is married and the mother of four children, of whom only the youngest, Sylvia, is still in her care. \r\n

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy 2 sacks of cassava flour and a half-sack of sugar

description: Муминова Тожинисо, 1974 года рождения и у нее 3 иждивенцев. Она начала свой бизнес с продажи токи. Сейчас ее ассортимент товаров увеличился, это разновидность токи (национальные головные уборы), махси (национальные сапоги) и чапаны (национальное пальто). Свой товар она закупает у поставщиков из Коканда, Андижана и продает на рынке Сафар Гисарского района.\r\nДля увеличения товарооборота хочет получить займ в сумме 3500 сомони для закупа чапанов.
description_translated:
Tojiniso M. was born in 1974. She has 3 dependents. Tojiniso started her business by selling tokis (ethnic hats). Today, her product assortment has increased and she sells tokis (ethnic hats), mahsis (ethnic boots), and chapans (ethnic coats). She purchases her products from suppliers from Kokanda and Andizhana and sells them at the Safar market in the Gissar region. In order to increase her inventory and purchase additional coats, Tojiniso would like to take out a loan for 3500 somoni ($1050).

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase coats

description:
Este banco comunal, esta conformado por 17 integrantes, pertenece al municipio D. la Guardia, con su punto D. reunion ubicadoen el Km 9, Barrio 23 D. diciembre, del municipio D. El Torno, Santa Cruz, Bolivia. Este grupo tiene en común la producción D. D. alimentos y la venta D. comida. Y la mayoría son vecinas del barrio.
ZULEMA D., Es la líder del grupo, vive en el Km. 9 Barrio 23 D. diciembre del municipio del Torno, vive en la casa D. sus padres, con su esposo, tienen cuatro hijos. Su Actividad es la venta D. comida que realiza en forma ambulante, y el crédito que necesita será para invertir en el mismo negocio, aumentando su capital D. trabajo. Y con el ahorro que vaya acumulando en el banco comunal con el tiempo, quiere colocar una tiendita en su barrio.
MIREYA RIOS, Es la secretaria del banco comunal, vive en el Km. 9 Barrio 23 diciembre en la misma zona. Ella venD. frutas en el mercado y también se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos  vive en casa alquilada con sus dos hijos y desea tener una casa propia. 
MARIEL J., Es la tesorera del Banco comunal, ella vive en la misma zona es decir en su negocio es la venta D. comidas.  Vive en la casa propia con sus dos hijos, el negocio con el que cuenta actualmente es ambulante y D. la misma manera que las otras compañeras con el tiempo quiere llegar a tener su negocio fijo.
description_translated:
This communal bank is maD. up of 17 members. It belongs to the municipality of La Guardia, with a home base at Km. 9, in the neighborhood of 23 of December in the El Torno municipality, Santa Cruz, Bolivia. This group produces, prepares, and sells food items. The majority are neighbors in the area. Zulema D. is the leader of the group. She lives with her parents, her husband and four children at Km. 9, in the neighborhood of 23 of December, El Torno municipality. She sells food from door to door, and the loan she requires will be used to invest in this business to have more working capital. Over time, and with the income she makes with the help of the communal bank, she wishes to create a small store in her neighborhood. Mireya Rios is the secretary of the communal bank. She lives at Km. 9, in the neighborhood of 23 of December in the same area. She sells fruits at the market and also sells cosmetics. She lives in a home that she rents with her two children and would like to own a home. Mariel J. is the treasurer of the communal bank. She lives in the same area and sells prepared foods. She lives in her own home with two children. Her business is performed from door to door and just like her partners, she would like to have a stationary business.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Increase working capital
borrower_names: Isabel, Reina Gladis, Zulema, Mariela, María, Yolanda, Angela, Reyna, Mireya, Lola, Jiovana, Aida, Guido, Neysa, Cándida, Lidia, Silvia Magdalena
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, male, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, false, true, true, true, true, true, false, true, true, false, true, true, true, true, true, true

description: Simeón tiene 54 años, vive al lado de su esposa y su hija. El trabaja en la agricultura y la ganadería desde hace mas de 5 años, diariamente está al cuidando de sus animales para sostener a su familia, también cultiva papa y maíz para luego venderlos. Su labor diaria consiste en realizar el cuidado de los animales que tiene, para ello corta el pasto por las mañanas, y cuida de sus tierras de cultivo para ver si están regadas las plantaciones, de esta manera garantiza los ingresos para su familia. Don Simeón se asegura tener ingresos económicos con la ganadería, porque muchas veces en la agricultura existen perdidas por los cambios climáticos severos.  Este padre y esposo, lucha para su familia progrese. Solicita este préstamo con el que podrá comprar más animales para poder vender.
description_translated:
Simeón is 54 years old and lives with his wife and daughter. He has worked in agriculture and livestock for more than 5 years, taking daily care of his animals in order to support his family. He also farms potatoes and corn that he sells retail. His daily work consists of taking care of the animals and cutting the grass for them each morning. He takes care of his farm land and makes sure the fields are irrigated. In this way, he earns income for his family. Simeón ensures that he has income from the livestock because often times, his crops fail due to the severe climate. As a father and husband, he works to improve conditions for his family. He requests this loan to purchase more animals that he can resell.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Increase the amount of livestock

description:
Mr. N. Ny, a villager in Kouk Trob Village in Kadal Province, is an ice-cream seller who now wants to sells his product door-to-door. He is therefore requesting a loan to add to his savings to buy a motorbike for that purpose. His wife, Mrs. Nheab Na, owns a small piece of land upon which she cultivates rice to earn a living.

Mr. N. Ny is 26 years old and the father of two children, one of whom is enrolled in the local school while the youngest is only two years old. His wife is on the right in the photo.
loan_use: To buy a motorbike to sell ice-cream door-to-door.

description: Katerin tiene 20 años, es natural de la ciudad de Juliaca, es soltera y vive en casa de unos familiares. Desde que termino la secundaria y no teniendo posibilidades para seguir estudios superiores, decidió dedicarse al comercio, es así que desde hace 4 años puso una librería, donde ofrece, cuadernos, lapiceros, libros, etc. El negocio va bien, justamente por la dedicación que le pone Katerin, abriendo desde las 8 de la mañana y quedándose hasta las 9 o 10 de la noche, para poder alcanzar las ganancias deseadas. Lo más difícil para ella es tener que permanecer todo el día atendiendo su negocio, ya que tiene que dejar de lado otro tipo de actividades, pero pasando este pequeño inconveniente, a ella le agrada su trabajo porque es tranquilo y le permite ganar lo suficiente para su manutención. Katerin quiere ser una mujer independiente que no necesite de nadie para ser feliz y logrará todos sus objetivos. Con el dinero del préstamo implementará mejor su librería, y así abarcar la preferencia de los clientes, para en un futuro hacer que su librería sea las más grande y la que satisfaga las necesidades de todos.
description_translated:
Katerin is 20 years old. She is a native of the city of Juliaca. She is single and lives in the house of some relatives. Since she finished high school and did not have opportunities to continue with higher education, she decided to work. Therefore, four years ago she set up a book store, where she offers folders, pens, books, etc. The business is going well, precisely because of the dedication Katerin gives it, opening from 8 in the morning and staying until 9 or 10 in the evening to be able to earn the income she wants. The hardest part for her is to have to spend all day tending to her business, since she has to put off other activities. But in spite of this small inconvenience, she likes her work because it is laid-back and allows her to earn enough for her basic needs. Katerin wants to be an independent woman who does not need anyone to be happy and achieve all of her goals. With the money from the loan, she will stock her book store, and therefore meet the preferences of the clients, so that in the future she can make her store the biggest and satisfy the needs of everyone.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To stock her bookstore to meet the needs of her clients

description:
Ana belongs to the community bank Atenas Portillanasu, located at Raul Porras Barrenechea Number 170 in the district of Yarina Cocha of the department of Ucayali. She is 62 years old, a mother of 9 grown children, and married. Her husband works as a farmer. With the first loan of about $100 USD from Manuela Ramos, she invested in a grocery business. She has been working with the bank for 7 years. She owns two transport motorcycles and with the help of her two grandsons, who work daily providing transportation, she makes enough to repay her loan on time. With this loan of $500 USD, which she will repay in 5 months, she can buy 4 tires, headlights, have the seats recovered, and fix and maintain the engines. Thanks to Manuela Ramos, she has realized one of her dreams, that of having two transport motorcycles of her own and thanks to them her financial situation has improved.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Ana pertenece al Banco Comunal “Atenas Portillanas”, ubicado en el Jr. Raúl Porras Barrenechea Nº 170 del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 62 años y es madre de 9 hijos mayores de edad, es casada, su esposo se dedica al trabaja de agricultor. Ana con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/300 decide invertir en la venta de abarrotes. Tiene 7 años trabajando con el Banco.nnEn la actualidad ella cuenta con 2 motokar y con la ayuda de sus nietos, quienes trabajan todos los días en el manejo de su movilidad, brindándole ganancias para cumplir con el préstamo y pagar puntualmente.nnCon este préstamo de S/1.500 el cual será pagado en 5 meses comprará: 4 llantas, focos, tapizar los asientos, arreglo de motor y otros mantenimientos. nnGracias a Manuela Ramos hizo realidad uno de sus sueños, tener 2 movilidades propias y gracias a ello su estabilidad económica ha mejorado.n
loan_use: Purchase tires, headlights and engine maintenance.

description: Usaha beternak babi ini sudah lama ditekuni oleh Ni Ketut Murti usaha ini dilakukannya untuk membantu suaminya membiayai kebutuhan hidup keluarganya. Saat ini Ni Ketut Murti tinggal berdua dengan suaminya karena anaknya sudah menikah dan tinggal dengan keluarganya masing -masing. Ni Ketut Murti mengaku selama ini  ia sangat berkeinginan untuk mengembangkan usahanya, namun hal itu sulit dilakukanya karena modal usahanya yang pas-pasan sementara kebutuhan hidup keluarga yang semakin hari semakin meningkat. Dengan kandang yang sederhana Ni Ketut Murti memulai usahanya. Saat ini Ni Ketut Murti memelihara 1 ekor induk babi dan dalam waktu 6 bulan  sudah bisa menjual hasil ternaknya yaitu anak dari induk tersebut dengan sekali beranak bisa 8 sampai 10 ekor. Melalui program DINARI Ni Ketut Murti mendapat  pendampingan serta pinjaman modal usaha  sebesar Rp. 5.000.000,- dengan jangka waktu pinjaman selama 6 bulan dan pembayaran dilakukan pada akhir periode pinjamamn. Dengan tambahan modal tersebut Ni Ketut Murti menggunakan untuk membeli pakan dan satu bibit babi lagi sehingga Ni Ketut Murti berharap usahanya bisa lebih maju dan berkembang sehingga bisa mendapat panghasilan yang lebih meningkat dari hasil sebelumnya dan kehidupan keluarganya bisa lebih baik.
description_translated:
Ni Ketut Murti has been farming Pigs for a long time to help her husband pay for daily living expenses. Currently she only lives with her husband as her children have gotten married. Ni Ketut Murti has expressed her willingness to grow the business, however it is difficult due to limited funding and rising cost of living. \r\n\r\nNi Ketut Murti started with simple pig pens. Currently she farms 1 breeder pig, and in 6 month, she hopes to sell the piglets. In one breeding cycle, her pig can produce 6-8 piglets. Ni Ketut Murti is seeking training and a 6-month $475 loan from DINARI. Ni Ketut Murti Plans to use the loan to purchase feeds and an additional breeder pig. She hopes that her business will grow to give her higher income in the future for her family.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase breeder pig

description: Zaidi S., 35, is our client at Pearl Microfinance. He has had a business for the past 10 years of buying mukeneu, a small silvery fish, and dried fish from the fishermen at his neighboring landing sites in Nazigo. He is married with 5 children, who are still in school, and he takes care of 1 orphan. He is so proud of the trend that his business is taking after he joined his lending group, whereby he now buys good quality fish in greater numbers compared to before the loans. He is seeking a loan to be able to buy more fish so that he will be able to sell more for greater profits.
loan_use: He will buy more fish with the loan.
borrower_names: Steven, Joseph, Sulaiman, Mohammed, Zaidi, Patrick
borrower_genders: male, male, male, male, male, male
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true

description: Mrs. Mut M. is a villager in Kraing Sromor village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She owns a small plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Phoung Py, is a cow breeder. Mrs. Mut M. is 41 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, one is a construction worker while the other three children attend the local school. Despite the revenue, they barely make ends meet. Thus, Mrs. Mut M. requests a loan to buy cow to add her husband's business.
loan_use: To buy cow to add her husband's business.

description: Mrs. Sun L. was born in 1949 and now lives in Moen Tomrang village in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. L. Chhorn, are farmers. Mr. L. Chhorn also is a vice president of the village. They own a plot of land to cultivate rice. The income does not produce enough money to support their lives. Thus, Mrs. Sun L. requests a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.
loan_use: To buy a cow for breeding.

description:
This is the Drivers Group. Its members include Alusine J., Alusine B., Musa J., Chernoh A. B., and Fatmata B.. This is their first time seeking a loan from SMT and they are requesting Le 2,000,000 to help them strengthen their businesses.

Alusine J. is the leader of the group. He was born in Fadugu, about 23 miles from Kabala. He is 32 and married with two children, who are not yet of school age. Alusine has fifteen years of experience as a driver. Presently, he travels between Kabala and Makeni in a Renault 29 automobile that carries nine passengers. The fare per passenger is Le 14,000.

Currently, Alusine faces a lot of constraints because his vehicle's engine is too old and breaks down. When the engine fails, he is not able to work for the remainder of the day and sometimes even two days until a spare part is bought from Freetown. He will use this loan, along with his savings, to buy a new engine for the Renault 29. Alusine's greatest desire is to then save money for a brighter future in which he can build himself a house and feed himself and his family.
loan_use: To buy a new engine for his taxi
borrower_names: Fatmata, Alusine, Musa, Alusine, Chernoh A.

description: Con sólo 24 años de edad, la señora Amparito cuenta con un alma emprendedora, muestra de ello es los 2 negocios que tiene, ambos con su respectivo local: boutique y restaurante. Viviendo con su menor hijo de 4 años y siendo madre soltera, la señora Olga no deja de denotar esfuerzos en ambos negocios, que tienen 4 meses de ya implementados adecuadamente. Debido al Mercado que se encuentra en la zona, la competencia es grande y le depara mucho esfuerzo porque está al tanto de ambos negocios a la par.nEn pro de financiar ambos negocios y poder asegurarle a su hijo lo mejor y, más aún, a portas de su inicio escolar, es que necesita del préstamo de 600 soles.n
description_translated:
At the young age of 24, Mrs. Amparito already has an entrepreneurial soul. She is the owner of 2 businesses - a boutique and a restaurant - each with their own seperate location. Mrs. Amparito is a single mother who lives with her 4 children, and she is hardworking with both of her businesses that have each been operating successfully for about 4 months. Competition is fierce in the area that she works, and she must continually work hard to keep up with the conditions of the market. She has solicited a loan of 600 soles so that she can finance both of her businesses, and in turn be able to provide the best for her youngest son as he begins to start school.\r\n

Translated from Spanish by michelle kreger, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To purchase food + goods for her restaurant,  and to capitalize her boutique.

description:
Mrs. Sarith M. was born in 1961. She lives in Kampong Chrey Village in Takeo Province.

She owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice, which is how she earns a living. On her plantation, she faces a small problem - her field is infertile. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Sarith M. has decided to ask for a loan so she can buy fertilizers to support the field and make her crop more productive.

Her husband Mr. Oem Sareth helps his wife on the plantation.

Mrs. Sarith M. has four children. They all attend the local school.

Mr. Oem Sareth is presented on the left photo.
loan_use: To buy fertilizers to support her farm

description:
Mrs. Sarann T. was born in 1947. She now lives in Kruos Village in Takeo Province.

She is a farmer who cultivates rice. She harvests her crop and earns most of her revenue every January. Unfortunately, she now faces a hurdle because the soil on her plantation is infertile. Therefore, Mrs. Sarann T. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer so she can support her field and make her crop more productive.

She has four children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory. The youngest child is enrolled in the local school.
loan_use: To buy fertilizers to support the field

description: Irma tiene 30 años, es madre soltera, vive con su madre anciana y sus dos menores hijos, su pareja los abandonó. Se dedica a trabajar en sus cultivos desde su niñez, ha sembrado 15 sacos de semilla de papa, asimismo tiene sembrado arvejas, pero en menor cantidad. Se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para preparar los desayunos y almuerzos de su familia, después, a eso de las 8 saca la leche de su vaca, prepara los quesos y reparte a los negociantes, esto es solo dos veces por semana, también lleva a sus vacas al campo, y finalmente se va a su chacra todos los dias.  Le agrada la actividad que realiza, pero le falta el capital, nos dice que la agricultura es muy cansada y requiere mayor inversión. Es la primera vez que saca un préstamo de esta institución. Además de mantener en buen estado sus tierras, este préstamo para ella es la oportunidad de incursionar en otro negocio, así que también se va dedicar a la compra y venta de carne roja.
description_translated:
Irma is a 30-year-old single mother of two, who lives with her mother (her partner left them on their own). She has worked on her land since childhood, sowing 15 sacks of potato seed, as well as peas although in lesser quantities. She is up at 4am to prepare breakfast and lunch for her family; by 8am she is milking the cow, and preparing cheeses which she distributes to her clients twice per week; she then takes her cows out to pasture, and daily attends to her small farm. She enjoys her endeavors, but she lacks capital - she has shared with us that agricultural work is exhausting and requires heavy investment. This is her first request for a loan from this institution. In addition to maintenance of her land, this loan will provide her with an opportunity to invest in another business, so she will start buying and selling red meat.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Capital for farming investment and to start a business.

description: Edwin tiene 26 años, convive con su pareja y sus dos hijos que ya están estudiando. Es agricultor desde muy pequeño, tiene campos de cultivo en zonas donde se siembra por temporada, según las lluvias, entonces tiene que alquilarse campos que tienen zonas de regadío. Cuando le toca regar su chacra lo hace a 4 de la madrugada para aprovechar el caudal del agua. Después regresa a desayunar y eso de las 9 nuevamente regresa a su chacra hasta las 5 de la tarde. Edwin está muy contento con la agricultura, porque tiene temporadas que su producción es muy buena. Considera que sus productos son rentables porque son de consumo cotidiano. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero que pide comprará abono, tales como el fosfato de nitrato y potasio, para sus chacras ya sembradas.
description_translated:
Edwin is 26 years old and lives with his wife and two student-age children. He has been a farmer since he was young and he has land where he plants various crops each season depending on the rains but occasionally he has to rent irrigated land. When it is his turn to irrigate his land, he has to do it at 4 in the morning to take advantage of the water flow. Afterwards, he returns home to eat breakfast then works on his land from 9 to 5. Edwin is very happy as a farmer because he has seasons when his production is very good. His crops are profitable because they are things that are consumed by most people every day. This is his first loan from Prisma Microfinance and he will use the money to buy fertilizers such as phosphates, nitrates, and potassium for his land.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase of fertilizer for his land

description: La señora Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Perseverantes”, ubicado en el Jr. Mariano Melgar Nº  596, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Ttiene 52 años de edad y es madre de 3 hijos mayores de edad. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de fréjol cocido. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.nnEn la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio, venta de fréjol regional y canario. Se levanta a las 3 a.m. a cocinar sus fréjoles para luego salir a venderlos a las 6 a.m. en el mercado Micaela Bastidas. nnCon este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será pagado en 4 meses comprará 15 kilos de fréjol regional y canario. nnGracias al banco comunal de Manuela Ramos sus ventas han crecido y en estas últimas semanas sus clientes han aumentado con la bendición de Dios.nn
description_translated:
Mrs. Maria belongs to the "Mujeres Perseverantes" Communal Bank, located at 596 Jr. Mariano Melgar, in the Calleria district, Coronel Portillo Province, in the region of Ucayali. She is 52 years old and has three grown children. She has been working with the Communal Bank for 2 years. She invested the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, of $100, into the sale of cooked beans. Today, she continues to sell a variety of regional bean dishes. She gets up at 3 a.m. to cook so that her dishes will be ready for sale in the Micaela Bastidas market by 6 a.m. With this new loan of $400, which will be payed back over 4 months, she will buy 15 kilos of beans. Thanks to the Manuela Ramos, her sales have increased and she has been blessed with an ever expanding number of clients. \r\n\r\n.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: For the purchase of various beans

description:
This group consists of six people from the village of Slab Ta Aon Village in Kandal province, and they are seeking a loan for different business purposes. Mrs. Chantha S. was selected by the other group members to be the group leader.

\r\n\r\nBy way of a brief background, Mrs. Chantha S. is a 37-year-old widow, and she has one child who attends the local school. She sells goods in the local village for a living. And, because her business has been doing well, she wants to expand the business. As such, she is seeking a loan to buy more goods to re-sell, which she hopes will improve her family's living conditions in turn.
loan_use: To expand her business by increasing inventory
borrower_names: Nareth, Ratana, Panhar, Mom, Chantha, Both
borrower_genders: female, male, male, female, female, male
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Adolat B. is 46 years old. She is a widow and the mother of 4 children. Over the years, as her family has been living off the crops they grow, the property has been divided among the children and grandchildren. Since she is divorced, it is very difficult for her to raise her children alone. But the love for her children is what made her to work hard day by day. 

Now all of her children are adults and alongside them, she works cultivating wheat and different kinds of vegetables. When their crop comes in, they transport it to Dushanbe city for sale. This activity has helped to pay the expenses of her family and to give an education to her children. 

Today she needs a loan for purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing wheat. With this desire in mind, she asks your consideration to receive her family into your kind heart. She is requesting 800 USD for a term of 12 months. Adolat wants to thank everyone for supporting her and promises to repay the loan on time.
loan_use: Seeds and mineral fertilizer for her fields

description: Chidima O., 38 years old and married with three children, lives in Lagos State, Nigeria where she sells food spices in her shop. With demand for her products high, she is requesting a loan to buy more spices in bulk.  Chidima says thank you to all who make this loan possible.
loan_use: To buy more food spices to sell.

description: Marissa A. est âgée de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est revendeuses des légumes depuis 5 ans à Wome, un village situé au nord-ouest de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Avec ce crédit de FECECAV, madame Marissa désire se ravitailler afin de mieux répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle. Cette chance lui permettra de gagner plus d’argent afin de répondre aux besoins de ses enfants.
description_translated:
Marissa A. is 42 years old, married, and the mother of three. She has been a retailer of vegetables for five years in Wome, a village located northwest of Lomé, the Togolese capital. With this FECECAV loan, Ms. Marissa would like to be resupplied in order to respond better to customer needs. This opportunity will enable her to earn more money to care for her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy vegetables for resale

description: N. Chukwuma is 34-years-old, married and has four children. He sells provisions like toothpaste, noodles and bathing soap. He is requesting a loan to purchase more basic provisions to sell to his customers. He thanks all Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE for their financial support.
loan_use: To purchase more provisions to sell to customers

description:
Unies par des liens de parenté et de voisinage, les membres  du groupe se  sont spécialisés dans le petit commerce de pagnes wax, de Bazin (tissus très prisés en Afrique de l’ouest), de chaussures, d’e fruits et de matériels en aluminium. Elles sont au nombre de neuf (7 mariées et  2 célibataires avec une moyenne d’âge de 27 ans et de 2 enfants) et vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à Mancourani I, un des quartiers du centre ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali).
Ce groupe, dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter a décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso à travers une association de femmes de leur quartier (Laïdou c’est à dire la promesse). Il est à son premier prêt solidaire (prêt du groupe).
Avec ce premier prêt, elles comptent acheter 14 pièces de pagne Wax, 120 métres  de bazins moins riche, 143 paires de chaussure, 10 sacs d’orange, 15 sacs de patates, un important stock de condiments alimentaires (gombos, oignons, aubergines, aromes, concentré tomate, etc.) et  des materièls en aluminium. Les  matériels en aluminium sont amenés à la forge pour en faire des marmites avant de les revendre. Elles s’approvisionnent dans la ville de Sikasso, dans les villages environnants ainsi qu’à Bamako ( capitale de la république du Mali).
Les produits sont vendus en gros et en  détail,  au comptant et à crédit dans le marché de Sikasso et  dans les foires des villages environnants et quelque fois à Koutiala. Au retour, elles achètent des savons et de beurre de karité qui seront vendus au marché de Sikasso à une clientèle composée généralement des femmes surtout des foraines et quelques hommes.           
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune avec ce premier prêt un bénéfice moyen de 30.000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir  aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités respectives.
description_translated:
United by bonds of family and neighborhood, the members of this group have specialized in re-selling “wax”-type pagnes (lengths of brightly colored African cloth), “Bazin” (a sort of damask that is often locally dyed and much prized in West Africa), shoes, fruit, and objects made out of aluminum.

There are 9 women in the group: 7 married and two single with an average age of 27 and, on average, 2 children. They live in big traditional families in Mancourani I, a neighborhood of downtown Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali).

In an attempt to satisfy the needs of their ever-expanding clientele, this group decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso through an association of women from their neighborhood (Laïdou, i.e. promise). They are on their first solidarity loan (group loan). With this first loan, they intend to buy 14 lengths of the cloth known as “Wax pagne”, 120 meters of medium-quality basin, 143 pairs of shoes, 10 sacks of oranges, 15 sacks of sweet potatoes, a large amount of condiments (okra, onions, eggplants, flavoring, tomato paste, etc.) and some aluminum. The aluminum is taken to the blacksmith to have it made into pots before re-selling it.

They stock up in the town of Sikasso and in nearby villages as well as in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). The products are sold wholesale and retail, for cash or credit in the Sikasso marketplace to a clientele composed generally of women, especially those who come to buy and sell at the weekly markets, and a few men.

They each hope to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 F CFA from this first loan. The profit will be used to make payments on the loan and to help support their families, with any remainder being invested back into their respective businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: purchase of various articles for re-sale
borrower_names: Awa, Alimata, Abi, Djénèba, Fatoumata, Maria, Kiatou, Mamou, Aminata
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Doña Maria es madre soltera y tiene un solo hijo. Actualmente tiene 60 años de edad, es profesora cesante y vive en el Jr. Yunguyo s/n, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno.

Es una de las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Niño San Salvador” de Juli. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 aumentó su capital y compró lana para tejer chompas. Desde los 28 años de edad empezó a trabajar tejiendo en Artesanías de Puno. Luchó por sacar adelante a su hijo y este negocio la ayudo a poder apoyar económicamente a su hijo que en ese momento estaba estudiando. En la actualidad teje chompas en palillo y los vende según el pedido que le hacen.

Con este préstamo de S/. 400, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará 3 Kg. de lana para tejer a S/.114 y otros materiales que necesita para dar el acabado a las prendas que teje.

Su deseo es sacar al mercado sus prendas y así obtener más ganancias.
description_translated:
Doña Maria is a single mother and has just one son. Currently she is 60 years old, she is an unemployed teacher and lives at Jr. Yunguyo (no house number), Juli district, Chucuito province, in the department of Puno. She is one of the founding members of the “Niño San Salvador” Communal Bank of Juli. With the first loan of S/. 300 she increased her capital and bought wool to knit sweaters. When she was 28 years of age she started to work weaving in Puno Crafts. She struggled to provide opportunities for her son and this business helped her to be able to economically support her son when he was studying. She currently weaves sweaters and sells them according to the orders that are placed. With this loan of S/. 400, which will be repaid in 4 installments, she will buy 3 Kg. of wool to weave at S/.114 and others materials that she needs to finish the items that she weaves. Her wish is to bring her items to market and through this obtain more earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: She will buy 3 kg. of wool at S/.114.

description:
Elisa tiene 42 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos de trece y nueve años, realizó estudios superiores y vive en el Jr. Santa Cruz s/n, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chuchito, departamento de Puno.

Es una nueva socia del Banco Comunal “Pequeña Roma” de Juli. Desde los 34 años de edad se inició en este negocio, el cual le permite sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 200, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, aumentará su capital para comprar mas mercadería para su negocio de venta de ropa. 

Su sueño es que sus hijos puedan tener lo que ella no tuvo y que puedan ser profesionales.
description_translated:
Elisa is 42 years old and is a single mother of 2 children, who are 13 and 9 years old. She did her higher education and lives in the Jr. Sanra Cruz s/n, in the district of Juli, Chuchito, Puno.

She is a new member in the Pequeña Roma Community Bank in Juli. At the age of 34, she started her business, which allows her to take her children forward.

With this loan of 200 soles, which will be repaid in 4 installments, she will increase her capital so that she can buy more merchandise for her business of selling clothes.

She dreams that her children can have what she didn’t have and that they can be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy more merchandise (clothes)

description:
La señora Benigna Amelia P. HU. tiene 50 años, pertenece al Banco comunal Mujeres Emprendedoras II y vive en la calle Desamparados 677 balneario de Buenos Aires Norte del distrito de Víctor Larco provincia de Trujillo departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió primaria completa pero no pudo seguir estudiando por motivos económicos, ya que vivía en la sierra donde no había educación superior, es de Santiago de Chuco.
Benigna es madre soltera, tiene un hijo por el que tiene que trabajar y luchar para mantenerlo y darle una vida digna.
Trabajaba vendiendo  insumos para el calzado, pero actualmente se dedica a elaborar adornos para el calzado, aprendió a hacerlos y ahora es su actual negocio.  También trabaja en un taller de costura. El negocio es en su propia casa.
Su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles devueltos en 4 cuotas con lo que compró materiales para los adornos.
Con este crédito de 350 que será cancelado en 4 cuotas ampliará su negocio, comprando cueros, lencería y otros materiales.
Su sueño es darle una vida cómoda a su hijo y verlo profesional.
description_translated:
Benigna Amelia P. HU. is 50 years old, is a member of the Mujeres Emprendedoras II community bank and lives at Desamparados 677 in the Buenos Aires Norte neighborhood in the Víctor Larco district, Trujillo Province, La Libertad department in Perú. She is from Santiago de Chuco and finished primary school but couldn't continue studying for economic reasons, since she lived in a mountainous region where there wasn't higher education. Benigna is a single mother, has a son for whom she has to work and fight to support and provide with a dignified life. She worked selling materials for shoe stores but currently works actually making decorations for shoes. She learned to make them and now it is her current business. She also works in a sewing workshop. The business is in her own home. Her first loan was for 300 Soles, repaid in 4 months with which she purchased materials for her decorations. With this loan of 350 Soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will expand her business, buying leather, linens, and other materials. Her dream is to provide a comfortable life for her son and see him become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase of leather and other materials for shoe decorations

description: Mr. R. Rounm, 49 years old,  is the leader of a group of six businessman who live in the Chrouy Dang Village in Kandal Province. He is a farmer who cultivates rice on a small plot of land that he owns, while his wife, Mrs. Pan Mom, is a housewife. The couple has six children, four of whom are employed in different businesses, while the other two still attend school. To improve the fertility of his rice plantation, Mr. R. Rounm currently needs a loan to be able to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.
loan_use: Purchase of fertilizers and pesticides to improve land productivity
borrower_names: Mach, Yorn, Neary, Suth, Thoeng, Roun
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, male
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true

description: Mrs. Chanthorn S., 29 years old, has four children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school, while the youngest one is too young to study. Mrs. S. is the leader of a group of six businessmen who all live in the Andong Village in Kandal Province. She earns income breeding pigs, while her husband, Mr. Em Lok, works as a motorbike-taxi driver, make very little. Mrs. S.'s business, on the other hand, is going well, and she wants to expand it. Therefore, Mrs. S. is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets for breeding. \r\nThis is a group loan mainly consisting of end-of-term loans. Three members of the group have end-of-term loans, while the others have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product, because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor, allowing them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term, and almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.\r\n
loan_use: Purchase of additional piglets for breeding
borrower_names: Sarem, Srorn, Chanthorn, Soeun, Chamroeun, Sony
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true

description: \nChị Nguyễn thị Ngoan năm nay 45 tuổi Ms 01030004 là một phụ nữ rất năng động, hàng ngày chị làm nghề sửa chữa xe máy và chồng chị là thợ cắt tóc. Hiện tại chị có 2 con đi làm công nhân nên mức thu nhập của gia đình chị cũng khá ổn định từ 200.000VNđ/ ngày. Chị và nhóm đã tham gia vay vốn qua 2 chu kỳ đèu trả rất tốt, chị rất thích hình thức vay trả này vì nó giúp chị được trả dần, đồng thời tiết kiệm tiền để lo cho con cái chị có công việc làm ổn định. Chu kỳ này chị đăng ký vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để mua phụ tùng về bán và sửa chữa xe máy. Trong nhóm chị có các thành viên như sau: Chị Đặng thị N. Ms 01030001 vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để kinh doanh và sửa chữa điện thoại . Chị Lê thị Quý Ms 01030003 vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để kinh doanh hàng ăn sáng. Chị Đặng thị N. T. Ms 01030005 vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để mua đồ sửa chữa máy tính. Chị Nguyễn thị H. Ms 01030035 vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để kinh doanh và bán nước giải khát.\n
loan_use: invest in repair shops
borrower_names: Ngoan, Nguyễn Thị, Lê Thị, Đặng Thị, Đặng Thị

loan_name: Mrs. Pok Khiev Village Bank Group
description:
Pok K. is a 68, and is married to Kuy S. who is a rice farmer. She owns a small grocery store in the local village. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she is asking for a loan to buy more grocery products for her inventory. This will help increase her output and sales.

The village bank which consists of ten people is located in Damnak Rovieng Village in Takeo Province and Pok K. is a village bank president. This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Seven members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.
loan_use: To ask for a loan to buy more grocery products for her inventory.
borrower_names: Sarin, Saroeun, Vai, Thav, Soeun, Chin, Pok, Mao, Tha, Oeurn
borrower_genders: female, female, male, male, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
William O. is 35 years old and married with four children. He is a furniture maker who makes furniture for both office and home use. The demand for his furniture is high and he needs a loan in the amount of N52,000 to purchase more wood in bulk for his furniture business.

\r\n\r\n

He says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support and LAPO Microfinance for their business training.
loan_use: To purchase more wood for furniture making.

description:
Guillermina es socia del Banco Comunal San Gabriel.
Guillermina es casada, tiene 63 años y 3 hijos D. 40, 38 y 32 años. Todos sus hijos  trabajan. 
Guillermina tiene su negocio D. crianza D. chanchos en el distrito D. Mala, Guillermina cría y venD. chanchos, ella viaja 3 veces al mes a Mala llevando la comida para sus animales, compra semanalmente 2 sacos D. comida, tiene personal en Mala que se encarga D. ver a sus animales .
Guillermina actualmente apoya a sus nietos , los está criando.
Guillermina necesita un préstamo D. 400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. comida para los animales. 
Guillermina sueña con seguir creciendo en su negocio.
description_translated:
Guillermina is a member of the San Gabriel Community Bank. She is married, 63 years old and mother of three children, ages 40, 38 and 32, all of whom work for a living. Guillermina's business raises pigs in the district of Mala, Peru. She raises the pigs and then sells them. She travels three times a month to Mala to take feed to her animals; she buys two sacks of feed a week. She has workers in Mala in charge of watching her livestock. Guillermina currently is raising her grandchildren. She's requesting a loan of 400 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of feed for her animals. Her dream is to continue growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Buy feed for her animals

description:
Mrs. Nen N., 57, and her husband, Mr. Yen Sao, 61, who live on an Island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1979 and have six children: two sons and four daughters. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home. One daughter is a weaver and the other two children study in the local school.

Mrs. Nen has been a silk weaver for twenty five years, a skill she learned from her parents when she was fifteen years old. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a motor-taxi driver for twenty years. 

Nen is requesting a loan to purchase silk materials for weaving.
loan_use: To purchase silk material for weaving

description:
Mrs. Chan C., 45, and her husband, Mr. Phat Krouch, live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were marred in 1984 and have two children; one son and one daughter. Their daughter is married and lives outside the family home and their son studies in local school. 

Chan has been a silk weaver for twenty-eight years, a skill she learned from her sister. Her husband has been a silk weaver for over ten years, a skill he learned from Chan. They sell their finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh.    

Chan is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase silk material for weaving.
loan_use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

description:
Mrs. Phal C., 43, and her husband, Mr. Min Lay, live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1983 and have seven children: two sons and five daughters. Three of their children are married and live outside the family house. Two children attend a local school, one son is employed full-time, and one daughter is a grocery seller.

Phal has been selling silk fabric since 1986. She buys the finished products from weavers in her village for resale in a Phnom Penh market. Her husband assists her in the business and also helps her daughter to buy grocery items for resale.

Phal is requesting a loan of $1000 to buy silk fabric for resale.
loan_use: To buy silk fabric for resale

description:
El señor Alfredo vive en casa propia con su esposa e hijos en la calle Docweiler de la zona de Tacagua de la Ciudad de La Paz; tiene por actividad la confección de chamarras las mismas que su esposa las vende por la mañana  ambulando por la calle, también trabaja con pedidos, el crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y comprar más insumos (tela, hilos, cuero, cierres, etc.) y de esta manera poder mantener y aumentar  su clientela y mejorar sus ingresos.

Su antecedente histórico es bueno y califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.
description_translated:
Mr. Alfredo M. lives in his own house with his wife and childen on Docweiler Street in the Tacagua district of the City of La Paz. He is in the business of making jackets, which his wife sells in the morning as a street vendor. His customers also place orders with him. He is requesting this loan in order to increase his capital and purchase more supplies (fabric, thread, leather, zippers, etc.), thus he will be able to both maintain and expand his clientele and boost profits. He has good credit history, which qualifies him for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase leather, fabric, lining, thread, and other supplies for jacket production

description:
Luz is a member of the Poder ("Power") Communal Bank. She is 32 years old and married with two children. Luz and her husband own a store, where they offer printing and photocopying services. The business is located one block from Ayacucho's main plaza. Luz also has a degree in Accounting, and provides accounting services to various businesses.

Luz needs a loan of 3000 soles to buy paper and ink. Her dreams are to build her own home, to open branches in other provinces and to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Luz es socia del Banco Comunal Poder.

Luz es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Luz tiene una tienda en donde brinda servicios de impresión de planos, fotocopias, su local es alquilado y esta ubicado a 1 cuadra de la plaza principal de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza con su esposo. Además Luz es de profesión contadora y brinda asesoría contable a diferentes empresas.

Luz necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papel y tintas. Los sueños de Luz son construir su casa, tener sucursales en diferentes provincias y mejorar su calidad de vida.
loan_use: Buy paper and ink for print shop

description: Hilmer tiene 27 años, es soltero, actualmente vive con sus padres, pero hay temporadas donde viaja a la costa para estar pendiente de las tierras de cultivo que posee en esa zona. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura, ya se en su pueblo o de lo contrario en la costa donde también se va a sembrar papa, comenta que para la siembra de este producto hay que tener suerte, porque el año pasado sembró en la costa, pero la papa no tuvo un buen precio. Pero esta vez el tubérculo tiene buen precio en el mercado, su actividad es sembrar y negociar porque trabaja con su capital 50% y el 50% con el banco. Le agrada lo que hace, porque cuando tiene un buen precio se dobla su capital. Es cliente por vez primera en MFP. Con el dinero solicitado primero comprará un insecticida denominad “rejin” que cuesta un aproximado 380 soles que le alcanza para dos hectárea de fumigado.
description_translated:
Hilmer is 27, single, currently living with his parents. Seasonally he travels to the coast to cultivate the farmlands that he possesses in that area. His entire life has been dedicated to agriculture. Whether in his town or on the coast, he already plans to sow potatoes. He comments that he needs luck to plant this crop because the previous year he planted on the coast, but the price for potatoes was low. But at this time tubers are bringing a good price in the market, so his job is to plant and negotiate, because he is working 50% with his own capital and 50% with the bank. \r\n\r\nHe likes what he is doing, because when prices are good he can double his investment. He is a first-time client of MFP. With the money he is requesting, he will first buy an insecticide called "rejin" that costs approximately $125 to cover 2 hecatres with insecticide.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase of insecticide for his farmlands

description:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Koly (2 veuves et  2  mariées) ont en moyenne 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivent dans des foyers polygames dans le quartier Bounoukobougou de la préfecture de Yanfolila (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Unies par des relations économique et de voisinage, elles font la préparation et la vente de l’attièké (Semoule d’igname ou de patate sauvage). En plus elles font de la friandise de haricot, de mil etc.
Elles sont parténaires de l’institution SoroYiriwaso depuis maintenat 2 ans et sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire(prêt de groupe).Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, 240 kg de manioc avec les commercantes venant d’Odjéné (en république de la  Côte d’Ivoire), du poisson , de l’huile de l’oignon et du piment. Les autres ingrédints entrant dans la préparation de l’attièké sont achetés sur place au marché.
La clientèle est contituée de forains et des nombreux passagers qui transitent par Yanfolila en partance pour les républiques de la Guinée Conakry  ou   de la  Côte d’Ivoire.
La vente se fait au marché de Yanfolila sous des hangards aménagés à cet effet. Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice hebdomadaire de 10.000 FCFA soit au minimum  40.000 FCFA par mois qui servira à rembourser les intérêts du prêt et assurer certaines dépenses de la famille comme l’éducation des enfants, la santé , l’habillement ...etc.
description_translated:
The four women of the Koly group (2 widows, 2 married) have an average age of 40 years, 4 children, and live in polygamous households in the Bounoukobougou quarter in the Yanfolila prefecture (the third administrative region in the Republic of Mali). United by economic and neighborly relationships, the women make and sell attièké (semolina flour made from yams or wild potatoes). They also make candies out of beans, millet, etc. They have been partners with the Soro Yiriwaso institution for two years and are now on their fourth solidarity (or group) loan. All of their previous loans were repaid in full. The current loan will be used to by 240 kg of cassavas with the merchants coming from Odjéné (in the Republic of Côte d’Ivoire), fish, oil onion, and peppers. The other ingredients used in making attièké are purchased on-site at the market. The client base is made up of stallkeepers and numerous passengers who pass through Yanfolila on their way to Conakry, Guinea or Côte d’Ivoire. They sell their products at the Yanfolila market underneath makeshift sheds designed for that purpose. They each hope to make a weekly profit of 10,000 FCFA or at least 40,000 FCFA per month which will be used to pay the interest on the loan and to take care of certain family expenses such as the children’s education, healthcare, clothing, etc.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase of food items

description:
Madame Naîda D. a 51 ans,  mariée et mère de 2 enfants vivant dans une famille polygame avec son mari, sa coepouse et leurs enfants dans le quartier Lafiala de la préfecture de Koutiala ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali)
Dès son jeune âge elle fut initiée(par sa mère)aux activitée génératrices de revenus notamment le commerce de vêtements d’enfants. Avec ses trentes ans d’expériences dans le secteur du vêtement, elle maitrise parfaitement les tenants et aboutissants de ce domaine, ce qui lui vaut aujourd’hui dans la ville de Koutiala, une réputation et une notorieté très enviable.  Elle est trés bien sollicitée  lors des céremonies sociales et des fêtes.
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante,  elle decida d’intégrer le programme crédit de l‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis  4 ans.  Après avoir correctement remboursés les  4 prêts  solidaires (prêt de groupe) et les 4 prêts individuels, elle est à son 5 eme prêt en individuel.
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt,  100 habits pour enfants à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) et parfois sur place à Koutiala auprès des grands commerçants grossistes. Elle vend ses marchandises au grand marché de Koutiala à une clientèle conctituée de femmes et hommes à crédit et au comptant.. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75.000FCFA qu’elle envisage d’utiliser pour rembourser les intérets du prêt et élargir son activité.
description_translated:
Mrs. Naîda D. is 51 years old, married, and has two children She lives in a polygamous family with her husband, her co-wife, and their children in the Lafiala quarter in the Koutiala prefecture (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Starting at a very young age, she participated (thanks to her mother) in income-generating activities, notably the selling of children’s clothing. With thirty years of experience in the clothing business, she has perfectly mastered the ins and outs of this field, which has given her an enviable reputation and fame in the city of Koutiala. She is often hired for social ceremonies and parties. In order to meet the needs of her ever-growing client base, she has been with the Soro Yiriwaso loan program institution for four years. After having repaid four previous solidarity (or group) loans, as well as four individual loans, she is now on her fifth individual loan. With this loan she hopes to buy 100 children’s outfits in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). Sometimes she also purchases outfits on-site in Koutiala from large commercial wholesalers. She sells her merchandise, on credit and for cash, at the large market in Koutiala to both men and women. She hopes to make a monthly profit of 75,000 FCFA which she hopes to use to pay off the interest on the loan and to increase the size of her business.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase of children's outfits

description: Chị Ngô Thị Lan năm nay 52 tuổi, gia đình chị có 3 con đèu đã trưởng thành. Hiện nay chị Lan đang bán hàng ăn sáng tại chợ còn chồng chị cho thuê bàn ghế phục vụ đám cưới. Với tổng thu nhập đạt 2.000.000đ/ tháng cuộc sống của hai vợ chồng chị khá ổn định. Vòngvốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9 triệu dồng, một phần chị đầu tư thêm vốn vào mua thêm thực phẩm phục vụ việc kinh doanh hàng ăn sáng, phần còn lại chị đầu tư mua thêm bàn ghế phụcvụ cho công việc kinh doanh của chồng.
description_translated:
Ms. N. Thi Lan is 52 yrs old and has 3 grown children. Currently she sells breakfast food at the market, while her husband rents furniture for wedding parties. With a combined income of 122 USD per month, their family life is stable. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 550 USD with 1/4 of the loan to purchase additional food items to serve in her restaurant, and the remainder of the loan to buy more chairs and tables to use in her husband's business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Business

description: Chị Phượng tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2007. Tuy mới 19 tuổi nhưng chịPhượng đã có khá nhiều kinh nghiệm trong kinh doanh hoa quả. Hiện nay với sự giúp đỡ của chồng và nguồn vốn vay của Quỹ tình thương công việc kinh doanh hoa quả của gia đình chị đã cho thu nhập 2 triệu đồng/ tháng. N.ài kinh doanh buôn bán gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu từ chăn nuôi nên  dù mới xay dựng gia đình nhưng kinh tếcủa vợ chồng chị Phượng khá ổn định. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9 triệu đồng để đầu tư thêm vốn vào công việc kinh doanh hoa quả
description_translated:
Ms. Phuong joined TYM fund since 2007. Even though she is only 19 yrs old, she already has a lot of experience in selling fruits. Currently with the help of her husband and a loan from TYM fund, her fruit selling business brings in 122 USD per month. In addition to her fruit business, another source of her income is from raising animals. Therefore, even though recently married, her family's income situation is quite stable.
