For this loan, she wishes to borrow 550 USD to invest in her fruit selling business

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Business

description:
Agé de 40 ans Madame K. F. est veuve depuis 2001 qui vit dans une famille nucléaire avec ses deux (2) enfants dans la ville de la sous-préfecture de Fana (région de Koulikoro République du Mali).
Avec le décès prématuré de son conjoint, elle devient l’unique soutien de la famille d’où l’intensification de ses activités économiques à savoir l’achat et la vente de chaussures (en plastique, en cuir etc), de sacs à main et de produits cosmétiques depuis maintenant 5 ans. Elle dispose d’une boutique au grand marché de Fana où défilent à longueur de journée les dames et quelques hommes.
Pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante et exigeante, elle rentre en relation avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso (qu’elle connue à travers une amie) avec qui elle est à son premier prêt individuel. 
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 100 paires de chaussures (de différentes sortes) pour hommes et femmes et 150 sacs à main pour les femmes auprès des grossistes du grand marché de la ville de Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali). 
Madame K. F. effectue ses ventes, en détail, au comptant et à crédit (payable mensuellement) à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Les activités de vente sont importantes en cette période de l’année en raison de la proximité de la fête de tabaski.
Avec ce prêt K. compte réaliser 35.000 FCFA de bénéfice par mois qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour subvenir aux dépenses (frais de nourriture, de santé et d’éducation) de ses deux orphelins.
description_translated:
Madame K. F. is 40 years old and has been a widow since 2001. She lives in a nuclear family with her two children in the city of the sub-prefecture of Fana (Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali). With the premature death of her husband, she became the only breadwinner, thus the intensification of her work, namely buying and selling shoes (made of plastic, leather, etc.), handbags, and cosmetics over the last five years. She has a shop at the grand marketplace of Fana, where women and some men come and go all day long.

To satisfy better her demanding and burgeoning customer base, she is re-associating herself with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso (that she got to know through a friend) with which she is on her first individual loan. She intends to use this loan to buy 100 pairs of shoes (of different sorts) for men and women and 150 handbags for women, from wholesalers of the grand marketplace of the city of Bamako (capital of Mali).

Accepting cash or credit (payable monthly) for her goods, Ms. K. F. makes her sales at the retail level to customers composed of men and women. Sales activity is high during this time of year because the Feast of Tabaski is approaching.

With this loan, she intends to realize 35,000 francs CFA of profit per month that will be used essentially to provide for her two orphans (in terms of the costs of food, health, and education).

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy shoes and handbags

description:
Buri H. is 54 years old. She is married and the mother of 3 children. 

Buri is a farmer. Her business has been able to support her children and provide a house for her family. On her land, she plants crops like wheat, onions and potatoes. She also raises cattle on the land. 

Buri buys calves in the market at a low price, feeds them, and then resells them in the same market at a higher price. Her younger son helps her with the business. Buri and her son grow enough crops to feed the family and to sell on the market to help the family earn a living. 

Today they are applying to IMON for a loan. Buri hopes to produce a rich crop yield, which she can sell in the market at attractive prices. She is therefore requesting a loan of 500 Somoni ($150 US Dollars) for the term of 12 months. Buri is planning to purchase fertilizer and to better maintain her cattle with the loan. 

Let’s support this courageous woman.
loan_use: To purchase fertilizer and maintain cattle

description:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Ndeshi M. from Mwanza. She is married with two children, ages three and nine. Ndeshi has been running a clothing business since 2008. She works at her business for 12 hours a day, six days a week. Ndeshi currently earns about 150 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase vitenge (African traditional clothing), shirts, children's clothes and trousers. Ndeshi thanks you for your support!\r\n

\r\nSELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.
loan_use: To purchase clothing for resale

description: Nancy tiene  52 años, vive con sus 5 hijos y sus nietos, quienes trabajan todos en la chacra en mutuo acuerdo. Desde su infancia fue a los campos de cultivo, ahora con sus hijos continua la misma actividad. Cuando termina de trabajar en la chacra vende gaseosas, hace un mes que empezó, con el anhelo de que algún día, antes que muera, nos dice, pueda tener una pequeña bodega. A Nancy el trabajo agrícola ya le cansa mucho, es por ello que le gustaría tener una tienda para ya no trabajar en la chacra, piensa que el negocio no sería tan rentable, pero si tendría ingresos diarios. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP. Este dinero, es su oportunidad de comprar varios paquetes de gaseosas y golosinas para vender en mayor cantidad, por ello invertirá  todo el dinero en esto.
description_translated:
Nancy is 52 years old. She lives with her five children and her grandchildren who all work on the farm together. Since her infancy, she has gone to work in the fields and now with her children she continues the same activity. When she finishes working on the farm she sells soft drinks. She started a month ago with the longing that one day before she dies to have a small general store. The agricultural work makes Nancy very tired and for that reason she would like to have a store to not have to work on the farm. She doesn't think the business would be very profitable but she would have a daily income. This is the first time she is requesting a loan from MFP. This money is her opportunity to buy several cases of soft drinks and candy to sell in greater quantities and for that reason she will invest it all in this.\r\n

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase soft drinks to sell

description: Penda S., 51 ans, mariée, 08 enfants  en charge dont  07 scolarisés. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Baghagha depuis 6 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter des poissons séchés à Baghagha pour revendre à Dakar. Elle veut un prêt pour renforcer son commerce. Les revenus  tirés de son commerce vont lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. \n\n
description_translated:
Penda S. is 51 years old, married, and has 8 children in her care, of whom 7 are in school. She has been a member of the village loan group of Baghagha for 6 years. Her business consists of buying dried fish in Baghagha to re-sell in Dakar. She is asking for a loan to strengthen her business. The income drawn from her business will allow her to improve her family's living conditions. The loan she is asking for will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.\r\n

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy and re-sell dried fish

description: Hermelinda tiene 26 años, es casada y tiene un hija de tan solo 8 meses, quien es la razón de su vida. De padres agricultores, su infancia fue vivir y jugar entre plantas, de paso ayudando a trabajar a  sus padres, por ello que no deja de sembrar. Hace un año atrás sembró mamones de plátanos, y hace 5 años tiene sembrado frutos cítricos, de los cuales ahora ya cosecha. Hace 6 meses atrás estaba trabajando como facilitadota del Programa Gubernamental PRONAMA alfabetizando a personas adultas, le a gustado mucho educar, por ello ahora quiere ser profesora de otro programa del gobierno y claro seguir trabajando en su chacra, que por nada la dejaría. Es nueva cliente en MFP. Con el dinero del préstamo va a hacer trabajar su chacra con peones  y en seguida sembrar maíz, después café, le costara un aproximado de S/800 todo el trabajo.
description_translated:
Hermelinda is 26 years old, married, and has an 8-month-old daughter who is her reason for being. Born to agricultural parents, her childhood was spent living and playing amongst the plants, sometimes helping out her parents, which is why she has never stopped planting. A year ago she planted bananas and 5 years ago she planted citrus fruits, which she is now harvesting. Six months ago she worked as a facilitator for the government program PRONAMA, teaching adults to read. She enjoyed teaching, which is why she now wants to be a teacher for another government program and, at the same time, continue working her small farm (chacra), which she wouldn't leave for anything. She is a new MFP client. With the loan money she will hire helpers for the chacra and immediately plant corn, then coffee; this work will cost her approximately 800 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To prepare farm for planting corn and coffee

description: Alida tiene 59 años, se quedo viuda hace 5 años, vive con sus 5 hijos y dos yernos que le apoyan. Es ama D. casa, se dedica al cuidado D. sus hijos, en su misma vivienda ha visto por conveniente hacer una granja D. cuyes, pero tiene una dificultad granD., la falta D. espacio para las jaulas. Por el momento los criá en dos jaulas, que por supuesto no se sienten cómodos los cuyes, a la vez siembra papa en chacras temporales para su consumo. Cada día a las 6.00am se va a comprar alfalfa al mercado, por paquetes le cuesta cada uno a S/7 invirtiendo a diario solo en pasto S7.14. Le gusta esta actividad, porque cada cuy lo venD. D. 10 a 12 soles. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero va comprar un terreno que está a su costado para que ahí pueda ampliar  y mandar a construir sus jaulas, ese terreno le va costar S/.1.200.
description_translated:
Alida is a 59-year-old woman who was widowed 5 years ago. She lives with her 5 children and two sons-in-law, who support her. She is a homemaker who takes care of her children in her home. She found it convenient to make a guinea pig farm, but her biggest difficulty is a lack of space for the cages. For the moment, she raises her guinea pigs in two cages, which of course is uncomfortable for them. She also grows potatoes in temporary farms for her consumption. Every morning at 6:00 am, she goes to the market to buy alfalfa in packs, which cost 7.00 PEN each. She invests 7.14 PEN daily in fodder alone. She likes this business because she sells each guinea pig for 10 to 12 PEN. This is her first loan with MFP. With this money, she will purchase a neighboring plot of land so that she can expand her business and have more cages maD.. This plot will cost 1,200.00 PEN.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase plot of land for guinea pig farm

description: Khuraman was born in 1958 and is a mother of two children. She lives in Khachmaz in Azerbaijan. Seven years ago she started a sheep-breeding business. She needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy sheep and a calf.
loan_use: Purchase livestock

description: Madame D. Kossiwa Edem est née le 21 novembre 1976 à Agou Gadzéfé, ville située à 110 Km de la ville d Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. \r\nElle a pour activité la vente des produits de consommation courante dans le quartier d’Agoè au nord de Lomé. Elle a commencé ce commerce depuis 2005.\r\nCe premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 9 cartons de savons, 10 cartons spaghetti, 5 cartons de tomate, 6 cartons de lait et 6 sacs de riz. Avec ce nouveau stock elle pourra mieux vendre et réaliser beaucoup de bénéfices.
description_translated:
Mrs. Kossiwa Edem D. was born on November 21, 1978, in Agou Gadzéfé, a city situated 110 km from the city of Lomé. She is married and the mother of two children. Her business is the sale of general consumption products in the Agoé neighborhood in the north of Lomé. She began this business in 2005. The first credit that she is now seeking will permit her to buy 9 cartons of soap, 10 cartons of spaghetti, 5 cartons of tomatoes, 6 cartons of milk and 6 sacks of rice. With this new stock, she will be able to sell more products and realize more profit.

Translated from French by Abby Gray, Kiva Fellow
loan_use: To buy general consumables

description: Comfort S. is widow who has 3 children. She has received no formal education. Comfort buys corn and beans in large quantities, dries them to avoid insect infestation and repackages them for sale at Kormantse near Cape Coast. She has been in this business since 1998. Comfort uses her income to pay school fees and other family expenses. \r\n\r\nComfort will use the loan to buy bags of corn and beans for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to invest into her children's education and also plough her profits back into the business.
loan_use: To buy bags of corn and beans for resale.

description: Agnes Q. sells a local meal popularly known as 'Kenkey', which is made out of corn.  It is one of the most commonly eaten foods in the country at Yamoransa Junction near Cape Coast.  Agnes has received no formal education.  She is married and has 2 children.  Her husband is a commercial driver. \r\n\r\nAgnes has been selling 'Kenkey' since 2006.  She is responsible for paying school fees, utility bills and feeding her family.  Her loan will be used to buy more maize as the raw ingredient, firewood as the fuel for cooking the Kenkey, and other things needed for the preparation of Kenkey.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to help her husband build a family house.
loan_use: Her loan will be used to buy more maize as the raw ingredient, firewood as the fuel for cooking the Kenkey, and other things needed for the preparation of Kenkey.

description: U. Anvar is a hard-working person and he makes an effort to give his 4 beloved children the best. He decided to stay in his homeland so that he could develop it, and now he carries out his everyday chores with a lot of love and affection as he cultivates the land and feeds his animals. \r\n\r\nThrough his business, he has been able to educate his children up to secondary school level. He would now like to extend his animal business and with this purpose in mind, he is asking for a loan of 2500 Somoni (750 USD) for the term of 12 months. He plans to increase the number of animals moved at a single time in future. Anvar thanks you very much for your kindness to others.
loan_use: Purchasing of the cattle and calves to expand his business

description:
Roberta Es socia del Banco Comunal Claveles.
Roberta es viuda, tiene 61 años y 7 hijos, Roberta es profesora jubilada, Roberta tiene una tienda en su casa ubicada en la Asoc. La victoria en donde vende abarrotes y bebidas variadas, atiende desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. Además Roberta se dedica a la agricultura de cereales en sus terrenos de Acosvinchos.
Roberta necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche y conservas diversas.
Los sueños de Roberta son sacar profesional a su ultimo hijo, continuar con su negocio hasta que pueda.
description_translated:
Roberta is a member of the communal bank Claveles (Carnations). Roberta is a widow, is 61 years old and has 7 children. Roberta is a retired teacher. Roberta has a store in her house, located in the La Victoria Association where she sells groceries and a variety of drinks. She attends her business from 6 in the morning until 10 at night. Additionally, Roberta work in grain farming on her land in Acosvinchos. Roberta needs a 1200 Soles loan, which will be invested in buying rice, sugar, milk, and various canned goods. Roberta's dreams are that her last son will become a professional and will continue with her business until he can.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Roberta needs a 1200 Soles loan which will be invested in buying rice, sugar, milk, and various canned goods

description: El señor José Feliciano L. tiene la edad de 27 años habita en la comunidad palo de leche ubicada en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposa eh hijos, la esposa de don José trabaja como domestica para ayudarle con los gastos de casa, este señor tiene siete años de trabajar como agricultor, pero le a costado mucho tener una buena producción ya que anteriormente no tenia el apoyo de ninguna institución para comprar los suficientes insumos. El sueño de don  José es llegar a ampliar sus cultivos para darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia esta muy contento ya que Afodenic le esta apoyando para sacar mejor producción y vender a buen precio.\n\n
description_translated:
Señor José Feliciano L. is 27-years-old and lives in the community of Palo de Leche, which is located in the area of Ticuantepe. He lives there with his wife and children. Don José's wife works as a maid to help him with their home's expenses. This gentleman has worked for 7 years as a farmer, but it has been very difficult for him to have a good yield since previously he didn't have the support of an institution to buy enough supplies. Don José's dream is to expand his crop to give his family better living conditions. He is very happy that Afodenic is supporting him to produce more and to sell his crops at a good price.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To purchase fertilizer and seeds to increase and fertilize his crops

description:
Maruja Sáenz R. pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Al Progreso del distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash.

Maruja tiene 37 años de edad y dos hijos con su esposo que trabaja en la parte administrativa de la UGEL (unidad de gestión educativa) en Yungay. Administra una bodega en su casa que queda en el jr. 02 de mayo Acobamaba en el distrito de Yungay. Ella expende sus productos y menciona que es su mayor satisfacción haber hecho crecer su negocio donde sin muchas dificultades ella ha podido iniciar y mantenerse y de esa manera apoya a su familia, además nos comenta que los miembros de su familia se sienten muy orgullosos de ella. Realiza los pedidos desde la ciudad de Huaraz o compra en los mayoristas de Yungay.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará específicamente con todo el préstamo, arroz, azúcar y leche, porque menciona que ahora han subido mucho los productos, nos cuenta también que ahora la caja de leche cuesta S/ 110. 

Maruja menciona que desearía capacitarse para mejorar su negocio y también en su  vida personal.
description_translated:
Maruja Sáenz R. belongs to the communal bank Mujeres at Progreso (“Women Progressing”) in the district and province of Yungay, Ancash. Maruja is 37 years old and has two children with her husband, who works in the administrative section of UGEL (UGEL is an administrative unit in charge of many schools in what you would call a "county") in Yungay. She manages a general store in her house, which is located on 2nd of May Street in the Yungay district. She sells her products, and notes that it is a great satisfaction to have made her business grow without many difficulties and help support her family. In addition, she tells us that her family is very proud of her. She fills orders in the city of Huaraz, or she buys from the wholesalers of Yungay. With this loan of 1,200.00 soles, to be canceled in six months, she will specifically purchase rice, sugar, and milk. This is because, as she mentions, prices have gone up quite a bit and a box of milk now costs 110.00 soles. Maruja mentions that she would like to train on how to better improve her business and also her personal life.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To purchase rice, sugar and milk.

description:
Rosalía pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso del distrito y  provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash.

Tiene 48 años de edad y dos hijas. Menciona que no ha tenido muchos logros debido a que quedó viuda de un esposo que no se hacía cargo de la familia, es por esta razón que ella siempre vivió como hasta ahora lo hace con su dos hijas. Tiene el negocio de comida que expende en el mercado en el centro ferial de la provincia de Yungay s/n, lugar donde procesa sus alimentos en su puesto, que a la vez aprovecha el lugar de venta para realizar sus compras en el mercado y en especial los días de feria. Menciona que ella empezó con una inversión de S/. 300 y que poco a poco ha ido creciendo, tan es así que actualmente invierte en el proceso de los alimentos y bebidas que tiene en stock en promedio unos S/. 2,000. Día a día sale a vender estos productos con lo cual favorece a toda su familia.

Con el préstamo de S/. 2,500, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, invertirá en la compra de víveres, como azúcar, arroz, fideos y aceite.

Rosalía se encuentra contenta porque menciona que ha sabido salir adelante y día a día va creciendo y saca adelante a sus dos hijas.
description_translated:
Rosalía belongs to the Communal Bank “Mujeres al Progreso” in the district and province of Yungay in Ancash state in Peru. She is 48 years old and has two daughters. She mentions that she hasn’t had many achievements as she was left widowed by a husband who didn’t support the family, so therefore she has always lived as she is living now with her two daughters. She has a food business in the central market in Yungay province, a place where she prepares her meals in a stall, where she takes advantage of the market locale to do her shopping especially on market days. She mentions that she began with an investment of S/.300 and that little by little she has grown. Today she will invest in the preparation of food and beverages that she can stock with a loan of around S/.2000. Day after day she sells these products which benefits her family. With this loan for S/.2,500, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will invest in purchasing supplies such as sugar, rice, noodles, and oil. Rosalía is content because she mentions that she has known how to be successful and day after day she is growing and providing a future for her two daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Buy sugar, rice, noodles and oil.

description: Chị Đại năm nay 35 tuổi, gia đình chị có 3 con đang tuổi đến trường. Năm 1995 chị tham gia quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Sau một thời gian  chăn nuôi lợn hiệu quả gia đình chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi vịt. Hiên tại với sự hỗ trợ thêm của chồng và các con công việc chăn nuôi của gia đìnhchị đang phát triển rất thuận lợi và cho thu nhập 3,5 triệu/tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 12 triệu để đầu tư vốn mua thức ăn phục vụ cho công việc  chăn nuôi vịt của gia đình\n                                    \n
description_translated:
Chị Đại is 35 this year. Her family has three school-aged children. In 1995, she joined the TYM Fund borrowing capital to invest in the business of rearing pigs. After a period of time, as they got good results from the pig rearing business, her family diligently borrowed more funds to raise ducks. Currently, with her husband and children assistance, the family's animal rearing business is growing successfully and provides an income of 3,500,000 VND per month. She hopes to borrow 12,000,000 VND during this loan cycle to purchase animal feed for the family's pig and duck rearing business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To purchase animal feed for family's pig and duck rearing business.

description: Chị Kim Thị Liệu năm nay 48 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương đã được 5 năm. Hiện nay nguồn thu nhập chủ yếu của gia đình chị là từ buôn than và công thợ xây của chồng và con. Hàng ngày chị đi lấy than về đóng và bán cho người dân địa phương còn chồng và con lớn đi làm thợ xây nên thu nhập của gia đình chị rất ổn định. Với mức thu nhập 4 triệu đồng/ tháng cuộc sống của gia đình chị Liệu đang ngày càng được cải thiện hơn. vòngvốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15 triệu đồng để đầu tư vốn mua thêm nguyên liệu phụcv ụ cho công việc sản xuất và kinh doanh than của gia đình
description_translated:
Mrs. L. Thi Kim, 48 years old, has been participating in the Fund for 5 years. Currently her family's main source of income is from selling coal and her husband's and son's salary as construction workers. Everyday, she takes coal home and packs it to sell to the locals, while her husband and oldest son work, so the family's total income is very stable. With an income of 4 million VND/month, the family's life is improving day by day. In this round of funding, she would like to borrow 15 million VND to invest in buying more raw materials to use in the family's business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Buy materials to be recycled

description: Mrs. Norn H. is a villager in Leap village in Takeo Province. She is a fish breeder. Her husband, Mr. Nget Met, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In Mrs. Norn H.’s business, she now faces a problem because she does not have enough money to buy food to feed her fish; in addition, her husband faces the obstacle of having infertile soil. In order to solve these problems, Mrs. Norn H. decided to ask for a loan to buy fish food and fertilizers. Her husband is presented on the left of the picture.
loan_use: To buy fish food and fertilizers for her and her husband's buisnesses.

description:
Khayrullo is married and has four children. He keeps his family together through dedication and lots of hard work as a farmer. He has worked in this area for the past 10 years, and has gained much knowledge and skill in the cultivation of wheat, corn, potatoes and other crops. Because he is a totally dedicated to his work, he spends most of his time on his farm, which demands total commitment. 

Khayrullo has applied for a loan of $600 for nine months to buy more supplies, especially seeds and mineral fertilizer. This loan will allow him to earn more money and educate all of his children. Khayrullo has been an active and strongly motivated client of IMON since 2006, and his credit history makes him eligible to receive new and larger loans. Please consider helping increase the well-being of this hard-working young man and his family.
loan_use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

description: Loun S., 36, is a teacher and a farmer. Her husband works raising fish and farming as well. This couple earns around US$3 of profit combined each day. Farming by depending on the sky is unreliable and sometimes they face crop damage because of lack of water. To escape this problem, Loun S. is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase a water pump. This machine will be used to hire to people for extra profit as well. Loun's husband is pictured in the photograph as the borrower was not available when the photo was taken.
loan_use: To purchase a water pump.

description:
Sadeta was born in 1951 and she lives in Klokotnica, a village in Bosnia.  She lives with her husband and with their two adult sons, both of whom are employed.  She is a housewife, but she also grows vegetables in a garden and takes care of two cows, whose milk she sells in the market.  

She is requesting a loan of 600KM ($400 USD) from Women for Women International to purchase food for her two cows.  She hopes that she will be able to continue raising cows for a long time because “this work makes her happy.”

This loan is guaranteed by Subhija D..
loan_use: To purchase food for cows

description: Mok K. L., 42, is married and lives with her three children and husband in Battambong province, Cambodia. She and her husband together sell many kinds of desserts at the market to earn approximately US$8 each day. She would like to take out a loan of US$1200 to purchase a motorbike for her to transport dessert to the market.\r\n
loan_use: To purchase a motorbike.

description: Betty K. is a proud member of Mayangayanga women’s group in Nakifuma, Kayunga.  She is one of the founding members of the group and runs a retail shop in the town center.  Betty is so impressed with her lending group because she has been able to buy more shop products using her loans, and once the profits come in from the variety, repaying back her loan is no problem.  Betty’s shop is now big and this has made her big profits in return.  She is also grateful to her husband with whom she works in the shop and on their farms for a better life of their family and children.  Betty says that each new loan helps her to buy new missing products for her shop as her profits and savings help to increase the quantity of the already existing products.  Betty needs a loan to help with buying more eggs for her shop.
loan_use: To buy more eggs and other goods for her shop.
borrower_names: Sylivia, Robinah, Regina, Mohammed, Zulia, Tamale, Betty, Deborah
borrower_genders: female, female, female, male, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
hola nosotras somos el grupo Mujeres victoriosas, somos mujeres luchadoras y con muchos deseos de salir adelante, somos vecinas cercanas y con experiencia de varios años en las actividades que realizamos, nuestro grupo se forma de la siguiente manera:
Ana A. soy la coordinadora del grupo tengo 3 años de dedicarme a la elaboracion y venta de comidas, de mi depende mi hija, soy madre soltera.
Doña Martha: ella se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de sopa de mondongoy nacatamales, la sopa de mondongo es una comida muy exquisita de nuestro pais, y se vende muy bien.  Dona Lorena: ella se dedica a la venta de productos vogue, (cosmeticos, cremas etc) ella es madre soltera y es madre de 4 hijos.  Dona Lucidalia: ella vende burritas de carne, frijoles, chirizo y refrescos en un punto de taxis, este es un lugar muy estrategico para la venta de su porducto, ella es viuda. Dona Francisca: ella vende ropa hace 4 años, ella vive sola.
todas necesitamos el credito para sacar adelante nuestros negocios que son la unica fuente de ingresos monetarios que tenemos, necesitamos tener una mayor venta para poder tener mejores gaancias.
description_translated:
Hello, we are a group called "Mujeres victoriosas" (meaning Triumphant Women). We are fighters and we have many hopes of become a success. We are close neighbors and with various years' experience in the businesses that we run. Our group is made up of the following:

Ana A.. I am the coordinator of the gorup and I have 3 years' experience in making and selling foods. My daughter depends on me, I am a single mom.

Martha makes and sells traditional soup "mondongo y nacatamales". The mondongo soup is a very delicious soup native to our country and it sells very well.

Lorena sells vogue products (cosmetics and creams etc.). She is a single mom of 4 children.

Lucidalia sells meat burritos, beans, sausages and drinks at a taxi station. It is a very strategic locale for the sales of her products. She is a widow.

Francisca has been selling clothing for the past 4 years and she lives alone.

We all require a loan for our businesses, our only source of income. We require to sell more to have better earnings.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To purchase ingredients to make foods.
borrower_names: Martha Mirian, Lorena Lizeth, Francisca, Lucidalia, Ana Eduviges

description:
Gabriela is a member of the Alelí Village Bank.

Gabriela is 40 years old, married, and has four children who are 19, 16, 9 and 3 years old. She sells hamburgers from a vending cart, but would like to open up a restaurant. Her hamburgers are homemade and sell very well, so she expects to have a lot of customers.

Gabriela is requesting a loan of 1750 soles to buy tables and chairs for the restaurant. She has already found a space to use in a high-traffic area on Manco Capac Street in the center of the city of Ayacucho.

This is Gabriela’s third loan cycle with the Alelí Village Bank. She says that FINCA has helped her by providing her with easily accessible investment capital. She finds the training/education sessions provided by her loan officer to be very helpful, and says that her work with FINCA has taught her to be punctual. She has almost 1000 soles in her FINCA savings account, and says she never would have saved this much were it not for the help of the institution. 

Gabriela’s dream is to eventually open up a soda fountain-style restaurant that would be open all day and sell cakes, pastries, and coffee in addition to meals.
loan_use: Buy tables and chairs for restaurant

description: LA FAMILIA DE SANTOS COMPUESTA POR 5  PERSONAS: ÉL, SU CONCUBINA Y SUS TRES HIJOS QUE TIENEN 8, 6 Y 4 AÑOS RESPECTIVAMENTE. ACTUALMENTE VIVEN EN UNA CASA POR LA CUÁL PAGAN ALQUILER. SANTOS ES EMPLEADO FIJO DE LA EMPRESA DE ACEITE FINO, DONDE SE DESEMPEÑA EN EL CARGO DE OPERADOR DE SOYA DESDE EL AÑO 2003. EL CREDITO SERA DESTINADO PARA LA COMPRA DE MATERIAL PARA LA CONSTRUCCION DE SU VIVIENDA. SUS ANTERIORES OPERACIONES FUERON CANCELADAS CON UNA BUENA PUNTUALIDAD Y RESPONSABILIDAD.
description_translated:
There are 5 people in Santos’s family: himself, his common-law wife, and their three children, aged 8, 6, and 4. They currently live in a home which they rent. Santos has worked full-time at the Fino soybean oil factory since 2003. He plans to use his loan to purchase materials for the construction of his home. He has paid off his prior loans very responsibly and punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase construction materials

description:
La señora Dalila tiene 54 años de edad, es la presidenta del Banco Comunal Fuente de Vida y vive en el Pasaje Jhon Kenedy 113 El Cortijo, distrito y provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió hasta tercer año de secundaria, pero se casó y ya no continuó sus estudios. Tiene 5 hijos, sólo dos dependen de ella porque son estudiantes.
Su negocio consiste en la confección y venta de camisas y blusas, esta actividad lo realiza en su casa  y también en otras provincias.
Con su primer préstamo de S/. 300 cancelado en 4 cuotas compró una máquina de coser.
Con este crédito de S/. 800, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará telas para hacer blusas y algunos insumos para navidad.
description_translated:
Dalila is 54 years old and the president of the communal bank “Fuente de Vida” (“Fountain of Life”). She lives in El Cortijo, Trujillo, located in the La Libertad region of Perú. She studied to the third year of secondary school, but she then married and did not complete her education. She has five children, two of whom still depend on her and are students. Her business consists of making and selling shirts and blouses, an activity she carries out in her house and also in other provinces. With her first loan of 300.00 soles, which was paid in four installments, she purchased a sewing machine. With this loan of 800.00 soles, to be repaid in six months, she will buy fabrics to make shirts as well as some supplies for Christmas.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To purchase fabrics and supplies for Christmas.

description:
Hassan is a 40 year-old-man who lives in Nabatieh, in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. He has been a blacksmith for seven years. He has requested a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase an electric generator.

Hassan is known for the quality of his work. He installs iron doors and windows. His clients are his friends, neighbors, and others. 

While work, he faced some difficulties because he had an accident in which he broke his leg.  As a result, his work was slower, which made him unable to handle big projects. Despite his accident, he has always been motivated. In the future, he intends to buy a bigger generator and small machinery to improve his business.
loan_use: Hassan needs the loan to purchase an electric generator

description:
Charles O. is 45 years of age and is married with 6 children. He is a hardworking man who operates a wholesale shop in Bugiri district. Before venturing into the wholesale business, Charles was obtaining his income from selling various food crops from his farm within the same locality. It is therefore the farming income that enabled him to set up his present business.

Charles is using the loan to add a variety of products like cooking oil, cosmetics, toiletries, sugar, rice, wheat flour, and some snacks to his store. Besides expanding his business, he hopes to spend some of the profits in educating his children and providing for the family’s basic needs. He enjoys farming and looks forward to opening a farm produce outlet in the area.
loan_use: To add a variety of products like cooking oil, cosmetics, toiletries, sugar, rice, wheat flour, and some snacks to his store

description: M. Soimhodja is 27 years old. Together with his wife they have one child. Bahodur is selling DVDs and CDs. He orders the disks from Russia and tries to have all new movies, and concerts of popular actors, singers, and others. He also provides computer services such as audio editing of video tapes and discs with records of family events of his clients. \r\nSoimhodja tries to use modern, up-to-date technologies in his work so he can satisfy demands and requirements of his customers. The business is now successfully generating the main income for his family. Today Soimhodja requests $1000 US dollars for the term of 12 months. He is planning to purchase more DVDs and CDs to sell. Soimhodja thanks all who are supporting him, and promises to be accurate and timely in paying the loan.
loan_use: Purchasing DVDs and CDs to sell.

description: Fumilayo is a photographer. She has her own photography studio. Fumilayo takes pictures at weddings, funerals, birthdays, and other ceremonies. She needs a loan of 140,000 naira ($1200) to purchase a digital computer printer and a generator. Her customers are asking for faster photo processing times, and she wants to meet this demand. Fumilayo is 34 years old. She is married and has three children. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support and LAPO MICROFINANCE for their business training.
loan_use: To buy a digital computer printer and generator

description: Don Celso habita en un barrio que se llama Concepción de Maria en la capital de Managua, su esposa le tiene dos hijos de 8 y 12 años de edad, estudiante de la primaria en la escuelita del barrio, el señor Celso trabaja de conductor desde hace muchos años, pues se le ha hecho difícil cambiar de trabajo lo cual desearía para mejorar sus ingresos y a si poder terminar de construir su casa que es de madera lo cual quiere hacerla de concreto para tener una vivienda digna para su familia. Con la solicitud de crédito es para invertir en comprar  materiales de construcción ya que va a construir paredes de su casa. A largo plazo es poder seguir haciendo mejoras  a la vivienda ya que es su anhelo.
description_translated:
Mr. Celso P. lives in a neighborhood called Concepción de Maria, in the capital city of Managua. He and his wife have two children, ages 8 and 12, who attend the neighborhood school. Mr. P. has been working as a driver for many years because it has been difficult for him to change occupations, which he would like to do in order to earn more income. He would like to finish building his wooden house and make it out of concrete so that he can have a decent home for his family. He wants to invest this loan in purchasing construction materials as he is going to build the walls of his house. In the long run, he would like to be able to continue with home improvement—his greatest wish.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase construction materials to build two walls

description: Marleny is a member of the Union II Village Bank.  Marleny is 37 years old and married with one daughter. Marleny sells two different lines of cosmetics by catalogue. She sells on credit to her clients, most of whom are friends, family members, and work associates.  Marleny needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy creams and perfumes.  Marleny’s dreams are to build her own house, provide her children with a good future, and expand her business.\r\n\r\n
loan_use: Buy creams and perfumes

description:
La señora Dolly pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Divinas ubicado en el Jr. Progreso Nº 168, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 42 años de edad y es madre soltera de 3 hijos, 2 mayores de edad y uno que aún depende de ella. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de productos de belleza.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de jugos y hamburguesas, todas las mañanas vende en el patio de su hogar, brindándoles buena atención a sus clientes.
  
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 3 kilos de betarraga, 7 papayas, 4 kilos de manzanas, 3 docenas de huevos, etc.

Dolly manifiesta que todas las mujeres pueden salir adelante, teniendo fe y entusiasmo para el trabajo.
description_translated:
Ms. Dolly S. is a member of the Las Divinas microfinance institute, located on Nº 168 Progreso Street, in the Callería district of the Coronel Portillo province, department of Ucayali. She is 42 years old and is a single mother of 3 children, 2 of whom are no longer her dependants. She decided to invest the first 300.00 PEN loan that she received from Manuela Ramos in beauty product sales.

She currently sells hamburgers and juice every morning on her patio, providing excellent customer service.

With this 1,700.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase 3 kg of beets, 7 papayas, 4 kg of apples, 3 dozen egg, etc.

Dolly states that all women can get ahead in life, as long as they have faith and enthusiasm for work.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase beets, papayas, apples, eggs, etc.

description:
Emilia is a member of the Amor y Esperanza (“Love and Hope”) Village Bank. She is 49 years old and married with three daughters. Her nephew, who is an orphan, also lives with her.

Emilia travels to different regional fairs to buy grains, guinea pigs (a Peruvian delicacy), sheep and pigs. She slaughters the animals herself and sells the meat in the city of Ayacucho to stores, restaurants and individuals. She has been working this way for 15 years. Emilia had left FINCA years ago for health reasons, but she recently ran into one of FINCA’s loan officers, who remembered what a good client she had been and invited her to come back. She is currently starting a second loan cycle with Amor y Esperanza.

Emilia is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy clothing in Lima, which she will bring back to Ayacucho to sell for the Christmas season. Her goal for the future is to make home improvements and to save up for old age so that she doesn’t have to depend on her children.
loan_use: Buy clothing to sell for Christmas

description: Mrs Nguyen Thi H. is 49 years old and lives in Nghe An Province. She has been in TYM for four years. She first took a loan to invest in a small trading business. Now her family has a restaurant in Nghi Loc district, which is the family's major income. She is requesting a loan to increase her food supply for the restaurant.\r\n
loan_use: To purchase more food for her restaurant

description:
Beatrice A. inherited a small plot of swamp land on the shores of Lake Victoria. Seemingly worthless, she found a way to turn it into an income-producing asset. She dredges the muddy clay soil and turns it into building bricks that she sells by the pallet to construction firms. Beatrice is perhaps the only woman in Uganda in this highly male-dominated profession. She employs village boys to help her with the hard labor of baking and piling the manufactured bricks.

Beatrice is 48 years old, married with 3 children aged 5-16. All her children are in school. She started her brick-making business a few years ago on a smaller scale to provide the income needed to pay school fees. This is her first loan. She will use the proceeds to buy firewood for the furnace, pay labor wages and purchase additional shovels and wheelbarrows. Beatrice can sell bricks for a bulk price of 80 to 100 Ush depending on the quantity. In a good week, she will sell 3,000 bricks and she feels her manufacturing capacity could be as high as 15,000 bricks per week. One of her business goals is to expand into this capacity. Her other goal is to buy a plot of land and built rental homes to provide further income so that she can save for university fees.
loan_use: Buying firewood for the furnace, pay labor wages and purchase additional shovels and wheelbarrows.

description:
Mary T. is a 44-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. She owns and operates a grocery shop in her neighborhood, where she sells items such as sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, pastries (which she proudly states that she prepares herself), powdered milk, and biscuits.

She is now seeking a loan because she would like to increase her store's inventory by purchasing more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, and boxes of biscuits. In turn, she hopes to increase her savings to support her children while they are in school.

Mary belongs to the community group known as the God is Good Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each other's loans as social collateral (i.e., if one member does not promptly repay her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for curing the arrears), and they provide support for one another to repay their respective loans.
loan_use: To increase her store's inventory by purchasing additional foodstuffs (e.g., assorted drinks, sugar, bottled mineral water, and biscuits)

description:
La señora Blanca M. se dedica al negocio de venta de frutas en el mercado La Terminal de León. Ella se dedica con mucho esfuerzo a su negocio desde hace 20 largos años el cual ha venido desarrollando en su tramo y con la visión de crecer y expandirse para obtener mejores ingresos para mejorar el nivel de vida de sus hijos ya que es madre soltera.  

Por esta razón es que la señora M. ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito el cual será utilizado en la compra de los perecederos como lo son las naranjas. Es importante destacar que ella espera confiadamente en que Ceprodel le brindará el préstamo y así saldrá adelante en su negocio.
description_translated:
Mrs. Blanca M. sells fruit at the market "La Terminal de León". She has maintained and developed her business with much effort for 20 long years and has the vision to grow and expand in order to obtain a higher income to improve the life quality of her children as she is a single mother.

For this reason, Mrs. M. has sought support from Ceprodel to get the benefit of a loan to be spent on the purchase of perichable goods such as oranges. It is important to point out that she trustfully expects Ceprodel to give her the loan and thus enable her to move ahead with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase fruits

description: Lola S. is 37 years old, married, and has three children who she supports by selling fabrics for sewing traditional clothes.  Having worked in this business for almost ten years, Lola has good taste and is trusted by her clients to choose various textiles for many different kinds of occasions.  She has also attracted a wide range of customers by offering fabrics at prices that appeal to all levels of the population.  Lola's commercial success recently allowed her to open a second store in another market, and her overall income is now enough to send her son to university.  In order to further develop her business, Lola is requesting a loan of $1000, which she will use to purchase an even wider array of fabrics for resale.\r\n
loan_use: To purchase more textiles for sewing traditional clothes.

description: Mr G. est un chauffeur agé de 43 ans marié et de famille qui fait de l'elevage de la volail sa seconde activité depuis trois ans il a construit chez lui un poulailet qui sert à l' élevage des poulets de chairs.chaque matin avant d ' aller au travail il s 'occupe des poulets et la  journée sa fill ainée prend le relais.Il sollicite un pret pour renforcer son activité .
description_translated:
Mr. G., age 43, is a chauffeur, married, and a father of a family. He has been raising poultry as his other work for three years. At his home, he has built a chicken coop for raising fryer chickens. Each morning before going to work, he takes care of the hens. And during the daytime, his eldest daughter take over for him. He is requesting a loan to bolster his business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Working capital

description:
El señor Juan Alberto D. se dedica a su negocio de pulpería el cual es atendido en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Telica de la bella ciudad de León. Este caballero se ha caracterizado por ser un buen esposo y un buen padre por la razón que siempre ha llevado el sustento a su hogar porque se ha dedicado arduamente a su negocio. 

El motivo por el cual él ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito que le permita la compra de granos básicos para comercializarlos en la pulpería. Es por esto que muy confiadamente espera que su crédito le sea otorgado y de esta forma salir adelante en su negocio de pulpería.
description_translated:
Señor Juan Alberto D. is dedicated to his store business which he attends in his house in the municipality of Telica of the beautiful city of León. This gentleman has been characterized as being a good husband and a good father for the reason that he has always made a living for his household because he has been dedicated arduously to his business. \r\n

\r\nThe motive that has brought him to Ceprodel to request a loan is the purchase of basic grains to allow him to market them in the store. It is for this that he very confidently hopes that the loan will be offered to him and in this way he will do well in his store business.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy basic grains to sell in his store

description: Tito tiene 35 años, es casado y vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos. Trabaja desde hace 6 años a la cerrajería, en un comienzo era un trabajador más de un taller, pero dio un paso firme para implementar su propio taller y ser independiente, realiza todo tipo de trabajo en  carpintería metálica, de acuerdo a los trabajos que le solicitan y por medio de ello ha adquirido contratos que le permiten tener buenas ganancias. Tito está contento con su labor, porque es independiente, además  puede disponer de su tiempo libre para atender a sus hijos, su deseo es seguir adelante, por el bien de su esposa y de sus hijos, por lo cual continuará esforzándose. En esta oportunidad, es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito, durante este tiempo ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos. Tito solicita este préstamo con el que podrá comprar fierros al por mayor, para seguir fabricando sus trabajos.
description_translated:
Tito, 35, is married and lives with his wife and their 2 children. He worked at a locksmith's shop for 6 years, first as a laborer and then as a craftsman. He's now taken firm steps to set up his own shop and become independent, doing all kinds of work related to shaping metal, depending on what his customers want. He's already received orders that will allow him to earn a good living. Tito is happy with his work because he's independent and because he now has time to spend with his kids. He's striving to get ahead, to make a better live for his wife and children, and he'll continue to work hard for them. This is the the third loan for which he's applied and he showed himself to be punctual in repaying past loans. He's applying for this loans so that he can buy wholesale supplies of iron in order to continue making his products.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Buy wholesale supplies of iron for metal-shaping business.

description:
Diana O. is married and has 2 children. She has received a junior high education and is responsible for taking care of her family's basic needs. Her husband is a fisherman.

Diana started her business not long ago. She sells foodstuffs such as rice and gari. Gari is made out of cassava only; the cassava is milled into dough and then the starch is extracted to reduce the starch content. The dough is then fried into gari, which is very popular in the country. Diana also prepares other food for sale. She does her business at Elmina.

Diana will use her loan to buy raw cassava for the production of gari and also to increase her rice sales. She hopes to save the new profits from her business for reinvestment.
loan_use: To buy raw cassava to produce gari and to increase her rice sales

description:
Aba Y., a single parent with five dependents and responsibility for paying her children's school fees, utility bills and other expenses, received schooling through junior high. Since 1995, Aba has processed and preserved fish purchased from local fishermen and then sends them to the Elmina market for sale.

She is now requesting a loan to increase her capital to buy more fish to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to save towards getting a piece of land to build a house for her family.
loan_use: To increase her capital to buy more fish for sale.

description: Efua A. sells fish which she buys from fishermen and brings home for processing and preservation, and then sends them to the market for sale at the fisheries at Elmina. Efua has received junior high education.  She is married and has 3 dependants. Her husband owns a fishing boat which he gives out on a rental basis. Efua has been selling fish since 1995. She is responsible for assisting her husband in meeting the family's financial needs. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy more fish for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards building a family house which she has planned to do with her husband.
loan_use: Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy more fish for sale.

description:
Chea S., 60, is a widow and resides with five of her children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She has a business renting rooms in her home to make approximately US$3 a day. To contribute to the daily expense, Chea S. is supported by four of her children who work selling rice and many kinds of food.

Chea S. is applying a loan of US$1000 to repair her home and add more rooms.
loan_use: To repair hotel and add more rooms.

description: This group loan which consists of five members is located in Sre Khtom village in Kampong Chhnang Province and they plan to use the loan which they obtained for different purposes. Mr. Arn C. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. He has a threshing machine for his business. He now faces a problem because his machine is not running properly. In order to deal this problem, Mr. Arn C. decided to ask for a loan to repair his machine. His wife, Mrs. Aum Noeun, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Mr. Arn C. is 58 years old and the father of three children, one of whom is a construction worker while the other two are enrolled in the local school. \r\nAll the members in this group loan have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva. \r\n
loan_use: To ask for a loan to repair his threshing machine.
borrower_names: San Oeur, Vet, Yan, Arn, Met

description:
This three-member group from Battambang Province is led by Mrs. Sakun C., 48, a seller in the local market of produce including water-lilies, cabbage, tomatoes, and bean trees. Her husband, Mr. Saren Som, is a 54-year-old motorcycle taxi driver. Sakun is applying for a loan of $100 to buy more vegetables to sell and piglets to breed.

The other two other members are:

Mrs. Taingun M., 33, a vegetable seller who seeks a loan of $200 to enlarge her business;

Mrs. Mom T., a 41-year-old who makes a living selling shrimp and is requesting a $50 loan to buy additional shrimp.
loan_use: To buy more provisions to sell.

description: Christiana C., 50 years old and married with seven children, lives in Benin City with her family. She has sold provisions and a local gin called Ogogoro for several years, and now hopes to expand her business through a loan to purchase more provisions and gin to sell. Christiana says a big thank you to all Kiva lenders.
loan_use: To purchase more local gin and provisions to sell

description: Evelyn O. is 32 years old and married with 3 children. She and her family live in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Evelyn sells foodstuffs and she has been in this business for a long time. She needs the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. Evelyn appreciates the efforts of Kiva lenders in eradicating poverty. She says "thank you" to all that made this loan possible.
loan_use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

description:
M. Abdurazok is 41 years old and has a very collaborative and supportive wife who joins him in tending to their crops.  This couple has 4 children who are all in school.  He and his wife have been working in agriculture for many years.  It is their livelihood.  

He likes the earth to be well worked.  He plants wheat, potatoes, onions and carrots.  His wife and 4 children work for the family's daily income. The eldest child is 20 years old, and helps take care of the crops, but then has to go and study. 

Now, Abdurazok needs a loan of 3500 Somoni ($1050 USD) for the term of 12 months.  He is planning to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer for sowing wheat and potato.  His goal, with time, is to plant larger quantities and educate his children.  With your help this will be possible.
loan_use: Purchasing of seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables

description: Mr T. est pére de famille agé de quarente (40) ans .Il est tailleur de profession depuis 22 ans .Dans son atelier il forme des jeunes au metier de tailleur en meme temps il confection des vetements.Les fetes de fin d' année constituent  des periodes de grandes opportinuté pour les tailleurs ainsi il sollicite un pret pour acheter de accessoires (fils biais bouton renfort ect)pour pouvoir beneficier des economies d'echelle.
description_translated:
Mr. T. is 40 years old and a father of a family. He has been a tailor by profession for 22 years. He uses his workshop to teach young people the tailoring trade while at the same time selling his clothing. The end of the year holiday is a very important sales period for tailors. For this reason he is requesting this loan to purchase accessories ( thread, buttons, cut material, linings, etc) that would increase his business and benefit from the economies of scale.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Operating funds (to purchase materials)

description:
P. Hafiza is 37 years old and is married with four children. Hafiza is a teacher in a local school. Considering that the teachers earn low wages, for the past seven years, Hafiza has had a small business of processing apricots. The dried fruits - especially dried apricots - are very popular in Tajikistan. In addition, it is very beneficial for the health. 

Considering the constant demand for this kind of good, the Hafiza's business is quite successful and brings about a stable income for the family, thereby allowing Hafiza to contribute significantly to the household and education of her dearest children. 

Today, she is requesting 2500 Somoni (750 USD) for the term of 11 months. She is going to spend the loan for purchasing the dried apricots with the purpose of processing and further selling them in order increase the range of goods. Hafiza expresses her gratitude for everyone supporting her. Please support this woman of immense strength and courage.
loan_use: To buy dried apricots in order to increase her food sales business inventory

description:
Teresita C., a 50-year-old farmer and mother five from Sto. Nino, South Cotabato, is a graduate of BS Agriculture. Her husband inherited a 2-hectare rice field from his parents, which they farm as for their daily sustenance.

“Rice is a very important crop”, Teresita says/  They have farmed rice to ensure food on their table. The entire family helps with the crop so they don't have to hire laborers.

Teresita is requesting a loan to purchase sacks of fertilizers and chemicals increase the productivity of her farm

She hopes the higher yield will help her buy another hectare of land, and slowly produce enough rice to raise her family's living conditions. In her own words: "With this loan, surely I could hit my target yield in my farm and slowly, I will be able to realize all my dreams."

CEV has provided all its clients insurance benefits plus credit assistance and training for their well being.
loan_use: To purchase sacks of fertilizers and chemicals.

description: Ilmer tiene 57 años de edad, y ha sido madre de 6 hijos, los mismos que ya son independientes y de familia, es madre soltera y en la actualidad vive con uno de sus hijos quien la apoya en todo. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida, por las mañanas y las tardes dentro de su vivienda, esta labor la viene realizando desde hace 3 años. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que mucha gente degusta de su buena sazón, le es rentable, ya que la zona donde tiene su negocio es muy transitada y concurrida. Lo que le es un poco difícil es no contar con los ambientes necesarios para atender a sus clientes. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado mandará a ampliar su negocio, ambientarlo como es debido, para dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes.
description_translated:
Ilmer is 57 years old and mother of 6 children. They are all independent and have families now. She is single and currently lives with one of her children, who supports her in everything she does. Ilmer works selling food in the mornings and afternoons from her home, which she has been doing for 3 years now. She likes that while she works many people can taste her delicious flavors. It is a profitable business as the area where her business is located is well traveled and attracts large crowds. It is a little difficult for her to not have a good place for her to serve her customers. This is her second loan from Kiva partner MFP (Microfinanzas PRISMA). With this loan she will expand her business and will make the environment more comfortable for her customers so they will feel welcome.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Expand and make restaurant more comfortable for customers

description:
Solange D. was born March 24, 1973 in Dogbo, a village in Mono County. She married Joseph Houssa, a retired member of the military. She has three children in school and she sells fish and eggs that she buys in neighboring Nigeria. She is requesting a loan so she can build her business by increasing her inventory.

Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.
loan_use: To purchase of 10 bags of fish and 20 crates of eggs

description:
Isabel es socia del Banco Comunal “Chojchoni”  hace 5 años, vive en el Sector Huaychani del distrito de Copani, Provincia de Yunguyo-Puno. Tiene 23 años, es soltera y se dedica a la crianza de ganado. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compro ganado porcino y ovino de Bolivia, negocio al cual sigue dedicándose día a día.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles el que pagara en 4 cuotas comprara
01 ganado vacuno a S/. 1.200

Su deseo es realizar negocio de ropa y vender en la Ciudad de Arequipa.
description_translated:
Isabel has been a member of the Communal Bank “Chojchoni” for 5 years. She lives in the Huaychani sector of Copani district, Yunguyo province, Puno, Peru. She is 23 years old, single, and raises livestock. With the first loan for S/. 300.00 nuevos soles she bought pigs and sheep from Bolivia, a business she dedicates herself to day after day. With this loan for S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy 1 head of cattle at S/.1.200. Her wish is to have a business selling clothing in Arequipa city.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Buy one head of cattle

description: \n Раджабова Норбиби проживает в районе Гиссар . Живет со своей семьей. У нег трое детей. Возраст 34 года. Образование среднее. Арендует столовую в центре района. Бизнес успешный , но помещение требует ремонта. Поэтому она обратилась к нам за кредитом . Полученные деньги она сможет использовать для покупки стройматериала.  Улучшив условия в кафе, таким образом она привлечет новых клиентов , что даст возможность больше заработать. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
description_translated:
Nurbibi R. lives in the Gissar district with her family. She has three children, and is 34 years old. She completed secondary school. She rents a cafeteria in the district's center. Business is good, but the facility needs repairs. To that end she came to us for a loan. The loan will be used to purchase construction materials. One she has improved the cafe's condition she will be able to attract new customers, and earn more income. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Facility repairs

loan_name: Mrs. Phan Chheun Village Bank Group
description: This village bank, which consists of eighteen members, is located in Kruos village in Takeo Province.  The members plan to use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Phan C. is the village bank president, selected by the members. She is a 33-year-old mother of four children who attend the local school.  Mrs. Phan C. is a mat weaver. Her husband, Mr. Chhorn Thoeun, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice to earn a living. He faces a small problem because his field is insufficiently fertile to support his crop. Thus, they decided to request a loan to buy fertilizer. \r\n\r\nThis is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. These loans do not require any principal repayment until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. The loans allow borrowers to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has an overall delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.
loan_use: To buy fertilizer.
borrower_names: Chin, Van, Sokhorn, Sok Ly, Von, Phann, Sambour, Nat, Touch, Ret, Sal, Ban, Sokhem, Cheng, Yom, Pring, Phan, Khoeun
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, male, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
D. Davlatkhuja is 37 years old and is married with two children. Davlatkhuja is a market vendor. He has been selling fruits for the past three years. 

During these years, Davlatkhuja has acquired the knowledge and skills required for the business. For instance, he knows how to store the fruits to maintain their marketable conditions and to not lose the taste and their useful properties. He sells fruits such as: apples, pears and pomegranates in the central, local market. 

Davlatkhuja begins his workday early morning - at 5:00 a.m. Buying vegetables and fruits from the local farmers, he sells them at the market. In the market, he is well-known because of his attractive prices and friendly customer service feature. All this allows Davlatkhuja’s business to generate a stable and considerable income stream for his family. 

Due to the current season, Davlatkhuja’s goods are in high demand. For this reason, he is planning to purchase new, fresh fruits to sell. Today, he is requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni ($ 600 US Dollars) that will allow him to expand his business. With your help, this will be possible. He promises to repay the loan within 9 months and thanks everyone for supporting him. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
loan_use: To purchase additional fruits to sell during the high-demand season

description:
Gladys is is a member of the Torcaza (“Wood Pigeon”) Village Bank. Gladys is 23 years old and single. She is currently studying to be a high school teacher. Gladys and her fiancé have a small stand on a very busy street in Ayacucho where they sell cell phones, prepaid phone cards, and accessories, and offer technical assistance.  Gladys needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy cell phones. Her dreams are to finish college, to be a good teacher, and to help her family. 
 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow 
 
Gladys es socia del Banco Comunal Torcaza.
Gladys es soltera, tiene 23 años y estudia educación secundaria en la universidad, Gladys junto a su novio tiene un pequeño puesto en una calle muy concurrida de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde vende celulares, recargas, accesorios y también servicio técnico.
Gladys necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de celulares.
Los sueños de Gladys son culminar sus estudios, ser una buena profesional y ayudar a su familia.
loan_use: Buy cell phones

description: Née en 1953 à Tabligbo, une ville située au nord-est du Togo, Madame S. Assoupi est veuve et mère de deux (2) enfants. Elle exerce le commerce des céréales et des poissons fumés dans son quartier, au nord de Lomé. Avec trois ans d’expérience dans ce commerce, elle a déjà reçu un crédit au près de WAGES et elle a bien remboursé.  \nElle sollicite ce deuxième crédit pour acheter 6 sacs de mais et 2 paniers de poissons fumés afin de reconstituer son stock et de pouvoir bien vendre.\n
description_translated:
Born in 1953 in Tabligbo, a city located in the northeast of Togo, Ms. Assoupi S. is a widow and the mother of two children. She does commerce in grain and smoked fish in her district north of Lomé. With three years of experience in this business, she has already received a loan from WAGES, and she repaid it. She is requesting this second loan to buy 6 sacks of corn and two baskets of smoked fish to replenish her stock and to be able to do well in her sales.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy grains and smoked fish

description:
Marcelina is a member of the Gratitud Village Bank. She is 36 years old and is a single mother to three children. Marcelina has a store in a rented space near the Abastos Market in the city of Ayacucho, where she sells dry goods, grains and drinks. Marcelina also sells prepared meals in the same location, for which she has an assistant.

Marcelina needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy sugar, rice and oil. Marcelina’s dreams are to provide her children with a good education, to save money to expand her business, and to give her customers good service. 
 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow 
 
Marcelina es socia del Banco Comunal Gratitud.  

Marcelina es madre soltera, tiene 36 años y 3 hijos, Marcelina tiene una tienda en un local alquilado que se ubica cerca al mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde vende abarrotes, cereales, gaseosas. Además Marcelina vende comida en el mismo local, para lo cual cuenta con una ayudante.  

Marcelina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz, aceite.  

Los sueños de Marcelina son brindar una buena educación a sus hijos, ahorrar para ampliar su negocio y dar servicio de calidad a sus clientes.
loan_use: Buy sugar, rice and oil

description:
Adjoa A. is married and cares for five family members. She attended school through senior high.

Adjoa sells used clothing at the Elmina New Market, which she has done since 2002. Her husband is a trader.

Adjoa uses her income to assist her husband in meeting the family's financial needs.

She will use this loan to increase her stock of goods for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business she plans to reinvest in her business and expand her capital base.
loan_use: Adjoa will use the loan to increase her stock of goods for sale.

description:
Née le 28 janvier 1970 à Lomé, madame W. Martine est une fille célibataire avec deux (2) enfants. Elle est revendeuse de boisson locale qu’elle-même prépare avec du sorgho, de l’eau et avec du bois de chauffe. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 1993 et a beaucoup de clients qui sont généralement des cultivateurs et des menuisiers.
Toutefois cette boisson est appréciée par la plupart des gens surtout en période de fête. 
Elle sollicite  ce premier crédit pour acheter deux (2) sacs de sorgho et 5 fagots de bois de chauffe.
description_translated:
Born on January 28, 1970 in Lomé, Mrs. Martine W. is a single mother of two. She sells a local drink that she makes herself from sorghum and water with the aid of firewood. She has been doing this since 1993 and has a lot of customers, mainly farmers and carpenters.Nevertheless, most people enjoy this drink, especially during festive periods. She is requesting a first-time loan to buy two bags of sorghum and five bundles of firewood.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy cereal and firewood

description:
Isaac G. is a 45-year-old sign writer and taxi driver. Isaac is married with three kids; two are still in school. 

For the past 25 years, Isaac has been in the business of screen printing – banners, handkerchiefs, t-shirts, etc., and also writing signboards for the people in his community. According to him, he is the pioneer in his community as far as sign writing is concerned and has trained a number of artists in his town and nearby towns. 

Isaac says he has to travel to the city where he will have access to the developing machine (a device used to copy or transfer paper designs onto the screen) and also buy the materials he will need (mesh, white wood glue, print paste, potassium dichromate, etc). Isaac desires to acquire his own developing machine, which will save him the trouble of traveling to have his screens developed. He says he can also develop for other screen printers for a fee. 

He wants a loan to buy this device and also some of the materials he works with. Isaac belongs to the group called “Victory Trust Group” which is made up of only five members. The group members guarantee one another as collateral to access the loan.
loan_use: To expand his printing business.

description:
Eugenia A. is 26 years old. She is married with two children who are both in school. 

Eugenia runs a provision shop in her community. She has been in this business for two years. She says she buys her goods from cities where the prices are quite affordable. 

Eugenia wants to expand her shop to meet the increasing demand of her customers.  She wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. Eugenia belongs to a group called “Peace” in her community. The group members guarantee one another as collateral to access the loan.
loan_use: To buy provisions in bulk such as boxes of assorted biscuits, vegetable oil, etc.

description: Madame T. Diane est née le 27 octobre 1974 à Sokodé, l’une des villes du Togo. Elle est célibataire et elle n’a pas d’enfants. Elle a pour activité la vente des chaussures, des habits et des pagnes.  Elle achète ses produits dans le grand marché de Lomé, et les revend dans le quartier d’Agoè au nord de la ville pour servir ses clients locaux.
