Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn cho công việc kinh doanh hàng khô.
description_translated:
Ms. P. Thi Bich is 55 years old, and joned TYM fund in 2003. Currently she has a grocery store at the market in the town of Phuc Yen. Every month, in addition to her store, she also makes extra money by renting out rooms to her employees. With average income of 360 USD per month, the loan program is very effective for her. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 600 USD to invest in her grocery store

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Business

description: Née vers 1975 à Abomey dont elle est originaire .Dame A. Alice fréquenta jusqu'en classe de CE2 avant d'abandonner pour apprendre la couture pendant 3 ans. Finalement elle préfèra le commerce dans lequel elle s'est lancée voiçi 15 ans déjà.Elle vendit au premier abord des épices ,puis elle commença à vendre divers articles qu'elle achète chez les Chinois:Assièttes,pagnes,ustensiles de cuisine,chaussure et autres pacotilles.Pour la vente de ces divers articles elle est ambulante.C'est pour le renforcement de cette activité à la fin des fêtes de fin d'année,qu'elle sollicite ce 3ème crédit pour s'approvisionner uniquement en chaussure.Mariée,elle a deux enfants:Abraham et Cathérine.\n
description_translated:
Born around 1975 in Abomey, the town she is from, Ms. Alice A. attended school through the 3rd grade before dropping out to learn how to sew, which she did for three years. In the end, she preferred commerce, in which she got started fifteen years ago already. At first, she sold spices and then started selling various items from China: plates, pagnes (colorful African-style cloth), kitchen utensils, shoes, and other cheap items. These are sold door-to-door. To boost this business for the year-end holiday season, she is requesting this third loan to get supplies of shoes only. Ms. A. is married and has two children: Abraham and Cathérine. \r\n

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Three boxes of shoes

description: Clement E. is a photographer and he also prints. He is 38 years old and married with a child. He needs the loan amount of N50, 000 to purchase films, camera, and printing papers. He says thank you to all who made this loan possible.
loan_use: To purchase more films, camera and printing paper

description:
Esta  microempresaria Cristian Carolina R. S.  tiene la edad de 30 años, su estado civil es casada tiene 2 hijos de los cuales su hijo mayor tiene la edad de 6 años y cursa recientemente el 1 grado de primaria  y su otro hijo de 14 meses no estudia, su esposo labora como controlador del tiempo de las rutas, sus propósitos son de mantener su negocio de forma activa y así superarse para mantener a sus hijos ya que necesita sacarlos adelante para que estos en un futuro no pasen necesidades sus deseos son de obtener un lugar mas adecuado para que sus clientes puedan apreciar mejor sus productos.

Su actividad económica es la venta de artesanía y bisutería que esta  ubicado en el parque central de león, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 10 años, la forma en como inicia este negocio es por su mama ya que su Mama era la que tenia el control de su negocio y mas tarde decide independizarse obtener su propio negocio Ella inicia con la inversión de 300 $ dólares netos que fueron destinados para la compra de de 1 docena de camisetas, 3 sillas playeras y algunos jarros donde aparecía Nicaragua y al paso del tiempo decide incrementar mas su productos y es así como obtiene este medio de trabajo, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita realizar la compra de llaveros, vestidos típicos, sillas playeras, hamacas, bolsos ya que todo este tipo de producto lo encuentra en Masaya de una forma mas factible.
description_translated:
This micro-entrepreneur, Cristian Carolina R. S., is 30 years old. She is married and has two children. Her oldest son is six years old and has recently started the first grade. Her other son is 14 months old and doesn't study. Her husband works controlling the time for drivers' routes. Her desires are to actively maintain her business and thereby improve her situation in order to take care of her children because she needs them to get ahead so that in the future they can manage their own needs. She wants to have a more suitable place so that her clients can better appreciate her products. Her business is selling handicrafts and imitation jewelry and she's located in the central park of León. She has had the business for 10 years. The way in which started is because of her mother because her mother was the one that had control of the business. Later she decided to become independent and create her own business so she started with an initial investment of US$300 that she used to buy one dozen T-shirts, three beach chairs and some jars that had "Nicaragua" on them. As time passed, she decided to increase the number of products. The financial assistance is for working capital that is needed to purchase key chains, typical dresses, beach chairs, hammocks and bags. These types of products are less expensive in Masaya.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Working capital to purchase inventory

description: Juana is a member of the Sumaq Huayta Village Bank; “Sumaq Huayta” means “Beautiful Flower” in Quechua. Juana is 30 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their three children. She and her husband have a locksmith shop in their home; they have one employee who helps them with their work. Juana also makes homemade ice cream, which she sells from a cart on the streets around the city of Ayacucho. Juana needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy iron rods and ingredients to make ice cream. Juana dreams of improving and outfitting her business and that her children will grow up to be working professionals. Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Sumaq Huayta que significa Linda Flor. Juana es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 3 hijos, Juana junto a su esposo tienen un taller de cerrajería que esta ubicado en su domicilio, además tiene un personal que le ayuda en los trabajos. Además Juana vende helados que ella misma prepara, sus ventas los realiza ambulatoriamente por diferentes calles de la ciudad. Juana necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de fierros y insumos para helados. Juana sueña con mejorar e incrementar su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
loan_use: Buy iron rods and ingredients to make ice cream

description:
La actividad económica a la que se dedica la señora Irene Candia es a la costurería la cual atiende en su casa de habitación en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur y se ha destacado por elaborar excelentes trajes de vestir para niños, damas, caballeros de todo tipo y de diferentes tamaños.

Desde que comenzó con su negocio ha logrado mejorarlo y para esto lo ha hecho por medio de los créditos que solo Ceprodel brinda. Es importante destacar que gracias a este apoyo brindado ha logrado comprar su máquina, y materiales de trabajo. Hoy en día la razón por la cual solicita el crédito es para la compra de materiales de trabajo como tela, hilo y agujas para continuar en su actividad.
description_translated:
Irene Candia's business activity is sewing, which she performs in her house in the neighborhood of San Rafael del Sur, and has stood out by making excellent suits for children, women and men of all types and sizes. Since starting her business she has managed to improve it through loans that only Ceprodel provides. It's important to note that thanks to this support she has managed to purchase her sewing machine and work materials. Today the reason for her loan request is for the purchase of work materials, such as fabric, thread and needles to continue her work.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase of work materials

description:
“Time is gold but the only difference is in us. While there is still time, use it to the fullest” This is the inspirational thought conveyed by Ma Daisy as she told her story. At the age of 40 Ma Daisy has three children: Airish – 17 years old, college freshmen, Kim Lawrence – 14 years old, junior high school student, and Aimee Dae – 11 years old graduating in elementary. They reside in Brgy San Mateo, Quirino, Isabela near the municipal hall. Farming is the major source of income for most of the residents.

Ma Daisy is a food/snack vendor in her village, selling pork barbecue, cleaned chicken intestines, hotdogs and other kinds of street foods that are in demand. She prepares her roasting materials and ingredients every afternoon just in front of her house and her regular customers will come by for their snacks in the afternoon. She hopes to improve the business and add a greater variety of snacks to sell so that she will able to increase her income and better provide for the needs of her children in school. She is therefore requesting a loan for business capital. Ma Daisy is doing all these things to feed her children and accrue savings for their education in the coming years.
loan_use: To add a variety of snack foods to sell.

description:
Joel J., who is 24 and single, still lives with his parents, but he is preparing for his future family by striving hard to have a better life. In their village, he operates his family's passenger tricycle. The tricycle carries a minimum of five passengers. He transports passengers from their village to the town proper and other nearby municipalities like Roxasand Ilagan, Isabela. Joel uses the daily income from operating the tricycle to purchase feed for his pigs.

He requests a loan of $100 (4000 PHP) for maintenance of his tricycle and to buy stocks of feed for his pig-raising business. “The amount will be helpful in my business,” said Joel.
loan_use: Maintenance of his tricycle and to buy more feed for the pigs

description: Cette dame de trente huit (38) ans d’âge  à Adidogomé est une revendeuse de produits de beauté dans le quartier d’Adidogomé un quartier de Lomé non loin de l’ONG « IJD ». Elle exerce ce commerce depuis 2003. Elle na jamais obtenu de crédit de chez WAGES, la demande ayant augmentée, elle sollicite ce crédit pour s’approvisionner en mèches, chaussures et sacs de dames.\nElle est mariée avec Monsieur ANANI Prosper et ont ensemble trois (03) enfants. Avec les revenus tirés de ce commerce, elle compte aider sa famille dans les charges quotidiennes du foyer. \n
description_translated:
This 38 year old woman sales beauty products in the neighborhood of Adidogomé in Lomé, not far from the NGO "IJD". She practices this business since 2003. She has never received a loan from WAGES, but the demand has increased so she is requesting a loan to buy extensions, shoes and women's purses.

She is married to Mr. Prosper ANANI and together they have three children. With the income from this business she will help with the family's daily expenses.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase of extensions, shoes, and women's purses.

description:
Madame DAHOUE Amivi est âgée de 30 ans, et elle vend des tissus et des articles de mercerie dans son magasin qui s’appelle « MERCERIE DE HOLANDAISE ».  L’entreprise est située à Lomé, la capitale du Togo ou Madame DAHOUE est née.  Elle a commencé ce commerce depuis 2005, et elle n’a jamais bénéficié d’un crédit au près de WAGES.  Avec ce premier crédit, elle peut reconstituer son stock afin de mieux servir ses clients pendant les fêtes de la fin d’année. 
Madame DAHOUE est mariée avec un opérateur économique, et ils ont 6 personnes à charge.
description_translated:
Ms. Amivi DAHOUE is 30 years old and sells cloth and sewing supplies in her store called "MERCERIE DE HOLANDAISE". This enterprise is located in Lomé, the capital of Togo where she was born. She started this business in 2005 and has never been the recipient of a WAGES loan. With this initial loan, she can replenish her stock to serve her customers better during this year-end holiday season. Ms. DAHOUE is married to an economic controller, and they have six people in their care.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy sewing supplies and fabrics

description:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is forty-one year old Justina S. from Mwanza. She is widowed with four children, between the ages of sixteen and twenty two. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependants because they are orphans.

Justina has been running a tailoring business since 2002. This client’s business is in selling vitambaa (material), vitenge (a traditional Tanzanian cloth with wax print), and kanga (printed cotton fabric often with a border along all four sides) and makes them into clothing, mainly for women. She works at the business for eight hours per day, six days per week, and is assisted by two employees. She currently earns about 100 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 425 USD in order to buy more materials for making clothes to sell. In the future, she plans to buy two more tailoring machines. Justina thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.
loan_use: To buy more materials for making clothes to sell.

description:
Muninu B. is a trader. He operates a milling machine used by gari producers to get their cassava milled. He also produces gari for sale at Abrobeano near Elmina. His wife is also a trader and they have seven dependents. He has received no formal education.

Muninu intends to use this loan to buy more cassava so he can increase the amount of gari he makes. He will use the profits from this to pay his children’s school fees, to pay off bills and to feed his family.

The photo shows Muninu standing by one of his milling machines.
loan_use: To buy more cassava and increase his gari production.

description:
Victoria is a single Mom and is the sole support of her daughter. Her daughter’s father is an alcoholic and unable to help out. Victoria has to work hard to be able to provide for her daughter and pay all her bills. She runs a small vending business selling clothing items and linen sheets in the local markets in Levanevskyi district, Belaya Tserkov. She has just moved her vending location to a new market where she has purchased a container for her merchandise.

Victoria is requesting a loan of  5000 Grivnas (about $875) to increase her stock which will improve her sales. She has been running this trade for a year and a half. Victoria's first loan helped her double her inventory and complete renovation in her apartment, a costly project for a single mother. Lending assistance has also helped Victoria hire an employee and run her venture more smoothly and effectively while enabling another person to have a job.
loan_use: To purchase additional merchandise

description: Edalia tiene 36 años, vive con su esposo y sus  6 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de comida al paso en una esquina cercana a su casa, su platillo se llama anticuchos (son como brochetas de corazón de res y papa), vende todas las tardes, incluyendo los domingos, y sus vecinos que ya conocen de su buena sazón acuden a ella diariamente para consumir este rico platillo. Su principal herramienta de trabajo es su parrilla, es fácil de transportar y así sale todas las tardes con los ingredientes preparados para tal fin. A Edalia, esta actividad le permite obtener ganancias en poco tiempo y no desatender a sus pequeños. Es su segundo préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado puntualidad en sus pagos. Esta vez Edalia solicita esta cantidad para invertir en la compra de los ingredientes para los anticuchos, además iniciará otro negocio, transporte de pasajeros, para lo cual adquirirá un motocarro.
description_translated:
Edalia, 36, lives with her husband and their 6 children. She sells fast food on a corner near her house, the dish she sells is called "anticuchos", which are like a kebab of beef heart and potatoes. She sells every afternoon, including Sundays, and her neighbors who already know her excellent flavorings come to her every day to eat this rich snack. Her main working tool is her grill, which is easy to transport, so she goes out every afternoon with the prepared ingredients for this purpose. \r\n\r\nThis work enables Edalia to earn money in a short time without neglecting her little ones. This is her second loan through MFP, and she has repaid punctually. This time Edalia is requesting this loan to purchase the ingredients for the anticuchos, and in addition she will start another business, carrying passengers, for which she will acquire a motorcycle cart.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase of ingredients for her anticuchos, as well as invest in another business

description: Nancy tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo y su pequeño hijo. Trabaja cada día para en pro de la mejora de su panadería, ella elabora sus propios panes en un horno artesanal. Su trabajo diario consiste en levantarse muy temprano para la preparación y venta de sus panes. Es un proceso complejo que va desde calentar su horno con leña, tamizar la harina hacer la mezcla, batir manualmente, bolear, controlar el tiempo de cocción del pan y contabilizar la cantidad de producción. Para Nancy la época de mayor venta es cuando comienza el año escolar (marzo – abril). En el futuro quiere implementar su panadería con maquinarias modernas, como una batidora y mezcladora. El esfuerzo de Nancy es motivado por sus hijos. Es la tercera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, y demostró en el anterior ciclo ser una persona puntual con sus créditos. Esta vez invertirá en la compra de sacos de harina y leña para su horno, comprará en grandes cantidades, lo almacenará para que el alza de precios no afecte sus ganancias.
description_translated:
Nancy, 31, lives with her husband and young son. She works hard at her small bakery, making bread in a traditional oven. Her day starts early in the morning so that she has time to make her bread and sell it. It's a complex process, heating the wood oven, sifting flour for the mix, beating the dough, rolling it, controlling the cooking time, etc. Nancy's strongest sales are at the beginning of the school year (March, April). In the future, she wants to set up a bakery with modern equipment. Nancy's motivation to work hard is her children. This is the third time that she's applied to MFP for a loan and she's show herself to be punctual in repaying past loans. She will use the loan to buy sacks of flour and wood for her oven. She will buy large quanitities of supplies and stock them so that price increases don't affect her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Buy supplies for bakery business.

description: Rene tiene 36 años y vive con sus 2 hijos. Ella tiene una botica desde hace 6 años, abrió este negocio debido a que estudió la carrera técnica de farmacia y sus deseos de ejercer su profesión la motivaron a  tener esta fuente de ingreso. Cada día atiende a sus clientes, sobre todo en las mañanas, por las tardes atiende a sus hijos, para Rene, esta actividad es una  buena opción como fuente de ingresos, ahora tiene grandes expectativas de seguir con este negocio, y una de ellas es abrir una sucursal. Es la segunda vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, y en el primer ciclo fue puntual en sus pagos. Esta cantidad será invertida en la compra de mercadería, es decir los medicamentos que usualmente comercializa en su botica
description_translated:
Rene is 36 years old and lives with her 2 children. For the past 6 years she has run a drugstore, which she opened because of her technical career in pharmacy studies, and her professional desire motivated her to create this source of income. She serves clients daily - especially in the mornings - and in the afternoons she looks after her children. This work is a good source of income for Rene, and she eagerly expects to continue with her drugstore, hoping to eventually open a branch. This is the second time Rene is asking for a loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA, and she was punctual with her first loan's payments. This amount will be invested in the purchase of merchandise, such as drugs that she usually sells at her store.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To purchase medicine for her drugstore

description: Agnes A. is a 35-year-old local restaurant operator. She is married and has three kids; two of them attend school. She prepares and sells local foods like banku, which is prepared from milled maize grains and is eaten with hot pepper or soup. She says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly, and she needs the support of a loan to enable her to pay her costs. With the loan, she plans to purchase more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood to prepare meals. He would be grateful for this assistance.
loan_use: To buy raw materials for making food for his restaurant

description: Xenia tiene 34 años, vive con sus padres. Ella es docente de profesión, y esto no fue dificultad para que inicie un negocio propio de venta de cosméticos por catálogo, sus productos los que ofrece principalmente a sus colegas de trabajo, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 2 años, cuando unas amistades le hicieron la propuesta sobre este negocio. En la actualidad, Xenia trabaja incansablemente para seguir adelante y acrecentar su capital de trabajo, ya que disfruta mucho de esta labor. Es la tercera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, y es una de las clientas más puntuales de su banco comunal. Xenia solicita esta cantidad que invertirá en la compra de más productos y cancelarlos al contado, lo que le permitirá a ella vender al crédito.
description_translated:
Xenia, 34, lives with her parents. She is a teacher by profession. She operates a business buying cosmetics from catalogs and reselling them to her customers, most of whom are work colleagues. She started the business 2 years ago after some friends suggested the idea to her. Xenia works tirelessly these days to get ahead and add to the value of her business because she enjoys the work very much. This is the third time that she's applied to MFP for a loan and she's one of her community bank's most punctual clients. Xenia will use the loan to buy more products and pay her account in cash, something that will allow her to sell on credit.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Buy cosmetic products for resale.

description: Cette dame de vingt cinq (25) ans est une femme travailleuse qui exerce dans le commerce de charbons, ce commerce marche bien au Togo, elle s’approvisionne dans le marché local d’Anié. Elle a déjà obtenu un crédit de 300000f de chez WAGES qu’elle a bien remboursé et sans difficultés. Elle sollicite un deuxième prêt pour s’approvisionner avec vingt (20)sacs de charbons.\nElle est divorcée de son époux  KOFFI Yao avec qui elle a eu un enfant, elle pourra à l’aide de ce crédit soutenir sa famille et son enfant\n
description_translated:
This 25-year-old woman is a hard-working woman who sells charcoal, a trade which is profitable in Togo. She purchases her stock from the local market in Anié. She has already taken out one loan of 300,000 XOF with WAGES which she repaid in full with no problems. She is requesting this second loan so she can purchase 20 sacks of charcoal. She is divorced from her husband Yao Koffi with whom she has one child. With this loan she will be able to support her family and her child.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase of charcoal

description: Madame Akouvi Yamani est âgée de trente huit ans, elle réside dans le quartier d’Agoè, elle exerce dans la restauration, elle a un  bar qu’elle  a nommée « BAR LES EPERVIERS ». Elle est très dynamique et tient son bar depuis 2006 dans le quartier d’agbalepedo un quartier au nord de Lomé (Togo). Elle a déjà obtenu un crédit de 300000f de chez WAGES qu’elle a bien remboursée et sollicite ce deuxième crédit pour acheter 15 sacs de riz, 08 cartons de couscous, 15 cartons de spaghetti et 12 cartons de poissons.\nElle est célibataire et a deux (02) enfants à charge, avec le profit tiré de ce commerce, elle pense bien subvenir aux charges de ses enfants.\n
description_translated:
Mrs. A. is 38 years old and lives in the Agoè region. She is involved in the restaurant trade and has a bar named “Bar Les Éperviers” (Sparrowhawk Bar). She is very dynamic and has operated her bar since 2006 in the Agbalepedo area in northern Lomé in Togo. She has already taken out a loan for 300,000 XOF with WAGES which she repaid in full. She is requesting this second loan so she can buy 15 sacks of rice, eight cartons of couscous, 15 cartons of spaghetti, and 12 cartons of fish. She is unmarried and has two children under her care. With the money she makes from her business, she hopes to be able to provide for her children.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase of supplies

description:
La señora Olga Lorena T. tiene la edad de 47 años, su estado civil es soltera, esta Señora tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 2 dependen de ella su hijo mayor de 27 años de edad y es labora de contador y su otro hijo de 20 años que cursa recientemente el 2 año de la carrera de administración de empresas, su propósitos son de aumentar su negocio además desea seguir ayudando a sus hijos y dejarle a ellos un futuro en el negocio  para que el día de mañana pueda mantenerse por si solos y en sus deseos esta darle a sus hijos su propia casa para que vivan tranquilos y tengan un lugar propio.

Su actividad económica es venta de comida el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 12 años, la ubicación de su negocio es en el mercado de subtiava, ella da inicio a este negocio por la necesidad de salir adelante y es entonces que implementa el negocio de venta de comida y comienza con huevos y gallo pinto mas tarde los diferentes clientes le pedían otro tipo de comidas y es así que decide implementar su negocio y obtiene un lugar donde ofrecer su venta, por lo que solicita financiamiento que será utilizado para capital de trabajo ya que necesita realizar la compra de los granos básicos para suministro de su trabajo ya que ella lucho mucho para conseguir un trabajo y este le ha proporcionado la ayuda necesaria para salir adelante agradece siempre trabajar con Fundación León 2000 y las organizaciones amigas.
description_translated:
Olga Lorena T. is 47 years old, single, and has four children, of which two depend on her. Her oldest son of 27 is an accountant. Her son of 20 years is in currently in his second year of venture administration. Olga’s intention is to increase her business. Furthermore, she wishes to continue helping her children and to leave them a future in the business so that in the future they will be able to maintain themselves. She also hopes to give her children their own house so that they may live peacefully and have their own place. Her economic activity is the sale of food. She has had her business for 12 years, and it is located in the market of Subtiava. She started her business because she needed to move forward. She began with the sale of eggs and gallo pinto (a national dish). Later on, different clients asked for different types of food and for this reason she decided to implement her own business and to obtain a place where she could offer her sale. It is for this reason that she is asking for this loan that will be used as capital to buy basic grains for her business’s supply since she struggles a great deal to secure a job. In this pursuit she has supplied herself with the necessary help to move forward, always grateful to work with the Fundación León 2000, and their friend-organizations.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy supplies.

description:
Mrs. May Annelieze D., is  42 years old, married, and blessed with 4 children. Her husband is an auditor in MHARS General hospital, Ozamiz City. As of now 2 of her children are studying in college as Nursing Student and the other 2 are elementary pupils. 
 
Even though her husband has a permanent job, she needs extra income because of economic crisis and 2 of her children are college students. That’s why she decided to engage in Ready-to-Wear (RTW) Clothes retailing. Since her capital to her business is not sufficient she decided to join Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative because she heard from her neighbor that the cooperative is offering livelihood programs and microfinancing services.

The PMPC became a great help to her business because she was able to put up additional capital to her RTW Business. She is a member in good standing in  Sampaguita Center, Dolores, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase additional RTW clothes for sale.

Mrs. D. plans to have an additional quality stocks of RTW clothes for her business and enable her college students finish their studies.
loan_use: Purchase additional ready to wear clothes

description:
Marilizabeth, or “Beth” as she is fondly called in their village, is 29 years old and still single. She lives with her parents and helps them earn their daily living. They live in Barangay San Mariano, Isabela which is located at the back of their town's public market. 

Beth manages a sari-sari store (a community-based store) in their village wherein she is able to generate a weekly income of PHP 2,000 which is used as a revolving capital in her business and to support the needs of their family while her parents are managing their small farm despite their old age.  

She wants a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy additional products in her store. Beth also intends to use some of her loan to assist her parents financially in their farming needs. She also dreams of developing her store into a mini grocery so she could meet the needs of their fellow villagers.  

“Whenever I feel exhausted due to financial problems, I always think of the word perseverance so that I will be inspired again to face the hardships in life,” Beth said.
loan_use: Buy more products to sell in her store and support her family's farming needs
town_name: Old San Mariano, San Mariano Isabela

description:
Sarah N. is a 40 years old businesswoman. She is married with six children, four of whom are working. This lady has been operating a bar and restaurant in Kyengera for over four years to date. She would use this loan to boost her business by purchasing more beers, wines, and spirits. Her greatest dream is to own rental houses in one of the Kampala suburbs, a dream she hopes to achieve by saving some of the profit from the business.

\r\n\r\n
loan_use: To purchase more beers, wines, and spirits to sell.

description: Jesús tiene 48 años, vive solo ya que migró de la ciudad de Arequipa, hace 3 años. Es un hombre muy trabajador que desde que llegó a la ciudad de Puno, no ha hecho más que trabajar y trabajar en busca de un mejor porvenir, es así que desde hace un año se viene dedicando a brindar servicio de taxi para solventar sus gastos. A Jesús le gusta su trabajo, ya que le no es rutinario y puede visitar diferentes lugares transportando a sus clientes. Para suerte de Jesús, es muy solicitado por los clientes que prefieren de su servicio, es por eso que quiere seguir brindándolo y mejorando, para lograr mayores ingresos. Jesús se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado refaccionará su carro para brindar un mejor servicio.
description_translated:
Jesús is 48 years old and lives alone as he migrated from the city of Arequipa 3 years ago. He has worked hard since his arrival in Puno, only having worked and worked in search of a better future. So one year ago he decided to provide taxi service to meet his expenses. Jesús enjoys the work, as it is always different and he can visit different places while transporting customers. Fortunately for Jesús, he is sought after as customers prefer his service, so therefore he wants to continue providing and improving his service to obtain greater profit. This is Jesús’ first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money he will repair his car to provide better service.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Repair his car

description: Khaty tiene 25 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Trabaja diariamente disponiendo de sus horarios para vender productos naturales, va en búsqueda de sus clientes caminado por las calles, así vende sus productos, y aunque para ella no fue nada fácil comenzar este trabajo, hoy mira con satisfacción los resultados, pues ahora sus clientes recomiendan a otros sus productos y de esta manera es una forma de captar nuevos clientes. Adicionalmente, Kathy tiene un puesto de venta de jugos que generalmente es atendido en las mañanas, este también es un espacio para ofrecer sus productos. Hace algunos días su puesto de jugo estuvo cerrado, porque Kahty estaba ocupando casi todo su tiempo en la venta de sus productos naturales, pero ya está dispuesta a volver a vender sus deliciosos jugos. Es la segunda vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado durante este tiempo ser responsable en sus pagos. El dinero será utilizado en la compra de los productos que vende, además de fruta para su puesto de jugos.
description_translated:
Kathy is 25 years old and lives with her husband and 2 sons. She works daily around her schedule to sell natural products. She goes in search of her clients by walking through the streets, and this is how she sells her products. Although it was not easy for her to start this business, today she can look with satisfaction on the results, since now her clients recommend her products to others and this is one way for her to get new clients. In addition, Kathy has a juice stand that she generally works from in the mornings. Her juice stand is also a place where she can sell her products. It was closed a few days ago because Kathy was busy almost the whole time selling her natural products, but now she is ready to sell her delicious juices again. This is the second time that she is requesting a loan with MFP, and during this time she has proven to be responsible with her payments. The money will be used to buy the products she sells and fruit for her juice stand.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To increase the number of products she sells

description: Lili tiene 34 años, vive con sus 6 hijos. Hace más de un año que se dedica a comprar diversos productos y venderlos en la ciudad de Lima, uno de los productos que vende es queso, que lo compra al por mayor y cada quincena viaja para venderlos en los mercados principales de la capital, de esa manera se genera los recursos económicos suficientes que le permiten sostener a sus 6 hijos, lo admirable es que ella sola es el único sostén para sus hijos, es por ello que los esfuerzos de esta madre son tan necesarios. Es la segunda vez que Lili solicita un préstamo con MFP, y está comprometida en ser puntual en sus pagos. Con este dinero adquirirá más mercadería para aprovechar estas fiestas navideñas, además de comprar quesos al por mayor, también comprará truchas.
description_translated:
Lili is 34 years old, she lives with her 6 children. For more than a year she has been buying different products to sell in the town of Lima. One of the products is cheese which she buys in bulk and every fortnight she travels to sell at the principal markets of the capital and this way obtain sufficient economic resources to support her 6 children. It is to be admired that she is their only means of support and therefore the efforts of this mother are very necessary. This is the second time Lili requests a loan with MFP and she is commited to be punctual with the payments. With the money she will purchase more merchandise to take advantage of the Cristmas season. Apart from buying cheese in bulk she will also purchase trouts.\r\n\r\n

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Increase stock to improve sales.

description: El señor Santos Isabel García tiene la edad de 51 años, habita en el barrio Panamá ubicado en municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa y hijos , la esposa de don Santos le ayuda con la casa ya que ella no trabaja ,los planes de don Santos es mejorar la producción y darle mejor condición de vida a su familia . La ayuda que el recibe es por parte de un hijo el cual trabaja como albañil. Este cliente desde hace treinta  años trabaja como agricultor y por falta de financiamiento y de recursos no ha podido ampliar su plantación. El necesita el apoyo para comprar fertilizantes para aplicarle a sus cultivos y poder vender una buena producción que le genere buenos ingresos.
description_translated:
Santos Isabel García is 51 years old and lives with his wife and children in the Panamá neighborhood of Ticuantepe. His wife takes care of their home since she is no longer employed. He has a son who is a construction worker and helps support the family.

Santos has worked for thirty years as a farmer, but due to lack of funding and other resources has not been able to increase his farm's production. His dream is to increase his harvest in order to give his family a higher standard of living. He will use this loan to buy fertilizer for his crops so that he can sell more and generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides for crops

description: Mrs. Chim L., 29, is a grocery seller who lives in Prongel Commune in Pursat Province. She sells items such as cooking ingredients, plastic goods, canned foods, soft drinks, beers, and cakes. She began her business in 2000, and receives a profit of approximately $4 per day. \r\n\r\nShe is married and cares for one young child who is attending school. Her husband, Phat Chay, is a 35-year-old rice farmer, who also raises pigs in their home to help meet the family's expenses. Mrs. L. hopes to expand her business, so she would like to request a loan to purchase a range of groceries items to store and resell.
loan_use: To purchase groceries items

description:
Florence is a leader of a group of 5 members. She is a 43 year old widow with three children aged between 13 and 23. Two of her children go to school, and Florence also takes care of her old father. She resides in and rents a one room house where she stays with four people. They have electricity but no piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day.

Florence works in a semi-rban area which is o the outskirts of Kampala. She doesn’t incur any transportation costs since she buys from trucks which get the products from the villages. Florence runs a stall in Kamwokya Market, where she sells to an average of 50 customers a day and works seven days a week. Florence sells to all categories of people both retail and wholesale. Florence has been in this business for over ten years. She has been with MCDT for ten years, and has worked with the same group mates all the time, and is now servicing her twentieth loan.

Florence wants to use this loan to expand her business. She hopes to buy food directly from the farmers in the villages.
loan_use: To buy more bunches of bananas

description:
Melanie B. is 40 years old, and married with six children. She is a rice farmer. Her husband is a carpenter, and they joyfully work together to provide all of their children’s needs and send all of them to school.

Melanie would like a loan of $125 to purchase sacks of certified seeds and fertilizers for her farm. She is certain that she needs to invest well in her farm to achieve a good yield.

She is thankful to have joined the CEVI credit program because she now has access to credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage, which the program offers to all of their clients.
loan_use: To purchase certified seed and fertilizers

description: Nanama A. is a single parent with 3 children. She has received schooling through junior high. Nanama sells soft drinks at Atonkwa near Elmina, which she has done since 1995. Nanama uses her income to take care of her children's financial needs. Nanama will use the loan to increase her capital to buy soft drinks in larger quantities  in addition to purchasing other goods for sale. With the additonal profits from her expanded business, Nanama plans to save for a house she would like to build for the family and also save for education expenses for her children.
loan_use: Nanama will use the loan to increase her capital to buy soft drinks in larger quantities.

description: Rufina tiene 47 años, es madre soltera de dos niños, Janet de 16 y Brolin de 13 años, con quienes vive. Preocupada por el bienestar de sus pequeños hijos incursionó en el negocio de la venta de pescado, negocio con el cual viene manteniendo a su familia durante 13 años. Rufina vende el pescado de manera ambulatoria, generalmente pejerreyes, ya que estos tienen más demanda por su escasez y se usan en múltiples platos como en el ceviche, frituras, etc., los cuales buscan bastante las cocineras de los restaurantes. Lo difícil es adquirir los pescados, tiene esperar largas horas para la distribución. Rufina se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de pescado para vender y aumentar sus ingresos.
description_translated:
Rufina is 47 years old, single and lives with her two children, Janet 16 and Brolin 13. Worried about the well being of her small children, she got into the fish selling business which has supported her family for 13 years. Rufina travels to sell the fish. She generally sells silversides since there is more demand due to its scarcity. It is used in many dishes such as ceviche, fried food, etc. and many restaurant cooks look for it. It is difficult to get the fish. She has to wait long hours for delivery. This is Rufina's first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money she has requested, she will buy larger amounts of fish to sell and increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase larger amounts of fish

description: Stella A. is a single parent and has 4 dependents. She has received no formal education. Stella prepares porridge, which is known as Koko, and a special kind of doughnut which is also known as Koose. She uses corn and millet for the preparation of the Koko and she uses beans and flour to prepare the Koose. She normally sells in the morning as breakfast to her customers at Ataabadze near Elmina, which she has done since 1990. Stella uses her income to pay for utility bills and the children's school fees. Stella will use the loan to increase production and sales by buying more corn, millet, beans and other ingredients which are needed for the food production. With the new profits from her expanded business, Stella plans to invest in her grandchildren's education.
loan_use: To purchase more corn, millet, beans and other ingredients which are needed for the food production.

description: Agnes M. is married to a blacksmith and has 5 dependents. She has received schooling through junior high school. Since 1994, Agnes has been selling a local meal popularly known as 'Kenkey' which is made out of corn. It is one of the most commonly eaten foods in the country and it is normally eaten with hot sauce and fried fish at Ataabadze near Elmina. Agnes uses her income to assist her husband in meeting the family's financial needs. Agnes will use the loan to increase her purchase of maize, fresh fish and other ingredients which she uses to prepare the Kenkey. With the new profits from her expanded business, Agnes plans to invest in her children's education.
loan_use: To increase her purchase of maize, fresh fish and other ingredients which are used to prepare the Kenkey.

description:
This loan composed of four borrowers. All of borrowers live in Toul Ta Ek Commune in Battambang Province. 

Mrs. Thap Y. is 41 years old. She owns and runs a small workshop in her home in which her employees provide  service, making chairs, tables, and cupboards for sale. She has run the business since 1979 and currently earns a profit of approximately $6 a day. She is married to Ty Lihak, age 63, a construction supervisor who earns about $3 per day. The couple have five children: three are married, one is single, and one daughter also helps in her mother's business. Y. is applying a loan to purchase carpentry materials for her business activities. 

Y. is the leader of three members;
Kruy G., 55, sells used-clothes at the market and is requesting a loan to buy more second-hand clothes to sell.
Keo K. E. is 51 years old and sells groceries. She needs a loan to purchase groceries for sale. Hach P., 56, makes a living selling Khmer Noodles and roasting bananas. P. requested a loan to enlarge her business.
loan_use: To purchase carpentry materials

description: Cette jeune dame de quarante (40) ans vit dans le quartier d’Agoè Légbassito, un quartier de Lomé. Elle est une revendeuse de boissons locales, elle exerce ce commerce depuis 1985, et ce dans son quartier, ce commerce marche bien pour cette dame  parce qu’elle a beaucoup de clients. Elle a déjà obtenu de chez WAGES un crédit de 150000f qu’elle a remboursé sans difficultés. Elle sollicite un deuxième crédit pour acheter quinze (15) bidons de boissons locales.\nMadame H. marie est mariée avec un monsieur  qui est actuellement à la retraite. Elle a trois(03) enfants à charge.\n
description_translated:
This young woman of 40 lives in the Agoè Légbassito neighbourhood of Lomé. She resells local drinks; she has been doing this in this same neighbourhood since 1985. Business is good because she has a lot of clients. She has previously borrowed from WAGES a loan of 150000f which she repaid without difficulty. She is asking for this second loan in order to buy 15 vats of local drinks.\r\n\r\nMarie H.'s husband is retired. She is supporting 3 children.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy local drinks

description: Cette  dame de  trente huit ans vit dans le quartier d’adidogomé à Lomé la capitale du Togo, elle est une revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale. Elle exerce ce son commerce depuis 2004 et elle n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de WAGES et sollicite ce premier crédit  pour augmenter son stock de produits d’alimentation générale.\nElle est mariée à un monsieur qui est un chef coutumier et ils ont ensemble  un enfant à charge .\n
description_translated:
Tchamélé E. is a 38-year-old woman living in the neighborhood of Adidogomé in Lomé, the capital of Togo. She sells groceries and has been running her business since 2004. This is her first loan request with WAGES, which she would like to use to increase her supply of general food products. She is married to a village chief and they have one child in their care.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To purchase general food products

description:
Emerenciana is a member of the Bienestar (“Well-being”) Village Bank. She is 48 years old and married with three children.

Emerenciana owns two cars and a truck. She rents the two cars to drivers to use for inter-provincial passenger transport, and pays each driver 30 soles per trip (drivers typically make two trips per day). Her husband works for a local gas company, driving his truck to Lima and back to transport workers, equipment and machinery. He earns a fixed salary. Emerenciana and her husband have been working in transportation for ten years now.

Emerenciana is requesting a loan of 3600 soles to pay for replacement parts and new tires for her cars. Her goal for the future is to buy more cars and start her own transport company.
loan_use: Buy replacement parts and tires for cars

description: La Sra. Maria Elena, casa, de 37 años de edad, con un hijo de 13 años estudiando la secundaria, su esposo trabaja y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.  Maria Elena es una persona responsable, buena madre y desea darle un hogar digno y propio a su hijo, ya que ella en estos momentos alquila y quiere salir de esa situacion pues en el cuarto que habita no puede realizar ninguna mejora porque no es de ella, con los creditos anteriores compro un terreno y parte de los materiales de construccion, con este 3er credito quiere levantar paredes y poner techo; plantea que en un futuro cuando haya cancelado este credito continuara con otros hasta lograr la construccion completa de su propia vivienda que han sido los sueños de toda su vida para que su hijo tenga estabilidad y no estar de un lugar a otro, porque los dueños de las casas donde habita actualmente le pueden pedir en cualquier momento desaloje el cuarto.
description_translated:
\r\n\r\nMaria Elena is 37 years old, she is married and has a 13 year old son who is in high school. Her husband works and helps her with the household expenses. Maria Elena is a responsible person, she is a good mother and wants to giver her son a worthy and proper home. She currently rents and wants to get out of this situation since she cannot make improvements to the room that she lives in as it does not belong to her. With the previous loans that she received she bought a plot of land and a portion of the construction materials. With this third loan she wants to erect walls and build a roof. She plans that in the future, when she has paid this loan, she will continue with others until the construction of her own home is complete. It has been her life long dream that her son have stability and not move from place to place because the owners of the homes where she currently lives can ask her to leave at any time.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Erect walls and build a roof for her home currently under construction.

description:
Ilda David S. é natural do bairro da Machava no distrito municipal da Matola um dos distritos da província do Maputo, tem 53 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de 5 filhos, apenas sustenta os seus filhos.

Ilda estudou até 4ªclasse e não continuou por ter tido problemas sociais quais não quis revelar ao nosso repórter. Teve a sua infância junto dos pais com 7 irmãos. Tem sua casa própria.

Ilda dedica se ao negócio de vende de produtos de mercearia é dona e tem um estabelecimento que abre as 6:00h e fecha as 22:00h  tem a destacar das mercadorias que tem mais saída é o peixe carapau que compra uma caixa por 1050,00mr e vende por 1350,00mt. Com isso tem lucros mensais de 8000,00mt e poupa algum. 

Para Ilda este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no kiva, pretende aumentar o seu estoque. Ilda tem planos futuros a aquisição de um estabelecimento para venda de carne de vaca.
description_translated:
Ilda David S. comes from Machava (a city that belongs to the district of Matola located in the Maputo province). She spent her childhood with her parents and 7 other siblings. Currently, this 53-year-old widow does not support anybody else besides her 5 children -- she owns the house where they live. She attended school up until the 4th grade, but social motives she did not want to share with our reporter cut her education short. Ilda owns a grocery goods retail establishment that opens from 6:00am until 10:00pm. She states that one of her best selling products is the carapau fish that can be bought for 1050,00mt per box and sold for 1350,00mt, enabling her to produce 8000,00mt in monthly revenues and to save a part of that. This will be Ilda's first loan through Hluvuku and Kiva and she wants to increase her stock merchandise. In the future she wants to purchase a commercial establishment that will be used to sell beef cattle. \r\n

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase and sale of assorted products

description:
Dalal, a 28-year-old woman living in Bourj el Barajneh, Lebanon with her husband and their child, has owned a grocery store selling food and candy for almost a year, having begun it with the support and encouragement of her brother. Her clients are friends and neighbors.

Dalal is requesting a loan of $1000 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase more merchandise and food products for her shop. Although this is the first time she has asked for a loan, in the future she plans to expand her business.
loan_use: To purchase merchandise and food products.

description:
La señora Corina es socia del Banco Comunal "Mujeres Unidas al Triunfo" del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 74 años de edad, es casada y se encarga de apoyar a sus nietos que están en edad escolar.

Con el primer préstamo que recibió aumentó su capital y mejoró su local para atender mejor a sus clientes. Tiene casi 4 años trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que su esposo es una persona discapacitada y que ella se encarga de él con mucha dedicación.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, pintará su restaurante, comprará mesas e insumos para mejorar sus ventas durante las fiestas de navidad.

Corina desea continuar trabajando para apoyar a su esposo y a sus nietos.
description_translated:
Ms. Corina is a member of the Village Bank "Women United to Triumph" in the district, province and department of Puno. She is 74 years old, married and in charge of her school-aged grandchildren. With the first loan she received, Corina increased the amount of capital in her business and improved the condition of her restaurant in order to better serve her clients. Corina has been working with the village bank for four years and tells us that her husband is handicapped and that she cares for him with great dedication. With this loan of 3000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles, to be repaid in four installments, she will paint the restaurant, buy tables and other goods to improve her sales during the holiday season. Corina wishes to continue working to support her husband and grandchildren.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy tables and products for the restaurant

description:
La señora Luz es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Unidas al Triunfo” del distrito, provincia  y el departamento de Puno. Tiene 61 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 3 hijos de los cuales 2 están aún bajo su responsabilidad. 
Con su primer préstamo que recibió de S/.300 compró papa para venderla. Nos cuenta que primero se dedicó a la venta de papa y posteriormente cambió de rubro para dedicarse a la venta de prendas de vestir. Tiene 6 años trabajando con el banco comunal.
Con este préstamo de S/.700, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará más prendas de vestir para vender en las fiestas de navidad.
Luz desea seguir trabajando para aumentar sus ganancias y continuar apoyando a sus hijos.
description_translated:
Luz is a member of the “Mujeres Unidas al Triunfo” Communal Bank located in the district, province and state of Puno. She is 61 years old, married, and mother of 3 children, 2 of whom are still under her responsibility. With the first loan for S/.300 she bought potatoes to sell. She tells that that at first she sold potatoes, but then changed profession to selling clothing. She has been working with the communal bank for 6 years. With this loan for S/.700, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy more clothing to sell in the Christmas holidays. Luz wishes to continue working to increase her earning and continue supporting her children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Buy clothing.

description:
Esperanza is a member of the Retoño (“Sprout”) Village Bank.  Esperanza is 39 years old and is the single mother of one child.  

Esperanza lives in a rental property in the Los Artesanos neighborhood.  She travels to different regional markets to buy grains and cheeses, which she then sells in bulk to market vendors in Ayacucho.  Sometimes, she also works as a street vendor and sells her wares directly to the public.  Esperanza also knits custom-ordered sweaters.  

Esperanza needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy grains.  She dreams of building her own home and of providing her son with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Esperanza es socia del Banco Comunal Retoño. 
Esperanza es madre soltera, tiene 39 años y 1 hijo, Esperanza vive en una casa alquilada en el barrio de Los Artesanos, Esperanza viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra cereales, quesos, que luego los comercializa por mayor a los comerciantes de los mercados, y en algunas oportunidades lo vende directamente de manera ambulatoria. Además Esperanza teje chompas variadas que realiza según pedido. 
Esperanza necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales. 
Esperanza sueña con construir su casa y brindar una buena educación a su hijo.
loan_use: Buy grains in regional markets

loan_name: Mrs. Srey Hun Village Bank Group
description:
The village bank loan, which consists of eighteen members, is located in Chreaek Village in Kampong Cham Province. Mrs. S. H. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members to receive a loan. She owns a small grocery store where she sells grocery products. She is a 45-year-old widow with three children, two of whO. are fishermen while the youngest one attends the local school. Since their fishing business faces some problems, Mrs. S. H. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishnets and fish line for this business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this new loan.
 
This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Sixteen members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end-of-the-loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.
loan_use: To ask for a loan to buy more fishnets and fish line for the family fishing business.
borrower_names: Sroy, Norn, Mach, Muth, Thavy, Yorn, Noeurn, Srey, Sam, Neang, Nuy, Thoeurn, Nov, Kemma, Srey Mao, Chandy, Heang, Roeurn
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, male, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, false, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
A. Gavhar is 41 years old. She is married and the loving mother of three children. Gavhar sells office supplies and school supplies. Her trading place is located in the central market. She has a wide range of goods and the majority of her customers are schoolchildren. In comparison with larger stores selling office supplies, Gavhar’s prices are lower and more attractive. Now she requests $600 USD for the term of 12 months to purchase office supplies to sell. Gavhar has already taken one loan through IMON International and repaid her previous loan successfully without any violations. Gavhar wishes Kiva and all lenders a happy new year and thanks everyone for their support. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
loan_use: Purchasing office supplies to sell.

description:
La señorita Laidy Martínez de 20 años de edad vive todavía con sus padres. Terminó la carrera de técnico en farmacia y luego sus padres le habilitaron una farmacia, la cual está administrando desde hace dos años. Su proyecto es seguir estudiando el año próximo la carrera de Bioquímica.

El cliente solicita el préstamo para la compra de medicamentos en general, perfumes, artículos para regalos, lentes, shampoo, acondicionador, golosinas. De esta forma podrá ofrecer a sus clientes mas variedad de productos, aumentar sus ventas y con eso aumentar sus ingresos.
description_translated:
Laidy Martínez is 20 years old and lives with her parents. She is a pharmaceuticals technician and works a pharmacy her parents opened for her, which she had managed for the last 2 years. Her goal is to keep studying to obtain a degree on Biochemistry next year.\r\n\r\nLaidy is requesting for a loan to purchase drugs in general, perfumes, gift shop items, glasses, shampoo, and candy. This way, she will be able to offer a variety of products to her customers, increase her sales and therefore her income.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase drugs in general, perfumes, gift shop items, glasses, shampoo, and candy

loan_name: Mrs. Sithat Ung Village Bank Group
description:
Twenty people who live in Phum Dabprambei village in Kampong Cham province comprise this village bank. Each of the members will use their loan for a different purpose. 

Mrs. Sithat U. is the village bank president. She and her husband, Mr. Seim Oul, are laborers. Even though they try to work hard, they still earn less income than they need to support their household. 

To improve their living conditions, Mrs. Sithat U. has decided to request a loan to buy a cow to start a  breeding business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan. 

She is 49 years old and the mother of six children. Two of her children are laborers, three attend the local school, and the youngest is just five years old.
loan_use: To buy a cow to start a breeding business.
borrower_names: Sitha, Sareun, Srei Raen, Thol, Sarun, Thary, Neang, Vanny, Chantho, Sokhy, Sokoeurn, Khan, Buthoeurn, Phean, Hean, Sokhim, Sithat, Roeurn, Sinal, Bunny
borrower_genders: female, female, female, male, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, male, female, male, female, female, male, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
The village bank, which is located in Phum Soupy village in Kampong Chhnang province, consists of eighteen people who will each use the loan that they obtain for different purposes.  

Mr. Torn S. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members.  He owns a small grocery store in the local market.  Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it.  So, he decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery products for his inventory.  His wife, Mrs. Yun Soky, helps him in the current business. 

Mr. Torn S. is 43 years old and the father of five children who are all attending the local school.
 
All the members in this group loan are end-of-term loans, so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term.  End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor.  It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to.  Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term.  Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time.  AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.
loan_use: To buy more grocery products for his inventory.
borrower_names: Ry, Yun, Rorn, Yen, Torn, Larn, Roeurn, San Art, Reu, Sokhorn, Hory, Lum, Sophun, Phalla, Sam Oeurn, Nen, Chan, Thary
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, male, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Paa K. is 42 years old.  He is single and the father of one child who is in school.  He had an unexpected divorce, so he had to take his child and look after him on his own.  

Paa is very hard working and resourceful to his family.  He trades in charcoal in Abeka of Accra in his neighborhood.  Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in almost all Ghanaian traditional homes.  Paa obtains his supply of charcoal from the surrounding villages of Accra.  Such places include the Afram plains and others.  He retails the charcoal to his customers in the market place of Abeka. 

He wants to use the loan to buy a bulk supply of charcoal to increase his inventory.  He hopes the loan will enable him to increase his savings and pay his child's educational fees.  

He belongs to the community group called Vibrant Trust Group.  In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral to repay the loan.  Paa wants help for his business.  He says he wants to help his child before leaving earth.
loan_use: Paa wants the loan to buy more bags of charcoal before the raining season.

description:
Reynalda is a member of the Imperio (“Empire”) Village Bank. She is 47 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their six children. Their youngest child is six years old, while their older children are adults. Reynalda is a seamstress; she sews custom clothing in her home, mostly for women. She has had this business for many years, and she works alone. Reynalda also sells meals on Sundays from her home. 

Reynalda is requesting a loan of 1050 soles to buy fabric and other materials for sewing clothing. Her goal for the future is to open her own restaurant.
loan_use: Buy fabric and other materials for sewing clothes

description:
Juana is a member of the Amaqella Village Bank; “Amaqella” means “Don’t be lazy” in Quechua. She is 48 years old and married with six children. Juana and her husband sell construction materials, mainly bricks and sand. They inherited the brick-selling business from Juana’s parents, and they started selling sand about 20 years ago. Juana and her husband take the sand from a nearby river and buy the bricks directly from the manufacturers. They sell both sand and bricks from their car, and have many regular customers.

Juana is requesting a loan of 1500 soles to buy fuel for her vehicle and pay her brick-makers. Her goal for the future is to buy a bigger car to haul more construction materials around.
loan_use: Buy fuel for vehicle, pay brick makers

description:
The leader of this group of five is Mrs. Sokhan C. and all the members live in Sdao Kanlaeng village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sokhan C. is single. She is a primary teacher who can make a small salary to support herself. In order to improve her living conditions and increase her income, Mrs. Sokhan C. seeks a loan to conduct a souvenir shop.\r\n

\r\nMrs. Sokhan C. will share this loan with the other members of her group.
loan_use: To open a souvenir shop.

description:
Nurillojon is originally from Isfara, Tajikistan. For 17 years he has been processing and selling dried apricots. Nurillojon is married with two children. Family effort has been the key to his business's growth since everyone collaborates and now, he has a steady customer base due to the quality of his products. At the high season, he even sends some of his products to Russia where dried apricots are very expensive. Currently, he is seeking a loan of 4000 Somoni (US$ 1175) to buy tables so he can buy more dried apricots in order to fill the high demand from his customers. He promises to repay this loan in 11 months. Be a part of this family's achievements! They sincerely thank you for your support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
loan_use: To buy dried apricots to expand his business

description: Mrs. Man N. lives in Sambuor Village in Kandal Province. She is a farmer who owns 0.6 hectar on which she makes a living cultivating rice. She would like to grow a crop in the dry season, and has decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice seeds to cultivate. She will also use a portion of this loan to buy fertilizers and fuel to make her crop larger. Mrs. Man N. is a 57-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is a fisherman while the other helps her on her plantation.
loan_use: To buy more rice seeds and other items.

description: Mrs. Rom L. was born in 1962 and she now lives in Bro Vash village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Some Noeurn, is a pig breeder. Since his pigs are getting bigger and bigger, he does not have enough money to buy enough feed to support them. Thus, Mrs. Rom L. decided to ask for a loan to buy pig feed. Mrs. Rom L. is 46 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom is a garment factory worker, while the other three attend the local school, and the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is only four years old. Her husband is presented with her in the picture.
loan_use: To buy pig feed for her husband's pigs.

description:
Nhoek Y. is a 19-year-old who lives in Saladeng Village in the Banteay Meanchey Province. She grows mushrooms to sell, and has been growing them since 2005. Her business is going well. 

Her husband, age 28, is employed as a driver with a fixed salary, and he drives very well. The young couple have two small children. She also cares for an elderly woman who can help her a little in her work. 

Because she wants to improve her family's income, she wants her husband to have has own car to drive as a taxi. Hence, she would like to request a loan, which she will use with her savings to purchase a used car for $3200 for her husband to drive.
loan_use: To buy a used car for her husband to drive as a taxi

description:
Para la formación del comité  fue la señora Rosana V., está casada con el Señor Diosnel Evancio es madre de 2 Hijos ella es Peluquera vive en el km 8 Monday de C.D.E. A la señora le agrado mucho el Programa de comité e Mujeres Emprendedoras contacto con sus vecinas y amigas  para formar el comité en dicha zona.
El comité se denomina “Lucerito”, está constituido  por 15 señoras muy activas y solidarias todas de la misma zona.
Ellas tienen actividades diferentes como ser:
Ramona A.	Venta de Frutas
Rosana V.	Peluquería
Beatriz D.	Venta De Huevo
Margarita R.	Despensa
Estela Ramírez	Venta De Ropa Interior
Eulalia Espínola	Venta De Cubiertos
Gregoria M.	Venta De Frutas
Gladys Ibáñez	Venta De Materiales De Limpieza
Asunción C.	Venta De Ropa
Maria T.	Venta De Ropa
Noelia A.	Venta De Joyas
Elisa A.	Venta De Ropa
Maria V.	Venta De Huevo y Queso
Rosana A. 	Venta De Verduras
Librada Agüero	Venta De Gallina


El Crédito destinaran a la compra de mercaderías para y artículos de primera necesidad para la venta como: pantalones, remeras, tomates, cebollas, pulseras, cadenas cremas para el rostro,  manzanas, bananas, gaseosas, galletitas, caramelos, melones, sandias, azúcar, leche, aceite, escobas, rapo de piso, detergente, suavizante y otras que emprenderán una nueva labor y cuentan con un  ingreso fijo y desean invertir en una actividad extra.
Las señoras retiran un crédito de Gs 300.000 c/u
description_translated:
Mrs. Rosana V. formed this committee. She is married to Mr. Diosnel Evancio and is the mother of two daughters. She is a hairdresser and lives at Km 8 Monday de C.D.E. She is very grateful to the program of the committee and the Mujeres Emprendedoras' contact with neighbors and friends to form the committee in this zone. The committee is called Lucerito (Little Star) and is made up of 15 very active and supportive women all from the same neighborhood. They all have different professions such as: Ramona A. Fruit sales Rosana V. Hair dresser Beatriz D. Egg sales Margarita R. Shop owner Estela Ramírez Sale of undergarments Eulalia Espínola Sale of cutlery Gregoria M. Fruit sales Gladys Ibáñez Sale of cleaning products Asunción C. Clothing sales Maria T. Clothing sales Noelia A. Jewelry sales Elisa A. Clothing sales Maria V. Sale of eggs and cheese Rosana A. Sale of vegetables Librada Agüero Sale of chickens The loan will be used for the purchase of merchandise and needed items such as: pants, t-shirts, tomatoes, onions, bracelets, chains, face creams, apples, bananas, soft drinks, cookies, candies, melons, watermelons, sugar, milk, oil, brooms, mops, detergent, fabric softener, and other things that will bring in more work and provide a fixed income and allow investments in additional activities. The woman are requesting a loan of Gs 300.000 c/u.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchse of fruits, vegetables, chickens, cosmetics, eggs, candy, beverages, cutlery, plastics, clothing, foods, cleaning products, etc.
borrower_names: Gregoria, Elisa, Estela, Ramona, Librada, Gladys, Rosana, Beatriz, Maria, Rosana, Asuncion, Margarita, Noelia, Eulalia, Maria
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description: El grupo las "Solidarias" están representadas por la señora Nancy y por doce miembros D. los cuales existen parentescos lejanos entre primos pero todos con ingresos totalmente independientes. Dentro del grupo una mayoría se dedica al comercio D. cosméticos, zapatos, abarrotes y otros se dedican al transporte publico y a la confeccion y comercializacion D. prensas D. vestir. El crédito esta destinado a la compra D. herramientas D. trabajo para incrementar sus productos terminados así como para la compra D. mercadería para abastecer al mercado en épocas D. fin D. año. La competencia en el mercado D. venta D. productos es dificil D. llevar si no se tiene buena ubicación y productos D. calidad para el mercado competitivo, pero los socios (as) ya tienen experiencia en el rubro y saben como sacar a flote sus negocios y mejorar sus ingresos para salir adelante. Los socios (as) tiene experiencia en grupos solidaR. ya que trabajaron en otras instituciones por lo que conocen la responsabilidad que se requiere para este tipo D. financiamientos.
description_translated:
The Solidarity Group is represented by Nancy and by 12 other members, among whom there are distant relationships between cousins, though all of the businesses are totally independent. Within the group, the majority of members sell cosmetics, shoes, groceries and clothing, and others proviD. public transportation and tailoring services.\r\n\r\nThis loan will be used to buy items needed to increase the businesses' end products. For example, it will be used to purchase merchandise for stocking up the stores for the end of the year. It is hard to weather the sales competition if one doesn't have a good location and quality products, but the group members already have experience in this area and know how to stay afloat in their businesses and improve their profits. The members have experience in these types of groups because they have already worked with other institutions and understand the responsibility associated with this type of loan.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Operating expenses
borrower_names: ROSSEMARY, CARMEN ROXANA, BENIGNA, WALTER HUGO, PACESA, JESUSA, MARIA TERESA, MARCOS RUFO, Nancy, ROSSIO SHIRLEY, IRMA FELICIDAD, JOSE FERNANDO
borrower_genders: female, female, female, male, female, female, female, male, female, female, female, male
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true
