description: This is Ghulam Mustafa, who is 25 years old. He is married, the father of two children and he lives in Angoorbagh in Nangarhar province. He has a tailoring shop in Jalalabad city. Mustafa has decided to make a group loan with four other members. They all work at different trades: Mujeeb operates a Public Call Office, Merwais and Shapooris are  tailors and Samsoor has a retail food shop. They would like to take out a 50000(AF) group loan with a term of 10 months (for each person 10000AF). Mustafa says that he can manage his group and that they can repay the loan on time.  They would like to thank all the lenders from around the world, Kiva and AFSG in Afghanistan, for providing this process for loan to the poor countries.
loan_use: Invest in business stock and supplies.
borrower_names: Samsor, Gullam Mustafa, Mujeeb, Merwais, Shapoor

description:
Mrs. Teodosia C., age 59, lives in Miputak, in Dipolog City. She is married to Mr. Jaime C., age 62, who is a motor-cab driver. They are blessed with two children.

In 2006, Teodosia became an official member of Paglaum MPC. For her first loan, she borrowed PHP 3,000.00 and  established a small sari-sari (variety) store. Being a loyal member of Paglaum MPC for 3 years, she has borrowed for six loan cycles. She works hard for her family, despite of many challenges. Both the husband and wife have managed their business well.

Now Mrs. Teodosia is taking a loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase basic goods to display in her sari-sari store. She dreams of owning a lot. Paglaum helped to uplift their lives. They are so very thankful for everything that Paglaum has done for them.
loan_use: To purchase goods for her sari-sari store

description:
La señora Valentina es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Unidas al Triunfo” del distrito, provincia y departamento. Tiene 57 años de edad, es separada y tiene 5 hijos mayores de edad. 
Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 compró mercadería para vender en su puesto de trabajo en el puerto. Tiene 18 ciclos trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que vive con su hija, su nieto y su yerno. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará panetones y demás mercadería para ser vendida en las fiestas de navidad.
Valentina desea continuar trabajando para apoyar a su familia.
description_translated:
Valentina is a member of the community bank “Mujeres Unidas al Triunfo” in the district, province, and department. She is 57 years old, separated, and has 5 adult children. With her first 300 soles loan, she bought merchandise to sell in her stall in the port. She has been working for 18 cycles with the community bank and says that she lives with her daughter, her grandson, and her son-in-law. With this 1,200 soles loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy panettones and more merchandise to sell during the Christmas holiday. Valentine wants to keep working in order to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy panettones and other merchandise.

description: Carmen tiene 29 años, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos. Hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de quesos que compra en comunidades alejadas para luego traerlos a las ciudades y venderlos en los mercados, dentro de su labor, lo que más le agrada realizar es la comercialización, y lo tedioso es ir a los pueblos lejanos. Pero de todas maneras esta actividad es muy rentable, ya que los pobladores solicitan todos los días quesos frescos y muy ricos, típicos de zonas rurales donde los preparan. Carmen es nueva en MFP, pero se muestra muy comprometida y responsable  ante los demás. Invertirá lo que solicita en la compra de mayores cantidades de queso, para venderlos, ya no tan solo en su ciudad, sino también en las ciudades aledañas.
description_translated:
Carmen is 29 and lives with her husband and 3 children. She has sold cheese that she buys in remote communities and takes to the cities to sell in the markets for 4 years. What she likes most about her job is selling. The tedious part is going to far away towns. But this business is very profitable because the people who live in the city request fresh and very delicious cheeses from her every day that are traditional to the areas where they are prepared. Carmen is new to Microfinanzas Prisma, but she has shown that she is committed and responsible above all. She will invest her loan in the purchase of larger quantities of cheese to sell, not only in her city, but also in nearby cities.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase of a larger quantity of cheese to sell

description:
La señora Marilu es socia del Banco Comunal “El Alto Mayo”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia y distrito de Rioja, se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida tipo menú vende de manera diaria, da pensión a quienes lo requieren y desarrolla su negocio en su propia casa. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará los insumos como arroz, azúcar en saco, aceite en galón, fideos, verduras y carnes  y otros insumos que necesita para la preparación de sus platos a ofertar a sus clientes. 
La señora Marilu tiene 41 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 03 hijos, dos de ellos aún estudian y dependen de ella, además son la razón para luchar cada día. Más adelante quiere arreglar su casa y ampliar más su negocio.
description_translated:
Marilu belongs to the "El Alto Mayo" Communal Bank and lives in the San Martín Region in the Rioja district and province. She earns a living by preparing and selling menu-of-the-day type food. She offers food and accomodation to those needing it and carries out her business in her own house. With this loan of US$350 (S/. 1,000) which will be paid over six months, she will buy ingredients such as rice and sugar by the sack, oil by the gallon, pasta, vegetables, meat and other goods that she needs for the preparation of the meals to offer to her clients. Marilu is 41 years old and lives with her husband and their 3 children. Two of the children are still studying and dependent on her, and moreover are the reason to keep pushing onwards every day. In the future she wants to fix up her house and expand her business further.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: She will buy rice, sugar by the sack, oil by the gallon, pasta, vegetables, meats and other goods

description:
Mrs. Julieta S. is 36 years old and lives at Sunset Boulevard, Dawo, Dapitan City. She has been a single mother of five children since her husband left them in 2000. Three of her children are in school. Now, she finds herself again in a relationship and has been living with him for several years already. Their source of income is a sari-sari store. She has difficulty in raising her children considering the situation, but life must go on for Julieta. Her live-in partner also helps them financially through day labor.

Due to lack of capital, Julieta joined Paglaum MPC last April. She was inclined to be a member due to its benefits given to members. She has made good use of several loans and, at present, she is applying for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods and soft drinks for her sari-sari store. 

Julieta plans to make her sari-sari store into a mini-grocery someday, with a variety of goods for sale. She really strives hard to be able to send all of her children to school and to become fulfilled seeing her children finish their studies and  have comfortable careers.
loan_use: to buy canned goods & soft drinks for her sari-sari store

description: Mr. Chhunmeng M. was born in 1961, and he now lives in Choeung Wat village in Kampong Cham province. He is a nurse at the Provincial Health Care Center. His wife, Mrs. Yun Kim Yan, sells medicines. Since Mr. Chhunmeng M. has a lot of patients, he decided to ask for a loan to purchase more medicines to sell them for an income. He hopes to increase his income and provide a better life for his family. He is the father of three children, two of whom stay at home to do housework while the other attends the local school. His wife is shown on the right of picture.
loan_use: To buy more medicines to sell

description:
Malohat S. is 49 years old. She is married and the loving mother of two children. Malohat breeds calves and cows. She buys the calves at the market for a low price, then feeds them and resells them at the same market for a more profitable amount. Her husband, who is in the picture too, also helps with this business. Malohat works hard in order to make the business successful and generate a stable income for the family.

Now, Malohat is planning to purchase three calves to raise and then sell. With this purpose in mind, she is requesting a loan. Malohat would like to thank everyone for their support and promises to manage the loan without violations or delinquency.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions. But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
loan_use: To purchase cattle for breeding and selling.

description: Waliholla is 39 years old and married with 3 children. He works hard in agriculture, and lives in Shewa, Nangarhar province. He has been involved in the business of agriculture for more than 5 years, and now wants to take out a loan from AFSG. He would like the loan to help his business grow, and promises to be a good client for Kiva and AFSG. Waliholla is certain that he can repay the loan on time and he is very happy about receiving this loan. He would like to thank everybody who helps him, in the poor country of Afghanistan.\r\n
loan_use: To increase his agricultural business.

description:
Ghurzang is a young man who is uneducated, but has lots of experience in the agricultural business. He has been involved in this business for more than 10 years in Shewa, Nangarhar province. Prior to this loan, he worked in agriculture in his own village, but now he has responsibility for his family. For the past 10 years he has tried many times to increase his sales of animals, but was unsuccessful. Then he was pleased to find AFSG in Jalalabad city, and decided to apply for a loan.

Now he requested an individual loan to enlarge his work and further his business with more success and become strong in his business and make a good monthly income for his family.
loan_use: To buy animals.

description:
Miroslav is married and has two children. He rents a store and sells various construction supplies that are used to build and fix houses. His large assortment, good prices and good location bring more and more clients to his store. Miroslav has been in this business for six years. He knows what is in demand and offers his clients what they need.

Miroslav is a very optimistic person and believes that his business can grow even more. His goal is to purchase the store so that he can save money on rent. Moreover, one of his children (his one-year-old daughter) has an eye problem and the family needs money for the surgery and following treatment.

Miroslav would like to receive a loan of 7,000 UAH (USD$900) to purchase more inventory. At this time the prices for construction supplies are low and he can make very good deals and receive more profit.
loan_use: To increase the inventory in his construction supply store.

description: Dilan Satan S., 59 ans, mariée, 05 enfants scolarisés en charge est membre du banc villageois de Peyrissac depuis 3 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des robes et ensembles africains. Les revenus tirés de son commerce vont lui permettre d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
description_translated:
Dilan Satan S., age 59, is married and has five children in school who are in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group of Peyrissac for three years. Her work consists in buying and reselling dresses and African suits. The income derived from her commerce is going to allow her to improve her family's living conditions. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Commerce in dresses and African outfits

description: Mrs. Sarikakeo P. is a villager in Damnak Sangke village in Kandal province. She is a wedding chef who has been hired by the villagers to cook at wedding ceremonies, parties, and so on. She is a 26 year old widow with a child who is attending the local school. She now wants to purchase a motorbike to go to work; unfortunately, she does not have enough money. In order to deal this problem, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.
loan_use: To purchase a motorbike to go to work.

description:
There are three members that jointed this small loan, and Mrs. Chhom M. is the group leader. She is 39 years old and earns a living by selling different kinds of fruit in the local market. She started her business more than ten years ago and is currently earning around $4 a day. She has five children, all of whom are single; three are students and two are employed, while her husband is a local chef for wedding parties and ceremonies. M. plans to expand her business, thus now she decided to apply for a loan to purchase additional fruits to resell. 

The other two borrowers are:
Phon R. is 40 years old and is selling fruits for a profit. She needs a loan to buy more kinds of fruit for sale.
Sar S. is 29 years old and is selling electronic materials. She requests a loan to purchase piglets to raise. 

They all live in Odombang Commune in Battambang Province.
loan_use: To purchase additional fruits for sale

description: La  señora Rita tiene 59 años, es separada sin hijos , hace 25 años  que trabaja en esta actividad, es una persona muy emprendedora , sueña con tener  algún día casa propia  y ampliar su taller y así convertirse en fuente de trabajos para madres solteras ya que este es el sector menos apoyado por la sociedad.\nSu deseo es seguir progresando.\n
description_translated:
Rita is 59 years old, is separated from her husband and doesn't have any children. She has worked in this field for the past 25 years. She is a very hard-worker and dreams of one day owning her own home and expanding her workshop so she can offer employment to single mothers, the segment of the workforce least supported by society. Her goal is to continue to build a better life for herself.\r\n

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To purchase fabric, thread, zippers, buttons etc. for her workshop

description: Amon J. is a Tanzanian businessman. He runs a shop at Vituka Ward. He sells a variety of items including cereals. He purchases from wholesale shops in Kariakoo business center and other things directly from the producers. The income generated by his business is used to pay his children's school fees and meet the family's daily demands. He wants to purchase more items to meet his customers' demand. He needs a loan of Tshs 800,000.\r\n\r\n
loan_use: To expand his  business selling cereals, etc.

description:
Mrs. Saroeun S., age 45, and her husband, Mr. Yorn Yin, age 44, live in a small village across the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1990 and have six children: three sons and three daughters. Three of their children attend school, one child is a weaver and the youngest child is still very young and stays at home.

Saroeun has been a silk weaver for 17 years, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to a middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a house builder and rice grower for the last 10 years. He is a horse cart driver as well. 

Saroeun is requesting a loan of 300USD to purchase silk material for her weaving business and part of the loan for growing rice.
loan_use: To purchase materials for weaving and for growing rice.

description:
La señora  Pilar es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Amigas” de la provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno. Tiene 45 años de edad, es casada  y  madre de 3 hijos. Con su primer  préstamo de S/. 300 compró ropa para venderla. Tiene casi 2 años trabajando con el banco. Pilar nos cuenta que todos sus hijos están estudiando actualmente; ella trabaja actualmente en el restaurante del colegio militar
Con este préstamo de S/. 1500 que pagará en 4 cuotas comprará  una cocina más grande y mayor cantidad de vajilla, mesas largas.
Pilar desea continuar trabajando para llegar a ser propietaria de una cafetería en el centro de la ciudad.
description_translated:
Ms. Pilar is a member of the “Las Amigas” microfinance institute in the province and department of Puno. She is a 45-year-old married mother of 3 children. With her first 300.00 PEN loan, she purchased clothing for resale. She has been working with the microfinance institute for almost 2 years. Pilar states that all her children are currently in school; right now, she is working at a restaurant in a military school.

With this 1,500.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 4 monthly installments, she will purchase a bigger stove, more dishware and long tables.

Pilar hopes to continue working so that she can one day own a cafe downtown.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase bigger stove, more dishware and long tables

description:
The Las Ameritas Village Bank has twelve members and is beginning its second loan cycle. During the group’s first cycle, members were given training and educational sessions, which they are now putting into practice in their daily lives.  The group members are involved in a variety of different businesses; they sell condiments, accessories, bread, dry goods, sweets, clothing and fruit, and also prepare natural juices. Some sell from home or in local markets, while others sell in the street or make home deliveries.  The group members are requesting different loan amounts, like 300, 600 or 1,050 soles. The group as a whole is requesting a total of 8,400 soles. The loans will be used to buy cookies, caramels, hot peppers, cumin, bananas, papayas, bread, t-shirts and pants.  Group members dream of improving and expanding their businesses, of owning their own homes or their own stores, and that their children will graduate will professional degrees.

 Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

El Banco Comunal Las Américas inicia su segundo ciclo con 12 socias, en el primer ciclo recibieron diferentes temas de capacitación que ahora están poniendo en practica en su vida diaria. 
 Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta de condimentos, pasamanería, panes, abarrotes, golosinas, preparación de jugos naturales, ropa, frutas. Sus ventas los realizan en algunos mercados, en sus domicilios, reparten a domicilio, ambulantemente. 
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de préstamos, algunos montos son de 300 soles, 600 soles, 1050 soles  haciendo un total de 8,400 soles de préstamos en el Banco Comunal. 
Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra de galletas, caramelos, ají, comino, plátano, papaya, panes, polos, pantalones. 
Los sueños de las socias son mejorar y ampliar su negocio, tener casa propia, tener un local para sus negocios y sus hijos sean profesionales.
loan_use: Buy cookies, caramels, hot peppers, cumin, bananas, papayas, bread, t-shirts and pants
borrower_names: Teodoro, Eufrosinia, Marino, Janett, Doris, Fermina Flora, Marleny, Clara Victoria, Rufelia, Rosa, Abigail Sara, Digna Gladis
borrower_genders: male, female, male, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description: Ronald tiene 30 años, es soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos. Es ingeniero civil, pero a la par de ejercer su carrera tiene un negocio asociado con su hermana, con la quien desde muy pequeños estuvieron juntos en todo y ahora también en los negocios, que es uno de los aspectos que más le agrada de  su actividad. Para Ronald tiene una bodega, la cual es muy rentable, ya que cuenta con los productos básicos y a muy buenos precios, que son iguales a los de los mercados, y lo dificultoso es justamente eso, conseguir productos de buena calidad, pero que puedan estar al alcance de sus clientes. Ronald está en su 7mo crédito con MFP, y hasta la fecha no tuvo problemas de pago, es un cliente muy comprometido con los socios de su banco comunal y con la institución. Invertirá la cantidad solicitada en la compra de mercaderías y productos para ampliar su tienda.
description_translated:
Ronald is 30 years old; he is single and lives with his parents and siblings. He is a civil engineer but he also owns a business in partnership with his sister; the two of them have always been very close and their joint venture is a source of great satisfaction for him.

They have a grocery store which is a very profitable; it stocks staple items at very good prices, in line with market prices (it is difficult to find good quality products at affordable prices). Ronald is on his seventh loan from MFP; to date, he has not had any problems with repayment and he is strongly committed to the other members of the community bank and to the institution itself.

He will use the loan to buy merchandise and products to expand the store.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Increase stocks in his store

description:
Carmen H. T. is 40 years old.  She lives in Pucallpa, Peru, a major city in the eastern jungle region of the country.  This steaming, humid city is situated on the banks of the Ucayali River, a tributary of the Amazon River. 

Carmen is a member of the Las Heroinas communal bank and has been taking out small business loans for 10 years to support her hammock business.  Carmen makes hammocks for a living, a popular purchase of travelers leaving on riverboats headed to other port towns along the Ucayali.  Riverboats often do not have beds for passengers to sleep in, so everyone must bring along their own hammock.  Carmen sells both to travelers and to people who would like a hammock to relax in their own home.  She has a shop in the “No. 1” market in Pucallpa which is located one block from the city´s river port.

Carmen is currently requesting a Kiva loan of 3,000 Nuevo Soles to purchase cloth, thread and other materials used in making hammocks.  She will repay the loan in monthly installments.  She thanks you for your support.
loan_use: to purchase cloth, thread and other materials used in making hammocks

description: Эсангул женщина в возрасте 53 лет, имеет 6 детей.Она домохозяйка, занимается откормом скота.В основном Эсангул занимается отдоем молока.Весь посёлок Хамробод покупает у неё хорошее ,жирное домашнее молоко, а также и кефир.Эсангул хочет в кредит купить ещё пару коров,чтоб увеличить производство молока и молочных продуктов.
description_translated:
Esangul is 53 years old and has six children. She is a housewife who also raises livestock, mostly for milk production. The entire village of Hamrobod buys fresh, rich cow milk as well as kefir/buttermilk from her. Esangul would like to buy two more cows for her herd so that she can increase the production of milk and soured milk products.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: cattle

description:
Cecilia Madeleine M. Rodriguez is forty years old.  She lives with her husband and her two children in the city of Pucallpa, Peru.  Cecilia’s business is growing and selling plants.  Cecilia is a member of the Las Brisas communal bank and has worked with her group for two years.

Cecilia uses her loans to purchase plant food, pesticides, soil, seeds, seedlings and other plant growing materials.  She is currently requesting a Kiva loan of 2,500 Nuevo Soles to purchase more plants, chemicals and fertilizers.  She will also use the money to rent tools to help her cultivate her plants.  Cecilia appreciates the opportunity to work with more capital and appreciates your support.
loan_use: To purchase more plants, chemicals and fertilizers.

description: Rocío tiene 22 años, está casada, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos. Se dedica a la crianza de animales menores desde hace 2 años, desde esa fecha se desvive por brindar el mejor cuidado a sus animales, sobre todo a sus cuyes, que son los más demandados en el mercado nacional e internacional, ya que hay personas que realizan pedidos para exportar la carne de cuy, la cual es bastante consumida, esto hace rentable su negocio, ya que venderlos para exportación es más rentable porque tienen un costo más elevado, pero para llegar a abastecer los pedidos tiene que tener grandes cantidades de cuyes y de buenas razas. Rocío está en su 13vo crédito con MFP, y todo este tiempo ha sido una persona muy responsable en sus pagos, ganándose así la confianza ante los demás miembros de su banco comunal y de la institución. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más cuyes de raza que mejoren su producción y ventas.
description_translated:
Rocío is twenty-two years old and married. She lives with her husband and their two children. She has been raising small animals for two years. Since the time she started, Rocío has been devoted to giving her animals the best care -- especially her guinea pigs, which are the most popular in both the national and international markets. Guinea pig meat is commonly eaten, and there are people who export guinea pig meat. Rocío’s business benefits from this since the meat can be sold at a higher value as an export than it can locally. However, Rocío has to have huge numbers of guinea pigs and good breeds to be able to stay in stock and meet demand. This is Rocío’s thirteenth loan with MFP. All this time she has been a very responsible person with her payments, winning the trust of every member of her communal banc and the institution. With the money she is requesting, Rocío will buy more guinea pigs of breeds that will increase her production and sales.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchasing better breeds of guinea pig.

description:
Rosa P. D. R. is sixty-eight years old. She lives with her retired husband in the tropical Amazon River basin region in eastern Peru. Rosa supports herself and her family through her juice selling business. Rosa is also a member of the Talented Women communal bank; she has taken out loans through her group for two years, at first to help implement a groceries business and now to fund a juice and beverage sales stand.

Rosa is requesting 1,000 Nuevo Soles to purchase materials with which she will concoct her beverages and juices. She is also planning to invest in one case of eggs and one case of milk to sell in her bodega. Rosa will repay her loan in monthly installments over the course of four months.
loan_use: Rosa would like to buy supplies for her juice stand, and to buy milk and eggs to sell.

description: Seneuefa T., 40, is married and has four children.  She has many years of experience in the BBQ business. She sells to the villagers and general public three days per week. She has had three previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala ($104 US).  SPBD loans are Seneuefa’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.The loan will be used to purchase mutton flaps, chicken, sausages, onions, garlic, and soy sauce, as well as plastic plates, cups, forks, spoons, pots, and tissues. Her children are helping her run the business.
loan_use: To purchase mutton flaps, chicken, sausages, soy sauce, onions, garlic, plastic plates, cutlery, tissues, and pots

description: Oliana M., 30, is married with two children.  She has four years of experience in the BBQ business. She sells to the villagers and general public four days per week. She has had one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala ($187 US).  SPBD loans are Oliana’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.
loan_use: Purchase mutton flaps, chicken, sausages, soy sauce, onions, garlic, plastic plates, tissues, and pots

description:
Mtetwa, 26, is married with one son of 2 years old. She owns a video library in Mwananyamala. She started this business three years ago and works daily from 8am until 10pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of about US$ 217.

This will be Mtetwa’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the first two to increase the inventory of her library, and she wants to open a beauty salon so she has started to buy things for the salon and has paid the loans back successfully. She now hopes for a new loan to improve the salon.

Mtetwa will share this loan with subgroup B of the Serena group. The subgroup has 8 members who run shops, a salon, and sell cosmetics, food, and shoes. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Mtetwa is second from right front row.
loan_use: To start up and improve her little salon
borrower_names: Augustino, Rehema, Mate, Abdallah, Gaby, Mtetwa, Stamili, Asha
borrower_genders: male, female, male, male, male, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Herminia es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres del Futuro 
Herminia es casada tiene 59 años cinco hijos   de 37, 33, 32, 30 y 25 años, cuatro de sus hijos están casados y el último está soltero.
Tiene  una pequeña tienda en su casa, empezó hace dos años, y  por las tardes en su tienda se dedica a vender comida  y   tiene una combi que la trabaja su esposo. 
Desde  que ella  recibe los préstamos, ha podido invertir en su negocio y comprar llantas para su combi y productos para su tienda.
Herminia necesita  un préstamo  de 800 soles, que los va a invertir en la compra de gaseosas, cervezas y en la compra de abarrotes para la preparación de comidas.
description_translated:
Herminia is a member of Bancomunal Mujeres del Futuro (Women of the Future). She is a 59-year-old married mother of five children, aged 37, 33, 32, 30 and 25 years old, all married themselves, except the youngest. She runs a small shop out of her home, which she started two years ago. She sells food from her shop in the afternoons and she has a small van, which her husband works for her. Since she began receiving loans she has been able to invest in her business, buying tires for the van and products for her shop. Herminia needs a loan of 800 soles to buy sodas, beers, and provisions to prepare her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Herminia needs a loan of 800 soles to buy sodas, beers, and provisions to prepare her dishes.

description:
Norme es socia del Bancomunal San Juan.  Norma tiene 42 años vive en casa de sus padres con su esposo,  es profesora de primaria tiene tres hijos de 14,13 y 4 años están en el colegio estatal, a Norma le gusta hacer manualidades empezó hacer adornos  con madera de tulipán  aproximadamente hace dos años y los vende en los colegios a los profesores, también realiza trabajos de enchapado de puertas  como reposteros de cocina, roperos etc, su negocio funciona en su casa y se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo de la empresa Unique.
Ha pasado momentos difíciles le atropello una moto golpeando su brazo derecho estuvo por quince días en reposo. No pudo salir a trabajar

Norma pide un préstamo a Finca de 1200  para comprar materiales para enchapar puertas y hacer sus adornos en madera de tulipán, esta contenta por que recibe orientación de cómo llevar su negocio, 
Los sueños que le gustaría realizar son tener su casa propia, tener una librería bazar y llegar hacer directora de  venta por catalogo de Unique
description_translated:
Norma is a member of the San Juan cooperative bank, 42 years old, and lives in her parents’ house with her husband. She is a primary school teacher and has three children ages 14, 13 and 4 who are in public school. Norma enjoys making handcrafted items, having started out two years ago making decorations from tulip wood. She sells these at schools to the teachers, and she also makes wood veneer doors such as those for kitchen confectioners, wardrobes, etc. Her business is run out of her house, and she also dedicates herself to selling Unique brand beauty products by catalog. She has had some difficult times, particularly when she was hit by a car which injured her right arm and forced her to be on bed rest for fifteen days. She was not able to work during this time. Norma requests a loan from Finca of 1,200.00 Peruvian soles, with which she will purchase materials for making her doors and decorations. She is glad to be receiving orientations on how to best run her enterprise. Her dreams are to own her own home, to have a bookstore/bazaar, and to become a director of Unique brand product sales.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To purchase materials for making wood veneer doors.

description:
Betty es socia del Bancomunal San Juan
Betty es separada tiene 53 años, dos hijos de 31 y 18 años, el mayor esta casado y él ultima estudia en la universidad. Betty tiene un negocio de cabina de locutorio empego alquilando el teléfono de su casa a sus vecinos luego puso tres cabinas de locutorio 
Desde que comenzó en Finca tiene Seguridad de pertenecer por que puede seguir solicitando prestamos, le gusta los momentos de amistad en las reuniones 
Ella necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles para el  pago de  computadoras     
El sueño es tener un centro de computo e investigación.
description_translated:
Betty is a member of the community bank San Juan. She is separated and is 53 years old. She has two children, of 31 and 18 years of age. The eldest is married and the other is studying in university. Betty has a business of telephone booths, where she rents the telephone in her house to her neighbours, and has recently put in three telephone booths. Since she began with Finca, she has had the certainty of belonging, and so she is able to continue asking for loans. She likes the friendly moments in the meetings. She needs a loan of 1200 soles in order to pay for computers. Her dream is to have a computer and communications center.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To pay for computers

loan_name: Mrs. Mally Theom Village Bank Group
description:
Eighteen people who are all from Angkrang village in Kampong Cham province make up this village bank. Mrs. Mally T. is the village bank president. She is a Khmer cake seller, working in the local market. In her business, she now faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to buy ingredients to make the delicious food for her customers. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Mally T. decided to ask for a loan to buy the ingredients for her purpose. Her husband, Mr. Pho Hak, is a policeman who can make only a small salary to support the household. Mrs. Mally T. is 37 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is a driver while another one is a laborer and the youngest one is attending the local school.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Ten members have end-of-term (EoT) loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. EoT borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.
loan_use: to buy ingredients to make food for her customers
borrower_names: Sarin, Saren, Mally, Simorn, Sokhon, Ravy, Chantha, Chankosal, Ly, Salin, Chantho, Laiyheoun, Chamreurn, Savuth., Chantha, Srei Leap, Neang, Savy
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, male, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Mrs. Vin N. was born in 1978 and she now lives in Beong Veng village in Kampong Cham province. She has 3 hectares where she cultivates rice to earn a living. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because her field is infertile. To deal with this problem, Mrs. Vin N. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Nai Nat, is a pig breeder.

\r\n\r\nMrs. Vin N. is 30 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study because that child is only five years old. Her husband is also in the photo.
loan_use: to buy fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive

description:
Mrs. Sokkhoeun T., 33, and her husband, Mr. Senghout Chea, 37, live in a small village across the Mekong River, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1991 and have one daughter who attends school. The daughter assists her with weaving silk when she is free from her studies. Sokkhoeun also has her grandmother living with her.

Sokkhoeun has been a silk weaver for 19 years, a skill she learned from her grandmother. She sells her finished product to a middleman, who then takes it to re sell at the market in Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. Sokkhoeun has also been hired by the villagers to spin silk where she can earn extra income. Her husband has been a mechanic in Phnom Penh for a year.

Sokkhoeun is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase silk material for weaving and to buy a motorbike for her husband to drive to work.
loan_use: To purchase silk material for weaving and a motorbike.

description: Ray C., 46, is married with no children.  He has many years experience in the vegetable garden business. He sells to the general public and villagers six days per week.  He is also a good florist and makes money from this talent as well. Ray has had five previous loans with SPBD, which are his only access to capital because he has never been able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks. He plans to purchase Gromoxone and sting for his vegetable garden business.  The remainder of his loan will be used for purchasing iron roofing and sacks of cement for his house.
loan_use: Purchase Gromoxone and sting for vegetable garden business

description: Ane A., 37, is married and has two children.   Her husband is working in a mechanics shop, where they get money to improve the family finances.  Ane has two years experience selling chips to the villagers, public and families five days per week. She has had three previous loans with SPBD, which are her only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Ane plans to purchase bananas, peanut oil, salt, plastic bags, and flavorings for her chips business.
loan_use: Purchase bananas, peanut oil, salt, plastic bags, and flavorings for chips business

description:
Mrs. Sothim V. is a group leader of five women who all live in Phum Por village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. Her husband, Mr. Nim Savy, is a fisherman. He now faces a small problem because he does not have enough fishnets for his fishing. Thus, Mrs. Sothim V. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishnets for her husband's business. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. She is 28 years old and a mother of a child who is too young to work or study because that child is seven months old.

All the members in this group loan have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK (Kiva's Field Partner) has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.
loan_use: To buy more fishnets for her husband's business.

description: Asafa A. sells dry gin (ogogoro) in her neighborhood. She lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She has lots of customers that are patronizing her. She hopes to meet the demands of her customers. A. needs the loan amount of 50,000 NGN ($375 US) to purchase more local gin to sell. A. is 40 years old and married with four children. She says, "thank you to all that made this loan possible."
loan_use: To purchase more dry gin (ogogoro) to sell.

description:
Christine O., 33, lives in the village of Achuth in the Rongo District of Kenya. Christine is married to an accountant at the Kenyatta National Hospital. They have 3 children, 2 of whom are currently attending school. 
 
Christine runs a posho mill (a machine that grinds maize into flour) in Achuth, which she started in 2001. On a daily basis, Christine raises between 300-400 KSH. There is stiff competition in the area, as there are other posho mills around. 
 
In 2003, Christine started a second small business selling household items to the local community. She buys her inventory in bulk from Nairobi, where it is less expensive. 

With her two businesses, Christine is able to support her family by paying school fees and taking care of domestic expenses. Christine is rigorous in saving money so that she may soon purchase a parcel of land on which to start a poultry project.  

She is applying for a loan of KSH 22,500 ($USD 300) in order to have enough start-up capital for her dream of a poultry business. With the loan money, Christine will purchase at least 50 broiler chicks to raise and later sell.
loan_use: To purchase chickens

description: Edem is 39 years old and married with two children. Edem sells drinks in wholesale and retail to her customers. She loves this business because it is highly profitable. The demands for her drinks are high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She needs the loan amount of 140,000 NGN ($1,000 US) to purchase more drinks to sell. She says, "Thank you to Kiva lenders for their financial support."
loan_use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell.

description: Shola is 43 years old and divorced with two children. She sells crates of drinks and foodstuffs. Shola has been in this business since 2004.  She needs a loan of 140,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She thanks everyone who makes this loan possible. \r\n\r\n
loan_use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

description: Gataiala A., 54, is married with 10 children.  She has many years of experience selling vegetables and fruit. She sells to the villagers, the public, and families four days per week. She has four previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (about US$250).  SPBD loans are Gataiala’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. In addition to funding the growth of her business, part of the loan will be used to buy timber, cement, bricks, nails, and iron roofing for improving her living conditions. Gataiala and her husband also have a cattle farm that provides some income.
loan_use: Purchase chemicals and pesticides as well as fertilizers and vegetable seeds to maintain the growth of the business

description: Tusiata I., 25, is married with three children. She has 5 years of experience in the taro plantation business. She sells to people in the village 1 day a week. She is a new member of SPBD. Tusiata expects her weekly net cash flow to be 50 Tala (~$15USD). SPBD loans are Tusiata’s only access to capital because she was unable to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use the loan of $275 to expand her taro farming business.
loan_use: To expand her taro plantation

description: Fialupe P. is 29 years old, and married with 6 children.  She has one years of experience in the taro growing business. Besides growing taro, she sells to the people in her village and to the public one day every week. Fialupe is a member of SPBD and she has made a previous loan with this microbank.  With this, her second loan, she expects her weekly net cash flow to be around 50 Tala.  SPBD loans are Fialupe’s only access to business capital as she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.
loan_use: To purchase farming equipment and expand her taro planting

description: Sabah is a 51-year-old married woman with three children, living in Old Saida, southern Lebanon. She owns a small shop, where she sells cloth and gadgets to people in the surrounding neighborhoods. Sabah wants to buy cloth for a very good price, in order to increase her profit, therefore she is asking to borrow US$ 1,200.
loan_use: Buy cloth for re-sale

description: Loretta C. F., 28, is married with 2 children.  She has many years of experience in the sales business. She sells to the villagers and passing tourists 5 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 1500 Tala (~625 USD).\r\n\r\nSPBD loans are Loretta’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase a freezer and goods for the shop.
loan_use: Purchase freezer, herring, milk, twisties, spaghetti, coils, and oil

description: Ulata U., 30, is married with 2 children.  She has 2 years of experience in the pancakes, noodles, taro, and banana business. She sells to the village people and the public, and school children 5 days per week. She is a new member and this is her first loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 50 Tala.  SPBD loans are Ulata’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.
loan_use: expand her plantation and her canteen

description: Tineimu P., 20, is single with no children.  She has 1 year of experience in the puletasi (traditional long dresses), T-shirts, uniforms business. She sells to the village people and the public, and other families 3 days per week. She is a new member and this is her first loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 70 Tala (~ USD).  SPBD loans are Tineimu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.
loan_use: Purchase material to expand her sewing business

description: Foisaga F., 32, is single with no children. She has many years of experience in a plantation business. She sells to the villagers and general public 4 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 800 Tala (~333 USD). SPBD loans are Foisaga’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The usage of the loan is to purchase chemicals, gallons and seedlings for her plantation business.
loan_use: To purchase chemicals, gallons and seedlings

description: Peau K., 25, is married with 3 children. She has 2 years of experience in a chicken farm business. She sells to villagers and shops all around, 2 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD). SPBD loans are Peau’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy fencing, cement, roofing, timber and nails to build a shelter for the chickens to live in. Her husband is lending a helping hand to run the business.
loan_use: To purchase fencing, cement, roofing, timber and nails

description:
Mrs. Poeun M. lives in the Kanthorm village in Kampong Speu province. She is a farmer who owns a small plot of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. She is a 59-year-old widow with a child who is attending the local school. \r\n

\r\nThis family has only the income from their rice business, so they cannot provide a better life for the family. Thus, Mrs. Poeun M. is requesting a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business. She hopes to increase her income when she sells the cow.
loan_use: Buy a cow to start a breeding business

description: Dame I. Rachidatou est née le 20/06/1974 à Cotonou. Originaire de Cana dans le zou, elle a fréquenté jusqu'en classe de 6ème et abandonna sur sa propre volonté. Après son abandon des classes, elle aida sa tante dans la vente de divers articles de consommation. Elle s'est mise à son propre compte à l'àge de 25 ans et elle se livrait à la vente du gari, d'arachide grillé et ensuite a ajouté à cette activité la vente de divers d'autres articles de grande consommation: les conserves, les pâtes alimentaires, etc. Elle sollicite ce 2ème prêt pour renforcer son activité. Elle compte s'approvisionner en savons, conserves et les pâtes alimentaires. Elle est mariée à ADENKA Mamoudou et a 4 enfants.
description_translated:
Mrs. Rachidatou I. was born on June 20, 1974 in Cotonou. Originally from Cana in the Zou district, she attended school up to 7th grade and left off of her own accord. After she left school, she helped her aunt sell various consumables. At the age of 25, she struck out on her own and began selling gari (flour made from cassava) and grilled peanuts, and then began to sell other staples as well: tinned goods, pasta, etc. She is requesting this second loan to bolster her little business. She intends to stock up on soap, tinned goods, and pasta. She is married to Mamoudou Adenka and has four children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchasing 1/2 case of soap, 1/2 case of pasta, and 1/2 case of tinned goods

description: Dame K. Madeleine est née le 03/06/1979 à Cotonou. Elle a fréquenté jusqu'en classe de CM1 où elle abandonna de don propre gré. Elle alla 3 ans après en apprentissage de couture et reçut son diplôme après 4 ans de formation. Elle exerça le métier pendant 3 ans et abandonna au profit de la vente de poulet avec sa maman au marché dantokpa. Elle s'est ensuite mise dans la vente de lingerie, des tenues prêt à porter et divers d'autres articles. Elle sollicite ce 2ème prêt pour renforcer son activité. Elle compte s'approvisionner en chaussure, emballages sachets, huile végétale, riz. Mariée à SEHOUNON Marc, elle a des jumeaux Chadrac et Mechac.
description_translated:
Madeleine K. was born in Cotonou on June 3rd, 1979. She went to school until grade 4, at which time she chose to leave school. She apprenticed as a seamstress for three years and after four years of training, she received her diploma. She worked as a seamstress for three years, then decided to join her mother in selling chickens at the Dantokpa market. She then started selling lingerie, ready-to-wear clothing and various other articles. She is asking for this, her second loan, to bolster her business. She plans to purchase shoes, plastic bags, vegetable oil and rice. She is married to Marc Sehounon and is the mother of twins named Chadrac and Mechac.\r\n

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy 4 dozen shoes; 6 dozen plastic bags; 1-25kg bag of rice; 1-25L drum of vegetable oil.

description:
Nana Obeng A. lives in Agogo, a suburb of the Ashanti region, Ghana. His major occupation is crop farming. He's also a professional carpenter and makes all kinds of furniture including dinning sets, beds, chairs and coffins for over 3 years. He recently added coffins to his business to sell within his community after realizing families had to travel long distances to buy coffins for deceased relatives.  

Nana is 51 years old, married and father with seven children. Four of his children have successfully completed senior high school, and the other 3 are still in primary school. Lots of people in the community are amazed with his work and his good health. Nana is happy because he has work to do and is not idle.  
 
Nana requests a loan to buy more wood, nails, and coffins because the demand is very high. With the loan, Nana will be resourceful and use the loan wisely in his business so he can continue taking care of his family. He is grateful for your assistance.
loan_use: Nana wants a loan to buy wood, nails, and coffins

description: Ernestina A. is 54 years old. She is divorced and the mother of seven children. At the moment, four have completed senior high school. She sells baby clothes, Pampers, powder, napkins, detergents, feeding bottles, etc., through hawking. She balances her stock on her head and walks miles to her customers at their doorsteps to sell. She needs the loan the enable her to inject more capital into the business to make progress. She wants to use the loan to buy more supplies of baby clothes, napkins, Pampers, baby oil and detergents, to increase her stock and to make more income, to provide her children with a good education. Ernestina says she would be grateful for your assistance. With the loan she wants to save more to rent a store so that her burden of hawking would be minimized. This, she says, would also help her to support her kids at the university level.
loan_use: To buy more supplies of baby clothes, napkins, Pampers, baby oil, detergents and plastic materials

description:
La señorita Rosa Milagritos P. B. tiene 43 años, vive en Buenos Aires, distrito de Víctor Larco Herrera, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella es profesora de Educación Inicial, carrera que aun no ejerce porque esta realizando los trámites para su título, no tiene hijos.
Rosa tiene un locutorio, inicio su negocio con un pequeño teléfono fijo, con las ganancias obtenidas logro adquirir una cabina de madera, con el tiempo se hizo conocida y tiene mucha clientela que le ha permitido adquirir otra cabina  para su negocio que lo desarrolla en su propia casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Las Palmeras”, lo invirtió en la compra de una cabina.
Con el crédito de 1300 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en mejorar su local.
Rosa tiene el gran sueño de tener su propio jardín de niños.
description_translated:
Rosa Milagritos P. B. is 43 years old and lives in Buenos Aires, located in the Trujillo province of La Libertad, Perú. She is a primary school teacher, however does not pursue her career because she is continuing to work toward her degree. She does not have children. Rosa runs a “locutorio” (a phone service kiosk where people can come to make calls), having started with one phone. With her earnings, she was able to build a wood cublicle. Over time, she has become well-known and has a good customer base that has allowed her to purchase another cubicle. She runs her business out of her house. With the first loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles that she received from her cooperative bank “Las Palmeras”, she invested in the purchase of a cubicle. With the loan of 1,300.00 Peruvian soles, to be repaid in six months, she will invest in making improvements to her establishment. Rosa has a grand dream of one day having her own nursery school.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To make improvements to her phone call center.

description: Olga tiene 39 años, convive por 15 años con su pareja, tiempo que le ha permitido construir su casa y darles comodidad a sus hijos. Hace 5 años estuvo dedicada a la venta de pollos y en horas de la tarde vendía de productos de la marca Unión, la cual produce panes y variedades de queques y pasteles, pero exactamente hace dos años se propuso a dedicarse solo a la venta de estos productos, porque todo este tiempo le ha servido para hacer clientela y por ello han aumentado sus pedidos. Olga empieza a visitar a sus clientes a partir de las 7.00am, y así continúa hasta 10.00am, luego regresa a casa para cocinar los alimentos para su esposo e hijos, y luego, nuevamente a las 3.00 de la tarde empieza con las cobranzas hasta las 8.00pm. A Olga le agrada conversar con sus clientes acerca de las bondades de su producto, y de paso les va dando una orientación acerca de nutrición y alimentación, ella está muy contenta de vender estos productos, ya que le es muy rentable, además tiene plazos para que pueda pagar su cuenta a la promotora que le proporciona la mercadería. Olga viene trabajando con su banco comunal durante casi 3 años, este es su sexto préstamo con MFP, y al momento de solicitar dicho crédito ha renovado su promesa de pagar todas sus cuotas. Con este dinero comprará panteones, postre tradicional que vende por navidad e inicios de año, el resto de meses ofrece panes y pasteles.  \n
description_translated:
Olga, 39, has lived for 15 years with her partner, allowing her to build her house and make her children comfortable. She had sold chickens for the last 5 years, and in the afternoon she sold Unión brand products, such as breads, cakes, and pastries. Exactly two years ago she decided to exclusively sell these products, because in all that time she had built up her clientele and increased her orders. Olga starts visiting her clients at 7:00am until 10:00am, then she returns to her house to cook food for her husband and children, and then again at 3:00pm she works on collections until 8:00pm. Olga enjoys talking with her clients about the benefits of her product, along the way giving them information about nutrition and healthy foods. She is so happy to be selling these products, it is very profitable for her, as well as that she is able to pay her bill to the merchandise distributor in installments. Olga has been working with her communal bank for almost 3 years, and this will be her sixth loan through MFP. At the time she requested this loan, she renewed her commitment to pay every payment. With this money she will buy "panteones", a traditional dessert sold at Christmastime and New Years, and the breads and pastries she sells the rest of the year.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To increase the quantity of merchandise she has to sell

description: Leticia, de 25 años convive hace 8 años con su pareja, es madre de tres hijos, y hace unos meses atrás acaba de construir su propia casa. Es una ama de casa muy dedicada, cada día prepara el almuerzo de su esposo y eso de las 11.00am lo envía en el transporte de la empresa minera donde labora su esposo, hace como un año atrás incursionó en la venta de productos de belleza y le está yendo muy bien, cada vez aumenta su clientela. El deseo de Leticia es crecer en su negocio para contar con su propio capital de reserva, ya que a veces cuando sus clientes no le han pagado a tiempo, tiene que recurrir al dinero que le deja su esposo para luego reponerlo, pero ella prefiere tener sus propios recursos, por lo que se está esforzando mucho. Además, está muy contenta de dedicarse solo a las labores domésticas, sino que también se considera una mujer útil, ya que de sus ganancias con la venta de cosméticos puede solventar los gastos de sus hijos. Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP, y durante este tiempo ha demostrado ser muy responsable en sus pagos, también está muy agradecida con las personas que hacen posible su obtención del crédito. Con el dinero que solicita pagará los pedidos de la caja de cosméticos mensual, de ese modo podrá empezar a juntar su propio capital de trabajo.
description_translated:
Leticia, 25, has lived with her partner for 8 years, is the mother of three children, and several months ago completed the construction of her own house. She is a dedicated homemaker, preparing lunch every day for her husband to send at 11:00am on the mining transport to where her husband works. About a year ago she started selling beauty products, which is going well for her, with a steadily increasing clientele. Leticia's desire is to grow her business so she can have her own cash reserves, since sometimes when her clients don't pay her on time, she has to use the money given to her by her husband and later to replace it--she would prefer to have her own reserves, which she is working hard towards. She is very content to spend her time in her own household, but she also considers herself to be a practical woman, since her earnings from the cosmetic sales cover her children's expenses. This is her sixth loan through MFP, and during this time she has shown herself to be very responsible in her payments. She is very grateful to the persons who make it possible for her to obtain her loans. With the money she is requesting, she will pay her monthly bill for her box of cosmetics, and will be able to begin accumulating her own working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To pay her last cosmetics invoice

description:
Gifty Acquah is thirty-seven years old. She is divorced and a mother of four children: two boys and two girls. She lives with her children in a business community called Nkawkaw in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Some of her children are in the senior high school while others are in the junior high school. Gifty says she is the sole provider for her children’s needs. She says her ex-husband cares less about the children’s upbringing. She therefore works very hard to meet the children’s needs and, most importantly, to pay their school fees.

\r\n\r\n

Gifty sells vegetables of all kinds, like tomatoes, peppers, onions, and garden eggs. She sells on a table top in front of her house. She says her target customers are the people in her community who walk all the way to the market everyday to buy such products. She buys from Kumasi and at times from farmers who come who to sell in the local market. She has been in business for ten years. Gifty wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase her profit margin.
loan_use: To buy goods in bulk, like boxes of tomatoes.

description:
Janet D. is forty years old. She is married and has three children. All her children have completed senior high school and are yet to continue their schooling. She lives with her husband and family in a business town called Nkawkaw in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants are engaged in commercial activities.

Janet’s husband is a farmer. He cultivates oranges and palm nuts. Janet is in the business of palm oil production. She buys the palm nuts from local farmers in addition to what they harvest from her husband’s farm. She processes them at her house to produce the oil and sells at wholesale prices to her customers. She has been in business for eight years.

Palm oil is a local vegetable oil produced from the fruit of a palm tree which has been cooked, pounded, sieved and boiled for hours. The reddish substance (the oil) is skimmed off and boiled again to expel any water content. Janet desires to use the loan to expand her business by buying the palm fruit in bulk to be able to supply more customers.
loan_use: To procure palm nuts in bulk

description:
Alice A. is thirty-seven years old. She is married with two children, both girls. Both of her children are currently in junior high school. Alice says her husband is a farmer. He cultivates crops such as oranges and palm nuts in the community in which they live. She is an entrepreneur. She sells provisions such as milk, sugar, bread, and vegetables such as tomatoes, peppers, onions, etc.

\r\n\r\n Alice sells on a tabletop in front of her house. She has been in business for over fifteen years. Alice says she buys her goods from Kumasi and at times, from the wholesalers in her community. It is her dream to expand her business by acquiring a store to sell out of. She wants a loan to procure goods in bulk from the big cities where the cost is economical.
loan_use: To buy provisions and vegetables in bulk

description:
Vera is married and has two children. She is a very kind and hard working person. She sells electronic home equipment like tea castles, coffee makers, irons, and so on. She has invested 15,000 UAH in her goods; her profit is 2,000 UAH per month.

Vera has been in this business for four years. She rented a kiosk at the central market in hopes of selling even more electronic home equipment. Her good location at the market, and Vera's good character has helped her to attract many clients and increase her sales.

Vera would like a loan of 3,000 UAH for two months. She needs to increase the assortment of her inventory, so she can provide better choices to her clients. Additional income will help Vera to take better care of her family.
loan_use: Increase assortment of inventory

description: Adelaida tiene 44 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a su bodega, notó que este negocio era una buena oportunidad porque cerca de su casa está el paradero de una empresa de transportes, entonces, los conductores siempre buscan alimentos para consumir durante el día, así fue como Adelaida y su esposo decidieron juntar de sus ahorros y abrir una tienda, la cual empezó  con poca mercadería, pero que con el paso del tiempo se ha venido acrecentando, es por ello que Adelaida  tienes planes de seguir creciendo en su negocio, ya que contribuye a la educación de sus hijos, que son lo más importante para ella. Por el momento su dificultad radica en que están reparando la pista donde se ubica su casa y momentáneamente el paradero de los transportistas ha cambiado, pero pronto cuando la pista esté terminada, volverán a su anterior ubicación. Es la primera vez que Adelaida solicita un préstamo con MFP, fue invitada a formar parte de su banco comunal  porque vieron en ella sus deseos de superación y la responsabilidad con que maneja sus cuentas. Con este dinero invertirá en la compra de más productos para su tienda, adquirirá yogurt y otras bebidas, por paquete al por mayor, valorizado en 50 soles cada uno, también comprará sacos de menestra, de arroz y de azúcar, y otros productos adicionales.
description_translated:
Adelaida is a 44-year-old woman who lives with her husband and 2 children. Her general store has been in business for three years. She noticed that this business was a good opportunity for her because there is a bus stop for a transportation company near her house, and the drivers are always looking for food to eat throughout the day. Thus, Adelaida and her husband decided to put their savings together and open a general store. It started out with only a few goods, but as time went by, it has grown. Adelaida would like to keep expanding her business because it contributes to the education of her children—the most important people in her life. The problem she is currently facing is that the road on which both her house and the bus stop is located is being repaired, but when the road work is finished, the drivers will once again come through there. This is the first time that Adelaida requests a loan from MFP. She was invited to join her microfinance institute because her desire for self-improvement and her responsibility in managing her finances are evident. She will invest this loan in purchasing more goods for her general store. She will purchase yogurt and other drinks in wholesale bulk, which cost 50.00 PEN each, as well as sacks of legumes, rice and sugar, among other products.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Increase goods

description:
Konstantin is divorced. He lives in Kherson, in the southern part of Ukraine. Konstantin sells bikes and accessories in the local Dneprovskyi market. He offers a good assortment of inventory and the quality of all his stock is always the best. Konstantin has been in this business for 6 years. He has about 21,000 Grivnas invested in his business. His monthly income is about 5,000 Grivnas.

Konstantin is very disciplined, responsible, and accurate in every activity he takes on. He likes healthy competition but would never envy the success of his fellow businessmen who work in the same sphere of business. His competitors talk about him as a competent, respectful, and balanced entrepreneur. Konstantin is seeking a 5,000 Grivna loan to purchase additional merchandise for his vending kiosk, expecting to increase his income as a result.
loan_use: purchase additional merchandise

description:
Pavlo is married and has a one-year-old daughter. Their family lives in Drogobych. Pavlo runs a small business offering vehicle refurbishment services and further sales of used cars. His business is located in one of the local car markets. Pavlo works with his brother who drives used cars from England and then leaves them at Pavlo’s shop for refurbishment. After Pavlo is done fixing and adding polishing touches to a car, it’s ready to be re-sold in Ukraine. Pavlo has been in this business for 2 years. His income was about 15,000 Grivnas before the financial crisis hit Ukraine very hard.

Pavlo is seeking a 5,000 Grivna loan to fix a car for further re-sale. He is happy to have followed his brother’s advice to start this business. Pavlo believes he can apply his technical skills and work in the sphere of vehicles which has always been his passion. Pavlo is really good with all his clients. They all recommend him as a competent and skillful technician and are satisfied with the refurbished cars he had sold them.
loan_use: fix a car for re-sale

description: El negocio de papelería de la señora Veronica Sanchez le esta haciendo falta mas mercancía de artículos escolares, es por eso que solicita un préstamo para poder invertir en el negocio y así tener mas variedad de productos.\nDoña Veronica Sanchez es madre soltera y tiene bajo su responsabilidad a dos hijos de edad escolar y así su mama que le ayuda atender el negocio cundo ella no esta. Esta solicitando este crédito para poder tener más ingresos en su negocio ya que es la fuente de ingresos de su familia.\n
description_translated:
Ms. Veronica Sanchez has an office supply store and she needs more school supplies, so she is asking for a loan to invest in her business and thereby have a greater variety of products. Veronica Sanchez is a single mother and is responsible for two school-aged children. Her mother helps her with the store when Veronica is unable to be there. She is asking for this loan in order to be able to have greater income in her business as it is the source of her family’s income.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Buy merchandise for her store

description: Agnes T. is married and has 4 dependants. She has received no formal education. Agnes sells charcoal, groceries and other food supplies like maize and groundnut at Elmina, which she has done since 1998. Her husband is a fisherman. Agnes uses her income to support her husband with paying rent, utility bills and other basic family expenses. Agnes will use the loan as additional capital to purchase food items and charcoal for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Agnes plans to save towards a house she wants to build with her husband for the family.
loan_use: Additional capital to increase her purchases of food stuffs and charcoal for resale.

description:
Ira is a single mom. She raises her son on her own and works really hard to meet all the needs of their family and pay her bills. Ira lives in Novomoskovsk and sells jean clothing in the central marketplace.  Ira has been running this business for 15 years. 

Some of her strongest entrepreneurial characteristics are integrity and consistency. Ira is very determinedand she tries to stay optimistic in every situation. She is seeking a loan of $1025 to purchase assorted inventory to help her build her sales.
loan_use: To purchase assorted inventory

description: Aminata F. est une femme mariée. Elle souhaite avec ce prêt acheter des tissus afin d’en faire des robes qu’elle va vendre. Elle projette aussi de préparer de l’encens traditionnel afin de le commercialiser. Cette activité va lui permettra de  mieux améliorer les conditions de vie familiales.
description_translated:
Aminata F. is married. She will use this loan to buy cloth which she will make into dresses and then sell. She also plans to make traditional incense to sell. In this way she will improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy cloth to make dresses and then sell as well as make incense for resale.

description: La dame Fatou N. est mariée, mère de 07 enfants. Elle veut avec ce prêt faire un petit commerce de différents produits d’entretien ménagers. Cette activité lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie de s progéniture.
description_translated:
Mrs. Fatou N. is married and has seven children. She is asking for this loan to start a small business selling a variety of household cleaning products. This will allow her to improve her children's living conditions.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy a variety of household cleaning products in bulk to sell retail.

description:
Fredy O. se destaca en el Mercado Central de la ciudad de León en su negocio de venta de refrescos como lo son  gaseosas, jugos y agua los cuales él mismo comercializa con mucho esfuerzo y con dedicación ambulantemente por las calles de dicho mercado y en su bicilceta.

La razón por la cual el señor Fredy O. ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel es para ser beneficiado con un crédito que le permita la compra de las bebidas y por esto espera muy confiadamente en que su crédito sea otorgado y así bridar las condiciones de vida necesaria a su familia.
description_translated:
Fredy O. is well known in the central market in León in his business selling drinks like sodas, juices, and water, which he markets with much effort and dedication as a street vendor and on his bike. The reason Fredy O. has looked for the support of Ceprodel, a Kiva partner, is to receive a loan which will allow him to buy these drinks. For this he hopes his loan will be granted so he can offer the quality of life necessary for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase of sodas, juices, and water

description: En el grupo "Virgen de Caguay" esta representado por la señora Jacinta, dentro del grupo existe un parentesco consanguíneo entre la señora Giovanna uy el señor Iván ellos son hermanos pero ambos tienen ingresos totalmente independientes uno del otro. Los socios (as) tienen diferentes actividades comerciales como la venta de comida, carne roja,  jugos caseros, frutas, transporte público, venta de alfombras y cosméticos. El crédito esta destinado al incremento de mercadería e insumos para la venta así como al mejoramiento de las herramientas de trabajo. La mayoría de los socios cuentan con buenos antecedentes crediticios en otras entidades financieras por lo que conocen de grupos solidarios, en general alguno de los miembros del grupo ya trabajaron con la fundación Agrocapital demostrando responsabilidad y cumpliendo a la hora de los pagos del financiamiento
description_translated:
The group "Virgen de Caguay" is represented by Jacinta. Two members of the group are related: Giovanna and Iván are siblings but their incomes are entirely independent. The members have a variety of businesses: food sales, red meat, homemade juices, public transportation, carpet sales and cosmetics\' sales. The loan will be used to buy more goods and foodstuffs for resale as well as to improve the tools for work. Most of the members have a good credit history with other financial institutions known as solidarity groups. Some of the group members have already worked with Agrocapital and shown that they are responsible, having repaid previous loans on time.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Working capital
borrower_names: FRANZ, EMILIANA, NICOLASA, CATALINA, FRANCISCA, ALBERTO HENRY, ALAIN IVAN, LOURDES GLORIA, GIOVANNA GIOVANKA, ALICIA, JUAN MAXIMO, PAULINA, JACINTA, INES ROSARIO
borrower_genders: male, female, female, female, female, male, male, female, female, female, male, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, false, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Margret N. (2nd from the left) is a hard-working and determined businesswoman. She is 28 years old, married and the loving mother of 4 children who are all in school. Margret sells cereals in Pallisa market. She buys her stock from the village farmers in her locality. The profit she earns from sales is approximately 20%.

\r\n\r\nShe is using the loan to boost her business by purchasing beans, peas, rice, maize, and groundnuts. The rest of her group members sell cereals, too. Margret's dream is to open up a wholesale store for cereals within Pallisa town. She also hopes that her business will enable her to see her children through school.
loan_use: Purchasing beans, peas, rice, maize, and groundnuts for re-sale

description: S. Annet is the member of Kisimba in Lugazi. She is a hard working and devoted lady with a drugstore business selling medicines like panadols, anti-malarial syrups and tablets, in the service of the people in her locality. She has been in her lending group for 5 years and her reason for joining was to boost her drugstore's business. With her profits, Annet has been able to buy 2 cows that produce milk, a number of goats including young ones, plus a bicycle that she uses to collect grass for her animals. She has a plan of buying a plot of land, once she is able to accumulate enough savings. Her children are able to go to school and she is happy with where she is now. She needs a loan to help with buying more medicines, syringes, needles, cotton wool and others items to restock her store.
