loan_use: To buy more medicines, syringes, needles, cotton wool and other items for restocking her drugstore.

description: Ndèye Badji Sané, 54 ans est mariée avec 07 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Boucotte Peyrissac depuis 7 ans et demi. Son activité consiste à  acheter et revendre du jus de citron et de l’huile de palme .Elle achète en Guinée pour revendre à Dakar. Ndèye veut renforcer son commerce pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.  Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
description_translated:
Ndèye Badji Sané, 54 years old, is married and cares for seven children. She has been a member of the Boucotte Peyrissac village bank for seven and a half years. She buys and sells lemon juice and palm oil. She travels to Guinée to buy and sells in Dakar. Ndèye wants to strengthen her business in order to improve her family's living conditions. The loan she is requesting will be repaid in a lump sum at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy and resell lemons and palm oil.

description:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Mariam W. from Mwanza. She is married with two children, 7 and 11 years old. Mariam has been running a poultry ("kuku") business. Raising "kuku" is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst our borrowers. Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. Firstly, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiply naturally! Secondly, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Thirdly, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein.

Mariam has been in this business since 2000 and her business is doing well. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 7 days per week, and is assisted by one employee. Mariam W. currently earns about US$ 250 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of US$ 400 in order to continue with her poultry business. Mariam thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.
loan_use: To buy 200 chicks

description:
Hilaria trabaja preparando comida a pedido. Es decir, ella prepara y reparte comida a obreros que trabajan en obras cercanas a su casa.

Hace tres años ella ayudaba a atender en la tienda de una prima suya, hasta que una amiga la motivo a tener un negocio propio. Hilaria se animó a invertir en el negocio de la comida porque se dio cuenta de que habían muchas fábricas por su casa. Ella vende almuerzos y le dedica toda la mañana a ello.

Por las tardes eventualmente ella continua ayudando a su prima con la atención de la tienda; sin embargo, cada vez que puede también prepara picarones (postre peruano) para venderlos fuera de su casa.

Gracias a su empeño por conseguir siempre recursos con los cuales mantener a su pequeña familia, ha logrado ser padre y madre para su hijo que hoy ya tiene diecinueve años.
description_translated:
Hilaria works making food on demand. She makes and delivers food to workers near by her home. Three years ago, she used to help at a store owned by one of her cousins, until a friend encouraged her to open her own Business. Hilaria, then, decided to do so and invested her savings on this food business as she figured it was a good idea to sell lunch packs to the workers at the factories near by. She devotes all morning to prepare these meals. In the evenings, she still helps her cousin taking care of the store. She also makes special Peruvian deserts called “picarones” for sale. Thanks to her performance, she has always managed to obtain the resources to support her small family. Hilaria is a single mother with a 19 year old son.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Pay for her son's undergraduate studies

description:
Desde hace cinco años Glacida Q. se dedica al a venta de ropa. No tiene una tienda, por lo que ella debe salir a ofrecer puerta por puerta. Felizmente, con el tiempo, se ha hecho concocida entre sus amigos y eventualmente recibe visitas de algunos cleintes en su propio domicilio.

Antes ella trabajaba como niñera, sin embargo, una vez que tugvo a sus dos hijos ya no tenia quienlos cuidara mientras ella se ausentaba, es asi quele nace la idea de vender ropa cerca de su casa. Gracias a su trabajo ella no solo mantiene a sus doshijos si no tambien a su papá, que vive con ellos.

Poco a poco ella cree ensu negocio, pero aun le faltamuchopor crecer, es por ello que ella requierede un préstamo, para poder comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería.
description_translated:
Glacida Q. has worked selling clothes for five years. She doesn't have a store, so she has to go selling them door-to-door. Happily, over time she has become known among her friends and eventually has come to receive visits from some clients in her own home. Previously she worked as a nanny, but once she gave birth to her two children she didn't have anyone to take care of them while she was away. That's how the idea of selling clothing near her house came to her. Thanks to her work she is able to support not only her two children but also her father, who lives with them. Little by little her business is growing, but it still has a lot of growing to do. That's why she needs a loan, to be able to buy a larger quantity of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Buy merchandise and open a store in her house

description: Jhudy, de 25 años está conviviendo cerca de 10 años con su pareja,  es madre de dos hijos que son la adoración de ella y de su esposo, viven en su propia casa que hace poco lograron construir. Cuando empezó a convivir con su pareja decidieron en cultivar las tierras de sus padres, y empezaron sembrando plantones de frutos cítricos y plátanos, todo este tiempo abonaron y fumigaron sus plantas para cosechar buenos frutos, y así pasaron los cuatro primeros años necesarios para que las plantas den buenos frutos, aquella vez fue su primera cosecha, y les fue muy bien, tanto que le alcanzó para comprar su terreno y con las ganancias de las siguientes cosechas construyeron su casa. Desde entonces pusieron un negocio de venta de abarrotes en su casa, donde ahora ella se dedica a la atención desde las 6.00am hasta 10.00pm, y cuando tiene que realizar las compras se va a la ciudad a 5.00am para alcanzar comprar su larga lista de los requerimientos para su bodega, y luego tiene que regresar de prisa para atender a sus clientes. Con esta actividad Jhudy está muy contenta y sobre todo porque le agrada conversar y dar un buen trato a sus clientes, ya que son ellos quienes producen sus ganancias. Mientras tanto su esposo sigue dedicándose a la agricultura, en tiempo de cosecha, en horas de la tarde ella también le apoya en preparar la carga, de ese modo trabajan en armonía con anhelos de progresar, mientras haya juventud, dice Jhudy. Durante su primer préstamo ocupó el cargo de secretaria en su banco comunal, ahora, en este, su segundo crédito se compromete nuevamente a pagar con la misma responsabilidad con que lo hacía anteriormente. El dinero que solicita es para incrementar la mercadería de su bodega con bebidas, para que de este modo tenga acumulado su capital en estos productos que son los más demandados.
description_translated:
Jhudy, aged 25, has been living with her partner for around 10 years. She is the mother of two children who are the apple of her and her husband's eye. They live in their own home which they recently managed to finish building. When she began to live with her partner, they decided to cultivate their parents' lands, and they began to sow citrus fruit plants and bananas. They fertilised and fumigated the plants all the time in order to harvest good fruits and the four years necessary for the plants to mature and bear fruit passed in this way. Their harvest went very well, so much so that they managed to buy a plot of land and with the profits from following harvests they built their house. Since then they have set-up a grocery-store business in their house, where she now works from 6am to 10pm, and when she has to buy stock she heads to the town at 5am in order to buy the long list of merchandise she needs for her store, and then she has to hurry back in order to wait on her customers. Judy is very content with this activity, above all because she likes to talk and provide her customers with good service, as its they who provide her profits. While her husband still works in agriculture,during the harvesy she also helps to prepare the loads during the afternoon, and in this way they work in harmony with a desire to keep progressing while they are still young, says Jhudy. During the time of her first loan she acted as secretary of the Community Bank and now, with this second loan she promises again to repay it with the same responsibility as last time. The money she is asking for will be to increase the stock in her store with drinks, because in this way she will have put her capital into the products most in demand.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Increase her grocery-store's stock

description: Mrs. B. is a grocery seller out of her house in Krangpophlaek Village in Pursat Province, Cambodia. She sells a variety of products such as food ingredients, cakes, candy, oils, pork, etc. She is married to Sophat, 43, who is a rice farmer. And she has five children, two of whom are married. \r\n\r\nIn order to grow her business, to increase  her grocery inventory, B. would like to ask for a loan to purchase more grocery inventory to sell. She expects the loan will improve her business and income.
loan_use: to purchase more grocery inventory to sell

description:
Mary A. started selling fish eight years ago in a village in a suburb of Nkawkaw, in the eastern region of Ghana, where she lives. Mary prepares and serves her customers very tasty and good quality fish and many customers buy from her stand. 

She is 52 years old and is married with four children who are currently in school. She wants to use the loan to buy more assorted fishes to increase her sales and income and to support her children’s education and business growth.

Mary buys her fish in Afram Plains directly from the fisher. This helps her to avoid the middlemen who sell at higher prices. She is requesting a loan to buy more fish, because the more she buys, the lower is the cost of each fish. 

Mary belongs to a village bank called ‘Asetenapa,’ which means "good living." She hopes to receive GH¢500 to help her business progres and she would be grateful for your support.
loan_use: To buy more smoked fish

description:
Munavvar N. is 45 years old. She is married and has a child. Munavvar has a grocery store which she attends to herself, aside from caring for her family and her home. She began her business 4 years ago with financial support from her husband. The reason for starting the business was to increase her family’s income and the business has been gradually growing ever since.

In order to grow her business still further, Munawar is requesting a loan of 2500 Somoni (725 US Dollars). Munavvar is planning to spend the loan on purchasing more goods to sell, thus increasing the range of goods of her grocery. She promises to repay her loan within 6 months and thanks everybody who decides to support her.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
loan_use: Purchasing goods to expand her inventory

description: Soledad tiene 35 años, es casada, vive en una casa arrendada con su esposo y sus hijas. Vende cosméticos desde hace un año, incursionó en este negocio debido a la necesidad de generarse más ingresos económicos, empezó con poca mercadería, pero con el avance del tiempo pudo mejorar sus ingresos, ahora se está preparando para la próxima campaña de ventas, por lo que necesita abastecerse de cosméticos para empezar a buscar a sus amistades y personas cercanas a quienes pueda vender sus productos mostrando previamente sus catálogos, así como los muestrarios. Soledad se está preparando en reunir capital para invertirlo en otro negocio como la venta de ropa. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está satisfecha por la labor que realiza dentro de su banco comunal, además, es una de las integrantes que alienta a los demás a seguir trabajando juntos. Soledad está solicitando esta cantidad para usarla en su totalidad en la compra de cosméticos.
description_translated:
Soledad is 35 years old, married, and lives in a rented house with her husband and daughters. She has been selling cosmetics for a year. She started this business because she needed to make more money. Initially, she had only a little merchandise but with time she earned more and is now getting ready for the next sales campaign. She needs to start sourcing cosmetics and samples so that she can show her friends and people close to her to whom she may sell her products and to whom she has already shown her catalogues. Soledad is getting ready to raise funds to invest in another business, such as selling clothes. This is her second loan with MFP. She enjoys the ongoing work with her community bank, and is one of the members who encourages the other to continue working together. Soledad is asking for this loan to buy cosmetics exclusively.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To increase her stock of cosmetics.

description:
Mr. Chann S. lives in Chrork Rom Deng village in Kampong Cham province. He is a bed maker. Since this business is going well, he wants to make a lot of beds to reach his customers’ demand. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy more lumber to make beds to sell.

\r\n\r\n His wife, Mrs. Chaem Roeun, is a housewife. Mr. Chann S. is 31 years old and the father of a child who is attending the local school. His wife is also in the photo.
loan_use: to buy more lumber to make beds to sell

description: 36-year-old K. is a resident of Banteay Meanchey Province. She works as both a cultivator and a seamstress in her village. For eight years, she has been sewing clothes, a skill she learned from her grandmother. Her husband, Mr. Dong Seum, 43, works at the CMAC Organization earning $180 a month to support his family. K. is asking for a loan of $1000 to build a well at her home. She hopes this will help her expand her business, as well as improve her family's living conditions.
loan_use: To build a well

description: Mrs. Horn H. is a villager in Kdey Tnaut village in Takeo province. She is a duck breeder. Since her business of breeding ducks is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducks and duck food. \r\n\r\nHer husband, Mr. Tim Ken, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a motorbike taxi driver. Mrs. Horn H. is a 32-year-old mother of four children, two of whom are attending the local school while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is on the left of the photo.
loan_use: To buy more ducks and duck food.

description:
Samuel O. is twenty-nine years old. He is married and has no child at the moment. His wife is a hairdresser by profession. Sammy and his wife reside in Somanya in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Somanya is the native town of a tribe in Ghana called the ‘Krobos’. Though people of other tribes have migrated there as a result of their occupations, the Krobos are the dominant people in this land.

Samuel is a commercial driver. He owns a mini-bus which he uses as commercial transport. He conveys passengers and goods from his community to Accra and its environs. He has been driving for twelve good years and is full of rich experiences. Sammy says he wants a loan to repair his car so as to keep it in good working condition. It is his dream to put aside savings enough to buy a new and bigger bus.
loan_use: To repair his commercial vehicle

description:
Nor Mohammad is the group leader of Nor Mohammad Qaleen baf group. There are four members in this group. All of them would like to make a group loan for their businesses.

Bazally and Raza jan want to take a loan out for their business of tailoring. They want to buy a new machine for their business. Arozo wants a loan for her business of carpet weaving. She wants to buy supplies of basic materials for her business. Khier Begom would like the loan for her "in house bakery"  as she wants to increase her stock. Together, they are requesting a loan of 40000 Afghani for the term of 8 months.

With this loan they can increase the size of their businesses and support their families,  making a better future for themselves and there families.
loan_use: to buy supplies of basic materials for her business
borrower_names: Bazally, Arozo, Raza jan, Khier begom

description:
Lallagha is the group leader of the Lallagha group. There are four members in this group. They each want to take a loan for his/her own business.

Abdul Malek and Shima want to take out a loan for their general stores; they want to make their shops larger. Also, Raza Gall wants to take out a loan for her business of tailoring. She wants to buy a new sewing machine for her shop and complete her stock. Leena wants to take a loan for her brother’s business; he has a general store. He wants to buy necessary materials for his shop.

With this loan they can expand their businesses and support their families and make a better future for their families. They are really happy with this small loans process in this poor country.
loan_use: buy necessary materials for their shops
borrower_names: Abdul Malek, Shima, Raza Gall, Leena

description: Adeyeyin M. sells kerosene wholesale and retail to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time.  She hopes to expand this business through this Kiva loan. She learned this business from her mother. She needs the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more kerosene to sell. She is 49 years old and married with five children. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.
loan_use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

description:
Le groupe Bendiya de l’association Sabaly kimparana est constitué de 4 femmes qui se connaissent il y’a des années pour la pratique de la même activité. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et ont chacune 4 enfants au moins et vivent dans des familles traditionnelles dans la préfecture de San, région de Ségou(quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Vendeuses de condiments alimentaires, pour transformer leurs rêves en réalité ces femmes avaient besoin d’un appui financier. C’est ainsi qu’elles ont sollicité Soro Yiriwaso depuis 3 ans maintenant. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt après le remboursement intégral des 4 précédents. Elles se procurent des marchandises au marché de kimparana en gros et revendent en détail sur place, à la maison et devant la porte de leurs maisons.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter des sacs d’oignons de piments et divers condiments avec les paysans pour les revendre.
Les membres du groupe Bendiya se propose d’avoir un bénéfice de 90 000 FCFA chacun avec ce prêt.
le bénéfice obtenu sera utilisé pour rembourser l’intérêt du prêt et faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille. 
Dans les jours à venir les membres du groupe Bendiya veulent renforcer leur partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’avoir un montant de prêt élevé et diversifier les marchandises.
description_translated:
The "Bendiya" group of the Sabaly Kimparana association is made up of four women who have known one another for many years as they have the same type of business. They average 40 years of each and each have at least four children and live in traditional families in the San Prefecture, in the region of Ségou in Mali. They sell condiments. In order to make their dreams come true, these women need financial help. This is why they have been working with Soro Yiriwaso for three years now. This is their fifth loan, having repaid all four previous loans in full. They buy their goods in bulk at the market of Kimparana and retail them in the same market, from home and in front of their homes. This current loan will be used to buy bags of onions, peppers and various condiments from farmers to resell. The "Bendiya" group members expect to make a profit of 90,000 FCFA each thanks to this loan. The profits will be used to pay back the interest on the loan and to contribute to the household expenses. In the future, the members of this group want to reinforce their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso in order to borrow a greater amount and diversify their merchandise.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy seasonings/condiments.

description: Amilcar tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero, aún está viviendo en la casa de sus padres, sus demás hermanos ya migraron a otras ciudades. Cuando sus hermanos se fueron a vivir a otras ciudades se hizo cargo de todos los sembríos, tanto de su padre como los propios. Amilcar comenta que gracias a su madre a aprendió a ser responsable, ahora trata de cumplir en realizar el trabajo de las chacras de sus padres y de él mismo con gran responsabilidad. En esta oportunidad quiere incrementar sus siembras de papa con la siembra de más de 10 sacos de semilla, y también una bolsa de semilla de arvejas, para el próximo mes tiene preparada su chacra para sembrar maíz para su consumo propio. Labrar la tierra le complace enormemente, lo dificultad es cuando el mercado no cotiza un buen precio a los productos, y muchas veces con las justas llega a recuperar lo invertido. Amilcar ingresó a su banco comunal por recomendación de un cliente antiguo de ese banco, y en sus préstamos solicitados no ha caído en morosidad. Con el dinero que está solicitando es para la compra de un saco de semilla de arvejas y de abono para la chacra de papa.
description_translated:
Amilcar is 25 years old; he is single and still living in his parents' home. All his brothers have moved to other cities. When his brothers moved away, he took on the responsibility for all the crops: those of his father and well as his own. Amilcar says that thanks to his mother he learned to be responsible. He is trying to do the work on his parents' farm as well as his own with great responsibility. He wants to take this opportunity to increase his potato crops by sowing more than 10 bags of seed as well as a bag of seed of peas, and to prepare his farm to sow corn for his own consumption next month. He is very happy to work the land; it is hardest when the market does not pay well for his products and many times he just breaks even. Amilcar joined his community bank at the recommendation of a long-standing client of this bank, and he has repaid his loans on time. He will use the loan monies to buy a bag of pea seeds and fertilizer for his potato farm.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

description: Rosa tiene 40 años, vive con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos quienes la animan  a seguir adelante. Ella vende postres (piononos, chifón, y otras variedades de dulces) y panes integrales de una marca muy reconocida en su región que le deja los productos a consignación. Se dedica a esta actividad hace 2 años, repartiendo por los distintos lugares de su zona a sus diferentes clientes. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que muchas personas degustan de estos dulces, además conoce muchos lugares y socializa, ya tiene una buena gama de clientes y solo trabaja a pedido. Este es su 6to préstamo con MFP, y con el dinero solicitado comprará más dulces, también adquirirá una vitrina para exhibirlos de manera segura.
description_translated:
Rosa is 40 years old, and lives with her husband and their four children who inspire her to get ahead. She sells pastries such as piononos (bite-sized cream-filled pastries), chiffon cakes and other types of sweets, and whole grain breads of a well-known brand name in her region that are left on consignment. She has been dedicated to this work for two years, delivering to her different clients throughout the various areas of her community. What she likes about her work is that many people enjoy these sweets, and furthermore she gets to know many places and socializes, since she has a wide range of clients and only works by the order. This is the sixth loan with MFP, and with the funds she is requesting she will buy more sweets, and will also acquire a showcase to better display her products.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Increase in the range of products that she sells

description: \n Саидов Хайриддин жиьтель города Яван.Возраст 32 года , имеет шестерых детей. Работает на стройке подсобным рабочим и его заработной платы не хватает на такую большую семью. Поэтому у него есть небольшое хозяйство , где он оразводит бычков . Теперь он решил получить кредит и использовать его на покупку дойной коровы. Получаемое молоко он будет реализовывать на рынке . Это немного улучшит его положение . Погасть кредит сможет в течение восьми месяцев.
description_translated:
Hairiddin S. resides in Yavan town. He is 32 years old and has 6 children. He is a helper at a construction site and his income is not enough to support his large family. Therefore he raises bull calves. Hairiddin decided to get a loan for buying a milk cow. Selling milk at the local market would help improve his financial situation. Hairiddin would be able to pay off the loan within eight months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: to purchase a milk cow

description:
Faustina N. is married and has 3 children. She has received schooling through senior high. Faustina sells electrical items at Bantama, which she has done for a while now. Her husband works with a credit union.

\r\n\r\nFaustina uses her income to help her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Faustina will use the loan to purchase more electrical parts for her store. With the new profits from her expanded business, Faustina plans to reinvest back into the business to increase her profit margin so as to meet the financial needs of her family.
loan_use: to purchase more electrical parts for the store

description: Jesusa O. has enjoyed her more than 8 years of association with Paglaum Munlti Purpose Cooperative, a partner through thick and thin for her business.  Its a daily challenge for her to meet her loan payments on time but this has now become a habit.  Jesusa at 59 years old, a widow and has 12 children. She tells us with pride that she is able to nurture all her children well.  Finishing a degree was far out of sight for her and she only reached 3rd year high school. But, with the skills of dressmaking, she was able to feed her children and provide them with good education.  \r\n\r\nShe hs applied with Paglaum MPC, for a loan of Php 15,000.  With this loan she will purchase additional sewing materials. She wants to expand her business, employ 1 dressmaker, and have all her children finished their studies.
loan_use: To purchase sewing  materials

description: Mrs. Sree H. is a villager in Taing Roleang village, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband, Mr. Rong Pheak, are farmers who own a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Their field is infertile soil so Mrs. Sree H. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to make her field more productive. Mrs. Sree H. is 33 years old and the mother of a 5-year-old child. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.
loan_use: To purchase fertilizer and fuel.

description:
Eleven years ago, Nodira started her clothing business. Experienced and talented in the business, Nodira has expanded her business into a successful trade, supporting her family. Throughout the last four years, IMON International has provided ongoing assistance to Nodira’s business through microfinance loans. Committed to growth and successful entrepreneurship, Nodira has used each loan wisely and has repaid each with a perfect credit history. Currently, she is seeking a loan of 4000 Somoni to purchase more clothing for selling. With the rotation of supplies in her business, she plans to repay the loan within 6 months. The well being of Nodira’s family and her business are in your hands. Nodira and her children are sincerely grateful for your support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
loan_use: Purchasing of the new clothing for increasing the range of goods.

description: Nhanch L., 32, pictured with her husband and her son, is a mother of three school-aged children, and lives in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She and her husband earn income grinding rice crops for the farmers of the village. They are able to make about US$10 in profit each day. Mrs. Nhanch L. currently needs a loan of US$1,000 to be able to purchase a stock of gas for the rice grinding machine. \r\n
loan_use: Purchase of a stock of gas for a rice grinding machine

description: Maritza tiene 21 años de edad, muy pronto será madre, actualmente está viviendo en la casa de su madre con sus 6 hermanos y sus padres. Maritza trabaja en la chacra de sus padres conjuntamente con sus hermanos, siembran papa, a ella le agrada sembrar este tubérculo porque es muy rentable, se vende el saco a 60 ó 65 soles, pero tienen que pagar el transporte que es 3 soles por saco, por ello Maritza prefiere esperar a que los compradores pasan por su chacra y así ahorrar el transporte, porque el que compra se lleva el producto. Luego de la cosecha de la papa hecha los granos de arvejas para aprovechar el abono que tiene la chacra y está rica en sustancias que fertilizan la tierra, por ello es que procede a sembrar los granos de arvejas rápidamente, entonces para el proceso de maduración de este producto ya no requerirá mucha inversión, solo estar pendiente de las plagas. Maritza tiene casi 3 años en MFP, este es su 6to préstamo, y está comprometida a seguir con la misma dinámica de trabajo y de pagos puntuales. El dinero que está solicitando es para la compra de fertilizantes, asimismo bolsa de semilla de arvejas para sembrar en la chacra donde va cosechar la papa, con la finalidad de ir incrementando su producción.
description_translated:
Maritza is 21 years old. She will become a mother very soon. At present she is living at her mother's house with her 6 brothers and sisters. Maritza works at her parent's small farm along with her brothers. They sow potatoes and she likes it because it is very profitable. The sack of potatoes sells for 60 to 65 soles ($18-20), but they have to pay 3 soles ($1) per sack for transportation; for this reason Maritza prefers to wait for the buyers to come to her small farm and this way to save on transportation, because the buyer takes the product. After they harvest the potatoes, they sow pea grains because the land is quite rich in substances that fertilize the ground, therefore they don't need a big investment. They only need to look after it to prevent plagues.\r\nMaritza has been a member of MFP (Kiva's partner) for almost 3 years. This is her 6th loan, and she is committed to continue with the same dynamics of work and of punctual payments. The requested money will be use to buy fertilizers, also a bag of pea seeds to sow at the small farm where they will harvest potatoes, in order to increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Buy seeds and fertilizers

description: Victoria tiene 42 años, es madre de 3 hijas que están estudiando, vive con su esposo quien junto a sus hijas le brindan el apoyo necesario en su negocio, su casa es propia. Se dedica a la confección, es especial de carteras y manteles, ella y sus hijas trabajan juntas desde hace 5 años exhibiendo sus productos en las afueras de su casa. Victoria vende durante todo el día, lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que aprende cada día más sobre las novedades y diseños para sus confecciones. Lo difícil es no contar con un local adecuado, ya que sus artículos están expuestos a cualquier robo y no puede dar comodidad a sus clientes. Pero por otro lado, le es muy rentable porque se encuentra ubicada en una buena zona muy transitada y vende todo el día. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y con el dinero que ha solicitado hará realidad o que tanto desea, que es mandar a construir un local para su negocio.
description_translated:
Victoria is 42 years old. She is the mother of 3 daughters who are studying. She lives with her husband who, along with her daughters, give her the help she needs in her business. Her house is her own. She works as a seamstress. Her specialties are bags and alter cloths. She and her daughters have worked for the past 5 years showing her products in outside her house. Victoria sells during the entire day. What she likes about the work is that each day she learns more about the novelties and designs for what she makes. The hard part is she doesn’t have a suitable place for it, such that the articles are exposed for any robber and she is not able to provide comfort for her clients. But, on the other hand, it makes a good income because she has found she is located in a good area with many passers by and she sells all day. This is her first loan with MFP, and with the money that she is asking for she would make her dream a reality, which is to order the construction of a kiosk for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To construct a stall for her textile business

description: Christiana O. is 52 years old and married with 6 children, she sells foodstuffs like palm oil, salt and rice etc. Her husband is a painter.  Presently, she plans to increase her sales so that she can earn more profit to take care of her children’s school fees and other expenses. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 to purchase more food products to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.
loan_use: To purchase more food products to sell

description:
German Antonio L. C. tiene la edad de 58 años, su estado civil es acompañado, Don German tiene 3 hijos sus edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 38 años y trabaja por cuenta propia su otro hijo de 36 años también labora por cuenta propia y su hijo menor de 32 años todos sus hijos están casados y trabajan por cuenta propia, su compañera de vida labora en la atención de una comideria en su casa de habitación, sus propósitos son de darle el mantenimiento adecuado a su camión por lo que sus clientes exigen lo mejor de sus servicios sus sueños son de establecer un billar para que este le genere mas ingresos para su familia además que este negocio es solicitado por lo jóvenes y obtendría afluencia de clientes además podría heredarle a su hijos este negocio para que el día de mañana tengan un respaldo para los ingresos sus sueños son de cambiar su unidad de transporte y que a la ves este sea moderno y grande para que sus clientes tengan una excelente comodidad en su unidad.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es el transporte de personal de la zona rural a la ciudad y viceversa, la ubicación de su negocio en de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 40 años, Don German inicia su negocio en Managua con fondos propios ya que comercializaba con mercancías vendía productos como: cuadros de pintura, jarrones y electrodomésticos pero este tipo de negocio le fue difícil mantenerlo por que algunas veces no vendía toda la mercadería por lo que decide establecer otro negocio de auto lavado pero no tenia mucha experiencia en este tipo de negocio  por lo que no duro mucho este tipo de negocio y decide establecer el negocio del transporte de personas de la zona rural a la ciudad por lo que necesita el financiamiento para capital de trabajosa que necesita darle mejoras a su camión que es el que se encarga de trasladar a las personas y necesita comprar: llantas, frenos entre otras cosas.
description_translated:
German Antonio L. C. is 58 years old, partnered, and has three sons (ages 38, 36, and 32) who are all married and self-employed. His partner runs a small restaurant in their home. German's goal is to provide proper maintenance for his truck to give his customers high-quality service. He would also like to upgrade to a larger and more modern vehicle so that his customers are more comfortable. His dream is to have a pool hall, which would generate greater income for his family. As a pool hall is in great demand from young people, he would have a large clientele and he would be able to pass on the business to his sons so they would have adequate support.

For forty years, German has offered transportation between the city and rural areas. He began his business in Managua, using his own money. Previously he had sold products such as picture frames, vases, and appliances. That business was difficult to maintain because he often was unable to sell all his merchandise. So, he decided to start a car wash, but he did not have enough experience to make that business a success. Finally, he began his transportation business.

German is requesting a loan for working capital in order to make repairs to his truck. He will purchase tires, brakes, and other parts.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Working capital

description: Opeyemi O. is 30 years old and married without a child. He lives in Ibadan, Nigeria. He sells electronics. He started this business in 2005. He needs the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more electronics to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.
loan_use: To purchase more electronics to sell

description: Olateju A. is 42 years old and married with 3 children. She sells women's and men's shoes. She has been in this business for a long time. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more shoes to sell. She says thanks to all who made this loan possible.
loan_use: To purchase more shoes to sell

description: Sarela tiene 24 años, es madre soltera, vive con sus dos hijos y sus hermanos en la casa de sus padres. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes pero no en un local, sino que lo lleva y ofrece por los caseríos que están lejos de la ciudad y donde no hay es fácil acceder a estos productos fácilmente, es por eso que Sarela tiene muchos clientes que le solicitan productos constantemente y además ella les cobra un precio justo, sin aprovecharse de la situación como otras personas que suelen vender a precios muy altos. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 8 años, como le gusta conocer nuevos lugares no tiene problema de trasladarse todo el tiempo de una zona a otra. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y con la cantidad que está solicitando quiere comprar más abarrotes, y también mandar a construir un pequeño local que le sirva de almacén de sus productos para no tenerlos todos en su casa.
description_translated:
Sarela is 24 years old. She is a single mother living with her two children and her brothers in her parents' home. She sells groceries but not from a fixed location, rather she travels to sell them to farmhouses which are far from the city and which do not have easy access to these products. Because of this Sarela has many customers who constantly ask her for products. In addition, she sells at a fair price without taking advantage of the situation, which others do who sell at inflated prices. She has had this business for eight years. As she likes going to new places, she has no problem travelling from one area to another. This is her first loan with MFP: she will use the loan to buy more groceries and arrange for a something small to be built which she will use as a warehouse so that her goods are not all in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To increase her inventory.

description: Vilma tiene 27 años, es natural de la ciudad de Juliaca, vive sola en casa de unos familiares. Se dedica a la venta de comida en su pequeño restaurante, el cual puso en base a mucho esfuerzo y dedicación hace 6 años y felizmente le arroja buenos resultados, ya que los ingresos cada vez son mejores, gracias a los clientes que cada vez prefieren su sazón. Lo que le gusta a Vilma de su trabajo es la cocina, siempre le ha gustado la preparación de ricos platos los cuales son el deleite de sus clientes, lo complicado muchas veces es el abastecerse para cocinar para tantas personas, para lo cual a veces no se da abasto. Vilma al hacer crecer su negocio decidió obtener un préstamo de Microfinanzas Prisma para lograr expandirlo y desde entonces le ha ido muy bien, este es su cuarto préstamo en esta entidad y es muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero que solicita quiere comprar algunas mesas, ollas, y otros utensilios para mejorar la atención y si es posible contratar a un asistente de cocina que le ayude a abastecerse para toda su clientela.
description_translated:
Vilma is 27 years old and is from the city of Juliaca. She lives alone in the home of one of her relatives. She works selling food in her small restaurant, which she started with a lot of effort and dedication 6 years ago. Happily, she has had good results and her earnings continue to grow, thanks to her customers that choose her seasonings. What Vilma likes most about her job is cooking; she has always liked preparing delicious dishes, much to the pleasure of her customers. The complicated part of her job is gearing herself up to cook for so many people, sometimes she doesn’t have the energy. Vilma decided to apply for a loan with Microfinanzas Prisma in order to help her business grow and expand. Since then, things have gone very well for her and she is now in her fourth loan with this organization. She is always on-time with her payments. With the money she is asking for she wants to buy some tables, cooking pots and other utensils in order to improve her service. Also, if possible she would like to hire a cook’s assistant to help her feed all of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase tables and food for her restaurant

description: Rene Hilario M. R. tiene la edad de 49 años, su estado civil es casado, Don Hilario tiene 1 hijo su edad es de 7 años y cursa el 5 grado de primaria, su compañera de vida labora como dependiente de farmacia, sus propósitos son de seguir trabajando para sustentar a su familia y así pagar las deudas contraídas con la Fundación León 2000 sus sueños son de conseguir otra unidad de transporte por que la que posee actualmente no esta en muy buen estado pero debido a la difícil situación económica en la que el país se encuentra es muy difícil cambiar la unidad de transporte además con lo que gana tiene que mantener a su hogar sus sueños son que su hijo logre prepararse lo suficiente para que pueda tener un buen futuro además quiere que su hijo se prepare ya que el no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar y no le gustaría que su hijo pase por este tipo de situación es por eso que el trabaja muy duro para que su hijo tenga la posibilidad para que sea una persona preparada en el ámbito del estudio.\n\nSu actividad económica es el servicio de taxi, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 2 años, Don Rene inicio este negocio como chofer de un camión de transporte y lo que le pagaban lo conservaba ya que sus intenciones eran las de comprar un carro y lo ocuparía para dar los servicios de taxi ya que este seria el medio de trabajo que utilizaría para mantener a su familia pero debido a la situación no pudo completar el dinero y mas tarde su hermana se encargo de ayudarlo para que Don Rene pudiera comprar su unidad de transporte y es así como obtiene su taxi sus experiencias obtenidas con los clientes al dar este servicio le ha gustado mucho ya que le gusta servir a la población y su familia lo apoyado en lo necesario ya que es un trabajo digno y humilde además por medio de esto es que logra que su familia obtenga lo necesario, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo es para mejorar la unidad y consiste en la compra de amortiguadores traseros, espirales traseros, foco delanteros y juego de valineras y todas estas cosas las consigue en un buen precio en Managua además agradece la oportunidad del crédito otorgado por la Fundación León 2000 y las diferentes organizaciones.
description_translated:
Rene Hilario Mondragon Ramirez is 49 years old, married, has one son who is seven years old, and attended school through the fifth grade. His life partner works as a pharmacy sales clerk. His plans are to continue working to support his family and pay the loan from Foundation Leon 2000. He hopes to get another transport vehicle because the one he now has is not in very good condition, but because of the difficult economic condition the country finds itself in it is very difficult to replace the vehicle, since with what he earns he needs to maintain his home. His dreams are that his son is able to prepare himself sufficiently so that he can have a good future. Also, he wants his son to study since he did not have the opportunity to study and he does not want his son to face this type of situation, which is why he works so hard, so that his son has the possibility to be prepared for studying. \r\n\r\nHis work is to provide taxi service, moving around. He has had this business for two years. Don Rene started this business as a truck driver and saved what he was paid since he was planning to buy a car and use it to provide taxi service. This would be the type of work that he would use to maintain his family but due to the situation he could not get all the money together, but later his sister took it upon herself to help him so that Don Rene was able to buy his vehicle and that's how he got his taxi. His experiences with his clients, providing this service, have pleased him a lot, since he likes to serve the public. And his family has helped him as necessary since it is dignified and humble work, plus it is through this means that he assures that his family obtains what is necessary. The financing is for working capital to improve his vehicle and will be used to buy rear shock absorbers, rear springs, front headlights, and a set of ball bearings. All these things can be obtained at a good price in Managua. He is grateful for the credit opportunity offered by the Foundation Leon 2000 and the different organizations.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Working capital to improve his taxi

description:
Luisa,  vive en la  calle Junín de la  Zona de Alto Lima, vive en casa propia junto a sus hijos, ya que por circunstancias de la vida su esposo hizo abandono del hogar.


Ella se dedica a la compra venta de ropa de señoras en las distintas ferias de la ciudad y los días domingos se dedica a la venta de pollos en la feria  16 de julio la más grande de la ciudad, con lo cual sostiene económicamente a su familia.

El crédito lo destinara en la compra de mayor mercadería.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación presentada lo califica para otorgar el crédito.
description_translated:
Luisa lives in Junín St, in the Alto Lima zone, in her own home with her children. Owing to the circumstances of life, her husband abandoned their home. She works selling women's clothes in various markets around the city, and on Sundays she sells chicken in the 16 de Julio market, the largest market in the city. With this income she is able to support her family financially. The loan will be used to purchase wholesale merchandise. This is her first loan with Impro. They have evaluated her application and classified her as suitable for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To purchase merchandise

description:
This group of borrowers consists of four people led by Mrs. S., who was born in 1962 and has been making brooms for more than two years from her home. Daily, she normally makes about 10 or 15 brooms which she sells to villagers and the market seller.

She is the mother of four children, two of whom are employed; all are single. Her husband, Nary, 50, is a local fisherman who currently catches fish from Tunle Sap Lake and sells them at the market. His ability to catch fish has recently been compromised due to aging equipment, so Mrs. S. is requesting a loan to buy more fishing tools.

The other three borrowers are: P., a fisherman who needs a loan to buy nets and traps; P., a fisherwoman who is requesting a loan to purchase fishing tools; R., a fisherwoman who is requesting a loan to buy additional fishing equipment. The borrowers all live in Chong Kneas Commune in Siem Reap Province.
loan_use: To buy more fishing equipment.

description: Rachael I. is 31 years old and married with one child. She lives in Ibadan, Nigeria. She sells rechargeable phone cards. She started this business in 2007. She would like to expand this business. She needs the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell. She says thank you to everyone that made this loan possible.
loan_use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell

description: Ebere O. sells second-hand clothes. The demand for her second-hand clothes is high. Ebere is 31 years old and married with 5 children. Ebere is a LAPO client. Ebere needs the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more second-hand clothes to sell. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.
loan_use: To purchase more second-hand clothes to sell

description:
Abena M. is the 43-year-old mother of six children, three of whom are attending elementary school in Abofour, a town in the Ashanti region where they live. Abena has been selling food items such as maize for over six years, having begun the business when demand for cereals became very high. Purchasing her goods from the farmers in her town, she markets them both locally and in the surrounding communities.

Abena is requesting a loan to increase her working capital in order to buy in bulk, a measure that will expand both her customer base and her profit margin, her goal being to save more money to better assist her husband in meeting their children’s educational needs.
loan_use: To buy cereals such as maize in bulk.

description:
En la zona de villa tejada, se encuentra ubicado el centro focal del mismo nombre, a este pertenece la asociación “Joyitas de Oro”. Un grupo muy simpático y particular formado por 18 miembros que trabajan de manera organizada en todas sus actividades, cumpliendo mas de cinco años de trabajo junto a Pro-Mujer.  Las actividades que realiza la asociación Joyitas de Oro, son variadas; DEysi se dedican a la venta de artículos en plásticos, que los comercializa en la ciudad de Cochabamba; su hermana  costura sombreros, otras diseñan productos en miniatura (alasitas),
También se  dedican a la venta de ropa.
Afirman que necesitan mayor capital para la compra de productos al por mayor, están seguras que sus ventas aumentarían, de este modo obtendrán mayores ganancias y beneficios para sus familias.
description_translated:
The “Joyitas de Oro” group is from the Villa Tejada area. This is a very nice and particular group made up of 18 members who are very organized, having worked with Pro-Mujer for more than five years. The “Joyitas de Oro” group's members have a variety of businesses: Deysi sells plastic articles in Cochabamba; her sister sews hats; others design miniatures for the festival of Alasitas. They also sell clothing. They needs more capital in order to buy their goods wholesale; they are certain that their sales will increase, thus they will make more money and more profits for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: capital in order to buy goods at wholesale prices
borrower_names: FRANSISCA, ROSMERY, ROSA, GABRIEL, FRIDA, REMEDIOS, SHIRLEY, EPIFANIA, SONIA, MARIA, AGUSTINA, LUISA, NORAH, FLORA, GLORIA, LOURDEZ, PAULINA, DEYSI
borrower_genders: female, female, female, male, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, false, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Anorbi K. is 49 years old. She is married and the loving mother of five children. She lives in Dushanbe and owns a small store in the local market. Anorbi has been selling kids' clothing for about 3 years. Her store is well known in the market for having a nice variety of assorted kids' clothing at affordable prices. Her profit from the business has increased extensively since she started her business.

Anorbi has a unique ability to analyze a merchandise market and find her niche. This is something that helped her start her business and make it successful. Today she is requesting a loan of 2500 Somoni for the term of 9 months to increase the assortment of her inventory and her sales and profits as a result. With your help this will be possible.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
loan_use: Increasing her working capital

description:
Gulrukhon K. is 45 years old. She is married with three children. A friend of Gulrukhon's invited her to help sell clothing at the marketplace and Gulrukhon jumped at the offer. This is how she learned the vitals skills needed to manage a store in the marketplace. She decided to open her own business. She put some money together and bought some clothing and started her business 15 years ago with these items.

Gulrukhon has been able to help her husband with their living expenses and to provide for her children. However, Gulrukhon thinks it is imperative to buy new merchandise to have more variety of items, which in turn will attract more customers. Gulrukhon is requesting a loan of 600 USD which will be paid off in installments over the course of 6 months. With this loan, Gulrukhon will be able to buy the necessary merchandise, to earn more and in that way will be able to support her family with your help.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
loan_use: Increasing her working capital

description:
Les membres du groupe Sindiya (composé de 4 femmes  mariées et d’une célibataire) ont une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans avec en moyenne 1 enfant. Elles resident  dans le quartier  Ouayerma II dans la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mal).
Elles  exercent des activités commerciales différentes mais les plus dominantes sont la vente du bois de chauffe, la vente d’habits  auxquelles s’ajoute la vente d’oranges et divers petits articles.
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle de plus en plus croissante les membres de ce groupe ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle, ils sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 5 chargements de charrettes  en oranges, 2 chargements de camionnette en bois de chauffe, 2 douzaines de vêtement  pour enfants, 2 balles de friperie et 3 paquets d’articles divers. Elles s’approvisionnent soit à Bamako (capitale du Mali),  ou sur place à Sikasso et dans les villages environnants auprès des paysans producteurs.
Les produits sont vendus en détail et  au comptant dans les marchés de la ville de Sikasso  et à domicile  à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 15 000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
description_translated:
The members of the group Sindiya (composed of 4 married women and one single woman) have an average age of 32 with, on average, one child. They reside in the Ouayerma II neighborhood of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali) .

They are engaged in different commercial activities, but especially selling firewood, clothing, and also oranges and various small items. In order to satisfy the needs of their ever-growing clientele, the members of the group decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom they are on their fifth solidarity loan (group loan). The preceding loans have all been repaid correctly.

They intend to use this loan to buy 5 wagon loads of oranges, 2 truckloads of firewood, 2 dozen outfits for children, 2 bales of used clothing, and three packs of various small items. They buy their goods in Bamako (capital of Mali) or right in Sikasso and in the surrounding villages, from the farmers who produce the foodstuffs.

The products are sold retail and for cash, in the markets of the town of Sikasso and out of their own homes to a clientele composed of women and men.

They each hope to make an average profit of 15,000 F CFA per month which they will use make repayments on the loan and support their families.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: purchase of firewood, children's outfits, used clothing, fruit, etc.

description:
Les membres du groupe Finesse (composé de 5 femmes toutes mariées) ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans avec en moyenne 1 enfant. Elles resident dans le quartier  Médine de la ville de sikasso(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles exercent différentes activités commerciales mais la plus dominante est la vente du bois de chauffe puis la vente de  savon de fabrication locale et de l’huile alimentaire. 
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle de plus en plus croissante les femmes de ce groupe collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a 1 an. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Le prêt précédent a été correctement  remboursé.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 1 chargement de camionnette en bois de chauffe, 4 bidons de 20 litres d’huile alimentaire et 3 sacs de 100 morceaux de savons traditionnels. Elles s’approvisionnent soit à Bamako (capitale du Mali),  ou sur place à Sikasso auprès de grossistes. Les produits sont vendus en détail et  au comptant dans les marchés de la ville de Sikasso, dans le quartier et à domicile à une clientèle composée de femmes et de quelques hommes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 19 000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt,subvenir aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités.
description_translated:
All the members of the group Finesse are married women who average 30 years of age and one child. They live in the Médine district of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They do different commerce-related work, but predominating is the sale of firewood and then locally-made soap and cooking oil.

To satisfy their burgeoning customer base, the women of this group have been collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso for a year now and are on their second solidarity loan (group loan). The preceding loan has been correctly repaid. They plan to use this loan to buy one truck-load of firewood, four 20-liter drums of cooking oil, and three 100-piece sacks of traditional soaps. Supplies are gotten either in Bamako (capital of Mali) or locally in Sikasso from wholesalers. These goods are sold retail for cash in the marketplaces of Sikasso, in the district, and at residences, to customers composed of women and a few men.

The group members each hope to realize a monthly profit of 19,000 francs CFA that will be used to pay the loan interest, to provide for the family, and to invest the rest in the businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy firewood, soap, and cooking oil

description:
Ama G. is sixty years old. She is widowed but has given birth to five children: four boys and a girl. Currently, Ama says two of her children have completed senior high school, while the rest are still in primary school. Ama says she also takes care of her late sister's five children. She lives with her family in a rented house in Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Offinso is both a farming and commercial community.

Ama, therefore, works very hard to take care of the family. She sells fresh yams in the local market square. She procures the tubers of yam from the farmers in the surrounding villages. Ama has been in business for five years. She also distributes the yam to some food vendors in her community. She wants a loan to buy tubers of yam on a large scale so that she can distribute to more customers and thus increase her profit margin. It is her dream to give all her children and late sister’s children formal education.
loan_use: To procure tubers of yam

description:
Adiza I. is a married woman. She is forty-eight years old and a mother of six children, all male. Four of her children are currently in school. The first two have completed junior high school and are yet to continue. Adiza lives with her husband and children in a town called Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Her husband is a farmer. He cultivates food crops such as maize, plantains, and vegetables to provide food for the family.

\r\n\r\nAdiza enjoys trading and has been selling for over fifteen years in the town where she lives. She sells food items like beans, maize, groundnuts, and all kinds of cereals and grains. She buys her goods from the farmers in her locality and the surrounding towns. At times, Adiza travels all the way to the northern part of the country to procure goods at affordable prices. She sells to the people of her locality, most of whom are food vendors. She says she wants to buy the goods in bulk so that she can reach a larger size of the market by trekking to markets in nearby towns. She says this is possible only by increasing her working capital. Basically, this is what she aspires to use the loan for. It is Adiza’s dream to help her husband provide for their children to make it to the tertiary level of school.
loan_use: To procure cereals and grains

description:
La señorita Alison vive en casa de sus padres en la Av. Buenos Aires de la zona de San Martín de la ciudad de La Paz; trabaja en una tienda vendiendo joyas de plata.
El crédito que solicita es para comprar billetes de alasita y armar canastitas para vender en la feria de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos. “Alasita” es una feria anual que comienza el 24 de Enero y termina tres semanas después, donde todos los productos artesanales que se venden son miniaturas, desde billetes hasta casas.

No es cliente de Impro pero por la actividad y el carácter social califica para obtener un crédito.
description_translated:
Alison lives with her parents in the neighbourhood of San Martín in La Paz; she works in a store selling silver jewelry. She is asking for a loan to buy miniature money for the festival of Alasita and prepare small baskets to sell at the festival so that she can earn more money. The festival of Alastita is an annual celebration which starts on January 24 and lasts three weeks and where all sorts of products are made in miniature and sold, everything from money to houses. She is not a client of Impro but the nature of this activity and her reputation qualify her for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy miniatures to sell during the festival of Alasita.

description:
Abiba S. is a 29-year-old woman. She is married but has no children. She lives with her husband in her matrimonial home, in a suburb of Offinso in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Abiba is an achiever and a resourceful woman. She loves selling goods, the business through which she makes a living.

Abiba has been trading bananas in Abofour market for four years. She treks to surrounding villages in the Central part of Ghana to purchase bulk stock of bananas from farmers and to retail to her customers. For lack of adequate working capital, she is not able to pick up enough stock to make enough profit to support her family. Abiba will buy the unripe banana in bulk, and she will cover it with plantain leaves in the bush. This would be there for a while so when it is ripe she would go for them and retail to her customers.

With the loan, she wants to purchase a bulk supply of bananas to enable the scale-up of her sales. She believes the loan would enable her to save more income to support her business growth. Abiba belongs to a village bank (loan group) called ‘Paul.’ She also hopes to receive GH¢600 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. This would enable her to save more to support her husband in taking care of their home.
loan_use: To purchase a supply of bananas in bulk.

description: Margarita G. M. is one of the members of group 6 in the "Comunidad Unida" (United Community) Bank of Hope. This loan is also being taken by group 5 in the same bank, for a total of 10 borrowers. These groups are located in Brisas del Ozama, a community located on the eastern part of Santo Domingo, very near the Ozama River, one of the largest in the country. During rainy season, this river is a serious threat to these people`s houses. Margarita sells clothes as a business. With her new loan she wants to increase her business even more. Elize hopes that she one day will be able to buy a nice house to live in. She is also very preoccupied about the future of her children. Please help us support these ladies` hard work. Thank you!
loan_use: purchase new merchandise to refurbish their businesses
borrower_names: Flerida, Perla, Margarita, Marilyn, Elizabeth, Miguelina, Nicaury, Alma, Katherine, Sugeidy
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
La Sra. Sabina está casada hace 13 años con el Sr. Segundo López, el matrimonio posee 5 hijos todos menores de edad.

 Doña Sabina comenzó a trabajar desde muy pequeña , a lo edad de 10 años mas o menos en la venta de frutas (bananas, manzanas, naranjas y otros), debido a que provenía de una familia muy humilde compuesta por varios hermanos.
 
Además de eso tuvo la oportunidad de comprar un local dentro del mercado municipal de Itá, y no dejó pasar esa oportunidad. Hoy día utiliza el mismo para poner a la venta las menudencias que compra de distintos carniceros de la zona. Comenta que le va muy bien y que ya ha formado muy buena clientela.

Ella está muy orgullosa de si misma por que hasta el día de hoy sigue manteniendo su local de ventas y gracias a eso puede hacer posible que sus hijos puedan estudiar, ya que ella no tuvo la oportunidad de terminar sus estudios debido a su mala situación económica.

En esta oportunidad solicita el crédito para la compra de menudencias debido a que tiene mucha demanda de sus mercaderías.
description_translated:
Sabina has been married for 13 years to Mr. Segundo López and they have five young children. Sabina started working when she was very young and at more or less 10 years of age sold fruit (bananas, apples, oranges and others) since she came from a humble family composed of various siblings. Besides this she had the opportunity to buy her own stand inside the municipal market of Itá and she took advantage of this. Today she uses it to sell products that she purchases from butchers in the area. She says that things are going well for her and that she has established a very good clientele. She is very proud of herself because up until now she continues to manage her stand and thanks to that her children are able to study while she never had the opportunity to due to her bad economic situation. At this time she is requesting a loan to buy products since there is so much demand for her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase merchandise

description: La Señora Mercedes del Carmen C. H. tiene la edad de 43 años, su estado civil es casada, Mercedes tiene 2 hijos su edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 15 años cursa el 2  año de secundaria y su hijo menor de 10 años cursa el 5 grado de primaria, su compañero de vida labora como operario, sus propósitos son de mantener activo su negocio ya que este es su único medio de vida para ella y su familia sus deseos son de obsequiarles a sus hijos una casa donde puedan vivir en futuro con sus familias por lo que es importante para que se independicen de una forma segura sus sueños son de proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda ya que le gustaría que toda su familia se encuentra cómoda y segura por lo que así no tendrían problemas en la temporada de lluvia ya que tienen problemas en su vivienda.\n\nLa actividad económica es la de mercadería en general como: calzado, ropa y cosméticos, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 3 años, Doña Mercedes inicia su negocio como todo negocio pequeño por lo que primero se dedico a la venta de cosméticos y sus clientes le realizaban pedidos de diferentes marcas por lo que mas tarde decide implementar en el negocio la venta de de calzado y sus clientes siempre en busca de sus servicio ya que ofertaba sus productos de casa en casa y por idea de una de sus clientes decide además vende ropa y ya con esta mercadería salio adelante con su familia y esto se realizo con mucho esfuerzo por que sabia la responsabilidad de su familia, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que su interés es de realizar la compra de uniformes y calzado por la temporada de clases que se avecina.
description_translated:
Mercedes del Carmen C. H. is 43 years old and married. She has two children, a 15-year old son in high school and a 10-year old son in elementary school. Her husband is a factory worker. Her goal is to keep the business going because her family's income depends on it. She wants, in the future, to give each of her children a house where they can live with their families so that they can be both independent and secure. She also wants to make improvements to her house because she would like her family to be comfortable and safe, free of the problems they have during the rainy season. \r\n

\r\nMercedes makes a living selling general merchandise: footwear, clothing and cosmetics. She is a street vendor and has operated her business for 3 years. Like many small businesses, she started out selling a single product, cosmetics, and then added other products, such as footwear, as she built a base of customers. Her customers like the service that she provides and look to her for new products. That's how she got the idea to sell clothing, a product that will help her to help her family, a responsibility that she feels deeply. Selling clothes requires a lot of effort, though. The loan will be used for working capital so that Mercedes can buy uniforms and footwear appropriate for the upcoming school year.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Working capital.

description: Lann S., 26, is married and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She sells vegetables at the market to earn approximately US$ 5 per day, while her husband also works and makes US$ 2 per day. This couple has one little child. Lann S. would like to take out a loan to purchase a motorbike for her husband to use to commute to work. This will reduce the cost that he spends every day on public transportation.\r\n
loan_use: To purchase a motorbike

description: Rachael O. is 57 years old and married with 5 children. She plans to increase her stock to make more profit. She is requesting the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.
loan_use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

description: Juan tiene 28 años, es soltero y vive de forma independiente en casa de sus padres, ya que estos le dieron un cuarto donde el mismo se mantiene y puso su pequeño negocio. Siempre ha sido un joven muy trabajador, al no poder acceder a estudios superiores y en busca de un mejor porvenir decidió incursionar en el comercio, vendiendo maletines elaborados en base a tejidos de la zona (llamado “llijillas”), los cuales vende en la ciudad de Juliaca.
