Felizmente para Juan las ventas son muy buenas y cada vez obtiene más clientes ya que los bonitos modelos de maletines que elabora son muy cotizados por la clientela, además trabaja por pedidos al por mayor para exportarlos. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es abastecerse sin ayuda para confeccionar los maletines que le solicitan, ya que sólo cuenta con una sola máquina de coser. Juan se encuentra en su octavo préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, siendo muy responsable y puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de material en llijllas, hilos, cierres, etc., para elaborar sus maletines y aumentar su producción.
description_translated:
Juan is 28, he is single and lives independently at his parents house; they provided him with a room where he supports himself and started his own business. He has always been a hardworking man, he didn’t have access to professional studies and looking for a better future he decided to get into commerce, selling bags made with local fabrics (called “llijillas”) in the city of Juliaca. Fortunately for Juan, the sales are very good and he has more clients every time because the nice styles of the bags he makes are in high demand from his clients, he also works on major orders to export them. The most difficult part of his job is to get supplies without help to make the bags that people request because he only has one sewing machine. Juan is on his 8th loan from Microfinanzas PRISMA, being very responsible and punctual with repayments. The money required will be used to purchase higher quality materials such as, threads, llijillas, zippers, etc., to make the bags and increase production.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase materials to make the bags he sells

description:
Desde hace diez años Olinda se desenvuelve como consultora de belleza y desde hace ocho años como artesana de tejidos a crochet. Vende productos de belleza a raíz de que una amiga suya la animó y en vista de sus necesidades en aquel entonces empezó a vender. 

Luego de dos años de haberse convertido en consultora decide unirse con un grupo de amigas y formar una pequeña asociación que se dedique a la elaboración de tejidos de lana y crochet. Hoy en día esta asociación, aún no formalizada, confecciona tejidos de todo tipo para venderlos al extranjero gracias a familiares que se encuentran fuera del país.  

Por otro lado, colabora voluntariamente en el comedor popular desde hace dieciocho años. Gracias a su trabajo puede ayudar en la educación de sus hijos y al  mantenimiento del hogar. Por ahora ella desearía poder formalizar su empresa junto con sus compañeras para poder exportar más productos al extranjero.
description_translated:
For the last ten years, Olinda has worked as a beauty consultant, and for the last eight years as a crafter of crocheted fabrics. She sells beauty products because a friend of hers encouraged her to and so in light of her needs she began to sell. Two years after having become a consultant, she decided to join with a group of friends and form a small association dedicated to the making of wool and crocheted fabrics. Toady, this association, although still not formalized, makes all sorts of fabrics to sell abroad, thanks to relatives who are based outside the country. Additionally, she works on a volunteer basis in the communal eatery for the last eighteen years. Thanks to her work she is able to help with the education of her sons and to maintain her home. Now she would like to formalize her company together with her colleagues in order to be able to export more products abroad.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Materials for weaving

description: El señor Cesar Napoleón  es habitante de sector tres de Nueva Guinea, está solicitando su primer crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda y poder efectuar compra de de material para hacer un repello de la pared de su casa, labora en la financiera FAMA Nueva Guinea como asesor de crédito, él es un hombre profesional con alto espitud de superación, él tiene un niño menor de 5 años edad, fue recomendo por clientes de la institución de AFODENIC por caracterizarse como un hombre responsable en su labores que desarrolla, su sueño  es de mejorar las condiciones de su hogar para brindarle comodidad a su familia ya que es el patrimonio que les dejará.
description_translated:
Mr. Cesar Napoleón is a resident of sector three of Nueva Guinea. This is his first loan and he will use it to invest in improving his home. He would like to buy materials to add a plaster coat to the walls of his home. He works for the financial company FAMA Nueva Guinea as a credit counselor. He is a professional with a great attitude for overcoming obstacles. He has a 5-year-old son and was recommended to AFODENIC for being a responsible man. His dream is to improve the conditions of his home in order to make his family more comfortable, since this is the heritage he will give them.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: buy materials to plaster his home

description: La Sra. Glenda tiene 46 años de edad,  reside en el barrio Jonathan González, en la ciudad de Managua, con dos hijos que trabajan  por su propia cuenta ya que con esfuerzos tienen ganado, se dedican al negocio de ganadería. Doña Glenda vende electrodomésticos, ropa, cosméticos, desde hace ocho años, en las ventas que comenzó con ahorros propios solo vendiendo ropa, con esta solicitud de préstamo quiere invertir en la compra de ropa variada, y de colegio ya que es la temporada que se vende mas por que inicia un nuevo curso del año, su objetivo es aumentar el volumen de venta que le genere mayores ganancias, a corto plazo es seguir haciendo mejoras a su casa y terminarla.
description_translated:
Glenda is 46 years old and lives in the Jonathan González neighborhood in the city of Managua. She has two children who already have bought livestock and work as ranchers. Glenda has sold domestic electronics, clothing, and makeup for 8 years. She began her business with her own savings and just sold clothing. She would like to use this loan to invest in the purchase of a variety of clothing, particularly school uniforms because it is the time of year when school begins and she sells many school uniforms. Her goal is to increase her sales so she can earn more income. She hopes to soon be able to continue improving her house and complete it.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Buy clothing for children and adults

description:
Julieta J. B., 39 years old, is married to Reynaldo B. and lives at Owaon, Dapitan City. Luckily, they have 4 children and all are in elementary school.

She dreams of the success of her children, because she doesn’t want them to have the difficulties they encounter right now. With all her strength, she always researches new strategies in earning money. So she came up with hog-raising as an idea. But she hasn’t enough capital in this business and has tried to ask some of her friends, and they referred her to Paglaum Cooperative. This cooperative offers quality services to its members and gives benefits as well. Wholeheartedly the Cooperative accepted her and granted her wishes.

For a year she’s been a member of Paglaum MPC, and she sees that their life simply is getting better. Now she applies a loan of 7,000 php to buy vaccines for her hogs as well as feed for hog-fattening. Through this, she hopes that her children can go to college.
loan_use: to purchase feed & vaccines for hogs

description:
La señora Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas del Rio Blanco”, en el sector cuatro, comunidad de Sucano, distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 41 años de edad, de estado civil es casada y tiene cinco hijos, asimismo posee estudios de primaria incompleta (segundo de primaria).
Trabaja desde hace cuatro años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, posee un negocio de compra y venta de ganado ovino; su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, para rescatar mas ganado ovino y comercializarlo en carne y en pie en las ferias ganaderas de Pilcuyo y de Ilave.
Ella piensa mejorar su crianza, por ello requiere asistencia técnica ya que piensa comprar mas ganado (mas ovejas), asimismo quiere dedicarse a comercialización de chuño, papa y oca, es decir comprar al mayor en los mercados de desaguadero y venderlos al menor en los mercados de Tacna y Arequipa, con este préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles le servirá para lo que viene proyectando, finalmente la ganancias de su negocio lo viene invirtiendo en la educación de sus hijos y el sustento diario; se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo en tres cuotas mensuales.
description_translated:
Margarita is a member of "Las Brisas del Rio Blanco" Communal Bank in sector four of the Sucano community located in the Pilcuyo district of the province of El Collao in the state of Puno. She is 41 years old, married with five children and has an incomplete secondary school education (equivalent of the 8th grade). She has worked for four years with the Manuela Ramos Movement and has a business buying and selling sheep. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to purchase more sheep and she then sold the meat and animals in the markets of Pilcuyo and Ilave. She wants to improve her business and for that she requires technical assistance. She also would like to purchase more sheep and to start selling chuño (dried potatoes used to make soup), potatoes and oca (another type of indigenous potato); in other words, buying at wholesale prices and selling in the markets of Tacna and Arequipa. This loan of 3,000 soles will help with what she has planned and the earnings from her business will be invested in the education and daily care of her children. She promises to repay the loan on time in three monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase sheep

description:
La señora Rosalía es socia del banco comunal “Las brisas del río blanco” comunidad Chipana, distrito D. Pilcuyo, Provincia Del Collao, Departamento D. Puno; D.  40 años D. edad, estado civil casada, con nueve hijos y solo estudio hasta primero D. primaria.
Trabaja hace 3 años  y seis meses con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo invirtió en la compra y venta D. ovejas, toro y  cerdos  para engorD..
Con este préstamo S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles para poder comprar más animales (toros, cerdos y ovejas); D. esta manera contribuirá ayudar con los gastos D. su hogar, brindado ayuda en la educación D. sus hijos, finalmente  se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo en cinco cuotas mensuales.
description_translated:
Rosalía is a member of "Las Brisas del Río Blanco" Communal Bank in the community of Chipana located in the Pilcuyo district of the province of Collao in the state of Puno. She is 40 years old, married with nine children and has a 1st graD. education. She has worked for three years and six months with the Manuela Ramos Movement. Her first loan of 300 soles was invested in purchasing and selling sheep, a bull and pigs. With this loan of 3,000 soles she will be able to purchase more animals (bulls, pigs and sheep) and will therefore contribute to help with household expenses and give her children an education. She promises to repay the loan on time in five monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase animals

description:
CLAUDIA PAMELA P. CÁRDENAS, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Guerreras”, ubicado en el Jr. Fernando Stall N° 187 en la ciudad de Pucallpa, en el Distrito de callería, tiene 21 años de edad, es una joven muy trabajadora, no tiene niños, es soltera, su actividad es la cocina y repostería.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró moldes para hacer tortas y galletas y venderlos en un billar en el que trabaja su papá.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá para comprar más moldes, y materia prima para realizar su preparación como: un honor moderno, para tortas, esencias, azúcar, brinda servicios de alimentos bufetes, comidas varias.

Está muy agradecida de Manuela Ramos, porque le da un gran apoyo a las mujeres para poder trabajar.
description_translated:
Claudia Pamela P. Cardenas belongs to the Communal Bank 'Las Guerreras," located on Jr. Fernando Stall No. 187 in the city of Pucallpa, in the Calleria district. She is 21 years old, and is a very hardworking young owman,. She does not have children, is single, and her activity is cooking and baking. The first loan she received was for 200 Nuevos Soles, she bought molds to make cake and chickens and sold them at her father's work. With this loan of 1500 Nuevos Soles, she will invest in buying more molds and raw material to complete her perparation like: a modern oven for cakes, spices, sugar, and various foods. She is very thankful to Manuela Ramos, because it gives a lot of support to women to be able to work.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: buying molds and ingredients for cakes

description:
La asociación kantutas pertenece al centro focal Cascada ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto, hace un año que trabajan junto a la familia de Pro – Mujer.
La mayoría casadas y con familias numerosas, necesitan recursos económicos, para cubrir ciertas necesidades como ser guardapolvos y material escolar, ya que empieza un nuevo año escolar. Por este motivo  necesitan de mayores créditos para ampliar sus ventas con la seguridad de obtener mayores ingresos.
La asociación Kantutas se dedica al comercio en general, diversos productos son vendidos en puestos de mercados y calles de la ciudad, otras también tiene tiendas de barrio.
description_translated:
The Kantutas Association is in the Cascada center of the city of El Alto. They have been working for one year with the Pro-Mujer family. Most are married with large families, in need of economic resources to cover certain necessities such as school uniforms and supplies, since a new school year is starting. This is why they need large loans to increase their sales and to have the security of a larger income. The Kantutas Association are all in general business, selling various products in market stands and on the streets of the city. Some also have neighborhood shops.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: They need loans to increase their sales
borrower_names: JUAN, ROXANA, LAURA, OLGA, CATY, ROSA, NORHA, WILMA, MIRIAM, IRENE, JHEYMI, JUSTINA, MARIA
borrower_genders: male, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, false, true

description: Mrs. Cham Chou is 50 years old and she now lives in the Ta Keb Village in the Kampong Cham Province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. In cultivating vegetables, she faces a problem because she does not have enough money to grow cassavas in the fields. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more cassavas to plant and grow. Her husband, Mr. Lorn Sao, is a fisherman. Mrs. Cham Chou has a child who is a laborer. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.
loan_use: To buy cassavas to plant and grow in the fields

description:
Mrs. Kheun H., 44, and her husband, Mr. Huot Hin, 41, live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penn, the capital of Cambodia. They were married in 1992 and have two children: one son and one daughter, both of whom attend school.

Kheun and her husband have been farming for 29 years. They grow cucumbers, green beans, and jasmines. They sell them at the Prek Phnao market. Kheun hopes to support her children so they can attend the university. She is requesting her first loan of $500 to use for growing cucumbers and green beans and to build a kitchen.
loan_use: To use for growing cucumbers and green bean and to build a kitchen

description: Mrs.Reaksmei I. is a villager I. Kvav village I. Takeo province. She is a basket maker. Her husband, Mr. Morm Virak, is a coconut seller. His business is going well and he wants to expand it. Mrs. Reaksmei is requesting a loan to buy more coconuts to resell. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. She is a 27-year-old mother with a young child, who isn't able to work or study yet. Her husband is with her I. the picture.
loan_use: To buy more coconuts to resell

description:
La elaboración de alimentos es una actividad que requiere de mucha dedicación por el motivo de que se deben preparar con alta calidad para lograr la satisfacción del cliente. En el mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León, la señora Gladis A. se dedica al negocio de elaboración y venta de comida para ofrecerla todos los días al personal que visita el mercado.

Sus inicios fueron muy difíciles para ella pero a medida que el tiempo ha venido transcurriendo ha logrado obtener firmeza en su negocio y esto gracias al apoyo que le ha brindado Ceprodel y una vez más solicita un crédito para la compra de la materia prima para la elaboración de dichos alimentos en su localidad.
description_translated:
The production of food is an activity that requires a lot of dedication because food should be prepared with high quality to satisfy the customer. In the market La Terminal in the city of León, Mrs. Gladis A. dedicates herself to the production and sale of food to offer food every day to the people that visit the market. Her start was difficult for her but over time she has been able to obtain security in her business, thanks to the support that Ceprodel has offered her. Once again, she's requesting a loan to buy more ingredients for the preparation of food in her town.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lutz, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy ingredients

description:
S. has been farming for a long time and she specializes in growing rice.  It is a skill she learned from her grandparents. 

She is 24 years old, married and has two children, both of whom are teenagers and in school.  Her husband is a local fisherman and also helps his wife in growing rice. 

The couple is requesting a loan to buy a motorbike that will be used to ride for catching fish.  The family lives in Pursat Province and they appear in the picture.
loan_use: To buy a motorbike

description: Margaret N. is the leader of the Bbogo loan group in Lugazi. She is a very hard working lady and manages her businesses well.  She sells a small silvery fish known as ‘mukene’ that she buys from the fishermen either late at night or very early in the morning depending on the fishing schedule and season.  She then sells these fish to people at the landing site, in the village, and others in Lugazi.  In addition to this business, she makes chapattis for customers for breakfast.  Her sales depend on the weather, on some days she can use up to 1.5 packets of flour.  Lastly, she has a small scale farm. Margaret is requesting a loan to buy more fish to sell and a carton of flour.
loan_use: to buy more fish to sell and a carton of flour

description: Kyei B. sells groceries and other food supplies in Nyankumasi near Cape Coast. Kyei has received a junior high school education.  He is married and has 3 children. Kyei has been selling groceries and other food supplies since 2006. He is responsible for paying the children's school fees, rent, utility bills and other financial expenses. He will use his loan to buy more groceries and bags of rice, cartons of cooking oil and other food items to meet the recent increase in demand. He hopes to reinvest the profits from his business in the further expansion of his store.
loan_use: His loan will be used to buy more groceries and bags of rice, cartons of cooking oil and other food items to meet the increase in demand by her costumers.

description:
Hawa I. is a 25-year-old. She is single and a mother with one child who is currently in primary school. She is very hard-working and resourceful for her family. She sells bags of maize, and she also sells food in her neighborhood. She has been selling "kenkey" for the past six years now. Hawa prepares kenkey from milled maize. It is well packed in maize leaves and it is left to boil for 2 hours to be served with hot pepper or any gravy stew together with fried fish.

Hawa obtains her supply of foodstuffs like maize, vegetables, and charcoal from the surrounding villages near Abofour. Hawa then retails them to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy bulk supplies of charcoal, maize, fish and vegetables to increase her inventory, especially in this season of "hamatan" where demand for her goods is high. She hopes the loan will enable her to increase her savings to pay her child's educational fees and also to save part to restock her inventory. Hawa belongs to a village bank called ‘Naomi’. She hopes to receive a loan in the amount of GHS 700 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.
loan_use: To buy bulk supplies of charcoal, maize, fish etc.

description: Doña Maria Hortencia tiene 46 años de edad, reside en  villa reconciliación con cuatro hermosos hijos mayores de edad, su esposo vende repuestos de motos en un establecimiento de un mercado de la capital, su negocio es una pulpería y vende también medicamentos, ropa zapatos con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado establecer este negocio con ahorro y ayuda de su esposo desde hace quince años, y créditos que Afodenic le ha brindado para crecer en  su negocio, con esta solicitud es la once la cual va invertir en insumos diarios para ofertar a sus clientes. Sus planes  es aumentar su inventario, así como remodelar su vivienda.\n\n
description_translated:
Maria Hortencia is 46 years old, and resides in the village of Reconciliación with 4 beautiful children whom are all of age. Her husband sells motorcycle replacement parts in an establishment in a market in the capital. Her business is a convenience store and she also sells medicines, clothing, and shoes. With much effort she has been able to establish this business with savings, and help from her husband for the last 15 years. Loans from Afodenic have also helped her expand her business. This loan request will be her 11th, which will be invested in daily supplies to offer her clients. Her plan is to increase her inventory, as well as to remodel her home.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To purchase daily supplies to stock her convenience store.

description: Ernestina del Socorro M. tiene la edad de 49 años, su estado civil es soltera, Doña Ernestina tiene 2 hijos su edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 30 años y trabaja por cuenta propia u su hijo menor de 28 años que trabaja y estudia, su compañero de vida labora como chofer, los propósitos de Doña Ernestina son de aumentar su pulpería para que tener mas seguridad y confianza en el aspecto económico ya que todo depende de la economía del país, sus sueños son que las ayudas económicas que tenemos de los países industrializados sigan apoyándonos como lo han hecho hasta los momentos por lo que realmente es un gran beneficio el que se obtiene por que ayudan a crecer a personas pobres con el fin de lograr una mejor calidad de vida para cada uno de ellos, sus deseos son de establecer un mini súper para obtener mas ingresos para sufragar los pagos del hogar y las deudas contraídas con la institución ya que le gustaría administrar un negocio en donde sus clientes queden satisfechos con sus compras.\n\nSu actividad económica es una pulpería y la venta de comida,la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación, por lo que el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 29 años, Doña Ernestina inicia este negocio por iniciativa propia y empezó con un puesto en el mercado pero dio inicio con otro negocio como lo fue la venta de comida por lo que comenzó a buscar la atracción de sus clientes con la venta de comida y la popularidad de atraerlos y así empezó este negocio además decide incorporar su pulpería en la que tenia una canasta donde ofrecía golosinas pero debido a las circunstancias que se le presentaron Doña Ernestina no pudo seguir con el puesto del mercado ya que no podía pagar el arrendamiento del tramo por lo que decide establecerse en su casa de habitación y así implementa su negocio, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que esta destinado para la compra de productos variados ya que tiene que abastecer su pulperia.
description_translated:
Ernestina de Socorro M. is 49-years-old, single, and has two children. Her oldest son is 30 and works for himself. Her younger son, 28, works and studies. Her partner is a driver. Ernestina wants to grow her general store so she can have more economic security and confidence, as everything depends on the national economy. Her dream is that the economic aid we get from the industrialized countries will continue to support us as it has up to this point. It really does provide a great benefit because it helps poor people grow, bringing a higher quality of life to each and every one of them. Ernestina would like to open a mini mart so she can earn more money to defray household expenses and her debt to the Foundation. She wants to run a business in which customers are satisfied with their purchases. She has been in business for 29 years, working from her house running a general store and selling food. She went into business on her own initiative, opening a stall at the market; but then she started her food business, because food is very popular and she was looking to attract customers. That's how she got into her current business. She also added a candy basket to her store. Circumstances, however, did not allow Ernestina to keep up her stall at the market because she couldn't pay the rent on the space, so she decided to set up shop in her house and run her business there. Ernestina is seeking a loan for working capital so she can buy a selection of products, which she'll use to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Working capital

description: Monsieur D. Laurès est né le 03 Décembre 1983 à Cotonou. Il a fréquenté jusqu'en classe de seconde.Après l'abandon des classes ,il a suivi une formation en maintenance informatique pendant 2 ans et a reçu son parchemin de fin de formation. Parrallèlement à son métier,il est très entreprenant et a ouvert des cabines téléphoniques, il vend également les cartes de recharges.C'est dans le souci de renforcer et diversifier ses activités que M. D. sollicite ce prêt.
description_translated:
Mr. Laurès D. was born on December 3, 1983 in Cotonou. He attended school up to 10th grade. After he left school, he took a computer maintenance training course for two years and received his diploma at the end of the course. Along with this trade, he is quite an entrepreneur and opened telephone booths. He also sells rechargeable phone cards. It is to bolster and diversify these businesses that Mr. D. is requesting this loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: purchasing 40 rechargeable phone cards for all available networks

description: Fati S. is a forty five years old widow and has given birth to eleven children. Unfortunately, 5 of the children have passed away. Four of her remaining children are males and two are daughters, all of whom are in school. She lives with the children in a rented apartment in Koforidua, a small town not very far from Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Fati works very hard to provide for her children. She is a farmer and trader of banana and cassava. She buys cassava and unripe banana from farmers in her locality and from the nearby villages and resells to retailers in her community local market. Fati has been in business for six years. It is Fati’s desire to save enough money to support her children in their academics. She is requesting a loan to procure banana and cassava in bulk so she can maximize her profit margin.
loan_use: To procure banana and cassava for resale.

description:
Marina  es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino.
Marina es casada, tiene 45 años y 3 hijos, Marina junto a su esposo tienen una ferretería en su casa, actividad que vienen realizando hace 1 año,  y les esta yendo cada vez mejor. Además Marina tiene una tienda de abarrotes y bebidas.
Marina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de chapas, focos, pinturas.
Los sueños de Marina son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener una ferretería grande y ser mayorista, tener un hogar unido.
description_translated:
Marina is a member of the communal bank "Amor Divino" (Divine Love). Marina is married, is 45 years old and has three kids. Marina and her husband have a small store in their house where they sell hardware supplies. They have been doing this for a year now and the business continues to improve. Marina also has a store where she sells groceries and drinks.

Marina needs a loan of 1,000 Soles which she will invest in the purchase of door knobs, locks, light bulbs and paint. The dreams of Marina are that her children will become professionals, she will have a large hardware store, she will be a wholesaler, and that she will have a loving and close family.

(Translated by Andrea and Tyler of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: The Purchase of Door Knobs, Locks, Light Bulbs and Paints

description:
Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino.
Carmen es casada, tiene 56 años y 6 hijos, Carmen junto a su esposo se dedica a la fabricación D. ladrillos en la comunidad D. Compañía, actividad que realizan con la ayuda D. peones. Además Carmen se dedica a la siembra D. verduras que venD. en el mercado D. abastos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.
Carmen necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. leña y pago D. los peones.
Los sueños D. Carmen son mejorar su casa, tener una tienda en su casa y que su hija sea profesional.
description_translated:
Carmen is a member of the communal bank "Amor divino" (Divine Love). Carmen is married and is 56 years old. She has 6 children. She and her husband make a living by making bricks. in a community called Compañía. They hire day laborers because they need help making the bricks. Carmen also makes a living raising and selling vegetable plants. She sells them at a wholesale market in Ayacucho. Carmen needs a loan of 1,000 Soles. She will invest this money in the purchase of fire wood and will also use it to hire workers.

Carmen dreams of making improvements to her house, having a store in her house and her daughter becoming a professional.

(Translated by Nikki of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy firewood and to hire workers

description:
Margalena G. is the bank coordinator for "Esfuerzate y Sed Valiente" (Group 3). The bank operates in San Marcos, a neighborhood a little bit outside of the city of Puerto Plata. Her group is the newest addition to this community bank, bringing their total number to 15 members. These entrepreneurs will undertake a variety of businesses, mostly involving clothing and food sales.

Margalena is 43 years old and is married to a man her own age. They have three grown children and three grandchildren. Margalena is a very active woman and has not delayed in putting time into her business. Most people probably see their business as a mean to achieve something, but Margalena also sees her business as a passion. Over 20 years ago, she started a beauty salon in her own house and in the front of her house she has a small frituria - which means that she fries a variety of foods for sale. About 4 years ago she also started to buy and sell clothes and natural products like medicine and drinks. Sometimes she is so busy with everything she is involved in that her husband and friends help her out. "I simply love to do business," she says.

San Marcos is a poor neighborhood, but the participants in the group think their economy has improved lately and that loans from Esperanza are one important reason for this improvement. It is no wonder that they have chosen Margalena as their coordinator. She is energetic and the one that has the most experience running a business.

With her upcoming loan, Margalena wants to expand her businesses, in particular she wants to sell more clothes. By being responsible with her loan, her businesses, family, group, and neighborhood will have more opportunity to prosper.
loan_use: Expand her fried food business and continue a new business activity: natural products sales

description:
Elvie B. lives in Barangay Lapogan, Tumuini, Isabela.  The village is located between the boundary of Ilagan and Tumauini, Isabela.  She is already 42 years old and married to Apolinario, a baker.  They are living with their only son Jay–Pee who is now 20 years old and a graduate of automotive course.  Their eldest daughter died of leukemia. The village where they live is an Agrarian Reform Community where main sources of income come from rice and corn farming. 

She is hoping that she will be able to avail a loan amounting to PhP4,000 for her direct selling business. Elvie is a selling agent for Avon and Natasha cosmetic products outlet in the town center, where she purchases the orders of her costumers from their village. She is earns income on commission basis at 25% for every PHP100 sales. She hopes to increase her business capital and income especially that she expect peak sales this coming month because it is harvest season for corn in their village.  She and her husband do not have other sources of income but she is still thankful that through their income they were able to send their son to school and finish a vocational course.  

Elvie intends to do her best to prosper her business and save some of her income for emergencies.
loan_use: Additional Capital for her direct selling business

description: Amaeze is 50-years-old and is married with five children. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria where she sells provisions like noodles, toothpaste, bathing soap, detergent and drinks. She is requesting a loan amount of $475 (N70, 000) to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders and LAPO micro finance for their financial support.
loan_use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

description:
Juana es socia del Bancomunal Maria Milagrosa.
Juana es conviviente, tiene 51 años, tiene cuatro hijos de 28,27,24 y 10 años, los mayores trabajan y él último esta en la escuela.  

Juana llega del Cuzco a los 17 años, con su hermano,  entró a la preparatoria para ingresar a la universidad, para educación inicial, pero su esposo no la dejó estudiar, ni trabajar por que decía que las mujeres tienen que  estar en su casa dedicadas  a cuidar hijos.  Es así como ella pasó su vida, hasta que su esposo le permitió trabajar pero en la puerta de su casa, tiene un negocio de venta de picarones desde hace siete años, pero también aprovecha para vender   entradas como  papa rellena y  causa. 

Desde que esta en Finca recibe  préstamos los cuales  han ayudado mucho para surgir en su negocio, en el Bancomunal pasa tiempos bonitos, sé desestreza.
Juana necesita un crédito de 1000 soles, para la compra de descartables, harina, saco de papas.
El sueño de Juana es abrir un restaurante. En su casa, sus vecinos le dicen que tiene buena sazón.
description_translated:
Juana is a member of Bancomunal Maria Milagrosa. Juana has a life partner and is 51 years old. She has four sons of 28, 27, 24, and 10 years. The older sons work, and the youngest is in school. Juana arrived in Cuzco when she was 17 years old with her brother. She entered school to enroll in the university for education, but her husband did not permit her to study or work because he said that women should be in the house to care for children. This is how she spent her life until her husband allowed her to work from home. For seven years, she has had a business that sells fritters and also starters, such as stuffed potato and causa. Since she has been with Fina, she has received loans that have helped her greatly to succeed in her business. With Bancomunal, the time that passes is beautiful, and she relaxes. Juana needs a loan of $325 to purchase perishables, flour, and a sack of potatoes. Juana’s dream is to open a restaurant. In her home, her neighbors say that she has a good flavor.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To purchase perishables, flour, and a sack of potatoes.

description:
La señora Ermida  L. S. tiene 40 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal Jesús Nazareno del distrito de Agallpampa de la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió secundaria completa, pero no continuó estudiando debido a la falta de apoyo económico de su familia.
A los 25 años se casó y tiene 2 hijos a quienes educa con mucha ilusión.
Su negocio consiste en compra de reses en la provincia de Julcán y las vuelve a vender en pie.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles cancelado en 4 cuotas, invirtió en una res.
Con este crédito de 1000 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas invertirá en una res.
Su máximo sueño es tener un capital propio para trabajar sola.
description_translated:
Ermida L. S. is 40 years old and belongs to the Community Bank of Jesus of Nazareth in the Agallpampa district, Otuzco province, La Libertad state, Peru. She completed a high school education but did not continue her studies to due a lack of financial support from her family. At 25 years old, she married and then had 2 chidren who were brought up with a lot of hope. Her business puchases beef from the Julcan province and then she travels around selling it. With her first loan of 300 soles, paid in 4 payments, she invested in a cow. With this loan of 1000 soles, to be paid in 6 payments, she will invest in another cow. Her highest dream is to have enough capital of her own to work alone.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase cattle for her business

description:
Afia S. is 48 years old. She is divorced and has four children, two of whom are in school, while the other two are learning a trade. Afia and her children live in Koforidua in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Afia earns income selling fresh fish (tilapia and red fish) and dried fish. She has been in this business for 35 years and has obtained a lot of useful experience. She buys the fish from farmers and fish mongers living in sea shore communities. This way, she avoids the extra expenses she would incur if buying from middlemen. Afia currently needs a loan to be able to buy an additional quantity of fresh and dried fish to meet the growing daily demand from her customers. She hopes to thereby increase her profit and use part of it to support her children in school. Afia belongs to a village bank called ‘Dea Nyame Beka’ which means 'What God will say.'
loan_use: Purchase of fresh and dried fish

description:
La señora Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “Miraflores”, distrito D. Pilcuyo, Provincia D. El Collao, Departamento D. Puno; D. 52 años D. edad, tiene 05 hijos, es casada y no posee estudios.
Trabaja hace 02 años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su negocio es la compra, engorD. y venta D. ganado vacuno, su primer préstamo fue D. S/.500.00 nuevos soles que le sirvió para adquirir alimento balanceado para engordar sus vacunos. 
Con este préstamo D. S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 03 meses D. manera puntual, el dinero le servirá para poder adquirir ganado (02 toros) y continuar dedicándose al engorD. y venderlos en las ferias ganaderas D. Pilcuyo o Ilave. Las ganancias le servirán para poder ayudar en los estudios superiores D. sus hijos.
description_translated:
Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank “Miraflores” located in the district of Pilcuyo, in the province of El Collao. She is 52 years old, has five children, is married, and has no education. She has worked for 2 years with the Manuela Ramos Movement. Her business consists of the purchase, raising, and sale of cattle. Her first loan was for 500 new soles and that helped her purchase feed for her cattle. With this loan of 2000 new soles, which will be repaid in three months, Rosa will purchase two bulls, and continue raising her other cattle and sell them at the fairs. Her earnings from that will allow her to help with the costs of her children’s education.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchas of 2 bulls and feed for her cattle

description:
Rose was born on July 24th, 1972. Through unmarried, she is blessed with one child, who is under 15 years of age.  She is a hard working lady and has faced so many challenges in life such as being unable to get married, ill health and  being unable to take care of her only son. Due to all of these challenges she made up her mind to become a GHAPE member in 2007. In this same year, she received her pioneer loan of 40,000FRS, and her repayments were made promptly. 

With a loan of 100,0000FRS, she plans to buy 7 cases of corn, 5 cases of beans, 4 cases of garri, and 5 buckets of coco yams. The loan repayment will start on the day the loan is disbursed . She is sure the business will succeed because she has been doing this activity for long period of time. She is has a good site for this particular business and she has a lot of customers. Her neighbors are happy with the business that she is doing because their travel distance to the market is reduced and the can buy from her late in the night. She plans to use her profits to reinvest into the business, to cater for her son's needs and to give good medical attention to her self and her son. She prefer to borrow from GHAPE because of the social services that GHAPE offers, and the method of repayment is comfortable.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.
loan_use: buy and sell of corn, beans, garri, cocoyams and dressmaking services.

description:
Olena is married with two sons. She owns a business that produces wood products - various souvenirs and decorative items. Her shop is located at home so she does not pay any rent. Her husband and sons are involved in this business too.

Olena has been in this business for more than 10 years. Her husband used to work at a small factory that made similar souvenirs. When the factory downsized, her husband was fired, and they began to produce similar items at home. The produce is sold in bulk in a different city located about 300 miles from them. Recently they bought a van to transport their products.

Olena would like to get a loan of 7,500 UAH to purchase raw materials for production. She hopes to increase the production and use additional profit to fix their house, which burned last summer.
loan_use: to purchase raw materials

description: Ceferina, es una madre abnegada, que desea con todas sus fuerzas ver profesional a su único hijo, a sus 54 años a logrado tener su casa propia, pero aun quiere obtener muchas cosas más. Para Ceferina, su hijo Cristian de 11 años, se ha convertido en el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Con su bolsa de cosméticos en mano, sale todos los días a convencer a sus clientas de comprarle una crema o alguna pieza de maquillaje, Ceferina es muy convincente en su trabajo, no en vano es una de las mejores vendedoras y lleva ya 3 años en este negocio, del cual lo que más le gusta, es conversar con sus clientes e informarle sobre los productos más novedosos, en el futuro le gustaría poner su tienda de cosméticos, puesto que se le hace muy difícil cobrarle a sus clientes todos los meses. Ella trabaja sin descanso mes a mes con el único fin de mejorar la vida que actualmente lleva su adorado hijo Cristian. MFP le a concedido por primera vez un préstamo a Ceferina, quien esta muy feliz por ello, ha trabajado mucho en su banco comunal para lograr este crédito y no quiere faltar a ninguna de sus cuotas. Con este préstamo, Ceferina comprará más cosméticos, invertirá todo el monto en incrementar su mercadería, para tener productos más surtidos.
description_translated:
Ceferina is a selfless mother who wants, with all her might, to see her only son adopt a profession. At 54, she's managed to get her own house but there are still a lot of things she wants. For Ceferina, her son, Cristian, 11, has become the focus of all her efforts. With her bag of cosmetics in hand, she goes out every day to convince her customers to buy a cream or some item of make-up from her. Ceferina is very persuasive and it's not surprising that she's one of the top saleswomen. She's operated the business for 3 years. What she likes most is talking to customers and telling them about new products. In the future, she would like to set up her own cosmetics shop becuase she's found it difficult to see all of her customers during every month. Ceferina works tirelessly, month after month, with the single-minded goal of making a better life for her beloved son, Cristian. This is Ceferina's first MFP loan and she's very happy to get it. She's worked hard at her community bank to get this loan and doesn't want to miss a single installment. She will use the loan to buy more cosmetics, investing the total amount in adding merchandise so that she has the stock she needs.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Add merchandise.

description: Joyce B. is a 34 year-old woman, married with two children, one of whom is currently schooling and the last born is breastfeeding. Joyce works very hard to provide for herself and her children.  She is into the sale of ladies slippers by hawking (door to door sales). With her good customer relations, Joyce believes she would make more sales if she purchases the right quality of goods demanded by her loyal customers. She says this would help her make more profit to expand her business and also finance her kid’s education. She also sells gari and fried fish at the main road of Koforidua where she currently lives. Gari is prepared from milled cassava. It has been her wish to restock her inventory with raw materials but she is constrained with adequate funds to make business progress.  Joyce again believes this will help expand her business to raise more income to support her husband to provide food and finance her children education.  Joyce belongs to a village bank called God will provide. She hopes to receive GH¢500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.\r\n
loan_use: To buy more slippers and cooking oil, gari and fresh fish.

description:
Akosua A. is a 50-year-old woman. She is married and has six children. Two of her children are learning a trade and the rest are in school. She lives with her husband in her matrimonial home at Koforidua, a suburb of Offinso, in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She is an achiever and a resourceful woman. She loves selling goods, the business through which she makes a living.

Akosua has been buying and selling bananas and cassava in Koforidua market for more than ten years now. She treks to surrounding villages near Abofour to purchase bulk stocks of bananas and cassava from the farmers and retails them to her customers. For lack of adequate working capital, she is not able to pick up enough stock from the farmers to make enough profit to support her family. She wants to use part of the profit to support her children's education.

With the loan, she wants to purchase a bulk supply of bananas and bunches of plantains to enable her to scale up her sales. She believes the loan would enable her to save more income to support her business growth. Akosua belongs to a village bank called ‘Fawohoma Nyame’. She hopes to receive GHS 700 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. This would enable her to save more to help her husband in taking care of the household.
loan_use: To purchase bulk bananas and plantains

description: María de los Ángeles O. tiene 56 años, está casada, y no tiene hijos. Doña María es costurera y hace más de cuarenta años que tiene de poseer este negocio. Con el fin de obtener ingresos, decidió comercializar sus productos en los mercados. El lugar en donde se ubica su negocio está en su casa de habitación, por lo que sus clientes le realizan los encargos de prendas de vestir. Cuando inició este negocio, dio inicio con una pequeña máquina de coser, elaborando sencillas prendas de vestir como faldas y trajes para dama. Es así como su negocio logró a crecer. El financiamiento que necesita es para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de sus prendas de vestir. Sus sueños son de tener una fábrica de costura en la que pueda emplear a muchas personas que realmente quieren trabajar. El monto que solicita es de C$ 21.000 córdobas a un plazo de 10 meses.
description_translated:
María de los Ángeles O. is 56 years old, married, and does not have children. María is a seamstress, and has had this business for more than forty years. With the goal of generating income, she decided to sell her products at the markets. Her business is located in her own home, where her customers realize their clothing orders. She started out with just one small sewing machine, making simple garments such as skirts and women’s suits. This is how she managed to grow her business. The financing she needs is to buy raw materials for making her clothes. Her dream is to have her own tailor shop, where she could employ a lot of people who truly want to work. The amount she is requesting is 21,000 Nicaraguan, over a term of 10 months.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Working capital.

description:
Adisa S. is 41-year-old trader, married with six children--five are in the community school and the last-born is in school. She lives in her husband's family house with the children at Koforidua, which is a farming community in the Ashanti region. She believes in hard work and dedication as the primary antidote to minimizing poverty and she is very serious with her business. She trades in cereals, like maize, and bananas. She started this business three years ago from Offinso but realized that business was slow. She then relocated to the next town, Abofour, and has remained in this business since then. Through this, Adisa has been very resourceful for her family. She wants to use the loan to buy a larger supply of maize and bananas to serve her customers throughout the season. Especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in the country, she believes with the loan she can buy more bags of maize grains and bunches of bananas from the farmers, avoiding middlemen who sell to her at a high price.

Adisa belongs to a village bank called ‘Nhyira’, which means Blessing. She hopes to receive GH500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. This would enable her save more to support her husband in taking care of the home.
loan_use: To buy larger supply of maize and bunches of bananas.

description:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Estrella.
Juana es casada, tiene 37 años y 1 hijo, Juana vende cosméticos por catálogos  que ofrece a amigos, familiares. Además Juana vende ropa, calzados, edredones, artefactos y todo cuanto le pidan sus clientes, productos que adquiere en la ciudad de Lima y Tacna.
Juana necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de zapatillas y ropa.
Juana sueña con tener un local estable en donde vende sus productos y comprar un carro.
description_translated:
Juana is a member of the Estrella (Star) communal bank. Juana is 37 years old, married and has one son. She sells cosmetics by catalog that she gives to her friends and family. Furthermore, Juana sells clothes, shoes, quilts, devices y everything her clients ask for. She gets the products in the city of Lima and Tacna. Juana needs a loan of 2000 soles that will be invested in the purchase of shoes and clothes. Juana dreams of having a local shop where she can sell her products and of buying a car.\r\n\r\n

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lutz, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy shoes and clothing

description: Doña Aura tiene 48 años de edad, reside en Villa libertad,  con cuatro hijos de 2, 5,16 y 20 años de edad, su negocio es la venta de ropa y cosméticos al crédito como al contado, que inicio desde hace dieciocho años, con dinero propio y ayuda de su esposo, con la solicitud va invertir en compra ropa escolar como útiles escolares y cosméticos esta es su sexta solicitud que ha sido de muchos beneficios para su negocio como en su vida personal, con esto espera lograr mejorar las ventas como captar clientes. ya que la venta de uniformes es la prioridad de los estudiantes,  sus planes a corto plazo es invertir mas.\n\n
description_translated:
Aura is 48 years old, and she lives in Villa Libertad with her four children, ages 2, 5, 16 and 20. She is in the business of selling clothes and cosmetics on credit as well as for direct payment. She started her business eighteen years ago with her own money and help from her husband. With the loan she will invest in school clothes, school supplies and cosmetics. This is her sixth request. Her previous requests have greatly benefited her business as well as her personal life. With this loan she hopes to improve sales and gain more customers. Buying uniforms is a priority for students, so her short term plans are to invest more in them. \r\n

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy fabric and cosmetic products

description:
These are teachers of the Christian Reform Church Primary School, Kabala. The Christian Reform Church Primary School Kabala was founded by Mr. Dennis De Groot and the school started its operations on the 26th of September 2007. At the end of the war, the school was set up with a desire to give quality education to the children of Koinadugu District and to rebuild good moral attitudes in the minds of the children by diligently teaching them the word of God. The school currently has 147 pupils with a staff of seven.

The school is still a new one with only classes one to five. Come next year, they will get their first group of pupils to write the National Primary School Examination (BECE). Only two years since its inception now, the school has gained a reputation for quality education. It is the only school in Kabala with a ratio of thirty pupils to one teacher. It has a very good resource center for both teachers and pupils. They encourage teachers from other schools to use their resource center. By comparison, their resource center is far more equipped than many secondary schools in the town (i.e. for the few schools that have a library). It is also the only primary school in Kabala that provides cooked rice to its pupils. Other primary schools either do not have this facility or manage to provide for their pupils with bulgur wheat supplied by the UNHCR.

This school is not a government-assisted school like the other schools in town; hence, it gets all these opportunities that are lacking in other primary schools. Its teachers receive their salaries from Frasirvalley Christian High School in Canada, and their salaries are said to be far better than government-sponsored schools. (Learn more about this school at http://kabalaschoolproject.blogspot.com).

The Christian Reform Church Primary School Kabala suffers from a few constraints. The school is situated far away from the town center, making it strenuous for both pupils and staff to come to school everyday. The continuing rise in the cost of food stuffs is also affecting the running of the school, and in addition to these, the school currently lacks enough drugs to give first aid to the children.

James T. K. (left) is the Head Teacher of the school. He was born in Koinadugu District and he is thirty-five years old. James is married and the couple have four children together: one is in secondary school, one in primary school, one in nursery and the last is still sucking. With this loan, James will buy building materials like bags of cement, truckloads of sand, and boards.
loan_use: Buy building materials
borrower_names: Bomba, Bockarie S., Sheku D., Fina S., Mariama S., James T., Mankapri, Bunduka, Tamba, Ibrahim
borrower_genders: male, male, male, female, female, male, female, male, male, male
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description: La joven emprendedora Darling Aracely Rodríguez Martínez tiene 25 años, está soltera, tiene un hijo quien tiene la edad de 7 años. Por lo que en estos momentos está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresa ya que en sus planes esta el saber administrar de buena forma su negocio. La actividad económica de la joven Darling es la venta de cosméticos como: talcos, cremas, perfumes y pinturas de uñas entre otros. Su sueño es de emprender su propia empresa ya que la experiencia que ha obtenido le ha otorgado la confianza necesaria. El préstamo que solicita es de C$ 6.000 córdobas a un plazo de 6 meses.
description_translated:
Darling Aracely Rodríguez Martínez is a young entrepreneur. She is 25 years old, single and has a seven-year-old son. She is currently studying business administration since she plans on knowing how to manage her business well. Young Darling works selling cosmetics such as powders, creams, perfumes and nail polishes among other things. Her dream is to start her own business since her experience has given her the confidence she needs. She is applying for a loan of 6.000 Córdobas in a period of 6 months.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: working capital

description:
A raíz de que sus hijos empezaron a trabajar en un centro comercial, se fue dando cuenta de la demanda que existía de parte de los trabajadores para poder vender menús como pensión, es decir un servicio delivery al centro de trabajo. Gracias al apoyo de sus hijos fue haciéndose conocida y hoy en día cuenta con un número regular de clientes a quien reparte almuerzo a diario.

Por otro lado,  Delma se dedica también a vender productos de belleza en sus tiempos libres y por las noches vende salchipapas.

Su esposo trabaja como albañil y entre ambos contribuyen a cubrir los gastos de la casa. Sus seis hijos ya son independientes, por ello en un futuro quisiera abrir un restaurante en su  propia casa.
description_translated:
When her children started to work in a commercial center, she realized that there was demand by the workers for daily homemade meals. That is, a delivery service of meals to their workplace. Thanks to the support of her children, she became well known and nowadays she has a regular number of customers to whom she delivers a daily lunch. In addition, Delma also sells beauty products in her free time, and at night, she sells salchipapas (meat and potatoes fast food dish). Her husband works as a laborer, and together they contribute to the household expenses. Their six children are already independent, and so they would like to open their own restaurant in their own house.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Fixing a cart for selling fast food (salchipapas)

description:
Lube es socia de Bancomunal San Judas Tadeo.
Lube es casada, tiene 50 años, cuatro hijos, de 18, 15  13Y 10 años que está en la escuela estatal. 
Lube nació en cañete en la cacha de sus padres, desde niña ayudada en la chacra, y aprendió el manejo de la misma, con el tiempo estudio contabilidad y ahora la aplica a su negocio. Su negocio es de venta de frutas, uvas, manzanas, y palta. Que siembra en su chacra. 
Necesita un crédito de 2600 soles, para la compra de insecticida, abono.
El sueño de Lube es que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener una casa, por que vive en casa de sus padres, le gustaría tener una tienda.
description_translated:
Lube is a member of San Judas Tadeo Communal Bank. Lube is married, 50 years old and has four children aged 18, 15, 13 and 10 who are at the state school. Lube was born in the city of Cañete in the home of her parents and from the time that she was a child she has helped on the ranch and learned the operation of the business; with time she studied accounting and now she applies it to her business. Her business is selling fruit- grapes, apples, and avocado, which she raises on the farm. She needs a loan of 2600 soles to purchase insecticide and fertilizer. Lube dreams of her children becoming professionals, having a house because she lives in the house of her parents, and she would like to have a store.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Needs a loan of 2600 soles to purchase insecticide, fertilizer.

description: Elijah A. is 30 years old and married with 2 children. He sells provisions, medicine and drinks. He started this business in 2000. He needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more provisions, medicine and drinks to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.
loan_use: To purchase more provisions, medicine and drinks to sell

description:
Adela, pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”, ubicado en el Jr. Lloque Yupanqui Mz. G Lt 21, de Km 6,200 en la Asociación Pro vivienda San Martin D. Distrito de Callería. Tiene 50 años de edad con 02 hijos, su esposo trabaja en la Municipalidad de Coronel Portillo. 

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de Trescientos Nuevos Soles (S/. 300.00), compró gaseosas, ollas y artículos de primera necesidad para poder vender menú.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1300 nuevos soles, comprará una olla arrocera,  4 ollas grandes ya que  brinda servicios de alimentos  a todo el personal  de una empresa maderera  cerca de su casa donde su hija labora. 

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por su  ayuda y confianza  que  deposita en ella.
description_translated:
Adela belongs to The Winners community bank located in San Martin, Peru. She is 50 years old and has two children. Her husband is a works in the municipality of Coronel Portillo. With the first loan Adeloa received of 300 soles, she purchased soft drinks, pots and pans, and articles of primary need to be able to sell her meals. With the current loan she is requesting of 1,300 soles, she plans to purchase a rice cooker and four big pots so she can provide food services to all the workers at a lumber business where her daughter works near her home. She thanks Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for its help and the confidence it places in her.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase a rice cooker and four big pots

description:
GABRIELA RAMIREZ D. A., Pertenece al Banco comunal “Las Triunfadoras”, ubicado en Mz, I Lt. 03, Urbanización Pedro Portillo – Distrito de Yarinacocha, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 43 años de edad, 03 hijos, su esposo es constructor civil.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de Trescientos Nuevos Soles (S/. 300.00), compro una impresora pequeña, artículos de oficina, papeles bond A-4.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, compró artículos de oficina en mayor  cantidad, una impresora con escáner, y se financio una computadora, para realizar en su casa tipeos, y diseños gráfico.

Agradece a Manuel Ramos, por apoyarla, su anhelo era tener una computadora completa, ahora lo tiene gracias a Manuela Ramos, y puede realizar y cumplir con sus proyectos.
description_translated:
GABRIELA RAMIREZ D. A. belongs to the communal Bank called "Las Trinfadoras" located in the urban development Pedro Portillo – District of Yarinacocha in the city of Pucallpa. She is 43 years old and she has 3 children. Her husband is a civil builder. The first loan of 300.00 Nuevos Soles ($90), she bought a small printer, office supplies and A-4 paper. With this loan of 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles ($375) she bought more office supplies, a printer with scanner, and a computer to be able to do graphic designs. She is grateful to Manuel Ramos (Kiva's partner) for supporting her. Her wish was to be able to have a complete computer equipment, now she has it thanks to Manuela Ramos, and she can make and fulfill carry out her projects.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Buy more office supplies, a printer with scanner, and a computer to be able to do graphic designs.

description:
La señora Erminia V. A. tiene 47 años, vive en el sector Gran Chimu del distrito El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudio hasta 3ro de primaria, dejó los estudios debido a que su padre se enfermó y tuvieron que trabajar para salir adelante, tiene una pequeña hija que depende enteramente de ella.
Erminia se dedica a la venta de ropa de dormitorio y quesillo, se inicio con la venta de accesorios de carro, negocio que le fue muy rentable hasta que perdió todo su capital cuando le decomisaron su mercadería. Viajo a Argentina por un tiempo y al regresar empezó vendiendo menú, el mismo que abandono debido a que se enfermó; luego se inició en la venta de carne, quesillo y ropa de dormitorio, negocio que aun desarrolla en su propia casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Mujeres  del Milenium”, lo invirtió en la compra de una cocina semindustrial.
Con este crédito de 1000 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de  ropa para dormitorio. 
Erminia sueña con abrir una tienda de accesorios para carros.
description_translated:
Ms. Erminia V. A. is a 47-year-old woman who lives in Gran Chimu, district of Porvenir, in the Trujillo province of the department La Libertad, Peru. She completed three years of grade school, but then stopped studying because her father got sick and they had to work in order to get ahead. She has one dependent young daughter. Erminia sells bedclothes and cheese for a living. She began by selling car accessories, which was a very profitable business until she lost all her capital when her merchandise was confiscated. She then went to Argentina for a while and when she returned began selling menu meals. She had to abandon this business because she got sick. She then began selling meat, cheese, and bedclothes from her home. A business she is still in the process of developing. She invested the first 300.00 loan she received from her local bank “Mujeres del Milenium” in the purchase of a semi-industrial kitchen. She will invest this 1000.00 loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, in the purchase of bedclothes. Erminia’s dream is to open a car accessories store.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Invertir en la compra de ropa para dormitorio, negocio que tiene en su casa.

description:
La señora María del Pilar Ruiz D. tiene 25 años, vive en el distrito de Paijan,  provincia de Ascope, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudio Secretariado Ejecutivo, carrera que no ejerció debido a que los sueldos no cubrían sus expectativas, tiene 02 hijos que dependen económicamente  de ella.
María se dedica a la venta de regalos y adornos, se inicio vendiendo ropa interior y regalos, con el tiempo fue abandonando la venta de ropa y dedicándose solo a la venta de regalos y sandalias por campaña de verano negocio que le es muy rentable el mismo que lo desarrolla en su propio domicilio.
 Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Confianza”, lo invirtió en la compra de mercadería para aumentar su capital.
Con el crédito de 800 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de  sandalias para campaña de verano.
María sueña con tener un stand donde pueda vender mecería, bijouteri y ropa.
description_translated:
Maria del Pilar Ruiz Diaz is 25 years old and lives in the district of Paijan, province of Ascope, department of La Libertad, Peru. She studied to be an executive secretary but did not practice her career because the salary would not have covered her expenses as she has two children that economically depend on her. Maria dedicates herself to the sale of gifts and decorations. She started off selling undergarments and gifts and in time she stopped selling clothes and dedicated herself to selling only gifts and sandals during the summer. She carries out this business from her home and the business is very profitable. Maria invested the first loan that she received in the amount of 300 soles from the communal bank "Honestidad y Confianza" in purchasing merchandise in order to increase her capital. This loan which she is requesting in the amount of 800 soles and which she will repay in four months will be invested in purchasing sandals for the summer. Maria dreams of having a stand where she can sell her merchandise, costume jewelry and clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase sandals to sell during the summer season.

description: Josphine sells colourful traditional beads. Traditional beads are worn in Nigeria on special occasions like marriage, naming ceremony, etc. The demand for her traditional beads is high and Josephine needs a loan for N50,000 in order to purchase more beads to sell. Josephine is 55 years old and married with five children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.\r\n
loan_use: To purchase more beads to sell

description:
La señora Dina es socia del Banco Comunal “03 de Mayo”, en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 27 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 01 hijo y posee estudios de secundaria completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 05 meses, ella tiene una tienda donde vende abarrotes, gaseosas, golosinas, etc.; su primer préstamo fue de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual adquirió mas mercadería para su negocio. 
Ella desea mejorar su negocio. Con este préstamo de S/ 800.00 nuevos soles, monto que pagará en 5 cuotas mensuales; podrá incrementar su capital y adquirir mas mercaderías (bebidas, abarrotes y golosinas  todo lo que requieran sus clientes), de esta manera obtendrá mejores ingresos y lo invertirá en la educación de su hijos, así como en su alimentación y salud.
description_translated:
Dina is a member of the Banco Comunal “03 de Mayo” in the district of Ilave, province of El Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 27 years old, lives with her domestic partner, has one son, and has finished high school.\r\nShe has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for five months. She has a store where she sells groceries, sodas, candy, etc. Her first loan was for 500 soles, which she used to purchase more merchandise for her business.\r\nShe wants to improve her business. With this 800-soles loan, which she will pay in five monthly installments, she will be able to increase her capital and acquire more merchandise (drinks, groceries, and candy, everything her customers need), and in that way increase her income, which she will use for her son's education, as well as for keeping him well-fed and healthy.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Increase her capital and acquire more merchandise (drinks, groceries, candy)

description:
Mrs. Liem P. is a group leader of four members who all live in Thmey village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a grocer. Her husband, Mr. Seng Socheat, is a vet in the local village. Aside from this career, he is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate lotus. In this plantation, he does not have enough lotus seed to grow. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Liem P. decided to ask for a loan to buy more lotus seed for her husband’s plantation. She hopes to increase income and improve their living conditions with this loan. She is 30 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school, while the youngest one is too young to work or study.

All the members in this group loan have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan's term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.
loan_use: To buy more lotus seed for her husband’s plantation.

description:
Kul S., 48, is married and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She makes about $7 per day by growing yams and selling them in the market, while her husband earns around US$ 15 by working as a taxi-driver. She and her husband have five children, four who are employed as taxi drivers and one who is in school.

Mrs. Kul S. would like to take out a loan to purchase a small truck for her husband to operate as a taxi.
loan_use: purchase a truck for transport

description: Seng T. is 59 years old and has a business selling grocery items to the people in the community to earn about US$ 3 in profit every day. She has one child and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province. Her husband is a farmer who grows and sells vegetables at the market to earn approximately US$ 1.50 in profit per day. Her child is a worker and makes US$ 2 a day. She would like request a loan of US$ 300 to expand her grocery store by adding more goods to meet her customers’ demands. \r\n
loan_use: supplies for grocery store

description:
Suon K., 52, is married and lives with one of her daughters in Kampong Cham, Cambodia She sells cake on campus at a nearby school and makes US$ 5 per day. Her daughter is a university student and is pictured here. She has a small business selling grocery items when she is free from her studies. On average, she makes US$ 3 every day.

Mrs. Suon K. is asking for a loan to expand her daughter’s grocery store.
loan_use: expanding grocery store

description: Irina sells bed sheets, towels, and blankets at the central market. She has been in this business for 17 years. These types of goods are in high demand. Irina is divorced and both of her children are gown up. Her daughter is married and lives separately. Irina lives with her son. \r\n\r\nThis business is the only source of income for Irina. Irina would like to get a loan of 5,000 UAH to purchase 50 bed sheet sets. She knows that having good variety of product is one of the main keys in making good sales.
loan_use: To purchase 50 bed sheet sets

description: Much N., 37, a widow who lives with her five children in Siem Reap, Cambodia, works as an authority at Angkor Temple and makes $40 per month. Two of her children are in school and one is employed as an authority at Angkor Temple. Mrs. N. is requesting a loan of $600 to repair her house and start a new business selling souvenirs. \r\n
loan_use: To repair her house and sell souvenirs.

description:
“Hard work and patience are virtues one needs to become a successful entrepreneur” said Marites D., a micro- entrepreneur living in the village of Rizal, Santiago City.  

Marites operates her gown rental and catering businesses. Aside from these, she also sells frozen foods in their village for extra income to support the education of their children especially that her eldest child is about to entercollege this school year.  Her weekly income is carefully budgeted for their daily needs, school allowance and working capital for her businesses.  She wants to improve and develop her businesses for her family. For her gown rental business, she wants to avail a loan of PHP5,000.  She believes that to become successful, she needs to trust in her own ability and have faith in God.  

Her husband Jimmy is engaged in farming.  Their children are: Zyrene Andrella,16, a senior high school student and Wyndie Reeze,12, a graduating elementary student.
loan_use: Additional working capital for her business

description: Sally is a determined mother of 3 children and a compassionate wife to a sick husband. She never loses hopes and works hard to support her family. She manages a variety store and twice a week has to wake-up as early as 3 o'clock in the morning to buy inventory for her variety store as the market is 67 kms. from her home. Starting with a small capital of PHP 5000 obtained from a loan with HSPFI, Sally was able to expand her variety store. She hopes to  buy inventory in large quantity for her variety store so that she won't need to frequently go to the market  to purchase supplies.. Therefore she is requesting a loan for additional capital amounting to PHP 11,000.
loan_use: To buy supplies for her general store
town_name: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

description: Mary is 43 years old and married with four children. She lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. Mary sells provisions like noodles, detergent, toothpaste, etc. She sells retail to her customers. Mary hopes for a loan to purchase more provisions to sell to her customers. She says thank you.\r\n
loan_use: To purchase more provisions to sell.

description:
Mary M. earns a living selling provisions and drinks to retail customers. She would like to expand her inventory. She therefore needs a loan of N50,000 so she can purchase more provisions and drinks to sell.

Mary is 45 years old. She is married with 5 children. Her husband is a commercial driver.

She says thank you to all kiva lenders for their financial support.
loan_use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

description:
El señor José está casado con la señora Ermelinda de Díaz, tiene 4 hijos, vive en un barrio muy cercano al centro de la ciudad de Itá, se dedica a la fabricación y venta de planteras de todos los modelos y tamaños hace más de 18 años. Su fábrica lo tiene situado en su domicilio, dos de sus hijos lo ayudan en el negocio, los demás se dedican a actividades diferentes a la de él, mientras que su señora ayuda en los quehaceres del hogar.  Sus ventas las realiza en la ciudad de Itá, alrededores e interior del país.
 
El señor José solicita el préstamo para la compra de leña y arcilla, los cuales son materias primas esenciales para la elaboración de sus productos, de modo a satisfacer la demanda de un pedido importante que uno de sus clientes solicitó.
description_translated:
José is married to Ermelinda de Díaz; he has four children and lives close to downtown Itá. He has been making and selling planters of all sizes and shapes for more than 18 years. His factory is located in his home; two of his children help him in the business, the other two have their own lines of work. His wife helps with all the household chores. He sells in the city of Itá, in the surrounding areas and in the interior of the country.\r\n\r\nJosé is asking for a loan to buy firewood and clay, which are the raw materials essential to his business, in order to fill a large order placed by one of his customers.
