Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy firewood and clay

description: La Sra. Seferina García D. C. desD. hace años se dedica al servicio D. venta D. comida, en un pequeño kiosco ubicado en una zona residencial D. La Paz trabajo con el que conseguía ingreso para su familia, ella llega a Emprender en calidad D. Garante D. su ahijada quien le alquilo dicho kiosco, con el paso del tiempo la ahijada se va sin dejar rastro D. su existencia y es así como la  Sra. Seferina García se hace cargo D. esta deuda.\nEs así como esta señora muestra inicialmente una gran voluntad D. pago y responsabilidad junto a su Esposo quien la colabora incondicionalmente, ese fué el motivo por el cual ingresa al microcrédito, felizmente para ella y su familia con buena fortuna, ya que actualmente la Sra. se encuentra en su Tercera secuencia D. crédito y con la actividad D. venta D. comida en su pequeño kiosco.\n
description_translated:
Seferina García D. C. has been selling food for many years from a small kiosk in a residential neighbourhood of La Paz, work which brought income for her family. She came to Emprender as a guarantor to her goddaughter who rented her the kiosk. With time, her goddaughter left without a trace, leaving Seferina García with this debt.\r\n\r\nThis is how this woman showed from the beginning a great will to pay and sense of responsibility together with her husband who supports her unconditionally. And so she was introduced to microloans; happily for herself and her family she is now on her third loan cycle and selling food from her little kiosk.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Working capital

description: Las socias D.  la banca comunal "Jazmines" estan representadas por la señora Lourdes y son socias que  se conocen entre si ya que residen en el mismo barrio,  existe un parentesco consanguíneo entre la señora Santa Cecilia y Florencia las cuales son hermanas pero ambas cuentan con ingresos totalmente independientes por lo que no existe riesgo en el grupo. En cuanto al rubro que desempeñan es más del ámbito comercial y venden productos como comida, ropa, cosméticos por catálogos y al transporte público .en cuanto a la competencia se pueD. decir que ellas están conscientes D. la misma y también mencionan que la capacidad D. administrar bien el crédito, favorece para mejorar su negocio y obtener mejores ingresos.  El crédito que se les otorgó  esta destinado para aumentar su mercadería, comprar material D. trabajo y compra D. herramientas para desempeñar mejor sus funciones. Efectivamente las socias comentan que ya tuvieron créditos anteriores  en otras entidades financieras similares y una mayoría D. las socias ya estuvieron con otros grupos en la fundación agrocapital demostrando responsabilidad y cumplimiento en sus planes D. pagos.
description_translated:
The members of the 'Jazmines' community bank are represented by Lourdes. The members know each other well as they live in the same neighbourhood. There is a blood relationship between the members Santa Cecilia and Florencia, who are sisters, however both have incomes completely independent of each other and so there is no risk of dependence within the group. The members mostly work in the commercial sphere, selling products such as food, clothing and cosmetics by catalogue, or offering public transport services. In terms of competition, it can be said that the members are conscious of this, and they also mention that their capacity to manage credit well helps them to improve their businesses and increase their income. This loan will be used to expand their merchandise, buy materials for work, and buy tools to better carry out their services. The members say that they have previously received loans from other similar financial entities, and a majority of the members have previously participated in other groups with the Agrocapital Foundation, thus demonstrating responsibility and commitment in making their repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Working capital
borrower_names: FLORENCIA, LOURDES, CLARA, YVONNE, SANTA CECILIA, SEVERO, DELY, VIVIAN RAQUEL, ANA MARIA, VERONICA, ELIGIA, PATRICIA, RUTH, ELIGIA, ROSARIO, ERMEGILDA
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, male, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description: Patricia de 29 años, vive con su hija Camila de 6 años en su propia casa, ella quiere darle lo mejor a su hija y para lograrlo está dispuesta a trabajar sin descanso. Su trabajo es muy divertido, realiza figuras para decoración o adorno a base de corrospun, aprendió este arte de su mamá y ahora se dedica a ello, vende sus productos a centros educativos iniciales, centros de estimulación temprana y a cualquier madre que desee algo bonito para el cuarto de su pequeño niño. Son 5 años los que lleva Patricia en este negocio, disfruta mucho de armas la figuras que le piden y se puede pasar días enteros realizándolo, lo que menos le gusta de su trabajo es limpiar los pedazos que caen al suelo, ya que tiene que mantener limpio su lugar de trabajo. Lo que anhela es tener una tienda donde pueda vender sus manualidades, ya que actualmente los vende ambulantemente y a pedido, ella trabaja duro para darle a su pequeña hija unos buenos estudios. Es el primer préstamo de Patricia con MFP, y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, es muy participativa en su banco comunal y muy solidaria con las demás socias. Invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de más materiales para realizar sus figuras de corrospun y así vender a más clientes.
description_translated:
Patricia is 29 years old and lives with her six-year-old daughter Camila in the house she owns. She wants to provide the best for her daughter and, to do so, she is willing to work non-stop. Her job is a lot of fun. She makes decorative figures from plastic sheeting. She learned this craft from her mother and now dedicates herself to it full-time. She sells her products in primary and early education centers, and to mothers who want something nice for their children's rooms. Patricia has been involved in this business for five years. She really enjoys assembling the requested figures and can spend days finishing them. The thing she likes least about her job is cleaning up the pieces that fall on the floor, as she must keep her workspace clean. Her greatest wish is to have a shop where she can sell her handicrafts -- she currently sells them door-to-door and by request. She works hard to provide her daughter with a good education. This is Patricia's first loan with [kiva.org partner] Microfinanzas Prisma (MFP), and she is ready to make her payments on time. She is an active member of her community bank and very supportive of the other female members. Patricia will invest the requested loan in the purchase of more materials for making her figures from plastic sheeting and, in doing so, sell to more clients.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase of materials for making decorations

description: El señor José Alfredo M. tiene ya mas de 6 años dedicándose a la venta de comidas preparadas como es tacos, burritos, quesadillas y hamburguesas, este es un negocio familiar, sus tres hijos que ya son mayores cada uno tiene su negocio.\n     Él esta iniciando un nuevo local que estará ubicado en la carretea de Nuevo Laredo pero le está haciendo falta terminarlo, en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder terminarlo y no quiere descapitalizar su negocio. Es por eso que solicita un préstamo y así poder terminar su nuevo local con el cual de dará empleo a dos personas para que lo atiendan.\n
description_translated:
José Alfredo M. has more than six years experience dedicating himself to selling prepared meals such as tacos, burritos, quesadillas and hamburgers. It is a family business. His three children, all grown up, help him with the business. He is opening up a new store that will be located along the Nuevo Laredo highway, but he is having trouble completing it because at the moment he doesn't have the necessary funds and he doesn't want to take money away from his business. For this reason he is requesting a loan so he will be able to finish his new store and hire two employees to tend to it.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Complete construction of store

description: Elva tiene 39 años y vive con sus 4 hijos en su propia casa. Ella trabaja en los bordados artesanales desde hace 25 años y ofrece bellos trabajos elaborados a mano, esta trayectoria la ha coronado como una de las mejores en su zona. Los fustanes ya acabados los lucen las mujeres en las fiestas costumbristas de su región, ahora ella está muy animada en seguir adelante  porque  algunos de sus paisanos regresan después de mucho tiempo y  hacen pedidos en cantidades para asistir a las festividades que se programan en los próximos meses. Elva considera su trabajo como  una profesión, la cual disfruta cada día. dicionado a esto también se dedica a la crianza de animales  para venderlos cada cierto tiempo en la feria ganadera. Es la primera vez que  Elva tiene un préstamo con MFP, comprometiéndose a  trabajar en equipo y ser puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita es para comprar hilos de diversos colores en cantidades para bordar los fustanes, además lo empleará en el pago de salario para la persona que contratará para que la ayude a terminar los bordados en menor tiempo.
description_translated:
Elva is 39 years old and lives with her four children in a home she owns. She has been creating handcrafted embroideries for 25 years and sells beautiful hand-worked crafts. She is known as one of the best embroiderers of her area. The finished skirts are worn by women during local traditional celebrations. Now she is very cheerful about the future because some villagers are returning after a long time away and they are placing large orders for the upcoming celebrations. Elva thinks of her work as a profession which she enjoys every day. In addition to embroidery she raises animals to sell at market after a certain time. This is Elva's first loan with MFP, she is committed to working in a group and to being punctual in her repayments. She will use the loan to buy large quantities of wool in a medley of colours in order to embroider the traditional skirts as well as to pay the salary of an assistant she will hire so she can finish the embroideries more quickly.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy materials for embroidering

description:
Maryle A. grows rice to earn a living. Her life is on the farm. Her parents taught her everything she knows about farming, such as how to plant rice and other crops. They hoped that when the time came for her to have her own family, she would know how to support her children. Her husband Marlino A. is a very experienced farmer. Together, they work hard for their family's future. Eleven years ago, that they started their rice farm business. They reserve a portion of the harvest for their family and they sell the remainder to rice traders in town.

Maryle is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and seeds. She believes that the loan will help to give her a better return on her business investment. She hopes that increased income will hep to improve their living conditions.

Joining the CEVI credit program gave Maryle access to credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage.
loan_use: To buy fertilizers and seeds

description: Tsend Z. is a 28-year-old man who lives with his parents and younger sister. His family has a grocery store. Two years ago, he began borrowing from the bank to buy a car to use in a taxi business. From his profits, he repaid the full amount he borrowed and bought another car for his father. Now, his father is running a taxi business, too. Besides the taxi business, they also use the car to pick up and drop off food products for the family grocery store. They live in a "ger" (a traditional nomadic Mongolian home) district in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Z. is taking a loan to buy car supplies and tires. All the family members are working hard to make their little grocery store a supermarket.
loan_use: To buy car supplies and tires

description: M., 47, is a widower. He earns a living by raising pigs, which he sells when they mature. He currently lives with his daughter who is a garment worker at a garment factory in Phnom Penh City. M. wants his daughter to stop her work at the garment factory, so he want to provide her with a grocery store to run. Therefore, M. is asking for a $1000 loan for his daughter to use as capital to begin a grocery store. (He and his daughter are pictured.)
loan_use: To start a grocery store

description: Mr. Norng N. is a villager in Kdey Tnaut village in Takeo province. He is a construction worker. His wife, Mrs. Tom Ley, is a farmer who owns a piece of land where she cultivates rice. In this plantation, she faces a problem because her field is far from the irrigation system which has a bad effect on her crop. Thus, Mr. Norng N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a pump in order to have water to support the field. He is a 40-year-old father of a child who is attending the local school. His wife is also in the photo.
loan_use: to buy a pump for her field

description: Lermie T. is 31 years old and a mother of 6 children. She is married to Rosalito T., who is a farmer and they live in Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City, Southern Philippines. She is very determined to earn money for the family. With her first loan from HSPFI amounting to PHP 5, 000, she started a little variety store. Sadly, the business failed due to the unexpected pregnancy of her 6th child. She was able to make a 2nd loan and part of it was used for her  medication . Now, Lermie would like once again to strengthen her variety store and support his husband with improving  the living conditions of their family. With an amount of PHP 11, 000, she will purchase grocery items to sale in her sari-sari (variety) store. \r\n
loan_use: to purchase grocery items to sale in her store.
town_name: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

description:
Les membres du groupe Kokadiè sont tous des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et  5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies  dans le village de Tinimbougou, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro république du Mali.  
Unies par des relations professionnelles, elles font l’achat et la  vente  du charbon de bois. 
Dans le souci d’avoir assez de charbon de bois en stock et de mieux servir les clients, elles ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro  Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire et tous les précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Ces femmes comptent acheter, 4 tonnes de charbon de bois auprès des producteurs charbonniers du village de Tinimbougou et environnants pour ensuite les revendre au comptant sur place dans le même village aux grossistes venant de Dioïla.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune avec ce prêt, 11 000 FCFA de bénéfice qui servira à développer leur commerce.
description_translated:
The members of the Kokadiè group are all married women who average 30 years of age and 5 children. They live in extended traditional families in the village of Tinimbougou, Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region in the Republic of Mali. Linked by professional bonds, their businesses consist in buying and reselling charcoal. Anxious to have enough charcoal in stock to better serve their customers, they decided to join Kiva's partner, the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their third solidarity loan (group loan). All previous loans were repaid without problems.\r\n

\r\nThese women intend to buy 4 tons of charcoal from producers in Tinimbougou and in the surrounding villages, to resell it for cash or on credit in the same village to wholesalers coming from Dioïla. They foresee turning a profit of XOF 11'000 (ca US$ 22), to be used to bolster their businesses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy and resell charcoal
borrower_names: MAGNE, AWA, KOROTOUMOU, NIEFLA, YAMA, MAKORO, SALI
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Nadezhda is married. She and her husband live in Zaporozhye. Nadezhda sells women’s clothing in Yubileynyi market. She has been in the trade for 10 years. Presently, Nadezhda has about 25,000 Grivnas in inventory. Her gross income amounts to 5,000 Grivnas.

Nadezhda sees an opportunity for business growth this spring season. Her expertise in quality clothing merchandise is greatly appreciated by her customers. Her desire to assist clients and her entrepreneurial spirit are part of what makes her business successful. Nadezhda has requested a loan for 2,500 Grivnas to broaden the assortment of clothing items she offers at her kiosk so she will be ready for the busy season. She has proven to be a strong and reliable client with “Nadiya Ukraine”. We believe that this loan will be a big help to Nadezhda as she looks for ways to increase her business activity.

Note: this is a short-term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.
loan_use: To increase assortment of clothing items.

description:
A partir de las seis de la tarde hasta la medianoche, Vilma Casimiro se dedica a vender anticuchos en la puerta de su casa desde hace un par de años. Antes de vender anticuchos vendía frituras puesto que consiguió un carrito ambulante donde cocinar. En este negocio estuvo solos dos años hasta que el carrito se descompuso. Además la competencia en la venta de frituras era cada vez más alta.
Vilma empezó a trabajar vendiendo productos variados, especialmente cosméticos por catalogo. Su esposo, quien trabaja como chofer contratado de una reconocida clínica, y ella cubren los gastos del hogar. En unos años ella quisiera abrir un restaurante si se le presentara la oportunidad.
description_translated:
From 6 in the afternoon until midnight Vilma Casimiro sells kebobs from the door of her home – something she has done for six years. Prior to selling kebobs she used to sell fried food as she obtained a small cart where she could cook. She was in this business only two years when her cart broke. In addition, the competition in fried food continued to grow. Vilma began working selling various products, including cosmetics through a catalogue. She and her husband, who works as a contracted driver for a well-known clinic, cover the household expenses. In a few years she would like to open a restaurant if she has the opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Ingredients and materials for her business

description:
Janet K. is twenty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to four children: a boy and three daughters. The first three of her children are already in school; the last born is yet to start. She lives with her husband and children in a family house at a small town called Simpa. Simpa is a farming community which is a few kilometers away from Tarkwa in the Western Region of Ghana.

\r\nJanet’s husband is a farmer who cultivates palm nuts. She is a bread baker. Janet buys bags of flour and other ingredients from wholesalers in the nearby markets. She bakes bread in a traditional oven made from clay. Janet says she supplies to beverage sellers and retailers in her community. Janet has been in business for four years. It has been her desire to expand her business so she can make enough savings to help her husband take very good care of the family. She wants a loan to procure bags of flour in bulk so she can supply bread to more customers.\r\n
loan_use: To buy bags of flour

description:
Eduardo is a responsible husband to Donata and a good father to their two children: Edonna, 20 years old and a college student, and Edmund, 19 years old, a high school graduate. Their younger child is helping his father in the farm since he was not able to pursue his college studies due to financial difficulties.

Eduardo is engaged in raising chickens and is also a farmer. With lack of capital, he is now asking for a loan of PHP 4,000 that he can use in the business. They are hoping that through his business, he can provide the immediate needs of his family and cater for the education of their daughter.
loan_use: business capital

description:
Anna F. is a single parent and has 2 children. She has received schooling through junior high. Anna sells plastic products and soft drinks near the Elmina police station, which she has done since 2003. Anna uses her income to pay rent, utility bills, and other financial expenses.

\r\n\r\nAnna will use the loan to purchase more plastic products and soft drinks to meet the increase in demand by her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Anna plans to reinvest for the expansion of her trade.
loan_use: A purchase more plastic products and soft drinks for re-sale

description:
Rakia Z., married to a commercial driver and with seven dependents, was educated through junior high school. Since 1987, she has prepared food for sale and sold foodstuffs such as maize and plantain at Kotokoraba in Cape Coast. Rakia uses her income to help support her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family.

Rakia is now requesting a loan as additional capital to buy more food supplies to meet increased customer demand. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save towards acquiring a piece of land upon which to build the family home in order to stop paying rent and have a comfortable shelter for the family.
loan_use: As additional capital to buy more food supplies to meet increased customer demand.

description: Rose N. is a single parent and has 7 dependants. She has received no formal education. Rose sells food supplies like tomatoes, maize, cassava and plantain at Coronation near Cape Coast, which she has done since 1977. Rose uses her income to pay for rent, utility bills and other financial expenses . Rose will use the loan as additional capital to enable her to buy more food supplies to increase sales to meet the increase in demand by her costumers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rose plans to save towards acquiring a piece of land for the building of the family house so that they can stop paying rent and also get a comfortable shelter for the family.\r\n\r\n
loan_use: Rose will use the loan as additional capital to enable her to buy more food supplies to increase sales to meet the increase in demand by her costumers.

description: Theresa A. is a hair dresser who owns a beauty salon at Abura. Theresa has received primary level education.  She is a single parent and has 5 dependants.  Theresa has been a hair dresser since about 2 years ago. She is responsible for paying rent, utility bills and other financial expenses. Her loan will be used to buy a variety of hair products to meet the demand of her costumers who come to the salon. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back for the expansion of  her trade .
loan_use: Her loan will be used to buy a variety of hair products to meet the demand of her costumers who come to the salon.

description: Foye lives in largo State, Nigeria. She is engaged in the rental service of itms like chairs, tables, and canopies. Foye has been in this business since the year 1990 and she has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 4 years. Foye is 58 years old and married with 5 children. Foye is soliciting for a loan amount of N90, 000 to purchase more canopies, chairs, pots and tables to rent out. This will enable her to satisfy the demand of her numerous customers. She thanks you.
loan_use: To buy more canopies and chairs to rent

description: Christiana sells sarongs and is also a fashion designer. Christiana learned this business in 2 years, and she has had this business for 5 years. Christiana is married and she is 32 years old. Christiana lives at Ilaje, and she has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 2 years. She requests a loan for $550 (80000 NGN) to purchase more sarongs to sell. She thanks you for your support.
loan_use: Buy more sarongs to sell

description:
K. is 54 years old and a resident of Pursat Province. She has six children: four of them are attending school, and the other two are married and living separately. She is married to Bo, 60, who is a local farmer.

K. has raised pigs behind her house for more than 8 years. To meet her family's needs, she also helps her husband plant rice on another plot of her farmland located a bit farther from her house. Her children help her with her work after their classes. The family has earned a better profit with its businesses.

K. is applying for a loan of $1200 to buy a plot of farmland and more piglets for her stall. The loan will help the family achieve a better standard of living.
loan_use: To buy a plot of farmland and more piglets for her stall

description:
Saidniso M. has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2002. She recommends herself as a serious and reliable client who has not had any loan repayment delays. Her business turnover increase helped her to take each following loan step.

Saidniso is 29 years old. She is married with 3 children. She lives in Khujand and works in the local crowded bazaar. She sells small items and electrical items (electrical heaters, water heaters, telephone accessories, etc.) She has been engaged in this business for 2 years. She brings in her goods herself from Istaravshan.

Saidniso is applying to KIVA with a request for a business support loan in the amount of 4100 STJ for 2 months to increase her business inventory assortment and turnover. She thanks KIVA lenders for their support.
loan_use: business assortment and turnover increase

description: Абдуразок мужчина 25 лет , женат имеет одного ребёнка.Проживает в отдалённом районе Уткансой, расположенном вблизи гор.Жена молодая доярка собственных двух коров.Сам Абдуразок работает в колхозе трактористом.Ему колхоз не выплачивает зарплату , а выдают в начале года продукты питания на проживание(муку, рис , хлопковое масло,и.т.д.)поэтому для дополнительного дохода Абдуразок занимается бизнесом животноводства.Для увеличения Скота он хочет получить кредит.
description_translated:
Abdurazok A. is 25 years old, married and has a child. He lives in a distant Utkansoi district situated near mountains. His wife is a young milkmaid for their own two cows. Abdurazok works as a tractor driver at a collective farm. The farm does not pay him salary, but gives him food products (flour, rice, cottonseed oil, etc.) at the beginning of a year. Therefore, Abdurazok raises cattle to subsidize his income. He wants to obtain this loan to increase cattle headcount.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Raising cattle

description: K., 29, owns a battery-powered machine (battery AA) recharged in her family's land in the Siem Reap Province. She has been in this business for more than four years and runs it very well. To help add more income to the family, K. owns a grocery store, and she is noted for her service. Yun, 32, is K.’s husband; he owns a medium vehicle used as a dump truck. The family has three children, all of whom are single and attending school. Now, K. wants to increase her income to provide for her family’s expenses. Thus, K. is requesting a loan of $400 to buy more grocery products and to renovate her grocery shop. K. was not available during the photograph, so her husband is shown instead.
loan_use: To buy more grocery products and to renovate her grocery shop

description: Galina is divorced with one daughter. She sells women's clothing at several locations. She started her business 13 years ago. At that time there were few people with similar goods. Today Galina understands that having several locations is a real advantage over her competitors. Galina is very entrepreneurial and a hard-working person. Recently, she started new business - selling small home equipment. She is thinking about developing it further, provided sales are good.\r\n\r\nGalina would like to receive a loan of 5,000 UAH to increase her inventories. Her business is the only source of income for Galina and her daughter.
loan_use: To increase her inventory

description: Adama D., 44 ans est mariée avec 03 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Goudomp depuis 5 ans et demi.. Elle veut renforcer son activité de vente de tissus (tissus teintés et wax) pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie et de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
description_translated:
Adama D., age 44, is married and has three children to support. She has been a member of the village council of Goudomp for five and a half years. She wants to bolster her business selling cloth (dyed and Wax-brand) to satisfy her customers better. The income derived from her commerce enables her to improve living conditions and to cover the children’s schooling costs. She’s requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy and resell cloth

description: \nMaría Delfina M. Castellón tiene 45 años, la actividad económica a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de cosméticos como pintura de uñas, pinturas de labios, perfumes, cremas y maquillaje. Doña María se ha dedicado a este negocio hace más de 11 años. Por lo que esta solicitando un financiamiento para seguir con este negocio ya que es el único medio de supervivencia para su familia. La cantidad que solicita es de C$9.800 córdobas a un plazo de 12 meses y con esto podría comprar los diferentes productos. Sus sueños son de estudiar la carrera de derecho internacional para poseer más conocimientos.
description_translated:
María Delfina M. Castellón is 45 years-old -- she buys and sells beauty products such as nail polish, lipstick, perfume, cream, and make-up. She has dedicated herself to this business, which provides the only source of income for her family, for over 11 years. Maria is requesting a loan of C$ 9,800 cordobas (that she will re-pay in 12 months) to purchase various beauty products. Maria dreams of increasing her knowledge by studying international law.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To puchase various beauty products

description: \nBernabé Lionel E. tiene 49 años, su estado civil es soltero, y tiene 2 hijos. Todos sus hijos estudian. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de bananos verdes y plátanos. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a la venta de plátanos y bananos, ya que anteriormente trabajo en una bananera en san Luis y mas tarde decide independizarse y por medio de los préstamos es que ha logrado salir adelante. Don Bernabé tiene los propósitos de incrementar su negocio para seguir proporcionando a su familia ingresos. Los deseos de Don Bernabé son de conseguir una camioneta para ofrecer los productos de casa en casa. Este financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que tiene que realizar la compra de más productos. La cantidad solicitada es de  C$ 12.700 a un plazo de 12 meses.
description_translated:
Bernabe Lionel E. is 49 years old, single, and has 2 children. Both of his sons study. The business he works in is the sale of green and yellow bananas. For more than 5 years he has been dedicated to the sale of bananas. Before that he worked in a banana factory in San Luis, and he later decided to become independent; it is with his loans that he has been able to achieve this. Don Bernabe's goal is to increase his business to continue providing income for his family. Don Bernabe's wishes are to get a truck so he can offer his products door to door. This financing is for working capital since he has to be able to purchase more products. The amount requested is C$12,700 over a 12 month period.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: working capital

description:
Mrs. Chantha N. is a villager in Ta Pen village in Takeo province. She uses rice to make wine. Her husband, Mr. Chang Nhoeb, is a farmer who owns a piece of land where he cultivates rice. Although they try to work hard, they still cannot support their family well.

\r\n\r\n In order to provide better conditions, Mrs. Chantha N. is requesting a loan to buy five piglets for a pig-breeding business. She hopes to increase their income and improve living conditions with this loan. She is 26 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to work or study. Her husband is also in the picture.
loan_use: to buy five piglets

description:
Anita is married to Henaro L. and they are gifted with four children: Gina - 28 years old, working as a domestic helper abroad; Jimmy L. - 26 years old, high school undergraduate; Romelo - 22 years old and Natalia - 17 years old, a first year college student. They are living a simple life in the village of Marabulig 1 in Cauayan City. 

Anita sells RTW’s including doormats for almost a year.  In a week, she was able to earn at least PHP1,000.  She wants to expand her business for it to become progressive, thus, she wanted to borrow a loan of PHP25,000 so she can buy stocks of RTW that she can sell in their community. Her business right now is their major source of income than their farming activity.  This has been a great help in providing the needs of their family and education of their children.  

Anita believes that every person she meets contributes for her personal transformation.  This is the reason why she enjoys dealing to different type of people with her business.
loan_use: To buy stocks of RTW

description:
Marilou S. used to engaged in the buy and sell business.  However, due to some business difficulties, she then opted to start another business which is a community store.  In her store, she is earning an average income of PHP5,000 a month that she utilizes to provide the immediate needs of her family and as business capital.  To further improve her business, Marilou extended her wish to borrow a loan of PHP30,000.  She will use the loan to purchase different stocks for her store and hopefully achieve her dream of having a grocery store in their village.  She promised that if she will be given an opportunity, she will work hard and sacrifice to become successful.  

Marilou is happily married to Rodante S. and they are blessed with four children. The eldest is Mariel, 30 years old, married; Joyce, 28 years old, a college graduate and also married; Rodante Jr., 26 years old, college graduate, and the youngest is Love, 25 years old.
loan_use: To purchase different merchandise for sale

description:
Victoria is a beautician in her village.  Some of the services that she offers are haircutting, pedicure, manicure, and make-up.  She has been in this business for almost 20 years and it helps her in providing for and supporting the needs of her children and her family.  

Victoria wants to purchase more inventory that she needs in her business, such as cuticle remover, nail polish, powder, scissors, and other beauty products. In order to acquire these items, Victoria is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 5000.00 pesos. She dreams to expand her business by having her own beauty salon and an assistant some day.  She also wishes to train those out-of-school youth in her village so that they would have an extra income.  

Victoria is 42 years old and married to Albert, a driver in their community.  They have three children: Jenalyn - 23 years old, a college graduate now working in a department store as a cashier; Maryjoy - 21 years old, a college student; and Albert - 18 years old, also a college student. Victoria loves her family so she sacrifices a lot in order to give them a better life.
loan_use: To increase beauty products inventory

description:
Magdalena, 44 years old, is married to Paul A., a church pastor in their village. In the past few years, they lived in Mountain Province, Philippines. But now, they came to settle for good in Barangay Del Pilar, where there are more livelihood opportunities. They were blessed with five children, namely; Enrique, 21 years old, a college graduate and an account officer in a banking corporation; Winnielyn, a domestic helper abroad who, at her young age of 19, also helps her husband with their family; Phoebe, 8 years old, now entering the second grade in the primary level; and the youngest, Valerie, 2 years old. The family is a God-fearing one. Magdalena envisions bringing her family closer to God for she believes in this Bible passage: “Trust in the Lord and He will direct your path.”

Madalena manages a store in their current village retailing gasoline, lubricants (for automobiles), and “bagoong” (a type of kitchen spice) for almost 11 years. Her weekly income from the business has an average of PHP1,000, which is not enough to support the education of her children since they don’t have other sources of income. She would like to receive a loan amounting to PHP5,000 to add to her business revolving capital. She plans to also purchase  some bottled drinks and snacks to increase her weekly income to meet all her family’s necessities. Magdalena is hoping and praying that some day their living situation will become progressive by working hard and motivating her family members to work together in combating life’s difficulties.
loan_use: To increase business Capital

description:
Marilyn is married to Gerardo, a tricycle (local 3-wheeled vehicle) driver. They have two lovely daughters: Mary Ann, 11 years old and Marielle, 8 years old; both are in elementary school. The family lives in Nuesa Roxas, Isabela. They own a passenger tricycle, which Gerardo is using to earn an income.

To help her husband support the family, Marilyn started a village store business which serves as their source of added income wherein she earns a gross income of PHP 700 a day that they utilize as rolling store capital and for their basic needs at home. She wants to further develop her enterprise, thus, she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 that will assist her for the progress of her store. She will then purchase basic commodities that she can offer to her customers.

Marilyn is determined to sacrifice everything for her family and to send her children to school because she wants them to finish their studies and have a better life. She says these things will be possible if you always put God in everything you do.
loan_use: business improvement

description:
S. Zulfiniso lives in the Gafurov region of Tajikistan. She is married with 3 children. At present, she supports the family on her income alone. Her husband went to the Russian Federation to find work, but because of the world financial crisis, he could not find a job that would provide his family with the basic necessities.

Zulfiniso has been working at home for six years, running the family business that makes and sells the type of bread most popular in her country. She prepares the dough herself and makes “lepeshky,” which is the traditional bread in Central Asia, including the Tajik Republic.

Zulfiniso has applied for a loan of 3000 STJ for 3 months from KIVA. She wants to expand her business by importing large amounts of flour.
loan_use: Import large amounts of flour

description: Flor tiene 46 años, vive con su esposo y sus cuatro hijas en la casa que terminaron de construir hace poco tiempo atrás. Ella se considera una gran empresaria dentro de las líneas de belleza donde trabaja hace 15 años, siempre cubre sus metas de venta, obteniendo premios por su buen desempeño, lo cual la motiva a seguir trabajando por mucho más tiempo y tener proyección a futuro en base a esta actividad, pues le agrada conocer a muchas personas y relacionarse con gran diversidad de clientas ofreciéndoles productos de belleza. Esta actividad la realiza todos los días a partir de las  8 de la mañana, sale a visitar a sus clientas con sus diversos catálogos y en las tardes solo se dedica a la distribución de los pedidos y las cobranzas, que siempre es lo más tedioso para ella. En el futuro Flor desea tener un bazar en su casa para exponer sus productos de belleza y que estén al alcance de todas las mujeres de su localidad. Este es su dieciochoavo préstamo, lo que la hace una cliente fiel de MFP, pues es una de las clientes fundadoras de la institución en esta zona. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más productos de belleza en promoción, lo que favorecen a toda promotora para incrementar sus ganancias.
description_translated:
Flor is 46 years old and lives with her husband and four daughters in the house they built a while back. She is considered an astute businesswoman with regard to the lines of beauty products she has sold for the last 15 years. She consistently makes her sales goals, winning prizes for her good performance. This motivates her to continue working and to develop future sales projections. She enjoys being involved with her diverse customer base and being able to offer them beauty products. Every day, starting at 8:00 in the morning, she leaves with a variety of catalogs to visit her customers. Late afternoons are dedicated to the distribution of orders and bill collection, something that is always more tedious for her. In the future, Flor wants to have a shop at her house to display her beauty products, one that would be accessible to all the neighborhood women. This is her eighteenth loan, making her a loyal customer of MFP as well as one of the founders of this institution in her area. With the requested funds she will buy more beauty products on sale, something favored by any businessperson to increase profits.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Increase merchandise

description:
This group of borrowers consists of three people. Its leader, Mrs. P., 44, makes a daily income by cultivating rice and some fruit out of her house, earning approximately US$ 2 per day. To help with the family's food needs, P.'s husband works on a construction site and earns around US$ 4 a day. The couple has given birth to four children who are single; two of them are students and the other are employed. The family faces a problem; they are too tired and must take a taxi to work frequently. Thus, P. is asking for a loan to buy a used motorcycle to ride.

The other two borrowers are:

P., 54, who is a widow and a farmer; she's applying for a loan to buy more kinds of fruit to sell to earn a living; and

S., 40, a widow and a farmer who is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to sell.

The borrowers are people living in Battambang Province, Cambodia.
loan_use: To buy a used motorcycle for riding

description: Kafayat, 30 years old and married with three children, wholesales and retails crates of drinks at the Ojoo Market in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. She is requesting the loan amount of N100000 to purchase more drinks for the business. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.
loan_use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell.

description:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Sabali, avec une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, 4 enfants  vivent dans des grandes familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies au quartier Santoro 1 de la ville de San (région de Ségou, république du Mali). Elles se sont  connues  à travers des liens   de voisinage et de parenté.
Elles exercent presque la même activité de production et vente  de pain. Elles sont très sollicitées dans cette activité qu’elles ont apprise avec les grands parents. 
Afin  de satisfaire  le besoin de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Sabali a décidé d’intégrer  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son deuxième  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter des sacs de farine de blé et du bois de chauffe pour faire du pain et  revendre au comptant,  à la maison, au marché de San et environs. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen  de 80 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités. Elles ont pour ambition de diversifier leur commerce en embrassant d’autres activités génératrices de revenu.
description_translated:
The four women of the group Sabali (meaning "wisdom") average 32 years of age and 4 children. They live in traditional extended conjugal families in the Santoro 1 district of the city of San (Ségou region, Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of community and family. They do almost the same work, producing and selling bread. The women are in high demand in this business, which they learned from their grandparents.

In order to satisfy the ever-growing needs of their customers, the group members decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second solidarity loan (group loan). All the preceding ones have been correctly repaid.

With this loan, the group members want to buy sacks of flour and some firewood to make bread and to make sales in cash, at the house, at the San marketplace, and in surrounding areas.

They hope to realize an average profit of 80,000 francs CFA over the course of this cycle. The profits will be used to pay the loan interest, to provide for the extended family, and to invest the rest in the businesses. Their ambition is to diversify their commerce by embracing other income-generating work.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy flour and firewood

description: Raúl tiene 40 años de edad, está casado hace 16 años, siendo padre de 7 hijos, de los cuales 5 viven en su casa. La agricultura es parte de las buenas costumbres que le heredaron sus padres, en todo este tiempo ha tratado de sembrar mayor cantidad arvejas y habas, aunque éstas en menor cantidad por ser de menor ganancia. Raúl procura alquilar chacras donde ya hayan crecido papas anteriormente, esto facilita la siembra de arvejas, ya que de un saco de granos de arvejas, llega a cosechar de 50 a 60 sacos, esto lo realiza 3 veces como máximo en la misma chacra. Pero no todo es bueno, ya que Raúl en ciertas oportunidades se ve amenazado por las plagas que se implantan en las chacras por la excesiva lluvia, y tambien la helada (clima helado), sabiendo que si la rancha ataca a sus cultivos, se puede contrarrestar con funguicidas y pesticidas, pero con la helada no hay solución alguna para salvar los cultivos. Raúl está muy feliz con sus cultivos de arvejas, pese a las dificultades que tiene, los precios lo alientan a seguir sembrando, ya que son muy rentables para él. Él es secretario de su banco comunal, en cada una de las reuniones está encargado de redactar todos los acuerdos, este es su 2do préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo viene pagando puntualmente sus cuotas. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes para sembrar nuevamente arvejas y con la venta de ellas comprar semillas. Raúl nos comenta su alegría por habérsele otorgado el crédito, lo que le permite seguir trabajando.
description_translated:
Raúl is 40 years old, married for 16 years, and is the father of 7 children, 5 of whom are still at home. Farming is part of the good habits he inherited from his parents, he has always tried to grow a large quantity of peas and beans, even though these in smaller quantity products smaller profits. Raúl was able to rent farms where they previously grew potatoes, and this facilitated growing peas, as from one sack of pea seeds he can harvest 50-60 sacks, and this he does at the most 3 times on the same farmland. But not all is well, as Raúl has been threatened by various plagues on his fields because of excessive rain, and also frost (in this cold climate), knowing that if a pestilence attacks his crops, he can use fungicides and pesticides, but with the frost there isn’t a way to save his crops. Raúl is very happy with his pea crops, despite the difficulties that he has, the prices support him continuing to grow this crop as they are very profitable for him. He is secretary of his communal bank; at each of the meetings he is in charge of recording all the agreements. This is his 2nd loan with MFP, and all this time he has been punctual with his payments. The money he seeks is to buy fertilizer for his next pea planting and with the sales of his peas buy seeds. Raúl tells us he is happy to be given a loan as it enables him to continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Buy fertilizers

description:
La Señor Victor Raúl B. de 38 años de edad, vive en el Barrio Remanso de la Ciudad de Villa Elisa, posee un automovil Chevet modelo del añoi 1981 que utiliza para la compra de mercaderías para surtir su Despensa.- 
Esta casado hace 10 años con la señora María Cristina Vera de B. su cónyuge quien también se dedica a la misma actividad y le ayuda para la economía familiar, tienen 2 hijos una niña de 8 años y un nene 7 meses. La hija concurre a una escuela pública en el tercer grado.
El negocio esta ubicado en su domicilio sito en las calles Buenos Aires Nº 138 c/ Paso Medin y Av. Von Poleski del Barrio Remanso de la Ciudad de Villa Elisa camino a San Antonio., es casi la única Despensa en los alrrededores, además recientemente tienen nuevos vecinos de un asentamiento nuevo que son todos clientes suyos. 
El Sr. Victor B., retira el préstamo para la compra de varios mercaderías como Embutidos como panchos, chorizos, Fiambre, Carnes vacunos de diferentes cortes, (carnaza de 1a, de 2a, ) pollo(alita de pollo, puchero de pollo), Suavizante para ropa, Jabón de tocador, jabón en polvo, Pañal Desechable, Yogurth, Leche, Leche en Sachet, Yerba, Azúcar, Chocolate, Jugo Ades, Gaseosas, Cervezas, Vino, verduras varias como: tomates, locotes, cebollas, papas, lechuga, y frutas: Banana, naranjas, melones, piñas, ciruelas,etc.
El Sr. Victor se levanta a las 4:00 de la mañana y se dirije con su automovil al Mercado Central de Abastos de donde se provee de sus mercaderías, llega alli aproximadamente a las 05:00 Hs A.M. A fin de comprar todo lo que necesita para su negocio. 
Una de sus aspiraciones es poder ampliar próximamente el negocio, en lo que se refiere a la venta de Bebidas como Cervezas y Gaseosas.
description_translated:
Mr. Victor Raúl B., a 38-year-old man who lives in the Remanso neighborhood of the city of Villa Elisa, has his own 1981 Chevet, which he uses to purchase goods to stock his general store.

He has been married for 10 years with Ms. María Cristina Vera de B., who helps out with the family business in order to cover the family expenses. They have 2 children—an 8-year-old daughter and a 7-month-old son. Their daughter currently attends the third grade at the local public school.

The business is located inside their own home on Buenos Aires Street in Villa Elisa. Theirs is almost the only general store in the area. Furthermore, they recently got new neighbors, who are now their customers, from a newly constructed housing development nearby.

Mr. Victor B. is seeking this loan in order to purchase provisions, such as sausages (i.e. hot dogs and chorizo—seasoned pork sausage), cold cuts, different cuts of beef, chicken, fabric softener, bars of soap, detergent, disposable diapers, yogurt, milk, milk in a bag, herbs, sugar, chocolate, juice, soft drinks, beer, wine, vegetables (tomatoes, bell peppers, onions, potatoes, lettuce), fruit (bananas, oranges, melons, pineapples, plums), etc.

Victor gets up a 4am, gets in his car, and drives down to the Central Wholesale Market, where he obtains his products. He arrives at approximately 5am so that he can get everything he needs for his business.

One of his aspirations is to expand his business soon so that he can sell more beverages, such as beer and soft drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase provisions for his business

description:
Lucila tiene 55  años de edad, vive  en pareja con Nemesio Torres de 57 años de edad, viven en  casa propia, tienen  dos hijos, todos mayores de edad y profesionales, gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres.
Lucila se dedica a la venta de maderas para la construcción de viviendas, se dedica al ramo hace más de 15 años.

Realiza las ventas en su local propio que funciona en la ciudad de Paraguari. Su esposo le ayuda en el negocio y a la par se dedica a la música debido a que canta en un grupo de mariachis de la ciudad.
Gracias al esfuerzo y empeño puesto por ambos, hoy día ya cuentan con varios vehículos de su propiedad, así como casas y terrenos. También el negocio va creciendo día a día.

Necesita el crédito para la compra de madera y así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes
description_translated:
Lucila is 55 years old and lives together with Nemesio Torres who is 57 years old. They live in their own home and have two children, both of whom are adults and professionals thanks to their parents’ effort. Lucila works selling wood for home construction and she has worked in this field for more than 15 years. She carries out sales in her own locale which operates in the city of Paraguari. Her husband helps her in the business and also works in music as he sings in a group of mariachis in the city. Thanks to the effort and hard work of both, today they have various vehicles as their property as well as houses and land. The business also grows day by day. She needs a loan to purchase the wood in order to satisfy the demand of her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase of wood

description: La señora Cenit de 47 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus 2 hijos que la apoyan mucho, sobre todo en su negocio. Se dedica a vender productos de primera necesidad (leche, arroz, golosinas entre otras variedades), ella es una comerciante viajante, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 5 años atrás, y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar lo mejor de ella a sus clientes para que los mismos se sientan satisfechos, además de conocer nuevos lugares, ya que sus productos los lleva a vender a unos caseríos a 18 horas de viaje río  arriba. Este negocio le es rentable porque sus productos los vende de inmediato “a ojo cerrado”, razón por la cual le va muy bien. En el futuro quiere tener una bodega en su casa para estar cerca de sus hijos. Este es su 2do préstamo con MFP, y con el dinero que solicita comprará más productos de primera necesidad para llevarlos a vender y utilizará todo lo adquirido.
description_translated:
Cenit is a 47-year-old single mother living with her two children who help her greatly, especially in her business. She sells basic foodstuffs (milk, rice, candies and so on). She has been a traveling saleswoman for the past five years and what she enjoys most about her work is giving her all to her customers so that they can feel satisfied as well as going to new places, since she transports her products to villages 18 hours upriver. This business is profitable because she sells her goods immediately, sight unseen, which is why business is very good. In the future she wants to have a store in her home so that she can be near her children. This is her second loan with MFP; she will use the entire loan amount she is asking for to buy more staple goods to resell.\r\n

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To increase her merchandise

description: Glenis de 26 años de edad, vive en su casa propia con su conviviente, ella es madre de 3 hijos los cuales vienen estudiando. La señora Glenis es propietaria de 2 mototaxis, los cuales manejan ella y su conviviente, quienes se dedican al transporte de pasajeros desde hace 2 años atrás para cubrir con todos los gastos de su hogar. Lo que a ella le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce muchos lugares y sobre todo se relaciona con varias personas, haciendo muchas amistades, quienes recomiendan el servicio de Glenis, ella considera muy rentable su labor ya que sus dos herramientas de trabajo le generan muy buenos ingresos económicos,  los cuales administra ella, haciéndolo de la mejor forma para que alcance a cubrir los gastos diarios y del mes. Ella quiere mas adelante comprar otro mototaxi y empelar a una persona que lo necesite y así generar un puesto de trabajo. Glenis ya tiene 7 préstamos en MFP y es muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que  le gusta trabajar con sus amigas de su banco comunal. Con el dinero del préstamo mandará a reparar sus herramientas de trabajo, comprando repuestos y motores generando un gasto de 1800 soles, el dinero restante lo ahorrará para comprar un mototaxi de segundo uso.
description_translated:
Glenis is 26 years old, lives in her own house with her boyfriend, and is the mother of three children in school. Glenis is the owner of two motorcycle taxis, which she and her boyfriend drive. They have been working in transportation for two years to cover their household expenses. What she likes best about her job is getting to know many places--and most of all, meeting new people and making friends who recommend her services. She considers this work very profitable as her two vehicles generate a very good income, which she administers, so it's the best way to cover her daily and monthly costs. In the future, she wants to buy another motorcycle taxi and employ another person, thus generating a new job. Glenis has had seven loans through MFP. She is very punctual in her repayments, and enjoys working with her friends at the communal bank. With this loan, she will repair her two motorcycles, buying spare parts and engines at a cost of 1800 soles. She will save the remaining money to purchase another motorcycle.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Motorcycle repairs

description:
Zenaida C. owns a rice field. She is 37 years old and has 2 children. She dreamed of having a carabao (water buffalo) someday to plow her field. Now, she is renting a tractor to really loosen the soil before planting rice. Her husband is the one who manages their farm. Their harvest is what they use to raise their family and provide for their daily needs. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 13,000 from Kiva's partner, CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and to rent a tractor. The loan will truly help Zenaida grow her harvest. She also is willing to venture to another line of business. In this way, she could be able to contribute more to the family income. 

CEVI provides Zenaida credit assistance. Aside from that, CEVI gives all their clients training and insurance coverage.
loan_use: To buy fertilizers and rent a tractor

description:
Mrs. Leonora C., 42 years old, married, lives at Tawi-tawi, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She has 2 children. Her husband is a fisherman. Because she is skilled at making toys, she ventured into this business together with running a sari-sari (convenience) store. During her free time, she makes toys out of cloth, together with her husband. Fortunately, her first customer who happened to be her neighbor and saw her work bought it.

\r\n\r\nNow there are customers who buy her toys from Tangub, Molave, Kapatagan and Dipolog areas. Due to inadequate working capital, she decided to join Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in July 2008. She was not wrong when she chose Paglaum because of its add-on benefits given to members. She has received loans up to 3 times already. Today, she is appliying for PHP 14,900 to buy meters of cloth for making toys and additional merchandise for her sari-sari store. She wants to expand and have a market in toy crafting in different areas.
loan_use: to buy meters of cloth for toy crafting and additional merchandise for her sari-sari store

description:
Amina is twenty years of age, married, and has one child who is two years old. She rents a one room house where she lives with her husband and child. She has three meals a day and her greatest expense every month is food, since she has to buy everything they eat at home.

She has a retail shop as her business, which she rents. She works seven days a week, and receives about 20 customers a day. She has done this kind of business for over six years now and her main challenge is transportation since she buys the bananas from the village. She has to transport them to town where she sells them.

She has worked with MCDT for two years now and the reason why she chose to work with MCDT is because she wanted some capital to put in her business. She has worked with her group for two years and her goal right now is to have a successful business and be able to sustain her family needs.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible
loan_use: To increase stock.

description: Charles de 23 años de edad, es casado y  tiene una hijita de 4 años la cual está estudiando. Él es un hombre muy trabajador que siempre se ha dedicado a trabajar, da todo de sí en las labores que realiza, desde hace 4 años se dedica al transporte de pasajeros, es propietario  de un motocarro, con el cual se moviliza por las calles de su ciudad en busca de pasajeros, gustándole el conocer varios lugares y relacionarse con muchas personas, porque es muy amistoso y su gran carisma ha hecho que su servicio gane fama, siendo muy cotizado por las personas del lugar, lo que le es muy rentable. Charles administra su dinero separándolo para comprar cosas para su familia y para hacerle algunos arreglos a su principal herramienta de trabajo, porque él quiere seguir creciendo en el negocio del transporte y para ello tiene que tener en muy buenas condiciones a su moto. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP y le gusta mucho  trabajar con su grupo ya que son muy unidos. Con el dinero que solicita quiere comprar repuestos para mandar a reparar su mototaxi en lo que gastará un aproximado de1000 soles, y que gracias a ello pueda lograr mayores ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, el resto del dinero lo invertirá en pequeño taller de soldadura que atiende en sus ratos libres.
description_translated:
Charles is 23 years old, married and has a small daughter aged 4 who is already studying. He is a very hard-working man who has always devoted himself to his work and gives his all in the labours he undertakes. For the last four years he has worked transporting passengers, as he is the owner of a motor-bike which he drives through the town's streets looking for passengers. He likes knowing different places and interacting with many people, because he is very friendly and his great charisma means that his services have become famous, and he is much sought-after by people in the area. This means his business is very profitable. \r\n\r\nCharles manages his money, dividing it to buy things for his family and for making some repairs to his main tool of trade, because he wants to continue expanding his transport business and for that he need to keep his motor-bike in excellent condition. This is his 3rd loan with MFP and he likes working with his group very much, as they are all very united. With the money that he has asked for he wants to buy spare parts to make repairs to his taxi, which will cost around 1000 soles. Thanks to this he will be able to increase his income and improve his family's quality of life. He will invest the rest of the money in a small soldering workshop which he deals with in his spare time.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase spare parts for his motorcycle

description:
Bernarda es socia del Bancomunal Avancemos Juntas.
Bernarda es casada, tiene 49 años, dos hijos de 26 y 24 años que trabajan. 
Hace ocho años Bernarda vio que por la escuela donde sus hijos habían estudiaban no había librería, entonces ella decidió alquilar un local y poner una librería, se llama Librería  LUCY, empezó con pocas cosas, actualmente sus hijos le ayudan cada día.
Bernarda  necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para comprar útiles escolares, papel, cuadernos, lapiceros, de diferentes marcas. 
En Finca aprendió a través de las charlas  de negocio  cómo  administrar mejor su librería, le gusta la solidaridad entre las socias y ha hecho buenas amigas. 
El sueño de Bernarda es que el negocio crezca y dejar el negocio a sus hijos, y poner otro negocio.
description_translated:
Bernarda is a member of Bancomunal Avancemos Juntas. Bernarda is married, 49 years old, and has two children, 26 and 24 years old, who work. Eight years ago Bernarda noticed that there was no bookstore near the school where her children had studied, so she decided to rent a place and start a bookstore called Librería LUCY. She started with just a few things, and now her children help her every day. Bernarda needs a loan for 1000 soles to buy various brands of school supplies, paper, notebooks, and pens. At Finca, she learned from business talks how to run her bookstore better, she likes the support she gets from the members, and she has made good friends. Bernarda's dream is for the business to grow so she can leave it to her children and start a new business.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Bernarda needs a loan for 1000 soles to buy various brands of school supplies, paper, notebooks, and pens.

description:
Reveca es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy que significa Siembra en quechua.
Reveca es casada, tiene 32 años y 4 hijos, Reveca vende flores por mayor y menor de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Magdalena, además Reveca también se dedica a la producción de flores pero en menor proporción.
Reveca necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de remedios y abono.
Los sueños de Reveca son tener una florería en un local estable y brindar buenos estudios a sus hijos.
description_translated:
Reveca is a member of the Communal Bank Tarpuy which means Harvest in Quechua. Reveca is married, 32 years old, and has 4 children. Reveca sells flowers wholesale and retail as a street vendor in the Magdalena Market. In addition, Reveca dedicates herself to flower production but in smaller proportion. Reveca needs a loan of 1000 PEN, money which will be invested in the purchase medications and fertilizer. Reveca’s dream is to have a flower shop in a stable locale and to offer her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To purchase medications and fertilizer.

description: Mrs. Son M. is a villager in Kbal Damrey Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In this plantation, she now faces a small problem because her field is infertile soil, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Tob Chron, helps her in the farming. Mrs. Son M. is 57 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is a motorbike taxi driver while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.
loan_use: To buy fertilizers to make her crop more productive.

description: Helen is 50 years old and married with 6 children. She sells soup ingredients. She has been in this business for a long time. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more soup ingredients to sell. She says thanks to all who made this loan possible.
loan_use: To purchase more soup ingredients to sell

description:
Akua A. is married and has six children. Two of Akua's children are in junior high school. She lives with her family at Wasa Simpa, a suburb of Tarkwa in the western region of Ghana. She is 50 years old. Her husband is a farmer who harvests maize. For the past 4 years, Akua has run a shop where she sells items like women's rubber slippers and bags of rice. Through Akua's unique customer care and bookkeeping management she has attracted many customers who buy from her stand. Sometimes she sells her items door to door ("hawking"). 

Akua belongs to a village bank called "Joy." Akua is constrained by funds for running her business. She hopes to receive GH¢500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. The loan will help her upgrade her inventory by purchasing good quality and in more quantity. She needs the loan to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She will be grateful for that assistance.
loan_use: To purchase rubber slippers and bags of rice.

description:
Marcelina es socia del Banco Comunal Firmeza.
Marcelina es divorciada, tiene 38 años y 1 hija, Marcelina es instructora de aeróbicos y hace algunos meses inauguro su propio gimnasio, negocio que esta creciendo, Marcelina tiene proyectado implementar con mas servicios como masajes, nutricionista. Además Marcelina vende cosméticos, medicina natural por catálogos.
Marcelina necesita un préstamo de 2600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de extractor, licuadora y para pintar un ambiente para el cafetín.
Marcelina sueña con implementar su gimnasio con maquinas exclusivas para mujeres, salón de spinning, sauna y brindarle una educación de calidad a su hija.
description_translated:
Marcelina is a member of Communal Bank Firmeza. She is 38 years old, divorced, and has a daughter. Marcelina is an aerobics instructor. A few months ago she opened her own gym, a business that is growing. Marcelina plans to add more services such as massage and a nutritionist. She also sells cosmetics and natural medicine through catalogs. Marcelina needs a loan of 2600 soles that will be invested in the purchase of a juicer/blender and to paint a room for a cafe. Marcelina dreams of equipping her gym with machines exclusively for women, a spinning room and sauna, and of providing a quality education for her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To purchase a juicer/blender and to paint a room for a café

description:
Luisa es socia del Banco Comunal Violeta.
Luisa es casada, tiene 48 años y 4 hijos, Luisa viaja a las ferias en donD. compra animales que luego transporta a la ciudad D. Ayacucho, sus ventas los realiza en la feria D. San Juan y en algunas oportunidades los beneficia y venD. por mayor.
Luisa necesita un préstamo D. 2600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. ganado vacuno y porcino.
Los sueños D. Luisa son tener mas capital, comprar un carro para transportar los animales y construir el segundo piso D. su casa.
description_translated:
Luisa is a member of the Violeta Community Bank. She is married, is 48 years old, and has 4 children. Luisa travels to the markets where she buys animals which she then transports to the city of Ayacucho. Her sales take place at the San Juan market and on some occasions she improves the animals and sells wholesale. Luisa needs a loan of 2600 Peruvian soles that will be invested in the purchase of cattle and pigs. Luisa's dreams are to have more capital, to buy a car to transport the animals, and to build the second floor of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: For the purchase of cattle and pigs

description:
Esther sells loaves of bread. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan in the amount of N50,000 to purchase more loaves of bread to sell.

\r\n\r\n

Esther is 44 years old and married with six children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.
loan_use: To purchase more loaves of bread to sell.

description:
K. Nazokat is a 54-year-old woman. Nazokat and her husband have been married for almost 30 years and raised three wonderful children. Two of them are already married and have children of their own who adore their grandparents. Nazokat has been running her own small business for 7 years already; she has a store where she sells shampoo, detergent, toothpaste, brushes, and other items. Her youngest daughter helps her in the storeat the register and serving clients. Nazokat and her daughter are very friendly and polite, which allows them to gain more clientele. Now she is requesting for $1000 US dollars. Nazokat is planning to spend the loan to purchase more goods to sell, thus increasing the range of her products. Nazokat promises to pay her loan within 6 months and thanks everybody who decides to support her. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It was the home of famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
loan_use: To increase the variety and volume of items to sell in the business

description: Yin S., 55, is a widow who lives with her seven children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She sells meatballs and typically makes USD $3 every day. Three of her daughters are garment factory workers and each makes USD $2 per day. The rest of her children are in school. Mrs. Yin S. would like a loan to purchase more meatballs to sell.\r\n
loan_use: To purchase meatballs

description: El señor José Leonel tiene la edad de 38 años, habita en el kilómetro. 11 ½ carretera a Masaya entrada Esquípulas, todavía no es casado vive con su mamá y trabaja como Administrador de cybernik, los sueños de don José es llegar a tener su propio negocio y lograr mejorar la casa de su mamá ya que en un futuro piensa casarse y formar una familia .La mayor necesidad que tiene es la falta de financiamiento, ya que lo que el gana aporta parte para la casa y sus propios gastos. El solicita la cantidad de C$ 8.000.00 para comprar materiales de construcción y poder mejorar parte de la vivienda y poder sentirse sastifecho con los logros
description_translated:
Señor José Leonel is 38 years old and lives in the 11 1/2 km of the highway to Masaya entering Esquípulas. As of yet he is not married. He lives with his mother and works as a Administrator of an Internet cafe. José dreams of one day owning his own business and to manage to improve his mother's house, since in the future he hopes to be married and to form a family. His greater need is for financing, since what he earns he contributes partly for the house and partly for his own expenses. He requests the amount of C$ 8.000 ($400 US) to buy building materials to be able to improve part of the dwelling and to be able to feel satisfied with the progress.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Comprar materiales de construccion para hacer mejoras a la casa

description: Mónica tiene 33 años, es casada y tiene un hijo con quienes reside en su casa propia. Ella es docente en una institución privada, pero para cubrir las gastos en su hogar inició hace 8 años un negocio de venta de zapatos, los cuales compra en el centro de Lima para venderlos en su distrito donde ofrece a sus vecinas y amigas, a quienes les deja a crédito diversos zapatos para que poco a poco le puedan pagar, siendo así un negocio rentable pues el costo es mayor al que puede dar al contado, ya que incluye el costo por la movilidad que hará para los cobros semanales. Sin embargo, es muy cansado tener que trabajar durante el día enseñando y salir por las tarde a distribuir sus pedidos de zapatos y a realizar sus cobranzas hasta muy noche. Por estos motivos desea alquilar un stand donde pueda atender su negocio en las tardes sin tener que caminar mucho por las calles y dedicarse a buscar nuevos modelos de zapatos que llamen la atención de las personas. Mónica es cliente de MFP desde hace cinco años y este es su octavo préstamo y espera seguir formando parte del grupo, pues encontró un verdadero equipo de trabajo. Con el dinero que solicita adquirirá nuevos modelos de zapatos escolares para seguir aprovechando la temporada de inicio de clases.
description_translated:
Monica is 33 years old. She is married and has a son that she lives with in their own house. She is a teacher at a private school, but in order to cover all of her expenses, she began a shoe sales business 8 years ago. She buys the shoes in downtown Lima in order to sell them in her neighborhood to her neighbors and friends. She sells the shoes on credit, allowing her customers to pay for them little by little, which makes it a profitable business, as the final price is higher, because it includes the fees charged for making monthly payments.

However, she is very tired of having to teach during the day and then go out in the evenings to deliver shoe orders and collect her payments until late at night. For this reason, she would like to rent a stand where she can run her business in the afternoons without having to walk so much around the neighborhood, and can focus on looking for new shoe designs that will interest people. Monica has been an MFP client for 5 years and this is her 8th loan. She hopes to continue being part of the group, because she has found a true work team.

With the money she is requesting she will acquire new school shoe designs, in order to take advantage of the start of the school year.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Expand her business

description: Дилрабо женщина 33 лет, замужем имеет двоих детей.Муж работает инспектором ГАИ.Сама Дилрабо домохозяйка,но около своего дома имеет ларёк по продаже продуктов питания первой необходимости для дома.В начале открытия бизнеса, финансами  помог её муж.У неё постоянные клиенты соседних домов.Их микрорайон отдалён от центрального рынка , поэтому её торговля постоянно кипит.Для расширения бизнеса Дилрабо решила взять кредит.
