description_translated:
Dilrabo is a 33 year old woman, she is married and has two children. Her husband works as an police inspector. Dilarbo is a housewife, but has a small kiosk near the house where she sells food and goods for the household. When she started her business her husband helped her with finances. She has regular customers from the neighboring homes. Their small region is far away from the central market and this is why her sales are always high. To expand her business Dilrabo want to get a loan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy foodstuffs

description:
“Jesus es Prosperidad” is a group of 10 women entrepreneurs seeking their third loan from Esperanza International, Kiva's partner. The group’s past two loans have been successfully repaid, and the group hopes to utilize additional loan funds to further business expansion and allow for additional profits.

Angela is one of the coordinators of this group in the city of Santiago. Angela, mother of four married children and grandmother to nine grandchildren, operates clothing sales from her home and throughout the streets of Santiago. She declares business is well and Dominicans love to buy clothing. Angela’s past loan performance demonstrates a commitment to her goal of improving the life of her grandchildren and providing for their physical needs.

Other members of Angela’s microfinance bank run similar entrepreneurial activities including food, clothing and variety sales.

On behalf of Esperanza and this group of business entrepreneurs, we would like to thank you for your support!
loan_use: Purchase Clothing to Sell
borrower_names: Cristobalina, Dulce, Vianka, Maria, Clara, Fulvia, Carmen, Ramona, Angela, Berenice
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Jona D. C. is a rice grower. She is 26 years old and has 2 children. She also maintains a vegetable and flower garden in her backyard. She has been a farmer since she married her husband, Helbert D. C.. She owns a 9-hectare farm in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. She uses her harvest to support her family's needs.

She is asking for a loan of Php 11,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and herbicides. She has been a CEVI client for 2 years now. She believes that her loan will bring her a good harvest. The loan will truly help her increase her yield. This also will help her start a new business.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that helps people start up and run a business on their own. They teach people to earn a living for their family. They provide credit assistance, training and insurance coverage to help their clients sustain and grow their businesses.
loan_use: To purchase fertilizer for her farm

description:
A. Theresa is 24 years old. She is married and the mother of three kids. She lives in Bekwai Zongo community with her husband. Her husband is a cleaner at the public toilet at the community. Zongo is a place which is dominated by Muslims.

A. Theresa is a local manufacturer of palm kernel oil. Palm kernel oil is produced from palm kernels. The palm kernel is a by-product of palm oil. The palm kernel is processed through various stages to obtain palm kernel oil which is used to prepare many local dishes like frying fish, making local soaps, and pastries. She produces and supplies oil to food vendors to prepare their meals. However, her production is on the low side as a result of low working capital to afford a machine for processing.

A. Theresa wants to use the loan to buy more bags of palm kernels, three additional pots, and an electric milling machine to reduce the drudgery of using manual effort to help produce oil in larger quantities. She believes the loan will enable her to save more toward her children's education.

A. belongs to a village bank called ‘Bamali Allah’ which means ‘It is only God who can do it’. She hopes to receive GHS 600 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.
loan_use: To buy bags of palm kernel, three big pots, etc.

description: Хабиба продолжает работать, а также одновременно к своей основной работе занимается бизнесом. Как и планировала Хабиба, она приобрела в аренду один из торговых мест в большом универмаге г. Исфары. Благодаря КИВА бизнес Хабибы приобрел устойчивость и подавая заявку на новый займ Хабиба собирается приобрести весенний ассортимент детской обуви.
description_translated:
Habiba continues working at her job and does her business at the same time. As Habiba has planned, she rented out a vendor stall in a large mall in the town of Isfara. Thanks to Kiva Habiba's business has stabilized and now Habiba is applying for a new loan and plans to purchase a spring assortment of children's shoes.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy a spring assortment of children's shoes

description:
Juliet Y. is a rice grower. Everyday, she checks her farm, removes the weeds, works under the heat of the sun to ensure enough food for the family. She is 47-years old and has six children. Her husband, Leo Y., helps her  manage the farm. Their harvest is mainly for family use, and what is left over is sold at market for additional income.

She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers like Ammonium Nitrate, and Urea. She will also buy insecticides to ensure a good harvest form her farm. Juliet is also interested in finding other ways to earn income. She hopes to grow pigs in her backyard when she has the capital.

CEVI helps her sustains her business. CEVI provides her not only credit assistance but trainings and insurance coverage as well.
loan_use: To purchase fertilizers, ammonium nitrate, urea and herbicides

description:
Remedios A. is a rice grower. She is 57 years old and has 7 children. When her children are not busy in school, they help her at the farm. Aside from rice, she also grows vegetables in the backyard. They even raise chickens. When they don't have enough money to buy food, they cook their native chickens for the whole family to share.

She is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and herbicide. From her wide experience in the farm, Remedios recognizes the importance of applying fertilizers and herbicide to ensure a quality harvest.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that helps people start and own their own business. CEVI provides all their clients with credit assistance, as well as trainings and insurance coverage to make their businesses grow.
loan_use: To purchase fertilizers and herbicides.

description: Mrs. Milagos, age 52, is married and has four children. For many years, she was relaxed and contented relying on her husband's income to support their family needs, but when her husband lost his job as a government employee for political reasons, she was compelled to engage in business. \r\n\r\nFortunately, a neighbor introduced her to HSPFI to finance her business. She took a loan of PHP 5000 to start a business in which she buys and sells ready-to-wear items. With hard work and determination, she was able to expand her business. Now she needs PHP 8000 to purchased more stock to meet the demands of her customers.
loan_use: To buy more ready -to-wear items.

description: Svetlana is married with one child. She sells women's clothing and shoes at Ulana market in Pavlograd city. Twelve years ago she quit her job and decided to be self employed. She began her business with just one location selling the clothing. Svetlana was very determined to develop her business. Today she has four locations at the market. This is a family business now and is the only source of income for Svetlana's family.\r\n\r\nSvetlana would like to borrow $900 to build another kiosk. She believes that the more locations she has the more chances that people will buy her inventory. Svetlana's goal is to fix her apartment and to give her daughter a good education.
loan_use: to build another kiosk

description:
Chị Nguyễn Thị T. năm nay 50 tuổi Ms 020201050058, chị đăng ký vay mức 3.186.000VNđ để thêm vốn đầu tư vào việc T. mua phế liệu, ngoài ra chị và chồng còn tái sản xuất lại đồ nhựa, phế liệu. Chính vì vậy mà T. nhập của gia đình chị ngày càng có thêm T. nhập, đồng thời có điều kiện để nuôi 2 con ăn học. Chị rất thích hình thức trả dần, vì nó giúp gia đình chị và người dân lao động có điều kiện để kinh doanh, tích luỹ cho gia đình, nên các thành V. rất thích. 
 Trong nhóm của chị có các thành V. sau:
 Đỗ Thị V. năm nay 36 tuổi Ms 020201050059 chị vay mức 3.186.000VNđ để đầu tư vào việc T. mua phế liệu.
 Đặng Thị L. năm nay 20 tuổi Ms 020201050060 chị đăng ký vay mức 3.186.000VNđ để T. mua phế liệu, tái tạo lại đồ nhựa.
description_translated:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi T. is 50 years old (020201050058). She wishes to borrow VND3,186,000 to invest further in buying scrap materials. She and her husband also reprocess scrap plastic. Therefore the family can earn extra income and has financial resources to send their two children to school. She is interested in the installment repayment method, as it creates opportunities for her family and other farmers to do business and save. Her group includes:

Ms. Do Thi Vien, 36 years old (ID: 020201050059). She borrows VND3,186,000 to invest in buying scrap materials

Ms. Dang Thi Lien, 20 years old (ID: 020201050060). She borrows VND3,186,000 to buy and reprocess scrap plastic.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Buy scrap material

description:
Edith S. is 30 years old and is married with two children, ages 4 and 12. She rents a one-roomed house where she lives with her family. She prepares three meals a day, and her greatest expenses every month are her house rent and school fees for her children. She works seven days a week selling her charcoal at the market, serving about 30 customers a day. The main challenge Edith faces is that her customers often want to buy her charcoal on credit, which hurts her ability to conduct business.

She has been with MCDT for four years now. The reason she joined was because she needed a loan to improve her business.

Edith will use this loan to increase her business. She hopes to save enough money from her business to build a house.
loan_use: To increase charcoal stock.

description:
Muborak A. is a 36-year-old nurse at the central hospital in the town of Isfara. Together with her husband, who is currently working in Russia, Muborak has raised three children. In addition, she has run a drug store for eight years, selling certified medicines. The drug store is located in the town center, so it attracts many customers. Muborak is requesting $600 USD to expand her business. With the consequent increase in income, she is planning to educate all of her children through higher education. Being very precise by nature, Muborak would like to assure lenders that she is able and ready to repay the loan in nine months. This loan will help her accomplish her goals in a short time. Your generosity can change lives. More about Tajikistan Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. More about IMON International Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj
loan_use: To purchase medicines in order to expand the business

description:
Yudaya N. is 49 years of age; she is a widow and mother of six. She rents a four-roomed house where she lives with her children. She does have access to piped water and electricity in her house. She also looks after four grandchildren who lost their father. She also looks after her elderly mother and auntie. She has two meals a day and her greatest expense is that of food for the family and rent for her house.

Yudaya N. owns a retail business in a shop she is renting and she works seven days a week. She receives about thirty customers a day and she sells on a retail basis. Yudaya N. also works as a cleaner in a nearby health centre. The challenge she has while doing this business is during rainy seasons, because that disrupts her business.

She has worked with MCDT for six years. She chose to work with MCDT because it was convenient for her. It is near her place of work and she also wanted capital to expand her business. She will use this loan to expand her stock and she also looks forward to expanding her business with subsequent loans.

Yudaya N. also looks forward to being able to pay school fees for her grandchildren till they complete their education.
loan_use: increase her stock

description:
LAURA P. T., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuevo Edén” con domicilio en el Jr. Callería N° 670 del distrito de Yarinacocha, tiene 59 años, 04 hijos, y su esposo está dedicado a la agricultura.

La primera vez obtuvo un préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con el que se dedicó a la venta de abarrotes en la chacra, llevando mercadería a sus vecinos, encontrando luego una actividad más, traer pescado fresco y venderlo, por ello implemento junto con su esposo lo necesario para pescar y comercializar pescado fresco.

Con este préstamo de S/.2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, que invertirá en la compra de un motor de peque peque, financiar un bote de pesca y dar mantenimiento a su motocar, para poder alquilarlo y obtener más ganancias.

Dice “Manuela Ramos es una ONG que me ha dado la mano cuando lo necesitaba, por ello no fallo en mis cuotas desde el  día que empecé”.
description_translated:
LAURA P. TAMINI belongs to the Communal Bank "New Eden" and lives in Jr. Calleria #670 in the district of Yarinacocha. She is 59 years old, has 4 children, and her husband works in agriculture. The first time she obtained a loan for S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, with which she worked selling first necessity products in their small farm, bringing merchandise to their neighbors and finding another activity bringing fresh fish and selling it. This is why, together with her husband, she set up what was necessary to fish and sell fresh fish. With this loan of S/.2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, she will invest in a motor, financing a fishing boat, and giving maintenance to their motocar, to be able to rent it and obtain greater profits. She says, "Manuela Ramos is an NGO that has given me a hand when I needed it. That is why I have not missed my payments since the day I started."

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Buying a motor for a fishing boat. Financing a boat and giving maintenance to their motorcar

description:
Majaliwa M. is 30 years old and married with a 4 year old daughter. He sells DVDs, CDs, and VCDs and has a video library.  He started his business in 2000 and works daily from 8am until 10pm and is able to earn a monthly profit of around $154. 

This will be Majaliwa’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase his stock and has repaid the loans successfully. He hopes for a third loan to buy more CDs and DVDs.
	
Majaliwa will share this loan with his loan group, Tarangire, with 6 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Majaliwa, is in the middle in a blue and black shirt.
loan_use: Buy more DVDs and CDs
borrower_names: Majaliwa, Salma, Zaituni, Rehema, Ester, Fadhil
borrower_genders: male, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true

description: Mrs. Sean K. was born in 1959 and now lives in An Doung Samrith village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Heng Lo, is a teacher in the local school. This couple has three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another is a cow breeder and the remaining is a farmer who helps with the plantation. Mrs. Sean K. is applying for a loan to buy a cart to use with an electric motor for transportation. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.
loan_use: To buy a cart to use with an electric motor for transportation

description:
M. Kuziboy has been in the farming business for 22 years. It is through farming that he was able to provide for his family and send his children to school, even though they were not able to earn a college degree. Kuziboy would like to request a loan of 4500 Somoni to buy necessary farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers, as they are very expensive. He is very optimistic that this will improve his yield and he hopes to have a continuous partnership with the lenders. Kuziboy always makes sure that he respects the people around him because he believes that respect begets respect.  

More about Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and being the location of the end of Alexander the Great's rule.  It is also known for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, filled with epic mountain passes,  is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and to a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

More about IMON International

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
loan_use: Purchase of seeds and fertilizer

description:
Fati M. is 45 years old. She is married and has given birth to six children: three sons and three daughters. Fati tells us her two youngest children are currently in school and the rest are married and live independently with their spouses. Fati lives with her husband and their two younger children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Bekwai, close to Obuasi, a gold-mining town in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. The majority of the inhabitants of Bekwai engage in commercial activities.

Fati trades in fresh yam to earn some income to support her husband and cater for the family. She procures the fresh yam all the way from Ejura in the Brong Ahafo region, where prices are more economical. She then distributes the yam to retailers and food vendors in her community. She has been in business for eight years.

Fati wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure yam tubers in bulk. She hopes to support her husband so that they can improve upon their standard of living.
loan_use: To procure tubers of yam

description:
La señora Lady Vivian Carolina M. C., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Tesoro Escondido”,  vive en el Jr. Eduardo Peña Meza Nº 294, Distrito de Juanjui, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente,  tiene 29 años y es madre de un niño, que todavía depende de ella.
Tiene 07 años trabajando con el Banco. 

Actualmente, se dedica a la venta de uniformes, y lo vende a sus alumnas del Instituto donde también trabaja como secretaria en el mismo lugar, nos cuenta que sus ventas aumentaron, ya que es muy carismática y sonriente, con sus alumnos.

 Con el préstamo de S/3,000.00 que cancelará a plazo de 06  meses,  invirtirá en la compra de 100 juegos de uniformes de damas y varones  para satisfacer la demanda de los alumnos(as) del  Instituto.

Hoy, se siente mas independiente y tranquila, ya que es ella quien tomas sus propias decisiones en su negocio y en los ingresos que genera. 

Lady Vivian, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
description_translated:
Lady Vivian Carolina M. C. is a member of the "Tesoro Escondido" community bank. She lives in the district of Juanjui in the department of San Martín. She is in a common-law marriage, is 29 years old and has one son, who is still a dependent. She has been working with the bank for seven years. She currently sells uniforms to the students of the institution where she also works as a secretary. She says that her sales will increase because she is very charismatic and cheerful with her students. With this loan of S/ 3,000 soles which she will repay in six months, she will buy 100 sets of girls' and boys' uniforms to satisfy the demands of the students. She now feels more independent and calm as she is making all her own decisions with respect to the business and to the income it generates. Lady Vivian is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her grow as an entrepreneur and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy 100 sets of girls' and boys' uniforms

description:
La señora Juana A. D. Diaza, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Amistad y Paz”, vive en el Jr. 28 D. Julio, Distrito D. Juanjui, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Viuda, tiene 69 años y es madre D. 10 hijos, 04 D. ellos ya fallecidos y el resto todos independientes. 

Con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00, motivada por uno D. sus hijos  emprendió su  negocio propio. 

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes, en su bodega ubicada en su misma casa. 

Con el préstamo D. S/1,300.00 que pagará en un  plazo D. 06  meses, lo invertirá, comprando más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en sacos , papel higiénico en paquete, leche y conservas D. pescado en cajas, insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, productos variados para mantener contenta a su clientela.

Ella, toma las decisiones en las ganancias D. su negocio. En lo personal, nos cuenta que es más sociable, más segura y responsable con el pago D. sus cuotas. 
 
Juana, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
description_translated:
Ms. Juana A. D. Diaza is a member of the “Amistad y Paz” (Friendship and Peace) Microfinance Institute. She lives in the Juanjui district of the department of San Martín. She is a 69-year-old widow with 10 children, 4 of whom have passed away while the others are independent.

With her first 300.00 PEN loan, which she obtained after much encouragement from one of her children, she started her own business.

She currently sells goods in her general store, which is located within her own home.

With this 1,300.00 PEN loan, which she will repay in 6 monthly installments, she will purchase more products to re-stock her shop, such as sacks of rice and sugar, packages of bathroom tissue, crates of milk and canned fish, household cleaning products, and various other goods in order to keep her customers satisfied.

She is the decision-maker in her business. She personally feels that she is more sociable, more confident, and more responsible with her repayments. Juana expresses her gratituD. to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow both as an entrepreneur and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase goods

description:
Aida A. is a scrap buyer. She goes out to the nearby village and buys used bottles, papers, plastics, metals, iron roofs, and other scrap materials. She sells all of them to a main buyer, and she earns enough money for her family's needs. She is 53 years old and has 7 children. She started her business in 1998 using her small savings of Php 2,000. 

She is asking for a loan of Php 20,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy more scrap materials to sell. She believes that her loan will bring her better profit because the more scrap materials she buys, the more income she gets.

CEVI is a non-profit organization and a partner of WorldVision Philippines that helps people start and have their own businesses. They not only provide credit but trainings and insurance coverage as well to help their clients' businesses to grow.
loan_use: To buy more scrap materials to re-sell

description: Janet D. is thirty-three years old. She is married and has two daughters and a son, who are all currently in the basic school. She lives with her family at Kwahu Da in the Eastern region of Ghana. Janet’s husband is food crop farmer. Janet runs a grocery store to help provide for the family. She has been in business for three years. She sells items such as tins of milo, milk, sugar, bread, canned fish, etc. Janet buys her goods from wholesalers in the big cities nearby, such as Kumasi. \r\n\r\nShe seeks a loan to expand the size of her store and also to buy goods in bulk. She hopes to increase her profit margin, which will enable her save more for her family, especially for her children’s education. She belongs to a trust bank group called Heaven. Members in this group guarantee for one another, as social collateral, in order to access loans and to support one another in handling the repayment of loans.
loan_use: To buy groceries in bulk.

description:
La señora DINA C. F., pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres Unidas” de la Comunidad de Carancas, distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; de 40 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos, y posee estudios de secundaria incompleta (hasta tercero de primaria). 
Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 07 años y su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles que invirtió en su negocio de engorde de porcinos (venta como carne y en pie) y su venta en las ferias del distrito de Desaguadero y de Ilave.
Actualmente requiere un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, para poder invertir en infraestructura (corrales mejorados) y adquirir mayor capital pecuario (porcinos) y alimento balanceado (afrecho, maíz molido, vitaminas, etc) con ello podrá iniciar un sistema de crianza mejorada y vender su producto en mejores condiciones de calidad a otros mercados de la región; con las ganancias pretende ampliar este negocio y ayudar a la economía familiar, finalmente se compromete en cumplir con los pagos del préstamo, según lo acordado con las socias de su grupo y con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos.
description_translated:
Dina C. F. belongs to the Mujeres Unidas ('United Women') community bank of Carancas, in the Desaguadero district of the Chucuito province. She is 40-years old, has four children, and has an incomplete secondary education (she went to school until the third grade). She has worked with the Manuela Ramos program for seven years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN that she invested in her business of fattening pigs (whose meat she then sells, traveling on foot) and in her sales at markets in the districts of Desaguadero and Ilave. Dina now needs a loan of 2,000 PEN to invest in infrastructure (improved pig pens), and to acquire better livestock and nutrient-balanced feed (bran, ground corn, vitamins, etc.). With these things she can improve her system of raising pigs and sell higher quality products than are sold at other markets in the region. With her profits she expects to expand her business and improve her family's financial situation. Finally, she promises to make her loan payments according to the agreement made by the members of her group with Movimiento Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Investment in infrastructure and purchase of more pigs and nutrient-balanced feed.

description:
Desde hace quince años Margarita maneja su negocio de alquiler de videojuegos y venta de bebidas. Al inicio, su esposo era el encargado de este negocio, no obstante cuando él consiguió un puesto de trabajo en otro lugar, fue Margarita quien se hizo cargo del negocio.

Tiempo después, tuvo que hacerse cargo también del cuidado de sus dos hijos, muy pequeños en ese entonces, motivo por el cual abandono la atención en su negocio, pues la casa donde vivía quedaba muy lejos de donde estaba el quiosco. Una vez que su esposo se fue a trabajar al extranjero, hace casi diez años aproximadamente, ella se mudo a vivir con su suegra, gracias a la ayuda de ella retomo su negocio. Ahora solo sale a trabajar por las tardes.

Hoy en día tiene planes de mudar el local de su negocio a su actual vivienda, para lo cual necesita construir un espacio más y trasladar los equipos de videojuegos a su casa. De este modo, alquilaría la otra casa que quedaría libre para ser habitada por algunos inquilinos.

Las ganancias de su trabajo las destina para los gastos básicos del día a día. Su esposo es quien se encarga de mantener el hogar enviándole dinero del extranjero.
description_translated:
For fifteen years Margarita has managed her videogame rental and beverage sales business. At the beginning, her husband was in charge of running the business, however when he found a job in another place, it was Margarita who took over. A little while later, she had to take charge of the care of her two children, very young in those days, and for this reason she had to give up her business, because the house where she lived was very far away from the store. Once her husband went to work in another country, about ten years ago, she moved to live with her mother in law, and thanks to her help, Margarita returned to her videogame rental business. Now she goes to work in the afternoon. Today she has plans to move her store into her current home, so she needs to build a bigger space and bring the videogame machines to her house. This way, she will rent the other building, which will be free for her to rent out to some tenants. Margarita uses the earnings from her work to pay her basic day-to-day expenses. Her husband is the one who maintains the home, sending her money from the exterior.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Hospital debts due to her daughter's illness.

description:
La señora María H. C. es socia del Banco Comunal “Urbano Central”, distrito de Copani, Provincia de Yunguyo, Departamento de Puno; tiene 41 años de edad, es casada, tiene 07 hijos y posee estudios primaria completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 04 años con seis meses, se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado menor, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra de insumos para realizar el engorde de su ganado (alimento balanceado y forraje).  
Actualmente requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 04 cuotas, el dinero le servirá como capital adicional para poder comprarse una vaca, para engorde y su posterior venta en la feria ganadera de Yunguyo, ella tiene la aspiración de brindar una educación adecuada a sus hijos hasta que sean profesionales.
description_translated:
María H. C. is a member of the Community Bank “Urbano Central”, district of Copani, Province of Yunguyo, Department of Puno. She is 41 years old, she is married and has 7 children. She also finished primary school. She’s been working for the ‘Manuela Ramos’ Movement for 4 and a half years. She buys and sells small cattle. She received a first loan of 300 new soles, money that she used to purchase products for cattle fattening (balanced food and forage). Currently, she is requesting for an additional loan of 500 new soles, which will be repaid in 4 months. She will use this loan as additional capital to buy a cow, its fattening and to sell it later on to a farmer’s fair in Yunguyo. Her dream is to provide her children with a good education until they are professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase a cow and complete its fattening process

description:
Lolita S. is a 29-year-old mother of three: Raniel, seven years old; Patricia S., six years old; and her youngest, Angel. They live in a peaceful community of Minante 2 in Cauayan City. She is married to Ramuel S. Jr, her partner in business and in taking care of their three children. Most of his time is devoted to maintaining their small farm lot where they generate their major source of income. 

Prior to starting a community store, Lolita was engaged in the food vending business for almost two years. Then she decided to shift into poultry production (livestock) and the sari-sari store (community store) business. She is requesting a loan of PHP10,000 to purchase more goods for her store to increase her weekly income and support her children’s education and her poultry raising business.
loan_use: To purchase goods for her store

description: El señor Francisco Javier Z. C. tiene la edad de 45 años habita en la comunidad el Edén ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa la cual le ayuda con las cosas del hogar y en los cultivos, ellos tienen a su cargo tres hijos dos jóvenes que estudian su secundaria y un  pequeñito de cuatros años, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida ya que su casa esta construida de madera y quiere que en un futuro se le apoye para construir su vivienda , el desde hace treinta años se dedica a la agricultura la mayor dificultad que se le ha presentado es la falta de financiamiento ya que sus cultivos carecen de fertilizantes e insumos , el inicio con sus propios esfuerzos para poder mantener  a su familia , el quiere financiamiento para la compra de insumos y poder vender a mejor precio en el mercado.
description_translated:
Francisco Javier Z. C. is 45 years old. He lives in the community of Edén in the Ticuantepe municipality with his wife, who helps him in the house and on the farm. Together, they care for their three children, two children in secondary school and a four-year-old boy. Their plans for the family are to improve their quality of life and their house, which is made of wood. In the future, they hope to be able to build a better home.

\r\nSince the age of 30, Francisco has worked in agriculture. The biggest challenge that he has faced is not having enough money to purchase the fertilizers and other supplies that his crops need. He began farming on his own in order to support his family. He wants a loan so he can purchase necessary supplies and obtain better prices for his products at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase agricultural supplies for crop production

description:
Charles L. is single. He is staying with his sister’s daughter. He sells chips at Mwenge. He started this business two months ago and works daily from 11am until 12pm. He is able to earn a monthly profit of around US$ 48.

This will be Charles’s 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He wants a loan to open another chips place.

\t Charles will share this loan with his loan group, Mt. Elgon, which totals 17 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Charles is 1st on the right behind standing in a white shirt.
loan_use: To open another chips place
borrower_names: Batuli, Veila, Simprisia, Chrisanja, Flora, Saidi, Prisca, Zena, Fatuma, Charles, Jumanne, Matilda, Stella, Elizabeth, Rukia, Joyce, Magret
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, male, female, female, female, male, male, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, false, true, true, true, true, false, true, true, true

description: Mrs. Tessie C., 40 years old, married, lives at Lower Langcangan, Oroquieta City. She has 3 children. Her husband started the idea of mango production many years back.  They also have an existing business of selling fresh farm eggs but due to financial problems, Mrs. C. joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative to access their loan facility. She has  received loans several times already. Now, she is applying for PHP 10,000 to buy pesticide and fertilizer to revive their mango production. She has many plans for the future. She dreams that one day she will be the one to supply mangoes to Oroquieta City.
loan_use: to buy pesticide and fertilizer for mango production

description: S. is 71 years old and the father of one child who is married and lives with him in Seim Reap Province. His wife, Lang, is 59 and owns a grocery shop. Since 2000, S. has made a living repairing vehicles and supervising a construction crew. He is a great father and a responsible neighbor because he works hard and never wastes time. Because this is the harvest season and prices are low, S. wants to buy rice which he will store for later use. He has applied for a $700 loan to buy more products for his wife's shop and to buy rice. The loan will help the family attain a better standard of living.
loan_use: To buy more products for his wife's shop and to buy rice to store for later use

description: Eunice O. lives in Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria. She is 36 years old and is married with eight children. She sells gallons of palm. The demand for her palm oil is high. In order to meet the demands of her customers, she needs a loan for N50000 to purchase more gallons of palm oil to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.
loan_use: To purchase more gallons of palm oil

description:
La señora Candelaria Marina G. M. es socia del Banco Comunal “Flor Andina”, del barrio M.,  en el distrito de Platería, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 43 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos, posee estudios de secundaria completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 02 años, su negocio es la artesanía (tejido a mano), su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra de lana para sus tejidos.  
Actualmente requiere un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 04 cuotas, con el dinero podrá adquirir mas fibra de alpaca al por mayor y poder hilarlo para elaborar sus tejidos tales como chompas, guantes, chullos, etc. es decir todo lo que le pidan sus clientes; su deseo es comprarse un carrito para transportar sus tejidos a las diferentes ferias de la región.
description_translated:
Mrs. Candelaria Marina G. M. is a member of the Banco Comunal "Flor Andina" in the M. neighborhood, Plateria district, Puno province, Puno department. She is 43 years old, single and has no children. She completed middle school. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuel Ramos for the past two years. She is an artisan knitter and her first loan was for 300 new soles which she used to purchase wool for her knits. She now needs a loan of 1000 new soles which she will pay back in four payments. These funds will be used to acquire additional alpaca fiber at wholesale which she will spin into yarn in order to knit sweaters, mittens, caps, etc., in other words, whatever her customers require. Her wish is to purchase a small cart to transport her knits to the various regional fairs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To purchase alpaca fiber to knit sweaters, mittens, caps, etc.

description:
La señora Mari, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Claveles”, vive en la Av. La Paz – Las Malvinas, Distrito de Picota, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 45 años y es madre de 2 hijos, 1 que todavía depende de ella.

Se inicio con S/.300.00 por iniciativa propia, empezó su negocio vendiendo sabanas, cortinas. Tiene 8 años trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad se dedica a la costura, y realiza diferentes modelos en costura como calzones, pijamas, carteras; y prendas de niños, cuenta con una maquina que es su herramienta principal de trabajo, también vende y ofrece productos de belleza.

Con el préstamo de S/800.00 que cancelara a plazo de 06  meses, lo invirtió comprando telas en metros, hilos, elásticos, adornos en cantidad de variados colores y tener una mayor producción de lencería para damas. 

Se siente mejor ahora, que en sus inicios, mas segura al ofrecer sus productos y al mismo tiempo mas constante y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.

Mari, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
description_translated:
Mari belongs to the Banco Comunal "Los Claveles", lives at La Paz avenue, Las Malvinas, Picota District, San Martin Department. She is 45 years old, has a live-in partner and is the mother of two children, one of whom is still dependent on her. She started a business selling sheets and drapery with 300 soles of her own money. She has been working with the Banco for 8 years. Currently she sews and her area of emphasis is underwear, pajamas, purses and children's wear. She owns a sewing machine which is her main work equipment. She also sells beauty supplies. With the loan of 800 soles, which she will repay in 6 months, she purchased at wholesale fabric, threads, elastics and decorations of various colors to increase her production of women's lingerie. She is more confident now than at the beginning of offering her products and at the same time more constant and responsible in the repayment of her loan. Mari would like to thank Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as an entrepreneur and as a Woman.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To purchase fabric, thread, elastics and docorations at wholesale for lingerie produccion.

description:
La señora Diana Maria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Picota”, vive en la Urb. Las Almendras S/Nº, Distrito de Picota, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 45 años y es madre de 5 hijos, 4 que todavía dependen de ella

Se inició, con S/. 300.00, por iniciativa propia, empezó vendiendo anticuchos, juanes, maduros y plátanos asados. Tiene más de 1 año trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio de venta de anticuchos, ubicada afuera de su casa, donde atiende a sus clientes, vecinos, amigos y moradores de la comunidad.

Con el préstamo de S/800.00 que cancelará a plazo de 6 meses, desea invertirlo comprando insumos para la prepación de sus comidas como arroz, azúcar, aceites, servilletas; como también implementando su negocio, comprando mas mesas, sillas, platos, vasos y vajillas así dar una mejor atención y comodidad a sus clientes.

En lo personal, se siente más independiente y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas y sabe tomar sus propias decisiones.

Diana Maria, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
description_translated:
Diana Maria belongs to the community bank "Picota" and lives at Urb. Las Almendras S/N, Picota district, San Martin state. She is single, 45 years old, and a mother of 5 children, 4 of whom she still supports. With an initial loan of S/ 300, she started selling meat skewers, a rice dish, fruit, and grilled bananas. She has been workign with the bank for more than a year. Currently, she continues with this same business that is located outside of her home where she serves her customers, neighbors, friends, and others from the community. With this loan of S/ 800, to be paid in 6 monthly installments, she would like to invest in the food preparation items such as rice, sugar, oils, and napkins. She would also like to buy tables, chairs, plates, glasses, and cups to establish her business and make her customers more comfortable. Personally, she feels more independent and responsible with her monthly payments and she knows how to make her own decisions. Diana Maria would like to express her gratitude to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a woman and entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To purchase rice, sugar, oils, napkins, tables, chairs, plates, glasses, and cups

description:
Modeste M. produces and sells soap made from palm oil. He makes about US$ 20 in profit per week. He started doing business by selling prepaid cell phone minutes in 2005 with a working capital of US$ 200. From 2005 to 2007, he diversified his business by adding women’s clothing. He started selling in Mbuji-Mayi which is in central DRCongo.

Modest's business prospered, increasing his working capital to US$ 1500. In 2007, thieves broke into his shop and took of all his goods and the working capital. He closed the business and moved to Kinshasa.

From 2008 to the present he has sold cell phone minutes and soap made from palm oil with a capital of US$ 150. His vision is to open a small factory to produce soap to meet people’s need in his area.

Modeste is 53 years old, married and has seven children between the ages of 12 and 30. Six of them are students and one is independent.
loan_use: To increase working capital to purchase tools and equipment to produce soaps
country_name: The Democratic Republic of the Congo
borrower_names: Modeste, Gidelle, Marthe, Mabundu, José, Opel, Ndaya, Jeanne, Sabina, Thérèse, Théophile, Nathalie, Patience, Bitshilualua, Thérèse, Odette, Julienne, Angel, Anny, Kutekemeni, Kasasa, Fiston, Ruth, Sophie, Anny, Adrienne, Elise, Céléstine, Phonsine, Hélène, Mireille, Germaine, Stanis, Aziza, Jacqueline, Louison, Mpongo, Muanza, Florence, Madelene, Ivone, Nkumu
borrower_genders: male, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, male, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, male, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, male, female, female, male, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Clementina  es socia del Bancomunal El Sembrador.
Clementina es viuda, tiene 73 años, nueve hijos  mayores que están casados. 
Clementina  siempre trabajo en un mercado vendiendo frutas, hasta que dejo  ese trabajo. Después de un buen tiempo decidió  vender golosinas en su casa, su negocio fue creciendo ahora tiene su tienda de  abarrotes una de sus hijas le ayuda, A la edad  que tiene de Clementina  trabajar  por que  sé  distrae.
Clementina necesita un crédito de 800 soles, para compra mercadería, arroz fideos, aceite, detergente.
Desde que esta en Finca los prestamos le son de mucha ayuda para compra la mercadería que cada mes necesita.
El sueño de Clementina es trabajar para que su negocio crezca más.
description_translated:
Clementina is a member of Bancomunal Sembrador. Clementina is a widow, is 73 years old, and has nine children who are married. Clementine had always worked in a market selling fruit, until she left her job. After a while, she decided to sell candy in her home. Her business has been growing, and she now has a grocery store which one of her daughters helps out with. At Clementina’s age, she works to keep herself entertained and occupied. Clementina needs a credit of $275 to buy goods, rice noodles, oil, and detergent. Since she has been with Finca, the loans have been very helpful to purchase the merchandise that she needs every month. Clementina's dream is to work for her business to grow more.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To purchase merchandise, rice noodles, oil, and detergent

description:
Mariam S., age 45, is married with three children ages 29, 27, and 12. She sells cloth. She started this business three years ago and works daily from 10am until 4pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around US$ 112.

This will be Mariam’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her capital and has repaid the loans successfully. She hopes for a third loan to increase her stock and buy fabrics and sarongs.

Mariam will share this loan with her loan group, Kaja, which totals 17 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Mariam is just behind the man with a striped T-shirt.
loan_use: To expand her business and sell fabrics and sarongs
borrower_names: Petro, Meshack, Lukresia, Valecy, Warida, Fatuma, Jofrey, Esther, Hawadhi, Rehema, Ali, John, Rukia, Mwanahamis, Mwasiti, Matiam, Mariam
borrower_genders: male, male, female, male, female, female, male, female, male, female, male, male, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, false, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Nhem B., 47, is a villager living in the Kampong Chhnang Province in Cambodia, where he has established a family with six members. They live in a small wooden house. He currently makes a daily income to help support his family by working as a construction worker. \r\n

\r\nHe is married to Em, 43, who is a local rice farmer. The couple has four children: three of them are single and the other one is married. One of their daughters is employed as a garment worker. To earn extra income, B. is applying for a $100 loan in order to buy a piglet to raise. (Mr. B.'s wife and his daughter are pictured.)
loan_use: To buy a piglet to raise

description:
Corazon G. is a dealer and retailer of “basi” (vinegar) in their village.  Her husband, Dominador, is a simple farmer and most of their products are root crops and vegetables.  Despite her age, she still strives in developing her business in order to earn and save for their future. She is presently requesting for a loan of PHP 6,000 that she will use as business capital for their farming business.  

Corazon said that by patience, she will somehow develop her business for its progress.  She is already 60 years old but still very determined to have a good life.  Through their hard work and the cooperation of their children, they were able to send them all to school which she considers the fruit of their sacrifices.
loan_use: Capital for farming business

description: Basilia es una mujer muy tranquila y trabajadora, a sus 36 años a logrado formar una familia y ser  el principal sustento de ella, vive en una casa alquilada y no pierde las esperanzas de mejorar su situación económica. Rodeada de sus queridos animales Basilia pasa sus días, ella trabaja muy duro para que su ganado se alimente bien y crezca sano, para luego llevarlo a la feria dominical y venderlos en espera de sacar un buen precio por sus animalitos y casi siempre lo consigue, ya que son los más grandes de la feria. Lo que más le gusta a Basilia de su trabajo, es que puede pasar sus días en el campo que tanto quiere y respirar su aire limpio, son ya 10 años, los que lleva en este negocio y piensa continuar el tiempo que sea necesario, con tal de darle una mejor vida a su familia. Lo que menos le gusta de su trabajo es perseguir a los corderitos que a veces se escapan y corren muy lejos del resto del ganado. Basilia anhela poner un negocio propio, tal vez una tienda de abarrotes o un restaurante, todavía no se decide, pero sabe que tiene que trabajar duro para mejorar la vida que actualmente tiene su familia. Es su primer préstamo con MFP y se siente en la responsabilidad de pagarlo a tiempo para poder acceder a otro, en su banco comunal es muy activa y siempre participa de todas las decisiones que se toman. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más ganado, para mejorar sus ingresos, también comprará forraje para alimentar a sus animales en la temporada de heladas (frío intenso) que se avecina.
description_translated:
Basilia is a very peaceful and hardworking woman. At 36 years of age, she has formed a family and is its primary breadwinner. She lives in a rented house and has not lost hope of improving her economic situation. She passes the days surrounded by her beloved animals. She works very hard to ensure that her livestock eat well and grow up healthy, then takes them to the Sunday market and sells them in hopes of getting a good price for her animals, and she nearly always does since hers are the largest in the market. What she loves most about her work is that she can spend her days in the country she loves so much, breathing clean air. She has spent 10 years in this business and plans to continue doing so as long as it takes to give her family a better life. What she likes the least about her work is chasing after lambs that escape and run very far from the herd. Basilia wishes to have her own business, perhaps a grocery store or a restaurant; she still hasn't decided, but she knows that she has to work hard to improve her family's lives. This is her first loan with MFP, and she understands her responsibility to make repayments on time in order to access more loans. She is very active in her communal bank and always participates in their decisions. With this loan, she will buy more livestock to improve her income, and will also buy forage to feed her animals during the seasonal frost (intense cold) that lies ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Increase livestock and buy food for the animals

description: Ruth has had her poultry business for about 5 years now.  She has 400 broiler chickens that she raises.  People come to her home and buy these chickens to take to the market to sell.    Ruth says that the market for broiler chickens is very large so it is able to support the large number of people who do it. Ruth buys her chickens from Uga-chick.  Uga-chick is a place where many Ugandan poultry farmers buy day-old chickens.  Although this practice does not differentiate her from other poultry farmers, she tries to be competitive in the market by spending extra money on food supplements.  The important thing with broiler chickens is that they are heavy.  If you just feed the chickens a lot of food, they will grow heavy, but not as heavy as if you spend a little extra for supplements.    Ruth has four older children who stay around her home.  She says that although they are now old (32, 30, 28, and 25), they still depend on her.  She also has 3 small children that she cares for.  Two of these children are from her late brother and one of them is a grandchild.  These children all need their daily needs met as well as school fees.    Ruth is requesting a loan of 250,000 USH.  This will allow her to buy the critical supplements as well as four bags of feed.
loan_use: Food for her chickens as well as supplements to make them fat.
borrower_names: Ruth, Margaret, Patrica, Prossu, Barabara, Annett, Suzane, Phoeb
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description: \n Мирзоева Саъбатгуль проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 50 лет, замужем и имеет шестерых детей. Занимается животноводством уже 12 лет. Этот бизнес является единственным источником дохода ее семьи. Поэтому она решил развивать бизнес и увеличить поголовье скота.В данный момент она планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы купит пару голов бычков, которых она сможет реализовать после откормки. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 8 месяцев.
description_translated:
Sabatgul M. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi district. She is 50 years old, married and has six children. She has been involved in animal husbandry for 12 years. This business solely supports her family. This is why Sabatgul decided to develop her business and increase the livestock headcount. Currently, she plans to obtain a loan in order to purchase a couple of bulls to raise and sell. She will be able to repay this loan within 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To increase livestock headcount

description:
Abena D. is 45 years old. She is a widow and mother of three kids who currently attend school. Abena lives with her family in their own house at Anyinem, a farming community in the Eastern region of Ghana.

Abena works hard to support her kids’ welfare and schooling.  She sells foodstuffs and vegetables like plantains, cassavas, yams, tomatoes, onions, egg plant, etc. on a table top in the community market.  She buys her goods from farmers in surrounding villages.  Abena has been in business for twelve years. She also distributes cassavas and plantains to local ‘chop bar’ (restaurant) operators.  Abena wants a loan to buy food stuffs on a large scale so she can cut down on costs by reducing her number of trips to procure goods to maximize profit.

She is a member of the community group called Patience.  Members guarantee one another as social collateral to access the loan and repay loans.
loan_use: Buy food stuffs in bulk.

description: Banco D. Emprendimiento: VIRGEN D. FATIMA  se encuentra situado en el B/ 24  D. SEPTIEMBRE. El grupo  esta en su 3° ciclo.Esta compuesto por 16 personas. En el grupo hay señoras que se dedican a la venta D. cosmeticos ,comida ,abarrote y venta D. ropa , mermeladas.  son actividades que necesitan creditos rapidos, las reuniones del grupo se llevan acabo los dias jueves  a horas15:30 PM en la casa D. la señora Tesorera .Ruth Negri Rodriguez  A .Las Sra:estan conformes D. trabajar con Emprender por que aprendieron ahorrar y tener mucha responsabilidad, ademas que comparten entre ellas.\nLa Sra Delicia V. M. es Presidenta del grupo, tiene 3 ciclos D. antiguedad como presidenta del Banco D. Emprendimiento.La Sra Delicia nacio el 11 D. Junio  D. 1973 en el Beni .Ella se dedica al rubro D. venta D. cosmeticos ,tambien se dedica a los   tejidos D. carteras ,bolsos,monederos ,ect. Es muy responsable y cumplida en el grupo.Tambien ella es unas D. las lideres del grupo y hace que todas cumplan con sus cuotas.La Sra Delicia con los ingrersos que percibe ayuda al sustento D. su hogar, ella tiene dos hijos pequeños, que estudian en el nivel primario .
description_translated:
The "Virgen D. Fatima" entrepreneurial bank is in its third cycle, and consists of 16 people. The group includes women who sell cosmetics, food, groceries, clothing and jams. These activities require quick credit. The group meetings take place on Thursdays at 3:30 PM in the home of the treasurer, Ruth Negri Rodriguez. The partners are committed to working with Emprender; they have learned to save and they have a lot of responsibility, which they share with each other. \r\n\r\nDelicia V. M. is the president of the group, and has been for three cycles. Delicia was born June 11, 1973 in Beni. She works selling cosmetics, as well as fabric wallets, handbags, purses, etc. She is very responsible and accomplished in the group. She is also one of the leaders of the group and ensures that everyone makes their payments. Delicia helps sustain her family with her income--she has two small children in primary school.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase cosmetics and piola for macrame
borrower_names: Delicia, Lucia, Asunta, Ruth Negri, Felicia, Aida, Asunta, Nieve, Rolando, Carmen Enriqueta, Maria Antonia, Graciela, Pura, Raquel, Carmen, Cristina
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, male, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, false, true, true, true, false, true, true, true, true, true, true

description: A. Mohy first applied to MicroInvest in 2003. She is reliable and responsible and has had no loan repayment delays. She is married and has three children. Mohy lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan and works in the local bazaar, selling children's shoes and clothing. She buys an assortment of goods from Istaravshan and Uzbekistan. Mohy has been selling shoes for fifteen years and she is a skillful trader. Mohy is asking KIVA for a business development loan of $225 for 3 months. The loan will allow her to buy a new seasonal assortment of shoes and clothing. She thanks KIVA for its support.
loan_use: to buy new seasonal clothing to sell

description:
Committed to his family and his business, U. Solijon, works very hard at ranching. His has his own herd of cattle and works in the field every day to earn a living to support his dear wife and two children. As every business requires investment, Solijon needs some young bulls, which will be raised and sold. For this reason, he turns to IMON International again, to obtain a loan which will allow him to acquire cattle and help him improve the standard of living for his beloved family. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, including a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets-Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities still speaking the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization dating back to the 4th millennium BC.  Today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R and further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
loan_use: Purchasing young cattle to raise and sell

description: Koeut S. is 31 years old and a group leader for loan borrowers, consisting of 4 members. She is a mother of three children: all are students. She is married to Duong, 37, who works as a garden worker in the private sector. S. sells fish and vegetables in the market. She gets up early in the morning and goes to the riverside where fish and vegetables are sold in bulk and then hurries to the market to sell them for a good price. She is requesting a loan to buy hundreds of kilos of fish and fermented fish sauce (Khmer cheese) because this the fishing season. She has been selling in the market since 2000.\r\n\r\nThe other members are: Ork S., 47, who sells vegetables in the market and is requesting a loan to buy fish and fermented fish sauce. Koeut S., 27, who sells fermented fish sauce and is needs a loan to buy more fermented fish sauce for her shop. And Horm K. S., 21, who is a local construction worker requesting a loan to buy a motorbike for his work. They all live in Siem Reap Province.
loan_use: To buy hundreds of kilos of fish and fermented fish sauce (Khmer cheese)

description:
T. Feruza lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. She sells food products in market and in the week-end bazaar. She works with direct suppliers so she can sell at low prices and she has repeat customers. She sells sour milk products, meat, and oil.

\r\n\r\nFeruza is applying to KIVA for financial support in the form of a business development loan of 3200 STJ for 6 months for importing vegetable oil from Iran. She thanks KIVA for its support.
loan_use: importing vegetable oil  from Iran

description: M. Rose is the leader of the Ekirirwa Eira group in Jinja. She is a business lady with a retail shop that she has managed for eight years now. Rose says that before the loans, she always figured out what she would sell out to her customers, and this mostly happened because she did not have enough capital. Then there was not a lot of competition in her area. But the use of loans helped her to include more goods on her shop shelves and now she is happy that although there are bigger shops in her neighborhood, she can afford to sell and make a weekly profit of 40000 Ushs and save for her family and future developments. She needs another loan to help with restocking her shop.
loan_use: Restocking Rose's retail shop with more goods
borrower_names: Isa, Gadhafi, David, Sarah, Rehema, Tans, Rose, Razilo
borrower_genders: male, male, male, female, female, male, female, male
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description: Toribia de 27 años es una joven madre soltera, vive en su propia casa, la cual consiguió con mucho sacrificio. Tiene 3 hijos; Juan de 8, Sandra de 5 y Mónica de 3 años, a quienes quiere mucho. Se dedica al negocio de la compra y venta de triciclos, actividad que le ha servido de mucho para mantener a su familia y brindarle ciertas comodidades, compra triciclos usados que han sido dejados de lado porque ya no funcionan, los repara y los pinta dejándolos como nuevos. Lleva 8 años en este negocio y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender sus triciclos y ver que están bien refaccionados, pero lo que menos le gusta, es que para arreglarlos realiza un trabajo muy pesado y cansado, que le toma mucho tiempo, aun así ella sigue adelante en espera de mejorar su vida. Toribia anhela tener un taller propio, donde pueda arreglar con mayor comodidad sus triciclos, ya que actualmente realiza esta labor en su casa. Es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y tiene muchas ganas de pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, en su banco comunal es una socia muy querida, ya que le da alegría a las demás. Invertirá los seiscientos soles que solicita en comprar más triciclos para arreglar y así incrementar la cantidad que vende.
description_translated:
Toribia, who is 27 years old, is a young, single mother. She lives in her own home, which she obtained through much sacrifice. She has 3 children she loves very much; Juan is 8, Sandra is 5, and Monica is 3. Her business is buying and selling tricycles. The business has really helped maintain her family and provide them with some comforts. She buys used tricycles that have been abandoned because they no long work. She repairs and paints them so that they look new. She has been in this business for 8 years. What she likes best about her work is selling the tricycles and seeing that they are refurbished well. What she likes the least is that it is hard, tiring, and requires a lot of time. Even so, she continues in the hope of improving her life. Toribia would like to have her own shop, where she could be more comfortable refurbishing her tricycles. She now does it in her house. This is her first loan with MFP. She fully intends to make her payments on time. She is a well thought of member of her community bank. She brings joy to others. She will use the loan of 600.00 PEN to buy more tricycles to fix and be able to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Increase her merchandise

description:
Chea S. was born in 1980 and is a resident of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, where she sells different kinds of vegetables in the local market to earn a living. Besides this, she is a good homemaker who cooks tasty meals and cares for her two children in the family home. Her children are students in the secondary school.\r\n

\r\nHer husband, named Sothom, 39, pictured here, is a trailer-motorbike taxi driver (Tuk Tuk). He also provides his service to tourists who visit the area around the commune. Recently, he has not been able to provide as good a service as before because his motorbike has frequently broken down. To solve the problem, he talked with his wife and she has decided to request a loan of $800 to replace their broken motorbike.
loan_use: To replace their broken motorbike

description:
Mr. Leody C. is a responsible father to his three children and all are in school. He is 41 years old and resides at P-5, Talairon, Oroquieta City. His wife stays home and takes care of their “sari-sari” store (general store) for income.

Mr. C. bought a motorcycle to be used as public vehicle. He believes this will help their family with added income. 

Recently, he joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative to obtain additional working capital for his sari-sari store as well as to buy spare parts and tires for his motorcycle that was damaged. 

In the future, he will be happy enough if all his children will finish their studies.
loan_use: To buy additional commodities for sale and major repair of motorcycle

description:
Mrs. Lourdes D. dreams of a simple life that is fulfilled and satisfied. She is 43 years old, married and resides at Poblacion 2, Oroquieta City. She has three children. She wants to give all of her support to her children, who are presently studying. Her husband is a laborer. 

Because of her husband’s unstable income, she has found ways to sustain the needs of her family. She spends most of her time working, working and working. Fortunately, her eldest child works in a famous restaurant in the city and helps her with their daily expenses.  

At present, she is thinking of venturing into pig raising. In order to have working capital, she decided to join Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in August 2008. Now, she is applying for PHP10,000(US$225) to buy piglets and feed. In the future, she will be fulfilled and contented if all her children will have successful careers and obtain a comfortable life.
loan_use: To buy piglets and feed

description: Rosario tiene 41 años, está separada de su pareja, vive con sus 4 hijos; Victor de 23 años, Esther de 14, Estrella de 11 y Franco de 6 en su propia casa. Ella es una mujer muy alegre y carismática, su buen humor ha logrado que se desenvuelva en variedad de oficios; como en la venta de ropa, actividad que dejó de realizar porque la alejaba del contacto con los niños, con los cuales le encanta trabajar, es así que actualmente gracias a lo ahorrado tiene un puesto de golosinas cerca de un colegio muy conocido del distrito de Ancón en la ciudad de Lima. Muchas veces se pone una nariz de payaso y así atrae la atención de los niños vendiendo su mercadería entre bromas y juegos, haciendo que su puesto siempre esté repleto de niños a la hora del recreo y a la salida. Además, también tiene un negocio paralelo que es la animación de eventos infantiles, labor que mayormente realiza los fines de semana con gran alegría ya que a Rosario le encantan los niños, pues para ella son seres llenos de energía que te transmiten alegria y ganas de vivir, no como los adultos que siempre paran preocupados y serios, es por eso que todos su trabajos siempre tienden a ser para niños. Rosario quiere, en el futuro, tener más puestos de golosinas en los otros 4 colegios de la zona y así generar trabajo a otras personas y mejores ingresos para su familia. Hace varios años que viene trabajando con MFP, pero este es su primer préstamo individual y espera ser tan puntual como lo fue en su banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de golosinas y con la otra parte quiere ayudar a su hijo Victor en el negocio que tiene de venta de CDs.
description_translated:
Rosario is 41 years old, separated from her partner, and lives in her own home with her four children: Victor, 23 years old; Esther, 14 years old; Estrella, 11 years old; and Franco who is 6. She is a very happy and charismatic woman, and her good sense of humor has helped her get by very well in a variety of activities, such as selling clothing. She stopped selling clothes because it kept her too far from contact with her children, who she loves to work with.

Now, thanks to her savings, she has a little candy shop close to a very well known school in the district of Ancón in Lima. She often puts on a clown nose in order to attract children, selling her candy with jokes and games, making sure her shop is always full of children at recess time and when school lets out. She also has another business, which is animation for children's parties, which she primarily does with great joy on the weekends. Rosario loves children, and for her they are beings full of energy that transmit joy and a thirst for life, unlike adults who are always worried and serious. This is why her work always tends to have something to do with children.

Rosario wants, in the future, to have more candy shops near the other four schools in the area to be able to create jobs for other people, as well as a better income for her family. She has been working with MFP for a number of years, but this is her first individual loan and she hopes to be as punctual with her payments as she was with her group loans. With the money she is requesting she will buy more candy, and with some of the money she wants to help her son with his CD sales business.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy more merchandise to sell

description: Esi K. is married and has 5 dependents. She has received no formal education. Esi sells fish, which she buys from the fishermen, brings home for processing and preservation, and then sells at the market. Her business is located at the Elmina sea shore. Her husband is a fisherman. Esi uses her income to assist her husband with house keeping expenses. Esi will use the loan to increase her capital in order to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to save towards buying a house, which she wants to build with her husband.
loan_use: To buy fish in larger quantities for processing and for sale.

description:
Norma es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Era.
Norma es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 3 hijos, Norma tiene una tienda en un local alquilado en donde vende abarrotes y también es un pequeño bar, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Norma necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerveza, arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Norma son tener casa propia y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
description_translated:
Norma is an associate of the New Era Communal Bank. Norma lives in a shared home. She is 29 years old and has 3 children. Norma has a store in a rented location where she sells groceries and also tends a small bar; an activity that she carries out every day. Norm needs a loan of 1500 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of beer, rice and sugar. Norma's dreams are to have her own home and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy beer, rice and sugar for her grocery store.

description: Millicent T. sells groceries like milk, Milo, canned products, soap and other goods near the Graphic house in Elmina. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a fisherman. Millicent has been selling groceries since 2004. She is responsible for assisting her husband with housekeeping expenses. Her loan will be used as additional capital to enable her to increase sales and meet her customers' growing demands. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in her children's education.
loan_use: To buy additional goods to sell.

description: Wosila A. is married and has 4 dependents. She has received schooling through the primary level. Wosila sells food supplies like groundnuts and yams at the Abura market, which she has done since 1996. Her husband is a trader. Wosila uses her income to assist her husband in the housekeeping expenses. Wosila will use the loan as additional capital to increase the sale of food supplies like groundnuts and yams to meet the increase in demand by her costumers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Wosila plans to reinvest for the expansion of her trade.
loan_use: Wosila will use the loan as additional capital to increase the sale of food supplies like groundnuts and yams to meet the increase in demand by her costumers.

description: Zenabu H. operates her own hair cream and cosmetics vending business at Abura. Her husband works as a trader. Zenabu opened her own business in 2007, and has been working ever since. She helps contribute to her household by paying and maintaining expenses. Zenabu is requesting a loan to expand her business and the range of her products, maximizing her outreach to potential customers.
loan_use: To expand her business and attract new customers

description: Susan tiene 20 años, vive en la casa de sus padres con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a los bordados, trabajo que realiza en su  casa durante todo el día después de atender a sus pequeños. Luego de trabajar durante un mes, vende toda su producción, por medio de su hermana que se dedica a llevar sus bordados a quienes los solicitan, generalmente existe mayor durante las diversas festividades típicas de la zona. Susan ha notado que con el correr del tiempo los ingresos para su hogar se han ido incrementando debido al esfuerzo que realiza con sus bordados.  Es por ello, que para el futuro quiere seguir dedicándose a esta actividad produciendo cada vez más, y para ello también comprara un puesto de venta donde ofrecer sus bordados. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, por su parte se compromete a ser una persona muy diligente en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en sus bordados, va a comprar telas y pagará una parte de lo que cuesta adquirir su puesto de ventas.
description_translated:
Susan is 20 years old and lives in her parents' house with her husband and their two children. She has been embroidering for three years, working from home during the day after taking care of her little ones.
