So far, her sales have been satisfactory. She hopes to increase sales to a level that in time, will allow her to finish building her house.

We'd like to thank you for your support these entrepreneurs.
loan_use: Purchasing more fresh fish to sell.
borrower_names: Osvaldo, Danuris, Efigenia, Alejandra, Bernaldina, Magnolia, Daniela, Gisela, Reina, Lourdes
borrower_genders: male, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description: Tunde O. is 27 years old and single.  He sells building materials like nails, saw blades, painting brushes, chisels and screw driver etc.  He is requesting a loan of N100 000 to purchase more building materials to sell.  He says thanks to Kiva lenders.
loan_use: Purchase more building materials to sell.

description: Elsa tiene 24 años, es madre soltera, pero gracias al apoyo que tiene de sus padres, ha salido adelante y tiene la posibilidad de brindar lo necesario a su pequeña hija de 2 años. A pesar de las dificultades que tuvo en su juventud, Elsa nunca perdió el interés por los estudios y gracias a su empeño académico logró concluir sus estudios de cocina y repostería, obteniendo así, el titulo de chef profesional. Este logro la ayudo a iniciar su propio negocio, junto a su madre, quien cultivo en su hija el arte culinario, y juntas ahora, llevan el negocio de preparación de bocaditos. Por el momento reparten a domicilio, pues no cuentan con un local propio para atención al cliente, pero a pesar de las dificultades y limitaciones han logrado tener una gran acogida con las personas, debido sus deliciosos bocaditos, ya que son preparados con productos de buena calidad. En poco tiempo han logrado gran demanda y se encuentran en la necesidad  de alquilar un local con la finalidad de implementar una fuente de soda o una pastelería, que con el tiempo están seguras será muy reconocida. Elsa está iniciando su primer crédito con MFP y espera que las relaciones con sus compañeras y con la institución sean armoniosas y de gran aprendizaje. Los 800 soles que solicita serán invertidos en la compra de utensilios necesarios para la producción de dulces, además de incrementar la cantidad que requiere para el alquiler de su local.
description_translated:
Elsa is 24 years old and a single mother, but thanks to her parents' support she is getting ahead and has the possibility of providing for her little two-year-old daughter. In spite of the her youthful difficulties, she never lost interest in her studies and through her academic determination she succeeded in completing her training in cooking and pastrymaking, and obtaining the title of professional chef. This achievement helped her to start her own business, together with her mother, who groomed her daughter in the culinary arts. Together now they have opened a business preparing bocaditos (hors dourves and savory snacks). For the time being they are working out of their home because they don't have a location appropriate for their customers. But in spite of the difficulties and limitations they are having success and getting a good reception from the public thanks to their delicious bocaditos which are prepared using the best ingredients. In just a short time they have generated a huge demand and have found it necessary to rent some space with the aim of setting up a soda fountain or a pastry shop, which in time they are certain will become very well known. Elsa is beginning her first loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA and hopes that her relationships with the other members and with the institution will be harmonious and a great learning experience. The 800 Sols which she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of utensils necessary for the production of sweet things, as well as to help pay the rent for their location.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy cooking utensils and pay rent for the business.

description:
Les femmes du groupe Sabaly II  sont toutes mariées, âgées de 25 à 50 ans avec en moyenne 6 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier  Tougoumela de la sous-préfecture de Garalo, préfecture de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali)
Ces femmes sont partenaires de Soro Yiriwaso depuis 1 an. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Elles sont unies par les liens du voisinage de quartier.
Le présent prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 80 kg de fonio (cette céréale se consomme beaucoup dans la capitale Bamako).Ces vendeuses s’approvisionnent avec les agriculteurs des villages environnants de Garalo et font leur vente à Bamako et Bougouni. Les vendeuses de thé et de sucre s’approvisionnent à Bamako où ces articles coûtent moins cher pour venir vendre à Garalo.
Ces activités permettent aux membres du groupe Sabaly II de gagner  chacune en moyenne 15.000FCFA par mois. Cette marge bénéficiaire leur permet de rembourser l’échéance du prêt et de faire face également à quelques dépenses de la famille (éducation des enfants, santé et habillement surtout).
description_translated:
The women in the Sabaly II group are all married and average 6 children. Their ages range from 25 to 50. They live in extended traditional families in the Tougoumela neighborhood in the Garalo subprefecture, prefecture of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women joined Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, one year ago. They are seeking their third solidarity loan. All previous loans were repaid without problems. They are linked by bonds of neighborhood.

This loan will be used to buy 80 kg of fonio (a cereal very much consumed in Bamako, the capital). They get their supplies from farmers in the villages surrounding Garalo, and resell the products in Bamako and Bougouni. The women selling tea and sugar get their supplies in Bamako, where these items are less expensive, and resell them in Garalo.

These businesses enable the members of the Sabaly II group to earn each an average of XOF 15'000 (ca US$ 30) each month. These profits will be used to repay the loan and to pay for a few family expenses (schooling, health, clothing).

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy and resell fonio (cereals), tea, and sugar

description:
Mrs. Many P., 32, and her husband, Mr. Sen Samrith, 42, who live on an Island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia, were married in 1999 and have three children: one son and two daughters. One of their children attends school and the other two are still young. 
 
Many has been weaving and raising pigs since 2000. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who then distributes them to sell in market in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a policeman for fifteen years. She is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to add with her own money to buy neighboring land to expand her property.
loan_use: To add with her own money to buy neighboring land to expand her property.

description:
K. Mahbuba is a school teacher by professional background but she had to start her business because a teacher’s salary is too low. Mahbuba is engaged in street selling (sunflower seed, packages, etc.).

Mahbuba wants to earn money in order to start a serious business opening a national restaurant, so she is ready to work hard. She knows many people who, thanks to their hard work, were able to open a serious business.

Today Mahbuba applies to Kiva for business financial support in the loan of 2,000 STJ to purchase ice-cream and drinks for the coming season. She thanks Kiva for its support.
loan_use: To purchase ice-cream and drinks for resale

description: Awolola is 52 years old and married with 5 children. She sells provisions and medicines. She is requesting a loan of 70,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more medicines and provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.
loan_use: To purchase more provisions and medicines to sell

description: Akua O. is 40 years old, married and the mother of four children. Currently three of her children are working and her last is still in senior high school. She lives at Eguase in the central region of Ghana. She is a trader who deals with assorted products like cooking utensils and plastic bowls, lunch boxes etc. She mostly sells through hawking, which is house-to-house selling. She has been trading for five years now. She has attracted lots of customers who purchase from her stand. She treks to Accra to purchase her stock of goods. Recently she has been facing challenges in her business as a result of inadequate funds to buy stock. She is requesting a loan to buy more products like cooking utensils etc., which are frequently demanded by her numerous customers. With the loan, she believes she will be more prepared to make lots of profit, to build a store, and to reduce the frequent walking in the street to sell. She would be grateful for your assistance. Akua belongs to a village bank called ‘Mpeasem’, which simply means I don’t want trouble.
loan_use: To increase her stock of inventory like cooking utensils.

description: Victoria S. is 54 years old. She is a married woman with five children. Two are in high school, one is dead, and the rest are working. She lives with her family at Twifo Praso in the central region of Ghana. For the past 20 years, Victoria has been baking bread and other pastries and taking care of her household. In spite of the challenges she faces, she bakes sugar bread, wheat bread, cake, meat pie, chips etc and retails them to her customers. She supplies them by herself in the market center to her customers.\r\nHer only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw materials as prices are shooting up. She is requesting a loan to remain in business. With the loan, she believes she can provide for her family and most especially her children's education. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Mpaebo Tiefo' which means Prayer answering God.\r\n
loan_use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood etc.

description: Кизимат мужчина 41 года , женат имеет двоих детей. Проживает Кизимат в при горном посёлке Кичик Айри , района Уткансой. В их районе все семьи занимаются откормом и продажей скота. Также и Кизимат имеет основной доход на проживание благодаря бизнесу животноводства. Он сам имеет большой земельный участок , где посеял арахис. Земледелием он занимается с молоду, поэтому имеет постоянных оптовых клиентов. На деньги получившие в Микроинвест Кизимат хочет закупить скот, увеличить оборотный капитал. Сейчас у него имеется три коровы и десяток коз.
description_translated:
Kizimat is a 41 year old man, he is married and has two children. Kizimat lives in a mountain village called Kichik Ayri in the Utkansoi area. In their area all the families feed and sell livestock. Kizimat’s main source of income is the livestock business. He owns a large plot of land where he has planted peanuts. He has worked in agriculture since he was a youth and as a result he has regular wholesale customers. Kizimat plans to use the money that he will receive from MicroInvest to purchase livestock and increase his working capital. Right now he owns three cows and ten goats.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase livestock

description: Ислом 26 летний молодой человек, отец двоих детей. Занимается откормом и продажей скота. А также имеет бизнес по продаже плетёного камыша, которого используют для покрытия полов новых домов .Т.к. в районах  Учбог вместо деревянных полов оставляют землю и покрывают данным покрытием, и застеливают коврами. Это изделие имеет большой спрос у сельского населения. Ислом решил получить кредит для увеличения товарооборота скота.
description_translated:
Islom is a young man of 26 years of age, a father of two children. He is raising and selling cattle. He also has a business selling woven cane which is used to cover the floors of new homes. Because in the regions of Uchbog this type of covering is used instead of the wooden floors and then covered with rugs. This product has a high demand among the village population. Islom decided to get a loan to increase the commodity circulation of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy a cattle

description: Odile N. vend de la braise dans un quartier le plus peuplé, situé au nord de Kinshasa. Son capital actuel est de $150. Son affaire génère un bénéfice de $11 par semaine. Odile a commencé sa première activité commerciale en 2000. Après s’être divorcée avec son mari en 1998, elle a traversé une période économique très difficile avec sa fillette de 8 ans. Elle a commencé son affaire avec un capital initial de $20. Son activité consistait à faire des omelettes et du thé aux clients. De 2000 à 2008, son chiffre d’affaire a atteint $200. Son capital a connu une baisse en 2009 à cause de l’instabilité de la monnaie. Le nouveau crédit a permit à  Odile  d’acheter trente sacs de braise pour revendre afin d’accroitre son bénéfice. Son rêve est d’ouvrir un dépôt de braise à livrer aux détaillants. Odile a 43 ans, divorcée et mère de quatre enfants dont une fillette de 8 ans qui étudie, habite avec elle.
description_translated:
Odile N. sells charcoal in a very populous neighborhood situated north of Kinshasa. Her present working capital amounts to US$ 150. Her business makes a profit of US$ 11 per wek.

Odile began her first business in 2000. After divorcing from her husband in 1998, she and her 8-year-old daughter came through a very difficult economic period. She began her business with an initial capital of US$ 20. She was selling omelettes and tea to her customers. From 2000 to 2008 her capital rose to US$ 200.

She had a drop in capital in 2009 due to the instability of the currency. This new loan has permitted Odile to buy 30 sacks of charcoal for re-sale so as to increase her profit. Her dream is to open a charcoal depot so as to supply retailers.

Odile is 43, divorced, and the mother of 4 children, of whom one daughter of 8 years old lives with her and is enrolled in school.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: purchasing 30 sacks of charcoal for re-sale
country_name: The Democratic Republic of the Congo
borrower_names: Régine, Kumba, Sylvie, Mengo, Eveline, Marie, Brandon, Tshiabu, Fidèle, Israel, Berthe, Félicité, Odile, Joseph, Chantal, Alphonse, Scola, Françoise, Espérance, Rebecca, Henri, Gode, Michel, Ida, Léa, Mamie, Sécile, Patience, Marthe, Vicky
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, male, female, female, female, female, female, male, male, female, female, female, male, female, male, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description: Mariama D. est une mère de famille qui a en charge ses 02 enfants ainsi que 5 de ses petits fils. Elle vend sur étal divers produit alimentaire (pate d'arachide , légumes etc) et souhaiterait promouvoir son activité avec ce prêt. Son objectif est de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
description_translated:
Mariama D. is the mother of a family and raising 2 of her children as well as 5 of her grandchildren. She has a little display where she sells various foodstuffs (peanut butter, vegetables, etc.) and she would like to reinforce her business with this loan. Her goal is to support her family better.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: sale of various foodstuffs

description: la Sra. Maura G. tiene 35 años de edad y es madre soltera, tiene una hija de 18 años de edad que estudia en la universidad autonoma de Honduras, ella se dedica al negocio de venta de golosinas como ser: pastelitos, tacos, baleadas,pan con frijoles, tajaditas fritas de platano, pollo frito, pastelitos de carne de res y cerdo., ella tiene este negocio desde hace 10 años y gracias a el a podido salir adelante ella y su hija, necesita el credito para comprar los materiales con que hace sus golosinas.\nel deseo mas grande de ella es poder graduar a su hija de la unversidad.
description_translated:
Maura G. is 35 years old and is a single mother with an 18 year old daughter who studies at the Autonomous University of Honduras. Maura works in her business of selling snacks such as: pastries, tacos, baleadas (Honduran tortillas filled with mashed, fried beans and other ingredients), bread with beans, fried sliced bananas, fried chicken, and pastelitos (pastries) of beef and pork. She has had this business for 10 years and thanks to it has been able to move ahead for herself and her daughter. She needs the loan to buy materials with which she makes the snacks. Her greatest desire is for her daughter to graduate from the university.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy beef, port, and chicken, flour, oil, lard, vegetables, salt, spices, soft drinks, fire wood, beans, and bread.

description:
The picture is Mrs. Bin R., 40, who lives in Phnom Penh City and is the mother of five children who are single. One of her sons works as a local building worker. 

To make a daily income, she usually buys raw ingredients from the local market to make cakes and sells them to the villagers who live near her house. Beside this, she always has cultivated rice for income. She is married to Mr. Sokhon, age 41, who makes a a living by fishing, and who works with her in the farming business. 

The mature rice season is approaching, The family is lacking the money to hire a harvester to harvest their rice crop. Therefore, R. has decided to ask for US$400 to be able to make that possible.
loan_use: To hire a harvester to harvest their rice crop

description:
Dagiisuren A. lives with her husband and two teenage daughters in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her two children are high school students and her husband drives a passenger bus between cities. 

Dagiisuren has a small drug store in the Chingeltei district. She started the drug store in 2000, and her business has been a success from the start. From her profit, she has been able to rent a stall in a local apparel retail market that she runs in addition to her drug store. 

With these two businesses, her business capital has reached to 3,000,000 MNT ($1 USD=1,450 MNT). As her businesses do well, she needs more capital to expand. She requests a loan to buy more drugs and clothing for her shops. 

Dagiisuren is a hard-working woman with many dreams. She hopes that her daughters will receive good educations and pursue the careers that they choose.
loan_use: To buy more drugs

description:
Estos socios representan al banco comunal  “CRISTO CAMPESINO”; Ellos son un grupo conformado por 10 miembros, todos ellos son naturales D. la comunidad D. Huacaytaqui, en el distrito D. quispicanchis, ubicados a 2 horas D. la ciudad del Cusco.

La mayoría D. los socios alternan sus actividades domésticas y la agricultura con: el engorD. D. ganados, la tala D. bosques, la venta minorista D. comidas en los mercados centrales D. las comunidades aledañas y D. mayor confluencia, y a la venta D. ropa que son traídas D. las ferias D. la ciudad del Cusco; nuestros socios solicitan el préstamo para invertir en sus diferentes actividades y D. este modo seguir aportando económicamente en sus hogares.

Los socios quedan muy agradecidos por el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago total D. sus deudas.
description_translated:
These partners represent the “Cristo Campesino” cooperative bank. They are a group comprised of 10 members, all of whom are from the community of Huacaytaqui in the Quispicanchis district, located about 2 hours from the city of Cusco. The majority of the members alternate between their domestic chores and farming with: fattening livestock, clearing forest, and retail food sales in the neighboring and most frequented markets of the city of Cusco. Our members request a loan to invest into their various activities so they can continue to support their households financially. The members are very grateful for the support provided through this medium, and simultaneously commit to the payment of all their debts.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To implement their various businesses.
borrower_names: EUTROPIA, LUIS, JUANA ROSA, FELICITAS, ISABEL, VICENTINA, JULIA, LUCIA, WILFREDO, ANGELICA
borrower_genders: female, male, female, female, female, female, female, female, male, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description: Teofila tiene 28 años, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos en su casa propia. Se dedica a la agricultura, a la ganadería y al comercio; tiene una tienda de abarrotes que implementó en su misma casa, de esta manera, todos los días vende en su misma tienda parte de los productos que cosecha y los fines de semana, en la feria ganadera, vende los animales que atiende en su establo. En la época de cosecha sus esfuerzos se concentran en recoger de sus tierras de cultivo el fruto del trabajo familiar de varios meses, y prepararlos para la comercialización. Para el futuro, Teofila desea intensificar sus actividades y tener más ingresos para solventar los gastos educativos de sus hijos. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está muy confortada de saber que pertenece a un grupo al que considera muy unido y solidario. El dinero que esta vez viene solicitando es para la compra de más abarrotes para su tienda, y a la vez, adquirir 4 sacos de abono.
description_translated:
Teofila is a 28-year-old woman who lives in her own home with her husband and three children. She partakes in agriculture, cattle ranching, and retail. She owns a general store that she set up in her home so that she can sell the crops that she harvests everyday. On weekends, she goes to the cattle market to sell the animals that she has in her stable. During harvest time, she focuses all her efforts on reaping the fruits of her family’s months-long labor, preparing the produce to be sold. In the future, Teofila would like to expand her business activities so that she can increase her income and cover her children’s educational costs. This is the second time that she obtains a loan with MFP, and it comforts her to know that she belongs to a group that she considers to be united and supportive. The money that she is requesting this time will be used to purchase more goods for her general store, as well as obtain 4 sacks of fertilizer.\r\n

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Increase merchandise

description: Alejo tiene 35 años, vive en su casa propia con su esposa y sus 4 hijos. Desde hace más de 15 año se dedica a las actividades ganaderas y agrícolas, aprendió desde su niñez, ya que proviene de una familia que se dedica a la agricultura. En la actualidad todo lo que ha aprendido le sirve para trabajar con toda su familia, sus hijos le ayudan a pastear los animales y en algunas otras tareas. A pesar de los problemas económicos que existieron en años anteriores por las pérdidas que sufrió, Alejo se orienta hacia un éxito en sus cosechas y la venta de sus animales porque ha llegado a ser capacitado con algunas charlas para progresar en su negocio. Para más adelante está pensando en mejorar su establo y sembrar más extensiones de terreno para aumentar sus ganancias. Es la segunda vez que Alejo viene solicitando un préstamo con MFP, él se siente muy contento de formar parte de su banco comunal porque tienen reuniones con mucha coordinación y tratan de ayudarse entre todos con sus negocios. El dinero que ahora requiere es para la compra de sacos de abono y fertilizantes para su próxima etapa de siembra.
description_translated:
Alejo is 35 years old, lives in a house he owns with his wife and four children. More than 15 years ago he started working in farming activities, which he learned during childhood because he comes from a farming family. Currently, everything he’s learned helps him work with his family, his children help him feed the cattle and in other activities. In spite of the economic problems that happened in prior years due to losses he suffered, Alejo is moving towards success in harvest and the sale of livestock because he has been taking some training in how to improve his business. He is thinking to later on improve his farm and use more crop land to increase his profit. This is the second time that Alejo requests a loan from MFP, he feels very happy by being part of the community bank because they have well coordinated meetings and they try to help each other in their respective businesses. The money requested is to buy fertilizer for the next crop season.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase fertilizer

description: Хусанбой - мужчина 48 лет. Женат. Отец 2-х детей. Хусанбой занимается откормом и продажей крупнорогатого и мелко рогатого скота.  Он закупает скот на рынке и откармливая 2-3 месяца продает на том же рынке. Жена нигде не работает, а только помогает по хозяйству дома. Когда муж уходит на пастбище вместе со скотом, она смотрит за оставшимся скотом дома. Этим они зарабатывают на жизнь, чтобы прокормить своих детей.
description_translated:
Husanboi is 48 years old, married and has 2 children. He is involved in raising and selling cattle and small livestock. He buys the livestock at a market, raises it for about 2-3 months and then resells it at the same market. Husanboi’s wife is not employed and helps with household work. She also looks after the livestock at home whenever Husanboi takes other livestock to pasture. Husanboi’s family makes a living with this business and provides for their children.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Raising and selling livestock

description:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 30 year old Dina B. from Mwanza. She is married and has been running a pharmacy business since 2006. Dina sells different medicines which are used as treatment for different sicknesses.  She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Dina currently earns about 270USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to purchase more medicine to resell to customers.   In the future, she plans to expand her business. Dina thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.
loan_use: To purchase more medicine to resell to customers.

description: Мирзоали Нурбеков 1978 года рождения. Имеет высшее неоконченное образование. Учиться на экономиста, параллельно занимается разведением скота. Для покупки скота потребовалась необходимая сумма. Для этого обратился в Микроинвест. Узнал об условии кредитовании и получил кредит. Сейчас купил несколько голов скота, расширил свой коровник.Вскоре, в мае он будет стричь коз, половину продаст и несколько килограмм оставит для продажи через пол года.
description_translated:
Mirzoali N. was born in 1946, he is married and has 7 children. He does not have a college education. He does not have a job, but he raises livestock. In order to purchase livestock he needed a sum of money. He turned to MicroInvest for this. Mirzoali found out about the loan terms and received credit. Now he purchased several heads of livestock and expanded his shed. Soon, in May, he will shave his goats, selling half of the wool and keeping half to sell in half a year.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase livestock

description:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 34-year-old Tatu M. from Mbeya. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 4 and 20. Tatu has been running a batiki business since 1990. She sells traditional clothing worn by Tanzanian women, called batik. Batik is a piece of printed cotton fabric, often with a border along all four sides. It is printed in traditional ways with various colors and symbols of native African people.

Tatu works at her business for 12 hours per day, 7 days per week, and is assisted by her husband. Tatu currently earns about 160USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 975USD in order to purchase more materials in bulk. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Tatu thanks you for your support!

About SELFINA
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; therefore, they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.
loan_use: To purchase more materials in bulk for making clothing

description: Odion is 38 years old and married with 3 children. She sells provisions, foodstuffs, and drinks. She hopes for the loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more drinks and provisions to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.
loan_use: To purchase more drinks and provisions to sell

description: Doña Ángela tiene 38 años de edad, reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la ciudad de Managua, su esposo trabaja en servicio de seguridad, tiene dos hijos de 11 y 20 años de edad, que estudian, ella trabaja de afanadora en una casa social y en tiempos libres lava y plancha para obtener otros ingresos. Con esta solicitud quiere invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para construir una pared de su casa ya que su casa esta en mal estado ya que es zinc y plástico negro, lo que mas desea es poder tener una casa digna para su familia. Ya que esta empuesta a todo antisocial, Su anhelo es terminar de construir su casa con las mejores condiciones.
description_translated:
Ms. Ángela is 38, residing in the Memorial Sandio neighborhood in the city of Managua. Her husband works in security. She has two kids, ages 11 and 20, who both study. She works as a cleaning woman in a social home, and in her free time she washes and irons to earn additional income. With this request she wants to invest in the purchase of construction materials to construct a wall for her home since her house is in poor condition, made of zinc and black plastic. What she desires most is to be able to have a dignified home for her family. Her hope is to finish building the house with the best conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase of construction materials to raise a wall

description: Motunrayo A. is 43 years old and married with 4 children. She sells yams to retail customers, and has been doing so for a long time. Motunrayo is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more yam tubers to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.
loan_use: Purchase yam tubers to resell

description: Marisol tiene 29 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos que viven en su casa. Sus padres fueron agricultores, y a ella no le gustaba está actividad, por ello que jamás imaginó terminar casada con un agricultor. Desde entonces se involucró en el campo mucho más que cuando vivía con sus padres, ahora trabaja en los montes quitando las malezas juntamente con su esposo. Cada tres meses esta labor se hace más intensa cuando son cultivos de café, mientras que en los cítricos o plátanos es menor el trabajo, y es cada seis meses. Ahora, dice gustarle lo que realiza, porque ella misma cultivó sus plantita de café con la ayuda de su esposo y esta es su única fuente de trabajo. Por el momento, no obtienen grandes ganancias, pero sí lo suficiente para cubrir los gastos de educación y alimentación de sus hijos. Marisol tiene anhelos, de que con el pasar de los años pueda adquirir un puesto en el mercado, para vender todos sus productos, y de ese modo mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Esta es la 2da vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha tenido capacidad de pago en las fechas señaladas, y ahora también hace compromisos de seguir la misma rutina. El dinero solicitado es para mandar a sacar todas las malezas de sus chacras de café, de ese modo, cosechar con mayor facilidad.
description_translated:
Marisol is 29 years old, married and has two children that live in her home. Her parents were farmers and she did not like this activity, so she never imagined that she would end up being married to a farmer. Since her marriage, however, she has been involved in the fields much more than when she lived with her parents, now she works on the hills getting rid of the weeds together with her husband. Every three months this work gets more intense, when it is the coffee harvest, however for citrus fruit or plantains the works get easier and it only needs to be done every six months. Now she says that she likes what she does because she has cultivated a coffee plant on her own, with the help of her husband, and this is her only source of work. For now, her income is not large, but enough to cover the educational expenses and food for her children. Marisol plans that in time she could get a place in the market where she can sell her products, and improve the quality of her life and that of her family. This is the second loan that she has with MFP, in all this time she has been able to pay the installments on time, and she is making the commitment of continuing this practice. The money will allow her to have all the weeds removed from the coffee fields and this way be able to cultivate with more ease.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Cleaning of the coffee fields.

description: Olver tiene 18 años de edad, es soltero y vive en la casa de sus padres. Tras ver el liderazgo de su hermano en las diversas siembras que realizan sus padres, él se ha propuesto en seguir su ejemplo, sobre todo, tener sus propios ingresos para cubrir sus gastos de educación. Por ello, que a su padre le propuso que lo apoyara con unas tierras cultivables, con la finalidad de sembrar plantas de café para cumplir sus propósitos de culminar sus estudios técnicos. Olver estudia todos los días y los fines de cada semana se dedica a sus cultivos para no saturar las responsabilidades de su padre, él quiere ser independiente económicamente, por ello ya inició con las labores de la chacra haciendo las limpiezas y quitando la densa vegetación que hay en sus chacras. Posteriormente, con las ganancias obtenidas, quiere adquirir un auto para transportar su producción de la chacra a la ciudad. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y está muy entusiasmado de trabajar en su banco comunal, y sobre todo cuenta con una buena predisposición de pagar cada una de las cuotas programadas. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de plantitas de café, calcula que le costarán un aproximado de 500 soles, ya que cada mata está 2 soles.
description_translated:
Olver is 18 years old, single, and lives with his parents. After seeing the leadership of his brother with the various crops his parents cultivate, he has decided to follow his brother’s example in order to have his own salary and to pay for his education expenses. His father has offered him a job working on some land, planting coffee plants. This will help his achieve his goals of finishing technical school. Olver attends class every day and on the weekends he helps in the fields, in order to keep up with his responsibilities to his father. He wants to be economically independent and because of this he has already started cleaning up the fields and taking out the dense vegetation. Later, once he has the money, he wants to purchase a car to transport his crops to the city. This is his first loan with MFP and he is very excited to work with his community bank. He will pay all of the programmed payments and with the money, he will buy the coffee plants that he needs. He calculates that he will need approximately 500 soles, since each plant is 2 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: buy coffee plants

description: Лолахон – молодая женщина 28 лет, замужем и мать 2-х детей. Её муж занимается купле -продажей скота на скотном рынке. А она откармливает крупнорогатый скот дома. Она помогает мужу в развитии его бизнеса, потому что хочет иметь больше прибыли, чтобы растить своих сыновей.  За счет займа они хотят увеличить количество скота и  получить больше прибыли.
description_translated:
Lolakhon is a young 28 year old woman, she is married and is a mother of two children. Her husband buys and sells cattle on the market. She raises and feeds the cattle at home. She is helping her husband in developing his business because she wants to get more profit to raise her sons. She will use the loan to increase the number of cattle and increase profit.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: For raising and reselling of cattle

description:
Tina is 34 years old and married with three children. She has a salon where she makes lovely hairstyles for her customers. She also sells hair extensions and cream to her customers.\r\n

\r\nTina hopes for the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more hair extensions and cream to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.
loan_use: To purchase more hair extensions and cream to sell

description: Uche O. sells motor spare parts. He is 26 years old and married with a child. His wife also helps in taking care of the business when he is not around. He hopes for the loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more motor spare parts to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.
loan_use: To purchase more motor spare parts to sell

description:
Primer prestamo:
http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=82574
Marivel  es socia del Bancomunal El Triunfo. 
Marivel es casada tiene 44 años, tres hijos de 13, 9 y 6 años que están en la escuela estatal.
Marivel hace dos años juntos sus ahorros  alquilo un local, compro una  maquina fotocopiadora  y se puso a trabajar, ella atiende  sola todos los días en su negocio de fotocopiadoras.
Marivel necesita 1000 soles, para invertirlo en su negocio y comprar más hojas, tintas para fotocopiadoras.
Desde que está en Finca ha aprendido a invertir su dinero, le gustan las reuniones del Bancomunal y tiene amigas.  
El sueño de Marivel es tener un local propio para su negocio de fotocopias.
description_translated:
Marivel's first loan: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=82574

Marivel is a member of the Communal Bank El Triunfo ("Triumph"). Marivel is married and 44 years old. Her three children are 13, 9, and 6, and they are in public school. Two years ago, Marivel put together her savings and rented a space, bought a photocopy machine and started to work. She alone tends to her copy store every day.

Marival needs 1000 Peruvian nuevo soles to invest in her business and buy more paper and ink for the machines. Since she has been with Finca, she has learned to invest her money. She likes her Communal Bank and has friends in it. Marivel's dream is to own a space for her copy store.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To invest in her business and buy more paper and ink for photocopy machines.

description:
La señora Amada Flor Luján D. Z. tiene 54 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal Buen Pastor, vive en el caserío D. Lluin distrito D. Mache, provincia D. Otuzco, departamento D. La Libertad Perú.
Estudió hasta segundo año D. educación secundaria, no continuó estudiando porque no tuvo apoyo familiar. Se casó D. 22 años y tiene 4 hijos.
Se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. pan.  Empieza su trabajo desD. la 1 D. la madrugada, para poder abastecer con el pan para el desayuno.
Con su primer crédito D. 300 soles cancelados en 4 cuotas compró insumos para la panadería.
Con este crédito D. 2,000 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas comprará harina, manteca y levadura.
Amada sueña con tener una gran panadería que no solo abastezca para su zona sino hasta Trujillo.
description_translated:
Mrs Amada Flor Luján D. Z. is 54 and belongs to the Good Shepherd community bank. She lives in the village of Lluin in the District of Mache, Otuzco Province, La Libertad Department of Peru. She completed the second year of secondary education, but did not continue in school because she had no support from her family. She married at 22 and has 4 children. She makes and sells bread. She begins her work at 1 am to be able to supply bread for breakfast. With her first loan of 300 soles, repaid in 4 installments, she bought supplies for the bakery. With this loan of 2000 soles which will be repaid in 6 installments, she will purchase flour, butter and yeast. Amada dreams of having a large bakery that not only supplies her area but all the way to Trujillo,

Translated from Spanish by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase flour, butter and yeast

description: At 33, Nelieza R. finds her own way to share the burden of her family's daily expenses. They were blessed with five children; as parents, they find it hard to raise and give a better future for them. With her variety store, she is able to give financial support to her husband. She plans to expand her store in the future. For her second loan, she is applying for the amount of PHP 7,000 as additional capital for her existing business.
loan_use: To purchase additional items for her variety store
town_name: Purok 9B, Kiwalan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

description: Doris is 40 years old and is married with three children.  She sells foodstuffs.  She hopes for a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.
loan_use: To purchase inventory.

description: Gladys tiene 28 años, vive con sus padres en la casa propia de ellos. Se dedica a las actividades agrícolas y también en ocasiones al bordado de fustanes que aprendió a elaborar desde su niñez. Trabaja todos los días, sin excepción, en el cuidado de sus tierras de cultivo y en la crianza de sus animales (ganado vacuno y ovino) en su establo. Gladys es una gran ayuda para sus padres y se constituye en el sostén de su casa, su deseo es seguir mejorando la infraestructura de su establo y aumentar la cantidad de animales que tienen. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, está muy satisfecha de pertenecer a su banco comunal porque le permite mejorar su calidad de vida y también de los demás integrantes mutuamente. El dinero que está solicitando es para la compra de sacos de abono para esta campaña de siembra. También comprará insumos y materiales (telas e hilos) para sus bordados.
description_translated:
Gladys is 28 years old and lives with her parents in the house that they own. She does agricultural work and also makes embroidered slips (underskirts), which she learned to make as a child. She works everyday without fail, taking care of her farmland and raising livestock (cattle and sheep) in her stables. Gladys is a great help to her parents and supports most of the household. She wishes to keep improving the infrastructure of her stables and increasing the number of animals that she has. This is her second loan with MFP; she is very happy to belong to a community bank because it allows her to improve the quality of her life while also helping other members improve their quality of life. The money that she is requesting will be used to buy sacks of fertilizer for this sowing season. She will also buy supplies and materials (cloth and thread) for her embroidery.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase of fertilizer and materials for embroidering

description:
Benita es socia del Banco Comunal Ayni que significa Ayuda en Quechua.
Benita es casada, tiene 50 años y 7 hijos, Benita vende comida actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijas, la comida lo vende en la universidad a los obreros.
Benita necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y fideo.
Los sueños de Benita son mejorar su negocio, comprar una casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
description_translated:
Benita is a member of Ayni Community Bank, which means Help in Quechua. She is a 50-year-old married mother of seven. She sells food to the workers at the local university, which she does with the help of her daughters. Benita is requesting a loan of 600 soles, which she will use to purchase rice and noodles. Her dreams are to improve her business, buy a home and for her children to be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase rice and noodles

description: Dora tiene 41 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia. Se dedica a la crianza de animales desde hace más de 30 años, proviene de una familia agrícola que le enseñó estas actividades. Cada día se levanta temprano para atender a sus animales y de esta manera mantenerlos saludables, después de un tiempo los vende a vender, o sino ella mismas los sacrifica para vender su carne, que es aun más rentable. Esta labor la realiza con ayuda de sus hijos, pues es muy agotadora. Dora desea continuar con este trabajo para seguir sosteniendo las necesidades de sus hijos. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y ha notado logros positivos en su vida a lo largo de este periodo trabajando en su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de alimento balanceado para su ganando y el pago para desparasitar a sus animales.
description_translated:
Dora is 41 years old, and lives in her own house with her husband and children. She's been raising animals for more than 30 years, since she comes from a farming family that taught her the trade. Every day she gets up early to take care of her animals and keep them healthy. After a while she sells them, or slaughters them and sells their meat, which is even more profitable. Her children help her with the slaughtering, since it's quite exhausting. Dora hopes to continue this work in order to continue to provide for her children's needs. This is her second loan from MFP, and she's noticed positive developments in her life during the time she's been working with her community bank. She will use the requested loan to buy feed for her livestock and to treat her animals for parasites.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Buy feed and care for her animals

description: Janeth tiene 25 años, vive en casa de su suegra con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de anticuchos (brochetas de corazón de vaca con papas) y otras comidas en una esquina cerca de su casa. Cada día trabaja todas las tardes, sin ayuda de nadie, sin embargo ver crecer su negocio la llena de satisfacción, ya que antes vendía al aire libre, y ahora dispone de una carpa donde puede atender con mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Con esta innovación que ella misma ha implementado ha notado que la clientela ha aumentado y eso le da más ánimos para continuar. El gran anhelo de Janeth es tener un local estable para su negocio. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y es muy puntual en sus cuotas, por ello que se siente bien porque paga del producto de su arduo trabajo. Janeth esta solicitando este dinero para la compra de carbón al por mayor, ya que es básico en su negocio. También adquirirá sacos de arroz, azúcar y menestras.
description_translated:
Janeth is 25 years old and lives in her mother-in-law’s home with her husband and their 2 children. She sells kebabs (skewers of cow’s heart with potatoes”) and other foods on a corner near her house. Each day, she works every afternoon without anyone’s help. However, seeing her business grow fills her with satisfaction. Before, she sold in the open air, and now she has a tent where she can tend to her clients with more comfort. With this innovation, which Janeth herself implemented, she has noticed that her clientele has expanded, and this gives her more energy to continue. Janeth’s great desire is to have an established locale for her business. This is the second time that she has had a loan with MFP. She is very punctual in [paying] her installments. For this reason, she feels good because she pays with the product of her hard work. Janeth is asking for this money to buy charcoal, which is necessary for her business. She will also purchase sacks of rice, sugar and vegetable stew.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy charcoal for her grill

description: Rosita P., 58, is married to Bienvinido, a farmer.  The couple is blessed with seven children and lives in Cebulin, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.  Their source of income is from her husband.  Rosita decided to become a member of Paglaum Co-op to support the needs of her child who is in school.  She has applied for a PHP 10,000 loan to buy a pig, feed and vitamins.  Rosita wishes to improve their lives with her business.
loan_use: Buy pig , feed and vitamins.

description: Mrs. Tita M. of Purok Bonifacio, Bacolod, Ozamiz City is a new member of PDP-LP Microfinance Program. She is 36 years of age, with five sons and one daughter. They have twins who are boys. Her husband is a carpenter. With the help and idea of her friend, she decided to engaged in the RTW buy and sell business in order to help her husband support their family. For the past year, her business has been growing with her neighbors and friends as her loyal customers. She is very happy being a member of PAGLAUM because of the services and insurance she enjoys. Now she is applying for a loan of PHP 3,000.00 to add to her capital for her RTW buy and sell business. She is hoping that someday she will own a house and a lot and be able to expand her business. She believes that KIVA and PAGLAUM are continually reaching those micro-entrepreneurs like her to improve the quality of living.
loan_use: Additional capital for her RTW buy & sell business

description: Rose is 52 years old and she is a widow with a child. She sells drinks and local gin. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more drinks and local gin to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.
loan_use: To purchase more drinks and local gin to sell

description: An T. A. D. was born in 1983. She lives with her husband and two children. Her husband is a driver. They have a monthly income of about 3,500,000 VND ($196 USD). She is asking for a loan of 1,972,000 VND ($110 USD) to buy flowers and fruits to sell. The other group member is Lan N. T., who was born in 1978. She hopes to borrow 2,204,000 VND ($124 USD) to be repaid in six months. She will use the loan to buy food for pigs and chicken.\r\n\r\n
loan_use: to buy flowers and fruits to resell

description: Marilyn tiene 30 años de edad, es soltera y aun vive en la casa de su madre. Con mucha alegría y organización atiende a cada uno de sus clientes que acuden a sus cabinas públicas de Internet, las que hace 3 años viene administrando. Los primeros años de su negocio le resultó muy rentable, porque no contaba con competidores, pero ahora está sintiendo la presencia de la competencia, por lo que ve la necesidad de incrementar el número de computadoras que tiene y aumentar la velocidad de su conexión. Aun así Martilyn está contenta por la rentabilidad de su negocio, y por otra parte, cuanta con el apoyo de su madre que le ha facilitado el local, por lo que no tiene la necesidad de pagar alquiler. En consecuencia, aporta económicamente para las necesidades diarias de su casa y apoya a sus hermanos menores con  la compra de sus útiles escolares, asimismo cuando ella tiene que salir, sus hermanos atienden su negocio. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, se está integrando a un grupo de solidaridad, por ello, hace compromisos de pagar cada una de las cuotas fijadas por su asesor de crédito. El dinero que solicita es para re potenciar la velocidad de sus computadoras para su mejor conexión a la Internet.
description_translated:
Marilyn is 30 years old, single, and still lives in her mother's house. With great joy and organization she serves each one of the customers who come to her public Internet booths, which she has been running for 3 years. The first years of her business were very profitable, as she did not have any competitors, but now she is feeling the presence of the competition. For this reason she sees the need to increase the number of computers that she has and to increase her connection speed. Even so Martilyn is happy with the profitability of her business, and on the other hand, she counts on the support of her mother, who has provided the building, for which she does not need to pay rent. Consequently, she contributes financially to the daily needs of the house and to her younger brothers by purchasing their school supplies. Likewise, when she has to go out, her brothers take care of her business. This is her first loan with MFP. She is joining a solidarity group, therefore she agrees to pay each one of the payments established by her credit adviser. The money she is requesting is to upgrade the speed of her computers for her best Internet connection.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Upgrade her computers

description:
Solomon A. is a thirty-eight year old married man and the father of four children, all of whom are boys. The firstborn is currently in the senior high school and the rest are in the junior high and the primary schools. His wife is a hardworking woman. She is a farmer and a trader as well. She trades in infant layettes. Solomon lives with his family in a rented apartment in a town called Achiase, a farming and busy trading community in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Solomon deals in building materials such as roofing sheets, nails, cement, paint, etc. He sells in a store in the market square and has been in business for four years.

Solomon wants a loan to procure more goods to increase his stock. He is hopeful to give his children the best education he can afford.
loan_use: To procure more building materials to increase his stock

description:
Ebenezer B. is 39 years old. He is married and a father with two kids: one is currently in school and the newborn baby is still being breastfed.

Ebenezer is a dealer and supplier of phone cards and phone chips. He also provides repairs and services for his customers. He says the sale of phone credits has become a very lucrative business in Ghana because almost every Ghanaian desires to possess a mobile phone and always recharges his or her phone credit. He buys his supplies from agents at wholesale prices and sells to his customers at retail prices.

He requests this loan in order to enable him to increase his stock of mobile phone credits. He hopes the loan will enable him to increase his savings as well as to expand his shop to include the sale of mobile phones. He belongs to the village bank called ‘Yesu Abusua,’ which literally means 'God’s family.'
loan_use: To increase his stock of mobile-phone credits and unit transfer.

description:
Theresa A. is thirty-seven years old. She is a married woman who has seven children. Five of them are currently pursuing education in the junior and senior high schools. Theresa’s husband is a food crop farmer. Theresa and her family live at a family house in Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants of Oda are either into farming or trade in farm products. Very few people run different types of business. 

Theresa trades in clothing materials and jewelry. She buys textile fabrics, bedspreads, and all kinds of brand new clothes, including ladies’ wear and men’s wear, from Accra, a nearby city, and sells them in her shop in the market square in her community. Theresa has been in this business for seven years now and wants a loan to increase her working capital so that she can buy more textiles to serve her customers. 

She believes the loan assistance would enable her to upgrade her inventory and eventually make very good profits. She is a member of a Trust Bank group called "Abandenden" Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support themselves in handling repayment of the loan
loan_use: To purchase clothes and jewelry.

description: Nancy tiene 35 años, es madre de 3 hijos, vive con su esposo quien es maestro constructor. Esta familia habita en su casa propia. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de comida por las noches afuera de su casa, en un espacio que acondiciona cada día para esta labor, para complementar sus platos a la parrilla y otros, también vende bebidas heladas, debido al intenso calor de la zona. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es relacionarse con muchas personas, además le es rentable porque ya cuenta con clientes regulares que siempre acuden a degustar de su buen a sazón. Esta es la primera vez tiene un préstamo con MFP y se siente muy contenta por la oportunidad  de salir adelante en su negocio. Con el dinero que solicita comprará calaminas y madera para construir un local más adecuado y dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes.
description_translated:
Nancy is 35 years old. She has 3 children. She lives with her husband who is a construction supervisor. They own they house where they live. \r\nFour years ago, she started selling food at night outsider her home, in a stand she has ready for this task. She sells barbecue dishes and ice drinks, due to the high heat of the area. What she likes about her job is to be able to talk to many people. Besides, it is also very profitable as she has regular customers that attend her stand every day to taste her delicious meals. This is the first time she requests of a loan to MFP and she is very happy about this opportunity to continue running her business. With the money she will receive, she will purchase plate sheets and wood to build a more suitable stand and provide a better service for her customers.\r\n

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase materials to build her own business

description:
Ursulo G. manages a small sari-sari (general) store. He is married and has three children. He wants to grow his business to supply their needs. He works also as a vegetable vendor. He goes out in the streets and sells cabbages, squash, and beans.

Ursulo wanted a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy a new refrigerator for storage of his merchandise. He wants to include selling beverages like Coke and Pepsi in the future. A refrigerator will truly be a help to realize his plans.


CEVI is a non-profit organization and a partner of WorldVision Philippines. CEVI gives not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.
loan_use: To buy a commercial refrigerator for use in his sari-sari store

description:
Cecilia M. is married with three children and has received an education through junior high school. Since 2004, she has worked as a trader in Elmina, selling clothes, various materials and shoes. While Cecilia works as a trader, her husband is employed as a miner. \r\n

\r\nShe uses her income to help support her family and provide housekeeping money. Cecilia will use the loan to purchase additional clothes, shoes and materials to expand her business. With her newly gained profits, Cecilia plans to save in order to build a house.
loan_use: To purchase clothes, shoes and materials to expand her business

description: Isaac D. is employed as a trader and teacher, selling provisions in Kissi near Elmina.  He has received an education through senior high school and has been in business since 2007.  Isaac is single and has 4 children.  He is responsible for paying school fees, bills, and housekeeping money for his family. His loan will be used to buy additional goods such as sugar, Milo (cocoa powder) and milk, for re-sale. He hopes to use the new profits to reinvest into his business and also pay his children’s school fees.
loan_use: buy additional goods such as sugar, Milo and milk, for re-sale.

description: Oyetunji B. is 38 years old and married with 2 children. She has a salon where she makes lovely hair styles for her customers. She is requesting a loan in the amount of N30, 000 to purchase more salon materials to make her customers hair. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.
loan_use: To purchases more salon materials

description: Bigué S. est une femme mariée, âgée de 44 ans. Elle envisage avec ce prêt de renforcer son petit commerce de fruits pour mieux augmenter ses revenus et contribuer aux dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille.
description_translated:
Bigué S. is a married woman who is 44 years old. She envisions using this loan to bolster her small fruit business in order to increase her revenues and to help with day-to-day family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy and resell fruit

description:
Vida D. is forty years old. She is the mother of two children and is still married. Her kids attend school in the primary and junior high schools. Vida lives with her family in a family apartment at a community called Oda. Oda is in the Eastern Region of Ghana. A sizeable number of the inhabitants are engaged in the farming activities. However, many are also involved in trading and other business activities. 

Vida is a hair dresser by profession. She does both plaiting and perming. She says she started her solon five years ago and has since trained five young ladies in hair dressing who have started their own businesses in other communities. Apart from hairdressing, she also trades in groceries. She has her grocery kiosk attached to her beauty saloon. 

This loan would enable her to buy hairdressing equipment, fashion accessories, artificial human hair, pomades and other material that she will need to serve her clients satisfactorily. She hopes to increase her income to allow her to save more to support her childrens education. Vida is a member of the Charity Trust Bank group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and provide support in repayment of the loan.
loan_use: To buy hairdressing materials and fashion accessories.

description:
Samuel F., a 35-year-old trader, is married and the father of three children. Two of the children are in school and his last born is still breastfeeding. Samuel is a very resourceful and hardworking father whose hard efforts bring livelihood to the family.

Samuel supports his children through the sale of used belts and socks. The selling of used belts and socks has a very big market share in Ghana as brand new socks, belts and even clothes are very expensive for the economically active poor. Therefore the selling of used products like socks and belts has created a business for many men. He has been in this business for the past ten years. Samuel travels to a nearby city called Accra to purchase his stock of goods.

Samuel wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used socks and belts to increase his inventory. He believes this loan would help him to save for his children’s future and also enable him to rent a store to trade in. He mostly sells through hawking, that is: house-to-house selling.

Samuel belongs to a village bank called “1st Kings” and would be grateful for your assistance.
loan_use: To buy more bales of used socks and belts

description:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: Linda Urania F. L., Suyen de los Angeles H. S. y María Milagros A. M. .

El grupo solidario Cereza está compuesto por tres mujeres trabajadoras, originaria de la ciudad de Masaya, empezaron a obtener crédito con Adim a través de referencias con clientas de la institución que les dijeron que se prestaba con fianza solidaria por no tener garantías. 

Doña Linda Urania es la coordinadora de este grupo, ella tiene su negocio de venta de comida, vende en el mercado municipal comidas derivadas del cerdo como caldos de carne. El crédito lo usó para comprar cerdos en pie y luego procesar los caldos, así como especies y bolsas de plástico. Ella es madre de un hijo pequeño y su esposo es carpintero y le ayuda con los gastos. Sueña con mejorar su vivienda para tener más seguridad y proteger más a su familia.

Doña Suyen de los Angeles es una joven mujer vende helados, gaseosas, frescos, con esta actividad ayuda a los gastos del hogar, con el crédito compro frutas, azúcar, bolsas. Sus ventas se han mejorado porque ofrece de todos los sabores. Su esposo le ayuda ya que vende truchas en Costa Rica y viaja tres veces a la semana.

Doña María Milagros vende productos varios como: pan, café, leche preparada, etc.es casada pero no tiene hijos, sueña con tener su propia vivienda para cuando tenga un hijo. Con el crédito ella ha logrado capitalizarse en su negocio.

El grupo está comprometido con quedar bien a Adim para seguir obteniendo créditos y seguir trabajando mejor.
description_translated:
The Cereza group has three members, all of whom come from Masaya city. They are, as seen left to right in the photo, Linda Urania F. L., Suyen de los Angeles H. S. and María Milagros A. M.. They began borrowing from Adim after speaking with other members of the bank who assured them that they could have access to loans despite not having any collateral. Doña Linda Urania is the group's coordinator and she runs a business selling meals in the local market. She makes many types of pork dishes, including stews. She will use this loan to buy live pigs, which she will butcher for her stews. Linda's husband is a carpenter and supports her business. Together, they have a young son. Linda dreams of bettering her quality of life so that she and her family are more secure. Doña Suyen de los Angeles is a young woman who sells ice cream, soft drinks and juices, thus contributing to her household's income. With this loan she will buy fruit, sugar, and plastic bags. Her sales are continually increasing because she offers a large variety of flavours. Her husband has also been doing well. He sells trout in Costa Rica and travels there three times a week in order to do so. Doña María Milagros sells a variety of products like bread, coffee, milk etc. She is married but has no children. She dreams of having her own home for when she has a child. She will use this loan as working capital for her business. As a whole, the group is committed to keeping in good stead with Adim so that they can continue receiving loans and bettering their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy pigs and a variety of foodstuffs.
borrower_names: Suyen de los Angeles, Linda Urania, María Milagros

description: Cliente que viven con su madre tiene su negocio de venta de lubricantes en la zona sur de la Ciudad de La Paz, el barrio de Bella Vista; ademas estudia en la universaidad estatal; gracias a su negocio ella puede continuar con sus estudios en la universidad y colaborar con los gastos familiares, su madre le colabora en la atencion del negocio mientras ella va a la universidad, Claudia pese a ser una persona muy joven es muy responsable.
description_translated:
This customer lives with her mother. She has a business selling motor oils in the central zone of the city of La Paz, in the neighborhood of Bella Vista. Furthermore, she studies at the state university; thanks to her business she can continue with her studies at the university and help with the household expenses. Her mother helps her attend to the business while she goes to university. Though she is a very young person, Claudia is very responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To purchase motor oil in bulk and bottles

description:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: Lilliam del Socorro C., Celia María B. y Aura Lila G. M..

 Este grupo solidario es originario de la comarca Las Flores, del municipio de Masaya, los tres se dedican a la misma actividad de venta de frutas y verduras, venden en el mercado municipal de Masaya, ellas tienen muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad, llevan varios ciclos de trabajar con Adim y han demostrado ser personas responsables y puntuales, están comprometidas para quedar bien en la institución.
 
Doña Celia María es una joven mujer que es madre de dos hijos pequeños, vende y compra las frutas en el mercado en horas muy tempranas de la mañana, esta actividad la aprendió de su madre que hasta el día de hoy realiza la misma actividad, está satisfecha de  haber obtenido créditos en base a la confianza. Sueña con poder dar estudio a sus hijos y un mejor nivel de vida.

Doña Aura Lila G., es una mujer trabajadora desde muy joven, es madre de un niño pequeño al que mantiene sola, ella es madre soltera y esto le ha dado mayor fuerza para trabajar y poder sacar adelante a su hijo, este estudia en la escuela de la comarca, piensa que la secundaria la pueda cursar en Masaya.

Doña Lilliam del Socorro C. es la coordinadora del grupo, ella es muy responsable y el grupo le ha dado el cargo porque sabe leer más que las otras dos integrantes y puede firmar bien. Trabaja en el mercado desde muy joven junto con su mamá, vende frutas y verduras, ahora con el crédito ella ha invertido su propio dinero y tiene su propio puesto, donde ofrece naranjas, limones, tamarindo, cebollas, ajos, etc. Compra los productos en el mercado y en la zona donde vive.
Tiene cuatro hijos en edad escolar, con tres adolescentes y un pequeño, estudian en la escuela de la comunidad y uno estudia en Masaya, esto porque ella considera que debe de salir de la comarca y estudiar además otros cursos.
Su horario de trabajo es de las 3 a.m. hasta las 2 p.m., cuando regresa a su casa lleva las provisiones para la comida, expresa que el crédito le permite comprar mayor cantidad de frutas y tener mayor margen de ganancia.
Ella anima a sus compañeras a quedar bien para que le sigan financiando y así seguir creciendo.
description_translated:
Photo from left to right: Lilliam del Socorro C., Celia María B., and Aura Lila G. M.. This group is from the Las Flores region in the Masaya municipality. The three members are involved in the same business activity: fruit and vegetable sales. They sell their produce at the Masaya municipal market. They have been in this business for many years, and they have been working with Adim for several loan cycles, demonstrating that they are punctual and responsible people. They are committed to be in good standing with the institute. Ms. Celia María is a young mother of two young children. She buys and sells fruit at the market very early in the morning. She learned this skill from her mother, who is in the same line of work even today. She is pleased to have obtained loans based on trust. She dreams of being able to give her children an education and a better quality of life. Ms. Aura Lila G. has been a hard-worker since she was young. She is raising her young son on her own. As a single mother, she has become strong enough to work and help her son get ahead in life. He is a student at the local school, and she thinks that he will be able to attend secondary school in Masaya. Ms. Lilliam del Socorro C. is the group coordinator. She was given this post because she can read more then the other members, and can sign her name well. She has been working at the market from a young age alongside her mother. She sells fruits and vegetables. She has invested this loan, she has been able to invest her own money and now has her own stand in which she sells oranges, lemons, tamarind, onions, garlic, etc. She purchase these products at the market, then sells them in her area of residence. She has four school age children—three adolescents and one child—who study at their local school. One of her children studies in Masaya because she feels that he should leave the region and take extra courses. Her work schedule begins at 3 a.m. and ends at 2 p.m. When she returns home, she takes groceries. She states that the loan allows her to purchase a greater amount of fruit, which yields her greater profits. She motivates her colleagues to be in good stand and keep borrowing so that they can continue to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase fruits and vegetables
borrower_names: Celia María, Lylliam del Socorro, Aura Lila

description:
La señora Francisca A. se dedica a laborar arduamente en su negocio de venta de queso teniendo su establecimiento en el mercado Central de Chinandega donde se dedica a comercializarlo.

El motivo por el cual la señora A. ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra del queso ya que lo requiere con mucha urgencia y de esta forma saldrá adelante en su negocio.
description_translated:
Mrs. Francisca A. works arduously in her business selling cheese. Her establishment is located at the market "Central" of Chinandega.

The reason why Mrs. A. has approached Ceprodel is to benefit from a loan in order to buy cheese urgently so she can get ahead with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase cheese.

description:
Virgilio G. is working so hard to provide for the needs of his family. He manages a small sari-sari (variety) store and sells a variety of goods like rice, sardines, instant noodles and other goods. He is 33 years old and both of his two children are in school.

He is requesting a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI, Kiva's partner. He will use the loan to buy additional merchandise for his store. The loan will truly help him win more customers. He thinks that when there are more displays in his store, he will earn more profit to support his family.

CEVI is reaching out to more people to help start and have their own businesses. CEVI helps provide livelihood. It provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.
loan_use: To purchase additional merchandise for his store

description: Миновар – 34 лет. Она замужем и мать 4-х детей. Её муж уехал в Россию работать. Здесь он не смог найти хорошую работу, чтобы накопить денег и купить для себя скот. У Миновар было всего лишь 10 овец. Но год назад она узнала о кредитовании нашей организации, и пришла брать кредит для покупки одной дойной коровы. Сейчас у Миновар две дойной коровы. Пока ее муж найдет работу в России и пришлет ей деньги, ей будет помогать ее брат. Миновар очень рада что в трудный момент ее жизни наша организация помогает ей.
description_translated:
Minovar is 34 years old. She is married and is the mother of 4 children. Her husband went to Russia to work. Here he could not find a good job in order to save money and purchase livestock for himself. Minovar had just 10 sheep. But a year ago she found out about credit from our organization and came to take out a loan to purchase one dairy cow. Today, Minovar has two dairy cows. Until her husband finds a job in Russia and sends her money, her brother will help her. Minovar is very happy that our organization is helping her at a difficult moment in her life.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Livestock

description:
Armie S. has been a farmer since she was just a small child. Her parents are farmers and everything she knows about farming is a credit to her parents. She is 39 years old and has four children. She told CEVI about her life as a family woman and she said, "I will be the best farmer to win food for my children."

She is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI, a Kiva partner. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers for her farm. Fertilizers are a critical factor for a good harvest. She needs to buy more fertilizers to increase her yield.

CEVI is reaching out to farmers to help them sustain their livelihood. It helps people, especially the poor, to start and have their own livelihood. CEVI provides not just loans but also training and insurance coverage.
loan_use: To purchase fertilizers

description: Edith is 32 years old and married with 3 children. She sells medicines. She hopes for the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.
loan_use: To purchase more medicines to sell

description: Since 1996, Hussana S. has worked as a trader in Siwdu selling eggs. She is married with 3 children and received education through primary school. While Hussana works as a trader, her husband is employed as a tailor. Hussana is responsible for paying utility bills and also caring for her children. The loan will be used to buy additional goods which will increase her productivity and improve her business in the selling of the eggs. She hopes to use her newly gained profits to reinvest back into her enterprise and improve her capital.
loan_use: To buy additional goods which will increase her productivity and improve her business in the selling of the eggs.

description:
Marcia P. and Octavia D. L. C. are two representatives of the ten entrepreneurs applying for this Kiva loan. Both Marcia and Octavia have small cafeterias. They sell mostly juices, sandwiches, and fried pastries filled with either meat or cheese. These make great snacks and are cheap, easy-to-take-on-the-go breakfast options as well. This loan will be used to purchase more juices and pastries in order to serve larger clienteles in the morning when both of them have the largest crowds. Marcia and Octavia want to own the houses they live in so they don't have to pay rent in the future and can take more advantage of what their businesses are generating.\r\n

\r\nAll of the group members live in San Pedro D. Macoris, in southeast Dominican Republic. They have successfully repaid five previous loans to Esperanza International, and are working towards consolidating their businesses. These hardworking women have shown great determination in taking their micro businesses to the next level. Please help us to continue supporting them with this Kiva loan. Thank you!
loan_use: To purchase flour, meat and cheese for fried pastries
borrower_names: Araseli, Octavia, Griseyda, Ana, Marcia, Maria, Suraini, Maria, Maria, Ramona
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Ms. Carmel Joy A., 25 years of age, is single and has been an active member of Paglaum MPC for almost two years. She lives with her parents but she has an existing sari-sari store to generate her own income.\r\n
