\r\nNow she has obtained another loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 intended for the purchase of assorted grocery stocks for display. She dreams that someday she can expand her business and have more income to help her parents financially.
loan_use: To purchase grocery stock for her sari-sari store

description:
Mrs. Merly A. is 29 years of age and married to Mr. Jovenal A., an Overseas Filipino Worker. They have two lovely children to raise and hope to give them a good education.\r\n

\r\nMerly is a newly recognized member of Paglaum MPC under its micro-finance program. Her business is dried-fish vending and she sells to her neighbors and friends. She applied for the loan to provide additional capital.
loan_use: To purchase more dried fish to sell

description: Розие 44 года, замужем и имеет 2 детей. Муж находится на заработках в России., а Розия занимается предпринимательством и продает ткани. Ассортимент тканей включает в себя все ценовые категории: от дешевых до дорогих. За товаром ездит на оптовый китайский рынок раз в неделю. А постоянное место для торговли арендует в центральном универмаге города. Розия собирается закупить оптом ситец и велюровую ткань и поэтому подала заявку на КИВА.\n
description_translated:
Roziya is 44 years old, she is married and has 2 children. Her husband is working in Russia and Roziya is an entrepreneur and sells fabrics. Her fabric assortment includes all price categories from cheap to expensive. She travels for her products to a wholesale Chinese market once a week. Roziya rents a permanent sales location at the central department store in the city. Roziya plans to purchase chintz and velour fabrics and this is why she has put her application on KIVA.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase chintz and velour fabrics

description: Эшматов Одилчон- мужчина 30 лет. Женат, имеет одного ребенка. Одилчон занимается. Одилчон после того как  приехал из заработок, с Российский Федерации в майе 2008 года занялся  откормом и продажей мелко рогатого кота. Одилчон имеет достаточный опыт в этой сфере. На полученный займ хочет купит  корм для своих овец. Таким образом, Одилчон ведет свои хозяйства и кормит свою семью. Ему также помогает сын и жена. Жена Одилчона  Гульмира имеет опыт работы в сфере откорма скота
description_translated:
Odiljob E. is thirty years old, married, and has one child. Since he returned in May 2008 from working in Russia he has been raising and selling small livestock, an area in which he has experience. He would like to use a loan to buy feed for his sheep. This business allows him to take care of his property and feed his family. His wife and son also help him. Odiljon's wife Gulmira also has experience in raising livestock. \r\n\r\n

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Raising livestock

description: Зебинисо - женщина 39 лет. Она вдова. Воспитает 3-х детей. Занимается продажей мужской одежды на рынке "Афганбазар"  города Худжанда. Она арендует магазин. Зебинисо привозит товар из города Бишкека Киргизской Республики. Она раз в месяц ездит за товаром. Зебинисо кредитуется в нашей организации 2 года. В начале кредитования она закупала товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан. Сейчас она расширила бизнес. Зебинисо планирует дальше расширять бизнес и потихоньку перейти и на женскую одежду.
description_translated:
Zebiniso is a 39 year old woman. She is a widow, she raises three children. She sells men's clothing on the market Afganbazar of the town of Khujand. She rents out a store. Zebiniso brings the merchandise from Bishkek of the Republic of Kyrgyztan. She travels for the merchandise once a month. Zebiniso has been taking out loans in our organization for two years. At the beginning of her credit history she was buying the goods from a wholesale market of the town of Istaravshan. She has now expanded her business. Zebiniso plans to further expand her business and slowly start selling women's clothing.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To expand business

description:
Le groupe  Sinjiya  est  constitué de quatre femmes  mariées (dont deux sont polygames et  les deux autres monogames) qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent à Médine un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur troisième  collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de pouvoir combler le vœux de leur clientèle et augmenter leur chiffre d’affaire.
 Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente d’habillements,  de pomme de terre, et de   fruits.
 Avec ce prêt, elles comptent acheter  40 sacs de 100 kg d’oranges, 20 paniers  mange. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso auprès des grossistes et des producteurs. 
Les marchandises sont vendues au comptant, en détail et à crédit au grand marché de Sikasso ville   et souvent de façon ambulante à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour aider les maris à subvenir aux charges de famille et  l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
description_translated:
The group Sinjiya is composed of four married women (two are polygamous, and the other two are monogamous). They average 36 years of age and 2 children each and live in Médine, a district in Sikasso City, third administrative region of Mali.

The group members are on their third collaboration with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to fulfill the wishes of their customers and to increase their turnover. They do a diversity of work, including the sale of clothing, potatoes, and fruit.

With this loan, they intend to buy forty 100-kg sacks of oranges and twenty baskets of mangoes. Supplies are gotten at the grand marketplace of Sikasso City from wholesalers and producers. The merchandise is sold retail to customers composed of women and men, cash or credit accepted, at the grand marketplace of Sikasso City and often door-to-door.

The group members each envision realizing an average monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA. A portion of the profits will be used for helping their husbands to meet family expenses, and the other portion will be invested in business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy fruit

description: ЗАМИРА Монадкулова 1973 года рождения, замужем , имеет 4 детей. Имеет среднее образование. В   Микроинвест обратилась для расширения бизнеса. Она продает в киоске, журналы газеты, а также сладостями и другими мелочами. Ее киоск находиться  возле остановки и большого магазина. Планирует в будущем расширить свой  киоск.Благодарна КИВА за поддержку.
description_translated:
Zamira M. was born in 1973; she is married and has 4 children. She has a high school education. She turned to MicroInvest to grow her business. She sells magazines, newspapers and also sweets and other miscellaneous items at a kiosk. Her kiosk is located next to a stop and a large store. She plans to expand her kiosk in the future. She is grateful to Kiva for the support.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Grow product assortment

description: Hannah M. is a widow with 1 child and has received an education through Primary School. Hannah sells cloth at Abura, which she has done for 3 years.  Hannah uses her income to pay for clothing and feeding her child. She will use the loan as additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of cloth for re-sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Hannah plans to save towards expanding her business.
loan_use: additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of cloth

description:
La señora  Edith es socia del Banco Comunal “María Asunción Galindo” del sector Kajje de la comunidad Chucasuyo, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, en el departamento de Puno. Tiene 29 años de edad, es conviviente, madre de 01 hijo y tiene estudio de secundaria completa.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 18 años y es fundadora del dicho Banco Comunal, tuvo un primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, con el cual pudo comprar ropa de adultos y bebes; este negocio le va bien, asimismo ella compra  su mercadería en los distritos de Desaguadero, Juliaca y los vende en la comunidad y en Ilave.

Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, comprará prendas de vestir como chompas, camisas, medias, etc.  De esta manera pretende ayudar económicamente a su hijo.  Este crédito será pagado en 4 cuotas. 
La señora Edith desea seguir trabajando para ayudar a su hijo y comprarse una casa en Juliaca.
description_translated:
Edith is a member of the "María Asunción Galindo" communal bank, in the Kajje section of the community of Chucasuyo, district of Juliaca, Chucuito province in the department of Puno. She is 29 years old, lives with her common-law husband, is the mother of 1 child and completed her secondary school studies. For the past 18 years she has worked with Manuela Ramos and is a founder of her communal bank. Her first loan was for S/. 300 new soles and with that she was able to buy clothing for adults and children. Her business is going well for her. She buys merchandise in the districts of Desaguadero and Juliaca and she sells it in her community. With this loan for S/. 500 new soles she will buy clothing such as sweaters, shirts, socks, etc. In this way she tries to support her son financially. The loan will be paid in 4 installments. Edith would like to keep working to help her son and to buy a house in Juliaca.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Buy sweaters, shirts and socks.

description:
La señora Benita es socia del Banco Comunal  “Dios es Amor”, en el distrito D. Mazo-Cruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 44 años D. edad, ella es casada, tiene 04 hijos y posee estudios D. primaria incompleta (tercer grado).
Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace ya 10 años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/300.00 nuevos  soles, monto que invirtió en la compra D. abarrotes para su tienda.

Con este préstamo D. S/3000.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se compromete a pagar en 05 cuotas mensuales, piensa adquirir mas mercadería para su tienda, ahora mayorista, y abrir una pollería  que le generará mas ingresos para su familia.
Su mayor deseo es poner una tienda mayorista y una pollería; Lo que mas le gusta D. su Banquito son las reuniones y los ahorros.
description_translated:
Benita is a member of the “Dios es Amor” community bank in the MazoCruz district, Collao province, Puno department. She is 44, married, and has 4 children. She has a third graD. education. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 10 years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, which she used to buy groceries for her store. With this loan of 3,000 PEN, which she promises to repay in 5 monthly payments, she will buy more merchandise for her store – now a wholesale store. She will also open a chicken store to generate more income for her family. Her biggest desire is to have a wholesale store and a chicken store. What she likes best about her bank are the meetings and the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy noodles, flour, canned goods, soft drinks and other basic needs items

description:
Josephine J. is renting a small parcel of land to farm rice. She is 55-years old and already a widow. She would like to grow her business and buy her own rice field someday. Now, she is worrying about how she will be able to stretch her limited income. She has decided to grow vegetables in her backyard for additional income.

She is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm necessities. The loan will help her family a lot to increase the harvest.

CEVI is a non-profit organization set up to respond to the needs of small entrepreneurs. It helps provide not just loans, but training and insurance coverage as well.
loan_use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm necessities

description:
Melita B. is a pig grower. She started her business in 2000 with only one sow. She wants to grow her business even more to support all their needs. Presently, she has two sows and five pigs. She also sells piglets to her friends who are pig growers. She is already a widow and has only one child. She works diligently for the family. Aside from pigs, she owns a small sari-sari (community-based mini grocery) store. She sells variety of goods to supplement her income.

She is requesting a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI, a Kiva partner. She will use the loan to buy piglets to increase the size of her piggery. The loan will also be used to buy additional merchandise for her store.

CEVI is reaching out to more people to start and have their own livelihood. It provides not just loans but also training and insurance benefits to all the clients as well
loan_use: Purchase piglets and pig feed

description: Petronila es una joven muy alegre de 26 años, vive en la casa de su padre, a quien quiere dar una vejez tranquila y lo que más desea es salir adelante. Para Petronila la crianza de ganado es una actividad que viene de familia, desde muy pequeña  aprendió a realizar esta labor, actualmente realiza este trabajo y es muy buena haciéndolo, su ganado es muy solicitado en las ferias de Huancane y Juliaca. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es pastar a sus animales y permanecer al aire libre, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y lo más difícil para ella es llevar a sus animales hasta las distintas ferias para venderlos. Para el futuro espera incrementar el número de ganado que tiene para así mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Este es el primer préstamo de Petronila con MFP y se siente feliz de la oportunidad brindada, en su banco comunal es una socia muy querida, ya que siempre ayuda en todo lo necesario. Con los 1000 soles solicitados comprará una vaca para incrementar su ganado, para ello está dispuesta a poner dinero de sus ahorros si es necesario incrementar el monto.
description_translated:
Petronila is a very happy young woman who is 26 years old. She lives in her father's house, who she wants to give a tranquil old age. What she wants most is to get ahead in life. For Petronila, livestock husbandry is an activity that comes from her family as she learned how to do it from a young age. She currently carries out this work and is very good at doing it. Her livestock is very sought after in the Huancane and Juliaca markets. What she most likes about her work is to graze her animals and to be outside in the fresh air. She has been doing this activity for 15 years and the most difficult part for her is to take her animals to the different markets to sell them. In the future she hopes to increase her number of heads of livestock to improve her income. This is Petronila’s first loan with MFP and she feels happy about the opportunity it provides. In her communal bank she is a much loved member as she always helps in everything required. With the 1000 soles requested she will buy a cow to increase her livestock and for this she is prepared to contribute money from her savings if it is necessary to increase the amount. \r\n

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy a cow

description: Hilda tiene 37 años, vive con Jesús su esposo, y su hijo Yomar de 6 años en su casa propia. Desde hace uno año, junto a su esposo, se dedica a la compra y venta de madera, para cubrir los gastos de su pequeño Yomar, nombre que le pusieron en su honor a su negocio, el cual les arroja bueno resultados, gracias a todo el empeño que le ponen, ya que Jesús viaja constantemente a otras provincias para dejar los pedidos que le hacen, resultándole muy rentable siendo sus servicios son muy demandados y obteniendo un buen dinero de todas sus ventas, mientras Hilda es quien administra el negocio. A ella le gusta su negocio, y aunque a veces hay cosas feas, como que la gente no paga a tiempo sus pedidos y tienen que estar detrás de para que les paguen, siempre le ha puesto mucha energía y ganas a su trabajo. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual y responsable en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de madera para aumentar sus ventas.\t¿Qué es lo que comprará con este dinero?
description_translated:
Hilda id 37 years old. She lives with Jesus, her husband, and her son, Yomar, who is 6 years old, in her own house. For the past year, together with her husband, she has been buying and selling timber in order to cover the expenses of her youngster, Yomar, name also given to their business in his honor and it it providing good results thanks to their effort as Jesus constantly travels to other provinces delivering orders. Their services are in high demand and it is a good business and they earn well. While he travels, Hilda is in charge of the business. She enjoys her business and even if sometimes there are ugly issues when customers do not pay punctually and they have to be on their back to make them pay, she has always provided energy and passion to her work. This is her first loan with MFP and she is committed to repay punctually and responsably. With the money requested she will buy more timber in order to increase sales. \r\n\r\n

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Increase merchandise

description: Roberto tiene 56 años, es un hombre muy trabajador, tiene su casa propia en el distrito de Ventanilla, donde vive con su esposa y sus hijos. Desde muy joven incursionó en gran cantidad de trabajos, aprendiendo en uno de ellos a conducir, y desde entonces su meta fue tener un carrito propio, es así que con el esfuerzo de muchos años de trabajo logró comprar un camión con el cual trabaja actualmente dedicado al servicio de transporte de carga. El trabajo es duro, ya que suele salir desde tempranas horas de la mañana y terminar muy tarde por la noche, felizmente no está solo, pues tiene a su lado a su esposa, quien es el motor de su hogar y quien lo apoya incondicionalmente, sabe que juntos podrán lograr todos sus objetivos, ya que tienen muchas ganas y siempre ponen lo mejor de sí en cada cosa que hacen. Roberto se encuentra en su primer préstamo con MFP, y promete ser muy puntual en sus pagos, porque sabe que se está comprometiendo con una gran responsabilidad, él agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su crédito y lo acercan más a sus objetivos. Con el dinero está solicitando refaccionará su camión y dará la cuota inicial para la adquisición de otro camión, el cual le permita mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
description_translated:
Roberto is a very hard-working 56-year-old man. He lives with his wife and children in their own home in the Ventanilla district. He began working when he was very young and has had a variety of jobs. At one of his jobs, he learned to drive, and since then he has had the goal of having his own car. After many years of hard work he was finally able to buy a truck, which he now uses to transport cargo. The work is difficult, as he usually has to leave very early in the morning and finishes late at night. Happily, he doesn't work alone, as his wife is by his side. She is the driving force behind their home, and supports him unconditionally. Roberto knows that together they can achieve all their dreams, as they are very motivated and always do their best in everything they do.

This is Roberto's first loan from Microfinanzas PRISMA, and he promises to be punctual with its repayment. He knows that this is a great responsibility, and he is grateful to all those who are making this loan possible and helping him get closer to his goals. He will use this loan to refurbish his truck and to put a down payment on another one, which will increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Refurbish his truck

description:
Alfredo es socio del Banco Comunal Bienestar.
Alfredo es soltero y tiene 30 años, Alfredo es técnico dental de profesión, tiene un laboratorio dental en un local alquilado, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Alfredo necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de materiales dentales,
Los sueños de Alfredo son ahorrar para el futuro y estudiar odontología.
description_translated:
Alfredo is a member of the Bienestar communal bank. He is single and 30 years old. Alfredo is a dental technician and has a dental laboratory in a rented location. He adquires his products in the city of Lima. Alfredo needs a loan of 1050 Soles which will be invested in the purchase of dental materials. Alfredo's dreams are to save money for the future and to study odontology.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase of dental supplies

description:
Flor es socia del Banco Comunal Renacer.
Flor es casada, tiene 42 años y 4 hijos, Flor junto a su esposo viajan a las ferias D. la región en donD. compra ganado y luego los comercializa en la feria D. San Juan, también benéfica los animales y venD. la carne en un puesto del mercado D. Carmen Alto.
Flor necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. oveja.
Los sueños D. Flor son tener una bodega en su casa, comprar una cortadora D. carne y educar a su ultimo hijo.
description_translated:
Flor is a member of the communal bank “Renacer.” She is married, 42 years old, and has 4 children. Flor and her husband travel to the region’s fairs to buy cattle and then sell them at San Juan’s fair. They also take care of the animals and sell the meat from a post in the Carmen Alto market. Flor needs a loan of 1500 soles that she will invest in buying sheep. Flor would like to have a store in her house, buy a meat cutter, and give her last son an education.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Para la compra de oveja.

description:
An active member of Paglaum MPC for two years, Mrs. Rosefina D. is 45 years old and married with three children. Her husband previously worked as a carpenter. He also helped his wife raise pigs because this is their one way of earning an income. Both want to have a decent living in the future so they want to be secure, especially for the future of their children.

\r\n\r\n

They have heard good views on the cooperative and they like the insurance and savings services. Now, they need additional capital to acquire piglets. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP. She wishes that this will be her stepping stone to become popular in the piggery business.
loan_use: To buy pig feed and additional piglets.
town_name: Dipolog - Dicayas, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Nor

description:
Irene S. is a vendor of different snacks such as rice cakes and also vegetables in their village. She also plants vegetables and morning glories which she also sells for extra income. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 9,000 for the development of her store.

Her husband Rex helps her gather vegetables that she can sell in the public market and in their village. They have four children who are all studying and who help them in their planting and selling, especially during school vacations.
loan_use: Business development

description: Бизнес Абдухакима продолжает свое развитие. Также как и раньше он приобретает товар на оптовых рынках, а затем продает. Абдухаким на прибыль, полученную от своего бизнеса приобрел телевизор для своего дома. Он считает что если хорошо поработать то можно всего добиться. Сейчас он планирует получить новый займ и собирается приобрести новый ассортимент товаров для своего бизнеса.\n
description_translated:
Abduhakim's business continues to grow. Just as before, he purchases goods from wholesale markets for resale. With his profit Abduhakim was able to purchase a TV for his home. He believes that those who work hard can achieve everything. Now, he plans to receive a new loan and purchase a new range of goods for his business. \r\n

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: For Business Expansion

description:
Lorna T. manages a small piggery business. She is 36 years old, married and has four children. Her husband abandoned them when her children were still small. She is the one working to feed and clothe her family well.

She is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI, a Kiva partner. She will use the loan to buy feed for her pigs. The loan will help her family grow its business even more. Raising more pigs will make her earn a lot of pesos to support their needs.

CEVI is reaching out to more women to help them start and have their own businesses. CEVI offers not just loans but also training and insurance coverage as well.
loan_use: To piurchase feed for pigs

description: Cristina has been managing her village store business for almost two years.  Her husband, Eduardo, is an electrician in their village.  The couple is working hard to further the education of their seven children: Valeny, Rosette, Janette, Edison, Norbert, Tio and Mariel. Some of her children are already married, while the others are still in the high school level. Her desire to improve her business leads her to ask for a loan of PHP 7,000 ($US 150). She believes that this amount will assist her in making her store become more profitable.
loan_use: Business Capital - village store

description:
Imelda A. is 42 years old and vending has always been a good source of income for her. She was married to Cresencio who is 5 years younger than she. They were blessed with three children: Michelle Joy - 22 years old, Kenneth Mark - 19 years old and a third year high school student, and Atasha Mae - 4 years old, and a pre-school student. They are happy living in Luna, Isabela.

She is engaged in wholesale and retail sales. She sells fresh eggs and dried fish in the market. Her weekly net income is around 3,000 Philippine Pesos (about US $61) which they budget to support the basic needs of their family. However, it is not sufficient to satisfy their needs; she and her husband are working hard to sustain their business for their future. For this she decided to request a loan amounting to 16,000 pesos. She believes that strong determination and patience are the keys to success.
loan_use: Business capital

description:
Issah A. is a forty-four-year-old married man and the father of two children, a son and a daughter. He says his son has yet to start school while his daughter is in nursery school. His wife works to make some income to help him out financially. She is a food vendor.

Issah lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a town called Takorase. Takorase is a farming and busy trading community in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Issah is a butcher. He works in his own small abattoir shed in the market square. He buys live animals such as goats, sheep, cattle, etc, kills them and sells the meat. According to Issah, most of his customers are food vendors in his community. He buys the livestock from the farmers in his community. He has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to procure more livestock.
loan_use: To buy livestock to slaughter and sell

description:
Doris A. is married with 2 children and has received an education through Junior High School. Since 2006, Doris has worked as a seamstress in the Elmina area making clothes and also selling materials. While Doris works as a seamstress, her husband is employed as a salt producer.

\r\n\r\nDoris’ husband pays their family’s financial expenses, and because of this, she is able to focus her attention and monies on her business. She plans to use the loan to purchase additional sewing materials for the sewing of her customers' clothing and with the new profits from her expanded business, Doris plans to save and reinvest.
loan_use: purchase additional sewing materials for sewing

description:
Norma A. owns a small rice field. She is 41 years old, a widow, and has seven children. She is the only one who works to win food and clothing for the family. She would like to buy another farm to increase her harvest. She dreamed that someday, all her children will graduate in college and have better jobs in the future.

The reason why Norma would like to loan from CEVI is that she wants to buy herbicides and fertilizers for her farm. The loan will also be used to venture into another line of business to supplement their income.


CEVI is reaching out to more people to help them start and have their own business. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.
loan_use: To purchase fertilizers and herbicides for her farm

description:
The leader of this group is Mrs. C.. She is 33 and has been selling all kinds of vegetables in the local market for years. She buys her products in bulk from farmers and sells them from 7:00 am to 4:00 pm. To help meet the family's foods demands, her husband owns a car and uses it to pick up the passengers for income. He leaves his house in early morning to provide his service and comes back in late afternoon with much income. The couple lives with three single children, who are all local students. To earn additional income and accrue business capital, Mrs. C. has decided to seek a loan to buy more vegetables and fruits to sell.

\r\n\r\n

This group also consists of four other borrowers. All the borrowers live in Siem Reap Province, in Cambodia. Mrs. S. sells souvenir gifts to tourists and seeks a loan to add to her savings in order to finish building her house. Mrs. S. sells fresh vegetables and is applying for a loan to add rice to the stocks for resale in order to gain income. Mrs. N. works as a staff member in a hotel and she would like a loan to replace her old motor so she can ride to work more easily. Mrs. M. is a souvenir seller who is requesting a loan to add to her savings in order to build house.
loan_use: To purchase vegetables and fruits to sell.

description: Mrs. Jovita B., who resides in Lagag, Sindangan, Zamboanga Del Norte, is married with 3 children. Her main source of income is a sari-sari store, or small convenience shop. She started her business with a small amount of capital, and it is currently supported with the help of her husband, who is a farmer.\r\n\r\nHer business caters to the basic needs of her neighbors.  She is applying for a loan of Php 5,000.00 in additional capital for her sari-sari store. Her plans are to improve the business and to improve the quality of life for her family.
loan_use: Additional capital for sari-sari store

description:
NINFA R. C. pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS MARGARITAS” vive en el Jr pachitea nº 785. del distrito de Calleria, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 57 años de edad y su pareja es ganadero

Se inició en el negocio de venta de comida y gaseosas, con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles compró gaseosas y golosinas.

Actualmente se dedica a al venta de productos de la Región, tiene la oportunidad de ir a las chacras y trae los diferentes productos para venderlos a sus vecinos.  Con este préstamo de S/. 2,200.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará más productos como frutas para abastecer su negocio.  También hará arreglos del local.

“Muchas veces tenemos oportunidades pero no sabemos aprovecharlas, sin embargo Manuela Ramos nos da la oportunidad de obtener créditos para aumentar nuestro capital y así contar con mas ingreso en la casa”.
description_translated:
NINFA R. C. belongs to the “LAS MARGARITAS” cooperative bank. She lives in the Calleria district of the city of Pucallpa, is 57 years old, and her partner is a rancher. She started in the business of selling food and soft drinks with her first loan of 300.00 soles, which she used to buy sodas and sweets/snacks. Currently, she dedicates herself to selling regional products. She has the opportunity to go to the farms and bring back different products to sell to her neighbors. With this loan of 2,200.00 soles she will buy more product, such as fruit, with which to supply her business. “Many times we have opportunities, but don’t know how to take advantage of them. Regardless, Manuela Ramos gives us a chance to obtain loans to augment our capital allowing us to increase the income we bring to our households.”

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy regional food products (fruits).

description:
Mrs. Hon H. was born in 1958 and has been living for years with other family members in Battambang Province. Mrs. H. and her husband own a plantation that was inherited from their grandparents, on which they cultivate all kinds of crops. The couple has four children: one is married and lives separately and the other three are students, and they also help their parents' business when they are not attending school.\r\n

\r\nThe family is lacking capital in order to support their business actions. Therefore, H. humbly requests a loan of $ 800 from Kiva's partner HKL to be used to buy fertilizers and seeds to grow.
loan_use: To buy fertilizers and seeds to grow

description:
Maria S. is a farmer. She grows rice a short distance from their house. She is 47 years old and has two children. Her husband, Jose S., is also a farmer. He is the one managing the farm. Maria worked previously in Manila as a salesclerk. She stopped working there because she was paid less by her employer.

She is asking a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and other farm necessities. The loan will truly help her increase the yield of her farm. She is looking forward for the upcoming harvest once she can purchase the things she needs for her farm.


CEVI is reaching out to more people to help them grow their business. It provides credit assistance, training and insurance coverage as well.
loan_use: To purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and herbicides

description: Eupricina M. a 51-year-old fish and vegetable vendor. She lives in Navalan Village, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is married to Felix M. who works as a farmer. She has six children; two are studying and four are married.  Her fish and vegetables are displayed in the village market everyday.  She applied for a loan of PHP 14,000.00 to purchase more kinds of fish and vegetables. She plans to sell every morning to other villages. Her business income helps them meet their daily expenses.
loan_use: To purchase fish and vegetables

description: La Sra. Gloria M. tiene 26 años de edad, tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos y joyeria de fantasia enchapes de oro, ella tambien vende lociones, cremas, polvos, shampoos, desodorantes, etc. ella tiene un año de dedicarse a esta actividad, ella vive en el barrio San Jose. en estos momentos ella necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia al por mayor ya que es mas barato y se obtienen mas ganancias, pero ella tiene que viajar para comprar su produto, por eso es que le sale mejor comprarlo al por mayor para tenerlo para varios meses. \npor tal razon es que ella esta solicitando el credito. tiene muchos deseos de superarse y quiere llegar a tener una tienda grande para poder mantener a su hijo y darle lo mejor en esta vida. ella quiere que su hijo sea una persona de bien y que sea un buen profesional.
description_translated:
Mrs. Gloria M. is 26 years old and has a 4-year old son. She sells cosmetics and gold-plated costume jewellery. She also sells lotions, creams, powders, shampoos, deodorants, etc. She has been doing this for one year. She lives in the San Jose district. At the moment she needs money to buy more wholesale merchandise because it is cheaper and increases her earnings. However, she must travel to buy her products which is why it is better to buy in bulk so that she has enough to last several months. It is for this reason that she is asking for a loan. She is eager to succeed and would like to have a large shop so that she is able to look after her son and give him the best start in life. She would like her son to be a good person and a good professional.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy cosmetics and costume jewellery

description:
Bilsam B. is a rice grower. He is 38 years old and the father of three children. He wants to provide for all the needs of his family especially now that all the children are going to school. He was a tourist driver before. For 13 years, Bilsam worked very hard as a driver until he met his wife, Deborah, and got married. 

In his desire to be a good husband and father, Bilsam invested much in rice farming. His harvest is what he uses to buy all their needs. He also saves some rice for their own consumption. Now, he needs a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer, fungicides and other farm inputs.

CEVI aims to help small businesses like his grow. It provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.
loan_use: To purchase fertilizer, fungicides and other farm inputs

description:
Buchi has a chemist shop where he sells medicines. He has the only chemist shop in his community. The demands for his medicines are high and he hopes to meet the demands of his customers.\r\n

\r\nBuchi hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. Buchi is 27 years old and single. He is an active LAPO client. He says thanks.
loan_use: To purchase more medicine to sell

description: Mary Ann A. is 28 years old, married to Ronnie A. and blessed with one child. Presently she resides at Mangidkid, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a motorcycle driver. Pig-raising is her project, for which she has borrowed PHP 10,000 to buy pigs, feed, and vitamins. Mary Ann wants to have a pen for her pigs. She also wants to own a concrete house and to have her child be able finish school in the near future.
loan_use: To buy pigs, feeds and vitamins for her pig-raising

description: Afolashade sells vegetable and palm oil. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more vegetable and palm oil to sell. Afolashade is 36 years old and married with four children. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.
loan_use: To purchase more vegetable and palm oil to sell

description: Elizabeth sells sarongs and underwear. She is a LAPO client. She hopes for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. Elizabeth is 45 years old and married with five children. She says thanks to all Kiva Lenders.
loan_use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

description: Mojisola sells sarongs and jewelry. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. Mojisola is 43 years old and married with four children. She says thank you to all Kiva Lenders.
loan_use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

description: Шаходат-женщина 47-ми лет,замужем,имеет двоих детей.Она начала свой бизнес с одного маленкого стола,который ставила возле входа в вещевой рынок.Её мужу Икрому пришлось уехать на заработки в Россию,где заработав небольшую сумму он решил вложить в бизнес своей жены.Сейчас они имеют хорошее место в самом центре вещевого рынка.На полученный кредит Шаходат решила привезти из Истаравшана сезонный товар и этим расширить свой ассортимент.До осени она решила накопить намного денег на учёбу своего сына.
description_translated:
Shahodat is a 47-year-old woman, who is married and has two children. She started her business with one small table that she placed near the clothing market entrance. Her husband had to go to Russia for work, where he earned a small sum of money and decided to invest it in his wife’s business. They now have a store right in the center of the clothing market. Shahodat wants to use this loan to bring in seasonal goods from Istaravshan and expand her assortment. Before autumn, she decided to save some money to use for her son’s education.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Expanding goods assortment

description: Oshinowo sells tailoring supplies and she also weaves material. She hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase a weaving machine and tailoring supplies to sell. She is 37 years old and married with a child. She says thank you.
loan_use: To purchase tailoring materials and a weaving machine

description: K. Vanice is the leader of Bihanga II group in Ibanda. She works very hard at her used clothing business. She is thirty-two years old and married with five children, ages ten, eight, six, four and two. She also cares for two orphans. She started her business in 2005 and sells daily at the market, where she has regular customers. As a result of having quality clothes in stock, Vanice is able to make a good weekly profit. Her dream is to increase her stock so as to make more profit, and in that way be able to educate all her children, with the help of her husband. She needs a loan to be able to meet her customers' needs by adding more clothes to her inventory.
loan_use: To buy more clothes to sell.
borrower_names: Aloysious, Topius, Vanice, Federesi, Harriet, Deus, Moses, Charles, Juliet, Denis, Scolastica, Benon, Margaret, John, Francis, Bernard, Nico, Johnson, Jovia, Viola, Viola, Sylivia, Christopher
borrower_genders: male, female, female, male, female, male, male, male, female, male, female, male, female, male, male, male, male, male, female, female, female, female, male
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description: Mrs. Angelita I. is married to Mauricio I. and has two children. She requested a loan of Php 5,000.00 as additional capital for her hog-raising venture.  She will use the proceeds for the purchase of feed and vitamins for her hogs and for the purchase of more piglets. She is planning to put up capital for her own sari-sari store as an expansion to her hog-raising business and for added income as well. Her other future plan is for her children to finish their studies and hopefully establish their own careers.
loan_use: To purchase feed and additional piglets

description:
San Roque, Burgos, Isabela is where Lilia B. lives. She is already 26 years old and married to Wilfred B., 25 years old. They are blessed with one child named Peter Justine, 4 years old. She lives happily and peacefully with her family and parents since they are still living with them because they don’t have their own house yet.

Lilia enjoys managing her direct selling business of NATASHA, MSE and AVON cosmetic products. According to her, she will work hard in order to achieve all her goals in life such as living a progressive life, building their simple dream house and sending her son to school. Her desire to increase her capital in direct selling made her decide to request a loan amounting to PHP 5,000. The loan will be used to purchase more products to be able to acquire many customers. Lilia wants to make her business more productive in order to earn more profit thus making all her dreams possible.
loan_use: buy more products to sell

description:
Ofelia H. lives with her family in a peaceful village of San Jose Norte I, Mallig, Isabela. Ofelia has a small business of piggery in their backyard that serves as her only source of income. Most of the people in their village are engage in hog raising business as their source of income in order to provide their needs in their daily living. Ofelia works hard to maintain her business and to sustain the daily needs of her family. But she doesn’t have enough capital in order to improve her piggery into a progressive one.

Then, she learned about ASKI, she is now asking to avail a loan amounting to Php6, 000.00. The loan proceeds will be use to buy additional piglets to be raised and also some feeds supply and vitamins to make her pigs healthy, thus it may increase its price if she sells to the buyer. She wants to make her piggery profitable and make it productive. Because she wants to improve their living condition into a more better one. She also dreams to provide good education for her children to have them a brighter future. Ofelia always believes that through her sacrifices and strong faith to God, she can attain all her goals in life.
loan_use: buy more piglets and feeds

description:
Kimry V., age forty-five, and her husband, Kheun Chorn, age forty-six, were married in 1987 and have three daughters. Two of them weave silk at home and another daughter is in school. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Kimry has been a silk weaver for six years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman who takes them to sell in the market in Phnom Penh.  Her husband has been a construction worker for two years. He works in his village and in another district which a distance away from their house. The couple hopes to support their children’s continuing education. 

Kimry is requesting a loan to purchase silk materials for herself and her daughters' weaving business.
loan_use: To buy silk materials for her weaving business.

description: Mrs. Saroeurn L. lives in Ta Preak village in Takeo province. She is a grocer who owns a small grocery store. Her husband, Mr. Ya Sorn, is a farmer who owns a piece of land and cultivates rice. Although this couple works hard they still earn too little income to support their family. Thus, Mrs. Saroeurn L. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income. She is a 49-year-old mother of a child who is employed in a garment factory. She and her husband are shown in the photo.
loan_use: To buy a cow for breeding to earn more income.

description: Сангин Розиков мужчина 59 лет, женат, имеет 4 детей. Проживает в Ганчинском районе. Животноводство для Сангина основной источник доходов в его семье. Он имеет большой стаж в этой сфере и опыт, так как занимается откормом скота и его  продажей около 19 лет. Дома у Сангина 7 голов крупнорогатого скота, он хочет получить займ, в размере 300 сомони, сроком на 6 месяцев, для закупа корма для домашнего скота.\n Кроме животноводства Сангин работает в сфере сельского хозяйства.Он дехканин.   \n
description_translated:
Sangin R. is a 59-year-old man, who is married and has four children. He lives in the Ganchin district, where raising livestock is his main source of family income. Sangin has been in this line of work for many years and has a great deal of experience, since he has raised and sold cattle for nearly 19 years. Sangin has seven head of large-horned cattle at home, and he wants a six-month loan in the amount of 300 somoni to purchase cattle feed. In addition to raising livestock, Sangin works in agriculture. He is a farmer.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Raising cattle

description:
F. Zohirjon is 30 years old and lives with his wife and 4 children. He has been a farmer for 10 years, since the time of his marriage. This work enables him to support his family and it is for this reason that he works so hard and with such determination.

Zohirjon enjoys planting tomato and onion on his land and he likes harvesting even more because this is when he can see and appreciate the high quality of his products. In general, the production of tomato and onion in his area is good and there is great demand for them. The most difficult part of the business is planting season, especially with the cost of fertilizers that are necessary for good yield. This is Zohirjon’s first loan through IMON International. He plans to purchase seeds and fertilizer for his crop.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
loan_use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

description:
Dominga N. is 55 years old and is a resident of Barangay Quirino in Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She married after finishing her elementary education but, unfortunately, ended up separating due to family conflicts. Their three children live with her and she is sacrificing to earn a living for them. She works hard to satisfy their daily needs and to send them to school. She aims to have her children attend college.

Dominga is a walking vendor. She sells vegetables, fruits and some homemade snacks from house to house in her village. She also sells her products at the bus terminal since there are so many customers there. She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 from ASKI, Kiva's partner. She will use the loan to buy a larger quantity of products in order to increase her daily income, which is just a minimum of PHP 100 daily. She aims to save money in hopes of improving her vending business for her children’s welfare.
loan_use: buy addtional products to sell

description: Moniera and Tirso M. are simple people who live peacefully in Barangay Nangalisan, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. They have been blessed with three children and know that parenthood is a great responsibility. The couple support their children, both in terms of basic necessities and education. They also provide their children with moral and spiritual support, and are doing their best to earn and save for their future.\r\n\r\nMoniera manages a village store where she sells different grocery and frozen items. She buys most of her products in the Solano Public Market. She is seeking a loan to improve her business, increase her income and better support her family. She believes that the small amount she is asking to borrow will be a big help to her business and her family.
loan_use: To expand and improve her business

description: Saheed is thirty years old and married with a child. He has cameras that he uses for video coverage and for photography. He is requesting a loan to purchase a camera and more film. He is thankful to the Kiva lenders.
loan_use: To buy a camera and film

description:
Nuestra socia es la Sra. NILDA; ella es natural del distrito de Ollantaytambo, situado a 1:40 minutos desde la ciudad del Cusco en transporte público.

La socia tiene 33 años de edad y tiene 5 hijos de (15, 10, 8, 5, 4) años, nuestra socia es madre soltera y trabaja mucho para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos que aún dependen de ella, ella tiene un pequeño puesto o tienda de venta de desayunos en el mercado central del distrito de Ollantaytambo, da el servicio de desayunos, en base a jugos y diferentes bebida calientes, también ofrece el desayuno cuzqueño que trae (un plato de comida seco, un par de panes de la región y una bebida fría o caliente, café, té, leche, mates, jugos), ofrece sándwich de diferentes carnes, pasteles, leches y ponches, ella solicita el préstamo para poder implementar mejor su negocio y comprar más insumos.

La socia valora y agradece el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su préstamo.
description_translated:
Nilda is from the district of Ollanyatambo, which is an hour and forty minutes from the city of Cusco on public transportation. Nilda is 33 years old and has five children who are 15, 10, 8, 5, and 4 years old. She is a single mother and she works very hard to create a life for her children, who still depend on her. She has a small breakfast stand in the central market of Ollanyatambo district where she provides a breakfast service of juices and different hot drinks. She also offers a Cuzco breakfast that includes a plate of dried fruits, a couple of local breads, and a cold or hot drink (coffee, tea, milk, mate, or juice). She also sells different kinds of meat sandwiches, pastries, milk, and punches. Nilda seeks a loan so that she can improve her business and purchase more supplies. She values and appreciates the support offered through this channel and she also promises to repay her loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Leah Karlins, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To purchase ingredients for her breakfast stand

description: Sonia es una mujer admirable por el empeño que le pone a las cosas que hace, tiene 39 años y vive en un cuarto alquilado, ella está dispuesta a cualquier sacrificio con tal de tener una vida mejor. Su negocio de venta de golosinas está ubicado en uno de los parques más importantes de la ciudad de Juliaca, ha puesto todo su empeño en hacer de su pequeño negocio uno de los más concurridos por lo clientes, los cuales la prefieren debido a la amabilidad con que los trata. Los 10 años que lleva en este negocio le han servido para ganarse un lugar preferencial en el parque, ya que está ubicada en la esquina más transitada, donde es mucho más fácil de encontrarla. Lo que más le gusta es conversar con sus vecinas de venta, pero lo que menos le gusta es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto sin poder ir a ningún lado. Para el futuro, espera tener una tienda de golosinas, la cual le pueda dar mejores ingresos. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, en su primer crédito fue muy puntual y espera poder serlo ahora también, en su banco comunal es una socia muy querida. Con los 2000 soles que solicita planea comprar más productos para incrementar la mercadería que vende.
description_translated:
Sonia is an admirable woman because of the effort that she has put into the things that she has. She is 39 years old and lives in a rented room. She is ready for any sacrifices as long as she has a better life. Her sweets-selling business is located in one of the most important parks in the city of Juliaca. She has put all of her effort into having her small business be one of the most popular with clients, who prefer her business because of kindness with which she treats them. The 10 years that she has spent in this business have allowed her to earn a preferred location in the park, since it located in the busiest corner, where it is a lot easier to find her. What she likes most is to talk with the neighboring merchants, but what she likes least is to have to spend all day in her stand without being able to go anywhere. For the future, she hopes to have a sweets store, which will give her more earnings. This is her second loan with MFP. In her first loan, she was very punctual and hopes to continue that now as well. She is a very beloved member of her community bank. With the 2000 soles that she requests, she plans to buy most products to increase the merchandise that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To increase her merchandise

description: Hilda tiene 37 años, vive con Jesús, su esposo y su hijo Yomar de 6 en su casa propia. Ambos se dedican a la compra y venta de madera, desde hace un año para cubrir los gastos de su pequeño Yomar, nombre que le pusieron en honor a su negocio, el cual les arroja bueno resultados gracias a todo el empeño que le ponen, ya que Jesús viaja constantemente a otras provincias para dejar los pedidos que le hacen. Este negocio le resulta muy rentable, siendo sus servicios muy cotizados y obteniendo un buen dinero por todas sus ventas. A Hilda siempre le ha gustado su negocio y aunque a veces hay cosas feas como que la gente no paga a tiempo sus pedidos y tiene que estar detrás para cobrarles, siempre ha puesto mucha energía y ganas a su trabajo, ya que no está sola, cuenta con su esposo, y porque no, el pequeño Yomar también la apoya en todas las labores que tienen que realizar, haciendo un buen equipo con el cual espera salir adelante en bien de su porvenir. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual y responsable en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita es para comprar mayor cantidad de madera para vender en otras provincias y aumentar sus ventas.
description_translated:
Hilda is 37 years old. She lives with her husband, Jesús, and her son Yomar, age 6, in a house that they own. For the past year, Hilda and her husband have been buying and selling wood to cover the expenses of little Yomar. They named their business after Yomar, and it has delivered good results thanks to the hard work that they put into it. Jesus travels constantly to other provinces to delver the orders that they receive. This business has been very profitable, and their services in high demand, and they earn good money on each of their sales. Hilda has always liked sales. Even though she sometimes has to deal with unfortunate situations, like clients who don't pay for their orders on time and have to be reminded constantly to pay, she has always put a lot of energy and desire into her work. She is not alone, she has her husband, and, why not - little Yomar who support her in all of the work she undertakes. They make a good team and hope to get ahead and improve their future prospects. This is Hilda's first loan with MFP and she promises to be very punctual and responsible for all of her payments. With the money she is requesting she plans to buy a larger quantity of wood to sell in other provinces and increase their sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase more product to sell

description:
Барно Ашурова женщина 43 лет, проживает в городе Истаравшане, получила среднее образование. Замужем, мать четырех детей. 
 Барно с юношеских лет обучалась швейному мастерству, и на сегодняшний день она считается одной из опытных портних в своем городе. У Барно много клиентов, для которых она шьет национальные платья и халаты. Помогает ей в этом мастерстве, ее дочь. Она тоже, с огромным желанием обучилась швейному мастерству у своей мамы.
 Барно запрашивает займ в размере 1200 сомони, для приобритения дополнительной швейной машинки.
 Дополнительно к ее бизнесу, деньги ей присылает сын, который работает в Российской Федерации.
description_translated:
Barno A. is a 43-year-old woman, who lives in the town of Istaravshan. She graduated from high school, and is married and the mother of four children. Barno has sewn since she was a teenager, and today is considered one of the most experienced seamstresses in her town. Barno has many customers for whom she sews traditional dresses and robes. Her daughter assists her in the business, and greatly desires to become a master of the craft like her mother. Barno is requesting a loan in the amount of 1200 somoni to acquire another sewing machine. In addition to income from the business, her son, who has taken a job in Russia, sends her money.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Sewing machine

description:
La señora Alejandrina Lila O. M. tiene 34 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Alfa y Omega y vive en el caserío de Carabamba en la provincia de Julcán el departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Tiene estudios superiores, pero no concluyó porque tuvo su segundo hijo y está delicado de salud.  Alejandrina tiene 3 hijos.
Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, tiene una bodega.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles que canceló en 4 cuotas compró artículos de primera necesidad los que vendió a muy buen precio.
Con este crédito de S/.1,000 que será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en la compra de insumos para la preparación de alimentos y comprará artículos de librería.
Alejandrina sueña con tener un Mini Mercado para poder abastecer mejor a los pobladores de Carabamba.
description_translated:
Mrs. Alejandrina Lila O. M., 34, belongs to the Alfa y Omega community bank. She lives in the village of Caramba, Julcán province, La Libertad department, Perú. She attended college. She did not finish because she had her second son, and his health is delicate. Alejandrina has 3 children. She sells groceries, and she has a grocery store. With her first loan of 300 PEN, which she repaid in 4 payments, she bought basic needs items that she sold at a good price. With this loan for 1,000 PEN, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy ingredients for food preparation and bookstore items. Alejandrina dreams of having a mini market to be able to better supply the inhabitants of Carabamba.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy ingredients for food preparation.  Buy bookstore items.

description:
La señora Delfina es socia del Banco Manuela Ramos  del Distrito de Mazocruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 53 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 6 hijos, vive en el Barrio Villa Esperanza calle del ejercito y cuenta con estudios de 3er grado de primaria.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 11 años e inicio sus préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de venta abarrotes.
En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo, el cual solicitará por el monto de 500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitirá comprar mayor cantidad de productos para su negocio y poder surtirlo, comprará gaseosas, golosinas, huevos,, otros.
Su mayor deseo es comprarse una casita.
description_translated:
Señora Delfina is a member of the Manuela Ramos Bank in the Mazocruz District, Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 53 years of age, living with her domestic partner and has six children. She lives in the Villa Esperanza neighborhood, on Army Street, and has completed a third grade primary education. The Señora has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last eleven years. She began with a loan of 300 New Sols which enabled her to increase her working capital for her business selling groceries. At present, she is requesting a new loan in the amount of 500 New Sols. This would allow her to buy larger quantities of merchandise and to stock up her business. She is going to buy soft drinks, sweets, eggs and other things. Her greatest desire is to buy herself a little house.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy soft drinks, sweets, eggs, etc.

description:
Ruth es socia del Bancomunal Las Gitanas.
Ruth es casada tiene 63 años, tiene siete hijos todos mayores y están casados.
Ruth desde joven confeccionaba para varias empresas y estos últimos años para ripley dejo de trabajar por que la operaron de la vista y por restricción médica no pudo seguir en el mismo trabajo, se puso a vender productos de belleza por catalogo. 
Ruth necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles,  para la compra de zapatos y la compra de productos de belleza.
Desde que esta en Finca, aprendió a ahorrar, a ser responsable, saber valorar el trabajo.  
El sueño de Rut es tener su negocio en su casa, quiere poner un bazar.
description_translated:
Ruth is a member of Las Gitanas Communal Bank.

Ruth is 63 years old, married and has 7 grown-up and married children.

Ruth has worked for various companies since she was young, and most recently for Ripley. She stopped working after undergoing eye surgery. Her medical restrictions prevented her from returning to her old job, so she started selling cosmetics by catalogue.

Ruth is requesting a loan of 1400 soles to purchase shoes and cosmetics.
Since she has been with FINCA, she has learned to save, to be responsible, and to value work.

Ruth’s dream is to set up a shop in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase shoes and cosmetics

description:
Lucia L. is a rice grower. She is 49 years old and has four children. Her husband, Lito L., is also a farmer. Together they want to provide a better life for their children. She helps her husband manage their small rice field. Their harvest is intended for family consumption while the rest is sold to rice traders in their village.

She is asking for a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase sacks of Urea fertilizer and other farming needs. The loan will help her increase her yield. At some point, Lucia will be able to support the schooling of her kids because she is planning to venture into another business. 

CEVI aims to help small business to grow. It provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.
loan_use: To buy Urea fertilizer and other farming needs

description:
Mirzoali H.'s economic activity is agriculture, which he has dedicated himself to for several years. He is married and the father of 4 children. Mirzoali learned farming business from a young age and now has a lot of experience. It is very important to point out that his business requires a lot of effort, which is why he dedicates himself to growing potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers, etc. This requires a lot of exposure to the sun as well as moving the product long distances. The reason why Mirzoali is requesting a loan from IMON International is to invest in technological assistance in cultivation. With this loan he will be able to succeed and have better opportunities for the sale of his products after the harvest. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
loan_use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

description: Mrs. Marta T. is a resident of Dapitan City, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and blessed with 10 kids. Out of the 10, only one is still studying. She is an active member of Paglaum Co-op, a Kiva partner. She engages in raising pigs to help her husband, who is a farmer. Now she seeks a loan in the co-op for 5,000 Ph intended to purchase feed for her pig with the hope that it will grow faster for the education of her child.
loan_use: Purchase feed

description: Mariama S., is twenty-eight years old, married, and has three children who are in school. Mariama lives with her family at Bawjiase in Ghana. She runs a small provisions kiosk in her neighborhood. She also sells food items such as macaroni, tomatoes, etc. on a table top in front of her kiosk. She has been in business for seven years. Mariama buys her goods from wholesalers in the city and markets in nearby towns.  She desires to buy the goods in bulk whenever she travels to the city in order to minimize the problem of frequent trips. She is a member of a group called “Shining Star”. The group members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan and provide support in handling repayment.
loan_use: To buy groceries in bulk for resale

description:
La señora Claber Jasinta C. D. R. tiene 57 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Virgen del Carmen vive en la calle Alfonso Ugarte del sector Cochaya caserío D. Salpo, D. la provincia D. Otuzco departamento D. La Libertad Perú.
Estudió hasta cuarto grado D. educación primaria, pero no continuo estudiando porque no tenía apoyo D. sus padres.
Se caso a los 19 años y tiene 5 hijos, D. los cuales dependen D. ella 3.
Su actividad económica consiste en la cria D. animales, fabricación D. queso y quesillo.
El primer crédito recibido fue D. 300 soles los que canceló en 4 cuotas, recuerda con mucha alegría que con el primer préstamo compró queso, carne D. cerdo y carnero, los que volvió a vender a muy buen precio.
Con este crédito D. 500 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas, invertirá en medicina (fertilizantes) para la chacra.
Claber sueña con tener un buen capital para poder invertir en negocios diversos.
description_translated:
Señora Claber Jasinta C. D. R., 57, belongs to Banco Comunal Virgen del Carmen and lives on Alfonso Ugarte Street, Cochaya area, Salpo district, Otuzco Province, La Libertad Department, Perú. She studied to fourth graD. primary school, but did not continue studying because she did not have her parents' support. She married at 19 and has 5 children, 3 still dependent on her. Her business is raising animals and making cheeses. She remembers her first loan of $105, repaid in 4 installments, happily because she was able to buy cheese, pork, and mutton, which she brought back and sold at a very good profit. With this loan of $175, which will be repaid in 6 installments, she will invest in fertilizers for the land. Claber dreams of having capital to invest in various businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase of fertilizers for her fields

description:
La señora Petronila tiene 52 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal Alfa y Omega, vive en el caserío D. Carabamba, provincia D. Julcán Departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió educación primaria completa y se casó a los 15 años, aun siendo una niña, por lo que piensa que no tenia suficiente madurez para manejar su hogar, tiene 7 hijos D. los cuales solamente uno depenD. D. ella. Actualmente vive separada D. su esposo.
VenD. molidos distintos (especerías) y los días domingo venD. comida en forma ambulatoria.
Su primer crédito D. 300 soles fue cancelado en 4 cuotas y lo invirtió en su negocio, compró arroz, fideos y otros productos para sus comidas.
Con este crédito D. S/. 1000, el cual cancelará en 4 cuotas, invertirá en su negocio, en la compra D. insumos para preparar comida rápida.
description_translated:
Señora Petronila, 52, belongs to Banco Comunal Alfa y Omega, and lives in the Carabamba neighborhood, Julcán Province, La Libertad Department, Perú. She completed her primary education and married at 15, although she was still a girl and feels that she was not mature enough to manage the household. She has 7 children, only one of whom is still dependent on her. She is currently living apart from her husband. She sells various ground spices, and on Sundays she sells meals as a street vendor. Her first loan of $105, paid back in 4 installments, was invested in her business, buying rice, noodles, and other products for her meals. With this loan of $350, which will also be paid back in 4 installments, she will invest in supplies to prepare her quick meals.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase of supplies to prepare her quick meals

description:
La señora Lesly Judiht R. E. tiene 27 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal  Alfa y Omega y vive en el distrito de Carabamba, provincia de Julcán departamento de La Libertad.
Estudió hasta tercer año de secundaria  pero ya no pudo continuar estudiando por falta de apoyo de sus padres. Se unió a su pareja a los 16 años y actualmente tiene 3 hijos los que dependen de ella económicamente.
Su actividad económica consiste en la venta de víveres y fruta en su bodega.  Paralelamente se dedica a la cría y engorde de animales menores.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles cancelado en 4 cuotas, compró insumos para su bodega y alimentos para sus animales.
Con este crédito de 1500 que será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en la compra de insumos para la preparación de queso.
description_translated:
Lesly Judiht R. E. is 27 years old and belongs to the Alpha and Omega cooperative bank. She lives in the Carabamba district, located in the Julcán province of La Libertad. She studied until the third year of secondary school, but her parents weren’t able to support her enough to continue her education. She married at 16 years of age, and currently has 3 children who depend on her financially. Her economic activity consists of selling provisions and fruits in her store. Concurrently, she raises and fattens small animals. With her first loan of 300 soles, repaid in 4 installments, she bought supplies for her store and feed for her animals. With this loan of 1500 soles, to be canceled in 4 installments, she will invest in the purchase of ingredients for making cheese.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To purchase ingredients for making cheese.

description:
Gladys es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres Emprendedoras.
Gladys es casada tiene 62 años, cuatro hijos todos mayores.
Gladys se dedicaba a su casa pero quería hacer algo productivo  y una amiga la animo a vender ropa usada y ropa  nueva, consiguieron un sitio en Pista Nueva  y vende hace seis años le va muy bien. 
Gladys necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para la compra de ropa por el día de la madre.
Desde que esta en Finca, tiene mas amigas, son solidarias y amigas, le gusta las reuniones se distrae.
El sueño de Gladys es seguir trabajando, hasta que sus fuerzas lo permitan.
description_translated:
Gladys is a member of the community bank, Bancomunal Mujeres Emprendedoras. Gladys is married, 62 years old and has four children, all adults. Gladys was a housewife but wanted to do something productive. A friend suggested that she sell used and new clothing. She obtained a place in Pista Nueva and has sold there for six years with success. Gladys needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy clothing for mother's day. SInce she has been with Finca, she has more friends. They are each other's support and friends. She likes the meetings for diversion. Gladys has a dream to continue working as long as her strength allows it.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To purchase clothing for Mother's Day

description:
Le groupe Djiguifa est constitué de neuf  femmes mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogamiques avec en moyenne 33ans et 4enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Djaka kin de Kirango Markala (4ème Région administrative  de la république du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et d’amitié.
Ce groupe fait essentiellement le commerce de poissons. En plus du poisson certaines d’entre elles font parfois le commerce d’oignon et de bois de chauffe à domicile.
Afin d’augmenter le volume de leurs activités génératrices de revenus, elles décidèrent d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir remboursé correctement leurs trois premiers prêts solidaires, elles sont à leur 4ème  qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 60 corbeilles correspondant à 900 kg de poisson frais. 
Elles se ravitaillent en poisson sur les berges du fleuve Niger à Kirango. Une partie du poisson est séchée dans un coin de la maison à l’aide d’un séchoir traditionnel et l’autre moitié est vendue à l’état crue. Le poisson ainsi séché est revendu au comptant et en détail dans les foires de Konobougou, Sansanding et Siribala à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. 
Elles  envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 51 000FCFA  qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement du prêt et pour l’épargne. 
Elles ont pour ambition d’avoir chacune un congélateur pour pouvoir conserver le poisson pendant les périodes de mévente.
description_translated:
This Djiguifa group is made up of nine married women, mostly from monogamous families, with an average age of 33 and 4 children, on average. They all live in the Djaka kin neighborhood of Kirango Markala (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali) and they met because of being neighbors and friends.

This group essentially sells fish. Besides fish, certain of them sometimes sell onions and firewood out of their homes. So as to increase the volume of their money-earning activities, they decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso. After having reimbursed their first three solidarity loans correctly, they are on their 4th, which will be used to buy 60 baskets, corresponding to 900 kg of fresh fish.

They buy their fish on the banks of the Niger River at Kirango. Part of the fish is dried in a corner of the house on a traditional dryer and the other half is sold raw. The dried fish is sold retail and on a cash basis in the market fairs of Konobougou, Sansanding and Siribala to a clientele composed mainly of women. They each expect to make a monthly average profit of 51,000 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the loan and to add to savings. Their ambition is to each have a freezer so that they can keep the fish during periods where sales are slow.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: purchase of fish to sell
borrower_names: Mamou, Makoro, Fatoumata, Teningnini, Karia, Ami, Awa, Tenata, Sitan
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description: Grace operates a grocery store in her neighborhood. She started her business four years ago. She is 29 years old. She trades in products like rice, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, assorted biscuits, candies, evaporated milk, etc. With the loan, she wants to buy cartons of evaporated milk, bags of rice, canned foods and drinks and cooking oil to increase her stock of goods. With the possibility of having increased inventory of different varieties, Grace would appreciate the loan very much. She belongs to the community group called Jonathan Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.
loan_use: To purchase cartons of evaporated milk, bags of rice, canned foods and drinks and cooking oil.

description:
