Esther O. is 46 years old. She is married and has five children: two sons and three daughters. She tells us that all of her children are still in school - senior high, junior high and the primary schools. 
Esther lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Her husband is a cocoa farmer. Esther is a trader. She trades in second hand textiles: clothes for both men and women and also bed linens. She purchases bales of textiles from Accra and sells in her community by hawking. Esther says she also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for eight years and desires to expand her business. She is hopeful to improve her standard of living and to give her children the best of education.
loan_use: To buy used clothes for selling at market.

description: Хоринчону недавно исполнилось 30 лет. Он женат но еще не имеет детей. Живет он вместе с родителями. После окончания школы Хоринчон сразу стал заниматься мелким предпринимательством. Начинал он с купли продажи сухофруктов на местных рынках. Постепенно наработав собственный капитал стал покупать и сухофрукты оптом и привезя домой проводить сортировку. Это позволяло получить большую прибыль, так как разделение по сортам улучшало качество сухофруктов. Постепенно стал также заниматься куплей продажей корма для скота. Для этого он приобрел маленький грузовичок, на котором ездит за кормом в соседний Кыргызстан. На сегодня оборот его бизнеса вырос и позволяет содержать не только его семью, но и семью его родителей. С МикроИнвест Хоринчон сотрудничает уже больше года. Он и дальше планирует расширять свой бизнес, и поэтому решил подать новую заявку на займ.\n
description_translated:
Horinchon recently turned 30 years old. He is married but does not have children yet. He lives with his parents. After finishing school Horinchon right away became a small entrepreneur. He started by purchasing and selling dried fruits at the local markets. Gradually after earning his own capital he started purchasing dried fruits in wholesale quantities and sorting them at home. This allowed him to earn big profits, because sorting by grade improves the quality of dried fruits. Gradually he also started to purchase and sell animal feed. He purchased a small truck for this on which he travels to neighboring Kirgizstan for feed. By this point his turnover has grown and allows him to support not only his own family but also his parent’s family. Horinchon has been working with MicroInvest for over a year. He plans to grow his business further and this is why he decided to put in a new application for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Grow business

description:
Helen is 49 years old and runs a vending business. She mostly sells fried peanuts and chips. Helen is happily married to Eduardo T.. The couple is thankful because they are blessed with two children. There is Edwin, who is 24 years old and a college graduate. He now works as an Overseas Foreign Worker (OFW). They also have Joel, who is 20 years old. He is currently in his second year in college and is studying Hotel and Restaurant Management.

Aside from snack vending, Helen sells frozen foods and makes native cakes to help generate more profit to meet her children’s needs. In the future, she hopes to have a permanent vending stall, which would make selling easier and generate more customers.

Currently, Helen does not have enough capital to expand her business. She is therefore requesting a loan amounting to PHP8,000.00 to further achieve her business goals. With the loan she will purchase additional items to sell. She prays to God to give her strength in order to become a successful entrepreneur and to provide a better living for her family.
loan_use: To grow the business

description:
Flora es socia del Banco Comunal Chaska Lucero.
Flora es viuda, tiene 60 años y 4 hijos, Flora tiene un puesto en el mercado F. Vivanco en donde vende ropa variada, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Flora necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de casacas, polos, pantalones.
Los sueños de Flora son que sus hijos sean mejores que ella y culminen sus estudios, surtir su negocio y tener una tienda.
description_translated:
Flora is a client of the Chaska Lucero Communal Bank.

Flora is a widow, 60 years old, and has 4 children. Flora has a shop in the F. Vivanco market, where she sells clothing. She acquires the clothing in the city of Lima, and works every day.

Flora needs a loan of 2000 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of jackets, sweaters and pants.

Flora's dreams are that her children will have a better life than she had, and will finish their studies, to supply her business and to have a store.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase jackets, sweaters and pants.

description:
Nelida es socia del Banco Comunal Chaska Lucero.
Nelida es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 2 hijos, Nelida junto a su esposo viajan a las diferentes ferias de la región 5 veces a la semana en donde venden medicinas naturales, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Nelida necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de jarabes y cápsulas.
Los sueños de Nelida son abrir una tienda y construir su casa.
description_translated:
Nelida is a client of the Chaska Lucero Communal Bank. She is 29 years old, and lives with her 2 children and their father. Nelida and her husband travel to different regional markets 5 times a week, where they sell natural medicines. She acquires her merchandise in the city of Lima.

Nelida needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of syrups and capsules.

Nelida's dreams are to open a store and to build a home.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase of syrups and capsules.

description: Ndioro D. est âgée de 40 ans, marié et mère de 5 enfants. Elles vend de la crème et de la glace en cette période de forte chaleur et aimerait la rentabiliser. Elle souhaite améliorer les conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité de sa famille.
description_translated:
Ndioro D., age 40, is married and the mother of five. She sells cream and ice during this period of high heat and would like to make her business profitable. She hopes to improve the family’s situation in terms of health and education.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To sell cream and ice

description: Marleni es una mujer que a sus 23 años es madre de tres hijos, junto a su pareja, quien es un joven de 26 años, tratan juntos, de sacar a su familia adelante. Están viviendo en un cuarto alquilado, ya que por el momento no tienen una casa propia donde vivir. Desde que salió de su tierra natal en busca de mejoras económicas tuvo que dedicarse a múltiples oficios para solventar los gastos de sus hijas. Pero hace 2 meses ha iniciado un negocio de venta de comida, el cual realiza todas las noches en la puerta de su casa, ofreciendo sus platillos a las personas que transitan por la zona, desde las seis de la tarde hasta la media noche para luego descansar e iniciar por la mañana su trabajo limpiando casas. Estas actividades le ayudan a apoyar a su pareja, quien se dedica a la construcción, y juntos pretenden  progresar y aúnan sus esfuerzos con tal de otorgarles a sus hijas las condiciones necesarias  para su desarrollo. Para el futuro, Marleni desea tener un negocio de abarrotes dentro del terreno que muy pronto comprarán para construir su casa. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y fue acogida en su grupo debido a la responsabilidad que muestra. Los 800 soles que solicita los invertirá en la compra de algunos utensilios de cocina para mejorar la atención a sus clientes.
description_translated:
Marleni is a 23 year-old mother of three, who, together with her partner who is 26 years old, tries to make her family get ahead. They live in a rented room, as presently they don't have a house of their own. From the time she left her birthplace in search of economic improvements she has been doing multiple things to be able to cover the expenses of her daughters. 2 months ago she started a business selling food from the frontdoor of her house to pedistrians from 6 p.m. till midnight, then she sleeps and starts cleaning houses in the morning. With these jobs she helps support her partner who is a construction worker and together they hope to get ahead and with the united efforts offer their daughters the necessary conditions for their development. For the future, Marleni wishes to have a generalstore on the land they soon will buy to build their house. This is her first loan with MFP and she has been accepted by the group as she is very responsible. The 800 soles will be invested in buying some kitchenware to improve service for her customers.\r\n

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase kitchenware.

description: Para Rosa, es indispensable es el bienestar de sus seres queridos, por ello, en su casa tratan de estar unidos siempre y apoyarse entre ellos, ejemplo que les quiere dejar a sus dos hijos para cuando conformen su propio hogar. Desde muy jovencita le gustó estar bien arreglada y maquillada, y debido a que invertir en la compra de cosméticos es costoso, tomó la decisión de formar parte de las promotoras de belleza de su localidad.  Y desde hace 7 años ha ganado experiencia en realizar esta actividad, ya que para Rosa, el secreto es visitar a varias personas y salir diariamente a ofrecerles productos novedosos a través de catálogos y distribuirlos en las fechas indicadas para tener contenta a su clientela. Ahora tiene la ambición de ser empresaria, pues en las líneas de belleza motivan a las mujeres a no ser sólo promotoras, sino a buscar un equipo a las cuales puedas liderar y capacitar en las ventas, pero sin descuidar sus propios pedidos, por lo que le gustaría tener una tienda para la venta de estos productos. Rosa viene trabajando con MFP, desde hace 6 años, este es su catorceavo crédito, y durante esta temporada ha visto progresar a su grupo, pues tratan de organizarse adecuadamente para evitar circunstancias difíciles. Los 1500 soles que solicita los usará en la compra de productos para las fechas festivas que se aproximan, como el día de las madres.
description_translated:
For Rosa, the well-being of her loved ones is the most important thing, and so in her home they try to always remain supportive of one another. This is an example she wants to leave her children for when they form their own homes. Ever since she was a young girl, she has liked to care for her appearance and use makeup, and due to the high cost of buying cosmetics, she decided to become a cosmetics salesperson in her area. For the past 7 years she has gained experience in this activity. Rosa's secret is to visit many people and go out every day to offer them the newest products by means of catalogs, and then deliver the products by the deadline in order to keep her clients happy. Now she has the ambition to be a business woman, since the beauty products business encourages the women to not only be product promoters, but to look for a team they can lead and equip in sales, but without neglecting their own customers' orders. For this reason she would like to have a store to sell these products. Rosa has been working with MFP for 6 years, this is her fourteenth loan, and during this period she has seen her group progress, since they try to organize themselves in order to avoid difficult circumstances. She will use the 1,500 soles she is requesting to buy products for the approaching holidays, like Mothers' Day.\r\n

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To increase merchandise

description:
La señora Sandra M. muy esforzadamente se dedica a atender su negocio de reparación de joyas de todo tipo teniendo su establecimiento en su propia casa de habitación.

Ella es una dama muy trabajadora que con sus herramientas ha logrado salir adelante en la reparación de todo tipo de joyas tales como aretes, pulseras, anillos, entre otros. Por esta razón espera en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito de manera que pueda comprar sus materiales de trabajo para continuar.
description_translated:
Ms. Sandra M. works painstakingly in her jewelry repair business, which is located in her own home.

She is a very hardworking woman who has been able to get ahead in her business with her work tools, repairing all types of jewelry, such as bracelets, earrings, and rings, among other pieces. For this reason, she is hoping to be granted a loan from Ceprodel so that she can purchase work supplies to continue with her duties.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase work supplies

description:
Sanilyn E. is a farmer. Her main crop is rice. She is 36 years old and has 7 children. She has been tilling the land that she inherited from her parents. Her husband is the one managing their small rice field. She hopes that someday she will be able to buy another farm to give more support to her children.

She is asking a loan of Php 14,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase herbicides and fertilizers. The loan will truly help her improve her harvest and income as well.

CEVI gives their clients not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.
loan_use: To purchase herbicides and fertilizers

description:
This is Mariatu K., Ramatu C., Ramatu K., Wullamatu K., Adamsay K. and Hassan T.. They have named their group Believe in God. This is a group of local entrepreneurs in Makeni City. This is the fourth time they’ve received a Kiva loan through SMT. Previously, each one of them in the group received a loan of (~US$250) SLL 800,000. Meaningful changes were created in lives of these people with those previous loans. They were able to use the proceeds to pay for their children’s school fees, in cases where times were difficult for their husbands. They also were able to add to the daily allowances that their husbands gave them for food. Today, they are requesting a loan of (US$ 315) SLL 1,000,000, each, to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Mariatu K. (second from left) is the leader of the group. She is 30 years of age. She was born in Sanda Kamaranka, one of a series of small villages about thirty miles from Makeni. She has four children: one in secondary school, two in primary schools and the last is still quite young. Her husband is a schoolteacher. Mariatu sells ready-to-wear-clothes and has been in the business for three years now.
loan_use: Invest in her business of ready-to-wear clothing.
borrower_names: Ramatu, Wullamatu, Adamsay, Hassan, Mariatu, Ramatu
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Ruth is the leader of a four-member group. She is a 33-year-old mother of five children between the ages of 8 and 16. All her children go to school. She owns a four-room house where she is staying with seven people. Ruth takes care of additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala.

Ruth sells charcoal in Lugala. She sells to an average of 25 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. Ruth buys charcoal from delivery trucks from Kasubi and pays for transport costs to and from Kasubi. Her major monthly expenses include rent for the business premises, electricity and medication. She has been in this business for the last five years. Her main challenges are thieves and seasonality. Ruth has been with MCDT for over five years and is on her tenth loan, working all this time with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal.
loan_use: To buy more charcoal and firewood

description: Roseline is 39 years old and married to O. and they have three children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria.  Roseline sells food items and soft drinks. She hopes for a loan amount of N140,000 to purchase additional items to sell. She says thank you.
loan_use: To purchase more soft drinks and foodstuffs to sell

description:
Mrs. Jovie E. is 25 years old and married with two children. She is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. Her husband is a salesboy in an establishment.

\r\n\r\n

Mrs. E. has been a member of Paglaum MPC since April of 2009. She is seeking a loan for her sari-sari store to purchase additional stock, such as laundry items, seasonings, goodies, toiletries, drinks, and other household items. She aims to have a successful business with a concrete store and for her children to finish college degrees and have good futures.
loan_use: To purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store.

description: La señora Maria Elsa C. García , tiene la edad de 37 años , habita en el barrio la Francia numero dos , junto a su esposo , el cual trabaja como albañil y le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene a su cargo dos hijos , uno de 13 y otro de 14 , los cuales trabajan y estudian , los planes hacia su familia es poder darle un mejor bienestar a su hijos , ella desde hace cuatro años se dedica a esta actividad agrícola , inicio con sus propios esfuerzos , sus sueños es poder establecer una manzana de piña . El financiamiento lo quiere para la comprar  insumos y fertilizantes para aplicar al cultivo y tener mejores resultado en la producción como en las ventas.
description_translated:
Mrs. Maria Elsa C. García is 37 years old. She lives in the "Barrio la Francia" number two together with her husband, who works as a building worker. They have two children, 13 and 14 of age, who work and study. Her family plans are to be able to offer a better lifequality to her children. She has been working with farming for the past four years, she started with her own effort and it is her dream to plant a property with pineapples.The loan will be spent on buying supplies and fertilizers and thus obtain better results in the production as well as in the sales.\r\n\r\n

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase supplies and fertilizers to improve crops.

description: El Sr. Andres A. vive en casa de sus padres, tiene una esposa que trabaja con tejidos y le ayuda en la manutención del hogar, ellos tienen tres hijos en edad escolar,el Sr. Andres se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 10 años, el trabaja en el Radiotaxi Sureño, en la populosa zona sur de la ciudad de La Paz. Es cliente de Emprender desde el año 2007, como cliente de credito individual, al momento se encuentra en su quinta secuencia, demostrando cumplimiento y responsabilidad en sus pagos. Con el credito realizara algunas reparaciones como ser: arreglo de motor y chaperia, pintura y desabollado.
description_translated:
Mr. Andres A. lives in his parents' home, has a wife that works in knitting and helps in the maintenance of the home. They have three school age children. He works at the Radiotaxi Sureño, in the busy area of the city of La Paz. Mr. Andres has been doing this for 10 years. He has been a client of Emprender since 2007 as a personal loan customer. He is currently in his fifth loan cycle, demonstrating compliance and responsibility in his repayments. He will use the loan to carry out some repairs to the vehicle motor and body, such as painting and dent removal.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Vehicle repair, mechanical and body work.\t\t\t

description: La señora Dominga es una cliente antigua tiene cinco niños en edad escolar, ella es migrante de la region sur del pais(Tarija) por lo tanto no tiene casa propia vive en casa alquilada, conjuntamente su esposo tienen un taller de carpinteria, así mismo la señora para ayudar en la manutencion de su familia se dedica a la elaboracion de pan y empanadas, para lo cual ella cuenta con un hornito domestico, en el que diarimente elabora panes y los distribuye diariamente en la zona sur de la ciudad de La Paz
description_translated:
Ms. Dominga is an old client who has 5 school-age children. She is a migrant from the southern region, Tarija, which is why she doesn't have her own home and has to rent. She and her husband have carpentry workshop. She also makes bread and empanadas to help maintain her family. She has a small oven that she makes breads on each day and distributes them on the south side of La Paz.\r\n\t\t\t\t\r\n

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Cliente invertira en la compra de materia harina y otros insumos para la elaboracion de panes \t\t\t\t

description:
En el Mercado Central de Chinandega, la señora Darlin Celeste S. se dedica a su actividad de venta de carne en su propio establecimiento situado en el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega.

Hoy en día ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de la carne y para ello espera muy confiadamente en que su crédito será otorgado y así saldrá adelante en su negocio de venta de carne en su localidad.
description_translated:
At the Chinandega Central Market, Darlin Celeste S. sells meat in her own establishment, situated in the Central market of the city Chinandega. Now she has turned to Ceprodel for a loan with which to buy meat. She hopes and trusts that this loan will be granted, and help her keep her business selling meat in her local area afloat.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchasing meat

description:
La señora Candida D. se dedica a la venta de especies en su propio tramo en el Mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega donde a diario vende sus productos a sus clientes que le visitan.

Ella es madre soltera y con dos hijos que mantener y para ello es que ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de las especies para preparar los alimentos y de esta manera mejorar en el negocio.
description_translated:
Ms. Candida Davila sells spices in her own stand at the central market in the city of Chinandega where she works, daily, selling products to clients who visit her. She is a single mother with two children to support. For this reason she has turned to CEPRODEL to obtain a loan for the purchase of spices to prepare food and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase of Spices

description:
En la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Ana Basilia R. se dedica a su actividad de venta de artesanías de madera ofrecidas en su localidad el cual la posee muy surtida gracias a sus múltiples esfuerzos en su negocio.

Actualmente, el negocio requiere de una inversión por medio de la compra de los productos artesanos y para ello ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de dichos productos y así salir adelante en su negocio que tanto requiere de su apoyo por medio de dichas compras.
description_translated:
In Chinandega city, Ana Basilia R. sells hand-crafted wooden items from her store which she keeps well-stocked thanks to her many business efforts. Currently, the business requires an investment in additional wooden artisan works, and to do this she has sought the support of Ceprodel, requesting a loan to purchase these products so she can advance her business. Her store really needs Ceprodel's support, which can be provided with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase of artisan works

description:
Mrs. Aurelia P. is presently living in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a farmer and they own a little parcel of land. He is the one who cultivates vegetables.

Last November 2008 Aurelia became a member of Paglaum MPC and was able to acquire additional capital for a "sari-sari" (variety) store. She is now applying for a loan amounting to Php 7,000 for additional stock. Her customers are neighbors, friends and relatives. She is coping well with the challenges of her business because it requires hard work and patience. Her aspiration is to have a big store and a baby someday.
loan_use: Additional capital for sari-sari store

description:
“When I started farming, I didn’t know how to plant rice. My husband taught me how to. Now, I am his assistant when we are to prepare the land for another planting season. I would say it’s really hard. But when you think of your children, it doesn’t seem like hard work," says Elizabeth T., a 28-year-old mother of two children.

She is asking a loan of PHP 7,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and insecticides. The loan will help her achieve better yield in her farm. In that way, she believes, she could easily provide her children education.

CEVI gives not only loans to its clients but also offers trainings and insurance coverage services to help small business grow.
loan_use: To purchase fertilizers, seeds and insecticides

description: Olaide is 45 years old and married with four children. He sells bags of cassava flour, and is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more bags of cassava flour to sell. He sends his thanks to Kiva lenders.
loan_use: To purchase bags of cassava flour to sell

description:
N. V. Lucienne est née à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Lucienne est mariée à DAGA Richard. Lucienne est mère de trois (3) enfants. Lucienne n'a jamais été à l'école, ni appris un métier. Lucienne a été élevée par ses parents et aidait sa mère dans la vente de maïs et de l'huile végétale. Après son mariage, Lucienne s'était lancée dans la vente de bouillie de maïs. Actuellement, Lucienne vend la même chose que sa mère, mais pour son propre compte. Lucienne a déjà eu deux prêts de la part de ALIDé pour développer son activité. Lucienne sollicite un troisième crédit présentement pour s'approvisionner en une importante quantité de maïs et d'huile de noix de palme afin de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.  

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
description_translated:
Lucienne N. V. was born in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Lucienne is married to Richard Daga. Lucienne is the mother of three children. Lucienne never went to school, nor did she learn a professional trade. Lucienne was raised by her parents and helped her mother sell maize and vegetable oil. After getting married, Lucienne began selling maize bouillie (a thick cornmeal porridge). Currently, Lucienne sells the same things as her mother, but for herself. Lucienne has already obtained two loans through Alidé to develop her business. Lucienne is currently seeking a third loan to supply herself with a sizable quantity of corn and oil from palm nuts in order to better respond to the needs of her clientele. The meaning of Alidé in Fon, the local language of Benin is "there is always a way for the poorest." Benin is a small country in West Africa, next to Nigeria, and its per capita income is $1,500.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy 4 sacks of maize and 2 50-litre cans of palm nut oil

description:
A. Julienne est née à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Julienne est mariée à DJOTCHOU Nounangnon un pêcheur de profession. Julienne est mère de six enfants mais seulement deux (2) sont encore à sa charge. Julienne n’est jamais allée à l’école. Julienne a été élevée par sa grand-mère paternelle pour qui elle vendait de la pâte de maïs et de poissons frits. La pâte de maïs localement appelée akassa, accompagnée de piment et de poissons frits est un repas consommé par beaucoup de béninois. Après son mariage, Julienne s'est mise à son propre compte dans la même activité que sa grand-mère. Julienne a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits à ALIDé pour le compte de son activité. Julienne demande un troisième prêt à ALIDé pour acheter et stocker de maïs pendant que c’est moins cher. Ainsi, Julienne pourra faire plus de bénéfices sur ses ventes. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
description_translated:
Julienne A. was born in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Julienne is married to Nounangnon Djotchou, a fisherman by profession. Julienne is the mother of six children, but only two of them are still in her care. Julienne never went to school. Julienne was raised by her paternal grandmother, for whom she sold maize paste and fried fish. Maize paste, locally known as "akassa", accompanied by spices and fried fish, is a meal consumed by many Beninese. After getting married, Julienne began working on her own in the same business as her grandmother. Julienne has already benefited from two loans through Alidé on behalf of her business. Julienne is seeking a third loan from Alidé to buy and stock maize while it is cheaper. This way, Julienne will be able to make a higher profit on her sales. The meaning of Alidé in Fon, the local language of Benin is "there is always a way for the poorest." Benin is a small country in West Africa, next to Nigeria, where the GDP per capita is $1,500.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy 5 bags of maize and one box of fresh fish

description:
La señora Rina es socia del Banco Comunal “Punta Sahuacasi” en la  provincia de Azangaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos a su cargo.  Vive en la comunidad de Punta Saguacasi, Sector Acochupa.  Ella posee estudios  de  primaria completa. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año, la actividad a la que se dedica es la venta de galletas y golosinas.  Su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con el cual compró máss productos y obtener mas ganancias.

Con este préstamo de S/ 400.00 nuevos soles, comprará mas golosinas, galletas y gaseosa, para ser vendidos en las ferias existentes en la zona.

Le gustaría  tener una tienda bien surtida para distribución al por mayor. Su sueño es poder tener una tienda muy grande.

Asimismo ella refiere que le gusta mucha la puntualidad y el cumplimiento en el pago de las cuotas, así como las charlas que les dan y los encuentros deportivos.
description_translated:
Rina is a member of the Punta Sahuascasi community bank in the Azangaro province, Puno department. She is 34, married, and has three children. She lives in the Punta Saguacasi community, Sector Acochupa. She has an elementary school education. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year. She sells cookies and sweets. She used her first loan of 300 PEN to buy more products and get more earnings. With this loan for 400 PEN she will buy more sweets, cookies, and soft drinks to sell in the fairs in her zone. She would like to have a well stocked store for wholesale distribution. Her dream is to be able to have a very large store. She likes the punctuality and the accomplishment of paying back the loans. She also likes the talks they give and the sporting events.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Buy cookies, sweets, and soft drinks

description:
Perlita V. is from the village of Salvador. She is 39 years old and married. She owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 11 years.

Perlita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seed, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 


About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
loan_use: To purchase additional seed, seedlings and young crops

description:
Virginia S. is from the village of S.. She is 47 years old and married with three school-aged children. Virginia owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale.

Virginia joined ASKI (Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc.) to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seed, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the borrower's business. 


About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
loan_use: To purchase additional seed, seedlings and young crops to raise

description:
Akosua A. is forty-six years old. She is married and has given birth to six children: four sons and two daughters. She says all are currently in the junior high and primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase which is a farming/trading community near Dorma, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a maize farmer.

Akosua is a food vendor. She prepares and sells banku, a local dish made from corn dough. It is served hot with soup. She sells the food on the street in the mornings. Akosua procures bags of maize and other ingredients from nearby towns.

Akosua has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.
loan_use: To procure bags of maize to make banku

description: Kwabena is 44 years old. He is married with four kids. Kwabena has been a taxi driver for the past 12 years. Taxi driving has been his major occupation and the main source of livelihood for his family. He drives passengers from the local lorry station to the nearby towns at a transport fare of 55 pesewas per head. However, his car has been giving him some problems and he needs money to maintain it. He therefore requests a loan to enable him to maintain his taxi to earn an income to support his family and get his kids back to school. He belongs to the community group called “Nyame be kyere” Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.
loan_use: To undertake maintenance on his car

description:
Sergei owns a butcher business. He uses his car to go out to villages and purchase meat from farmers in bulk. Then he sells the meat at the local market. He has been in this business for eight years.

Since Sergei always sells fresh meat, he has many regular clients. Sergei would like to borrow 6,000 UAH so as to buy more meat items for sale.

His goal in business is to build his own kiosk and develop his business further.
loan_use: To purchase meat items for sale

description: Ni Ketut Wetri (DNR.M-0672) is a 29-year-old female living in the town of Kaliakah. She is married and has two infant children. She owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 200,000 IDR a month. In 2008, Ni Ketut Wetri joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. The loan will be her 2nd loan from DINARI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About DINARI: The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Ni Ketut Wetri - (DNR.M-0672) merupakan 29 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Kaliakah. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 2 anak usia balita. Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Ketut Wetri memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Ketut Wetri sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 2 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Ketut Wetri menghasilkan sekitar 200,000 IDR sebulan. Dalam 2008, Ni Ketut Wetri bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Ketut Wetri telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya dari DINARI. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 5,000,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Ni Ketut Wetri berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk mendukung keuangan anggota keluarga langsung peminjam. Tentang DINARI: Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil. *Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.
loan_use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

description:
Primer préstamo:
http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=86599&_tpos=16&_tpg=2
Rosa  es socia del Bancomunal Las Orquídeas. se quedo sin trabajo, y  por necesidad tuvo que dedicarse a cocinar, empezó  llevando  menús a diferentes empresas, hasta que le empezaron a pedir que hiciera buffet para eventos especiales, actualmente solo se dedica a hacer buffet.
Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de víveres para su buffet, según le pida. 
Desde que Rosa esta en Finca aprendió a esforzarse en el trabajo, a ser puntual con sus pagos y ser responsable  en el negocio.
El sueño de Rosa es poner un restaurante y tener una flota de taxi.
description_translated:
Rosa is a member of “Las Orquideas” community bank. She was unemployed and, out of necessity, begin to work as a cook. She started by taking menus to different businesses until they began to ask her to provide buffets for special events. Now she works solely with buffets.

Rosa needs a loan of 1000 soles (Peruvian currency) to purchase the buffet supplies that her clients request.

Since Rosa has been with Finca she has learned to work hard, be on time with her payments and be responsible in her business practices.

Rosa’s dream is to open a restaurant and own a fleet of taxis.

Rosa's first loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=86599&_tpos=16&_tpg=2

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase of buffet supplies that clients request.

description:
Albertha is 32 years old. She is divorced and has two daughters attending primary school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a farming and trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. 

Albertha is a trader. She trades in textiles such as ladies’ underwear and printed fabrics. She also deals in footwear. Albertha hawks her wares in her neighborhood and also journeys to other towns to sell. She procures her materials from Dormaa. She has been in business for eight years and would like a loan in order to procure textile materials in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and to give her children the best education she can afford.
loan_use: To procure textiles in bulk for sale.

description:
Antonia is requesting a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP15,000 ($325) as her working capital for the maintenance of her hog raising business.  She is 54 years old and single. She is happy with her life and raising her hogs.  

She considers her business a family, a home, a habit and a good livelihood that she hopes to grow in the future for it really helps her in providing for the needs of her parents and assisting her younger sister and brothers with their own families.
loan_use: working capital

description: Холматова Гульсара- женщина 43 лет , мать троих детей. Проживает и работает в Худжанде. Её муж работает в мастером по ремонту автомашин. Сама Гульсара занимается откормом и продажей скота. Ей на счёт продажи помогает её муж. Узнав от соседей, Гульсара решила получить кредит и увеличить свой бизнес. Хочет купить ещё пару голов коров, которые дают молоко. Для чего Гульсара и обратилась в Микроинвест. На снимке Гульсара  кормит баранов.
description_translated:
Gulsara K., 43, mother of 3, lives and works in Khujand. Her husband is an auto mechanic. Gulsara is a cattle farmer. Having learned from her neighbors about MicroInvest, Gulsara decided to apply for a loan to expand her business. She plans to use the money to purchase a pair of milk cows.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To purchase milk cows

description: Бобочонова Масуда кредитор Фонда, которая занимается продажей канцелярских товаров. Её точка реализации  находится на рынке Худжанда. Свои кредиты она использует на расширение своего бизнеса. Она закупает школьные товары, тетради, ручки, пеналы и т.д . Следующий займ она хочет потратить на завоз общих тетрадей и школьных альбомов.
description_translated:
Masuda B. is a client who works selling school supplies. Her sales booth is at the Khudjand market. She uses loans to expand the business. She buys school supplies, notebooks, pens, pencil cases, etc. The next loan will be used to supply writing and sketch books. \r\n\r\n

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: School supply sales

description:
Le groupe Kanoumafin est composé de femmes 2 veuves et 4 femmes mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 52 ans et 4 enfants et habitent toutes le quartier Bamanan kin de Markala (4ème Région administrative du Mali).
Ce groupe de femmes est aussi encadré par l’ONG ROCAM dans le domaine de la teinture, alphabétisation, assainissement et la réorganisation des tontines en caisses de micro crédit  avec un intérêt de 10% par mois. 
Ce groupe fait  le commerce de produits cosmétiques, de pagnes, de céréales, de chaussures, de condiments alimentaires, du savon etc.
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont intégré le programme crédit solidaire de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur 4ème  prêt solidaire, après avoir bien remboursé les prêts précédents. 
Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 57pièces de pagnes wax, 2 sacs de maïs, 2 sacs de riz, 1sac de haricot, 1 sac d’oignon de 25 kg, 1 sac de savon local contenant 300 morceaux et 20 paires de chaussures. Elles se ravitaillent en pagnes wax et chaussures au grand marché de Bamako, en céréales à Koutiala, en oignon et savons à la foire de Diamarabougou. Les produits sont revendus à crédit ou au comptant dans les foires de Diamarabougou, Sibila, Boussin, Dougabougou et Siribala à une clientèle mixte. 
Elles comptent  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 43 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour augmenter leur fonds de commerce et acheter petit à petit des trousseaux de mariage pour leurs filles.
description_translated:
The group Kanoumafin is composed of women (2 widows and 4 who are married) mostly in monogamous families. The women average 52 years of age and 4 children each. They all live in the Bamanan Kin district of Markala (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). This group of women is also trained by the NGO ROCAM in the dyeing of cloth, literacy, sanitation, and organizing micro-credit tontines banks with an interest rate of 10% a month. This group does commerce in cosmetics, pagnes (colorful West African cloth), grains, shoes, condiments, soap, etc. To satisfy customer needs, the group members joined the Soro Yiriwaso loan program and are on their fourth solidarity loan, after having indeed repaid their preceding loans. This current loan will be used to buy 57 bolts of Wax pagnes, two sacks of corn, two sacks of rice, a sack of beans, a 25-kg sack of onions, a 300-count sack of local soap, and 20 pairs of shoes. The women resupply themselves with Wax pagnes and shoes at the grand marketplace of Bamako; with grains in Koutiala; and with onions and soaps at the Diamarabougou fair. The goods are resold to a mixed customer base, cash or credit accepted, at the fairs of Diamarabougou, Sibila, Boussin, Dougabougou, and Siribala. The group members intend to realize an average monthly profit of 43,000 francs CFA that will use to augment their working capital and to buy trousseaux, little by little, for their daughters.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy various goods
borrower_names: Marama, Sitan, Fanta, Massan, Awa, Baro
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true

description: Elizabeth I. is 45 years old and married with seven children. She sells dried fish. She hopes for a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more dried fish to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders!
loan_use: To purchase more dried fish

description: Marilly tiene 23 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en la casa de su suegra. Junto a su esposo se dedican al servicio de transporte con una camioneta (combi) que es su principal instrumento de trabajo, trabajan durante todo el día y en esta actividad su esposo es el que conduce la movilidad, mientras Marilly está pendiente del control del tiempo en cada recorrido, y también se da tiempo para atender a sus 2 pequeñas hijas. La ruta que cubren con el servicio de transporte recorre 2 distritos, en una distancia aproximada de 20 kilómetros. Marilly y su esposo tienen grandes deseos de crecer, y uno de sus grandes anhelos a futuro, es adquirir otra camioneta. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y se ha comprometido a ser una integrante activa en su banco comunal. El dinero que está solicitando será invertido en la compra de repuestos para el mantenimiento de su movilidad, para que de esa manera tenga menos inconvenientes y no interrumpa su trabajo por un desperfecto imprevisto.
description_translated:
Marilly is 23 years old, and lives with her husband and 2 children in her mother-in-law’s home. Accompanied by her husband, Marilly works in transportation services using a van (combi) that serves as their principal work instrument. They work all day with her husband driving the van while Marilly keeps track of the time during each trip; Marilly also makes sure to set aside time to attend to her 2 small daughters. The route that they cover with their transportation service serves two districts, a distance of approximately 20 kilometers. Marilly and her husband have great hopes of expanding their business, and one of their future wishes is to acquire another van. This is their first loan with MFP, and she has committed herself to being an active member of her communal bank. The money that she has solicited will be invested in the purchase of spare parts for the maintenance of their vehicle so that they face fewer problems that can interrupt their work when unexpected issues arise.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To purchase spare parts for her van.

description:
Justine N., 50, is the chairperson of Kasenge group in Mukono. She is a business lady with a stall in Kasenge where she sells fresh fruits and vegetables she gets from the Mukono and Nakawa markets every day. She does this because she wants to sell all her produce fresh and this has enabled her to keep her customers to herself.

She also has a business of selling clothes from the same area for ladies, children and men, and this helps bring in an extra income. She is married with six children. Four of the children are in school (candidate classes). She also cares for an orphan. Justine needs a loan to help buy more clothes for sale. She has a dream of owning a boutique in the future.
loan_use: Buying more clothes for sale
borrower_names: Eva, Yudaya, Lydia, Jane, Rehema, Maria, Justine, Fatuma, Rebecca, Moses, Florence, Joseph, Rose, Margaret, Ronald, Nono, Sarah, Milly, Madina, Rosette, Kigongo
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, male, female, male, female, female, male, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description: Melba Mercedes R. tiene la edad de 45 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Melba tiene 2 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Doña Melba es la elaboración y venta de comida. Hace más de 14 años que se dedica a este negocio. Doña Melba inicio este negocio por su Mama, y con el tiempo fue que el negocio le gusto este tipo de negocio. Los propósitos de Doña Melba son de mejorar cada día la calidad de sus comidas para obtener una variedad de clientes. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, huevo y cuajada todo esto es para materia prima por lo que tiene que elaborar la comida. El deseo de Doña Melba es tener su negocio de una manera mas estable y la mismo tiempo ayudar a generar fuentes de trabajo ya que necesitaría de un personal que le ayude a elaborar  la  comida.
description_translated:
Melba Mercedes R. is 45 years old and she is married. Melba has two children and they are both studying. Melba's economic activity is the making and selling of food. For more than 14 years, she has been involved in this business: she started this business for her Mother, as it was the type of business that she liked. The aims of Melba are to improve the quality of her meals every day in order to attract a variety of customers. The financing is to add to her work capital for buying rice, beans, sugar, oil, egg and curd as raw ingredients from which she makes her dishes. Melba's wish is to make sure her business is more stable and at the same time to help generate a source of employment as she needs an assistant to help with making the food.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Work capital

description:
La señora Mauricia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Rio Desaguadero” del distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; de estado civil casada, tiene 31 años de edad y 2 hijos, posee estudios de secundaria completa.  Vive en la Av. Ilo. Nº 284.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 8 años e inicio su negocio de abarrotes con un préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que le sirvió de capital.
Actualmente ella pretende ampliar su negocio y adquirir más mercadería (cereales, enlatados, bebidas, entre otros)  para lo cual requiere un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, con ello podrá mejorar sus ingresos y ampliar su negocio (mini market).
description_translated:
Mauricia belongs to the Rio Desaguadero Community Bank in the Desaguadero district, Chucuito province, Puno department. She is married, is 31 years old and has two children. She has completed high school. She lives at 284 Av. llo. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for eight years and began her grocery business with a loan of 300 soles, which served as capital. Currently, she wants to expand her business and acquire more merchandise (cereals, canned goods, drinks, among other items) for which she requires a loan of 2000 soles. WIth this, she will be able to improve her income and expand her mini-market business.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: For the purchase of cereals, canned goods, drinks, sodas, among other items.

description:
La señora Salome pertenece al Banco Comunal “Río Desaguadero”, del distrito de Desaguadero, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno.  Tiene 37 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 2 hijos.  Tiene estudios de secundaria completa.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desde  hace 09 años, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de sogas de nylon, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual invirtió en su negocio.  
Con este préstamo de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles podrá adquirir mayor materia prima (nylon) y elaborar sogas en mayor volumen, los mismos que los comercializará en los diferentes mercados de la región; obteniendo ganancias que los destinará en la educación de sus hijos.
description_translated:
Señora Salome is a member of the Banco Comunal “Río Desaguadero", of the district of Desaguadero in the province of Chucuito in the department of Puno. She is 37 years old, married, and has two children. She completed her high school studies. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement since she was 9 years old. She works producing and selling nylon rope. Her first loan was for S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, which she invested in her business. With this new loan for S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles she will be able to purchase more raw materials (nylon) to produce rope in greater volume, similar to the type that is sold in the markets of the region. She will use her earnings to help pay for her children's education.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To purchase strands of nylon

description:
Rosalina is married to Domingo C., a seller of agricultural fertilizer in their village. They are blessed with 3 children; Lorelie is 29 years old and an Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW), Randy is 27 years old & a farmer, and finally Rogie is 23 years old and a Nursing graduate. Rosalina and Comingo both still live in their family home in Barangay La Paz, Cabatuan, Isabela. 

Rosalina owns and operates her own tailoring business and she specializes in curtains. For as long as she has been in business she has not had the success she would have hoped. Rosalina wants to change this and is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to help expand her business. She believes that patience should always be accompanied by hard work in order to become successful in every business endeavor.
loan_use: Business Expansion

description: An M., 27, raises pigs in a stall next to her house. She also grows vegetables, such as cabbage, morning glory and cucumbers, and sells them to a market-seller three months after they mature. She is married to Sothea, who is 35 and works as a motorbike taxi driver. The couple is responsible for three young children. An M. recently sold all her pigs to a slaughterer. She hopes to acquire another pig to raise. Therefore, she would like to ask for a $300 loan to buy more piglets to raise and more fertilizers to grow crops.
loan_use: To buy more piglets to raise

description:
Yaa O. is forty-three years old. She is married and has given birth to two kids who are pursuing education in primary school. Yaa is hard working and resourceful to her family. She is a food vendor and sells donuts and meat pies. She also is engaged in the sale of cassava, yam and palm fruits. She believes selling multiple products will enable her to meet her household expenditure demands. She has been in business for 10 years.\r\n

\r\nYaa wants to use the loan to procure flour, sugar, oil for her pastry and also to buy more cassava and yams to sell. She is a member of a Trust Bank group Mo din mmo ("hard work") where the members guarantee for one another as collateral so as to access and support one another in handling repayment.
loan_use: To buy flour, sugar, oil, cassava and yams in bulk.

description:
Hak P. is 53 years old, married, and is the mother of six children: two are single and the other four are married and live separately. Most of her children are employed at different occupations. Her husband, Yeam, age 62, earns his daily income by providing a lottery service for a commission.

Hak P. currently sells fish and chickens in the local busy market. She has been running her business since early 2000 and is able to make her revenue of $7 each day.  She will use the loan to buy fresh fish to make into dried fish to sell.
loan_use: To buy fresh fish to make into dried fish to sell

description:
Z. Paul is the leader of Kwesitukira group in Lugazi. He is a friendly and hard-working man with a farming business, selling produce mostly from his farm. During the 10 years that he has run this business, he has been faced with a few challenges, like the high transport costs to deliver his produce to his customers, and the high cost of purchasing the produce when he does not have enough to supply to his customers. \r\n

\r\nThis is his 14th loan from his group and he is able to make a profit of 200,000 UGX in a month. Paul has a dream of buying his own truck to transport his goods, as well as having an educated family. He is a 41-year-old married man with 10 children; the eldest is 21 years old and in school. He also cares for 10 dependents, some of whom are orphans. He requests a loan to purchase produce like cassava and sweet potatoes for his business.
loan_use: Buy more produce (cassava and sweet potatoes) to sell
borrower_names: Isa, Abdu, Paul, Barbara, Esereda, Ruth, Milly, Sarah, Joyce, Juma
borrower_genders: male, male, male, female, female, female, female, female, female, male
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description: Cinthya es una joven de 23 años que trabaja con la finalidad de ayudar a sus padres, quienes son su mayor tesoro, para ella, vivir con ellos es una bendición. Entablar rápidamente amistad con personas le ayudó a dedicar sus tiempos libres en realizar actividades productivas como brindar servicios de llamadas telefónicas en su localidad, negocio  que viene desarrollando hace 2 años a lado de unas amigas. Lo difícil de esta actividad es el riesgo de sufrir asaltos, pues dispone de varios celulares por la cantidad de personas que solicitan sus servicios y para evitar peligros trata de ser muy prudente. Con las ganancias que obtiene puede pagar sus estudios, y durante sus horas de clase, su padre cubre su puesto de trabajo para no perder clientes. Su deseo a futuro, es asociarse con su padre para instalar un centro de llamadas y venta de teléfonos en el centro de su ciudad. Con los 1000 soles que solicita comprará algunos celulares para mejorar e incrementar la prestación de sus servicios.
description_translated:
Cinthya is a young woman who is 23 years old and works to help out her parents, who are her greatest treasure. For her, living with them is a blessing. Her ability to make friends quickly has helped her to use her free time to do productive activities like set up a phone call service in her town, a business that she has been developing for 2 years with some friends. The difficult part of this work is the risk of muggings, as she has a number of cell phones due to the volume of customers who request her services. She tries to avoid danger by being very careful. With the profits she earns she is able to pay for her studies, and while she is in class, her father takes over the business so as to not lose customers. Her hope for the future is to partner with her father to install a call center and sell telephones in the center of the city. With the 1000 soles that she is requesting, she will purchase a few new cell phones to improve and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase of cell phones

description:
Alima A. is forty-five years old. She is married and the mother of six children. All of the children are in school. She has been a manufacturer of palm oil for seven years now. Palm oil is produced from palm nut fruits, and the palm kernel is a by-product of palm oil which is produced first. The palm kernel is processed through various stages to obtain the palm kernel oil.\r\n

\r\nAlima produces and supplies the oil to food vendors to prepare their meals, and she even treks to the villages to purchase the finished product elsewhere when demand becomes very high. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of palm nuts and gallon containers to store the oil, and to increase her efficiency by producing oil in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business and raise more income to support her husband, to provide food for her family and to finance her children\'s education. She belongs to a village bank called ‘‘Hwe die Nyame Aye’ which means "see what the Lord has done."
loan_use: To buy more bags of palm nuts and an electric milling machine to produce palm oil in larger quantities.

description:
La señora Celia Agripina G. C., es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Tiunfadoras de Catac”, vive en la Av. 31 de Mayo S/N, del Distrito de Catac - Provincia de Recuay, Departamento de Ancash. Está casada y tiene un hogar bien constituido, madre de 03 hijos que todavía dependen económicamente de ella. Tiene 52 años de edad y se nota una mujer muy tranquila y emprendedora. trabaja en la Municipalidad Distrital de Catac como Registradora Civil.
Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00, siendo socia del Banco Comunal “Villa Turística de Catac” , compró 02 cajas nucleras para la producción de miel de abeja. Tiene 03 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos.
En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio, siempre ubicado en su casa, la gente del lugar ya la conocen y siempre le hacen pedidos por la calidad del producto. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 comprará una máquina cosechadora centrífuga que tiene un costo de S/. 1,200.00 para facilitar su proceso de cosecha.
Manifiesta su agradecimiento al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como mujer y empresaria, porque manifestó que también ha implementado sus cajas nucleares en el Centro Poblado de Síncuna ubicado en Recuay.
description_translated:
Ms. Celia Agripina G. Castillos is a member of the “Las Triunfadoras de Catac” Microfinance Institute. She is a married woman with a well-built home. She is a mother of three children who still depend on her financially. She is 52 years of age and appears to be a calm and enterprising woman. She works in the Catac District Municipality as a civil registrar.

With her first 300.00 PEN loan as a member of the Villa Turística de Catac Microfinance Institute, she purchased 2 beehives for honey production. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 3 years.

She currently owns this same business, located in her house. The residents of the area know her and always order her products because of the quality. With this 1,000.00 PEN loan, she will purchase a cappings spinner, which costs 1,200.00 PEN, to facilitate the harvesting process.

She expresses her gratitude to the Manuela Ramos Movement for allowing her to grow both as a woman and as an entrepreneur. She states that she has also set up beehives in the Síncuna settlement, located in Recuay.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase honey cappings spinner

description:
La señora Modesta, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mi Sueño”, vive en el Jr. A.A.H.H. Tupac Amarú Mayor Fap, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 64 años, 04 hijos todos ellos ya independientes y formando sus propias  familias.

Modesta, a su edad aun se siente con fuerzas para seguir trabajando, ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas gasificadas. Manifiesta que con el negocio que ejerce se siente muy tranquila y contenta, vive sola y es ella quien administra su negocio. También se dedica al alquiler de cuartos, donde recibe mensualmente los pagos por ellos adicionando a estos las ganancias por las  ventas de sus bebidas, se siente muy capaz y responsable con las cuotas que debe pagar mensualmente al Banco Comunal.

Actualmente continúa con el mismo negocio,  es conocida en el barrio; ya que sus gaseosas las vende bien heladitas al gusto del cliente.
Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando mas bebidas gaseosas de diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas. Así como agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
Modesta, se siente orgullosa por haber logrado implementar su negocio, y asegurarse una vejez tranquila. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por haberla ayudado a superarse y a otras mujeres que quieren salir adelante y a defenderse como mujeres.
description_translated:
Modesta belongs to the Mi Sueño Community Bank. She lives at Jr. A.A.H.H. Tupac Amarú Mayor Fap, Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, San Martín department. She is 64, married, and has four children. All of them are independent and have their own families. At her age, Modesta still feels strong enough to keep working. She sells soft drinks. She feels very calm and happy about the business she does. She lives alone, and she runs the business. She also rents out rooms for which she receives monthly payments. Those payments, plus the earnings from her soft drink sales, make her feel very capable and responsible about the monthly payments she needs to make to her Community Bank. She continues with the same business. She is known in her neighborhood since she sells the soft drinks nice and cold just as her customers like. With this loan for 1,000 PEN she would like to buy more soft drinks in different flavors, sizes, and brands. She would also buy carbonated and non carbonated mineral water. Modesta feels proud of herself for having been able to implement her business and assure herself of a peaceful old age. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for having helped her improve herself. They have helped her and other women who want to get ahead and take care of themselves as women.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy soft drinks to increase her drinks

description: Antonia tiene 58 años, vive con su esposo y su último hijo de 14 años en su casa propia.\tEdad, estado civil, miembros de su familia. Desde hace 5 años tuvo la idea de comprar carbón por camionadas y venderlo, desde entonces abastece cada semana a sus principales compradores que son las pequeñas fábricas de ladrillo que abundan por su localidad, ya que les sirve como combustible de sus hornos de condensación. En época de lluvia baja la demanda, por lo que es importante tener un almacén, este negocio le ha dado buenos resultados, y constantemente compra carbón de piedra y lo almacena en el patio de su casa. Para más adelante, Antonia desea seguir trabajando en esta actividad pero comprando mayores cantidades. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y su deseo es trabajar de manera armoniosa con sus compañeros de grupo. Este crédito será de mucha utilidad para Antonia, pues planea comprar una camionada de carbón de piedra para abastecerse.
description_translated:
Antonia is 58 years old and lives with her husband and youngest child, who is 14 years old. They live in their own home. Five years ago she had the idea of buying a truck load of coal and selling it. Ever since, she stocks her main buyers on a weekly basis. Her buyers are the many small factories that make bricks in her area. They use it for fuel in their condensation ovens. During the rainy season, there is not as much demand, which is why it’s important to have a warehouse. This business has been good so she is constantly buying stone coal and storing it on her home's patio. In the future, Antonia would like to continue working in this field, but she would like to buy in bigger quantities. This is her first loan with MFP, and she would like to work harmoniously with the other members of the group. The loan will be very useful to Antonia as she is planning to buy a load of stone coal to stock up.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Incremento de mercadería

description:
Marleni is a member of the Virgen de los Angeles Village Bank, which meets once a month in the town of Huayllacocha, about an hour from the city of Cusco. Asociacion Arariwa is the only institution offering loans in this town. Marleni is 30 years old, single, and lives with her parents and siblings. Marleni’s family has a farm in Huayllacocha, where she works with her siblings. Marleni also has her own business buying and selling locally grown barley and bean flour; she buys from her neighbours and travels to Cusco and Quillabamba to resell the products. She usually travels two or three times per month, depending on how much she is needed on the farm. Marleni also has a few farm animals of her own: five pigs, two cows, and a handful of guinea pigs (a Peruvian delicacy).

Marleni is requesting a loan of 2000 soles to buy local crops. She plans to buy about ten sacks of broad beans (“habas”), eight or nine sacks of corn, and twenty sacks of barley. Her goal for the future is to buy more animals so that she can start her own small farm; she would like to buy chickens, more pigs and more guinea pigs.
loan_use: To buy beans, corn, and barley for resale

description:
Guillermina is a member of the Virgen D. Los Angeles VIllage Bank, which meets once a month in the town of Huayllacocha, where she lives. Her daughter, Zoila, is the group’s president and is also a Kiva client. Guillermina is seventy-eight years old and married with four children, fourteen grandchildren, and five great-grandchildren. Guillermina sells chicha, a traditional Andean corn beer, as well as vegetables at the market in Izcuchaca, the largest nearby town, which is located about thirty minutes away. She works seven days a week at the market, as does her daughter Zoila. Guillermina has been selling chicha for fifty or sixty years now, she says. 

Guillermina is requesting a loan, which she plans to use to buy corn for making chicha, as well as to buy a variety of locally grown foods like potatoes, broadbeans (“habas”), onions and barley. She usually buys thirty 14-kilo sacks of corn a week for making chicha; each sack generally costs about $7. 

Guillermina has been a member of her village bank for the past four years. She has pledged to repay her Kiva loan in full and on time. She is grateful for the loan being offered to her by Asociacion Arariwa, since it is the only financial institution that offers services in her town.
loan_use: Buy corn to make chicha, other vegetables

description:
“In today’s situation, we must be wise enough in order to survive the current crisis of life,” stated Jenny Joy A.. She is a hardworking mother who aims to become a successful hog-raiser someday and to give her children a better future. She is a faithful housewife to Joselito and they are living in Barangay Monguia, Dupax Del Norte in Nueva Vizcaya. They are blessed with two children: Mark John - 7 years old, and Joshua - 3 years old.

Aside from hog-raising, Jenny is also engaged in the direct-selling business of Avon, Natasha & MSE products. She sells them to her friends and neighbors and in their village. She wishes to borrow PHP 10,000 for her hog-raising and direct-selling businesses. With her perseverance, she knows that she will be able to increase her monthly income and be able to have a more comfortable living condition.
loan_use: As business capital for her hog-raising and direct selling businesses
town_name: Monguia, Dupax Del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

description: Кулдашева Гулнора-женщина 42-х лет,замужем,имеет 2-х детей. Вместе со своим мужем Азимовым Баходуром она на протяжении 10 лет занимается откормом и купля-продажей скота.Её муж покупает млодых бычков на скотном рынке за низкую цену.Гулнора откармливает их дома и на пастбище 3 или 4 месяца,затем продает мясникам по хорошей цене.Таким образом она вносит свой вклад в семейный бюджет.Кроме того её муж зарабатывает таксистом.
description_translated:
Gulnora K. is a 42-year-old woman, who is married and has two children. For the past ten years, she and her husband Bahodur Azimov have raised and traded in cattle. Her husband purchases young steers at the cattle market for a low price. Gulnora fattens them for three or four months at home and in the pasture, and then sells them to the butchers for a good price. This is her way of contributing to the family finances. In addition, her husband earns a living as a taxi driver.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase of cattle

description:
Janet A. is thirty-nine years old. She is widowed and has given birth to three children, two sons and one daughter. She says they are in junior high and primary schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. It is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.

Janet is a petty trader. She trades in maize. She procures bags of maize from farmers in the nearby communities and sells in the local market to retailers. Janet also treks to other towns to sell. She has been in business for six years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize in bulk. Janet is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.
loan_use: To buy bags of maize

description: Margie is now 45 years old. She is residing in the urban area of Calamagui 1st Ilagan, Isabela. She is married to Yollie J., 43 years old. Her husband is helping in their vending business. They are blessed with a son who is Yolmar, 12 years old, attending elementary school. Margie is engaged in selling seasoning products such as onions, garlic, vegetable, etc. She is requesting a loan to have her business grow. She is planning to purchase more products to sell to have sufficient supply of vending products to be able increase her income. \r\n\r\nMargie is dreaming that her son could also finish his studies and have a good future someday, and to able achieve this, she must therefore work patiently no matter how hard life is. Finally, Margie shared that “You see things and say, \'why?", but “I dream things and say, \'Why not?” Indeed, every dream that we have right now, could someday become real through our own ways and deeds, pursuing the right decisions we desire to do.
loan_use: Business Capital

description:
Edna D. is from the village of Puntod, Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, she has a a "sari-sari," or retail store, selling daily use products, such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. She has had her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Edna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC and is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell in her store. This will be her third GDMPC loan. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children for the coming school year.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
loan_use: To purchase additional products to sell.

description:
"I have a friend named Oliver. My husband and I work on his farm. Together, we till a two-hectare farm in order to provide for the needs of our family," says Aquilina A., a forty-two year old mother of two children.

She would like a loan from CEVI, one of Kiva's field partners. She will use the loan to purchase urea fertilizers, insecticides, and herbicides. She also considers venturing into another line of business to help contribute to the family income.

CEVI helps small businesses to grow. They provide not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.
loan_use: To purchase urea fertilizers, insecticides, and herbicides

description:
Juvy Lynne P. is from the village of Magsaysay. She is 23 years old. To make a living, Juvy Lynne owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling food products in the local community. Juvy Lynne has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for this activity. Juvy Lynne joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juvy Lynne has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Juvy Lynne is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell and to support also for her poultry raising. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Juvy Lynne from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
