Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
loan_use: to purchase additional products to sell

description:
CAMILA B. S., pertenece al Banco comunal “LORETO” su domicilio está ubicado en el Jr comandante suares Nº 344, Distrito de Calleria, tiene 27 años, 2 hijos pequeños, y su esposo es también comerciante.

	El primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, que invirtió en compra de algunos abarrotes, para surtir su pequeña bodega, y desde hace 2 años que está trabajando con Manuela Ramos.  Su negocio ha ido creciendo cada vez y por eso le ha sido necesario subir el monto de sus préstamos.

Con este préstamo  de S/.2,500.00 Nuevos Soles,  invertirá en ampliar su local y además comprar 1 paquete de tallarines, 1 caja de atún y 1 caja de leche para surtir su tienda.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos, por ser una institución que sirve a la comunidad con el servicio que da, y contribuye con las mujeres de esta región.
description_translated:
Camila B. S. belongs to the “LORETO” Communal Bank. Her home is located at Jr comandante suares Nº 344 in the Calleria District. She is 27 years old, has two small children and her husband is also a merchant.
She invested the first loan of S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles from Manuela Ramos in the purchase of various groceries to stock her little store. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 2 years. Her business has kept growing such that it has been necessary to increase her loan amounts.
With this loan of S/.2,500.00 Nuevos Soles, she will expand her business and also purchase 1 pack of noodles, 1 case of tuna, and 1 case of milk to stock her store.
She thanks Manuela Ramos for being an organisation that serves the community and helps out the women of this region.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase noodles, tuna and milk.

description:
Madelyn A. is from the village of San Carlos in the municipality of Tukuran, which is in the Zamboanga del Sur province of the Philippines. She is 28 years-old and married with one infant child. To make a living, Madelyn provides pedicab transportation services. Madelyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

Madelyn joined GDMPC in 2008 with hopes of gaining access to financial services that would help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Madelyn successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase an additional pedicab for the business. Madelyn is now requesting her second loan from GDMPC and plans to use the extra income from growing her business to help improve her family's living conditions.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.
loan_use: To grow her pedicab transportation business.
town_name: San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

description: La Señora Aura A. tiene 36 años de edad, habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación en la capital de Managua, madre soltera con dos hijas mujeres como madre soltera es muy difícil salir adelante sin apoyo del padre de las niñas. Los planes siempre son realizados en beneficio de sus hijas y la construcción de su vivienda es unos de ellos.Doña Aura tiene su pequeño negocio de variedad de producto como:cosméticos y otros.Gracias al préstamo que solicito en Afodenic lograra comprar nuevos productos: ropas, zapatos, perfumería, aumentando sus inventarios y obteniendo mayores ganancias.\n
loan_use: Comprar ropa, zapatos y perfumenes

description:
Josephine B. is from the village of Talisay, Malaubang, Ozamiz City. She is 42 years old. Josephine is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine operates a family member's business venture in the retail sector, operating a sari-sari (general store). While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business is selling soap, shampoo, toothpaste etc. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Josephine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase products to sell in her sari-sari (general store). This loan will be the first loan taken out by Josephine from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business for her children's education and for her family's basic needs.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
loan_use: To purchase additional products to sell

description: Mrs. Cherrylyn M. is a bonafide resident of Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. Married and blessed with 2 children, she started her business with their own capital together with her sister. Their customers are mostly their  neighbors and passers-by. The status of her store is stable and progressing, expanding and full of stock. Recently, she's requesting her loan in the amount of 3,000 that will be used to buy additional stock. Her future plan is to have branches in other municipalities. And for her family, that her children will be able to finish their studies and become successful in their profession.
loan_use: to buy additional stock

description: Mrs. Jeselyn C. has been a member of Paglaum Coop since October 30, 2000. She is a resident of Upper Bunawan, Calamba Misamis Occidental, is married to Mr. Danice C., and blessed with three children. She used income from her coconut tree business to open a sari sari (general store). Now she is requesting a loan so she can improve her store and her income.  She hopes to send her children through school and college so they will be able to find decent, stable jobs.
loan_use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store

description:
Sérieux est un groupe constitué de sept femmes dont trois monogames et quatre polygames qui ont en moyenne 32 ans et  3 enfants. Elles habitent à Bougoula hameau, une des communes rurales  de  Sikasso  (3ème région administrative du Mali).  
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente  de condiments alimentaires, de  pagnes wax, des  fruits et  des céréales.
Elles sont à leur  sixième  collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de  satisfaire le besoin croissant des  clients  et d’accroitre leurs revenus. Tous les prêts précédents ont été  bien remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt, elles comptent acheter  30 colis de condiments alimentaires, 30 sacs  de 100 kg de céréales  et  25 paniers de fruits.  Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso et dans  les villages environnants auprès des producteurs. Les marchandises sont vendues au grand marché de Sikasso ville  sur place,  à domicile et de façon ambulante à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes au comptant et en détail.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’éducation et  la santé des enfants et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités et le remboursement du prêt.
Les femmes du groupe Sérieux ambitionnent d’entreprendre des voyages d’affaire en vue d’élargir leur horizon.
description_translated:
Sérieux is a group composed of seven women (3 monogamous and 4 polygamous) who average 32 years of age and 3 children each. The women live in the hamlet of Bougoula, a rural community of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They operate diverse businesses, including the sale of condiments, Wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), fruit, and grains. They are on their sixth collaboration with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy customer demand and to grow their revenues. All of the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. With this loan, they intend to buy thirty packages of condiments, thirty 100-kg sacks of grain, and 25 baskets of fruit. Supplies are gotten at the grand marketplace of Sikasso City and in surrounding villages from producers. The merchandise is sold retail in cash transactions at the grand marketplace of Sikasso City locally, out of the house, and door-to-door. The customers are composed of women and men. The group members each envision realizing an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA. A portion will be used for the education and health of the children, and the other portion will be invested in business and used for making loan payments. Their ambition is to embark on business trips with the aim of expanding their horizons.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy various goods

description:
Este comité se formo a traves de la Sra. Jorgelina L. de Valdez, quien se entero acerca de la  Fundacion Paraguaya y del programa gracias a las integrantes de otro grupo.

Una de las integrantes es Sra. Isidora E. de Garcia.  Ella tiene 46años y tiene 8 hijos.  Ella es una mujer sacrificada, hace 11 años que se dedica en la venta de chipas en la zona de Lambare.  Tambien ella recorre para vender su chipa en los barrios y otras localidades. Ella hace 2 años que esta en el grupo, y actualmente ya cuenta tambien con un negocio en su casa.

Ella valora y agradece esta iniciativa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras porque a partir de esto ella puede ayudarle al marido para los gasto de la casa y tambien para los gastos escolares de los hijos y dice que solo hay que poner ganas y perseverar en el objetivo trazado porque ella siempre soñaba con tener su propio negocio en su casa y ahora es un sueño hecho realidad.

Las otras integrantes son:

description_translated:
This group formed via Jorgelina L. de Valdez. She found out about the Fundacion Paraguaya and the program thanks to members of another group. One of the members, Isidora E. de Garcia, is 46 and has eight children. She is a self-sacrificing woman. For eleven years she has been selling chipas, a typical corn-bread street snack in Paraguay, in the Lambare zone. She also travels to the neighborhoods and other places to sell her chipas. She has been in the group for two years. She currently has a business in her house as well. She values and is thankful for this initiative by the Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. Because of this she can help her husband with the household expenses and the children’s school expenses. She says you just have to set your mind to it and persevere to meet your objective. She has always dreamed of having her own business in her house, and now her dream has become a reality. The other members are: Jorgelina Lopezde Valgez. Clothing sales Maria N. R. de Vargas. Small Fast Food Stand Isidora E. de Garcia. Sells chipas Juliana A. M. Small Fast Food Stand Liliana Beatriz A.. Sells candy and recycling Maria Vicenta V.. Sells drinks Martina M.. Manicurist Carolina S.A.. Clothing sales Juana F.C. . Recycling Maria N.F.. Sells drinks Maria A.Gamez. Sells nutrional products Natividad V.. Sells cosmetics Rosalia I.M. L. Small Fast Food Stand Anacleta A. Small grocery store

description: Akua A. is a food vendor. She runs a chop bar. She prepares and sells all kinds of local dishes at her restaurant. She buys food items such as cassava, plantain, rice and other ingredients from the local market. She is 44 years of age, divorced and the mother of three children – one daughter and two sons. She says her children are in senior high and primary schools. She lives with the children in a rented apartment in a very busy commercial town called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Akua has been in business for one year now and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. Akua is hoping to expand her business and increase her profit margin. It is her desire to sponsor her children through school to high levels.\r\n\r\n
loan_use: To buy foodstuffs

description: Analy A. is from the city of Plaridel. She is 35 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. Analy owns and operates a general store, primarily selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Analy has been engaged in her business for over six years. In 2007, Analy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Analy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Analy is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
loan_use: To purchase additional products to sell

description:
Renalyn O. lives in the village of Solinog, Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old, married and has two young children. To make a living, Renalyn owns and operates a small  retail stall where she sells home utensils and school supplies. Renalyn has been in this business for over four years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2009, Renalyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services that will help improve her living conditions and ability to engage in business. Renalyn is requesting a loan, her first, to buy additional products to sell in her retail stall. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to expand her business and meet her family's basic needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
loan_use: to buy additional products to sell

description:
Jeffie E. is from the village of Mialen Clarin Misamis Occidental. He is 22 years old and married. To make a living, Jeffie owns and operates a business venture in the services sector, operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating a tricycle for transportation services. Jeffie has been engaged in this business for over 1 year and earns approximately 9300 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jeffie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Jeffie is requesting a loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used for additional payment for his motorcycle for transportation services. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jeffie from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

description:
Edna A. is from the village of Danao. She is 46 years old. Edna is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Edna owns & operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Edna has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Edna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edna is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Edna from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

description:
Erma A., 39, is from the village of Migcanaway, Tangub City. She is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Erma owns and operates a business venture in the food sector running a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from fishing and selling of fish. Erma has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Erma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erma is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase materials to fix her fishing net. This loan will be Erma’s first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business and to support her family's basic needs.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

description:
Ludivina is 35 years old and has a stand where she sells sim cards and minutes for two local cell phone companies. Ludivina has been running this stand for three years and it has been a big help to her family, especially for the education of her three children in school.

Ludivina is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 as working capital for her business and to help repair her husband’s motorcycle transport.
loan_use: To use as working capital for her business and to repair her husband’s motorcycle transport

description:
Rufina said, “It is through hardwork and patience in managing her general store business, that one can achieve progress.” 

Rufina is 52 years old and married to Ricardo who is a farmer in their village of Liwayway Diffun Quirino. She manages a store in their village and, because she wants her business to grow, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000. She has been running the business for eight years and she hopes she can continue to sustain it and even expand it.

She is thankful because she is blessed with five children: her two eldest are already married; her third child is Rochelle who is 20 years old and a college graduate who is working at Centro mall as a sales lady; Rickson is 18 years old and finished a two-year course in college; and the youngest, Russel John, is 16 years old.

Rufina hopes that her children will someday develop her retailing business so that the family can afford to send Russel John to college.
loan_use: To expand her business

description: S. Majorine is the leader of Myanzi Tukolerewamu group in Mityana. She is a strong and hard working lady and by the time I visited the group, she had just given birth to a baby girl but she managed to come and attend to her duties in the group.  She has a retail shop in the Myanzi trading center where she sells sugar, salt, cooking oil, flour and cold drinks plus many other items.  She has been doing this for 9 years.  She has been in the lending group for 4 years, and she has seen a change. She has been able to increase the stock of her shop as well as buying animals like cows, goats, and hens that she keeps at home. She is in need of a loan to buy more stock for her shop.
loan_use: To buy more stock for her retail shop.

description:
"When I got married, I experienced emotion because of the many challenges. But my husband is encouraging me to always be strong. Now, we both till the land of 1-hectare. We are renting farmland from a friend. We get a share of every harvest. The more harvest we have, the more our share increases," says Fe A., 48-year old mother of two children. 

She would like to ask for a loan of PHP 7,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and molluscide. The loan will also help in the education of her children.

CEVI has been providing financial services to rural communities. CEVI gives not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.
loan_use: To purchase fertilizers, herbicides and molluscide for farming.

description:
Mrs. Isabel A. is 46 years old, married and lives at Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative last March 2005, having faith in true service and assistance to needy people. Determination and hard work are what Mrs. A. believes in.

The poverty in which Isabel and her family live urges her to do her part in improving their lives. She is requesting a loan from Paglaum MPC in order to have additional capital for her sari-sari store. The couple’s aspiration is to have a concrete store and house someday and be able to send their children to school to obtain college educations and a good quality of life.
loan_use: Additional capital for sari-sari store

description: Lady es una joven de 19 años, muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en la casa de sus padres, quienes siempre la apoyaron para que pueda generarse sus propios ingresos. En el mercado Santa Bárbara (Mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), se encuentra su negocio, tiene un pequeño puesto donde vende aretes, collares, anillos, etc. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y convincente, lo cual sumado al precio accesible de sus joyas, hacen que sus ventas sean muy buenas. Lady disfruta de conversar con sus vecinas de venta, con lo cual hace que sus jornadas de trabajo sean más amenas, pero lo que menos le gusta es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto, sin poder salir a la calle a realizar otras actividades. Son 2 años los que lleva con este negocio y le está yendo muy bien, aunque todavía no se siente realizada, ya que desea poner una tienda más grande donde pueda brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes. Es el segundo préstamo de Lady con MFP, sabe que tiene que cumplir con sus cuotas y espera poder hacerlo, además que no desea traerle problemas a su banco comunal, donde ha sido bien recibida. Con los mil nuevos soles de solicitados, comprará más joyas para mejorar su stock y así poder ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes.
description_translated:
Lady is 19, very happy, and a hard worker. She lives in her parent’s house. They have always helped her so that she can generate her own income. Her business is in the Santa Bárbara market (an important market in the city of Juliaca). She has a small stand where she sells earrings, necklaces, rings, etc. She is a very cheerful and convincing sales person who sells jewelry at reasonable prices. Therefore, her sales are very good. Lady enjoys talking with her neighboring vendors, which makes her work more pleasant. What she likes the least is having to stay in her stand all day without being able to leave and do other things. She has been in this business for two years. It is going well for her, even though she still does not feel satisfied. She wants to set up a larger store where she can offer her customers better attention. This is Lady’s second loan with MFP. She knows that she has to make her payments, and she expects to be able to do so. Also, she does not want to cause problems for her Community Bank where she has been so well received. With the 1,000 PEN that she is asking for, she will buy more jewelry to improve her stock and be able to offer greater variety to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Increase merchandise

description:
Sylvia A. is twenty-two years of age. She is married and has no child at the moment. She lives with her husband in a rented apartment in a very busy commercial town called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Her husband is a fitting mechanic.

Sylvia is a trader, trading in utensils. She buys her wares from wholesalers in Kumasi at a cost-effective price. She hawks (sells door-to-door) in her community. Sylvia also treks to other towns to sell on their market days.

She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure utensils in bulk. Sylvia is hopeful to expand her business and increase her profit margin.
loan_use: To buy utensils in bulk

description:
Cecelia B. owns and operates a sari-sari (general store) selling a variety of different products in the local community. She is 45 years old, married and has four school-aged children. They are from Oroquieta City. Cecelia has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Cecelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Cecelia has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Cecelia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her seventh loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

description: Hardworking and determined, Mrs. Helen J. is from Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 59 years old, married and has been blessed with four children who are studying in primary and secondary levels. Her husband is a farmer. Her cassava and corn production project is still in the growing phase. She requests a loan of 5,000 PHP to defray operating expenses for her land. She needs to cover farm expenses such as fertilizers and labor costs. She hopes and prays that her business will expand and produce enough savings for her children’s education.

description:
Mr. Daniel is single and lives with his retired mother, who is under his care. Daniel started his position thanks to his father, who taught him the profession and who is very well known throughout the area for the good work he does.

Currently Daniel works in a friend’s workshop, who lent it to him for three years. This lease is very expensive and he needs a new workshop. Daniel was saving little by little to construct his own work space.

He has demonstrated that he is a good and responsible person with his committments. The credit applied for is to finish a phase of construction of a new workshop.
loan_use: Construction of his own repair shop

description:
Analyn D. is from the village of Senor, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Analyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Analyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & selling crops for sale such as corn, cassava, banana, etc. Analyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,500.00 Philippine Pesos (about US $32) a month for these activities.

In 2005, Analyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Analyn is requesting a new loan of 2,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Analyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
loan_use: to purchase ingredients needed to make products for sale

description: Аличон - кредитор в Микроинвест уже третий год.Каждый займ он берёт для расширения своего бизнеса, торговли запасными частями для автомашин.Аличон ездит за товаром в Истаравшан и закупает на оптовом рынке по оптовым ценам и с наценкой продаёт на рынке " Фаровон" города Гафурова.Для завоза различных замков и запчастей  Аличон хочет получить повторный кредит. На фото Аличон на месте бизнеса.
description_translated:
Alichon has been a MicroInvest borrower for three years already. He takes out every loan in order to grow his business, the sale of spare auto parts. Alichon travels for products to Istaravshan and purchases them at the wholesale market at wholesale prices and sells them with a markup at the “Farovon” market in Gafurov. Alichon would like to get a repeat loan to purchase various locks and spare parts. In the photo is Alichon at his place of business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Sale of auto parts

description: El señor Ramiro Eleuterio T. C. tiene 60 años de edad, todos sus hijos son mayores de edad y cada uno tiene su familia por lo que ahora don Ramiro debe luchar por su propio sustento. El se dedica a la elaboración y reparación de zapatería desde hace 20 años, además vende productos que se utilizan en este oficio y esta es la principal fuente de ingreso de su hogar, es este el motivo que lo incita a realizarle mejoras a su pequeño negocio. Su mayor anhelo es mantener en funcionamiento su negocio y que Dios le de salud, en estos precisos momentos Ramiro esta necesitado de un financiamiento, que le permita comprar los materiales que le mantienen la actividad de su trabajo, necesita invertir en: cuero, cuerina, suelas, cordones, hormas, pega clavos moldes y otros materiales que son de suma importancia en este trabajo.
description_translated:
Sr. Ramiro Eleuterio T. C. is 60 years old. All of his children are grown and they each have their own families so Don Ramiro must struggle to make his way by himself. He has made a living making and repairing shoes for 20 years. He also sells products that are used by this market and that is the main source of his income which, in turn, is what motivated him to make improvements to the business. His greatest hopes are to keep the business running and, God willing, his health. Ramiro now needs a loan to buy the materials he needs to continue his business. He needs to buy: leather, cuerina [a synthetic leather], soles, laces, shoetrees, nails and other materials required for this kind of work.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Working capital.

description:
Tarcila es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras.
Tarcila es casada, tiene 62 años y 4 hijos, Tarcila tiene una vidriería en su casa llamada San Cristóbal, actividad que realiza junto a su esposo, además D. los vidrios venden vitrinas, para lo cual cuenta con 1 empleado.
Tarcila necesita un préstamo D. 2600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. aluminios.
Los sueños D. Tarcila son aumentar sus productos.
description_translated:
Tarcila is a member of Obreras ('Workers') community bank. She is 62-years old, married, and has four children. Tarcila has a glass shop called San Cristóbal in her house; she runs the business with her husband. In addition to glass they sell glass display cases, for which they have hired an employee to help with. Tarcila needs a loan of 2,600 PEN that will be invested in the purchase of aluminum. She dreams of increasing the products she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase of aluminum

description: Myrho es una joven luchadora y persistente en sus metas, tiene 27 años y vive en un cuarto alquilado junto a sus 2 hijos; Brigith de 7 y Alex de 3 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Sus días son largos y agotadores, camina por las calles de la ciudad de Juliaca distribuyendo cajas de licores a las diversas tiendas y bodegas, pero también lleva su mercadería hasta otros distintos del departamento de Puno. Para Myrho, la actividad que realiza es muy beneficiosa, ya que aprovecha muy bien sus ratos libres para atender los deberes de su hogar, lleva 5 años en este negocio y lo que menos le gusta es tener que caminar tanto, ya que esto disminuye sus fuerzas y evita que venda su mercadería con muchas más ganas, aun así sabe que tiene que hacerlo para salir adelante. Para un futuro cercano espera tener un negocio propio en un local estable, tal vez una tienda de abarrotes, todavía no se decide por el rubro. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, espera pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo para no causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy respetada, por la responsabilidad que demuestra. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados aumentará la mercadería que distribuye, para poder mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
description_translated:
Myrho is a young fighter who perseveres in order to reach her goals. She is 27 years old and lives in a rented room with her two children: Brigith who is seven and Alex who is three. Her children are what motivate her to do all she does. Myrho’s days are long and arduous. She walks the streets of Julilaca distributing boxes of liquor to various stores and warehouses. She also brings her merchandise to districts outside of Puno. This business is beneficial for Myrho and she takes advantage of her free moments to take care of her household chores. She has been doing this for five years and what she likes least is having to walk so much because it makes her weak and too tired to sell with much gusto. But she knows she has to do this to get ahead. In the near future, she would like to have her own business in an established place – possibly a grocery store. She hasn’t decided exactly what it will be yet. This is her third loan with MFP and she expects to be able to make her payments on time so she doesn’t cause any problems for the other members of her communal bank. She is well respected because she is so responsible. She will increase the merchandise she sells with the 1, 500 she has requested in order to improver her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Incremento de mercadería

description:
La socia es la Sra. FANNY, vive en la ciudad del Cusco en el distrito de san Sebastián.

Nuestra socia tiene 40 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo de 11 años, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con su profesión, ella es contadora pública y el motivo por el cuál está solicitando el préstamo es para poder invertir ese dinero en la compra de accesorios para su computadora.

Nuestra socia agradece el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
description_translated:
Fanny lives in the city of Cusco, which is in the San Sebastián district. She is 40, and she is the single mother of an 11 year old son. She alternates her activities between her home and her profession. She is a public accountant. The reason she is asking for a loan is to be able to buy accessories for her computer. She is grateful to have this means to borrow funds, and she commits to complete repayment of the loan in the agreed-upon time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy accessories for her computer

description:
Maruja es socia del Bancomunal Maria Elena Moyano.
Maruja es conviviente tiene 30 años, un hijo de 2 años que esta al cuidado de ella.
Maruja trabaja con su esposo, el inicio el negocio por que el trabajaba en una carpintería, y decidió independizarse alquilo un local y se pusieron a trabajar,  han puesto una carpintería, ella también ayuda en las compras y en algunos trabajos.
Desde que esta en Finca, puede invertir en mas mercadería, en cada reunión aprende algo nuevo y se distrae mucho por que ha hecho nuevas amigas.  
Maruja necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para  de una compresora. 
 
El sueño de Maruja es comprar un terreno para poner su taller de carpintería por que donde están es alquilado.
description_translated:
Maruja, 30, is a member of the Maria Elena Moyano Communal Bank. She has a 2-year-old son in her care. Maruja works with her husband, who started the business because he was working as a carpenter, and decided to become independent. They rented a place and started to work as a carpenter's workshop. She also helps with purchases and in certain jobs. Now with Finca, she can invest in more merchandise. In every meeting she learns something new and is distracted often with the number of new friends she's made. Maruja needs a loan of 2,000 soles (Peruvian currency), for a compressor. Maruja's dream is to buy land for her carpenter's shop, since it is currently rented.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase of a compressor

description: Doña Laura B. tiene 34 años de edad, reside en el barrio Villa Venezuela en la capital de Managua, tiene dos hijos menores de edad, sus planes es poder apoyar a sus hijos con los estudios y darle una buena educación ya que es madre soltera, su negocio es una tienda que desde seis años administra, el cual comenzó con fondos propios y prestamos en micro financieras el cual ha podido mantener con variedad y mercancías su negocio, este es su octavo ciclo en Afodenic el cual comprara ropa para niño y adulto para incrementar las ventas. Su meta es poder tener una segunda tienda en otro mercado y así poder mejorar sus ingresos y poder dar a sus hijos mejor bienestar economico.
description_translated:
34-year old Señora Laura B. lives in the Villa Venezuela neighbourhood of the capital city Managua. She has two children, and her hope is to be able to support them through school and provide them with a good education even though she is a single mother. She has owned her own business for seven years, starting out using her own savings and small loans, and managing to maintain a variety of merchandise. \r\nThis is her eighth loan with Kiva partner Afodenic; she will use it to buy children’s and adults’ clothing in order to increase her sales. Her goal is to be able to open a second store in another market so she can earn more money and give her children a better standard of living.\r\n

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy clothing for children and adults

description:
Asunta es socia del Bancomunal Las Flores .
Asunta  es conviviente tiene  41 años, dos hijos de 12 y 8 años que están estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Asunta estudio enfermaría pero no la ejerció, se puso a vender en los mercados  como ambulante por 18 años, hasta  que decidió confeccionar buzos en su casa y también  consiguió trabajo como enfermera.   
Desde que esta en Finca Asunta aprendió a ser responsable con los pagos, ser unidas, con sus compañeras. 
Asunta necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para compra de ropa por temporada.
El sueño de Asunta es que sus hijos sean profesionales y darles lo mejor.
description_translated:
Asunta is a member of The Flowers cooperative bank. Asunta is married, 41 years old, and has two children ages 12 and 8 that are studying at the public school. Asunta studied nursing, but never practiced. She started selling at the markets by the age of 18, until she decided to make sweatsuits from her home. She also got a job as a nurse. Since she has been with Finca, Asunta has learned how to be responsible with her payments and how to work in conjunction with her colleagues. Asunta needs a loan of 1,200 soles to buy seasonal clothing. Asunta’s dream is to see her children become professionals, and to be able to provide the very best for them.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Asunta needs a loan of 1,200 soles to buy seasonal clothing.

description:
"Before, I was selling food items in the streets. I stopped selling when we started to grow rice for our livelihood. My husband is a farmer. He is the one who manages our small rice field. Our harvest is mainly intended for family use. When there is excess, we sell our rice to our neighbors," says Janeth E., 44-year-old mother of two children.

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase farm supplies like fertilizers and chemicals. The loan will definitely help her expand her harvest and improve her income.

CEVI is help more people to start businesses. CEVI provides its clients with credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage.
loan_use: To purchase farm supplies, such as fertilizers and chemicals.

description: Mrs. Susana A. is 52 years old, married to Mr. Rogelio A. and blessed with 2 children. She became a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative under the PDP-LP program last April 16, 2007. Her one child is already married and the other one is working in Dubai. Currently, she's requesting a loan in the amount of 18,000 as additional capital for her existing project, which is a sari-sari store. She just hopes that her sari-sari store will become mini-grocery someday. And for her family, she hopes that someday also they could build a new house.
loan_use: To provide additional capital for sari-sari store.

description:
"Twenty-five years, we have been farming. My husband and I grow rice to be able to feed and clothe our family. We wanted to grow our business more so that we could send our child to school and be able to provide her a brighter future," says Rosie S., a 46-year-old mother of one child. In addition to growing rice, she also raises pigs. Raising pigs is another way she thinks could supplement her family's income.

She would like to ask for a loan of 10,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers and chemicals. The loan will really help to improve their harvest and sustain their pig business.

CEVI is providing financial services to the poor. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.
loan_use: To purchase fertilizers and chemicals

description: Maricar M. is a 28-year-old mother of one child. She has a sari-sari (variety) store business. She sells variety of goods to be able to raise funds to pay the family expenses. She started her business in 2008. Because of their growing needs, she also grows rice. She has a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) rice farm which helps supplement their income. She aspires to buy another hectare of land someday and to have a stable income for her family. She would like to ask a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase additional merchandise for her sari-sari store. The loan will also help in maintaining their rice field. CEVI helps small businesses to grow. It provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.
loan_use: To purchase additional merchandise and to maintain their rice field

description: Victoria A. is thirty years old. She is married and has given birth to five children. All are currently in primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Suhum in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Victoria works very hard to support her husband and to provide for the family. Her husband is a fisherman. She is a fish monger. Victoria buys fresh fish from nearby stores and smokes them herself. She also fries some of the fish and sells it on a tray in the lorry station. She also distributes to retailers and food vendors in her community. Victoria has been in business for two years and wants a loan buy fresh fish in bulk so she can increase her stock. She is hopeful to be able  to send her children to higher levels in school.\r\n
loan_use: To buy fresh fish

description: S., 39, lives with her family members in the province of Pursat. S. and her husband are engaged in farming and they also raise animals for their offspring. Besides this, the couple has also been hired by other farmers to harvest their crops. The couple now has five single children, all of whom help with farm work when not studying. To alleviate farm plowing, S. seeks a loan from Kiva to purchase an oxen. She will rent out the oxen to farmers as other income.
loan_use: To purchase an oxen to rent out to other farmers

description:
Samuel M. is forty-two years old. He is married and has one child, a girl, who is currently in primary school. Samuel lives with his wife and daughter in a rented apartment in a town in Ghana called Suhum. Suhum is a busy business centre in the Eastern Region. The majority of the inhabitants are in one particular type of business activity or the other.

Sammy, together with his wife, runs a provision store by the roadside in their community. The couple procures groceries such as tins of milk and Milo (cocoa powder), bags of sugar, candies, soap, etc. from big supermarkets in the surrounding towns and also from vans that come round to distribute. Samuel has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to increase his stock.
loan_use: To buy provisions for re-sale

description:
Ernestina A., age 49, is divorced and the mother of two children. Currently, one is in the university and one is a teacher in training. Ernestina is a seamstress. She has been sewing for 25 years now. She specializes in women's clothing and funeral dresses.

Her skills and designs are of the highest class. She sews clothing in styles that give her customers a unique look, creating apparel such as church attire, kaba and slit clothing, children's school uniforms, wedding dresses, and funeral clothes.

Ernestina wants to use this loan to buy increased supplies of sewing materials such as linen, threads, and thimbles, in order to increase her output and efficiency. Thanks to her dedication and hard work, Ernestina has two apprentices, to whom she is providing quality training so that they may develop valuable career skills.

She hopes to increase her savings to provide her university-going child with a quality education. She belongs to the village bank called ‘Emmanuel.’
loan_use: To buy increased supplies of sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc. to increase her output and efficiency.

description:
Esterlita is 45 years of age and married to Sonny A. Sr. They are blessed with five children: Aries is 23 years old; Aileen is 21 years old; Sonny A. Jr. is 18 years old; Stephanie is 11 years old; and Lovely Ann is 8 years old. Her family is peacefully residing in Barangay Tandul ,Cabatuan, Isabela.

Esterlita has her own vegetable garden in her family’s farm. She works hard to generate income from selling her vegetables. She wants to help her children finish their studies by working very hard and always being patient in pursuing her business. She herself was not able to finish a high level of education but is grateful now that, despite the hardship of life, she manages to send her children to school.

Esterlita is requesting a loan of PHP 13,000 as additional capital. She promises to utilize the loan wisely towards the improvement of her business and to further support her children’ needs.
loan_use: To use as business capital

description: Elsa Gioconda R. Pérez es una señora de 55 años de edad. ella esta casada y tiene 4 hijos los cuales viven por cuenta propia. ellos están agradecidos con ella y su esposo pues se esforzaron dándoles el sustento y la educación. Elsa inicio su negocio cuando una situación muy difícil le forzó a dejar su trabajo fijo. desde muy joven Elsa era profesora de la escuela primaria, pero el uso de las tizas descuido su garganta haciendo que le brotaran nódulos de inflamación a causa de la tiza y el esfuerzo que hacia para hablarle a sus alumnos, esta fue la causa por la que sus empleadores decidieron despedirla, pero Elsa no se dio por vencida y con su insignificante indemnización estableció una pequeña pulpería. la cual desde entonces ha sido su fuente de ingresos tanto para ella como para su familia. por lo que su esposo es simplemente un técnico de electricidad y trabaja de manera ambulante y sus ganancias no son muchas, la señora Elsa desea este préstamo para surtir su negocio  y de esa forma recopilar un mayor porcentaje de ingresos.
description_translated:
Elsa Gioconda R. Pérez is a 55 year old woman. She is married and she has 4 children, who live on their own. They are grateful to Elsa and her husband due to the efforts they made for sustenance and education. Elsa began her business when a very difficult situation forced her to leave her fixed job. \r\n\r\nFrom a very young age, Elsa was a primary school teacher, but using the chalk disagreed with her throat, and the chalk and the effort that she made for her students caused nodes of inflammation. This was the reason why her bosses decided to lay her off, but Elsa was not vanquished and with her small severance she started a small grocery store. This is what has been a source of income for her and her family since them. Because her husband was an electrical technician and works without a fixed location, they don’t earn much. Señora Elsa wants this loan to stock her business and in this manner gather together a bigger portion of income.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Working Funds

description:
Dady R. is from the village of Paypayan Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Dady is married and has five small children. To make a living, Dady owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, specifically, selling "buko" or young coconut in the local community. Dady has been engaged in her business for over 22 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month from this activity.

In 2008, Dady joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She wished to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Dady has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC.

Dady is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to buy "buko" to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Dady from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
loan_use: to purchase "buko" or young coconut to sell

description: Джалолова Сайнисо – женщина 52 лет. Сайнисо замужем у нее 4 детей. Сайнисо узнала о нашей программе кредитование у односельчан и решила попробовать. Сайнисо занимается продажей продуктов питания и хозтоваров у нее есть собственный магазин. Сайнисо не имела возможности расширится из за финансовых ресурсов, теперь она получила кредит у нас и ее бизнес дает хороший прибыль. Сайнисо также о своим мужем каждую неделью торгуют на рынках Аппон, булок и Гудос Аштоского района. \n\n
description_translated:
Sainiso D. is 52 years old, married and has 4 children. She found out about our lending program from her neighbors and decided to give it a try. Sainiso is involved in the sales of food products and household goods at her own store. Sainiso has not been able to expand her business due to lack of financial resources. She received this loan from us, and now her business is more profitable. Sainiso and her husband also sell at the Appon, Bulok and Gudos markets in the Asht district every week.\r\n

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase of merchandise and expansion of assortment

description: Martina tiene 52 años, vive en una casa arrendada con sus dos menores hijos de 10 y 12 años. Desde hace más de 20 año se dedica a las tareas agrícolas, todas las mañanas, junto a sus hijos procesan la papa manualmente, pelándola y haciéndola secar en el sol para venderla en el mercado principal de su comunidad. Este trabajo es muy sacrificado puesto que requiere de largas horas de trabajo bajo el intenso sol, a pesar de eso, continúa, porque sabe que esta actividad le brinda las ganancias para sostener a su familia. Martina quiere seguir mejorando su producción y para más adelante emprender otro negocio. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, por lo que tiene grandes expectativas de conocer y ser parte de esta nueva experiencia de un trabajo solidario en su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de costales y el pago del transporte de la papa que va a cosechar.
description_translated:
Martina, 52, lives in a rented house with her two young children, 10 and 12, respectively. She has made a living doing farm work for more than 20 years. Every morning, with her children, she processes potatoes by hand, peeling them and drying them in the sun before selling them in the town's main market. The work is very difficult because it requires long hours of labor in the blazing sun. She goes on, despite this, because she knows that the business provides the living that supports her family. Martina wants to continue improving her production and, in the future, set up another business. This is her first MFP loan and she's very much looking forward to learning about and being part of a community bank, a new experience for her. The money that she's requesting will be used to purchase bags and to pay to transport the potatoes that she will harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Pay for bags and transportation for food business.

description: Agueda es una mujer soltera de 30 años, vive en la casa de sus familiares, quienes la apoyan mucho, ella desea sobresalir en la vida y sabe que para eso tiene que trabajar mucho. Trabaja arduamente todo los días realizando tejidos artesanales, sus clientes la buscan por la calidad y lo bonito de sus tejidos y es que ella le pone mucho amor a sus artesanías porque le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que puede pasar mucho tiempo en su casa aprovechando su estadía para realizar las labores hogareñas. Son 6 años los que lleva en este negocio y anhela tener un puesto estable donde pueda vender sus tejidos, ya que actualmente sólo distribuye a tiendas artesanales. Ella considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es realizar los acabados de las prendas, puesto que necesitan mucha precisión, ella es consiente que el camino a su desarrollo personal no es fácil y está dispuesta a afrontar cualquier dificultad que se le presente. Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a ahorrar, un poco todos los días para lograrlo, es una socia muy alegre en su banco comunal y es muy querida por la demás socias. Con los tres mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lana, de mejor calidad, para darles a sus artesanías un mejor acabado.
description_translated:
Agueda is a 30 year old single mother. She lives in her relatives’ house. They give her lots of support. She wants to get ahead in life, and she knows that to do so she has to work a lot. She works arduously every day making her weavings. Her customers look for the quality and beauty in her weavings. She puts a lot of love into her handicrafts because she likes the work so much. She is able to spend a lot of time at home, taking advantage of that time to do housework. She has been in this business for six years. She longs to have her own stable place where she can sell her weavings. She currently only distributes them to handicrafts stores. She considers the most difficult part of her work to be making the finishings for the garments. You need to be very precise. She is aware that the road to her personal development is not easy. She is prepared to confront any difficulty along the way. This is her sixth loan with MFP. She knows that she needs to make payments on time, and she is ready to save a little every day to do so. She is a happy member of her community bank, and she is loved by the other members. She will use the 3,500 PEN she will buy more wool of better quality to be able to give her handicrafts a better finish.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Buy wool

description:
Jorgie S. is making a living from raising pigs to sell. She is 28 years old, married and has two school-aged children. They are from the village of Calaran, Calamba Misamis Occidental. Jorgie has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Jorgie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Jorgie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC. Jorgie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. This will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
loan_use: To purchase livestock

description:
Flora C. is from the town of Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old. Flora is separated. To make a living, Flora owns & operates a "sari-sari" (general) store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Flora has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month. In 2007, Flora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Flora has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Flora is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Flora from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
loan_use: To purchase additional inventory to sell.

description: Judith V. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 28 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. Judith owns and operates a business selling alcoholic beverages including beer and wine in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Judith joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to invest in renovating her business. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
loan_use: To invest in renovating her business

description: Сохибчамол Гулматова проживает в районе гиссра. Возраст 48 лет. Замужем, имеет 2 детей. Сохибчамол имеет торговую точку на центральном рынке, где торгует растительным маслом. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 15 лет. Клиентка просит кредит, чтобы увеличить свой товараоборот.
description_translated:
Sohibchamol G. lives in the Gissar district. She is 48 years, married and has 2 children. Sohibchamol has a retail stand at the central market, where she sells vegetable oil. She has been involved in this business for over 15 years. Our client is requesting this loan in order to increase her product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To increase product turnover

description: Hilda is already 58 years old. She sells native cakes (glutinous snacks) in their village of Barangay Divisoria, Santiago City. She is a mother with strong determination. She has been able to raise her children alone and sustain her family’s daily needs through her hard work and patience in vending her cook snacks. She says that she needs additional vending capital for her to gain bigger income in order to continue to support the schooling of her youngest daughter. She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 4,000 to KIVA lenders as financial assistance in her vending business. “This amount will already be a big help,” Hilda further said. \r\n\r\n
loan_use: Business Capital.

description:
Actualmente, en el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Dominga D. se dedica a la comercialización  de carne de res, cerdo y pollo en su propio establecimiento donde a diario atiende a sus clientes.

Ella es una dama muy esforzada y hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de la carne porque requiere adquirirla para comercializarla y por medio de esto, mejorar sus ingresos y la situación de vida de ella y de su amada familia.
description_translated:
Dominga D. sells beef, pork and chicken in the Wholesale Market in the city of Managua. She has her own establishment where she waits on her customers daily. She is a woman who tries very hard. She is asking Ceprodel for a loan to buy meat because she needs to get the meat to sell it. This way she will improve her earnings and the quality of life for her and her beloved family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Buy meat

description:
This small loan group is made up of only two borrowers, who are shown in the picture. The group leader, Mrs. Kim T., is 44 years old. She currently sells flowers to people who come to eat in restaurants, and she is earning an average of US$ 5 profit per day. She usually buys various kinds of flowers from farmers, making them into bouquets and selling them retail, while walking around the village.

\r\n\r\nKim T. is married with three kids who are attending school, while her husband works driving a motorcycle taxi. Because their current income is not enough for their family’s daily expenses, Kim T. would like a loan of US$ 300 in order to buy piglets to raise. This will provide her with additional income to meet her family’s needs and provide more financial stability. The other borrower is Mr. Sem S., who is asking for a US$ 300 loan as well. He wants it to add to his savings to replace his existing motor that has broken.
loan_use: To buy piglets to raise

description:
Muhamadayub K. is 36. He is married with 3 children. Muhamadayub says he comes from a humble family and, from a very young age, he helped his father in the fields, which is why he never finished his studies. Despite that, he feels fortunate to be with his wife, who helps him sell with their farming business. Muhamadayub cultivates tomatoes, potatoes, onions, and watermelons. He comments that he is very thankful for what he has and, thanks to the dedication and support from his family, he can have a dignified life and give a better life to his children. At this time, he is applying for a loan in order to buy more seeds and fertilizer which will help him cultivate more vegetables. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
loan_use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer.

description:
La señora France, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cristo Blanco”, ubicada en la ciudad de Juliaca, Provincia de San Román, Departamento de Puno. Tiene 33 años, es madre soltera con 01 hijo, tiene estudios de educación superior completa (educación y auxiliar de contabilidad). 

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00, compró caramelos, galletas, chocolates, yogurts y otros.

Actualmente solocita un préstamo de S/. 500.00, para poder invertir en su negocio de venta de golosinas, utilizara el dinero para comprar golosinas como: chocolates, galletas, caramelos, yogurts y gaseosas.

A ella le gustan las reuniones de su Banco Comunal, la unión de sus compañeras y el buen trato de la Promotora. Su mayor sueño es poder comprarse una casa en la Rinconada.
description_translated:
Ms. France is a member of communal bank “Cristo Blanco” (White Christ) which is located in the city of Juliaca, in the San Roman province, district of Puno. She is 33 years old, is a single mother with one son, and finished college (in education and as an accounting assistant).

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for the past two years with an initial loan of 300 Soles (Peruvian currency), with which she bought candy, cookies, chocolates, yogurt, and other items.

She is currently requesting a loan of 500 Soles to invest in her sweets business. She will use the money to purchase chocolates, cookies, candy, yogurt, and soda.

She likes the meetings of her communal bank, the unity between members, and the loan officer’s good treatment. Her greatest dream is to be able to buy herself a house in La Rinconada.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: For purchase of sweets such as chocolates, cookies, candy, yogurt, and soda.

description: La señora Elba se dedica a la comercializacion de edredones, almohadas y gorras en la feria 16 de Julio ubicada en la Ciudad de El Alto, actividad que realiza desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana los dias de feria los cuales son jueves y domingos, aparte doña Elba en algunas ocaciones viaja a Caranavi (Sud Yungas) a vender este mismo tipo de mercaderia.  Ella vive con Hermogenes Botello su esposo, ambos trabajan bastante para poder sacar adelante a sus dos hijas ya que ambas estan estudiando en la universidad. Requieren el credito para adquirir una movilidad, la cual la pondran a trabajar como taxi.
description_translated:
Elba sells comforters, pillows and hats in the 16 de Julio market in the city of El Alto. To do this, she gets up very early on market days which are Thursdays and Sundays. Occasionally, she also travels to Caranavi (Sud Yungas) to sell the same type of merchandise. She lives with her husband, Hermogenes Botello, and they both work a lot to be able to support their two daughters who are both in college. They are requesting this loan to purchase a vehicle, which they will use to provide taxi service.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase of a vehicle, to be used for public service\t\t\t

description:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=82745&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Juana continua con su restaurant D. venta D. comida criolla y arequipeña que realiza en su casa, antes vendía solo los fines D. semana, ahora venD. todos los días, sus clientela ha aumentado y le está yendo bien.
Juana aprendió en FINCA como administrar su negocio y su dinero, Juana necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles, para mandar hacer una reja D. fierro en su casa por protección, le han querido robar en dos ocasiones y también comprar víveres para su restaurante.
description_translated:
First loan

Juana carries on with her restaurant selling traditional home-maD. food from the region (criolla and arequipeña). She used to only sell during the weekends but now she sells daily given that her client base has been improving and things have gone her way.

Through Finca (Kiva Field Partner), Juana learned how to administer her business and how to manage her money. Juana requires a loan of 1200 soles to have a wrought-iron fence installed for her house for protection. She has been victim of theft twice. She would also like to purchase a plot of land to build a restaurant.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To install a wrought iron fence in her house for protection.

description:
Noralyn T. is from the village of Biasong. She is 37 years old. Noralyn is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Noralyn owns & operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Noralyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Noralyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Noralyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Noralyn is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Noralyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
loan_use: To purchase fishing equipment

description:
Rosalie B. makes a living primarily from selling clothes in her local community. She is 46 years old, married and has three adult children. They are from the village of Pines, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. Rosalie has been in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2007, Rosalie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Rosalie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from GDMPC. Rosalie is now requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to buy new items to expand her product offerings. This will be her fifth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
loan_use: To buy new items to expand product offering

description:
K. Murod is a 49-year-old married man and the loving father of four children. For 13 years Murod has had a small shop near his house where he sells all kinds of household and foodstuff items. His children (one of them is pictured) help him with the business. He dreams that his children will enter higher education, and that is why he is working hard, together with his wife who always assists him in everything. Murod's business is successful in bringing considerable income to the family. Today Murod wants to expand his business and to increase his working capital for purchasing new goods to sell. With this purpose he is requesting a loan of 10,000 TJS. Murod has had loans from Kiva partner IMON several times already and has demonstrated that he is a reliable client. Murod promises to manage this loan reliably as well.  

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj
loan_use: To increase his working capital for purchasing goods to sell

description:
ROSARIO G. D. P., pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES SOLIDARIAS” vive en el Jr. Pisqui Nº 362, en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, tiene 50 años D. edad y es madre soltera D. 03 hijos.

Se inició en el negocio D. perfumes y productos D. belleza, con el primer préstamo D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró perfumes para tener en stock y así poder mostrarlos, ella continua trabajando en ese rubro y cuenta con clientes.

Con este préstamo D. S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en la compra D. perfumes, cosméticos y nuevos productos.

 “Manuela Ramos es una ONG, que apoya a una gran cantidad D. mujeres trabajadoras, con pequeños prestamos que permite a las mujeres pucallpinas a iniciar o a mejorar sus negocios y estoy contenta con esa ayuda” refirió.
description_translated:
Rosario G. D. P. belongs to the "Mujeres Solidarias" Community Bank and lives in the Jr. Pisqui Nº 362 in the city of Pucallpa. She is 50 years old and is unmarried with 3 children. She started her perfume and beauty products business with her first loan of S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles. She used the loan to purchase perfumes to build her inventory and have testers for customers to try. She continues to improve her business and build her clientele. With the loan for S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles she will purchase perfumes, cosmetics, and new products. She was referred by the field partner, Manuela Ramos, an ONG that endorses a large quantity of working women. Manuela Ramos provides the women of Pucallpa with small loans that allow them to start or improve their business and is happy to be able to proviD. support.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To purchase perfumes, cosmetics, and new products.

description:
La señora Sara María A. Díaz tiene 41 años, vive en el Distrito de La Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Secundaria Completa,   tiene 4  hijos que depende económicamente de ella.
Sara  se dedica a la venta de comida y cervezas, su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Con su primer crédito de 200 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal Nueva Esperanza  II, lo invirtió  en la compra de utencillos para el restaurante como ollas, platos y cerveza.
El crédito de 1500 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de  productos como cerveza y gaseosas para implementar su negocio.
Sara tiene como sueño  tener su librería para crecer como microempresaria.
