Sus productos los obtiene en tiendas mayoristas cuyos proveedores la visitan en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su Banco Comunal Virgen D. Fátima, lo invirtió en la compra D. insumos para la preparación D. alimentos (arroz, aceite, azúcar, huevos y detergentes).
Con este crédito D. 500 soles, lo invertirá en la compra D. golosinas, bebidas gaseosas, e implementación D. su librería.
Julia tiene como sueño tener su propio bazar donD. pueda ofrecer productos como mercería, útiles D. escritorio y abarrotes.
description_translated:
Julia Sanchez D. Martinez is 73 years old and lives in the district of Moche, in the province of Trujillo, Peru. She completed her primary eduction, and she still has one son who is financially dependent on her. Julia has a small general store where she sells grocery items and office supplies. When she began working with Manuela Ramos, she had the same business, but her sales were slow and she was only selling sweets and a few basic items such as notebooks and pens. With the income from her increasing sales, she has begun selling fruit. She purchases her inventory from wholesale vendors who come to her house. With the first loan she received from the Communal Bank, she purchased items such as rice, cooking oil, sugar, eggs and detergents. With this loan, she will purchase sweets, sodas and more office supplies. Julia's dream is to have a larger store where she can offer more merchandise, office supplies and groceries.

\r\n\r\n

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To stock her small general store with sweets, sodas and office supplies.

description:
La señora Carmen pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cajas Reales”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Chucuito, Provincia D. Puno, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 78 años D. edad, estado civil viuda es madre D. 6 hijos todos ya mayores e independientes, no tiene estudios. vive en el Comunidad D. Chinchero Sector Nueva Alianza.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 1 año, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el mismo que utilizó para la compra D. lanas para la elaboración D. artesanías en miniaturas.

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, para compra D. lana acrílica para la elaboración D. artesanías.  Ella también tiene un puesto D. venta D. condimentos.
 
Su mayor  deseo es continuar trabajando para solventar los gastos familiares.

A ella le gustan las facilidades D.  los préstamos que ofrece Manuela Ramos.
description_translated:
Carmen is a member of the “Cajas Reales” Village Bank located in the Chucuito district in the Puno province. She is a 78-year-old widow and mother of six children who are now grown and independent. For the past year she has worked with field partner Manuela Ramos and her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, which she used to buy wool for her miniature handicrafts. This time she requests a loan for 1500 nuevos soles to buy acrylic wool for her handicrafts. She also has a stand selling seasonings. Her greatest wish is to continue working to pay off family-related expenses. She likes the ease that the Manuela Ramos loans offer her.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: to purchase wool

description:
La señora María Victoria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 69 años, 12 hijos que ya son independientes y tiene su familia.

María Victoria, es una mujer luchadora, se dedica a la venta de verduras y a su edad no tiene dificultad de seguir adelante con el trabajo que realiza, nos cuenta que se siente muy bien con lo que hace, se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. para ir al mercado central de la Ciudad de Moyobamba, para vender sus productos.

En la actualidad ya es conocida por sus clientes, que a diario acude a su puesto a comprar donde cuenta con todo lo necesario que el ama de casa necesita y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00, comprará sacos de yucas, sacos de frejoles, y otros productos para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Vicki, como le dicen de cariño hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de seguir adelante hasta donde Dios le de las fuerzas. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por haberla ayudado a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
description_translated:
Ms. Maria Victoria A. is a member of the “Mujeres Emprendedoras” Microfinance Institute in the Moyobamba district and province, department of San Martin. She is a 69-year-old married mother with 12 children who are all independent and have their own families.

Maria Victoria is a hardworking woman who sells vegetables for a living. At her age, she does not have difficulty moving forward with her business. She states that she feels satisfied with what she does. She wakes up at 4:00 a.m. to go to the central market in the city of Moyobamba to sell her produce.

She is currently well-known by her customers, who go to her stand daily to purchase everything that a homemaker needs. She personally attends to her customers with the charm that she is noted for.

With this 1,500.00 PEN loan, she will purchase sacks of cassava, sacks of beans, and other products so that she can continue giving the best customer service.

Vicki, as she is affectionately called, now feels very fulfilled and with the desire to keep moving forward, as far as God gives her the strength to go. She thanks Manuela Ramos for having helped her to start her own business, as well as for having helped other women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase vegetables

description: Alicia tiene 27 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 2 hijas; Daniela de 5 años y Mayori de 2 en la casa que le cedieron sus padres. Tras haber sufrido un terrible accidente hace 20 días atrás, Alicia ha quedado con heridas en su cuerpo y en el rostro, por eso se cubre la cara con una chalina para evitar que el sol genere mayores infecciones. Antes de este accidente trabajaba diariamente en las chacras de sus padres y de suegros; últimamente, con su esposo, decidieron sembrar papas y arvejas dejando a sus pequeñas al cuidado de su madre. A ella le gusta mucho el labrado de la tierra ya que lo  realizó desde muy pequeña y ahora que está descansando por sus dolencias se aburre mucho en su casa. Desde entonces, su esposo solo viene trabajando en los cultivos y ella espera  pronto poder recuperarse para realizar las cosechas, ya que es la época más trabajosa, pero una vez pasada esa temporada siente tranquilidad hasta la próxima siembra. Su deseo a futuro es poder adquirir sus propios terrenos de cultivo. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, pero su esposo trabajó en los ciclos pasados en su banco comunal y demostró pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Cabe mencionar que Alicia acude a todas las reuniones en compañía de su esposo, ya que son muy comprometidos en los trabajos de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicitan lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos y algunas medicinas para su recuperación oportuna.
description_translated:
Alicia is 27 years old and lives her husband and their two daughters, Daniela, 5, and Mayori, 2, in a home given to her by her parents. After suffering a terrible accident 20 days ago, Alicia was left with injuries to her body and face, which is why she covers her face with a scarf to block out the sun and stave off worse infections. Before the accident, she worked daily on the fields of her parents and in-laws. Ultimately, she and her husband decided to plant potatoes and peas of their own while they left their daughter in the care of Alicia's mother. Alicia really enjoys working on the land because it's something she has done since she was very little, and now that she is recovering from her ailments at home she is very bored. Since then, her husband has been the only one working on the crops, and she hopes she'll be able to get better soon so she can help with the harvest since that's when the most work is required, but once it passes everything relaxes until the next planting. Her wish for the future is to be able to acquire her own land to cultivate. This is her second loan with Kiva partner MFP, and her husband has worked with loans in the past with his communal bank and has shown himself to be punctual with his payments. With the money Alicia is currently requesting, she plans to invest in the purchase of chemical fertilizers and some medicines for her speedy recovery.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase fertilizers

description: Robert is a charcoal vendor. He is 28 years old, single and lives in Barangay Sinili, Santiago City. He wants to have additional capital that he can use to buy more sacks of charcoal.  With this, he decided to borrow a loan amounting to PHP 5,000.00.  He is hoping that through his business, he can have an increase in income so he can continue to support his family with their needs.  \r\n\r\n
loan_use: To buy more charcoal to sell

description: Katerina is married with one child. She sells agriculture produce at two markets in Nikopol city and at several food markets in the greater area.\r\nKaterina has been in this business for 5 years. She grew up in a village and is used to growing and selling vegetables and other produce. She offers good quality at reasonable prices and thus has many loyal customers. A few months ago she purchased a car to help her in sales. Katerina would like to borrow $1900 to increase the assortment. She enjoys being in this business for it enables her to provide for her family.
loan_use: to increase inventory

description:
Ni Putu Suantini - (DNR.M-0580) is a 39-year-old woman living in the town of Palasari - Melaya. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. To making a living, Ni Putu Suantini owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Ni Putu Suantini has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 300,000 Indonesian rupiahs (about $29 US) a month from these activities.

In 2008, Ni Putu Suantini joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ni Putu Suantini has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000,000 rupiahs from DINARI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Ni Putu Suantini is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell. The loan will be the second she has taken out from DINARI. Ni Putu Suantini plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Ni Putu Suantini - (DNR.M-0580) merupakan 39 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Palasari - Melaya. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 3 anak usia sekolah. Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Putu Suantini memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Putu Suantini sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 6 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Putu Suantini menghasilkan sekitar 300,000 IDR sebulan.

Dalam 2008, Ni Putu Suantini bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Putu Suantini meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli ternak indukan. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 5,000,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Ni Putu Suantini berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk tabungan sebagai cadangan bagi keadaan darurat di masa mendatang.

Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. . Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.
loan_use: For baby livestock to raise & sell

description:
Omo B. is from the village of Panduma, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 56 years old. Omo is widowed and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Omo owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling "malong" or tube skirts in the local community. Omo has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 Philippine pesos (about $62 US) a month for these activities.

In 2008, Omo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Omo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 pesos from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Omo is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Omo from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
loan_use: To expand store inventory

description: El banco comunal “Las Activas” están representadas por la señora Claudia y conformada por 12 miembros residentes del barrio 1ª de mayo que van cursando juntos su segundo ciclo demostrando responsabilidad, honestidad y ganas de trabajar para salir adelante. Una mayoría de los miembros del grupo se dedican a actividades comerciales como comida, pan, ropa, refrescos y al servicio de amenización de fiestas. La competencia en el ámbito comercial y de servicios es alta pero los miembros del grupo saben como salir adelante gracias a su experiencia y sus ganas de trabajar. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición de materiales, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar un mayor ingreso ya que de ello depende el sustento de sus familias y mejoramiento de su calidad de vida. Por cursar su segundo ciclo juntas las socias cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios por lo que la fundación Agrocapital coadyuva otorgando un apoyo económico mientras el grupo demuestre unidad y solidaridad entre ellos.
description_translated:
The communal bank “Las Activas” [“The Active Ones”] is led by Claudia and consists of 12 member that reside in the 1st of May neighborhood; they are on their second loan cycle together and have demonstrated responsibility, honesty, and a drive to work to get ahead in life. The majority of the group members run businesses in the sale of food, bread, clothing, drinks, and party planning services. Competition in the commercial and services sector is high but the group members know how to get ahead thanks to their experience and drive to work. The loan will be used to acquire materials, supplies, and tools that will help the group generate higher incomes; their families depend on this income and it will afford them a better quality of life. Because they are in their second loan cycle together, the group members count on their experience in solidarity groups for which the Agrocapital Foundation continues given them economic support as long as the group continues showing unity and solidarity amongst themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Operation capital (to acquire materials, supplies, and tools).
borrower_names: JUANA PATRICIA, CLAUDIA, ANA MARIA, ROSMERY, GLENDA GANDY, PURA, CONCEPCION, BACILIA, MARIA CRISTINA, DARIO, VIVIAN, MARIA CLAUDIA
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, male, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description: La señora Petrona de Los Angeles Q. Torres.  Tiene la edad de 42 años el negocio de la señora consiste en una pulpería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que es una mujer muy responsable y disfruta mucho de su trabajo. Tiene un varón de 7 años su compañero de vida está fuera del país, por lo que la crianza de su hijo, solamente le corresponde a ella. El negocio de ella consiste en una pulpería que está ubicada en su casa de habitación tiene además de mantener este negocio, Petrona imparte clases en colegio muy humilde de su comunidad. En la actualidad ella ya ha realizado 2 financiamientos en fundación LEON 2000 para la pulpería. La señora Petrona aspira mantener su negocio y lograr tener más recursos para mantener con varios productos en su negocio y de esta manera ayudarse para la crianza de su hijo ya que ella es madre soltera y su pareja no la ayuda económicamente a su hijo.
description_translated:
Petrona de Los Angeles Q. Torres is 42 years old, and she runs a small grocery store. She has dedicated herself to this business for over 5 years; she is a very responsible woman and enjoys her work very much. She has a 7-year-old son, and her life partner is currently outside the country, because of this she is solely responsible for raising her son. Her small grocery store is located in her house and in addition to maintaining this business she also gives classes in a humble school in her community. Currently she has had 2 loans through the LEON 2000 Foundation, which she invested in her grocery store. Petrona hopes to maintain her business and to be able to have more resources available to her to be able to carry various products in her business; in this way she will be able to help herself in raising he son given that she is a single mother and her partner does not help financially with her son.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Work capital.

description: Flor B. is from the village of Brgy. Yumbing Camiguin. She is 25 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. Flor owns and operates a specialized retail business, primarily selling clothing and shoe products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month. In 2009, Flor joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Flor is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family.  About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
loan_use: To use as additional capital for her business

description:
Floria B. is 57 years old. She is already an old mother but still strives hard for the best to give her family a good future. She was gifted with two children, named Ginalyn and Roldan. They both have successfully finished their studies through their sacrifices. 

Floria manages a general store business, since she can no longer go to farm to till their farm lot. Instead, she establish a store to further gain income for their daily living and for the future of her children. She is asking for financial support from Kiva, amounting to PHP 20,000, as additional business capital to be able to improve her store and to make it more profitable.
loan_use: Business Capital

description: Analyn S. is from the village of Purok 9, GK, Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City. She is 30 years old, is married to Naser S., and has four school-aged children. Analyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She is just starting this business. In July 2009, Analyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family and to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
loan_use: To purchase additional products to sell
town_name: Purok 9, Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City, Lanao del

description:
Roselyn S. is from the village of Barangay Santiago, Iligan City. She is 25 years old. Roselyn is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Roselyn owns & operates a waste management service. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from hauling plastics & other recyclables for local businesses and community members. Roselyn has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In July 2009, Roselyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roselyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Roselyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
loan_use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital
town_name: Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

description:
Lourdes es socia del Banco Comunal Compartir, vive en la comunidad de San Martín de Paraíso.
Lourdes es conviviente, tiene 28 años, Lourdes tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo.
Lourdes necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite.
Los sueños de Lourdes son mejorar su negocio.
description_translated:
Lourdes is a member of the Sharing Community Bank. She lives in the community of San Martín de Paraíso. Lourdes is married and is 28 years old. Lourdes has a store in her house, where she sells general groceries with the help of her husband. Lourdes needs a loan for 2000 soles, which will be invested to buy rice, sugar, and oil. Her dreams are to improve her business.\r\n\r\n

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy rice, sugar, and oil

description:
La señora Lucrecia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 46 años de edad, de estado civil casada y es madre de 7 hijos.  Tiene estudios de primaria completa, vive en el Centro Poblado de Rosa Cani.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 5 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la compra de ganado menor. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ganado menor (ovinos) para engorde.

Su deseo es seguir trabajando y darles educación a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones de los Bancos Comunales.
description_translated:
Mrs. Lucrecia, belongs to the Communal Bank "Manuela of Today" which is located in the district of Llave, Province of El Collao, Puno Department. She is 46 years old, married and a mother of 7 children. She has completed primary school and lives in the town of Rosa Cani. She has been a member of the Manuela Ramos group for 5 years. Her first loan was in the amount of S /. 300.00 , which she used for the purchase of small livestock. At this time she requires a loan of S /. 500.00 new soles for the purchase of small livestock - (sheep) for fattening. Her desire is to continue working and to provide her children with an education. She enjoys the savings and meetings of community banks.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Hungria, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy livestock

description:
La señora Reina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Sra. D. Guadalupe”, Distrito D. Bellavista, Provincia D. Bellavista, Departamento D. San Martín. Es casada, tiene 40 años y es madre D. 03 hijos, ya independientes.

Ante la necesidad D. aportar al ingreso económico del hogar, motivada por ella misma, emprendió un pequeño  negocio D. venta D. abarrotes con su primer crédito D. S/. 300.00 obteniendo muy buenos resultados desD. un inicio por la calidad D. sus productos, sus precios cómodos y la buena atención al cliente.
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su propia casa, donD. sus principales clientes son los vecinos D. su barrio.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,200.00, comprará  más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en kilos, huevos en javas,  insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes, golosinas  y otros productos para mantener contenta a su clientela.

Hoy se siente muy feliz D. la labor y servicio que brinda y agradece a Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.
description_translated:
Reina belongs to the Our Lady of Guadalupe Communal Bank, Bellavista district, Bellavista province, San Martín department. She is married, 40 years old, and the mother to 3 grown children. Upon needing to add to her family’s household income, she began a small business selling groceries all by herself with a loan for S/.300.00 soles. She was successful from the start because of the quality of her products, her attractive prices, and good customer service. Today she continues this same business located in her own home, where her primary customers are her neighbors. With this loan for S/.2,200.00 she will buy more products to stock her store such as kilos of rice and sugar, crates of eggs, personal care products and household cleaning products, soda pop, candy, and other products to keep her customers happy. Today she is very happy with the work and service she provides and she is grateful to Manuela Ramos for supporting people such as herself who wish to work and get ahead. She hopes to continue on for a long time and help many families and women entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Buy products to stock her business

description:
Mely P. is from the village of Taboo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Mely is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Mely owns & operates a business venture, fishing and retailing fish. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from fishing and selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Mely has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Mely joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mely has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used for additional working capital. Mely is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase kerosene, and as working capital. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Mely from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
loan_use: For additional working capital, as well as the purchase of kerosene and additional fish to sell

description:
Cynthia S. is from the village of Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. She is 50 years old. Cynthia is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Cynthia owns and operates a general store where she sells daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Cynthia has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (about $104 US) a month from these activities.

In June 2009, Cynthia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cynthia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 pesos which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Cynthia's first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
loan_use: To purchase additional products to sell

description: Henriette B. est vendeuse des haricots, épices, et divers devant sa maison dans la partie nordique et la plus peuplée de Kinshasa. Son savoir faire et la bonne gestion ont fait prospérer son activité commencée avec un sac d’arachides comme capital initial. Aujourd’hui, Henriette est membre fidèle d’un des groupes de Hope RDC dénommé « Ephraïm Plus ». Elle compte développer son affaire avec les prêts reçus de Hope RDC. Le prochain crédit lui permettra d’acheter des articles pour renforcer le stock. Actuellement, son activité lui génère un bénéfice de $50 par semaine. Son rêve est d’acheter une parcelle pour ses enfants. Henriette a 49 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont trois entre eux fréquentent l’école.
description_translated:
Henriette B. is a seller of beans, spices, and various other goods in front of her house in the northern and most populated area of Kinshasa. Her know-how and the right management practices are behind the prosperity of her business, which she started with a sack of peanuts as initial capital. Today, she is a loyal member of a Hope RDC group named "Ephraïm Plus". She intends to develop her business with the loans received from Hope RDC. The next loan will enable her to buy goods for bolstering her inventory. Currently her business generated a profit of $50 a week. Her dream is to buy a parcel of land for her children. Henriette is 49 years old, married, and the mother of six children. Three of them attend school.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy items for bolstering her stock of merchandise
country_name: The Democratic Republic of the Congo
borrower_names: Emilie, Jacquie, Micheline, Marie, Fély, Meneyame, Marcéline, Antoinnette, Régine, Lolo, Serge, Tshala, Siska, Annie, Anto, Séraphine, Marcéline, Lyliane, Laurentine, Augustine, Dona, Henriette, Bebe, Futu
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, male, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Progreso Hacia Adelante is a brand new Esperanza Bank of Hope from Consuelo, a town just outside of San Pedro de Macorís in the Dominican Republic. The group lives in a 'batey' community, a rural sugarcane plantation with very harsh living and working conditions. Fighting to overcome such challenges, these new entrepreneurs are seeking to take out their first microloan to develop their exciting business ideas and improve their lives and their families' lives.

Miguelina B. is the coordinator of one group within Progreso Hacia Adelante. She is 21 years old and is a single mother with three kids, ages six, five, and five months. She lives in a small house with her mother and her children. Until now she has had unsteady work substituting at the local school that two of her children attend.

Despite her difficult circumstances, she is enthusiastic and optimistic about the future. With the money from her loan she will start a new business selling food supplies. The first items she plans to carry include rice, beans, cooking oil, and snack items like crackers and candy. More than anything, she wants to provide for her children so they can continue their education and fulfill their dreams. She also wishes to finish her own education, and talks excitedly about someday learning to use a computer, opening her own bank account, and using an ATM.

Please support Miguelina and the rest of her group as they work to support their families and better their lives!
loan_use: buying rice, cooking oils, beans, snack items for resale

description: Fatima is 30 years old and married with three children. She owns a business center where she makes calls, sells rechargeable phone cards, and rents out VCDs. Fatima hopes for the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell. She says thank you.
loan_use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell

description:
Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Azucenas.
Carmen es casada, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, Carmen tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende ropa variada, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Carmen viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde también vende ropa.
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de casacas, chompas y pantalones.
Los sueños de Carmen son mejorar su negocio, implementar un taller de confección de ropa.
description_translated:
Carmen is a member of the White Lilies Community Bank. Carmen is married, is 35 years old, and has two children. Carmen has a stand in the 12th of April Market, where she sells a variety of clothing. She does this every day. Also, Carmen travels to different fairs in the region, where she sells clothing. Carmen needs a loan of 1600 soles, which will be invested to buy jackets, sweaters, and pants. Her dreams are to improve her business and install and workshop to make clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy jackets, sweaters, and pants

description: La Sra Ana Carola Tiene 27 años de Edad reside en la ciudad de Santa Cruz de la sierra en la casa de sus suegros(los padres de su esposo ) , viven junto con su  esposo los dos trabajan para sacar adelante a sus tres hijas, la menor cuenta con 10 meses de edad la Sra Ana Carola vende afuera de su domicilio, ya cuenta con su propia  clientela. El Sr. Rodrigo, el esposo, trabaja como taxista y esta acabando de pagar la deuda que contrajo por  la compra de su taxi. La pareja requieren de  capital  para la elaboracion de pan ya que la Sra acaba de comprar un  horno y necesita las latas y los insumos.
description_translated:
Sra. Ana Carola is 27 years old and resides in the city of Santa Cruz. She and her husband live in the house of her in-laws. They both work to support their three daughters, the youngest one being 10 months old. Sra. Ana Carola sells her products outside her home since she already has her own clientele. Sr. Rodrigo, her husband, works as a taxi driver and is currently repaying the contractual debt used to acquire his vehicle. The couple is requesting capital for Sra. Ana Carola’s bread business. They just bought an oven and the necessary ingredients and baking pans.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase flour in bulk

description:
El Banco Comunal Ceraturo es un grupo nuevo de 17 socias y socios que son residentes del barrio Ceraturo Irquis en Victoria del Portete ubicado al sur de la  ciudad de Cuenca, este sector es de un clima demasiado frío y que por la tarde baja la neblina  lo que hace que la gente no transite por las calles ni salgan de sus casas.

La socia María Tránsito P. vive ya unos tres meses en casa de su cuñada que reside en el extranjero. María tiene 23 años de edad, es casada y tiene cinco hijos de 9, 7, 5, 3 años y la última de un mes de edad, los tres primeros hijos los cuales son varones están estudiando en la escuela de Ceraturo. Antes de ser socia de la Fundación trabajaba conjuntamente con su esposo en una hacienda la  Victoria del Portete  como peones, sacando leche de las vacas, en labores del campo, su horario era de 6 AM. A 6 PM. En esta hacienda los jefes eran algunos buenos y otros malos, pero lo que no le gustaba a María era que no los consideraban ya que debían ser cumplidos con su trabajo que no había ningún justificativo para faltar, no les importaba hijos ni enfermedades. Es socia más o menos desde el 16 de Junio de este año, un vecino del barrio les hizo conocer de la fundación y les invitó a que ingresen, pidió $110 de préstamo para comprar cuyes y hierba, para de esta manera salir de la hacienda en donde ella trabaja porque el tiempo no le alcanza para cuidar a sus hijos. Su meta es poder trabajar en la crianza de animales no solo de cuyes sino también de vacas, puercos y pollos para así progresar y poderles dar lo que ellos necesiten.

La socia Rosalía C. tiene 36 años, es casada, y tiene una hija de 16 años. Su esposo trabaja en latonería, reparando y pintando los carros, mientras ella trabaja como empleada doméstica y además vende productos cosméticas de Avon y de otras marcas también. Sus clientes son principalmente sus vecinas, amigas y conocidas. Hace 8 años que vende cosméticos, y desde niña está trabajando en los trabajos que le surgen, como empleada o en restaurantes. Ella también se encarga de los quehaceres domésticos de su propia casa. Suele trabajar desde las 7:30am hasta las 5pm. Está pidiendo este crédito de $220 para comprar productos de Avon, porque vende a crédito. Aveces la empresa hace promociones, entonces para ella le conviene cubrir los costos en estos momentos y recuperarlos después. Ella toma pedidos de sus clientes para cada quincena, y suele recibir $100-$120 en pedidos cada quincena, de los cuales un 25% es ganancia para ella (la ganancia se desminuye entre 5% y 10% después de tomar en cuenta sus costos). Este es la primera vez que ella ha sacado un préstamo. Para el futuro, le gustaría poner un negocio propio, por ejemplo un restaurante, porque le gusta mucho cocinar. 

Todos los socios y las socias están comprometidos a pagar el crédito puntualmente y de una manera responsable.
description_translated:
The Ceraturo Communal Bank is a group of 17 women and men who are residents of the Ceraturo Irquis neighborhood of Victoria del Portete, located to the south of the city of Cuenca. This region experiences extreme cold while fog develops in the afternoons, making it difficult for people to travel through the streets and preventing them from leaving their homes.

Member María Tránsito P., for the past 3 months, has been living in the house of her sister-in-law who currently resides abroad. María is 23 years old, married, and has 5 children (ages 9, 7, 5, 3 and 1 month). Three of the children attend school in Ceraturo. Before joining Fundación ESPOIR, she and her husband worked on the Victoria del Portete Estate as farm laborers. They milked the cows and worked in the fields. Their work schedule was from 6am to 6pm. At the estate, some of the supervisors were good and while others were bad. However, none of them liked it whenever María had to miss work or leave early to take care of her children whenever they became sick. She became a member around June 16th of this year when a neighbor told her about the Foundation and invited her to join. She is requesting a loan of $110 so that she can buy guinea pigs and grass, enabling her to quit her farm job so that she can spend more time caring for her children. Her goal is to start breeding more animals, not just guinea pigs, but also cows, pigs and chickens so that her family can get ahead and become self-sufficient.

Member Rosalía C. is 36 years old, married and has a 16 year old daughter. Her husband works in an auto body shop, repairing and painting cars. Meanwhile, she works as a domestic helper and also sells Avon cosmetic products and other brands as well. Her clients are primarily neighbors, friends and acquaintances. She has been selling cosmetics for 8 years. When she was younger she previously worked as a temporary employee, a salaried employee, and also in restaurants. She also takes charge of the domestic duties for her own home. Rosalía works from 7:30am to 5pm. She is requesting a loan of $220 to buy Avon products because she sells on credit. Sometimes the company has promotions, so she can pay for the products now and recoup the costs afterwards when customers make their payments. She takes orders from her customers every two weeks, which totals between $100-$120, of which 25% is profit. (That figure is reduced between 5-10% after taking into account the costs of the products.) This is the first time she has taken out a loan. In the future she would like to open her own business, such as restaurant, because she enjoys cooking.

All members have promised to pay their loans on time and in a responsible manner.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Operating capital
borrower_names: LUIS JERONIMO, JULIO CESAR, DELIA MARIA, JULIO ENRIQUE, MARIA TERESA, MERCEDES DE JESUS, MARIA ROSALIA, JOSE ISAIAS, ADEMIR FRANKLIN, MARIA TRANSITO, GLORIA ISABEL, TELMO VICENTE, CARMEN PATRICIA, VICTOR ALFONSO, PRISCILA ELIZABETH, ROMMEL GONZALO, LUIS MEDARDO
borrower_genders: male, male, female, male, female, female, female, male, male, female, female, male, female, male, female, male, male
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
La señora Jesus Maria S. D. T. tiene 55 años D. edad, vive en el distrito D. Víctor Larco, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad. Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º D. secundaria y tiene 4 hijos.
Jesús se dedica a la confección y venta D. manualidades como: adornos D. corrospun, tejido, almohadas y también a la confección y venta D. bisutería.
Con el crédito D. 300 nuevos soles compro materiales para la elaboración D. sus manualidades.
Este crédito D. 1000 soles lo invertirá en la compra D. piedras, corrospum, alambre, tijeras, etc para confeccionar sus manualidades y también comprara 2 vitrinas para poder exhibir en su domicilio sus manualidades y bisuterías para aumentar sus ventas.
Jesús sueña con tener un stad en un centro comercial para exhibir y vender sus manualidades.
description_translated:
Mrs. Jesus Maria S. D. T. is 55 years old and lives in the district of Víctor Larco, in the province of Trujillo, in the department of La Libertad, Perú. The businesswoman has studied until her fifth year of secondary school and has 4 children. Jesús makes and sells handicrafts like corrospum decorations, textiles, and pillows. She also makes and sells imitation jewelry. With a previous loan for 300 soles, she bought materials to make her handicrafts. This loan of 1000 soles will be invested to buy stones, corrospum, wire, scissors, etc. to make her handicrafts. She will also buy 2 showcases so that she can exhibit her handicrafts and imitation jewelry in her home to increase her sales. Jesús dreams of having a stand in the commercial center to exhibit and sell her handicrafts.\r\n

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy stones, corrospum, wire, scissors, etc. to make handicrafts and to buy 2 showcases so she can exhibit handicrafts and imitation jewelry in her home to increase her sales

description: Santa tiene 50 años, es una madre muy trabajadora y alegre, vive en la casa que heredó D. sus padres junto a sus 2 hijos: Norma D. 29 y Néstor D. 24 años, quienes ya tienen sus respectivas familias. Su negocio está ubicado en el mercado Cerro Colorado (Mercado importante D. la ciudad D. Juliaca), tiene un pequeño puesto donD. venD. toda clase D. productos, comestibles y no comestibles, es por eso que es muy concurrido, ya que sus clientes saben que siempre encontraran lo que necesitan. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es conversar con sus compañeras D. venta, lleva 17 años realizando este trabajo y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día cuidando su negocio, ya que siempre hay personas que esperan que tenga un descuido para llevarse algo sin pagar. Para el futuro anhela tener una tienda propia donD. pueda vender con mayor comodidad y brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal participa activamente y siempre está al tanto D. las decisiones a las que llegan las demás socias. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para incrementar la cantidad D. mercadería que tiene en su puesto.
description_translated:
Santa is 50 years old and is a very hardworking and happy mother. She lives in the house she inherited from her parents along with her two children: Norma is 29 and Néstor is 24, and they both already have their own families. Her business is located in the Cerro Colorado market (an important market in the city of Juliaca); she has a small stand where she sells all types of products, both edible and inedible. Because of this it is very popular, since her customers know that they will always find what they need. What she likes best about her job is chatting with her fellow vendors. She has been working like this for 17 years and she says the most difficult thing about her job is being attentive to her business all day, since there are always people waiting for her to not pay attention so that they can take something without paying. For the future she longs to have her own store where she can do business more comfortably and proviD. better services for her customers. This is her fourth loan with MFP and she has always been very punctual in her payments and she hopes to do that this time as well. She actively participates in her village bank and is always aware of the decisions of the rest of the members. With the 1000 nuevos soles that she is requesting she will buy more products to increase the quantity of merchandise she has at her stand.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Increase in merchandise

description: Juana tiene 29 años, es una madre muy responsable y hogareña, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Alberto de 33 años y su hija Yanela de 6 años y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. La venta de gas a ayudado en mucho al progreso de la vida de Juana, quien ha visto como poco a poco su vida está mejorando, ella tiene su tienda en una céntrica calle de la ciudad de Juliaca, siendo una de la distribuidoras de gas más conocidas de los alrededores y es que su carisma y alegría han hecho de ella una muy buena vendedora. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que al mismo tiempo que vende puede realizar las labores de su hogar, lleva un año realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil para es cerciorarse de que los balones estén en perfectas condiciones y así evitarse de correr riesgos innecesarios. Para el futuro que su negocio crezca y pueda poner una distribuidora de gas más grande. Este es el cuarto préstamo de Juana con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy respetada por la responsabilidad que demuestra. Con los tres mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más balones de gas para incrementar la mercadería que vende actualmente.
description_translated:
Juana, 29 years of age, is a responsible mother and homemaker. She lives in a rented house with her 33-year old husband, Alberto, and 6-year old daughter, Yanela. What she wishes for most is to improve her standard of living. The sale of gas has helped Juana’s progress a great deal, and she has seen how her situation has improved over time. Her store is on a major street in the city of Juliaca, and she is one of the most well known fuel distributors in her area. Her charisma and good humor have turned her into an excellent saleswoman. What she most enjoys about her work is that it allows her to still have time to tend to her family and home. She has been in this business for a year, and finds the most difficult aspect to be making sure her gas cylinders are in perfect condition so she doesn’t run any unnecessary risks. She hopes that her business will continue to grow, and that she can turn it into a larger enterprise. This is Juana’s fourth loan with MFP; she knows she must pay her loan installments on time, and is committed to doing so. She is a well-respected member of her cooperative bank, given the responsible qualities she has demonstrated. She will use the loan of three thousand five hundred soles she is requesting to buy more gas cylinders so she has more product to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Incremento de mercadería

description: Zaida tiene 28 años, es una joven madre soltera que vive en la casa de sus familiares junto a sus 3 hijos Erick de 10, Britney de 8 y Lidia de un año, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. El restaurante de Zaida es muy concurrido por los clientes que buscan una comida deliciosa y un precio accesible, ella es una buena cocinera y sus sazón es muy admirada por todos sus clientes, sus menús son muy surtidos llegando a ofrecer hasta 5 platos de fondo para que el cliente escoja según su agrado. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cocinar y darle a la comida su toque secreto, lleva 6 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que atender sola a todos los clientes que entran a su restaurante. Para un futuro cercano espera que pueda contratar a personas que la ayuden a realizar un mejor trabajo y ha mejorar la atención en su restaurante. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, está muy feliz por la oportunidad de crédito, en su banco comunal es una socia muy solidaria con el resto de sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevas ollas y hará arreglar la infraestructura de su restaurante.
description_translated:
Zaida, 28, is a young single mother. She lives in her relatives’ house with her three children; Erik, 10; Britney, 8; and Lidia, 1. Her children are the motivation for all of her efforts. Zaida’s restaurant is very busy with customers who look for a delicious meal at a reasonable price. She is a good cook, and her good seasoning amazes all of her customers. Her menu items are varied. Her customers can select, according to their preference, from up to five main dishes. What she likes best about her work is cooking and giving her food her secret touch. She has been doing this for six years. The most difficult thing is to have to wait on all of the customers in her restaurant by herself. In the near future she hopes to be able to hire people to help her do a better job and to improve the service in her restaurant. This is her first loan with MFP. She is very happy for the opportunity to receive a loan. She is very united with her colleagues in her community bank. She will use the 1,000 PEN to buy pots and make repairs to the restaurant’s infrastructure.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Buy utensils and make repairs to her restaurant

description:
Este es el banco comunal “SR. D. CCOYLLORITY CACHIMAYO”, Los miembros D. este banco son originarios del distrito D. Cachimayo, ubicado a 40 minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco.

Los socios alternan sus actividades del hogar con la ganadería y la agricultura en primer orden, después se dedican al comercio minorista, algunos socios tienen una tienda D. abarrotes, otros venden celulares y zapatos en el centro comercial paraíso en Cusco, otros socias tienen una tienda D. locería ellas venden ollas, platos, vasos y demás; otro grupo D. socias venden leche fresca que sus vacas producen, una tiene restaurante, y otros 2 socios trabajan brindando el servicio D. taxi. Para lo cuál requieren el préstamo para poder reinvertir en sus diferentes actividades y continuar con el progreso económico D. sus hogares.

Nuestros socios se encuentran muy agradecidos y valoran el apoyo prestado debido a que en este distrito la banca financiera es escasa, del mismo modo se comprometen a cumplir eficientemente y disciplinadamente con el pago D. sus deudas en el plazo estipulado.
description_translated:
This is the Sr. D. Ccoyllority Cachimayo community bank. The members of this bank are natives of the Cachimayo district, some 40 minutes from the city of Cusco.

The members alternate their work at home with businesses, mostly farming and raising livestock which they then sell, but other members operate groceries or sell cell-phone serices or footwear in Cusco's Paraiso shopping area. Still other members have a "loceria" [don't know--might be loncheria or snack bar] store where they sell pots, plates, drinking glasses and so on. Another group of members sells fresh milk straight from their own cows. One member owns a restaurant and 2 others operate taxi services. They need loans so that they can invest in their different businesses and continue to improve their economic well-being.

Our members are grateful for the help the loans offer them in a region where bank financing isn't widely available. They are committed to being disciplined about repaying the debt within the agreed-upon time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Working capital.
borrower_names: EUGENIA, RAYMUNDO, AGAPITO, AMBROCIO, PETRONILA, FRANCISCA, MERI ESTELA, SANDI, AUGUSTA, VICTORIA, MERCEDES, BERNARDINA, JUAN CARLOS, LUISA, JUDITH
borrower_genders: female, male, female, male, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, male, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, false, true, true, true, true

description:
Maria es  socia del Bancomunal Melcochita.
Maria es Viuda tiene 44 años, cuatro hijos el menos tiene 14 años que esta en al escuela estatal.
Maria  empezó a trabajar en casas cocinando por varios años, ahorro hasta poner una bodega  en su casa hace dos años, pero igual ella sigue saliendo a trabajar en casa mientras que su hija se queda  atendiendo al publico.  
DesD. que Maria esta en Finca aprendió a  valorar el dinero que tiene en sus manos y a ser responsable con  el pago del préstamo.  
Maria necesita un préstamo D. 1600 soles, para surtir su bodega, aceite arroz, azúcar y leche.
El sueño D. Maria es que su negocio crezca más y abrir un restaurante por que le gusta cocinar.
description_translated:
Maria is a member of the communal bank “Melcochita.” She is a 44 year old widow and mother of four children, the youngest of whom is 14 and a student in the state school. After having worked as a cook in private homes for several years, Maria had saved enough to open a small grocery store in her home. Her store has been open for two years but she continues to work as a cook while her daughter watches the store. Maria has learned to value the money she has and to make her loan payments responsibly. She needs a loan of 1,600 soles to stock her grocery store with oil, rice, sugar, and milk. Maria hopes to grow her business and open a restaurant because she likes cooking.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Stock small grocery store with oil, rice, sugar, and milk

description:
Carmen es socia del Bancomunal  las empresarias.
Carmen es casada tiene 37 años,  dos hijo de 16 y 10 años que esta estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Carmen  empezó vendiendo chicha con su suegra allí aprendió la preparación hasta que su suegra le dijo que ella  tenia que  independizarse y ella compro su carreta, baldes,  vasos, todo lo necesario para salir a vender chicha, ella sale a vender chicha  por las mañanas de nueve de la mañana hasta las dos de la tarde, y en las noches  a partir del las ocho de la noche hasta las seis de la mañana ella vende hamburguesas. Con la ayuda de sus hijos.
Desde que esta en Finca aprendió a invertir en el negocio y a ser responsable.
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para la compra de un saco de azúcar, quinua, habas, cebada, maracayá.   
El sueño de Carmen es que sus hijos terminen el colegio hasta que sean profesionales.
description_translated:
Carmen is a member of the Las Empresarias Community Bank. Carmen is 37, married, and has two children ages 16 and 10, who go to the state school. Carmen started selling “chicha” (a drink made from corn or fruit) with her mother-in-law. She learned how to make it, and her mother-in-law told her she needed to become independent. She bought her cart, buckets, glasses, and everything she needed to go out and sell chicha. She leaves to sell chicha at nine in the morning until two in the afternoon. With help from her children, she sells hamburgers from eight at night until six in the morning. Since she has been with Finca she has learned to invest in her business and to be responsible. Carmen needs a loan for 800 PEN to buy a sack of sugar, quinoa, beans, barley, and passion fruit. Carmen’s dream is that her children finish school and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Buy a sack of sugar, quinoa, beans, barley, and passion fruit

description:
Jesus A. is from the village of Comon, Mambajao Camiguin. He is 34 years old, married, and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jesus operates his own business venture in the services sector. The main source of income for the business comes from providing services such as vulcanization and tire repair. Jesus has been engaged in this business for over 36 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jesus joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jesus is now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase materials and equipment that will improve the services he offers. This will be his first loan from HSPFI, and Jesus plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
loan_use: Purchase of materials and equipment that will improve the services offered

description: Yuriy is married with three grown-up children. He owns a car repair business. Yuriy used to work in this business as an employee. Then he purchased it and became the owner. Yuriy’s son, who is 22 years old, helps him a lot. Yuriy can say now that he runs a family business. \n\nHaving a large experience Yuriy knows this business well and has many repeat clients. Yuriy's purpose is to develop this business further by purchasing necessary equipment and learning to fix new cars and leave it for his son to continue when he retires.
loan_use: to purchase equipment

description:
Helen E. is doing pretty well in her rice farm business. She has been doing this since she got married to Ramel E., a farmer also. She has three children and her only wish is to be able to send all her kids to school and let them pursue a degree in the future.

She needs capital to grow her farm. She is asking a loan of Php 10,000 to be able to buy complete fertilizers and chemicals.

Now, she is actively participating in the CEVI credit program. CEVI provides their clients loans, training, and insurance coverage as well.
loan_use: To purchase complete fertilizers and chemicals

description: Antonio tiene 53 años, es padre de un hijo en edad escolar y vive con su esposa quien lo apoya en todo. Desde hace 10 años brinda el servicio de transportes de pasajeros con un motocarro que compró gracias a la buena administracion de sus ganancias. Lo más le gusta de su trabajo es que no tiene la presión de un jefe y es independiente, además considera que su actividad es rentable porque sus ingresos son diarios. Para un futuro cercano, Antonio desea tener más motocarros para incrementar sus ganancias, contratando a un chofer que trabaje para él. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFPy lo que le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que entre todos los integrantes se conocen y se apoyan entre sí en alguna circunstancia adversa. Con el dinero solicitado comprará repuestos y un motor para mandar a reparar su motocarro y pueda trabajar tranquilamente.
description_translated:
Antonio is 53 years old and the father of a school aged child. He lives with his wife who supports him in everything. For 10 years, he has been providing passenger transport services using a motorcar that he bought as a result of managing his money well. What he enjoys most about his work is that he is independent and does not have the pressure of a boss. He also considers this line of work to be more profitable because he generates a daily income. In the near future, Antonio would like to acquire additional motorcars and hire another driver so that he can increase his earnings.

This is his 4th loan with MFP and he enjoys working with his communal bank group. All of the members know each other and support one another whenever there are difficult circumstances. With the money he is requesting, he will purchase a replacement motor for his motorcar so that it can run quietly.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Motorcar repairs

description: Ismael López  de 51 años de edad, es integrante del grupo “Nueva Esperanza” y tiene el negocio de elaboración de muebles (bancos, sillas, mesas, cómodas, estantes), se unió al grupo hace un año y necesita el préstamo para  comprar  madera, él espera seguir con el grupo hasta obtener un crédito mayor. Al igual que Ismael las demás integrantes del grupo cuentan con diferentes negocios como la venta de zapatos, comida, otras se dedican a la confección de mantas, chamarras y algunas cuentan con tienda de barrio y necesitan el crédito para la comprar  mercadería (zapatos, arroz, fideo) y compra de materia prima (tela, lana y forro). A todas las integrantes de “Nueva Esperanza” les gusta confraternizar así que todas se preparan par compartir un apthapi (cada persona prepara comida y trae para compartir con el grupo).
description_translated:
Ismael López, 51, is a member of the Nueva Esperanza group. He makes furniture (benches, chairs, tables, dressers, shelves). He joined the group a year ago. He needs a loan to buy wood. He hopes to continue with the group and even get a larger loan. Just like Ismael, the rest of the group members have different businesses like selling shoes, food and other things. Some make blankets and jackets. Some have neighborhood stores. They need a loan to buy merchandise (shoes, rice, noodles) and to buy raw material (fabric, wool, and lining). All of the members of Nueva Esperanza like to get together with each other. They share potluck meals together.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Buy raw material (wood, fabric, wool, and lining) and merchandise (shoes, rice, noodles)
borrower_names: CATALINA, MARTHA, MARGARITA, JUSTINA, VALERIA, LUCIA, MARIA NELA, JUSTINA, ISMAEL, SILVIA
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, male, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Fernando F. owns and manages a sari-sari store (a kind of general store) in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. His wife has died and now it is only he who takes care of their six children. He formerly worked as a security guard, but, because the compensation is low, he decided to quit and open his sari-sari store.

In 1995, he started selling different goods. His profit enabled him to buy a parcel of rice farm to generate additional income.

Now, he needs additional capital to grow his business. He wants to use this loan to buy additional groceries and increase his income.

He chose CEVI for its wide services. CEVI gives him credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage.
loan_use: to purchase assorted groceries

description:
Elizabeth es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza. 
Elizabeth es soltera, tiene 40 años y 1 hijo, Elizabeth tiene cabinas de Internet en su casa, negocio que administra con la ayuda de su sobrina, además Elizabeth vende dulces en su casa y tiene un pequeño tópico. Elizabeth tiene proyectado implementar una agencia de turismo.
Elizabeth necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido para la implementación de la agencia de turismo.
Lo sueños de Elizabeth son tener estabilidad en el negocio, implementar la empresa de turismo.
description_translated:
Elizabeth is a member of the communal bank group “Nobleza”. She is 40 years old, single and the mother of one child. She operates an Internet café out her home and is assisted by her niece in running that business. Elizabeth also sells candy and runs a small dispensary. She has plans to open a travel agency.

Elizabeth needs a loan of 2000 soles to pay for expenses related to starting her travel agency. She dreams of getting her travel venture up and running, and that it becomes an established business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Start a travel agency

description:
Eugenia es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza. 
Eugenia es casada, tiene 52 años y 3 hijos, Eugenia vende cereales y menestras en el mercado de la ciudad de Cañete que se ubica a 6 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, los cereales los compra en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Eugenia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales.
Eugenia sueña con mejorar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijas.
description_translated:
Eugenia is a member of the Nobleza Communal Bank.
Eugenia is 52 years old, married and has three children. Eugenia sells cereals and legumes at the market in the city of Cañete, which is located six hours from the city of Ayacucho. She buys the cereals at Ayacucho’s wholesale food market.
Eugenia needs a 1,000 PEN loan to purchase cereals.
Eugenia dreams of improving her business and giving her daughters a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase cereals

description: Marleny tiene 25 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en la casa de unos familiares y tiene mucho deseo de salir adelante. Para ella, el negocio de fabricar muebles es una actividad muy rentable, desde muy niña siempre le gusto trabajar con la madera, ya que su padre tenía una carpintería y ahora ella que tiene la suya propia se siente muy feliz. Marleny trabaja junto a sus hermanos, quienes también decidieron dedicarse a la carpintería. Ella disfruta de manejar las maquinarias y de darle su toque femenino a los muebles acabados, lleva 10 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es cortar las maderas, ya que siempre hay peligro de que suceda algún percance. Para un futuro cercano espera tener una carpintería más grande donde pueda trabajar profesionalmente. Este es el cuarto préstamo de Marleny con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo, puesto que quiere acceder a otros préstamos en el futuro, en su banco comunal es muy alegre. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más madera para fabricar nuevos muebles y así generarse mejores ingresos económicos.
description_translated:
Marleny, 25, is a very happy and hardworking woman. She lives in her relatives’ house, and she has a great desire to get ahead. The business of making furniture is very profitable for her. Since she was a very young girl, she has always liked to work with wood. Her father had a carpentry shop, and now that she has her own she feels very happy. Marleny works together with her siblings, who also decided to do carpentry work. She enjoys working the machines and giving her feminine touch to the furniture’s finishing details. She has been in this business for ten years. The most difficult thing about her work is cutting the wood, because there is always the danger of an accident. In the near future she hopes to have a larger carpentry shop where she can work professionally. This is Marleny’s fourth loan with MFP. She knows that she needs to pay it on time, and she is prepared to do so. She wants to access future loans. She is very happy in her community bank. She will use the 2,000 PEN that she is asking for to buy more wood to make new furniture and generate better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Buy wood

description:
Pigs! This is what keeps Rex R. busy every day. He has been raising pigs since 1999. He started with four piglets; now he has five, six or more pigs in his backyard.

Rex would like to ask for a loan of 8,000 PHP from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy feed. He knows very well that feed is the only thing that makes his pigs grow; unfortunately, his money is not enough to buy the feed that is needed.

Like other clients, Rex receives not just loans from CEVI. He also receives education about savings and insurance coverage.
loan_use: To purchase pig feed

description:
Monica L., 36, is a very hard-working lady and a widow with 6 children of whom 5 are still in school. She has owned and managed a restaurant at a nearby market for 13 years, serving local food every day.

\r\n\r\n Since receiving her first micro-credit loan, Monica has been able to purchase non-perishable items in bulk and thereby save time and money and up her profit. In order to further increase the efficiency of her restaurant and earn still more profit, which will be used to continue educating her children, Monica is requesting a loan to be able to buy more raw foodstuffs that will help bring in more income and increase profitability to be able to continue paying school fees for her children. She is happy that now she can also offer cold drinks to her customers during and after meals.
loan_use: Buying more food stuffs for her restaurant
borrower_names: Safina, Monica, Rosette, Patricia, Grace, Faith, Grace, Florence, Alice, Lydia, Mukasa
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, male
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, false, true, false, true, true, true, true

description: Marie D. est une jeune femme de 27ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle veut utiliser son prêt pour s’activer dans la vente de produis rafraîchissant à domicile puisqu’elle a déjà un congélateur. Ses bénéfices lui permettront de payer ses frais d’électricité et de subvenir aux différents besoins familiaux.
description_translated:
Marie D., age 27, is married and the mother of 5 children. She wants to use this loan to sell refreshments at her home, since she already own a freezer. Her profits will enable her to pay her electricity bills and to provide for her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To make and sell refreshments

description: Hadiango B. est âgée de 36 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle achète des moutons qu’elle revend dans sa localité et aux environs. Son objectif est d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
description_translated:
Hadiango B., age 36, is married and the mother of 4 children. She buys sheep that she resells in her village and in the surroundings. Her goal is to improve the living standard of her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy and resell sheep

description:
Amada  es socia del Bancomunal  San Luís 
Amada es madre soltera, tiene 56 años, dos hijos de 38 y 16 años el ultimo esta estudiando en al escuela estatal.
 Amada  desde muy joven se dedico a trabajar en las ventas, empezó vendiendo libros y revistas le iba muy bien de repente las ventas empezaron a bajar, y ya no le resultaba,  tuvo que buscar otra cosa que vender,  se puso a vender desayunos en la  calle en una carreta  con los años a logrado tener un puesto reconocido por la municipalidad donde da desayunos todos los días de lunes a sábado, todas las mañanas.    
Desde que Amada esta en Finca cuenta con más capital para invertir, su economía ha mejorado.
Amada necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de café, leche, pollo, embutidos, para dar desayunos.
El sueño de Amada es tener una tienda de ropa.
description_translated:
Amada is a member of the Bancocomunal San Luis. She is a 56 year old single mother with two children, ages 38 and 16. The youngest is studying in a state school.

From a very young age, Amada has been involved in working in sales. She began selling books and magazines, which went very well for her until suddenly sales began to go down and no longer succeeded for her. She had to look for something else to sell and began selling breakfast in the street from a cart. With the years she succeeded in having a recognized spot by the city hall where she makes breakfasts every morning from Monday to Saturday.

Since Amada is in Finca calling upon on more capital for investing, her economic situation has improved. Amada needs a loan of 1200 soles for the purchase of coffee, milk, chicken and sausages in order to make breakfasts. Amada's dream is to have a clothing shop.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: purchase of coffee, milk, chicken and sausages

description: Doña Liliana se enuentra en su septima secuencia en su credito indiidual, la señora ha trabajado junto a la Institucion desde el año 2007 adicionalmente cuenta con un credito paralelo en el que se encuentra en su segunda secuencia nunca ha presentado problemas en sus pagos.  La actividad economica que realiza es la venta de desayunos en el Mercado yungas de la Cuidad de La Paz, la señora comienza su jornada de trabajo desde muy temprenas horas de la mañana.  Ella vive con sus hijos y su esposo quien cuenta con un trabajo fijo y colabora on los gasto generados dentro de la familia.  La cliente invertira el dinero del prestamo en la compra de insumos para su puesto de venta y cambiara algunos artefactos (calderas y tazas).
description_translated:
Liliana is in her seventh individual loan cycle. She has worked with the Institution since 2007. She also has another loan in its second loan cycle. She has never had problems with her payments. She sells breakfast in the Yungas market in the city of La Paz. She starts her trip to work in the very early hours of the morning. She lives with her children and her husband, who has a steady job and contributes to the family expenses. She will use the money from the loan to buy supplies for her sales location. She will also buy some new utensils (kettles and cups).

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Buy supplies for her sales location
