description:
Frances A. is from the village of Magting, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 25 years old and single. To make a living, Frances owns & operates specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling electronic cellphones to local community members. Frances is just starting this business.

Frances joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Frances is requesting a new loan of 5000 Philippine pesos (or about $125 US). This will be used as additional working capital, and is the first loan Frances has taken out from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
loan_use: To generate additional working capital.

description:
Luz S. is from the village of Canicapan. She is 51 years old, is married, and has three adult children.

Luz operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for ten years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Luz joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
loan_use: To purchase additional piglets to raise

description: Oriundo de la provincia de Tarma, emigró a Lima con sus pequeños hijos de su primer compromiso, a fin de brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. César empezó a vender desayuno hace diez años en una carreta ambulatoria, en ese entonces ayudaba a Catalina Barra Vilca, quien ahora es su esposa, con quien tuvo dos hijos más. Durante los seis meses que trabajó con ella ahorró un pequeño capital invirtiéndolo en un carrito para trabajar en la venta de desayuno pero ahora de manera independiente; con los ingresos de este negocio les dieron a sus hijos educación escolar, compraron un pequeño terreno. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD lo invirtió en la construcción de su vivienda, posteriormente compró abarrotes con un pequeño capital para empezar con  esta venta, lo que generó ganancias y actualmente es una pequeña tiendita surtida, gracias a los créditos que recibió de nuestra institución durante este año y medio. El préstamo reciente lo invirtió en su matrimonio, y piensa seguir invirtiendo en su tienda a fin de terminar en la ampliación de su casa.
description_translated:
Originally from the province of Tarma, César moved to Lima with his small children from his first marriage in order to provide them with a better quality of life. For the past ten years César has sold breakfast from an ambulatory cart. He was helping Catalina, who has now become his wife. They have two children together. During the six months that he worked with Catalina, he has saved a little bit of capital. They invested this money in their own little cart that they use to sell breakfast. They now are independent business people. With the investment in this business they have provided an education for their children and have purchased a small plot of land. With the first loan that they received from “EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD" they invested in the construction of a house. Previously he bought groceries with a small amount of capital in order to start a small grocery store. The store has generated income and actually is a small store with a variety of items thanks to the loans that he received from our institution during the last year and a half. With his most recent loan he invested in his wife’s business and he hopes to continue investing in his store until he finishes building his home.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy supplies

description:
Marites A.'s main source of income comes from harvesting and selling wild caught fish to local community members. She is 29 years old, married and has four school-age children. They are from the village of Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. Marites has been in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Marites joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Marites is requesting a loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials to repair a fishing net. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the family's income.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
loan_use: To purchase materials to repair a fishing net

description:
Norma L. is from the village of San Isidro Bajo. She is 50 years old. Norma is a widow with four adult children. To make a living, Norma sells a variety of products to local community members. Norma has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately Php 2,000.00 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Norma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norma is requesting a loan of  5,000 PHP, which will be used to expand the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Norma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
loan_use: To purchased additional products to sell

description: Felicitas is very lucky to have a good and loving husband, neighbors usually say to Felicitas. She is the manager of her own general store in their rural village of Catabban Burgos, Isabela. She is married to Livegildo D., a kind and hard working farmer. While Felicitas is taking care of her general store, her husband manages their farm lot and maintains their hog raising business. The couple helps each other to improve their living situation, to become progressive and give their five children a better living. Through their business with hard work, patience, sacrifice, loyalty, and faith in God, they successfully sent their children to school though their youngest still is studying at the moment. To further maintain their business, Felicitas is asking the support of Kiva to lend her the amount of PHP10,000 as additional business capital. She promises to work hard so that somehow she will be able to pay the loan and become successful someday to prove to others that “poverty is not a hindrance to success”.
loan_use: Additional capital

description:
Rowena is married to Angelito A. and they are fortunately blessed with an only child named Owen Angelo. He is now 8 years old and is currently attending the elementary level of education. Her husband is operating a passenger transport business where most of the passengers are students going to and from their village to school in their town proper. Rowena is engaged in a typical village store business. She provides most of their daily basic necessities at home while some of her income was used to send her children to school. She is thankful for having her business beneficial to her family needs, and she hopes to sustain the business for their growing needs, especially when her two children go to college. Her dream is to become a successful businesswoman and give her children a better future someday. 

She is requesting additional business capital for her store from Kiva. She hopes to improve her business and sustain it for the future welfare of her children. She knows that being patient and working hard are the keys to a successful enterprise, thus Rowena keeps doing her best to able meet the standards in managing business.
loan_use: additional capital

description:
MRS. ELNA P. is 43 years old, married with 3 children and a resident of Purok Paglaum, Brgy Atipuluhan, Bago City, Negros Occidental.

When she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon 12 years ago, she learned that poverty is not a hindrance to success and she lived by these words - she strived harder in order to improve her family's quality of life.

She started by selling a variety of delicacies and later ventured into pig fattening to supplement her income. Now on her 14th loan cycle, Elna is borrowing PHP 15,000.00 to buy more piglets to raise and sell.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.
loan_use: ADDITIONAL CAPITAL FOR HER HOG RAISING VENTURE

description:
Virgie P. is a 38-year-old farmer and single mother with one child. She also raises chickens as a means of additional income. She owns a 6-hectare farm. She is worried because the farm has remained unplanted. She has decided to utilize the farm for growing vegetables, coconuts, and rice.

She would like to ask for a loan of 6,000 PHP to be able to get started in her plan. She will use the loan to purchase four bags of ammonium sulfate, as well as farm chemicals. She is a very optimistic woman and hopes very much for the possibility of success in her business.

Now, she is actively involved in the CEVI credit program. She receives not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.
loan_use: To purchase four bags of ammonium sulfate, as well as farm chemicals

description:
Señora Marlene appears in this photo in her sewing workshop together with her 16-year-old granddaughter. Marlene's sewing workshop is located within her home. She is 57 years old and has five adult children. Her husband is a carpenter who works independently.

Marlene has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos through her communal bank, "Nuevas Amigas" (New Friends), since the communal bank's founding nine years ago. Marlene invested in the sale of candies with her very first loan of 300 soles (about $100). At that time she was also studying sewing, and has devoted herself to sewing as a full time business venture for the past seven years. Marlene plans to use this loan of 1500 soles to invest in materials for her business (including fabrics, thread, etc.). Marlene's goal is to eventually have her own boutI., complete with show windows and mannequins, where she can display her clothing.

Marlene is pleased to be working with Manuela Ramos and is grateful for the organization's financial support. Combining her own efforts with the help of loans from Manuela Ramos, she was able to purchase her sewing machine. Marlene continues to develop as a microentrepreneur.
loan_use: Materials for sewing (fabrics, thread, etc.)

description: “Strive hard to achieve your dreams in life,” says Erlinda B.. She is a farmer in the of village in Barangay Inaban Dupax del Norte in Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Leonardo B. and they are blessed with five children. The couple has been farming since childhood. And because of life's difficulties, they were not able to send their children to college. Instead, they sent them to the high school level only, but some of their children are still studying in elementary level and one is patiently coping with his high school studies. \r\n\r\nErlinda wants to borrow a loan from Kiva of PHP 10,000.00. If she is given the chance, Erlinda will invest the amount in their rice farming business and plans to buy a piglet that will be beneficial to her family when it grows and is sold to buyers. Erlinda is also planning to venture into the vegetable-selling business for additional income.  She hopes that Kiva lenders will assist her in uplifting their family from poverty.
loan_use: Additional working capital

description:
Señora Nery has two business ventures. She prepares and sells typical regional foods in front of her home in the evenings and also does sewing work, specializing in undergarments. She is 40 years old and is a single parent to four children, two of whom are still minors. She lives with her children in the city of Pucallpa.

Nery has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for about seven years and belongs to the communal bank "Nuevas Amigas" (“New Friends”). Nery invested her very first loan of 300 soles (about $100) in purchasing a semi-industrial sewing machine.

Nery plans to invest this loan of 1,200 soles in both of her current business ventures. She will buy food to prepare meals for her evening restaurant business and she will also buy materials for her sewing work.

Nery's goal is to improve the interior of her house in order to make part of it into a sewing workshop. She would also like to construct a better space from which to sell her meals in the evenings. Nery is grateful for the help she has received from Manuela Ramos, particularly because the organization serves women entrepreneurs who have few financial resources.
loan_use: To buy food for her restaurant business and materials for sewing undergarments

description:
In this photo, Señora Lizbeth shows her jewelery catalogs and the few products she has left after having had a month of good sales.  Lizbeth sells clothes, costume jewelry and other merchandise.  She works independently with the loans she receives from the Kiva partner, Manuela Ramos.  Lizbeth is thirty-three years old and is married with two young children.  Her husband is a high school teacher.  The family lives in the city of Pucallpa.  

Lizbeth has been working with Manuela Ramos for about ten years and belongs to the communal bank "Nuevas Amigas" (New Friends).  With her first loan of 300 soles (about $100), she purchased regional farm products such as plantain and chickens to later resell in the city.  Lizbeth will use this loan of 1600 soles to purchase clothing and costume jewelery to sell.  All of her merchandise is ordered in advance by her customers.

Lizbeth's goal is to construct a second story for her house.  Once this construction is finished, Lizbeth plans to convert the first floor into a store where she can display her merchandise and hopefully increase her sales.  Lizbeth is grateful for the financial assistance she has received from Manuela Ramos.  She also appreciates the educational sessions (about how to expand and improve one's business) given by Manuela Ramos' loan officers at each monthly meeting of her communal bank.
loan_use: To buy clothing and costume jewelry to sell

description:
Conchita D. is 36 years old, married to Fernando. She manages a village store and lives in Aguinaldo Cordon, Isabela. They have a nine-year-old son named Richard, and he is now in the elementary level.  

Conchita is maintaining her store in order to generate a daily income for her family, especially for her child’s education. The store keeps growing and her desire to improve it motivates her to be more patient and hard-working. She also decided to request a loan from Kiva amounting to PHP 5,000 as additional capital to be used for her store.  

Conchita is looking for the benefits of her family; that is why she is so diligent and patient. Also her husband is sacrificing a lot for them. Her child Richard gives them the inspiration to move on and keep life going.
loan_use: additional capital for her store

description: Georgia is a 7th grade drop-out, married with 6 children. For the period of 10 years, Georgia has been involved in a tabletop marketing business which allowed her to send her children to school until the completion of high school. Georgia is dreaming of educating all of her children and providing good medical attention for all of them.
loan_use: buying bags of rice, gallons of oil, etc. for retail sale
borrower_names: Siah, Siah, Siah, Georgia F., Tenneh

description:
Préstamo anterior: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 101969&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Gloria  es socia del Bancomunal El Triunfo. 
Gloria esta en el negocio de  venta de ropa, de segunda importada, tiene un puesto alquilado con su hermano. 
Gloria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles,  de dos  sacos de ropa de invierno.
El préstamo  es de gran ayuda  por que puede tener su puesto surtido.
El sueño de Gloria es tener una tienda para vender su ropa y seguir prosperando.
description_translated:
Previous loan: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 101969&_tpos=7&_tpg=1 Gloria is a member of the cooperative bank El Triunfo. Gloria sells second-hand, imported clothing; she and her brother rent a site. She needs a loan of $350 to buy two sacks of winter clothing. The loan is a great help because she can keep her site well-stocked. Gloria's dream is to have a clothes store and continued prosperity.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: two sacks of winter clothing

description:
La señora SILVIA SOLEDAD S. D. A. , tiene 49 años, vive en el distrito deL Porvenir  , provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco ESPERANZA DEL MAÑANA
La empresaria presenta estudios 5to D. secundaria, tiene 3 hijos D. 28, 27 y 25  años quienes no  depenD. económicamente D. ella.
SILVIA  se dedica a la elaboración D. artesanía y manualidades, como: chompas, tapetes, cojines, manteles, aretes, collares, anillos, etc.
El primer crédito D. 300 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra materiales para sus manualidades como: hijos, alambres, piedras, broches, cierres, etc.
Este crédito D. 1,200 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra D. mas materiales como: lanas, hilos, perlas, piedras, lentejuelas, algodón, relleno, etc.
 SILVIA  sueña con tener un stand en un centro comercial donD. pueda vender su artesanía y lograr ventas mayores.
description_translated:
Sra. Silvia Soledad S. D. A. is 49 years old and lives in the district of El Porvenir in Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She belongs to the Communal Bank “Esperanza del Mañana” (Hope of Tomorrow).

This entrepreneur completed her education through the 5th year of secondary school. She has 3 children (ages 28, 27, and 25) who are financially independent. Silvia is a craftswoman who makes handmaD. items such as sweaters, rugs, cushions, tablecloths, earrings, necklaces, rings, etc. She used her first loan of 300 soles to buy handicraft materials such as wire, stones, pins, locks, etc.

Her current loan of 1200 soles will be used to purchase more materials such as wool, yarn, beads, stones, sequins, cotton, batting, etc. Silvia dreams of having a vending post at the central market where she can sell her handicrafts and increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase handicraft materials

description:
La señora Gregoria es socia del Banco Comunal “Chijuyo Copapujo”, ubicado en Centro Poblado de Chijuyo Copapujo del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 50 años de edad, estado civil casada y madre de 3 hijos, ella es iletrada, vive en de Chijuyo Copapujo.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace mas de 2 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para su negocio de venta de sogas.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, con este monto ella va adquirir sogas para luego venderlos en las ferias de la zona.  Paralelamente se dedica a la crianza de ganado menor.

Su deseo es dedicarse a la venta de animales y compra de forraje.

A ella le gustan los ahorros las reuniones.
description_translated:
Sra. Gregoria is a member of the community bank “Chijuyo Copapujo”, located in the village of Chijuyo Copapujo, in the Ilave district, province of El Collao, department of Puno. She is 50 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children. She cannot read and lives in Chijuyo Copapujo.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for more than 2 years. Her first loan was for 300 soles, which served as capital for her business of selling ropes. Currently she requires an additional loan, which she is requesting for the sum of 500 soles. With this amount, she will buy ropes to later sell in the regional markets. In parallel, she is also breeding small livestock. Her wish is to sell animals and buy forage crops. She likes saving and the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To purchase ropes

description:
La señora Maruja pertenece al Banco Comunal “3 De Mayo II”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 37 años de edad, estado civil conviviente, es madre de 07 hijos y tiene estudios de primaria incompleta, (3er grado), vive en el Barrio Chacarilla Alta.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace varios años,  con un préstamo inicial de S/. 200.00 nuevos soles,  para la preparación de salteñas (alimento de la zona. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de pan e insumos para la preparación de salteñas (alimento de la zona). Ella también tiene un puesto de venta de chifles solo los días de ferias.

Su deseo es seguir con su trabajo para darles una educación a sus hijos.

A ella le gusta la cuenta interna (ahorros) y la forma de trabajo.
description_translated:
Mrs. Maruja belongs to the May 3 II (“3 de Mayo II”) Community Bank, which is located in the district of Puno, in the province of Puno, in the department of Puno. She is 37 years old, lives with her partner, is the mother of 7 children, and has completed the 3rd year of primary school. She lives in the Chacarilla Alta neighborhood. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for many years. She used an early loan of 200 nuevos soles to make salteñas (a regional food, similar to an empanada). At present, she needs a loan for 500 nuevos soles to buy bread and supplies to make salteñas. She also has a stand, where she sells chifles (fried green plantains) only at fairs. Her dream is to continue her work so that she can provide an education to her children. She likes taking account of her finances (savings), and she enjoys her work.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy bread and supplies to make salteñas, a regional food similar to an empanada

description:
Shaban J., age 34, is married with two children, ages 5 and 1 year. He has a chicken business, which he started in 2007.  He works from 6am to 9pm daily and is able to earn a monthly profit of about $.65. 

This will be Shaban’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to increase the stock of his business and has paid the loans back successfully. He now hopes for a new loan to increase his stock even more by buying more chicks.

Shaban will share this loan with subgroup A of the Puma group. The subgroup has six members who own shops and a salon, and sell clothes, sarong and dry food. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Shaban is the only man.
loan_use: To increase stock of chickens, and start clothing sales
borrower_names: Hawa, Shabani, Sophia, Shaban, Zaituni, Halima
borrower_genders: female, male, female, male, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Margaret is a 55-year-old married woman with four children between 10 and 27 years old.  Three of her children are in school. The eldest child is working. She resides in and owns a one-room house where she is staying with six people. Margaret doesn’t take care of any additional family members.  There is electricity and piped water at her home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area where she owns a stall selling bananas in Kalerwe market.  She doesn’t incur any transport costs as she buys from her place of work.  Margaret sells to an average of 25 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works six days a week. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and feeding the family.  She has been in this business for the last 10 years. Margaret has been with MCDT for eight years and is servicing her 16th loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more clusters of bananas. Margaret aspires to see her business grow bigger and to own a permanent home. 
 

.
loan_use: To buy more banana clusters

description: “Patience is the key to success,” says Shirley, village store owner in San Antonio, Jones, Isabela. She wants her business to grow for the welfare of her children. With the full support of her husband, Shirley has been able to maintain her business for almost 25 years and still counting.  She would like to take out a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 5,000 as additional capital to expand her business.  She is planning to buy various sorts of merchandise such as vegetables, meat, and fish.  She is a very hard-working entrepreneur and always believes that having that attitude ensures her ability to become a progressive individual.
loan_use: additional working capital

description:
Merlinda is known as a woman who is full of fighting spirit and strong determination. For her, as she puts it, “Poverty is not a hindrance in achieving one's dream in life. Just work diligently and face all the trials that will come along." She adds, "Don’t let anyone or anything bring you down." Merlinda dreams of giving her children a complete education despite their difficulties in life. She says that she will do everything she can for the sake of attaining their dreams for her children.

Merlinda is engaged in a retail business: specifically, a general store. She also raises livestock. To allow for a continuous business growth, she is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 7,000, which will to be used for the maintenance of her businesses. She plans to purchase food, supplies, and additional goods for the store.

Merlinda is 41 years old and married to Rodolfo, a Jeep transport driver. The couple have six children, five of whom are in school. Her youngest is just a year old. She hopes that through her patience and diligence, she will be able to fulfill her dreams of expanding her business to sustain the needs of her children.
loan_use: To purchase food, supplies, and additional goods for the store.

description: B. Edward is the leader of his group in Jinja. He is a responsible and hard -working married man with 6 children aged 16 – 4 years and all in school as he cares for 4 orphans belonging to his late brothers and sisters. His business is buying timber and transporting it from deep in the villages and this alone is a challenge that he is living with. He has had the business for 7 years and at the moment makes some good profit that enables him to pay his children’s school fees and general upkeep.\r\n\r\nEdward’s goal is to increase his stock of timber so that he can make more profit out of it to be able to educate all his children to university level. He needs a loan to help him buy more timber for resale. Also in the photo is Richard, the Officer in charge of the group.
loan_use: Buying more timber for resale
borrower_names: Isooba, Rehema, Fred, Cosma, David, Madina, Edward, Jesca, Edward, Jackson, Jamawa
borrower_genders: female, female, male, female, male, female, male, female, male, male, male
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, false, true, true, false, true, true

description:
La señora Felipa  es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Retamas”, en el distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 59 años de edad, estado civil casada, tiene 8 hijos (dos independientes), ella estudió educación primaria incompleta (1er grado), vive en el Barrio Chanu Chanu.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 2 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que lo utilizo en su negocio de preparación de chicharrón.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, y lo invertirá en su actual negocio de venta de chicharrón,  comprara carne de chicharrón, papas, chuño, ocas, camote, etc. también hace huatia de ocas y camote (comidas típicas) y lo vende en el mercado, siempre hay clientes. 

Su deseo es comprar materiales para construir su casa.

A ella le gustan los ahorros, las reuniones y las charlas de capacitación.
loan_use: Para la compra de carne de chicharrón, papas, chuño, ocas, camote, etc.

description:
La señora Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal “Central Progreso”, en el distrito de Cuturapi, provincia de Yunguyo, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 35 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 4 hijos.  Ella estudió primaria completa, vive en el Centro poblado de Chimbo.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto con el cual pudo adquirir ganado menor.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para poder adquirir ganado menor, y ropa de abrigo como casacas los cuales los lleva por pedido a Kalana.

Su deseo es poner una tienda bien grande y surtida en su centro poblado.

A ella le gustan las charlas y las facilidades de préstamo.
description_translated:
Nancy is a member of the Central Progreso Community Bank in the Cuturapi district, Yunguyo province, Puno department. She is 35, married, and has four children. She has an elementary school education. She lives in town of Chimbo. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bought small livestock. She currently needs a loan for 1,500 PEN to buy small livestock and warm clothes like jackets, which she will take on order to Kalana. Her wish is to set up a large, stocked store in her town. She likes the talks and the simplicity of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Buy sheep and jackets

description:
Gema P.'s main source of income comes from selling cosmetics and clothing products in her community. She is 27 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the village of Barangay 3, Talakag, Bukidnon. Gema has been in business for over one year and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Gema joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Gema is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the income of her family and support the education of her children.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
loan_use: To purchase additional cosmetics and clothing to sell

description:
La señora Maria Cristina es socia del Banco Comunal “Flor de Canela”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 60 años de edad, de estado civil soltera y es madre de 02 hijos, ella pudo estudiar solo la primaria completa.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para la preparación de comida.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional de S/. 600.00 Nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para poder comprar papa, arroz, carne, aceite, combustible, etc. Para poder preparar comida que vende en forma ambulatoria y también atiende pedidos.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando así ayudar a sus hijos y luego poner un restaurante.

A ella le gustan las reuniones y las facilidades en los pagos
description_translated:
Señora Maria Cristina is a member of the Flor de Canela (Cinnamon Flower) Community Bank in the district of Puno, Puno province, Puno department. She is 60 years old, single, has two children, and completed her primary education. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos organisation for one year. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy ingredients for making food. She now needs an additional loan of 600 soles to buy potatoes, rice, meat, oil, and fuel etc so that she can prepare food which she sells in the street. She also accepts orders. Maria Cristina wishes to continue working so that she can help her children and open a restaurant. She enjoys the meetings and the credit facilities associated with her bank.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: to buy potatoes, rice, meat, oil, fuel etc

description:
La señora Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres progresivas”, ubicado en la el distrito de Asillo, provincia de Azangaro, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 40 años de edad, es conviviente y es madre de 02 hijos, ella estudió educación primaria completa.  Vive en la comunidad Casa Blanca.


La señora Nancy es socia nueva, ella requiere un primer préstamo es de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvirá para comprar ganado menor (ovinos).  Esta actividad la realiza solo una vez a la semana en las ferias regionales.

Su deseo es comprarse una casa en Juliaca.

A ella le gustan y las reuniones entre Bancos Comunales.
description_translated:
Sra. Nancy is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Progresivas” (Progressive Women), which is located in the District of Asillo, Azangaro Province, Department of Puno. She is 40 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 2 children. She completed her elementary school education and lives in the community of Casa Blanca. Sra. Nancy is a new member and is requesting her first of loan of 500 soles to buy small livestock (sheep). She conducts her business once a week when she travels to the regional fairs. She hopes to buy a house in Juliaca. Sra. Nancy enjoys her Communal Bank meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase sheep for fattening

description: La señora Juanita P. C. es una señora grande de edad y no por ello le impide ser una mujer  emprendedora y llena de ganas de trabajar y salir adelante. Desde hace tres años coloco un negocio en un cuarto de su casa con el deseo de hacerlo mas grande, la señora comenta que empezó con poco capital y con el tiempo las ganancias le permitirán surtir mas su tienda de abarrotes. Ahora ella muy preocupada por que su negocio prospere al igual que ella y su familia quiere invertirle para que así puedan ver más ganancias y seguir con su proyecto.\nSu esposo es un agricultor de alfalfa  que la vende a otras partes de la ciudad y rancherías de por aquí cerca, su hija siempre esta al pendiente de ellos y con sus ingresos ayuda a los gastos que se tienen en la vivienda.\n
loan_use: Surtir su negocio de Abarrotes

description:
Annabelle S. is from the village of Naasag, Mambajao Camiguin. She is 33 years old. Annabelle is separated from her spouse and has 3 school aged children. To make a living, Annabelle owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Annabelle has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Annabelle joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annabelle is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Annabelle from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
loan_use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

description: N. Alice is a widow that is taking care of her 3 children of which 2 are still in school and she works so hard to ensure that their school dues payments are on time. Alice has a retail shop in Bajjo since 1998 and is blessed with the help of her children in managing the shop in times when she is not around and attending to other duties. She also has a restaurant in the same area and prepares local foods and sauce for 1 year. She says that she managed to utilize her profits and savings to start up the restaurant business and vies to continue expanding it with the more profits and savings derived from the retail shop. She needs a loan to help restock her shop with more products.
loan_use: Buying more products for her retail shop's expansion so as to make more profits.
borrower_names: Immaculate, Monica, Sarah, Justine, Esther, Sophie, Faridah, Faridah, Suzan, Alice, Michael, Majorine, Florence
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, male, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, false, true, true, true, true

description:
Irene es socia del Banco Comunal Bonanza.
Irene es casada, tiene 42 años y 4 hijos, Irene se dedica a la siembra de papa, producto que vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, además Irene se dedica a la crianza de animales.
Irene necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de abono para la siembra de papa.
Los sueños de Irene son construir su casa, educar a sus hijos y comprar un carro.
description_translated:
Irene belongs to the Bonanza Village Bank. She is 42-years-old, and married with four children. She earns her living growing potatoes, which she sells at the wholesale market in the city of Ayacucho. She also raises animals. Irene is seeking a loan of 1200 soles, which she'll use to buy fertilizers for growing potatoes. She dreams of building her house, educating her children, and buying a car.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy fertilizer for growing potatoes.

description: Vong S., age 37, is married and has three school-aged children. She lives with her husband and children in Phnom Penh. To make a living, she buys palm sugar from the local farmers in her village and resells it at the provincial town, typically earning an income of US $3.00 per day in revenue. She is assisted by her husband, a public school teacher who earns US $3.00 per day.\r\n\r\nThe financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, S. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, S. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US $600 to purchase more palm sugar to expand he inventory. By doing so, she believes that she will be able to provide a good standard of living for her family.
loan_use: To buy more palm sugar

description: Carol M. is from the village of Banlag, Valencia City. She is 30 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Carol owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In May 2009, Carol joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Carol is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
loan_use: To purchase additional products to sell

description: Armando tiene 47 años, es un padre de familia dedicado, vive al lado de su esposa y sus 2 hijos. Hace 5 años decidió crear su propia fuente de ingresos, para ello, abrió una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, la cual con el tiempo ha crecido y hoy es un minimarket que abastece a sus clientes con todo tipo de comestibles de primera de necesidad y otros diversos artículos. Debido a la gran variedad de los productos que ofrece se ha ganado la preferencia de sus clientes, quienes reciben una buena atención, que es el valor agregado que les brida Armando y su esposa. Para el futuro, esta pareja de esposos quieren seguir creciendo en su negocio y tener un local más amplio y con mayor variedad de productos. Esta es la primera vez que Armando tiene un crédito con MFP, es un nuevo integrante de su banco comunal, por lo que se compromete a ser responsable en sus pagos. El dinero que viene solicitando será utilizado en la compra de mercadería en menestras y detergentes.
description_translated:
Armando is a 47-year-old father and husband devoted to his two children and wife. Five years ago he decided to go into business for himself and opened a small grocery store in his home. His business has grown and over time become a mini-market that provides his customers with a tremendous variety of high quality goods. Armando and his wife are very attentive and offer such a wide range of goods; they have won over their customers. They would like to continue to grow their business, having a bigger space and an even wider array of products. This is the fist time Armando is applying for a loan with MFP as he is a new member of his communal bank. He promises to pay his loan back responsibly. He plans to buy vegetables and detergents with the loan money.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: increase merchandise

description: Felicita tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en la casa que heredó de sus padres. Se dedica a la venta de comida, desde su juventud ha vendido de manera ambulante platillos al paso, pero actualmente ya cuenta con su propio local donde ofrece desayunos, almuerzos y cenas. Sus principales clientes son los trabajadores de los diferentes talleres de mecánica automotriz que abundan alrededor de su establecimiento y conocen de la buena sazón de Felicita. Debido a las buenas ganancias que le proporciona su pequeño restaurante ha decidió continuar dedicándose a este rubro y mejorar la apariencia de su local. Esta es la sexta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, Felicita tiene grandes deseos de seguir realizando un trabajo solidario con los demás integrantes de su banco comunal. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de utensilios para su establecimiento, asó como la renovación de su estante y sus mesas.
loan_use: Compra de utensilios y muebles para su negocio

description:
Delfina es socia del Banco Comunal Sarita.
Delfina casada, tiene 42 años y 5 hijos, Delfina vende ropa a pedido que ofrece a amigos y familiares, la mayor parte de sus ventas son al crédito, además compra quesos de la comunidad de Totos y lo vende de casa en casa.
Delfina necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de quesos.
Los sueños de Delfina son que sus hijos sean profesionales y hacer crecer su negocio.
description_translated:
Delfina is a member of the Sarita Communal Bank. She is 42 years old, married and has five children. Delfina sells clothing on order that she offers to her friends and family. For the most part, her sales are on credit. She also buys cheeses from the community of Totos and sells them door-to-door. Delfina needs a loan of 600 Sols which she will use to buy cheese. Delfina dreams of her children becoming working professionals and of building up her business.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy cheese

description:
Eusebio B. is 58 years old and owns a 3-hectare farm in Trento, Agusan del Sur. He has been farming since 1960. He has six children and a supportive wife who also helps him with managing the farm. He is a proud CEVI client. He said he has been requesting loans from CEVI for a quite long time already and is currently hoping to get his seventh loan.

He told CEVI that he needs additional capital to run his farm. He said that he definitely needs PHP 15,000 to be able to buy good quality rice seeds and to pay the laborers who help prepare the land.

He is pleased with services of Community Economic Ventures Inc. He still would want to request its services in the future.
loan_use: To buy rice seeds for his farm and be able to pay laborers

description:
Vivian B. is from the village of Zone 1, Luyong Bonbon Opol, Misamis Oriental. She is 51 years old, and is a widow with three adult children. To make a living, Vivian owns and operates a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling pork and chicken meat in the local community. Vivian has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Vivian joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vivian is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the needs of her relatives and family members.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
loan_use: To purchase additional products to sell

description: Titi E. is 70 years old and married with six children. She lives in Warri with her family. She sells provisions. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. Thanks to Kiva lenders.
loan_use: To purchase more provisions to sell

description:
Rosa is 29 years old and is married with one child. She runs a small home-based grocery shop. She also has a food stand at a local company, where she sells lunch daily to its workers. Rosa’s husband works as a bricklayer. She can count on his support for her business ventures.

Rosa has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for three years and is a member of the communal bank “Madres Coraje” (Mothers with Courage). Rosa plans to use this loan of 1000 soles to buy products for her shop as well as food items, including oil and rice, for her lunch business.

Rosa’s goal is to improve and grow her grocery business. She also wants to someday have a home-based restaurant.
loan_use: To buy items for a grocery shop and a lunch business

description:
Doña Ricarda es originaria de Managua, Capital de Nicaragua; Ciudad céntrica para el comercio y de mucha conglomeración. 

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, sobre todo ropa para damas y caballeros y en algunos casos vende ropa de niño, pero muy pocas veces, nos dice doña Ricarda, debido a que no tiene mucha demanda.

Ella desea poder poner un tramo en el mercado Roberto Huembes, donde su hermana está actualmente trabajando y cree lograrlo con la ayuda de los créditos que ADIM le vaya facilitando y conforme al crecimiento de estos.

Es su tercer ciclo en ADIM, pero tiene muy buenas expectativas puesto que nunca ha quedado mal con sus cuotas. Su crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa surtida para no tener que pedir crédito a su hermana y así ganar mucho más en su negocio.
description_translated:
Ms. Ricarda is originally from Managua, the capital city of Nicaragua, a city central for trade and conglomeration.

She sells clothing mainly for men and women but occasionally for children, although very rarely, Ms. Ricarda tells us because there isn't a lot of demand for it.

She wants to have a stretch in the market "Roberto Huembes" where he sister works and she thinks that with the help of the loan from ADIM this will be possible and she can expand her business.

This is her third loan cycle with ADIM and she has very high expectations because she has never been late with her dues. She will invest the loan in buying a selection clothing so that she doesn't have to borrow from her sister and can increase her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Buying a selection of clothing for sale

description:
Aurea es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.
Aurea es casada, tiene 45 años y 7 hijos, Aurea viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende verduras y panes, y de las ferias compra cereales, animales, sus ventas los realiza en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho de manera ambulatoria.
Aurea necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales.
El sueño de Aurea es mejorar su negocio.
description_translated:
Aurea is a member of the Arco Iris Community Bank. Aurea, 45, is married and has seven children. Aurea travels to different regional fairs to sell vegetables and bread. At the fairs she buys grains and animals. She then sells them in an ambulatory manner at the markets in the city of Ayacucho. Aurea needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy grains. Aurea’s dream is to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Buy grains

description: Doña Rosa Amelia  trabaja como docente en en la colonia la Fonseca  a 35 km de Nueva Guinea desde hace 20 años, esta solicitando su 3er  crédito a AFODENIC para inventirlo en pintar la casa y hecharle el piso a la cocina, tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad que a pesar que no los tiene a cargo economicamente viven con ella en su casa y le ayudan con los gastos familiares del hogar,  se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy responsable y un ejemplo en su comunidad, pues enseñó a sus hijos buenos valores, a trabajar y a estudiar para ser personas de bien;  Rosa Amelia es una mujer muy querida en su colonia y en su centro de trabajo por ser una persona de buen vivir, responsable, trabajadora y  sociable en su comunidad, su sueño es mejorar sus condiciones de vida y llegar a conocer a sus nietos, salud y que su familia siempre permanezca unida.
description_translated:
Doña Rosa Amelia has been a teacher for 20 years in the town of Fonseca, which is 35 kilometers from New Guinea. She is requesting her 3rd loan from AFODENIC so that she can paint her house and install a kitchen floor. Her two adult children are financially independent, but they still contribute toward the family expenses.

Doña Rosa Amelia is known for being a very responsible woman and a role model in her community. She has taught her children good values, work ethic, and how to become good people. She is loved by many in the neighborhood. At the core of her work she tries to be a person that lives well, is responsible, works hard, and socializes within the community. Doña Rosa Amelia hopes to improve her living conditions, get to know her grandchildren, stay healthy, and always keep her family together.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: House painting & installation of a kitchen floor

description:
Magali is a member of The Dawn village bank. She is 37 years-old, lives with her partner, and has three children who are 14, 12, and 3. They are studying in the public school.

Magali started an education but didn’t get to apply it because she got married and left on a trip to Argentina, but things didn’t work out and she had to return. She constantly suffered beatings by her husband to the point where she had to go to the hospital.

This is when she decided to start selling clothes. She bought three shirts for little girls and two pairs of pants. She succeeded in selling them and then bought more. Since then, Magali has sold clothes for a living. Twelve years have passed, and she now has a partner that respects and supports her.

Since joining FINCA, Magali has learned to value herself as a woman and to work toward her dreams. Magali needs a loan of 1400 PEN to buy discounted clothes and footwear. Her dream is to see her daughters grow up and become professionals.
loan_use: To buy discounted clothes and footwear to sell.

description: Diomedes is 47 years old and he is managing a repair shop, he is skillful in repairing some damage appliances such as electric fan, washing machine, iron and other appliances. He wants to double his income in order to provide the needs of his family. He is hoping that he could avail the loan that he is requesting which is amounting to PHP5, 000.00. The said amount will serve as a big help to have additional business capital to be able to increase his income. He works hard to be able to provide the needs of his family.
loan_use: additional capital

description:
La señora Maximiliana pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy II”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Camicachi de el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 47 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 05 hijos y tiene estudios de primaria incompleta (3er grado), vive en la parcialidad de Lupaza Maya Pamaya.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 04 meses,  con un préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles  para la compra de ganado mayor. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ganado vacuno para engorde, para luego venderlos en la feria de la zona.

Su deseo es seguir trabajando.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones.
description_translated:
Maximiliana belongs to the Manuela de Hoy II Community Bank, which is located in the Camicachi community, Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 47, married, and has five children. She has a third grade education. She lives in the Lupaza Maya Pamaya region. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for four months. With her initial loan for 500 PEN she bought large livestock. She currently needs a loan for 800 PEN to buy cattle to fatten. She will then sell them at the regional fair. Her wish is to keep working. She likes the savings and the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Buy cattle

description: Juliet T., the leader of her lending group in Bushenyi, is a 38-year-old lady who puts a great deal of determination and hard work into all of her business and general endeavors. She is a business lady with a hotel in Kitwe town along Mbarara-Bushenyi Road that has been running for six years. Juliet says that before she started preparing meals, she had only prepared tea and a few snacks, but with the help of loans, she was able to buy saucepans, forks, spoons and plates in addition to various foodstuffs that enabled her to expand her offerings. She is now able to make a net profit of 35,000 per week which enables her to save for her children’s education, food, health and clothing. \r\n\r\nJuliet is a mother of three children, a 20-year-old and an 18-year-old, both secondary school students, and a 13-month-old.  She dreams of owning a bigger hotel in town so that she can increase her customer base, and she is requesting a loan to help purchase more foodstuffs for resale in a boiled form in order to meet her customers' needs.
loan_use: Buying more foodstuffs for her restaurant.
borrower_names: Francis, Robert, Yonah, Josie, Eldah, Eva, James, Juliet, Agnes, Night, Aston, Eldard, Rehema
borrower_genders: male, male, male, female, female, female, male, female, female, female, female, male, female
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Inti.
Carmen es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 1 hijo, Carmen junto a su esposo tienen un taller de planchado y pintura en un local alquilado, además compran y venden carros.
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de repuestos.
Los sueños de carmen son tener casa propia y un taller propio.
loan_use: Para la compra de repuestos.

description:
Danny has been 15 years engage in his transportation business. This is the main source of his family’s daily income and he is hoping that his business will survive as long as he has the strength to operate his passenger tricycle. Danny would like to ask for financial assistance to finance the needed maintenance of his motorcycle thus he is requesting to avail a loan amounting to PHP5,000.00 to KIVA lenders. Aside from driving his passenger tricycle, Danny is also raising hogs in order to have an extra source of income. He has a big family and he is hoping to sustain their needs especially the studies of his children.


Danny is already 42 years old and he already has six children who are all studying. She is married to Sonia, who helps him in supporting the needs of their children. Danny hopes to provide the educational needs of her children because they also have dreams to finish their degrees in college. He is now currently sending three of his children in college that is why he uses his time wisely in his business just to provide them with sufficient financial support.
loan_use: additional capital

description: Rossemary C. Q., es una señora la cual quedo viuda hace un año atrás y desde entonces mantiene sola a sus 4 hijos, los dos mayores aportan trabajando eventualmente en cualquier trabajo que se les presente, la señora tambien trabaja acomodando algunos viveres y cobra a crédito, ella no saca montos fuertes pero tiene muchas ganas de tener con el tiempo un almacen mucho mas grande.
description_translated:
Rossemary C. Q. became a widow one year ago and since then she alone supports her 4 children. The two adult children contribute by working in whatever job that they find. She also works selling some products on credit. She doesn't earn a lot but she has the desire of having a larger store.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase of beer to sell at area festival

description:
Laila M., age 34 is married with one son of two years.  She has a grocery store which she started since 2006.   She works from 9am to10pm daily and she is able to earn a monthly profit of about $.113.

This will be Laila’s 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase on her business, bought chairs, empty crates and has paid the loans back successfully. She now hopes for a new loan to increase on business by buying a blender to start selling juice, is going to stat selling water whole sale and bites as well.

Laila will share this loan with her loan group, Ferrari which totals 19 members.  These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Laila  is second from left front row.
loan_use: To increase on business by buying a blender and start selling juice,water  whole sale and start selling bites.
borrower_names: Dayawa, Saida, Halima, Amina, Aida, Theophil, Rehema, Mpokigwe, Esther, Modesta, Laila, Zitta, Asha, Siraji, Iddi, Peace, Ashura, Stamil, Hamida
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, male, male, female, female, male, female
borrower_pictured: false, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
La señora Paula es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 51 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 06 hijos (solo 2 están a su cargo), estudio educación primaria incompleta (3do grado), vive en el Barrio Tupac Amaru  Av. Alfonso Ugarte 707.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 3 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invirtió en la compra de ovinos y cerdos. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 850.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ovinos y algunos chanchos para engorde, también se dedica a la artesanía en  bordado en bayeta.

Su sueño es continuar trabajando.

A ella le gustan las reuniones y los ahorros.
description_translated:
Paula is a member of the communal bank “Santa Rosa de Lima” that is located in the Juli district, Chucuito province, Puno. She is 51 years old, married, and is the mother of 6 children (only 2 are currently in her care). She completed only 3 years of primary education, and lives in the neighborhood Tupac Amaru Av. Alfonso Ugarte 707. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos organization for 3 years, her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, which she used to purchase sheep and pigs. She is currently requesting a loan of 850 nuevos soles to purchase more sheep and some pigs to fatten. She also does cloth embroidery. Her dream is to continue working. She enjoys saving, and attending the meetings of her communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: to purchase sheep and pigs

description:
Cesinia B., 46 years old, resides at Piao, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and is blessed with five children. Her husband is with the Philippine National Police but his income is not enough for the needs of their family, since their children are all in school.

The school tuition fees had been increased and Cesinia has to find ways on her own to support her husband. She owns a small sari-sari store started with a small amount of capital and she has been an active member of Paglaum since June 2007. She's thankful that Paglaum came to their place because she believes that it can help to put more capital into her business. She also enjoys its programs and services.
loan_use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

description:
Labour and Achieve, led by Massia K., is a group of five borrowers living in Kolahu, Lofa County, Liberia.

Massia is 41 years old and is married with six children age 7 to 30. She also cares for two children who were orphaned in the war. Her younger children are in school. Massia herself was unable to attend school because, although she enjoyed it, the cultural norm was for girls to rely on their husbands to provide, and therefore school was considered unnecessary. Massia lives in the remote city of Kolahu in rural Lofa County, the breadbasket of Liberia.

Massia’s business is retail dry goods, including oil, rice, salt, etc., which she buys wholesale from nearby Guinea and sells in a temporary market stall on the Kolahu-Foya highway. She has run her business for three years and is successful because of the way she treats her customers.

Massia is taking the loan to increase her inventory to meet increased demand. Her dream is to grow her business so she can one day have the biggest table in the central market. With the profits from her business she dreams of building her own house.
loan_use: To purchase oil, rice, and salt to increase her inventory

description: Graciela is a member of The Orchid Village Bank. She is 55 years-old and married. She had two children, but both died. However, she is happy to have two nieces who love her very much. Graciela sells breakfasts in the mornings with her husband. They have hired someone to help them. She has also begun another venture selling china sets. She sells them on Calle Pista Nueva in the district of San Juan. She works in the streets everyday until 5 in the afternoon. Graciela needs a loan of 1400 soles to buy glasses, cups, and pitchers. Her dream is to have a restaurant in another country. She would also like to visit her brother in Italy. Click to read about Graciela's first loan and second loan.
loan_use: To buy glasses, cups, and pitchers

description:
Doris es una persona trabajadora y jovial, ella  tiene 30 años de edad y es madre de tres niños, ella se dedica a la costura (lencería) para ello cuenta con una máquina de coser y una remalladota.  Su esposo se dedica a la venta de madera. 
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “ Las  Heroínas” desde hace un año. Doris empezó con un préstamo de 300 soles.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1800 soles, ella  invertirá parte de este dinero en la compra de telas, hilos, elástico, y la otra parte invertirá en el mantenimiento de su motocarro. 
La meta de Doris es tener su propio taller de costura y también tener un restaurante.
description_translated:
Doris is a hard worker and cheerful person. She is 30 years old and a mother of 3 children. She is a seamstress (linen goods) for which she uses a sewing machine and an industrial sewing machine. Her husband sells lumber.

Since a year ago, she is part of the Communal Bank “The Heroines.” Doris started with a loan of 300 soles. With this loan of S/.1800 soles, she will invest part of the money to buy fabrics, threads, and elastic; the other part she will invest in the maintenance of her motorcycle taxi.

Doris’ goals are to have her own sewing shop and have a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Buy fabrics, threads, elastics, etc.

description:
La señora Nicolasa es socia del Banco Comunal “Lucero del Amanecer”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Juliaca, Provincia de San Román, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 60 años de edad, estado civil soltera y es madre de 5 hijos, estudio educación primaria incompleta (2do de primaria), vive en el Barrio Alto Rinconada Av. Tupac Amaru s/n.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace varios años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, para invertirlo en su negocio de compra venta de golosinas. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de chocolates, caramelos, yogures, galletas, gaseosas, etc. Para venderlo en su puesto.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le gusta la facilidad en los prestamos así puede con facilidad aumentar en su capital para salir adelante.
description_translated:
Sra. Nicolasa is a member of the Morning Star Community Bank which is in the Juliaca district, the San Román Province, in the Puno Department. She is 60 years old and a single mother of 5 children. She studied through the 2nd grade of primary school and lives in the Alto Rinconada neighborhood on the street of Tupac Amaru. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for many years, and her first loan was for the amount of 300 New Soles, for investment in candles for her business. Currently she is seeking a loan of $525, for the purchase of chocolate, caramel, yogurt, crackers, soda, and other items to sell in her stand. Her wish is to continue to work. She likes the ease of the loans so that she can easily increase her capital to be able to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: For the purchase of chocolate, caramel, yogurt, crackers, soda, and other items

description: Las Socias del grupo “Margaritas” están representadas por la señora Alejandrina y conformado por 14 miembros los cuales 11 son mujeres y 3 los cuales se dedican a diferentes actividades como la venta D. joyas D. fantasías, cosméticos, comida, abarrotes, Dulces, al servicio D. limpieza y los varones se dedican a la construcción D. viviendas y al transporte publico D. pasajeros. La competencia dentro D. su rubros es alta pese a eso saben sacar adelante la actividad económica a la que se dedican. El crédito esta destinado al crecimiento D. sus negocios con la compra D. mercaderías, insumos y herramientas para mejorar más sus ingresos que les permitirá darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias van cursando su primer ciclo pero saben el trabajo en grupos solidarios gracias a créditos en otras instituciones similares a la Fundación Agrocapital. \n
description_translated:
The “Margaritas” Group is led by Sra. Alejandrina and consists of 14 members (11 women and 3 men). They are involved in different retail business selling products such as costume jewelry, cosmetics, food, groceries, and candy. Some have service businesses such as housekeeping. The men are involved in construction and public transportation. The competition in their area is high but they know how to succeed in their respective businesses.

This loan is intended to increase their businesses through the purchase of merchandise, supplies, and tools needed to improve their earnings. This will enable them to give their families a better quality of life. Regarding their credit experience, the members are starting their first loan cycle, but they know how solidarity groups operate because they have worked with other institutions similar to Fundación Agrocapital.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Operating capital
borrower_names: CAROLINA, MARIA ANEL, ESTELA, ELIANA, TEREZA, RONALD, MARIA ELIANA, SATURNINO, ALEJANDRINA, ROBERTO, INGRID, VERONICA, IVANA VEATRIZ, PETRONA
borrower_genders: female, female, female, female, female, male, female, male, female, male, female, female, female, female
borrower_pictured: true, false, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Matilde es socia del Bancomunal un Nuevo Día, es casada, tiene 39 años y tres hijos de 21, 19 y 8 años, los mayores trabajan y estudian en un instituto y el último está estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Matilde estudió contabilidad, consiguió un trabajo de conciliadora extrajudicial, trabaja en una casa de bienestar social en Pamplona (ubicado al sur de Lima) desde hace diez años, también se dedica  a las ventas de productos de belleza por catálogo.
Desde que ingreso a FINCA, ya no depende económicamente de su esposo, ahora tiene su propio capital y puede invertir, se siente más segura y muy contenta de pertenecer al Bancomunal.  
Matilde necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles para la compra de productos de belleza.
El sueño de Matilde es poner  un bazar de ropa  en su casa.
description_translated:
Matilde, 39, married, is a partner of Bancomunal un Nuevo Día (Communal Bank of a New Day) and has three children, aged 21, 19 and 8. The eldest children work and study in an institute and the youngest is studying in a state school. Matilde studied accounting which led to a job in out-of-court settlements and now she works in a social well-being house in Pamplona (to the south of Lima) where she has been for ten years. She also works selling beauty products through a catalogue. Since joining FINCA, she no longer depends financially on her husband. She has her own money to invest and feels more secure and very happy to belong to the Bancomunal. Matilde needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy beauty products. Matilde's dream is to have a clothes shop in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy beauty products.

description:
La señora Irma es socia del Banco Comunal “Generación 2000”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Santa Rosa Mazocruz, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 45 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 03 hijos, estudio educación primaria completa, vive en el Jr. Tupac Amaru S/N Villa Esperanza Mazocruz.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 11 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invirtió en la compra de lana y bayetas para bordados.

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de lanas de colores, bayetas, etc. Para la elaboración de bordados, también compra lana de alpaca para hacer tejidos en telar, que luego los lleva a Puno para su venta.

Su sueño es poner una tienda de venta de artesanías.

A ella le gustan las facilidades en los préstamos.
description_translated:
Irma is a member of the Generation 2000 Community Bank which is located in the Santa Rosa Mazocruz district, in El Callao province, Puno department. She is 45 years old, is married and is mother to three children. She completed elementary school. She lives in Jr. Tupac Amaru S/N Villa Esperanza Mazocruz. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for eleven years. Her initial loan was for 300 new "soles", which she invested in the purchase of wool and cloth for embroidery. At this time, she is requesting a loan of 1,000 new "soles" for the purchase of colored wool, cloth, etc. In order to create the embroidered pieces, she will also buy alpaca wool to make woven textiles which she will then take to Puno to sell. Her dream is to start a shop where she can sell her handicrafts. She likes the freedom these loans provide.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: For the purchase of colored wool, cloth and alpaca wool.

description: La señora Banny, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mi Sueño”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 28 años y es madre de 01 hijo, que  aun depende de ella.El espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de Venta de Cosméticos de la línea Unique, poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio  ubicado en su misma casa donde vende todo el día y también sale  a ofrecer casa por casa los productos que vende  a sus amistades. Tiene ya buen tiempo, trabajando en este negocio y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,100.00, comprará productos de belleza como: perfumes y colonias refrescantes, cremas corporales y de rostro, labiales y polvos compactos, así de esta manera mantener a sus clientes satisfechos y contentos.   Banny, se siente muy tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
loan_use: Comprará productos de belleza.

description:
Lourdes is 44 years old and married to Manuel, a truck driver. They are blessed with six children, three of whom are still studying. Their family lives in the village of Arcon Tumauini, Isabela which is located along the national highway and farming is the common source of income of the residents.  

Lourdes manages a small business located in the public market of Tumauini. She sells different dry goods like toys, accessories, personal necessities and some farm inputs that she sells at lower prices.  She also offers services like manicure and hair cutting in her stall for additional income.  She hopes that she will be able to have additional capital that she can use to purchase more fertilizer to increase her income.  Her retail business is very beneficial to her family so she always wants to expand her business.  With this, she wants a loan amounting to PHP4,000 that will help her to maintain and to expand her current business.
loan_use: Business Expansion

description:
Marylou E. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 19 years-old and single. Marylou owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling food and daily use products in the local community. Marylou is just starting this business.

In 2009, Marylou joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marylou is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:
