HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
loan_use: To purchase new items to expand product range

description:
Leticia is 32 years old.  She an d her family are living in the village of Arcon, Tumauini, Isabela. She is married to Elmer, a tricycle driver and they have three children: Erwin,12 years old, elementary student; Emerson, 11 years old , also in elementary level and Erick Jay, 3 years old. Leticia is working hard so she can able to help her husband in providing the needs of their family especially to meet the needs of their children.  
 
Leticia is engaged in the vending business.  She sells fish, food snacks and vegetables in their village. She also sells different items such as fruits whenever she has extra capital to use. She sells her products in three neighboring villages and she is able to earn a daily net income of PHP500.00.  Fish vending is her first business until she was able to expand into vegetables, fruits and snacks. 

She hopes to further improve it and hoping to have her own stall in their village. She would like to borrow a loan of PHP4, 000 from KIVA lenders that she can use in the business.  Leticia dreams of having her own general store in the future for bigger income.  She hopes to attain all her dreams by starting to save some of her profits from her existing business and with the help of lenders. She is praying that God may help her reach her dreams.
loan_use: Additional Capital

description: Mohamad is a 50-year-old single man living with his brother. He owns three rental homes which provide enough income to improve the lives of his brother and himself. Today, Mohamad wants to borrow $500 for repairs and maintenance on a rental home.
loan_use: Maintenance for a rental home

description:
Mark Lester is 20 years old and already married to Miracmelie. They are both striving hard to make their marriage successful and have a better life.  They live in Barangay La Paz, Cabatuan, Isabela, a rural and plain area located near the Catholic church and their Barangay Health Center unit. The young couple is blessed with a two-year-old daughter named Haycee Crismacion.

Mark has operated and managed a small bakeshop in front of their house for almost four years. His weekly income of PHP 3,500 is already of big use in the maintenance of his bakeshop. He is now borrowing business capital of PHP 20,000 from Kiva lenders for the continuous growth of his business.

Mark also plans to have a bigger venue where he can hire out-of-school youth in their village. He wishes that he can become a successful entrepreneur someday for the welfare of his family.

Mark is a very hardworking and responsible father, despite his young age. He spends most of his time in making his business grow. He is very thankful that, even at a young age, he is blessed with his own business to provide for the growing needs of his children.
loan_use: To use as additional business capital

description:
K. George is the leader of his lending group in Ibanda. He is 52 years old and married with six children aged 20 to 6 years, all in secondary school.

George is a hardworking man who manages two businesses: that is, he is a farmer and at the same time has a carpentry workshop in Rwemengo Trading Centre. It’s because of his loyalty that he is successful in business. He does his two businesses interchangeably and employs a few people to help with his businesses so that he can expand his business as well as have a happy and educated family.

George needs a loan to be able to buy farm inputs like fertilizer and quality seeds to ensure quality production.
loan_use: To buy farm inputs like fertiliser and quality seeds
borrower_names: Soverino, Averino, Denis, Marosi, Jane, Geofrey, George, Regina, Donards, Prosfer, Moses, Judith, Ednance, Amos, Innocent, Jeresom, David, James
borrower_genders: male, female, male, female, female, male, male, female, male, female, male, female, female, male, male, male, male, male
borrower_pictured: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

description:
Eustaquia es socia del Banco Comunal Paraíso.
Eustaquia es casada, tiene 54 años y 8 hijos, Eustaquia tiene una Bodega en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su hija.
Eustaquia necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Eustaquia sueña con educar a sus hijos.
description_translated:
Eustaquia is a member of the community bank, Banco Comunal Paraíso.

Eustaquia is married, 54 years old and has 8 children. Eustaquia has a store in her home from which she sells groceries, vegetables and fruits. She works everyday with the help of her daughter.

Eustaquia needs a loan of 750 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of rice and sugar.

Eustaquia’s dream is to educate her children.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To purchase rice and sugar

description: Ruth, de 29 años es una joven muy alegre, vive en la casa de su madre a quien quiere mucho y juntas trabajan muy duro para salir adelante. En uno de los paraderos de transporte público más importantes de la ciudad de Juliaca, se encuentra el kiosco de golosinas de Ruth, su negocio es muy concurrido ya que los chóferes siempre aprovechan para comer algo entre cada viaje y también es el kiosco donde la mayoría de pasajeros compra algo para el camino. Lo que más le gusta a Ruth de su trabajo es atender a sus clientes y conversar con ellos, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su kiosco, sin poder salir a pasear por su ciudad. Para el futuro anhela tener una tienda grande de abarrotes donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad. \nEste es el sexto préstamo de Ruth con MFP y al igual como hizo en sus primeros crédito desea pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que sabe que si no lo hace así meterá en problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy respetada por lo responsable que es. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más golosinas para implementar mejor su kiosco y así ofrecerles una mayor variedad de golosinas a sus clientes.
description_translated:
Twenty-nine-year-old Ruth is a very happy young woman. She lives with her mother, whom she loves very much. They both work very hard to get ahead in life. Ruth’s snack shop is located in one of the city of Juliaca’s most important public transportation stations. Her business is much frequented because the drivers always stop by to eat something in between every trip. Her stand is where the majority of passengers purchase something to eat for the road. What Ruth most likes about her job is attending to her customers and conversing with them. She has been in business for 5 years. What she thinks is the most difficult aspect of her job is having to stay in her kiosk all day long, without being able to take a walk around her city. In the future, she would like to have a big grocery store where she can sell her products with greater comfort.

\r\nThis is Ruth’s sixth loan with MFP. Just like she did with her previous loans, she intends to make her payments on time because she knows that if she doesn’t, she will cause problems in her communal bank, where she is respected for being so responsible. With this 1,000.00 PEN loan, she will purchase more snacks to restock her kiosk and in so doing offer her customers a greater selection.\r\n

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Increase merchandise

description:
Luz Maria tiene su negocio de taxi, que su esposo lo maneja. Ella es enfermera técnica, trabaja en un Centro Médico de Villa Maria al Sur de Lima, por las noches estudió podología por un año y este mes de setiembre se estará graduando como Podóloga. 
Los préstamos que recibe le permiten invertirlo en sus carros, Luz María necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para el arreglo técnico de sus carros.
El sueño de Maria es ahora ejercer su nueva carrera con eficacia
loan_use: arreglo técnico de sus carros

description: Ángela tiene 22 años, vive en la casa propia de sus padres. Desde hace un año y medio se dedica a la venta de ropa, sus principales clientes son sus amistades y vecinos, pero también continuamente está en búsqueda de nueva clientela. Ángela adquiere su mercadería en su mismo centro de trabajo, que es una tienda de ropa y en otras ocasiones, viaja a otra ciudad donde compra novedosos diseños. Este negocio le permite generar los ingresos que necesita para pagar sus gastos estudiantiles, razón por la cual planifica su futuro adquiriendo cada vez mejores prendas para sus clientes. \nEsta es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es muy puntual  con sus cuotas, es parte de un banco comunal y es un buen ejemplo para los demás. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mayor cantidad de ropa para incrementar sus ventas.
description_translated:
Ángela is 22 years old, lives at home with her parents, and has been selling clothes for the past 1½ years. She sells mainly to friends and neighbors, but she is always looking for new customers. Ángela acquires her merchandise at the clothing store where she works. In addition, she buys new designs whenever she travels to other cities. Her business allows her to pay for her educational expenses and make plans for her future of buying high quality clothing for her customers.

This is Ángela’s second loan with MFP. She is very punctual with her payments and sets a good example for the other members of her Communal Bank. The money she is requesting will be used to buy a larger quantity of clothes so that she can increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase more merchandise

description:
For Francisca, success in life will be fulfilled if you know how to manage it wisely. She is 57 years old and she remains strong and still very busy in her general store business.  She is married to Benjamin and they were blessed with six children and all of them are married. 

Francisca is engaged in vending vegetables to earn money for their daily needs. Aside from vending vegetables she also has a home based store as part of her additional source of income. With this regard, Francisca would like to avail a loan amounting PHP4, 000 to further improve her vending and humble store. She would be very glad if she will be given the chance by the KIVA lenders by lending her loan request.
loan_use: additional capital

description:
Mary B. lives in the Foyah Market Community. She is widowed and has five children. For about six years, Mary has been engaged in the sale of fish and rice at retail prices. Financial problems and illiteracy have been her biggest challenges, and but she is successful in attracting consumers to her business by using effective sales methods. \r\n

\r\nShe dreams of someday owning a storage center which will help her more successfully to support all of her children.
loan_use: To buy fish and rice for market sale

description:
Dulce María T. J. de 38 años de edad, es la coordinadora del Grupo Yo tengo Fe. Quien posee un taller de sastrería muy humilde pero de gran calidad en cuanto a los productos que elabora.

Desde hace 15 años, Dulce aprendió este oficio, trabajando en un taller como operaria. Cuando sintió que poseía la capacidad para hacerlo sola, con la ayuda de su familia (Sus hijos de 19 y 22 años y su esposo). Tomaron la decisión de poner un taller propio donde trabajaran y salieran adelante con sus conocimientos.

Actualmente su meta es lograr la adquisición de maquinas industriales y sustituir algunas de pedales que posee. Su negocio lo inicio con capital propio y aunque tuvo que enfrentar el hecho de que con la crisis económica en honduras perdió más de 14,000 córdobas en mercadería que exportaba, con sus ahorros y disciplina hoy ha alcanzado recuperarse de esta pérdida.

Darling T. trabaja en la compra de frutas y verduras en Masaya para luego llevarla a vender ha Matagalpa, cuando viene de regreso trae frijoles para venderlos en Masaya y así incrementar sus ingresos. Lorenzo posee un vivero donde compra y vende plantas.
description_translated:
Dulce María T. J. is 38 years old and the coordinator for the group “Yo Tengo Fe” (I Have Faith). She owns a modest tailoring shop where she manufactures high quality products.

Fifteen years ago, Dulce learned her trade working as a seamstress at a textile factory. When she decided to work on her own, she had the support of her family (her husband and children, ages 22 and 19). They made the decision to build Dulce her own workshop where she could use her knowledge to get ahead.

Today her goal is to acquire industrial machines and replace the pedals on her existing equipment. She started her business with her own money. Due to the economic crisis in Honduras, she recently lost 14,000 Nicaraguan córdobas on merchandise she exported (due to the exchange rates). Through saving and discipline, she has been able to recover from that loss.

Darling T. buys fruits and vegetables in Masaya and sells them in Matagalpa. She brings back with her beans that she sells in Masaya in order to increase her earnings. Lorenzo owns a nursery where he buys and sells plants.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase materials to fulfill customer orders
borrower_names: Darling Yohana, Dulce María, Lorenzo Isabel

description:
La Señora Maritza del Socorro F. P. de 39 años de edad es comerciante desde sus hace mas de 15 años,  ella se dedica junto con su esposo a la compra y venta de cosechas de verduras, algunas veces y según la demanda de los clientes, compra también cosechas de frutas. Pero originalmente ella se especializa en la compra de cosechas de verduras.

Su meta es ampliar su terreno y llegar a ella ser productora y vendedora de sus cosechas, esto lo quiere lograr conforme a su crecimiento de crédito y la ayuda de sus hijos que tienen 17 y 18 años, quienes a pesar de que estudian, ella los involucra en su negocio para que aprendan a valorar el trabajo de sus padres.

Es una mujer muy dedicada y disciplinada, con mucho potencial y quiere seguir creciendo en sus créditos para mejorar sus condiciones económicas. Con este crédito comprara tres tipos de cosechas de verdura (Pipián, chayote y chilotes).
description_translated:
Mrs. Maritza del Socorro F. P. is 39 years old. She has been a merchant for more than 15 years. She and her husband are in the business of buying and selling vegetable crops. Sometimes, depending on the demand from her clients, she also buys fruit crops, but originally she specializes in the purchase of vegetable crops.

Her goal is to expand her acreage and to become the grower and seller of her own crops, which she plans to achieve in accordance with the growth of her credit and the help of her children who are 17 and 18 years old. Despite the fact that they are students, she will involve them in the business so that they learn to value the work of their parents.

She is a very dedicated and disciplined woman with a lot of potential, and she wants to continue growing her credit in order to improve her economic conditions. With this loan she will buy three types of vegetable crops: squash, vegetable pear, and baby corn.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: purchase of vegetable crops

description: Ayllin es una persona dinámica y muy colaboradora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 33 años, es madre soltera tiene un hijo menor de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir y productos de belleza. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Galácticas ll” desde hace tres años. El primer préstamo que obtuvo fue de 300 soles que le permitió invertir en perfumes.\n\nCon este préstamo de S/ 3000 soles, utilizará una parte en comprar productos de belleza y otra parte invertirá en blusas, pantalones y polos. La meta de Ayllin es tener un bazar  con artículos para toda ocasión.
loan_use: Invertirá una parte en comprar productos de belleza y otra parte invertirá en blusas, pantalones y polos.

description:
Ramona O. se dedica a la venta de ropa exhibiendola en su establecimiento donde a diario es visitada por sus clientes que acuden para adquirir la ropa. Es de importancia destacar que ella ha logrado salir adelante gracias a sus esfuerzos por su negocio.

Actualmente, el crédito lo ha solicitado para dar lugar a la compra de la ropa ya que se le está agotando y de esta manera mejorar las condiciones de su negocio.
description_translated:
Ramona O. sells clothing displayed at her store where she is visited everyday by her clients who come to shop for clothes. It is important to point out that she has been able to get ahead thanks to the effort put in the business. Currently, the loan requested is to purchase merchandise because her inventory levels are low and with the loan the conditions of the business will be better.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase clothing merchandise

description:
La señora Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal “Gregoria Apaza” del centro poblado de Pusuyo del Distrito de Ilave, Provincia de el Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 38 años de edad, de estado civil casada tiene 05 hijos, vive en el centro poblado de Coraraca, estudio educación secundaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 1 año y medio, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado menor.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado vacuno para mejorarlos y luego ella los comercializa en las ferias zonales que se realizan una ves por semana.

Su mayor deseo es convertirse en mayorista de venta de ganado.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros.
description_translated:
Gloria is a member of the Gregoria Apaza Communal Bank in the Pusuyo community center in the Ilave district, Collao province, Puno department. She is 38, married, and has five children. She lives in the town center of Coraraca. She has a high school education. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for almost a year and a half. She started with a loan for 300 PEN, which allowed her to increase the capital in her business of buying and selling livestock. She currently needs a new loan for 3,000 PEN, which will allow her to buy cattle. She will improve them and then sell them in the regional fairs that are held once a week. Her greatest desire is to become a wholesaler selling livestock. She likes the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy cattle

description:
Enma es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes.
Enma es conviviente, tiene 39 años y 2 hijos, Enma tiene un molino en su casa en donde procesa cereales variados en harinas, sus ventas los realiza a diferentes instituciones. Además Enma brinda servicios de molido.
Enma necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo y cebada.
Enma sueña con ampliar su local y buena educación a sus hijos.
description_translated:
Enma is a member of the Communal Bank “Tulipanes” (Tulips). She is 39 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 2 children. Enma has a mill in her home where she processes different grains into flour. She sells her products to different institutions. She also provides milling services.

Enma needs a loan of 2100 soles to buy wheat and barley. She dreams of expanding her business and providing a good education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: Purchase wheat & barley

description:
“ If there’s a will, there’s a way”  is the guiding principle of Monica L., a mother living in Brgy. Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. High school was her highest educational attainment, as her parents could not afford to finance her college education. Despite of it, she found a job and helped her parents  earn a living. When she is 24, she married Julio L. and they are blessed with two children whom they called Julius L. and Jesica L.. Both of them are now in secondary school. They want that their children to finish a degree so that they will someday find good jobs and have a bright future. In this regard, this couple is striving hard to earn income to satisfy their needs and finance their childrens education. 

Her husband is one of the farmers in Brgy. He cultivates their farm by planting rice and variety of vegetables twice a year while Monica engages in selling soft drinks and ice in their village. She will use the loan that she has requested from one of the Microfinance organization, as capital in acquiring her products. Every week, she is able to sold 10-15 cases of soft drinks, earning a net income of Php 600.00 which she uses to acquire their daily needs, finance the school fees of their children, and pay her weekly loan amortization. Due to the high cost of commodities and school expenditures, she needs to earn more income to satisfy and meet their needs. Therefore, she is requesting a loan amount of Php 8,000.00 to strengthen her capital in the improvement of her business. With the loan amount, she would able to purchase more soft drinks to sell. She hopes that with her patience and sacrifices, she can improve her business and support the studies of their children.
loan_use: additional capital to purchase more soft drinks

description: Leah M. is a young mother who lives in Brgy. Villa Coloma, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She was born on March 12, 1989 and only finished secondary education. She did not pursue college because she got married at an early age. Her husband is Mr. Rey M. and they are blessed with a child whom they called Reymarch M., a four year old boy. It is difficult for them to look for a job because they are only high school graduates. \n\tSo her husband cultivates their farm by planting a variety of vegetables. This is the common source of their income. When her son is on his best behavior Leah sells frozen foods and vegetables. She is the one who displays/sells their produce at the Public Market of Villa Coloma, bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. Since she does not have enough money to acquire more frozen foods, she wants to be a member of the Lending institution in Solano and applied for a loan of PHP 5,000.00 to be used in acquiring more frozen foods and vegetables to be sold at retail. She is so happy and she believes that she can make her business grow through this financial assistance.\n
loan_use: additional capital for her process foods business

description: Ferdinand is a hard-working farmer from Agusan Del Sur. He is 33 years old and still single. His rice crop is starting to grow but still needs inputs like fertilizer to continue growing. Ferdinand is a new member of CEVI and in his opinion, CEVI’s program is very helpful to him and his fellow farmers. Add to that, the benefits they can receive through the insurance service. For his first loan, he requested PHP 6,000. He will use this loan to acquire the farm inputs he needs.
loan_use: To purchase fertilizer

description: Long Y., 54, is married and lives with four of her children in the Takeo province. She works as a farmer together with her husband and they typically make US$1.50 every day. They are also supported by their children who work in the garment factories, casino and blacksmith. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also forced food prices to skyrocket. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians. In light of these times of economic difficulties, Long Y. is asking CREDIT for a loan of US$1000 to aid her son’s business. He currently works as a blacksmith, and could make a lot more money if he opened up his own shop. She sees this loan as a way to increase her income and is confident that the business venture will be successful.\n
loan_use: Open up blacksmith shop.

description: Alma D. J., together with her beloved husband, is striving to earn enough income to support the education of their two children who are presently studying in tertiary education. Being parents, they are concerned with the future of their children. They sacrifice everything to send their children to school for they know that education is the only way to find a stable job. \r\n\tThe main source of their income is farming. They cultivate their farm lots in two cropping cycles by planting rice and vegetables. Due to the high cost of commodities and school expenditures, they need to earn more income to meet their daily needs and finance the tuition fees and allowances of their children. In this regard, Alma put up a small eatery in their village located at Brgy. Poblacion, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya to earn additional income. She started this with a small amount of capital in which she can only earn a net income of P 500.00 per week. In this regard, she wants to improve it but she has inadequate capital. Therefore, she wants to borrow additional capital from KIVA lenders amounting to P 5,000.00 to be added to her capital to improve her small eatery. She wants to buy more ingredients for her eatery. She believes that with her patience and sacrifices, she will be able to improve her business and support the studies of their two children.\r\n
loan_use: To buy more ingredients to cook

description:
Anecito T., 36, is from the city of Bitoon Ozamiz City.  He is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Anecito owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a "sari-sari" retail store. This is not his only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Anecito has been engaged in this business for over 25 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Anecito joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anecito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Anecito is requesting a new loan of 14489.79 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Anecito from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
loan_use: to invest in expanding the business

description: Berlisa M. is from the village of Mabini, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental.  She is 51 years old. Berlisa is married and has 1 adult-aged child. To make a living, Berlisa owns and operates a business venture in retailing. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling of variety of goods in the local community. Berlisa has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 2,000.00 PHP net a month for these activities. In 2005, Berlisa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Berlisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. Berlisa is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used for additional capital of sari-sari store. This loan will be the 3rd cycle loan taken out by Berlisa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.  \t
loan_use: Additional Capital of her retail store

description: Marilou V. is from Catadman, Ozamiz City. She is 34 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Marilou owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. Captured in the photo is a customer with her. In April 2009, Marilou joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Marilou is now requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
loan_use: To purchase additional products to sell

description: Mrs. Solita V. and her husband live harmoniously in a village located at Barangay Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. They are gifted with five children, two males and three females. Despite their education, they aim to improve their status of living. They help each other earn a living and support the schooling of their children. As a result of their patience and sacrifice, three of their children graduated from college and presently work abroad and the other two are busy managing their respective businesses.\r\n\r\nDespite her age, Solita wants to continue to manage her small eatery while her husband manages their parcel of land by planting rice and vegetables. Every week, she earns a net income of PHP800, which they use for their daily needs and save for their future. She wants to improve her small business so she can earn a higher income. Thus, she applied for a loan from KIVA lenders of PHP5,000 to improve her small business and to maintain their crop production.
loan_use: Additional capital to improve her small eatery

description:
Mrs. Pheary M., 39, is widow with three sons. One of her sons is a driver for a company and other two are attending school. She lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh about 25 kilometers away.

Pheary has been selling rice in a local market for 3 years. She now is asking for her first loan of $1,200 to buy a motorcycle for her son to drive to work.
loan_use: To purchase a motorbike for her son to drive to work.

description:
El grupo Calidez está integrado por Olga María S., Alicia L. S. y Magali Nohemí G. L..  La señora S. inicio vendiendo dulces como caramelos y chiverías ahora tiene una modesta venta.

Alicia L. S. vende sopas y nacatamales los fines de semana y Magali G. vende leña. Este grupo lleva cinco ciclos con Adim en los cuales han ido prosperando y esperan seguir adelante
description_translated:
The group Calidez is make up of Olga María S., Alicia L. S. and Magali Nohemí G. L.. Señora S. began selling sweets like caramels and sweets, and now she has a small shop. Alicia L. S. sells soup and nacatamales (steamed corncakes) on the weekends, and Magali Gonzalas sells firewood. This group has done five loans with ADIM, in which they have prospered, and they hope to continue on.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer
loan_use: To buy business supplies
borrower_names: Magaly Nohemi, Olga María, Alicia del Socorro

description: Mrs. Kolab I. lives in Thommoney village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a field to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Uy Thorn, is a fisherman. Although this couple tries to work hard, they still earn less income than they need to support their family. Thus, Mrs. Kolab I. decided to ask for a loan to buy a buffalo for breeding and for plowing the field. Mrs. Kolab I. is the mother of six children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, another is a construction worker, and the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is on the right in the photo.
loan_use: to buy a buffalo for breeding and for plowing the field.

description:
Maribel A. is 30 years old and has three children. Her husband is Mr. Artemio A. and they happily live in a village located at Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. All of their children are studying in the secondary and elementary levels of education. Because of their interest to give their children a better future, they are striving hard to support their schooling.

They cultivate their farm lot twice a year by planting vegetables and root crops. Aside from this, Maribel also buys and sells vegetables to help her husband in gaining  more income. She sells her products at Solano Public Market during market days, as well as in their village through house to house delivery. Since her capital is not sufficient to acquire more vegetables, she wants to borrow additional capital from Kiva lenders of Php10,000 to increase her capital and improve her small business. She expects that with this financial assistance, she will be able to improve her business and earn more income for the sake of their children.
loan_use: For additional capital to buy and sell vegetables.

description: Due to hardships and difficulties of life, Josephine and Melesio A. help each other earn a living for their survival and to give their daughter a better future. They live in a village of Barangay Buliwao, Quezon,Nueva Vizcaya.\t\r\n\r\nTheir main source of income is through farming. They plant rice and vegetables twice a year. Sfter planting her husband uses their tricycle to earn income while Josephine engages in selling the vegetables in their village and at the public market. The average income she earns for the month is about to 3,000 PHP which they use to acquire their daily needs and for their daughter's school. She is able to earn additional income if she sells more vegetables. Since her capital is not sufficient, she wants to borrow a 5,000 PHP loan from KIVA lenders which will be used in acquiring more fruits and vegetables to resell. She hopes that she will become successful in her journey as a businesswoman.
loan_use: additional capital in buying and selling of fruits and vegetables

description:
Gloria and her husband are engaged in manufacturing an improvised stove. It is being assembled by her husband. Gloria helps him in delivering their product to different villages and to some dealers. For each stove, they earn PHP700. Gloria would like to further expand her business to make her business more profitable. She hopes to obtain a loan of PHP5,000 to use as additional capital in purchasing more materials needed to manufacture more stoves. According to her, the more capital they have, the more stoves they can make. She hopes that her loan will be granted by some generous KIVA lenders. 

Gloria is 41 years old and she is married to Gabriel who manages his own welding shop in their house. They are blessed with four children; two are married and two are still being supported by them.  They live in the village of Punit, Benito Soliven, Isabela.
loan_use: To purchase materials needed in their manufacturing business

description:
Danilo G., who is known in his community as “Danny,” is 38 years old and is married to Myrna. They are blessed with one son named Danny Boy G., seven years old. They live in Barangay Paniki, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. They aim to be successful in life to give their son a better future. Despite the hardships and difficulties in life, they strive harder to earn a living.

Farming is their way of making a living. They till their land twice a year to plant rice and vegetables. They are also engaged in hog raising to earn additional income. They want to expand their plantation to have a plentiful harvest and to improve their piggery by increasing their livestock. Since they don’t have enough capital, they want to borrow from Kiva lenders the amount of 10,000 Philippine pesos to be used in acquiring the needed materials for the maintenance of their crop production and piggery. They hope that through patience and sacrifice, they will achieve their goal. They believe that “God is merciful to those who are honest and faithful.”
loan_use: Additional capital for his hog raising business
